
442 
FXUS61 KILN 010337
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1035 PM EST MON DEC 31 2001


LATEST SATELLITE INDICATES LOW CLOUD DECK ACROSS SOUTH DIMINISHING 
AS DRIER AIR WORKS IN. WILL UPDATE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN ZONES TO 
REFLECT THIS. WITH DAYTONS TEMPERATURE AT 13 AND DEW POINT OF 2 AT 
10 PM WILL DROP LOWS IN MIAMI VALLEY AND WHITEWATER VALLEY TO 5 TO 
10 ABOVE.


.ILN...NONE.

PARKER

















292 
FXUS61 KILN 010128
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
825 PM EST MON DEC 31 2001


LATEST SATELLITE INDICATES LOW CLOUD DECK ACROSS SOUTH HANGING IN. 
BASED ON RADAR CANT RULE OUT A FEW FLURRIES AS WELL. 00Z SOUNDING 
INDICATED INVERSION SOMEWHAT STRONGER TONIGHT THAN LAST NIGHT...BUT 
MAY BE LESS RH TRAPPED BELOW INVERSION. WILL ADJUST SOUTH TO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY WITH A FEW FLURRIES...BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
ONLY OTHER CHANGE IS TO EXTREME NORTHERN ZONES WHERE CLEAR SKIES 
WILL PREVAIL UNTIL SOMETIME AFTER MIDNIGHT. WILL ADJUST SKY COVER 
WORDING AND DROP LOWS TO 5 TO 10.


.ILN...NONE.

PARKER















000 
FXUS61 KILN 311928 AAA
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...AMENDED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST MON DEC 31 2001

*********************************************************************
MESOETA SFC TEMPS AND AVN MAV/SFC TEMPS CONTINUE TO BE INFLUENCED BY 
BAD DATA IN THE MODEL...SO WILL USE FWC GUIADANCE AND THICKNESS 
SCHEMES TO FCST TEMPS IN THE SHORT TERM
*********************************************************************

ALBEIT THE SHORT TERM FCST INVOLVES CHC/S OF FLURRIES AND 
CLDS...STILL DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT...SO WILL DO MY BEST.

18Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATES A WEAK SFC TROF REFLECTION ACRS ERN AND 
SE OHIO.  KILN RADAR HAS SHOWN THAT THE FLURRIES HAVE ENDED ACRS THE 
REGION AS DRIER AIR IS NOW CURRENTLY WORKING INTO THE WRN CWFA.  
MEANWHILE...IN THE UPPER ATMOSPHERE...AS PORTRAYED ON CURRENT WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY...UPR POLAR VORTEX CONTINUES TO SPIN EAST OF JAMES BAY 
WITH WEAK AREAS OF SHEAR VORTICITY SPINNING AROUND ITS CENTER.  ONE 
AREA OF SHEAR VORTICITY IS CURRENTLY LOCATED OVER SE SD INTO 
IOWA...NRN IL...NRN IN...AND NRN OHIO.

WEAK SFC TROF COMBINED WITH STRONG WAA BETWEEN 925 MB AND 850 MB 
WERE NOT REFLECTED IN THE MESOETA MODEL AT ALL...AND KILN 12Z 
SOUNDING COMPARED TO THE MODEL GIVES CREDENCE TO THIS.  THESE 
FACTORS SEEM TO HAVE BEEN THE REASON FOR THE FLURRIES LAST NIGHT 
INTO EARLY THIS AFTN.  QUESTION WILL BE:  WILL THIS HAPPEN AGAIN 
TONIGHT?  BELIEVE THE MESOETA SHOULD HAVE THE TREND OF DECREASING 
925 MB RH INTO W CNTRL OHIO AND SE INDIANA CORRECT ATTM...COMPARED 
TO WHAT IS GOING ON CURRENT VISIBLE IMAGERY.  CASE IN POINT:  FLOW 
AT 925 MB AND 850 MB IS COMING OFF OF LAKE MICHIGAN INTO NE 
INDIANA.  HOWEVER...THERE HAS BEEN A DECREASE IN CLOUDS/SNOW SHOWERS 
THERE...GIVING ME SOME CONFIDENCE THAT DRIER AIR IS IN PLACE TO THE 
NORTHWEST OF HERE ATTM.  THE BIG BUGABOO IS THAT THIS DRIER AIR IS 
SLOW TO MOVE IN...AND WHERE THERE ARE CLOUDS NOW (SUCH AS IN THE 
EAST AND SOUTH)...THEY MAY HOLD ON OVERNIGHT UNDER A STRONG 
INVERSION (IF IT STILL EXITS ATTM).  I AM PLANNING ON GOING MOSTLY 
CLEAR DAY AND CVG GROUPS AND PARTLY CLOUDY ELSEWHERE...LETTING THE 
EVENING SHIFT OBSERVE SATELLITE TRENDS TO SEE WHAT HAPPENS.

ON TUESDAY...ALL MODELS SHOW A GRADUAL INCREASE IN 925 MB AND 850 MB 
MSTR ACRS THE NRN CWFA.  HOWEVER...WE DO NOT HAVE ANY SHEAR 
VORTICITY ALOFT...AND MODEL SOUNDING ADJUSTMENTS ARE NOT YIELDING AN 
LOW LVL INSTABILITY LAYER.  WILL LEAVE CHC OF FLURRIES OUT OF THE 
FCST FOR TOMORROW.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE H5 UPR AIR PATTERN 
TRIES TO COMBINE S/WV ENERGY FROM THE SRN BRANCH OF THE JET STREAM 
WITH AN H5 TROF FROM THE NRN STREAM...PRODUCING A SIGNIFICANT STORM 
ACRS THE SE U. S. AND MID ATLANTIC.  FOR THE OHIO VLY...WE GET 
CAUGHT IN A WEAK LOW LVL DEFORMATION ZONE...AS PORTRAYED BY THE 
AVN.  THUS...WITH H85 MSTR AROUND AND WEAK FORCING...WILL LEAVE A 
CHC OF FLURRIES IN ALL LOCATIONS.  AS SYSTEM MOVES AWAY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...GRADUAL DRYING SHOULD OCCUR AS SFC HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION.

NEXT CHC FOR SNOW IS POISED FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  CURRENT LONG 
RANGE MODELS SHOW A DEVELOPING SFC LOW IN THE GULF OF 
MEXICO...MOVING NE ALONG APPALACHIAN SPINE THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  
ALSO...A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES BY 
SATURDAY.  BASED ON PAST EXPERIENCE OF GULF LOWS...THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIAN TRACK ALMOST NEVER HAPPENS.  THUS...THE STORM WILL 
EITHER TAKE A MORE WESTERLY TRACK IF H5 TROF DIGS ENOUGH...OR A 
WEAKER SFC LOW OVER THE SE U. S. WILL TRANSITION OVER TO A 
DEVELOPING SFC LOW OVER THE GULF STREAM WATERS OFF THE ATLANTIC 
COAST.  EITHER WAY...THIS SYSTEM...COMBINED WITH THE APCH OF THE 
WEAK COLD FRONT...WARRANTS A CHANCE FOR SNOW BOTH SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN













FXUS61 KILN 311926
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST MON DEC 31 2001

ALBEIT THE SHORT TERM FCST INVOLVES CHC/S OF FLURRIES AND 
CLDS...STILL DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT...SO WILL DO MY BEST.

18Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATES A WEAK SFC TROF REFLECTION ACRS ERN AND 
SE OHIO.  KILN RADAR HAS SHOWN THAT THE FLURRIES HAVE ENDED ACRS THE 
REGION AS DRIER AIR IS NOW CURRENTLY WORKING INTO THE WRN CWFA.  
MEANWHILE...IN THE UPPER ATMOSPHERE...AS PORTRAYED ON CURRENT WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY...UPR POLAR VORTEX CONTINUES TO SPIN EAST OF JAMES BAY 
WITH WEAK AREAS OF SHEAR VORTICITY SPINNING AROUND ITS CENTER.  ONE 
AREA OF SHEAR VORTICITY IS CURRENTLY LOCATED OVER SE SD INTO 
IOWA...NRN IL...NRN IN...AND NRN OHIO.

WEAK SFC TROF COMBINED WITH STRONG WAA BETWEEN 925 MB AND 850 MB 
WERE NOT REFLECTED IN THE MESOETA MODEL AT ALL...AND KILN 12Z 
SOUNDING COMPARED TO THE MODEL GIVES CREDENCE TO THIS.  THESE 
FACTORS SEEM TO HAVE BEEN THE REASON FOR THE FLURRIES LAST NIGHT 
INTO EARLY THIS AFTN.  QUESTION WILL BE:  WILL THIS HAPPEN AGAIN 
TONIGHT?  BELIEVE THE MESOETA SHOULD HAVE THE TREND OF DECREASING 
925 MB RH INTO W CNTRL OHIO AND SE INDIANA CORRECT ATTM...COMPARED 
TO WHAT IS GOING ON CURRENT VISIBLE IMAGERY.  CASE IN POINT:  FLOW 
AT 925 MB AND 850 MB IS COMING OFF OF LAKE MICHIGAN INTO NE 
INDIANA.  HOWEVER...THERE HAS BEEN A DECREASE IN CLOUDS/SNOW SHOWERS 
THERE...GIVING ME SOME CONFIDENCE THAT DRIER AIR IS IN PLACE TO THE 
NORTHWEST OF HERE ATTM.  THE BIG BUGABOO IS THAT THIS DRIER AIR IS 
SLOW TO MOVE IN...AND WHERE THERE ARE CLOUDS NOW (SUCH AS IN THE 
EAST AND SOUTH)...THEY MAY HOLD ON OVERNIGHT UNDER A STRONG 
INVERSION (IF IT STILL EXITS ATTM).  I AM PLANNING ON GOING MOSTLY 
CLEAR DAY AND CVG GROUPS AND PARTLY CLOUDY ELSEWHERE...LETTING THE 
EVENING SHIFT OBSERVE SATELLITE TRENDS TO SEE WHAT HAPPENS.

ON TUESDAY...ALL MODELS SHOW A GRADUAL INCREASE IN 925 MB AND 850 MB 
MSTR ACRS THE NRN CWFA.  HOWEVER...WE DO NOT HAVE ANY SHEAR 
VORTICITY ALOFT...AND MODEL SOUNDING ADJUSTMENTS ARE NOT YIELDING AN 
LOW LVL INSTABILITY LAYER.  WILL LEAVE CHC OF FLURRIES OUT OF THE 
FCST FOR TOMORROW.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE H5 UPR AIR PATTERN 
TRIES TO COMBINE S/WV ENERGY FROM THE SRN BRANCH OF THE JET STREAM 
WITH AN H5 TROF FROM THE NRN STREAM...PRODUCING A SIGNIFICANT STORM 
ACRS THE SE U. S. AND MID ATLANTIC.  FOR THE OHIO VLY...WE GET 
CAUGHT IN A WEAK LOW LVL DEFORMATION ZONE...AS PORTRAYED BY THE 
AVN.  THUS...WITH H85 MSTR AROUND AND WEAK FORCING...WILL LEAVE A 
CHC OF FLURRIES IN ALL LOCATIONS.  AS SYSTEM MOVES AWAY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...GRADUAL DRYING SHOULD OCCUR AS SFC HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION.

NEXT CHC FOR SNOW IS POISED FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  CURRENT LONG 
RANGE MODELS SHOW A DEVELOPING SFC LOW IN THE GULF OF 
MEXICO...MOVING NE ALONG APPALACHIAN SPINE THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  
ALSO...A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES BY 
SATURDAY.  BASED ON PAST EXPERIENCE OF GULF LOWS...THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIAN TRACK ALMOST NEVER HAPPENS.  THUS...THE STORM WILL 
EITHER TAKE A MORE WESTERLY TRACK IF H5 TROF DIGS ENOUGH...OR A 
WEAKER SFC LOW OVER THE SE U. S. WILL TRANSITION OVER TO A 
DEVELOPING SFC LOW OVER THE GULF STREAM WATERS OFF THE ATLANTIC 
COAST.  EITHER WAY...THIS SYSTEM...COMBINED WITH THE APCH OF THE 
WEAK COLD FRONT...WARRANTS A CHANCE FOR SNOW BOTH SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

THERE...GIVING ME SOME CONFIDENCE THAT DRIER AIR IS IN PLACE TO THE 
NORTHWEST OF HERE ATTM.  THE BIG BUGABOO IS THAT THIS DRIER AIR IS 
SLOW TO MOVE IN...AND WHERE THERE ARE CLOUDS NOW (SUCH AS IN THE 
EAST AND SOUTH)...THEY MAY HOLD ON OVERNIGHT UNDER A STRONG 
INVERSION (IF IT STILL EXITS ATTM).  I AM PLANNING ON GOING MOSTLY 
CLEAR DAY AND CVG GROUPS AND PARTLY CLOUDY ELSEWHERE...LETTING THE 
EVENING SHIFT OBSERVE SATELLITE TRENDS TO SEE WHAT HAPPENS.

ON TUESDAY...ALL MODELS SHOW A GRADUAL INCREASE IN 925 MB AND 850 MB 
MSTR ACRS THE NRN CWFA.  HOWEVER...WE DO NOT HAVE ANY SHEAR 
VORTICITY ALOFT...AND MODEL SOUNDING ADJUSTMENTS ARE NOT YIELDING AN 
LOW LVL INSTABILITY LAYER.  WILL LEAVE CHC OF FLURRIES OUT OF THE 
FCST FOR TOMORROW.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE H5 UPR AIR PATTERN 
TRIES TO COMBINE S/WV ENERGY FROM THE SRN BRANCH OF THE JET STREAM 
WITH AN H5 TROF FROM THE NRN STREAM...PRODUCING A SIGNIFICANT STORM 
ACRS THE SE U. S. AND MID ATLANTIC.  FOR THE OHIO VLY...WE GET 
CAUGHT IN A WEAK LOW LVL DEFORMATION ZONE...AS PORTRAYED BY THE 
AVN.  THUS...WITH H85 MSTR AROUND AND WEAK FORCING...WILL LEAVE A 
CHC OF FLURRIES IN ALL LOCATIONS.  AS SYSTEM MOVES AWAY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...GRADUAL DRYING SHOULD OCCUR AS SFC HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION.

NEXT CHC FOR SNOW IS POISED FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  CURRENT LONG 
RANGE MODELS SHOW A DEVELOPING SFC LOW IN THE GULF OF 
MEXICO...MOVING NE ALONG APPALACHIAN SPINE THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  
ALSO...A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES BY 
SATURDAY.  BASED ON PAST EXPERIENCE OF GULF LOWS...THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIAN TRACK ALMOST NEVER HAPPENS.  THUS...THE STORM WILL 
EITHER TAKE A MORE WESTERLY TRACK IF H5 TROF DIGS ENOUGH...OR A 
WEAKER SFC LOW OVER THE SE U. S. WILL TRANSITION OVER TO A 
DEVELOPING SFC LOW OVER THE GULF STREAM WATERS OFF THE ATLANTIC 
COAST.  EITHER WAY...THIS SYSTEM...COMBINED WITH THE APCH OF THE 
WEAK COLD FRONT...WARRANTS A CHANCE FOR SNOW BOTH SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN














NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1045 AM EST MON DEC 31 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES A WEAK TROF NEAR THE OHIO/INDIANA BORDER 
WITH CONVERGENCE AREA STRETCHING ACROSS SRN INDIANA/OHIO.  VISIBLE 
SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES BROKEN MVFR SKY COVER OVER FA.  

WILL UPDATE FORECAST A LITTLE AFTER 11 AM TO RESOLVE MORNING WORDING 
IN ZONES.  WILL GO MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER TODAY AS 12Z 
ETA INDICATES LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HANGS (<850 MB).  PROGGED SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE SOME POSITIVE AREA BELOW THE INVERSION WHICH INDICATES SC 
DEVELOPMENT WHERE THERE ARE ALREADY HOLES.  WILL KEEP THE MENTION OF 
FLURRIES WITH THE MIXING IN THE VERY LOW LEVELS.  WILL ALSO ADJUST 
TEMPS ACROSS THE SOUTH BY PUSHING THEM A BIT LOWER.  MORNING 
SOUNDING SUGGESTS LOW 20S FOR HIGHS.  LOW LEVEL THICKNESS OFF THE 
12Z RUN SUGGEST MID TO UPPER 20S.  

.ILN...NONE.

IN THE SHORT TERM BAND OF CLDS AND FLURRIES OVR OH AHD OF WK SHEARED
OUT VORT AXIS. MODELS NOT HANDLING THESE CLDS VRY WELL. THIS MSTR
APPEARS TO BE BTWN 950MB AND 900MB. FCST SOUNDINGS SUGG THAT THESE
CLDS MAY HANG ON FOR A WHILE TDA. WL TREND MORE PESSIMISTIC ON CLDS
AND TAKE TEMPS DOWN A LTL TDA. WL KEEP SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY TONIGHT 
DUE TO CONTD WK PVA. MAV GUID WAY TOO COLD WITH TEMPS. WL STAY
CLOSER TO FWC TNGT AND ONLY A LTL COLDER THAN FWC GUID TUE.   

COLD WX PATTERN TO CONT WITH S/WV TROF BREAKING OFF MAIN UPR TROF 
OVR ERN CAN CENTERED JUST E OF JAMES BAY. THIS TROF TO DROP SE THRU 
GRTLKS TUE WITH UPR LO DVLPG OVR LWR MS VLY WED. AVN MODEL MORE 
SIGNIFCANT WITH THIS TROF AND HS BEST CONTINUITY. WL LEAN FCST TWD 
THIS SOLN MAINTAIN CHC OF FLURRIES AHD OF THIS TROF AXIS IN FAVORED 
PVA AREA TUE AFTN AND WED ACRS CNTRL AND N SECTIONS.

LWR MS VLY UPR LO RESULTS IN SFC CYCLOGENESIS OVR SE U.S. BEST 
MSTR AND FORCING TO STAY S OF CWA. MODELS HV TRENDED S WITH THIS
SYS. WL CONT CHC OF FLURRIES WITH UPR LO PASSING THU TN VLY.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 301954
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EST SUN DEC 30 2001

NW/CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT TO CONT THRU THE SHORT RANGE...WITH A
FEW SHORT WAVES SHEARING ACRS THE AREA.  MODEL TIMEHEIGHTS ADVERTISE
A DRY ATMOS AND GENERAL SUBSIDENCE THRU THE PD...WITH SOME HIGH LVL 
MSTR SKIRTING THE SOUTH TNGT AND SOME LLVL MSTR IN THE NORTH ON TUE 
BEHIND A WEAK BNDRY.  WL CARRY MCLR/MSNY THRU THE 3RD PD (MON 
NGT)...THEN PTLY CLDY TUE WITH A CHC OF FLURRIES IN THE NORTH TUE AS 
H8 TEMPS DROP BACK BLO -12 AND FLOW A LITTLE MORE NORTHWESTERLY.  

INTERESTING TEMPERATURE FCST.  ETA...AND CORRESPONDINGLY THE 
AVN...SFC TEMPS HV TRENDED MUCH COLDER.  META SFC TEMPS ADVERTISING 
0-3 ABV TNGT IN W-CENTRAL OHIO...THEN 5-8 BLO MON NGT.  EVEN COLDER 
TO OUR WEST...WITH -15 OR COLDER PROGGED NORTH OF IND.  META SFC 
TEMPS HV BEEN DOING FAIRLY WELL OF LATE...BUT IT APPEARS SUDDENLY TO 
BE FACTORING IN A DEEP SNOWPACK WHICH DOES NOT EXIST.  AVN ALSO 
SHOWS THIS BIAS...BUT TO A LESSER DEGREE.  WITH THIS IN MIND...HV 
TRENDED MUCH CLOSER TO THE FWC NUMBERS.  SFC TRAJECTORIES REMAIN OUT 
OF THE WNW...BUT WITHOUT MUCH SNOWPACK OR REINFORCING SHOTS OF CAA 
WE SHUD SEE A SLOW MODERATION.  GENERALLY WENT A DEG OR 2 BLO THE 
FWC NUMBERS ACRS THE BOARD.

GUID NOW IN GD AGREEMENT WITH SYS MOVG OFF THE SE COAST DURING THE 
END OF THE WEEK.  MAY KEEP A MENTION OF A FLURRY FRI...ESPLY IN THE 
NE...BUT OVERALL LKS LIKE BEST LLVL MSTR AND H8 CAA WL BE WELL TO 
THE NORTH AND EAST OF OUR AREA.  SAT-SUN SYS LKS A LITTLE MORE 
INTERESTING...WITH ALL GUID ADVERTISING LIGHT PCPN IN A BROAD WAA 
PATTERN.  LKS PLENTY COLD FOR SNOW...AND WL INCLUDE LOW CHC POPS ALL 
ZONES.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

000 
FXUS61 KILN 301434
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 AM EST SUN DEC 30 2001

KILN RADAR THIS MORNING SHOWS 12 TO 16 DBZ ECHO RETURNS.  THESE 
VALUES WERE ASSOCD WITH LIGHT SNOW FLURRIES...WHICH ARE CONTINUING 
HERE AT ILN AND EAST INTO S CNTRL OHIO.

UNLIKE YESTERDAY...06Z MESOETA IS INDICATING A LITTLE MORE BOUNDARY 
LAYER MSTR FOR TODAY.  THE NGM...ON THE OTHER HAND...IS DRIER.  THIS 
IS NO SURPRISE AS THE MESOETA TENDS TO BE TOO MOIST AND THE NGM 
TENDS TO BE TOO DRY.  SO THE QUESTION TO ASK IS:  HOW MUCH MSTR WILL 
BE IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER THIS AFTERNOON?  RIGHT NOW..AM LEANING 
TOWARD A MORE MOIST SOLUTION AS 12Z ILN SOUNDING INDICATES A 2.5 C 
SPREAD AT 925 MB.  IF THIS HOLDS TRUE...WE SHOULD SEE AN EXPANSION 
OF CUMULUS WITH A LITTLE DAYTIME HEATING...AND AN UNSTABLE SHALLOW 
LAYER.  THUS...WILL GO PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THIS AFTN EVERYWHERE.  WITH 
H5 SHEAR VORTICITY OCCURRING ALOFT ACRS THE REGION THIS AFTN 
COMBINED WITH SHALLOW INSTABILITY AND CYCLONIC FLOW...CUMULUS MAY 
SQUEEZE OUT A FEW FLURRIES.  AT THIS POINT...WILL CONTINUE A CHANCE 
OF FLURRIES IN THE ERN ZONES AS THEY ARE ALREADY ON THE EDGE OF 
DEEPER MOISTURE (AND FLURRIES ARE HAPPENING THERE ATTM).  FOR THE 
OTHER ZONES...WILL HAVE TO WATCH CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT AND RADAR TRENDS
BEFORE I AM CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO INCLUDE.

KILN 12Z SOUNDING YIELDS 20 DEGREES IN FULL SUNSHINE.  WITH SOME 
CLOUDS AND ONLY SLIGHT MODIFICATION OF THE AIRMASS...CURRENT FCST 
TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE.  MAY OPEN UP A RANGE IN TEMPS FOR THE PMH 
GROUP.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

POLAR VORTEX OVR ERN CANADA CENTERED JUST E OF JAMES BAY. SHEARED

ERLY THIS MRNG. COLD ARCTIC AMS WITH H8 TEMPS OF -18 DEG MEASURED
AT ILN WITH 00Z SOUNDING. THIS COLDEST CORE OF AIR SHIFTS E ACRS
OH INTO WRN OH TDA. DRY ARCTIC AMS SHUD NOT SUPP MUCH IN THE WAY
OF CLDS TDA ONCE AFOREMENTIONED ERLY MRNG CLDS EXIT THE AREA.

LO LVL THICKNESS AND TRAJECTORIES ALL SUPP HI TEMPS COLDER THAN
FWC GUID TDA. WL TREND HI/S TOWARD COLDER MAV NUMBERS.

H5 FLO BACKS WITH CONFLUENCE DVLPG FM LWR MS INTO TN VLY TDA INTO
MON. THIS WL ALLOW SFC RDGG TO BLD SE WITH FLO BCMG ANTI-CYCLONIC.
XPCT OVRNGT TO BE MAINLY CLD FREE WITH ONLY SOME HI LVL MSTR INDICATED
ON CROSS SECTIONS. IN MOSTLY CLEAR ENVIRONMENT PREFER TEMPS A LTL 
COOLER THAN FWC GUID FOR LOWS.

SOME MODERATION TO TEMPS SHUD OCCUR ON MON WITH WK WAA. FWC AGN APPEARS
TOO WARM. PREFER A BLEND OF MAV/FWC GUID VALUES FOR HI/S.  

MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH UPR PATTERN WITH TROF AXIS DROPPING
S FM CAN THRU GRTLKS TUE/WED TIME FRAME. MODEL TRENDS A LTL SLOWER

CORE OF COLDEST AIR AT H8...TEMPS -16C OR BLO...WILL MOVE EAST OF 
THE CWFA ERLY TNGT.  XPCT THE LIGHT CONVECTIVE SNOWS...ASSOCIATED

WEST...AND THRU THE EVE IN THE EAST.  OTHW...DECENT DRYING 
ADVERTISED THROUGOUT THE ATMOS...AND XPCT A GRADUAL CLEARING FROM 
THE WSW.  TRAJECTORIES SUPPORT TEMPS A DEG OR 2 COOLER THAN THE FWC 
GUID...WHIGH I WL UNDERCUT SLIGHTLY ACRS THE BOARD.

SHORT WAVES WL SHEAR OUT ACRS THE AREA IN THE 2ND-4TH PD IN A 
GENERAL REGIME OF CONFLUENT FLOW IN THE MID/UPPER LVLS.  LLV FLOW 
MAINTAINS MORE OF A WESTERLY COMPONENT...WHICH KEEPS THE BETTER MSTR 
TO THE NORTH.  TIMESXNS ADVERTISE AN EXTENDED PD OF DRYING WITH 
DOWNWARD VERTICAL MOTION...AND HV MAINTAINED THE PREV PARTLY-MOSTLY 
SUNNY FCSTS.  TRAJECTORIES/META SFC TEMPS SUGGEST FWC TOO WARM ON 
SUNDAY...AND HV UNDERCUT.  LOWERED THE FWC AGAIN SUNDAY NIGHT AS NGM 
LKS TO BE HITTING THE HIGH LVL CLOUD A BIT TOO HARD...AND THE 
AIRMASS WOULD SUPPORT THE COOLER MAV NUMBERS W/CLR SKIES.

ADDED FLURRIES TO THE NORTH 1/2 ON NEW YEARS DAY AS LLVL FLOW 
BECOMES MORE NNW...AND H8 TEMPS PROGGED BLO -14 ON THE NEW AVN.  WL 
CONT CHC SNOW SHOWERS NORTH...FLURRIES SOUTH TUE NGT INTO WED.   

.ILN...NONE.

LKS TO BE HITTING THE HIGH LVL CLOUD A BIT TOO HARD...AND THE 
AIRMASS WOULD SUPPORT THE COOLER MAV NUMBERS W/CLR SKIES.

ADDED FLURRIES TO THE NORTH 1/2 ON NEW YEARS DAY AS LLVL FLOW 
BECOMES MORE NNW...AND H8 TEMPS PROGGED BLO -14 ON THE NEW AVN.  WL 
CONT CHC SNOW SHOWERS NORTH...FLURRIES SOUTH TUE NGT INTO WED.   

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE
















FXUS61 KILN 291411
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
910 AM EST SAT DEC 29 2001

BAND OF LIGHT SNOW HAS NOW EXITED SE OUT OF THE CWFA.  SOME 
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WERE SEEN ON KILN RADAR FROM ABOUT CMH TO 
OWENTON.  THESE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE OFF QUICKLY TO THE SE.

ANOTHER S/WV IS FCST TO PUSH THROUGH THE CWFA THIS AFTN.  CHC FOR 
SNOW SHOWERS CAN BE EXPECTED AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM...AS NOTED BY THE 
RADAR RETURNS OUT OF IND.  SWISS CHEESE HOLES IN THE CLOUDS...AS 
OBSERVED BY CURRENT VISIBLE IMAGERY...WILL FILL IN WITH ANY 
INSOLATION.  TEMPS WILL STAY NEARLY STEADY OR SLIGHTLY FALL DUE TO 
CAA AND 850 MB TEMPS DROPPING OFF ABOUT 3 DEGREES C.

ONLY UPDATE EXPECTED ATTM WILL BE TO CLEAN UP THE WORDING IN THE SE 
CWFA.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 290808
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
309 AM EST SAT DEC 29 2001

UPR LO FM SE CAN THRU NEW ENGLAND WITH ELONGATED TROF THRU THE
GRTLKS. WV IMGRY SHWS EMBEDDED S/WV OVR LWR OH VLY. THIS FEATURE
SETTING OFF BAND OF LGT SNW OFF ACRS SRN IL...SRN IN...KY AND
SRN OH. THIS S/WV TO SWING THRU OH VLY THIS MRNG WITH Q-VECTORS 
INDICATING FORCING BTWN 700MB/500MB ACRS THE S DURG MRNG HRS.
925MB SHWS FAVORABLE LO LVL CNVRGC AXIS ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH
THIS SNW.  WL BREAK OFF A GROUP ACRS NRN KY AND INDICATE CAT
POPS FOR SNW THIS MRNG AND ACCUM UP TO ONE INCH PSBL. WL TREND 
POPS FM LKLY ACRS SRN OH TO CHC ACRS THE CNTRL AND N. GOOD CAA 
ACRS THE AREA TDA AS ARCTIC AMS SETTLES INTO OH VLY. XPCT NR 
STEADY TEMPS ACRS ALL BUT S-SE SECTIONS WHERE A MRNG HI WL GIVE 
WAY TO SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS.

H8 COLD POOL OF -18 DEG C TO SETTLE INTO OH OVRNGT. IN CAA PTN
WITH WK PVA AS WK S/WV DROPS FM UPR MS VLY THRU OH VLY TNGT.
XPCT SOME SCTD FLURRIES WITH SKIES BCMG PARTLY CLOUDY. MAY BE 
A FW MORE CLDS ACRS FAR N WITH FETCH OFF LAKE MICH BUT XPCT MOST
OF THESE CLDS TO STAY N OF CWA. WL TREND TEMPS TOWARD COLDER
MAV GUID WITH LOWS TNGT.

UPR LO TO REMAIN OVR SE CAN WITH BAGGY TROF OVR THE GRTLKS GIVING
WAY TO CONFLUENT FLO OVR THE LWR OH AND TN VLYS THRU THE PD. THIS
WL ALLOW SFC HI PRES TO BLD SSE WITH FA DRYING OUT THRU FIRST 
PART OF NEW WEEK. IN DRY ARCTIC AMS XPCT TO SEE GOOD DEAL OF 
SUNSHINE SUNDAY. ENERGY BLOCK METHOD POINTS TO TEMPS COLDER THAN
FWC GUID SUN. THIS LOOKS REASONABLE GIVEN NATURE OF THIS COLD 
AIRMASS. THERFORE WL TREND HI TEMPS DOWN A LTL.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

FXUS61 KILN 290217
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 PM EST FRI DEC 28 2001

WSR-88D INDICATING SOME LT SNOW/FLURRIES EXTENDING FROM DAY AREA NE 
IN RESPONSE TO MID LVL S/W CURRENTLY MOVING E ACROSS THE NRN PORTION 
OF THE ILN FA. EXPECT THIS ACTIVITY TO DIMINISH OVER THE NEXT FEW 
HOURS. ANOTHER AREA OF LT SNOW HAS MOVED INTO NRN MO/W-CTRL IL IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH E-W ORIENTED MID LVL S/W AND CLD FRONTAL BDRY. IT 
IS THIS WX MAKER THAT WILL MAKE ITS PRESENCE FELT LATER TONIGHT 
ACROSS THE SWRN PORTION OF OUR FA. MODELS STILL INDICATING THAT THE 
BEST FORCING WILL REMAIN S-SW OF OUR AREA...BUT Q-VECTOR ANALYSIS 
SUGGEST SOME ENHANCED FORCING TO REACH INTO THE SRN PORTION OF OUR 
FA LATER TONIGHT AND EARLY TOMORROW. WITH THIS IN MIND WILL CONTINUE 
PRETTY MUCH ALONG THE LINES OF EARLIER FCST WITH ONLY MINOR CHANGES.

ZONE UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO

194 
FXUS61 KILN 282000
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM EST FRI DEC 28 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A SFC TROF FROM CNTRL MI SW INTO CNTRL 
INDIANA AND S CNTRL ILLINOIS.  THIS SFC TROF...IN CONJUNCTION WITH 
S/WV ENERGY NOTED ON WATER VAPOR...WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SCATTERED 
SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY NOW OCCURRING ACRS THE WAPAKONETA...DAYTON AND 
COLUMBUS REGIONS.  RADAR TRENDS HAVE SHOWN THE SNOW SHOWERS PIVOTING 
TO THE NORTH...BUT THEY NOW SEEM TO HAVE STOPPED THEIR NORTHWARD 
PROGRESSION.  WILL KEEP SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS IN THE FCST FOR THE 
NRN TWO THIRDS OF THE CWFA THIS EVENING WHILE THE FAR SOUTH WILL 
REMAIN DRY.  VISIBILITIES WITH THE SNOW SHOWERS HAVE BEEN RANGING 
FROM 1 1/2 MILES TO 5 MILES.  THUS...I AM NOT EXPECTING ANY 
SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS.  WILL JUST MENTION LITTLE ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED.

FOR THE REMAINDER OF TONIGHT AND INTO SATURDAY...A WEAK ARCTIC 
FRONT...NOW LOCATED FROM NRN MICHIGAN SW INTO SRN WI AND SRN IOWA 
WILL MOVE SE INTO NORTHWEST OHIO BY MORNING.  ASSOCD S/WV ENERGY 
WITH THE ARCTIC FRONT...LOCATED OVER SOUTH DAKOTA ATTM...WILL ALSO 
DIVE SE INTO THE OHIO VLY BY 12Z SATURDAY.  MODELS...ESPECIALLY THE 
MESOETA...SHOW DEEP LIFT FROM THE 700 MB TO 300 MB LEVELS VIA Q 
VECTOR ANALYSIS FROM LATE TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING.  
ALSO...DEEP MOISTURE DEVELOPS ACRS THE REGION...ESPECIALLY ACRS THE 
SOUTH.  THE STRONGEST LIFT IS PROGGED NEAR AND SOUTH OF THE OHIO 
RIVER WITH WEAKER LIFT AS ONE MOVES NORTH.  WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL 
BRING A CHANCE OF SNOW TO ALL LOCATIONS LATE TONIGHT AND AGAIN ON 
SATURDAY.  WILL MENTION AN INCH OR LESS OF ACCUMULATION ACRS SRN 
ZONES WITH LITTLE ACCUMULATION EXPECTED ACRS THE NORTH.  AREAS OF 
SNOW WILL TAPER OFF TO SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS BY AFTERNOON AS CAA 
AND A SHALLOW UNSTABLE SOUNDING TAKE OVER.

BY SATURDAY NIGHT...LOW LEVELS BEGIN TO DRY OUT.  WILL ONLY KEEP 
SOME EVENING FLURRIES IN THE NORTH...OTHERWISE PARTLY CLOUDY 
CONDITIONS SHOULD SUFFICE.

ON SUNDAY...AVN/MESOETA SHOW CONTINUED DRYING IN THE LOW LEVELS.  
WILL GO MOSTLY SUNNY...EXCEPT ACRS THE FAR NORTH WHERE SOME MOISTURE 
OFF OF LAKE MICHIGAN MAY ALLOW FOR CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT.

ONLY TWEAKED MOS GUIDANCE VALUES UPWARD FOR TONIGHT...AND THEN 
PRETTY MUCH USED A SPLIT BETWEEN THE MOS/MAV GUIDANCE (WHICH FALLS 
IN LINE WITH 2 METER SFC MESOETA TEMPS).

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 281509
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1005 AM EST FRI DEC 28 2001

ENUF LLVL CONVERGENCE/WAA AND SHALLOW INSTABILITY THIS MORNING 
TO DRIVE SOME PRETTY IMPRESSIVE SHSN...WITH OBS INDCIATING VSBYS 
BRIEFLY 1/2SM OR LESS NEAR AND NORTH OF I-70.  ADDITIONALLY...LARGER 
SCALE FORCING FOR LIFT IN THE MID/UPPER LVLS WAS INCREASING ACRS THE 
RGN THIS MORNING IN ADVANCE OF NEXT SHORT WAVE TO PIVOT THRU.  VIRGA 
HAD EXPANDED AND LOWERED ACRS IN/SW OH SINCE 12Z...AND RECENTLY THE 
-SN WAS REACHING THE GROUND.  THE SNOW WAS REACHING THE GROUND AS A 
FAIRLY SUBSTANTIAL DRY LAYER...BETWEEN 750-450 MB ON THE 12Z ILN 
SNDG...IS SLOWLY BEING OVERCOME.  LIFT PROGGED TO GRADUALLY INCRS BY 
LATE AFTN...SO AM INCLINED TO INCRS ALL OF THE NORTHERN PART OF THE 
CWFA(DEEPEST MSTR) TO LIKELY POPS.  WL KEEP SOUTHERN SXNS IN THE CHC 
RANGE...BUT WORD AS AREAS OF LIGHT SNOW AS OPPOSED TO CHC.  
ACCUMULATIONS LESS THAN AN INCH STILL LKS RSNBL IN THE NORTH.  REST 
OF PREV FCSTS APPEARS IN GREAT SHAPE...AND XPCT NO ADDNL CHGS.  

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

255 AM EST THU DEC 27 2001

BLOCKY PATTERN CONTS WITH E-W ELONGATED UPR LO FM GRTLKS THRU NEW 
ENGLAND WITH A SERIES OF VORT LOBES PIVOTING THRU THE OH VLY
SETTING OFF PERIODS OF SNW SHWRS. INITIAL S/WV AXIS OVR WI TO
DROP SE THRU OH TDA. AREA OF SNW SHWRS AND FLRYS FM IL THRU WRN
OH AHD OF THIS FEATURE. LO LVL LAPSE RATES STEEPEN THIS AFTN AND
LO LVL CVNGRC INCRS AHD OF TROF AXIS WHICH PIVOTS INTO OH. THIS
SHUD WORK TO CONT SCTD SNW SHWRS. DEEPEST MSTR AND FORCING ACRS
THE CNTRL AND NRN TDA. THEREFORE WL TREND POPS FM LKLY IN NRN 
MIAMI VLY TO CHC S. XPCT SNW ACCUM TO BE LESS THAN ONE INCH.
TEMP WISE...DO NOT XPCT TOO MUCH DIURNAL RANGE TDA DUE TO 
CLD CVR. WL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FM GUID VALUES.

WL CONT CHC OF SNW SHWRS THIS EVE WITH SHEARED OUT VORT PROVIDING
PVA. THESE SNW SHWRS SHUD DIMINISH TO FLURRIES OVRNGT. HV GONE WITH
A BLEND OF MAV/FWC TEMPS OVRNGT.

NXT SIGNIFICANT S/WV TO ROTATE FM NRN PLNS THRU OH VLY SAT NGT/SUN.
THIS VORT CENTER STRONGER THAN TDA/S AND COULD PROVIDE SOME MINOR
SNW ACCUMULATION ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE I-70 CORRIDOR. SNW ACCUM 
ARND ONE INCH LOOKS PSBL FM THESE SNW SHWRS SAT. WL CONT HIGH CHC
POPS SAT. TEMP WISE PREFER READINGS A LTL COOLER THAN FWC GUID FOR
HI/S IN CAA PTN. 

WL TREND SAT NGT/S LO TEMPS COLDER TOWARD MAV GUID WITH FRESH SNW
AND -17 DEG H8 POOL SETTLING INTO RGN. SCATTERED FLURRIES LOOK 
TO DIMINISH SUN WITH BEST MSTR LIFTING NE.
        
HI PRES LOOKS TO NOSE INTO OH VLY MON/TUE PROVIDING DRIER AND COLDER 
CONDITIONS. 

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

FXUS61 KILN 271922
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EST THU DEC 27 2001

A SHORTWAVE A DAY FOR THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  MODELS AGREE THAT 
SHORTWAVES WILL ROTATE AROUND THE POLAR VORTICES IN EASTERN 
CANADA...BUT VARY A LITTLE ON THE STRENGTH AND PATH.

MODELS AGREE PRETTY WELL ON VORT LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY 
NIGHT...BRINGING IT ACROSS SOUTHERN OHIO.  JUST LIKE TODAY...THE 
DEEP MOISTURE IS LACKING RIGHT ALONG THE PATH OF THE SYSTEM...WITH 
BETTER MOISTURE TO THE NORTH.  WILL CARRY 50 POPS FROM DAY-CMH 
NORTH...WITH 40 POPS SOUTH...DUE TO THE SET UP OF THE MOISTURE.  
LEMO WOULD SUGGESTION AROUND AN INCH...BUT WILL CARRY LESS THAN AN 
INCH DUE TO LACK OF MOISTURE.

NEXT VORT SWINGS AROUND BETWEEN 12Z-18Z ON SATURDAY.  THE ETA IS A 
LITTLE QUICKER THAN THE AVN WITH THIS VORT...WITH THE AVN A SMIDGE 
FARTHER SOUTH.  ONCE AGAIN DEEP MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE LACKING.  
DONT LIKE THE NGM POPS WHICH ARE IN THE 10S AND 20S...BUT WILL KEEP 
THINGS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY FOR NOW.  SIMILAR POP SETUP AS FOR 
FRIDAY.

AS FOR TONIGHT...FA WILL START OF IN BETWEEN SYSTEMS...BUT BY 
MORNING THE CLOUDS SHOULD HAVE RETURNED.  NW COUNTIES GET INTO SOME 
PVA...SO WILL KEEP A MENTION OF POPS LATE THERE.  

BOTH MOS AND MYSELF HAVE BEEN TOO COLD THE LAST COUPLE OF NIGHTS.  
LATEST MOS LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL GO WITH IT TONIGHT.  WILL STAY 
BELOW TOMORROW WITH THE SNOW COMING THROUGH...THE SAME FOR SATURDAY.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES




NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1010 AM EST THU DEC 27 2001

ILN SOUNDING DEPICTS CONSIDERABLE MSTR THIS MORNING...ESPLY BLO 
500MB.   PREV GUID AND REMOTE SENSING DATA HWVR INDC A SHARP NE-SW 
GRADIENT IN THIS DEEPER MSTR...SO THE BETTER FORCING FOR LIFT OVER 
SOUTHERN SXNS OF THE AREA IS DECOUPLED FROM THE MOST EFFICENT RGN 
FOR PCPN.  AT ANY RATE...-SN WAS WIDESPREAD THIS MORNING IN THE OHIO 
PORTION OF OUR CWFA...IN ASSN WITH WAA AND SOME WEAK DPVA.  VSBYS 
OCNLY BLO 2 MILES...AND SNOW WAS LIGHTLY ACCUMLATING TO THE NORTH 
AND EAST OF CVG.  THINK MUCH OF THIS ACTIVITY WL TAPER OFF THIS AFTN 
AS FORCING WEAKENS...AND SW FLOW ADVECTS DRIER AIR ACRS THE RGN.  
LATE MORNING ZONE UPDATE WL TAPER ACTITY TO FLURRIES/LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS ALL ZONES.  WL MENTION ADDNL ACCUMS <1 INCH N-NE...AND 
LITTLE TO NO SW.  PREV TEMP FCSTS LK RSNBL.

.ILN...NONE.

LO LVL CVNGRC INCRS AHD OF TROF AXIS WHICH PIVOTS INTO OH. THIS
SHUD WORK TO CONT SCTD SNW SHWRS. DEEPEST MSTR AND FORCING ACRS
THE CNTRL AND NRN TDA. THEREFORE WL TREND POPS FM LKLY IN NRN 
MIAMI VLY TO CHC S. XPCT SNW ACCUM TO BE LESS THAN ONE INCH.
TEMP WISE...DO NOT XPCT TOO MUCH DIURNAL RANGE TDA DUE TO 
CLD CVR. WL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FM GUID VALUES.

WL CONT CHC OF SNW SHWRS THIS EVE WITH SHEARED OUT VORT PROVIDING
PVA. THESE SNW SHWRS SHUD DIMINISH TO FLURRIES OVRNGT. HV GONE WITH
A BLEND OF MAV/FWC TEMPS OVRNGT.

NXT SIGNIFICANT S/WV TO ROTATE FM NRN PLNS THRU OH VLY SAT NGT/SUN.
THIS VORT CENTER STRONGER THAN TDA/S AND COULD PROVIDE SOME MINOR
SNW ACCUMULATION ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE I-70 CORRIDOR. SNW ACCUM 
ARND ONE INCH LOOKS PSBL FM THESE SNW SHWRS SAT. WL CONT HIGH CHC
POPS SAT. TEMP WISE PREFER READINGS A LTL COOLER THAN FWC GUID FOR
HI/S IN CAA PTN. 

WL TREND SAT NGT/S LO TEMPS COLDER TOWARD MAV GUID WITH FRESH SNW
AND -17 DEG H8 POOL SETTLING INTO RGN. SCATTERED FLURRIES LOOK 
TO DIMINISH SUN WITH BEST MSTR LIFTING NE.
        
HI PRES LOOKS TO NOSE INTO OH VLY MON/TUE PROVIDING DRIER AND COLDER 
CONDITIONS. 

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL









FXUS61 KILN 270742
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EST THU DEC 27 2001

SERIES OF VORTS/WAVES CONTS AS UPR LOW SPINS NR HUDSON BAY. NEXT 
VORT SHOWS UP WELL ON WATER VAPOR MOVING ACROSS IA INTO IL. THIS IS 
TRIGGERING LIGHT SNOW/FLURRIES ACROSS IL/IND. WE WILL AGAIN SEE SOME 
ENHANCEMENT OF THE SNOW AS THE VORT DROPS INTO THE BASE OF THE TROF 
LATER THIS MORNING. AN INCH OR SO IS POSSIBLE ESP SOUTH CLOSER TO 
VORT TRACK. THINK CURRENT ZNS HAVE GOOD HANDLE ON THIS.  ALL BUT 
LLVLS DRY OUT IN WAKE OF VORT BY TONIGHT SO JUST THE USUAL 
FLURRIES/LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS. 

FRI A LITTLE TRICKY AS ANOTHER VORT SET TO DIVE ACROSS AREA. THIS 
TIME DYNAMICS A LITTLE BETTER WITH LFQ OF 130-140KT UPR JET ENHANCING 
LIFT. MSTR DEFINITELY MORE LACKING ON FRI WITH MAINLY LLVL. BUT WITH 
WAA AND TREND OF PAST FEW DAYS TO EEK A COUPLE OF TENTHS OUT OF 
SEEMINGLY NOTHING...WILL GO 50 POPS NORTH AND 40 SOUTH. COLDER AIR 
WILL MOVE IN BEHIND FRIDAYS TROF AND UPR LOW SHIFTING EAST. TEMPS 
COOL DOWN 5 TO 10 DEGS FROM FRI. 

WITH HIER LLVL THICKNESSES AND WARMER 850 TEMPS FRI...WILL WARM 
CURRENT FCST A CAT OR SO.

.ILN...NONE.

945 PM EST WED DEC 26 2001

HEAVIER SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE TO DIMINISH IN INTENSITY AS THEY MOVE 
EAST ACROSS THE ERN PORTION OF OUR FA. THIS WILL BE FOLLOWED BY MO 
CLOUDY CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT WITH SCATTERED LT SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES. 
WITH MO CLDY CONDITIONS...WILL OPEN UP A RANGE OF TEMPS ACROSS THE 
SRN PORTION OF OUR FA AS TEMPS MAY STRUGGLE TO DROP INTO THE MID 
TEENS ACROSS THIS ENTIRE AREA.

THE NEXT S/W WHICH WILL AFFECT OUR AREA CAN BE OBSERVED FROM THE 
LATEST SAT IMAGERY AS IT APPROACHES IA. THIS SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO 
MOVE RAPIDLY SEWARD AND WILL BRING THE NEXT THREAT OF SNOW TO THE 
SOUTHWEST PORTION OF OUR FA BY LATE TONIGHT/EARLY TOMORROW AM.

LATEST ZONE UPDATE ALREADY OUT.

.ILN...NONE.



FXUS61 KILN 261918
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 PM EST WED DEC 26 2001

500 MB LOW WILL REMAIN CUTOFF NORTH OF THE GREAT LAKES THROUGH THE 
FORECAST PERIOD.  NUMEROUS SMALL VORT MAX ROTATE THROUGH...AND AN 
OCCASIONAL SHORTWAVE SWINGS ACROSS THE FA TO KEEP EITHER FLURRIES OR 
SNOW SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

WEAK BOUNDARY IS CURRENTLY RUNNING FROM NORTHWEST OHIO BACK INTO 
EXTREME SOUTHERN ILLINOIS.  THE SNOW ACTIVITY HAS ENHANCED ON THE 
BOUNDARY THIS AFTERNOON.  THE BOUNDARY FINALLY MOVES EAST BETWEEN 0Z 
AND 6Z TONIGHT...BUT THEN STRONG VORT DIVES INTO THE BASE OF THE 
EASTERN U.S. TROF. TRACK OF LOW IS INTO KENTUCKY JUST SOUTH OF THE 
FA.  MEAN MOISTURE IS LACKING RIGHT ALONG THE TRACK OF THE LOW...BUT 
JUST TO THE NORTH IS BETTER MOISTURE.  LEMO TECHNIQUE GIVES A LITTLE 
OVER AN INCH ALONG THE PATH.  WILL FORECAST LESS THAN INCH INCH WITH 
LIKELY POPS IN THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE FA.  ALONG I-70...40 POPS 
AND NO ACCUMULATION WORDING...BUT EXPECT POSSIBLY A DUSTING.

BROAD NORTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES THURSDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE VORT. WITH 
GOOD LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE...WILL CONTINUE WITH SNOW SHOWER 
FORECAST.

ON FRIDAY...MODELS DIFFER ON STRENGTH AND TIMING OF CLIPPER.  ETA 
HAS A NICE COMPACT VORT THAT SWINGS ACROSS NW OHIO.  MEANWHILE AVN 
IS WEAKER AND MORE SHEARED WITH THIS VORT AS IS FOCUSES ON A 
SHORTWAVE ROUNDING THE RIDGE IN THE SOUTHERN STREAM.  TREND OF THE 
MODELS ON THE LAST COUPLE OF SYSTEMS HAS BEEN TO TREND SOUTH...SO 
WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY RIGHT NOW...BUT WILL PUSH THEN 
UP TO 50.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE CLOSE TO CURRENT NUMBERS.  MAYBE
A TWEAK HERE OR THERE.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

BAND OF STRATOCU AND -SHSN AFFECTING MOST OF THE NW 2/3 OF THE CWFA 
THIS MORNING...WITH A FAIR AMNT OF SUNSHINE LINGERING OVER THE SE 
AND FAR NW.  THE CLOUDS AND LIGHT PCPN ARE IN ASSOCIATION WITH A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE...AND AN ASSOCIATED SFC BNDRY WHICH EXTENDED FROM EAST OF 
AOH TO NR BMG AT 15Z.  COMBINATION OF WEAK LIFT ACRS THE AREA...AND 
THE DIURNAL CONVECTIVE PROCESS...SHUD KEEP CLDS FAIRLY WIDESPREAD 
AND MAINTAIN THE CHC FOR FLURRIES ALL DAY.  WL NEED TO UPDATE TIMING 
OF CLOUDS/-SHSN OVER THE NW/SE...OTHW ONLY MINOR TEMP TWEAKS ARE IN 
ORDER.  

.ILN...NONE.

MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN HOLDING THE STACKED LOW

PIVOTING TO MORE N-S ORIENTATION AND IS KEEPING CLOUDS AND FLURRIES 
OUT OF MOST OF CWFA. BUT THE CLOUDS SHOULD REDEVELOP AFTER SUNRISE 
INVOF TROF SO WILL MENTION MORNING SUN THEN BECOMING MOCLDY. WILL 
ALSO BACK OF ON SNOW WORDING TO FLURRIES MOST AREAS. 

DEEPER MOISTURE PROGGED TO OVERSPREAD AREA AS NEXT MORE POTENT S/W 
APPROACHES. SMALL POP SHSN FOR WED NITE THEN BETTER CHC THU AS 
VORT/WEAKENING SFC TROF SWING THRU IN THE AFTN. WITH VORT SET TO 
MOVE NR OH RIVER...WILL GO HIER POPS IN THE SOUTH BUT ALL IN CHC 
CAT. IF PERFECT PROG...COULD SEE AROUND AN INCH. 

ANOTHER VORT MOVES ACROSS FRI BUT IT LOOKS TO BE SHEARING OUT AND 
850 TEMPS WARM ABOVE -10C. WILL GO AGAIN WITH CHC SNOW EVERYWHERE. 
WILL KEEP FLURRIES IN THROUGH WEEKEND AS VORT PARADE CONTINUES.

GUID TEMPS ARE SIMILAR AND WILL STCK CLOSE.

905 PM EST TUE DEC 25 2001

BLOCKY PATTERN TO CONT WITH CUTOFF LO JUST N OF GRTLKS TO REMAIN
DOMINANT FEATURE WITH VORT LOBES ROTATING AROUND IT.

INTIAL VORT AXIS HS TAKEN CLDS AND FLRYS E OF CWA PLACING AREA
IN CLR SLOT. NXT VORT LOBE CNTRD OVR SRN LM TO PIVOT THRU WRN
OH LT TNGT/ERLY MON. BAND OF CLDS AND FLRYS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
FEATURE HV SPREAD EWD ACRS NRN IN THIS EVE. WL UPDATE FCST BRINGING
CLDS AND FLRYS BACK INTO NRN MIAMI...DAY AND CMH ZONES. TAIL OF 
THESE CLDS SHUD CLIP CVG ZONE SO WL ALSO INDICATE SOME CLDS HERE AND 
A PSBL FLURRY HERE. BASED ON INCRS IN CLDS WL MAKE MINOR UPWARD
ADJUSTMENT TO TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT.      
 
NXT VORT LOBE SWINGING INTO NRN WI TO DROP INTO MN TROF PSN
OVR OH MON AFTN. THIS SHUD CONT SCTD SNW SHWRS N AND FLURRIES S.

BEST ORGANIZED CHC FOR MEASUREABLE SNW DURG THE FORECAST LOOKS TO
BE ON THU. ALL MODELS DIG S/WV FM MID MS VLY INTO OH VLY THU AFTN.
MODIFIED LEMO TECHNIQUE INDICATES UP TO 1 INCH PSBL FM THIS SYS
WITH THE BEST PLACEMENT OVR AREAS NR OH RVR.

FXUS61 KILN 251939
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EST TUE DEC 25 2001

UPPER LOW WILL REMAIN CUTOFF THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH VORT 
LOBES ROTATING AROUND IT.

FIRST VORT TO WORRY ABOUT IS OVER ERN IA/WRN IL ATTM.  VSBYS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE VORT WHERE 2 TO 3 MILE IN SNOW.  THIS FEATURE IS 
AT THE 850 MB LEVEL...AND THE ETA HAD A NICE HANDLE ON IT AT 18Z.  
THE ETA SWINGS THE FEATURE INTO WESTERN OHIO AROUND 18Z...SPREADING 
SOME 850 RH IN THE FA.  THE VORT SHEARS NORTHEAST DURING THE 
DAY...BUT WITH 850 TEMPS BELOW -12C...SHOULD BE ABLE TO SQUEEZE OUT 
SOME FLURRIES OR SNOW SHOWERS.

AHEAD OF THE VORT TONIGHT...WINDS WILL BACK BRINGING IN DRIER AIR.  
SKIES SHOULD GO MOSTLY CLEAR.  NEW MOS NUMBERS CLOSE TO CURRENT 
FORECAST...SO LITTLE CHANGE ON LOWS TONIGHT.

ANOTHER SHOT OF CAA AFFECTS THE FA BEHIND THE INITIAL VORT.  WILL 
CONTINUE WITH MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

BEST ORGANIZED VORT OF FORECAST PERIOD AFFECTS THE FA THURSDAY.  AVN 
DIGS THE VORT RIGHT ACROSS CVG BETWEEN 12Z-18Z THURSDAY.  LEMO WOULD 
INDICATE AROUND 1.5 INCHES.  THE ETA IS FARTHER SOUTHWEST WITH THE 
VORT...TAKING IT OVER SDF.  THE NEW 18Z AVN IS A LITTLE FARTHER 
SOUTHWEST.  WAS THINKING ABOUT GOING LIKELY POPS...BUT WILL ONLY
INCREASE POPS TO 50 IN THE SOUTHWEST.

PREFER THE COOLER TEMPERATURES OF THE CURRENT FORECAST...COMPARED TO 
THE NEW MOS. 

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

ACRS CNTRL AND SRN OH. WL ALSO ADJUST TEMPS IN THE S UP A LTL DUE
TO ANTICIPATED CLDS.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL








FXUS61 KILN 242017
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EST MON DEC 24 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN FEATURES CUTOFF LOW NORTH OF LAKE HURON.  UPPER 
LOW WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEK...KEEPING THE OHIO VALLEY IN THE 
GRIPS OF A COLD REGIME.

SFC MAP ALSO SHOWS A LOW NEAR LAKE HURON...WITH ASSOCIATED CYCLONIC 
FLOW DOMINATING GREAT LAKES WX.  CYCLONIC FLOW IS KEEPING CLOUDS AND 
-SHSN FROM DAY TO CMH.  WEAK RIDGE EVIDENT FROM KENTUCKY TO WEST 
VIRGINIA IS GIVING THE SOUTHERN HALF OF ILN CWA MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.  

IN KEEPING WITH BLOCKED UPPER PATTERN...MODELS SHOW LITTLE CHANGE TO 
OUR WX THROUGH CHRISTMAS.  GREAT LAKES CYCLONE WILL KEEP MORE CLOUDS 
OVER OUR NORTH HALF...THOUGH MODELS INDICATE NOT QUITE AS MUCH H8 
MOISTURE AS TODAY.  

AFTER THAT...MODELS SHOW SHORT WAVE GENERATING A SFC FRONT THAT IS 
PROGGED TO APPROACH AND CROSS THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...WITH THE ETA 
SHOWING A STRONGER SYSTEM WITH BETTER CONVERGENCE. HOWEVER... 
MOISTURE WILL LIKELY BE LACKING...SO ILL LEAVE JUST FLURRIES FOR 
NOW.  PERHAPS LATER RUNS WILL SHOW A MOISTER TREND FOR THE 
SYSTEM...AND THEN WE MAY NEED TO ADD POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  
GENERALLY...THE WEST TO SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL KEEP LAKE 
EFFECT SNOW OVER MICHIGAN...NORTHERN INDIANA...AND NEW YORK (SEE 
BUFWSWBUF).

FWC GUIDANCE CAPTURES THE GENERAL COLD TREND.  WITH COLD AIRMASS TO 
BE REINFORCED TONIGHT THROUGH CHRISTMAS...ILL GO AROUND OR SLIGHTLY 
BELOW FWC.  FOR WEDNESDAY...ILL GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FWC AT CVG AS NGM 
PROBABLY HAS UNDERESTIMATED WARM ADVECTION IN SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD 
OF COLD FRONT.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EST MON DEC 24 2001

VORT MAX ACROSS NORTHERN OHIO THIS MORNING WILL SWING EAST INTO PA 
BY AFTERNOON.  WINDS REMAIN FROM THE WEST...KEEPING THE CLOUDS FROM 
ADVANCING SOUTHWARD.  MODIFIED ILN SOUNDING AND CURU IS SHOWING THAT 
THERE SHOULD BE CU DEVELOPMENT IN THE SOUTH LATE THIS MORNING INTO 
THIS AFTERNOON.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...ILN SOUNDING IS GIVING HIGHS OF 30 TO 31 IN 
THE SOUTH...SO WILL UP THE CVG ZONES TO AROUND 30.  AS FOR 
TEMPERATURES IN CENTRAL AND SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO...THEY HAVENT REALLY 
DROPPED THAT MUCH YET AND STILL ARE AROUND THE FORECASTED HIGHS.   
WILL GO WITH NEAR STEADY WORDING.  WILL ALSO NEED TO TIDYING UP THE 
BECOMING WORDING FOR CLOUDS. 

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

616 
FXUS61 KILN 240826
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
327 AM EST MON DEC 24 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES LOWS PRESSURE OVER EASTERN LAKE SUPERIOR 
WITH CYCLONIC FLOW OVER FA.  11-3.9 SATELLITE WINDOW SHOWS CLOUDS 
OVER FA.  BACK EDGE OF CLOUD SHIELD IS ENTERING CENTRAL INDIANA AND 
WILL BE INTO SOUTHWEST OHIO AROUND SUNSET.

MODELS ARE ALL PRETTY SIMILAR WITH KEEPING UPPER LOW OVER GREAT 
LAKES THROUGH THE WEEK.  THIS WILL KEEP FA COOL ALONG WITH AN 
OCCASIONAL SHOT OF FLURRIES OR SNOW SHOWERS.  WILL BE A BIT MORE 
OPTIMISTIC ON THE FORECAST FOR TODAY THROUGH CHRISTMAS (THAT IS 
UNLESS YOU WANTED SOME SNOW FOR CHRISTMAS)  LOW LEVEL CIRCULATION 
AROUND LOW OVER GREAT LAKES WILL KEEP BEST MOISTURE ACROSS NORTHERN 
HALF OF OHIO.  AS A RESULT WILL GO WITH MO CLOUDY MAINLY NORTH OF 
I-70 AND PARTLY CLOUDY OR BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH OF I-70.  CU 
RULES OF THE ETA ALSO SUPPORT THIS PLAN.  WILL THEN KEEP PARTLY 
CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLEAR FORECAST ACROSS FA FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY AS 
BEST MOISTURE IS KEPT JUST NORTH OF FA.  TUESDAY NIGHT WILL BRING 
SOME INCREASE IN CLOUDS AS LOBE OF UPPER LOW SWINGS TOWARDS FA.

FWC LOOKS GOOD WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.  

MISILN WILL BE OUT BEFORE 4 AM.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

LTST SFC ANLYS SHWG CDFNT PUSHG INTO ERN OH WITH JUST A FEW 
LINGERING -SHRA ACRS FAR ERN FA. DRY SLOT FINALLY WORKING INTO WRN 
PORTIONS OF FA WHR SKIES HAV PARTIALLY CLEARED. MEANWHILE...RADAR 
AND SFC OBS INDICTG SCT SHSN IN WRAP ARND ACRS ILN AND IND. VSBYS 
BACK ACRS IL OCNLY DRPG BLO 2 SM BUT MUCH OF THIS LOOKS TO BE 
DIURNALLY INDUCED. STILL THO...MSTR PROGD TO PUSH ACRS FA OVRNGT 
WITH SCNDRY VORT MAX PUSHG THRU. SHUD SEE INTENSITY OF SNOW DCRS 
WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HTG BUT WL STILL GO WITH SCT SHSN ACRS THE N 
AND A CHC OF FLURRIES S. 

DPR MSTR LIFTS OFF TO THE NE LATE TNGT WITH SOME SBSDNC DVLPG ACRS 
AREA ON MON. HOWEVER...MDLS HANGING ON TO HI LLVL RH AND WITH CONTG 
LLVL CYCLNC FLOW...WL HANG ON TO MSTLY CLDY SKIES OVR ALL BUT SW WHR 
WL INDICT PRTLY SUNNY. SIMILAR TREND THEN CONTS THRU WED WITH DPR 
MSTR RMNG TO OUR N. CUD SEE A FEW FLURRIES ACRS FAR NRN PORTIONS OF 
FA BUT WL GNRLY GO WITH A DRY FCST...RANGING SKY CONDS FM MSTLY CLDY 
NE TO PC SW. NEXT CHC FOR ANY PCPN LOOKS TO BE WED NGT INTO THUR 
WITH AVN SWINGING ANOTHER S/W DOWN ACRS THE AREA. 

WL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FM GUID TMPS IN THE SHORT TERM WITH HIGHS 
GNRLLY IN THE LOW TO MID 20S AND OVRNGT LOWS IN THE MID TEENS. XPCT 
SMALLEST DIURNAL RANGE IN THE NE WHR CLDS WL BE MORE PREVALENT.

FXUS61 KILN 231603
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1104 AM EST SUN DEC 23 2001

COLD FRONT IS CURRENTLY CROSSING OUR CWA NEARING ILN AT 16Z.  PRECIP 
IS EXITING WITH THE FRONT.  TEMPS HAVE ALREADY FALLEN INTO 30S AT 
DAY AND CVG BEHIND THE FRONT.  FRONT IS MOVING SLOWLY AS IT IS 
NEARLY PARALLEL WITH UPPER FLOW AND THERE IS A WAVE TO THE SOUTH 
WHICH MAY BE HELPING TO SLOW IT. FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH THE AREA BY 
21Z AS UPPER TROF AXIS PROGRESSES EASTWARD TOWARD OUR AREA.

ILL UPDATE TO ADJUST TEMPS AND REMOVE SHRA IN WEST...AND TO MENTION 
FALLING TEMPS EAST.  DRY SLOT TO THE WEST COULD POSE A PROBLEM WRT 
SKY CONDITION FCST...BUT CU SHOULD FORM SO MOSTLY CLOUDY WILL 
PROBABLY STILL WORK.   

.ILN...NONE.



FXUS61 KILN 230848
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
347 AM EST SUN DEC 23 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS COLD FRONT IN CENTRAL INDIANA.  KILN SHOWING 
THE BULK OF PRECIP ACROSS FA WITH A LINE OF SHOWERS OVER CENTRAL 
INDIANA (WHICH COINCIDES WITH COLD FRONT).

MODELS ARE IN RELATIVE AGREEMENT.  NGM HANGS UPPER LOW A BIT TO THE 
WEST COMPARED TO THE ETA/AVN.  HOWEVER SURFACE PATTERN IS NEARLY THE 
SAME.  MODELS DO VARY ON TIMING OF WAVE ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW.

RAIN WILL END FROM WEST TO EAST OVER FA THIS MORNING.  DRY SLOT WILL 
WORK IN FROM THE WEST.  SKIES ARE CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY CURRENTLY 
IN THE DRY SLOT.  THINK WITH SOME DAYTIME HEATING...RECENT RAINFALL 
AND COLDER AIR WORKING IN ALOFT THAT EXTENSIVE CU FIELD WILL FORM.  
SO WILL KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY WORDING.  WILL BACK OFF TO SOME DEGREE ON 
SNOW SHOWERS.  WILL HAVE MORE FLURRY WORDING AND EMPHASIZE SNOW 
SHOWERS WHEN THERE IS A BETTER THREAT.  THE THREAT IN GENERAL IS 
BETTER ACROSS THE NORTH.  WILL ALSO BE MORE OPTIMISTIC IN GENERAL 
ACROSS THE SOUTH WITH CLOUD COVER.  00Z RUN IN GENERAL IS A BIT 
DRIER AND TRAJECTORIES OFF THE LAKES KEEP BEST MOISTURES ACROSS 
NORTHERN OHIO.

FWC TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD.  THE ONLY REAL ADJUSTMENT WILL BE FOR 
MONDAY WHERE A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE MAV AND FWC SEEMS REASONABLE 
COMPARED WITH TEMPERATURE TECHNIQUES USING THE ETA.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY AFTER 4 AM. 

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
906 PM EST SAT DEC 22 2001

LTST WV IMGRY SHWS UPR LO OVR ERN SD WITH S/WV AXIS ROTATING ANRD
THE E SIDE OF THIS LO THRU THE MID MS VLY. PROFILER NETWORK SHWS 
40-45KT SWRLY JET DVLPG INTO LWR OH VLY. THIS COUPLED WITH FAVORABLE 
UPR DIV IN RR QUAD OF 115KT OF 300MB JET HS LED TO CONVECTION. THIS 
CONVECTION IS SPREADING NE ACRS CNTRL KY AND SRN IN. XPCT SHWRS
TO INCRS IN COVERAGE BY 06Z WITH AXIS OF FAVORABLE LO LVL CNVRGC
AND UPR DIV SHIFTING INTO SW OH. WL CONT CATAGORICAL POPS ACRS THE
ENTIRE FA OVRNGT. WL ADD MENT OF ISOLD THUNDER TO SW OH ZONE.
REMAINDER OF FCST LOOKS GOOD.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

FXUS61 KILN 222007
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EST SAT DEC 22 2001

SAT PIX STILL SHWG FAIR AMT OF SUN ACRS FA THIS AFTN. CLDS ON THE 
INCRS JUST TO OUR W AHD OF CDFNT SHOWN ON LTST SFC ANLYS STRETCHING 
FM CNTL IA THRU FAR WRN MO INTO SE OK. MDLS HAV COME INTO DECENT 
AGRMT...BRINGING FNT TO JUST W OF FA BY 12Z SUN MRNG AND THEN PUSHG 
IT ACRS AREA THRU MID AFTN. PCPN CRNTLY PRETTY SPOTTY OUT AHD OF FNT 
BUT DPR MSTR ON THE INCRS THRU THE OVRNGT HRS WITH 50+ KT 8H JET 
SETTING UP ACRS TN VLY. THIS SHUD PROVIDE FOR GOOD LLVL CONV TO DVLP 
ACRS AREA OVRNGT TNGT AND WL GO WITH HI POPS ACRS THE BOARD. WL 
INDCT DVLPG THIS EVNG IN THE W AND TWD MIDNIGHT IN THE E. 

MDLS SHWG DRY SLOT WORKING ACRS AREA BEHIND FNT LATE SUN MRNG AND 
INTO THE AFTN. WL HANG ON TO LIKELY POPS ERLY IN THE W AND THRU THE 
MRNG IN THE E BEFORE DRYING THINGS OUT. GOOD SHOT OF CAA SETS IN 
THRU THE AFTN WITH 8H TEMPS DRPG INTO THE -5 TO -10 DGR RANGE BY 
00Z. WL HV FALLING TMPS FOR THE W BUT JUST KP HIGH WORDING IN THE E 
WHR TMP DROP OFF SHUD HOLD OFF TIL A LTL LATER IN THE AFTN. SOME 
WRAP ARND MSTR BEGINS TO WORK INTO TO THE NW LATE AND TMPS LOOK COLD 
ENUF BY THEN FOR A FEW FLURRIES IN THE NW. 

A LTL DPR MSTR SLIDES ACRS FA SUN NGT ASCTD WITH A SECONDARY S/W AND 
WEAK 8H TROF FOR A CHANCE OF SNOW SHWS N/FLURRIES S. CYCLNC FLOW 
THEN PROGD TO CONT THRU MUCH OF THE XTNDD WITH A CONTD CHC FOR SNOW 
SHWRS/FLURRIES. WL TRY TO TIME PCPN BASED ON S/W ENERGY ROATING ARND 
LOW WITH BEST CHC RMNG ACRS NRN PORTIONS OF FA...CLOSER TO DPR 
MSTR...UPR LVL ENERGY AND ANY RESIDUAL LAKE EFFECT SNOW. 

AS FOR TMPS...WL GO A LTL WRMR THAN GUID TNGT AS WNDS SHUD STAY UP 
AND CLDS MOVING IN. WL STICK CLOSE TO GUID TMPS FOR HIGHS ON SUN 
WITH FALLING TMPS W. WL THEN GO A LTL WRMR THAN GUID FOR LOWS AND A 
LTL COOLER FOR HIGHS THRU RMNDR SHORT TERM WITH FAIR AMT OF CLDS 
XPCTD ACRS AREA.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

FXUS61 KILN 220841
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
940 PM EST FRI DEC 21 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES RIDGE TO THE EAST WITH DEEPENING LOW OVER 
UPPER UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES HIGH 
LEVEL CLOUDS STREAMING IN OVER FA.

00Z ETA STILL IS FASTER THAN AVN WITH PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT LATE 
TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  00Z UKMET CLOSER TO AVN SOLUTION.  DPROG/DT 
SHOWS RUN TO RUN THE ETA AND AVN ARE BOTH CONSISTENT WITH THERE 
RESPECTIVE POSITIONS.  WILL GO WITH SLOWER AVN BUT WILL NOT TOTALLY 
NEGLECT ETA TIMING.

WILL GO WITH THICKENING CLOUDS TODAY AS STORM SYSTEM APPROACHES.  
WILL HOLD OFF PRECIP UNTIL AFTER MID ACROSS FA.  BEST POPS WILL GO 
ACROSS THE SOUTH WITH BETTER UPWARD MOTION.  DRY SLOT WORKS THROUGH 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...1000 TO 850 THICKNESSES INDICATE BACK 
EDGE OF PRECIP MAY CHANGE OVER TO SNOW OR THERE MAY BE A FEW 
FLURRIES IN THE DRY SLOT.  SO WILL GO WITH SOME KIND OF CHANGE OVER 
WORDING ACROSS THE WEST.

UPPER LOW THEN PARKS ITSELF OVER GREAT LAKES WHICH WILL KEEP TEMPS 
BELOW NORMAL WITH THE THREAT OF LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES THROUGH 
THE REST OF FORECAST.

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD THROUGH THE FIRST 2 PERIODS.  WILL GO 2 TO 4 
DEGREES WARMER ON SUNDAY AS IT APPEARS THE COLD FRONT WILL BE A BIT 
SLOWER.  WILL ALSO GO WARMER SUNDAY NIGHT WITH EXPECTED CLOUD COVER 
AND FLOW OFF THE LAKES KEEPING TEMPS IN THE 20S.

MISILN WILL BE OUT BEFORE 4 AM WITH THE REAL PACKAGE SOON AFTER.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS MISSISSIPPI VALLEY H5 RIDGE BUILDING TOWARD 
ILN CWA.  RIDGE AXIS IS PROGGED TO CROSS OUR AREA ON SATURDAY BEFORE 
A DEEPENING TROF BEGINS ITS INFLUENCE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  

SFC MAP HAS HIGH PRESSURE FROM CENTRAL CANADA THROUGH THE OHIO 
VALLEY TO THE GULF OF MEXICO.  HIGH IS FCST TO MOVE EASTWARD TO THE 
EAST COAST BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  SOUTHERLY GRADIENT WILL TIGHTEN 
HERE SATURDAY AS DEVELOPING LOW MOVES TOWARD THE WESTERN GREAT 
LAKES.  LOW WILL THEN DRAW GULF MOISTURE IN HERE LATE SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY WITH A GOOD SHOT OF COLDER AIR FOLLOWING COLD FRONT LATE 
SUNDAY.

WITH HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE IN ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE SFC LOW 
ARRIVING TONIGHT AND STICKING AROUND SATURDAY...PARTLY CLOUDY/PARTLY 
SUNNY WILL STILL WORK.  WITH ETA COMING IN LINE WITH AVN...SHOWERS 
LIKELY LATE STILL SOUNDS GOOD FOR SATURDAY NIGHT.  ILL GO WITH 
SHOWERS LIKELY ALL ZONES FOR SUNDAY...IN LINE WITH THE AVNS SLOWER 
MOISTER SOLUTION.    

TEMPS:  FWC LOOKS A BIT CHILLY FOR TONIGHT SO ILL TREND TOWARD THE 
MAVS AND MESOETAS MID-UPPER 20S. FWC HAS CAUGHT UP WITH WARMING 
TREND ON SATURDAY...THOUGH IT MAY NOW BE A BIT TOO WARM WITH CLOUDS 
FILTERING INSOLATION SOME...SO ILL TREND TOWARD THE COOLER 
MAV/MESOETA.  FWC LOOKS CLOSE SATURDAY NIGHT AS TEMPS WILL STAY 
MILDER WITH CLOUDS AND BREEZY CONDITIONS.  SUNDAY WILL FEATURE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS WITH SHRA AROUND AND SOME COLD ADVECTION 
TAKING PLACE.  

.ILN...NONE.

SO WILL GO WITH A COMPROMISE.

12Z GUIDANCE.  WILL CUT A COUPLE DEGREES OF CVG TODAY.  OTHER THAN

FXUS61 KILN 200219
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 PM EST WED DEC 19 2001

AT 01Z...COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM FAR ERN OHIO...SOUTHWEST TO 
NEAR HTS AND JKL.  COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE MOVING EAST OVERNIGHT 
...ALLOWING WINDS TO RELAX SOMEWHAT FROM CURRENT WINDY CONDITIONS.
KILN RADAR SHOWS THAT ALL PCPN HAS ENDED.  LOOKING UPSTREAM NEAR 
IWX...ONLY WEAK RETURNS (8 TO 12 DBZ) WERE NOTED ON RADAR.  
THUS...PERHAPS A FLURRY MAY BRUSH THE FAR NRN CWFA...BUT THINK 
CHANCE IS PRETTY SLIM...SO WILL CONTINUE TO LEAVE OUT.  18Z MESOETA 
IS IN LINE WITH CURRENT FCST WHICH CLEARS OUT MOST OF THE SOUTHERN 
AND SOUTHWESTERN CWFA OVERNIGHT WITH CLOUDS LINGERING IN THE FAR 
NORTH.  TEMPS WILL DROP INTO THE MID AND UPPER 20S.

THE POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY WITH 50 PERCENT.  WILL GO WITH A 
SCATTERED WORDING TO MAKE IT SOUND LIKE THE SHOWERS MORE DEFINITE. 

AS FOR PRECIPITATION TYPE...WILL KEEP IT ALL RAIN TODAY.  1000-850MB 
1300 LINE TRIALS RIGHT ALONG THE BACK EDGE OF THE PCPN AND BESIDES 
THE BOUNDARY LAYER WILL BE WARM TOO MUCH FOR ANY SNOW TO GET THROUGH.
HOWEVER TONIGHT IN CENTRAL OHIO...THE COLUMN COOLS QUICKLY AND COULD 
SEE A SNOW FLAKE BEFORE THE PCPN ENDS EARLY.  ALTHOUGH WILL CARRY 
PCPN WORDING EARLY TONIGHT IN SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO...WILL KEPT IT ALL 
RAIN AS LOW LEVEL THICKNESS ARE TOO WARM.

NEW DATA SHOWING THE CLOUDS COULD CLEAR A LITTLE QUICKER THAN 
PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT...SO WILL GO WITH A BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR IN THE 
WEST.  WITH LESS CLOUDS WILL LOWER TEMPERATURES A CATEGORY TONIGHT.

FA GETS INTO A NW FLOW ALOFT AND WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY A NORTH WEST FLOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES A 
LITTLE MORE SEASONABLE.

ONCE AGAIN CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON TEMPERATURES...WITH 
EXCEPTION OF TONIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

LOWS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 AM EST SUN DEC 16 2001

THANKS TO IWX FOR COORD.

AM CONCERNED ABOUT TRACK OF THE LOW THROUGH FCST AREA TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. MODELS ARE COMING TOGETHER AND IT LOOKS LIKE A HEAVY RAINER 
BEGINNING TONIGHT INTO MONDAY. HOWEVER...MODELS ARE TRENDING TOWARDS 
PREVIOUS AVN SOLUTION...WHICH IS A BIT FURTHER SOUTHEAST WITH THE 
TRACK OF THE LOW. GUT FEELING IS THAT PREVIOUS RUNS OF THE AVN HAD 
THE SFC LOW TRACK A BIT FURTHER NW AND THAT THE BEST CHANCE FOR 
HEAVY RAIN WILL BE HERE. PRECIP EFFICIENCIES ARE ALSO NOTED THE BEST 
HERE OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...WITH AXIS OF BEST PWAT 1.5 STAYING OVER 
SRN CWA. 

WILL SPLIT THE MINOR DIFFERENCE IN THE MODELS AND LESSEN THE CHANCE 
OF RAIN IN THE EAST AND SOUTHEAST TODAY...AND EXPECT THE HEAVIEST 
RAINS TONIGHT IN THE NORTHWEST. AM RELUCTANT TO GO WITH A 2ND PERIOD 
WATCH AS AXIS OF HEAVY RAIN COULD TRACK FURTHER SOUTHEAST AND AFFECT 
CENTRAL PORTIONS OF CWA FROM SW-NE AS OPPOSED TO MAINLY THE NW. 
HOWEVER...HEAVY WORDING WILL BE NOTED FOR WESTERN CWA IN ZONES. 
CATEGORICAL POPS TONIGHT AND MONDAY EXPECTED FOR ENTIRE FCST 
AREA...AS ANY OF THE PROJECTED TRACKS OF THE LOW WOULD BRING A NICE 
SHOT OF RAIN WITH THE GULF WIDE OPEN. 

CURRENT FCST SEEMS TO HAVE THINGS WELL IN HAND...WILL TREND WARMER 
THAN GUIDANCE TONIGHT AND TOMORROW AS WARM SECTOR ENTERS CWA. 

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 AM EST SAT DEC 15 2001

THERMAL TROF SKIMMING OVER NERN CWA THIS MORNING SHOULD BE E OF FCST 
AREA BY 12Z AND CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST. WEAK TEMPERATURE INCREASE AT 
H9 (ONLY ABOUT A DEGREE FROM 18-0Z) IS INDICATIVE OF THE AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE THATS HANGING AROUND AT THIS LEVEL DURING THE DAY. H8 TEMP 
RISES QUITE A BIT MORE THROUGH SAME TIME FRAME (5 DEGREES) IN 
RESPONSE TO BUILDING THERMAL RIDGE. BY 12Z SUNDAY...THERMAL RIDGE IS 
WEST OF CWA RUNNING N-S AS SFC WAVE DEVELOPS AHEAD OF H5 TROF.

PROBLEM HERE IS THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE ADVECTION SHOWN AS INCREASED 
1000-500 RH OVERSPREADING OHIO SW-NE BY 0Z MON. AVN WANTS TO DEVELOP 
THIS AS A WAVE SETTLING OVER OHIO FOR ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE CENTER TO 
RIDE ALONG. OTHER MODELS INDICATE A MORE OPEN WAVE VS CUTOFF LOW... 
AND EXPECT TO TAKE A SPLIT BETWEEN THE MODELS AFTER SUNDAY. AM 
RELUCTANT TO CONTINUE THE FCST AS A STRONG CUTOFF LOW FROM THE AVN 
FOR MONDAY...BUT THE RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS UNCANNY. OTHER MODELS 
KEEP AN OPEN WAVE AND WOULD SEE RIDGING BUILD IN FROM THE NORTHWEST 
WHICH IS SHOWN BEST ON THE CANADIEN. PMDHMD HAS ONLY TOUCHED ON THIS 
THROUGH SUNDAY...BUT HAVE NOTED THAT A SLOWER SOLUTION WITH A MORE 
OPEN TROF WOULD BE PRUDENT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK AS STRONG RIDGE OVER 
THE EAST IS STILL DOMINANT. WILL SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE AND LEAN 
TOWARDS AN ETA/AVN COMPROMISE FOR MONDAY. CONFIDENCE DROPS OFF 
SIGNIFICANTLY AFTER THIS...SO NO CHANGES TO FCST AFTER MONDAY.

PROBLEM FOR TODAY WILL BE TEMPS WHICH RELY ON THE CLOUD COVER. ETA 
IS OPTIMISTIC ON CURU TODAY...AND A NUMBER OF SUCKER HOLES ARE 
SHOWING UP IN THE LLVL CLOUD DECK TO THE WEST JUST WEST OF THE SFC 
HI ALONG ILL/IN LINE. WILL EXPECT SOME OF THESE BREAKS OVER CWA 
TODAY...ESPECIALLY TO THE WEST. WILL SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN 
FWC AND MAV GUIDANCE WITH THE THINKING OF AN EARLIER BREAK IN CLOUD 
COVER AND LITTLE TO NO CU DEVELOPING IN THE OPEN PATCHES. ETA TEMPS 
LOOK MORE REALISTIC THAN NGM WHICH SUPPORTS TEMPS WARMER THAN FWC... 
ESPECIALLY WITH LESS CLOUDS. WILL ALSO LEAN TOWARDS WARMER AVN 
GUIDANCE TONIGHT...THIS IS IN LINE WITH CURRENT FCST. TEMPS ON 
SUNDAY SHOULD BE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE...AND CLOUDS SHOULD BE THE RULE 
OF THE DAY. THERMAL RIDGE SHOULD BRING INCREASING TEMPERATURES 
OVERNIGHT SUNDAY...AND FWC DOESNT NOTE THIS. WILL BE QUITE A BIT 
WARMER WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS OCCURRING EARLY. 

IN ALL...MINOR CHANGES EXPECTED TO FCST...NOTE INCREASING TEMPS SUN 
NIGHT AND WILL BUMP READINGS A LITTLE ON MONDAY AS WE SHOULD SPEND 
SOME TIME IN THE WARM SECTOR. WILL CUT BACK TO CHANCE POPS MON IN 
NORTHWEST BUT AM CONCERNED ABOUT POSSIBLE WRAP AROUND IF AVN 
SOLUTION WORKS. IF SYSTEMS SLOW DOWN DUE TO MEAN RIDGE TO THE 
EAST...WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS IN EARLY MON PM FOR EVERYONE BUT 
THE NORTHWEST WHERE RIDGE WOULD BUILD IN FIRST. 

.ILN...NONE.

300 PM FRI DEC 14 2001

FIRST CONCERN THIS AFTERNOON IS THE WIND ADVISORY ACRS THE ERN 
CWFA.  
SFC LOW PRESSURE NEAR MNN WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE OFF TO THE NORTHEAST 
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON AS WELL AS THE ATTACHED COLD 
FRONT (EXTENDING SOUTH FROM JUST EAST OF CMH AND JUST WEST OF HTS).  
THERE WILL BE ABOUT A TWO HOUR PERIOD OF VERY GUSTY WINDS...FOLLOWED 
BY A RAPID DECREASE IN THE WIND SPEED AS THE SFC LOW MOVES AWAY.  
MAY HOLD ZONES UNTIL 430 PM TO SEE HOW THE WINDS ARE DOING (I.E. MAY 
CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORY BEFORE 6 PM).  WE SHALL SEE.

OTHERWISE...SFC HIGH PRESSURE WILL WEDGE INTO THE REGION FROM THE 
WEST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY OVERNIGHT.  ALL MODELS ARE SHOWING (AND 
VISIBLE SATELLITE CONFIRMS) THAT LOW LEVEL MSTR WILL BE FOUND ACRS 
THE REGION OVERNIGHT.  THUS...MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES LOOK GOOD.  
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE LOWER AND MID 30S.

ON SATURDAY...AM A LITTLE CONCERNED THAT LOW LVL MSTR MAY STICK 
AROUND LONGER THAN PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT.  THUS...WILL ERROR ON THE 
SIDE OF CAUTION AND WILL ALLOW SKIES TO BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY INSTEAD 
OF MOSTLY SUNNY BY SATURDAY AFTN.  MIDNIGHT SHIFT SHOULD HAVE A 
BETTER HANDLE ON THIS.  WITH LOW CONFIDENCE OF CLOUD 
DISSIPATION...WILL GO WITH MOS VALUES FOR HIGHS.

ONCE AGAIN...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE OUT OF THE PLAIN STATES INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  THE MODELS HAVE NOT DONE WELL 
THIS WEEK IN DETERMINING SFC LOWS RIPPLING FROM THE SOUTHWEST ALONG 
THE COLD FRONTS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  CASE IN POINT IS THE MRF.  
TWO RUNS AGO...DEEP SFC LOW PRESSURE WAS LOCATED OVER WRN PA BY 12Z 
MON.  ONE RUN AGO...DEEP SFC LOW PRESSURE WAS LOCATED ACRS ERN 
WISCONSIN BY 12Z MON.  MOST CURRENT MRF RUN SHOWS A MUCH WEAKER SFC 
LOW RIPPLING INTO ERN KY BY 12Z MON.  NOW THE FRI 12Z AVN MODEL 
SHOWS A WEAK SFC LOW RIPPLING THROUGH CNTRL KENTUCKY BY 12Z MON.   
AM CONFIDENT THAT WARM...MOIST AIR WILL DEVELOP RAIN ACRS THE REGION 
BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...CONTINUING INTO MONDAY EVENING AS THE SFC LOW 
AND COLD FRONT TRAVERSE THROUGH THE REGION.  HOWEVER...GIVEN THE 
UNCERTAINTY OF THE SFC LOW POSITION...WILL SHOW ONLY SMALL DIURNAL 
CHANGES IN THE LOWS MONDAY MORNING AND THE HIGHS MONDAY AFTN AS ANY 
DEVIATION OF THE SFC LOW TO A MORE WESTERN TRACK WILL CAUSE TEMPS TO 
BE MUCH WARMER.

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL OHIO...SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO AND N
       CNTRL KY TIL 6 PM.

873 
FXUS61 KILN 130702
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
202 AM THU DEC 13 2001

LOOKS LIKE LOW LEVEL RH DOESNT GET SCOURED OUT FOR QUITE A WHILE. 
H7 LOOKS TO HAVE QUITE A PRONOUNCED DRY PUNCH...BUT RH VALUES 
BENEATH H8 DONT BUDGE THROUGH 60 HOURS. THOUGH A FEW BREAKS MAY BE 
EVIDENT OVER NRN PORTIONS OF CWA THIS EVENING...WILL GO WITH 
MOCLOUDY FCST VS THE PARTLY CLOUDY MENTIONED OVER THE NORTH.

FOR THE MID TERM...AVN AND CANADIEN MODEL BOTH IN AGREEMENT WITH 
LONGWAVE PATTERN THROUGH 12Z SUN. SFC FEATURES DIVERGE BY 0Z MON 
WHERE AVN WANTS TO SPIN UP STRONG LOW OVER THE GTLKS. WILL FAVOR THE 
CANADIEN HERE AS AVN SHOWS H5 LOW BOMBING OUT OVER LK MICH WITH 
STRONGLY AMPLIFIED RIDGE OVER WESTERN PLAINS CUTTING OFF SYSTEM FROM 
NRN PACIFIC ORIGINS. CANADIEN MODEL ALSO BUILDS IN A RIDGE...BUT IS 
QUITE LESS AMPLIFIED AND NEVER CUTS OFF H5 LOW HERE. THIS ALSO KEEPS 
THE SFC FEATURES LESS DRASTIC. SINCE MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT...AND RAIN LIKELY NOTED ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WILL 
NOT EXPECT TO MAKE MANY CHANGES TO FCST IN EXTENDED.

PLACEMENT OF SFC LOW IS UNRESOLVED FOR ANY OF THE MODELS AND A 
CONSENSUS WOULD PUT IT IN CENTRAL KY 12Z FRI. MAIN CENTER OF THE LOW 
RANGES ANYWHERE FROM SRN OH ON THE CANADIEN THROUGH S OF BNA ON THE 
NGM. WITH THE ELONGATED WARM FRONT AHEAD OF IT...MAJOR FEATURES ARE 
NOT IN THAT FAR APART.

AS FOR PRECIP IN THE SHORT TERM...WILL KEEP A DRIZZLE MENTION FOR 
CWA THIS MORNING. EXPECT THE HEAVIEST RAIN TONIGHT TO BE NEAR THE 
WARM FRONT AND JUST SKIM SE FCST AREA BY 12Z FRI. THINK THAT NRN 
PORTIONS OF FCST AREA SHOULD ONLY SEE SOME LIGHT RAIN AND SPRINKLES 
THROUGH THIS TIME. TIMING IN CURRENT FCST IS GOOD WITH LATE MENTION 
FOR MOST AREAS. POPS ON FRIDAY SHOULD BE TRICKIEST AS MODELS HAVE 
INDICATED BEST SHOT OF RAIN NW OF LOW TRACK UNDER WEAKENING H5 TROF. 
THIS DIFFERS FROM PREVIOUS RUNS WHERE WARM SECTOR AND SE FCST AREA 
HAD BEST SHOT OF RAIN. THOUGH AN ISOLATED STRIKE OR TWO IS EXPECTED 
DIRECTLY SE OF THE SFC LOW...WONT MENTION THUNDER IN ZONES AS UPPER 
SUPPORT IS DIMINISHING AND ACTUAL TRACK OF LOW IS STILL IN QUESTION.

TEMPERATURES ON FRIDAY WILL ALSO PROVIDE QUITE A CHALLENGE. 
NUMERICAL GUIDANCE SEEMS TOO LOW...AND THE STEADY NATURE OF TEMPS 
THAT DAY SHOULD ONLY BE NOTED IN FAR NW PART OF CWA. MESOETA TEMPS 
SHOULD BE CLOSER TO THE TRUTH FOR SW AND NE CWA...THOUGH THE WARM 
SECTOR LOOKS JUST TOO WARM ON THESE TEMPS AND MAY NOT EVEN GET THAT 
FAR NORTH. 

RIDGE BUILDS IN FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AND HIGH IS PROGGED TO BE 
IN GENERAL VISCINITY OF OHIO BY SATURDAY MORNING FOR A GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING NIGHT. WILL NOT STRAY FROM GUIDANCE AND GO 
WITH NEAR FREEZING TEMPS ACROSS FCST AREA. 

.ILN...NONE.

831 
FXUS61 KILN 122001
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM WED DEC 12 2001

COMPLICATED FCST FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS.

SATELLITE AND REGIONAL RADAR SHOWS CLOUDS AND WIDESPREAD SHOWER 
ACTIVITY PUSHING NORTHEAST FROM THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE 
MIDDLE OHIO VALLEY.  THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING 
HOURS.  ETA/AVN SIMILAR FOR TONIGHT IN DEVELOPING LOW LVL 
CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF 925 MB AND 850 MB JET NOSE.  THIS WILL BRING 
WIDESPREAD SHOWER ACTIVITY TO THE REGION.  THUS...WILL GO 100 POPS 
ALL LOCATIONS.  OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL BE A LITTLE TRICKY AS THEY MAY 
FALL OFF JUST A BIT BEFORE THEY STEADY OUT AND SLOWLY RISE TOWARD 
MORNING AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT (CURRENTLY ACRS THE PLAIN STATES).
SHOWERS WILL BEGIN TO TAPER LATE TONIGHT AS MAIN CONVERGENCE POCKET 
PASSES TO THE NORTHEAST.

ON THURSDAY...A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER IN THE SOUTH AND EASTERN 
CWFA...OTHERWISE SKIES SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY.  IT IS POSSIBLE 
THAT SOME SUNSHINE MAY WORK INTO THE WRN ZONES DURING THE AFTN.  
BUT...ATTM...IT IS HARD TO DETERMINE IF THIS DRIER SLOT WILL FILL 
IN RAPIDLY WITH LOW STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS.  THUS...WILL GO 
PESSIMISTIC ATTM (MOSTLY CLOUDY).  MESO ETA SFC TEMPS CONTINUE TO 
SHOW MUCH WARMER READINGS ACRS THE REGION.  THIS IS ALSO NOTED ON 
THE AVN GUIDANCE.  THE NGM MOS IS THE ONLY GUIDANCE THAT IS COLDER.  
BASED ON THE LAST FOUR RUNS...BELIEVE THERE IS SOME CREDENCE TO THE 
MESO ETA TRENDS AS WELL AS THE AVN GUIDANCE.  HENCE...WILL GO WARMER 
FOR HIGH TEMPS TOMORROW.

AFOREMENTION COLD FRONT BEGINS TO STALL OUT TO THE SE OF THE CWFA 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  MESO ETA DEVELOPS SFC LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE FRONT 
OVER THE LOWER MS VLY...PIVOTING IT NE INTO THE WEST VA/WRN VA AREA 
BY FRIDAY.  IT APPEARS THAT DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT (AROUND 295 K) 
WILL DEVELOP OVER THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY (AS 
PRESSURE CONDENSATION DEFICITS DROP BELOW 10 MB).  AS A 
RESULT...WILL BRING RAIN INTO THE SRN CWFA AROUND MIDNIGHT THURSDAY 
NIGHT...CONTINUING RAIN ACRS THE REGION ON FRIDAY.  SINCE I WENT 
WARMER WITH THURSDAY HIGHS AND WITH INCREASING CLOUDS THURSDAY 
NIGHT...WILL GO WARMER THAN MOS GUIDANCE FOR LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT.

WITH THE RAIN AND NORTHERLY FLOW ON FRIDAY...WILL KEEP TEMPS STEADY 
FROM THE OVERNIGHT LOWS.  SFC LOW PUSHES OFF EAST COAST FRIDAY 
EVENING AS SFC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  SKIES 
SHOULD CLEAR BY THEN...WITH A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY EXPECTED ON SATURDAY.

THE NEXT WEATHER MAKER WILL MOVE INTO THE PLAIN STATES ON 
SUNDAY...DRAWING COPIOUS GULF MSTR INTO THE REGION SUNDAY INTO 
MONDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
205 AM WED DEC 12 2001

DPROG/DT AT 36 HOURS SHOWS LITTLE IF ANY CHANGE ON AVN MODEL...AND 
SLIGHT CHANGES ON ETA. HAVE NOTICED THAT THE AVN PICKED UP ON A WEAK 
WAVE OVER THE PAC NW WITH PREVIOUS 2 RUNS WHERE ETA IS JUST NOW 
CATCHING UP ON THIS. LIKE THE FACT THAT THE MODELLERS POINTED OUT 
THE AVN CONSISTENCY. A WEAK NRN AND DISTINCT SRN S/W SPLITS THE SFC 
LOWS AND OTHER MODELS ARE STARTING TO REALIZE THAT THE S/W ISNT 
GOING TO RUN N-S FROM CANADA TO TX. THIS WOULD ALSO ENHANCE THE 
TRENDS FROM THE AVN. 

AS SFC LOW GETS PULLED NE AWAY FROM REMNANTS OF FRONT EXTENDING FROM 
OH VLY TO LOWER MS VLY...NEXT WAVE GETS SPUN UP OVER THE GULF STATES 
DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. NGM AND ETA ARE NOTABLY SLOWER WITH THIS 
FEATURE THAN THE AVN...THOUGH THE TRACK OF THE STRENGTHENING LOW 
REMAINS SIMILAR THROUGH ALL MODELS. THOUGH THE ETA COMES IN MUCH 
FURTHER SW WITH SFC LOW OVER THE GULF STATES...ITS RH AND QPF FIELDS 
MIMIC THE NGM AND AVN. THOUGH IT WONT AFFECT MUCH IN THE TIMING OF 
PRECIP OVER SERN CWA OVERNIGHT THURS...WILL STILL LEAN TOWARDS THE 
AVN.

AM HESITANT TO KEEP MENTION OF SHOWERS OVER ERN FA TODAY. WILL DROP 
DOWN TO THE POSSIBILITY OF SPRINKLES AND HAVE LATE WORDING HERE. WRN 
FCST AREA SHOULD SEE A BATCH OR TWO OF LIGHT RAIN FROM SOUTH TO 
NORTH AS IT BECOMES MORE WIDESPREAD BY THE EVENING. WILL STICK WITH 
PREVIOUS FORECAST AND RANGE FROM 40 POPS WEST AND SOUTHWEST AND 30 
WAPAKONETA AREA. TIMING IN CURRENT FCST IS GOOD TOO. STRONG THETA E 
ADVECTION GOING ON OVERNIGHT WED INTO THURS...BUT ELEVATED LIS 
DONT REALLY GO NEGATIVE UNTIL 12 AND 18Z THURS. WILL BREAK OUT FAR 
SOUTHWEST PORTION OF FCST AREA AND THROW THE POSSIBILITY OF A 
THUNDERSTORM HERE TOWARDS MORNING. WILL KEEP IT OUT OF CINCY METRO 
AREA HOWEVER. 

DRY PUNCH SHOULD ALLOW FOR A BREAK ON THURSDAY AS NEXT SYSTEM PUSHES 
IN FROM THE SOUTH. THIS LOW AFFECTS MAINLY SERN FCST AREA WITH THE 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT. CURRENT FCST DOESNT HAVE PRECIP 
MENTIONED AND WILL NOT JUMP OVER THE 60 HOUR ETA BUT INCLUDE POPS IN 
THE SOUTHEAST AND PASS ON THE POSSIBILITY TO THE NEXT SHIFT FOR AREA 
SOUTH OF OHIO RIVER. 

CURRENT TEMP SCHEME IN FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. 

.ILN...NONE.

UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S ACRS THE REGION BEFORE THEY SLOWLY FALL BACK 
INTO THE MID TO UPPER 50S LATE IN THE DAY.

STRATA CU DISSIPATING ACROSS THE EASTERN FA.

MODELS ARE ALL SIMILAR WITH THE 12Z RUN.  HOWEVER, DPROG/DT 
INDICATES SOME TRENDS.  THE AVN IS MOST CONSISTENT WITH EJECTING 
WAVE CURRENTLY OVER TEXAS INTO THE MID ATLANTIC/UPPER OHIO VALLEY.  
THE ETA IS TRENDING SLOWER AND A BIT FARTHER NORTH WITH THE PAST 
THREE RUNS.  WILL INTRODUCE A 30 POP FROM OWEN COUNTY UP INTO 
SOUTHEAST OHIO.  ETA SHOWING DESCENT PRECIPITATION EFFICIENCY ALONG 
WITH A WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENT/UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENT COUPLET.  IT 
MODELS CONTINUE TO TREND SLOWER AND FARTHER NORTH THE POP MAY NEED 
TO BE INCREASED WITH POPS SPREAD FARTHER NORTH.  HOWEVER THINK WITH 
MODEL TO MODEL CONSISTENCY THIS RUN THAT IT HAS ABOUT LOCKED ON TO A 
REASONABLE SOLUTION.

FWC TEMPS LOOK A BIT TOO WARM TONIGHT ESPECIALLY IN THE WEST WHERE 
TDS ARE IN THE MID TO UPPER 20S.  MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT LOOKS 
GOOD.  WILL GO A FEW DEGREES WARMER ON TUESDAY TO BE MORE IN LINE 
WITH CURRENT FORECAST AND MAV NUMBERS.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

DAY WITH 39.  FWC LOOKS A BIT COOL THROUGH THE REST OF THE FCST SO 
ILL ADJUST UPWARD ACCORDINGLY.

WEAK ISENTROPIC DOWNGLIDE PROGGED TO COMMENCE THIS MORNING 
THROUGHOUT THE 290-310K LAYER...COMPROMISING BASICALLY THE ENTIRE 
LWR ATMOS.  PLENTIFUL MSTR WL BE TRAPPED IN THE LLVLS HWVR...AND THE 
BIG FCST CHALLENGE TDY REVOLVES ARND HOW MUCH CLEARING WELL BE ABLE 
TO REALIZE IN AN ENVIRONMENT OF WEAK SUBSIDENCE AND MIXING.  SAT 
TRENDS HV SHOWN SOME RATHER SIZEABLE HOLES IN THE STRATO-CU...BUT TO 
THE WEST THESE HV QUICKLY FILLED IN WITH STRATUS AND SOME FOG.  FEEL 
WE WL SEE MOST OF THE HOLES FILL IN THIS MORNING PER TRENDS TO THE 
WEST...THEN SLOWLY IMPROVE DIURNALLY.  TEMPS CONTINUE TO RUN ABV THE 
FWC 3 HOURLIES...AND WITH AN HOUR OR 2 OF SUN TODAY THE MUCH WARMER 
MAV NUMBERS(57 VS 50 AT CVG) WOULD BE REALIZED.  FAN NUMBERS OFFER 
A NICE COMPROMISE AND MAINTAIN CONTINUITY...AND HV TRENDED CLOSE.

DPROG/DT OF THE PAST SEVERAL MODEL RUNS DEPICT A SUBSTANTIAL TREND 
TWRD A FURTHER NORTH/MORE AMPLIFIED/AND WET SOLN FOR THE CWFA.  WL 
INTRODUCE CHC POPS FAR SOUTH (N KY) LATE TNGT...OTHW PCLDY AND TEMPS 
IN LINE W/GUID.  NCEP FOLLOWING THE FURTHER NW TRACK OF THE 
AVN/NGM...AND GIVEN RECENT MODEL TRENDS AND A RATHER VIGOROUS 
APPEARANCE OF THE SYS ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS LKS RSNBL.  
BASICALLY HV CAT POPS OVER FAR SOUTHERN OHIO/SE INDIANA AND POINTS 
SOUTH...TAPERING TO CHC NORTH OF I-70.  WL OCNT TO CHC POPS SAT NGT 
AS MSTR WRAPS ARND INTENSIFYING SYS...AND SOME LAKE EFFECT COMES 
INTO PLAY.  A CHGOVER TO SHSN IS PSBL...BUT GIVEN THE EXTREMELY WARM 
ANTECEDENT CONDS TO NOT EXPECT ACCUMS.  GUID TEMPS REMAIN IN DECENT 
AGREMEENET...AND HV NOT STRYAED FAR.

.ILN...NONE.

POORLY DEFINED SFC PATTERN HAS A WEAK TROF IN WESTERN OHIO BETWEEN 
WEAK HIGHS OVER WEST VIRGINIA AND INDIANA.  RADAR SHOWS SHRA EXITING 
OUR CWA.  SATELLITE INDICATES CLEARING IN NORTHERN INDIANA.  SHORT

PROCESS...WITH LOW CLOUDS BULGING NORTH INTO ILLINOIS AND INDIANA.  

SHORT WAVE WILL RESULT IN PERSISTENT CLOUDS TONIGHT...WITH MESOETA 
SHOWING 850 MB RH LIFTING THROUGH AND ALLOWING DRYING BY LATE 
TONIGHT. ILL GO WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY...THEN PARTIAL CLEARING 
AROUND/AFTER MIDNIGHT.  ILL KEEP MOSTLY SUNNY FOR FRIDAY WITH 
LITTLE MOISTURE AROUND.  A SHOT OF MID LEVEL MOISTURE ARRIVING AHEAD 
OF SHORT WAVE AND AFFECTING MAINLY THE NORTH HALF OF OHIO WILL 
WARRANT PARTLY CLOUDY NORTH/MOSTLY CLEAR SOUTH FOR FRIDAY NIGHT.  

SATURDAYS OUTLOOK LOOKS IMPROVED FROM PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS. 
MODELS HAVE DELAYED THE ARRIVAL OF COLDEST AIR AND SIGNIFICANT LOW 
AND MID LEVEL MOISTURE UNTIL SATURDAY NIGHT.  THEREFORE ILL TAKE  
PRECIP OUT FOR SATURDAY EXCEPT IN WEST CENTRAL COUNTIES WHERE ILL 
KEEP A CHANCE OF SHRA LATE.  FOR SATURDAY NIGHT ILL GO WITH CHANCE 
OF RAIN SHOWERS CHANGING TO SNOW SHOWERS ALL ZONES.  

FWC HAS A HANDLE ON THE GENERAL COOLING TREND OVER THE NEXT TWO 
DAYS.  HOWEVER...FWC APPEARS A BIT COOL SO ILL ADJUST UPWARD TOWARD 
MESOETA AND MAV NUMBERS.

PRECIPITATION OVER NORTHWEST 2/3 OF FA WITH SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS 
OVER SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO AND NORTHEAST KENTUCKY.  88D IS NOT DOING 
WELL WITH PRECIPITATION ESTIMATES WITH SIGNIFICANT BRIGHT BANDING 
TAKING PLACE.  SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS DIFFUSE FRONT OVER FA WITH A 
MESO HIGH OVER SOUTHWEST OHIO.  FRONT WILL LIKELY PULL BACK NORTH AS 
SHORT WAVE EVIDENT ON WATER VAPOR OVER NORTHERN MISSOURI WORKS ITS 
WAY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  THIS WAVE WILL KEEP CLOUDS AROUND ALL DAY 
AND KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM CLIMBING TOO MUCH.  MAY LOWERS TEMPS A 
BIT BUT WILL WAIT FOR LATEST 12Z ETA AND LOOK AT 11 AM TEMPS BEFORE 
MAKING FINAL CALL.   

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EST THU DEC 6 2001

IT WILL BE A TRICKY FCST FOR THE NEXT 12 TO 24 HRS.

08Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT SLICING THROUGH OHIO ATTM.  
IT EXTENDED FROM WEST OF A CLE TO MFD TO DAY TO CVG LINE.

AVN/ETA TRENDS OVER THE LAST FEW RUNS HAVE THE COLD FRONT STALLING 
ALONG OR JUST SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER TODAY.  SHOWERS THIS MORNING 
WILL TAPER OFF ACRS THE NRN TIER OF THE CWFA BY NOON.  FOR THE SRN 
CWFA...THE STALLED OUT FRONT WILL BECOME A FOCUS FOR MORE SHOWER 
REDEVELOPMENT AS A S/WV PUSHING OUT INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS ACTS AS 
A CATALYST TO CAUSE WAA OVER THE STALLED BOUNDARY.  THUS...WILL KEEP 
OCCASIONAL SHOWER WORDING ACRS THE SOUTH.  TEMPS A TOUGH CALL 
BECAUSE OF CLOUD COVER/SHOWERS.  WILL STICK CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE.

FOR TONIGHT...AFOREMENTIONED STALLED BOUNDARY FINALLY GETS PUSHED 
OFF TO THE EAST BY THE S/WV ACRS THE CENTRAL PLAINS.  SOME SHOWERS 
WILL LINGER IN THE CVG/CMH/PMH REGIONS...FOLLOWED BY GRADUAL 
CLEARING.  

FRIDAY LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY AS ALL LEVELS DRY 
OUT AND WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION.

ANOTHER DIGGING S/WV FROM THE PAC NW WILL BRING MORE DECEMBER LIKE 
TEMPS TO THE REGION BY SATURDAY.  ATTM...IT LOOKS FAIRLY DRY WITH 
THIS SYSTEM (I. E. NOT A LOT OF PCPN BUT A LOT OF SC CLOUDS).  WILL 
CONTINUE SML CHC OF -SHRA/-SHSN POSSIBLY AS 1000-850 MB THICKNESS ON 
LATEST AVN HOVERS BETWEEN THE CRITICAL 1290 TO 1300 M LINES FOR 
RAIN/SNOW.

.ILN...NONE.

851 
FXUS61 KILN 051930
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EST WED DEC 5 2001

AMPLIFIED UPR AIR PTN WITH STG RDG OVR ERN U.S. AND MEAN TROF 
OVR THE W. INTIAL S/WV OVR THE CNTR/NRN PLNS TO LIFT NE THRU
UPR MS VLY AND WRN GRTLKS TNGT AND INTO SRN CAN THU. LO LVL 
JET ASSOCIATED WITH THIS S/WV WILL CONT TO ADVCT WRM AND MSTR 
AIR N AHD OF THIS SYS. LLJ TO LIFT ACRS GRTLKS LT TNGT INTO
THU WITH FAVORED AXIS OF LO LVL CNVRGC INTO WRN OH LT TNGT. 
MODEL TRENDS ARE SLOWER WITH ASSOCIATED CDFNT PASSAGE. THIS
IS REASONABLE WITH MAIN ENERGY PIVOTING THRU THE LAKES AND
UPR FLO REMAINING W-SWRLY. XPCT SFC CDFNT TO MOV TO NW OH BY
12Z THU AND ACRS OH DURG THE DAY. FAVORABLE PRECIP EFF AND
LO LVL CNVRGC INTO WRN OH LT TNGT. WL CONT CHC SHWRS AFTR
MIDNIGHT NRN MIAMI AND LATE UP TO I-71 CORRIDOR. WL KEEP 
S CNTRL OH DRY OVRNGT. S-SW WINDS STAY UP IN 10-15 MPH RANGE
TNGT. THIS COUPLED WITH INCREASING CLDS WL KEEP TEMPS MILD
OVRNGT. THERFORE...PREFER LOWS A LTL WRMR THAN GUID VALUES
OVRNGT. 

OH IN RR QUAD OF UPR JET THU PLACING THE AREA IN FAVORABLE UPR 
DIV AXIS. THIS COMBINED WITH LO LVL CNVRGC AND PE/S OF 1.2 TO 
1.3 INCHES. SFC DWPTS IN UPR 50S ADVCT NWD INTO OH VLY AHD OF THE
FNT. XPCT TO SEE WIDESPREAD SHWRS AND THEREFORE WL GO HIGHER THAN
GUID POPS WITH CATEGORICAL POPS XPCTD DURG THE DAY. A TSTM OR TWO 
IS PSBL ESPEACIALLY ACRS S CNTRL OH/NE KY WHERE FROPA TIMING IS MST 
FAVORABLE. HOWEVER INSTBY IS LIMITED AND WITH THE BEST JET DYNAMICS
PASSING TO THE N DO NOT XPCT MUCH IN THE WAY OF TSTM ACTVTY. WL
LIMIT MENT OF PSBL THUNDER TO PMH ZONE. LOOKING AT LO LVL THICKNESS
AND UPSTEAM TEMPS PREFER HIGHS ON THU A LTL WRMR THAN GUID VALUES.

IN THE WAKE OF THE FNT DRYING TO TAKE PLACE THU NGT. WL INDICATE
CLRG IN ALL BUT S CNTRL OH WHERE SOME CLDS MAY LINGER. GUID TEMPS
APPEAR CLOSE THU NGT.

AS UPR RDG BLDS OVR THE W A TROF IS CARVED OUT OVR THE PLNS INTO 
THE GRTLKS FRI. AVN IS FASTER AND MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH NXT S/WV 
WHICH IS EXPECTED TO AFFECT OH VLY/GRTLKS FRI NGT. WL FOLLOW FAVORED
AVN SOLN. IN BTWN SYS DURG THE DAY FRI...SHUD ALLOW FOR A FAIR AMT 
OF SUNSHINE. PREFER TEMPS CLOSER TO WRMR MAV GUID FRI. WL INTRODUCE 
A CHC OF SHWRS ACRS THE N FRI NGT AND CONT ACRS THE ENTIRE CWA SAT.
AS SECONDARY CDFNT PASSES THRU AREA AND CAA DVLPS RN SHWRS TO MIX 
WITH AND CHANGE TO SNW ON SAT.      


.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

FXUS61 KILN 051456
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
956 AM EST WED DEC 5 2001

HIGH PRESSURE PERSISTS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST CONUS TODAY...KEEPING 
THE OHIO VALLEY IN AN UNSEASONABLY WARM BREEZY SOUTHERLY FLOW.  
MID-LEVEL CLOUDS IN WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT ARE AFFECTING MAINLY OUR 
NORTHERN COUNTIES.  AC NEAR EVV WILL REACH CVG BY AFTERNOON...BUT 
OUR SOUTH CENTRAL COUNTIES SHOULD STAY MOSTLY SUNNY.  THEREFORE... 
ILL NEED TO UPDATE TO MOSTLY SUNNY THERE.  OTHERWISE FCST LOOKS 
GOOD WITH MORNING SOUNDING REAFFIRMING EXPECTED RECORD HIGH TEMPS. 

.ILN...NONE.


620 
FXUS61 KILN 050900
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
400 AM EST WED DEC 5 2001

A VERY WARM DAY IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY.

HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT OVER THE EASTERN UNITED 
STATES WILL BRING RECORD WARMTH TO THE REGION.  A WEAK S/WV IN THE 
SWLY FLOW ALOFT ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL BRING MID AND HIGH 
CLOUDS TO THE AREA (15K TO 25K).  USING ETA FORECAST SOUNDING AND 
ACCOUNTING FOR THESE CLOUDS...TEMPERATURES SHOULD STILL MAKE OR 
EXCEED RECORD TEMPERATURES.  THE ONLY THING THAT WOULD STOP THE 
RECORDS FROM BEING BROKEN IS IF THE CLOUDS BECOME TOO THICK.  I AM 
BANKING ON SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER...SO NEAR RECORD OR RECORD 
WORDING WILL BE USED IN THE ZONES TODAY.


ETA/AVN MODELS ARE FAIRLY SIMILAR WITH THE SENSIBLE WEATHER ELEMENTS 
THROUGH THE NEXT 36 HOURS...THEN THEY DIVERGE SOMEWHAT.   TWO 
S/WVS...ONE MOVING INTO THE SRN PLAINS AND THE OTHER INTO THE NRN 
PLAINS...WILL TEAM UP...BRINGING A COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION LATE 
TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  PCPN EFFICIENCIES ARE HIGH ENOUGH...COMBINED 
WITH LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND UPR LVL DIVERGE...TO PRODUCE SHOWERS 
ALONG AND BEHIND THE FRONT.  SHOWERS WILL APCH THE FAR NORTHWEST 
AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND THEN THEY WILL MAKE IT INTO THE SE CWFA DURING 
THE DAY THURSDAY.  OVERNIGHT LOWS TONIGHT IN THE LOWER AND MID 50S 
SHOULD BUDGE LITTLE ON THURSDAY.  SKIES WILL CLEAR GRADUALLY FROM NW 
TO SE ON THURSDAY.

THE ETA MODELS TENDS TO HANG THE COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY JUST SOUTH 
OF THE OHIO RIVER THURSDAY NIGHT WHILE THE AVN PUSHES THE FRONT A 
LITTLE FARTHER ALONG.  EITHER WAY...BELIEVE PCPN AND CLOUDS SHOULD 
GET FAR ENOUGH SOUTH OF THE REGION SO THAT A MOSTLY CLEAR FCST WILL 
BE EXPERIENCED BY ALL.

A DEVELOPING TROUGH OVER THE PLAIN STATES ON FRIDAY IS FCST TO MOVE 
INTO THE EASTERN UNITED STATES FOR THE WEEKEND.  THIS WILL BRING 
MUCH COLDER AIR TO THE REGION AND EVEN A CHANCE FOR SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
317 PM EST TUE DEC 4 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE EAST COAST WITH 
RELATIVELY STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW IN THE REGION.  SATELLITE IMAGERY 
INDICATES PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVER FA.

MODELS ARE SIMILAR WITH SURFACE PATTER THROUGH 48 TO 60 HOURS.  AT 
500 MB THE NGM IS A BIT FASTER.  ETA 36 HR DPROG/DT INDICATES A 
SLOWER AND DEEPER TREND WITH THE PREVIOUS RUN NOT TO FAR OFF FROM 
THIS RUN.  POSITION OF AVN 36 HR DPROG/DT IS SIMILAR BUT DEEPER WITH 
MORE RECENT RUNS.  RIDGE BUILDS IN OVERNIGHT AND WEDNESDAY IN FRONT 
OF NEXT TROF.  THIS WILL BRING RECORD OR NEAR RECORD TEMPERATURES.  
THE TROF WILL RAIN BEGINNING LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  
ETA IS RATHER STRONG WITH ITS SHORT WAVE.  BELIEVE IT WILL LIKELY BE 
WEAKER AS WITH THE OTHER MODELS.  WILL KEEP THE LIKELY WORDING FOR 
THURSDAY.

THE NEXT THREAT OF PRECIP WILL COME ON SATURDAY.  THINK THE CURRENT 
AVN AND 00Z MRF ARE A BIT TOO FAR NORTH AND PREFER A BIT FARTHER 
SOUTH SOLUTION WITH THE UKMET AND ECMWF.  WILL GO RAIN CHANGING TO 
SNOW ON SATURDAY AS REGIONS BEEN SO WARM LATELY.

FWC TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR TWEEKS. 

MISILN WILL BE OUR AROUND 345 PM.

.ILN...NONE.
