
FXUS61 KILN 041101
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
600 AM EST TUE DEC 4 2001

KILN RADAR HAS CHANGED TO PCPN MODE.  MIE OBSERVATION REPORTED 0.01 
MEASURABLE RAINFALL.  BASED ON THIS DATA...WILL CHANGE SPRINKLE 
FORECAST TO A 30 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS.

...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS MORNING SHOWS EXTENSIVE CLOUDINESS ACRS THE 
CWFA.  THIS WAS IN RESPONSE TO ISENTROPIC LIFT (WAA).  A COUPLE OF 
WEAK S/WVS ARE FCST TO MOVE ACRS THE REGION TODAY IN COMBINATION 
WITH THE WAA.  MOSAIC RADAR NOW BEGINNING TO SHOW SOME LIGHT RETURNS 
ACRS IL...IN...AND PARTS OF NRN KY.  DEEPER MSTR REMAINS OVER THE 
FAR WRN CWFA WITH DRIER LOW LEVELS EAST.  AT THIS POINT...WILL 
INTRODUCE SPRINKLES TO THE FCST AREA..AND WILL LET THE DAY SHIFT 
DETERMINE THE STRENGTH OF DEVELOPING ECHOES.  RIGHT NOW...IF 
MEASURABLE RAIN SHOULD OCCUR...IT WOULD FAVOR THE WRN CWFA.  TEMPS 
TODAY WILL BE CLOUD DEPENDENT.  MOS LOOKS VERY REASONABLE IN 
COMPARISON TO FCST SOUNDINGS...SO WILL GO WITH MOS TODAY..

FOR TONIGHT...PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ARE EXPECTED.  WITH A S/WV PUSHING 
INTO THE PLAINS FROM THE DESERT SW...MID AND HIGH LVL MSTR WILL 
PRODUCE CLOUDS THAT WILL ADVECT TOWARD THE REGION LATE TONIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING.  MEAN H5 LVL RIDGING WILL TAKE PLACE AHEAD OF THE 
S/WV...ALLOWING FOR HIGHER HEIGHTS AND INCREASING WAA.  TEMPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY WILL BE BALMY WITH HIGHS MEETING OR EXCEEDING RECORD 
VALUES.  MAX TEMPS AGAIN WILL BE DEPENDENT ON THE MID TO HIGH LVL 
CLOUDINESS.  THERE IS A HINT THAT SOME OF MID AND HIGH LVL 
CLOUDINESS MAY PIVOT NORTH OF THE SRN CWFA.  GIVEN FCST SOUNDINGS 
AND ACCOUNTING FOR CLOUDS...WILL STICK CLOSE TO OR GO SLIGHTLY 
HIGHER THAN MOS VALUES.

MODELS ARE STILL CONSISTENT IN BRINGING A COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION 
BY THURSDAY MORNING.  THE ONLY DIFFERENCE IN THE MODELS HAVE BEEN TO 
THE INTENSITY OF A SFC LOW PUSHING NORTHEAST INTO CANADA.  THIS IS 
BECAUSE THE MODELS HAVE SHOWN A TREND TOWARD A STRONGER S/WV MOVING 
IN FROM THE PAC NW INTO THE NRN PLAINS.  REGARDLESS...THIS SHOULD 
HAVE LITTLE IMPACT ON THE ANTICIPATED WX FOR OUR REGION.  WILL BRING 
LIKELY SHOWERS INTO THE NW WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH CHC POPS FOR CMH AND 
CVG.  COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION DURING THURSDAY MORNING.  
SHOWERS WILL BE LIKELY ACRS THE ENTIRE CWFA DURING THE 
MORNING...WITH DRYING CONDITIONS OCCURRING FROM NW TO SE THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS.

IT LOOKS LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLING DOWN FOR THE WEEKEND 
BASED ON LATEST AVN RUN.  

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

ACRS IL...IN...AND PARTS OF NRN KY.  DEEPER MSTR REMAINS OVER THE 
FAR WRN CWFA WITH DRIER LOW LEVELS EAST.  AT THIS POINT...WILL 
INTRODUCE SPRINKLES TO THE FCST AREA..AND WILL LET THE DAY SHIFT 
DETERMINE THE STRENGTH OF DEVELOPING ECHOES.  RIGHT NOW...IF 
MEASURABLE RAIN SHOULD OCCUR...IT WOULD FAVOR THE WRN CWFA.  TEMPS 
TODAY WILL BE CLOUD DEPENDENT.  MOS LOOKS VERY REASONABLE IN 
COMPARISON TO FCST SOUNDINGS...SO WILL GO WITH MOS TODAY..

FOR TONIGHT...PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ARE EXPECTED.  WITH A S/WV PUSHING 
INTO THE PLAINS FROM THE DESERT SW...MID AND HIGH LVL MSTR WILL 
PRODUCE CLOUDS THAT WILL ADVECT TOWARD THE REGION LATE TONIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING.  MEAN H5 LVL RIDGING WILL TAKE PLACE AHEAD OF THE 
S/WV...ALLOWING FOR HIGHER HEIGHTS AND INCREASING WAA.  TEMPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY WILL BE BALMY WITH HIGHS MEETING OR EXCEEDING RECORD 
VALUES.  MAX TEMPS AGAIN WILL BE DEPENDENT ON THE MID TO HIGH LVL 
CLOUDINESS.  THERE IS A HINT THAT SOME OF MID AND HIGH LVL 
CLOUDINESS MAY PIVOT NORTH OF THE SRN CWFA.  GIVEN FCST SOUNDINGS 
AND ACCOUNTING FOR CLOUDS...WILL STICK CLOSE TO OR GO SLIGHTLY 
HIGHER THAN MOS VALUES.

MODELS ARE STILL CONSISTENT IN BRINGING A COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION 
BY THURSDAY MORNING.  THE ONLY DIFFERENCE IN THE MODELS HAVE BEEN TO 
THE INTENSITY OF A SFC LOW PUSHING NORTHEAST INTO CANADA.  THIS IS 
BECAUSE THE MODELS HAVE SHOWN A TREND TOWARD A STRONGER S/WV MOVING 
IN FROM THE PAC NW INTO THE NRN PLAINS.  REGARDLESS...THIS SHOULD 
HAVE LITTLE IMPACT ON THE ANTICIPATED WX FOR OUR REGION.  WILL BRING 
LIKELY SHOWERS INTO THE NW WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH CHC POPS FOR CMH AND 
CVG.  COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION DURING THURSDAY MORNING.  
SHOWERS WILL BE LIKELY ACRS THE ENTIRE CWFA DURING THE 
MORNING...WITH DRYING CONDITIONS OCCURRING FROM NW TO SE THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS.

IT LOOKS LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLING DOWN FOR THE WEEKEND 
BASED ON LATEST AVN RUN.  

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

CATEGORY COOLER...ESPECIALLY IN OUTLYING AREAS. ASIDE FROM DROPPING 
TEMPERATURES A BIT FOR THE EAST...NO CHANGES EXPECTED.

FXUS61 KILN 031941
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EST MON DEC 3 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN FEATURES BROAD H5 HIGH CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
CONUS.  RIDGE AND ASSOC UNSEASONABLY WARM WEATHER WILL PERSIST FOR A 
COUPLE MORE DAYS UNTIL TROF BEGINS ITS INFLUENCE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  
OHIO VALLEY WILL STAY IN A WESTERLY TO WEST-SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH INCREASING CLOUDS BUT LITTLE IF ANY PRECIP.

SFC MAP HAS HIGH OVER VIRGINIA. HIGH IS PROGGED TO DROP SLOWLY SOUTH 
OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS.  AREA OF WARM ADVECTION/ISENTROPIC LIFT IS 
EVIDENT FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO OHIO.  THE MAIN RESULT OF 
THE ADVECTION AND LIFT HAS BEEN CLOUDS...MILD TEMPS AND A BIT OF 
LIGHT PRECIP OVER ARKANSAS.  THIS WEATHER REGIME WILL CONTINUE ITS 
INFLUENCE THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  THE RESULT FOR OUR AREA WILL BE AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPS AS AREA OF ISENTROPIC 
LIFT MOVES EAST.  WITH THE PATTERN NEARLY UNCHANGED...WEDNESDAYS 
WEATHER WILL BE SIMILAR TO TUESDAYS WITH MILD TEMPS AND SOME CLOUDS 
BUT NO SIGNIFICANT PRECIP.

NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE ON THURSDAY AS H5 RIDGE FINALLY BREAKS 
DOWN.  WITH PERSISTENT UPPER RIDGE IN PLACE...PROGRESS OF SFC COLD 
FRONT WILL LIKELY BE SLOWER THAN EARLIER MODEL RUNS HAD 
SUGGESTED...SO ILL PULL RAIN CHANCE WEDNESDAY NIGHT EXCEPT IN WEST 
CENTRAL OHIO WHERE ILL LEAVE 30% CHANCE LATE.

WITH HIGHER DEWPOINTS AND CLOUDS ADVECTING IN TONIGHT...FWC TEMPS 
LOOK A BIT COOL.  FWCS DAYTIME HIGHS LOOK ABOUT RIGHT FOR TUESDAY 
BUT ILL ADJUST THEM UP A BIT FOR WEDNESDAY TOWARD THE FAN AND 
MESOETA SKIN TEMPS.

.ILN...NONE.

SW. ELSEWHERE THE LOW LEVELS MIGHT BE TO DRY.

FORECAST...AFTER THAT...DIDNT STRAY TOO FAR FROM MOS.

SHORTWAVE INTO THE FA ON SATURDAY.  THE MRF IS A LITTLE QUICKER AND 
STRONGER THAN THE ECMWF.  WILL TREND TOWARD THE ECMWF SOLUTION...BUT 
WILL HAVE TO ADD MENTION OF SNOW.

JUST TO THE EAST OF FA.  SATELLITE ANALYSIS SHOWS A FEW BREAKS IN 
OVC ACROSS THE NORTHEAST HALF.  THESE SHOULD FILL IN QUICKLY AND 
ADVECT TO THE NORTH.  RADAR INDICATES RAIN EXITING TO THE EAST WITH 
A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS/SPRINKLES OVER FA.

CLOUD COVER...COLD AIR ADVECTION AND MINIMAL DAY-TIME HEATING WILL 
KEEP TEMPS NEARLY STEADY IN THE WEST AND STEADY IN THE EAST ONCE 
THEY DROP TO AROUND 50.  WILL KEEP WINDY WORDING GOING AS PLENTY OF 
GUSTS IN EXCESS OF 20 KTS OVER FA AND ACROSS INDIANA.

UPDATED EARLIER TO RESOLVE WESTERN WORDING AND TO ADD SPRINKLES.  
WILL UPDATE BETWEEN 10 AND 11 AM TO RESOLVE EASTERN WORDING.

.ILN...NONE.

CHANCES FOR THUNDER TONIGHT LOOK GREATLY DIMINISHED. EXPECT AN

MORNING) MENTION. 

AM CURRENTLY THINKING THAT FLOODING WONT BE MUCH OF A CONCERN 
WITHIN FCST AREA TONIGHT...BUT TRACK OF H5 LOW PRECLUDES ME FROM  
DROPPING THE WATCH. RADAR ESTIMATES ARE OVERDONE...BUT STEADY LIGHT 
RAIN WITH OCCASIONAL MODERATE SHOWERS SHOULD MAINTAIN CATEGORICAL 
POPS OVERNIGHT.

PREVIOUS PACKAGE HAD PREVAILING SOUTH WIND 10 TO 20 IN WRN 
ZONES...WILL WORD IT AS BECOMING FOR DAY AND CVG GROUP. TEMPS WILL 
BE ALL OVER THE BOARD TONIGHT...LOOKS LIKE MESOETA HAS A GOOD HANDLE 
ON WHAT TEMPS ARE DOING WITH CURRENT READINGS AND WILL EXTRAPOLATE 
FOR OVERNIGHT TEMPS. THIS LEADS ME TO A SHARP DECREASE TOWARDS 
MORNING FOR CVG GROUP...AND STEADY FOR REMAINDER OF FCST AREA.

355 PM EST FRI NOV 29 2001

ETA/AVN HAVE COME INTO FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE POWERFUL UPPER 
LOW EJECTING OUT OF THE LOWER MS VLY. A SFC WAVE IS DEVELOPING OVER 
SC INDIANA IS BACKING WINDS TO THE SE. THIS IS CAUSING SOME BREAKS 
IN THE CLDS IN THE SE PART OF CWFA WHERE THEY ARE GETTING 
DOWNSLOPING. THE SOUTHERLY WINDS ARE ALSO PUSHING THE NR 60 
TEMPS/DWPTS INTO THE NRN GRPS AND THIS SHOULD CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. IN 
THE SOUTH...WOULD EXPECT NEARLY STEADY TEMPS WHILE THE NRN GRPS WILL 
SEE TEMPS RISE OVERNIGHT. 

THE BAND OF STRATIFORM RAIN CURRENTLY NEAR THE OH RIVER WILL 
CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTH WITH THE WARM FRONT WHILE THE AREA OF HEAVIER 
RAIN IS MOVING INTO WRN KY. BASED ON CURRENT RADAR TRENDS AND MDL 
GUID...LOOKS LIKE HEAVIEST RAIN WILL STAY WEST OF US BUT COULD 
EASILY CLIP WRN FRINGE WHERE THEY RECEIVED SOAKING RAIN YDA. WILL 
KEEP CURRENT FFA AS IS ALTHOUGH THINK THE NRN MIAMI VLY DOES NOT 
HAVE THE BEST CHC OF FLOODING. BUT AM HESITANT TO DROP GOING WATCH 
IN LIGHT OF PWS 300 PERCENT OF NORMAL. WILL GO CAT POPS EVERYWHERE 
BUT WILL MENTION BEST CHC TOWARDS MIDNIGHT. 

UPR LOW SWINGS THROUGH FRI MORN AND WILL TAKE RAIN WITH IT. ETA 
HINTS AT SOME RAIN ON BACKSIDE...BUT WITH LOW HEADING NORTH...DO NOT 
THINK THE CHC IS WORTH MENTIONING. TEMPS AGAIN ARE TRICKY WITH THE 
COLD POOL GOING FROM SW TO NE AND THEN NEUTRAL TO WARM AIR ADV FOR 
THE AFTN. WILL MENTION STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING WEST AND EARLY HIGH 
EAST. 

RELATIVELY MILD CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE AS UPR FLOW REMAINS SW. 
GUID LOOKS REASONABLE AND WILL STICK CLOSE INTO WEEKEND.    

THANKS SDF/CLE/IWX/JKL FOR COORD.

.ILN...FLOOD WATCH CINCINNATI DAYTON AND WAPAKONETA GROUPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
254 AM EST THU NOV 29 2001

SPLIT FLOW IN UPPER ATMOSPHERE FEATURES VERY MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW 
OVER OHIO VALLEY WITH TROF MOVING THROUGH TEXAS.  AVN AND ETA IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT IN BRINGING TROF TO OHIO AT 12Z FRIDAY.  TROF IS THEN 
PROGGED TO MOVE QUICKLY TO NORTHERN NEW YORK BY 00Z SATURDAY LEAVING 
OUR AREA IN A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.

SFC MAP HAS INVERTED TROF EXTENDING FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY UP INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AHEAD OF THE AFOREMENTIONED UPPER 
TROF.  SFC TROF IS FCST TO INTENSIFY AND CLOSE OFF AS IT MOVES WEST 
OF HERE THROUGH INDIANA EARLY ON FRIDAY.  WARM FRONT ON THE 
NORTHEAST SIDE OF THE TROF IS MOVING TOWARD OUR AREA FROM CENTRAL 
KENTUCKY.  MODELS HAVE FRONT CROSSING OUR AREA EARLY TODAY...WITH 
THE ETA SLIGHTLY FASTER. 

RADAR SHOWS GOOD SHOT OF PRECIP MOVING UP THE OHIO VALLEY TO CVG 
JUST NORTH OF WARM FRONT AND AHEAD OF SHORT WAVE.  PRECIP WILL BE 
WIDESPREAD THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY SO ILL CONTINUE LIKELY TO 
CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SHRA ACROSS THE FA TODAY.  WITH MAIN TROF/VORT 
MAX AND SFC LOW MOVING UP HERE TONIGHT...NEAR 100 POPS LOOK GOOD FOR 
SHRA/TSRA.  ACTIVITY SHOULD END FAIRLY EARLY ON FRIDAY AS TROF 
ACCELERATES NORTHEAST.

WITH HEAVY RAIN ON THE WAY AND ALL SIGNS POINTING TO A PERSISTENT 
EVENT...AND WITH GROUND MOIST FROM PREVIOUS RAIN...WE ARE HOISTING 
FLOOD WATCH FOR CVG DAY AND WAPAKONETA GROUPS. 

AS FOR TEMPS...WITH WARM FRONT CROSSING AREA...ILL GO A DEGREE OR 
TWO ABOVE FWCS UPPER 50S TODAY.  WELL BE IN WARM SECTOR UNTIL 
AROUND 12Z FRIDAY BEFORE COLD ADVECTION TAKES OVER BEHIND THE SFC 
LOW.  THERES LOTS OF COLD AIR BEHIND THE LOW...SEE TEXAS...SO WE 
SHOULD COOL CONSIDERABLY ON FRIDAY TO BELOW FWC LEVELS. 

.ILN...FLOOD WATCH CINCINNATI DAYTON AND WAPAKONETA GROUPS.

FXUS61 KILN 281928
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
227 PM EST WED NOV 28 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES WARM FRONT ACROSS TN INTO SOUTHERN WV 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE STRETCHED ALONG THE NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY.  
TEMPERATURES NORTH OF THE WARM FRONT OVER FA ARE AROUND 40.  KILN 
SHOWING SOLID AREA OF PRECIPITATION OVER NORTHERN FA WITH A SOLID 
BAND EXTENDING ALONG I-71.  ALL AREAS MOVING NORTH.

MODELS ARE IN DESCENT AGREEMENT.  HOWEVER THERE ARE SUBTLE 
DIFFERENCES.  AVN IS A BIT FASTER AND DEEPER (48-60 HRS) THAN THE 
ETA/UKMET.  WILL CHOOSE THE ETA/UKMET.  THE UKMET HAS BEEN THE MOST 
CONSISTENT WITH THE TRACK AND TIMING SINCE MONDAY.  ETA HAS ALSO 
STUCK THE CLOSEST TO THIS SOLUTION SINCE IT INTRODUCED IT AT 60 
HOURS.

WARM FRONT WILL LIFT NORTH OVERNIGHT BRINGING RISING TEMPERATURES.  
WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL POPS OVERNIGHT WITH PERSISTENT LOW LEVEL JET 
KEEPING NOSING INTO FA.  UPPER LEVEL JET REMAINS FAVORABLE (RIGHT 
FRONT ENTRANCE REGION) FOR UPWARD MOTION THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING.  
LOW LEVEL JET ALSO REMAINS FAVORABLE FOR CONVERGENCE NEAR IN THE 
VICINITY OF THE FRONT.  THE BEST LIFT WILL OCCUR THURSDAY NIGHT AS 
THE WAVE FINALLY KICKS OUT NRN MEXICO/GULF OF MEXICO WITH A DUAL 
UPPER LEVEL JET.

CONCERNED ABOUT FLOODING POTENTIAL IN THE WEST TOMORROW AND ACROSS 
THE WHOLE FA THURSDAY NIGHT.  THE GULF IS WIDE OPEN PWS WILL BE 
AROUND 1.5 INCHES THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING.  STEERING WINDS STAY FROM 
THE SOUTHWEST WITH CONSISTENT LIFT OVER FA.  1-HR FFG IS GENERALLY 
AROUND AN INCH WITH 3-HR GENERALLY LESS THAN 2 INCHES.  WILL 
CONTINUE WITH ESF AND LET MID SHIFT EVALUATE THREAT FOR 
THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT.  WILL TRIM BACK THE MENTION OF THUNDER A 
BIT TONIGHT AND THURSDAY.

WILL MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS OF FWC TEMPS PER MAV AND MESOETA SURFACE 
TEMPS.  OVERNIGHT WILL GO COLDER AS TEMPS AT 00Z WILL NOT BE TO FWC 
LOWS THEN WARMING.  WARM SECTOR ON THURSDAY WILL BE WARMER.  OVERALL 
TEMPS WILL BE WARMER THURSDAY NIGHT BUT COLDER AIR WILL BE ON THE 
DOOR STEP AT 12Z FRIDAY SO WILL STICK PRETTY CLOSE.  THINK HIGHS 
FRIDAY WILL BE AROUND 12Z AND HIGHER THAN FWC.

MISILN WILL BE OUT AROUND 330 PM.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
415 AM EST WED NOV 28 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN HAS SPLIT FLOW WITH TROF FAR SOUTH INTO MEXICO.  
FLOW IS PICKING UP COPIOUS MOISTURE...SOME OF WHICH IS BOUND FOR THE 
OHIO VALLEY.  FIRST IN A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES WILL WORK IN 
CONJUNCTION WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT TO BRING PRECIP TO OUR CWA TODAY.
STRONGER SHORT WAVES WILL AFFECT THE AREA THURSDAY AND THURSDAY 
NIGHT.

07Z SFC MAP SHOWS WEAK RIDGING WORKING INTO OHIO BEHIND COLD 
FRONT...WITH A TROF REMAINING OVER THE GREAT LAKES.  INVERTED TROF 
DEVELOPING ALONG THE GULF COAST WILL LIFT NORTH TOWARD THE OHIO 
VALLEY TODAY. THEN THE TROF IS PROGGED TO STRENGTHEN INTO A CLOSED 
LOW ON THURSDAY AS IT RECEIVES UPPER SUPPORT FROM VIGOROUS SHORT 
WAVE.

MODEL DIFFERENCES ARE SIGNIFICANT WRT STRENGTH AND ORIENTATION OF 
SYSTEM AS IT MOVES NORTH ON THURSDAY.  AVN BRINGS MORE ENERGY AND 
PRECIP MORE QUICKLY INTO OUR AREA WHILE THE ETA KEEPS MOST OF THE 
ACTION FARTHER SOUTH WITH THE MAIN VORT CENTER.  OVERALL...THE AVN 
SOLUTION POINTS TO A WIDESPREAD HEAVY RAIN EVENT...WITH THE ETA 
SHOWING A MODERATE AMOUNT OF RAIN MAINLY OVER THE NORTHERN PART OF 
OUR CWA.

AT ANY RATE...ILL GO WITH HIGH POPS THROUGH THE FCST PERIOD AS PER 
CURRENT GUIDANCE.  DUE TO MODEL UNCERTAINTY I WONT TRY TO SPLIT 
HAIRS BY VARYING COVERAGE AND TIMING.  I WILL KEEP CHANCE TSRA AS 
ISENTROPIC LIFT/MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL BE STRONG.  

TEMP FCST IS TRICKY WITH TIMING OF SYSTEM CAUSING NON-DIURNAL 
TRENDS...E.G. WARM ADVECTION OCCURRING TONIGHT AND COLD ADVECTION 
DURING THE DAYTIME ON THURSDAY.  HAVING SAID THAT...FWC TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK TOO LOW SO ILL TREND WARMER TOWARD THE MAV AND MEX.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 272021
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 PM EST TUE NOV 27 2001

GET READY FOR A WET PERIOD.

SFC ANALYSIS AT 20Z DEPICTED A COLD FRONT SLICING THROUGH OHIO AND 
KENTUCKY.  THIS FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SAG TO THE SOUTHEAST 
OVERNIGHT.  A FEW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE FAR SE CWFA FOR 
THE REMAINDER OF THIS AFTERNOON...OTHERWISE A DRY PERIOD IS EXPECTED 
OVER MOST LOCATIONS FOR A GOOD PORTION OF THE NIGHT TIME HOURS.

ETA AND AVN ARE SIMILAR IN THE FRONTAL POSITIONS IN THE SHORT TERM 
(FROM NOW THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING)...BUT THEY SOMEWHAT DIVERGE ON A 
DEVELOPING SFC LOW AND ASSOCIATED UPR LEVEL LOW ON THURSDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY.  BOTTOM LINE IS THAT THE AVN MODEL HAS CONTINUED TO TREND TO 
A SLOWER SOLUTION WITH UPR LOW PIVOTING NE AT OF THE GULF COAST 
STATE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  AS A RESULT...WILL TREND TOWARD A 
SLOWER SOLUTION.

BEFORE THE BIG PUSH OF MOISTURE ARRIVES HERE LATE THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT....WARM...MOIST AIR WILL DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT AND 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD 
FRONT RETURNS NORTHWEST THROUGH THE REGION AS A WARM FRONT.  THERE 
WILL BE A HIGH PROBABILITY OF SHOWERS THROUGH THIS PERIOD WITH ONLY 
A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS.  PCPN WILL BECOME MORE SCATTERED 
IN NATURE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY ACROSS THE FAR SRN AND ERN CWFA AS 
THIS REGION WILL FIND ITSELF IN THE WARM SECTOR.

AS STATED BEFORE...WILL GO WITH THE SLOWER AVN SOLUTION FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY.  THUS...I HAVE LINGERED PCPN INTO FRIDAY.  

THE WEEKEND LOOKS RELATIVELY QUIET.  A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATE SATURDAY NIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY MORNING.  
THIS MAY BRING A FEW SPRINKLES OR A SHOWER.  WILL HOLD OFF NOW AND 
LEAVE FCST DRY...ONLY MENTIONING 20 POPS IN THE CCF.

WITH RECENT HEAVY RAINS LAST NIGHT AND ANTICIPATED RAINS THROUGH 
FRIDAY MORNING...WILL ISSUE A HYDROLOGIC OUTLOOK EMPHASIZING 
POSSIBLE RISES ON AREA CREEKS...RIVERS AND FLOODING PROBLEMS THAT 
MAY OCCUR DURING THE PERIOD.

.ILN...NONE.


HICKMAN

OVER MOST LOCATIONS FOR A GOOD PORTION OF THE NIGHT TIME HOURS.

ETA AND AVN ARE SIMILAR IN THE FRONTAL POSITIONS IN THE SHORT TERM 
(FROM NOW THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING)...BUT THEY SOMEWHAT DIVERGE ON A 
DEVELOPING SFC LOW AND ASSOCIATED UPR LEVEL LOW ON THURSDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY.  BOTTOM LINE IS THAT THE AVN MODEL HAS CONTINUED TO TREND TO 
A SLOWER SOLUTION WITH UPR LOW PIVOTING NE AT OF THE GULF COAST 
STATE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  AS A RESULT...WILL TREND TOWARD A 
SLOWER SOLUTION.

BEFORE THE BIG PUSH OF MOISTURE ARRIVES HERE LATE THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT....WARM...MOIST AIR WILL DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT AND 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD 
FRONT RETURNS NORTHWEST THROUGH THE REGION AS A WARM FRONT.  THERE 
WILL BE A HIGH PROBABILITY OF SHOWERS THROUGH THIS PERIOD WITH ONLY 
A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS.  PCPN WILL BECOME MORE SCATTERED 
IN NATURE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY ACROSS THE FAR SRN AND ERN CWFA AS 
THIS REGION WILL FIND ITSELF IN THE WARM SECTOR.

AS STATED BEFORE...WILL GO WITH THE SLOWER AVN SOLUTION FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY.  THUS...I HAVE LINGERED PCPN INTO FRIDAY.  

THE WEEKEND LOOKS RELATIVELY QUIET.  A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATE SATURDAY NIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY MORNING.  
THIS MAY BRING A FEW SPRINKLES OR A SHOWER.  WILL HOLD OFF NOW AND 
LEAVE FCST DRY...ONLY MENTIONING 20 POPS IN THE CCF.

WITH RECENT HEAVY RAINS LAST NIGHT AND ANTICIPATED RAINS THROUGH 
FRIDAY MORNING...WILL ISSUE A HYDROLOGIC OUTLOOK EMPHASIZING 
POSSIBLE RISES ON AREA CREEKS...RIVERS AND FLOODING PROBLEMS THAT 
MAY OCCUR DURING THE PERIOD.

.ILN...NONE.


HICKMAN

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1020 AM EST TUE NOV 27 2001

...UPDATE AROUND 1030 FOR SOUTH EASTERN GROUPS...

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES COLD FRONT ALONG THE OH/IN BORDER WITH 
DOUBLE BARREL SURFACE LOW OVER THE UPPER MS VLY.  IR IMAGERY SHOWING 
SOME COOLING TOPS TO OUR SOUTHWEST.  HOWEVER IN THE SAME VICINITY 
RADAR IMAGERY IS NOT SHOWING MUCH IN THE WAY OF RETURNS.  KILN 
SHOWING STRATIFORM AREA OF RAIN OVER SOUTHEAST FA.

UPDATED FORECAST AROUND 8 AM TO RESOLVE CURRENT TRENDS OF PRECIP 
ENDING FROM WEST TO EAST.  WILL LEAVE IN CHANCE POPS IN THE WEST AS 
COLD FRONT IN THE VICINITY WITH BETTER POPS TO THE EAST.  EXPECTED 
SOME CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON IN THE EAST/SOUTHEAST AS 
TEMPS WILL CLIMB INTO THE MID TO UPPER 60S.  AS A RESULT LEFT 
MENTION OF THUNDER IN THE SOUTHEAST WHERE ETA IS SHOWING BEST 
INSTABILITY.

WILL UPDATE AROUND 1030 AM TO CLEAN UP WORDING IN SOUTH CENTRAL AND 
THE REST OF THE PACKAGE.

.ILN...NONE.


FXUS61 KILN 270919
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
410 AM EST TUE NOV 27 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN HAS BROAD HIGH AMPLITUDE TROF WITH AXIS OVER THE 
HIGH PLAINS...WITH A SOUTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY.  AS ONE 
WOULD EXPECT WITH SUCH A LARGE WAVE...THIS TROF IS NOT GOING 
ANYWHERE TOO QUICK.  WITH THE BASE OF THE LONG WAVE FAR SOUTH...THE 
GULF IS OPEN FOR BUSINESS.  SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROUNDING THE TROF WILL 
HELP SQUEEZE OUT PLENTY OF PRECIP OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.  

COMPLEX SFC MAP HAS VIGOROUS LOW OVER IOWA AHEAD OF MAJOR SHORT WAVE 
WITH WARM FRONT EXTENDING THROUGH KENTUCKY NORTH OF LEX.  COLD FRONT 
IS TRAILING THE LOW ROUGHLY ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER...WITH A 
WAVE ALONG THE FRONT IN WESTERN TENNESSEE.  AS THE LOW STRETCHES 
EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES IN SOUTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW...WARM FRONT 
WILL PUSH THROUGH OUR CWA EARLY THIS MORNING.  COLD FRONT WILL 
FOLLOW AND IS PROGGED THROUGH THE AREA BY 00Z THIS EVENING ACCORDING 
TO AVN AND ETA.  

RADAR SHOWS NUMEROUS SHRA/TSRA ENTERING OUR AREA FROM THE SOUTHWEST 
ASSOC WITH 50 KT 850 JET MAX THAT IS PROGGED TO THE OHIO RIVER AT 
12Z TODAY. WITH RADAR ACTIVE AND MORE PRECIP ON THE WAY...ILL KEEP 
CATEGORICAL POPS TODAY. MODELS ARE SHOWING DRYING BY AFTERNOON IN 
THE WAKE OF THE SHORT WAVE AND JET MAX...SO ILL GO WITH OCCASIONAL 
SHRA/TSRA EARLY...THEN MOSTLY CLOUDY ALL ZONES EXCEPT SOUTH CENTRAL 
COUNTIES WHICH SHOULD EXPERIENCE PRECIP THROUGH THE DAY. 

THE BREAK IN PRECIP WILL BE SHORT LIVED AS NEXT SYSTEM WILL APPROACH 
LATE TONIGHT.  CHANCE POPS STILL LOOK GOOD LATE TONIGHT.  ILL RAISE 
POPS TO CATEGORICAL FOR WEDNESDAY.  THOUGH 850 JET WILL STILL BE 
QUITE STRONG AND FEEDING US A LOT OF MOISTURE...ILL KEEP OUT 
MENTION OF THUNDER WEDNESDAY AS INSTABILITY AND SFC CONVERGENCE WILL 
BE SIGNIFICANTLY LESS THAN TODAY.

FWC HAS TEMP TRENDS FAIRLY WELL IN HAND...THOUGH DAYTIME HIGHS LOOK 
LOW IN WARM ADVECTION TODAY AND AGAIN BEHIND THE FRONT ON WEDNESDAY.
RISING TEMPS LOOK LIKELY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS YET ANOTHER SHORT WAVE 
BRINGS MORE WARM ADVECTION OUR WAY. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO






CRNT BATCH OF PCPN HEADED THAT WAY AND GIVEN UNCERATINTY OF EXACT

CLOSE TO FCST LOWS TNGT (LHQ ALREADY DOWN TO 41) BUT WITH CLDS AND

193 
FXUS61 KILN 261910
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
210 PM EST MON NOV 26 2001

IT LOOKS LIKE A RELATIVELY DRY NOVEMBER WILL END ON A VERY WET NOTE 
THIS WEEK.

MESOETA MODEL HAS TRENDED TOWARD THE AVN MODEL IN TERMS OF THE SHORT 
TERM WEATHER FEATURES.  A VIGOROUS S/WV ACRS THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL 
PIVOT NE INTO THE UPR MS RIVER VLY ON TUESDAY.  ITS ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE CWFA BY TUESDAY AFTN.  BEFORE THE COLD 
FRONT...A DEVELOPING WARM FRONT ACRS THE SRN GULF CST STATES WILL 
MOVE NE TOWARD THE CWFA TONIGHT AND THROUGH THE REGION TUESDAY 
MORNING.  IT IS THIS FRONT AND ASSOCIATED LOW LVL DYNAMICS THAT WILL 
BRING WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY TO THE REGION 
OVERNIGHT.  ACTIVITY WILL BEGIN IN THE SW CWFA FIRST AROUND 
MIDNIGHT...THEN PROGRESS NE THROUGH THE REMAINDER CWFA BY SUNRISE 
TUESDAY MORNING.  THE CONVECTION WILL BE OF AN ELEVATED NATURE.  
MESOETA 4 AM FCST SOUNDING FOR CVG YIELDS ABOUT 550 J/KG OF ELEVATED 
CAPE.  THIS ELEVATED CAPE WILL BE PRODUCED BY STRONG...WARM...MOIST 
ASCENT INTO THE OHIO VLY.  THE LOW LEVEL INVERSION IS SHALL...BUT 
STRONG.  THUS...WOULD TEND TO THINK THAT IF SEVERE WEATHER 
DEVELOPS...HAIL WOULD BE THE PRIMARY THREAT (AND IT SHOULD BE 
MARGINAL IN SIZE AT BEST).  HOWEVER...THE WINDS ALOFT WILL BE VERY 
STRONG (50 KT BETWEEN 3K AND 4K ABOVE THE SFC).  IF CONVECTION CAN 
DEVELOP IN A LINEAR NATURE...THERE WOULD BE THE POTENTIAL TO PUSH 
SOME OF THIS WIND ENERGY TO THE SFC DESPITE THE LOW LVL INVERSION.  
IN ADDITION...STORM RELATIVE HELICITIES EXCEED 400 MS/S2.  AM 
CONCERNED THAT A FEW STORMS MAY CONTAIN ROTATING UPDRAFTS...AND 
WOULD BE DANGEROUS IF LOCATED NEAR THE SFC WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY.  
WILL ISSUE AN SPS BASED ON THIS.

ON TUESDAY...COLD FRONT IS FCST TO BE ALONG THE IN/OH BORDER BY 18Z 
AND EAST OF A CLE...CMH...PMH LINE BY 00Z WEDNESDAY.  SHOWERS...AND 
POSSIBLY SFC BASED THUNDERSTORMS CAN BE EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE DAY.

ON TUESDAY NIGHT...THE FRONT STALLS JUST SOUTH OF THE REGION.  
ANOTHER VIGOROUS S/WV PIVOTING OUT OF THE DESERT SOUTHWEST WILL 
BEGIN DEVELOPING ANOTHER SFC LOW OVER THE LOWER MS VLY.  THIS S/WV 
WILL BRING ANOTHER SURGE OF MOIST AIR FROM THE GULF COAST 
STATES...KEEPING THE REGION ON THE RAINY SIDE WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY EVENING.  THE HEAVIEST RAIN WILL LIKELY FALL ACRS THE 
CWFA...BUT ITS AXIS WILL DEPEND ON HOW THE LOW LEVEL JET DEVELOPS 
ACRS THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY.

WILL BASE FCST TEMPS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM ON A BLEND OF SFC ETA 
SKIN TEMPS AND MOS GUIDANCE.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

IN THE OFFERING. XPCT A GOOD AMT OF SUNSHINE WITH THICKENING CI THIS
AFTN. ENERGY BLOCK AND THICKNESS TECHNIQUES SUPP TEMPS A COUPLE DEGS
WRMR THAN FWC GUID TDA.

INTO THE RGN OVRNGT. AVN HS BEEN SLOWER AND MOST CONSISTENT WITH
ASSOCIATED CDFTN INTO WRN IN BY 12Z TUE. ETA HS TRENDED CONSIDERABLY
SLOWER TWD THE AVN SOLN. FAVORABLE PE/S AND LO LVL CNVRGC INTO WRN
SECTIONS TWD 06Z AND INTO THE E BTWN 08Z AND 10Z. FOLLOWING FAVORED 
SLOWER AVN SOLN WL MENT SHWRS LKLY AFTR MIDNIGHT W AND A CHC LATE IN
THE E. TEMP WISE...GUID VALUES HV TRENDED WRMR AND ARE ACCEPTED 
TNGT.

INTIAL UPR LO FILLS AS ENERGY DROPS INTO LONG WV TROF OVR SW U.S.
TUE. THIS PLACES OH VLY IN SWRLY FLO ALOFT WITH DWPTS ARND 60 DEG
INTO OH VLY AHD OF FROPA. WL ADD MENT OF THUNDER TO SRN SECTIONS
TUE AHD OF FROPA AND WL CONT A MENT OF SHWRS ACRS THE S INTO 
TUE NGT.

UPSTREAM.  TIMESXNS DO SHOW INCREASING DEEPER LIFT AND MSTR OVER THS 
SW IN THE AFTN...AND WL INDC A BECMG MCLDY TREND THERE...OTHW WITH A 
21Z SUNSET THINK MSNY IS THE BETTER CHARACTER OF THE DAY ELSW.  
TRAJECTORIES SUPPORT TEMPS CLOSER TO THE WARMER AVN BASED GUID.

MSTR PROGGED TO SURGE BACK INTO THE RGN AHEAD OF NEXT SYS MON NGT.  
FORCING FOR LIFT NOT TREMENDOUS...BUT SUFFICIENT GIVEN 50KT+ H8 JET 
AND SOME DPVA.  WEAK INSTABILTY WL AID THE LIFTS EFFICENCY...AND HV 
RAISED POPS INTO THE LIKELY RANGE ALL ZONES.  GUID TEMPS LK RSNBL.  
ALL MODELS INDCG SOME MANNER OF DRY SLOT OVER THE RGN TUE...ALTHOUGH 
THE BACKING MID/UPPER LVL FLOW DOES RAISE THE CONCERN OF CLOUDS/PCPN 
LINGERING OVER THE EAST.  WL CARRY POPS ALL DAY IN THE SE...OTHW WL 
CONT MORNING WORDING.  WITH A WARM START AND SOME SUN XPCTD HV MADE 
SOME MINOR UPWARD ADJUSMENTS TO THE FWC.

ERN SECTIONS OF CWA ATTM. SATL IMGRY SHWS DRY SLOT OVR ERN IN AND
WRN OH IN THE WAKE OF THIS FNT WITH WRAP ARND LO LVL MSTR PUSHING
E ACRS WRN IN. AVN MODEL H8 MSTR HS GOOD HANDLE ON THIS SC DECK WITH
CLDS FILLING BACK IN EARLY THIS MRNG INTO THE W AND BY MID MRNG IN
ERN SECTIONS. XPCT TO SEE SOME CLRG INTO THE W BY LATE AFTN. TEMP
WISE...HV NOT STRAYED TOO FAR FM GUID TDA ONLY A DEG OR SO WRMR THAN 
FWC VALUES.
      
WK SFC AND MID LVL RDDG BLDS OVR OH VLY TNGT. WITH FLO BCMG ANTI-CYC
SKIES WL BCM MSTLY CLR WITH ONLY A FEW THIN CI XPCTD. CLRG SKIES AND
LGT WNDS SHUD ALLOW TEMPS TO FALL A LTL BLO FWC GUID TNGT.

NXT UPR LO TRACKING FM CNTRL PLNS INTO UPR MS VLY MON NGT WILL CAUSE
FLO TO BACK AND MSTR TO INCRS IN SWRLY FLO. XPCT TO SEE AN INCRS IN 
HI LVL MSTR DURG THE DAY MON. IN WAA PTN PREFER WARMER HI/S TRENDED
TOWARD MAV GUID VALUES.

SOME DIFFERENCES EXIST IN TIMING OF ASSOCIATED CDFNT PASSAGE LT 
MON/ERLY TUE. AVN A LTL SLOWER WITH FROPA AND HS HAD BEST RUN TO 
RUN CONTINUITY WITH THIS SYS AND THEREFORE IS FAVORED. WL INCRS
POPS MON NGT AND ADD TIMING. GIVEN SLOWER FROPA AND ANTICIPATED CLD 
CVR AND SFC DWPTS IN THE LWR AND MID 50S PREFER LOWS WRMR THAN
FWC MON NGT.

.ILN...NONE.

AR











839 
FXUS61 KILN 241743
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1245 PM EST SAT NOV 24 2001

HAVE TAKEN A LOOK AT THE EXTENDED FORECAST FROM THE MODELS AND AM 
THROWING MY HANDS UP IN DISGUST. MEAN H5 PATTERN LOOKS RELATIVELY 
OKAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH LARGE RIDGE OFF OF THE EAST COAST AND 
LONGWAVE TROF OVER CENTRAL PLAINS. HOWEVER...SFC PATTERNS FROM 
MODELS COULDNT BE FURTHER APART. DONT HAVE ENOUGH CONFIDENCE TO 
TAKE ONE MODEL OVER ANOTHER. WHEN PMDEPD DISCUSSION FROM GURUS COMES 
OUT ILL TRY TO TREND TOWARDS WHAT THEY PICK UP ON. RIGHT NOW... 
LONGWAVE TROF INDICATED TO PUSH FROM THE PLAINS THROUGH THE ERN 
THIRD OF THE COUNTRY AND SPARK A SFC LOW OVER THE MID ATLANTIC THURS 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. WINTER SHOULD BE ON ITS HEELS AS TROF ROTATES 
NORTHEAST AND SFC LOW RIDES UP THE COAST WITH GOOD NRLY FLOW CAUGHT 
BETWEEN THIS AND THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE THAT SETS UP FROM N-S 
THROUGH THE CENTRAL U.S.  PROBLEM HERE IS THAT MRF HAS SWITCHED 
DRAMATICALLY OVER PAST 3 RUNS AT BOTH THE SFC AND H5 LONGWAVE 
PATTERN. AVN SFC PATTERN DOESNT APPEAR TO BE METEOROLOGICALLY SOUND 
DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY WITH THE SFC TROF OVER THE EAST 
COAST...STRONG RIDGE INTO THE OHVLY AND BACK DOOR CDFNT IN THE GT 
LKS. CONFIDENCE IN FORECAST IS SHOT FROM WEDNESDAY ON. 

NOW FOR SOME WEATHER THAT COULD BE PREDICTED...MODELS HAVE CONTINUED 
TO SPEED UP THE MOISTURE PLUME WELL AHEAD OF LOW PRESSURE ENTERING 
THE GTLKS. WIND SHIFT WITH FROPA IS HARDLY NOTICEABLE BY THE TIME IT 
PASSES THROUGH FCST AREA...BUT DEWPOINT GRADIENT SHOULD CLEARLY MARK 
FROPA. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AFFECTS FAR NRN PARTS OF FCST AREA ON 
SUNDAY...THOUGH TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN ON THE WARM SIDE WITH GOOD SW 
FLOW AND GUIDANCE NUMBERS SUGGEST THIS. SHORT TERM MODELS ARE IN 
FAIR AGREEMENT AND WILL NOT STRAY MUCH FROM GUIDANCE HERE.

MISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS






FXUS61 KILN 241452
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EST SAT NOV 24 2001

13Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT ALONG THE MS RIVER 
VLY...EXTENDING NORTHWEST TO A DEEP SFC LOW OVR ERN NEBRASKA.  THIS 
FRONT IS FCST TO PIVOT NE TOWARD THE MIDDLE OHIO VLY OVER THE NEXT 
12 TO 18 HRS.

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS TWO SIGNIFICANT S/WVS ROTATING AROUND H5 
UPR LVL LOW OVR THE CENTRAL UNITED STATES.  THE FIRST WAS ROTATING 
NORTH INTO IOWA.  THE SECOND...AND THE ONE WHICH WILL AFFECT OUR 
AREA...WAS LOCATED OVR N CNTRL TX.  THIS S/WV IS FCST TO PIVOT NE 
INTO THE OHIO VLY BY THIS EVENING.  GIVEN THE CURRENT NATURE OF THE 
MEAN CLOUD BEARING WIND AHEAD OF THE FRONT (A MORE SSW ORIENTATION 
VS A WESTERLY ORIENTATION)...BELIEVE SHOWERS WILL BE SLOWER TO MOVE 
INTO THE REGION.  AS A RESULT...WILL CUT BACK POPS FOR THE AFTN 
HOURS OVER MOST OF THE REGION.  WILL WORD HIGHEST POPS FAR WEST 
(80)...LIKELY POPS WAPAKONETA...DAYTON...CVG BY LATE AFTN (60) AND 
LOW POPS (30) EAST.  GIVEN WARM FLOW...NEAR RECORD OR RECORD TEMPS 
MAY BE REACHED IN CMH TODAY.  WILL MENTION THIS IN THE CNTRL OHIO 
ZONE...AND MAY ADJUST TEMPS ELSEWHERE SLIGHTLY.

WILL REISSUE SEVERE WEATHER OUTLOOK FOR THE CWFA.  IT APPEARS BEST 
CHC FOR SVR WEATHER WILL BY LATE AFTN SW AND INTO THE EVENING HOURS 
DAY/CVG/WAP (GIVEN STRONG WIND FLOW REGINE ALOFT).

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN









MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH UPR LO OVR CNTRL PLNS LIFTING NE
INTO UPR MS VLY TDA/TNGT AS STG JET ROTATES ARND THE BASE OF THE
INTO OH VLY. 

LEAD S/WV IN SWRLY FLO AIDING WK INSETN LIFT WHICH IS SETTING OFF
A FW LGT SHWRS/SPRINKLES WHICH ARE PIVOTING N THRU AREA ATTM. THIS
PRECIP SHUD EXIT THE AREA EARLY. IN RESPONSE TO DEEPING SYS STG 
LO LVL SRLY JET DVLPS TDA. THIS JET ADVCTS MSTR NWD INTO OH VLY 
WITH UPR 50S AND PERHAPS A 60 DWPT BY 00Z. DYNAMICS ARE STG
AND SHUD OVRCOME LIMITED INSTBY WHICH DVLPS OVR THE W DURG LT AFTN
AND ACRS THE AREA THIS EVE. WL ISSUE SVR-WX OUTLOOK WITH THE MAIN
THREAT BEING DMGG WNDS. WL GO WITH CATAGORICAL POPS W AND LKLY 
POPS LATE E. TEMP WISE...PREFER VALUES A LTL WRMR THAN GUID IN
STG WAA PTN TDA.

SHWRS AND SOME TSTMS PIVOT ACRS THE AREA TNGT WITH FROPA BTWN 06-09Z.
DRY SLOT WORKS INTO OH FM THE W LATE TNGT. WL GO WITH CATAGORICAL POPS
ACRS CWA. TEMP WISE...PREFER COOLER LOWS CLOSER TO MAV GUID IN WAKE
OF CDFNT. 

BEST WRAP ARND LO LVL MSTR TO AFFECT NRN OH SUN. WL CONT PARTLY CLOUDY
ACRS THE S AND MOSTLY CLDY SKY COND ACRS THE NRN MIAMI VLY. AGN PREFER
TEMPS A LTL COOLER THAN FWC GUID. 

.ILN...NONE.


FXUS61 KILN 231907
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
205 PM EST FRI NOV 23 2001

S/W RIDING ALONG INVERTED SFC RIDGE OVER CAROLINAS/VIRGINIA SHOULD 
STRETCH OUT WITH NRN PORTION OF THE S/W AXIS SKIMMING ERN FCST AREA 
TONIGHT. INITIAL THOUGHT FOR NWRN CWA IS THAT S/W WOULD BE TOO WEAK 
TO PROVIDE ENOUGH LIFT BUT MESOETA IS CRANKING OUT SOME QPF HERE AND 
NOT IN THE EAST. WILL GO WITH A 20 POP OF SPRINKLES OVER ALL BUT 
SWRN FCST AREA AS ATMOSPHERE IS MOIST ENOUGH FOR LIGHT STUFF TO 
REACH THE GROUND...AND MENTION LATE WORDING FOR CMH GROUPING.

ONLY MINOR CHANGES EXPECTED IN SHORT TERM WITH NEXT SYSTEM BRINGING 
RAIN ON SATURDAY. WILL REMOVE THE CHANCE OF THUNDER FOR THE EASTERN 
HALF OF FCST AREA FOR THE DAYTIME PERIOD ON SATURDAY AND PLAY IT 
DOWN OVERNIGHT. ETA/MESOETA SHOWING AXIS OF BEST INSTABILITY 
REMAINING OVER IN/OH BORDER AFTER 0Z AND DECREASING DRAMATICALLY 
OVERNIGHT AS LLJET GETS PUSHED AHEAD OF FRONT. ACTUAL FRONT LINGERS 
WEST OF PRECIP AREA AND WRAP-AROUND PRECIP SHOULD BE N OF FCST AREA 
CLOSEST TO GT LKS. WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY.

BIG PROBLEM IS HOW WARM AMS WILL GET IN THE WAA TOMORROW. CLOUDS 
WILL HAMPER A BIT...AND RAIN IN THE WEST LATER IN THE AFTERNOON 
SHOULD SET UP A NICE W-E GRADIENT. MAV GUIDANCE A FAR CRY FROM 
FAN...AND FWC SEEMS TO CUT A MIDDLE ROAD. WILL TREND COOLER IN THE 
WEST AND WARMER IN THE EAST. THIS WOULD PUT NEAR RECORD (68) HIGHS 
FOR CMH.

SFC HIGH PRESSURE CENTER SHOULD PROVIDE A BREAK BETWEEN RAIN EVENTS 
ON MODAY AND TUESDAY...AS NEXT SYSTEM SPINS UP IN THE PLAINS AND 
BRINGS STREAM OF GULF MOISTURE BACK INTO THE PICTURE FOR TUESDAY PM 
AND WEDNESDAY. MODEL TRENDS FOR THE SFC LOW/TROF AND ASSOCIATED 
MOIST PLUME ARE QUICKER THAN SLOWER...BUT PLACEMENT OF CENTER OF SFC 
LOW PRESSURE IN THE PLAINS LEAVES A GOOD BIT OF ROOM FOR TIMING 
DIFFERENCES. CANADIAN MODEL AND MRF WOULD HINT AT THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME LINGERING SHOWERS IN THE EAST ON THURSDAY. CONFIDENCE DROPS 
QUICKLY IN FCST FOR THURS AND FRIDAY...BUT WILL NOT GO WITH TEMPS 
THAT COLD AS INDICATED BY MRF.

MISILN OUT BETWEEN 330 AND 4PM. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





802 
FXUS61 KILN 230748
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
248 AM EST FRI NOV 23 2001

FLO AMPLIFIES WITH ENERGY OVR SW U.S. CARVING OUT UPR LO OVR CNTRL 
PLNS BY 00Z SAT. MODEL SOLNS ARE SIMILAR WITH ETA TRENDING SLOWER 
AND DEEPER CLOSER TO AVN SOLN. THIS UPR LO TO LIFT NE ACRS THE PLNS
INTO UPR MS VLY SAT NGT. ASSOCIATED CDFNT TO PASS THRU CWA SAT NGT.

IN SHORT TERM...FLO BACKS WITH GOOD WAA PATTERN DVLPG. XPCT TO SEE
AN INCRS IN MAINLY HI AND MID LVL CLDS TDA. WL CONT PARTLY SUNNY
SKY COND TDA. THICKNESS AND ENERGY BLOCK TECHNIQUES SUGG TEMPS ARND
ONE CAT WRMR THAN YDA. MAV GUID APPEARS TOO COOL AND WL GO WITH TEMPS
A COUPLE DEGS WRMR THAN FWC NUMBERS.

MSTR INCRS TNGT AHD OF PLNS SYS IN SWRLY UPR FLO. ISENT FLO CONTS BUT
IS WEAK AND PRES COND DEFICITS REMAINING HI. ONLY MARGINAL PE/S XPCTD
INTO WRN SECTIONS LT. DUE TO LACK OF FOCUSING MECHANISM ONLY XPCT A 
SPRINKLE OR LIGHT SHWR AT MOST. THEREFORE...WL GO WITH DRY FCST 
OVRNGT. PRES GRAD INCRS AND WNDS AND ADVCTN OF LO LVL MSTR SHUD HOLD
TEMPS UP TNGT. HV STAYED CLOSE TO GUID TEMPS TNGT.

LO LVL JET INCRS TO 55-60KTS SAT. BREEZY CONDS DVLP IN RESPONSE TO 
THIS INCRS IN PRES GRAD WITH SFC DWPTS INCRS INTO UPR 50S. SYS TAKES
ON NEG TILT WITH FAVORABLE UPR DIV/LO LVL CNVRGC COUPLET SAT 
AFTN/EVE. GIVEN HI DWPTS FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR AND STG DYNAMICS WL 
CONT MENT OF TSTMS WITH LKLY POPS IN W AND HI CHC IN ERN SECTIONS. 
WL GO WITH CATAGORICAL POPS SAT NGT CWA WIDE.          

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

240 PM EST THU NOV 22 2001

FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE STREAMS AHEAD OF NEXT LOW DEVELOPING 
SOMEWHERE OVER PLAINS STATES. THOUGH ISENTROPIC LIFT COULD SPARK 
SOME LIGHT SHOWERS LATE ON FRIDAY...MAIN THINKING HERE IS THAT THERE 
WONT BE A TRIGGER AND SPRINKLES WOULD BE THE WORST-CASE SCENARIO. 
CURRENT FCST HAS A CHANCE IN THE SOUTHWEST WITH AFTERNOON WORDING 
AND WILL BUMP DOWN TO A 20 POP.

SHOWERS ON SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT MAY HAVE SOME THUNDER THROWN 
IN THERE ALONG THE FRONT...BUT WILL KEEP MENTION OUT ATTM AS TIMING 
PUTS FROPA AT AN UNFAVORABLE OVERNIGHT PASSAGE. ALSO...BREEZY ON SAT 
WITH 15-20 MPH WINDS.

WILL NOT STRAY TOO MUCH ON GUIDANCE TEMPS...AND FAVOR THE WARMER 
FWC/MAV NUMBERS IN THE 50S FOR TOMORROWS LOWS. PROBLEMS ARISE 
SATURDAY AS STRONG WAA KICKS IN...THOUGH CLOUDY SKIES AND CHANCE OF 
RAIN IN THE WEST COULD POSE A BIT OF A PROBLEM WITH COOLER HIGHS. 
WILL STAY CLOSE TO FWC NUMBERS HERE.

HAVE DONE SOME SWITCHING AROUND ON THE EXTENDED WITH PULLING OUT 
SHOWERS ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY...ADDING THE CHANCE ON WEDNESDAY IN 
THE WEST AND FOR THE REST OF THE FCST AREA ON THURSDAY. LOOKS LIKE 
THE NEXT SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS WILL ALSO BRING WAA OVER FCST AREA AT 
THIS TIME...BUT IT SHOULD STILL BE ON THE TOUGH SIDE TO WRING OUT 
THE RAIN IF THIS PATTERN IS REALIZED. AM KEYING ON THE ECMWF AND 
UKMET VS THE MRF AT THIS TIME. SFC RIDGE OVER ERN THIRD OF U.S. 
SHOULD BREAK DOWN AND ALLOW DIGGING SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS TO SPIN 
UP. MRF HAS SFC LOW A BIT FAR TO THE WEST AND KEEPS THE RIDGE OVER 
THE ERN U.S. EVEN THOUGH IT INDICATES NEAR ZONAL H5 FLOW. WILL BE 
ABOVE NORMALS ON TEMPS FOR THE LATTER PART OF FCST PERIOD. 

MISILN OUT 330-400.

.ILN...NONE.

TONIGHT.

THINGS GET MORE INTERESTING ON FRIDAY AS THE SYS IN THE PLAINS TAKES 
SHAPE. MDLS HAVE HAD A HARD TIME DECIDING ON A SOLN WITH THIS LAST 
RUN OF AVN AND ETA INDICATING THE SYS IS GOING TO TRY AND BECOME 
VERTICALLY STACKED. THIS WOULD CERTAINLY SLOW IT DOWN AND KEEP CWFA 
OUT OF THE BEST RAIN UNTIL SATURDAY. BIG QUESTION IS WAA SHOWERS ON 
FRI. AVN AND ETA BOTH SHOW DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT AT 300K AND WITH 
GULF OPENING UP THINK SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ARE CERTAINLY A POSSIBILITY 
IN THE WEST. BUT AM LOATHE TO KEEP FLIP-FLOPPING ON RAIN CHCS FRI SO 
WILL LEAVE IT IN JUST THE SW AFTN FOR NOW. FRI NIGHT ACTUALLY LOOKS 
AS THOUGH WE GET INTO A DRY SLOT AHEAD OF THE MAIN FRONT BUT AGAIN 
WILL LEAVE PRECIP IN BUT WILL CUT BACK TO 30 POPS. 

AVN GUID SHOWING AROUND 70 FOR SAT WITH 850 TEMPS JUMPING UP TO 11C 
AND BREEZY SOUTHWEST WINDS. THIS WOULD BE NEAR RECORD HIGH FOR US SO 
WILL NOT GO THAT WARM NOW...BUT WILL BUMP UP TEMPS A CAT OR TWO.

W-E WARM FRONTAL SYSTEM ACROSS THE GRT LKS THURSDAY/FRIDAY. WARM SLY 
FLOW DEVELOPS ACROSS THE ILN FA DURING THIS PERIOD. STRONG STORM 
SYSTEM EXPECTED TO DEVELOP IN THE CTRL PLAINS ON FRIDAY. IT IS WITH 
THIS SYSTEM THAT THE ETA/AVN HAVE SOMEWHAT DIFFERING SOLUTION. IT 
APPEARS THAT THE ETA IS THE MORE CONSISTANT MODEL AT THIS POINT. ITS 
TENDENCY IS TO SOMEWHAT SLOW THE PROGRESS OF THIS SYSTEM AS IT TENDS 
TO DEVELOP IT FURTHER W. THIS MAY AID IN SLOWING THE INITIAL ONSET 
OF PRECIPITATION INTO OUR AREA. MODEL ALSO HAS WINDS BACKING INTO 
THE SE AT THIS TIME...ALLOWING SOME WK DOWNSLOPE TO ASSIST IN 
KEEPING US DRY FOR A BIT LONGER.

SO AT THIS TIME WILL NOT INTRODUCE POPS UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY 
FRIDAY FOR SW PORTION OF ILN FA. MODELS HAVE TENDED TO TREND WARMER 
THROUGH 60HR WITH BDRY LAYER THICKNESS...THUS WILL TREND A BIT 
WARMER WITH MAX TEMPS...BUT STILL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 PM EST TUE NOV 20 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN HAS H5 TROF EXITING THROUGH NEW ENGLAND AS RIDGE 
GRADUALLY BECOMES REESTABLISHED OVER THE CENTRAL CONUS.  RIDGE AXIS 
IS PROGGED TO CROSS OHIO ON THANKSGIVING BEFORE OUR AREA COMES UNDER 
THE INFLUENCE OF ANOTHER TROF BEGINNING FRIDAY.

SFC MAP SHOWS BROAD HIGH PRESSURE MOVING UP THE OHIO VALLEY.  HIGH 
IS FCST TO DROP SOUTHEAST OVER THE NEXT DAY BENEATH THE UPPER TROF 
BEFORE IT MERGES ON THANKSGIVING WITH A CANADIAN HIGH ALONG THE EAST 
COAST.  PERSISTENT HIGH WILL KEEP PRECIP OUT OF OUR AREA THROUGH 
THANKSGIVING...SO SKY CONDITIONS AND TEMPS WILL BE THE FOCUS OF THE 
48 HOUR FCST.  

SATELLITE SHOWS LOTS OF CU ACROSS OUR CWA IN RESIDUAL MOISTURE ON 
THE EAST SIDE OF THE HIGH.  CU WILL DISSIPATE AS THE SUN 
SETS...HOWEVER...HIGH CLOUDS WILL ENTER THE PICTURE BY LATE EVENING 
AS THEY WORK DOWN HERE FROM WISCONSIN.  THUS...PARTLY CLOUDY WILL 
WORK FOR TONIGHT.  HIGH CLOUDS WILL LIKELY STAY AROUND FOR A GOOD 
PART OF WEDNESDAY...WHILE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL EXIT AS 850 MB 
FLOW TURNS WEST...SO CU WILL PROBABLY NOT BE HERE ON WEDNESDAY. 
THEREFORE...ILL STAY WITH PARTLY SUNNY FOR WEDNESDAY.  WITH LITTLE 
MOISTURE SHOWING UP ON MODEL PROGS...ILL KEEP MOSTLY CLEAR FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  ON THANKSGIVING WELL EXPERIENCE A RETURN OF HIGH 
CLOUDS...SO PARTLY SUNNY WILL BE APPROPRIATE.  

NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE FRIDAY...WHEN ISENTROPIC LIFT KICKS IN 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT H5 TROF.  CONDITIONS COULD REMAIN MOIST THROUGH 
MUCH OF THE EXTENDED FCST AS A PERSISTENT SOUTHWEST UPPER FLOW TAKES 
HOLD.

MILDER WEATHER WILL RETURN AS SFC HIGH MOVES EAST AND UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS IN.  FWC TEMPS LOOK A BIT TOO WARM SO ILL SPLIT THE 
DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE GENERALLY COOLER MAV AND THE FWC.

.ILN...NONE.

SHOULD END ALL ZONES BY MIDNIGHT.

HOWEVER...LOW CLOUDS ARE TRUCKING DOWN FROM THE UPPER GREAT LAKES 
AND SHOULD REACH OUR AREA ON TUESDAY.  FOR TUESDAY ILL STAY CLOSE 
TO PREVIOUS FCST AGAIN AND GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH AND MOSTLY 
CLOUDY/CHANCE MORNING FLURRIES NORTH.  THE CHANCE FOR SIGNIFICANT 
PRECIP LOOKS MINIMAL ON TUESDAY WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOWING 
INADEQUATE MOISTURE ABOVE 6K FT.  

SFC HIGH ALONG WITH NVA WILL BE MOVING IN BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  
WITH HIGH DROPPING SOUTHEAST AND UPPER RIDGE REENTERING 
PICTURE...DRY AIR WILL BE AROUND TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...WITH 
ONLY HIGH CLOUDS TO DEAL WITH...SO MOSTLY CLEAR/MOSTLY SUNNY WILL 
WORK.

FWC TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY GOOD WRT UPCOMING COOLING TREND... SO ILL 
ONLY DEVIATE SLIGHTLY.  GREATEST ROOM FOR IMPROVEMENT OVER FWC 
APPEARS TO BE FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...WHEN COOLER MAV NUMBERS LOOK 
BETTER.

DIVERGE.  ETA IS THE FASTEST WITH THE AVN AND UKMET BEING SLOWER.  
DPROG/DT ON THE AVN INDICATES THAT THE AVN HAS BEEN SPEEDING UP AND 
APPEARS TO BE LOCKING ON WITH THE PAST TWO RUNS.  THUS WILL GO WITH 
AVN/UKMET SOLUTION FOR FRONTAL PASSAGE ON MONDAY.  WILL BUMP UP POPS 
IN THE WEST ON MONDAY WITH BETTER POPS IN THE EAST MONDAY NIGHT.  
WILL ALSO BUMP UP TEMPS A BIT WITH A SLOWER SOLUTION.

FOG WILL BURN OFF AROUND MID MORNING RESULTING IN MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES.  WILL STICK CLOSE TO FWC TEMPS TODAY.  UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES 
TO BUILD OVER THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT AND SUNDAY.  WILL GO SEVERAL 
DEGREES ABOVE FWC CLOSER TO MAV FOR SUNDAY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE.  
AS FOR LOWS WILL STICK CLOSE TONIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT.  CLOUDS WILL
INCREASE WITH THE APPROACH OF THE FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

INTO OUR CWA BY TONIGHT...BEFORE IT WASHES OUT AROUND THE OHIO

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 AM EST FRI NOV 16 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM MID MS VLY 
INTO WEST VIRGINIA WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER SOUTHERN GREAT 
LAKES.  SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES STRATA CU OVER FA IN ADVANCE OF 
COLD FRONT.

MODELS ARE ALL SIMILAR WITH 500 MB AND SFC FEATURES.  HOWEVER, THERE 
ARE SUBTLE DIFFERENCE IN THE LOWER LEVEL THERMAL PATTERNS BETWEEN 
THE NGM AND ETA/AVN.

DRY COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH TODAY WITH LITTLE EFFECT ON OUR 
WEATHER EXCEPT ADDING SOME SCT-BKN CLOUD COVER.  TODAYS HIGH WILL BE 
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAYS...ALTHOUGH A FEW DEGREES COOLER ACROSS THE 
NORTH.  NGM IS TRYING TO BRING BACK DOOR COLD FRONT INTO CENTRAL 
OHIO ON SATURDAY.  AVN/ETA HAVE A HINT OF THIS FEATURE BUT THE 
STRENGTH IS MUCH WEAKER.  WILL GO WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST AND ETA/AVN 
AND BUMP UP FWC SEVERAL DEGREES SATURDAY AND A FEW DEGREES SAT NIGHT.

NEXT THREAT OF RAIN STILL LOOKS LIKE LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.

MISILN SENT TO ALL. 

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

255 PM EST THU NOV 15 2001

SFC HI PRES CNTRD ACRS THE TN VLY THIS AFTN PROVIDING FOR MSTLY 
SUNNY SKIES ACRS FA. NARROW BAND OF CLDS FM CNTL IL INTO NRN IND 
APPEAR TO BE ISENTROPICALLY INDUCED. THIS AREA OF ISENT LIFT PROGD 
TO WKN SOMEWHAT AS IT SLIDES E INTO NRN FA OVRNGT ALG WITH AN INCRS 
IN COND PRED DEFS. THUS...NOT SURE HOW MUCH WL ACTUALLY SEE IN THE 
WAY OF CLDS TNGT BUT WITH MSTR AT AND BLO 8H PROGD TO INCRS...WL GO 
WITH PRTLY CLDY SKIES IN THE N TNGT AND THEN KP MSTLY CLR IN THE S. 
WITH CLR SKIES IN THE S...WL UNDERCUT GUID A LTL AND OPEN UP A RANGE 
AS WE SHUD SEE COOLER TMPS IN THE LOW LYING AREAS. 

CDFNT CRNTLY LOCATED ACRS NRN MN AND NRN MI PROGD TO DROP S FRI INTO 
FRI NGT AND WASH OUT ACRS OUR AREA. WITH RDG IN PLACE TO OUR S...AVN 
APPEARS TO BE BRINGING FNT TOO FAR S AND WL LEAN TWD MORE OF A 
ETA/NGM SOLUTION FOR WND FCST AND TMPS. NOT A WHOLE LOT OF MSTR 
ASCTD WITH FNT SO THINK JUST SEE PRTLY CLDY SKIES AT WORST SO WL 
GNRLLY KP PRTLY CLDY IN THE N AND MSTLY CLR S. 

AMPLIFYINNG RDG OVR WRN US HELPING TO CARVE OUT TROF OVR ERN US AS 
WE HEAD INTO THE LATER PDS. AVN CONTG ITS TREND OF SPEEDING THINGS 
UP...NOW BRINGG FNT THRU SUN NGT INTO ERLY MON. AVN ALSO CONTG TREND 
OF BACKING OFF A LTL ON PCPN/MSTR FIELDS. THUS...WHILE MOST AREAS 
SHUD SEE PCPN SUN NGT...WL ONLY KP PCPN IN HIGH CHC CAT FOR NOW. CUD 
SEE SOME PCPN LINGER INTO MON MRNG ACRS THE FAR S...BUT AGN GIVEN 
FSTR MDL TRENDS...THINK WL KP MENTION OUT OF FCST FOR MON. GOOD CAA 
THEN SETS IN THRU THE DAY ON MON. THIS MAKES FOR A TRICKY TEMP FCST 
AS DRY SLOT PROGD ACRS AREA CUD ALLOW FOR SOME PDS OF SUN. 

MRF AND ECMWF BOTH KPG TROF ACRS ERN US THRU RMNDR OF FCST SO SHUD 
SEE COLD TEMPS THRU END OF WK. 

.ILN...NONE.

618 
FXUS61 KILN 150724
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 AM EST THU NOV 15 2001

BROAD H5 RIDGE OVER CONTINENTAL U.S. HOLDS TOGETHER FOR ANOTHER FEW 
DAYS. MORE OF THE SAME EXPECTED THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH MOCLEAR TO 
PTCLDY SKIES AND NO RAIN. TEMPS SHOULD EXPERIENCE LITTLE CHANGE AS 
WELL. 

A PIECE OF ENERGY CURRENTLY IN THE PACIFIC GETS ROTATED AROUND THE 
LOW AND SETTLES INTO WRN CONTINENTAL CANADA. AS A BUILDING RIDGE 
OVER THE LEFT COAST STRENGTHENS...THIS ENERGY WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST 
TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES. WITH THE BUILDING RIDGE AND DEEPENING TROF 
OVER THE GREAT LAKES...PRECIP SHOULD RETURN TO THE FCST AREA 
SOMETIME MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AS A MORE CLIMATALOGICAL LONGWAVE 
PATTERN SETS UP.

AND NOW FOR SOMETHING COMPLETELY DIFFERENT...INCREASED H8 MOISTURE 
TODAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY SHOULD ONLY BE REALIZED AS SCATTERED CLOUDS. 
MOISTURE POOLS AHEAD OF A WINDSHIFT LINE...CANT CALL IT A COLDFRONT 
AS TEMPS ACTUALLY RISE BEHIND IT. AS LINE STRETCHES OUT OVER 
OHVLY...CLOUD COVER SHOULD HOLD TEMPS DOWN A BIT. HOWEVER...WITH 
SOME CLOUDS BEGINNING LATE TONIGHT, OVERNIGHT LOWS ARE PROGGED TO 
ONLY BE AROUND 50. EVEN IF CLOUDS ARE ABUNDANT ON FRIDAY...STARTING 
OUT THIS WARM COULD BRING TEMPERATURES BACK TO THE MID 60S IN THE 
AFTERNOON. WILL MIX BETWEEN FWC AND AVN GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS FRIDAY. 
H8 TEMPS BY 12Z SAT ARE +10 OR SO AND GUIDANCE SEEMS TO BE QUITE A 
BIT LOWER THAN I WOULD EXPECT. WILL PROBABLY BUMP 4TH PERIOD LOWS BY 
A CATEGORY FROM GUIDANCE. EVEN IF THERES COLD AIR POOLING IN LOW 
LEVELS BEHIND FRONT...TEMPS AT H9 ARE STILL +12.

MISILN OUT BY 4.

.ILN...NONE.

GRADIENT IS STRONGEST IN THE WEST AND LIGHTER IN THE EAST.  AS A

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1245 AM EST TUE NOV 13 2001

WX PATTERN STILL SEEMS TO BE UNCHANGED IN CURRENT MODEL RUNS FROM 
PREVIOUS RUNS. MEAN H5 WEAK RIDG OVER OH VLY BREAKS APART AND GETS 
CAUGHT IN ZONAL FLOW...ALLOWING FOR A WEAK S/W TO SPIN OVER NRN GT 
LKS. WHATEVER THIS HAS TO DO WITH WX IN THE OH VLY I DONT KNOW BUT 
ITS THE ONLY FEATURE IN THE SHORT TERM THAT SEEMS WORTH MENTIONING. 
SOME MID TO HI LVL CLOUDS MAY BE FOUND OVER NRN CWA FROM THIS ON 
TUES PM...BUT EVEN THIS IS SKETCHY.

RIDGE OF SFC HI PRESSURE EXTENDING W-E OVER TN/KY BORDER AND SHOULD 
SHUNT MOISTURE FROM ANY S/WS CAUGHT IN ZONAL FLOW TO THE NORTH. 
ILNS SRN FCST AREA IS CAUGHT IN THIS AXIS AND THE ACUTAL SFC HI 
SEEMS TO RETROGRADE TO THE W OVER MS VLY.

MRF SEEMS TO HAVE A LOGICAL PROGRESSION TO THE H5 LOW SPINNING OVER 
AZ/NM. CUTOFF LOW HOLDS SWAY THROUGH THURS AM AND THEN STARTS TO 
WEAKEN AND GET CAUGHT IN WEAK SW FLOW OVER THE WEEKEND. BY THE TIME 
IT MAKES IT JUST W OF FCST AREA...CUTOFF IS BARELY A WEAK TROF BUT 
SHOULD PROVIDE AMPLE CLOUDINESS TO REGION FOR THE LATE WEEKEND AND 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.

DONT EXPECT TO BE MAKING ANY SWEEPING CHANGES FROM PREVIOUS 
PACKAGE. CHANGING MOSTLY CLEAR ON MODAY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY. WILL 
EXTEND THIS THROUGH TUESDAY. 

144 HOUR ON CANADIAN MODEL IS CLOSE ENOUGH TO THE MRF WITH MEAN 
TROF...BUT ON THE WHOLE IS DEFINITELY MORE AMPLIFIED WITH LONGWAVE 
PATTERN. ECMWF AT THIS TIME IS CLOSE AS WELL...BUT UKMET IS JUST A 
TAD FASTER WITH SFC TROF AT 12Z SUN. LONGWAVE PATTERN IN LAST 2 
PERIODS IS DIFFERENT BETWEEN MOST MODELS WITH CANADIAN AND UKMET 
AMPLIFYING PATTERN AND EUROPEAN AND MRF KEEPING A MORE ZONAL...LESS 
AMPLIFIED PATTERN. IN ANY CASE...THIS JUST LEADS TO A LOWER 
CONFIDENCE IN FORECAST FOR DAYS 6 AND 7. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
841 PM EST MON NOV 12 2001

TEMPS ACROSS THE AREA HAVE DROPPED OFF TO AROUND 40 MOST PLACES WITH 
THE USUAL COLD SPOTS WELL INTO THE 30S. A FEW WISPS OF CIRRUS ARE 
SPILLING OVER THE RIDGE BUT CERTAINLY NOT WORTH MENTIONING. ONLY 
UPDATE WILL BE TO LOWER THE OUTLYING AREAS SINCE TEMPS ARE ALREADY 
AROUND FREEZING IN THOSE LOCATIONS.

FXUS61 KILN 122028
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
327 PM EST MON NOV 12 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY 
WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLEAR SKIES OVER THE REGION.

MODELS ARE ALL SIMILAR WITH HANDLING THE WEATHER OVER FA.  THERE 
ARE SOME SUBTLE DIFFERENCES TO THE NORTH OF OHIO.  ONLY CONCERN IS 
WITH POTENTIAL CLOUD COVER.  ETA BRINGS LOW LEVEL (850 MB) MOISTURE 
FROM THE CAROLINA COAST AROUND LOW LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE UP INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  NOT TOTALLY BUYING THAT 
THIS MOISTURE WILL RESULT BKN/OVC SKY COVER OR THAT IT WILL EVEN 
MAKE IT UP HERE.  BUT WILL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES INSTEAD OF 
MOSTLY SUNNY TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS POSSIBILITY.

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD FOR TH LAST 3 PERIODS WILL STICK WITH THE COOLER 
MAV FOR TONIGHT.

MISILN ALREADY SENT TO ALL. 


.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 120623
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
122 AM EST MON NOV 12 2001

HIGH PRESSURE CURRENTLY OVER OHIO...WILL SLOWLY DRIFT INTO THE 
CAROLINAS BY 60 HRS.  MODELS SHOWING SOME 300 MB MOISTURE WORKING 
INTO THE FA DURING THE DAY...AND LINGERING INTO TONIGHT.  THEREFORE 
THE MOSTLY SUNNY/MOSTLY CLEAR FORECAST STILL LOOKS GOOD.  MOISTURE 
AHEAD OF SHORTWAVE BEGINS TO WORK INTO THE FA ON TUESDAY...SO EXPECT 
SOME SCATTERED CU ON TUESDAY...BUT FEEL THAT THE CHARACTER OF THE 
SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY COMPARED TO PARTLY CLOUDY.  SKIES SHOULD 
GO PARTLY CLOUDY TUESDAY NIGHT AS MOISTURE CONTINUES TO PUSH EAST.

WILL WARM TEMPERATURES UP A CATEGORY TODAY...CLOSE TO MOS NUMBERS.  
FA WILL BE ON THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE HIGH...AND THE HIGHS YESTERDAY 
IN THE SAME LOCATION COMPARED WITH THE HIGH WERE IN THE LOWER TO MID 
50S.  FOR TONIGHT WILL CONTINUE WITH THE CURRENT FORECAST OF 27 TO 
32 IN THE EAST AND LOWER 30S IN THE WEST.  THIS IS 3 TO 5 DEGREES 
BELOW MOS. ALTHOUGH 850 TEMPERATURES WARM...THE BOUNDARY LAYER 
SHOULD DECOUPLE.  IN ADDITION THE SURFACE FLOW IS FROM THE 
SE...WHICH IS NOT CONDUCIVE TO A REAL WARM NIGHT. NOT MUCH CHANGE TO 
TEMPS ON TUESDAY...BUT WITH MORE CLOUDS IN THE NORTH TUESDAY NIGHT 
COMPARED TO THE SE...WILL RAISE TEMPS NW AND LOWER SE.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

901 PM EST SUN NOV 11 2001

CHILLY NIGHT EXPECTED AS HIGH PRESSURE CURRENTLY LOCATED OVER NE 
INDIANA DRIFTS SOUTH AND EAST ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT.  TEMPS HAVE 
DROPPED RAPIDLY SINCE SUNSET INTO THE MID AND UPPER 30S...WITH LOW 
30S ALREADY ACROSS N CNTRL OHIO.  WITH LIGHT WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES 
OVERNIGHT...WILL BE NO PROBLEM REACHING UPPER 20S OVER CWA.  THE 
USUAL COLD SPOTS SOUTH AND EAST OF CMH MAY BOTTOM OUT IN THE LOWER 20S 
(LHQ ALREADY DOWN TO 30)...AND PREVIOUS FORECAST ACCOUNTS FOR THIS 
WITH LOWER TEMP SPREAD ACROSS CENTRAL OHIO. 

NO UPDATE PLANNED.

FXUS61 KILN 111909
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
209 PM EST SUN NOV 11 2001

HIGHLY AMPLIFIED FLO WITH RDG OVR THE W AND TROF OVR THE NE PLACING 
GRTLKS AND OH VLY IN NW FLO. SFC HI PRES OVR NRN IL TO BLD SE BCMG 
CNTRD OVR CNTRL OH BY 12Z MON. CU/SC HS DVLPD OVR THE RGN DUE TO COLD
AIR ALOFT. THESE CLDS WL DISSIPATE WITH LOSS OF HEATING. GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING NIGHT WITH LIGHT WND AND CLR SKIES. IN THIS
GOOD RAD COOLING REGIME PREFER LOWS COLDER THAN FWC GUID TNGT.

SFC HI PRES TO SLIDE SLOWLY E WITH EERLY LO LVL FLO ON MON. SYNOPTIC
SUBSIDENCE WL PROVIDE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. AFTER A CHILLY START XPCT
TEMPS TO BE CLOSE TO TDA/S HI/S. BASED ON LO LVL THICKNESS AND ENERGY
BLOCK TECH/S AGN XPCT THESE VALUES TO BE COLDER THAN FWC GUID 
VALUES.

S/WV OVR NRN ROCKIES TO PROGRESS E ACRS PLNS MON AND THE NRN GRTLKS
TUE/TUE NGT. AFTER ANOTHER CLR AND CHILLY NIGHT MON NGT XPCT TEMPS
TO WRM UP ON TUE AS LO LVL FLO BACKS. HV ACCEPTED GUID VALUES TUE.

BEST DYNAMICS AND MSTR STAY TO THE N TUE NGT. WL REMOVE PRECIP CHC/S
FROM FCST. UPR RDG BLDS INTO OH VLY THRU END OF THE WEEK AND INTO
NXT WEEKEND. THIS WL PROVIDE A WRMG TREND AND FAIR WX THRU THE FCST
PD.

.ILN...NONE.

LOOKS LIKE AN OTHER SUNNY/MOSTLY SUNNY DAY.

IN...DOMINATING THE WEATHER INTO TUESDAY.

NW MID/UPR LVL FLO WITH S/WV DROPPING SE THRU ERN GRTLKS. 
ASSOCIATED E-W ORIENTED CDFNT WHICH EXTENDS FM CNTRL LWR MI 
THRU SRN WI WL DROP S THRU OH THIS EVE. BEST DYNAMICS STAY
WELL TO OUR NE AND MSTR IS LIMITED WITH THIS SYS. LTST VIS
SATL IMGRY SHWS BAND OF SC CLDS IN THE WAKE OF THIS FNT ACRS 
NRN GRTLKS. THESE CLDS ARE MAKING SWD PROGRESS. ETA 900MB RH
SHWS LO LVL MSTR ENCROACHING INTO NRN AND CNTRL OH LT TNGT.
SOME OF THESE CLDS MAY DISPT SO WL INDICATE SKIES BCMG PARTLY
CLOUDY ACRS THE N LT TNGT AND STAY WITH MSTLY CLR ELSEHWERE.
TEMP WISE...TRAJ SUGG LOWS COOLER THAN FWC GUID. WL TREND LOWS
TWD COOLER MAV TNGT.

SFC HI PRES BLDS SE THRU GRTLKS INTO OH VLY ON SUN. LO LVL CAA
WITH N-NE FLO. CENTER/S ENERGY BLOCK METHOD AND LO LVL THICKNESS
METHODS POINT TWD COOLER MAV. WL STAY WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKY COND
OVR NRN AND ERN SECTIONS AND MSTLY SUNNY ELSEWHERE.

SFC HI SETTLES INTO OH BY MON MRNG. CLR SKIES...LGT WNDS WL PROVIDE
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING REGIME. AGN PREFER TEMPS CLOSER TWD COOLER
MAV. 

DRY WX TO CONT MON AND INTO TUE WITH TEMPS WRMG AS FLO BACKS AND
S/WV RDGG BLDS INTO OH VLY. NXT CHC OF RAIN LOOKS TO BE TUE NGT/WED
TIME FRAME WITH S/WV TRACKING EWD THRU GRTLKS. BEST CHC FOR SHWRS
WL BE ACRS THE N.

343 
FXUS61 KILN 091956
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EST FRI NOV 9 2001

SFC RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING FROM THE LOWER MS RIVER VLY 
INTO THE OHIO VLY WILL SAG SOUTHWARD OVERNIGHT AS A COLD FRONT...NOW 
NEAR NRN PLAINS/CANADIAN BORDER...SWEEPS SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION.

ONLY A FEW HIGH CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED OVERNIGHT...SO MOSTLY CLEAR SKY 
WORDING WILL BE USED.  TEMPS WILL BE A LITTLE TRICKY AS A SOUTHWEST 
GRADIENT TIGHTENS.  WARMEST LOWS SHOULD BE ACROSS THE NORTHWEST CWFA 
WITH THE COOLEST READINGS IN THE SOUTHEAST.  

ON SATURDAY...MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST...DESPITE THE 
APPROACH OF THE COLD FRONT TO THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES BY 18Z (1 
PM).  MOST OF THE DEEP MSTR ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT SHOULD REMAIN 
TO THE NORTH AND EAST OF THE CWFA.  FCST MODEL SOUNDINGS CONFIRM 
THAT DESPITE VERY WARM AIR ALOFT...THE INVERSION IS TOO DEEP AND TOO 
STRONG TO MIX EFFECTIVELY.  THUS...MIXING UP TO AROUND 925 MB GIVES 
HIGHS IN THE MID 50S NORTH TO THE LOWER 60S SOUTH.  BREEZY 
CONDITIONS WILL BE USED ACRS THE NRN CWFA GIVEN THE PRESSURE 
GRADIENT AND A LITTLE MIXING INTO THE 925 MB LEVEL.

AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT SHOULD BE NEAR THE OHIO RIVER BY 00Z 
SUNDAY (7 PM SATURDAY EVENING) AND THEN SOUTH OF THE REGION BY 03Z 
SUNDAY.  CAA BEHIND THE FRONT WILL DROP HIGH TEMPERATURES ON SUNDAY 
5 TO 10 DEGREES.

SFC HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE OVER THE CWFA SUNDAY NIGHT...PROVIDING 
FOR COLD LOWS.  A SLOW WARM UP IS EXPECTED EARLY INTO NEXT WEEK AS 
THE FLOW BECOMES SOUTHWESTERLY ONCE AGAIN.  THE NEXT CHANCE FOR PCPN 
STILL LOOKS POISED FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS A ZONAL TYPE FLOW 
PATTERN TRIES TO DEVELOP.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

WHICH KICKS IN ABT 50 DEGS SEEMS REASONABLE. WL MAKE MINOR COOLER 
ADJUSTMENT TO TDA/S HI TEMPS.     

.ILN...NONE.

OVERNIGHT. THIS SHOULD ONLY BRING AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER TO NRN 
FCST AREA AS ATMOSPHERE IS QUITE DRY UNDER THE MEAN RIDGING PATTERN. 
THIS TROF IS IN RELATION TO A S/W NORTH OF THE GTLKS. SFC CENTER OF 
LOW PRESSURE ALSO DEVELOPS HERE...BUT LOOKS TO BE TOO FAR N OF FCST 
AREA TO REALLY BE A PLAYER. WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER BUT NOT MUCH 
ELSE FOR THIS FEATURE. 

MRF HINTING AT A RETURN TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
WM FNT APPROACHES SWRN FCST AREA 12Z MONDAY AND LIFTS TO THE NORTH 
LATER THAT NIGHT. THOUGH CANADIAN MODEL ONLY GOES OUT TO 0Z 
MON...PICTURED WITH THE MRF AT THIS TIME...THIS CHANCE OF RAIN LOOKS 
REASONABLE AND WILL PUT IN 30 POPS FOR THE DAY AND NIGHT. STRENGTH 
OF THE HIGH TO THE EAST AND THE LOW IN THE PLAINS SHOULD ALLOW THIS 
CHANCE OF RAIN TO ZIP NORTH AND BE OUT OF THE PICTURE ON TUESDAY. 
MRF HOLDS BACK AND KEEPS A CHANCE OF RAIN FOR TUESDAY...BUT ILL ERR 
ON THE SIDE OF OPTIMISM AND EXPECT THE FLOW TO PUSH IT NORTH. 

GUIDANCE TEMPS OUTSIDE OF THURSDAY LOOK REASONABLE. TIMING OF THE 
FRONT WILL BE THE BIGGEST CHANCE FOR ERROR ON TEMPS. FWC PUSHES 
READINGS TO THE UPPER 60S ACROSS ENTIRE FCST AREA THOUGH AVN IS 
STILL LOOKING AROUND 60. AGREE THAT THICKNESSES WILL DEFINITELY 
SUPPORT THE WARMER TEMPS...BUT CI SHIELD AHEAD OF FRONT SHOULD 
HAMPER HIGHS THIS DAY. WILL PLAY THE MIDDLE ROAD HERE AND RANGE FROM 
LOW 60S NORTHWEST TO AROUND 70 IN THE SOUTHEAST. OTHERWISE WILL STAY 
NEAR GUIDANCE THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT (50S AND 30S) AND THEN WARM FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.

.ILN...NONE.

HIGHS TDA 2-3 DGRS WRMR THAN YSTRDY. THIS IN LINE WITH ENERGY BLOCKS

THUS MID 50S N TO UPR 50S S SEEMS RSNBL. RMDR FCST ALSO LOOKS GOOD 
SO DO NOT PLAN ON ISSUING AN UPDATE.

.ILN...NONE.

HIGHS FOR THE WEEKEND COULD PUSH THE 60S...ESPECIALLY SOUTH...BUT NW

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS SOUTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY

SUNDAY.

LOW PRESSURE IN CANADA.  LINE OF SHRA ARE OCCURRING IN OUR CWA OUT 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  MODELS AGREE IN MOVING FRONT THROUGH OUR AREA 
BY 06Z TONIGHT AND SHOWERS WILL BE OUT OF HERE BEFORE THAT.  

RAPID CLEARING WILL ACCOMPANY HIGH PRESSURE FOLLOWING FRONT AS 
EVIDENT ON SATELLITE...SO ILL GO WITH MOSTLY CLEAR IN OUR NORTHWEST 
ZONES.  ILL KEEP CHANCE OF EVENING SHRA SOUTH AND EAST...THEN MOSTLY
CLEAR/PARTLY CLOUDY.

WITH HIGH BUILDING EASTWARD ACROSS THE AREA ON SATURDAY...ILL STAY 
WITH MOSTLY SUNNY.  A FEW CLOUDS SHOULD MOVE THROUGH WITH SHORT WAVE 
SATURDAY NIGHT...SO PARTLY CLOUDY WILL WORK THEN.

MODELS DIFFER ON NEXT SHORT WAVE DUE TO AFFECT OUR AREA ON SUNDAY. 
AVN AND ETA BOTH SHOW STRONG SHORT WAVE RESULTING IN AMPLIFICATION 
OF TROF WITH AXIS OVER NEW YORK STATE.  AVN GIVES US MINOR QPF ON 
SUNDAY...WHILE ETA BRINGS A GOOD SHOT OF DRY AIR.  SINCE THE AVN 
USUALLY HAS THE OVERALL PATTERN CORRECT BUT OFTEN EXAGGERATES QPF I 
EXPECT WELL JUST SEE A FEW CLOUDS HERE SO ILL KEEP PARTLY CLOUDY 
FCST EAST AND GO WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SOUTH AND WEST. THOUGH WINDS WILL 
BE FROM THE RIGHT DIRECTION FOR LAKE EFFECT...TEMPS WILL BE TOO WARM 
FOR PRECIP TO FORM.  

WITH MILD TEMPS EVIDENT BEHIND THE FRONT IN ILLINOIS...ILL RAISE 
SATURDAYS FCST HIGHS TOWARD FWC.  SINCE NGM SOLUTION LOOKS TOO WEAK 
FWC TEMPS WILL PROBABLY BE TOO HIGH FOR SUNDAY.  THEREFORE ILL 
TREND TOWARD THE MAV AND GO WITH LOW 60S SUNDAY.  

.ILN...NONE.

900 PM EST THU NOV 1 2001

WINDS HAVE DROPPED OFF TO AROUND 10 MPH IN MOST EVERYWHERE 
DESPITE DECENT LLVL WINDS. WILL BACK OFF ON WINDS TO AROUND 10 MPH 
AND DROP RFW. 

A BAND OF COOLING CLOUD TOPS IS FORMING IN NW OH AND SOME DROPS 
COULD BE REACHING THE GROUND. WILL LEAVE TIMING OF AFTER 
MIDNIGHT/LATE FOR NW ZNS. TEMPS ARE COOLING IN THE SW QUICKER THAN 
DUE TO THINNER CLD COVER AND SOME LIGHTER WINDS. WILL DROP LOWS 
THERE TO MID 50S.

LOOKS LIKE MDLS ARE OVERDOING THE MSTR AT BOTH THE SFC AND LLVLS 
WHICH WOULD ACCOUNT FOR THE LACK OF PRECIP ALONG THE FRONT. WHERE 
THE 850 DWPTS ARE ARND 10 IN CNTRL IL THE SHOWERS ARE BECOMING MORE 
NUMEROUS. WILL LEAVE FRI POPS AS IS IN HOPES THAT RAIN AREA WILL 
CONTINUE TO GROW AS THE FRONT APPROACHES.  

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE









FXUS61 KILN 012033
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EST THU NOV 1 2001

AREA UNDER SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH RIDGE ALONG THE EAST COAST AND 
TROF DIGGING INTO UPPER PLAINS.  TROF IS PROGGED TO PROGRESS THROUGH 
THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY ON FRIDAY TO THE EAST COAST BY 
SATURDAY. THOUGH TROF WILL HAVE RELATIVELY LOW AMPLITUDE...SHORT 
WAVE ENTERING THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT AND FRIDAY WILL SCOOP UP A 
DECENT AMOUNT OF MOISTURE.

SFC MAP SHOWS COLD FRONT ASSOC WITH SHORT WAVE IN EASTERN IOWA 
TRAILING FROM LOW IN CANADA.  THOUGH FRONT CURRENTLY HAS ONLY A FEW 
ASSOC SHRA...AREA OF PRECIP WILL EXPAND BY THE TIME THE FRONT GETS 
HERE AS SHORT WAVE ROUNDS BASE OF TROF AND ADDS UPPER SUPPORT.  AVN 
AND ETA AGREE IN TIMING THE FRONT JUST THROUGH OUR CWA AT 00Z 
FRIDAY EVENING.  

MODELS HAVE SLOWED SYSTEM AND STRENGTHENED CONVERGENCE A BIT WRT 
PREVIOUS RUNS. ILL KEEP CHANCE POPS NORTHWEST LATE TONIGHT AS 
ACTIVITY STILL COULD ARRIVE THERE BY 12Z.  ILL CONTINUE LIKELY POPS 
ALL ZONES FRIDAY...WHILE ADDING CHANCE OF THUNDER WITH MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY INDICATED.  I THINK THAT PRECIP WILL OVER BY EVENING IN 
NORTHWEST PART OF CWA...WHILE LINGERING IN THE SOUTH AND EAST WHERE 
ILL KEEP CHANCE EVENING SHRA.  HIGH PRESSURE MOVING IN BEHIND THE 
FRONT WILL RESULT IN MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ALL LOCATIONS ON SATURDAY.  

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK GOOD SO I WONT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THEM.  
THIS WILL NOT BE A PARTICULARLY STRONG COLD FRONT FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR WITH POST-FRONTAL HIGHS REMAINING CLOSE TO 60 ON SATURDAY.

.ILN......RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING ALL 
ZONES.

CONIGLIO






FXUS61 KILN 010811
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 AM EST THU NOV 1 2001

IR SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS MORNING SHOWS CIRRUS ACRS THE FCST 
REGION.  MAINLY HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS WILL CONTINUE FOR THE GOOD PART 
OF THE DAY.  CWFA WILL BE INFLUENCED BY A MID LVL RIDGE TODAY.  THE 
AXIS OF THE RIDGE WILL MOVE OFF THE EASTERN SEABOARD BY TONIGHT AS A 
COLD FRONT FROM THE PLAIN STATES MOVES TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VLY.  INCREASING PRESSURE GRADIENT COMBINED WITH SOME STRONGER 
WINDS ALOFT WILL RESULT IN BREEZY CONDITIONS MOST AREAS DURING THE 
DAY LIGHT HOURS.  FCST SOUNDINGS AND THICKNESS SCHEMES POINT TO 
HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S.

AVN AND ETA ARE FAIRLY SIMILAR WITH THE TIMING OF THE COLD FRONT 
TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.  CLOUDS WILL THICKEN OVERNIGHT...AND A 
FEW SHOWERS WILL PROBABLY DRIBBLE INTO THE NORTHWEST SECTIONS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT AND TOWARD SUNRISE.

AS THE FRONT MOVES ACRS THE REGION DURING FRIDAY...ENOUGH UPPER LVL 
DIVERGENCE COMBINED WITH LOW LVL FORCING SHOULD BRING SHOWERS TO OUR 
REGION.  I PLAN ON KEEPING THE LIKELY POPS OVER THE NRN SECTIONS AND 
WILL INCLUDE LIKELY IN THE SOUTH AS WELL.  SIGNIFICANT DRYING IS 
INDICATED AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE...AND WILL PROBABLY HAVE TO END THE 
SHOWERS IN THE NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS BY MID AFTERNOON.  CLOUDS AND 
SHOWERS SHOULD HOLD TEMPS DOWN IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S MOST 
LOCATIONS.

OTHER THAN A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS EARLY FRIDAY EVENING...CLEARING 
SKIES WILL MOVE RAPIDLY INTO THE REGION.

MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON SATURDAY AS SFC HIGH 
PRESSURE WEDGES INTO THE REGION.
 
.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

UPR RDG AXIS OVR OH VLY/GRTLKS RGN WL SHIFT E AS S/WV OVR 
PACIFIC NW AMPLIFIES THE NRN STREAM AND TRACKS ACRS SRN CAN.

ON BACK SIDE OF SFC HI PRES SRLY FLO WL CONT TNGT WITH AN INCRS
IN HI LVL MSTR. WL GO WITH MSTLY CLR SKY COND AND TEMPS A LTL
COOLER THAN GUID VALUES.

ON THU UPR LVL FLO BACKS AS AFOREMENTIONED TROF TRACKS EWD ACRS
SRN CAN PLNS. SFC GRAD INCRS WITH GUSTY SWRLY WNDS XPCTD. TEMP WISE
ANOTHER WARM DAY INSTORE FOR THE RGN. HV GONE A DEG OR SO WRMR THAN 
GUID VALUES.

ETA MODEL HS TRENDED TWD AVN SOLN BEING DEEPER AND FARTHER S WITH 
UPR LO OVR SRN CAN. WEAK LO LVL CNVRGC AND DEEP MSTR INTO NW OH LT 
THU NGT. WL LIMIT CHC SHWRS TO NRN MIAMI VLY LT THU NGT. 

ASSOCIATED CDFNT TO PASS THRU OH THU AFTN/EVE. BEST DYNAMICS ACRS
THE N WITH THIS SYS. WL GO WITH TREND POPS FM LKLY N TO CHC ACRS THE
S ON FRI. AVN HS MOST CONSISTENT SOLN WITH SLIGHTLY SLOWER FROPA.
WL KEEP A LO POP CHC OF A SHWR FRI EVE IN ERN SECTIONS. GIVEN 
ANTICIPATED CLD COVER PREFER TEMPS A LTL WRMR THAN GUID THU NIGHT AND
A LTL COOLER DURG THE DAY FRI.

.ILN...NONE.

331 
FXUS61 KILN 310813
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 AM EST WED OCT 31 2001

LATEST SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS A MID LVL/HIGH LVL CLOUD MIX ACRS THE 
NRN CWFA WITH MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS ACRS THE SOUTH.

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM FORECAST.  500 
MB RIDGING WILL TAKE PLACE ACRS THE CWFA TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT. THIS 
WILL ALLOW MID LVL MSTR NOW OVER THE NRN CWFA TO MOVE EAST...THEN NE 
DURING THE MORNING HOURS...LEAVING ONLY SOME CIRRUS IN ITS WAKE.  
THE REMAINDER OF THE REGION WILL JUST HAVE SCATTERED CIRRUS.  WARM 
TEMPS ARE FCST FOR TODAY AS 1000-850 MB THICKNESSES RISE COMPARED TO 
YESTERDAY/S VALUES.  HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S CAN BE EXPECTED OVER THE 
ENTIRE AREA.  THESE HIGHS WILL BE ABOUT 8 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL 
FOR THIS LATE IN OCTOBER.

AS STATED EARLIER...MID LVL RIDGING WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR 
OVERNIGHT.  TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE MID TO UPPER 40S.

ON THURSDAY...THERE WILL BE AN INCREASE IN THE HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS 
AS A WEATHER SYSTEM CURRENTLY ACRS THE GREAT BASIN MOVES INTO THE 
MID SECTION OF THE UNITED STATES.  THICKNESS SCHEMES SUGGEST ABOUT A 
2 TO 3 DEGREE WARM UP COMPARED TO TODAY/S VALUES.  HOWEVER...ENERGY 
BLOCK METHOD FROM FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE TEMPS WILL BE ABOUT 
THE SAME.  WILL ONLY WARM THE SOUTHERN LOCATIONS ABOUT A DEGREE AND 
LEAVE THE REMAINDER ABOUT THE SAME AS TODAY/S VALUES DO TO THE 
CONFLICTING DATA.

ANOTHER S/WV FROM THE PAC NW WILL ABSORB AFOREMENTIONED S/WV ON 
THURSDAY AS IT TRAVERSES ALONG THE UNITED STATES/CANADIAN BORDER.  
AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WITH THIS FEATURE WILL PUSH TOWARD THE 
REGION THURSDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY.  ENOUGH 
MOISTURE AND LOW LVL FORCING WILL BRING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS THURSDAY 
NIGHT ACRS THE WRN 2/3 OF THE CWFA AND TO THE ENTIRE AREA ON 
FRIDAY.  AS THE FRONT MOVES EAST FRIDAY NIGHT...A FEW SHOWERS MAY 
LINGER IN THE EVENING ACRS THE ERN CWFA.  SKIES WILL CLEAR FROM 
NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST FRIDAY NIGHT.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

CLOUDS HAVE THICKENED TODAY ALONG AND NORTH OF WARM FRONT.

WITH THE SURFACE LOW OVER MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AT 60 HRS.  AS FOR 
TONIGHT THE CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY CLEAR FROM THE SOUTH AS THE WARM 
FRONT PULLS NORTH ACROSS THE FA.  SKIES WILL BE MO CLEAR/SUNNY IN 
THE WARM SECTOR UNTIL THE NEXT COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND MOVES 
THROUGH LATTER IN THE WEEK.  WITH DRY PATTERN IN PLACE AND FRONT NOT 
BEING ALL THAT STRONG WILL KEEP 30 POPS AND KEEP THEM LIMITED TO THE 
PERIOD IN WHICH THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH.  

FWC TEMPS LOOK VERY GOOD WILL ONLY MAKE A TWEAK OR TWO.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

FXUS61 KILN 300822
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 AM EST TUE OCT 30 2001

08Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT NEAR I-70 ACRS OHIO AND 
INDIANA..THEN INTO CNTRL ILLINOIS AND NRN MISSOURI.  THIS FRONT WILL 
SAG SLOWLY INTO THE SRN CWFA THIS MORNING...BECOMING HARD TO DISCERN 
AT THE SFC BY THE AFTN HOURS AS THE FLOW BECOMES EASTERLY.  CURRENT 
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS HIGH SC/LOW AC CLOUD DECK ACRS THE DAY...CVG 
AND CMH LOCATIONS.  THIS SEEMS TO BE IN RESPONSE TO MSTR NEAR 775 
MB.  ISENTROPIC LIFT NEAR THIS PRESSURE LEVEL (300 K) INDICATES THAT 
WEAK LIFT WILL CONTINUE DURING THE MORNING HOURS...AND PERHAPS 
WEAKEN EVEN FURTHER BY THE AFTN HOURS.  IT IS DIFFICULT ATTM TO KNOW 
IF THE WEAKER LIFT BY AFTERNOON COMBINED WITH SOME HEATING OF THE 
SUN (TO LOWER THE RH VALUES WITHIN THE CLOUD DECK) WILL BE ENOUGH TO 
DISSIPATE THE CLOUDS.  WILL GO OPTIMISTIC AND BELIEVE THIS WILL BE 
THE CASE BY THE AFTN HOURS.  WITH WEAK CAA ACRS THE NORTH...TEMPS 
WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN YESTERDAY/S READINGS.  MOS TEMPS LOOK 
GOOD.

FOR TONIGHT...THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT ACRS INDIANA AND 
ILLINOIS WILL MOVE NE AS A WARM FRONT INTO THE SRN GREAT LAKES.  
BOTH THE ETA AND AVN MODEL SEEM TO SHOW SOME CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK TO 
THE VORTICITY MAX ACRS MICHIGAN TONIGHT.  A MESO SCALE COMPLEX IS 
FORECAST TO FORM ACRS SRN WISCONSIN...MOVING INTO SRN MICHIGAN.  850 
MB TO 300 MB THICKNESS PATTERN WOULD SUGGEST THAT SOME PCPN MAY 
DRIBBLE INTO THE FAR NRN CWFA OVERNIGHT.  WILL KEEP A SILENT 20 
POP ACRS THE NORTH ATTM.  SKIES WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY OVERNIGHT AS 
MAINLY MID TO HIGH LVL CLOUDS MOVES ACRS THE REGION.

ON WEDNESDAY...WARM FRONT WILL LIFT NE AWAY FROM THE REGION.  RH 
PROGS AT HIGH LVLS SUGGEST SOME CIRRUS.  WILL KEEP THE OPTIMISTIC 
MOSTLY SUNNY FCST.  TEMPS WILL WARM NICELY INTO THE MID 60S TO 
AROUND 70.

NEXT CHC FOR PRECIPITATION MAY NOT HAPPEN UNTIL FRIDAY AS A 
WEAKENING COLD FRONT TRIES TO PUSH THROUGH THE REGION.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

564 
FXUS61 KILN 300822
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 AM EST TUE OCT 30 2001

08Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT NEAR I-70 ACRS OHIO AND 
INDIANA..THEN INTO CNTRL ILLINOIS AND NRN MISSOURI.  THIS FRONT WILL 
SAG SLOWLY INTO THE SRN CWFA THIS MORNING...BECOMING HARD TO DISCERN 
AT THE SFC BY THE AFTN HOURS AS THE FLOW BECOMES EASTERLY.  CURRENT 
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS HIGH SC/LOW AC CLOUD DECK ACRS THE DAY...CVG 
AND CMH LOCATIONS.  THIS SEEMS TO BE IN RESPONSE TO MSTR NEAR 775 
MB.  ISENTROPIC LIFT NEAR THIS PRESSURE LEVEL (300 K) INDICATES THAT 
WEAK LIFT WILL CONTINUE DURING THE MORNING HOURS...AND PERHAPS 
WEAKEN EVEN FURTHER BY THE AFTN HOURS.  IT IS DIFFICULT ATTM TO KNOW 
IF THE WEAKER LIFT BY AFTERNOON COMBINED WITH SOME HEATING OF THE 
SUN (TO LOWER THE RH VALUES WITHIN THE CLOUD DECK) WILL BE ENOUGH TO 
DISSIPATE THE CLOUDS.  WILL GO OPTIMISTIC AND BELIEVE THIS WILL BE 
THE CASE BY THE AFTN HOURS.  WITH WEAK CAA ACRS THE NORTH...TEMPS 
WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN YESTERDAY/S READINGS.  MOS TEMPS LOOK 
GOOD.

FOR TONIGHT...THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT ACRS INDIANA AND 
ILLINOIS WILL MOVE NE AS A WARM FRONT INTO THE SRN GREAT LAKES.  
BOTH THE ETA AND AVN MODEL SEEM TO SHOW SOME CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK TO 
THE VORTICITY MAX ACRS MICHIGAN TONIGHT.  A MESO SCALE COMPLEX IS 
FORECAST TO FORM ACRS SRN WISCONSIN...MOVING INTO SRN MICHIGAN.  850 
MB TO 300 MB THICKNESS PATTERN WOULD SUGGEST THAT SOME PCPN MAY 
DRIBBLE INTO THE FAR NRN CWFA OVERNIGHT.  WILL KEEP A SILENT 20 
POP ACRS THE NORTH ATTM.  SKIES WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY OVERNIGHT AS 
MAINLY MID TO HIGH LVL CLOUDS MOVES ACRS THE REGION.

PROGS AT HIGH LVLS SUGGEST SOME CIRRUS.  WILL KEEP THE OPTIMISTIC 
MOSTLY SUNNY FCST.  TEMPS WILL WARM NICELY INTO THE MID 60S TO 
AROUND 70.

NEXT CHC FOR PRECIPITATION MAY NOT HAPPEN UNTIL FRIDAY AS A 
WEAKENING COLD FRONT TRIES TO PUSH THROUGH THE REGION.

FXUS61 KILN 292032
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EST MON OCT 29 2001

CENTRAL TO WESTERN CONUS CURRENTLY DOMINATED BY BROAD UPPER RIDGE.  
RIDGES INFLUENCE WILL PERSIST THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK AS ITS AXIS 
SHIFTS ACROSS OHIO TOWARD THE EAST COAST.  A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES 
WILL RIDE THROUGH THE RIDGE OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS...BUT MOST OF 
THEIR EFFECTS WILL STAY NORTH OF OUR CWA WITH ONLY SOME CLOUDS 
EXPECTED HERE.

SFC MAP SHOWS COLD FRONT FROM SOUTHERN MICHIGAN TO KANSAS.  MODELS 
BRING FRONT SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER TONIGHT...THEN BACK NORTH AS A 
WARM FRONT BY LATE TUESDAY IN RESPONSE TO SECOND SHORT WAVE.  AVN 
TAKES FRONT FARTHER SOUTH THAN ETA...THEN KEEPS CLOUDS AND QPF OVER 
OUR AREA INTO TUESDAY NIGHT IN CONTRAST TO ETA WHICH MOVES MOST 
MOISTURE NORTH OF HERE.  ALL MODELS SHOW AREA OF ELEVATED 
CONDITIONAL INSTABILITY AT 12Z WEDNESDAY...WITH THE AVN SHOWING AXIS 
OF INSTABILITY FARTHER SOUTH AROUND CVG.

SATELLITE AND OBS INDICATE CLOUDS ALONG AND BEHIND FRONT.  MODELS 
SHOW CLOUDS INCREASING AS FRONT MAKES ITS WAY DOWN HERE.  WITH 
CLOUDS WORKING THEIR WAY DOWN HERE TONIGHT AND AFFECTING MAINLY OUR 
NORTHERN COUNTIES...PARTLY CLOUDY NORTH AND MOSTLY CLEAR SOUTH WILL 
STILL WORK FOR TONIGHT PERIOD.  

THOUGH FRONT WILL BE AROUND...IT WILL BE MOISTURE-STARVED...SO DRY 
FCST STILL LOOKS GOOD THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  FOR TUESDAY ILL GO WITH 
PARTLY SUNNY ALL ZONES WITH WARM FRONT AND ISENTROPIC LIFT PRESENT.  
CONTRARY TO AVN QPF SCENARIO...I DO NOT EXPECT PRECIP TO REACH 
GROUND AS ANYTHING THAT DEVELOPS INVOF ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL LIKELY 
DRY UP AS IT FALLS THROUGH DRY LAYER NEAR SFC. WEDNESDAY FCST OF 
MOSTLY SUNNY IS STILL APPROPRIATE WITH FRONT LIFTING FARTHER NORTH 
AND UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN.

AS FOR TEMPS...FWC TEMPS LOOK TOO WARM SO ILL TREND TOWARD THE 
COOLER MAV. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO








SHUD ALLOW SOME MID HI LVL CLDS TO MAKE IT INTO MAINLY NRN PORTIONS 
OF FA THRU THIS AFTN BUT MSTR NOT ALL THAT IMPRSV SO THINK MSTLY

BEFORE LIFTING IT BACK OFF TO THE NE. MESOETA BRINGING IT DOWN TO 
ABT I70 BY 12Z TUE MRNG AND THEN SLOWLY HAS IT PUSHING BACK TO THE 
NE THRU THE DAY ON TUE. WITH FNT WKNG...FORCING NOT ALL THAT GOOD.  
SUPPOSE WE COULD SEE A SPRINKLE OR TWO ACRS THE N LATE TNGT AND TUE 
BUT FOR NOW WL JUST GO PRTLY CLDY TNGT AND PRTLY SUNNY ON TUE AS DPR 
MSTR RMNS TO OUR N AND NE. S/W PASSING ACRS NRN ROCKIES THEN ALLOWS 
FOR S/W RDGG ACRS RGN TUE NGT INTO WED WITH SKIES BCMG MSTLY 
CLR/MSTLY SUNNY.

TDA BUT TRAJECTORIES AND FCST SNDGS ONLY SHWG UPR 50S FOR HIGHS SO

DPNDG ON CLDS AND HOW FAR S FNT ACTUALLY GETS. MAY GO A LTL COOLER 
FOR CMH AREA WHERE FNT AND CLDS SHUD HAV BEST CHC OF REACHING BUT 
ALL IN ALL WL STICK PRETTY CLOSE TO GUID.

NUMBERS.

059 
FXUS61 KILN 271820
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
221 PM EDT SAT OCT 27 2001

NO MAJOR DIFFERENCES IN THE MODELS THIS RUN.  HAVE BEEN SITTING HERE 
TRYING TO FIGURE OUT HOW QUICKLY THE CLOUDS WILL CLEAR TONIGHT.  SC 
HAS REFORMED DURING THE DAY AND THE WESTERN EDGE HAS NOT YET SHOWN 
SIGNS OF PUSHING EAST.  CENTER OF HIGH IS FORECAST TO REACH CENTRAL 
KY BY 06Z..THEN STRETCHES ACROSS KY FROM NE TO SW BY 12Z.

ALL MDOELS KEEPING 925 MOISTURE GREATER THAN 70 PERCENT ALL 
NIGHT...BUT 850 MOISTURE ON THE ETA GOES FROM 70 PERCENT AT 00Z TO 
LESS THAN 40-50 PERCENT BY 06Z.  EXPECT TO SEE A GRADUALLY DECREASE 
IN CLOUDS BETWEEN SUNSET AND MIDNIGHT.  WILL GO WITH A 
CLOUDY...BECOMING CLEAR SCENARIO.  NEW NGM MOS IS WARMER THAN 
00Z...BUT IS MORE IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS RUNS. DEWPOINTS ACROSS THE 
WESTERN COUNTIES ARE AROUND 30...BUT ACROSS THE EASTERN COUNTIES AND 
IN INDIANAN ARE IN THE LOWER TO MID 20S.  AS THE HIGH BUILDS IN FROM 
THE WEST...WINDS SHOULD BECOME WESTERLY BRINGING IN DRIER 
AIR...BEFORE THEY BECOME LIGHT.  FEEL THAT CURRENT FORECASTS NUMBERS 
ARE MORE IN LINE THAN CURRENT MOS...SO MAY ADD A DEGREE TO THOSE.  
COLDEST AREAS SHOULD BE IN THE SOUTHWEST.

HIGH PRESSURE IS ACROSS THE FA ON SUNDAY...SO SUNNY SKIES EXPECTED.  
DURING THE LAST COLD OUTBREAK WE WERE TOO SLOW IN WARMING 
TEMPERATURES.  WILL RAISE CURRENT FORECAST AND GO WITH MOS NUMBERS 
WHICH COINCIDE WITH TEMPERATURES TECHNIQUES PRETTY WELL. 

HIGH SLIDES TO THE EAST SUNDAY NIGHT...SO EXPECT SOUTHEAST TO BE THE 
COLDEST.  WITH CLEAR SKIES...WILL KNOCK A COUPLE OF DEGREES OFF NEW 
MOS...CLOSER TO CURRENT FORECAST.  

COLD FRONT TRIES TO PUSH INTO THE GREAT LAKES ON MONDAY...BUT 
STALLS IN THE LAKES.  FA STILL SHOULD SEE PLENTY OF SUN.  ONCE AGAIN 
NGM MOS IS MUCH WARMER THAN FORECAST ON MONDAY...PREFER THE WARMER 
NUMBERS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES


FXUS61 KILN 271820
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
221 PM EDT SAT OCT 27 2001

NO MAJOR DIFFERENCES IN THE MODELS THIS RUN.  HAVE BEEN SITTING HERE 
TRYING TO FIGURE OUT HOW QUICKLY THE CLOUDS WILL CLEAR TONIGHT.  SC 
HAS REFORMED DURING THE DAY AND THE WESTERN EDGE HAS NOT YET SHOWN 
SIGNS OF PUSHING EAST.  CENTER OF HIGH IS FORECAST TO REACH CENTRAL 
KY BY 06Z..THEN STRETCHES ACROSS KY FROM NE TO SW BY 12Z.

ALL MDOELS KEEPING 925 MOISTURE GREATER THAN 70 PERCENT ALL 
NIGHT...BUT 850 MOISTURE ON THE ETA GOES FROM 70 PERCENT AT 00Z TO 
LESS THAN 40-50 PERCENT BY 06Z.  EXPECT TO SEE A GRADUALLY DECREASE 
IN CLOUDS BETWEEN SUNSET AND MIDNIGHT.  WILL GO WITH A 
CLOUDY...BECOMING CLEAR SCENARIO.  NEW NGM MOS IS WARMER THAN 
00Z...BUT IS MORE IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS RUNS. DEWPOINTS ACROSS THE 
WESTERN COUNTIES ARE AROUND 30...BUT ACROSS THE EASTERN COUNTIES AND 
IN INDIANAN ARE IN THE LOWER TO MID 20S.  AS THE HIGH BUILDS IN FROM 
THE WEST...WINDS SHOULD BECOME WESTERLY BRINGING IN DRIER 
AIR...BEFORE THEY BECOME LIGHT.  FEEL THAT CURRENT FORECASTS NUMBERS 
ARE MORE IN LINE THAN CURRENT MOS...SO MAY ADD A DEGREE TO THOSE.  
COLDEST AREAS SHOULD BE IN THE SOUTHWEST.

HIGH PRESSURE IS ACROSS THE FA ON SUNDAY...SO SUNNY SKIES EXPECTED.  
DURING THE LAST COLD OUTBREAK WE WERE TOO SLOW IN WARMING 
TEMPERATURES.  WILL RAISE CURRENT FORECAST AND GO WITH MOS NUMBERS 
WHICH COINCIDE WITH TEMPERATURES TECHNIQUES PRETTY WELL. 

HIGH SLIDES TO THE EAST SUNDAY NIGHT...SO EXPECT SOUTHEAST TO BE THE 
COLDEST.  WITH CLEAR SKIES...WILL KNOCK A COUPLE OF DEGREES OFF NEW 
MOS...CLOSER TO CURRENT FORECAST.  

COLD FRONT TRIES TO PUSH INTO THE GREAT LAKES ON MONDAY...BUT 
STALLS IN THE LAKES.  FA STILL SHOULD SEE PLENTY OF SUN.  ONCE AGAIN 
NGM MOS IS MUCH WARMER THAN FORECAST ON MONDAY...PREFER THE WARMER 
NUMBERS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1015 AM EDT SAT OCT 27 2001

RADAR SHOWING A FEW LIGHT RETURNS EXTENDING FROM LAKE MICHIGAN DOWN 
TO BETWEEN RICHMOND INDIANA AND DAYTON.   FLOW AT 925 AND 850 MB 
REMAINS FROM THE NORTH/NORTHWEST THROUGHOUT THE AFTERNOON.  
THEREFORE CANNOT RULE OUT A FLURRY IN THE WEST THIS 
AFTERNOON...SO WILL LINGER PRECIP IN THE WEST.  IN THE EAST...THE 
FLOW WILL BE MORE OFF THE LP OF MICHIGAN...SO WILL END THE SNOW 
CHANCES THERE.

UPPER RIDGE TRIED TO BUILD IN DURING THE DAY...BUT THE LOW LEVEL 
FLOW REMAINS CYCLONIC.  WILL KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON...ALTHOUGH A FEW BREAKS ARE EXPECTED AND POSSIBLY THE 
INDIANA COUNTIES COULD BE PARTLY CLOUDY BY LATE AFTERNOON.

TEMPERATURE FORECASTS LOOK GOOD...SO NO CHANGE EXPECTED THERE.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW.


.ILN...NONE.
