AREA TDA WITH 9H WINDS RANGING FROM 30 KTS S TO 40 KTS FAR N. THINK 
WINDS WL STAY BLO ADVS CRITERIA BUT WL INDCT SOME GUSTS TO ARND 40  
IN THE N. 

FOR TNGT...S/W ENERGY STILL GNRLLY TO OUR N AND E BUT FETCH OFF OF 
LAKES BECOMES A LTL MORE FAVORABLE. HARD TO TELL EXACTLY WHERE 
THINGS MIGHT LINE UP SO FOR NOW WL JUST GO WITH 30 POPS ACRS NRN 
HALF OF FA AND TRY TO KP S DRY. WITH SOME COOLING OF BNDRY 
LAYER...WL GO AHD AND INDICT PSBL MIX FOR TNGT. 8H THERMAL TROF 
THEN BEGINS TO SHIFT E THRU THE DAY ON SAT. MAY HANG ON TO A LOW CHC 
ERLY IN THE N WITH OTHRWS MSTLY CLDY N/PRTLY CLDY S ON SAT. RIDGING 
THEN STARTS TO BUILD INTO RGN THRU ERLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. 

LLVL THICKNSS ONLY GIVING HIGHS IN THE LOWER 40S TDA BUT WINDS 
CRNTLY HELPING TO KP TEMPS UP SO WL PRBLY HAV TO GO WITH LOW TO MID 
40S FOR HIGHS TDA. THINK WINDS MAY STAY UP ENUF TNGT TO KP TMPS FM 
DROPPING OFF TOO MUCH SO WL GO A LTL WRMR THAN GUID FOR LOWS. LLVL 
THCNKSS RMN ON THE COOL SIDE FOR SAT SO WL UNDERCUT GUID TMPS A BIT 
FOR HIGHS. WNDS SHUD FINALLY DROP OFF FOR BETTER COOLING SAT NGT SO 
WL GO A LTL COOLER THAN GUID.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
355 PM EDT THU OCT 25 2001

STRONG WINDS CONTINUE TO BUFFET AREA...ESP NORTH WHERE THEY ARE AT 
LOW END OF ADV. HAVE EXTENDED THE ADVISORY SOUTH A TIER OF COUNTIES 
AND THROUGH SS. THINK THE BIG REASON WE HAVE SUSTAINED WINDS OVER 30 
IS THE ABUNDANT SUNSHINE TODAY HAS ALLOWED US TO MIX UP. WITH SUN 
GOING DOWN...EXPECT WINDS TO DROP BELOW 30 SUSTAINED AND FOR GUSTS 
TO DIMINISH. SAME GOES FOR TOMORROW WHEN WE SHOULD HAVE MORE CLOUDS 
ACROSS THE NORTH. BUT WINDS WILL REMAIN IN 20-30 CAT WHICH IS PLENTY 
WINDY.

MDLS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN TAKING UPR LOW AND STARTING TO OPEN IT 
AND PULL IT NE. THE NEXT VORT TO ROTATE AROUND BOTH LLVL AND UPR LOW 
WILL MOVE THRU FRIDAY WHICH WILL BRING THE CHC FOR PRECIP TO THE 
NORTH. WILL GO 40 PERCENT WITH SOME SN POSSIBLE TO MIX IN. BUT THINK 
IT WILL BE MAINLY AN AFTN EVENT SO THINK SNOW CHC IS SMALL. 

BREAK AGAIN FRI NITE BETWEEN VORTS BUT NRN AREAS STILL IN FAVORABLE 
FETCH SO WILL MAINTAIN 30 POP THERE. THEN UPR TROF FINALLY MOVES 
THRU SAT WITH A CHC EVERYWHERE. WILL NOT MENTION SN SOUTH. 

WILL GENERALLY SHAVE A FEW DEGS OFF FWC HI TEMPS. THANKS IWX FOR 
COORD.

.ILN...

OHZ026-OHZ034>035-OHZ042>046-OHZ051>056-OHZ060>065-OHZ070>072-OHZ074.

FXUS61 KILN 250749
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT THU OCT 25 2001

UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER WESTERN LAKE SUPERIOR WILL MOVE THROUGH 
SOUTHEASTERN CANADA DURING THE NEXT TWO DAYS.  OHIO VALLEY WILL STAY 
IN WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT THROUGH THE PERIOD. 

06Z SFC MAP SHOWS 979 MB LOW OVER EASTERN LAKE SUPERIOR...WITH TWO 
COLD FRONTS TRAILING FROM THE LOW.  FIRST COLD FRONT IS EAST OF HERE 
ALONG WITH SEVERE WX.  SECONDARY FRONT WAS LOCATED IN CENTRAL 
INDIANA.  MODELS DIFFER SLIGHTLY IN LOWS MOVEMENT...WITH ETA 
KEEPING IT FARTHER SOUTH THAN AVN BY 12Z FRIDAY.  

WITH PRECIP EAST OF HERE WINDS ARE MAIN FCST PROBLEM IN STRONG 
PRESSURE GRADIENT SOUTH OF SFC LOW.  EVEN THOUGH THE AVN TAKES SFC 
LOW FARTHER NORTH THAN THE ETA...AVN SFC WINDS ARE STRONGER...IN THE 
30 KT RANGE AT 18Z TODAY.  ETA HAS 25 KT SFC WINDS AT THE SAME TIME. 
ILL CONTINUE WINDY FCST WITH WEST WINDS 20-30 MPH TODAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY...WITH GUSTS TO 40 MPH DURING THE DAY.   

SATELLITE SHOWS CLOUDS AROUND SECONDARY FRONT MOVING BACK IN BEHIND 
DRY SLOT.  CLOUDS WILL BE MORE PREVALENT TODAY IN THE NORTH HALF OF 
OUR CWA CLOSER TO SFC LOW.  PREVIOUS FCST HAD SITUATION WELL COVERED 
WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH AND PARTLY SUNNY SOUTH.  FOR TONIGHT ILL 
USE SIMILAR SKY CONDITION FCST WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH AND PARTLY 
CLOUDY SOUTH.  ON FRIDAY LOW LEVEL WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WILL 
PERSIST.  ILL KEEP CLOUDY FCST NORTH...AND ADJUST TO MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SOUTH WHERE SOME DRIER AIR WILL WORK IN.  

HIGH TEMPS BEHIND SECONDARY FRONT WERE AROUND 50 WEDNESDAY SO ILL 
STAY BELOW FWC GUIDANCE TODAY IN UPPER 40S TO AROUND 50 AS PER 
PREVIOUS FCST.  ADDITIONAL COLD ADVECTION BY FRIDAY WILL RESULT IN 
COOLER READINGS IN LOW TO MID 40S...AGAIN BELOW FWC.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
925 PM EDT WED OCT 24 2001

WILL CLEAR TORNADO WATCH OVER REST OF THE WESTERN HALF OF FORECAST

469 
FXUS61 KILN 242159
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
600 PM EDT WED OCT 24 2001

WILL UPDATE TO ISSUE A FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR PORTIONS OF THE 
TRI-STATE...MAINLY FOR COUNTIES IN IMMEDIATE CVG AREA ALONG OHIO 
RIVER AND SE IND. THREE HOUR FLOOD GUIDANCE IS AROUND AN INCH FOR 
MUCH OF THIS AREA AND UPSTREAM VALUES OF ONE AND STP FORM IND AND 
IWX WOULD SUGGEST THAT WELL GET THIS. ONLY FLY IN OINTMENT WOULD BE 
SPEED OF THE LINE MOVING THROUGH...BUT GROUND IS QUITE SATURATED 
ATTM AND ANY RAIN WOULD BE NEAR TOTAL RUNOFF.

...3PM DISCUSSION...
SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES STRONG POSITIVELY TILTED COLD FRONT OVER 
EASTERN IL WITH WARM FRONT ENTERING THE TRI-STATE.  SATELLITE 
IMAGERY INDICATES PLENTY BREAKS IN THE WARM SECTOR WITH TDS INTO THE 
UPPER 60S.

COMPLICATED FORECAST SO WILL JUST HIT THE HIGHLIGHTS AND HAVE ZONES 
READY EARLY.  POSITIVELY TILTED COLD FRONT WILL BECOME NEGATIVELY 
TILTED THIS EVENING AND BLAST ACROSS THE FA.  CAPE VALUES ARE 
EXPECTED TO BE 1000 TO 2000 J/KG WITH HELICITIES IN EXCESS OF 300 
M2/S2.  AS A RESULT BULK RICHARDSON  IS VERY FAVORABLE IN THE 
TEENS.  WILL HIT EVENING THROUGH MIDNIGHT HARD WITH SEVERE WORDING 
EXPECT SPC TO ISSUE A BOX OVER WESTERN OHIO LATTER THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH DEVELOPMENT IN THE WARM SECTOR AND PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT.  
SKIES WILL CLEAR RAPIDLY FROM WEST TO EAST OVER FA.  WINDS WILL BE 
20 TO 30 MPH WITH SOME 40 MPH GUSTS THURSDAY.  THERE IS POTENTIAL 
FOR THEM TO BE STRONGER WHICH COULD PUSH INTO WIND ADVISORY BUT WILL 
LET LATTER SHIFTS DEAL WITH IT.  WILL KEEP MENTION OF RAIN AND SNOW 
ACROSS THE NORTH ON FRIDAY THRU SATURDAY BUT WILL DRY OUT THE SOUTH 
EXCEPT FRIDAY NIGHT.

FWC LOOKS RESPECTABLE FOR THE FIRST 3 PERIODS BUT WENT SIGNIFICANTLY 
COLDER...CLOSER TO MAV...FOR THE 4TH PERIOD. 

.ILN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH INZ073>075-080 KYZ089>093 OHZ077-078.

FRANKS





942 
FXUS61 KILN 240814
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
414 AM EDT WED OCT 24 2001

WITH UPPER LOW DROPPING INTO NORTH DAKOTA...OHIO VALLEY IS IN VERY 
MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THIS MORNING.  WITH AVN SHOWING MORE 
CONSISTENCY...MODELS PROGS HAVE UPPER LOW MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES TO NEW ENGLAND BY FRIDAY.

SHORT WAVE MOVING INTO INDIANA IS TOUCHING OFF WIDESPREAD TSRA.  
TSRA ARE WORKING THROUGH OUR CWA AND SHOULD CONTINUE TO DO SO INTO 
MID MORNING.  DRY SLOT EVIDENT ON SATELLITE BEHIND SHORT WAVE SHOULD 
BE HERE BY LATE MORNING BRINGING DESTABILIZING BREAKS IN THE 
CLOUDS.  AFTER DRY SLOT STRONG COLD FRONT WILL ARRIVE IN OUR WESTERN 
COUNTIES ACCOMPANIED BY POWERFUL AND WELL ORGANIZED OMEGA...WIND 
FIELDS/HELICITY...PVA...AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE.  THUS...WE ARE 
OUTLOOKED IN HIGH RISK FOR SVR (SEE SWODY1). 

WITH PRECIP ALREADY OCCURRING AND PERSISTING ILL GO ABOVE FWC POPS 
TODAY INTO NEAR 100% RANGE.  PRECIP WITH FRONT WILL CONTINUE INTO 
TONIGHT PERIOD SO CAT POPS AGAIN WILL BE APPROPRIATE.  ILL GO WITH 
SEVERE WORDING TODAY AND TONIGHT.    

LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEHIND FRONT TONIGHT AND THURSDAY WILL WARRANT 
MOSTLY CLOUDY FORECAST.

RATHER LOW SOIL MOISTURE PRIOR TO CURRENT RAINFALL HAS PREVENTED 
FLOODING PROBLEMS...UNTIL NOW.  SOUTHEAST INDIANA HAS BEEN HARDEST 
HIT WITH 6-8 RADAR ESTIMATE IN RIPLEY COUNTY (FFW ISSUED).  

FWC TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR TODAY.  TONIGHTS FWC LOWS AND 
THURSDAYS HIGHS LOOK TOO HIGH BEHIND THE FRONT SO ILL UNDERCUT FWC 
FOR THEN.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

996 
FXUS61 KILN 231910
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 PM EDT TUE OCT 23 2001

VERY CHANGEABLE WEATHER WILL OCCUR ACROSS THE REGION.

MESOETA AND AVN IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH S/WV TIMING AND FRONTAL 
PASSAGE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM FORECAST.

TO START...A WEAK S/WV WAS NOTED OVER SRN IL/IN THIS AFTN.  VERY 
WARM...MOIST FLOW IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS FEATURE WILL BRING 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE CWFA THIS EVENING.  RADAR AND 
SATELLITE TRENDS CONFIRM THIS AS ACTIVITY WAS INCREASING IN COVERAGE.
BEHIND THIS FIRST S/WV IS ANOTHER S/WV...NOW LOCATED OVER OK/NRN TX.
THIS WILL ARRIVE TOWARD MORNING INTO THE MID OHIO VLY.  AS IT 
DOES...LOW LVL CONVERGENCE AT 925 MB AND 850 MB WILL TEAM UP WITH 
THIS S/WV TO CONTINUE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE REMAINDER OF 
THE NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING.  CONSEQUENTLY...WILL HAVE CHANCE 
POPS FAR NORTH (40?)...LIKELY POPS DAYTON AND COLUMBUS (70?) AND 
CATEGORICAL POPS SOUTH (80?) CVG AND PMH FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.

THE BIG STORY FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING WILL BE A VIGOROUS 
COLD FRONT/UPR LVL LOW CURRENTLY ACRS THE PAC NW/INTERMOUNTAIN 
REGION...WHICH WILL DIG SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES.  THERE 
SEEMS TO BE A SMALL WINDOW DURING THE EARLY AFTERNOON HOURS WHERE 
PCPN WILL BE ON THE LOW SIDE IN TERMS OF COVERAGE.  WITH VERY STRONG 
WINDS ABOVE THE SFC (50 TO 60 KT AT 925 MB BY LATE WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON) ...CAPES FROM 1000 TO 1500 AND MASSIVE DYNAMIC 
LIFT...SEVERE WEATHER IS POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT IN THE 
FORM OF A SQUALL LINE.  ISOLATED TORNADOES ARE ALSO NOT OUT OF THE 
QUESTION (STORM RELATIVE HELICITIES ABOVE 300 M2/S2).  IT WILL BE 
WINDY ON WEDNESDAY.  TEMPS WILL BE DEPENDENT ON WHETHER ANY SUNSHINE 
IS PRESENT WHICH COULD PUSH TEMPS INTO THE UPPER 70S.  I DO NOT HAVE 
THE CONFIDENCE OF THIS ATTM...SO WILL GO SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN MOS 
WITH TEMPS INTO THE LOWER TO MID 70S.

STRONG SUBSIDENCE WILL FOLLOW BEHIND THE FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO 
SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY.  WILL GO ABOUT A CATEGORY COLDER 
THAN MOS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT BECAUSE OF THIS.

IT WILL BE BRISK AND MUCH COLDER ON THURSDAY AS 850 MB 
TEMPS/THICKNESSES BEGIN TO FALL.  WITH COLD POOL AND DEVELOPING 
CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT WITH UPR TROF...WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY 
ATTM.

FRIDAY AND SATURDAY LOOK VERY COLD AS THE UPR TROF...850 MB TEMPS 
AROUND -8 REMAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA.  WITH THE MAIN JET BEING 
SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER AND COLD FLOW OFF THE GREAT LAKES...A CHANCE 
OF RAIN SHOWERS...AND YES...EVEN SNOW SHOWERS...WILL BE INTRODUCED 
INTO THE FORECAST.  1000-850 MB THICKNESSES SUPPORT SNOW SHOWERS FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  THE SMALL BUGABOO WILL BE HOW WARM THE 
BOUNDARY LAYER WILL BE TO ALLOW SNOWFLAKES TO REACH THE SURFACE.  
WILL WORD CHC OF RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY 
BECAUSE OF THIS.  HAVE GONE COLDER WITH HIGHS (UPPER 30S) AS BKN-OVC 
CONDITIONS/THICKNESSES SUPPORT THESE VALUES.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

370 
FXUS61 KILN 231444
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1044 AM EDT TUE OCT 23 2001

AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS NORTHWEST OHIO/EAST CENTRAL 
INDIANA IS LIFTING NORTHEAST RATHER QUICKLY...LEAVING SOUTHERN 
SECTIONS OF THE FA WITH JUST A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS.  THIS BATCH OF 
CONVECTION APPEARS TO ASSOCIATED WITH VORT LOBE THAT RACES INTO 
MICHIGAN BY 18Z.

FA IS IN A NVA EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THEN ANOTHER VORT SWINGS 
UP INTO SOUTHWEST OHIO BY 00Z.

WILL ADJUST SOUTHERN ZONES TO GO SCATTERED SHOWERS EARLY THIS 
AFTERNOON...THEN LIKELY LATE.  IN THE NORTH...WILL GO THE OTHER WAY 
AROUND...MENTIONING LIKELY POPS EARLY ...THEN TAPERING TO SCATTERED 
CONVECTION.

TEMPERATURES AND WINDS LOOK...SO NOW CHANGES THERE.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.
 

.ILN...NONE.

404 
FXUS61 KILN 230733
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
334 AM EDT TUE OCT 23 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN FEATURES BROAD TROF WITH AXIS OVER HIGH PLAINS 
RESULTING IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY.  TROF IS PROGGED 
TO STRENGTHEN AND BECOME CUTOFF OVER THE UPPER GREAT LAKES BY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH BOTH THE ETA AND 
AVN SPEEDING UP TROF AND DROPPING IT FARTHER SOUTH WRT PREVIOUS 
RUNS.  A GREAT DEAL OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL BE ROUNDING THE TROF 
AND AFFECTING OUR WX OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.  

SFC MAP SHOWS 1001 MB LOW OVER NORTHWEST ILLINOIS AHEAD OF FIRST 
SHORT WAVE WITH WARM FRONT ARCING THROUGH SOUTHERN LAKE MICHIGAN AND 
THEN INTO OHIO.  LOW WILL MOVE THROUGH WISCONSIN AND MICHIGAN 
TODAY...AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND MOISTURE WILL MOVE INTO OUR AREA 
ALONG WITH IMPRESSIVE WIND FIELD AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE.   
THEREFORE ILL KEEP LIKELY POPS TODAY.  FOR TONIGHT...ENOUGH 
MOISTURE AND PVA WILL LINGER TO KEEP CHANCE POPS NORTH...AND LIKELY 
POPS IN THE SOUTH WHERE MOISTURE AND PVA WILL BE GREATER. 

AS THE NEXT MORE VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST ON WEDNESDAY AHEAD 
OF THE CUTOFF LOW...A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH LATE IN 
THE DAY.  MODELS ARE SHOWING STRONG WINDS AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY...WITH 
50+ KT 850 MB JET INDICATED OVER SOUTH OHIO.  OMEGA ASSOC WITH SHORT 
WAVE WILL ALSO BE QUITE STRONG...WITH MOISTURE WELL STACKED AS 
WELL.  INSTABILITY WILL ALSO BE PRESENT WITH ETA SHOWING -6 LI JUST 
WEST OF CVG AT 18Z WEDNESDAY.  LIKELY POPS ABOVE FWC ARE STILL 
APPROPRIATE WITH THIS SYSTEM.  SWODY2 INDICATES MODERATE RISK SO 
ILL ISSUE SPS TO HEIGHTEN AWARENESS OF SVR WX THREAT. 

FWC TEMPS APPEAR TOO LOW FOR TODAY AND WEDNESDAY...AND TOO HIGH FOR 
POST-FRONTAL CONDITIONS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  ILL GO TOWARD MAV 
NUMBERS WITH LOW-MID 70S FOR HIGHS RATHER THAN AROUND 70 ON FWC.  
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT...ILL GO BELOW FWC WITH AROUND 40 WEST AND 
LOW/MID 40S SOUTH AND EAST WITH MESOETA SHOWING SHARP COOLING 
FOLLOWING THE FRONT. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

FNTL BNDRY STILL JST N OF FA AND XTNDGG BACK INTO NRN IN. FNT SLOW 
TO PUSH N TDY...BUT IS SHOWING SOME MOVEMENT. 

AS FAR AS MDL OF CHOICE...AVN HAS BEEN MOST CONSISTENT WTH THIS NXT 
SYSTEM FOR TNGT...WTH THE SECOND S/WV PUSHING THROUGH ON WED AND 
BRINGING THE ACTUAL SFC FNT THROUGH FA. ETA IS FALLING MORE IN LINE 
WITH AVN WITH EACH MDL RUN THO. AVN STILL MORE AGRESSIVE WTH 
DYNAMICS AND PCPN. 

LOOKS LIKE AS THE FNT APCHS TNT AND INTO EARLY TUE...WHILE WE GET A 
45 TO APCHNG 50KT LLJ DURING THE DAY ON TUE BEFORE THE FNT PRETTY 
MUCH STALLS OUT TO THE N OF FA. WL BRING IN A CHC OF PCP INTO 
DAY/LIM AREA LATE TNGT...BUT HOLD OFF TIL TUE FOR REST OF AREA. AS 
FIRST S/WV PUSHES THRU BY LATE TUE AFTN...SECONDARY VORT (CRNTLY NR 
TX/OK PANHANDLE) RUSHES NE AND MOVES OVR SRN FA FOR TUE NT. LLJ 
AGAIN INCRS...AS DOES 925 CONVG...ENHANCING PCP POTL. WL KEEP LIKELY 
POPS FOR SRN ZONES TUE NT WTH THIS FEATURE...WTH CHC ELSEWHERE. WL 
ALSO KEEP MTN OF THUNDER FOR SRN ZONES AS LLJ...WK INSTABY AND LL 
CONVERGENCE.

FCST CHALLENGES FOR WED INCLUDE TIMING OF PCPN. AS LLJ BREAKS DOWNS 
AND LL CONVG WEAKENS AS THE VORT PULLS OFF WED MORNING...WL LIKELY 
SEE A BREAK IN PCPN MOST AREAS. THEN AS THE THIRD S/WV FINALLY 
PUSHES IN FM NRN PLAINS AND BRINGS THE FNT WITH IT...PCP CHCS ON THE 
RISE FOR LATE WED AFTN AND THRU WED NIGHT. WL KEEP MTN OF THUNDER 
FOR WED ALSO...AS AGAIN SOME LL CONVG AND INSTABY AHEAD OF FNT. THIS 
WEAKENS BY WED NT...JUST CHC SHRA FOR FROPA.

FOR THU AND INTO THE WEEKEND...MAIN CHC FOR -SHRA WL BE DURING THE 
DAY AND EARLY EVENING ON FRI...SO WL KEEP MTN OF RAIN SHRA ONLY 
ATTM.  

LS1 CRASHED...SO HAVE TEMPORARILY LOST MY GFE. SO MISILN WL NOT BE 
READY TIL CLOSE TO 4PM.

.ILN...NONE.


DIAN-REED





FXUS61 KILN 221320
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
920 AM EDT MON OCT 22 2001

12Z SFC ANALYSIS SHOWED A STATIONARY FRONT ACRS CNTRL INDIANA INTO 
NRN OHIO (NORTH OF CWFA).  THIS STATIONARY FRONT WILL LIFT NORTH 
TODAY AS A WARM IN RESPONSE TO A DIGGING S/WV INTO THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS (CAUSING THE MID LVL FLOW TO BACK TO THE SOUTHWEST). AS A 
RESULT...A WARM DAY IS IN STORE FOR THE CWFA.  KILN SOUNDING YIELDS 
A HIGH OF 74 IN FULL SUNSHINE AND 72 WITH CLOUDS.  HOWEVER...THIS IS 
WITH AN 850 MB TEMP OF 9.4 C.  MODELS SHOW 850 MB TEMPS RISING TO 
AROUND 11.5 DURING THE AFTERNOON.  CONSEQUENTLY...THIS INCREASE 
YIELDS A HIGH OF 76 IN FULL SUNSHINE AND 74 WITH CLOUDS.  BOTTOM 
LINE...7O FAR NORTH...LOWER 70S DAYTON AND COLUMBUS REGIONS AND MID 
70S SOUTH LOOK ON TRACK.  WILL KEEP PARTLY CLOUDY WORDING AS CIRRUS 
IN WESTERLY FLOW AT 300 MB WILL MOVE ACRS THE REGION FROM TIME TO 
TIME COMBINED WITH AFTERNOON SCATTERED CUMULUS.           

WILL UPDATE NORTHERN ZONES TO CLEAN UP WORDING AND ADJUST TEMPS.

.ILN...NONE.

308 AM EDT MON OCT 22 2001

LTST SFC ANALYSIS SHWS E-W ORIENTED QUASI-STATIONARY FNT FM
NRN OH THRU NRN IN...CNTRL IL AND INTO CNTRL PLNS. THIS BNDRY
HS MOVD SLGTLY N TO PSN FM NR NR MFD TO AOH TO GUS. ELEVATED
TSTM COMPLEX ALONG AND N OF THIS BNDRY OVR E CNTRL IL AND NW 
IN TO MOV E AND WEAKEN. AS THE REMNANTS OF THESE STORMS PUSHES 
E THE SRN EDGE WL AFFECT THE NRN MIAMI VLY. WL MENT A CHC OF 
SHWRS AND A PSBL TSTM THIS MRNG. 

FNT MAY SAG A LTL S BRIEFLY IN WAKE OF THIS INITIAL PRECIP AND
THEN SHIFT NWD AS ZONAL UPR FLO BEGINS TO BACK IN RESPONSE TO
S/WV MOVG ACRS CNTRL PLNS INTO MID UPR VLY. BASED ON LO LVL
THICKNESS AND ENERGY BLOCK TECHNIQUES WL GO A LTL WRMR THAN
FWC GUID TEMPS TDA.

AFOREMENTED S/WV TO LIFT NE FM UPR MS VLY INTO GRTLKS TNGT.
AVN HS EXCELLENT RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY WITH ASSOCIATED SFC LO
OVR NRN LM BY 12Z TUE. ETA HS TRENDED FASTER CLOSER TO THE
AVN SOLN. WL FOLLOW FASTER AVN SOLN. DEEP MSTR AND AXIS OF 
950MB CNVRGC TO NRN MIAMI VLY BY 12Z. WL INTRO A CHC OF
SHWRS/TSTMS TOWARD SUNRISE IN THE FAR NW. 

AXIS OF LWR 60 DWPTS ADVECTS INTO OH VLY WITH PE/S INCRSG
TO ABV 1.0 INCH ACRS THE AREA TUE. FAVORABLE COUPLE OF 
UPR DIV/LO LVL CNVRGC PIVOTS INTO THE W BY 18Z AND ACRS 
THE ERN SECTIONS DURG AFTERNOON HOURS. WL CONT LKLY POPS
MENTIONING MAINLY AFTN TIMING IN THE E.

CDFNT DOES NOT MAKE IT THRU CWA WITH UPR FLO BACKING IN 
RESPONSE TO DIGGING SYS OVR THE PLNS. ISENT LIFT DEVELOPS
INTO OH VLY LT TUE NGT. WL MENT LO POP CHC TUE NGT IN THE
SW LATE TUE NGT. ASSOCIATED CDFNT TO PASS THRU CWA WED 
AFTN/NIGHT.                 

.ILN...NONE.

OF THE OHIO RIVER.  DO NOT PLAN ON INCLUDING THUNDER ATTM AS 
INSTABILITY AND FORCING FOR LIFT ARE RATHER WEAK...BUT WL MAKE FINAL 
DECISION AT ISSUANCE TIME.  ON MONDAY...ANTICIPATE A WELL MIXED WARM 
SECTOR DAY OVER ALL BUT THE FAR NORTH.  WL KEEP LOW CHC POPS ERLY 
ALONG THE I-70 CORRIDOR...AND A LITTLE LONGER FAR NORTH WHERE GUID 
ALSO SUGGESTING DECENT INSTABILITY BY MID AFTN.  NOT BUYING ALL THE 
LOW CLOUD PROGGED BY THE FWC...AND HV GONE PCLDY OVER ALL BUT THE 
FAR NORTH.

WL CONT DRY FCSTS MON NGT ALL ZONES.  FA GENERALLY IN REGIME OF 
LARGE SCALE FORCING FOR DOWNWARD MOTION...AND PCPN EFFICIENCIES 
REMAIN QUITE LOW.  ON TUE...VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE NOW EVIDENT OVER 
WASHINGTON WL INDUCE SFC WAVE DVLPMNT TO OUR WEST...AND PROVIDE A 
NICE SHOT OF LIFT.  BASED LARGELY ON IMPRESSIVE APPEARANCE OF SYS ON 
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY...WL FOLLOW MORE AGGRESSIVE ETA PRESENTATION 
WITH REGARDS TO PCPN CVRG ON TUE.

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK GOOD...EXCEPT TOO COOL IN WARM SECTOR ON 
MONDAY.  HV GENERALLY MADE 1-2 CATEGORY UPWARD ADJUSTMENTS...AND 
GIVEN ENUF SUN SOME U70S NOT OUT OF THE QSTN IN THE SOUTH.

.ILN...NONE.

920 AM EDT SUN OCT 21 2001

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS MORNING CONTINUES TO SHOW A S/WV OVER SRN 
MN AND NRN IOWA.  THIS S/WV IS FCST TO MOVE EAST TODAY INTO THE SRN 
GREAT LAKES.  MEANWHILE...12Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT 
FROM NW MICHIGAN...SOUTHWEST TO CHI...TO PIA...THEN INTO NRN MO.  
THE COMBINATION OF THE SLOW APCHING FRONT AND S/WV WILL BE THE FOCUS 
FOR PCPN ACTIVITY THIS AFTERNOON.

LATEST MESO ETA STILL SHOWS THE BEST LOW LVL CONVERGENCE (925 MB) 
AND UPR DIVERGENCE (FROM S/WV AND RR QUAD WITH ASSOCD JET) ACRS NE 
INDIANA AND NW OHIO THROUGH THE AFTN.  HIGHEST POPS NW CWFA STILL 
LOOK OK.  HOWEVER...WITH THE SLOW APCH OF THE FRONT...BELIEVE 
SHOWERS MAY BE LATE IN ARRIVAL TO THE DAYTON AREA.  THIS IS ALREADY 
REFLECTED IN THE CMH REGION.  ELSEWHERE...AN INCREASE IN 850 MB MSTR 
AND SFC DEWPOINTS WILL GENERATE SOME AFTN CUMULUS CLOUDS.  AN 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM IS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION ACRS NW OHIO AND NE 
INDIANA THIS AFTN AS MODEL SOUNDINGS GENERATE ABOUT 400 J/KG OF 
CAPE.  HOWEVER...AN INVERSION ABOVE THE 850 MB LEVEL DEVELOPS AS ONE 
HEADS FARTHER AWAY FROM NW OHIO (I.E. MOVING TOWARD THE SE).  WILL 
KEEP A WATCH FOR THUNDERSTORMS NEAR OUR NW CWFA THIS AFTN...BUT WILL 
KEEP THE CURRENT FCST TREND ATTM TO LEAVE IT OUT.

TEMPS LOOK GOOD AS ILN SOUNDING YIELDS 75 DEGREES IN FULL SUN AND 72 
DEGREES WITH CUMULUS CLOUDS.  THUS...ONLY CHANGES THIS MORNING WILL 
BE TO ADJUST THE SKY COVER AND TIMING OF PCPN.

.ILN...NONE.

FNT WITH PE/S ABV 0.7 OVR NRN MIAMI AFTR 18Z. BEST DYNAMICS TO STAY
TO THE N BUT WK 925 MB CNVRGC SHUD BE ENOUGH TO PROVIDE A CHC OF
SHWRS ACRS NRN AND CNTRL SECTIONS THIS AFTN. WL KEEP THE S DRY TDA. 
TEMP WISE...GUID VALUES CLOSE. WL GO A COUPLE DEGS WRMR IN THE S
WHERE MORE SUN IS OBSERVED.

AS FNT BCMS PARALLEL TO UPR FLO IT SHUD STALL OUT E-W ACRS
CNTRL OH TNGT. DEEP MSTR WL BE IN PLACE TNGT BUT ORGANIZED UPR
SUPP WL BE LACKING. WL CONT A LO POP CHC OF A SHWR. 

AS WV MOVES FM THE ROCKIES INTO THE CNTRL PLNS ON MON THE FNT
WL PIVOT N AS THE UPR LVL FLO BACKS. WL CONT A CHC OF SHWRS ERLY
ACRS THE CNTRL AND N WITH THE WRM FNTL PASSAGE...WHILE KEEPING THE S 
DRY. IN WRM SECTOR XPCT TO SEE SOME SUNSHINE. THEREFORE...WL TREND 
MON/S HI/S CLOSER TO WRMR MAV GUID.         
   

THE AVN MODEL IS MORE PROGRESSIVE WITH S/WV AND ASSOCICATED SFC
LO MOVG THRU THE GRTLKS TUE. THE ETA HS TRENDED SLOWER AND MORE
AMPLIED WITH UPR SYS. WL TREND FCST TOWARD FASTER AVN BRINGING
A CHC OF PRECIP INTO THE W DURG THE AFTN AND ACRS THE ENTIRE
RGN TUE NGT. TSTMS LOOK POSSIBLE TUE AFTN/EVE WITH SFC DWPTS
ARND 60 AND LI/S GOING BLO ZERO.

OUR AREA COMBINED WITH SOME LOW LVL MSTR.  I EXPECT A WEAKENING 
TREND OF SHOWERS...AND THUS...DO NOT PLAN TO INTRODUCE IN THE 
FORECAST. OTHERWISE...SC CLOUDS SHOULD MIX OUT SOME AS CONVECTIVE 
TEMP IN THE LOWER 60S ALLOWS MSTR LAYER TO MIX WITH DRIER AIR ALOFT.
ATTM...WILL CLEAN UP ZONE WORDING IN THE NORTH TO MENTION MOSTLY 
SUNNY.  IN THE SOUTH...WILL MENTION SOME MORNING CLOUDS...THEN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EDT FRI OCT 19 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT EXTENDING FROM SRN ONTARIO 
...SOUTHWEST INTO SE LOWER MICHIGAN...NE INDIANA...AND CNTRL 
ILLINOIS.  MODELS AGREE IN WASHING OUT THIS SFC FEATURE OVERNIGHT AS 
IT PUSHES INTO NW OHIO.  S/WV ENERGY ALOFT COMBINED WITH MAINLY MID 
LVL MSTR WILL KEEP SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY ACRS THE FCST AREA.  AS A 
RESULT...HAVE TWEAKED TEMPS A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER THAN GUIDANCE 
...AND WILL GO WITH MAINLY UPPER 40S MOST LOCATIONS.

OTHER THAN SOME MID LVL CLOUDINESS LINGERING ACRS THE NORTH SATURDAY 
MORNING...THE SKY CONDITION IS FCST TO BE MOSTLY SUNNY.  A SOUTHWEST 
FLOW COMBINED WITH SUNSHINE SHOULD BOOST TEMPS CLOSE TO MOS 
GUIDANCE...THUS WILL STICK CLOSE.

A ZONAL FLOW TYPE PATTERN WILL CONTINUE INTO SUNDAY WITH ADDITIONAL 
S/WVS RIPPLING THROUGH.  NEXT COLD FRONT WILL TRY TO PUSH INTO NW 
OHIO DURING SUNDAY AFTN.  THE AVN IS MOST AGRESSIVE WITH DEEPER 
MSTR.  HOWEVER...ATTM...WILL LEAN TOWARD MORE CONSERVATIVE ETA AND 
KEEP SKIES PARTLY SUNNY (THINKING MOST OF THE CLOUD COVER WILL BE OF 
THE HIGH VARIETY).  TEMPS AGAIN SHOULD BE CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE.

AFOREMENTIONED FRONT IS FCST TO SAG ACRS CNTRL OHIO SUNDAY 
NIGHT...AND WITH WAA AND A WEAK S/WV ON MONDAY...A FEW SHOWERS MAY 
DEVELOP OVER THE WEST.  WILL LEAVE A LOW CHANCE POP WEST AND REMOVE 
FROM THE EAST.

IN THE EXTENDED...ZONAL FLOW PATTERN WILL BECOME A LITTLE BIT 
NORTHWESTERLY IN NATURE.  THIS MEANS THAT S/WVS WILL BE ABLE TO TAP 
INTO A LITTLE BETTER MOISTURE FROM THE GULF REGION.  AS A 
RESULT...WILL HAVE TO KEEP SOME MENTION OF PCPN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
OVER MOST OF THE REGION.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN













FXUS61 KILN 191412
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1010 AM EDT FRI OCT 19 2001

SHORT WAVE AND WEAKENING SFC FRONT CONT TO APPRCH THE CWFA.  LATEST 
MODEL GUID CONTS TO SHOW RATHER VIGOROUS FORCING FOR LIFT ASSOCIATED 
WITH THIS SYS...BUT LITTLE IN THE WAY OF MSTR TO WORK WITH.  MAY SEE 
SOME SPRINKLES FAR NORTH THIS AFTN...BUT PLAN ON MAINTAINING CURRENT 
DRY FCSTS.  CLOUDS ACRS THE RGN FAIRLY WIDESPREAD...BUT THERE ARE 
STILL SOME BREAKS AMD PLENTY OF THIN SPOTS.  MCLDY IS LIKELY BEST 
FAR NORTH...OTHW WL CONT WITH PSNY. 

40 KT WINDS AT 2000 FT AGL THIS MORNING.  MUCH OF THIS WL NOT BE 
REALIZED IN THIS WAA REGIME...BUT 10 TO 20 SUSTAINED LOOKS LIKE A 
GOOD BET ALL ZONES.  PREV TEMP FCSTS LK RSNBL...NO CHGS XPCTD.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

FXUS61 KILN 190717
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
318 AM EDT FRI OCT 19 2001

UPR LO JUST W OF HUDSON/S BAY WITH A SERIES OF WK S/WVS ROTATING
THRU THE UPR MS VLY/GRTLKS THRU THE PD. LTST SFC MAP SHWS WK CDFNT
FM NR APN TO CHI TO JUST N OF STL. THIS FNT TO WEAKEN WITH AND
LOOSE ITS IDENTITY AS IT MOVES INTO OH TDA. MAIN UPR SUPPORT AND
MSTR TO STAY TO THE N. XPCT A FAIR AMT OF HI CLDS AND SOME MID 
CLDS ESPECIALLY ACRS THE N. PRECIPIATION EFFCIENCY REMAINS LO
WITH THIS SYSTEM. WL MAINTAIN A DRY FCST WITH A SPRINKLE A MOST
PSBL THIS AFTN/EVE ACRS CNTRL OH. WL GO WITH PARTLY SUNNY SKY
COND TDA. TEMPS SHUD WARM UP SVRL DEGS BUT NOT AS WRM AS FWC BASED
ON CLDS.   

XPCT A FAIR AMT OF EVE CLDS AND THEN A DECREASE IN CLDS LT TNGT 
IN THE WAKE OF THIS SYS. IN LGT WND REGIME WITH CLDS DECREASING
HV GONE A DEG OR TWO COOLER THAN FWC TNGT. THESE NUMBERS ARE 
CLOSER TO MAV GUID.   

SWRLY FLO TO CONT SAT WITH LESS CLDS XPCTD. THICKNESS AND HGHT
RISES SHUD ALLOW FOR A CONTD WARMUP. BASED ON H8 TEMPS AND LO
LVL THICKNESS PREFER A BLEND OF MAV/FWC GUID FOR HI/S SAT.

NXT S/WV TO ROTATE THRU NRN GRTLKS/SRN CAN SAT NGT/SUN. WL GO
PARTLY CLDY SAT NGT ACRS THE N WITH MSTLY CLR CONDS ELSEWHERE.
TEMPS XPCTD TO CONT TO WARM WITH NXT LO POP CHC OF SHWRS MON
AS FNT DROPS INTO OH. BETTER CHC FOR PRECIP TUE NGT/WED.

.ILN...NONE.

561 
FXUS61 KILN 181646
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1246 PM EDT THU OCT 18 2001

GENERAL PATTERN IS HANDLED FAIRLY WELL BY ALL MODELS WITH ONLY SOME 
MINOR DIFFERENCES NOTED THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. MEAN H5 TROF WILL 
APPROACH FCST AREA DURING THE DAY FRIDAY AND PROVIDE SOME SPRINKLES 
TO NRN 1/2 OF FA. AS TROF GETS EJECTED...AT ANOTHER WEAK S/W RIGHT 
ALONG THE AXIS QUICKLY GETS PULLED NORTHEAST TOMORROW NIGHT. ZONAL 
FLOW SETS UP FOR SATURDAY AND INTO THE LATTER PERIODS OF THE FCST 
WITH VERY LITTLE IN THE WAY OF S/W ENERGY AFFECTING FCST AREA UNTIL 
SUN PM MON AM. AVN HINTS AT A STRONG S/W SKIRTING N OF ILN BUT 
CANADIAN MODEL ONLY INCREASES H7 RH VALUES. SFC HI TO THE SOUTHEAST 
WITH RIDGE EXTENDING WELL INTO THE GULF SHOULD LIMIT AVAILABLE 
MOISTURE AND SHUNT ANY PRECIP TO THE NORTH. CURRENT FCST HAS CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS IN NORTH 1/2 AND WILL KEEP THIS IN WITH A 30 POP.

IN THE VERY EXTENDED PORTION OF THE FORECAST...MRF HINTING AT A DRY 
TUESDAY AND WET WEDNESDAY WITH A STRONG CDFNT PUSHING THROUGH LATE. 
THIS CDFNT IS ASSOCIATED WITH GOOD CUTOFF LOW ENTERING THE GT LKS 
RGN EARLY THURS AND PULLING NORTHEAST THROUGH FRIDAY WITH A MEAN 
TROF OVER FCST AREA THROUGH THIS TIME FRAME. PLACING THE H5 LOW AND 
THE SFC LOW OVER THE DAKOTAS WITH MEAN SFC TROF STRETCHING TO TX ON 
TUES PM AND WED...MRF AND CANADIAN SHOW STRONG CONSISTENCY WITH EACH 
OTHER. WILL CUT THE SHOWERS OFF ON TUESDAY BASED ON MRF AND CONTINUE 
THE CHANCE ON WEDNESDAY EVERYWHERE...ADDING THE MENTION OF THUNDER 
WITH THE PROGGED STRENGTH OF THE CDFNT. THURSDAY LOOKS IFFY AND FCST 
CONFIDENCE GOES SOUTH AFTER PASSAGE OF SUCH A STRONG SYSTEM. WILL 
PLAY IT CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN IN THE NORTH 1/2. AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM...TUESDAY FEED FROM THE SOUTHWEST LOOKS STRONG AND TEMPS 
SHOULD BE UNSEASONABLY MILD...ESPECAILLY ON PM LOWS. WED COULD ALSO 
BE SNEAKY WARM AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND WILL BUMP TEMPS HERE TOO.

MISILN PROBABLY WILL BE LATE TODAY AS 5.1.1.1 WAS PUT IN AND WE 
STILL NEED TO TWEAK IFPS. COORDINATION WELCOME BUT NO SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES EXPECTED IN FIRST FEW DAYS OF FCST FROM PREVIOUS ONE.

ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 AM EDT THU OCT 18 2001

MDLS CONTINUE TO SHOW GOOD CONSISTENCY BRINGING A MSTR DEPRIVED SYS 
THROUGH AREA ON FRI. HIGH PRESSURE CURRENTLY OVER SE PART OF CWFA 
AND WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SLIDE EAST TODAY. RETURN FLOW WILL SET 
UP TODAY AND 850 WILL WARM ABOUT 6C BY THIS EVE. LLVL THICKNESSES 
INDICATE TEMPS IN THE LOWER 60S MOST PLACES. AND WITH JUST SOME 
CIRRUS SPILLING OVER THE UPR RIDGE...THIS SEEMS A GOOD BET.

CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE OVERNIGHT AHEAD OF NEXT SYS. SKIES 
SHOULD BECOME MOCLDY ON FRI WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SE WHERE THEY WILL 
STAY MORE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THE RETREATING HIGH. WILL GO PC 
THERE. THEY SHOULD ALSO BE ABOUT A CAT WARMER THAN ELSEWHERE. THINK 
THAT THE LACK OF SFC FORCING AND LIMITED MSTR WILL KEEP SHOWERS FROM 
AFFECTING AREA. POSSIBLE EXCEPTION IS THE NORTHERN FRINGE BUT THINK 
CHC IS SMALL ENOUGH NOT TO MENTION AT THIS TIME. 

WE SHOULD CLEAR OUT AGAIN FRI NIGHT BUT ETA HINTING AT ANOTHER WEAK 
VORT SO WILL KEEP PC GOING. WILL STICK CLOSE TO GUID TEMPS EXCEPT 
FOR SHAVING A FEW DEGS OFF TONIGHTS LOW IN THE SOUTH. 

.ILN...FREEZE WARNING THRU 830 AM EDT ENTIRE FORECAST AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 PM EDT WED OCT 17 2001

HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR BWG WILL SLIDE SOUTH OF THE FA AND TO 
SOUTHERN WV BY 12Z. SKIES HAVE ALREADY CLEARED AND WINDS SHOULD GO 
CALM AS THE HIGH PASSES BY.  WAS A LITTLE CONCERNED A COUPLE OF 
HOURS AGO...WHETHER OR NOT TEMPERATURES WOULD REACH THE FORECAST 
NUMBERS...AS DEWPOINTS WERE HOLDING UP IN THE LOWER 30S.  HOWEVER 
TEMPERATURES HAVE DROPPED 3 TO 5 DEGREES IN THE LAST HOURS TO AROUND 
40 MOST LOCATIONS.  THEY SHOULD BE ABLE TO DROP ANOTHER 10 BY 
SUNRISE...SO WILL LEAVE CURRENT FORECAST ALONE.

COULD SEE A LITTLE CIRRUS TOWARDS MORNING...BUT THAT IS COVERED WITH 
THE MOSTLY CLEAR. ONLY CHANGES WILL BE TO TIDY UP BECOMING WORDING.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EDT WED OCT 17 2001

XPCT STRATO-CU TO DISSIPATE QUICKLY WITH LOSS OF INSOLATION...AND WL 
INDC MCLR OR BECMG MCLR ALL ZONES.  EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL CONDS WL 
DVLP AS SFC RIDGE BUILDS IN...AND XPCT TEMPS AOB FREEZING IN ALL BUT 
THE WARMEST URBAN LOCATIONS.  FREEZE WARNING HAS ALREADY BEEN ISSUED.

LLVL FLOW WL TRANSITION TO S-SW ON THU AS SFC HIGH SHIFTS EAST.  THE 
FWC GUID TENDS TO WARM US TOO QUICKLY IN THIS REGIME...AND HV USED A 
BLEND OF THE FWC AND COOLER AVN BASED GUIDANCE.  SHUD SEE A MARGINAL 
INCRS IN HIGH LVL MSTR IN THE AFTN...BUT XPCT MAINLY THIN CLOUD AND 
WL CONT MSNY.  NEW GUID SUGGESTS ENUF HIGH/MID LVL MSTR THU NIGHT TO 
SUPPORT PREV PCLDY FCSTS...AND A BETTER SOUTHERLY GRADIENT SHUD HELP 
KEEP TEMPS CLOSER TO THE WARMER FWC NUMBERS.

HV OPTED TO CONT DRY FCST ALL ZONES ON FRIDAY.  VERY LITTLE MSTR 
RETURN PROGGED AHEAD OF THE FAST MOVING/WEAK FRONT...WITH DYNAMICS 
DAMPENING OUT AS WELL.  PCLDY ALL ZONES...WITH TEMPS CLOSER TO THE 
WARMER FWC NUMBERS.

.ILN...FREEZE WARNING TNGT ENTIRE FORECAST AREA.

UPDATE THIS MORNING WILL PROBABLY BE WARRANTED AS I THINK THAT THE 
SW EDGE OF CU FIELD WILL BE SOMEWHERE AROUND CVG. WILL WAIT UNTIL 11 
AS INITIAL CU SHOULD BE SPROUTING AT THIS TIME. EXPECT TO CLARIFY W 
CENTRAL OH AND E CNTL IN AS PTSUNNY AS OPPOSED TO VBY CY THOUGH NRN 
AND ERN FCST AREA SHOULD SWITCH BETWEEN MORNING SUN... AFTERNOON 
CU...BACK TO PM CLEAR. MAY ALSO OPEN UP A RANGE IN TEMPS WITH UPDATE 
DUE TO CHANGING CLOUD COVER.

H8 THERMAL TROF NOT AS PRONOUNCED IN MODEL FCSTS AS IT WAS 
YESTERDAY...BUT MEAN AXIS IS PROGGED TO PUSH W-E THROUGH FCST AREA 
TODAY AS LOW PRESSURE CONTINUES ITS DEPARTURE TO THE NE. EXPECT CU 
FIELD TO DIMINISH SLOWLY THROUGH THE DAY BEFORE DYING WITH LOSS OF 
HEATING. 

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP LIKE A ROCK 
TONIGHT AS IT SETTLES OVER FCST AREA. CURRENT FCST HAS AREAS OF 
FROST MENTIONED WITH LOW 30S. WILL PROBABLY HIGHLIGHT FREEZE 
POTENTIAL BEFORE PM ZONE ISSUANCE AND MENTION A HARD FROST IN ALL 
AREAS. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 170646
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 AM EDT WED OCT 17 2001

SKIES HAVE CLEARED OVER MUCH OF THE AREA WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A 
BAND OF LM ENHANCED CLDS. MDLS IN EXCELLENT AGREEMENT KEEPING NW UPR 
FLOW OVER AREA TODAY THEN BRINGING RIDGING IN TONIGHT THRU THU. WITH 
NW FLOW CONTINUING...SCT-BKN CLDS WILL CONTINUE OVER MUCH OF THE 
AREA. WILL HIT THE CLDS HARDEST IN THE NE WHERE THEY ARE CLOSEST TO 
THE BEST CYC FLOW. BUT S/W RIDGING MOVES IN TOWARDS 00Z AT 850 WHICH 
WILL CUT OFF THE LM FETCH. 

QUESTION ABOUT TEMPS TONIGHT IS A TOUGH ONE WITH RETURN FLOW/LLVL 
WAA SETTING UP LATER TONIGHT. WE HAVE A STRONG POSSIBILITY TO 
DECOUPLE BEFORE THE SFC HIGH SLIDES TO OUR SE WHICH WOULD ALLOW FOR 
COOLER TEMPS. GUID TEMPS SEEM REASONABLE SO WILL GO LOWER 30S. WILL 
ISSUE SPS FOR POTENTIAL FREEZE. 

START TO SEE A GOOD WARMUP THU AS FLOW GOES SW. MDLS HAVE TRENDED 
FASTER WITH NEXT SYS DUE TO MID LVL FLOW FLATTENING OUT. FRONT ALSO 
LOOKS TO BE WASHING OUT AS IT APPROACHES. WITH SUCH DRY AIR IN PLACE 
AND SYS MOVING THRU QUICK...WILL PULL POPS FROM FRI. 

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

BAND OF LM ENHANCED CLDS. MDLS IN EXCELLENT AGREEMENT KEEPING NW UPR 
FLOW OVER AREA TODAY THEN BRINGING RIDGING IN TONIGHT THRU THU. WITH 
NW FLOW CONTINUING...SCT-BKN CLDS WILL CONTINUE OVER MUCH OF THE 
AREA. WILL HIT THE CLDS HARDEST IN THE NE WHERE THEY ARE CLOSEST TO 
THE BEST CYC FLOW. BUT S/W RIDGING MOVES IN TOWARDS 00Z AT 850 WHICH 
WILL CUT OFF THE LM FETCH. 

QUESTION ABOUT TEMPS TONIGHT IS A TOUGH ONE WITH RETURN FLOW/LLVL 
WAA SETTING UP LATER TONIGHT. WE HAVE A STRONG POSSIBILITY TO 
DECOUPLE BEFORE THE SFC HIGH SLIDES TO OUR SE WHICH WOULD ALLOW FOR 
COOLER TEMPS. GUID TEMPS SEEM REASONABLE SO WILL GO LOWER 30S. WILL 
ISSUE SPS FOR POTENTIAL FREEZE. 

START TO SEE A GOOD WARMUP THU AS FLOW GOES SW. MDLS HAVE TRENDED 
FASTER WITH NEXT SYS DUE TO MID LVL FLOW FLATTENING OUT. FRONT ALSO 
LOOKS TO BE WASHING OUT AS IT APPROACHES. WITH SUCH DRY AIR IN PLACE 
AND SYS MOVING THRU QUICK...WILL PULL POPS FROM FRI. 

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
937 PM EDT TUE OCT 16 2001

HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPR AIR PATTERN WITH NEGATIVELY TILTED H5
TROF CNTRD OVR ERN GRTLKS LIFTING NE. LTST SFC MAP SHWS 
ASSOCIATED SFC LO PRES JUST N OF LAKE ERIE. IN CAA PTN BAND
OF WRAP ARND MSTR IN WAKE OF THIS LO OVR ERN AND CNTRL OH. 
CLDS OVR IN AND WRN OH LIFTING AND BREAKING UP. EXCEPTION IS
PLUME OF LAKE EFFECT MSTR COMING OFF LM. AS FLO BACKS A BIT
XPCT CLDS TO CONT INTO DAY AND NRN MIAMI. LAKE EFFECT PRECIP
MAY AFFECT NRN MIAMI VLY. WL MAINTAIN SLGT CHC OF A SHWR 
THERE...BUT WL DROP PRECIP ALL OTHER LOCATIONS. WL ADJUST
SKY COND TO MSTLY CLDY ACRS DAY..CMH AND NRN MIAMI VLY. 
FARTHER S ACRS CVG AND PMH XPCT PARTIAL CLRG TO OCCUR.
WNDS SHUD DIM INTO 10 TO 15 MPH RANGE AS GRAD RELAXES
OVRNGT. CURR FCST TEMPS LOOK GOOD.

400 
FXUS61 KILN 161924
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 PM EDT TUE OCT 16 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN FEATURES HIGH AMPLITUDE NEGATIVELY TILTED H5 
TROF/CUTOFF LOW LIFTING THROUGH THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY.  TROF IS 
PROGGED TO NEW ENGLAND BY MID DAY WEDNESDAY...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW 
PERSISTING OVER THE OHIO VALLEY.  AS THE TROF CONTINUES 
NORTHEASTWARD INTO CANADA A BROAD H5 RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO OUR CWA 
ON THURSDAY. AVN AND ETA ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAIN FEATURES 
AND TIMING. 

16Z SFC MAP SHOWS 1002 MB LOW OVER WESTERN LAKE ERIE THAT IS FCST TO 
MOVE WEST OF BUF THROUGH SOUTHEASTERN CANADA JUST AHEAD OF H5 
CUTOFF.  RADAR SHOWS LIGHT WRAP AROUND PRECIP OVER OHIO BEHIND THE 
LOW.  LAKE ENHANCED SHRA OFF LAKE MICHIGAN ARE ENTERING INDIANA AND 
THE STRONG FLOW AT 850 MB IS TAKING THE SHRA WELL INLAND TOWARD OUR 
NORTHERN COUNTIES.  
 
GUIDANCE INDICATES LAKE SHRA WILL MAKE IT DOWN TO NORTHERN ZONES BY 
TONIGHT.  THEREFORE ILL INTRODUCE 30% CHC SHRA IN DAY CMH AND WAPAK 
GROUPS.   IN THE SOUTH ILL USE REST OF AFTERNOON PERIOD FOR SCT 
LEFTOVER WRAP AROUND SHRA...THEN MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH PARTIAL CLEARING 
LATE.  IN THIS EVENT IT WILL STAY JUST WARM ENOUGH TO AVOID USING 
THE S WORD.  

AFTER TONIGHT...NO PRECIP IS EXPECTED THROUGH THURSDAY...AS SFC HIGH 
MOVES THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TO THE CAROLINAS.  THUS SKY 
CONDITION WILL BECOME CENTRAL ISSUE.  ON WEDNESDAY...LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE WILL PERSIST AROUND CMH SO ILL GO WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY 
THERE. PARTLY CLOUDY WILL WORK ELSEWHERE.  WITH DRY AIR MOVING IN BY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...MOSTLY CLEAR FCST LOOKS GOOD.  HIGH CLOUDS ARE 
INDICATED FOR THURSDAY...SO ILL CONTINUE MOSTLY SUNNY FCST.

FWC TEMPS APPEAR A BIT TOO COLD AT NIGHT AND TOO WARM DURING THE 
DAY...SO ILL MAKE THE NECESSARY ADJUSTMENTS...TRENDING CLOSER TO 
THE MAV. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

FXUS61 KILN 161427
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1027 AM EDT TUE OCT 16 2001

SFC LOW JUST SOUTH OF TOL WITH WRAPAROUND SHOWERS MOVING INTO THE 
WESTERN PART OF OHIO.  COLD FRONT EXTENDING FROM LOW JUST 
PASSED THROUGH CMH DURING THE LAST HOUR AND IS NOW ALMOST THROUGH 
THE ENTIRE CWA.  BEHIND FRONT...TEMPERATURES HAVE PLUMMETED INTO THE 
LOWER 40S WITH GOOD CAA...AND GUSTY WEST WINDS ARE MAKING CONDITIONS 
FEEL EVEN MORE MISERABLE.  MANY AREAS HAVE GUSTED BETWEEN 30 AND 40 
KTS LAST HOUR WITH SUSTAINED WINDS 15 TO 20 KTS.  

18Z MESOETA KEEPS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ACROSS CWA ALL DAY.  14Z VIS 
SAT INDICATES LOW CLOUDS EXTENDING ALL THE WAY BACK INTO CENTRAL 
ILLINOIS...AND CLEARING WILL NOT WORK INTO AREA UNTIL OVERNIGHT.  
WINDS AT 925 MB REMAIN BETWEEN 30 AND 40 KTS THROUGH LATE 
TONIGHT...AND WILL KEEP SFC WINDS UP THIS AFTERNOON.  FEEL TEMPS ARE 
TOO HIGH FOR AFTN WITH LOW AND MID 40S ALREADY PREVALENT ACROSS THE 
CWA.  WILL DROP TO MID 40S ACROSS THE SOUTH AND CMH AREA...AND 40 TO 
45 ACROSS DAY AND LIMA GROUPS.

RAIN IS FAIRLY WIDESPREAD ACROSS NORTHERN INDIANA AND WESTERN 
OHIO...AND THIS WILL FILL IN ACROSS ALL BUT THE SOUTH FOR THE 
AFTERNOON.  WILL TAKE OUT DRIZZLE WORDING AND MENTION PERIODS OF 
RAIN ACROSS THE NORTH...AND SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE SOUTH.  I MAY 
BREAK UP THE CVG ZONE...AS NORTHERN KENTUCKY COUNTIES WILL LIKELY BE 
DRIER THAN CVG AREA AND POINTS NORTH.

UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

RYAN

FXUS61 KILN 160805
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
400 AM EDT TUE OCT 16 2001

SFC LOW APPROACHING CVG WITH SHOWERS OVERSPREADING AREA AHEAD OF IT. 
SFC/500 LOWS ARE A LITTLE AHEAD OF SCHEDULE BUT FOR THE MOST PART 
MDLS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH EACH OTHER AND ACTUAL FEATURES. WRAP 
AROUND SHOWERS ARE EVIDENT ON RADAR MOSAIC BUT THEY ARE LIFTING NE 
WITH LOW. QUESTION WILL BE HOW QUICK THE RAIN WILL MOVE OUT AND 
WHETHER THERE WILL BE LE SHOWERS THIS AFTN/TONIGHT. 

DRY SLOT IS EVIDENT ON WV PUNCHING INTO INDIANA. THIS IS PROGGED TO 
MOVE ACROSS CWFA TODAY WHICH WILL HELP CUT OFF RAIN. WILL GO 
CATEGORICAL SHOWERS EARLY IN THE WEST AND THROUGH MIDDAY EAST 
TAPERING TO SCATTERED SHOWERS AFTERWARDS. AGREE WITH JKL THAT 
DRIZZLE IS A GOOD POSSIBILITY WITH STRONG CAA AND LINGERING LLVL 
MSTR. WILL MENTION FOR AFTER SHOWERS END AS WELL. 

SFC LOW CONTS TO DEEPEN AS IT PUSHES THROUGH SO WINDS WILL CONTINUE 
TO STRENGHTN AS WELL WITH CAA TRANSLATING 35-40KT 925 WINDS TO SFC. 
WILL KEEP CURRENT WINDY WORDING. WE ARE SEEING HIGHEST TEMPS OF DAY 
CURRENTLY IN THE WEST WHERE TEMPS WILL LIKELY REMAIN STEADY OR 
SLOWLY FALL THIS AFTN. IN THE EAST TEMPS WILL RISE A LITTLE BEFORE 
THE FRONT MOVES IN. 

TONIGHT A LITTLE TRICKY FOR THE NORTH AS THE SETUP IS FAVORABLE FOR 
LE SHOWERS. BUT THINK THAT THEY SHOULD STAY WEST OF CWFA AND ONLY 
HELP TO KEEP CLDS AROUND. WILL STICK WITH MOCLDY FOR NOW.   

SFC HIGH BUILDS IN FOR WED NIGHT BUT WARMING LLVL TEMPS SHOULD HELP 
KEEP TEMPS FROM BOTTOMING OUT TOO MUCH. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 151935
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
333 PM EDT MON OCT 15 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS SOUTHWEST FLOW OVER OHIO VALLEY AHEAD OF 
AMPLIFYING H5 TROF OVER GREAT PLAINS.  TROF IS PROGGED TO BECOME 
NEGATIVELY TILTED AS IT ENTERS OUR CWA ON TUESDAY. TROF IS FCST TO 
BECOME CUTOFF LOW OVER NEW ENGLAND BY LATE WEDNESDAY...LEAVING THE 
OHIO VALLEY IN THE CHILLY NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND IT. 

SFC MAP HAS DEVELOPING LOW ALONG MISSOURI ARKANSAS BORDER...WITH 
WARM FRONT EXTENDING INTO SOUTHERN ILLINOIS...AND COLD FRONT IN THE 
UPPER GREAT LAKES.  MODELS INTIALIZED LOWS POSITION WELL...AND 
AGREE IN BRINGING LOW TO NEAR DAY BY 12Z TUESDAY...WITH THE ETA 
OFFERING SLIGHTLY SLOWER SOLUTION.  CURRENT PRESSURE FALLS ALSO 
INDICATE THAT THE LOW WILL TRACK UP THE OHIO VALLEY.  ALL MODELS 
HAVE SLOWED LOWS PROGRESS WRT PREVIOUS MODEL RUN.  LOW WILL THEN 
LIFT NORTHEAST WITH THE UPPER TROF...ALLOWING SFC HIGH TO BUILD INTO 
THE OHIO VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY.     

ILX RADAR SHOWS PRECIP ALREADY ENTERING ILLINOIS ALONG WARM FRONT. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT CURRENTLY OVER MISSOURI ON 295K THETA SFC IS SHOWN 
TO BE MOST FAVORABLE OVER OUR CWA AT AROUND 06Z TONIGHT.  WITH SFC 
LOW TAKING AIM AT DAY ALONG WITH STRONG PVA...I WILL CONTINUE 
CATEGORICAL POPS TONIGHT...WITH TIMING THE ONLY ISSUE.  ILL START 
PRECIP AROUND MIDNIGHT WEST...AND EARLY MORNING EAST.    

SLOWER PROGRESS OF SYSTEM MEANS PRECIP WILL BE MORE PREVALENT ON 
TUESDAY THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED.  THEREFORE ILL INCREASE POPS TO 
CATEGORICAL NORTH AND LIKELY SOUTH.

ON TUESDAY NIGHT...FAVORABLE FETCH OFF LAKE MICHIGAN SETS UP BEHIND 
THE SFC LOW...ALONG WITH COLD 850 MB TEMPS AND H5 PVA.  FAVORABLE 
WINDS CONTINUE INTO WEDNESDAY...WITH SOME WARMING INDICATED AT 850 
MB.  AT THIS TIME ILL ONLY INCREASE CLOUD COVER TUESDAY 
NIGHT/WEDNESDAY FROM MOSTLY CLEAR/SUNNY TO PARTLY/MOSTLY 
CLOUDY...BUT WELL NEED TO MONITOR THIS SITUATION FOR THE 
POSSIBILITY OF LAKE ENHANCED SHRA.  

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK GOOD. ILL UNDERCUT ON TUESDAY AT CMH WHERE 
57 APPEARS TO HIGH. ILL GO WITH 54 THERE...SPLITTING THE DIFFERENCE 
BETWEEN FWC AND MAV.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

172 
FXUS61 KILN 150715
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 AM EDT MON OCT 15 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR SOUTH WITH DESCENT 
PRESSURE GRADIENT OVER FA.  SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES CLOUDS HAVE 
CLEARED.  WATER VAPOR SHOWS NICELY WAVE OVER WESTERN KS.

MODELS ARE IN CLOSER AGREEMENT WITH DEVELOPING LOW OVER FA TONIGHT 
AND INTO EASTERN GREAT LAKES ON TUESDAY.  AVN HAS BEEN THE MOST 
CONSISTENT WITH PLACEMENT AND DEPTH OF SYSTEM FROM RUN TO RUN.  THIS 
ETA RUN IS FASTER THAN THE 12Z RUN BUT SLOWER COMPARED TO THE 00Z 
RUN.  IT APPEARS THE ETA IS TRYING TO LOCK ONTO THE CONSISTENT AVN 
SOLUTION. 

SUNNY SKIES WILL GIVE WAY TO INCREASING CLOUDS IN THE WEST AS SYSTEM 
OVER WESTERN KS BEGINS TO AFFECT FA.  WILL HOLD OFF PRECIP UNTIL 
OVERNIGHT AS DEEPENING WAVE DEVELOPS LOW OVER OHIO AND THEN MOVES IT 
INTO NEW ENGLAND.  JET STRUCTURE AND STRONG LOW LEVEL Q-CONVERGENCE 
WILL BRING MODERATE TO HEAVY SHOWERS TO FA TONIGHT.  JET SUPPORT 
OVERNIGHT WILL COME IN THE FORM OF AN 850 LOW LEVEL JET AND THE 
RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 100+ KT UPPER LEVEL JET...WHICH PROVIDES 
A GOOD UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE SIGNATURE AT 
06Z AND 12Z TONIGHT.  Q-CONVERGENCE BELOW 700 MB IS ALSO IMPRESSIVE.

WILL BACK OFF POPS A BIT ON TUESDAY AS SERIOUS SINKING ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF LOW WILL BRING PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED LIGHT 
SHOWERS.  THESE SHOWERS WILL AFFECT COMMUNITIES MAINLY NORTH OF I-70 
WHERE LAKE MOISTURE WILL ENHANCE ANY PRECIP.

FWC TEMPS ARE IN DESCENT SHAPE WITH ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENT.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

.ILN...NONE.



FXUS61 KILN 141839
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 PM EDT SUN OCT 14 2001

LATEST SAT PICS CONTINUE TO SHOW CONVECTIVE SHOWERS ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE FRONT MOVING E OUT OF OUR AREA. PARTIAL CLEARING BEGINNING TO 
MOVE INTO OUR FA FROM THE SOUTHWEST. ANOTHER CONVECTIVE LINE HAS 
DEVELOPED ACROSS IL/IN IN ASSOCIATED WITH MID LVL S/W. EXPECT THIS 
LINE TO WEAKEN AS IT MOVES INTO ILN DURING THE EARLY EVENING HOURS 
ESPECIALLY AS WE LOSE PM HEATING. MAY NEED TO CARRYING CHC/SLT CHC 
ACROSS WRN PORTION OF FA. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR BEFORE RELEASING 
PACKAGE.

AS FOR TONIGHT...SHOULD SEE CLEARING CONDITIONS AS STRONG DVV BECOMG 
EVIDENT. FOR MONDAY...SHOULD SEE SOME INCR CLDS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
THE W/SW PORTION OF FA...AS THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES. ETA 
CONTINUES TO SLOW DOWN THE FORWARD PROGRESS OF THIS NEXT SYSTEM. 
WHEREAS THE AVN HAS BEEN ON THE WHOLE MORE CONSISTENT. FEEL THERE 
WILL BE A SLT CHC OF PRECIP MOVING INTO THE SW PORTION OF OUR FA 
LATER ON MONDAY. OVERALL HOWEVER FEEL THAT THE MORE LIKELY CHC POPS 
WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT AND FIRST HALF OF TUESDAY. ETA/AVN DIFFER QUITE 
A BIT DURING THIS PERIOD WITH RESPECT TO BOTH STRENGTH AND POSITION 
OF THIS SYSTEM. AT THIS POINT...WILL TRY TO INTRODUCE A BLEND OF 
SOLUTIONS.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO

FXUS61 KILN 141455
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1057 AM EDT SUN OCT 14 2001

H5 TROF AXIS IS APPROACHING CVG AS IT TAKES ON A NEGATIVE TILT.  
SHORT WAVE JUST AHEAD OF THE TROF IS PROVIDING LIFT THATS HELPING 
SUSTAIN OUR WIDESPREAD SHRA.

COLD FRONT IS HALFWAY THROUGH OUR CWA...ACCOMPANIED BY BRIEF +SHRA 
AND WINDS GUSTING TO 30 KT.  SHRA PERSIST BEHIND THE FRONT WITH 
ACTIVITY EXPECTED TO DIMINISH BY LATE AFTERNOON. ILL UPDATE TO 
ADJUST TEMPERATURE WORDING WITH CURRENT 50S BEHIND FRONT LIKELY TO 
RECOVER SLIGHTLY INTO THE LOWER 60S AS INDICATED ON 12Z MESOETA.  
ILL ALSO CLEAN UP WINDS AND PRECIP WORDING. 

.ILN...NONE.

916 
FXUS61 KILN 140738
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
338 AM EDT SUN OCT 14 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS PUTS SHARP COLD FRONT IN EASTERN INDIANA BORDER.  
REGIONAL RADARS INDICATE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS ACTIVITY.  WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY INDICATES MAIN WAVE LIFTING TO THE NORTHWEST TOWARDS FA.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH AVN BEING A BIT STRONGER 
WITH CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM ON MONDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL 
WORDING OVER FA WITH A TRANSITION TO CHANCE WORDING THIS AFTERNOON 
IN THE WEST.  RAIN SHOULD BE LIGHT TO MODERATE WITH LITTLE IF ANY 
FLOODING EXPECTED.  A SECOND SMALLER BATCH OF RAIN MAY DEVELOP THIS 
AFTERNOON AHEAD OF SECONDARY WAVE.  WILL REINTRODUCE SMALL CHANCE 
LATE ON MONDAY IN THE SOUTHWEST AS CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM MOVES FROM 
WEST TO EAST THROUGH THE BOTTOM OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH.  BEST 
CHANCE HOWEVER WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT AND IN THE EAST.  THIS SYSTEM 
HAS IMPRESSIVE Q CONVERGENCE AND PIVA SIGNATURES.  LIKELY WORDING 
WILL WORK FOR EAST AND CHANCE IN THE WEST. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY TOO WARM FOR THE MIDDLE TWO PERIODS.  WILL 
SHAVE A DEGREE OF DAY AND CVG.  WILL KNOCK 3 TO 4 DEGREES OFF MONDAY 
TOO KEEP FORECAST MORE IN LINE WITH WHAT WE HAVE OUT.  THIS IS ALSO 
SUPPORTED BY SEVERAL TECHNIQUES.  WILL MAKE AUDIBLE CALL ON TODAY 
TEMPS.  WILL USE FALLING WORDING IN THE EAST.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON





000 
FXUS61 KILN 140104 CCA
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED WORDING
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
902 PM EDT SAT OCT 13 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE OVER WI WITH A CDFNT 
TRAILING SWD ACROSS ERN IL INTO WRN KY AND TN.  STRONG GRADIENT 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT WAS PRODUCING GUSTS OVER 35 MPH IN INDIANA.

00Z KILN SOUNDING SHOWED A DRY LAYER BELOW 850 MB WHICH WAS CAUSING 
THE RAIN TO WEAKEN AND DISSIPATE AS IT MOVD E.  A SLOW SATURATION OF 
THE LOW LAYERS WL OCCUR THROUGH ABOUT 06Z AND THEN AS LLVL 
CONVERGENCE AND UPPER LVL DIVERGENCE PHASE ACROSS FA...A SLUG OF 
HEAVIER RAIN WILL ENVELOPE FA.  WL KEEP MENTION OF HEAVY RAIN IN 
DAY-CVG GROUPS BUT FLOODING WL NOT BE A THREAT.

00Z KILN SOUNDING ALSO SHOWED A VERY STABLE ATMOSPHERE.  WL REMOVE 
THUNDERSTORMS FROM OVERNIGHT FCST.  WIND WL LIKELY STILL GUST TO 
AROUND 40 MPH BUT SHOULD REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.

OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK REASONABLE.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON







FXUS61 KILN 131808
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
205 PM EDT SAT OCT 13 2001

CURRENT SAT IMAGERY SHOWING PARTIAL SUNSHINE ACROSS EASTERN TWO 
THIRDS OF FA. BREEZY AND VERY MILD CONDITIONS CURRENTLY PREVAIL. 
THICKER CLDS AND DEEPER MOISTURE POISED TO OUR WEST. THESE CLDS WILL 
MOVE BACK INTO THE AREA TONIGHT.

ETA/AVN IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAJOR SYNOPTIC FEATURES. CURRENT 
INDICATIONS ARE THAT A VERY STRONG FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE 
WESTERN PORTION OF THE ILN FA LATE TONIGHT AND THEN MOVE EAST ACROSS 
THE REMAINDER OF OUR AREA DURING THE FIRST PART OF SUNDAY. THIS WILL 
BE A VERY DYNAMIC SYSTEM...AS INDICATED BY THE STRONG AND DEEP LOW 
LVL CONVERGENT SIGNATURE...AS WELL AS THE UPPER LVL SUPPORT. THE ETA 
MODEL CONTINUES TO SHOW 70-75 KT WINDS AROUNG THE 85H LEVEL JUST IN 
ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. MODEL SOUNDING DATA SHOWS 50 KT WINDS AROUND 
1-2 KFT. ALTHOUGH INSTABILITY FORECAST TO BE NEARLY 
NEGLIGABLE...WILL STILL NEED TO BE CONCERNED ABOUT SOME OF THESE 
HIGH WINDS MIXING DOWN TO THE SFC IN ANY SHOWER/ISOLATED T-STORM 
ACTIVITY LATER TONIGHT AND EARLY TOMORROW MORNING. IT APPEARS THAT 
AS THIS FRONT CROSSES OUR FA ON SUNDAY...SOME INSTABILITY IS NOTED 
ACROSS THE S-CTRL PORTION OF OUR FA. WILL THUS NOTE A BETTER CHC OF 
T-STORMS FOR THIS AREA AT THAT TIME. AS FOR A FLOODING THREAT...FEEL 
THAT THIS WILL BE A FAST MOVING SYSTEM...WITH SOME HVY RAIN EXPECTED 
WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. AS MODELS CONTINUE TO BE QUITE PROGRESSIVE 
WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND WITH THE ONE HR FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE MAINLY 
IN THE 1.5 TO 2.O INCH CATAGORY...DO NOT FEEL AT THIS TIME A 
FLOOD/FF WATCH REQUIRED.

AFTER THE FRONT MOVE TO OUR EAST ON SUNDAY...EXPECT PARTIAL 
CLEARING. SUNDAY NIGHT WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR. MONDAY SHOULD BE FAIR 
AS WELL.

MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO











FXUS61 KILN 131352
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EDT SAT OCT 13 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS HIGH AMPLITUDE TROF DIGGING TO THE GULF OF 
MEXICO.  SHORT WAVE APPROACHING CVG LATE THIS MORNING WILL CROSS OUR 
AREA BY LATE AFTERNOON...WITH ANOTHER SHORT WAVE ARRIVING IN 
SOUTHWEST BY 00Z.

SFC MAP FEATURES LOW OVER IOWA...WITH A BIT OF CONVERGENCE INDICATED 
IN THE SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER OHIO.  MOIST AXIS IS PRESENT IN 
INDIANA...WITH 60 DEWPOINTS LEANING INTO OUR CWA.

RADAR SHOWS SCT SHRA NEAR CVG AND OVER CENTRAL OHIO.  ADDITIONAL 
SHRA/POSSIBLE TSRA SHOULD FORM THIS AFTERNOON AS ATMOSPHERE BECOMES 
MORE UNSTABLE...THOUGH UPPER SUPPORT WILL TEMPORARILY DIMINISH 
DURING EARLY AFTERNOON.  TSRA IN WESTERN INDIANA SHOULD REMAIN WEST 
OF OUR AREA AS THEY ARE STEERED BY H5 FLOW ON THE WESTERN FRINGE OF 
MOIST TONGUE.

WITH NVA EARLY THIS AFTERNOON FOLLOWED BY PVA LATER...ILL KEEP 
LIKELY POPS BUT USE MAINLY LATE WORDING.  FCST HIGH TEMPS IN 70S 
LOOK GOOD WRT 12Z SOUNDING AND 06Z MESOETA SO NO CHANGES TO TEMPS 
ARE NECESSARY. OTHER CHANGES WILL INVOLVE SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO WIND 
FCST.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

670 
FXUS61 KILN 130804
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
405 AM EDT SAT OCT 13 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLOUDS/MOISTURE STREAMING NORTHWARD AHEAD 
OF SIGNIFICANT WAVE WHICH IS EVIDENT OVER TEXAS IN THE WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY.  SURFACE ANALYSIS LOW PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN MS VLY.

MODELS ARE ALL IN DESCENT AGREEMENT WITH BRINGING DEEP UPPER TROF 
OUT OF SOUTHERN PLANES AND SWINGING IT THROUGH OHIO VALLEY.  SURFACE 
LOW WILL TRACK TO OUR NORTHWEST AGAIN.  HOWEVER A SHARP COLD FRONT 
WILL SWING THROUGH.  IN FACT THE FRONT SHARPENS AS IT MOVES THROUGH 
AND GOES FROM POSITIVE TO NEUTRAL TILT TO IT.  JET 
STRUCTURE/DYNAMICS ARE VERY IMPRESSIVE.  850 MB JET INCREASES TO 
>65KT WHILE THE UPPER JET STRUCTURE PROVIDES RESPECTABLE UPPER LEVEL 
DIVERGENCE.  CONCERNED ABOUT SEVERE THREAT WITH SUCH STRONG WINDS 
AND DYNAMICS.  HOWEVER THE LIMITING FACTOR WILL BE INSTABILITY.  ETA 
HAS AROUND 2 TO 3 HUNDRED CAPE AVAILABLE TONIGHT.  THIS MAY BE UNDER 
DONE...HOPEFULLY NOT.  ALSO CONCERNED ABOUT HEAVY RAIN.  EFFICIENCY 
WILL BE EXCELLENT WITH PWS EXPECTED TO BE OVER 1.5 INCHES WHICH WILL 
BE OVER 200%.  WILL ADDED HEAVY RAIN MENTION OVERNIGHT AND INTO PART 
OF SUNDAY.  FLOOD WATCH IS NOT NEEDED AT THIS POINT AS FFG INDICATES 
THAT 3 HOUR PRECIP IS GENERALLY GREATER THAN 2.5 INCHES.

ETA/AVN TO HOWEVER DIFFER A BIT IN HOW THEY HANDLE THE SECOND VORT 
WITH THE AVN BEING MOISTURE THAN THE ETA.  WILL GO CATEGORICAL 
SUNDAY MORNING AND THEN BACK OFF TO CHANCE.

FWC TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD.  WILL GO A COUPLE DEGREES COLDER FOR THE 
LAST TWO PERIODS.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON








FXUS61 KILN 130054
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
855 PM EDT FRI OCT 12 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A WEAK BOUNDARY STRETCHING FROM IND...TO 
MIE...TO FWA TO NEAR TOL.  THIS BOUNDARY WILL BEGIN TO LOSE ITS 
IDENTITY AS LOW LVL FLOW BEGINS TO BECOME MORE SOUTHERLY IN NATURE.

WARM...MOIST ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE ACRS THE CWFA OVERNIGHT WITH 
THE DEEPEST MSTR POISED OVER THE SE CWFA.  UPR DYNAMICS WILL BE 
MINIMAL AT BEST...BUT LOW LVL WARM...MOIST ADVECTION WILL WARRANT A 
SML CHC FOR SHOWERS IN THE DAY...CVG...CMH AND PMH ZONES.  WILL CUT 
POPS BACK TO 20 PERCENT FOR DAY...CVG AND CMH AND 30 PERCENT ACRS 
THE PMH ZONE.  FOR THE FAR NORTHWEST...SKIES SHOULD BE PARTLY CLOUDY 
WITH DRY CONDITIONS.  OVERNIGHT LOWS NEAR 60 OR LOWER 60S LOOKS GOOD 
AT THIS TIME.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

SCT SHRA DEVELOPING IN AN AREA OF LLVL CONVERGENCE THIS PM.  MODELS 
PROG SUFFICIENT LLVL MOISTURE AND CONVERGENCE TO KEEP SCT SHRA IN 
FCST OVERNIGHT.  PRECIP POTENTIAL FIELDS SHOW DRYING INTO NWRN FA 
OVERNIGHT.  WL KEEP AREA FM RID TO AOH DRY.

VIGOROUS SYSTEM WL DROP INTO THE LWR MS VLY ON SAT.  THIS WL LEAD TO 
A NWD SURGE OF DEEP MOISTURE BACK INTO FA. WL CARRY LIKELY POPS ALL 
GROUPS ON SAT. THE SYSTEM WL LIFT NWD ON SAT NIGHT AND SUN.  LLVL 
CONVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH STRONG LLVL JET WL LEAD TO WIDESPREAD 
RAINFALL SAT NIGHT AND EARLY SUN.  ELEVATED INSTABILITY AND STRENGTH 
OF DYNAMICS SUGGESTS THE POSSIBILITY OF THUNDER.

WL HAVE SUN NIGHT DRY BEFORE BRINGING SHRA BACK INTO FCST ON MON.

WITH HIGHER DEW POINTS IN PLACE WL RAISE OVERNIGHT MOS LOWS TONIGHT.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON





650 
FXUS61 KILN 121434
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1034 AM EDT FRI OCT 12 2001

SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS LO PRESSURE CENTERED OVER SW MICHIGAN AT 
14Z...WITH TRAILING COLD FRONT TO JUST SOUTH OF ST. LOUIS.  STEADIER 
RAIN HAS MOVED INTO CENTRAL AND EASTERN OH...AS SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR 
ATTEMPTING TO WORK ITS WAY INTO OUR SW.  12Z KILN SOUNDING WAS 
SATURATED UP TO AROUND 450 MB.  06Z MESOETA KEEPS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
ACRS THE CWA FOR THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON...BUT DOES BRING IN SOME 
DRYING AT THE MID-LEVELS.  14Z VIS SATELLITE WAS SHOWING A FEW 
BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS ACRS EASTERN INDIANA AND WESTERN OHIO.  
HOWEVER...THINK HIGHER LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY 
CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON.  INSTABILITY AXIS OVER CENTRAL INDIANA 
PROGGED TO MOVE ACRS THE CWA DURING THE AFTERNOON...SO WILL KEEP 30 
POPS ACRS THE WEST.  AM KEEPING HIGHER POPS ACRS THE EASTERN ZONES 
WHERE STEADY RAIN CONTINUES TO FALL.  THINK RAIN AREA WILL MOVE OUT 
OF CWA BY 18Z...AND TAPER TO SCATTERED SHOWERS.  WL LEAVE TEMPS AND 
WINDS ALONE AS CLOUD BREAKS SHOULD ALLOW FOR QUICK TEMP RISES.

UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

$$

RYAN

434 
FXUS61 KILN 120653
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
254 AM EDT FRI OCT 12 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES LOW JUST SOUTHEAST OF KHUF WITH A TIGHTLY 
PACKED GRADIENT OVER FA.  REGIONAL RADAR TRENDS INDICATE BEST RAINS 
JUST NORTH OF THE LOW OVER NORTHERN IL/IN.  RAIN OVER WESTERN OHIO 
WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD SLOWLY EAST INTO CENTRAL OHIO.  SATELLITE 
AND RADAR IMAGERY SHOWS DRY SLOT ACROSS SOUTHERN INDIANA.

MODELS ARE IN RESPECTABLE AGREEMENT AFTER 12Z RUNS.  THE ETA HAS 
SPEED UP A BIT AND THE AVN HAS SLOWED DOWN.  HOWEVER...THE AVN IS 
STILL FASTER AND DEEPER WITH SURFACE LOW.  12Z UKMET LOOKS VERY 
SIMILAR IN TIMING AND DEEPNESS OF 12Z AVN.  WILL LEAN CLOSER TO 
AVN/UKMET SOLUTION.

WILL KEEP LIKELY THREAT IN TODAY...MAINLY FOR THIS MORNING...BELIEVE 
THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE MORE OF A CHANCE.  WILL KEEP CURRENT FORECAST 
TREND OF CHANCE POPS SATURDAY AND WILL ADD SMALL POP IN TONIGHT AS 
BOTH AVN/ETA INDICATE SOME MARGINAL LIFT AND ALREADY SATURATED 
AIRMASS.  NEXT SHOT WILL COME LATE ON SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT.  
JET STRUCTURE IS VERY CONDUCIVE TO UPWARD MOTION WITH 850 JET IN 
EXCESS OF 60S KTS AND RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 100+ KT JET.  
THANKFULLY...TIMING OVER FA WILL BE MORE AFTER DARK AND THERE WILL 
BE PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER WHICH WILL HOPEFULLY ELIMINATE ANY 
INSTABILITY.  HOWEVER WITH SUCH A DYNAMIC SYSTEM AND LIS PROGGED TO 
BE JUST ABOVE ZERO WILL KEEP THE THREAT OF THUNDER.  IT WILL TURN 
COLDER ON SUNDAY AS DRY SLOT SWINGS THROUGH.

FWC TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

915 PM EDT THU OCT 11 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT FROM LAKE ONTARIO...THROUGH 
LAKE ERIE...THEN THE COLD FRONT BECOMES A WARM FRONT FROM EXTREME NW 
OHIO SOUTHWEST TO A SFC LOW OVER FAR SRN ILLINOIS.

THE SFC LOW WAS A LITTLE FARTHER NORTHEAST THEN THE 18Z MESO ETA.  
THIS SFC LOW WAS A REFLECTION OF A VIGOROUS S/WV NOTED OVER ARKANSAS 
BY THE WATER VAPOR.  S/WV WILL MOVE NORTHEAST OVERNIGHT AS WELL AS 
THE SFC LOW...REACHING SRN LAKE MICHIGAN BY FRIDAY MORNING.  STRONG 
925 MB TO 850 MB CONVERGENCE CURRENTLY ACRS ILLINOIS AND INDIANA 
WILL BEGIN TO GRADUALLY SPILL OVER INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT.  AS A 
RESULT...WIDESPREAD RAIN MAY NOT BE EXPERIENCED ACRS THE ERN CWFA 
UNTIL TOWARD DAWN.  WILL CONTEMPLATE THIS FOR AN EVENING UPDATE.  
FCSTS FOR WRN CWFA HAVE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.  MODELS DONT 
REALLY BRING IN THE INSTABILITY UNTIL FRIDAY.  WILL LIKELY REMOVE 
THESE FROM THE WEST FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD.  TEMPERATURES SEEMS 
REASONABLE ATTM.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 110702
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 AM EDT WED OCT 10 2001

SHORT TERM FORECAST LOOKS FAIRLY STRAIGHTFORWARD WITH GOOD AGREEMENT 
ON MAJOR FEATURES OF DIFFERENT MODELS. DEEPENING TROF OVER CENTRAL 
US WITH S/W ROTATING NE AHEAD OF IT IS NOTED ON ALL MODELS. 
PLACEMENT OF A SLIGHTLY CLOSED LOW AT 60H IN LOWER MIDWEST WITH MEAN 
TROF EXTENDING INTO ERN DAKOTAS LOOKS ENTIRELY REASONABLE.

SFC PATTERNS DONT DIFFER SIGNIFICANTLY THROUGH THIS PERIOD THOUGH 
THE ETA/NGM CLOSE OFF THE LOW UNDER THE INITIAL S/W TONIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY MORNING. I PREFER THE MORE OPEN PATTERN OF THE NEW AVN RUN... 
BUT EVEN WITH A CLOSED H8 AND SFC LOW NOTED ON OTHER MODELS...MAIN 
FEATURES DONT CHANGE MUCH. CLOSED PATTERN ENHANCES H8 40-50KT JET 
AND COULD CAUSE A HEADACHE LATE TONIGHT WITH ENHANCING HEAVY RAIN 
THREAT AND POSSIBLY BRINGING THESE WINDS TO THE SFC IN SOME 
CONVECTION. PRECIP EFFICIENCY MAX OF 1.5 INCHES NOTED OVER NRN KY AT 
6Z AND ERN HALF OF FCST AREA AT 12Z. THOUGH I DONT THINK THAT 
THERES MUCH OF A FLOODING THREAT...WILL MENTION HEAVY RAIN 
POSSIBILITY TONIGHT IN MOST AREAS.

WITH MODELS STARTING TO DIVERGE IN EXTENDED PART OF FCST...WILL MAKE 
NO CHANGES. CONFIDENCE IS LOW WITH THE LONGWAVE PATTERN AND 
DIFFERENT MODEL SOLUTIONS SO ANY CHANGES MADE HERE WOULD JUST BE 
GUESSWORK.

MISILN OUT AT SOME POINT IN TIME.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS



00Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A COLD FRONT FROM ERN WI...SOUTHWARD INTO

LVL S/WV ENERGY...WILL BE THE FOCUS FOR PCPN THROUGH FRIDAY.

MOSAIC RADAR TRENDS CONTINUE TO SHOW WIDESPREAD SHOWERS FROM NW OHIO 
INTO CENTRAL INDIANA.  THIS PCPN WAS BEING GENERATED FROM A 
MOIST...WAA PATTERN COMBINED WITH AN EMBEDDED S/WV OVER ILLINOIS.
CURRENT SHOWERS LINE UP WELL WITH 18Z AVN PCPN EFFICIENCY ...WHICH 
KEEPS A SHARP GRADIENT RIGHT ACRS THE CWFA OVERNIGHT.  THUS...FCST 
ATTM HAS HIGHEST POPS FAR NW TO NO POPS ACRS THE SE.  I SEE NO 
REASON TO CHANGE THIS GIVEN MOST UP TO DATE MODEL GUIDANCE AND RADAR 
TRENDS.  AS A RESULT...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...SO NO UPDATES 
PLANNED ATTM.

MIDNIGHT SHIFT WILL HAVE TO TAKE A LOOK AT FRIDAY/S FCST BASED ON 
LATEST GUIDANCE.  RAIN MAY LINGER A BIT LONGER ACRS THE REGION.

GENERALLY IN LINE WITH NEW GUID...ALTHOUGH HV LOWERED IN THE E-SE 
WHERE LESS GRADIENT/CLDS XPCTD.

PARALLEL TO FRONT CURRENTLY OVER THE MIDWEST.  A FEW MODERATELY 
STRONG SHORTWAVES/ASSOCIATED SFC FTRS WL DRIVE THE BNDRY 
PROGRESSIVELY CLOSER TO THE CWFA...BRINGING INCREASING CHCS OF PCPN 
FROM WEST TO EAST.  HV FOLLOWED A SOLN CLOSEST TO THE 06Z AVN...WITH 
THE NOTABLE EXCEPTION OF ALLOWING FOR PCPN TO LINGER A LITTLE LONGER 
INTO FRIDAY AS BNDRY SHUD NOT PUSH EAST QUITE AS FAST.

309 
FXUS61 KILN 100700
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 AM EDT WED OCT 10 2001

CURRENT FCST IS ONLY GETTING A FEW TOUCH UPS THIS MORNING. MODELS 
CONTINUE TO TREND WITH CHANCE PRECIP BEGINNING IN NWRN FCST AREA 
LATE TONIGHT WITH LIKELY POPS DURING THE DAY THURSDAY FOR AT LEAST 
THE NW 1/2 OF FCST AREA. WITH SOME UNCERTAINTY...KEPT HIGH CHANCE 
POPS IN SOUTHEAST BUT WASNT CERTAIN DUE TO DRY AMS THATS STILL ON 
THE RETREAT AHEAD OF CDFNT.

CDFNT DOESNT SEEM TO GET THROUGH FCST AREA TIL THE WEEKEND WITH 
PERTUBATIONS RIDING SW-NE BOTH THURSDAY AND SATURDAY AS H5 TROF 
CONTINUES TO DIG. ETA COMING INTO LINE WITH PREVIOUS RUNS OF AVN... 
BUT EVEN AVN HAS CONSIDERABLY WEAKENED H5 LOW/TROF TO A MORE OPEN 
WAVE PATTERN. 

DONT EXPECT TOO MUCH WIND IN WARM SECTOR...BUT AS INITIAL WAVE 
APPROACHES AREA OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...H9 WINDS REALLY START KICKING TO 
AROUND 40 KTS. WILL HAVE 10 TO 20 IN MOST AREAS WITH SOME MENTION OF 
GUSTS...THOUGH DONT EXPECT THESE GUSTS TO OCCUR OUTSIDE OF SHOWER 
ACTIVITY WHICH REALLY SHOULDNT GET GOING TIL THE DAYTIME. 

TEMP GUIDANCE GENERALLY OKAY...BUT WILL DIFFER BY ABOUT A CATEGORY 
THROUGH THE FORECAST...A LITTLE WARMER TODAY. LOOKING WEST AND 
SOUTHWEST RIGHT NOW... TONIGHTS LOWS SHOULD BE IN THE LOW 60S OR 
AROUND 60. WITH THE WINDS KICKING IN...THERES NO WAY WE SHOULD 
REALIZE THE FCST DEWPOINTS IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S FOR LOWS. 
FRIDAYS HIGHS LOOK REASONABLE WITH PRECIPITATION EXPECTED...AND I 
MAY EVEN CUT A FEW DEGREES IN WRN 1/2 OF FCST AREA. FRI PM LOWS 
SHOULD STILL BE ABOVE GUIDANCE AS FLOW STILL PROGGED TO BE SOUTH 
SOUTHWEST AT A FAIRLY GOOD CLIP. FEEL THAT GUIDANCE FOR TONIGHT 
LOOKS LIKE BETTER NUMBERS TOMORROW NIGHT. 

MISILN OUT AROUND 330. POSITIVE COMMENTS WELCOME.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

SOUTHWEST RIGHT NOW... TONIGHTS LOWS SHOULD BE IN THE LOW 60S OR 
AROUND 60. WITH THE WINDS KICKING IN...THERES NO WAY WE SHOULD 
REALIZE THE FCST DEWPOINTS IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S FOR LOWS. 
FRIDAYS HIGHS LOOK REASONABLE WITH PRECIPITATION EXPECTED...AND I 
MAY EVEN CUT A FEW DEGREES IN WRN 1/2 OF FCST AREA. FRI PM LOWS 
SHOULD STILL BE ABOVE GUIDANCE AS FLOW STILL PROGGED TO BE SOUTH 
SOUTHWEST AT A FAIRLY GOOD CLIP. FEEL THAT GUIDANCE FOR TONIGHT 
LOOKS LIKE BETTER NUMBERS TOMORROW NIGHT. 

MISILN OUT AROUND 330. POSITIVE COMMENTS WELCOME.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

SHORT TERM BRINGING A FRONT INTO THE NW WED NIGHT AND INTO THE REST

MDLS SHOW POSSIBLE NEG TILT UPR TROF BY THE WEEKEND. THE AVN HAS 
BACKED OFF ON THE STRENGTH OF THE SYS BUT STILL LOOKS LIKE A WET 
WEEKEND.

MORE IN THE SHORT TERM...LLVL TEMPS HAD RISEN TO AROUND 10 THIS MRNG 
AND ARE PROGGED TO RISE ANOTHER DEG OR TWO THRU WED. WE SHOULD 
CONSEQUENTLY BE A CAT OR SO WARMER THAN TDY WITH JUST SOME HIGH CLDS 
SPILLING IN. THEN MSTR INCREASES AS THE PACIFIC MSTR EVIDENT ON WV 
BEGINS STREAMING IN HERE. WILL ADD POPS TO DAYTON GRP FOR WED NIGHT 
AND GO LIKELY NW. THEN WILL HAVE LIKELY SW THU WITH CHC ELSEWHERE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
145 AM EDT TUE OCT 9 2001

MAIN FCST CHALLENGE THIS MORNING IS GOING TO BE HOW MUCH WARM 
ADVECTION GETS GOING AHEAD OF NEXT CDFNT EXPECTED THURSDAY. PRECIP 
ASSOCIATED WITH FRONT SHOULD ALSO PRESENT A BIT OF CONCERN AS TO 
WHETHER IT COMES IN WED PM OR THURS AM. DRY AIR IN PLACE AHEAD OF 
FNT AND GENERAL WEAKENING OF FNT WITH EWRD PROGRESSION WOULD HAVE ME 
ERR ON THE LATER SIDE OF TIMING PRECIP IN. DYNAMICS GET SHIFTED NE 
WITH GOOD 40-50KT H8 JET IN PLACE LATE WED INTO THURS AM.

UPPER SUPPORT LAGS BEHIND ACTUAL FRONT AND AXIS OF COLD AIR NEVER 
REALLY GETS ENTIRELY THROUGH FCST AREA ON THURS. FRONT APPEARS TO 
BECOME A WMFNT AHEAD OF A MORE VIGOROUS LOW THAT SHOULD AFFECT US 
FOR THE WEEKEND.

CURRENT TEMP FCST LOOKS TO HAVE THINGS WELL IN HAND WITH WARMER 
OVERNIGHT TEMPS AND NEAR GUIDANCE ON HIGHS. EXCEPTION TO HIGH TEMPS 
WILL BE A NW-SE GRADIENT ON THURSDAY.

COMMENTS WELCOME AND MISILN OUT EVENTUALLY.

SFC HIGH CENTERED OVER EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA CONTINUING TO PULL AWAY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EDT MON OCT 8 2001
 
MDLS IN GOOD AGREEMENT SORT TERM KEEPING ARE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF 
ATL HI PRES. SYS IN PLAINS WILL HEAD TOWARDS AREA AS WE BEGIN TO SEE 
PERTURBATIONS IN UPR FLOW. ETA/AVN ARE CLOSE FIRST COUPLE OF PDS 
THEN ETA A LITTLE FASTER WITH LESS AMPLIFICATION. BUT MDLS LAST FEW 
MONTHS HAVE TRIED TO MOVE HIGH OFF ATL COAST TOO FAST SO AM INCLINED 
TO GO WITH SLOWER SOLN. WILL GO CLOSER TO SLOWER AVN TIMING. 

SOME HIGH CLDS ARE SPILLING INTO THE AREA OVER UPR RIDGE AND THIS 
WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. BUT THEY ARE VERY THIN AND SHOULD HAVE 
LITTLE EFFECT ON TEMPS. BIGGER EFFECT WILL COME FROM SLY FLOW WHICH 
IS STARTING TO GET GOING BEHIND SFC HIGH. WE WILL SEE ABOUT AN 8 DEG 
RISE IN 850 TEMPS OVER 24 HRS. WILL GO WITH A MAV/FWC BLEND FOR 
TEMPS.

GENERALLY JUST WARM SWLY FLOW UNTIL WED NITE THU WITH NEXT WEAK SYS. 
WILL ONLY REMOVE RW OUT OF SE FOR WED NITE AS THEY LOOK TO STILL BE 
UNDER HI PRES INFLUENCE UNTIL THU.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 PM EST SUN OCT 7 2001

FCST CHALLENGE AGN TNGT REVOLVES ARND ASSESSMENT OF NEED
FOR FROST OR FREEZE HEADLINES. 

AMPLIFIED FLO PTN WITH BROAD TROF OVR THE GRTLKS/NE U.S. SHIFTING
E TO NEW ENGLAND MON. SFC HI PRES CNTRD OVR WRN OH TO BLD E ACRS
OH OVRNGT. THIS HI WL PROVIDE LGT WND REGIME WHICH WL RESULT IN
FAVORABLE RADATIONAL COOLING SETUP. MID LVL CLDS TO OUR W ACRS 
MID MS VLY ARE DISPTG AS THEY SPILL SE. A FEW MID CLDS NOT OUT 
OF THE QUESTION BUT THEY WL NOT INHIBIT COOLING TNGT. PREFER
LO TEMPS COOLER THAN BOTH FWC/MAV CLOSER TO FAN NUMBERS TNGT.
WL OPEN UP RANGE OF 30-35 IN THE W AND ARND 30 IN ERN SECTIONS.
THERFORE...WL GO WITH FREEZE WARNING IN ERN ZONES AND FROST WARNING
IN THE W.

UPR LVL RDG AXIS OVR PLNS WL BLD E OFFERING MODEST HGT AND THICKNESS 
RISES ON MON. ALL MODELS HV TRENDED LESS AMPLIFIED AND FARTHER N 
WITH S/WV OVR NRN ROCKIES WHICH TRACKS INTO UPR MS VLY/SRN CAN MON 
NGT/TUE. XPCT TO SEE MAINLY HI LVL MSTR SPILLING INTO RGN FM THE NW. 
WL MAINTAIN PARTLY CLOUDY SKY COND. FWC APPEARS TOO FAST WITH WARM 
UP. CENTER/S ENERGY BLOCK METHOD AND LO THICKNESS SCHEMES INDICATE 
FWC NUMBERS A LTL TOO WARM. WL GO BTWN MAV/FWC FOR HI/S MON.       

CONTD WRM UP TUE MID/UPR LVL RDG BLDS OVR OH VLY. LO LVL FLO
BCMS SRLY WHICH AID TEMPS IN WRMG UP CLOSE TO GUID VALUES.


NEXT THREAT FOR PRECIP APPEARS WED NGT/THU TIME FRAME WITH THE
APPROACH OF A CDFNT.

TEMPS IN THE SW MAY FALL TO AROUND 30.  WILL BREAK OFF THE CVG 
GROUP...PORTSMOUTH GROUP AND SOUTHERN PORTION OF DAYTON GROUP TO INTRODUCE 
FREEZE WARNING OVERNIGHT.  WITH FORECASTED WIND SPEEDS ACRS THE

CWA.

AXUS81 KILN 061907
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EDT SAT OCT 6 2001

...CORRECTS HEADLINE FROM FROST ADVISORY TO FROST WARNING...

CHILLY AMS WITH SCTD FROST AND ISOLD FREEZING TEMPS XPCTD
OVRNGT. 

HIGHLY AMPLIFIED FLO PTN WITH BROAD TROF OVR THE GRTLKS. FAIR AMT
OF CU/SC HS DVLPD WITH CAA AT H8. XPCT OF THESE CLDS TO DISPT AFTR
SUNSET. CLDS MAY LINGER A LTL LONGER OVR NRN MIAMI VLY WITH FLO OFF
LM. SFC RDG AXIS WHICH EXTENDS FM MN THRU MO BLDS A LTL ESE TNGT
INTO LWR OH VLY. COOLEST TEMPS SHUD OCCUR OVR OVR SE IN/SW OH WHERE 
WND GRAD WL BE LIGHTEST. LOOKING AT UPSTREAM LO TEMPS XPCT LOWS
TO BE A LTL COOLER THAN FWC CLOSER TO MAV GUID TNGT. SOME LOW LYING
PROTECTED AREAS COULD APPROACH 30 DEG TNGT BUT MST LOCATIONS WL
DROP INTO LWR 30S. GIVEN THAT WIDESPREAD AREAS ARE NOT XPCTD TO GO
BLO FREEZING FOR A CLIMATALOGICAL SIGNIFICANT TIME WL GO WITH FROST
WARNING ACRS ENTIRE CWA TNGT.     

SFC HI BLDS E ACRS OH SUN AND TO THE E SUN NGT. SCTD CU WL LKLY DVLP
AGN ON SUN WITH BEST COVERAGE ACRS NW LOCATIONS. WL MAINTAIN MSTLY 
SUNNY FCST. FWC APPEARS TOO WARM WITH HI/S SUN. LOOKING AT LO LVL 
THICKNESS AND ENERGY BLOCK TECHNIQUES...READINGS CLOSER TO MAV ARE
PREFERRED.

ANOTHER COLD NIGHT INSTORE FOR OH VLY SUN NGT WITH LGT WND REGIME.
ONLY XPCT SOME THIN CI TO SPILL OVR UPSTREAM UPR RDG. FROST IS PSBL
AGN SUN NGT. AGN PREFER COLDER MAV TEMPS.

S/WV TO TRACK ACRS NRN PLNS INTO UPR MS VLY MON. ETA IS MORE OPEN
WITH THIS SYS THAN THE AVN. ALL MODELS TRENDING TO A MORE AMPLIFED

MAINLY HI LVL MSTR MON. WL GO WITH PARTLY SUNNY SKY COND.

COLD FRONT HAS NOW PUSHED INTO WEST VIRGINIA WITH BACK EDGE OF

AS FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS WILL GRADUALLY BUILD EAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.  WILL 
CARRY BLUSTERY WORDING IN THE NORTHERN MIAMI VALLEY WITH 15 TO 25 
MPH WINDS. 10 TO 20 MPH ELSEWHERE. 

INITIALLY THOUGHT THAT TODAY WOULD BE A BIG CU DAY...WITH THE COLD 
AIR ALOFT.  LOOKING AT THE CURU AND FORECAST SOUNDINGS...IT APPEARS 
THAT THE DRY AIR WORKING IN OVER COMES THE COLD AIR ALOFT...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH PARTLY CLOUDY IN THE NORTH AND MOSTLY SUNNY SOUTH. 
CURRENT HIGHS FOR TODAY LOOK GOOD. 

ANY CLOUDS SHOULD DISSIPATE TONIGHT...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO FALL. 
FEEL THAT THERE WILL BE JUST ENOUGH WIND FLOW...WITH THE HIGH TO OUR 
WEST...THAT I AM NOT CONFIDENT AT THIS TIME TO ISSUE A FROST 
WARNING.  THE HIGH THEN SLIDES TO THE EAST OF THE FA ON SUNDAY. 
CURRENT HIGHS LOOK A LITTLE COOL CONSIDERING THAT WE GET A LITTLE 
WARM ADVECTION ON SUNDAY.  WILL UP THEM A FEW DEGREES. 

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

PAH.

ALL MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR THE SHORT TERM FORECAST.  VIGOROUS 
UPR LVL S/WV CURRENTLY PUSHING INTO IL AND MO WILL MOVE QUICKLY TO 
THE EAST OVERNIGHT.  THE DPVA WITH THIS SYSTEM...COMBINED WITH 
STRONG 925 MB AND 850 MB LOW LVL FORCING BEHIND THE SFC FRONT 
(KATAFRONT) WILL PRODUCE A PERIOD OF WIDESPREAD RAIN ACRS THE 
WESTERN CWFA UNTIL AROUND MIDNIGHT AND ACRS THE ERN CWFA UNTIL ABOUT 
3 AM OR 4 AM.  INSTABILITY AHEAD OF SFC LOW HAS BEEN HARD TO COME 
BY...ESPECIALLY WITH MID LVL CAPPING.  WILL STILL...HOWEVER...KEEP A 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN THE DAY...CMH...CVG AND PMH 
GROUPS...MAINLY FOR THE EVENING HOURS.

WITH PASSAGE OF THE S/WV...STRONG CAA AND SINKING AIR WILL CLEAR 
SKIES RAPIDLY TOWARD MORNING.  COLD AIR BEGINS TO MOVE ACRS THE WARM 
WATERS OF LAKE MICHIGAN ON SATURDAY.  HOWEVER...FETCH IS NOT DIRECTED
ACRS THE ENTIRE REGION.  ENOUGH MSTR FOR THE LAKE COMBINED WITH 
DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD PRODUCE SOME CUMULUS CLOUDS ACRS THE NRN 
ZONES WITH MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS SOUTH.  TEMPS WILL BE MUCH COOLER.

FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...ANOTHER S/WV IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT PIVOTS ACRS 
THE SRN GREAT LAKES.  850 MB FLOW BECOMES MORE FAVORABLE FOR CLOUDS 
TO MOVE INTO THE NRN ZONES FROM LAKE MICHIGAN (WITH TEMPS AT 850 MB 
AROUND -7 C)  FOR NOW...WILL LEAVE PARTLY CLOUDY NORTH AND MOSTLY 
CLEAR SOUTH.  FROSTY OR NEAR FREEZING CONDITIONS WILL AFFECT THE 
REGION SATURDAY NIGHT.

ON SUNDAY...MODELS LINGER 850 MB MSTR ACRS THE NORTH. WILL CONTINUE 
PARTLY CLOUDY THERE WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SOUTH.  850 MB TEMPS AND MODEL 
SOUNDINGS SUGGEST TEMPS ABOUT A CATEGORY COOLER THAN MOS GUIDANCE.  
THUS...FCST WILL REFLECT THIS.

FROSTY CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED SUNDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
OVERHEAD ALONG WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.

.ILN...NONE.

THEN INTO  CNTRL ILLINOIS WHERE IT TRANSITIONS OVER TO A WARM FRONT.

JUST ABOUT PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY.  CURRENT 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY OVER NRN INDIANA WAS BEING CAUSED BY 
AN INITIAL S/WV ACRS THE WRN GREAT LAKES.  THIS FEATURE WILL MOVE NE 
THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT.  MOST...IF NOT ALL...THE PCPN SHOULD

OVERNIGHT SEEM ON TARGET.

SFC LOW WILL DEVELOP ALONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY.  SINCE FRONT IS NOT

ALLOW FOR MORE WAA TO CONTINUE INTO THE REGION.  IN 
ADDITION...DEWPOINTS MAY CREEP INTO THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S.

60S...AND SFC BASED CAPES APCHING 600 J/KG...A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE USED IN THE ZONES FOR FRIDAY (MAINLY AFTERNOON 
WEST AND IN THE AFTERNOON EAST).  WITH 850 MB FLOW INCREASING TO 45 
TO 50 KT...SLIGHT RISK OF SVR THUNDERSTORMS IS NOT OUT OF THE 
QUESTION.

AS THE SFC LOW RIPPLES ACRS OUR NW CWFA LATE FRIDAY AFTN AND 
EVENING...THE COLD FRONT WILL SLIDE SE ACRS THE REGION.  STRONG 
DPVA...WAA AND 925 MB TO 850 MB CONVERGENCE LOCATED WEST OF SFC 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL PRODUCE A WIDESPREAD AREA OF RAIN ONCE FRONT 
PASSES THROUGH.  CATEGORICAL POPS WILL BE USED FOR FRIDAY EVENING.

COLD FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH THE REGION BY SATURDAY MORNING...WITH 
PCPN ENDING QUICKLY FROM WEST TO EAST.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH 
COLDER THAN WE HAVE EXPERIENCED OF LATE.  DRY WX AND PARTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES ARE ANTICIPATED ATTM FOR THE WEEKEND.

THE FIRST MAJOR FROST/FREEZE MAY COME TO THE REGION BY EARLY MONDAY 
MORNING AS CLOUDS SHOULD BE THIN AND WINDS LIGHT.

.ILN...NONE.

THERE...BUT LLVL THCKNSS AND FCST MDL SNDGS ELSEWHR ACRS FA INDICTG 
HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPR 70S.

8H CONV ON BACK SIDE OF FNT...BEST CHC FOR PCPN THUR NGT WL RMN ACRS 
THE N AND THINK FAR SE WL PRBLY RMN DRY. WL THEREFORE TAPER POPS FM 
LIKELY NW TO 20 PCT PMH AREA. FNT THEN PUSHES THRU AREA DURG THE DAY 
ON FRI WITH SERIES OF WAVES RIDING NE ALG IT SO HIGH POPS ACRS 
ENTIRE FA. WITH CLDS AND PCPN MOVG IN THUR NGT INTO FRI...WL TREND A 
LTL WRMR THAN GUID FOR LOWS AND A LTL COOLER FOR HIGHS.

LTL COOLER THAN PREV RUNS. BASED ON AVN 1000-850 THCKNSS...HIGHS FOR 
SAT AND SUN MAY NOT MAKE IT OUT OF THE 40S. WL NOT COMPLETELY BITE

OVR SRN CAN/GRTLKS BY WEEKEND. IN THE SHORT TERM UPR RDG CNTRD OVR 
TN VLY TO CONT TO CONTROL OH VLY WX THRU WED. WARM ADVECTION AHD OF 
INTIAL S/WV FM UPR MS VLY THRU NRN GRTLKS PRODUCING FEW/SCTD MID 
LVL CLDS. THESE CLDS WL BE MAINLY CONFINED TO NRN OH...SO WL MAINTAIN
MSTLY CLR SKY COND FCST. TEMPS RUNNING 5 TO 7 DEGS WMR THAN LAST NIGHTS
READINGS AT THIS TIME. THIS IS MAINLY A RESULT OF SWR WNDS IN 5 TO 
10 MPH RANGE. WND SHUD STAY UP IN 5 TO 10 MPH RANGE OVRNGT IN ALL BUT
PROTECTED AREAS. LOWS SHUD BE A FW DEGS WRMR THAN LAST NIGHTS. WL 
OPEN UP A RANGE FOR PROTECTED AREAS WHERE WND WL BCM LIGHT...
OTHERWISE FCST LOOKS GOOD. 

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
210 PM EDT TUE OCT 2 2001

A LOT TO LOOK AT WITH THE BEGINNING OF A LONGWAVE PATTERN SETTING UP 
FOR THE WEEKEND. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES ARE FAIRLY CONSISTENT (WITHIN 
3 DEGREES) THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT WITH THE EXCEPTION OF HIGHS FROM 
THE FAN FOR TOMORROW. WILL DISCOUNT HIGHS IN THE MID 70S NOTED HERE 
AND CONTINUE WITH A FCST AROUND 80. OTHERWISE...WILL NOT STRAY TOO 
FAR. ARCTIC AIRMASS INDICATED TO MOVE THROUGH FCST AREA ON FRIDAY 
BEHIND FIRST REALLY GOOD COLD FRONT OF THE SEASON. PRECIPITATION 
QUITE PREDOMINANT DURING THE DAY HERE AND WITH GOOD CAA IT LOOKS 
LIKE IT MIGHT BE A STEADY TEMPERATURE DAY. WILL STICK WITH NUMERICAL 
GUIDANCE AND NOTE A LOWER DIURNAL (<10 DEGREES) WITH HIGHS IN THE 
UPPER 50S.

LONG RANGE MODELS INDICATING THAT THE COLDEST AIR ON SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY MORNINGS WILL NOT BE AS PREVIOUSLY FCST IN THE MID 30S. 
REASONING HERE WOULD BE THE DECREASE IN CLOUD COVER LATE FRIDAY 
NIGHT AS OPPOSED TO ALL NIGHT. CENTER OF HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD BE 
CLOSE TO CWA SUNDAY MORNING WITH A DRY AMS BELOW 500MB. 
HOWEVER...THERES A FAIRLY SERIOUS INCREASE IN MEAN RH ABOVE 500 
THAT WOULD CORRELATE TO THE WARMER OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES FOR THIS 
TIME FRAME. WILL STILL HAVE TEMPS IN THE 30S...BUT DO NOT EXPECT THE 
BEST RADIATIONAL NIGHTS ATTM SO WILL TREND BACK TOWARDS CLIMATOLOGY 
FOR THE LAST FEW DAYS OF FCST. STILL EXPECT TO BE A BIT BELOW NORMAL.

REGARDING CONVECTION AND POSSIBILITY OF THUNDER ON FRIDAY...WILL 
CONTINUE TO HOLD OFF AND REALIZE THAT THE BEST CHANCE WOULD BE IN 
THE SOUTHEAST FCST AREA.

NEXT FEATURE TO LOOK AT IS WINDS ON WEDNESDAY AND THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS. FORECAST RIGHT NOW IS CALLING FOR 10-20 WITH GUSTS TO 30. 
30-40KT JET SHOULD SET UP FROM SW-NE AHEAD OF FRONT AND MAINTAIN 
ITSELF OVERNIGHT. ONLY PROBLEMS HERE IS ITS STILL A WARM ADVECTION 
PATTERN WHICH STATISTICALLY DECOUPLES OVERNIGHT. STRENGTH OF JET AT 
H9 TELLS ME TO KEEP WINDS JUST SLIGHTLY LOWER THAN THE DAYTIME AND 
KEEP MENTION OF GUSTS.

ANY INPUT MORE THAN WELCOME.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

THURSDAY PM. WILL REMOVE THE THUNDERSTORM WORDING CURRENTLY 
MENTIONED IN NW FCST AREA LATE WED...AS ANY PRECIP SHOULD BE SHOWERS 
TO OUR NORTH...VERY LIGHT RAIN OR SPRINKLES TO THE SOUTH. 
INSTABILITY LOOKS MINIMAL AT BEST AND FORCING MECHANISMS SHOULD BE 
CENTERED A LOT CLOSER TO THE UPPER LOW TO THE NORTH OF THE GREAT 
LAKES. 

AM CONCERNED ABOUT THE FEATURES PRESENT ON AVN MODEL TOWARDS FRI 
MORNING. DPROG/DT AT 12Z FRI SHOWS GOOD CONSISTENCY WITH THE HIGH 
OVER THE PLAINS...BUT LARGE CHANGES OVER NRN NEW ENGLAND AND THE H5 
AND SFC LOWS NORTH OF THE GREAT LAKES. THIS LEADS ME TO BELIEVE THAT 
THE TRANSITIONAL AREAS (INCLUDING FRONT DROPPING THROUGH OH VLY) 
ARENT BEING HANDLED THAT WELL. 

STRONGLY AMPLIFIED PATTERN OVER WRN U.S. EXPECTED FOR LONGER RANGE 
FCST WHICH TRANSLATES TO A COOL PERIOD. HOWEVER...PREVIOUS WEEKEND 
LOWS AROUND 30 LOOK WAY TOO COLD. WILL DEFINITELY BE A GOOD BIT 
BELOW CLIMO BUT NOT BY THAT MUCH.

SHOWS UPPER LOW RETROGRADING AND HANGING ON TO THE MID ATLANTIC MORE 
THAN ETA BETWEEN 48 AND 60 HOURS.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
DOMINATE FORECAST THROUGH PERIOD.  A WEAK/DRY COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
ACROSS FA TUESDAY NIGHT.  WILL REMOVE POPS AS FRONT HAS WEAK 
REFLECTION IN BOTH SURFACE AND 500 MB AND WILL BE GOING THROUGH THE 
NIGHT WHERE DIURNAL HEATING WILL ELIMINATE ANY CHANCE FOR 
INSTABILITY.  AFTER PERUSING PROGGED SOUNDINGS AND THE CU RULE 
BELIEVE AFTERNOON CU WILL BE LESS EXTENSIVE THAN TODAY AND BE MORE 
OF THE 1/8 TO 2/8 COVERAGE...MAKING MO. SUNNY LOOK REASONABLE.

FWC TEMPS ARENT TO BAD.  WILL LOWER TOWARD MAV TEMPS OVERNIGHT AS 
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO APPROACH TDS.  WILL 
ALSO GO WITH SOME KIND OF COOLER IN OUT-LYING AREAS.  FOR THE LAST 
PERIOD WILL DROP 2 TO 3 DEGREES FROM FWC TO COME MORE IN LINE WITH 
THE MAV.  FWC DOES NOT APPEAR REASONABLE RAISING HIGHS FROM SUN TO 
MON BY 5 TO 7 DEGREES.  AROUND 3 DEGREES SEEM MORE REASONABLE.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.
