507 
FXUS61 KILN 281939
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 PM EDT FRI SEP 28 2001

AREA UNDER NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT WITH UPPER LOW CENTERED AROUND 
SOUTHEAST NEW YORK.  MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT WRT THE UPPER LOWS 
POSITION THROUGH 24 HRS...THEN ETA BEGINS TO MOVE THE SYSTEM OFF THE 
COAST...WHILE THE AVN KEEPS THE TROF ALONG THE EAST COAST AND EVEN 
RETROGRADES THE LOW BACK INTO NORTH CAROLINA BY SUNDAY NIGHT AS IT 
DEVELOPS AN EARLY SEASON NOREASTER. I CONTINUE TO FAVOR THE AVN 
SOLUTION AS IT HAS DONE BETTER IN TRACKING THIS SLOW MOVING SYSTEM.

SFC MAP FEATURES HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER GREAT 
LAKES...WITH RIDGING EXTENDING THROUGH CVG TO CRW.  A WEAK TROF IS 
LOCATED ACROSS NORTHERN OHIO.  WITH THE UPPER AIR PATTERN NOT 
SHIFTING MUCH...THE HIGHS CENTER WILL SAG VERY SLOWLY SOUTHEAST 
TOWARD THE OHIO RIVER OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS.

DRY AIR...EXCEPT AT LOW LEVELS...ALONG WITH LARGE SCALE DOWNWARD 
MOTION BEHIND THE UPPER LOW...WILL KEEP US PRECIP-FREE.  WITH NO 
PRECIP IN THE PICTURE THROUGH THE WEEKEND...FCST PROBLEMS INVOLVE 
SKY CONDITION AND TEMPS.  WITH UPPER TROF REMAINING NEARLY 
STATIONARY THROUGH SUNDAY...IT DOES NOT APPEAR THAT THE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE THAT HAS RESULTED IN CLOUDS TODAY WILL BE MOVING ANYWHERE 
TOO FAST.  EVEN THE FASTER AND DRIER ETA KEEPS 925 MB MOISTURE 
AROUND ON SATURDAY BEFORE IT BRINGS SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL DRYING ON 
SUNDAY.  

WITH AN AREA OF DRIER AIR EVIDENT ON VIS SATELLITE OVER AND NORTH OF 
LAKE ERIE AND HEADED IN OUR DIRECTION AS SFC TROF MOVES SOUTH...I 
EXPECT CLOUDS TO DISSIPATE AROUND SUNSET THIS EVENING.  THEREFORE... 
ILL GO WITH BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT.  PERSISTENT LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE ON SATURDAY WILL RESULT IN CU FORMATION WHICH WARRANTS 
PARTLY SUNNY FCST.  MOSTLY CLEAR WILL WORK AGAIN FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT.  ON SUNDAY...AVN SHOWS UPPER LOW RETROGRADING IN OUR GENERAL 
DIRECTION...WITH SOME PVA INDICATED.  HOWEVER...A GOOD DEAL OF LOW 
LEVEL DRYING IS SHOWN BY SUNDAY...SO ILL GO WITH MOSTLY SUNNY.

FWC TEMPS HAVE GENERALLY BEEN TOO HIGH LATELY.  I THINK THAT TREND 
WILL CONTINUE WITH NORTHEASTERLY SFC FLOW...CLOUDS AROUND DURING THE 
DAY AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AT NIGHT...SO ILL UNDERCUT FWC BY A 
COUPLE DEGREES.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO






FXUS61 KILN 281939
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 PM EDT FRI SEP 28 2001

AREA UNDER NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT WITH UPPER LOW CENTERED AROUND 
SOUTHEAST NEW YORK.  MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT WRT THE UPPER LOWS 
POSITION THROUGH 24 HRS...THEN ETA BEGINS TO MOVE THE SYSTEM OFF THE 
COAST...WHILE THE AVN KEEPS THE TROF ALONG THE EAST COAST AND EVEN 
RETROGRADES THE LOW BACK INTO NORTH CAROLINA BY SUNDAY NIGHT AS IT 
DEVELOPS AN EARLY SEASON NOREASTER. I CONTINUE TO FAVOR THE AVN 
SOLUTION AS IT HAS DONE BETTER IN TRACKING THIS SLOW MOVING SYSTEM.

SFC MAP FEATURES HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER GREAT 
LAKES...WITH RIDGING EXTENDING THROUGH CVG TO CRW.  A WEAK TROF IS 
LOCATED ACROSS NORTHERN OHIO.  WITH THE UPPER AIR PATTERN NOT 
SHIFTING MUCH...THE HIGHS CENTER WILL SAG VERY SLOWLY SOUTHEAST 
TOWARD THE OHIO RIVER OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS.

DRY AIR...EXCEPT AT LOW LEVELS...ALONG WITH LARGE SCALE DOWNWARD 
MOTION BEHIND THE UPPER LOW...WILL KEEP US PRECIP-FREE.  WITH NO 
PRECIP IN THE PICTURE THROUGH THE WEEKEND...FCST PROBLEMS INVOLVE 
SKY CONDITION AND TEMPS.  WITH UPPER TROF REMAINING NEARLY 
STATIONARY THROUGH SUNDAY...IT DOES NOT APPEAR THAT THE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE THAT HAS RESULTED IN CLOUDS TODAY WILL BE MOVING ANYWHERE 
TOO FAST.  EVEN THE FASTER AND DRIER ETA KEEPS 925 MB MOISTURE 
AROUND ON SATURDAY BEFORE IT BRINGS SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL DRYING ON 
SUNDAY.  

WITH AN AREA OF DRIER AIR EVIDENT ON VIS SATELLITE OVER AND NORTH OF 
LAKE ERIE AND HEADED IN OUR DIRECTION AS SFC TROF MOVES SOUTH...I 
EXPECT CLOUDS TO DISSIPATE AROUND SUNSET THIS EVENING.  THEREFORE... 
ILL GO WITH BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT.  PERSISTENT LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE ON SATURDAY WILL RESULT IN CU FORMATION WHICH WARRANTS 
PARTLY SUNNY FCST.  MOSTLY CLEAR WILL WORK AGAIN FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT.  ON SUNDAY...AVN SHOWS UPPER LOW RETROGRADING IN OUR GENERAL 
DIRECTION...WITH SOME PVA INDICATED.  HOWEVER...A GOOD DEAL OF LOW 
LEVEL DRYING IS SHOWN BY SUNDAY...SO ILL GO WITH MOSTLY SUNNY.

FWC TEMPS HAVE GENERALLY BEEN TOO HIGH LATELY.  I THINK THAT TREND 
WILL CONTINUE WITH NORTHEASTERLY SFC FLOW...CLOUDS AROUND DURING THE 
DAY AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AT NIGHT...SO ILL UNDERCUT FWC BY A 
COUPLE DEGREES.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO





537 
FXUS61 KILN 271915
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EDT THU SEP 28 2001

H5 LOW OVER LAKE ONTARIO IS PROGGED TO MOVE TO NYC BY 00Z 
SATURDAY...WITH MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON ITS SPEED AND POSITION.
LOW IS THEN FCST TO BE AROUND DELMARVA BY 12Z SATURDAY. ETA AND AVN 
DIFFER BY 00Z SUNDAY...WITH ETA PUSHING THE LOW OFF THE COAST WHILE 
THE AVN KEEPS THE TROF ALONG THE COAST.  AVN HAS BEEN MUCH BETTER IN 
REPRESENTING THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE LOW...AND I STILL FAVOR THE 
AVNS SLOWER SOLUTION.
  
OUR AREA IS EXPERIENCING COOL CONDITIONS IN THE NORTHERLY FLOW 
BEHIND THE UPPER LOW...WITH CLOUDS MOVING DOWN FROM THE GREAT LAKES 
ASSOC WITH WEAK SFC TROFS.  SFC HIGH CENTERED OVER SOUTH CENTRAL 
CANADA IS MOVING SLOWLY SOUTHEAST BEHIND THE UPPER LOW.  THE HIGH 
SHOULD BE CENTERED FROM NEW ENGLAND THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY BY 
SUNDAY AS THE UPPER TROF BECOMES POSITIONED ALONG THE EAST COAST.

WITH THREAT OF LAKE ENHANCED PRECIP VIRTUALLY OVER HERE...SKY 
CONDITION IS MY MAIN CONCERN.  SATELLITE SHOWS LOW AND MID CLOUDS 
AND MODELS INDICATE MOISTURE WILL PERSIST TONIGHT.  MODELS SHOW A 
GRADUAL DECREASE IN MOISTURE AS THE UPPER LOW SLOWLY DROPS 
SOUTHEAST...WITH DRIER AIR BEGINNING TO MOVE IN FROM THE NORTH LATE 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...MODEL SOUNDINGS AND H8 RH PANELS SHOW 
THAT A FEW CLOUDS WILL STILL BE AROUND ON FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTH.

WITH CLOUDS LIKELY TO ERODE SOMEWHAT WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEATING...ILL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY FOR TONIGHT...THEN PARTLY SUNNY 
FOR SATURDAY WITH A FEW LESS CLOUDS AROUND THAN TODAY.  PARTLY 
CLOUDY WILL WORK AGAIN ALL ZONES FRIDAY NIGHT.  FOR SATURDAY...AS H8 
RH LEVELS CONTINUE TO DROP FROM NORTH TO SOUTH...ILL GO WITH MOSTLY 
SUNNY NORTH AND PARTLY SUNNY SOUTH. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK IN THE BALLPARK.  ILL GO A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW FWC 
AT CVG FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS WITH RADIATIONAL COOLING ALLOWING READINGS 
TO DROP OFF.   HIGH TEMPS ARE LAGGING FWC TODAY AT DAY AND CMH BUT I 
EXPECT LESS CLOUDS THERE ON FRIDAY SO FWCS LOW 60S SHOULD WORK 
THERE.  69 MAY BE A BIT HIGH FOR SATURDAY SO ILL UNDERCUT BY A 
DEGREE OR TWO.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO  







FXUS61 KILN 281530 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1130 AM EDT FRI SEP 28 2001

UPDATE TO BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH DAY...CMH AND WAPAK ZONE GROUP 
CLOUD COVER AND TEMPERAURES.  CLOUDS IN THE COLD AIR ADVECTION ARE 
FILLING IN.  STILL BELIEVE THAT THERE WILL BE SOME MIXING OUT BUT 
MORE PESSIMISTIC SEEMS TO BE THE WAY TO GO.  ACROSS THE SOUTH WILL 
STICK WITH PARTLY SUNNY BUT WILL BUMP TEMPS DOWN A BIT.

UPDATED ZFP WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

945 AM EDT FRI SEP 28 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM NORTHWEST 
INDIANA TO SOUTH OHIO.  TO THE NORTHEAST OF THIS AXIS CLOUDS ARE 
BROKEN CLOUD COVER.  TO THE SOUTHWEST SKIES ARE CLEAR.  CLOUDS TO 
THE NORTHEAST SHOULD BREAK UP TO SOME DEGREE AND LIFT...WHILE CU 
SHOULD FORM SHORTLY OVER THE SOUTHWEST.  CU RULE FROM 00Z ETA RUN 
INDICATES BKN SKIES OVER FA THIS AFTERNOON.

CURRENT FORECAST HAS SITUATION WELL IN HAND.  MORNING SOUNDING 
SUPPORTS FORECAST HIGHS.  CLOUD COVER WILL ALSO WORK OUT.

FXUS61 KILN 280711
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 AM EDT FRI SEP 28 2001

MSTR TRAPPED BLO THE STRENGTHENING INVERSION WL CONTINUE TO MAKE FOR 
A TUF SKY COND FCST...ESPLY IN THE FIRST CPL PDS.  SAT TRENDS DEPICT 
STRATO-CU WAS GRADUALLY CREEPING INTO NE PORTIONS OF THE CWFA 
(CENTRAL OHIO)...AND XPCT THIS TO CONT.  ALSO SEEING SOME MID LVL 
CLOUD...ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK UPGLIDE IN THE 290-295 K LAYER.  
CURRENT PLAN IS TO GO PSNY ALL ZONES TDY...ALTHOUGH WL HV TO MONITOR 
SAT TRENDS THRU ISSUANCE TO SEE IF MCLDY MAY BE MORE APPROPRIATE IN 
THE N AND E.  TYPICALLY COOLER META SFC TEMPS ACTUALLY 3-4 DEG 
WARMER THAN THE FWC NUMBERS TDY...BUT GIVEN CLOUDS AND NORTHERLY 
TRAJECTORIES CANT SEE HOW WELL BE WARMER THAN YDAY.  MODEL 
TIMESXNS ADVERTISE DEEP SUBSIDENCE/LOW RH ACRS THE AREA OVERNIGHT 
...BUT SOME CLDS WL LIKELY HANG IN BLO THE INVERSION.  WL FCST PCLDY 
ALL ZONES...AND STICK CLOSE TO THE WARMER FWC TEMPS WITH SOME 
UNCERTAINTY AS TO EXTENT OF CLDS.

DEEP SUBSIDENCE/DRYING CONT THRU THE SHORT RANGE.  GUID TEMPS LK 
RSNBL ON SATURDAY...BUT HV LEANED TWRD COMPROMISE MAV NUMBERS SAT 
NIGHT WITH GOOD RADIATIONAL CONDS XPCTD.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

SKIES HAVE CLEARED WITH JUST A FEW PATCHY CLOUDS FLOATING AROUND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1006 AM EDT THU SEP 27 2001

SFC ANALYSIS AT 13Z INDICATING WEAK SFC TROF ACRS SOUTHERN OH...FROM 
S OF HLG TO NW OF CVG.  06Z MESOETA TAKES TROF S OF OH RIVER AND 
WASHES IT OUT BY MID AFTN.  WITH SOME MRNG SUN AND CAA AT 850...DO 
EXPECT CU DVLPMNT THS AFTN ACRS CWA.  MOST CU WL BE ACRS W CNTRL OH 
AND CMH ZONES...WITH LESS CLDS NEAR OH RIVER.  FEW SHWRS NOTED ON 
RADAR S OF CMH AND WITH ADDL SHORTWAVE FORCING THRU 18Z...WL KEEP 
SLGT CHC IN CNTRL OH INTO ERLY AFTN.  SHLD BE DRY ELSWRE.  WL KEEP 
MO CLDY ACRS W CNTRL AND ADD IT TO CNTRL AREAS FOR THE AFTN.  HAVE 
OPTED TO GO WITH MIX OF CLDS AND SUN ACRS MIA AND WITEWTR VLYS.  MO 
SUNNY ACRS S LOOKS GOOD.

WL OPEN RANGE FOR AFTN TEMPS AT CMH AS 63 OR 64 NOT OUT OF QUESTION 
IN HOCKING AND ROSS COUNTIES.  WL LWR TEMPS ACRS SW AS 12Z ILN 
SOUNDING GIVNG 67 WITH FULL SUN AND 65 WITH SCT CLDS.  
OTHRWISE...TEMPS AND WNDS LOOK ON MARK.

.ILN...NONE.

RYAN/TIPTON




  














FXUS61 KILN 270657
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 AM EDT THU SEP 27 2001


...UPDATED FROM PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
APPARENTLY...VORT LOBE/SFC TROF/AND FETCH OFF LAKE MICHIGAN WAS 
CAUSING SOME SHOWERS ACRS THE NRN MIAMI VALLEY.  WILL HAVE TO PLACE 
A CHANCE OF PCPN IN THIS GROUP AND CNTRL OHIO GROUP FOR THIS MORNING.
A CHANCE OF SHOWERS OR SPRINKLES MAY HAVE TO BE ADDED ELSEWHERE 
DEPENDING ON RADAR TRENDS AT ISSUANCE.

...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE FCST TRENDS OF PESKY CLOSED 
LOW CENTERED NORTH OF LAKE ERIE.  FCST PROBLEMS FOR TODAY WILL 
CENTER AROUND CLOUDS AND DEVELOPING CAA AT 850 MB.

06Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A WEAK SFC TROF EXTENDING FROM NEAR CLE TO 
IND.  THIS WEAK SFC TROF WAS BEING REFLECTED BY A WEAK VORT LOBE 
ALOFT ROTATING AROUND CLOSED LOW.  WEAK SFC TROF AND VORT LOBE 
SHOULD BE NEAR THE OHIO RIVER BY SUNRISE.  WINDS WILL GRADUALLY 
SHIFT TO THE WEST THEN NORTHWEST DURING THE DAY BEHIND THE TROF.
BIG FCST PROBLEM WILL BE THE DEVELOPMENT OF 850 MB CAA BEHIND THIS 
VORT LOBE.  RH FIELDS INDICATE THAT THE SW PART OF THE CWFA WILL SEE 
DRYING BETWEEN 725 MB TO 700 MB FOR A GOOD PART OF THE DAY.  
MEANWHILE...STRATOCUMULUS/CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT WILL BE ON THE 
INCREASE FROM NORTH TO SOUTH AS THE 850 MB CAA SETTLES SOUTH DURING 
THE DAY.  WITH THE TUG OF WAR BETWEEN SUNSHINE...CAA AND INCREASING 
CLOUDS...WARMEST TEMPS WILL BE IN THE SW CWFA (CARROLLTON) WITH THE 
COOLEST READINGS IN THE FAR NORTHEAST (DELAWARE).  THUS...WILL KEEP 
MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR THE NRN MIAMI VALLEY AND CENTRAL OHIO.  
FOR THE WHITE WHITEWATER AND SRN MIAMI VALLEYS ALONG WITH SOUTH 
CENTRAL OHIO...WILL USE PARTLY SUNNY WORDING AS IT MAYBE MOSTLY 
SUNNY DURING THE MORNING FOR AWHILE WITH CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT AND 
ENCROACHMENT DURING THE AFTERNOON.  FOR THE SW CWFA (CVG 
GROUP)...WILL USE MOSTLY SUNNY WORDING.

FOR TONIGHT...850 MB COLD POOL AND FLOW OFF THE GREAT LAKES SHOULD 
KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY OVER THE NRN TWO-THIRDS OF THE CWFA.  THE 
SRN PART SHOULD SEE PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS AS IT WILL BE FURTHEST 
AWAY FROM THE SOURCE REGION OF THE GREAT LAKES.

ON FRIDAY...PESKY CLOSED LOW WILL BE NEAR SE NEW YORK...BECOMING 
MORE ELONGATED.  ONE MORE VORT LOBE IS FCST TO PASS THROUGH THE 
REGION DURING THE AM HOURS.  STRATOCUMULS/CUMULUS WILL KEEP SKIES 
PARTLY CLOUDY ACRS THE WRN FCST AREA.  A LITTLE BIT MORE MID CLOUDS 
IN THE EAST WILL KEEP CONDITIONS THERE MOSTLY CLOUDY.

THE WEEKEND IS LOOKING BRIGHTER AS HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SFC AND 
ALOFT BUILDS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY ALONG WITH MODIFYING TEMPERATURES.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN












FXUS61 KILN 270638
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EDT THU SEP 27 2001

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE FCST TRENDS OF PESKY CLOSED 
LOW CENTERED NORTH OF LAKE ERIE.  FCST PROBLEMS FOR TODAY WILL 
CENTER AROUND CLOUDS AND DEVELOPING CAA AT 850 MB.

06Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A WEAK SFC TROF EXTENDING FROM NEAR CLE TO 
IND.  THIS WEAK SFC TROF WAS BEING REFLECTED BY A WEAK VORT LOBE 
ALOFT ROTATING AROUND CLOSED LOW.  WEAK SFC TROF AND VORT LOBE 
SHOULD BE NEAR THE OHIO RIVER BY SUNRISE.  WINDS WILL GRADUALLY 
SHIFT TO THE WEST THEN NORTHWEST DURING THE DAY BEHIND THE TROF.
BIG FCST PROBLEM WILL BE THE DEVELOPMENT OF 850 MB CAA BEHIND THIS 
VORT LOBE.  RH FIELDS INDICATE THAT THE SW PART OF THE CWFA WILL SEE 
DRYING BETWEEN 725 MB TO 700 MB FOR A GOOD PART OF THE DAY.  
MEANWHILE...STRATOCUMULUS/CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT WILL BE ON THE 
INCREASE FROM NORTH TO SOUTH AS THE 850 MB CAA SETTLES SOUTH DURING 
THE DAY.  WITH THE TUG OF WAR BETWEEN SUNSHINE...CAA AND INCREASING 
CLOUDS...WARMEST TEMPS WILL BE IN THE SW CWFA (CARROLLTON) WITH THE 
COOLEST READINGS IN THE FAR NORTHEAST (DELAWARE).  THUS...WILL KEEP 
MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR THE NRN MIAMI VALLEY AND CENTRAL OHIO.  
FOR THE WHITE WHITEWATER AND SRN MIAMI VALLEYS ALONG WITH SOUTH 
CENTRAL OHIO...WILL USE PARTLY SUNNY WORDING AS IT MAYBE MOSTLY 
SUNNY DURING THE MORNING FOR AWHILE WITH CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT AND 
ENCROACHMENT DURING THE AFTERNOON.  FOR THE SW CWFA (CVG 
GROUP)...WILL USE MOSTLY SUNNY WORDING.

FOR TONIGHT...850 MB COLD POOL AND FLOW OFF THE GREAT LAKES SHOULD 
KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY OVER THE NRN TWO-THIRDS OF THE CWFA.  THE 
SRN PART SHOULD SEE PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS AS IT WILL BE FURTHEST 
AWAY FROM THE SOURCE REGION OF THE GREAT LAKES.

ON FRIDAY...PESKY CLOSED LOW WILL BE NEAR SE NEW YORK...BECOMING 
MORE ELONGATED.  ONE MORE VORT LOBE IS FCST TO PASS THROUGH THE 
REGION DURING THE AM HOURS.  STRATOCUMULS/CUMULUS WILL KEEP SKIES 
PARTLY CLOUDY ACRS THE WRN FCST AREA.  A LITTLE BIT MORE MID CLOUDS 
IN THE EAST WILL KEEP CONDITIONS THERE MOSTLY CLOUDY.

THE WEEKEND IS LOOKING BRIGHTER AS HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SFC AND 
ALOFT BUILDS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY ALONG WITH MODIFYING TEMPERATURES.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN









728 
FXUS61 KILN 270145
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 PM EDT WED SEP 26 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS SHOWED LOW NEAR LAKE HURON WITH TROF DOWN THROUGH 
CENTRAL OHIO. WITH UPR LOW ALSO SPINNING OVER THE LAKES...MID CLDS 
ARE RETURNING TO THE SRN TIER. WILL KEEP EVERYONE MOSTLY CLOUDY. 
TEMPS ARE DOWN INTO THE LOW TO MID 50S ATTM WITH DWPTS IN THE LOWER 
40S. BUT ALREADY SEEING A VARIETY OF TEMPS IN THE SOUTH FROM CLEAR 
SPELL SO WILL OPEN UP A RANGE THERE. OTHERWISE NO CHANGES.

.ILN...NONE.

616 
FXUS61 KILN 261836
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
236 PM EDT WED SEP 26 2001

PERSISTENT UPR LO LOCATED JUST E OF LAKE HURON WL DRIFT SLOWLY E
THRU ERN GRTLKS THU AND THEN ELONGATE AS IT MOVES INTO NEW ENGLAND 
FRI. AVN MODEL HS BEEN THE MOST CONSISTENT AND THE ETA MODEL HS
TRENDED SIGNIFICANTLY TOWARD THE AVN. BOTH MODELS ARE SHOWING 
A SLOWER MOVEMENT OF THE CLOSED LO. BASED ON RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY
FAVOR SOLN CLOSE TO AVN.

LOOKING AT THE DETAILS...WV IMGRY SHWS A VORT LOBE ROTATING 
ARND THE UPR LO THRU NRN OH WITH A SECOND LOBE OVR NRN LWR MI 
XPCTD TO ROTATE SE THRU OH LT TNGT/THU. CYCLONIC FLO TO CONT
ALONG WITH PVA WHICH WL WORK TO KEEP SKY CONDS MSTLY CLOUDY.

A FEW LIGHT SHWRS OR SPNIKLES WL BE PSBL ESPECIALLY ACRS ERN
SECTIONS LT TNGT INTO THU ASSOCIATED WITH NXT S/WV. BEST PE/S
STAY TOO OUR NE...SO WL PLACE THE SILENT 20 POPS IN FCST TNGT
AND THU.

DIFFERENCES DEVELOP BTWN AVN AND ETA FRI WITH THE AVN ELONGATING AND 
HOLDING BACK SRN PTN OF UPR TROF. THIS WL TEND TO KEEP MORE CLDS 
ARND. WL MAINTAIN PARTLY CLDY COND IN W AND WL GO WITH MSTLY CLOUDY
IN THE E.

TEMP WISE...WL FAVOR COOLER LOWS CLOSER TO MAV GUID THRU THE PD.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

704 
FXUS61 KILN 261410
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1010 AM EDT WED SEP 26 2001

PERSISTENT LOW PRESSURE NORTH OF LAKE ERIE WILL CONTINUE TO DRAW 
CHILLY AIR INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY.  MID LEVEL MOISTURE IS 
ROTATING IN AS WELL...AND MODELS INDICATE THIS MOISTURE WILL BE 
AROUND ALL DAY.

LATEST SATELLITE AND SFC OBS SHOW MID LEVEL CLOUDS RESULTING IN 
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES...WITH MORE BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS EVIDENT IN 
SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO.  THEREFORE ILL UPDATE SKY CONDITION TO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY ALL ZONES EXCEPT SOUTH CENTRAL...WHERE ILL USE PARTLY SUNNY.

WITH CLOUDS AROUND...FCST HIGH TEMPS WILL NEED ADJUSTMENT AS 
WELL...DOWN TO UPPER 50S NORTH...AND AROUND 60 SOUTHWEST.  WINDS 
NEED DIRECTIONAL ADJUSTMENT AND ILL ALSO MENTION GUSTS OVER 20 MPH 
AT DAY.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

FXUS61 KILN 261026
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
625 AM EDT WED SEP 26 2001

HAVE BEEN WATCHING THE SATELLITE TRENDS THE REMAINDER OF THIS 
MORNING.  AC CLOUD SHIELD NOW MOVING INTO THE SRN CWFA.  WILL HAVE 
TO UPDATE FOR AT LEAST MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS SOUTH THIS AM.  AC 
DECK EXTENDS FURTHER BACK TO THE NORTHWEST ACRS WISCONSIN AND 
MICHIGAN.  AM CONCERNED THAT IF SUNSHINE DOESNT ERODE AC DECK 
...PARTLY SUNNY MAY NOT WORK OUT FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  SO AS NOT 
TO YO-YO...WILL CONTINUE THE MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR THE AM 
HOURS...ALLOWING THE DAY SHIFT TO ASSESS THE SATELLITE TRENDS FOR A 
MORNING UPDATE.  IF THE AC DECK HOLDS TOUGH...TEMPS MAY HAVE TO BE 
TWEAKED DOWN A LITTLE.


.ILN...NONE.


126 
FXUS61 KILN 260643
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 AM EDT WED SEP 26 2001

TEMPERATURES AND SKY CONDITIONS WILL BE DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN TODAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY.

AVN MODEL SEEMS TO BE THE MOST CONSISTENT ON PESKY CLOSED LOW NOW 
CENTERED NEAR LAKE HURON.  THE ETA MODEL HAS TRENDED SIGNIFICANTLY 
TOWARD THE AVN...WHICH DEPICT A MUCH SLOWER EJECTION OF THE CLOSED 
LOW THROUGH FRIDAY.

CURRENTLY SATELLITE IMAGERY AND SFC OBS SHOW A RAPID DECREASE IN THE 
STRATOCMULUS DECK ACRS THE CWFA.  THIS WAS IN RESPONSE TO WAA AT THE 
850 MB LEVEL WHICH WILL CONTINUE THROUGH TODAY.  WITH THE WAA AND 
850 MB FLOW ORIGINATING OFF THE LAND MASS OF WISCONSIN/ILLINOIS...I 
AM NOT EXPECTING ANY CUMULUS/STATOCUMULUS.  HOWEVER...A VORT 
LOBE...NOW ACRS LAKE MICHIGAN...WILL ROTATE THROUGH THE REGION 
DURING THE MORNING HOURS.  IT MAY BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR A 
TIME..THEN PARTLY SUNNY AS SOME OF THE AC ERODES WITH SOME DAYTIME 
SUNSHINE.  THUS...WILL GO WITH A PARTLY SUNNY WORDING ALL LOCATIONS 
IN ORDER TO COMPROMISE THE MOVEMENT OF THE MID LVL CLOUDINESS.
AS FOR TEMPS...THEY WILL BE CLOUD DEPENDENT.  ALL TEMPERATURES 
SCHEMES CALL FOR HIGHS NEAR 60 NE CWFA TO THE LOWER 60S WRN AND SRN 
LOCATIONS.

FOR TONIGHT...MODELS BEGIN TO SHOW ANOTHER VORT LOBE ROTATING INTO 
OHIO.  THE 850 MB FLOW BEGINS TO COME OFF LAKE MICHIGAN AGAIN.  WITH 
THE VORT LOBE AND MSTR PICKED UP FROM THE GREAT LAKES...CLOUDS WILL 
BE ON THE INCREASE.  WILL GO BECOMING MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH AND 
INCREASING CLOUDS SOUTH.  TEMPS SHOULD STAY CLOSE TO MOS VALUES IF 
THE CLOUDS MOVE INTO THE REGION (MID TO UPPER 40S).

ON THURSDAY...THE AFOREMENTIONED VORT LOBE MOVES THROUGH THE REGION 
DURING THE MORNING...FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER ONE DURING THE AFTN.  THIS 
SHOULD KEEP CLOUDS ACRS THE CWFA.  THUS...ATTM WILL LEAVE SKY 
CONDITIONS MOSTLY CLOUDY.  ETA MODEL IS GENERATING SOME QPF ACRS THE 
NRN AREAS.  THIS LOOKS A LITTLE BIT LAKE INDUCED.  HOWEVER...IT MAY 
BE SPURIOUSLY PROPAGATED FROM ITS SOURCE REGION (OVER MICHIGAN).  
WILL GO WITH 20 POPS ATTM NRN AREAS...BUT WILL LEAVE FCST DRY.

PESKY UPR LOW SHOULD BEGIN TO RELINQUISH ITS GRIP ON OUR AREA BY 
FRIDAY AS IT BEGINS TO MOVE OFF THE EAST COAST.  WITH WEAK CAA 
CONTINUING ON FRIDAY...HAVE DECIDED TO TRIM HIGHS BACK A CATEGORY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 251850
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EDT TUE SEP 25 2001

17Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A TROF ACROSS NRN OH AND A CDFNT ALONG 
THE ERN SEABOARD.  EXTENSIVE CLOUDINESS REMAINED ACROSS FA DUE TO 
CYCLONIC FLOW AROUND THE STRONG MID-LVL LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES.

CLOUDINESS ACROSS CVG-PMH-DAY GROUPS IS EXPECTED TO BREAK UP DURING 
THE EVENING HOURS BUT SHOULD REMAIN ENTRENCHED FURTHER N. WL INCLUDE 
WDLY SCT -SHRA FOR THE NRN MIAMI VLY AND SPRINKLES FOR DAY-CMH 
GROUPS.  TEMPS WL NOT DROP MUCH WHERE THE CLOUDS REMAIN.  WL HAVE 
COLDEST READINGS VC CVG WHERE CLEARING IS EXPECTED THE EARLIEST.  WL 
GO UPPER 30S THERE BUT WL NOT MENTION SCT FROST DUE TO WINDS. 

UPPER LOW WL NOT MOVE MUCH ON WED BUT MODELS DO INDICATE SOME DRYING 
ACROSS CVG-PMH GROUPS.  WL GO WITH M/S CVG-PMH AND P/C ELSEWHERE.  

AFTER THAT CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ARE EXECTED AS HIGH PRESSURE 
TAKES CONTROL OF THE WX ACROSS FA. 

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

FXUS61 KILN 251345
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 AM EDT TUE SEP 25 2001

UPR LO OVR NRN OH TO DRIFT SLOWLY ENE THRU SRN GRTLKS TDA/TNGT.
WV IMGRY SHWS WRAP ARND S/WV OVR NW OH DROPPING ESE ARND THE UPR LO.
THIS S/WV ALONG WITH ADDITIONAL MSTR OFF THE GRTLKS PROVIDING SCTD
SHWRS. THE BEST CHC OF SHWRS WL OCCUR ACRS THE N WHERE BEST MSTR AND 
COLDEST TEMPS ALOFT WL BE FOUND. WL CONT GRADIENT OF POPS OF 40 N TO 
20 S OF THE OH RVR. 

12Z ILN SOUNDING SHWS CONSIDERABLE MSTR BLO 500MB. BREAKS WHICH HV 
OCCURED ACRS SRN OH AND NRN KY SHUD CU UP WITH SKIES BCMG MSTLY 
CLDY. ACRS NRN MIAMI..DAY..AND CMH ZONES XPCT CLDY CONDS TO PREVAIL. 
ENERGY BLOCK METHOD APPLIED TO 12Z SOUNDING ACCOUNTING FOR CLDS
YIELDS A HI ARND 50. WL ADJUST NRN MIAMI AND CMH TEMPS DOWN A LTL
TO ARND 50.

950MB SHWS 20-25KT NW FLO BCMG W ARND 20KT THIS AFTN. WL ADJUST WINDS
UP TO 10 TO 20 MPH RANGE AND ADD GUSTS.
    

.ILN...NONE.

970 
FXUS61 KILN 250658
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 AM EDT TUE SEP 25 2001

COOL...UNSETTLED WX WILL CONTINUE TODAY.

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS MORNING SHOWED ONE VORT MAX ACRS THE SRN 
CWFA...PIVOTING AWAY FROM THE REGION.  MEANWHILE...ANOTHER VORT MAX 
ACRS LAKE MICHIGAN/WRN MICHIGAN WAS POISED TO MOVE INTO THE REGION 
TODAY.

DEEPER MSTR AND ADDITIONAL MSTR OFF THE GREAT LAKES ASSOCD WITH LAKE 
MICHIGAN VORT MAX WILL PROVIDE FOR MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY SKIES 
TODAY.  A CHANCE OF SHOWERS CAN BE EXPECTED WITH THE HIGHEST POPS 
NORTH AND THE LEAST SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  WITH CLOUDY...COOL AIR 
ACRS THE CWFA...THERE WILL BE A SMALL DIURNAL INCREASE IN TEMPS.

FOR TONIGHT...AFOREMENTIONED S/WV PIVOTS EAST OF THE REGION.  A CHC 
OF SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO THE EVENING HOURS ACRS THE NORTH.  SKIES 
WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY.

ON WEDNESDAY...AVN/ETA SHOW ANOTHER WRAP AROUND S/WV PIVOTING ACRS 
NRN OHIO DURING THE MORNING HOURS.  AS OF NOW...LAKE INDUCED MSTR 
ASSOCD WITH THE S/WV SHOULD REMAIN ACRS NRN OHIO.  
WILL...HOWEVER...KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ACRS THE NE PARTS OF 
THE CWFA WITH PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ELSEWHERE.  TEMPS SHOULD WARM 
5 TO 10 DEGREES THAN TODAYS HIGHS.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL GRADUALLY BUILD INTO THE REGION THURSDAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND...ALLOWING FOR A WARM UP.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

LATEST SAT IMAGERY SHOWING CLDY/MO CLDY CONDITIONS CONTINUING ACROSS 
FA. 18Z ETA SHOWING MID LVL S/W ROTATING FROM W-E ACROSS ILN FA 
TONIGHT. THIS APPEARS TO BE ASSISTING IN GENERATION OF LIGHT SHOWER 
ACTIVITY AS NOTED ON 88D. AM SOMEWHAT CONCERNED THAT THE PARTIAL 
CLEARING CURRENTLY NOTED ACROSS SRN INDY WILL SPILL INTO THE SW 
PORTION OF OUR FA. MID LEVEL NVA AND DEEP LEVEL DVV MAY SUPPORT 
THIS. WILL STAY HOWEVER WITH CURRENT MO CLDY CONDITIONS TONIGHT AS 
ENHANCED CLOUDINESS ACROSS MI EXPECTED TO ROTATE SWARD.

WILL MAKE ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPS AND WINDS ACROSS SRN TWO 
THIRDS OF FA.

MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

630 PM EDT MON SEP 24 2001

UPDATING TO REMOVE AFTER MIDNIGHT WORDING FOR SHOWERS ACROSS 
NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF FA. ALSO WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHC SHOWERS 
ACROSS THE S AND S-CTRL PORTIONS OF FA GIVEN TIMING OF MID-LVL S/W 
AND CURRENT SAT/RADAR TRENDS.

.ILN...NONE.

JTD

FXUS61 KILN 241944
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
343 PM EDT MON SEP 24 2001

CAA AND EXTENSIVE LOW LVL MOISTURE ACROSS FA WL LINGER THROUGH TUE 
NIGHT.  MODELS PROG THE DEVELOPMENT OF A MID LVL CLOSED LOW OVER THE 
LAKES WHICH WL WRAP MOISTURE AROUND THE BACKSIDE OF THE LOW TOWARD 
FA.  LATEST WV IMAGERY INDICATED THAT THIS PROCESS WAS BEGINNING TO 
OCCUR.

WL GO WITH M/CDY SKIES OVERNIGHT ALL GROUPS AND CARRY A CHANCE OF 
-SHRA AFTER MIDNIGHT FOR DAY-CMH AND NRN MIAMI VLY GROUPS.  WITH 
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER WL RAISE FWC MOS LOWS TONIGHT.

MODELS PROG RAIN CHANCES ACROSS NRN FA THROUGH TUE NIGHT AS THE 
MOISTURE ROTATES AROUND THE LOW.  WL LIMIT RAIN CHANCES FOR CVG-PMH 
AREAS TO TUE AND LEAVE NRN KY GROUPS DRY SINCE MOISTURE WL VERY 
LIMITED THAT FAR S.

REST OF FA LOOKS DRY AND COOL AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE 
REGION.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

1006 AM EDT MON SEP 24 2001

AMPLIFIED UPR FLO PTN WITH RDG OVR THE ROCKIES AND TROUGH AXIS
FM LWR MI THRU CNTRL IN. THIS SYS DIGS WITH UPR LO CLOSING OFF
OVR LWR MI THIS AFTN AND THEN MOVG SLOWLY THRU SRN GRTLKS TUE/TUE 
NGT. 

LTST SFC MAP SHWS ASSOICATED CDFNT FM JUST E OF CLE TO NR ZZV TO 
NR PMH. BAND OF SHWRS INVOF OF THIS BNDRY ASSOCIATED WITH DEEPER 
MSTR AHD OF THE UPR TROF HAS EXITED ALL BUT SE OH. THIS PRECIP
SHUD EXIT THE ENTIRE CWA WITHIN AN HOUR. WITH UPDATE WILL DROP
MENT OF PRECIP IN THE ERN SECTIONS. 
  
LTST SATL IMGRY SHWS CLDS BEGINNING TO FILL IN ACRS WRN IN WITH
COLD FLO OFF LM. A FEW BREAKS MAY DVLP IN THE W BUT XPCT CONSIDERABLE
CLD CVR IN CAA PTN. SO WL GO CLDY WITH SKY COND FCST. TEMP WISE...
READINGS CONT TO DROP IN WAKE OF THE FNT. DO NOT XPCT TOO MUCH OF
A RISE DUE TO CLDS AND CAA. WL DROP HI TEMP FCST WITH UPDATE.

S/WV TO DROP SE THRU LM PROVIDING A CHC OF SHWRS IN NW OH THIS AFTN. 
WNDS ARE FAIRLY GUSTY UPSTREAM WITH H8 PROFILEROVR NW IN INDICATING 
30 KTS. THE BRISK WORDING LOOKS ON TARGET.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EDT MON SEP 24 2001

FNT PUSHG SLOWLY E INTO WRN PORTIONS OF FA ATTM WITH PCPN CONTG ACRS 
MUCH OF FA. GIVEN SLOW EWRD PUSH...WL HAV TO HANG ON TO AN ERLY 
MENTION OF PCPN ACRS NW PORTIONS OF FA AND THEN THRU MID MRNG CMH 
AND CVG AREA AND RMNDR MRNG PMH AREA. WINDS FAIRLY GUSTY UPSTREAM 
AND WITH 925 MB WINDS INCRSG TO 20 TO 30 MPH AND CAA...WL INDICT 
BRISK CONDS FOR TDA. TMPS A LTL TRICKY AS CRNT TMPS HIGHER THAN 
XPCTD TMPDS FOR LATER THIS AFTN BUT TMPS SHUD DROP OFF SVRL DGRS 
BETWEEN NOW AND SR. WITH GOOD CAA AND CLDS ARND...THINK AFTN TMPS WL 
ONLY BE IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. UPR LVL LOW DROPG DOWN INTO 
AREA LATE THIS AFTN INTO TNGT WITH WK 8H TROF SHOWN ON ETA ROTATING 
INTO FA LATE THIS AFTN AND TNGT. THIS WL PRODUCE SOME LLVL CONV ACRS 
AREA AND WITH NEXT BATCH OF MSTR ROTATING IN...WL GO WITH CHC POPS 
LATE THIS AFTN ACRS NW AND THEN ACRS ENTIRE AREA TNGT WITH BEST CHC 
ACRS THE N. UPR LVL LOW THEN PROGD TO LIFT SLOWLY NE AWAY FM AREA 
TUE INTO WED. WL CONT WITH CHC POPS FOR TUE AND THEN HANG ON TO AN 
ERLY CHC IN THE N FOR TUE NGT. SHUD HAVE PLENTY OF CLDS ARND ON TUE 
AND LLVL THCKNSS SUPPORTING HIGHS ONLY IN THE LOW TO MID 50S SO WL 
CUT BACK GUID TMPS A CAT OR SO. WL STICK PRETTY CLOSE TO GUID TMPS 
FOR OVRNGT LOWS. UNCERTAIN ABT AMT OF CLDS WL SEE ON TUE NGT. FOR 
NOW WL GO PRTLY CLDY BUT IF WE END UP MSTLY CLR...CUD SEE TMPS DRPG 
DOWN INTO THE 30S.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 240153
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 PM EDT SUN SEP 23 2001

MAIN FOCUS FOR UPDATE WL BE TO CLEAR COUNTIES FROM WW 757. 
COMBINATION OF LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...AND AN AIRMASS OVER OUR 
CWFA WHICH WAS DRIER/MORE STABLE TO BEGIN WITH...HAS LED TO A STEADY 
DECLINE IN CONVECTIVE INTENSITY AS ACTIVITY HAS MOVED INTO WESTERN 
OHIO/NORTHERN KY.  AT ANY RATE...NICE FORCING FOR ASCENT IS BEING 
PROVIDED VIA DIGGING SHORT WAVE AND A BROAD WAA PATTERN IN THE 
LLVLS.  THIS HAS RESULTED IN WIDESPREAD CVRG OVER THE WEST SO FAR...BUT 
XPCT A GRADUAL DECRS AS BEST LIFT SHIFTS EAST.  WL CUT POPS BACK TO 
SCATTERED IN THE WEST AS THE WATCH IS CLEARED.   CURRENT TEMP FCSTS 
LK RSNBL GIVEN UPSTREAM READINGS.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

575 
FXUS61 KILN 231852
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
253 PM EDT SUN SEP 23 2001

MODELS STILL HAVING THERE DIFFERENCES IN HANDLING THE DEVELOPING CUT 
OFF LOW OVER THE NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY.  ETA WHICH WAS CUTTING OFF 
THE LOW SOUTHWEST OF FA YESTERDAY NOW CUTS ITS OFF IN WESTERN PA AND 
LIFTS IT OUT QUICKLY.  THIS IS SIMILAR TO THE UKMET AND ECMWF 
SOLUTIONS.  THE AVN/MRF CONTINUES TO TRY TO CUT OFF THE SYSTEM OVER 
OHIO AND LINGER IT FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS.  THE NGM SEEMS TO BE 
SOMEWHERE IN BETWEEN.  THE AVN/MRF MODELS CONTINUE TO BE THE MOST 
CONSISTENT IN THEIR RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY...SO WILL LEAN TOWARDS 
THE SLOWER SOLUTION.

THROUGH 12Z MONDAY THE MODELS AGREE THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL BE 
LOCATED JUST EAST OF THE FA.  MODERATE INSTABILITY OVERNIGHT...SO 
WILL CONTINUE MENTION OF THUNDER.  WITH UPPER LOW CUTTING OFF AND 
COLD AIR ALOFT...ATMOSPHERE SHOULD SUPPORT SCATTERED SHOWERS.  WILL 
HOLD A MENTION OF SHOWERS THROUGH TUESDAY.

EXCEPT CMH HIGH ON MONDAY...WONT STRAY FROM MOS TEMPERATURES TOO 
MUCH THROUGH THE PERIOD.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.


SITES

340 AM EDT SUN SEP 23 2001

WV SAT IMGRY SHWG S/W ENERGY DIVING DOWN ACRS MN INTO IA THIS MRNG. 
MDLS IN GOOD AGRMT DRPG THIS FEATURE SE INTO RGN TDA AND CUTTING OFF 
LOW OVR AREA MON INTO TUE. 

SFC HI PRES CRNTLY OVR RGN WL SHIFT E THRU THIS AFTN WITH CDFNT 
PUSHING INTO WRN FA THRU ERLY EVNG AND ACRS FA TNGT. MDLS CONSISTENT 
IN KEEPING BEST CHC FOR PCPN POST FNTL AS GOOD UPR LVL DIVG DVLPS 
ACRS AREA TNGT. WL KP SKIES MSTLY SUNNY ACRS THE E TDA AND PRTLY 
SUNNY INTO THIS AFTN W. WL BRING IN INCRSG CLDS TO THE NW THRU 
MID/LATE AFTN AND INDICT A LOW CHC POP ACRS THE FAR NW LATE. WL THEN 
GO WITH CAT POPS/SHWRS DVLPG NW TO SE ACRS RMDR FA TNGT. INSTBLTY 
NOT VERY IMPRSV TNGT BUT WITH DECENT DYNAMICS MOVG IN...WL HANG ON 
TO A FEW TSTMS OVRNGT. UPR LVL LOW THEN SETTLES OVR AREA FOR THE 
NEXT SEVERAL DAYS SO WL CONT WITH CHC POPS THRU MID WEEK. 

LLVL THCKNS AND FCST MDL SNDGS BOTH SUPPORTING HIGHS TDA IN THE UPR 
70S TO ARND 80 WITH FULL SUN. WITH FAIR AMT OF SUN XPCTD ACRS S AND 
E PORTIONS OF FA...WL GO A LTL WRMR THAN GUID TMPS FOR HIGHS. COOLER 
ETA/AVN SEEM MORE REASONABLE WITH COLD POOL MOVING IN NEXT CPL DAYS 
SO WL TREND FCST TWD COOLER MAV TMPS RMNG PDS WITH HIGHS. HOWEVER 
WITH CLDS ARND...MAV TMPS MAY BE A LTL TOO COOL FOR LOWS NEXT FEW 
NGTS.

.ILN...NONE.

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY.

CIRRUS OVER FA.  TDS ARE IN THE LOW TO MID 50S.  CURRENT FORECAST IS

DENSE FOG FORMATION.  AT THE MOMENT DONT BELIEVE IT WILL HAPPEN BUT 
WILL KEEP MONITORING.

FXUS61 KILN 221946
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 PM EDT SAT SEP 22 2001

SURFACE HIGH WILL CROSS THE FA OVERNIGHT...PRODUCING CLEAR SKIES.  
EXPECT SOME MVFR FOG AROUND SUNRISE TOMORROW...BUT DONT FEEL THAT 
IS NECESSARY AT THIS TIME TO INCLUDE IT IN THE ZONES.

COLD FRONT REACHES WESTERN FRINGE OF FA BY 00Z SUN.  EASTERN 
COUNTIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY..WHILE EXPECT SOME INCREASING CLOUDS 
IN THE AFTERNOON ACROSS THE WEST.  WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY.

COLD FRONT CROSSES THE FA SUNDAY NIGHT.  MODELS IN PRETTY GOOD 
AGREEMENT IN SHOWING MODERATE INSTABILITY SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH LI 
DROPPING TO -2 TO -3.  WILL KEEP A MENTION OF THUNDER IN SUNDAY 
NIGHT. 

AFTER 48 HOURS MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE IN THEIR SOLUTIONS.  THE ETA 
IS THE FARTHER SOUTH OF THE U.S. MODELS IN CUTTING OFF THE 500MB 
LOW...BUT CLOSE TO THE ECMWF.  THE MRF IS FARTHER NE...BUT NOT AS 
FAR AS THE UKMET.  THE 12Z AVN IS NOW A LITTLE FARTHER SW THAN THE 
MRF.  IS THIS A HINT THAT THE AVN/MRF IS BEGINNING TO TREND FARTHER 
SW.  WILL GO WITH A AVN/ECMWF BLEND IN THE EXTENDED.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES IN THE SHORT TERM...DIDNT STRAY TOO FAR FROM MOS.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES

LATE ENUF TO KP THINGS MSTLY CLEAR TNGT.

BUT ETA STILL HOLDING THINGS OFF TIL SUN NGT. WL TRY TO KP SUN DRY 
FOR NOW AND THEN KP LIKELY POPS FOR SUN NGT AS INITIAL S/W ROTATES 
INTO AREA.

THEN A DGR OR TWO WRMR ON SUN AS LLVL WAA DVLPS. HAV STUCK PRETTY 
CLOSE TO GUID TMPS THRU SHORT TERM.

SOME DIFFERENCES IN THE XTNDD AS ETA NOT CUTTING OFF UPR LOW THRU 60 
HRS...LEAVING MORE OF AN OPEN TROF WHILE AVN FURTHER N WITH UPR LVL 
LOW AND FARTHER N AND E WITH SFC LOW THAN PREVIOUS RUNS THRU 00Z 
TUE. STILL THO...GIVEN AVN RUN TO RUN TRENDS OF CUTTING OFF LOW...WL 
CONT WITH CHC OF SHWRS THRU TUE AND MUCH COOLER TMPS THRU MID WEEK.

LOW AND FARTHER N AND E WITH SFC LOW THAN PREVIOUS RUNS THRU 00Z 
TUE. STILL THO...GIVEN AVN RUN TO RUN TRENDS OF CUTTING OFF LOW...WL 
CONT WITH CHC OF SHWRS THRU TUE AND MUCH COOLER TMPS THRU MID WEEK. 

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

FOR BEFORE MIDNIGHT.

FOR SKY CONDS TDA. 

WITH SOME SUN PSBL...THIS WL HELP DSTBLZ THINGS AS WE GO THRU LATE 
MRNG/ERLY AFTN. THIS WL BE OUT AHD OF SFC TROF AXIS WHICH IS PROGD 
INTO WRN FA LATE THIS AFTN AND ACRS ERN FA THRU ERLY EVNG. ETA 
INDICTG GOOD INSTBLTY AXIS INTO FA BY 18Z WITH GOOD WIND FIELDS ALSO 
ROTATING INTO AREA. NW FA IN LFQ OF 50 KT 5H JET AT 18Z SO SHUD SEE 
PRETTY GOOD CONV/DIV COUPLET SET UP...ESPCLY ACRS THE N THRU ERLY 
AFTN. QUESTION IS HOW MUCH MSTR WL BE LEFT. WL GO WITH CHC POPS ALL 
AREAS WITH BEST CHCS ACRS THE N AND E...IN AREA OF BETTER FORCING 
AND A LTL BETTER MSTR. WL KP AN EYE ON RADAR TRENDS AND TRY TO 
INDICT SOME TIMING AS IT LOOKS LIKE BEST CHC WL BE THIS AFTN. 

MDLS HANGING ON TO SOME LLVL MSTR INTO TNGT AND WITH 8H THERMAL TROF 
STILL TO OUR E...THINK WL SEE SOME CLDS LINGER. WL GO MSTLY CLDY N 
AND PRTLY CLDY S TNGT AND THEN PRTLY CLDY ENTIRE AREA ON SAT AS 
THERMAL TROF SHIFTS E. WL ALSO PUSH PCPN FOR SUN BACK TO SUN NGT AS 
DPROG/DT ON AVN SLOWING THINGS DOWN. HOWEVER...AVN CONTG TREND OF 
SHWG CUT OFF LOW DVLPG THRU TUE AND THIS IN LINE WITH UKMET SO WL 
ADD CHC PCPN FOR MON AND TUE IN THE XTNDD AND COOL THINGS DOWN A LTL.

DUE TO UNCERTAINTY OF CLD COVER...STUCK CLOSE TO FWC TMPS FOR HIGHS 
TDA THO IF WE SEE ENUF SUN...1000-850 THCKNSS ACTUALLY SUPPORTING 
HIGHS INTO THE UPPER 70S. FOR SAT...THCKNSS INDCT FWC TMPS MAY BE A 
LTL ON THE COOL SIDE SO WL LEAN TWD WRMR MAV TMPS FOR HIGHS.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 200741
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EDT THU SEP 20 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS H5 CUTOFF LOW MOVING INTO NORTHERN MICHIGAN. 
AS THE CUTOFF CONTINUES SLOWLY TOWARD SOUTHERN ONTARIO...THE FLOW 
ALOFT ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WILL SHIFT FROM SOUTHWEST NOW TO 
NORTHWEST THIS AFTERNOON. THE UPPER FLOW WILL THEN BACK TO WEST 
TONIGHT AND TO SOUTHWEST ON FRIDAY AS ANOTHER SHORT WAVE MOVES 
ACROSS THE LOWER GREAT LAKES.   

SFC MAP ALSO FEATURES LOW IN NORTHERN MICHIGAN.  COLD FRONT EXTENDS 
SOUTH FROM THE LOW THROUGH CENTRAL OHIO.  FRONTAL POSITION IS CLOSE 
TO ETAS SOLUTION FROM 24 HRS AGO. AS THE WEAKENING LOW MOVES 
NORTHEAST INTO ONTARIO...THE COLD FRONT WILL BE EAST OF OUR CWA BY 
THIS AFTERNOON.  WEAK RIDGING AND DRIER AIR WILL BUILD IN BRIEFLY 
TODAY BEFORE ANOTHER COLD FRONT APPROACHES FRIDAY AND CROSSES THE 
AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN AGAIN ON SATURDAY.

PARTLY CLOUDY FCST LOOKS GOOD FOR TODAY WITH PRECIP EAST OF THE 
REGION AND MOST CLOUDS PULLING NORTHEAST AS RIDGE BUILDS IN THE WAKE 
OF THE SFC LOW.  CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT AHEAD OF THE NEXT 
SYSTEM...SO ILL CONTINUE BECOMING MOSTLY CLOUDY FCST IN THE WEST 
AND PARTLY CLOUDY EAST.  

ILL KEEP SLIGHTLY ABOVE FWC POPS FOR FRIDAY WITH A GOOD CHANCE FOR 
SHRA/TSRA. WITH THE SHORT WAVE FARTHER NORTH AND WITH LESS FAVORABLE 
SFC CONVERGENCE...ACTIVITY WILL PROBABLY NOT BE AS WIDESPREAD AS IT 
WAS ON WEDNESDAY.  HOWEVER...A DECENT MOISTURE PLUME ALONG WITH 
ADEQUATE INSTABILITY...WIND FIELDS AND PVA SHOULD RESULT IN SOME 
PRECIP.  AVN IS AGAIN FASTER BRINGING THE FRONT THROUGH ON FRIDAY.

FWC TEMPS GOOD FOR TODAY.  FWC LOOKS TOO LOW TONIGHT WITH CLOUDS 
MOVING IN LATE.  SATURDAY SHOULD BE COOLER THAN FWC INDICATES WITH 
CLOUDS AND PRECIP AROUND SO ILL UNDERCUT.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

FXUS61 KILN 191905

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EDT WED SEP 19 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS DEEP LOW OVER SRN LAKE MI WITH COLD FRONT 
NEAR THE IN/OH BORDER.  SECONDARY (AND PERHAPS THE REAL COLD FRONT) 
IS OVER NORTHERN IL.  SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATING EXTENSIVE CLOUD 
COVER IN THE COLD SECTOR.

MODELS ARE IN DESCENT AGREEMENT.  HOWEVER, THERE ARE MINOR 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM ON FRIDAY.  WILL GO WITH THE AVN 
LATTER IN THE PERIOD AS IT SEEMS MORE CONSISTENT WITH THE INTEGRITY 
OF THE FEATURES OVER THE OHIO VALLEY/GREAT LAKES REGION.  OVERNIGHT 
WILL BACK OFF POPS TO 30 AS NOT MUCH ACTIVITY HAS TAKEN PLACE WITH 
UPPER LOW VORT AND IT WILL BE GOING THROUGH OVERNIGHT.  CLOUDS WILL 
HOLD TOUGH UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING AND THEN SLOWLY BREAK INTO PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES.  NEXT SYSTEM IS RIGHT ON ITS HEALS AND WILL SPREAD THE 
THREAT OF RAIN INTO FORECAST AREA FRIDAY.  WILL THROW BEST CHANCE 
ACROSS THE NORTH WHERE FORCING WILL OCCUR OVER A LONGER PERIOD OF 
TIME.

FWC TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD FOR THE FIRST 3 PERIODS.  THE FOURTH 
PERIOD WILL LOWER TEMPS A FEW DEGREES AND RAISE POPS TO BECOME MORE 
IN LINE WITH ETA/AVN SOLUTION.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE CWFA. A LINE OF

AROUND AN INCH AN HOUR. THIS IS EXPECTED AS PWAT OFF MORNING 
SOUNDING WAS AROUND 1.5. HEAVY RAIN WILL BE BIGGEST THREAT SINCE

WORDING IN THE EAST AND WILL LOWER TEMPS SW A CAT DUE TO RAIN/CLDS.

SPLIT UPPER FLOW CONTINUES WITH STRONG SOUTHERN BRANCH SHORT WAVE 
APPROACHING OUR CWA.  SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO LIFT NORTHEAST 
THROUGH MICHIGAN BY 12Z THURSDAY.  DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
FOLLOW THE SHORT WAVE ON THURSDAY.

SFC MAP HAS VIGOROUS LOW OVER ILLINOIS WITH A WARM FRONT EXTENDING 
FROM THE LOW ACROSS NORTHERN INDIANA AND OHIO.  LOW IS FCST TO LIFT 
THROUGH MICHIGAN WITH THE SHORT WAVE.  LOW WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT 
ACROSS OUR REGION TONIGHT.  AVN IS FASTER WITH THE FRONT...BRINGING 
IN TO CVG BY 00Z THIS EVENING...WHILE THE ETA HAS THE FRONT AT CVG 
AT 06Z TONIGHT.  SLOWER ETA SOLUTION MAKES MORE SENSE WITH LOW 
LIFTING NORTHEAST WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN A MORE GRADUAL EASTWARD 
MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT.

RADAR SHOWS SWATH OF PRECIP ALONG THE INDIANA/OHIO BORDER.  
THUS...100 POPS LOOK GOOD FOR TODAY.  RAIN WILL REACH CMH AND OTHER 
EASTERN AREAS LATER THIS MORNING SO ILL GO WITH SHRA/TSRA 
DEVELOPING THERE.  WITH THE FRONT IN THE AREA...LIKELY POPS WILL 
STILL WORK FOR TONIGHT...AS WILL CHANCE POPS EAST EARLY THURSDAY.  
OTHERWISE... SKIES SHOULD BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY ON THURSDAY IN DRIER 
AIR BEHIND THE FRONT.  

HEAVY RAIN IS LIKELY TODAY...BUT WITH THE RATHER PROGRESSIVE NATURE 
OF THIS SYSTEM...AND WITH THE UPPER FLOW PUSHING THE FRONT THROUGH 
BY LATE TONIGHT...WE HAVE DECIDED THAT A WATCH IS NOT REQUIRED AT 
THIS TIME.

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK ACCEPTABLE SO I WONT BE DEVIATING FROM 
THEM BY MORE THAN A DEGREE OR TWO. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO







AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
755 PM EDT TUE SEP 18 2001

WL UPDATE ZONES SHORTLY TO REMOVE EVNG PD. LTST SFC ANLYS SHWG LOW 
PRES CNTRD OVR NE MO WITH WRM FNT XTNDG E ACRS CNTL IL/IN INTO NW 
OH. BULK OF PCPN ACRS FA DURG PAST CPL HRS HAS BEEN ALG WRM FNT ACRS 
NW PORTIONS OF FA THO A FEW SHWRS LINGERING IN WARM SECTOR IN CNTRL 
OH. MORE WIDESPRD PCPN STILL WELL TO OUR W IN ACSTN WITH BETTER UPR 
LVL DYNAMICS/EMBEDDED S/WS MOVG THRU MS VLY. 18Z MESOETA SEEMS TO 
HAVE A PRETTY DECENT HANDLE ON CRNT PCPN SITUATION AND THIS KPS BEST 
CHC OF PCPN OUT OF W TIL ARND 06Z AND NOT INTO E UNTIL LATE TNGT. 
HOWEVER...LLVL FLOW PROGD TO INCRS THRU THE REST OF THE WITH INCRSG 
ISENT LIFT SO MAY SEE WAA TYPE PCPN BCM A LTL MORE WIDESPRD THRU THE 
LATE EVNG HRS/ERLY MRNG BEFORE MAIN SHOT OF PCPN COMES IN. WL TRY TO 
REWORD ZONES A LTL TO INDICT SOME TIMING FOR BETTER CHC PCPN LATER 
TONIGHT. NO CHGS PLANNED TO TMPS.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT





638 
FXUS61 KILN 181844
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EDT TUE SEP 18 2001

A MOIST PATTERN IS EXPECTED ACRS THE REGION TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT.

16Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING FROM 
CNTRL OH...CNTRL IN...CNTRL IL...SOUTHWEST TO A SFC LOW OVER SE KS.
A COLD FRONT TRAILED FROM THE SFC LOW ACRS OKLA AND TX.

THIS WEATHER SYSTEM WILL BE THE MAIN WX MAKER ACRS OUR REGION 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT.  ALL MODELS INDICATE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS/TSTM 
POTENTIAL DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  THE SFC WEATHER SYSTEM WILL 
BE AIDED BY AN UPR LVL H5 TROF...WHICH IS NOW PUSHING INTO THE CNTRL 
PLAINS THIS AFTN.  A SERIES OF EMBEDDED VORT MAXES COMBINED WITH 
WARM...MOIST ASCENT WILL BE THE TRIGGERING MECHANISMS FOR THE PCPN.  
AS OF NOW...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD 
ACRS THE WRN CWFA AFTER MIDNIGHT WHILE THE ERN CWFA WILL JUST HAVE A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS/POSSIBLY A TSTM.  ON WEDNESDAY...THE SFC LOW 
PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO DEEPEN AS IT MOVES TO GRR BY LATE AFTN.  THE 
ETA/AVN ARE SIMILAR WITH THE DEEPENING...BUT FOR SOME ODD 
REASON...THE AVN SEEMS TO ACCELERATE THE SFC COLD FRONT ACRS THE 
REGION EARLY THURSDAY EVENING.  THE MORE SLOWER PUSH OF THE FRONT BY 
ETA/NGM IS A MORE PLAUSIBLE SOLUTION GIVEN THE DEEPENING OF THE SFC 
LOW.  REGARDLESS...WILL KEEP HIGHS POPS ACRS THE FCST AREA ON WED AS 
OCCASIONAL SHOWERS/TSTMS CAN BE EXPECTED.

AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES ACRS THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY MORNING...A DECREASING TREND IN THE PCPN WILL RESULT.

SKIES SHOULD EVENTUALLY BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY IN THE WAKE OF THE 
FRONT ON THURSDAY.

WILL STAY CLOSE TO MOS VALUES TONIGHT THRU WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS LITTLE 
DIURNAL CHANGE IS ANTICIPATED.  WENT A LITTLE WARMER THAN MOS ON 
THURSDAY.

IN THE EXTENDED...LONG RANGE MODELS HAVE DONE A REVERSE IN THE 500 
MB HEIGHT FIELDS.  YESTERDAY...A ZONAL PATTERN WAS THE SOLUTION.  
HOWEVER...TODAY...AN AMPLIFIED PATTERN IS NOW THE SOLUTION 
...BRINGING IN A S/WV BY LATE FRIDAY AFTN/EVENING...WITH ANOTHER 
POISED FOR SUNDAY.  PREFER THE UKMET SOLUTION ATTM WHICH IS A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE MRF AND EURO.  THUS...WILL NOT GO AS COOL FOR 
HIGHS NEXT WEEK AS THICKNESSES WOULD INDICATED...BUT DEFINITELY NOT 
AS WARM AS THE MRF MOS GUIDANCE.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN







1050 AM EDT TUE SEP 18 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES WARM FRONT INTO WESTERN KANSAS INTO WEST 
CENTRAL/NORTHWEST OHIO.  KILN SHOWING SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS 
SOUTHERN 2/3 OF FORECAST AREA.  THIS AREA IS SLIDING SOUTHWARD.  
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLEARING IN THE WAKE OF THE STRONG VORT 
MAX ACROSS NORTHERN IN/OH.  12Z ETA INDICATING NOT A WHOLE LOT OF 
FORCING THIS AFTERNOON.  SO THREAT SHOULD DIMINISH.  
HOWEVER...COVERAGE AT THE MOMENT IS MORE EXTENSIVE.  WILL UPDATE 
TEMPS ACROSS THE SOUTH TO OPEN UP RANGES AS MORE CLOUD COVER IS 
EXPECTED.

ALREADY UPDATED TO REMOVE PRECIP WORDING IN THE NORTHWEST GROUP.  
WILL UPDATE SOON TO TAKE REMOVE PRECIP IN THE DAY/NORTHERN CMH 
GROUPS AND WILL UPDATE AROUND NOON TO REMOVE PRECIP FROM THE 
SOUTHERN CMH GROUP. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 180752
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
350 AM EDT TUE SEP 18 2001

RATHER COMPLEX UPPER AIR PATTERN FEATURES SPLIT FLOW WITH A COUPLE 
OF SHORT WAVES IN THE SOUTHERN BRANCH ABOUT TO AFFECT OUR WX.  FIRST 
SHORT WAVE WILL CROSS NORTHERN OHIO TODAY WITH SECOND MORE 
SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE DUE TO ARRIVE ON WEDNESDAY.  ETA AND AVN 
AGREE IN TIMING SHORT WAVES...WITH AVN INDICATING A MORE AMPLIFIED 
TROF BY 12Z WEDNESDAY.

SFC MAP SHOWS WARM FRONT EXTENDING INTO OHIO FROM LOW ALONG 
TEXAS/NEW MEXICO BORDER.  FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY NORTH TODAY BEFORE 
SFC LOW STRENGTHENS AND MOVES THROUGH MICHIGAN ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
ALONG WITH THE SECOND SHORT WAVE.

RADAR SHOWS SCT TSRA OVER NW OHIO AND SHRA OVER INDIANA ASSOC WITH 
FIRST SHORT WAVE.  SHRA/TSRA WILL PROCEED ACROSS OUR CWA AS SHORT 
WAVE MOVES EAST. WITH SHORT WAVE AXIS PROGGED THROUGH THE AREA BY 
18Z...I EXPECT THAT MOST SHRA WILL OCCUR THIS MORNING AS PER 
PREVIOUS FCST. ILL KEEP MORNING WORDING IN OUR NORTHERN ZONES...AND 
USE MAINLY MORNING WORDING IN THE SOUTH WHERE POOLING DEW POINTS 
WILL MEAN THAT A CHANCE OF SHRA WILL STILL EXIST THIS AFTERNOON. 
ILL ALSO CONTINUE SCT POPS BASED ON COVERAGE.

CHANCE POPS STILL LOOK GOOD FOR LATE TONIGHT AS SECOND SHORT WAVE 
BEGINS ITS INFLUENCE.  ILL INCREASE POPS TO 90% FOR WEDNESDAY AS IT 
APPEARS SHRA/TSRA WILL BE WIDESPREAD WITH WELL STACKED SYSTEM AND 
GOOD DYNAMICS/MOISTURE.  

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK A BIT LOW WITH WARM ADVECTION OCCURRING... 
SO ILL GO A COUPLE DEGREES ABOVE FWC FOR THE MOST PART.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO






FXUS61 KILN 171846
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EDT MON SEP 17 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS SHOWED A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER SE IOWA.  
THIS WAS ASSOCD WITH A MID LVL S/WV (VORT MAX) JUST NEAR SE 
WISCONSIN.

MODELS ARE IN SIMILAR AGREEMENT OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS IN DRIVING THE
S/WV FROM WISCONSIN SE INTO OHIO DURING THE MORNING HOURS ON 
TUESDAY...THEN EAST OF THE REGION BY TUESDAY EVENING.  AVN CONTINUES 
TO BE A LITTLE STRONGER...BUT THE ETA IS NOT THAT FAR OFF.  ENOUGH 
DPVA AND WAA AHEAD OF THE S/WV SHOULD BRING A RISK OF A SHOWER AFTER 
MIDNIGHT ACRS THE WRN CWFA...THEN OVER THE ENTIRE REGION DURING THE 
MORNING HOURS ON TUESDAY.  BELIEVE SKIES MAY BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY 
DURING THE AFTN HOURS TOMORROW...AND WILL WORD FCST AS SO.

ANOTHER S/WV CURRENTLY LOCATED OVER THE INTERMOUNTAIN REGION WILL 
PIVOT E INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS ON TUESDAY...THEN E TOWARD THE OHIO 
VLY WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  AS MENTIONED BY NCEP...AVN 
SEEMS TO BE HAVING SOME CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK PROBLEMS WHILE THE ETA 
DID NOT INITIALIZE THE S/WV OVER THE INTERMOUNTAIN REGION 
CORRECTLY.  THIS PLACES A LOWER CONFIDENCE IN THE FCST GIVEN THE TWO 
SITUATIONS.  THE BEST SCENARIO HERE WOULD BE TO CONTINUE WITH 
CONSISTENCY.  ALL MODELS OVER THE LAST FEW DAYS HAVE BEEN SHOWING A 
HIGH PRECIPITATION EVENT OVER OUR AREA WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  I WILL CONTINUE THAT TREND.  COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH 
THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT...LEAVING PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS AND 
NEAR SEASONAL TEMPS FOR THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND.

HAVE TRENDED NEAR MOS TONIGHT AND TUESDAY (WITH EXPECTED SUNSHINE 
DURING TUESDAY AFTN)...WARMER TUESDAY NIGHT (GIVEN CLOUDS/HIGHER 
DEWPOINTS EXPECTED) AND COOLER WEDNESDAY WITH EXPECTED CLOUDS AND 
RAINFALL.

A WEAK FRONT IS POISED TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION AGAIN SOMETIME 
SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY.  RIGHT NOW...THE FRONT APPEARS MOISTURE 
STARVED...SO WILL KEEP DRY FORECAST FOR NOW.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN











FXUS61 KILN 171402
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1000 AM EDT MON SEP 17 2001

13Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED SFC HIGH PRESSURE EAST OF THE OHIO VLY.  
MEANWHILE...A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WAS CENTERED OVER IOWA.

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS MORNING WAS INDICATING TWO DISTINCT S/WVS.  
ONE S/WV WAS LOCATED OVER SE IOWA...WRN IL AND NE MO.  THE OTHER 
S/WV WAS CENTERED OVER SE MN.

THE WEAKER S/WV OVER SE IOWA...WRN IL AND NE MO IS FCST TO DAMPEN 
OUT AS IT MOVES EAST TOWARD THE REGION.  MID LVL MSTR ASSOCD WITH 
THIS SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MAKE IT TO OUR WRN AREAS BETWEEN 2 PM AND 
4 PM.  THUS...AM INCLINED TO LEAVE PARTLY SUNNY WORDING FOR THE WEST.
FOR THE EASTERN AREAS...CURRENT HIGH LVL AC (12K-15K) MAY ACTUALLY 
DISSIPATE WITH THE HEATING OF THE DAY SINCE IT IS VERY THIN.  WOULD 
LIKE TO SEE ONE MORE HOUR OF VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY TO SEE IF 
THIS WILL BE THE CASE.  IF SO...MAY LEAVE MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS 
ACRS THE EAST.  BASED ON THICKNESS SCHEMES AND CLOUDS...MOST 
LOCATIONS WILL TOP OUT BETWEEN 73 AND 76 DEGREES.

FOR TONIGHT...AVN CONTINUES TO BE MORE ENERGETIC WITH S/WV OVER MN 
AS IT PIVOTS SE INTO OUR REGION.  AS A RESULT...IT HAS A STRONGER 
RETURN FLOW (WAA) AND GENERATES MORE PCPN THAN CURRENT MESOETA.  
WILL LOOK AT THE NEW RUNS THIS AFTN TO SEE IF THE CONTINUES ITS 
CONSISTENCY.  IF SO...SCATTERED SHOWERS MAY BE A GOOD BET ACRS THE 
WEST LATE TONIGHT AND OVER THE ENTIRE REGION ON TUESDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN







ONE S/WV WAS LOCATED OVER SE IOWA...WRN IL AND NE MO.  THE OTHER 
S/WV WAS CENTERED OVER SE MN.

OUT AS IT MOVES EAST TOWARD THE REGION.  MID LVL MSTR ASSOCD WITH 
THIS SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MAKE IT TO OUR WRN AREAS BETWEEN 2 PM AND 
4 PM.  THUS...AM INCLINED TO LEAVE PARTLY SUNNY WORDING FOR THE WEST.

BUT NOT QUITE AS WRM AS MAV IS INDICATING BASED ON XPCTD H8 TEMPS
AND CLDS.

AVN MODEL BEING MOST CONSISTENT. PE/S INCRS TO ARND 1.0 INCH ALONG
WITH WK LO LVL CNVRGC IN RESPONSE TO S/WV. WL CONT LO POP CHC OF
SHWRS IN THE W WITH SILENT 20 POPS IN THE ERN SECTIONS. BASED ON CLDS
AND SRLY WNDS WL GO A LTL WRMR THAN FWC GUID CLOSER TO MAV WITH 
TNGT/S LOWS.

MOVES INTO CNTRL PLNS. A CHC A SHWRS WL CONT ON TUE WITH MAIN THREAT 
IN THE MRNG. CLDS SHUD INHIBIT TEMPS SOME ON TUE SO AGN PREFER HI/S 
A LTL COOLER THAN FWC GUID. 

ETA SOLN SUGGS THAT RDDG WUD HOLD OFF RETURN OF PRECIP UNTIL WED
MRNG. AVN NOT QUITE AS SHARP WITH NXT TROF AND THEREFORE A LTL 
FASTER WITH ASSOCIATED SFC WV. FOLLOWING FAVORED AVN SOLN WL SHW
HIGHEST POPS IN THE W WITH LO POP CHC LATE IN THE E.  

.ILN...NONE.

SUNNY WORDING.  RESIDUAL 850 MB MSTR...COLD TEMPS AT 850 AND AND A 
FLOW OFF LAKE ERIE SHOULD PRODUCE CUMULUS CLOUDS LATER THIS MORNING.


.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

245 AM EDT FRI SEP 14 2001

WV SAT PIX SHWG MID LVL S/W DROPPING DOWN ACRS LWR GRT LKS...WITH
SOME POST FRONTAL SHWRS CONTG ACRS PARTS OF CNTRL/SRN OH. S/W PROGD 
TO DROP SE OF FA THRU 12Z WITH NVA/DRYING WORKING ACRS FA FM THE NW. 
PLAN ON KPG AN ERLY MENTION OF SCT SHWRS ACRS THE S TO ACCOUNT FOR 
CRNT ACTIVTY. 

ETA AND NGM BOTH HANGING ON TO SOME RESIDUAL LLVL MSTR FM ABT 850 MB 
AND BLO. WITH CAA ACRS AREA TDA...XPCT TO SEE SOME CU DVLP THRU LATE 
MRNG/ERLY AFTN PER FCST MDL SNDGS...ESPLCY ACRS THE E WHR LLVL MSTR
BEST. HOWEVER...THIS WL BE COUNTERED SOMEWHAT BY PRETTY GUD 
NVA/SUBSIDENCE SO CU FIELD MAY BE MAINLY SCT. FOR NOW WL GO WITH 
PRTLY SUNNY TYPE WORDING. 

NELY LLVL FLOW TDA ALG WITH CONTD CAA SO PREFER COOLER ETA/NGM TMP 
PROFILES AND WL LEAN TWD COOLER FWC GUID NUMBERS FOR HIGHS TDA. 
MSTLY CLR SKIES TNGT BUT WNDS MAY STAY UP A LTL...ESPCLY ERLY 
...WHICH MAY LIMIT RAD COOLING A TAD SO WL GO A BIT WRMR THAN FWC 
GUID TNGT.

SFC HI PRES SETTLES INTO THE REGION THRU THE WEEKEND WITH MAYBE JUST 
SOME CI SPILLING INTO AREA FOR CONTD MSTLY SUNNY/MSTLY CLR. GUID 
TMPS LOOK PRETTY GUD THRU RMNDR SHORT TERM.

.ILN...NONE.

LVL SUPPORT HAS LED TO POST-FRONTAL PRECIPITATION.  THIS WL DROP 
QUICKLY SEWD OVERNIGHT.  PREVIOUS UPDATE HAS FCST WELL IN HAND FOR 
NOW BUT UPDATE EXPECTED BY MIDNIGHT EST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM EDT THU SEP 13 2001

FRONT LOOKS RATHER DIFFUSE AND SHOWER ACTIVITY BEHIND IT FROM IA TO 
MI IS FAIRLY LIGHT. WILL CONTINUE TO TREND PRECIPITATION INTO NRN 
FCST AREA THIS PM...BUT S/W THAT IS ALLOWING FOR THE SUPPORT OF MUCH 
OF THIS CONVECTION IS PROGGED TO MOVE ESE AND OUT OF THE FCST AREA 
OVERNIGHT. WILL KEEP ISOLD CHANCE OR WDLY SCAT IN ZONES WITH A 
HIGHER CHANCE IN CENTRAL OHIO WHERE EFFECTS OF S/W SHOULD BE 
REALIZED A LITTLE BIT MORE THAN REMAINDER OF FCST AREA.

AFTER THIS CHANCE OF RAIN BEHIND THE FRONT...FCST LOOKS NICE AND 
COOL. DAYTIME CU EXPECTED TOMORROW IN COLD POOL BUT PM SHOULD CLEAR 
QUITE QUICKLY FOR LOW TEMPERATURES DROPPING TOWARDS THE 40 MARK IN 
THE NORTH.

GENERALLY FOLLOWING AN AVN/ETA MIX AND AM TRENDING TOWARDS COOLER 
FAN VS FWC/MAV NUMBERS FOR NEXT COUPLE OF PERIODS. 

.ILN...NONE.



FXUS61 KILN 131613
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1212 PM EDT THU SEP 13 2001

WILL RAISE TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE BOARD BY ANOTHER CATEGORY. AMPLE 
SUNSHINE AHEAD OF FRONT ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO HIT 80 OR LOW 80S 
ACROSS ALL BUT FAR NRN FCST AREA. 

WASNT TOO SURE EARLIER THAT THICKNESSES WOULD SUPPORT RAISING TEMPS 
THAT MUCH...BUT CURRENT TEMPS WARRANT ANOTHER BUMP.

...EARLIER DISCUSSION...
WILL ISSUE MORNING UPDATE TO RESOLVE TIMING WORDING IN FORECAST AND 
DROP POPS OUT OF THE SOUTH. EXPECT MOSUNNY SKIES IN SOUTHERN FCST 
AREA...INCREASING CLOUDS IN THE MIDDLE AND CLOUDY IN THE NORTH BY 
AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES LOOK REASONABLE WITH A FAIRLY LARGE N-S 
GRADIENT RANGING FROM THE LOW 70S TO AROUND 80.

LOOKING AT THE FRONT YESTERDAY MORNING...TEMPERATURES IN WI/MN DID 
RECOVER SLOWLY EVEN AFTER THE FROPA SO OUR TEMP SCHEMES SHOULD BE 
CLOSE TODAY.

FAIRLY VIGOROUS S/W MOVING SE BEHIND FRONT MAY SPARK SOME CONVECTION 
LATER THIS EVENING...BUT RELATIVE DRYNESS OF AMS WILL MAINTAIN A 
VERY LOW AREAL COVERAGE OF PRECIPITATION. WILL REMOVE THREAT OF RAIN 
TODAY IN FAR SOUTHERN GROUP AS CURRENT RADAR SHOWS LIGHT SHOWERS 
WELL BEHIND FRONT.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EDT THU SEP 13 2001

6Z SFC ANALYSIS SHOWED COLD FRONT FROM LAKE ERIE BACK THRU LWR MI 
INTO NRN IL. THIS FRONT IS PROGGED BY MDLS TO COME THRU THIS MRNG 
WITH MSTR AND UPR SUPPORT LAGGING BEHIND. ALL MDLS HAVE SLOWER 
TIMING THAN YDA DUE TO MORE AMPLIFIED 500 PATTERN. BEST MSTR AND PVA 
SWING ACROSS AREA THIS AFTN THRU DAYBREAK. MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
EXISTS THIS AFTN MAINLY ACROSS THE SOUTH. WILL CONTINUE NO THUNDER 
FCST FAR NORTH. ONLY REAL CHG TO CURRENT PRECIP FCST IS ADDITION OF 
TIMING TO THE NORTH TDY AND REMOVING FRI POPS FROM SE. WILL LIKELY 
ONLY GO 20 POP SW TDY AS THEY WILL BE FARTHEST FROM UPR DYNAMICS. 

TEMPS AGAIN ARE TRICKY WITH STRONG CANADIAN HIGH BUILDING IN. GROUND 
IS STILL FAIRLY WARM WHICH WILL HELP KEEP OVERNIGHT LOWS FROM 
PLUMMETTING TOO FAR. WILL GO NEAR FWC GUID EXCEPT A LITTLE  WARMER 
FRI NIGHT.  

.ILN...NONE.

075 
FXUS61 KILN 121815
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
217 PM EDT WED SEP 12 2001

COLD FRONT OVER NORTHERN GREAT LAKES ATTM...WILL DROP SOUTH INTO THE 
FA TOMORROW. BIG QUESTION IS HOW MUCH PRECIP WILL ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE SYSTEM AND WHEN.  MODELS ARE SHOWING SOME INSTABILITY AHEAD AND 
ALONG THE OF THE FRONT AS LI DROP TO -2 TO -4 BY 18Z WITH CAPES 
AROUND 1000 J/KG.  MEAN AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS LACKING 
HOWEVER...THUS THE K-INDEX HAS A HARD TIME PUSHING ABOVE 20.  THE 
UPPER LEVEL FORCING LAGS WELL BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT NOT REALLY 
REACHING THE FA UNTIL AFTER 00Z THU.

WILL SLOW PRCIP DOWN A LITTLE TOMORROW...BUT WILL LEAVE CHC POPS FOR 
ACTIVITY ALONG FRONT.  WILL GO AFTN WORDING IN DAY/CMH GROUPS AND 
LATE AFTERNOON FOR CVG/PMH GROUPS.  PC GRIDDS INDICATING GOOD 
Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE BETWEEN 500-300MB FOR THURSDAY NIGHT.  THIS 
ALONG WITH PVA AND INCREASE IN MOISTURE AT LEVELS...WILL ADD CHANCE 
POPS OF SHOWERS.  WILL LINGER POPS IN THE SE FRIDAY MORNING.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES NGM MOS TEMPERATURES REAL CLOSE TO CURRENT 
FORECAST.  THURSDAY NIGHT HOWEVER THEY LOOK A LITTLE COOL...WITH 
CLOUD COVER...SO WILL KEEP THEM CLOSE CURRENT FORECAST.  850 
TEMPERATURES FALL TO PLUS 2 TO PLUS 4 ON FRIDAY.  UPPER 60S FOR HIGH 
LOOK A LITTLE WARM...SO WILL KNOCK A DEGREE OR TWO OFF.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES

835 
FXUS61 KILN 111855
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
256 PM EDT TUE SEP 11 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS BROAD H5 RIDGE OVER MOST OF THE CONUS...WITH 
A DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY.  STRONG SHORT WAVE 
CURRENTLY IN CENTRAL CANADA IS PROGGED TO CARVE A TROF OVER THE 
NORTHEASTERN STATES BY 00Z FRIDAY WHICH WILL RESULT IN SIGNIFICANT 
HEIGHT FALLS IN THE OHIO VALLEY.    

SFC MAP FEATURES HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER OHIO AND INDIANA.  
MODELS AGREE IN BRINGING HIGH TO PENNSYLVANIA BY 12Z WEDNESDAY.  AS 
THE HIGH CONTINUES EAST...LOW FORMING AHEAD OF SHORT WAVE WILL DRAG 
A COLD FRONT ACROSS OUR CWA ON THURSDAY.

CLEAR SATELLITE AND NIL RH EQUALS CLEAR FCST FOR TONIGHT.  MOSTLY 
SUNNY WILL WORK FOR WEDNESDAY WITH ONLY HIGH CLOUDS EXPECTED.  WITH 
THE FRONT STILL NORTH OF HERE...SKIES WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  

WITH FRONT MOVING THROUGH AND WITH AMPLE MOISTURE RETURN AND 
INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT...ILL INTRODUCE CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHRA/TSRA FOR THURSDAY.  MODELS SHOW FRONTAL CONVERGENCE MOVING 
THROUGH BEFORE PEAK HEATING...BUT I THINK THE SITUATION STILL 
WARRANTS CHANCE POPS. LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP WILL BE IN 
OUR SOUTHERN ZONES...WHERE LATER ARRIVAL OF FRONT WILL ALLOW MORE 
HEATING TO TAKE PLACE.

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK A BIT WARM SO ILL UNDERCUT THEM BY A 
DEGREE OR TWO FOR THE MOST PART.   

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

A COLD FRONT ACROSS OUR CWA ON THURSDAY.

CLEAR SATELLITE AND NIL RH EQUALS CLEAR FCST FOR TONIGHT.  MOSTLY 
SUNNY WILL WORK FOR WEDNESDAY WITH ONLY HIGH CLOUDS EXPECTED.  WITH 
THE FRONT STILL NORTH OF HERE...SKIES WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  

WITH FRONT MOVING THROUGH AND WITH AMPLE MOISTURE RETURN AND 
INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT...ILL INTRODUCE CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHRA/TSRA FOR THURSDAY.  MODELS SHOW FRONTAL CONVERGENCE MOVING 
THROUGH BEFORE PEAK HEATING...BUT I THINK THE SITUATION STILL 
WARRANTS CHANCE POPS. LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP WILL BE IN 
OUR SOUTHERN ZONES...WHERE LATER ARRIVAL OF FRONT WILL ALLOW MORE 
HEATING TO TAKE PLACE.

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK A BIT WARM SO ILL UNDERCUT THEM BY A 
DEGREE OR TWO FOR THE MOST PART.   

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO














940 AM EDT TUE SEP 11 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS BROAD H5 RIDGE OVER MOST OF THE CONUS...WITH 
A DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY.  SFC MAP FEATURES 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NORTHERN INDIANA.  HIGH IS FCST TO MOVE 
ACROSS OHIO TODAY TO PENNSYLVANIA BY 12Z WEDNESDAY.    

SATELLITE SHOWS NO CLOUDS...AND MODEL/ACTUAL SOUNDINGS INDICATE NONE 
WILL FORM...SO CURRENT SUNNY FCST LOOKS GOOD.  SINCE FCST HIGH TEMPS 
IN UPPER 70S AND NORTH WINDS 5 TO 10 LOOK FINE AS WELL I WONT NEED 
TO UPDATE THIS MORNING. 

.ILN...NONE.

935 PM EDT MON SEP 10 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A SPRAWLING RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM 
THE MID MS VLY EXTENDING EAST INTO THE OHIO VLY.

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS NO CLOUDS ACRS THE REGION...AND THIS IS NOT 
EXPECTED TO CHANGE OVERNIGHT.  LIGHT SOUTHWEST WINDS ACRS THE NORTH 
MAY SWITCH TO LIGHT NORTHWEST TOWARD MORNING AS THE HIGH MOVES 
CLOSER TO THE AREA.  PATCHY FOG WORDING IN CURRENT FCST PROBABLY OK 
GIVEN THE RAIN THAT FELL OVER WRN OHIO...SE IN AND NRN KY.  
HOWEVER...IT SHOULD NOT GET OUT OF HAND.  LOW TEMPS IN THE 50 TO 55 
DEGREE RANGE ALSO LOOK GOOD.

NO UPDATE PLANNED.

.ILN...NONE.



FXUS61 KILN 101934
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
333 PM EDT MON SEP 10 2001

WITH CUTOFF H5 LOW LIFTING THROUGH EASTERN CANADA...BROAD FLAT H5 
HIGH IS BEGINNING TO DOMINATE THE CONUS. DRY ZONAL FLOW IS SETTING 
UP OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AND WILL REMAIN IN PLACE UNTIL THE NEXT 
MAJOR SHORT WAVE BEGINS TO WARP THE FLOW LATE ON WEDNESDAY.

SFC HIGH MOVING UP THE OHIO VALLEY WILL STAY IN CONTROL THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. WITH THE HIGH MOVING SLOWLY THROUGH...WE WILL EXPERIENCE 
A COUPLE OF CLEAR COOL NIGHTS. WITH LITTLE OR NO MOISTURE AROUND ON 
TUESDAY...ILL GO WITH SUNNY. MOSTLY SUNNY WILL WORK FOR WEDNESDAY 
AS HIGH CLOUDS ARE INDICATED AHEAD OF A WEAK UPPER DISTURBANCE.

ILL MENTION PATCHY FOG FORMING LATE TONIGHT AS THE GROUND IS QUITE 
MOIST IN SPOTS AFTER YESTERDAYS AND LAST NIGHTS DOWNPOURS.

FWC TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY ACCEPTABLE.  LIGHT WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES 
WILL ALLOW LOW TEMPS TO DROP INTO THE LOWER 50S AS PER GUIDANCE.  
FWC HIGHS MAY BE A BIT OPTIMISTIC WITH LESSENING AFFECT OF 
INSOLATION...BUT I EXPECT HIGHS TO RECOVER TO NEAR FWC LEVELS DURING 
THE NEXT TWO DAYS ANYWAY. THEREFORE ILL UNDERCUT FWC HIGHS BY ONLY 
A DEGREE OR TWO.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO





175 
FXUS61 KILN 101409
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1009 AM EDT MON SEP 10 2001

VIGOROUS H5 TROF IS LIFTING NORTHEAST TODAY WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
AND COLD FRONT AS UPPER FLOW BECOMES WEST IN ITS WAKE.  SFC HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER EASTERN OKLAHOMA IS BEING DRAWN INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY BY THE WESTERLY UPPER FLOW.  

PATCHY LOW CLOUDS ARE CONTINUING TO ERODE AS DRY AIR ADVECTS IN AS 
MODELS INDICATE.  SOUTHEASTWARD MOVEMENT OF WEAK VORT MAX CURRENTLY 
OVER INDIANA WILL ALSO REMOVE UPPER SUPPORT FOR CLOUDS.  SATELLITE 
CONFIRMS THIS TREND WITH CLOUDS AT 1.5KFT BECOMING MORE RAGGED AS 
THEY MOVE SOUTHEAST.  FOG AND STRATUS OVER INDIANA SHOULD ALSO 
DISSIPATE SOON...LEAVING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES IN OUR WESTERN 
ZONE...WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AROUND CMH WHERE MORE CU WILL LIKELY 
PERSIST. IN OUR SOUTH CENTRAL ZONES ILL UPDATE TO MOSTLY CLOUDY 
THEN BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY LATE WITH UPSLOPE FLOW OCCURRING...AND 
PVA PERSISTING INTO EARLY AFTERNOON.

AFTER EXAMINING MODELS...MORNING SOUNDING AND YESTERDAYS UPSTREAM 
TEMPS...FCST HIGH TEMPS IN MID TO UPPER 70S LOOK GOOD. WINDS FCST 
ALSO LOOKS GOOD...SO ILL UPDATE TO ADJUST SKY CONDITION WORDING 
EAST AND THAT IS IT.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

298 
FXUS61 KILN 100748
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
348 AM EDT MON SEP 10 2001

KILN SHOWING A BAND OF SHOWERS MOVING EAST ACROSS EASTERN FA.  
SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES THESE SHOWERS ARE POST-FRONTAL AS THE 
FRONT IS FROM INTO EASTERN OHIO.  SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES 
CLEARING OCCURRING OVER INDIANA.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND ARE CONSISTENT WITH THERE 
PREVIOUS RUN.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN TODAY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT.  
COLD AIR ADVECTION IS STRONG AT THE MOMENT BUT BECOMES NEARLY 
NEUTRAL BY 18Z.  CU RULES INDICATE MOSTLY SUNNY IN THE WEST AND 
PARTLY IN THE WEST.  THINK THERE WILL BE SOME INITIAL SCT CU WHICH 
WILL MIX OUT RELATIVELY QUICKLY.  CLEAR SKIES WILL THEN DOMINATE THE 
FORECAST.  CONCERNED ABOUT SOME FOG TOMORROW MORNING...HOWEVER WITH 
24 HOURS OF DRYING BELIEVE AT BEST IT WILL BE PATCHY DENSE GROUND 
FOG.

FWC TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD FOR THE FIRST TWO PERIODS.  HOWEVER THE 
LAST TWO PERIODS THINK HIGHS ARE TOO WARM AS WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL 
MAINLY TAKE PLACE ALOFT.  SO WILL GO A BIT COOLER FOR HIGHS AND 
LOWS.  

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

HAVE NOT ISSUED A WARNING YET WITH CURRENT CONVECTION...AND ONLY

AT 01Z...COLD FRONT WAS ALREADY INTO NW OHIO...EXTENDING SOUTHWEST 
INTO SE INDIANA AND WRN KY.  CURRENT THINKING IS THAT FRONT WILL BE 
NEAR A DAYTON TO CVG LINE AROUND 11 PM EDT OR SO.  IT SHOULD MOVE 
EAST OF CMH TO JUST WEST OF A PMH LINE BETWEEN 1 AM EDT AND 2 AM EDT.
SATELLITE TRENDS SHOW GRADUAL CLEARING IN WAKE OF THE FRONT.  MODELS 
INDICATE THAT DOWNWARD VERTICAL MOTION WILL PREVAIL IN THE 
ATMOSPHERIC COLUMN BEHIND THE FRONT...DESPITE UPR LVL S/WV NOT 
HAVING PASSED ACRS THE REGION.  WITH THAT SAID...WILL HAVE TO END 
PCPN ACRS THE WEST AFTER MIDNIGHT AND WORD SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY 
THEREAFTER.  FOR THE EAST...CATEGORICAL TO LIKELY POPS STILL SEEM 
REASONABLE FOR THE REMAINDER OF TONIGHT.

315 PM EDT SUN SEP 9 2001

LTST SFC ANLYS SHWG CDFNT FM WRN LK MICH THRU SW IL INTO MO WITH 
SEVERAL LINES OF PCPN OUT AHD OF FNT. MDLS CONTG TREND OF SPEEEDING 
THINGS UP WITH ETA/NGM/AVN NOW ALL TAKING FNT THRU FA BY 12Z MON 
MRNG. 

LOOKS LIKE BEST CHC FOR PCPN WL BE THRU THIS EVNG W AND INTO 
ERLY MRNG HRS E AS BETTER UPR LVL FORCING PUSHES ACRS AREA. LEADING 
LINE OF PCPN CRNTLY WORKING ACRS WRN PORTIONS OF FA BUT EWRD PUSH 
HAS BEEN RELATIVELY SLOW THIS AFTN. IT MAY STILL TAKE A WHILE FOR 
MORE WIDESPRD PCPN TO MAKE IT INTO CMH/PMH AREAS SO WL INCLUDE A 
REST OF AFTN WORDING FOR ERN FA FOR JUST A CHANCE OF PCPN BEFORE 
BRINGING IN BETTER CHC THIS EVNG.

WL TAPER POPS FM CAT NW IN AREA OF BETTER FORCING TO LIKELY SE. WL 
HANG ON TO A LOW CHC POP FOR ERLY MON ACRS THE E AS WE MAY SEE A FEW 
LINGERING SHWRS RIGHT BEHIND FNT. OTRWS...XPCT TO SEE SOME CU THRU 
THE DAY WITH SOME LLVL CAA AND A LTL BIT OF LLVL MSTR HANGING ARND 
PER ETA FCST SNDGS. HI PRES THEN BUILDS IN FOR MON NGT AND TUE FOR 
MSTLY CLR/MSTLY SUN CONDS.

12Z MDLS INDICTG A LTL BETTER COOLING BEHIND FNT SO WL TREND CRNT 
TEMP FCST DOWN A TAD FOR HIGHS ON MON...CLOSER TO FWC NUMBERS. 

.ILN...NONE.


FXUS61 KILN 090800
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
358 AM EDT SUN SEP 9 2001

KIND INDICATES SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER CENTRAL INDIANA.  
HOWEVER THE BEST CONVECTION IS OVER EASTERN IL.  SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS COLD FRONT FROM LAKE MI INTO CENTRAL MISSOURI.

MODELS HAVE FINALLY CONVERGED ON SOLUTION...WHICH IRONICALLY IS 
CLOSE TO WHAT THE FORECAST WAS ON WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY.  DROG/DT 
INDICATES THE ETA/AVN ARE CONSISTENT WITH PREVIOUS RUNS.  

WILL BRING FRONT THROUGH OVERNIGHT WITH CATEGORICAL POPS AND HEAVY 
RAIN WORDING.  THEN WILL GO WITH ENDING WORDING FROM WEST TO EAST 
MONDAY MORNING.  AS FOR TODAY...DESCENT CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF FRONT 
ALONG WITH HIGH PWS/PES WILL KEEP LIKELY THREAT OVER WESTERN FA.  IN 
THE EAST CHANCE POPS SEEM BETTER AS CONVERGENCE IS NOT AS GOOD AND 
PWS/PES ARE A BIT LOWER.  NOT REAL HOT ON SEVERE THREAT AND TIMING 
OF IT IF IT OCCURS.  HOWEVER...BEST SHOT WOULD BE THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH A PREFRONTAL TROF AND THEN WITH FROPA OVERNIGHT.  BEST 
CONVERGENCE AND DYNAMICS WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH FRONT.  INSTABILITY 
WILL BE QUESTIONABLE BOTH INSTANCES BUT WILL BE THE BEST THIS 
AFTERNOON.  FEEL A BIT MORE CONFIDENT IN THE POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED 
FLOODING...ESPECIALLY IF AN AREA GETS HIT THIS AFTERNOON AND AGAIN 
TONIGHT.  CONVECTION IN BOTH INSTANCES SHOULD BE PROGRESSIVE.  

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND FRONT BRINGING FALL TYPE AIR TO 
FA.  CONCERNED ABOUT FOG...POTENTIALLY DENSE...TUESDAY MORNING IN 
THE EAST AND SOUTH.  THIS WILL BE HANDLED BY LATTER SHIFTS.

FWC TEMPS LOOK RESPECTABLE.  WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY. 

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON




NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 PM EDT SAT SEP 8 2001

LATEST RADAR INDICATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DECREASING IN 
INTENSITY AND DISSIPATING AS THEY MOVED NORTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTH 
PART OF FA. SCATTERED/ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUED 
TO MOVE INTO SOUTHWEST PART OF FA.  

WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD SEE A CONINUED DECREASE IN 
SHOWERS/THNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER...A WEAK UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE WILL 
PULL NORTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT AND WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE 
CONTINUING ACROSS THE REGION COULD NOT RULE OUT THE CONTINUED CHANCE 
OF A SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM. SO WILL CONTINUE 30 PERCENT CHANCE IN THE 
WEST AND KEEP THE EAST DRY. WILL LOWER WIND SPEEDS A FEW ZONES (EAST 
AND SOUTH). 

MISILN OUT SHORTLY.


.ILN...NONE.

PARKER









FXUS61 KILN 081912
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 PM EDT SAT SEP 8 2001

ETA/NGM HAV COME IN LINE WITH FASTER SOLUTION OF ERLYR AVN RUNS. 
MDLS NOW IN DECENT AGRMT WITH MORE OF AN OPEN WAVE MOVG ACRS FA SUN 
NGT INTO MON. THUS LOOKS LIKE BEST CHC FOR PCPN WL BE SUN NGT AND WL 
TREND FCST IN THAT DIRECTION.

IN THE SHORTER TERM...SOME SHWRS TRYING TO GET GOING ACRS CNTRL IND 
ATTM...JUST TO THE W OF FA. NOT A WHOLE LOT IN THE WAY OF FORCING 
OVRNGT BUT WITH MSTR PLUME CONTG TO SPRD N ACRS AREA AND WK WAA LIFT 
THRU THE OVRNGT HRS...CAN NOT RULE OUT A FEW SHWRS POPPING UP. THINK 
BEST CHC FOR THIS WL BE ACRS THE W SO WL INCLUDE GNRLY LOW CHC POPS 
ACRS THE W WHILE TRYING TO KP E DRY TNGT. CUD SEE A FEW OF THESE 
SHWRS LINGERING ARND IN THE MRNG BUT THINK BETTER CHC FOR PCPN ON 
SUN WL BE MAINLY FM LATE AFTN ON AS S/W ENERGY BEGINS TO APRCH FM 
THE W. WL BREAK OFF A FAR WRN GROUP FOR A LTL HIGHER POPS SUN AFTN AND 
THEN TAPER TO A 20 PERCENT POP IN THE E. WL THEN GO WITH LIKELY POPS 
ACRS ENTIRE FA FOR SUN NGT AS S/W MOVS THRU. WITH FASTER 
SOLUTION...WL JUST HANG ON TO CHC POPS FOR MON....MAINLY IN THE 
MORNING.

PREFER SLIGHTLY WRMR MAV TMPS FOR HIGHS ON SUN...ESPCLY IN THE E WHR 
A LTL MORE SUN PSBL. OTRWS...STAYED CLOSE TO FWC TMPS THRU THE SHORT 
TERM.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

FXUS61 KILN 080739
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
338 AM EDT SAT SEP 8 2001

KILN SHOWING A SHOWER TO THE NORTH OF DAY.  SATELLITE IMAGERY 
SHOWING DEBRIS FROM EVENING CONVECTION OVER PORTIONS OF WESTERN FA.

MODELS ARE GIVING MULTIPLE SOLUTIONS FOR UP COMING FORECAST.  THE 
AVN/UKMET ARE SIMILAR AND THE FASTEST.  THE NGM IS THE SLOWEST AND 
SIMILAR TO THE 12Z EUROPEAN RUN.  THE ETA IS IN THE MIDDLE.  
COMPARING TO PREVIOUS RUNS THE AVN IS MUCH FASTER THAN THE PREVIOUS 
RUN.  THE ETA IS A BIT FASTER BUT MUCH CLOSER TO PREVIOUS RUN.  WILL 
STICK CLOSEST TO THE ETA SOLUTION SINCE IT HAS BE BEST RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY AND ALSO LIES CLOSE TO THE MEAN OF ALL THE SOLUTIONS.

WILL KEEP THE THREAT OF CONVECTION ACROSS WEST AND NORTH WITH AN 
HONORABLE MENTION 20 IN THE SOUTHEAST.  THE THREAT CONTINUES UNTIL 
THE UPPER LOW FINALLY PROGRESSES EAST.  WHEN UPPER LOW FINALLY MOVES 
THROUGH (RIGHT NOW IT LOOKS LIKE MONDAY) IT WILL BRING A GOOD 
SOAKER.  HOWEVER WITH TIMING ISSUES WILL STICK WITH THE CURRENT 50 
POPS.  IT APPEARS SUNDAY MAY BE THE NICEST DAY AS DRIER AIR WORKS IN 
WITH TEMPORARY RIDGING.

FWC TEMPS DONT LOOK TO BAD...ALTHOUGH BELIEVE IN THE EAST THEY ARE 
ABOUT 2 DEGREE TO COOL.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON





258 PM EDT FRI SEP 7 2001

SEVERAL CLUSTERS OF SHRA/TSRA WERE MOVING ALONG THE GRADIENT BTWN 
DEEP MOISTURE OVER WRN FA AND SHALLOW MOISTURE OVER ERN FA THIS PM.  
A S/WV WAS ALSO EVIDENT IN WV IMAGERY ACROSS SRN KY.  ADDITIONAL 
ACTIVITY WAS OCCURING OVER ERN IL DUE TO ANOTHER S/WV INTERACTING 
WITH THE DEEPER MOISTURE.

WL CONTINUE CHC POPS FOR MOST OF FA TONIGHT.  XPCT LINE OF SHRA/TSRA 
ACROSS IL TO MOVE NE AND AFFECT WRN FA.  RIDGING AND ASSOCIATED DRY 
AIR WL HANG TOUGH VC PMH SO WL LEAVE THAT AREA DRY.

WL CARRY CHC POPS FOR DAY-CVG-CMH GROUPS FOR SAT-SUN BUT LEAVE PMH 
DRY UNTIL SUN.  FA WL BE CAUGHT IN AREA BTWN DEEP MOISTURE TO THE W 
AND RIDGING TO THE E.  THIS TREND WL CONTINUE INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.  
WL HAVE TO EXTEND CHC SHRA/TSRA INTO TUE AND TUE NIGHT BUT 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW DUE TO MODEL INCONSISTENCIES.

ONLY MAJOR CHANGE TO TEMPS WL BE TO RAISE LOWS TONIGHT INTO THE LWR 
70S. 

.ILN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1245 PM EDT FRI SEP 7 2001

CLUSTER OF STORMS VC SDF SHOULD LIFT NEWD INTO CVG-DAY AND NRN MIAMI 
VLY GROUPS.  HAVE UPDATED ZONES TO INCREASE THE POPS.  ALSO...BROKE 
OUT UNION AND DELAWARE COUNTIES FM CMH GROUP TO RAISE POPS.  NO

...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION BELOW...

13Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE MID-ATLANTIC 
COAST AND LOW PRESSURE OVER MN.  BTWN THESE FEATURES SLY FLOW WAS 
SUPPLYING A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS TO THE OH VLY.  BASED ON AMOUNT 
OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY AVAILABLE...WL CONTINUE CHC POPS DAY-CVG 
AND SLIGHT CHANCE VC CMH.  WV IMAGERY INDICATED A MUCH DRIER AIR 
MASS OVER PMH AREA.  RIDGE TO THE E WL BLOCK ANY FURTHER EWD 
PROGRESSION SO THAT REGION SHOULD STAY DRY.

KILN 12Z SOUNDING INDICATES MIXING TO NEARLY 800 MB TODAY.  THIS WL 
CAUSE WINDS TO INCREASE DURING THE PM HOURS.  WL INCREASE WIND 
SPEEDS IN ALL GROUPS.  PM HIGHS LOOK GOOD. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 070808
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
407 AM EDT FRI SEP 7 2001

KILN SHOWING A COUPLE THUNDERSTORMS TO THE NORTHWEST OF RDA MOVING 
NORTHWEST.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLOUDS ARE THINNING AS THEY 
MOVE EASTWARD INTO DRIER AIR.

INTERESTING FORECAST.  MODELS ARE ALL PRETTY SIMILAR UP TO ABOUT 36 
HOURS THEN BEGIN TO VERGE WITH THE ETA/AVN BEING SIMILAR.  THERE IS 
ALSO RUN TO RUN DIFFERENCES BETWEEN MODELS.  BOTH ETA/AVN ARE 
FARTHER SOUTH WITH UPPER LOW IN THE WEST AND SUBSEQUENTLY STRONGER 
WITH CYCLOGENESIS OVER MN/WI.  THIS ALL POINTS TO A SLOWER 
SOLUTION.  THE RIDGE TO OUR EAST WILL KEEP DRIER...WITH A BIT OF 
DOWNSLOPE COMPONENT...BATTLING HIGHER PWS OVER OUR WESTERN FA.  AS 
A RESULT WILL KEEP SMALL POPS IN THE WEST THROUGH MONDAY AND BE MORE 
SELECTIVE IN THE EAST.  THE BEST THREAT OF RAIN WILL COME SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS THE UPPER LOW KICKS EASTWARD ACROSS FA.  WILL 
KEEP CHANCE WORDING FOR NOW AS TIMING STILL A BIT OF A QUESTION.

FWC TEMPS ARE TO COOL FOR HIGHS WILL UP...ESPECIALLY TODAY AS THE 
90S WHERE NOT TO FAR TO OUR SOUTHWEST AND MIXING TO 850 MB IS MUCH 
MORE REASONABLE TODAY.

MISILN ALREADY SENT...ZONES WILL BE ISSUED AROUND 415 AM.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

920 PM EDT THU SEP 6 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A WARM FRONT FROM CNTRL TN...NW INTO SE 
INDIANA...THEN ACRS CNTRL IL.

THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACRS INDIANA 
...ILLINOIS AND KENTUCKY WERE BEING AIDED BY A S/WV ACRS THE MIDDLE 
MS VLY.  AS THIS S/WV MOVES NE AND SHEARS WITH TIME...THUNDERSTORMS 
SHOULD BECOME LESS ORGANIZED OVERNIGHT.  HOWEVER...AS THE WARM FRONT 
PIVOTS ACRS OUR REGION...WARM...MOIST ASCENT COULD STILL TRIGGER A 
STRAY SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM.  HIGHEST POPS (30 PERCENT) WEST AND 
LOWEST POPS (20 PERCENT) EAST STILL LOOK GOOD.  WILL ADJUST 
ZONES...HOWEVER...FOR WINDS AND TO WORD PCPN CHANCES EAST AS LATE.

TEMPS LOOK OK ATTM.

.ILN...NONE.

18Z SFC CHART INDICATED A BOUNDARY EXTENDING FM IA-IL ACROSS SRN KY 
INTO SC.  VISIBLE IMAGERY SHOWED MOISTURE RETURNING NWD INTO KY.

BOUNDARY AND ASSOCIATED LLVL MOISTURE WL CONTINUE TO PUSH NWD 
OVERNIGHT.  12Z ETA PROGS STRONG H8 THTE ADVECTION OVERNIGHT ALONG 
WITH SOME INSTABILITY.  THIS WL LEAD TO SCT/WDLY SCT SHRA/TSRA 
ACROSS FA OVERNIGHT.

DEEPER MOISTURE WL BE IN PLACE ACROSS FA ON FRI AS THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY LIFTS NWD.  WITH DIURNAL HEATING...SCT SHRA/TSRA WL 
DEVELOP.  THESE SHOULD DISSIPATE WITH LOSS OF HEATING ON FRI 
EVENING.  AS A WAVE DROPS INTO THE MS VLY...RIDGING DEVELOPS ACROSS 
THE OH VLY AND SOMEWHAT LWR DEWPONTS MOVE INTO FA SO PLAN ON MAKING 
FRI NIGHT DRY.

SYSTEM OVER THE CNTRL PART OF THE COUNTRY WL HAVE SEVERAL WAVES.  
THE FIRST WAVE WL PUSH MOISTURE EWD INTO CVG-DAY GROUPS ON SAT BUT 
RIDGING IS PROGD TO HOLD ON CMH-PMH.  WL ONLY CARRY POPS CVG-DAY 
GROUP.

WL CARRY CHC POPS FOR SAT NIGHT THROUGH SUN NIGHT.  MODELS HAVE 
DISAGREEMENTS ON TIMING SO WL PLAY CONSERVATIVE ATTM.

HAVE MADE ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMP GUIDANCE.

.ILN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 AM EDT THU SEP 6 2001

CURRENT FCST HAS 30 POPS RUNNING ACROSS THE SOUTH AFTER MIDNIGHT 
TONIGHT. MESOETA NOTING SOME WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE IN WIND AND 
RH WITH SOME WEAK UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE AS WELL. REST OF MODELS 
REALLY DONT HINT TOO MUCH AT CONVERGENT FIELDS...BUT RETURN OF 
MOISTURE ON SRLY FLOW AND BREAKDOWN OF THE RIDGE ARE NOTED. WILL NOT 
REMOVE THIS CHANCE...BUT WILL CUT BACK ON THE THUNDERSTORM WORDING. 
LIS ON ETA GO SLIGHTLY NEGATIVE FROM 6 TO 12Z DURING THIS TIME BUT 
REMAINDER OF MODELS ONLY HINT AT SOME OF THIS INSTABILITY. 

FOR FRIDAY...WILL ALSO CONTINUE THE 30 POPS RUNNING ACROSS FCST 
AREA. CANT FIND AN OBVIOUS TRIGGER FOR CONVECTION TO START...BUT 
AMS JUICES UP FAIRLY NICE AHEAD OF 35-40 KT H8 JET NOTED FROM MI TO 
MO THROUGH THE DAY ON FRI. SBCAPE FROM ETA SHOWING AROUND 1000 J/KG 
OVER FCST AREA AT 18Z...SO WILL KEEP THUNDER IN HERE. 

REGARDING TEMPERATURES...WILL STAY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TODAY...ERR ON 
THE WARM SIDE TONIGHT THROUGH FRI PM AS MOISTURE INCREASES ON GOOD 
SW FLOW. MODELS DIVERGE AFTER THIS TIME. CLOUDS AND PRECIP ON SAT 
WOULD SUGGEST A COOL SOLUTION. HOWEVER...DIGGING TROF LOOKS QUITE 
STRONG AND WOULD SUGGEST SOME SCREAMING LLVL SLY WINDS TO KEEP PM 
TEMPS UP AND ADVECT IN AIR FROM GULF STATES FOR DAYTIME HIGHS. FRONT 
NOTED TO COME IN LATE SAT ON AVN...AND WILL STICK WITH THIS FOR 
TIMING PURPOSES. FOR TEMPS...WILL CUT THE DIFFERENCE AND OPEN UP AN 
80-85 RANGE IN MOST AREAS. 

MISILN OUT EVENTUALLY.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





FXUS61 KILN 051932
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EDT WED SEP 5 2001

DEEP RIDGING WL AFFECT THE CWFA THRU THURS...PROVIDING CLEAR/MCLR 
SKIES AND KEEPING RH IN THE COMFORTABLE LEVEL.  GOOD RADIATIONAL 
CONDS TNGT...AND XPCT LARGE URBAN-RURAL TEMP DIFFERENCES.  GUID 
TEMPS IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LK RSNBL FOR THE CITIES...BUT WL USE AS 
HIGH END OF FCST RANGES TO ACCOUNT FOR VARIABILITY.  FOR THURS WE 
REMAIN IN THE CURRENT AIRMASS...ALBEIT MODIFYING QUICKLY.  FWC GUID 
TENDS TO WARM UP A LITTLE TOO QUICKLY IN THIS SCENARIO...AND HV 
GENERALLY TRENDED TWRD THE COOLER FAN NUMBERS/META SFC TEMPS.

SAT TRENDS AND OBSERVATIONAL DATA DEPICT...AS WITH THE PAST SEVERAL 
FRONTS...LLVL MSTR HAS NOT BEEN PUSHED AS FAR SOUTH AWAY FROM THE 
AREA AS PROGGED.  THE RETURN FLOW WHICH IS PROGGED TO DVLP 
TMRW...AND INTENSIFY THU NIGHT...HAS LOOKED MORE MOIST WITH EACH 
MODEL RUN.  THE DVLPMNT OF WEAK LLVL FORCING THU NIGHT IN THE FORM 
OF CONVERGENCE/THETA-E ADVECTION CUD BE ENUF TO DRIVE SOME SCT 
SHALLOW CONVECTION IN THE DEEPER MSTR OVER THE SOUTH.  THE ETA IS 
MOST AGGRESIVE IN THIS REGARD...AND DOES PROVIDE SOME QPF NEAR AND 
SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  GIVEN CURRENT PROXIMITY OF MSTR...AND 
RECENT SLOW BIAS IN TERMS OF MSTR RETURN IN THE MODELS...HV OPTED TO 
FOLLOW ETA TREND AND ADD LOW POPS IN THE SOUTH THU NGT.  WL CONT PREV 
CHC POPS ALL ZONES FRI AS PCPN EFFICIENCY CONTS TO INCRS AND WEAK 
WAA PROVIDES SOME LIFT. 

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE








FXUS61 KILN 050633
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 AM EDT WED SEP 5 2001

COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED SOUTH OF THE FA...LEAVING HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
GREAT LAKES IN CONTROL TODAY.  RH IS FORECAST TO BE IN THE 20 
PERCENT RANGE AT ALL LEVELS AND CURU SHOWING NONE TODAY...DESPITE 
COOLER TEMPERATURES ALOFT.

SURFACE HIGH PUSHES TO EAST COAST BY 12Z ON THU...WITH 500MB RIDGE 
OVER FA.  UPPER RIDGE THEN BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN ALLOWING A RETURN OF 
MOISTURE. FEW CU ACROSS FA ON THURSDAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTH.  
UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE REALLY STARTS TO SPILL OVER THE RIDGE THURSDAY 
NIGHT.  WILL GO WITH A PARTLY CLOUDY ON THURSDAY NIGHT.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES.  MODELS ARE PRETTY SIMILAR WITH 850 
TEMPERATURES TODAY...YIELDING HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S.  
WILL BUMP UP TEMPERATURES A LITTLE FROM CURRENT FORECAST TO GO CLOSE 
TO MOS. LOWS TONIGHT ARE TRICKY.  WARMING 850 TEMPERATURES WOULD 
SUGGEST LOWS IN THE 60S...BUT MESOETA SURFACE TEMPERATURES ARE IN 
THE LOWER 50S. MOS LOWS HAVE BEEN RUNNING COOL THE LAST COUPLE OF 
RUNS.  WILL BUMP TEMPERATURES UP A LITTLE IN THE WEST WITH THE FLOW 
BEGINNING ITS RETURN.  BY 18Z THU...ETA 850 TEMPERATURES ARE MUCH 
WARMER THAN EITHER THE AVN/NGM.  THE ETA WARM UP LOOKS TOO QUICK.  
PREFER THE AVN/NGM TEMPERATURES WHICH WOULD GIVE HIGHS IN THE MID 
80S.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES




