307 PM EDT TUE SEP 4 2001

19Z SFC PLOT INDICATED A CDFNT EXTENDING FM KCMH TO KILN TO NW OF 
KCVG.  WDLY SCT SHRA WERE DEVELOPING ALONG THIS BOUNDARY SO WL HAVE 
TO CARRY A LEFTOVER WX PERIOD FOR COUNTIES ALONG AND S OF THE OH 
RIVER.

MUCH DRIER AIR MASS WL CONTINUE TO PUSH INTO FA OVERNIGHT.  XPCT 
SKIES TO CLEAR QUICKLY LATE THIS PM SO WL GO WITH CLEAR SKIES FOR 
THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  LOW LEVELS WL BE VERY DRY ON WED SO CU SHOULD 
BE VERY LIMITED.  WL STICK WITH M/S.  DRY CONDITIONS WL CONTINUE 
THROUGH THU NIGHT.

NEXT CHC OF SHRA/TSRA WL BE FRI/SAT AS SLUG OF MOISTURE MOVES NWD ON 
THE BACKSIDE OF THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 041327
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
927 AM EDT TUE SEP 4 2001

13Z SFC PLOT INDICATED A CDFNT EXTENDING FM WRN NY ACROSS NRN OH AND 
NRN IN.  WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS WAS IN PLACE ACROSS FA.

CDFNT IS PROGD TO DROP SLOWLY ACROSS FA TODAY REACHING THE OH RIVER 
BY 00Z WED.  LIMITING FACTORS WITH THIS FRONT WL BE WARM MID LVL 
TEMPS AND LACK OF DYNAMICS.  HOWEVER...WITH FRONTAL CONVERGENCE AND 
INSTABILITY ON THE ORDER OF 2000 J/KG THIS PM SCT SHRA/TSRA 
EXPECTED.  WL INCREASE POPS TO 30% CVG-PMH AND ADD 20% VC CMH.

KILN 12Z SOUNDING SUPPORTS CURRENT TEMP FCSTS SO NO CHANGES 
PLANNED.  WL MAKE SOME WIND ADJUSTMENTS. 

.ILN...NONE.


000 
FXUS61 KILN 040923 CCA
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
522 AM EDT TUE SEP 4 2001

WILL UPDATE NRN 1/2 OF FCST AREA TO MENTION PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS 
MORNING. SEVERAL OBS IN DAY AND CMH METRO AREAS COMING IN WITH 1/4 
TO 1/2 MILE VSBYS. 

...2 AM DISCUSSION...
QUESTION OF THE DAY WILL BE IN SHORT TERM AS TO WHICH WINS OUT - 
THE DRY AIR RUSHING IN BEHIND THE FRONT FROM THE NORTHWEST OR THE 
DIFFERENTIAL HEATING AHEAD OF THE FRONT AS IT PASSES TO THE SOUTH OF 
FCST AREA. LOOKS LIKE ILL BE SPLITTING THE DIFFERENCE HERE AND DROP 
THE 30 POPS IN THE SOUTHEAST TO 20 AND EXPAND THE CHANCE OF AN 
ISOLATED SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM TO THE SRN 1/2 OR 1/3 OF FCST AREA, NOT 
JUST SOUTHEAST.

INITIALLY WANTED TO GO DRY HERE TODAY AND THINK THAT THIS IS THE WAY 
TO GO WITH CURRENT TRENDS ON IR IMAGERY AND RADAR ALONG THE FRONT 
RIGHT NOW. HOWEVER...PRECIP EFFICIENCIES DONT TOTALLY DROP OUT 
UNTIL AFTER 20Z OR SO FOR THE SOUTH. THROUGH THIS TIME...ETA NOTING 
SBCAPES 1600+ AND LIS OF -2.5 TO -3. THROW IN THE ACTUAL FROPA 
TODAY AND I HAVE A HARD TIME GOING DRY. THINK THAT THE AVN IS WAY 
TOO OVERDONE ON EXTENT OF PRECIP TODAY ALTHOUGH THE DRY ETA IS 
SUSPICIOUS WITH A RELATIVELY LARGE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY. 

CAP MAY HOLD IN PLACE FOR THE DRY SOLUTION IN THE SOUTH...BUT BUFKIT 
SOUNDINGS SHOW CAP CLOSE TO BEING BROKEN THIS MORNING AND AGAIN THIS 
AFTERNOON. AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES GO...WILL ERR ON THE SIDE OF 
GUIDANCE IN CENTRAL OHIO WHERE AXIS OF COLD AIR BRINGS IN +13 H8 
TEMPS BY 18Z WED. HOWEVER...THICKNESS CORRELATIONS ARE TELLING ME TO 
BUMP GUIDANCE BY AT LEAST A CATEGORY FOR DAYTIME HIGHS NEXT 2 DAYS. 
WITH SEVERE DRYNESS OF AIRMASS AND FULL SUNSHINE...WILL OPEN UP A 
GOOD DIURNAL AND GO WARMER ON HIGHS...A LITTLE COOLER ON LOWS. FAVOR 
THE WARMER MAV VALUES BUT STILL FEEL THAT ITS TOO COOL...ESPECIALLY 
FOR WEDNESDAY. 

OTHER THAN BUMPING UP TEMPS NEXT 2 DAYTIME PERIODS BY A CATEGORY... 
NO MAJOR CHANGES TO FCST. CLEAR SKIES THROUGH WED NIGHT WITH 
INCREASING CIRRUS FROM W-E ON THURSDAY WITH PASSAGE OF MEAN UPPER 
RIDGE AND SFC HI PRESSURE.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS








AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
430 AM EDT TUE SEP 4 2001

WILL UPDATE NRN 1/2 OF FCST AREA TO MENTION PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS 
MORNING. SEVERAL OBS IN DAY AND CMH METRO AREAS COMING IN WITH 1/4 
TO 1/2 MILE VSBYS. 

...2 AM DISCUSSION...
QUESTION OF THE DAY WILL BE IN SHORT TERM AS TO WHICH WINS OUT - 
THE DRY AIR RUSHING IN BEHIND THE FRONT FROM THE NORTHWEST OR THE 
DIFFERENTIAL HEATING AHEAD OF THE FRONT AS IT PASSES TO THE SOUTH OF 
FCST AREA. LOOKS LIKE ILL BE SPLITTING THE DIFFERENCE HERE AND DROP 
THE 30 POPS IN THE SOUTHEAST TO 20 AND EXPAND THE CHANCE OF AN 
ISOLATED SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM TO THE SRN 1/2 OR 1/3 OF FCST AREA, NOT 
JUST SOUTHEAST.

INITIALLY WANTED TO GO DRY HERE TODAY AND THINK THAT THIS IS THE WAY 
TO GO WITH CURRENT TRENDS ON IR IMAGERY AND RADAR ALONG THE FRONT 
RIGHT NOW. HOWEVER...PRECIP EFFICIENCIES DONT TOTALLY DROP OUT 
UNTIL AFTER 20Z OR SO FOR THE SOUTH. THROUGH THIS TIME...ETA NOTING 
SBCAPES 1600+ AND LIS OF -2.5 TO -3. THROW IN THE ACTUAL FROPA 
TODAY AND I HAVE A HARD TIME GOING DRY. THINK THAT THE AVN IS WAY 
TOO OVERDONE ON EXTENT OF PRECIP TODAY ALTHOUGH THE DRY ETA IS 
SUSPICIOUS WITH A RELATIVELY LARGE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY. 

CAP MAY HOLD IN PLACE FOR THE DRY SOLUTION IN THE SOUTH...BUT BUFKIT 
SOUNDINGS SHOW CAP CLOSE TO BEING BROKEN THIS MORNING AND AGAIN THIS 
AFTERNOON. AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES GO...WILL ERR ON THE SIDE OF 
GUIDANCE IN CENTRAL OHIO WHERE AXIS OF COLD AIR BRINGS IN +13 H8 
TEMPS BY 18Z WED. HOWEVER...THICKNESS CORRELATIONS ARE TELLING ME TO 
BUMP GUIDANCE BY AT LEAST A CATEGORY FOR DAYTIME HIGHS NEXT 2 DAYS. 
WITH SEVERE DRYNESS OF AIRMASS AND FULL SUNSHINE...WILL OPEN UP A 
GOOD DIURNAL AND GO WARMER ON HIGHS...A LITTLE COOLER ON LOWS. FAVOR 
THE WARMER MAV VALUES BUT STILL FEEL THAT ITS TOO COOL...ESPECIALLY 
FOR WEDNESDAY. 

OTHER THAN BUMPING UP TEMPS NEXT 2 DAYTIME PERIODS BY A CATEGORY... 
NO MAJOR CHANGES TO FCST. CLEAR SKIES THROUGH WED NIGHT WITH 
INCREASING CIRRUS FROM W-E ON THURSDAY WITH PASSAGE OF MEAN UPPER 
RIDGE AND SFC HI PRESSURE.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS








FXUS61 KILN 040157
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 PM EDT MON SEP 3 2001

ALTHOUGH SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF COLD FRONT TO OUR NW ARE 
DECREASING IN INTENSITY AND COVERAGE THEY MAY HOLD TOGETHER. WILL 
ADD A 30 PERCENT POP TO NORTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES. WILL RAISE LOW 
TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTH AND SOUTHEAST FOR TONIGHT. WILL ALSO ADD 
MENTION OF PATCHY FOG TO SOUTHERN ZONES. HIGH DEW POINTS AND LIGHT 
FLOW IS ALREADY RESULTING IN SOME LOWERING IN VISIBILITIES. 


.ILN...NONE.

PARKER

FXUS61 KILN 040033
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
830 PM EDT MON SEP 3 2001

WEAK SYSTEM TO THE SOUTH OF THE FA CONTINUES TO SPREAD CLOUDS ACROSS 
THE SOUTHEAST BUT BULK OF PRECIPITATION HAS DISSIPATED WITH LOSS OF 
DAYTIME HEATING. HAVE UPDATED ZONES TO REMOVE PRECIPITATION FROM 
SOUTHWEST ZONES. JUST MENTIONED A FEW SPRINKLES POSSIBLE IN 
SOUTHEAST ZONES. TEMPERATURES AND WINDS LOOK O.K. AT THIS TIME. NO 
CHANGES IN OTHER ZONES AT THIS TIME.

LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH COLD FRONT TO THE NORTHWEST 
CONTINUES TO MAKE PROGRESS TO THE SOUTH. MODELS INDICATE THERE 
SHOULD BE A WEAKENING IN THE DYNAMICS AS THIS AREA MOVES FURTHER TO 
THE SOUTHEAST...CLOSER TO ILNS FA. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS 
AREA FOR POSSIBLE UPDATE TO ADD PRECIPITATION.
 

.ILN...NONE.

PARKER

FXUS61 KILN 031936
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EDT MON SEP 3 2001

MAIN FCST CONCERN IN THE SHORT TERM IS THE FRONT DROPPING DOWN OUT 
OF THE GREAT LAKES LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUES. AVN HAS BEEN 
CONSISTENT OVER THE LAST COUPLE OF RUNS AND IS SLIGHTLY FASTER THAN 
ETA/NGM. THE BEST FORCING WITH THE FRONT SHOULD STAY TO OUR NE AS 
THE LOW PULLS INTO QUEBEC. MSTR POOLING ALONG THE FRONT BUT IT HAS 
TAKEN ALL DAY TO GET GOING UP IN WI/MI WHERE THEY ARE CLOSER TO GOOD 
DYNAMICS. ONLY POSSIBLE EXCEPTION IS SE WHERE INTERACTION WITH 
MOISTURE FROM SOUTHERN SYS IS POSSIBLE. WILL KEEP 30 POPS THERE. 

HIGH BUILDS IN QUICKLY TUES NIGHT WITH DECENT CAA. A PLEASANT REST 
OF THE WEEK IN STORE BEFORE NEXT SYS PROGGED TO MOVE THRU SAT. TEMPS 
TONITE/TUES WILL LIKELY BE AOA GUID AS DWPTS ARE ALREADY IN THE MID 
TO UPPER 60S AND TEMPS UPSTREAM ARE WARM. AFTERWARDS AOB CLIMO AS 
HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS.  

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

843 
FXUS61 KILN 030625
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 AM EDT MON SEP 3 2001

COUPLE OF FEATURES TO TALK ABOUT FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE.

FIRST IS SHORT WAVE THAT IS FORECAST TO LIFT NORTHEAST ACROSS TODAY 
INTO TONIGHT.  THIS RUN THE MODELS ARE FARTHER SOUTH AND A LITTLE 
WEAKER WITH THE WAVE. EXPECT CLOUDS TO SPILL INTO THE SOUTHEAST 
LATER TODAY INTO TONIGHT.  AVN PRINTS QPF OFF NORTH OF THE OHIO 
RIVER...BUT FEEL THIS IS JUST A RESOLUTION PROBLEM.  WILL GO WITH 
ETA AND NGM SOLUTION OF KEEPING THE QPF SOUTH OF THE AREA.  REST OF 
FA SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY TODAY.

SECOND FEATURE IS SHORTWAVE AND COLD FRONT DROPPING IN FROM 
NORTHWEST.  FRONT PUSHES INTO NORTHWEST FA BY 12Z TUE.  WILL ADD 
A 30 POP IN THE NORTHWEST FOR LATE TONIGHT.  FRONT PUSHES ACROSS THE 
FA ON TUESDAY.  WILL PUT A 30 POP IN FOR ALL LOCATIONS BUT THE 
NORTHWEST.

ONCE AGAIN...MOS TEMPERATURES LOOK REALISTIC...ONLY A TWEAK HERE OR 
THERE.


.ILN...NONE.

SITES

512 
FXUS61 KILN 021830
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EDT SAT SEP 2 2001

ZONAL FLO PTN AMPLIFIES THRU THE PD AS S/WV TROF OVR SRN PLNS OF CAN
DIGS ESE ACRS THE GRTLKS AND INTO NEW ENGLAND WITH UPR RDG BLDG OVR
THE W. TWO FEATURES WILL COME INTO PLAY AFFECTING OH VLY WX. UPR LO
OVR LWR MS TO TRACK ENE INTO TN VLY AS S/WV AND ASSOCIATED CDFNT 
DROP SE THRU GRTLKS IN MON NGT/TUE TIME FRAME.

ETA/AVN SOLN/S CONSIDERABLY SLOWER THAN NGM WHICH APPEARS TOO FAST 
WITH THE SRN LO GIVEN WK MID LVL FLO. AVN IS A MORE AMPLIFIED WITH 
GRTLKS TROF AND THERFORE IS A LTL FASTER THAN ETA WITH THIS SRN SYS. 
HV LEANED TOWARD THE ETA SOLN WHICH HS BEST CONTINUITY. 

CU WHICH HS DVLPD ACRS THE AREA XPCTD TO DISPT WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HTG. THIS SHUD ENABLE ALL LOCATIONS TO CLR THIS EVE. SOME THE OF 
VANGARD MID/HI LVL MSTR TO THE S WL ENCROACH INTO SRN SECTIONS
LT TNGT. WL INDCIATE CLRG THIS EVE WITH SRN LOCATION BCMG PARTLY
CLDY LT. TEMP WISE REGARDING TNGTS LOWS...HV GONE A LTL COOLER THAN 
FWC CLOSER TO FAN GUID IN DRY AMS.

AS MID AND HI LVL MSTR SPILLS INTO SRN OH ON MON XPCT A THICKENING
OF CLDS. WL INDICATE PS COND ACRS CVG AND PMH ZONES AND MS 
ELSEWHERE. HV NOT STRAYED TOO FAR FM GUID XPCT IN CMH AREA WHERE
MID 80S APPEARS A LTL TOO WRM.

FOLLOWING ETA SOLN...PE/S AND WK LO LVL CNVRGC INCRS ACRS THE 
SRN/SE SECTION MON NGT/TUE. WL INDICATE A LO POP CHC OF A SHWR
ACRS PMH ZONE. BEST DYNAMICS STAY TO OUR NE WITH WK FNT WHICH DROPS 
INTO THE STATE TUE. THEREFORE WL ONLY PLACE SILENT 20 POP IN 
ALL OTHER LOCATIONS ON TUE. DUE TO CLDS AND INCRS IN MSTR HV GONE
A LTL WRMR THAN FWC GUID MON NGT AND A LTL COOLER WITH HI/S TUE.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 011921
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 PM EDT SAT SEP 1 2001

FLO BECOMES BCMS MORE ZONAL WITH TROF OVR PAC NW TRACKING E ACRS
SRN CAN IN WESTERLIES THRU THE PD AS TX UPR LO TRACKS INTO TN VLY.
OH VLY WX DOMINATED BY MID/UPR LVL RDGG WITH LO OVR TX TRACKING NE 
INTO TN VLY MON NGT/TUE TIME FRAME. AVN FASTER WITH THIS FEATURE BUT 
GIVEN WK MID LVL FLO WUD XPCT A SLOWER SOLN MORE LINE WITH ETA. ETA 
HS TRENDED FARTHER NWD WITH THIS SYS. ATTM WL HOLDOFF ON ANY PRECIP 
WITH BEST FORCING XPCT TO STAY TO OUR S AND E.WL INTRODUCE MORE CLDS 
INTO SRN PTN CWA MON/TUE TIME FRAME.

IN SHORT TERM...LTST SFC MAP SHWS HI PRES CNTRD OVR LWR MI. VIS
SATL IMGRY SHWS BKN CU HS DVLPD THIS AFTN ACRS THE OH VLY. THIS 
CU WHICH HS DVLPD WL DISPT WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. ONLY OTHER 
CLDS XPCTD OVRNGT WL BE IN THE FORM OF SOME HI LVL CLDS WHICH SHUD 
CLIP THE N LT TNGT. 

GOOD RADITIONAL COOLG REGIME TNGT WITH LGT NE-E WNDS. THERFORE HV
GONE A LTL COOLER THAN FWC GUID TNGT. SOME PATCHY FOG TO DVLP OVRNGT 
BUT DO NOT XPCT IT TO BE ENOUGH TO MENT IN PUBLIC FCST. 

XPCT TO SEE MORE SUN ON SUN WITH SFC FLO BCMG SERLY. THIS SHUD
ALLOW TEMPS TO WRM UP TO HI/S FM THE UPR 70S N TO THE LWR 80S
S OF OH VLY. HV STAYED CLOSE TO GUID HERE. ENERGY BLOCK METHOD
APPLIED TO FCST MRNG SOUNDING GIVES A HI OF 80 DEGS AT ILN. 

ANOTHER GOOD NIGHT FOR RADIATIONAL COOLING SUN NGT. THEREFORE...
HV GONE A LTL COOLER THAN GUID WITH LOWS AGN.

PER AFOREMENTIONED SRN SYS WL GO PARTLY SUNNY ACRS SRN SECTIONS
ON MON. BASED ON THICKNESS AND H8 SCHEMES XPCT HI/S IN THE LWR/MID
80S FM N TO S ACRS THE CWA.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

OH VLY WX DOMINATED BY MID/UPR LVL RDGG WITH LO OVR TX TRACKING NE 
INTO TN VLY MON NGT/TUE TIME FRAME. AVN FASTER WITH THIS FEATURE BUT 
GIVEN WK MID LVL FLO WUD XPCT A SLOWER SOLN MORE LINE WITH ETA. ETA 
HS TRENDED FARTHER NWD WITH THIS SYS. ATTM WL HOLDOFF ON ANY PRECIP 
WITH BEST FORCING XPCT TO STAY TO OUR S AND E.WL INTRODUCE MORE CLDS 
INTO SRN PTN CWA MON/TUE TIME FRAME.

IN SHORT TERM...LTST SFC MAP SHWS HI PRES CNTRD OVR LWR MI. VIS
SATL IMGRY SHWS BKN CU HS DVLPD THIS AFTN ACRS THE OH VLY. THIS 
CU WHICH HS DVLPD WL DISPT WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. ONLY OTHER 
CLDS XPCTD OVRNGT WL BE IN THE FORM OF SOME HI LVL CLDS WHICH SHUD 
CLIP THE N LT TNGT. 

GOOD RADITIONAL COOLG REGIME TNGT WITH LGT NE-E WNDS. THERFORE HV
GONE A LTL COOLER THAN FWC GUID TNGT. SOME PATCHY FOG TO DVLP OVRNGT 
BUT DO NOT XPCT IT TO BE ENOUGH TO MENT IN PUBLIC FCST. 

XPCT TO SEE MORE SUN ON SUN WITH SFC FLO BCMG SERLY. THIS SHUD
ALLOW TEMPS TO WRM UP TO HI/S FM THE UPR 70S N TO THE LWR 80S

795 
FXUS61 KILN 010702
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
303 AM EDT SAT SEP 1 2001

COLD FRONT RUNNING FROM NR SDF-LEX-HTS AT 06Z.  FRONT SHOULD DROP A 
LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH...TAKING RAIN CHANCES WITH IT FOR THE WEEKEND.
DRIER AIR IS WORKING IN A ALOFT...BUT STRATUS DECK HAS FORMED 
ACROSS NORTHERN OHIO OFF LAKE ERIE.  THIS HAS LEAKED INTO NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE FA.  WITH FA ON THE EDGE OF THE STRATUS...IT SHOULD 
MIX OUT DURING THE DAY.  WILL HAVE TO MODIFY THE NORTHERN MIAMI 
VALLEY FROM MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS.    
ELSEWHERE TODAY...EXPECT CU TO DEVELOP LATE MORNING/EARLY 
AFTERNOON...SO CURRENT PARTLY CLOUDY FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.

SKIES SHOULD CLEAR TONIGHT AS CENTER OF HIGH CROSSES THE EASTERN 
LAKES.  MODELS NOT QUITE AS COLD WITH LOWS TONIGHT AS LAST NIGHT 
MODEL RUNS WERE SHOWING.  WILL RAISE THEM A DEGREE OR 
SOME...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTH.

MAYBE A FEW HIGH CLOUDS SUNDAY NIGHT AS MOISTURE BEGINS TO RETURN ON 
BACKSIDE OF HIGH.

AVN BEGINS VORT ACROSS TN/SRN KY ON MONDAY.  THIS PUSHES SOME 
MOISTURE BACK INTO EXTREME SRN/SE PORTIONS OF THE FA. QPF REMAINS 
SOUTH OF THE FA...PUT ITS IS CLOSE.  WILL LEAVE FORECAST DRY FOR 
MONDAY...BUT WILL PASS ALONG TO DAY SHIFT TO KEEP AN EYE ON THINGS.

CLEMISILN OUT LATTER.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 PM EDT FRI AUG 31 2001

H5 TROF AXIS IS CROSSING OUR FA TONIGHT...WITH FLOW BECOMING 
NORTHWEST. SFC FRONT HAS MADE IT TO AROUND CVG...WITH TSRA STILL 
GIVING AN IMPRESSIVE LIGHTNING DISPLAY TO OUR SOUTH.  12Z ETA HAS A 
DECENT REPRESENTATION OF CURRENT INSTABILITY WITH -4 LI MAX WHERE 
LIGHTNING IS OCCURRING. HIGH PRESSURE AND DRIER AIR HAVE WORKED INTO 
OUR NORTHWEST COUNTIES BEHIND THE COLD FRONT...WITH CLEARING SKIES 
EVIDENT ON SATELLITE.

TSRA HAVE ENDED IN ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE SOUTHEAST AND FAR SOUTH 
GROUPS. ILL UPDATE TO REMOVE POPS FROM CVG DAY AND CMH 
GROUPS...WHILE LEAVING SCT POPS UNTIL MIDNIGHT IN THE SOUTHEAST AND 
FAR SOUTH.  

OTHERWISE...FCST LOW TEMPS FROM LOW 50S NORTHWEST TO LOW 60S 
SOUTHEAST LOOK GOOD WITH LOW DEW POINTS MOVING DOWN RAPIDLY BEHIND 
THE FRONT.  PATCHY FOG IS STILL WORTH MENTIONING AS IT IS LIKELY TO 
FORM OVER OUR SOGGY GROUND IN THE PRESENCE OF A STRONG LOW LEVEL 
INVERSION INDICATED ON MODEL SOUNDINGS.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EDT FRI AUG 31 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS SHOWED A COLD FRONT FROM LOWER ONTARIO (PART NORTH 
OF LAKE ERIE) SOUTHWEST INTO FAR NORTHWEST OHIO...THEN JUST SOUTH OF 
KFWA AND WEST OF KIND.

WILL ONCE AGAIN USE A BLEND OF THE ETA/AVN SOLUTIONS WITH MORE 
EMPHASIS ON THE ETA.

COLD FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH THE NW CWFA BY 6 PM...THROUGH THE DAY 
AND CMH AREAS BETWEEN 7 PM AND 9 PM...CVG AND PMH BETWEEN 10 PM AND 
MIDNIGHT...AND THE FAR SOUTHERN CWFA FROM MIDNIGHT TO 2 AM.  S/WV 
NOTED ON WATER VAPOR OVER WRN OHIO WILL CONTINUE MOVING EAST THIS 
AFTERNOON.  THIS S/WV WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR MORE WIDESPREAD HEAVY 
RAINFALL.  FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON THROUGH 
MIDNIGHT...ONLY SCATTERED SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM IS 
EXPECTED.  SKIES SHOULD CLEAR BEHIND THE FRONT.  DRIER AIR ADVECTING 
BEHIND THE FRONT WILL BE AT ODDS WITH LEFT OVER GROUND MOISTURE.  
ATTM...FEEL BEST CHANCE FOR PATCHY FOG WILL BE THE CVG...PMH AND 
POINTS SOUTH WHERE DRIER AIR WILL WORK INTO LAST.

ON SATURDAY...HIGH PRESSURE OVER MN WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE 
LOWER GREAT LAKES.  MODELS TRY TO HANG ON A LITTLE BIT OF 850 MB 
MSTR.  WITH CAA BEHIND FRONT...GROUND MSTR AND DAY TIME 
HEATING...BELIEVE BEST CHANCE FOR PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS (FROM 
CUMULUS CLOUD DEVELOPMENT) WILL BE ACRS THE EASTERN AND SOUTHERN 
AREAS.

BY SATURDAY NIGHT...A WEATHER SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE NRN PLAINS.  
WEAK S/WV ACTIVITY IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT WILL SPILL SOME CIRRUS INTO 
THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT...CONTINUING INTO SUNDAY.  HOWEVER...THIS 
SHOULD BE THIN AND MOSTLY CLEAR/MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED.

ADJUSTED MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN









FXUS61 KILN 311322
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
920 AM EDT FRI AUG 31 2001

13Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT FROM CNTRL MI TO JUST W OF 
VPZ...SOUTHWEST TO SPI AND STL.

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY SOUTHEAST TODAY.  A COUPLE OF S/WVS WERE 
STILL DIGGING SOUTHWARD INTO THE WRN GREAT LAKES...WHICH IS THE 
REASON FOR THE SLOW MOVEMENT (MORE LIKE THE ETA MODEL).  VISIBLE 
SATELLITE AND MOSAIC RADAR HAVE SHOWN AN INCREASE IN SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FROM INDIANA INTO OHIO OVER THE LAST 1 TO 3 HRS.  I 
EXPECT THIS ACTIVITY TO CONTINUE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY.  
REGION WILL ALSO BE IN A FAVORABLE UPR DIVERGENCE REGION FROM A JET 
OVER THE SAINT LAWRENCE RIVER VLY AND A JET DEVELOPING OVER THE OHIO 
RIVER VLY.  CONVECTION ACRS ERN INDIANA IS FROM A SMALL S/WV IN THE 
500 MB FLOW.  THIS SHOULD MOVE INTO THE WHITEWATER AND MIAMI VLYS 
BETWEEN 10 AM AND NOON.

BIG PROBLEM FOR THE DAY WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING.  KILN 
SOUNDING YIELDED  1.80 INCHES OF PRECIPITABLE WATER.  THUS 
...THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE EFFICIENT RAIN PRODUCERS.  AT THIS 
TIME...BELIEVE THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE FAST ENOUGH TO PREVENT 
WIDESPREAD FLOODING.  HOWEVER...WILL HAVE TO KEEP AN EYE ON SVRL 
COUNTIES (DARKE...MIAMI AND CLARK) WHICH HAD VERY HEAVY RAINFALL 
YESTERDAY EVENING (4 INCHES TO AS MUCH AS 8 INCHES).  WILL PLACE 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN WORDING IN ZONES FOR NOW...AND WILL WATCH 
MESOSCALE TRENDS TO SEE IF A FLASH FLOOD WATCH WILL BE NEEDED FOR A 
SIZABLE AREA THIS AFTERNOON.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN






SFC BOUNDARY ACROSS CENTRAL OHIO...MODERATE INSTABILITY...AND 
500-300MB DPVA HAVE RESULTED IN TSRA INITIATION.  THE STRONGEST  
TSRA HAVE BEEN NORTH OF DAYTON FROM GREENVILLE TO SPRINGFIELD...WITH 
URBAN FLOODING THE MAIN CONCERN SO FAR.   

WITH SCT TSRA IN OUR AREA...ILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING 
AND GO WITH POPS ALL ZONES. ILL KEEP POPS LOWER...20-30%...IN OUR 
SOUTHERN COUNTIES THAT ARE SOUTH OF THE SFC BOUNDARY.  ILL ALSO ADD 
MENTION OF FOG ON AREAS THAT HAVE HAD HEAVY RAIN.

OTHERWISE...FCST LOW TEMPS IN UPPER 60S LOOK GOOD SO NO CHANGES TO 
TEMP FCST ARE NEEDED.

111 
FXUS61 KILN 301858
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM EDT THU AUG 30 2001

17Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A WARM FRONT NORTH OF THE REGION.  A COLD 
FRONT WAS ALSO NOTED FROM WISCONSIN INTO ERN IOWA...THEN INTO KANSAS.

KILN RADAR AND VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATED THAT WIDELY 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WERE TRYING TO FORM ACRS THE SRN 
AND WRN CWFA IN THE MOST UNSTABLE AIR.  WILL LIKELY HAVE TO CARRY AN 
EVENING WORDING FOR THIS ACTIVITY.

A BLEND OF THE ETA/AVN WILL BE USED FOR THE SHORT TERM FCST...WITH 
MORE EMPHASIS ON THE ETA.

FOR THE REMAINDER OF TONIGHT...WIDELY SCATTERED ACTIVITY SHOULD 
DISSIPATE WITH THE SETTING OF THE SUN.  COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY 
TO THE SOUTHEAST AS S/WV MOVING OUT OF CNTRL CANADA CONTINUES TO DIG.
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY OVER IL AND IN IS NOT EXPECTED TO REACH THE 
NORTHWEST AREAS UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT.  AS UPR JET STREAK BEGINS TO 
PIVOT SOUTHEAST...THEN TO THE NORTHEAST ACRS THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
BY MORNING AND DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY....SUFFICIENT UPR DIVERGENCE 
WILL BE PROVIDED.  WITH A MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE...A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE BROUGHT INTO THE DAY...CMH AND CVG 
LATE TONIGHT.  THE FAR SOUTHEAST SHOULD REMAIN DRY (EXPECT FOR 
CURRENT EVENING ACTIVITY).  WITH EXPECTED DIVERGENCE...WEAK 
CONVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE APCH OF THE SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT 
AND DEEP AVAIABLE MSTR...I AM ANTICIPATING WIDESPREAD SHOWERS 
FRIDAY.  WITH LIMITED INSTABILITY...WILL KEEP THUNDERSTORM WORDING 
IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY.

COLD FRONT IS FCST TO MAKE IT TO A CMH TO CVG LINE BY FRIDAY EVENING 
(8 PM?)...THEN THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE CWFA BEFORE MIDNIGHT.  
WILL HAVE TO LINGER A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR 
CMH...CVG AND PMH.  OTHERWISE...SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY.

HIGH PRESSURE IS EXPECTED TO WEDGE INTO THE REGION FROM THE WESTERN 
GREAT LAKES FOR SATURDAY.  AVN IS SKIMPY ON ITS 850 MB MOISTURE 
WHILE THE ETA HOLDS ON TO SOME.  I PLAN TO CONTINUE THE PARTLY 
CLOUDY WORDING FOR NOW AS CAA AND 850 MB MSTR SHOULD PROVIDE FOR 
DAYTIME CUMULUS CLOUDS.

HAVE DEVIATED A COUPLE OF DEGREES FROM MOS GUIDANCE IN REGARDS TO 
LOWS AND HIGHS (HIGHER TONIGHT BECAUSE OF CLOUD INCREASE...LOWER 
TOMORROW BECAUSE OF EXPECTED RAIN...AND A LITTLE WARMER FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY DUE TO SLOWER CAA.)

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

TO THE SOUTHEAST AS S/WV MOVING OUT OF CNTRL CANADA CONTINUES TO DIG.
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY OVER IL AND IN IS NOT EXPECTED TO REACH THE 
NORTHWEST AREAS UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT.  AS UPR JET STREAK BEGINS TO 
PIVOT SOUTHEAST...THEN TO THE NORTHEAST ACRS THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
BY MORNING AND DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY....SUFFICIENT UPR DIVERGENCE 
WILL BE PROVIDED.  WITH A MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE...A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE BROUGHT INTO THE DAY...CMH AND CVG 
LATE TONIGHT.  THE FAR SOUTHEAST SHOULD REMAIN DRY (EXPECT FOR 
CURRENT EVENING ACTIVITY).  WITH EXPECTED DIVERGENCE...WEAK 
CONVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE APCH OF THE SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT 
AND DEEP AVAIABLE MSTR...I AM ANTICIPATING WIDESPREAD SHOWERS 
FRIDAY.  WITH LIMITED INSTABILITY...WILL KEEP THUNDERSTORM WORDING 
IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY.

COLD FRONT IS FCST TO MAKE IT TO A CMH TO CVG LINE BY FRIDAY EVENING 
(8 PM?)...THEN THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE CWFA BEFORE MIDNIGHT.  
WILL HAVE TO LINGER A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR 
CMH...CVG AND PMH.  OTHERWISE...SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY.

HIGH PRESSURE IS EXPECTED TO WEDGE INTO THE REGION FROM THE WESTERN 
GREAT LAKES FOR SATURDAY.  AVN IS SKIMPY ON ITS 850 MB MOISTURE 
WHILE THE ETA HOLDS ON TO SOME.  I PLAN TO CONTINUE THE PARTLY 
CLOUDY WORDING FOR NOW AS CAA AND 850 MB MSTR SHOULD PROVIDE FOR 
DAYTIME CUMULUS CLOUDS.

HAVE DEVIATED A COUPLE OF DEGREES FROM MOS GUIDANCE IN REGARDS TO 
LOWS AND HIGHS (HIGHER TONIGHT BECAUSE OF CLOUD INCREASE...LOWER 
TOMORROW BECAUSE OF EXPECTED RAIN...AND A LITTLE WARMER FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY DUE TO SLOWER CAA.)

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN










409 
FXUS61 KILN 301405
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1005 AM EDT THU AUG 30 2001

13Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A WARM FRONT ACRS THE SWRN CWFA 
...EXTENDING FROM HTS TO DAY TO MKE TO GRB.  A COLD FRONT WAS NOTED 
FROM WRN LAKE SUPERIOR...NW WISCONSIN...SOUTHWEST INTO IOWA AND 
KANSAS.

WARM FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PIVOT NORTHEAST OF THE ENTIRE CWFA THIS 
AFTERNOON.  MORNING STRATUS AND PATCHY FOG SHOULD BEGIN TO DISSIPATE 
EARLY THIS AFTN.  CURRENT FCST HAS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF -SHRA/-TSRA 
MENTIONED IN THE FAR SOUTH.  12Z ILN SOUNDING INDICATES A CAPPING 
INVERSION FROM 810 MB TO 780 MB (ABOUT 1K FEET THICK).  WITH TEMPS 
APCHING THE MID TO UPPER 80S AND DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 60S...THE 
CAP IS JUST BARELY OVERCOMED BY SFC PARCEL ASCENT.  BOTTOM LINE...AN 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM COULD POP ANYWHERE SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT BY 
LATE AFTN (IT WILL HAVE TO TAKE ALL THE AVBL HEATING)...IF THE 
CAPPING INVERSION IS EXCEEDED.  THE DOWN SOUND IS THAT THERE IS A 
LACK OF LOW LEVEL FOCUSING TO AID THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT.  WITH 
THAT SAID...WILL LEAVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE WHERE IT IS IN THE SOUTH 
SINCE THE MOST UNSTABLE AIR WILL BE LOCATED HERE.  

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

325 AM EDT THU AUG 30 2001

05Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE OVER MN WITH A CDFNT 
TRAILING SWWD INTO THE PLAINS.  A WARM FRONT WAS ALSO EVIDENT 
EXTENDING SEWD INTO SRN IN AND NRN KY.

XPCT SFC LOW AND ASSOCIATED MID LVL SUPPORT TO MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES TODAY.  WARM FRONT SHOULD MOVE ONLY SLIGHTLY NEWD.  ETA 
INDICATES A DRY AIR MASS ACROSS FA XCPT FOR AREAS SOUTH OF THE OH 
RIVER. WL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHC OF PM SHRA/TSRA FOR NRN KY BUT LEAVE 
REST OF FA DRY.

SHRA/TSRA ASSOCIATED WITH COLD FRONT WL DROP INTO NRN FA TONIGHT 
WHILE DEEP MOISTURE FM THE S SURGES NWD.  MODELS SHOW THIS MOISTURE 
CONVERGING ON FA TONIGHT. WL INCLUDE CHC POPS ALL GROUPS.

WL CONTINUE LIKELY WORDING ON FRI AS CDFNT AND DEEP MOISTURE SLIDE 
SEWD ACROSS THE OH VLY.

CONTINUED TEMPS FROM PREVIOUS FCST FOR THE MOST PART.  DID LWR HIGHS 
TO MID 80S TODAY VC DAY BUT KEPT UPPER 80S ELSEWHERE.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 300141
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
939 PM EDT WED AUG 29 2001

AREA IS UNDER WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WITH H5 RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
CONUS.  SFC RIDGE AXIS EXTENDS FROM NEW YORK ACROSS OHIO. 

SATELLITE SHOWS MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES NORTH OF THE OHIO RIVER...WITH 
HIGH CLOUDS SOUTH OF THE RIVER FROM KENTUCKY TSRA.  TSRA HAVE BEEN 
TRAINING AND BACK BUILDING ALONG SFC BOUNDARY/THETA-E RIDGE AXIS.
THOUGH WE HAD SOME SFC BASED INSTABILITY TODAY...MID LEVEL CAP 
HAS PROTECTED US FROM TSRA FORMATION. 
  
CURRENT FCST HAS SKY CONDITION WELL COVERED WITH MOSTLY CLEAR 
NORTH/PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH...WITH PATCHY FOG FORMING IN SOUTH WHERE 
DEW POINTS ARE NEAR 70. 

FCST LOW TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S LOOK GOOD IN THE NORTH.  ILL 
RAISE LOWS IN MOST OF OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES TO UPPER 60S IN LIGHT OF 
HIGHER DEW POINTS AND THE PRESENCE OF CLOUDS.  WINDS WILL ALSO 
REQUIRE SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS.  

MISILN ALREADY SENT.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EDT WED AUG 29 2001

BNDRY STILL LOCATED ALG SRN EDGE OF FA WITH RADAR SHWG SCT TSTMS ALG 
AND TO THE S OF IT. WL MONTIOR RADAR TRENDS AND MAY NEED TO BREAK 
OFF A FAR SRN GROUP TO CARRY TSTMS THRU REST OF THIS AFTN. ETA 
BRINGING BNDRY SLOWLY N OVRNGT SO THINK WE WL AGAIN SEE SOME LOW 
CLDS AND FOG OVRNGT ACRS THE S. MEANWHILE...N RMNS DRY SO WL GO 
MSTLY CLR THERE. THIS SHUD RESULT IN A PRETTY GUD TEMP SPRD N TO S 
ACRS FA TNGT WITH NEAR 60 FAR N TO ARND 70 FAR S. 

BNDRY CONTS TO PUSH N THRU THE DAY ON THUR BUT APEEARS TO WASH OUT 
AS IT DOES. THIS ALLOWS LLVL FLOW TO BCM SWLY WITH GUD WAA DVLPG 
ACRS AREA. MDLS ALL BRINGING IN DECENT 8H WRMG THO ETA MAY BE A LTL 
OVERDONE WITH 8H TMPS IN EXCESS OF 18 DGRS BY 00Z. STILL THO...WL GO 
WITH HIGHS IN THE UPR 80S MOST AREAS ON THUR. SOME DECENT INSTBLTY 
PROGD ON THUR BUT WITH BNDRY WASHING OUT...NO REAL LLVL FORCING 
PRESENT PLUS WL PRBLY HAV A BIT OF A CAP WITH SOME WRMG ALF. 
THUS...WL KP FCST DRY ON THUR BUT AN ISOLD SHWR/TSTM MAY BE PSBL.

MDLS THEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT DROPPING FNT DOWN TWD AREA THUR NGT 
WHILE PULLING MSTR UP FM THE S. WL GO WITH CHC POPS FOR THUR NGT 
MAINLY AFT MIDNIGHT. AVN/ETA BOTH TRYING TO SHOW A WK WAVE DVLPG ALG 
FNT ON FRI WHICH MAY SLOW THINGS DOWN A BIT. WL GO WITH LIKELY POPS 
ENTIRE AREA ON FRI AND THEN TRY TO TAPER PCPN OFF NW TO SE FRI NGT.

WL GO A LTL COOLER THAN GUID TMPS FOR HIGHS ON FRI WITH PCPN ACRS 
AREA. 

.ILN...NONE.

WL ALSO INCLUDE MENTION OF PATCHY AM DENSE FOG ALONG AND JUST N OF 
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY SINCE DRIER AIR LAGS THE FRONT BY 50-75 MILES.

BOUNDARY SHOULD SETTLE JUST S OF FA TODAY.  MODELS SHOW SFC 
DEWPOINTS REMAINING IN THE 60S BUT DEEP MOISTURE WL BE LACKING.  WL 
KEEP FA DRY WITH SCT-BKN CU DEVELOPMENT EXPECTED.  CU SHOULD 
DISSIPATE TONIGHT LEAVING SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR.

A WARM AND HUMID DAY IS IN STORE FOR THU.  META PROGS STRONG 
INSTABILITY BUT LACK OF FOCUS.  WL KEEP DRY BUT A FEW ISOLATED 
SHRA/TSRA POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY IF REMNANTS OF CURRENT BOUNDARY LIFT N 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.

WL ADD MENTION OF SHRA/TSRA ON THU NIGHT.  ETA HINTS AT AN 
IMPRESSIVE MCS DEVELOPING OVR NRN IN THU EVENING.  THIS SHOULD DROP 
INTO FA AND WEAKEN OVERNIGHT.  THE ETA ALSO SHOWS A STRONG SURGE OF 
MOISTURE FM THE S SO COMBINATION WARRENTS CHC POPS.

WL STICK CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS.

FXUS61 KILN 281816
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 PM EDT TUE AUG 28 2001

PRE FRONTAL TROF/CONVERGENT AXIS SEEMS TO BE THE MAJOR SOURCE FOR 
DEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON. SOME SHOWERS ARE 
SPARKING ALONG ACTUAL FRONT IN NW OHIO ATTM...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO 
BE MARGINAL IN AREAL COVERAGE AND WITH RAINFALL. PRECIP EFFICIENCIES 
LESS THAN FAVORABLE OVER NW 1/3 OF FCST AREA BY 0Z. EXPECT SOME 
SHOWERS TO STILL BE LINGERING OVER BOUNDARY LATER THIS PM AND WILL 
RESOLVE WITH A SPLIT GROUP FOR THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND 
SCATTERED COVERAGE.

WILL JUMP CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTH HALF TO LIKELY AS 
FRONT SEEMS TO SLOW DOWN AS IT PUSHES SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER 
OVERNIGHT. PRECIPITATBLE WATER DECREASES FROM 1.5 INCHES TO JUST 
OVER 1 INCH...BUT AFTERNOON REPORTS INDICATE THAT THESE ARE VERY 
EFFICIENT STORMS. WILL TRY TO TIME THIS WITH MAINLY EVENING WORDING 
AS LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD HAMPER THESE STORMS FROM HOLDING 
TOGETHER THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. 

FOR REST OF THE FORECAST...NUMERICAL GUIDANCE DOESNT DIFFER BY MORE 
THAN A FEW DEGREES IN THE FIRST FEW DAYS. TONIGHT WILL BE A LITTLE 
COOLER NORTH...SIGHTLY WARMER SOUTH AS CLOUD COVER HOLDS TEMPS UP A 
LITTLE ALONG THE OHIO. SFC TRAJECTORIES SHOWING THAT AMS TOMORROW AM 
WILL BE FROM CENTRAL MI WHERE MID 50S TO LOW 60S WERE IN PLACE THIS 
AM. TOMORROW NIGHT SHOULD BE JUST AS COOL FOR THE MAJORITY OF CWA 
WITH POSSIBLE EXCEPTION OF THE SOUTHEAST. DRY AIR IN PLACE WITH 
LIGHT WINDS SHOULD BE GIVE ONE OF THE BETTER RADIATIONAL COOLING 
NIGHTS IN THE PAST FEW MONTHS...ESP IN THE NE. DONT THINK THAT THE 
RETURN TO S FLOW WILL MATERIALIZE AT THE SFC AS WIND FIELDS IN 
GENERAL ARE VERY WEAK. WILL ERR ON THE COOLER SIDE HERE AS WELL. 

DAYTIME HIGHS SHOULD BE LOW 80S ON WED AND WARM TO MID 80S THURS AS 
CLOUD COVER TAKES A WHILE TO RETURN. MOISTURE ENCROACHES FROM NW AND 
FROM S THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL ONLY GO WITH A LOW CHANCE OF 
PRECIPITATION TOWARDS MORNING IN THE NORTHWEST AS DYNAMICS SHOULD BE 
FOCUSED ALONG CONVERGENT AREA AHEAD OF NEXT FRONT SCHEDULED FOR 
FRIDAY.

MISILN OUT AROUND 330.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS


FXUS61 KILN 281352
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EDT TUE AUG 28 2001

WILL UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE FOG FROM SOUTHERN GROUPING OF 
ZONES AND TO REMOVE SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN IN NORTHWEST. DEPENDING ON 
DEVELOPMENT OF CU FIELD W OF MIE...MAY EVEN WANT TO BUMP LOW CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS OVER CENTRAL ZONES TO POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED.

SFC FRONT CURRENTLY STRETCHING FROM JUST S OF LK ERIE THROUGH MIE TO 
CENTRAL ILL AND IS NOTED BY FAIR AMT OF CU DEVELOPMENT ALONG IT. 
SBCAPES APPROACH 2000+ LATER THIS AFTERNOON AHEAD OF FRONT AND 
PRECIP EFFICIENCIES DROP SIGNIFICANTLY ALONG AND BEHIND IT. EXPECT 
MAIN THREAT FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO BE ALONG AND SE OF OHIO 
RIVER. WITH TIMING ON THE MESOETA...AFTERNOON CONVECTION SHOULD 
REALLY BE HAMPERED OVER THE NW 1/2 OF FCST AREA. HENCE THE DROPPING 
OF POPS BY 10 PERCENT FOR THE NW 1/2. CONVERGENCE AND WINDS AT 850 
ARE QUITE UNIMPRESSIVE AND THERE REALLY ISNT MUCH IN THE WAY OF MID 
AND UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT FOR THUNDERSTORMS. MAIN FORCING AND THREAT 
WILL BE WITH THE FRONT LATER THIS AFTERNOON.

MORNING SOUNDING SUGGESTS A HIGH OF 84 AT ILN AND CURRENT 80 TO 85 
RANGE LOOKS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THIS. EXPECT NW FLOW TO SLOW 
DOWN TEMPERATURE RISE IN THE NW AND WILL NOT CHANGE FCST OF NEAR 80.
 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

CENTRAL ILL AND IS NOTED BY FAIR AMT OF CU DEVELOPMENT ALONG IT. 
SBCAPES APPROACH 2000+ LATER THIS AFTERNOON AHEAD OF FRONT AND 
PRECIP EFFICIENCIES DROP SIGNIFICANTLY ALONG AND BEHIND IT. EXPECT 
MAIN THREAT FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO BE ALONG AND SE OF OHIO 
RIVER. WITH TIMING ON THE MESOETA...AFTERNOON CONVECTION SHOULD 
REALLY BE HAMPERED OVER THE NW 1/2 OF FCST AREA. HENCE THE DROPPING 
OF POPS BY 10 PERCENT FOR THE NW 1/2. CONVERGENCE AND WINDS AT 850 
ARE QUITE UNIMPRESSIVE AND THERE REALLY ISNT MUCH IN THE WAY OF MID 
AND UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT FOR THUNDERSTORMS. MAIN FORCING AND THREAT 
WILL BE WITH THE FRONT LATER THIS AFTERNOON.

MORNING SOUNDING SUGGESTS A HIGH OF 84 AT ILN AND CURRENT 80 TO 85 
RANGE LOOKS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THIS. EXPECT NW FLOW TO SLOW 
DOWN TEMPERATURE RISE IN THE NW AND WILL NOT CHANGE FCST OF NEAR 80.
 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
302 PM EDT SUN AUG 26 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS FRONT FROM KTOL TO KFWA TO KHUF TO SRN IL.  
KILN...KIND AND KIWX SHOWING SCATTERED CONVECTION ALONG AND AHEAD OF 
FRONT.  SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES BEST CLOUD COVERAGE OVER CENTRAL 
OHIO.

MODELS ARE FAIRLY SIMILAR THROUGH THE FIRST 36 TO 48 HOURS.  
HOWEVER...DIFFERENCES ARE EVIDENT BETWEEN 48 TO 60 HOURS WITH 
REGARDS TO CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM MOVING FROM THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES 
INTO FA.  AVN HAS BEEN VERY CONSISTENT WITH TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM 
THROUGH THE PAST 3 RUNS.  DROG/DT ON THE ETA AT 48HRS SHOWS THE ETA 
IS A BIT SLOWER AND SHARPER FROM ITS 00Z RUN. 12Z UKMET APPEARS TO 
BE A COMPROMISE BUT IS CLOSER TO ETA IN TIMING AND SHARPNESS OF 
SURFACE FRONT.  WILL LEAN TOWARDS AVN SOLUTION AS FAST NORTHWEST 
FLOW...WILL KEEP CLIPPER MOVING.

OVERNIGHT...CONVECTION WILL END FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST.  WILL 
MAKE AN AUDIBLE ON MENTION OF EVENING IN WAPAK.  DAYTON WILL GET 
EVENING WORDING.  CVG AND CMH WILL GET MIDNIGHT WORDING.  PORTSMOUTH 
ALL NIGHT.  CONCERNED ABOUT FOG IN THE MORNING.  UPSTREAM THERE 
WASNT A DENSE LAST NIGHT.  AT THE MOMENT FIGURE ON GROUND FOG OR 3 
TO 5 MILE RESTRICTIONS.  LATTER SHIFTS WILL HAVE TO MONITOR.   

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD. MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT SUN AUG 26 2001

SCT CONVECTION AFFECTING AREAS SOUTH OF ILN AND EAST OF CVG THIS 
MORNING...ASSOCIATED WITH RELATIVELY WEAK LLJ (25-30KT) WORKING INTO 
THE FA FROM THE WEST.  XPCT ACTIVITY TO REMAIN FAIRLY SCT THRU ERLY 
AFTN...BEFORE FRONT AND BETTER UPPER LEVEL FORCING COME INTO PLAY.
PLENTY OF MSTR AVAILABLE AS WELL...WITH THE 00Z UA DATA SUPPORTING 
THE ETAS FCST 1.75+ INCH PWAT OVER THE AREA THIS AFTN.  PREV FCST 
LIKELY POPS STILL LK FINE...BUT WL RAISE TO 70 IN THE EAST WHERE A 
LITTLE BETTER INSOLATION SHUD BE REALIZED.  UNCERTAINTY ABOUT CLOUD 
CVR MAKE FOR A TRICKY TEMP FCST.  META SFC TEMPS STAY IN THE M-U 70S 
ALL DAY...WHILE THE ALWAYS WARM MAV PUSHES EVRYBODY INTO THE M80S.  
THE FWC NUMBERS ARE IN LINE WITH THE PREV FCST...AND STILL LK RSNBL.

DEEP MSTR PROGGED TO MV OUT OF ALL BUT THE FAR SE BY MIDNIGHT.  WL 
KEEP LINGERING CHC ALONG THE I-71 CORRIDOR FOR THE EVE ALONG XPCTD 
FRONTAL POSN...AND ALL NIGHT OVER THE FAR SE.  WL LEAN TWRD THE 
WARMER FWC TEMPS TNGT...XPCTG MSTR TO LINGER BEHIND BNDRY.  DEEP 
DRYING OF THE ATMOS CONTS INTO MON...ALTHOUGH GUID SUGGESTS AN INCRS 
IN HIGH LVL MSTR OVER THE NW IN THE AFTN.  CURU MACRO PROVIDES JUST 
SCT CU...SO HV OPTED FOR MSNY OVER ALL BUT THE NW.  GUID TEMPS LK 
RSNBL...ALTHOUGH A LITTLE TOO COOL OVER THE SW AS WAA WL BE 
COMMENCING IN THE AFTN.

GUID HAS BEEN TRENDING FASTER/STRONGER WITH CLIPPER TYPE SYS FOR 
MON NGT.  NOCTURNAL TIMING IS UNFAVORABLE...BUT LKS LIKE ENUF 
MSTR/INSTABILITY TO SUPPORT LOW CHC POPS FAR NORTH. 

.ILN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1130 PM EDT FRI AUG 24 2001

CLOUDS ARE NOT MAKING MUCH HEADWAY SO WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE 
OVERNIGHT POPS AND ADD FOG IN THE WEST.  

.ILN...NONE.

564 
FXUS61 KILN 250144
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
944 PM EDT FRI AUG 24 2001

THE CLOUDS ARE STARTING TO SPILL INTO THE SW PART OF THE AREA WITH 
SOME SPRINKLES EVEN BEING REPORTED IN KY. WITH CLOUDS INCREASING IN 
THE WEST...FOG SHOULD BE KEPT AT BAY. WILL LEAVE PATCHY DENSE 
WORDING IN THE EAST WHERE THEY WILL HAVE LONGER PD OF MOCLR SKIES. 
TEMPS LOOK ON TRACK AS WELL. WILL ONLY TWEAK CLD WORDING. 

.ILN...NONE.



000 
FXUS61 KILN 242019 CCA
AFDILN



AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED DAY
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
334 PM EDT FRI AUG 24 2001

UPPER RIDGE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL GRADUALLY BE REPLACED BY A 
TROF THIS WEEKEND AS SHORT WAVES MOVE UP THE WEST SIDE OF THE 
RIDGE.  SHORT WAVES INFLUENCE WILL BEGIN TONIGHT AND CONTINUE INTO 
SUNDAY.

SFC RIDGE ACROSS OHIO IS CURRENTLY HOLDING NEARLY STATIONARY 
FRONT/TSRA NEAR SDF.  MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT...TAKING THE RIDGE 
EAST TONIGHT AND ALLOWING A WARM FRONT TO MOVE INTO OUR WESTERN 
COUNTIES BY SATURDAY MORNING.  COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO FOLLOW
ON SUNDAY. 

WITH FRONT APPROACHING...ILL KEEP CHANCE POPS SOUTHWEST TONIGHT 
AFTER MIDNIGHT AS PER PREVIOUS FCST.  ILL ALSO GO WITH CHANCE POPS 
ALL ZONES ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT.  ON SUNDAY...COLD FRONT 
AND UPPER SUPPORT ARE PROGGED TO COME INTO PHASE OVER OUR AREA...SO 
ILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS.  

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK GOOD. CLOUDS AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
KEEP TEMPS UP NEAR GUIDANCE AT NIGHT.  HIGHS IN MID 80S ON SATURDAY 
MAY BE HARD TO REACH WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIP AROUND. 
CONVERSELY...SUNDAYS FWC HIGHS APPEAR A BIT TOO LOW IN WARM 
ADVECTION AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...SO ILL ADJUST FWC ACCORDINGLY. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO






198 
FXUS61 KILN 241350
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
952 AM EDT THU AUG 24 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS H5 RIDGE BUILDING ACROSS OHIO.  SFC RIDGING 
IS WORKING SOUTH FROM MICHIGAN TO EASTERN KENTUCKY...WHILE TSRA ARE 
OCCURRING ALONG THE FRONTAL ZONE FROM MISSOURI THROUGH WESTERN 
KENTUCKY.

WITH FOG LIFTING WELL DROP DENSE FOG ADVISORY AT 10 AM AS 
SCHEDULED.  RELATIVELY DRY AIR WITH THE SFC RIDGE WILL ALLOW PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES THIS AFTERNOON.  12Z SOUNDINGS SHOW STRONG MID LEVEL 
CAP...AND FRONT SHOULD STAY TO OUR WEST...SO WE SHOULD REMAIN PRECIP 
FREE.

HIGH TEMPS IN 80S LOOK GOOD.  ILL UPDATE TO REMOVE FOG AND ADJUST 
WINDS SLIGHTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

135 
FXUS61 KILN 240730
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT THU AUG 24 2001

DENSE FOG WL BE THE INITIAL FCST PROBLEM TDY.  WIDESPREAD VSBYS 
ARND 1/4 MILE OVER THE NORTHERN 1/2 OF THE CWFA...AND EVEN A LITTLE 
WORSE UPSTREAM.  SEE NO REASON WHY FOG WONT CONT TO EXPAND/ THICKEN 
...AND PLAN ON XTNDG THE DFA TO CVR ALL BUT THE FAR SW(CVG AREA) 
PART OF THE FA.  OTHER THAN LLVL MSTR...WHICH WL LIKELY BE RATHER 
SLUGGISH TO SCOUR OUT...00Z MODEL GUID IN AGREEMENT WITH A GENERAL 
DRYING OF THE ATMOS TDY UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DEEP RIDGING.  WL 
LIKELY SEE A FAIR AMNT OF AFTN CU...AND ALSO SOME INCRSG MID/HIGH 
CLOUD LATE IN THE SW.  WL CONT PREV PCLDY FCSTS.GUID TEMPS LK 
RSNBL...ALTHOUGH WL RAISE A DEG OR SO AT TYPICALLY WARM CMH.

IMPORTANT MODEL DIFFERENCES APPEAR QUICKLY...SPECIFICALLY RELATING 
TO HOW STRONG/QUICKLY LLVL WAA WL DRIVE PCPN BACK INTO THE AREA.
AVN LOOKS PRETTY GOOD THRU 06Z...APPEARING TO HV A BETTER HANDLE ON 
THE STRONG LLVL CONVERGENCE DRIVING CONVECTION OVER SOUTHERN IL/IN 
ATTM.  WERE GOING TO LEAN TWRD THE AVN SOLN FOR POPS THIS PD...BUT 
NOT BRING ACTIVITY IN AS FAST (BEFORE 00Z TDY IN THE SW) DUE TO 
FAIRLY NICE DRYING IN THE LEE OF SYS MOVG OFF THE EAST COAST.  WL 
BRING CHC(40) POPS INTO THE FAR SW AFTER 00Z...AND LOW CHC POPS INTO 
THE DAYTON AND PORTSMOUTH GROUPS AFTER MIDNIGHT.  XPCT LOWS ABV THE 
FWC GUID...ESPLY WEST AND SOUTH...WITH CLDS AND HIER DWTS.

WL CARRY CHC POPS ALL ZONES SAT...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS(50) IN THE 
DEEPER MSTR SOUTH AND WEST.  PCPN EFFICIENCY FROM THE ETA/AVN 
INDICATING +RA POTNL DVLPG...ESPLY SAT NIGHT AS BEST FORCING 
COINCIDES WITH HIGHEST PWAT.  

.ILN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR ENTIRE FORECAST AREA EXCEPT FOR THE 
TRI-STATE.

JOHNSTONE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 PM EDT THU AUG 23 2001

CLOUDS ARE MOVING THRU THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWFA AND SHOULD EXIT 
BY MIDNIGHT. DWPTS REMAIN IN THE 65 TO 70 RANGE AND ARE ALL THE WAY 
BACK INTO MI. WITH MOIST AIR AND GROUND AND MOCLR SKIES...FOG A GOOD 
BET TONIGHT. WILL ADD PATCHY DENSE TO THE ZONES. AND WITH HIER DWPTS 
WILL BUMP UP LOWS TO MID TO UPR 60S. 

.ILN...NONE.

789 
FXUS61 KILN 231944
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 PM EDT THU AUG 23 2001

UPPER TROF AXIS CURRENTLY OVER THE AREA WILL MOVE EAST BY TONIGHT. 
H5 RIDGE WILL BUILD IN ON FRIDAY...BEFORE ANOTHER TROF BEGINS ITS 
INFLUENCE LATE ON SATURDAY.  

SFC FRONT WITH SHORT WAVE IS SAGGING SOUTH THROUGH OHIO.  FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO BE OUT OF OUR AREA BY 06Z TONIGHT.  DRIER AIR WILL FOLLOW 
ON FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY UNTIL MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE NEXT TROF MOVES 
INTO OUR SOUTHWEST COUNTIES BY 00Z SATURDAY EVENING. 

DRYING IS OCCURRING MORE SLOWLY THAN MODELS SUGGEST WITH CLOUDS 
PERSISTING. ALSO..MODELS SHOW A LOW TO MID LEVEL DISTURBANCE IN THE 
SOUTH AT AROUND 06Z TONIGHT...BUT THE QPF APPEARS OVERDONE. FOR 
TONIGHT ILL GO WITH PARTLY/MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH 20 POP SHRA IN OUR 
SOUTHERN ZONES AND BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY IN THE NORTH.   

WITH THE FRONT SOUTH OF HERE AND DRIER AIR BEHIND IT...FRIDAY AND 
FRIDAY NIGHT LOOK PRECIP FREE...BUT SFC RIDGING WILL BE RATHER WEAK 
AND THERE ARE CLOUDS EVIDENT BEHIND THE FRONT...SO ILL STAY WITH 
PARTLY CLOUDY. 

IT SHOULD REMAIN DRY ON SATURDAY FOR THE MOST PART...THOUGH THE NEXT 
TROF APPROACHING FROM THE WEST MAY AFFECT OUR WESTERN COUNTIES BY 
EVENING.  ILL LEAVE OUT OF FCST FOR NOW...BUT WELL NEED TO MONITOR 
THE PROGRESS OF THE NEXT SYSTEM IN CASE IT ARRIVES AHEAD OF MODEL 
ESTIMATES. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK IN THE BALLPARK.  THERE MAY BE SOME ROOM FOR 
IMPROVEMENT AT DAY WHERE OVERNIGHT LOWS OF 61-62 APPEAR TOO LOW. 
OTHERWISE ILL STAY CLOSE TO FWC.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO


FXUS61 KILN 231409
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1008 AM EDT THU AUG 23 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS SHORT WAVE AXIS MOVING INTO OUR AREA IN A 
MEAN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW.  SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO BE EAST OF THE 
AREA BY THIS EVENING.  

SFC MAP HAS FRONTAL ZONE FROM IOWA THROUGH THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES 
TO QUEBEC.  FRONT IS FCST TO MOVE SOUTH THROUGH THE REGION BY 
TONIGHT.  RADAR SHOWS WITHERING SHRA SOUTH OF THE FRONT NEAR THE 
SHORT WAVE AXIS...MAINLY FROM DAYTON TO COLUMBUS.  SATELLITE TRENDS 
INDICATE THAT THE FRONT IS INDEED SAGGING SLOWLY SOUTH...THOUGH IT 
IS MOVING SOMEWHAT SLOWER THAN MODEL PROJECTIONS. MODELS SHOW 
INSTABILITY PERSISTING ALL DAY...THOUGH A CAPPING SUBSIDENCE 
INVERSION IS FCST TO MOVE INTO OUR NORTHWEST COUNTIES BY LATE 
AFTERNOON.  

WITH SHRA DIMINISHING...ILL LOWER POPS TO 30/40 IN THE NORTH.  ILL 
KEEP POPS AT 50 IN THE SOUTH WHERE THERE IS A BETTER CHANCE FOR 
REDEVELOPMENT.  

TEMPS SEEM TOO WARM ACROSS CENTRAL OHIO WITH CLOUDS GOING NOWHERE 
FAST.  THEREFORE ILL LOWER HIGHS TO THE UPPER 70S AT DAY AND CMH. 
ILL LEAVE SOUTHERN ZONES NEAR 85 SINCE SOME SUNSHINE HAS AND WILL 
CONTINUE TO OCCUR THERE.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO






















FXUS61 KILN 231047
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
645 AM EDT THU AUG 23 2001

SINCE OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES HAVE NOW WASHED OUT OF THE SYNOPTIC 
PATTERN...OLD WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY ON LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS 
APPEARS TO BE LOCATED FROM SE IOWA...EXTENDING ACRS NRN 
ILLINOIS...INDIANA INTO LAKE ERIE.  THIS WARM FRONT WAS BEING 
FOLLOWED BY A COLD FRONT LOCATED ACRS NRN WISCONSIN AND MICHIGAN.  
S/WV DIGGING INTO OHIO THIS AM ALONG WITH COLD FRONT WILL GIVE WARM 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY A SHOVE TO THE SOUTH AND EAST.  WILL UPDATE FCST TO 
PLACE CHANCE POPS IN THE SRN CWFA SINCE NOT A LOT OF ACTIVITY IS 
GOING ON HERE ATTM.  WILL ALSO UPDATE THE WIND DIRECTION ACRS THE 
REGION TO A SOUTH/SOUTHWEST...UNTIL FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
GRADUALLY SHIFTS TOWARD THE SOUTH THROUGH THE DAY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN



FXUS61 KILN 230620
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 AM EDT THU AUG 23 2001

KILN RADAR AND MOSAIC RADAR WERE SHOWING SOMEWHAT OF A WEAKENING 
TREND IN THE PRECIPITATION COVERAGE ACRS THE REGION.  LIGHTNING 
ACTIVITY HAS WANED SOME...ESPECIALLY WHERE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY HAS CUT 
OFF AVAILABLE CAPE.  MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT ON SWINGING 
S/WV...NOW MOVING INTO INDIANA...THROUGH OHIO...THEN INTO 
PENNSYLVANIA BY EARLY AFTN.  ALL LOCATIONS WILL HAVE A CHC OF PCPN 
THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS...BUT AFTER THAT...ANY REDEVELOPMENT 
DEPENDS ON HOW MUCH SUNSHINE IS OBTAINED THROUGH CURRENT DEBRIS 
CANOPY AS VERTICAL MOTION AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WASH OUT DURING 
THE AFTN HOURS.  WILL WORD PCPN IN THE FCST AS MAINLY THIS MORNING.
AS FOR TEMPS...THICKNESS SCHEMES IMPLY HIGHS MAINLY IN THE LOWER 
80S.  SOME LOCATIONS MAY MAKE IT INTO THE MID 80S IF ENOUGH SUNSHINE 
IS MET.  HOWEVER...AS WHAT HAPPENED YESTERDAY...CLOUDS PUT A DAMPER 
ON WARMING TEMPS.  THUS...FEEL LOWER 80S ACROSS THE BOARD IS A SAFE 
BET ATTM.

FOR TONIGHT...A WEAK COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY SKIMS NE OHIO.  MODELS 
ARE SHOWING SOME VERY LIGHT QPF WITH THIS SYSTEM.  WITH MAIN S/WV TO 
THE NE OF REGION AND ALONG WITH SHALLOW MSTR...WILL LEAVE FCST DRY.

ON FRIDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WEDGES INTO THE REGION FROM THE 
NORTH...KEEPING SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY.  HIGH TEMPS IN THE LOWER 80S 
NORTH TO THE MID 80S SOUTH LOOK GOOD ATTM.

RAIN CHANCES MAY HAVE TO BE INTRODUCED INTO THE AREA BY SATURDAY AS 
ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES IN FROM THE WEST.  

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN


















NORTH TO THE MID 80S SOUTH LOOK GOOD ATTM.

RAIN CHANCES MAY HAVE TO BE INTRODUCED INTO THE AREA BY SATURDAY AS 
ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES IN FROM THE WEST.  

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 221827
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EDT TUE AUG 21 2001

MID/UPR LVL RDG AXIS CNTRD OVR LWR MS VLY FLATTENS AS A SERIES OF 
S/WVS ROTATE ARND THE PERIPHERY FM UPR MS VLY INTO OH VLY TNGT/THU.

LTST SFC MAP SHWS WRMFNT EXTENDING FM NRN IL THRU ERN IN AND CNTRL 
KY. MRNG CNVCTN HS SLOWED EWD PROGRESSION OF WRMFNT. XPCT THIS 
FEATURE TO CONT TO PIVOT SLOWY E INTO EXTREME WRN OH BY 00Z THU. SFC 
MAP ALSO SHWS OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FM JUST N OF PIA TO JUST
N OF IND TO NR AOH. SFC RUC INDICATES THAT WRM SECTOR HS BECOME
CONTD TO DESTABLIZE WITH CAPES OF 3000-3500 J/KG. XPCT CNVRGC 
ALONG THIS OUTLFLOW BOUNDARY TO OVERCOME THE CAP THAT EXISTS IN
THE WRM SECTOR. SCTD CNVCTN WHICH DVLPS ALONG THIS SHUD
TRACK ESE INTO SE IN/WRN OH WHERE FAVORABLE INSTBY AXIS IS EXPECTED 
AT 00Z. FAVORABLE LOW LEVEL SHEAR MAY RESULT IN SOME ROATATING STORMS
DURG THE FIRST PART OF THE EVE. 

AS ADDITIONAL S/WV ENERGY OVR ERN NE/IA ROUNDS THE RDG XPCT SFC
WV TO TRACK E FROM IA ACRS SRN GRTLKS WITH CDFNT DROPPING SE.
XPCT ORGANIZED CONVECTION TO DVLP ACRS IL AND IN AND TRACK INTO
OH TWD 06Z TIME FRAME. MAIN WEATHER THREAT WL BE WIND WITH THIS
ORGANIZED BUT SOME FAVORABLE SHEAR WL CONT THE THREAT FOR ISOLD 
ROTATORS.

WL CONT MENT OF POTENTIAL SVR STORMS TNGT AND TRANSITION POPS
FROM CATAGORICAL IN THE W TO LKLY SE. HV NOT STRAYED TOO MUCH 
FM GUID TEMPS TNGT.

WL COLDFRONT DROPPING SWD THRU CWA ON THU WL CONT CHC OF TSTMS.
WL SHW TREND OF POPS FROM 30 IN NRN MIAMI VLY TO LKLY ACRS THE S.
TEMP WISE...DUE TO CLDS/PRECIP AND THEN FROPA HAVE GONE SLGTLY 
COOLER THAN FWC GUID.

LO LVL FLO BCMS NERLY WITH DRYING TAKING PLACE THU NGT. THIS SHUD
ENABLE SKIES TO BCM PC. AGN PREFER TEMPS A LTL COOLER THAN FWC
GUID. DRY CONTS TO CONT FRI WITH NE-ERLY LO LVL ANDANTI-CYCLONIC FLO
AS SFC HI PRES BUILDS SE THRU ERN GTLKS.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL













FXUS61 KILN 221435
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1035 AM EDT TUE AUG 21 2001

MID/UPR LVL RDG AXIS CNTRD OVR LWR MS VLY FLATTENS AS A SERIES
OF S/WVS ROTATE ARND THE PERIPHERY FM UPR MS VLY INTO OH TDA.

LTST SFC MAP SHWS LO PRES OVR IA WITH WRMFNT EXTENDING ESE THRU 
IL AND WRN IN. PROFILER NETWORK INDICATES 30-35KT LOW LEVEL 
WRLY JET BTWN 925MB AND 850MB. THIS LO LVL JET IS PROVIDING MOIST
ASCENT OVR WRMFNT BNDRY. THIS LO LVL WAA HS LED TO DVLPMNT OF TSTM
COMPLEX WHICH IS DROPPING SSE THRU ERN IN AND WRN OH. THESE STORMS
PRODUCING LCL HVY RAIN. ALTHO RADAR HS INDICATED FAVORABLE MARC 
SIGNATURES...HV NOT RECEIVED ANY REPORTS OF SVR WND THUS FAR. THIS
MAY BE DUE TO THE DEPTH OF THE LO LVL COLD POOL WHICH EXISTS OVR 
WRN OH ATTM. 

MAIN FCST QUESTION REVOLVES ARND FURTHER TSTM DVLPMNT AND ASSESSMENT
OF SVR POTENTIAL THIS AFTN/TNGT. XPCT CURR TSTM COMPLEX OVR WRN OH 
TO CONT DROPPING SWD FOLLOWING FAVORABLE 850/300 MB THICKNESS AND 
WEAKEN AS THEY MOVE AWAY FM FAVORABLE GENESIS RGN. THEN EXPECT 
CONTD WEAKER CONVECTION  WITH ANOTHER MAJOR ROUND OF TSTMS XPCTD 
THIS AFTN INTO TNGT WITH NXT S/WV ROUNDING RDG TOP IN WI DROPPING 
INTO OH THIS EVE. SATL SHWG CONSIDERABLE CLOUDINESS WITH TSTM
ACTVTY POSSIBLY SLOWING EWD PROGRESSION OF WRMFNT OVR IN. WL MAKE
SOME MINOR COOLER ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPS OPENING UP RANGES FOR HI/S.
WL ALSO INCREASE TSTMS POPS IN THE AFTN PERIOD ACRS THE S. 
   
FCST SOUNDING BY LATE EVE SHWING CAPES ARND 2400 J/KG WITH WBZ DROPPING
INTO 10.7K FT RANGE. ALSO...FAVORABLE LO LVL SHEAR WL EXIST FOR PSBL
ROTATING STORMS. A CAP IS INDICATED ARND 850MB BUT XPCT FORCING TO 
OVRCOME THIS CAP. WL UPDATE SVR WX OUTLOOK FOR ENTIRE AREA. WL ALSO
MENT SVR POTENTIAL AND HVY RAIN IN ZONE FORECAST.
    

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL











FXUS61 KILN 220949
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
550 AM EDT TUE AUG 21 2001

LOOKING AT KILN RADAR AND REGIONAL RADARS...THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
DEVELOPING QUITE RAPIDLY NORTHEAST OF THE WARM FRONT.  WILL UPDATE 
ZONES TO REFLECT THIS.  I STILL BELIEVE THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE THIS 
MORNING...FOLLOWED BY A LULL IN THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE 
AFTERNOON...THEN THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD GET GOING BY LATE AFTN INTO 
THE EVENING (FROM NW TO SE ACRS THE CWFA).

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN











FXUS61 KILN 220639
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 AM EDT TUE AUG 21 2001

COMPLEX WEATHER PATTERN AHEAD FOR THE NEXT 24 TO 36 HOUR PERIOD.

KILN RADAR EARLY THIS MORNING WAS SHOWING SCATTERED SHOWERS ACRS 
MAINLY THE NRN TWO THIRDS OF THE CWFA.  THESE WERE SHOWING SIGNS OF 
WEAKENING.  THESE SHOWERS WERE BEING CAUSED BY A WEAK VORT 
LOBE/WAA...WHICH WAS NOT INTIALIZED VERY WELL BY THE MODELS.  WILL 
HAVE TO WATCH HOW MUCH OF THIS ACTIVITY FALLS APART BEFORE FCST 
ISSUANCE.

SFC ANALYSIS AT 04Z INDICATED A LOW PRESSURE AREA NEAR NE NEBRASKA.  
FROM THIS LOW...A WARM FRONT EXTENDS INTO FAR NRN IOWA THEN SE INTO 
CNTRL ILLINOIS.  A MOIST TONGUE OF 70 PLUS DEWPOINTS WAS ALSO NOTED 
FROM THE LOWER MS VLY INTO NRN IOWA.  ETA AND AVN GIVE A FAIRLY 
SIMILAR SOLUTION REGARDING DEVELOPING MCS OVER NE IOWA/SE MN.  THIS 
MCS...BEING DRIVEN BY A 40 KT LOW LVL JET AND ASSOCIATED H5 
S/WV...SHOULD REMAIN NORTH OF THE REGION TODAY AS THE AFOREMENTIONED 
WARM FRONT PIVOTS INTO AND NORTH OF THE CWFA.  THE REASONING BEHIND 
THIS IS THAT THE MAIN LOW LVL CONVERGENCE (AT THE NOSE OF THE LOW 
LVL JET) SHOULD REMAIN NORTH OF THE REGION...KEEPING THE CONVECTION 
AT BAY FOR MOST OF THE DAY.  THE COMPLEX SCENARIO FOR LATE THIS AFTN 
INTO TONIGHT WILL BE A COMBINATION OF A POSSIBLE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY 
FROM THIS MCS AND AN APCHING COLD FRONT FROM CANADA.  FCST SOUNDINGS 
FOR MOST OF THE CWFA INDICATE A SMALL LOW LVL CAP FOR MOST OF THE 
DAY UNTIL MAX HEATING.  IF MAX HEATING IS REACHED (AND I AM BANKING 
THAT IT WILL BE)...MIXING THROUGH THE 850 MB LVL...CAPES OF 3000 
PLUS J/KG WILL BE OBTAINED...ESPECIALLY ACRS THE SWRN CWFA.  IF AN 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY DOES DEVELOP FROM THE MENTIONED MCS...THIS COULD 
TRIGGER THUNDERSTORMS IN A VERY UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT.  IF AN OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARY STILL DOES NOT FORM/MOVE INTO OUR REGION...THE COLD FRONT 
FROM CANADA...COMBINED WITH ANOTHER S/WV OUT OF THE PLAINS...SHOULD 
INITIATE CONVECTION BY LATE AFTN INTO THE EVENING HOURS.  
THUS...WILL GO LIKELY POPS (60 PERCENT) ACRS THE ENTIRE CWFA FOR 
TONIGHT.

ON THURSDAY...THE COLD FRONT IS FCST TO LAY EAST/WEST ACRS THE 
CWFA.  CURRENT FCST OF KEEPING THE FAR NORTH DRY AND CHC POPS CNTRL 
AND SOUTH LOOK REASONABLE ATTM.

TEMPS TODAY WILL BE TRICKY...DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH THE WAA AT 850 MB 
POKES INTO THE REGION.  AS OF NOW...I CAN FORESEE MID 80S ALONG THE 
NRN PERIPHERY...UPPER 80S DAY AND PMH GROUPS AND LOWER 90S FAR SW.
TEMPS TONIGHT AND THURSDAY WILL BE CLOUD/RAIN DEPENDENT...AND I WILL 
MAKE A LAST MINUTE DECISION ON HOW FAR FROM MOS I WILL DEVIATE.

WILL ISSUE A SPS HIGHLIGHTING SVR WX POTENTIAL FOR LATE THIS AFTN 
AND EVENING.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN










FXUS61 KILN 220133
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 PM EDT TUE AUG 21 2001

00Z SFC-H8 ANALYSIS INDCS STRONG WAA IS OCCURING IN A BROAD ARC FROM 
MINNESOTA INTO WESTERN OHIO.  THIS WAA IS DRIVING ELEVATED 
CONVECTION OVER NORTHERN INDIANA...WHICH IS BEING STEERED SE ALONG 
THE 850-300 MB THICKNESS CONTOURS.  ANALYSIS AND PREV MODEL FCSTS 
REVEAL A DECENT EAST-WEST STABILITY GRADIENT HEADING INTO OHIO.  
AIRMASS REMAINS QUITE DRY ACRS THE RGN AS WELL...WITH GENERALLY M50S 
DWPTS AND ONLY .76 INCH PWAT ON THE ILN SNDG.  ALL THIS POINTS TO A 
WEAKENING TREND TO THE CURRENT BATCH OF PCPN...BUT AS WAA PATTERN 
CONTS TO SHIFT EAST XPCT LIFT...AND ELEVATED INSTABILITY...TO DVLP 
ACRS MOST OF THE CWFA.  CURRENT BREAKDOWN OF POPS LKS PRETTY 
GOOD...WITH 50 NW TAPERING TO DRY SE.  BASED ON RADAR TRENDS MAY 
BUMP THE FAR NW COUNTIES UP TO LIKELY...OTHW PLAN ONLY SOME WORDING 
CHANGES TO THE TIMING.

OVER THE SOUTH AND EAST CWFA...TEMPS HV ALREADY FALLEN TO/NR FCST 
LOWS IN A PRETTY GD RADIATIONAL SITN.  READINGS MAY FALL A FEW MORE 
DEG...THEN XPCT THEM TO LEVEL OFF OR EVEN RISE AS CLDS AND SW FLOW 
INCREASES.  

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

FXUS61 KILN 211913
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
313 PM EDT TUE AUG 21 2001

RIDGE IS PROGD TO BUILD ACROSS THE OH VLY TONIGHT.  AHEAD OF THIS 
FEATURE MODELS PROG DECENT WAA ACROSS FA OVERNIGHT.  AC ACROSS IL-IN 
WL MOVE EWD INTO FA.  ALSO...ETA PROGS AN MCS TO DEVELOP TONIGHT AND 
MOVE INTO NW OH TOWARD DAYBREAK.  WL CONTINUE CHC POPS WITH WORDING 
AFTER MIDNIGHT IN THE NRN MIAMI VLY AND TOWARD DAYBREAK DAY-CMH.  
ALSO WL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHC FOR CVG GROUP TOWARD DAYBREAK BUT WL 
LEAVE PMH REGION DRY.

MCS WL DROP ACROSS FA ON WED.  IT MAY WEAKEN AND THEN REFORM IN THE 
PM BUT STRENGTH OF MID LVL WINDS SUGGEST IT MAY MAINTAIN ITS INITIAL 
STRENGTH.  REGARDLESS OF DETAILS...WL INCLUDE CHC SHRA/TSRA ALL 
AREAS BUT CVG.  MID LVL RIDGING...700 MB TEMPS AROUND +10 AND DRYING 
SUGGEST THAT AREA WL REMAIN DRY.  MID LVL WINDS...WBZ HEIGHTS AND 
DELTA THTE VALUES SUGGEST THAT SVR STORMS WL BE POSSIBLE.

XPCT MCS TO FORM ON WED NIGHT VC DAY-CMH AND DROP SWD TOWARD THE OH 
RIVER.  THREAT SHOULD SHIFT TO HEAVY RAINFALL.

ETA SUGGESTS THAT OUTFLOW WL DROP S OF FA ON THU.  WL INCLUDE CHC 
POPS MOST AREAS BUT LEAVE THEM LOW. 

GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON


FXUS61 KILN 210626
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 AM EDT TUE AUG 21 2001

SFC HIGH PRES WAS CENTERED NEAR EAST CNTRL KY THIS MORNING.  THE 
HIGH WILL MOVE SLOWLY OFF TO THE EAST TODAY AS A WARM FRONT ACRS THE 
SRN PLAINS STATES PIVOTS TOWARD THE MID MS VLY REGION.  I AM ONLY 
EXPECTING SOME HIGH THIN CIRRUS COMBINED WITH SCATTERED AFTN CUMULUS 
CLOUDS.  THUS...CURRENT MOSTLY SUNNY LOOKS GOOD.  MOS VALUES ARE ON 
TRACK FOR TODAY/S HIGHS SO WILL NOT CHANGE.

THE WEATHER BEGINS TO GET INTERESTING TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

ETA AND AVN BOTH AGREE THAT AN H5 S/WV WILL EJECT FROM THE 
INTERMOUNTAIN REGION AROUND A MEAN UPR LVL RIDGE TOWARD THE GREAT 
LAKES OVERNIGHT.  THIS S/WV WILL INTERACT WITH THE WARM FRONT.  AS 
THIS HAPPENS...WARM...MOIST ASCENT WILL DEVELOP A MCS SOMEWHERE 
AROUND THE NE IOWA/WRN WISCONSIN REGION.  THE BIG QUESTION WILL BE:  
WHERE WILL THIS MCS TRACK AS THE WARM FRONT PIVOTS TOWARD THE OHIO 
VLY?  MODELS TEND TO HAVE A TOUGH TIME PINPOINTING THE EXACT TRACK 
OF AN MCS.  BASED ON THE 850 MB-300 MB THICKNESS PATTERN...MCS 
SHOULD MOVE TOWARD NRN INDIANA AND NW OHIO LATE TONIGHT...THEN ACRS 
THE REMAINDER OF THE FCST AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  HOW FAR SOUTH IT GETS 
WILL DEPEND ON THE EXACT LOCATION OF INITIATION.  FOR NOW...WILL GO 
50 POPS LATE TONIGHT FAR NW...30 POPS DAY AND CMH GROUPS TOWARD 
DAYBREAK AND LEAVE CVG AND PMH DRY.  ON WEDNESDAY...50 POPS NRN 
THREE ZONES (WAP...DAY...CMH) SEEM REASONABLE ATTM WITH 40 POPS 
SOUTH.  TEMPS WILL BE TRICKY ON WEDNESDAY WITH VERY WARM AIR TRYING 
TO PIVOT INTO THE REGION.  HOWEVER...WITH EXPECTED DEBRIS CLOUDS AND 
PCPN...WILL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM MOS.  AS OF NOW...WARM FRONT MAY 
GET AS FAR NORTH AS A TOL TO CMH TO MARRIETA OH LINE.  THE FLY IN 
THE OINTMENT WILL BE THE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY THE MCS LAYS OUT.  IT WILL 
LIKELY RETARD THE NORTHWARD MOVEMENT OF THE WARM FRONT.  AS A 
RESULT...THE AFOREMENTIONED WARM FRONT...WHERE IT DECIDES TO 
STOP...WILL BECOME STATIONARY WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  THAT LOCATION SHOULD 
BE OVER THE SRN CWFA.  WILL GO 40 POPS FAR NORTH AND 50 SOUTH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR SHWRS/TSMS ASSOCIATED WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN









FXUS61 KILN 210626

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 AM EDT TUE AUG 21 2001

SFC HIGH PRES WAS CENTERED NEAR EAST CNTRL KY THIS MORNING.  THE 
HIGH WILL MOVE SLOWLY OFF TO THE EAST TODAY AS A WARM FRONT ACRS THE 
SRN PLAINS STATES PIVOTS TOWARD THE MID MS VLY REGION.  I AM ONLY 
EXPECTING SOME HIGH THIN CIRRUS COMBINED WITH SCATTERED AFTN CUMULUS 
CLOUDS.  THUS...CURRENT MOSTLY SUNNY LOOKS GOOD.  MOS VALUES ARE ON 
TRACK FOR TODAY/S HIGHS SO WILL NOT CHANGE.

THE WEATHER BEGINS TO GET INTERESTING TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

ETA AND AVN BOTH AGREE THAT AN H5 S/WV WILL EJECT FROM THE 
INTERMOUNTAIN REGION AROUND A MEAN UPR LVL RIDGE TOWARD THE GREAT 
LAKES OVERNIGHT.  THIS S/WV WILL INTERACT WITH THE WARM FRONT.  AS 
THIS HAPPENS...WARM...MOIST ASCENT WILL DEVELOP A MCS SOMEWHERE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
324 PM EDT MON AUG 20 2001

CYCLONIC FLOW WL RELAX ACROSS THE OH VLY THIS EVENING.  THIS 
COMBINED WITH THE LOSS OF SFC HEATING SHOULD LEAD TO DISSIPATION OF 
THE CU ACROSS FA.  WL GO WITH A CLEARING TREND TONIGHT.

H8 FLOW IS PROGD TO BECOME MORE ANTICYCLONIC ON TUE WHICH SHOULD 
KEEP CU DEVELOPMENT DOWN SOME.  WL GO WITH M/S.

MODELS INDICATE STRONG RIDGING BUILDING INTO THE OH VLY ON TUE 
NIGHT. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO MCS DEVELOPMENT OVER THE LAKES.  THAT 
SYSTEM MAY ROLL SEWD ALONG THE 850-300 THICKNESSES INTO THE NRN 
MIAMI VLY BY DAYBREAK.  OTHERWISE...WAA WL LEAD TO AC FORMATION SO 
WL GO P/C.

A DECENT WARM FRONT WL BE ACROSS FA ON WED.  WITH THE ADDITIONAL  
PRESENCE OF A CONVECTIVE BOUNDARY AND UPPER LVL SUPPORT...WL 
INTRODUCE CHC SHRA/TSRA ON WED FOR MOST OF FA.  WL LEAVE CVG GROUP 
DRY AS STRONG MID LVL RIDGING AND LOW MEAN RH MOVE INTO THAT 
REGION.

TEMP GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE SO WL STICK CLOSE. 

.ILN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 PM EDT SUN AUG 19 2001

SURFACE LOW IS NOW IN EASTERN MICHIGAN...WITH TRAILING COLD FRONT 
RUNNING NEAR MFD-CMH-PMH LINE.  LINE OF CONVECTION IS GENERALLY EAST 
OF THIS LINE.  SURFACE ANALYSIS IS SHOWING AN AREA ON CONVERGENCE 
ALONG A TROF ACROSS NW INDIANA..NORTHERN IL.  ALONG THIS FEATURE 
SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS HAVE BEGUN TO DEVELOP.  MODELS WEAKEN THE 
CONVERGENCE AS SWINGS EAST IT HOWEVER.  ALTHOUGH FA WILL PROBABLY BE 
DRY THIS EVENING...FEEL THAT I NEED TO CARRY AT LEAST A 20 POP EARLY 
THIS EVENING ACROSS THE NORTH.

UPPER LOW PULLS NORTHEAST TONIGHT.  WRAP AROUND CLOUDS WILL AFFECT 
MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF...WHERE WILL GO PARTLY CLOUDY.  IN THE 
SOUTH... BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR.  NGM TRIES TO PRODUCE QPF 
TOMORROW...BUT WILL CONTINUE WITH DRY FORECAST PER ETA.   AS DRY AIR 
WORKS IN DURING THE DAY...CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY ERODE ACROSS THE 
NORTH.

MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPERATURES 
WONT STRAY TOO FAR FROM NGM MOS.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 190646
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 AM EDT SUN AUG 19 2001

WDSPRD PCPN BEGINNING TO TAPER OFF SOMEWHAT BUT STILL A LINE OF A 
FEW TSTMS ACRS S CNTRL OH AND NE KY. WL PRBLY HAV TO HANG ON TO SOME 
KIND OF MRNG WORDING ACRS THE E BUT WL MONITOR RADAR TRENDS TO MAKE 
A FINAL DECISION ON ERLY WORDING FOR ZONES. OTRWS...SFC ANLYS SHWG 
LOW PRES OVR SW LWR MICH WITH CDFNT XTNDG DOWN INTO S CNTRL IL. 
MEANWHILE...MDLS IN AGRMT SLOWLY LIFTING UPR LVL LOW TO THE NE AND 
WKNG IT THRU MON. ETA/AVN BOTH SHWG DRY SLOT WORKING INTO AREA THRU 
THIS AFTN WITH AVN A LTL MORE AGRSV. CDFNT PRODG TO PUSH E ACRS FA 
THRU MID/LATE AFTN WITH GOOD CONV ALG AND JUST AHD OF FNT AT 18Z 
JUST TO THE E OF DAY/CVG AREAS. THIS IN COMBINATION WITH SOME MID 
LVL VORTICITY SO THINK WE WILL SEE LINE OF TSTMS DVLP THRU ERLY AFTN 
SOMEWHERE NEAR OR JUST TO THE E OF A DAY-CVG LINE AND THEN PUSG E 
ACRS CMH AND PMH AREA THRU RMNDR AFTN. WL CARRY A LOW CHC POP ACRS 
THE W WITH HIGH CHC IN THE E FOR THIS AFTN. WIND FIELDS NOT QUITE AS 
IMPRSV AS YSTRDAY BUT ETA FCST SNDG FOR 22Z AT CMH INDCTG CAPES 
CLOSE TO 2000 J/KG AND WBZ ARND 8800 FT WHICH IS IN THE OPTIMAL 
RANGE FOR HAIL DVLPMT. MID LVL DRY PUNCH ALSO CREATING DECENT CONV 
INSTBLTY WITH MAX THETAE DIFF BLO 500 MB OF ABT 25 DGRS SO DMGG 
WINDS ALSO PSBL. WL ISSUE AN SPS TO HIGHLIGHT SVR THREAT PRIMARILY 
ACRS ERN PORTIONS OF FA. WL HANG ON TO A LOW CHC POP INTO TNGT FOR 
THE N AND E WITH SOME LINGERING MSTR AND SECONDARY TROF AXIS 
ROTATING DOWN ACRS AREA. HI FINALLY BEGINS TO BUILD INTO THE REGION 
THRU THE DAY ON MON SO SHUD SEE SKIES BECMG PRTLY SUNY THRU THE DAY.
WL STICK PRETTY CLOSE TO GUID TMPS THRU THE PD.

.ILN...NONE.

657 
FXUS61 KILN 181844
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EDT SAT AUG 18 2001

UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IS FORECAST TO 
DROP SOUTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND DEEPEN.  ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
LOW IS A 70 KT 300 MB CURVED JET.  AHEAD OF THIS JET IS A VERY 
STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE....WITH IS COUPLED WITH LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE.  SPC HAS ALREADY BOXED CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THESE 
FEATURES. 

HAVE TIMED THIS CONVECTION INTO THE WESTERN COUNTIES AT OR JUST 
BEFORE 00Z.  FORECAST SOUNDING ARE SHOWING GOOD CAPE AND 
HELICITIES.  HOWEVER DUE TO TIMING...AT OR AROUND SUNSET...THINK 
THAT THE CONVECTION WILL BE WEAKEN AS IT COMES INTO THE FA.  STILL 
WESTERN COUNTIES COULD SEE SOME SEVERE...SO WILL PUT MENTION OF 
POSSIBLE SEVERE IN THE WESTERN ZONES.

500 MB LOW BOTTOMS OUT AROUND 12Z SUNDAY...BUT ITS MOISTURE WILL 
AFFECT THE FA FOR MUCH OF SUNDAY.  NGM HAS VORT FARTHER SOUTH THAN 
ETA/AVN...WHICH HAS THE VORT STACKED WITH THE UPPER LOW.  PREFER THE 
ETA/AVN SOLUTION...WHICH WOULD BRING SLIGHTLY DRIER MEAN RH INTO THE 
FA AND LESS UPPER SUPPORT.  THEREFORE...THINK THAT THE NGM POPS ARE 
TOO HIGH FOR SUNDAY.  WILL GO WITH LOWER AVN POPS.  WILL ALSO LEAN 
TOWARDS WARMER AVN HIGHS.   WITH SYSTEM LIFTING OUT...WILL DRY OUT 
SUNDAY NIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES





THAT THE CONVECTION WILL BE WEAKEN AS IT COMES INTO THE FA.  STILL 
WESTERN COUNTIES COULD SEE SOME SEVERE...SO WILL PUT MENTION OF 
POSSIBLE SEVERE IN THE WESTERN ZONES.

500 MB LOW BOTTOMS OUT AROUND 12Z SUNDAY...BUT ITS MOISTURE WILL 
AFFECT THE FA FOR MUCH OF SUNDAY.  NGM HAS VORT FARTHER SOUTH THAN 
ETA/AVN...WHICH HAS THE VORT STACKED WITH THE UPPER LOW.  PREFER THE 
ETA/AVN SOLUTION...WHICH WOULD BRING SLIGHTLY DRIER MEAN RH INTO THE 
FA AND LESS UPPER SUPPORT.  THEREFORE...THINK THAT THE NGM POPS ARE 
TOO HIGH FOR SUNDAY.  WILL GO WITH LOWER AVN POPS.  WILL ALSO LEAN 
TOWARDS WARMER AVN HIGHS.   WITH SYSTEM LIFTING OUT...WILL DRY OUT 
SUNDAY NIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER FA WITH 
WESTERLY FLOW.  TDS ARE IN THE UPPER 50S.

18Z MESOETA AND AVN BOTH SPEED UP CLOUDINESS AND THREAT OF PRECIP 
ACROSS FA.  THIS APPEARS REASONABLE AS MODELS ARE TRYING TO CATCH UP 
TO WARM ADVECTION CLOUDS AND PRECIP.  WILL GO WITH THICKENING CLOUDS 
ACROSS THE WEST AND SPEED UP THE PRECIP IN THE SOUTHWEST.  MID SHIFT 
MAY HAVE TO SPEED UP PRECIP ELSEWHERE AND INCREASE POPS.  BUT AT THE 
MOMENT WILL ONLY ADJUST CVG GROUP.

OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK GOOD...HOWEVER THINK THEY MIGHT BE A DEGREE OR 
TWO WARMER WITH CLOUDS STREAMING IN.  BUT FEEL THEY WILL BE THIN 
ENOUGH AND THE WINDS WILL BE LIGHT ENOUGH FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT FOR 
THE FORECASTED ONES TO BE REALIZED.  

.ILN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
246 AM EDT THU AUG 16 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN FEATURES H5 TROF AXIS OVER CENTRAL CONUS WITH A 
VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE DIGGING THROUGH MINNESOTA.  WITH MODELS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT...SHORT WAVE WILL CROSS MICHIGAN TONIGHT AND THEN ITS 
PROGGED TO MAINE BY FRIDAY NIGHT.  NEXT SHORT WAVE IS FCST TO DIG 
TOWARDS OHIO BY SATURDAY NIGHT. 

SFC MAP AT 06Z SHOWS LOW NEAR UIN WITH WARM FRONT EXTENDING TO 
AROUND CVG.  MODELS HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON POSITION AND STRENGTH OF 
THE LOW...WHICH IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH MICHIGAN AND THEN TO 
MAINE IN RESPONSE TO THE SHORT WAVE. COLD FRONT SOUTH OF THE LOW 
WILL CROSS OUR REGION EARLY TONIGHT.

RADAR SHOWS DISSIPATING RAIN FALLING FROM MID LEVEL DECK MOVING 
THROUGH OUR NORTHWEST COUNTIES. MORE SIGNIFICANT PRECIP IS LOCATED 
IN ILLINOIS AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  

MODELS GIVE OUR AREA MODERATE AMOUNTS OF INSTABILITY AND SHEAR 
TODAY...ALONG WITH UPPER DIVERGENCE AND 40 KT H8 JET.  SPC HAS SLGT 
RISK FOR SVR OVER OUR ENTIRE REGION.  HEAVY RAIN IS ALSO POSSIBLE 
WITH HIGH PWAT AND BACKBUILDING INDICATED ON SOUNDING...THOUGH THE 
FRONT WILL PROGRESS RATHER QUICKLY IN WESTERLY UPPER FLOW.  

WITH RADAR SHOWING RAIN ADVANCING TOWARD OUR AREA...ILL INCREASE 
POPS TO 80% AT DAY AND CMH AND LEAVE 70 POPS IN THE SOUTH.  RAPID 
DRYING WILL FOLLOW THE FRONT THIS EVENING AND ITLL STAY DRY THROUGH 
FRIDAY.  FOR TONIGHT ILL KEEP OUR WESTERN COUNTIES DRY AND CONTINUE 
CHANCE POPS THROUGH MIDNIGHT EAST AS PER PREVIOUS FCST. MOSTLY SUNNY 
STILL LOOKS GOOD FOR FRIDAY.

FWC TEMPS LOOK SLIGHTLY WARM FOR TODAY WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIP 
AROUND.  TONIGHTS FWC LOWS LOOK ACCEPTABLE AS DO FRIDAYS HIGHS.  
FWC SATURDAY MORNING LOWS APPEAR TOO LOW WITH HIGH CLOUDS AROUND SO 
ILL ADJUST THEM UP SLIGHTLY. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO





FXUS61 KILN 160127
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
925 PM EDT WED AUG 15 2001

AREA OF PCPN ACROSS EASTERN IL/WRN IN IS ABOUT 6 HOURS AHEAD OF HERE 
THE MODELS HAD IT.  PCPN APPEARS TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH TWO 
FEATURES.  FIRST IS NOSE OF HIGHER DEWPOINTS RUNNING FROM EASTERN KY 
NORTHWEST INTO IN/IL.  SECOND IS 500 MB VORT.  MODELS LIFT VORT NE 
INTO NW OHIO.  THIS SHOULD PULL PCPN NE WITH IT.  

00Z SOUNDING WAS VERY DRY AT 700...SO IT WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO 
MOISTURE UP THE COLUMN...BUT PRECIP EFFICIENCY INCREASES RAPIDLY 
TOWARDS IN THE WEST TOWARDS 12Z. 

LOOKING AT EVERYTHING...FEEL THAT A MENTION OF 30 POP IS NEEDED 
TONIGHT IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA AND THE EXTREME WESTERN COUNTIES OF 
THE MIAMI VALLEY.

LOW TEMPERATURES LOOK GOOD.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES




794 
FXUS61 KILN 160127
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
925 PM EDT WED AUG 15 2001

AREA OF PCPN ACROSS EASTERN IL/WRN IN IS ABOUT 6 HOURS AHEAD OF HERE 
THE MODELS HAD IT.  PCPN APPEARS TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH TWO 
FEATURES.  FIRST IS NOSE OF HIGHER DEWPOINTS RUNNING FROM EASTERN KY 
NORTHWEST INTO IN/IL.  SECOND IS 500 MB VORT.  MODELS LIFT VORT NE 
INTO NW OHIO.  THIS SHOULD PULL PCPN NE WITH IT.  

00Z SOUNDING WAS VERY DRY AT 700...SO IT WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO 
MOISTURE UP THE COLUMN...BUT PRECIP EFFICIENCY INCREASES RAPIDLY 
TOWARDS IN THE WEST TOWARDS 12Z. 

LOOKING AT EVERYTHING...FEEL THAT A MENTION OF 30 POP IS NEEDED 
TONIGHT IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA AND THE EXTREME WESTERN COUNTIES OF 
THE MIAMI VALLEY.

LOW TEMPERATURES LOOK GOOD.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 151908
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 AM EDT WED AUG 15 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE POKING INTO FA FROM 
NEW ENGLAND WITH SURFACE LOW NEAR KMCI.  ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT 
EXTENDS INTO SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA.  SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES CU 
NEAR THE WARM FRONT BEGINNING TO ENCROACH INTO WESTERN FA.  
OTHERWISE GENERALLY CLOUDLESS SKIES.

MODELS ARE IN DESCENT AGREEMENT AND HAVE COME AROUND ON A BETTER 
SOLUTION.  DROG/DT INDICATES TODAYS 12Z RUN WITH ETA IS SIMILAR 
WITH POSITION AS 12Z TUESDAY RUN.  THE AVN HAS BEEN SIMILAR WITH 
THE PAST THREE RUNS WITH POSITION.  HOWEVER...THE UPPER TROUGH/LOW 
HAS STRENGTHENED WITH THE LATEST RUN.

CURRENT FORECAST HAS SITUATION HANDLED WELL.  WILL THROW IN A SMALL 
POP LATE IN WAPAK GROUP.  A LITTLE CONCERNED ABOUT POP CHANCES AS 
THE UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT IS LIMITED (I.E. WRONG SECTOR OF UPPER LEVEL 
JET).  HOWEVER, FRONT...LOW (30 KTS) AND MID (40 KTS) LEVEL 
JETS...AND INSTABILITY ALL INDICATE STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WILL 
DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOON.  WILL LINGER POPS INTO EVENING IN THE 
EAST.  STRONG MID LEVEL WAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THE OPENING CLOSED LOW 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN FA.  IT APPEARS MOISTURE WILL BE 
LIMITED AND THE SOUNDING INDICATES THAT WE WILL BE CAPPED.  WILL 
THROW IN A LITTLE BETTER CU COVERAGE ACROSS THE NORTH TO ACCOUNT FOR 
THIS WAVE.

FWC TEMPS LOOK REAL GOOD... WILL STAY CLOSE.  MISILN WILL BE OUT 
SHORTLY.    

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON





AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

905 AM EDT WED AUG 15 2001

CURRENT FORECAST IS IN GREAT SHAPE...NO UPDATE PLANNED.

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE FROM NEW ENGLAND INTO

INTO FA.  CIRRUS WILL LIKELY THIN OUR DURING DAY AS AMPLE MIXING 
TAKES PLACE WITH DRIER AIR ASSOCIATED WITH RIDGE.  IN OTHER WORDS 
PARTLY SUNNY LOOKS GOOD.  FORECASTED HIGHS ALSO LOOK GOOD WHEN 
COMPARING TO TECHNIQUES OF THE 06Z MESOETA AND MORNING SOUNDINGS.

.ILN...NONE.

370 
FXUS61 KILN 150743
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
343 AM EDT WED AUG 15 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS H5 RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY.
NEXT TROF WILL APPROACH ON THURSDAY AS STRONG SHORT WAVE DROPS FROM 
CENTRAL CANADA THROUGH MICHIGAN.  LATEST MODEL RUN INDICATES SLOWER 
PROGRESS AND STRENGTHENING OF THE TROF WRT TO PREVIOUS RUNS.

SFC PATTERN SHOWS RIDGE EXTENDING FROM MISSOURI THROUGH NEW ENGLAND 
WITH AXIS ACROSS OUR AREA.  RIDGE AXIS WILL SLIDE TO THE EAST COAST 
BY 00Z THIS EVENING.  COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA THURSDAY 
WITH MOST OF ENERGY CLOSER TO THE SHORT WAVE TO OUR NORTH.  MODEL 
INSTABILITY IS RATHER LOW FOR THURSDAY BUT HELICITY IS FAIRLY 
IMPRESSIVE.  

PARTLY SUNNY WILL WORK FOR TODAY WITH MID AND HIGH CLOUDS MOVING 
IN.  SOME CLOUDS WILL STICK AROUND TONIGHT IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. 

NEARLY PERPENDICULAR UPPER FLOW WRT THE FRONT WILL CAUSE THE FRONT 
TO PROGRESS RATHER QUICKLY...SO HEAVY RAIN MAY NOT BE AS MUCH OF 
PROBLEM AS EARLIER THIS SUMMER.  HOWEVER...ILL KEEP THURSDAYS POPS 
HIGHER THAN FWC IN THE LIKELY RANGE.

FWC TEMPS LOOK A BIT OPTIMISTIC FOR DAYTIME HIGHS. LOWS TONIGHT LOOK 
TOO COOL WITH CLOUDS PROVIDING INSULATION SO ILL GO A COUPLE 
DEGREES ABOVE. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO



FXUS61 KILN 141911
AFDILN



AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 PM EDT TUE AUG 14 2001

SFC HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR SE IOWA THIS AFTN WILL DRIFT ACRS 
NRN OHIO TONIGHT...THEN EAST OF THE REGION TOMORROW.  VISIBLE 
SATELLITE IMAGERY DEPICTED QUITE A BIT OF CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT.  
SINCE THESE ARE SUN DRIVEN...THE CUMULUS CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY 
DISSIPATE TOWARD SUNSET.  CIRRUS CLOUDS CURRENTLY OVER THE MID MS 
VLY WILL SPILL INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT...BUT I EXPECT THESE TO BE 
THIN ENOUGH TO CONTINUE MOSTLY CLEAR FCST.

A COMPLEX WEATHER PATTERN BEGINS TO DEVELOP ON WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY.  TWO NOTED S/WVS...ONE ACRS WRN CANADA (SASKATCHEWAN) AND 
ANOTHER PULLING OUT OF WYOMING WILL BRING A PAIR OF COLD FRONTS INTO 
THE GREAT LAKES REGION BY THURSDAY.  CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
WYOMING S/WV SHOULD CREATE ENOUGH CIRRUS/DEBRIS BLOW OFF TO KEEP A 
PARTLY SUNNY FCST ON WEDNESDAY.  TEMPS WILL BEGIN TO WARM AS WAA 
TAKES OVER AHEAD OF THIS SHORTWAVE.

THE MODELS BEGIN TO DIFFER ON THE STRENGH AND SPEED OF THE S/WVS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  THE ETA IS MUCH STRONGER WITH THE 
CANADIAN S/WV...DEVELOPING A STRONGER SFC LOW...WHILE THE AVN IS 
WEAKER.  HOWEVER...IT IS ODD THAT THE TWO SEEM TO BE SIMILAR WITH 
THE TIMING OF SOUTHERN COLD FRONT (THE ONE ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
WYOMING S/WV).  YOU WOULD THINK THE AVN WOULD BE FASTER...BUT THIS 
DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE THE CASE IN THE LOW LEVEL FIELDS.  AS IS 
TYPICAL IN THIS TYPE OF SITUATION...IT WOULD BE PRUDENT TO TAKE AN 
ETA/AVN COMPROMISE.  THUS...WILL BRING IN A SMALL CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AFTER MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT IN THE WAA AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT.  
THERE WILL BE ENOUGH UPR DYNAMICAL LIFT/CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT 
THAT A SQUALL LINE MAY DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON THURSDAY.   THE 
BIG QUESTION WILL BE: HOW MUCH INSOLATION WILL PENETRATE ACRS THE 
REGION BEFORE THE FRONT MOVES INTO THE WRN CWFA BY LATE AFTN/EARLY 
EVENING?  MOS IS WARM WHILE AVN IS COOLER (REFLECTED BY THE RAIN).  
WILL ONLY GO SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN MOS ATTM...BUT IF SQUALL LINE 
DEVELOPS AND MOVES EAST OUT AHEAD OF THE FRONT...TEMPS MAY STAY IN 
THE 70S WEST.

COLD FRONT MOVES ACRS THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT...BRINGING A GRADUAL 
END TO THE PRECIPITATION.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN












FXUS61 KILN 141345
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 AM EDT TUE AUG 14 2001

12Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT FROM NEAR HTS TO LEX TO PAH.  
THE COLD FRONT SHOULD SLIP FARTHER SOUTH TODAY.  HIGH PRESSURE WAS 
LOCATED OVER WISCONSIN.

THE SFC HIGH WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION THROUGH TODAY.  VISIBLE 
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWED SOME AC/ACCAS LINGERING ACRS THE SRN CWFA.  
THESE SHOULD DISSIPATE AND BE REPLACED WITH DIURNAL CUMULUS.   DRIER 
AIR IN TERMS OF DEWPOINTS WAS SLOWLY ADVECTING SOUTH.  HOWEVER ...60 
+ DEWPOINTS WERE LINGERING NEAR AND SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  THIS 
SEEMS TO BE INFLUENCED BY A WEAK INVERTED TROF EXTENDING FROM CVG 
TOWARD IND.  MOST LOCATIONS WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY...EXCEPT SOUTH OF 
THE RIVER WHERE CUMULUS WILL LIKELY BECOME BROKEN DUE TO THE HIGHER 
DEWPOINTS.  S/WV IN NW FLOW WILL MOVE TO THE SRN CWFA BY LATE 
AFTN/EVENING.  THERE IS A SLIM CHANCE THAT THIS S/WV COMBINED WITH 
LINGERING MOISTURE IN THE FAR SOUTH THAT A STRAY SHOWER/TSTM MAY 
FORM.  BECAUSE OF LOW CONFIDENCE ATTM...WILL LEAVE FCST DRY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN


005 
FXUS61 KILN 140739
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EDT TUE AUG 14 2001

H5 TROF AXIS IS CURRENTLY CROSSING OUR CWA ALONG WITH SHORT WAVES. 
TROF IS PROGGED TO THE EAST COAST BY 12Z WEDNESDAY AS LOW AMPLITUDE 
RIDGE BUILDS TEMPORARILY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  NEXT TROF IS DUE TO 
AFFECT THE REGION ON THURSDAY.

SFC MAP SHOWS HIGH OVER WISCONSIN BUILDING SOUTHEAST TOWARD OHIO 
BEHIND WEAK FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH LAST EVENING.  HIGH IS DUE TO 
CROSS OUR AREA TONIGHT WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW KICKING IN ON WEDNESDAY 
AS THE HIGH MOVES TO THE NEW ENGLAND COAST.

SATELLITE SHOWS A FEW CLOUDS LEFT OVER AS SHORT WAVES AND FRONT WORK 
EAST. CLEAR SKIES PREVAIL UPSTREAM FROM NORTHWEST OHIO TO WISCONSIN. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW INSTABILITY TODAY BUT VERY LITTLE MOISTURE 
ABOVE CAP AT 8 KFT. 

ILL KEEP MOSTLY SUNNY FOR TODAY WITH DRIER AIR WORKING IN AND LACK 
OF BOUNDARY TO TOUCH OFF WIDESPREAD CLOUDINESS.  ILL CONTINUE 
MOSTLY CLEAR FCST TONIGHT WITH HIGH MOVING THROUGH.  ILL MAKE MINOR 
CHANGE FOR WEDNESDAY TO MOSTLY SUNNY WITH MODELS SHOWING LITTLE 
MOISTURE.

FWC TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SINCE THEY HAVE TRENDED UP FROM PREVIOUS 
RUNS.  TONIGHTS LOWS LOOK JUST A BIT TOO HIGH WITH CLEAR 
SKIES...LIGHT WINDS AND DRY AIR.  WEDNESDAY MORNINGS LOWS MAY BE 
TOO LOW WITH CLOUDS MOVING IN.  FWC HIGHS WILL BE HARD TO BEAT.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

906 PM EDT MON AUG 13 2001

01Z SFC PLOT INDICATED THE LEADING EDGE OF DRIER AIR INTO NRN IN AND 
NWRN OH.  WDLY SCT SHRA/TSRA ASSOCIATED WITH A MID LVL S/WV WERE 
WEAKENING AND SHOULD BE GONE WITHIN A FEW HOURS.

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED TO REMOVE POPS FROM DAY AND NRN MIAMI VLY 
GROUPS.  PLAN ON UPDATING TO REMOVE EVENING MENTION FOR CVG-PMH-CMH 
GROUPS AS SOON AS RAIN DISSIPATES/MOVES OUT.

DRIER AIR WL MOVE IN OVERNIGHT ALLOWING TEMPS TO FALL TO CURRENT 
FCST LOWS.  NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

WILKINSON






FXUS61 KILN 131756
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
155 PM EDT MON AUG 13 2001

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE CWFA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
...THEN DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS AND SATELLITE IMAGERY PLACE THE COLD FRONT FROM 
NEAR KLAF TO FWA TO JUST SOUTH OF TOL AND CLE.  BIG QUESTION WILL BE 
HOW TO WORD ZONES FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING.
BELIEVE ATTM THAT THE FAR NRN ZONES SHOULD BE IN THE CLEAR BY AROUND 
4 PM EDT.  THE DAYTON AND COLUMBUS ZONES SHOULD SEE ACTIVITY THROUGH 
6 PM WITH POINTS SOUTH (CVG AND PMH) THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS.  
FRONT IS BEING AIDED BY A S/WV MOVING THROUGH ILLINOIS AT THIS TIME. 
WILL GO WITH SCATTERED POPS (30 OR 40) TO COVER THE SHORT TERM 
WEATHER EVENT.

OTHERWISE...ONCE THE COLD FRONT SLIPS SOUTH OF THE REGION THIS 
EVENING...SKIES WILL CLEAR AND COOLER TEMPS CAN BE EXPECTED 
OVERNIGHT.

ON TUESDAY...SFC HIGH PRESSURE...NOW OVER MN...WILL WEDGE INTO THE 
REGION.  BELIEVE 850 MB MOISTURE AND DAYTIME HEATING WILL PRODUCE 
SCATTERED AFTN CU...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A MOSTLY SUNNY FCST.

MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS ARE FCST INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE SFC HIGH 
MOVES OFF TO THE EAST.

ON WEDNESDAY...A STORM SYSTEM BEGINS TO ORGANIZE ACRS THE NRN AND 
CNTRL PLAINS.  SOME OF THE HIGH LVL MSTR FROM CONVECTION WILL LIKELY 
BLOW INTO THE REGION.  THUS...WILL WORD FCST PARTLY SUNNY.  MOS/MAV 
AND THICKNESS SCHEMES ARE CLOSE WITH TEMPS FOR TONIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO WILL ONLY ADJUST ACCORDING TO EACH FCST SITES 
BIASES.

AVN DIFFERS WITH ETA MODEL BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SEEMING TO BRING IN 
S/WVS THAT SEEM A LITTLE BIT FAST AND STRONG.  WILL SIDE WITH THE 
ETA MODEL ATTM AND KEEP PCPN AT BAY TO THE WEST.

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION ON THURSDAY...BRINGING THE NEXT 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  IF THE NEW AVN MODEL IS 
CORRECT FOR THE WEEKEND...MUCH COOLER TEMPS CAN BE EXPECTED (BY 
SUNDAY) AS A VIGOROUS S/WV DIVES INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN













