BLOW INTO THE REGION.  THUS...WILL WORD FCST PARTLY SUNNY.  MOS/MAV 
AND THICKNESS SCHEMES ARE CLOSE WITH TEMPS FOR TONIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO WILL ONLY ADJUST ACCORDING TO EACH FCST SITES 
BIASES.

AVN DIFFERS WITH ETA MODEL BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SEEMING TO BRING IN 
S/WVS THAT SEEM A LITTLE BIT FAST AND STRONG.  WILL SIDE WITH THE 
ETA MODEL ATTM AND KEEP PCPN AT BAY TO THE WEST.

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION ON THURSDAY...BRINGING THE NEXT 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  IF THE NEW AVN MODEL IS 
CORRECT FOR THE WEEKEND...MUCH COOLER TEMPS CAN BE EXPECTED (BY 
SUNDAY) AS A VIGOROUS S/WV DIVES INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN















FXUS61 KILN 131733 AAA

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
130 PM EDT MON AUG 13 2001

COLD FRONT IS MOVING A LITTLE BIT SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS ANTICIPATED.  
MOSAIC RADAR AND VISIBLE SATELLITE DATA INDICATING SHOWER 
DEVELOPMENT ACROSS NORTHEAST INDIANA AND NORTHWEST OHIO.  BELIEVE A 
SHOWER AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM WILL FORM ACROSS THE FAR NORTH 
BEFORE FRONT GETS THROUGH.  THUS...WILL THROW OUT A QUICK UPDATE TO 
HANDLE THIS.


.ILN...NONE.


FXUS61 KILN 131346
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 AM EDT MON AUG 13 2001

FCST UPDATE WILL CONCERN CHC/S OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
ASSOCIATED WITH COLD FRONT.

AT 12Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT FROM NEAR THE UPR SAINT 
LAWRENCE RIVER VALLEY...SOUTHWEST INTO FAR SRN ONTARIO...EXTREME SE 
MI...NRN INDIANA...THEN INTO S CNTRL ILLINOIS.

06Z MESOETA DEPICTS THIS FRONT TO PUSH THROUGH THE NRN CWFA BY EARLY 
AFTN...THEN INTO THE SRN CWFA BY LATE AFTN INTO EARLY EVENING.  THE 
FRONT WILL BE PUSHED ALONG BY A COUPLE OF S/WVS NOTED ON WATER 
VAPOR.  THE FIRST S/WV...LOCATED JUST NORTH OF LAKE SUPERIOR 
...SHOULD NOT HAVE AN AFFECT ON OUR WEATHER.  THE SECOND S/WV...NOW 
LOCATED NEAR IOWA...WILL PLAY A PART IN OUR WX THIS AFTN.  MODIFIED 
ILN SOUNDING WITH MAX HIGHS IN THE MID 80S AND DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 
60S SUPPORT SFC BASED CAPES AROUND 1200 J/KG (ENOUGH TO OVERCOME 
NOTED MID LVL INVERSION).  THIS AMOUNT OF ENERGY...COMBINED WITH LOW 
LVL CONVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT AND DPVA WITH 
AFOREMENTIONED VORT MAX...SHOULD PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ...ESPECIALLY OVER THE SRN CWFA.  NRN THIRD CWFA MAY 
ESCAPE ANY CHANCES OF RAIN AS THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THERE BY 
EARLY AFTN.  WILL CONTEMPLATE REMOVING POPS FROM THE FAR NORTH AND 
INCREASING POPS ACRS THE SOUTH.  ALSO...MAY INTRODUCE AN EVENING CHC 
OF PCPN ACRS THE FAR SOUTH AS THE FRONT WILL NOT HAVE PASSED THROUGH 
BY 6 PM.  CURRENT FCST TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE AND WILL NOT MESS WITH 
TOO MUCH.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN










FXUS61 KILN 130728
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 AM EDT MON AUG 13 2001

SOME LOCALLY DENSE FOG SHOWING UP IN ERN OBS AS DRIER AIR HAS YET TO 
MOVE IN THERE. ELSEWHERE FRONT CURRENTLY OVER WISCONSIN/MICH WILL 
MOVE SOUTH THRU CWFA TDY. THE PRECIP NEAR THE FRONT HAS BEEN 
DISSIPATING OVER LAST FEW HOURS BUT THINK CHC EXISTS TDY ACROSS 
AREA. AVN/ETA SIMILAR THIS RUN SHOWING WEAKENING DYNAMICS AS FRONT 
APPROACHES. BUT WITH BOUNDARY/MOIST GROUND/WEAK VORT BELIEVE A 
COUPLE OF SHOWERS WILL POP. A TS CANNOT BE RULED OUT THIS AFTN 
EITHER. WILL GO WITH LOW CHC NORTH/SLIGHT CHC SOUTH AS BEST UPR PUSH 
STAYS NE. 

MDLS THEN SHOW UPR TROF FOR EAST COAST AND SFC HIGH BUILDING INTO 
REGION THRU WED. COOL AIR OVER NRN LAKES WILL SETTLE IN MAKING FOR 
BELOW NORMAL TEMPS TUE/WED. WILL GO CLOSER TO MAV NUMBERS TUE AS 
YDAS HIGHS OVER UPPER MIDWEST WERE GENERALLY AT OR JUST ABOVE 80. 
TUE NIGHT COULD BE A SNEAKY COLD NIGHT AS SFC HIGH WILL ALLOW FOR 
GOOD RAD COOLING. 

NEXT CHC OF RAIN COMES THU AND FRI WITH NEXT SYS. 

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

FXUS61 KILN 121852
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EDT SUN AUG 12 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS SFC LOW NORTH OF CMH...WITH TRAILING FRONT 
THRU CENTRAL KY.  INVERTED TROF AXIS PERSISTED FROM THE LOW INTO NW 
OHIO...WHERE L70S DWPTS REMAINED AT AOH.  WITH UPPER SUPPORT AND 
DEEP MSTR CONTINUING TO SHIFT EAST...WL CARRY POPS ONLY ACRS THE 
EAST AND JUST FOR THE EVE.  LLVL MSTR WL REMAIN RATHER SLOW TO SCOUR 
OUT HWVR ...ESPLY EAST...AND ANY LULL IN THE GRADIENT WL ALLOW RAPID 
FOG FORMATION.  WL CARRY MENTION OF FOG IN THE ZONES FROM 
CMH-PORTSMOUTH.  GUID TEMPS LK RSNBL...ALTHOUGH WL RAISE A DEG OR SO 
CENTRAL OH WHERE IT DOESNT APPEAR MOS HAS A HANDLE ON THE LLVL MSTR.

FRONT WHICH ANALYZED ACRS WI/IA AT 18Z WL MV ACRS THE CWFA ON 
MONDAY.  NOT MUCH MSTR TO WORK WITH...BUT AM CONCERNED THAT WITH 
LINGERING LLVL MSTR...AND FROPA NR PEAK HEATING SOME CONVECTION WL 
FORM.  CURRENT PLAN IS TO CARRY 30 POPS ALL ZONES...WITH AFTN 
WORDING SOUTH.  TEMPS M80S IN IA/SW WI AHEAD OF THE BNDRY 
ALREADY...SO HV TRENDED TWRD THE SLIGHTLY WARMER MAV NUMBERS.

GOOD DRYING AND CAA MON NIGHT INTO TUE...WITH A NICE BREAK FROM THE 
HEAT/HUMIDITY IN STORE.  LOOKING AT AFTN READINGS IN THE M-U60S 
BEHIND THE NEXT FRONT ATTM...SO WL LEAN TWRD THE COOLER ETA NUMBERS.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

1045 AM EDT SUN AUG 12 2001

14Z SFC ANALYSIS INDCS SFC LOW NR CENTRAL OHIO...WITH AN INVERTED

WESTERN OHIO...WITH DWPTS DROPPING NOTICEABLY ACRS INDIANA AND EVEN 
DOWN TO SDF.  IN THE MEAN...DRYING WL OVERSPREAD THE CWFA TDY AS MID 
LVL SHORT WAVE CONTS TO SHEAR EAST.  LLVL MSTR WONT BE AS QUICK TO 
SCOUR HWVR...AS INVERTED TROF IS PROGGED TO MV VERY SLOWLY EAST.  
BASED ON WATER VAPOR/GOES SOUNDER PW IMAGERY...AND LOOKING AT PCPN 
EFFICIENCY FROM THE 12Z ETA...PLAN ON REMOVING POPS BASICALLY WEST 
OF AN AOH-CVG LINE.  WL KEEP POPS ELSW...HIGHEST IN THE EAST... 
CUTTING BACK ALL AREAS INTO THE CHC RANGE.  PREV TEMP FCSTS LK GREAT.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 120722
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 AM EDT SUN AUG 12 2001

LOOKS LIKE A CHANGE IN THE FCST THINKING...AS SFC MAP SHOWING A WEAK 
LOW OVR NRN IN...AND ANOTHER NR EVV. ORIGINAL THINKING WAS THAT 
DRIER DWPTS WOULD PUSH IN BY THIS AFTN...DRYING OUT AND STABLIZING 
THE FA. PROGRESSION OF THIS WAVE A LOT SLOWER THAN ANTICIPATED. 
LOOKS LIKE WHILE THERE WILL BE SOME DRYING STARTING BY AROUND 18Z 
MAINLY IN THE FAR W...THERE WL ALSO BE AN AREA OF 1400+ CAPES AND 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE LI/S IN SC OH AND NERN KY BY 00Z. 

AM GOING TO HOLD OFF FOR NOW ON FFA FOR SERN FA...AS IT LOOKS LIKE 
BEST INSTABY AND PRECIP EFFICIENCY (HIER PWS) SLOWLY SHIFT ESE 
THROUGH THE DAY. WTH THE FLOODING THAT OCCURRED OVR NERN KY AND SC 
OH SAT NT...PW/S WERE OVR 2 INCHES AS ASSOC WTH VORT MAX THAT SLID 
THROUGH AREA. PW/S NEVER GET THAT HIGH OVR FA AGAIN.

SEEMS MOST FAVORABLE AREA FOR FLD CONCERN WL BE THIS AFTN AND EVE 
OVR MAINLY JKL AND RLX AREAS. STILL A BIT CONCERNED THAT ANYTHING 
THAT DOES DEVELOP MAY STILL HAVE POTL FOR HEAVY RAFL...SO WL MTN 
SUCH WORDING IN SE ZONE GROUP. WHILE I DONT BELIEVE FFA IS NECESSARY 
NOW...POTL WL INCRS FOR MID AFTN AND NR 00Z SUN. DAY SHIFT WL BETTER 
BE ABLE TO MAKE THIS CALL.

WL ONLY PUT TIMING MTN FOR POPS IN THE LIMA GROUP...WTH ALL DAY MTN 
IN OTHER ZONES. WL GO LIKELY FOR CMH AND PMH GROUPS...AND AN EVENING 
MTN FOR SAME.

.ILN...NONE.

JDR

107 
FXUS61 KILN 111839
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EDT SAT AUG 11 2001

SFC WAVE HAS MOVED INTO SE INDIANA LATE THIS AFTN...WITH FRONTAL 
BNDRY NOW APPARENTLY NORTH OF CVG.  L-M 70S DWPTS WERE POOLING ALONG 
AND SOUTH OF THE BNDRY...LIKELY SETTING THE STAGE FOR SOME EFFICIENT 
RAINERS OVER FAR SOUTHERN (NORTHERN KY) PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA.  
DECENT LLVL CONVERGENCE PROGGED ACRS THE ENTIRE AREA OVERNIGHT AS 
WAVE MOVES ACRS...AND PLAN ON CARRYING POPS ALL ZONES.  WL HIT POPS 
HARDEST OVER THE SOUTH WHERE PCPN EFFICIENCY THE GREATEST...AND DUE 
TO SLOW MOVEMENT WL MENTION +RA.  BASICALLY PLANNING A 20% NORTH TO 
60% FAR SOUTH BREAKDOWN.  FWC TEMPS HV GOTTEN A LOT BETTER...BUT 
STILL WL LIKELY RAISE A DEG OR SO.

GUID IN PRETTY GD AGREEMENT THAT SFC WAVE/UPPER FORCING WL SHIFT 
EAST OF THE CWFA BY LATE AFTN SUN...FOLLOWED BY A DEEP DRYING OF THE 
ATMOS.  WL CARRY MORNING CHC POPS SOUTHWEST...AND THRU ERLY AFTN IN 
THE EAST...AND ADVERTISE SOME MANNER OF CLEARING ALL ZONES.  WITH 
FAIRLY WIDESPRD CLDS ERLY...AND CAA KICKING IN LATE...HV UNDERCUT 
THE FWC TEMPS A DEG OR 2.

FLOW CONTS TO AMPLIFY THRU THE SHORT RANGE...WITH THE NEW GUID INDC 
A WEAK BNDRY WL MV ACRS THE RGN ON MONDAY.  MSTR LKS SPARSE 
HWVR...AND DO NOT PLAN ON INTRODUCING POPS.   

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

132 
FXUS61 KILN 111419
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1020 AM EDT SAT AUG 11 2001

12Z SFC-850 MB ANALYSIS DEPICTS BNDRY ALONG-SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.
FAIRLY VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE MOVG ACRS THE UPPER MIDWEST WL HELP 
ENHANCE LLVL WAVE DLPMNT THIS AFTN AND TNGT.  ACTUALLY...WEAK WAVE 
ALREADY LOOKS TO BE FORMING OVER SOUTHERN INDIANA...WHICH SHUD HELP 
KEEP THE BNDRY QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE CWFA 
TDY.  GOOD PCPN EFFICIENCY PROGGED TO HOLD ON ACRS THE SOUTH...AND 
WITH A LLVL FOCUSING MECHANISM IN PLACE XPCT WDLY SCT SHRA/TSRA TO 
FORM LATER THIS AFTN.  WL ADD 30 POPS FROM SOUTH OF CVG TO 
PORTSMOUTH...AND MENTION WDLY SCT ACTIVITY ACRS SW OHIO.  PREV TEMP 
BREAKDOWN LOOKS GOOD.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

036 
FXUS61 KILN 110728
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT SAT AUG 11 2001

WSHFT JST S OF THE OH RVR...WTH DWPT BNDRY STILL TAKING ITS TIME 
HEADING S THROUGH FA...WTH DWPTS INDICATING TRUE FNT NOW INTO NRN 
FA. AVN SLIGHTLY SLOWER THAN ETA WTH PROGRESSION OF SFC FNT  
TDY...HANGING IT UP A BIT NR THE OH RVR BEFORE DVLPNG A WK WAVE THAT 
RUNS THRU FA TNT. PSBL ISOLD SHRA IN FAR SRN FA NR THE FNTL 
BNDRY...BUT WL KEEP MTN OUT AS THIS IS BEST FOR ERLY AFTN UPDATE IF 
NECESSARY. 

AS WAVE RUNS ALNG NRLY STALLED FNT TNGT...WL BRING IN CHC FOR ALL 
BUT LIMA ZONE. PSBLY SOME LINGERING CHC IN FAR S EARLY SUN...BUT 
OTHERWISE A DRY DAY BEFORE MON BRINGS RELATIVELY WK FNT THRU.

WHILE NOT TOO MUCH DIFFERENCE...AM LEANING A LTL MORE AVN AND ASSOC 
MAV TMPS.

.ILN...NONE.

JDR

FXUS61 KILN 110102
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
900 PM EDT FRI AUG 10 2001

CONVECTIVE BNDRY JUST ABT SOUTH OF OUR AREA WITH SOME LINGERING PCPN 
ACRS SERN NRN KY CNTYS. MEANWHILE...BETTER WINDSHIFT LINE FM ABT 
BAK THRU DAY TO ARND CMH WHILE TRUE CDFNT STILL LOOKS TO BE UP ACRS 
NRN IND AND NRN OH WHR DWPTS HAV DROPPED INTO THE LWR 60S. 18Z 
MESOETA IN NO HURRY TO PUSH FNT S AND BASED ON TRENDS THIS SEEMS 
RSNBL. RADAR SHWG A FEW LGT SHWRS ALG CONVERGENT BNDRY ASCTD WITH 
WIND SHIFT LINE AND WITH THIS FEATURE PUSHG S...WL HANG ON TO A SLGT 
CHC OF PCPN ACRS SRN ZONES FOR THE OVRNGT HRS. AS FOR TMPS...DWPTS 
STILL IN THE LWR TO MID 70S ACRS SRN FA AND WITH NO REAL GOOD PUSH 
OF DRY AIR XPCTD...OVRNGT LOWS MAY ONLY MAKE IT DOWN INTO THE LOW 
70S IN THE S. CRNT FCST HAS PRETTY GOOD HANDLE ON THIS THO SO WL 
STICK WITH CRNT TMP FCST.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT


FXUS61 KILN 101808
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
200 PM EDT FRI AUG 10 2001

CONFIDENCE IN FCST WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE/BOUNDARY SETUP IS LOW. 
MODELS ALL IN SOME KIND OF AGREEMENT, BUT CONVERGENCE FIELDS AND 
BALOONING SMALL SCALE PRECIP NOTED IN ETA MODEL TONIGHT AND TOMORROW 
NIGHT IS GOING TO BE A NIGHTMARE. 

WITH PRE-FRONTAL WINDSHIFT GETTING THROUGH FCST AREA TONIGHT, MODELS 
KIND OF GO SEPARATE WAYS WITH PLACEMENT OF THE ACTUAL SFC FRONT AND 
ACCOMPANYING PRECIP. ETA HANGS NORTH THE MOST...WHILE AVN/NGM 
CONTINUE A STRONG SOUTHEAST PROGRESSION. PROBLEMS WITH 1ST PERIOD OF 
FCST WILL BE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS TONIGHT...PARTICULARLY AS NOTED IN 
ETA MODEL. RIGHT NOW 30 AND 40 POPS ARE RUNNING, AND IM INCLINED TO 
DROP THEM TO WIDELY SCATTERED 20 PERCENT COVERAGE WHICH COMES IN 
LINE WITH THE MESOETA FIELDS. WILL TREND WITH MESOETA PRECIP FIELDS 
TO KEY ON PLACEMENT OF POPS.

FOR SATURDAY...SFC FRONT NOTED WELL SOUTH OF OH RIVER ON NGM/AVN 
WHILE ETA HOLDS A BROAD AREA OF LOWER PRESSURE IN S 1/2 OF CWA. MOST 
OF THE MODELS ARE POINTING AT A CHANCE FOR RAIN DURING THE NIGHT... 
SO THIS WOULD TREND ME TO THE ETAS SURFACE FEATURES AND WEAK LOW 
DEVELOPING OVER CWA AS IT RIDES NE THROUGH THE BOUNDARY. WILL WORD 
AS SCATTERED RIGHT NOW.

DRIER AIR WILL HAVE A HARDER TIME GETTING TO SRN CWA OVERNIGHT AND 
EXPECT A STRONG DIFFERENCE IN FCST TEMPERATURES FROM NW-SE. EXPECT 
DRIEST AIR NW OF DAYTON AND WARMER PM TEMPERATURES FOR SE 2/3 OF 
FCST AREA NEXT FEW DAYS. THIS IS NOT TOO FAR FROM MAV AND FWC 
GUIDANCE...AND EVEN THESE ONLY DIFFER BY ABOUT 2 DEGREES FOR ANY 
PERIOD. WILL STAY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON TEMPS.

THANKS TO CLE FOR COORDINATION.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS






AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1020 AM EDT FRI AUG 10 2001

MORNING UPDATE MAINLY TO REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. EXPECT DEVELOPMENT TO CONTINUE NW OF FCST AREA ALONG 
PRE-FRONTAL BOUNDARY CURRENTLY HEADING TOWARDS LIMA AREA. THE FEW 
BREAKS IN THE LOW OVERCAST OVER SE 1/3 OF OH SHOULD CONTINUE TO 
INCREASE...BUT THIS WILL ALLOW SFC MOISTURE TO DEVELOP INTO 
AFTERNOON CONVECTION WITH A LITTLE EXTRA HEATING.

WILL RAISE POPS TO THE 50 PERCENT MARK IN NORTHWEST AND HAVE IT 
UNIFORM ACROSS ENTIRE FCST AREA. MIDDLE 80S IN CENTRAL OH TOO COOL 
AS ITS ALREADY 80-81 OVER MUCH OF FRANKLIN COUNTY. WILL BUMP TEMPS 
HERE TO UPPER 80S. 

.ILN...NONE.

513 
FXUS61 KILN 100615
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 AM EDT FRI AUG 10 2001

CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THE FCST FOR TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

AT 03Z...A COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM NRN LOWER MI SOUTHWEST INTO 
NRN IL...THEN EXTENDING INTO NRN MISSOURI.  THIS FRONT IS FCST TO 
SLOWLY SAG INTO THE REGION TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT.

KILN RADAR SHOWED CONVECTION OCCURRING ACRS THE CWFA WITH THE 
GREATEST CONCENTRATION OVER THE SE CWFA.  THIS CONVECTION WAS IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH A WEAK VORT MAX FROM THE REMNANTS OF BARRY.  THIS 
S/WV IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SLOWLY EAST TODAY INTO WEST VA...SHEARING 
AS IT DOES.  MEANWHILE...THERE IS A MAJOR DIFFERENCE IN THE MODELS 
AS TO HOW FAST THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
REGION.  THE ETA MODEL HAS BEEN CONSISTENT IN ITS OWN TRENDS...BEING 
MUCH SLOWER THAN THE AVN/NGM.  WITH MID LVL FLOW EXPECTED TO BECOME 
WEAKER TODAY AND ZONAL...I HAVE A HARD TIME BELIEVING THAT THIS 
FRONT IS GOING TO BE SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER BY 18Z.  WITH THAT 
SAID...I AM SIDING WITH THE SLOWER ETA SOLUTION...WHICH SLOWLY SAGS 
THE FRONT TOWARD THE OHIO RIVER TONIGHT.  THE ETA DEVELOPS A WEAK 
SFC LOW ON THE FRONT INTO WEST CENTRAL OHIO DURING THE AFTN.  SINCE 
THIS IS THE FIRST RUN THAT HAS SHOWN THIS...WILL NOT BITE ON THIS 
FEATURE YET.  REGARDLESS...IF ENOUGH INSOLATION IS MET TODAY...2000 
TO 3000 J/KG OF CAPE COMBINED WITH LOW LVL CONVERGENCE AT THE SFC 
AND 925 MB SHOULD DEVELOP AREAS OF CONVECTION ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE 
FRONT.  PRECIPITATBLE WATER VALUES WILL REMAIN HIGH TODAY BETWEEN 
1.50 AND 2.00...PARTICULARLY IN THE SOUTH.  WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY 
FLASH FLOOD WATCH...ALTHOUGH LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE.  

FOR TONIGHT...WILL KEEP AN EVENING CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS 
EVERYWHERE.

ON SATURDAY...OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY SEEMS TO LAY OUT NEAR THE OHIO 
RIVER.  MAY THROW A 30 PERCENT CHANCE OF AN AFTERNOON SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE SOUTH AS INSTABILITY IS STILL PROGGED THERE 
(BASED ON THE ETA MODEL).

WITH SLOWER FRONTAL MOVEMENT...TEMPERATURES WILL BE AFFECTED...AND 
PLAN ON GOING WARMER WITH HIGHS AND LOWS THAN MOS GUIDANCE.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN










FXUS61 KILN 100133
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
932 PM EDT THU AUG 9 2001

01Z SFC PLOT INDICATED A CDFNT EXTENDING FM MI ACROSS SRN WI INTO 
NRN MO.  SCT SHRA/TSRA ASSOICATED WITH S/WV ACROSS THE OH VLY HAD 
MOVD E OF FA WHILE A SECOND AREA ALONG THE FRONT WAS MOVG SEWD.

ACTIVITY THIS EVENING HAS SERVED TO STABLIZE THE ATMOSPHERE ACROSS 
FA.  THUS...WOULD XPCT ACTIVITY ALONG THE FRONT TO WEAKEN AS IT 
MOVES INTO FA. PLAN ON CUTTING POPS BACK A LITTLE AND MENTIONING 
LATE IN SRN GROUPS.  WL ALSO INCREASE WINDS A LITTLE BASED ON 
CURRENT OBS. 

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

226 
FXUS61 KILN 091802
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
202 PM EDT THU AUG 9 2001

SCATTERED AIRMASS CONVECTION AHEAD OF S/W EXPECTED TO CONTINUE INTO  
THE EVENING. A RELATIVE LULL EXPECTED DURING A PERIOD OVERNIGHT AS 
THERMAL RIDGE AND MIN IN LLVL RH PROVIDES A BREAK IN MOISTURE 
AVAILABILITY AND THERMODYNAMIC SUPPORT. HOWEVER...SECOND S/W 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT SHOULD PROVIDE STRONG LIFT AND A GOOD 
CHANCE OF RAIN LATER OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY TO THE NORTHWEST. 

POPS TONIGHT WILL MENTION EVENING WORDING OR THROUGH MIDNIGHT IN 
EAST/SOUTHEAST AND TRY TO MENTION A BREAK IN THE NORTHWEST BUT WILL 
GO WITH LIKELY WORDING HERE. WOULD LIKE TO GO WITH THE MENTION OF 
HEAVY RAIN POSSIBILITY TONIGHT...BUT THINK THAT CONVECTION MAY BE 
SCATTERED ENOUGH AND MOVE JUST QUICK ENOUGH THAT THIS WOULDNT BE 
ENTIRELY REASONABLE.

WILL TRY AND GET A LITTLE FANCY WITH GFE AND TIMING OF FRONTAL 
PASSAGE TOMORROW. THIS WILL LIKELY CREATE A GOOFY ZONE BREAKDOWN 
FROM NW-SE AND AM CONCERNED ABOUT TEMPERATURE SCHEME FOR HIGHS 
DURING THE DAY. STRONG CAA BEHIND FRONT TODAY WILL LIKELY KEEP 
READINGS STEADY TO THE NORTHWEST IN THE UPPER 70S BEHIND FRONT. 
HOWEVER...BEST CAA IS NOTED TODAY AND NOT TOMORROW. COLD POOL STAYS 
NORTH OF FCST AREA AND SUSPECT THAT SOUTHEAST COULD BE SNEAKY WARM 
AROUND 90...BUT WOULD NEED A GOOD 2-3 HOURS OF SUNSHINE THAT DOES 
NOT SEEM TO BE REALIZED BY MODELS HERE. WILL MOS OUT IN SOUTHEAST 
AND TRY TO UNDERCUT IT FROM THE NORTHWEST AS TEMPS STAY NEARLY 
STEADY BEHIND FRONT. 

ON SATURDAY...EXPECT MORE OF THE SAME WITH TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM 
THE LOW 80S TO THE NORTH WITH SCATTERED PM CU...MIDDLE 80S IN THE 
SOUTH...DEPENDING STRONGLY ON CLOUD COVER. WILL PROBABLY GO THE 
MIDDLE GROUND IN ALL AREAS AND JUST OPEN UP AN 80-85 RANGE AS MORE 
CLOUD COVER EXPECTED IN THE SOUTH.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

FXUS61 KILN 091358
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 AM EDT THU AUG 9 2001

CURRENT AREA OF THUNDERSTORMS TO SW OF FCST AREA ARE RIGHT UNDER 
RELATIVE MIN/ABSENCE OF SBCAPE. AM A LITTLE CONCERNED ABOUT DROP IN 
PRECIP EFFICIENCIES NOTED ON ETA BETWEEN 18 AND 00Z AFTER THE 
INCREASE FROM 12 TO 18Z. 

STRENGTHENING S/W IN KY TO STRETCH INTO FCST AREA AS IT GETS 
ORIENTED SW-NE LATER TODAY. PRECIP SHOULD BE CONCENTRTATED ALONG AND 
JUST E OF SLOW MOVING S/W AS H5 TROF CONTINUES TO DEEPEN.

EXPECT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION TO BE LIMITED TO WRN 1/2 OF FCST AREA 
THROUGH 00Z TONIGHT...AND WILL MAKE A MORNING UPDATE TO REFLECT 
THIS. WILL CUT SRN GROUP IN 1/2 AND DROP POPS IN EAST TO 30 OR 
POSSIBLY WIDELY SCATTERED 20 POP WITH LATE WORDING. THIS SHOULD ALSO 
WORK FOR CMH ZONES AS WELL. THE 40 PERCENT RUNNING IN THE NW COULD 
BE BUMPED TO A 50...BUT THE ONLY REAL CHANGE TO FCST WILL BE TO 
REDUCE POPS IN EAST AS MOVEMENT OF SHOWERS IS VERY SLOW WITH 
1000-500 MEAN FLOW AROUND 15 KT.

MAY ALSO BUMP TEMPS IN SE TO AROUND 90 AND CMH GROUPING TO THE LOW 
90S AS MAX HEATING WOULD BRING A 94 WITH FULL SUN TO ILN. EXPECT 
EASTERN FCST AREA TO SEE CLOSE TO FULL SUN...AT LEAST THROUGH 3 OR 4 
PM AROUND NORMAL OCCURRANCE OF HIGH TEMP.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

FXUS61 KILN 090749
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EDT THU AUG 9 2001

MDLS CONT TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT ESP ETA/AVN. HTEY BRING THE FRONT 
CURRENTLY OVER THE UPR MIDWEST THRU AREA FRIDAY. BUT AS FRONT 
APPROACHES TDY...IT PULLS IN SOME OF THE MSTR ASSOC WITH BARRY INTO 
THE SOUTHWEST. THIS ADDITIONAL MSTR WITH THE LLVL INSTABILITY 
ALREADY IN PLACE SHOULD HELP TSRA DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. WILL GO 
WITH HIGHEST POPS IN SW AND TAPER TO NE. CHC CONTINUES THROUGH 
FRIDAY. BEST UPR SUPPORT STAYS WELL NORTH OF AREA SO THINK CHC FOR 
SVR IS LIMITED. AM MORE CONCERNED WITH FLOOD POTENTIAL AS PWS ARE 
NEAR 2. BUT SYS LOOKS TO BE PROGRESSIVE ENOUGH THAT IT TOO SHOULD 
BE ISOLATED.

GUID TEMPS LOOK MORE REASONABLE NOW THAT PATTERN IS CHANGING SO WILL 
STICK CLOSE.   

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EDT WED AUG 8 2001

SUBSIDENCE AND A NICE CAP HAS HELD CONVECTION AT BAY THIS AFTN.  
STILL CUD SEE AN ISOLATED SHRA/TSRA...ESPLY ALONG WEAK THERMAL MSTR 
BNDRY FROM AOH-NORTH OF CMH.  WL CARRY LEFTOVER PD FAR NORTH...OTHW 
NO POPS IN THE FIRST PD.  GUID TEMPS IN GOOD AGREEMENT TNGT...ALTHOUGH 
MAV WARMER IN THE NORTH.  BASED ON CMHS 75 LAST NIGHT...WL MAKE 
SOME MINOR UPWARD ADJUSMENTS TO THE FWC IN THE NORTH.

SOME QSTN AS TO THE EVNTL TRACK OF THE REMNANTS OF BARRY.  A LOOK 
AT THE LOW-MID LVL VORTICITY FIELDS FROM THE MODELS SHOWS IMPORTANT 
DIFFERENCES ALREADY AT 18Z...WITH SAT TRENDS SUGGESTING NONE HV A 
VERY GOOD HANDLE.  NGM WANTS TO EJECT SYS OUT THE QUICKEST... 
BRINGING IT ACRS OHIO TMRW.  THE ETA/AVN ARE MUCH SLOWER... 
SUGGESTING A GRADUAL DRIFT ACRS KY THRU THU NGT.  OUR FCST WL LEAN TWRD 
THE FURTHER SOUTH SOLN...BUT BASED ON WHAT APPEARS TO BE SOME STEADY 
NE MOVEMENT ON THE SAT IMAGERY WL TREND SLIGHTLY FASTER AND FURTHER 
NORTH THAN THE ETA/AVN.  WITH THIS IN MIND WL HIT POPS HARDEST (50) 
FAR SOUTH THURS...TRENDING TO LOW CHC IN THE NORTH.  WL KEEP POPS IN 
THE CHC RANGE ALL ZONES THU NIGHT.  PCPN EFFICIENCY PROGGED FAIRLY 
HIGH THU AFTN/EVE AS YOU WUD XPCT WITH A TROPICAL SYS...SO LOCALLY 
+RA PSBL.  COMBINATION OF CLDS AND SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS ADVECTING 
IN FROM THE SOUTH WL KEEP HIGHS A CAT OR SO COOLER THAN TDY...AND HV 
TRENDED TWRD THE SLIGHTLY COOLER MAV.  GUID TEMPS LK GD THU NGT.

FROPA FRIDAY WL USHER IN A REFRESHING AIRMASS FOR THE WEEKEND.  WL 
LIKELY SEE 2 RNDS OF CONVECTIVE POTNL FRI...ONE ERLY IN THE DAY JUST 
ABOUT ANYWHERE ASSOCIATED WITH OUTLFOW FROM ORGANIZED CONVECTION 
ANTICIPATED UPSTREAM.  SECOND WL BE WITH ACTUAL FRONT...WHICH GUID 
SUGGESTS WL BE MOVG ACRS THE SOUTHERN 1/2 OF THE CWFA IN THE AFTN.
 
.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 AM EDT WED AUG 8 2001

ETA/AVN CONT TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH APPROACHING FRONT FROM THE 
LAKES AND MOISTURE FROM BARRY REMNANTS PROGGED TO AFFECT AREA 
THU/FRI. DWPTS CONTINUE TO BE IN THE 70 TO 75 RANGE AND TEMPS IN THE 
LOWER 90S...SO LLVL INSTABILITY WILL BE IN PLACE. THE CONVERGENT 
BOUNDARY FROM LAST 2 DAYS IS ALSO HANGING AROUND...BUT DEVELOPMENT 
WILL AGAIN BE VERY LIMITED WITH LACK OF DEEPER MSTR. WILL KEEP TODAY 
DRY AS EXPECT ONLY ABOUT 10 PERCENT COVERAGE. WILL ALSO AGAIN GO AT 
OR BELOW GUID TEMPS TODAY AS THEY HAVE BEEN RUNNING A LITTLE WARM. 
WILL GO 90 TO 95 EVERYWHERE AS SOME CU SHOULD KEEP TEMPS FROM 
GETTING TOO HIGH THIS AFTN. 

WILL INTRODUCE CHC THU AFTN FOR THE SOUTH AS MSTR FROM BARRY 
REMNANTS GET PULLED NE AS RIDGE IS BROKEN DOWN. TEMPS WILL BE COOLER 
AS CLDS ARE ON THE INCREASE AND LLVL TEMPS DROP A DEG OR TWO. 

ETA/AVN BOTH INDICATE A PROGRESSIVE FRONT SO IT SHOULD CLEAR THE 
AREA FRI. HOPEFULLY THIS WILL PAN OUT BECAUSE WITH PWS APPROACHING 
2 HEAVY RAIN WILL BE A CONCERN.       
 
.ILN...NONE.

90...IN LINE WITH CURRENT FCST. 

NO UPDATE PLANNED.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH FLATTENING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER 
CENTRAL U.S. AND BUILDING IT IN OVER REGION.  THIS RELATES TO DRY 
FORECAST WITH TEMPERATURES SLOWLY WARMING EACH DAY.  

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD.  WILL BUMB UP A DEGREE OR TWO TODAY ACROSS THE 
NORTH AS MORE SUN AND DRIER ATMOSPHERE WILL ALLOW FOR TEMPS TO WARM 
UP A BIT MORE THAN ACROSS THE SOUTH.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 040146
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 PM EDT FRI AUG 3 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A WEAK COLD FRONT FRONT NEAR ZZV TO CVG TO 
EVV THEN TO STL.  THIS FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH SLOWLY SOUTH OF 
THE OHIO RIVER OVERNIGHT...THEN IT WILL GRADUALLY LOSE ITS FRONTAL 
IDENTITY (IN TERMS OF WIND SHIFT) ON SATURDAY.

KILN RADAR SHOWS CONVECTION SLOWLY DISSIPATING...AND THIS TREND IS 
EXPECTED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EVENING.  I AM HOPING THE 
CONVECTION WILL BE DONE BY THE 1030 PM ISSUANCE.  OTHERWISE 
...CLEARING SKIES AND FOG CAN BE EXPECTED OVERNIGHT.  HOW DENSE THE 
FOG GETS WILL DEPEND ON THE SPEED OF THE NORTHERLY WIND FLOW.  WILL 
WORD AREAS OF FOG IN THE ZONES...ESPECIALLY SOUTHERN HALF WHERE THE 
DEWPOINTS WILL REMAIN THE HIGHEST.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 030113
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
910 PM EDT THU AUG 2 2001

SFC WX MAP DEPICTED A WEAK COLD FRONT ACRS THE SRN GREAT LAKES INTO 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS.  THIS FRONT WILL MOVE VERY SLOWLY SOUTH AND 
EAST THROUGH THE CWFA ON FRIDAY.

MEANWHILE...SFC RUC AT 00Z INDICATED WEAK CONVERGENCE ALONG A LINE 
FROM NE OH...THEN EXTENDING SW INTO SW OHIO.  THIS CONVERGENCE AREA 
SEEMS TO BE THE REMNANTS OF AN OLD OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM A MCS OVER 
IL/IN EARLIER IN THE DAY.  KILN RADAR SHOWED CONVECTION ALONG THIS 
BOUNDARY.  KILN SOUNDING AT 23Z DEPICTED A WEAK CIN IN THE LOW LVLS 
ACRS ILN.  THIS IS PROBABLY THE REASON WHY NOT MUCH CONVECTION HAS 
OCCURRED ACRS THE SRN CWFA THIS EVENING (MOST OF THE AVAILABLE LOW 
LVL FORCING HAS BEEN ACRS THE NORTH).

18Z MESO ETA CONTINUES TO FOCUS WEAK AREAS OF FORCING AT 925 MB 
OVERNIGHT...MAINILY TOWARD NE OHIO.  DESPITE A WEAK S/WV ALOFT NOW 
MOVING INTO OUR CWFA...THE LACK OF SIGNIFICANT FORCING FROM A 
NOTICEABLE LOW LVL JET SHOULD ONLY PRODUCE SCATTERED ACTIVITY.  AS A 
RESULT...WILL CUT POPS BACK TO 40 PERCENT ALL AREAS...EXCEPT THE SE 
GROUP (PMH) WHERE 30 PERCENT WILL BE PLACED.  OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 
LOWER 70S LOOKS GOOD AT THIS TIME.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN







THEN FOR CVG-PMH IN THE PM HOURS.  MODELS PROG CAPES TO RISE TO 
AROUND 3000 J/KG ON FRI PM.  THIS SUGGESTS THAT A CHANCE OF 
SHRA/TSRA WL LINGER INTO THE PM HOURS FOR ALL GROUPS.

WK FRONT WL DROP TO THE S OF FA ON FRI NIGHT AND SAT.  PLAN ON 
LEAVING THOSE PERIODS DRY.

FXUS61 KILN 020724
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 AM EDT THU AUG 2 2001

WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO FCST. CURRENT TRENDS SHOULD ONLY 
BE ADJUSTED FOR SLOWER SOLUTION OF FRONT. EXPECT A CHANCE OF PRECIP 
TO LINGER OVER THE FAR SOUTH FRI PM INTO EARLY SAT WITH REMNANTS OF 
WASHED OUT FRONT LINGERING/DYING OUT JUST SOUTH OF OH RIVER. 

EVEN WITH A SLOWER SOLUTION...EXPECT A SLIGHTLY INCREASED  CHANCE OF 
PRECIPITATION LATE THIS AFTERNOON OVER SE FCST AREA. BEST 
INSTABILITY AND ENERGY FOCUSED IN NW OH...BUT SLIGHT RISE IN PRECIP 
EFFICIENCIES NOTED NW OF HTS ON AVN AND ETA AT 18Z TODAY. CURRENTLY 
RUNNING WITH 30 POPS FOR MOST AREAS...AND EXPECT TO KEEP LATE TIMING 
IN AS WELL. DONT REALLY THINK THAT CHANCES TODAY ARE THAT 
GREAT...BUT AVN AND NGM HINTING AT A PRE-FRONTAL CONVERGENT 
BOUNDARY/PRESSURE TROF THAT COULD AIDE DEVELOPMENT OF STORMS. 

FCST REALLY ISNT CHANGING HERE...BUT THE 20 PERCENT IN FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON SHOULD BE RESOLVED WITH ISOLATED AND LATE WORDING. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

FXUS61 KILN 020125
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
925 PM EDT WED AUG 1 2001

UPR LVL HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE FROM THE CNTRL PLAINS INTO THE SRN GREAT 
LAKES WILL BEGIN TO BREAK DOWN THROUGH FRIDAY.  THIS WILL ALLOW A 
COLD FRONT CURRENTLY FROM THE UPR MS RIVER VLY INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS 
TO SLOWLY SAG ACRS THE REGION DURING THE PERIOD.  FOR TONIGHT 
...ENHANCED HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS MOVING INTO NRN OHIO 
SHOULD MOVE SOUTH INTO THE NRN CWFA.  WILL GO PARTLY CLOUDY THERE 
TONIGHT.  FOR THE SOUTH...WL LEAVE MOSTLY CLEAR...NOT KNOWING HOW 
MUCH THINNING OF THE CIRRUS WILL TAKE PLACE.  LOW TEMPS AROUND 70 
DEGREES LOOK GOOD.


.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 011849
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EDT WED AUG 1 2001

SCT CU ACRS MUCH OF FA THIS AFTN SHUD DSIPT FAIRLY QUICKLY BY ERLY 
EVNG LEAVING MAINLY THIN CI ACRS FA OVRNGT. WITH AMS SIMILAR TO PAST 
FEW NGTS...XPCT PATCHY FOG DVLPMT AGN TNGT...ESPCLY IN SRN/ERN RVR 
VLYS. 

MDLS IN DECENT AGRMT WITH DROPPING FNT DOWN TWD FA A LTL QUICKER 
THRU THE DAY THUR AND INTO THUR NGT. NOT A WHOLE LOT IN THE WAY OF 
UPR LVL DYNAMICS BUT WK CONV BNDNY OUT AHD OF FNT COUPLED WITH CAPES 
ARND 2000 J/KG AND LI/S ARND -4 SHUD BE ENUF TO GET SOME STORMS 
GOING ACRS THE NW THRU THE AFTN. WL THEREFORE PUT A CHC OF TSTMS 
BACK INTO THE NW FOR THUR AFTN.  ETA/AVN BOTH DROPPING SOME S/W 
ENERGY DOWN INTO IND THRU 00Z FRI WHICH MAY BE ENUF TO GET SOMETHING 
INTO WRN AREAS OF CVG AREA LATE IN THE DAY AND WITH FNT DPG DOWN FM 
THE NW...CUD ALSO SEE SOMETHING INTO CMH AREA TWD 00Z. WL THEREFORE 
CARRY LOW CHC POPS FOR CVG AND CMH AREAS LATE IN THE DAY THO BEST 
CHC WL BE THUR NGT AS FNT PUSHES THRU. 

FNT SAGS SLOWLY S ACRS AREA THRU THUR NGT WITH CHC POPS ACRS ENTIRE 
FA. MDLS HAVING A TUF TIME FIGURING OUT WHAT TO DO WITH CUT OFF LOW 
RETROGRADING ACRS SE US THRU LATER PDS. DEPENDING ON HOW THIS PLAYS 
OUT...FNT CUD STALL OUT ACRS SRN PORTIONS OF FA FRI INTO SAT. FOR 
NOW...WL TAPER FM NO PCPN NW TO 40 OR 50 POP SE ON FRI AND THEN KP 
THINGS DRY SE FOR FRI NGT.

XPCT A LTL THICKER CI ACRS AREA ON THUR WHICH MAY LIMIT TMPS A TAD. 
WL THEREFORE LEAN TWD SLGTLY COOLER MAV TMPS FOR HIGHS ON THUR. 
OTRWS...MAV/FWC IN GOOD AGRMNT.

.ILN...NONE.

320 PM EDT TUE JUL 31 2001

NEED A MECHANISM UNDER RIDGE TO SPARK ANY SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS AS 
CAP IN LOW LEVELS IS IN PLACE. YESTERDAY SAW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS 
IN SE CWA ASSOCIATED WITH MAXIMUM OF PRECIP EFFICIENCIES AND HIGHEST 
PRECIPITABLE WATER. THIS DOESNT SUPPORT ANYTHING UNTIL FRONT ENTERS 
THE PICTURE OVERNIGHT THURSDAY.

CURRENT FCST ON THURSDAY HAS LOW CHANCE POPS IN WITH AFTERNOON 
WORDING FOR NW 2/3 OF FCST AREA AND WOULD LIKE TO BUMP THIS DOWN AND 
REMOVE FROM ALL BUT NORTHWEST GROUPING. TIMING OF S/W AND WEAK FRONT 
KEEPS GETTING SLOWER AND SLIGHTLY WEAKER WITH NEW RUNS.

WILL ADD CHANCE POPS TO SRN FCST AREA ON SATURDAY AS REMNANT OF SFC 
FRONT BECOMES MORE OF AN INVERTED SFC RIDGE/CONVERGENT BOUNDARY WITH 
RETROGRADING LO PRESSURE COMING OFF OF THE ATLANTIC TO THE 
CAROLINAS. 

WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR CHANGES TO FORECAST IN SHORT TERM AS TEMPS 
SHOULD BE ON THE MONEY. NOT MUCH TO SAY FOR A WIND FORECAST...AND 
CANT ARGUE WITH MOSTLY CLEAR/SUNNY SKIES.

.ILN...NONE.

THAT A POPCORN SHOWER CANT BE RULED OUT THIS PM...ESP WITH TEMPS 
RISING TO THE 90S. 

EXPECT A GRADUAL INCREASE IN TEMPS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK 
WITH THE NEXT S/W MOVING THROUGH ON THURSDAY. IF CONFIDENCE WERE 
HIGHER...ID TIME THE PRECIP WITH MAINLY LATE WORDING ON 
THURSDAY...BUT WONT SPLIT HAIRS AS MODELS ARENT IN TOTAL AGREEMENT 
FOR LATER PERIODS. 

PREVIOUS FORECAST IS ENTIRELY REASONABLE AND I DONT THINK THAT 
THERES TOO MUCH TO IMPROVE ON WITH LITTLE TO NO CLOUD COVER...LIGHT 
WINDS...AND HIGHS IN THE 90S.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1016 AM EDT SUN JUL 29 2001

MAIN S/WV EVIDENT ON WV IMGRY OVR SE IN WL CONT TO TRACK E ACRS
SRN OH/NRN KY INTO WV THIS AFTN. AREA OF SHWRS AND TSTMS AHD OF 
ASSOCIATED SFC WV TO PUSH E COMING AN END THIS MRNG OVR S CNTRL 
OH/NE KY. THEREFORE WL ALLOW FLASH FLOOD WATCH TO EXPIRE AT NOON.

FOCUS SHIFTS TO CHC FOR LINGERING SHWRS AND TEMPS TDA. LTST SFC MAP
SHWS SECONDARY LO PRES OVR SE WI ASSOCIATED WITH UPSTREAM S/WV. 
RADAR MOSAIC SHWS AXIS OF SHWRS THRU N CNTRL IN AND INTO S CNTRL LWR 
MI. WK AXIS OF LO LVL CNVRGC TO PIVOT THRU W CNTRL OH ERLY THIS AFTN
AND THRU ENTIRE CWA THRU THE REMAINDER OF AFTN. FCST SOUNDINGS SHW
SOME INSTBY ERLY BUT THEN INDICATE A STRENGTHENING OF THE MID LVL 
INVRSN BY MID AFTN IN THE NW. IN THE WAKE OF THE MAIN S/WV XPCT
SOME DRYING TO OCCUR. WL CONT A CHC OF SHWRS AND PERHAPS A TSTM

AFTN.

DIMINISHED TO SCT SHOWERS.

I EXPECT TSRA NEAR THE FRONT TO PERSIST WITH CONTINUED UPPER SUPPORT 
AS MCV TO THE WEST MOVES TOWARD THE SOUTHERN PART OF OUR CWA.  
THEREFORE ILL KEEP CAT POPS SOUTH AND EAST OF CVG.  IN THE 
NORTH...ILL DROP TO SCT POPS SINCE WIDESPREAD ACTIVITY HAS 
DISAPPEARED AND IS NOT LIKELY TO REFORM WITH LACK OF UPPER SUPPORT. 

WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY IN PLACE LOW FFG VALUES AND MCV HEADED OUR 
WAY...WELL ISSUE FFW FOR COUNTIES IN THE SOUTHERN PART OF OUR 
CWA...NOT INCLUDING HAMILTON COUNTY.  WITH ONLY SCT SHRA/TSRA 
EXPECTED WE WILL DROP FFW AT COLUMBUS.

TEMP FCST LOOKS GOOD WITH LOWS AROUND 70.  OTHERWISE...ILL ONLY 
NEED TO ADJUST WINDS WRT CURRENT CONDITIONS.

.ILN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR 
INZ075-080-KYZ089>100-OHZ078-079-081-082-088. 
     
CONIGLIO









AFDILN

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EDT WED JUL 25 2001

MODELS IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAJOR FEATURES. MAIN CONCERN 
THROUGH THURSDAY WILL BE FLOODING POTENTIAL. IT APPEARS THAT LOWER 
LEVEL FORCING...COUPLED WITH MODERATE TO HIGH INSTABILITY WHERE PWT 
VALUES CLOSE TO TWO INCHES WILL HELP TO PRODUCE VERY EFFICIENT RAIN 
PRODUCING STORMS.

THE LLVL BDRY WILL SLIDE SLOWLY SSE THROUGH OUR FA TONIGHT AND 
THURSDAY. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY WILL BE ENHANCED ALONG THIS 
BDRY...WITH VERY HVY LOCALIZED RAINFALL EXPECTED. WITH THE CTRL OH 
ALREADY HAVING BEEN WORKED OVER TDY...WILL FOCUS ON THAT AREA FOR 
FFA FOR TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING.

EXPECT THIS SFC FRONTAL BDRY TO CONTINUE TO MAKE SLOW PROGRESS S OF 
OUR FA DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY. SLOW CLEARING WILL TAKE PLACE 
FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. DRY WEATHER WILL FOLLOW FOR FRIDAY.

1025 AM EDT WED JUL 25 2001

E-W FRONTAL BNDRY FM PA ACRS NRN OH...IN AND INTO NRN IL. MID LVL S/WV 
OVR MID MS VLY TO TRACK E INTO OH VLY TDA/TNGT. INTO SFC WV XPCTD
TO TRACK INTO W CNTRL OH THIS AFTN. FAVORABLE LO LVL CNVRGC TO CONT
ACRS PORTIONS OF W CNTRL AND CNTRL OH TDA CLOSE TO VCNTY OF BNDRY. 
WL CONT LKLY POPS IN THE NRN SECTIONS OF FA. FARTHER S XPCT TO SEE
SCTD TSTMS DVLP DURG THE AFTN AND THEN INCRS TNGT AS FNTL BNDRY DROPS
S INTO SRN OH. WL DROP THIS AFTN/S PRECIP POPS INTO THE CHC CAT IN THE
S TDA...CONTG LKLY POPS TNGT.

TEMP WISE...ILN ALREADY SITTING AT 84 DEGS. ENERGY BLOCK METHOD YIELDS
HI/S ARND 90 WHICH ARE BACKED UP BY LCL THICKNESS SCHEME. WL ADJUST 
NRN KY AND S CNTRL OH TO ARND 90 AND DAY AND SW OH INTO UPR 80S. 
ACRS THE NRN MIAMI VLY WHERE MORE CLDS/PRECIP AND ERLY FLO WL BE 
OBSERVED WL OPEN UP 80-85 RANGE.   

XPCT STORMS TO TRACK SLOWLY E WITH PROPAGATION TO THE S/SW.  THIS 
IMPLIES SOME BACKBUIDING POTENTIAL. WITH PW/S RUNNING ARND 1.8 
INCHES AND PE/S ARND 1.6 XPCT TO SEE HVY RAIN TDA/TNGT. HEAVIEST 
RAIN THRU AFTN APPEARS TARGETED FOR MIAMI VALLEY AND PORTIONS OF 
CNTRL OH. WL CONT ESF AND HVY RAIN MENT IN ZONES. FFA MAY BE 
REQUIRED WITH 4 PM PACKAGE.    

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 250754
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
354 AM EDT WED JUL 25 2001

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING FROM KS 
NEWD INTO NRN IL AND THEN EWD ACROSS EXTREME SRN MI.  A MID LVL S/WV 
TO THE NW HAS ACTIVATED OLD CONVERGENT BOUNDARY ACROSS FA THIS AM 
WITH WDLY SCT SHRA/TSRA.

THE S/WV OR MCV IS PROGD TO MOVE ACROSS THE OH VLY TODAY.  ETA SHOWS 
PLENTLY OF ASSOCIATED LLVL CONVERGENCE ALONG THE BOUNDARY.  XPCT 
SHRA/TSRA ACTIVITY TO DEVELOP WITH THE BEST COVERAGE ALONG AND N OF 
THE OLD CONVERGENT BOUNDARY. WL CARRY LIKELY POPS DAY-CMH-CVG AND 
CHC FOR NRN KY AND PMH.  ISOLD HEAVY RAINFALL IS POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY 
ALONG THE BOUNDARY WITH SLOW STORM MOVEMENT.

THE FRONT WL SLOWLY SLIDE SWD TONIGHT.  WITH CONTINUED LLVL 
CONVERGENCE ALONG THE BOUNDARY...XPCT MCS DEVELOPMENT ACROSS FA.  
THE ETA INDICATES PW VALUES AROUND 2 INCHES AND A WARM CLOUD DEPTH 
APPROACHING 14KFT...IE 2KFT HIGHER THAN FOR THE CINCINNATI FLOOD 
LAST WEEK. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO A VERY EFFICIENT RAIN PROCESS SO WL 
MENTION HEAVY RAINFALL FOR ALL GROUPS BUT THE NRN MIAMI VLY TONIGHT.

TIMING OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS IN QUESTION SO WL KEEP A CHC OF 
SHRA/TSRA FOR MOST OF FA ON THU.

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
318 PM EDT TUE JUL 24 2001

OVERALL PATTERN FAIRLY RELIABLE...BUT PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND 
COVERAGE WILL REMAIN THE QUESTION OF THE DAY THROUGH THURSDAY. RIGHT 
NOW...LACK OF A FOCUS IS KILLING ALL BUT A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS 
ALONG CONVERGENT BOUNDARY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. OBS OUT OF KCMH ARE 
IMPRESSIVE WITH 1.2 INCHES IN A MATTER OF MINUTES IN BRIEF BUT 
TORRENTIAL SHOWER. 

THIS GOES ALONG FAIRLY WELL WITH AXIS OF BEST PRECIPITABLE WATER AND 
PRECIP EFFICENCIES (1.2 INCHES) BISECTING FCST AREA FROM SW-NE. THIS 
AXIS SLIDES OVER SRN FCST AREA BY MORNING AND EVEN BETTER AREA 
PROGGED TO COME IN WED PM. 

WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE OF STORMS IN SOUTH TONIGHT...DRY IT OUT FOR 
TOMORROW AND THEN HIT IT AGAIN FOR WED PM EVERYWHERE. EXPECT EARLY  
CHANCE ON THURSDAY...MAINLY SOUTHEAST. REST OF FCST LOOKS COOLER AND 
DRIER AFTER TOMORROW WITH A RETURN OF GULF MOISTURE ON SOUTHERLY 
FLOW SETTING UP FOR LATE THIS WEEK. LOOKS LIKE WE MOISTEN UP BY THE 
LATTER HALF OF WEEKEND ALTHOUGH TREND IS FOR PREICP TO CONTINUE 
PUSHING BACK IN TIME. WONT GET FANCY HERE THOUGH AND KEEP POPS IN 
FROM SUNDAY ON. 

WITH TEMPERATURES NOT GETTING INTO THE 90S TOMORROW...WILL LET HEAT 
WARNING AND ADVISORIES DIE OUT AT 8 PM TONIGHT THOUGH PM ISSUANCE 
WILL STILL HAVE HEADLINE FOR REST OF THIS EVENING.  

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING THIS EVENING OHIO ZONES 077-061-055
       HEAT ADVISORY THIS EVENING REMAINDER OF FCST AREA.

FXUS61 KILN 241450
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1050 AM EDT TUE JUL 24 2001

CURRENT SAT PICS HELPING TO IDENTIFY WK LLVL BDRY DRAPED SW-NE 
ACROSS THE CTRL PORTION OF FA. THIS WILL BE THE FOCUS FOR ANY 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY TDY. ANOTHER WK BDRY FURTHER N APPEARS TO BE 
WASHING OUT AS IT MOVE SLOWLY SE. ASIDE FROM THIS BDRY...ALL FORCING 
IS WEAK. WITH HIGH INSTABILITY AND VERY LITTLE IN THE WAY OF 
STEERING CURRENTS...EXPECT ANY CONVICTION WHICH DOES DEVELOP TO BE 
WIDELY SCATTERED TO SCT AT BEST. WILL THUS ADJUST POPS DOWNWARD FOR 
TDY TO REFLECT THIS THINKING. WITH THE CONVECTIVE INSTABLITY QUITE 
PRONOUNCED...ANY STORMS ACQUIRING A VIGOROUS UPDRAFT WILL NEED TO BE 
WACHED CLOSELY FOR POSIBLE DAMAGING WINDS...ALTHOUGH HVY RAIN WILL 
BE THE MAIN THREAT TDY.

TEMPS LOOK FINE SO WILL MAKE NO ADJUSTMENT HERE. ALTHOUGH SOME 
INDICATIONS ARE FOR OPENING UP A RANGE AROUND THE CMH AREA FOR 90-95 
GIVEN SOME THICKNESS ASSESSMENTS...WILL STILL HOLD ONTO THE LOW 90S.

NO ADJUSTMENTS WITH CURRENT HEAT WARNING/ADVISORY.

UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.


.ILN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING THROUGH TUESDAY OHIO ZONES 077...061 
       AND 055.
       HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH TUESDAY REMAINDER OF FCST AREA.

05Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A HIGH MOISTURE AIR MASS ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE CNTRL PART OF THE COUNTRY.  WEAK BOUNDARIES WERE IN PLACE WITH 
THE ONLY AIR MASS CHANGE BEING IN NRN WI AND NRN MN.

MODELS INDICATE THAT MOISTURE WL POOL ACROSS FA TODAY.  WITH TEMPS 
RISING INTO THE LOWER 90S AND DEWPOINTS IN THE L-M 70S...WL CONTINUE 
HEAT HEADLINES.  MODERATE INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED BY THIS PM SO SCT 
SHRA/TSRA WL DEVELOP.  WL CARRY HIGHEST POPS DAY-CMH WITH LOWER POPS 
BOTH N AND S OF THOSE AREAS.

BOUNDARY IS PROGD TO SHIFT SWD THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT.  WL CARRY 
POPS BEFORE MIDNIGHT DAY-CMH AND ALL NIGHT CVG-PMH.  NRN FA WL DRY 
OUT A LITTLE BUT DO NOT XPCT A STRONG PUSH OF COOL/DRY AIR.  

MODELS PROG A STRONGER WAVE TO MOVE ACROSS THE OH VLY ON WED AND WED 
NIGHT.  WL CONTINUE CHC POPS FOR BOTH PERIODS.

000 
FXUS61 KILN 231831 CCA
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EDT MON JUL 23 2001

...CORRECTED HEAT ADVISORY/WARNING AT BOTTOM OF AFD...

MINOR DIFFERENCES IN MODELS FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS SHOULD PROVIDE A 
GENERALLY GOOD VIEW OF THE WX BUT DISORGANIZED FORCING WITH A WEAK 
SFC FRONT PUTS A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH REGARDS TO PLACEMENT AND 
CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION. 

ATTM...TEMPERATURES WILL BE WITHIN A FEW DEGREES OF MODEL GUIDANCE 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY...THOUGH WILL NOT GO ANY HIGHER THAN CHANCE POPS 
THROUGH THIS PERIOD. ETA/MESOETA EARLIER THIS MORNING PROGGED PRECIP 
TO BE A GOOD BIT FURTHER SW THAN CURRENTLY SHOWING ON RADARS. STILL 
CANT RULE OUT CHANCE OF EVENING ISOLATED SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM...AND 
OUTFLOW FROM SYSTEM TO THE NW COULD SPARK SOME MORE TOWARDS MORNING. 
GUIDANCE SPLITTING FORCING MECHANISMS TO THE NORTH AND SOUTHWEST OF 
FCST AREA OVERNIGHT...ALONG WITH A DECREASE IN PRECIPITATION. THIS 
SEEMS TO BE FOCUSED WITH UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE MAXES. AREA OF 
DIVERGENCE MOVES NE FROM SDFS AREA TOWARDS CVG EARLY TOMORROW...BUT 
WILL STILL GO WITH ONLY CHANCE POPS. FOLLOWING SHIFTS WILL LIKELY 
HAVE A BETTER HANDLE WHERE CONVECTION PERSISTS OVERNIGHT. 

MAIN WAVE OF SFC FRONT TO PUSH THROUGH FCST AREA OVERNIGHT WED AND 
WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS. DRY PERIOD WITH A GENERAL COOL DOWN 
EXPECTED FOR LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK AS HIGH PRESSURE SETS UP N OF 
GTLKS REGION ON THURSDAY. AFTER INITIAL DROP IN TEMPS...NE FLOW AND 
DRY AMS SHOULD ALLOW FOR A DEGREE OR TWO RISE EACH DAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND...BUT WITH COOLER OVERNIGHT LOWS. 

FOLLOWING SHOT OF RAIN POSSIBLE THIS WEEKEND ON RETURN SOUTHERLY 
FLOW. EXPECT TO BE LATE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY AND MONDAY...BUT GUT 
FEELING IS THAT SLOWER IS BETTER.

STICKY AIRMASS AND LOWS TONIGHT IN THE 70S WILL WARRANT A HEAT 
WARNING IN METRO AREAS...AND ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

.ILN...HEAT WARNING THROUGH TUESDAY OHIO ZONES 077...061 AND 055.
HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH TUESDAY REMAINDER OF FCST AREA WITH EXCEPTION 
OF WEST CENTRAL OH/NORTHERN MIAMI VALLEY.

FRANKS






...CORRECTED HEAT ADVISORY/WARNING AT BOTTOM OF AFD...

MINOR DIFFERENCES IN MODELS FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS SHOULD PROVIDE A 
GENERALLY GOOD VIEW OF THE WX BUT DISORGANIZED FORCING WITH A WEAK 
SFC FRONT PUTS A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH REGARDS TO PLACEMENT AND 
CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION. 

ATTM...TEMPERATURES WILL BE WITHIN A FEW DEGREES OF MODEL GUIDANCE 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY...THOUGH WILL NOT GO ANY HIGHER THAN CHANCE POPS 
THROUGH THIS PERIOD. ETA/MESOETA EARLIER THIS MORNING PROGGED PRECIP 
TO BE A GOOD BIT FURTHER SW THAN CURRENTLY SHOWING ON RADARS. STILL 
CANT RULE OUT CHANCE OF EVENING ISOLATED SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM...AND 
OUTFLOW FROM SYSTEM TO THE NW COULD SPARK SOME MORE TOWARDS MORNING. 
GUIDANCE SPLITTING FORCING MECHANISMS TO THE NORTH AND SOUTHWEST OF 
FCST AREA OVERNIGHT...ALONG WITH A DECREASE IN PRECIPITATION. THIS 
SEEMS TO BE FOCUSED WITH UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE MAXES. AREA OF 
DIVERGENCE MOVES NE FROM SDFS AREA TOWARDS CVG EARLY TOMORROW...BUT 
WILL STILL GO WITH ONLY CHANCE POPS. FOLLOWING SHIFTS WILL LIKELY 
HAVE A BETTER HANDLE WHERE CONVECTION PERSISTS OVERNIGHT. 

MAIN WAVE OF SFC FRONT TO PUSH THROUGH FCST AREA OVERNIGHT WED AND 
WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS. DRY PERIOD WITH A GENERAL COOL DOWN 
EXPECTED FOR LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK AS HIGH PRESSURE SETS UP N OF 
GTLKS REGION ON THURSDAY. AFTER INITIAL DROP IN TEMPS...NE FLOW AND 
DRY AMS SHOULD ALLOW FOR A DEGREE OR TWO RISE EACH DAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND...BUT WITH COOLER OVERNIGHT LOWS. 

FOLLOWING SHOT OF RAIN POSSIBLE THIS WEEKEND ON RETURN SOUTHERLY 
FLOW. EXPECT TO BE LATE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY AND MONDAY...BUT GUT 
FEELING IS THAT SLOWER IS BETTER.

STICKY AIRMASS AND LOWS TONIGHT IN THE 70S WILL WARRANT A HEAT 
WARNING IN METRO AREAS...AND ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

.ILN...HEAT WARNING THROUGH TUESDAY OHIO ZONES 077...061 AND 055.
HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH TUESDAY REMAINDER OF FCST AREA WITH EXCEPTION 
OF WEST CENTRAL OH/NORTHERN MIAMI VALLEY.

FRANKS








FXUS61 KILN 231417
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1015 AM EDT MON JUL 23 2001

...UPDATED TO INCLUDE COLUMBUS IN HEAT ADVISORY...

AXIS OF MAIN INSTABILITY AND BEST PRECIP EFFICIENCY IS CAUGHT ON NW 
SIDE OF WEAK H5 RIDGE BEFORE IT GETS INTO ACC FLOW. WILL NOT EXPECT 
TOO MUCH IN THE WAY OF ACTIVITY FOR SOUTHEAST FCST AREA...AND REMOVE 
MENTION OF POPS HERE. HOWEVER...WOULD BE HARD PRESSED TO TOUCH 
ANYWHERE ELSE AS ISOLATED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD POP WITH 
DAYTIME HEATING. WILL CHANGE SLIGHT CHANCE WORDING THIS AFTERNOON TO 
ISOLATED AND TRY TO MENTION THE PM TIME FRAME.

TEMPERATURES SHOULD REACH THE LOWER 90S AS PREVIOUSLY FCST...WITH 
ILN SOUNDING GIVING A 93 FOR FULL SUN AND A 92 WITH MORNING FOG AND 
AFTERNOON CU. SFC WIND FIELD EXPECTED TO STAY LIGHT AND INCREASE ONLY
SLIGHTLY IN THE NORTHWEST WITH APPROACHING GRADIENT AND WEAK FRONT. 
WILL DROP 5 TO 10 MPH TO LIGHT FOR EVERYONE EAST AND SOUTH OF DAYTON.

PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING CONTINUING TO MIX OUT AND WILL SEND 
UPDATE OUT AROUND 10:30 WHEN ALL BUT ONE OR TWO SITES SHOULD BE FOG 
FREE.

.ILN...HEAT ADVISORY OHIO ZONES 077...061 AND 055.

FRANKS

FXUS61 KILN 230819
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
415 AM EDT MON JUL 23 2001


UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO EFFECT FA TODAY. INSTABILITY WILL 
BE PRESENT TODAY...HOWEVER BEST DYNAMICS AND FORCING WILL REMAIN TO 
WEST. WITH TEMPERATURES IN LOW 90S AND INSTABILITY CANT RULE OUT AN 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM THIS AFTERNOON. BETTER CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH APPROACH OF SHORTWAVE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL 
CONTINUE WITH TREND OF CURRENT FORECAST. WILL STAY CLOSE TO MOS 
TEMPERATURES. WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS WILL SEE HEAT 
INDICES JUST ABOVE 100 DEGREES IN MOST AREAS. THIS MEETS HEAT 
ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR HAMILTON AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES INCLUDING THE 
CITIES OF CINCINNATI AND DAYTON. 

CLEMISILN OUT.

.ILN...HEAT ADVISORY OHIO ZONES 077 AND 061.

FXUS61 KILN 230131
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 PM EDT SUN JUL 22 2001

ISOLATED RW/TRW CONTINUE TO AFFECT FA.  BEST INSTABILITY IS ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FA.  AREA OF RW/TRW SE OF  CHICAGO IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH AREA OF CONVERGENCE THAT SWINGS EAST OVERNIGHT.  
BASED ON CURRENT MOVEMENT OF TRW...EASTERN EDGE COULD AFFECT THE FA. 
CURRENT FORECAST HAS MENTION OF POPS ALL NIGHT IN THE WEST...SO WILL 
LEAVE AS IS.   WILL HOWEVER REMOVE POPS IN SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO AND NE 
KY FOR TONIGHT.

CURRENT LOWS LOOK GOOD...SO NO CHANGE THERE.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES





FXUS61 KILN 221916
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EDT SUN JUL 22 2001

FORECAST REMAINS COMPLICATED.  CURRENTLY REGIONAL RADARS INDICATE 
SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER SOUTHERN INDIANA AND NORTHERN KENTUCKY.  
VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.  WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY SHOWS A WEAK WAVE OVER NORTHERN INDIANA SLIDING SOUTHWARD.  
SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES TDS IN THE LOWER 70S.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC SITUATION.  
HOWEVER AS WITH THE PAST SEVERAL RUNS THERE ARE DIFFERENCES WITH THE 
THE STRENGTH AND TIMING OF WEAK WAVES.  THE 06Z MESOETA WAS 
INDICATED CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT FROM CHI TO THE OHIO RIVER 
OVERNIGHT.  THE NEW RUN SHOWS SOME DESCENT 925 MB CONVERGENCE THIS 
AFTERNOON OVER WESTERN FA ALONG WITH SOME CONVECTION DIVING 
SOUTHWARD FROM NORTHERN IL.  WE WILL BE UNSTABLE THROUGH TONIGHT 
WITH SEVERAL POSSIBLE TRIGGERS.  BUFKIT ALSO INDICATES THE SHEAR 
WILL BECOME SUFFICIENT FOR THE STORMS TO BE A BIT MORE ORGANIZED.  
HAVE CONTEMPLATED FLASH FLOOD WATCH OVER TRI-STATE AS FLASH FLOOD 
GUIDANCE IS MAINLY BELOW 2.2 INCHES IN A 3 HR PERIOD...PWS REMAIN 
>1.5 INCHES AND MEAN FLOW STILL INDICATE TRAINING AND SLOW MOVING 
STORMS WILL OCCUR.  BUT WILL HOLD OFF FOR KNOW SINCE WERE OVER THE 
FA IS THE BIG QUESTION.

OTHER CONCERN IS CONVECTION AND HEAT HEADLINES FOR MONDAY.  IF 
CONVECTION HOLDS OFF TILL EVENING THEN ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR DAY/CVG 
METRO MAY BE REACHED AS WELL AS THE REST OF THE FA.  WILL GO WITH A 
SILENT 20 POP.  HOWEVER...CONVECTIVE BLOW OFF AND AFTERNOON CU COULD 
KEEP THINGS A BIT COOLER.  SO WILL HOLD OFF ON HEAT HEADLINE FOR THE 
MOMENT AND LET MID SHIFT.

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD...THINK IT WILL BE A BIT WARMER THAN FWC TONIGHT 
AND ALSO CONCERNED THAT FWC MIGHT BE A TO WARM WITH MCS AND 
CONVECTIVE DEBRIS KEEPING THINGS COOLER BUT WILL NO BUCK IT AT THIS 
POINT. 

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON





913 
FXUS61 KILN 221412
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1012 AM EDT SUN JUL 22 2001

COMPLICATED FORECAST FOR TODAY.  CONVECTION NEAR DAY HAS DISSIPATED 
AND ACTIVITY AROUND THE OHIO RIVER HAS JUST MOVED SOUTH OF FA.  TDS 
ARE IN THE LOWER 70S ACROSS THE WEST.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING 
MAINLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH WATER VAPOR SHOWING UPPER 
FLOW FROM THE UPPER MS VLY/WRN GREAT LAKES.

MORNING SOUNDING INDICATES HIGHS NEAR 90 WHICH AGREES WITH USING 
LOCAL TECHNIQUES WITH THE 06Z MESOETA...SO WILL UP WEST AND CENTRAL 
OHIO TO AROUND 90.  WITH TDS EXPECTED IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 70S IN 
THE WEST WILL ADD HEAT INDEX WORDING TO WESTERN ZONES.  BELIEVE 
CU/CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON WILL PREVENT DAYTON AND HAMILTON 
COUNTIES FROM EXCEEDING HEAT INDEX OF 100 DEGREES AND IF THEY DO IT 
WILL BE FOR ONLY A SHORT PERIOD OF TIME.  THE SITUATION WILL BE 
MONITORED.

CONVECTION IS THE NEXT CONCERN.  BY LATE AFTERNOON AND THIS 
EVENING...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED.  THE COMBINATION OF 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES...>2000 J/KG...MAX SFC DELTA THETA-E DIFFERENCE 
NEAR 40 DEGREES AND WET BULB AROUND 10 KFT WILL ALLOW SOME OF THESE 
STORMS TO BE PULSE SEVERE.  HEAVY RAINERS WILL ALSO BE A THREAT AS 
WEAK STEERING WINDS AND HIGH PWS PERSIST.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON














FXUS61 KILN 220722
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 AM EDT SUN JUL 22 2001

MODELS IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT ACROSS OUR AREA THIS FCST PERIOD. 
APPEARS THE ETA A BIT SLOWER WITH S/W OVER SRN CANADA 24-36HR. THIS 
TRANSLATES TO THE MODEL BEING A BIT SLOWER WITH THE PROGRESSION OF 
ATTENDANT SFC. THICKNESS ALSO TRENDING A BIT WARMER.

FOR TODAY...WK MID LVL S/W EXPECTED TO DROP INTO FA BY MID-LATE 
AFTERNOON. THIS SHOULD AID IN SOME DESTABILIZATION AS ALSO SOME LOW 
LVL FORCING WILL BE IN PLACE ALONG WITH AXIS OF HIGHER INSTABILITY. 
WILL THUS KEEP 30 POPS ACROSS ALL BY CMH AREA WHERE WILL GO WITH 
ONLY 20 POPS. MAYS SEE SOME EARLY MORNING CONVECTION CONTINUE ACROSS 
SE PORTION OF FA AS CURRENT FORCING EXPECTED TO REMAIN IN PLACE 
EARLY TODAY. GUIDANCE TEMPS CONTRAST WELL WITH THICKNESS ANALYSIS.

FOR TONIGHT...SIMILAR TO THE LAST SEVERAL NIGHTS...FEEL THERE IS 
STILL A 20-30 CHC POPS ACROSS OUR FA. ALTHOUGH FORCING WILL BE 
WEAK...AXIS OF INSTABILITY WILL BE AREA OF FOCUS.

FOR MONDAY...VERY LITTLE IN THE WAY OF FORCING. WITH THICKNESS 
VALUES A BIT WARMER AND THE TREND TO INCREASE SOMEWHAT...FELL LOW 
90S POSSIBLE ACROSS MOST OF FA.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO

FXUS61 KILN 220156
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
957 PM EDT SAT JUL 21 2001

WELL...IVE TRIED TO OUT WAIT THE RAIN BEFORE UPDATING...BUT IT 
SEEMS TO HAVE MORE ENERGY TONIGHT. ENERGY IS COMING FROM WEAK VORT 
DROP SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE FA.  VORT SHOULD CONTINUE TO PUSH 
SOUTHEAST.

SO WILL DRY OUT THE NORTHWEST AND LEAVE CHANCE POPS ON CENTRAL OHIO 
UNTIL MIDNIGHT.  WILL KEEP MENTION OF RAIN IN THE SOUTH ALL 
NIGHT...ALTHOUGH EXPECT IT TO DIE SOMETIME AFTER MIDNIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

REGIONAL RADAR IMAGERY INDICATES CONVECTION HAS INCREASED IN 
COVERAGE OVER NORTHERN INDIANA AND FAR SOUTHWESTERN MI.  SATELLITE 
IMAGERY SHOWING CU OVER FA AND MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE VORT OVER 
SOUTHEASTERN IL.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH SYNOPTIC FEATURES BUT VARY 
WITH INTENSITY AND TIMING OF MID LEVEL WAVES.  RIDGE TO OUR WEST 
WILL SLOWLY BREAK DOWN IN THE NEXT 24 TO 48 HOURS.  AS IT BREAKS 
DOWN IT FLATTENS OUT BRINGING HIGHER HEIGHTS.  THE UPPER JET 
STREAM...HOWEVER DOES REMAIN NORTH.

WILL LEAVE IN MENTION OF EVENING THUNDERSTORMS IN THE WEST AS BEST 
INSTABILITY...WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WILL 
CREATE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY.  THINK CONVECTION OVER 
NORTHERN IN WILL REMAIN NORTH BUT IT DOES BEAR WATCHING.  WILL KEEP 
THE THREAT OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE SOUTH AS MOISTURE AXIS AND WEAK WAVE 
REMAINS.  WILL THROUGH IN MENTION AGAIN SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR SIMILAR 
REASONS.  FEEL MONDAY WILL BE MAINLY DRY AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN.  
HOWEVER WILL INCLUDE 30 POP TO NORTHWEST...WHICH WILL BE CLOSER TO 
THE FRONT.

TEMPS WILL GRADUALLY CLIMB A DEGREE OR TWO THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS AS 
WE HEAD INTO OUR LONGEST HOT SPELL OF THE SUMMER.  LOWS WILL HAVE A 
TOUGH TIME FALLING BELOW 70 UNTIL LATTER IN THE WEEK.  FWC TEMPS 
LOOK GOOD WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR TWEAKS.  

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON






FXUS61 KILN 211344
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 AM EDT SAT JUL 21 2001

...UPDATE AROUND CAN BE EXPECTED AROUND 10 AM...

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE VORT (MCV) OVER 
NORTHERN IL WITH AC CLOUD SHIELD EXTENDING OVER MUCH OF INDIANA.  
RECENT TRENDS INDICATE THE AC IS BEGINNING TO MIX OUT.  SURFACE 
ANALYSIS INDICATED 70 TDS INTO WESTERN OH WITH TDS BELOW 60 INTO 
EASTERN OH.  06Z MESOETA INDICATES THIS TD GRADIENT INCREASING WITH 
THE 70S STAYING IN THE WEST.  

CURRENT FORECAST IS IN GREAT SHAPE.  WILL UPDATE TO RESOLVE 
AFTERNOON WORDING AND TO BUMP UP TEMPS IN THE EAST TO NEAR 90.  
MORNING SOUNDING WITH FULL SUN GIVES 91 FOR HIGH AND BELIEVE WITH 
DRIER TDS IN THE EAST THAT IT RESULT IN A BIT WARMER TEMPERATURES.  
CONSIDERED TAKING POPS OUT OF EAST PER >20 CINH OFF 06Z MESOETA OVER 
EASTERN FA BUT WILL LET IT GO.  THINK POPS IN THE WEST ARE GOOD AND 
IN FACT MAY NEED TO BE INCREASED WITH APPROACH OF MCV AND STRONGER 
TD DISCONTINUITY...BUT WILL LEAVE AS IS AND MONITOR.  

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

FXUS61 KILN 210700
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 AM EDT SAT JUL 21 2001

UNCHANGING AIRMASS WITH LITTLE IN THE WAY OF PCPN FOCUSING 
MECHANISMS...SO BASICALLY A PERSISTENCE FCST THRU THE SHORT RANGE.
FWC/MAV TEMPS REMAIN IN GOOD AGREEMENT...AND SUPPORT READINGS CLOSE 
TO YDAYS HIGHS BOTH TDY AND SUNDAY.  HV GONE U80S ALL ZONES BOTH 
DAYS.  GUID MINS LK GD AS WELL...ALTHOUGH HV RAISED SLIGHTLY AT CMH 
AS MOS HAS BEEN A LITTLE TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH DRIER/COOLER AIR.
FOR POPS TDY...BEST INSTABILITY AND MSTR WEST WITH SKLIGHTLY DRIER AIR 
TRYING TO PUSH IN FROM THE EAST.  WL TAPER POPS FROM 30 WEST TO 20 
EAST THIS AFTN...AND CONT INTO THIS EVE.  A LITTLE BETTER PCPN 
EFFICIENCY PROGGED ALL AREAS SUNDAY...WITH BEST INSTABILITY WEST.  
WL CARRY LOW CHC POPS (30) ALL ZONES.  THE HIGH PWAT/LIGHT STEERING 
FLOW NATURE OF THIS REGIME WL CONT TO PROVIDE A THREAT FOR ISOLATED 
HEAVY-EXCESSIVE RAINERS...LIKE THE 1.4 INCHES AT CVG IN 40 MIN YDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

768 
FXUS61 KILN 201921
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
321 PM EDT FRI JUL 20 2001

PERSISTENT UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS TROF OFF THE EAST COAST AND RIDGE 
AXIS OVER THE PLAINS.  WITH UPPER RIDGE AXIS REMAINING TO OUR 
WEST...WEAK NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

AT THE SFC...WEAK BOUNDARY NEAR THE OHIO RIVER REMAINS BETWEEN HIGH 
OVER NEW YORK AND BROAD DIFFUSE LOW OVER THE HIGH PLAINS.  70+ DEW 
POINTS ARE EVIDENT FROM OUR PART OF THE OHIO VALLEY WEST TO THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  THIS SOUPY AIRMASS WILL STAY SITUATED ACROSS 
OUR AREA THROUGH THE FCST PERIOD.

RADAR SHOWS WDLY SCT SHRA/TSRA AROUND OUR CWA.  WITH MODELS SHOWING 
LIMITED UPPER SUPPORT TONIGHT...ILL GO WITH 30 POPS FOR THIS 
EVENING ALL ZONES AS COVERAGE SHOULD REMAIN SCT WITH LACK OF STRONG 
FORCING. 

WITH UNSTABLE AIR REMAINING IN PLACE AND MODELS INDICATING MORE PVA 
ROUNDING THE UPPER RIDGE...ILL CARRY 30 POPS FOR AFTERNOON TSRA 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  ILL ALSO CARRY 30 POPS SATURDAY NIGHT FOR 
ACTIVITY THAT MAY LINGER INTO EVENING. 

SLOW MOVING UPPER FLOW AND PWAT AROUND 1.7 GIVE HEAVY RAIN 
POTENTIAL TO ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP...THOUGH FFG VALUES HAVE 
REBOUNDED CONSIDERABLY SINCE THE HEAVY RAIN OF A COUPLE DAYS AGO.

WITH SODDEN AIRMASS HANGING AROUND...ILL KEEP MENTION OF FOG FOR 
TONIGHT.

WITH A SLIGHT WARMING TREND OCCURRING IN OUR STAGNANT AIRMASS...FWC 
TEMPS LOOK A BIT LOW SO ILL GENERALLY GO A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE.


.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

711 
FXUS61 KILN 201330
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 AM EDT FRI JUL 20 2001

NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT PERSISTS WITH H5 TROF ALONG THE EAST COAST AND 
H5 HIGH OVER TEXAS.  THOUGH MOST OF UPPER SUPPORT HAS DROPPED SOUTH 
OF HERE FOR THE TIME BEING...A WEAK VORT MAX CURRENTLY NEAR LAKE 
MICHIGAN IS ROUNDING THE TOP OF THE RIDGE TOWARD OUR AREA TODAY.

SFC MAP SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER EASTERN NEW YORK...WITH A 
POORLY DEFINED EAST-WEST BOUNDARY BETWEEN SDF AND CVG.  WEAK LOW 
ALONG THE BOUNDARY NEAR SDF HAS 74 DEW POINTS POOLING AROUND IT.  

RADAR SHOWS SHRA/TSRA SOUTH OF COLUMBUS WITH HOURLY RATES AS HIGH AS 
1.9 (SEE FFSILN).  ACTIVITY IS MOVING SLOWLY SOUTH IN UPPER 
FLOW...TOWARD MORE UNSTABLE AIR INVOF SFC BOUNDARY. 

FOR THIS UPDATE...ILL KEEP CHC/SCT POPS WITH SCT TSRA ALREADY 
OCCURRING AND MORE EXPECTED TO FORM WITH PVA PROVIDING SOME UPPER 
SUPPORT IN OUR UNSTABLE AIRMASS.  THE LACK OF STRONG FORCING SHOULD 
PREVENT WIDESPREAD AREAS OF PRECIP FROM FORMING...SO SCT POPS WILL 
STILL WORK.  

FCST TEMPS LOOK GOOD EXCEPT NEAR CVG WHERE IT HAS ALREADY REACHED 80 
AT 9 AM.  ILL RAISE THE CVG GROUP TO UPPER 80S WHILE LEAVING REST 
OF GROUPS TEMPS AS IS.

OTHERWISE...ILL UPDATE TO REMOVE FOG FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND THATS 
IT.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

FXUS61 KILN 200739
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
338 AM EDT FRI JUL 20 2001

07Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS BNDRY AND WEAK LPRES NEAR OR JUST SOUTH OF 
THE OHIO RIVER...WITH HIPRES RIDGING DOWN THE EAST SIDE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS.  AIRMASS HAS DRIED OUT SOMEWHAT...WITH PWAT ON THE 00Z 
SOUNDING BLO 1.5 INCHES FOR THE FIRST TIME IN A FEW DAYS.  PLENTY OF 
LLVL MSTR REMAINS HWVR...AND HV SEEN ISOLD SHRA DVLP IN THE WEAK 
LLVL FORCING NEAR THE BNDRY OVER SW OHIO/SE INDIANA.  MODEL GUID TDY 
SUGGESTS AREAS OF HIGHEST PCPN EFFICIENCY OVER THE EASTERN CWFA...AS 
WELL AS JUST TO THE SW OVER KY/SOUTHERN INDIANA.  WL CONT WITH LOW 
CHC POPS ALL ZONES AS CONVECTION PSBL JUST ABT ANYWHERE.  FWC TEMPS 
HV BEEN DOING WELL...ALTHOUGH RUNNING COOL AT CMH.  WL CONT PREV 
TREND OF M-U 80S WEST...U80S EAST.  MVFR VSBY MOST OF THE DAY IN THE 
SOUTH AND W YDAY...AND WL INCL HAZY WORDING TDY IN SIMILAR AIRMASS.

WL CARRY LOW POPS UNTIL AROUND MIDNIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR LINGERING 
DIURNAL ACTIVITY...OTHW PC TNGT.  AIRMASS HAS BEEN YIELDING FOG 
PRETTY CONSISTENTLY...AND WL INCLUDE MENTION TNGT.  WARMER FWC TEMPS 
LK BEST GIVEN XPCTD DWPTS AND RECENT TRENDS.  FOR SAT...LLVL FLOW  
TRENDS MORE SOUTHERLY AS HIPRES BECOMES CENTERED IN THE DELMARVA RGN.
WL CONT PREV 30 POPS GIVEN GOOD LLVL MSTR AND A FAIR AMNT OF DIURNAL 
INSTABILITY.  FWC TEMPS CONTINUE TO LK PRETTY GD...ALTHOUGH WL CONT 
TO RAISE A CATEGORY IN CENTRAL OHIO.  

HV ADDED POPS TO ALL BUT SE SXNS SAT NIGHT.  FAVORABLE SETUP FOR MCS 
DVLPMNT UPSTREAM...WITH 850-300 THICKNESS CONTOURS STEERING ACTIVITY 
INTO OUR AREA.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE



FXUS61 KILN 191915
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
314 PM EDT THU JUL 19 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS TROF ALONG THE EAST COAST WITH A RIDGE OVER 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  OUR AREA IS EXPERIENCING A NORTHERLY FLOW 
ALOFT BETWEEN THE TROF AND RIDGE.  THIS PATTERN IS FCST TO PERSIST 
THROUGH THE NEXT TWO DAYS...THOUGH OUR AREA WILL HAVE SLIGHT H5 
HEIGHT FALLS AS THE EASTERN TROF AMPLIFIES A BIT.

SFC MAP SHOWS PERSISTENT HIGH TO THE EAST AND WEAK LOW TO THE 
WEST...WITH A SOUTHERLY FLOW OF VERY MOIST AIR FEEDING INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY.   A WEAK BOUNDARY IS LOCATED NEAR DAYTON...WITH LOW 70S DEW 
POINTS ACROSS SOUTHERN OHIO AND NORTHERN KENTUCKY.  MODELS FCST THE 
BOUNDARY TO DROP SLOWLY SOUTH OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS IN 
RESPONSE TO AMPLIFYING EAST COAST TROF.  DEW POINTS ARE PROGGED TO 
DROP OFF SLIGHTLY INTO THE 60S AS THE FRONT MOVES SOUTH AND DRIER 
AIR ADVECTS IN FROM THE EAST.  

CURRENT RADAR SHOWS SCT SHRA IN OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES MOVING SLOWLY 
SOUTH IN UPPER FLOW.  ILL NEED EVENING PERIOD TO COVER THIS 
LEFTOVER ACTIVITY.  WITH THE ACTIVITY BEING DRIVEN BY SOLAR 
HEATING...THE REST OF TONIGHT SHOULD BE PARTLY CLOUDY.

THOUGH MAJOR FORCING WILL BE LACKING...WITH INSTABILITY STAYING 
RATHER HIGH AND SOME PVA OCCURRING...ILL KEEP CHC TSRA FOR FRIDAY 
AND INTRODUCE CHC TSRA INTO SATURDAYS FCST. MOST OF THE FCST PERIOD 
SHOULD FEATURE PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AS LACK OF FORCING SHOULD PREVENT 
WIDESPREAD ORGANIZED TSRA.

FWC TEMPS LOOK DECENT SO ILL STAY CLOSE.  HIGHS IN MID TO UPPER 80S 
LOOK REASONABLE IN THIS PERSISTENT AIRMASS.  LOWS IN UPPER 60S ALSO 
LOOK GOOD...THOUGH IT MAY DROP A FEW DEGREES COOLER IN OUR EASTERN 
COUNTIES DEPENDING UPON HOW MUCH DRY AIR ADVECTS IN.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO





NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 AM EDT THU JUL 19 2001

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES WITH H5 TROF OVER NEW ENGLAND AND 
RIDGE CENTERED OVER MISSOURI.  FLOW ALOFT IS BECOMING MORE NORTHERLY 
AS NEW ENGLAND TROF AMPLIFIES.  A COUPLE OF VORT MAXES MOVING SOUTH 
TOWARD OUR REGION WILL INFLUENCE TODAYS WX...WITH ONE VORT NEAR CHI 
AND THE OTHER AROUND LAKE ERIE.

SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS WEAK BOUNDARY ACROSS SOUTHERN OHIO. MAIN FEATURE 
OF CONCERN IS MOIST AIR POOLING NEAR THE BOUNDARY WITH AROUND 70 
DEW POINTS EVIDENT.  SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR IS ADVECTING INTO EASTERN 
OHIO WHICH IS SETTING UP A MOISTURE GRADIENT FROM WEST TO EAST.

WITH PVA PROVIDING UPPER SUPPORT AND RELATIVELY UNSTABLE AIR 
REMAINING ALONG SFC BOUNDARY AND MOISTURE GRADIENT...ILL KEEP 30 
POPS FOR TSRA THIS AFTERNOON.   

HIGH TEMPS IN MID 80S LOOK GOOD AFTER ANALYZING MORNING SOUNDING. 
REST OF FCST LOOKS GOOD WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. 
FOG IS DISSIPATING SO ILL ALLOW ADVISORY TO EXPIRE AT 10 AM AS 
SCHEDULED.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

445 AM EDT THU JUL 19 2001

WILL ISSUE A DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE CWFA (UNTIL 10 AM 
EDT) BASED ON CURRENT SATELLITE AND OBSERVATION TRENDS.

...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
WEAK STATIONARY BOUNDARY WAS LOCATED NW TO SE FROM NEAR LIMA DOWN 
TOWARD PKB.  THIS BOUNDARY IS FCST TO REMAIN QUASI STATIONARY 
THROUGH TODAY AND TONIGHT.

A FEW WEAK S/WVS PIVOTING IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT WERE RESPONSIBLE FOR 
THE SHOWERS OCCURRING OVER THE FAR SRN CWFA AND THE FEW BLIP SHOWERS 
OVER THE REMAINDER CWFA.  ONCE THESE S/WVS MOVE SE OF THE AREA OVER 
THE NEXT FEW HOURS...PCPN SHOULD COME TO AN END.  WILL LET FLASH 
FLOOD WATCH DIE A NATURAL DEATH (AND MAY ISSUE A FFS TO TIE THINGS 
UP).  FIRST PROBLEM OF THE DAY IS THE POTENTIAL FOR DENSE FOG.  
SKIES WERE PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLEAR OVER THE NORTH WITH 
CLEARING OCCURRING ACRS THE SOUTH.  WINDS ARE LIGHT...AND FOG WAS 
FORMING.  ATTM...IT IS HARD TO DETERMINE HOW MUCH WILL FORM INTO 
DENSE FOG OR A LOW STRATUS DECK.  WILL MENTION FOG IN THE ZONES FOR 
THE MORNING HOURS AND WILL WATCH THE OBSERVATIONS FOR THE REMAINDER 
OF THE NIGHT TO DETERMINE IF AN ADVISORY WILL BE NECESSARY.  
OTHERWISE...WITH NO SIGNIFICANT S/WV ACTIVITY EXPECTED TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND ONLY WEAK FORCING...DAYTIME LOW POP SHOWER/TSTM 
ACTIVITY IS FORECAST.

FOR TONIGHT...SKIES SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR.  HOWEVER...DEBRIS 
BLOW OFF FROM ANY CONVECTION FROM THE PLAINS COULD THROW A WRENCH 
INTO THIS.  WILL CONTINUE THE PARTLY CLOUDY FOR NOW AND LET DAY 
SHIFT WILL HAVE A BETTER LOOK AT DEBRIS POTENTIAL.

ON FRIDAY...THE QUASI STATIONARY FRONT MOVES SLOWLY WESTWARD.  
AGAIN...THERE WILL BE ENOUGH AFTN INSTABILITY TO WARRANT AN 
AFTERNOON SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM.

MOS/MAV TEMPS CLOSE AND WILL BE HARD TO BEAT BASED ON THICKNESS 
SCHEMES. 

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN













FXUS61 KILN 181927
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 PM EDT WED JUL 18 2001

WILL MAKE DISCUSSION SHORT AS TIME IS RUNNING SHORT.

WILL ISSUE A FLASH FLOOD WATCH OVER SOUTHWEST FA.  2 TO 6 INCHES OF 
RAIN FELL YESTERDAY AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT BRINGING A LOT OF 
PROBLEMS TO THE TRI-STATE AND WHITE WATER VALLEY.  FLASH FLOOD 
GUIDANCE IS LESS THAN AN INCH FOR MOST IF NOT ALL OF OUR COUNTIES IN 
THE WATCH AREA.  THE ONLY EXCEPTION IF A FEW NORTHERN KY WHICH ARE 
NEAR AN INCH.  CONVECTION OVER CENTRAL INDIANA WILL MOVE INTO EAST 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHEAST INDIANA BY 5 PM AND WILL LIKELY INTENSIFY TO 
SOME DEGREE AS REGION REACHES MAX DAYTIME HEATING.  12Z ETA PROGGED 
AND MODIFIED MORNING ILN SOUNDING INDICATE 2500 TO 3000 J/KG OVER 
SOUTHWEST FA THIS EVENING.

AVN IS MOST CONSISTENT WITH DEVELOPING MCS OVER SRN IL/IN THIS 
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT WITH THE ETA BRINGING A SHEARED OUT WAVE OVER 
FA THIS EVENING.  

FOR THE REST OF FORECAST WILL WILL KEEP SMALL THREAT OF CONVECTION 
THROUGH FRIDAY AS RIDGE BUILDS JUST TO OUR WEST WITH JET STREAM 
DIVING SOUTH OVER REGION.  THIS WILL ALLOW MID LEVEL WAVES RIDGE 
RIDERS TO DEVELOP CONVECTION TO OUR NORTH AND DIVE SOUTH INTO FA.  
ETA STILL INDICATING INSTABILITY OVER FA.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY ALONG WITH THE ZONES. 

.ILN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH UNTIL MIDNIGHT.
OH...060-070-071-077-078
IN...050-058-059-066-073>075-080
KY...089>098

 TIPTON

322 
FXUS61 KILN 181439
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1039 AM EDT WED JUL 18 2001

FCST CHALLENGE THIS MRNG REVOLVES ARND CHC/S FOR ADDITIONAL CNVCTN...
POTENTIAL FOR HVY RAIN AND SVR WEATHER. 

MID/UPR LVL RDG CENTERED OVR CNRL/SRN PLNS WITH A SERIES OF S/WVS 
DROPPING SE FM UPR MS VLY INTO OH VLY. MCS/S HV DVLPD ARND THE 
PERIPHERY OF THIS HI. LTST SFC ANLYS SHWS FNTL BNDRY FM IA..THRU NRN 
IL INTO CNTRL IN AND CNTRL OH. THIS BNDRY XPCTD TO DROP SLWLY S
ACRS THE SRN PTN OF CWA THIS AFTN/TNGT.  

MESOSCALE BNDRY WHICH HELPED FOCUS OVRNGT HVY RAIN HS PUSHED S FM SW 
IN THRU CNTRL KY. GOOD DEAL OF LO CLDS ACRS CWA ESPEICALLY ACRS
AREAS N OF FNTL BNDRY. 12Z ILN SOUNDING INDICATES LO LVL INVRSN
WHICH SHUD KEEP AREAS N OF ILN IN LO CLDS INTO ERLY AFTN. LTST VIS 
IMGRYS SHWS CLDS THINNING ACRS SRN OH/NRN KY S OF FNTL BNDRY. WL 
KEEP UPR 80S FOR HI/S HERE WHERE BEST SUNSHINE IS EXPECTED. THIS SS
SHUD LEAD TO THE RE-DVLPMNT OF CNVCTN WITH AFTN CAPES XPCTD TO BE
2000-2500 J/KG.

FCST SOUNDINGS SHWG THETA-E DIFF FM SFC-500MB OF ARND 30 DEG K. SOME 
POTENTIAL FOR DMGG WNDS IN FAR SW OH/SE IN/N CNTRL KY THIS AFTN/EVE. 
WL ISSUE SVR-WX OUTLOOK FOR THESE LOCATIONS. CONVECTION SHUD BE 
SCTD TDA BEING MAINLY INSTBY DRIVEN. SO WL HOLD OFF ON FLOOD WATCH 
ATTM AND WATCH DECAYING MCS OVR IL. WL HOWEVER...INCRS POPS TO 50 
PCT ACRS THE S AND MENT THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY HVY RAIN WITH 
PE/S RUNNING ARND 1.5 INCHES.

ONGOING MCS OVR NRN IL SHWG SIGNS OF WEAKENING AS IT MOVES INTO MORE
STABLE ENVIRONMENT. XPCT ANOTHER MCS TO DVLP THIS AFTN OVR MID MS
VLY AND DROP SE INTO THE OH VLY TNGT. AVN HS BEEN THE MOST CONSISTENT
WITH THIS FEATURE AND TAKES MCS ACRS IN AND INTO CNTRL KY OVRNGT. WL
CONT TO EVALUATE POTENTIAL FOR HVY RAIN TNGT ACRS SW OH/SE IN/N 
CNTRL KY FOR HVY RAIN. MAY NEED TO ISSUE FLASH FLOOD WATCH LATER 
THIS AFTN.        

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

075 
FXUS61 KILN 181000 AAA
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
600 AM EDT TUE JUL 18 2001

FLASH FLOOD WATCH NOW EXPIRING...SO WILL UPDATED ZONES.  KILN RADAR 
INDICATES THAT THE HEAVIEST RAINFALL HAS NOW SHIFTED SOUTH OF THE 
CWFA.  CURRENT URBAN AND SMALL STREAM FLOOD WARNINGS ACRS SE INDIANA 
AND NORTHERN KENTUCKY SHOULD BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT 630 AM EDT.

...PREVIOUS DISSCUSSION...
LATEST SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING FROM SRN 
PA...THRU NRN OH...NRN IN...THEN NWWD INTO WRN WISCONSIN.  THIS 
BOUNDARY WILL SAG SLOWLY SOUTH ACRS THE CWFA TODAY THRU TONIGHT.

IN THE SHORT TERM...MESOSCALE BOUNDARY ACRS THE SWRN CWFA COMBINED 
WITH LVL JET/SHORTWAVE ALOFT ARE THE REASON FOR THE CURRENT 
CONVECTION/VERY HEAVY RAINFALL.  LOW LVL JET SHOULD EASE BY 
MORNING...SO EXPECT CONVECTION TO EVENTUALLY WEAKEN TOWARD 
DAYBREAK.  BASED ON CURRENT RADAR TRENDS...WILL KEEP FLASH FLOOD 
WATCH GOING UNTIL 6 AM EDT FOR SWRN CWFA AN LET THE PREVIOUS WATCH 
THAT WAS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EXPIRE.

BELIEVE SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY DURING THE MORNING HOURS.  
AFOREMENTIONED FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE THE FOCUS FOR MORE 
CONVECTION TODAY.  S/WV NOW OVER NRN IOWA WILL SLIDE SE AROUND UPR 
LVL RIDGE INTO THE REGION...PROVIDING SOME UPR LVL SUPPORT.  WILL 
KEEP BROAD BRUSH 40 POPS GOING FOR TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT....FRONTAL BOUNDARY SETS UP NEAR THE OHIO RIVER.  AVN 
MODEL HINTS AT ANOTHER CONVECTIVELY INDUCED S/WV TO PIVOT JUST SW OF 
THE REGION.  AS IS USUALLY THE CASE...MODELS DO NOT HANDLE THESE 
FEATURES WELL.  WILL PLACE HIGHEST POPS IN THE SW CWFA TONIGHT 
...TAPERING TO THE LOWEST VALUES ACRS THE NORTH.

ON THURSDAY...I AM NOT SEEING ANY SIGNIFICANT S/WVS.  HOWEVER... 
AIRMASS REMAINS SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE ACRS THE NORTH AND MORE UNSTABLE 
ACRS THE SOUTH.  30 POPS IN THE AFTN NORTH AND 40 POPS (NO TIMING) 
SOUTH LOOKS GOOD ATTM.

TEMPS CLOUD DEPENDENT..THUS...WILL STICK CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
937 PM EDT TUE JUL 17 2001

CONVECTION ACROSS THE CWFA THIS EVE HAS BEEN RATHER STRONGLY 
FORCED...WITH NICE DPVA IN THE MID/UPPER LVLS AND RATHER ROBUST LLVL 
WAA.  FOR THE PAST FEW HOURS...ACTIVITY HAS BEEN FOCUSED ALONG 
MESOSCALE BNDRY DRAPED OVER SW OHIO AND EAST CENTRAL INDIANA.
PWAT ON 00Z SOUNDING OVER 2 INCHES (2.04)...AND HV SEEN INCREASINGLY 
EFFICIENT RAINERS INCLUDING A MEASUREMENT OF 4+ INCHES IN ADAMS 
COUNTY IN 90 MINUTES.  VERY DRY ANTECEDENT CONDS HV KEPT FLOOD 
THREAT DOWN SO FAR...BUT NOT REAL COMFORTABLE WITH HOW ACTIVITY IF 
BEGINNING TO TRAIN UP.  WL BE CONSIDERING FFA THROUGH 10-1030 PM.

REST OF PREV FCST STILL LKS GOOD.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

MESOSCALE BNDRY DRAPED OVER SW OHIO AND EAST CENTRAL INDIANA.
PWAT ON 00Z SOUNDING OVER 2 INCHES (2.04)...AND HV SEEN INCREASINGLY 
EFFICIENT RAINERS INCLUDING A MEASUREMENT OF 4+ INCHES IN ADAMS 
COUNTY IN 90 MINUTES.  VERY DRY ANTECEDENT CONDS HV KEPT FLOOD 
THREAT DOWN SO FAR...BUT NOT REAL COMFORTABLE WITH HOW ACTIVITY IF 
BEGINNING TO TRAIN UP.  WL BE CONSIDERING FFA THROUGH 10-1030 PM.

REST OF PREV FCST STILL LKS GOOD.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

FXUS61 KILN 171932
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EDT TUE JUL 17 2001

19Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES STATES.  AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY WAS APPARENT ON THE KILN 88D BTWN 
ILN AND CMH.  SCT SHRA/TSRA WERE OCCURING ACROSS FA.  A MORE 
ORGANIZED AREA OF SHRA/TSRA WERE DROPPING SEWD ACROSS NRN IN.

XPCT MCS OVER NRN IN TO MOVE SEWD INTO FA DURING THE LATE PM AND 
EVENING HOURS.  THIS SHOULD BRING MORE WIDESPREAD COVERAGE OF 
SHRA/TSRA THAN TODAY.  WL CARRY LIKELY POPS ALL AREAS TONIGHT.  
PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF SHRA/TSRA SHOULD PREVENT EXCESSIVE AMOUNTS SO 
WL NOT MENTION HEAVY RAIN IN FCST.

DO NOT TRUST MODEL TIMING FOR THE WED-THU TIME FRAME.  SYNOPTIC 
ENVIRONMENT SUGGESTS THAN ATMOSPHERE WL BE UNSTABLE WITH A BOUNDARY 
NEARBY THROUGH THOSE PERIODS.  XPCT SHRA/TSRA TO PERIODICALLY MOVE 
FROM NW TO SE ACROSS FA SO WL CARRY CHC POPS.  BEST CHANCE OF SVR WL 
BE WED PM OR EVENING IF WE GET MORE SS THAN TODAY.

TEMPS ARE TOUGH DUE TO UNCERTAINTY OF SHRA/TSRA PLACMENT.  WL STICK 
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON


928 
UXUS61 KILN 170637
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 AM EDT TUE JUL 17 2001

DIFFICULT FCST FOR THE NEXT 24 TO 48 HRS AS CHC/S OF PCPN DEPENDENT
ON MODEL/S RESOLUTION OF MCS DEVELOPMENT.

04Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A STATIONARY BOUNDARY ACRS THE WRN GREAT 
LAKES.  MEANWHILE...A BROAD SE TO S FLOW ACRS THE PLAIN STATES WAS 
ADVECTING 70 TO 75 DEWPOINTS NORTHWARD.

MODELS ARE IN SIMILAR AGREEMENT FOR TODAY/S FCST.  AN INCREASING SW 
FLOW ALOFT WILL ADVECT A VERY MOIST AIRMASS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  A 
WEAK LOW LVL JET POISED ACRS THE SRN CWFA WILL BRING THE BEST CHC OF 
SHOWERS AND TSTMS THERE (MAINLY IN THE AFTN).  FOR THE NORTH...CHC/S 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MORE DIABATICALLY DRIVEN...SO 
EXPECT A SML CHC (30 PERCENT) DURING THE AFTN HOURS.

FOR TONIGHT...AVN MODEL...AND TO A LESSER EXTENT THE MESO 
ETA...SHOWS A WEAK S/WV (CURRENTLY OVER NEBRASKA)...MOVING SE INTO 
THE REGION.  WITH A MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE COMBINED WITH THE PASSAGE 
OF THE S/WV...WILL KEEP A 30 POP IN ALL LOCATIONS.

THE BIG QUESTION FOR WEDNESDAY WILL BE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A MCS ACRS 
THE UPR MS VLY LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING.  THE MESOETA 
DEVELOPS A COMPLEX IN THE MN/IOWA/WI REGION...THEN ADVECTS IT SE 
INTO THE SRN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VLY DURING THE DAY.  THE AVN IS NO 
WHERE NEAR THIS SOLUTION.  ALTHOUGH THE MESOETA IS SUPPOSED TO 
HANDLE MCS DEVELOPMENT BETTER THAN THE AVN...CONFIDENCE IS STILL LOW 
BECAUSE THE MODEL OFTEN HAS TROUBLE PLACING THE FEATURE IN THE 
CORRECT POSITION (WHICH OBVIOUSLY MAKES A BIG DIFFERENCE IN THE 
FCST).  WITH THE MESOETA/S DEVELOPMENT OF THE MCS ACRS THE UPR MS 
VLY...IT/S FORMATION OF AN MCV HAS A RIPPLING EFFECT...INFLUENCING 
OTHER OTHER PARAMETERS (LIKE SUSTAINING A 925 MB TO 850 MB LOW LVL 
JET DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY WHILE THE OTHER MODELS SHOW WEAK FLOW 
AT THESE LEVELS).  THE BEST SOLUTION AT THIS TIME IS TO KEEP A CHC 
POP IN ALL LOCATIONS FOR WEDNESDAY GIVEN THE JUICY AIRMASS.  

MOS TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE AND WILL NOT DEVIATE MUCH.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN







MIDNIGHT WORDING IN CVG GROUPING. MAY ALSO BREAK OUT A WARMER 
TEMPERATURE IN COLUMBUS OVERNIGHT WITH OUTLYING AREAS WORDING FOR 
COOLER TEMPS IN CURRENT FCST. RIGHT NOW...DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW 60S 
SHOULD SEE A SLOW RISE FROM SW-NE OVERNIGHT AS MORE MOIST AIR GETS 
ADVECTED IN WITH LLJET. MID 60S STILL LOOKS GOOD...BUT A 65-70 RANGE 
MIGHT BE BEST FOR METRO COLUMBUS.

WILL WAIT FOR THE 11 PM OBS TO COME IN TO SEE IF I WANT TO GO WITH A 
WARMER RANGE IN THE COLUMBUS ZONE GROUPING.

TDA BUT XPCT CI TO BE THIN ENUF TO WARRANT MSTLY SUNNY FCST. LLVL

MARGINAL INSTBLY TWD 12Z TUE MRNG SO WL GO WITH LOW CHC POPS FOR 
LATE TNGT ACRS THE SW...OTRWS PRTLY CLDY SKIES TNGT.

DEPENDING ON AMT OF CLOUDINESS AND PCPN FOR TUE. WITH CHC POPS IN 
MIND...CRNT THINKING IS THAT WE WL STILL SEE FAIR AMT OF SUN ON TUE 
SO WL LEAN TWD WRMR FWC TMPS FOR HIGHS.

FXUS61 KILN 151822
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EDT SUN JUL 15 2001

HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE FA ATTM WILL CONTINUE TO HOLD RAIN AT BAY 
THROUGH MONDAY.  SOUTHERLY FLOW ON BACKSIDE OF HIGH WILL BEGIN THE 
INCREASE IN MOISTURE ON MONDAY.  GOOD WARM ADVECTION AT 850 MB OVER 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT...AS 25 TO 30 KT JET CROSSES 850 
TEMPERATURES.  EXPECT POSSIBLE MCS FORMATION TO OUR WEST MONDAY 
NIGHT...AND WITH STEERING WINDS...IT COULD REACH WESTERN PARTS OF FA 
BY TUESDAY MORNING.  THIS IS SUPPORTED BY PRECIP EFFICIENCY...WHICH 
RISES TO OVER AN INCH ON BOTH ETA AND AVN...AND 850 MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE.

CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY WITH VORT 
SLIDING ACROSS AND WARM FRONT ACROSS AREA.

LAST NIGHT GOT COOLER THAN MOS...AND FEEL THAT TONIGHTS MOS IS TOO 
WARM ALSO.  WILL UNDER CUT MOS...MOST IN THE SW.

TEMPERATURES TODAY ARE STRUGGLING TO REACH MID 80 IN THE WEST...AND 
WE DONT WARM THAT MUCH FOR TOMORROW. MOS LOOKS TOO WARM AGAIN...SO 
WILL KEEP EVERYONE IN THE MID 80S TOMORROW.  MOS POPS LOOK TOO LOW 
TUESDAY...WHICH MAY BE WHY MOS HIGHS ARE SO WARM.  WITH CONVECTION 
EXPECTED...WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES TUESDAY IN THE MID 80S ALSO.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

.ILN...NONE.

SFC TEMPS.

HAVE SHOWN A LITTLE RISE IN THE PAST HOUR. EXPECT FCSTD LOWS TO BE 
GOOD...WITH READINGS A LITTLE WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT. UNLESS TEMPS 
START TO GO SOUTH...WILL NOT UPDATE JUST TO CHANGE MOSTLY CLEAR TO

AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 PM EDT SAT JUL 14 2001

SHORT TERM FORECAST REMAINS RELATIVELY QUITE.  HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WORKS ITS WAY TO THE OHIO-INDIANA BORDER 
BY 12Z SUNDAY...THEN INTO THE APPALACHIANS BY MONDAY. SHOULD SEE 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES THROUGH SUNDAY.  MODELS INDICATE POSSIBLE MCS 
DEVELOPMENT OVER THE UPPER GREAT LAKES SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT GIVEN THE 
THICKNESSES...THIS SHOULD DROP TO OUR NORTHEAST.

MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE MONDAY...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH PARTLY CLOUDY.

MOS TEMPERATURES A LITTLE COOLER TONIGHT THAN CURRENT FORECAST IN 
THE EAST.  BASED ON THE TEMPERATURES TECHNIQUES...LIKE THE COOLER 
NUMBERS.  WILL ALSO DROP TEMPERATURES A CATEGORY TO NEAR MOS NUMBERS 
SUNDAY NIGHT.

IN THE EXTENDED...AVN SUPPORTS THE IDEA OF CONVECTION DROPPING 
SOUTHEAST AROUND RIDGE ON TUESDAY.  WILL MOVE MENTION OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS UP.

THANKS TO CLE FOR THE INFO.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 120753
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
350 AM EDT THU JUL 12 2001

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH H5 CUTOFF 
LOW OVER QUEBEC AND H5 HIGH OVER TEXAS.  REGIONAL H5 FLOW WILL 
BECOME MORE NORTHERLY OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AS TROF ALONG THE 
EAST COAST AMPLIFIES. 

PERSISTENT SFC HIGH WORKING DOWN THE WEST SIDE OF THE H5 TROF WILL 
DOMINATE THROUGH SATURDAY. WITH NO PRECIP EXPECTED...FCST PROBLEMS 
WILL INVOLVE TEMPS AND CLOUD COVER.

FOR TODAY...MID CLOUDS NORTH OF CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER NORTHWESTERN 
MISSOURI ARE SPILLING INTO OUR AREA NOW.  MODELS TAKE ASSOC 700 MB 
MOISTURE SOUTH OF HERE TO TENNESSEE AS VORT MAX DROPS SOUTHEAST AND 
H5 FLOW BECOMES MORE NORTHERLY.  HOWEVER...WITH SATELLITE SHOWING 
CLOUDS HERE ALREADY WITH MORE ON THE WAY...ILL ADJUST TODAYS FCST 
TO PARTLY CLOUDY.

WITH VORT MAX DROPPING FARTHER SOUTH AND MORE DRY AIR ADVECTING DOWN 
IN H5 FLOW...ILL KEEP MOSTLY CLEAR FCST FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY.

FWC TEMPS HAVE BEEN RATHER ACCURATE LATELY.  THIS TREND SHOULD 
CONTINUE THROUGH THIS FCST WITH 1000-850 MB THICKNESSES AROUND 1390M 
IN LINE WITH FWCS UPPER 70S. CLOUDS MAY KEEP TEMPS DOWN A BIT TODAY 
THOUGH.  CLEAR NIGHTTIME SKIES WILL ALLOW READINGS TO FALL INTO THE 
MID 50S AS PER FWC.  OVERALL I WONT BE STRAYING FAR FROM 
GUIDANCE.    

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

FXUS61 KILN 120110
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
910 PM EDT WED JUL 11 2001

LATEST SAT IMAGERY SHOWING SOME HIGHER CLDS SPILLING ACROSS THE NRN 
PORTION OF FA. APPEARS SOME CHANELLED VORT ADVT IN NW FLOW PARTIALLY 
RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS. AM ALSO CONCERNED ABOUT CLDS ACROSS ERN IA. 
SOME INDICATIONS THAT MID LVL S/W ASOCIATED WITH THESE CLDS WILL 
ALSO ADVECT SEWRD TOWARD SW PORTION OF FA...ALLOWING SOME OF THIS 
CLOUDINESS TO MOVE INTO THE SW LATER TONIGHT. BOTTOM LINE IS THAT 
ANY OVERNIGHT CLOUDINESS WILL EFFECT LOW TEMPS. THUS WILL ADJUST 
FCST FOR PC CONDITIONS TONIGHT...AND WILL OPEN UP A RANGE FOR THE 
OVERNIGHT LOWS ACROSS BOTH THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE FA.

MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO
