FXUS61 KILN 111813
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
210 PM EDT WED JUL 11 2001

TRANQUIL WEEK IN STORE FOR THE OHIO VALLEY AS HIGH PRESSURE SETS UP 
CAMP. UNUSUALLY STRONG UPR LOW WILL ONCE AGAIN SETTLE OVER SE CANADA 
RESULTING IN COOL NWLY FLOW FOR AREA. MAIN QUESTION WILL BE IF ANY 
LAKE CLOUDS WILL AFFECT THE NE PART OF CWFA THU. NLY LLVL FLOW 
BECOMES MORE NWLY WHICH WOULD PUSH ANY CLOUDS AWAY FROM AREA...SO 
WILL CONTINUE WITH MOSUNNY WORDING. SOME CIRRUS COULD ALSO SPILL 
ACROSS THE SOUTH TOMORROW BUT SHOULD BE THIN ENOUGH TO NOT AFFECT 
INSOLATION.  

DWPTS REMAIN IN THE LOW TO MID 50S THROUGHOUT 60 HOURS BUT THE WIND 
SHOULD STAY UP ENOUGH TO KEEP US FROM BOTTOMING OUT OVERNIGHT. LLVL 
TEMPS BEGIN TO WARM SLIGHTLY BY FRIDAY BUT TEMPS WILL STILL BE A CAT 
OR TWO BELOW NORMAL. NGM/AVN NUMBERS ARE ALL FAIRLY SIMILAR AND WILL 
STAY CLOSE.

.ILN...NONE.

REMAIN IN THE NE. THOSE SHOULD BE EXITING THE AREA SHORTLY LEAVING 
MOSUNNY SKIES. A FEW CU COULD POP UP IN THE GOOD CAA...BUT STRONG 
SUBSIDENCE SHOULD KEEP IT AT A MINIMUM. WILL LOWER TEMPS A CAT AS 
WELL SINCE TEMPS ACTUALLY WENT DOWN LAST HOUR DUE TO STRONG LLVL 
CAA.  

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

FXUS61 KILN 110738
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 AM EDT WED JUL 11 2001

WITH H5 LOW OVER SOUTHEAST CANADA AND HIGH OVER TEXAS...NORTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT WILL CONTINUE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH FRIDAY. 
DOWNWARD MOTION WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE PERIOD.  

SFC FRONT ACROSS NORTHERN OHIO WILL MOVE THROUGH OUR FA TODAY...WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE AND SUBSTANTIALLY COOLER AND DRIER AIR TO FOLLOW.  
ANTICYCLONIC FLOW AROUND HIGH WILL DOMINATE FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF 
DAYS.  DEW POINTS IN 50S CURRENTLY WORKING INTO NORTHERN OHIO WILL 
REPLACE THE 70S DEW POINTS OF THE LAST FEW DAYS.  FCST SOUNDINGS AND 
YESTERDAYS TRENDS SUGGEST A FEW CU WILL FORM BEHIND THE FRONT AND 
NOT MUCH ELSE.  THEREFORE...ILL CONTINUE DRY FCST WITH MOSTLY SUNNY 
DAYS AND CLEAR NIGHTS.  

FWC TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK GOOD...THOUGH AVN AND ETA GUIDANCE IS 
SLIGHTLY COOLER DURING THE DAY AND WARMER AT NIGHT.  

.ILN...NONE.

IN PLACE AS THE LIMITING FACTOR.  BASED ON CURRENT RADAR TRENDS AND 
MODEL DATA...LOOKS LIKE THE EASTERN COUNTIES MIGHT HAVE BEST SHOT 
TONIGHT...SO WILL CARRY A 30 POP WEST AND 40 EAST.

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  DIDNT TRY A 
WHOLE LOT FROM FWC TEMPERATURES.  THE NEW AVN CONTINUED THE TREND 
OFF THE 00Z MRF THAT CONVECTION MIGHT DROP ACROSS IN INTO THE FA 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  WILL ADD MENTION OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
THE SOUTHWEST.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
410 AM EDT TUE JUL 10 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY...WITH CUTOFF LOW MOVING THROUGH SOUTHEAST CANADA AND RIDGE 
OVER THE ROCKIES. A COUPLE SHORT WAVES WILL AFFECT OUR REGION...THE 
FIRST THIS AFTERNOON AND THE SECOND TONIGHT. 

SFC MAP SHOWS FRONT DRAPED THROUGH THE LOWER GREAT LAKES.  FRONT IS 
DUE TO CROSS OHIO TONIGHT WITH THE SECOND SHORT WAVE...WITH MOST OF 
PVA REMAINING NORTHEAST OF OUR AREA.

MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOWING ADEQUATE INSTABILITY FOR TSRA THIS 
AFTERNOON...THOUGH THEY ARE SHOWING A RATHER STRONG CAP AT 12 KFT. 
CAP DISAPPEARS ON MODELS SOUNDINGS LATE THIS EVENING FROM AOH TO CMH 
WITH CAPE REMAINING OVER 1000 J/KG.  

ANY TSRA THAT FORM MAY APPROACH SEVERE LIMITS AS WIND FIELDS ARE 
FCST TO STRENGTHEN THIS AFTERNOON INTO THIS EVENING IN RESPONSE TO 
SECOND SHORT WAVE WITH 50+ KT SPEED MAX PROGGED AT H5 IN NORTHERN 
OHIO. SPC HAS OUTLOOKED OUR AREA IN SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE...WITH 
MODERATELY LOW SHEAR SUGGESTING DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS.

ILL KEEP FCST SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS WITH CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE NORTH 
FOR AFTERNOON TSRA.  ILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS TONIGHT WITH NO 
TIMING IN THE SOUTH.  MOSTLY SUNNY WILL STILL WORK FOR 
WEDNESDAY...WHEN HIGH PRESSURE IS DUE TO BUILD DOWN FROM CANADA  
BRINGING A DRY ANTICYCLONIC NORTHEAST FLOW.

FWC TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY GOOD...WITH COOLING TREND ON WEDNESDAY TO 
NEAR 80 FOLLOWING THE FRONT.  

.ILN...NONE.

NORTHERN IN/OH.

FRONT PUSHING ACROSS FA.  IT WILL ENTER NORTHERN FA IN THE AFTERNOON 
AND GO THROUGH THE SOUTH MORE DURING THE EVENING...SO WILL WORD 
ACCORDINGLY.

BIT WARMER.

DIFF SUGG POTENTIAL FOR ORGANIZED WIND PRODUCING TSTMS TUE AFTN/EVE.

ACRS FA THRU THE OVRNGT HRS WHILE WAA PATTERN ALSO CONTS OVRNGT WITH 
00Z ILN SNDG SHWG 48 KTS AT 700 MB. 00Z SNDG DID HAV A FAIRLY 
PRONOUNCED CAP JUST BLO 700 MB BUT CAP WEAKENS CONSIDERABLY WHEN 
MODIFIED FOR HIGHER DWPTS THAT ARE BEING ADVECTED INTO AREA. WITH 
SOME SPOTTY SHWR ACTVTY ALREADY GOING ACRS PARTS OF NRN FA...STILL 
THINK WE MAY SEE SOME DVLPMT OVRNGT SO AM RELUCTANT TO CUT BACK ON 
POPS TOO MUCH. LTST SFC ANLYS SHWG CONV BNDRY ACRS NRN IND SO THINK 
THIS MAY BE WHERE THINGS GET GOING LATE THIS EVNG AND THEN DROP SE 
ACRS FA THRU THE OVRNGT HRS. WL CONT WITH HIGH POPS OVRNGT BUT XPCT 
BEST CHC FOR PCPN TO BE ACRS N AND E PORTIONS OF FA WITH LESSER CHC 
ACRS SW WHR CAP SHUD BE A LTL STGR. PWS ALL THE WAY UP TO 1.76 
INCHES ON THE EVNG SNDG SO IF STORMS DO GET GOING CUD SEE SOME LCLLY 
HVY RAIN.
  
.ILN...NONE.

PASSAGE OF MEAN H5 TROF TODAY ALLOWS FOR BUILDING RIDGE OVER FCST 
AREA FOR A PLEASANT END OF THE WEEK BEFORE NEXT SFC COLD FRONT 
BEGINS TO AFFECT OH VLY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THIS NEXT 
FRONT IS MAIN PROBLEM WITH FCST AS ETA AND MM5 MODELS HAVE REALLY 
PUSHED IT IN A LOT QUICKER THAN NGM AND AVN MODELS.

RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY ON ETA AT H48 IS FAIRLY IMPRESSIVE...AND 
THOUGH THE ACTUAL FRONT MAY HANG BACK A LITTLE...EXPECT CONVECTIVE 
BANDS AHEAD OF IT AND POSSIBLE MCS DEVELOPMENT TO CONTINUE FROM VERY 
EARLY SAT THROUGH THE DAY. GOOD LLJET PROGGED TO SET UP AHEAD OF H8 
TROF OVER GTLKS...BUT NOT ON ALL MODELS. EXACT POSITION OF PRECIP 
AHEAD OF FRONT WOULD BE QUITE HARD TO NAIL DOWN ATTM. CURRENTLY 
THINKING HAS SOMETHING DEVELOPING NW OF FCST AREA AND DROPPING S-SE 
ON SATURDAY IN 700-300 MEAN FLOW. EXPECT DEVELOPMENT TO CONTINUE N 
OF FCST AREA WITH GOOD AXIS OF SBCAPE INTERSECTING WITH RELATIVELY 
LARGE MAXIMA OF 1000-850 THETA E AIR.

WITH THIS QUICKER SOLN IN MIND ON SATURDAY...THIS WOULD LEAD TO A 
LARGER MARGIN OF ERROR AND LOWER CONFIDENCE IN EXTENDED PERIODS. 
THOUGH EARLIER SOLN LOOKS TO BE THE WAY TO GO...SUBSTANTIAL SFC HI 
PRESSURE PROGGED TO TAKE HOLD FOR A FEW DAYS AFTER THIS SYSTEM 
PASSES...SIMILAR TO WHAT WERE EXPECTING TOMORROW. 

GUIDANCE IS RELATIVELY CLOSE...BUT WONT MENTION RECORD LOWS IN THE 
UPPER 40S...AROUND 50 OR LOW 50S LOOK BEST. EVEN WITH DRY AIR AND 
GOOD CAA...MAXIMUM DIURNAL FROM DAYTIME HIGHS TO NIGHTTIME LOWS THIS 
TIME OF YEAR SHOULD ONLY BE AROUND 25 DEGREES...30 WITH VERY STRONG 
CAA.
   
.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS







ZONE GROUPINGS COULD BE CLARIFIED A LITTLE BETTER. 

LAST RADAR RETURNS GONE FROM KILN AND EXPECT DRY AIR BEING USHERED 
IN BEHIND PRE FRONTAL OVERNIGHT CONVECTION TO SQUASH ANY CHANCES FOR 
PRECIP...EVEN IN SOUTHEAST. WILL PLAY IT SAFE HOWEVER AND NOT REMOVE 
ALL PRECIP WORDING IN SOUTHEAST...BUT CUT TO ISOLATED PM SHOWER

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EDT THU JUL 5 2001

FRONT WORKING THRU NRN OH WITH SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
CONTINUING JUST AHEAD OF IT. SOME SHOWERS FIRING NOW IN CNTRL OH AS 
WELL AS THE ONGOING CONVECTION IN SRN PART OF CWFA. THIS ACTIVITY 
CLOSELY LINES UP WITH THETA-E RIDGE SLOWLY MOVING SOUTH TOWARDS THE 
RIVER. NGM LOOKS TO BE TOO FAST WITH FROPA WHILE ETA/AVN ARE SIMILAR 
MOVING IT THROUGH THIS AFTN. QUESTION WILL BE HOW LONG CURRENT 
ACTIVITY WILL LAST AND IF WE WILL SEE ANY REDEVELOPMENT WITH DAYTIME 
HTG. WILL OPT FOR MAINLY MORNING WORDING IN THE SW AND NO TIMING IN 
THE SE WITH CHC POPS. 

DRIER AIR AND LIGHT WINDS WILL ALLOW FOR ANOTHER CHILLY NIGHT 
TONIGHT SIMIALR TO FIRST OF MONTH. THINK MDL DWPTS ARE TOO LOW AND 
WILL STICK CLOSE TO GUID TEMPS/CURRENT FCST WHICH IS ABOUT A 
CATEGORY ABOVE RECORDS. FRIDAY WILL BE A NICE DAY WITH DRY AIR STILL 
IN PLACE AND PLENTY OF SUNSHINE. 

MESOETA TRYING TO SHOW A 50 KT JET FRI NITE BRINGING A QUICK 
INCREASE IN LLVL TEMPS/MSTR WHICH WOULD POINT TO POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT. WILL KEEP FCST DRY AS AVN IS NOT NEARLY AS 
AGGRESSIVE.

ATTM.  WL LIKELY UPDATE ONCE STORMS HAVE CLEARED THE NRN MIAMI VLY.

FXUS61 KILN 041825
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EDT WED JUL 4 2001

ACTIVITY STARTING TO PICK UP ALONG COLD FRONT.  ALL MODELS TRY TO 
BRING FRONT THROUGH TONIGHT DRY...ALTHOUGH AVN IN SHOWING SOME LIGHT 
QPF...DUE TO ITS LACK ON RESOLUTION.  MAV MOS ALSO SHOWING SOME SOME 
LOW POPS.  LACK OF QPF TONIGHT...MIGHT BE BECAUSE MODELS ARE 
WEAKENING THE CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT AS IT DROPS SOUTH.

ALTHOUGH RAIN HAS STABILIZED THE THE ATMOSPHERE TODAY...WITH SUCH A 
STRONG FRONT PUSHING THROUGH...WILL KEEP MENTION OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT.  TIMING OF FRONT MIGHT BE A LITTLE 
QUICKER...SO WILL END PCPN IN THE NORTH EARLY...AND SOUTH BY 06Z.
WITH QUICKER FRONT...WILL DRY OUT THE SE TOMORROW MORNING.  HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.

MOS HAS BEEN WARMING FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...SO CURRENT FORECAST IN THE 
LOWER 50S LOOKS GOOD.  AS FOR HIGHS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WILL GO 
WITH THE WARMER MAV HIGHS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

BACK TO THE WEST. CURRENT TREND ARE THAT STRONGEST CELLS WILL STAY 
SOUTH OF CWFA AS THE SFC BOUNDARY AND MID LVL VORT ARE THERE. 
ETA/AVN CONTINUE TO BE SIMILAR BRINGING THE FRONT THROUGH TONIGHT 
INTO THU MORN. THERE LOOKS TO BE 2 ROUNDS...ONE THIS AM THEN AGAIN 
THIS AFTN INTO TONIGHT. WILL NOT GO WITH ANY TIMING AS NOT SURE HOW 
LONG MRNG CONVECTION WILL LAST. ETA SHOWING ARND 2000 J/KG AND -5 LI 
IN THE SW LATE THIS AFTN. THE BEST PUSH LOOKS TO BE JUST AFTER SS 
WHICH WILL REDUCE THE THREAT FOR SVR. BUT WE START TO ADV IN DRIER 
AIR WHICH WILL GIVE US THE CHC FOR DWNBURSTS. WILL NOT MENTION SVR 
AT THIS TIME. 

FRONT MOVES THRU TONIGHT AND DRIER COOLER AIR WORKS IN. WILL LEAVE A 
MRNG CHC IN THE SE AS FRONT SHOULD STILL BE WORKING THRU THERE. WILL 
GO WITH 50 POPS WEST/40 EAST TODAY AND TONIGHT AND A 30 THU MORNING 
SE. TEMPS WILL BE TRICKY AGAIN TDY WITH CLD COVER. WILL GO CLOSER TO 
AVN NUMBERS TDY AND BLEND REST OF PDS.

MAIN BAND OF CNVCTN HS SHIFTED S TWD FAVORABLE INSTBY AXIS. MVC

ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE HV DIMINISHED. ALL ACTIVITY IS TO THE
S CLOSER TO E-W ORIENTED FNTL BNDRY ACRS CNTRL KY. WL BREAK OFF 
NRN KY COUNTIES AND CONT MENT OF CHC OF SHWRS/TSTMS TNGT CLOSER TO
FNTL BNDRY.

IN THE WAKE OF THIS MVC SUBSIDENCE AND CLRG SHUD TAKE PLACE. LTST IR 
SATL IMGRYSHWS CLRG ACRS IN. THIS CLRG WL WORK INTO OH LATER TNGT. 
WL ADJUST TMPS DOWN A LTL IN THE S ACCOUNTING FOR THIS CLRG. XPCT 
PATCHY FOG TO CONT TO DVLP DUE TO WET GRND...LITTLE SUNSHINE TO DRY 
OUT...LGT WNDS AND CLRG.

AMPLIFIED FLO PTN TO CONT ACRS THE U.S. WITH RDGG OVR THE W AND
TROF OVR THE E. VORTEX OVR HUDSON/S BAY TO DROP SE ACRS SRN CAN
AND TWD GRTLKS. CDFNT TO DROP THRU OH VLY WED NGT. AHD OF THIS FNT 
AMS WL BCM MODERATELY UNSTBL WITH SB CAPES BTWN 2000-2500 J/KG. 
XPCT SCTD TSTMS TO DVLP AGN ON WED WITH MAIN EMPHASIS DURG AFTN HRS. 
CURR FCST FOR WED LOOKS GOOD WITH MENT OF CHC OF TSTMS.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 031859
AFDILN



AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
258 PM EDT TUE JUL 3 2001

WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL PERSIST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY UNTIL LATE 
THURSDAY AS VIGOROUS H5 CUTOFF SPINS THROUGH SOUTHEASTERN CANADA. 
SHORT WAVE COMING OUR WAY FROM ILLINOIS WILL MOVE IN THIS 
EVENING...WITH OTHER SHORT WAVES DUE TO INFLUENCE OUR AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  

SFC MAP SHOWS OUR AREA EXPERIENCING THETA-E ADVECTION ON THE EAST 
SIDE OF HIGH MOVING OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST.  MCS IS MOVING 
THROUGH INDIANA INTO OHIO ROUGHLY ALONG THETA-E GRADIENT.  

FOR TONIGHT...ILL GO WITH EVENING PERIOD FOR CURRENT TSRA...THEN 
CHANCE POPS OVERNIGHT. INSTABILITY WILL PERSIST ON WEDNESDAY... 
WITH PVA AND SFC CONVERGENCE SO ILL KEEP CHANCE POPS.  

NEXT SHORT WAVE ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WILL MAINLY AFFECT 
OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES.  ILL GO WITH CHANCE TSRA ALL ZONES WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT WITH FRONT DUE TO CROSS THE AREA ACCOMPANIED BY PVA. FOR 
THURSDAY...ILL KEEP WEST CENTRAL ZONE DRY...USE MAINLY MORNING 
WORDING FOR CHANCE TSRA DAY AND CMH...AND I WONT INCLUDE ANY TIMING 
IN THE SOUTH WHERE FRONT IS PROGGED ACROSS THE AREA FOR A GOOD PART 
OF THE DAY.

FWC TEMPS LOOK A BIT WARM TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...THEN TOO COOL 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...SO ILL ADJUST THEM ACCORDINGLY.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 AM EDT TUE JUL 3 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS WEST-NORTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY 
WITH SHORT WAVES FROM MICHIGAN BACK TO IOWA. SFC MAP HAS AREA IN 
SOUTHERLY FLOW WITH HIGH OFF THE DELAWARE COAST.  TSRA ARE OCCURRING 
IN THE NORTHWEST PART OF OUR CWA ALONG LEADING EDGE OF 500 MB PVA AS 
IT INTERFACES 850 MB THETA-E RIDGE/WIND MAX.

MESOETA SHOWS 850 MB WINDS RELAXING BY AFTERNOON...SO CURRENT 
ACTIVITY SHOULD DIE OUT CONSIDERABLY.  ILL KEEP SCT/CHANCE POPS ALL 
ZONES FOR AFTERNOON FCST AS SCT TSRA SHOULD FORM WITH 
MOISTURE...TEMP AND VORT ADVECTION OCCURRING IN THE PRESENCE OF 
LEFTOVER BOUNDARIES. 

FCST TEMPS VARYING FROM 75-80 NORTHWEST TO MID 80S SOUTHEAST WILL 
STILL WORK...WITH CLOUDS KEEPING IT COOLER IN THE NORTH. ILL UPDATE 
NOW TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING...WITH UPDATE TO RAISE POPS POSSIBLE 
LATER IF CURRENT TSRA TO OUR NORTHWEST PERSIST LONGER THAN I EXPECT.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 030744
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EDT TUE JUL 3 2001

AVN/ETA IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE SHORT TERM. 
DIFFERENCES IN STRENGTH OF VORT/LIFT EXIST BUT THINK BOTH ARE BEING 
CONTAMINATED SOMEWHAT. COMPLEX CURRENTLY OVER THE PLAINS AND 
CONVECTION FIRING NEAR WARMFRONT SHOULD DECREASE AFTER SUNRISE BUT 
FRONT WILL MAKE SE PROGRESS DURING THE DAY. AREA WILL SEE GOOD MSTR 
ADV AS WELL AS LLVL WAA. AS THE AMS DESTABILIZES THIS AFTN...WE 
SHOULD SEE SOME STORMS FIRE ALONG WK BOUNDARY WHICH SHOULD BE IN THE 
WRN HALF OF CWFA. SOME WK SFC CONVERGENCE ALSO LOOKS TO EXTEND INTO 
NE OH SO WILL ADD A CHC THERE AS WELL FOR THIS AFTN. STORMS WILL 
LINGER INTO THE EVE WHEN THE QUESTION BECOMES WHETHER ANOTHER 
COMPLEX WILL DEVLOP. WOULD LIKE TO SEE A LLVL JET IN ADDITION TO THE 
THETA-E ADV BUT STILL THINK A COMPLEX COULD FORM OVER WRN INDIANA 
AND TRACK INTO SW CWFA. BUT WITH UNCERTAINTY WILL ONLY GO 50 POP 
SOUTH/40 NORTH WITH NO TIMING MENTIONED. ANOTHER VORT MOVES THROUGH 
IN NW FLOW FOR WED AFTN AND WILL GO 40 POP WITH JUICY AMS IN PLACE. 
WILL ADD CHC POPS SOUTH WED NITE AS FRONT IS SLOWER MOVING THRU. 

AS FOR TEMPS...WILL BUMP UP HIGHS TDY IN THE SOUTH AS THICKNESSES 
INCREASE. WILL GENERALLY STICK CLOSE TO FWC GUID AS MAV NUMBERS LOOK 
TOO WARM ON THE 4TH.     

THANKS CLE/SDF FOR COORD.

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

454 
FXUS61 KILN 030135
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
935 PM EDT MON JUL 2 2001

SFC HIGH PRESSURE WAS SPRAWLED FROM EASTERN OHIO THROUGH THE 
DELMARVA PENINSULA THIS EVENING.  THE HIGH WILL MOVE OFF TO THE EAST 
OVERNIGHT.  MEANWHILE...THE REGION REMAINS UNDER A NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...WITH A FEW EMBEDDED WEAK S/WVS PRODUCING SOME MID AND HIGH 
LVL CLOUDINESS.

CURRENT MID TO HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS IS THIN AND SHOULD MOVE OFF TO 
THE EAST OF THE CWFA.  ADDITIONAL MID AND HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS TO THE 
NORTH AND WEST ACRS THE MIDDLE AND UPR MS VLY SHOULD NOT ARRIVE HERE 
UNTIL LATE TONIGHT OR BY SUNRISE.  THUS...MOSTLY CLEAR FCST STILL 
LOOKS GOOD.  GIVEN LIGHT EASTERLY FLOW AND THE POTENTIAL FOR LIGHT 
VLY MIST IN WHICH TEMPS/DEWPOINTS COOL AT THE SAME RATE...I WILL 
OPEN A TEMPERATURE RANGE OF 50 TO 55 ALL LOCATIONS.

DEEPER MSTR BEGINS TO INCREASE TOMORROW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
HIGH.  LOOKING AT MODEL SOUNDINGS...LOW CHC THUNDERSTORM POTENTIAL 
IS STILL POISED FOR THE NWRN CWFA...MAINLY LATE.  I MAY REMOVE THE 
CHC FROM THE CVG GROUP AS SOUNDINGS NOT UNSTABLE HEAR UNTIL EVENING.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN


















094 
FXUS61 KILN 021847
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
248 PM EDT MON JUL 2 2001

AREA IS UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH H5 TROF OFF THE NEW ENGLAND 
COAST AND H5 HIGH OVER THE GREAT BASIN.  UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME 
WESTERLY ON TUESDAY AS ANOTHER H5 LOW MOVES TOWARD JAMES BAY CANADA.

SFC HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST TONIGHT...WITH PRESSURE FALLING 
GRADUALLY UNTIL THE NEXT COLD FRONT ARRIVES ON WEDNESDAY.  THE NEXT 
FRONT WILL NOT BE AS POTENT AS THE LAST...WITH THE AIR BEHIND THE 
FRONT NOT EXPECTED TO BE MUCH COOLER THAN AHEAD OF IT.

WITH HIGH STILL INFLUENCING THE AREAS WEATHER TONIGHT...ILL 
CONTINUE TREND OF PREVIOUS FCST WITH MOSTLY CLEAR.  MODELS DIVE THE 
NEXT SHORT WAVE SOUTHWEST OF HERE LATE ON TUESDAY.  ILL KEEP CHANCE 
AFTERNOON TSRA ON TUESDAY IN OUR WESTERN COUNTIES...BUT NOT IN THE 
EAST AWAY FROM THE SHORT WAVES INFLUENCE.  ILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS 
ALL ZONES TUESDAY NIGHT WITH DEEP MOISTURE AND VORTICITY ADVECTING 
ACROSS THE AREA.  SFC BOUNDARY MOVING ACROSS THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY 
IN THE PRESENCE OF INSTABILITY AND SOME MOISTURE WILL WARRANT CHANCE 
POPS THEN AS WELL.

TEMPS ARE RUNNING BELOW FWC TODAY AND I EXPECT THIS TREND TO 
CONTINUE.  WITH CHILLY AIR STILL TO THE WEST (65 AT STL/17Z) ILL 
KEEP FCST TEMPS BELOW FWC THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

THAT PRODUCED YESTERDAYS TSRA HAS MOVED SOUTH.

THERE ARE SOME CU AROUND BUT THEY WILL LIKELY DISSIPATE BY AFTERNOON 
AS BOUNDARY LAYER MIXES WITH DRY AIR ALOFT.  HIGH TEMP FCST IN 70S 
ALSO LOOKS FINE AFTER EXAMINING SOUNDING.

083 
FXUS61 KILN 020802
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
402 AM EDT MON JUL 2 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR KRFD BUILDING 
INTO FA.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS SOME PESKY MID AND HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS OVER FA WHICH SHOULD PREVENT RECORD LOWS THIS MORNING...BUT 
WE WILL HAVE TO WAIT AND SEE.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC SITUATION.  
THE AVN IS A BIT STRONGER AND SHARPER WITH UPPER LOW JUST SOUTH OF 
HUDSON BAY LATTER IN THE FORECAST PERIOD.  THE BIGGEST DIFFERENCE 
FOR FA IS TIMING OF CONVECTION.  ETA BRINGS UPPER LEVEL JET OVER 
GREAT LAKES 48 TO 60 HOURS OUT WHICH IN RESPONSE BRINGS A 40 KT LOW 
LEVEL JET AND SOME INSTABILITY TUESDAY NIGHT.  AVN HOWEVER IS 
QUICKER WITH THESE FEATURES BRINGING CONVECTION INTO WESTERN FA BY 
00Z.  HPC IS LEANING TOWARD ETA SOLUTION.  BUT TO CONSISTENCY WITH 
THE  FORECAST WILL KEEP CURRENT 30 POP IN FOR TUESDAY AS TIMING IS 
STILL IN QUESTION.  THIS MAY NEED TO BE CUT OUT WITH NEXT MODEL RUN.

COLD FRONT FOR JULY 4TH APPEARS TO PUSH THROUGH NORTHWESTERN FA BY 
MID AFTERNOON AND MAY LINGER IN THE SOUTHEAST THROUGH EVENING.  WILL 
TRY TO ADJUST WORDING PER THIS THINKING.

FWC NOT IN TOO BAD OF SHAPE TODAY COMPARED TO YESTERDAY.  WILL GO A 
BIT WARMER TODAY AS LOCAL TECHNIQUES PRODUCE TEMPERATURES GENERALLY 
A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER THAN FWC.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

FXUS61 KILN 020111
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
910 PM EDT SUN JUL 1 2001

SHOWERS ARE JUST ABOUT OUT OF THE CWFA ATTM...SO WILL HAVE TO UPDATE 
FCST TO REMOVE PCPN.  THERE ARE A FEW OTHER CONCERNS WITH THIS 
UPDATE PACKAGE.  FIRST OF ALL...IR SATELLITE SHOWS CIRRUS CLOUDS 
FROM IOWA/IL/IN MOVING SE INTO THE CWFA.  BELIEVE THIS CLOUD DECK 
WILL STICK AROUND UNTIL LATE TONIGHT.  ALSO...I AM A LITTLE 
CONCERNED ABOUT FOG..ESPECIALLY SOUTH WHERE THE DRIER AIR ACRS THE 
NORTH HAS NOT ADVECTED INTO THIS REGION AS OF YET.  SOME PATCHY FOG 
WILL LIKELY FORM...BUT FEEL THAT THE DRIER AIR WILL HELP MIX THE FOG 
AWAY WITH TIME...SO WILL NOT MENTION IN THE ZONES.  

ZONES HAVE RECORD WORDING FOR TONIGHT/S LOWS.  THESE MAY NOT BE 
REACHED GIVEN THE CIRRUS CLOUDS MOVING IN.  HOWEVER...WILL GO AHEAD 
AND LEAVE THE NEAR RECORD WORDING (IT MAY COME WITHIN 2 DEGREES) AND 
TWEAK TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT WTH FROPA IN SRN FA BTWN 00Z-03Z. LOOKS LIKE 
SRN ZONES WL HAVE EVE SHRA/TSRA BEFORE EVENTUAL CLEARING...SO WL 
INCLUDE AN EVE OR THROUGH MIDNT HERE.

MDLS ALSO AGREE ON BRINGING IN RETURN FLOW SHRA FOR TUE. AM LEANING 
TWD AVN MOS TMPS FOR SHORT TERM...WTH NR RECORD LOWS TNGT AND HIGHS 
IN MID 70S MON.

930 AM EDT SUN JUL 1 2001

SFC FNT NOW ALNG OH/MI BORDER AND INTO NRN IN...WTH LINE OF 
CONVECTION DVLPNG AHD OF FNT ACRS IWX AND CLE AREA. BAND SEEMS TO 
HAVE A MORE RAPID ERLY MOVEMENT THAN SRLY...THOUGH NEW DVLPMT 
OCCURRING ALNG SRN EDGE. LOOKS LIKE SHOULD ENTER LIM GROUP BY 11 AM.

WTH LINE FILLING IN...WL UPDATE NRN ZONE TO LKLY...BUT KEEP TIMING 
UNTIL MID AFTN. LIKE CRNT WORDING AND CHOICE OF AREA FOR SEVR 
MTN...AS WELL AS MTN BEING MAINLY WIND DAMAGE. WB0 IS 11.6K FT...SO 
LOOKS LIKE MAIN THREAT WL BE WND. 

FOR ILN FA...LOOKS LIKE EARLY AFTN IS WHEN THINGS WL KICK OFF FOR 
POTL SEVR IN ESPCY CNTRL OH...AND LATE AFTN FOR CVG/PMH AREA. LOOKS 
LIKE THREAT FOR SEVR SHOULD BE THROUGH FA AROUND 00Z.

FXUS61 KILN 010806
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
405 AM EDT SUN JUL 1 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES MAINLY MID TO HIGH LEVEL SCATTERED 
CLOUDS OVER FA.  SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES PRE-FRONTAL TROF 
ENTERING NORTHWEST OHIO WITH COLD FRONT FROM NORTHERN GREAT LAKES TO 
AROUND MN/IA BORDER.

MODELS ARE DESCENT AGREEMENT.  COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH FA 
BETWEEN 18 AND 00Z.  500 MB LOW WILL MOVE FROM NORTHERN GREAT LAKES 
INTO NEW ENGLAND BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.  DPROG/DT INDICATES COLD 
FRONT SHARPER WITH THIS RUN BUT WITH SIMILAR TIMING WITH THE 
PREVIOUS TWO RUNS.

SEVERAL CONCERNS WITH THIS PACKAGE.  FIRST IS AFTERNOON CONVECTION.  
THERE WILL LIKELY BE SOME SEVERE STORMS WITH ETA INDICATING 18Z LIS 
OF -6...CAPE >2000 J/KG...WBZ 10 TO 11 KFT AND SFC DELTA THETA E 
FROM BUFKIT INDICATING >25 DEGREE DIFFERENCE.  WITH THESE 
PARAMETERS WILL HIGHLIGHT WIND THREAT ACROSS SOUTHERN AND EASTERN 
FA IN ZONES.  FWC HIGHS 3 TO 5 DEGREES TO COOL TODAY SO WILL WARM 
UP.

STRONG HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN LATE TODAY INTO TONIGHT ACROSS FA 
BRINGING WITH IT NEAR RECORD LOWS.  FWC IS FORECASTING RECORDS BUT 
WILL BE A BIT MORE CONSERVATIVE AND GO WITH AROUND RECORD WORDING.

HIGH PUSHES TO OUR EAST ON MONDAY ALLOWING FOR RETURN FLOW AND AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER AND PERHAPS A SHOWER.  WILL LEAVE OUT FOR 
NOW BUT LATTER SHIFTS WILL HAVE TO MONITOR.  
 
MISILN SENT TO ALL.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

WV IMGRY SHWS SHARP MID LVL TROF OVR SRN CAN JUST N OF MN. THIS
TROF TO SWING THRU GRTLKS ON SUN. ASSOCIATED CDFNT ACRS NRN WI
WITH PRE-FRONTAL TROF OVR LWR MI AND FAR SE WI. SHEARED OUT 
VORT TO TRACK ACRS THE FAR S OVRNGT WHICH WL PROVIDE WK UVM.
WL KEEP A SLGT CHC OF SHWRS AND PERHAPS A TSTM OVR THE S AND
CNTRL. CNVCTN OVR NRN IL/SRN WI ASSOCIATED WITH PRE-FRONTAL TROF
MAY MAKE IT INTO FAR N LT TNGT. SO WL KEEP LO POP CHC GOING IN
FAR NRN GRP. LTL CHANGE XPCTD TO OVRNGT LO TEMPS.
   
MODELS GENERALLY SIMILAR WITH SFC CDFNT PUSHING INTO THE N DURG
MRNG AND THRU SRN OH BY EVE. CAPES INCRS TO ARND 1600 J/KG AHD OF 
THE FNT WITH SFC DWPTS NR 70 DEGS. BEST DYNAMICS AND PRECIP 
OVR ERN SECTIONS SUN AFTN. LKLY EVENT LOOKS REASONABLE DUE TO 
ANTICIPATED ISTBY AND STRENGTH OF FNT.
 
.ILN...NONE.

000 
FXUS61 KILN 301845
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EDT SAT JUN 30 2001

KILN SHOWING WIDEL SCT MAINLY SHRA...BUT PRETTY GOOD AREA OF SHRA IN 
SE OH ATTM. WL PUT AN EVE CHC ALL GROUPS...THERE MAY BE A NEED FOR 
AN OVERNIGHT POP...BUT HARD TO SAY WHERE ACTIVITY WILL LAST THROUGH 
MUCH OF THE NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...EVE PD ALL GROUPS...AND WL HAVE TO 
LET UPDATE CREW DECIDE IF TNGT WL GET A POP. 

AVN AND ETA FAIRLY SIMILAR...WTH AVN STRNGR WTH THE SFC FNT PUSHING 
THRU FCST AREA SUN. AS A RESULT...AVN MOS HAS HIGHER POPS FOR SUN. 
WL GO LIKELY ALL AREAS. GOING WTH AN AVN/ETA BLEND...TENDING A LTL 
CLOSER TO THE MORE RUN TO RUN CONSISTENT AVN. WL GO CLOSER TO AVN ON 
POPS FOR SUN...WTH A 60% ALL AREAS. WL MTN MAINLY THROUGH EARLY AFTN 
IN NRN GROUP...AS IT LOOKS LIKE LATE AFTN SUN WL DRY OUT THIS AREA.

IN CNTRL AND SRN GROUPING ON SUN...THIS IS WHERE BEST INSTABY 
RESIDES...MAINLY CNTRL OH AND POINTS E. WL ONLY MTN SHRA/TSRA FOR 
SUN IN DAY/CMH GROUPS...AND MTN A CHC FOR EVENING SHRA/TSRA IN S AS 
PE STILL HIGH ACRS THE S BY 00Z.

FOR SUN NT...WL GO SLIGHTLY HIER THAN AVN MOS...AS AVN IS HINTING 
TWD NR RECORD LOWS. WL GO MAINLY NR 50 N TO LWR 50S CNTRL AND S. MON 
LOOKS TO BE A GREAT COOL DAY...WTH HIGHS IN MID 70S.

.ILN...NONE.

JDR

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
350 AM EDT SAT JUN 30 2001

KILN SHOWING A COUPLE ISOLATED SHOWERS JUST SOUTH OF MGY AND JUST 
NORTHEAST OF RICHMOND.  THESE SHOWERS HAVE FORMED IN AN AREA OF 
MOISTURE CONVERGENCE.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING SCATTERED CLOUD 
COVER OVER SOUTHERN FA.  WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWING UPPER LOW OVER 
MO/AR...WHICH IS NEAR THE SAME SPOT AS 24 HOURS AGO.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT.  ONLY SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCE IS 
THAT AVN IS A BIT STRONGER WITH 500 MB TROF OVER NORTHERN GREAT 
LAKES AT 36 TO 48 HOURS.  DPROG/DT INDICATES THIS IS CLOSER TO 2 
RUNS AGO WITH THE 12Z RUN BEING THE WEAKEST WITH THIS FEATURE.  
DROG/DT ON THE ETA INDICATES THAT 500 MB TROF AND SURFACE FRONT ARE 
SHARPER AND STRONGER FOR SUNDAY.

UPPER LOW FINALLY BEGINS ITS DEMISE AS IT GETS PULLED INTO NORTHERN 
JET LATTER TODAY INTO SUNDAY.  AS LOW SHEARS APART SHORT WAVE AXIS 
WILL REMAIN OVER FA TODAY.  PROGGED SOUNDINGS INDICATE CAPE WILL BE 
AROUND 1000 J/KG.  BELIEVE HOWEVER THAT IT WILL BE CLOSER TO 1500 TO 
2000 J/KG AS ETA LAST NIGHT UNDER DID 00Z BY A FACTOR OF 2.  THIS 
SHOULD CREATE A BIT MORE COVERAGE THAN THIS EVENING.  BETTER THREAT 
OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS STRONG COLD FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH.  LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH FRONT WILL COME MAINLY FROM 
THE COLD AIR PUSHING QUICKLY SOUTH.  PES SUNDAY AFTERNOON ARE 
GREATER THAN 1.2 WITH SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE.  WILL KEEP 
50 POPS ACROSS THE NORTH AND UP THE 40 ACROSS THE SOUTH TO 50 AS 
FRONT IS A BIT FASTER THAN LAST RUN.

FWC TEMPS LOOK IN DESCENT SHAPE.  THE ONLY MAJOR CHANGE WILL COME IN 
THE 4TH PERIOD WHERE A CAT COOLER SEEMS REASONABLE CONSIDERING THE 
STRENGTH OF HIGH.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.  IFPS PROBLEMS SO RUNNING A BIT LATE.   

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
337 AM EDT FRI JUN 29 2001

KILN SHOWS CONVECTION HAS DIED OFF.  WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS UPPER 
LOW OVER MO/AR WITH A JET STREAK POKING INTO SW FA.  SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS WEAK HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL OF FA.

MODELS ARE ALL IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT.  ONLY REAL DISCREPANCY IS 
AROUND 60 HRS WHERE AVN IS SLOWER WITH ITS 500 MB TROF AND BRINGING 
ITS SURFACE LOW SOUTH.  THIS IS ALSO A TREND WHEN LOOKING AT 
DROG/DT.  HOWEVER ETA LINES UP BETTER WITH LATEST UKMET AND ECMWF.  
WILL GO WITH COMPROMISE AT THE MOMENT WITH THIS LATTER FEATURE.

CONVECTION FORECAST IS RATHER TOUGH.  BOTH ETA/AVN POKE ANOTHER 250 
MB JET STREAK INTO FA BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z THIS EVENING.  WITH SOME 
MARGINAL INSTABILITY 500 TO 1000 J/KG WILL PUT A 20 POP IN THE SOUTH 
FOR LATE THIS AFTERNOON.  THIS MAY OCCUR MORE IN THE EVENING BUT 
WILL HOLD IT TO ONE PERIOD AT THIS TIME.  INSTABILITY ON SATURDAY 
WILL BE ABOUT A 1000 J/KG MORE BUT AT THE MOMENT NO REAL KICKER 
BESIDES A SHEAR OUT WAVE.  AS A RESULT OF THE BETTER INSTABILITY 
WILL PUT 30 POP SINCE IF ONE GETS GOING WE WILL PROBABLY HAVE 
SCATTERED COVERAGE.  THE BEST THREAT BY FAR IS SUNDAY AS NORTHERN 
JET STREAM GETS IN THE ACT AND BRINGS A DESCENT COLD FRONT FOR THIS 
TIME OF YEAR THROUGH FA.

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS FOR FWC 
BIASES.  CLOUD COVER WILL BE MORE EXTENSIVE ON SATURDAY (BUT STILL 
PC) SO WILL DROP TEMPS 2 TO 3 DEGREES.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
948 AM EDT WED JUN 27 2001

12Z UA/SFC DATA INDCIATES ATMOS A LITTLE MORE UNSTABLE THAN YDAY.  
MID LVL TEMPS A DEG C OR SO COOLER...AND SFC DWPTS A FEW DEG HIER.
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY INDCS SHORT WAVE MOVED ACRS THE CWFA EARLIER 
THIS MORNING...PROVIDING ENUF WEAK FORCING FOR WDLY SCT CONVECTION.
LATEST SHORT RANGE GUID SUGGESTS A BIT OF MID LVL WARMING IN THE LEE 
OF THIS FTR TDY...BUT MODIFYING THE 12Z SOUNDING STILL YIELDS CAPE 
AOA 1500 J/KG.  STILL LACKING A STRONG FOCUSING MECHANISM...BUT ENUF 
WEAK VORT CENTERS ROTATING ARND UPER LOW TO HELP ENHANCE ACTIVITY 
FROM TIME TO TIME.  AT ANY RATE...TUF TO NAIL DOWN PCPN CVRG THIS 
AFTN.  BEST MSTR...AS EVIDENCED BY GOES SOUNDER AND SFC DATA WL BE 
NORTH OF THE OHIO RIVER...WHILE STEEPEST LAPSE RATES REMAIN OVER THE 
SW.  GIVEN DEGREE OF INSTABILITY WL RAISE POPS INTO CHC CAT (30) ALL 
ZONES.  HV ALSO MADE MINOR DOWNWARD TEMP ADJUSTMENTS OVER THE WEST 
AND SOUTH AS LLVL THICKNESS DONT SUPPORT THE HIGH END OF CURRENT 
RANGE...OTHW PREV FCSTS LK GD.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

NOT MUCH TO FIND IN WX FIELDS TO SUGGEST ONGOING CONVECTION IN

MEANDERING WEST...CANT RULE OUT ISOLATED/WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS 
OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...ESPECIALLY WITH EMBEDDED SHORTWAVES RIDING 
AROUND LOW. LOOKS LIKE MORE OF THE SAME. CAPES TODAY APPROACHING 
1300 AND STILL REACHING AROUND 1000 ON FRIDAY...WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE 
OR WIDELY SCATTERED POPS DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS AND LET CHANCES 
DIE OUT DURING THE OVERNIGHT. 

TEMPS CONTINUE TO BE CLOSE AND WILL NOT MAKE ANY BIG CHANGES.

SOUTHERN FA OVERNIGHT.  AS A RESULT 20/30 POP IN THE SOUTH AND EAST 
LOOKS GOOD.  OVERNIGHT LOWS ALSO LOOK REASONABLE AS TDS ARE IN THE 
LOWER TO MIDDLE 60S.

MDLS CONT TO SHOW GOOD RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY WITH THE RETROGRADING 
UPR LOW. BUT THE MULTITUDE OF VORTS ROTATING AROUND IT ARE NOT BEING

IS CURRENTLY OVER ERN TN. THE QUESTION IS HOW FAR NORTH WILL ITS 
EFFECTS BE SEEN. WILL GO WITH A 30 POP IN THE SOUTH OVERNIGHT WITH A 
20 IN THE CMH GRP. ON WEDNESDAY THE UPR IS FARTHER WEST BUT DOES 
HAVE ANOTHER VORT SWINGING THRU THE WEST. THE SW WILL HAVE THE 
BETTER CHC SO WILL GO WITH 30 THERE AND 20 DAY GRP FOR AFTN 
CONVECTION. BY THU THE UPR LOW IS IN THE OZARKS AND LLVL RIDGING IS 
ALLOWING FOR GOOD SUBSIDENCE. WILL WITH PERSISTENCE AS FOAR AS TEMPS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
208 AM EDT TUE JUN 26 2001

SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER SRN AND WRN WV SHOULD CONTINUE TO 
SLOWLY WEAKEN BEFORE COMING BACK INTO CWA FROM SOUTHEAST BY MORNING. 
MESOETA SHOWING A WEAK JETLET AT H8 OVER WRN WV THAT SHOULD HELP TO 
KEEP CONVECTION GOING INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. WEAK UPPER LEVEL 
DIVERGENCE IS COUPLED WITH THIS LOWER JET BY 18Z...THEN THE DYNAMICS 
FIZZLE. VORT MOVES THORUGH ERN CWA AND STRETCHES TO JUST ABOUT 
NOTHING BETWEEN 18 AND 0Z. LIS NEGATIVE FOR MUCH OF THE DAY WITH 
CONCENTRATION OVER SOUTHWEST 2/3 OF CWA. 

THREAT FOR PRECIP AFTER THIS PM SHOULD RESIDE MAINLY W OF FCST AREA 
AND WILL NOT MENTION ATTM FOR TONIGHT. PRECIP WATER STAYS OVER AN 
INCH THROUGH WEDNESDAY...AND INVERSION THAT SETS UP TONIGHT WILL 
LIKELY INHIBIT A MAJORITY OF THE SHOWERS THAT TRY TO GO WITH DAYTIME 
HEATING TOMORROW...BUT SWRN HALF OF FA COULD SEE ONE OR TWO HEAVY 
RAINERS CROP UP. COVERAGE SHOULD BE LOW...20 TO 30 PERCENT. 

TEMPS LOOK TO BE A LITTLE INVERTED TODAY WITH HIGHS TO THE NORTH A 
FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN IN THE SOUTH UNDER THE CLOUDIER SKIES. WILL 
STAY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE THROUGH THE FIRST FEW PERIODS AND WARM 
EVERYBODY BY A FEW DEGREES TOMORROW.

BASICALLY...ONLY SOME MINOR CHANGES TO PREVIOUS FCST.  

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

OVER KY ARE SLOWLY WORKING NW AND MDLS ARE SHOWING AN INCREASE IN 
PRECIP EFFS IN THE SOUTH...ESP AFTER MIDNIGHT. A WK VORT LOBE ALSO 
LOOKS TO AFFECT THEM SO WILL ADD A 30 POP TO THE SOUTH FOR MAINLY 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. TOMORROW LOOKS TO BE THE BEST CHC OF RAIN IN THE 
SHORT TERM SO WILL GO 40 SOUTH/30 NORTH FOR TSRA. SOME SHOWERS ARE 
POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT BUT THINK THE MAJORITY WILL BE DIURNAL SO WILL 
KEEP IT DRY. AS THE UPR LOW HEADS TOWARD PAH WED...TSRA SHOULD BE 
CONFINED TO THE SOUTH. 

AS FOR TEMPS...GUID NUMBERS ARE CLOSE AND PERSISTENCE LOOKS TO BE 
THE WAY TO GO. WILL GO A LITTLE WARMER IN THE NE ON WED AS SFC HIGH 
RETROGRADES AND LLVL THICKNESSES ARE A LITTLE HIGHER THERE.

ADD EVE PD HERE.

DIURNAL CU FIELD TO DISSIPATE THIS EVE WITH LOSS OF HEATING. SFC
HI PRES FM IN THRU OH TO PROVIDE LGT WNDS. LGT WNDS AND CLR SKIES
SHUD LED TO ANOTHER COOL NGT. HV ADJUSTED GUID TEMPS DWN SVRL DEGS
TNGT.

CUTOFF LO TO DRIFT SLOWLY W THRU THE TN VLY THRU MID WEEK. XPCT
A FAIR AMT OF SUNSHINE AGN ON MON. FCST SOUDNINGS SUGG THAT MOST
OF THE AREA SHUD BE CAPPED INHIBITING CNVCTN. COLDEST TEMPS ALOFT
AND BEST LO LVL MSTR WL BE LOCATED OVR S CNTRL OH/NE KY. WL OPT
FOR SILENT 20 POP HERE. LO LVL THICKNESS AND H8 TEMPS SUGG TEMPS
COOLER THAN GUID. THEREFORE WL GO WITH HI/S SVRL DEG/S COOLER THAN 
GUID VALUES.

S/WV TO WRAP ARND UPR LO INTO OH VLY ON TUE WITH AN INCRS IN MSTR.
SB CAPES INCRS TO ABV 1000 J/KG TUE AFTN WITH BEST INSTBY OVR THE
S WHERE THE COLDEST TEMPS ALOFT WL EXIST. WRM AIR IN THE MID LVL
SHUD CONT TO INHIBIT CNVCTN IN THE NRN MIAMI VLY. WL TREND PRECIP
CHC/S FROM 40 PERCENT IN THE S TO TO 30 PERCENT IN THE CNTRL TO 
20 FAR N. AGN GUID VALUES APPEAR TOO WRM ESPECIALLY WITH MORE CLDS
AND THE THREAT OF PRECIP.

FXUS61 KILN 240756
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
355 AM EDT SUN JUN 24 2001


SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY THIS 
MORNING. THE UPPER LOW PRESSURE TROF HAS MOVED A BIT FURTHER EAST TO 
EASTERN OH/KY. LATEST SATELLITE INDICATES LITTLE IN THE WAY OF 
CLOUDS OVER THE FA AND LATEST SURFACE OBS REPORTING FOG IN SOME 
LOCATIONS WITH VISIBILITIES DOWN TO 1/4 TO 1/2 MILE IN SPOTS. EXPECT AN 
INCREASE IN THE FOG AS SUNRISE APPROACHES. WILL MENTION PATCHY DENSE 
FOG IN ZONES TIL MID AM. 

MODELS SIMILAR IN FORECASTING UPPER LEVEL TROF TO REMAIN NEARLY 
STATIONARY THROUGH TODAY FOLLOWED BY THE LOW CUTTING OFF SOUTH OF 
THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT. THE CUTOFF LOW IS THEN FORECAST TO SLOWLY 
DRIFT WEST THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. WITH THE EXPECTED LOCATION OF 
UPPER TROF TODAY...WILL FORECAST LOW CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON SOUTHEAST ZONES. WITH CUTOFF LOW IN 
VICINITY OF SOUTHERN ZONES MONDAY...WILL FORECAST CHANCE 
PRECIPITATION MONDAY AFTERNOON IN THOSE AREAS.

WILL GO A LITTLE BELOW MOS TEMPS TODAY AND TONIGHT. MADE FEW CHANGES 
FROM CURRENT FORECAST AS IT LOOKS ON TRACK. WITH CUTOFF LOW EXPECTED 
TO HANG AROUND THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK...IT LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL 
BE CHANCE OF MAINLY DAYTIME SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH MOST OF 
THE EXTENDED.

MISILN ALREADY OUT.


.ILN...NONE.

PARKER

DRIFT WEST THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. WITH THE EXPECTED LOCATION OF 
UPPER TROF TODAY...WILL FORECAST LOW CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON SOUTHEAST ZONES. WITH CUTOFF LOW IN 
VICINITY OF SOUTHERN ZONES MONDAY...WILL FORECAST CHANCE 
PRECIPITATION MONDAY AFTERNOON IN THOSE AREAS.

WILL GO A LITTLE BELOW MOS TEMPS TODAY AND TONIGHT. MADE FEW CHANGES 
FROM CURRENT FORECAST AS IT LOOKS ON TRACK. WITH CUTOFF LOW EXPECTED 
TO HANG AROUND THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK...IT LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL 
BE CHANCE OF MAINLY DAYTIME SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH MOST OF 
THE EXTENDED.

MISILN ALREADY OUT.


.ILN...NONE.

PARKER

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
857 PM EDT SAT JUN 23 2001

WILL THROW OUT UPDATE A LITTLE AFTER 9 PM TO RESOLVE EVENING 
WORDING.  KILN SHOWING SHALLOW CONVECTION HAS COME TO AN END.  
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLOUDS HAVE REALLY THINNED ACROSS NORTHERN 
FA WITH THE CLOUDS HOLDING PRETTY GOOD ACROSS THE SOUTH.  18Z MESO 
ETA ALSO INDICATED THE COLD POOL ALOFT AND SHEARED OUT WAVE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LOW MORE PROMINENT ACROSS THE SOUTH.  SO 
WILL OPT FOR MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE NORTH AND PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS 
THE SOUTH.  OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK IN GOOD SHAPE.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 231747
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
148 PM EDT SAT JUN 23 2001

LTST WV SATL IMGRY SHWS UPR LO OVR NW OH WITH S/WV DROPPING SE
THRU CNTRL IN. THIS S/WV TO DROP INTO BASE OF TROF INTO NRN KY
BY EVE. PVA...700MB CNVRGC AND COLD POOL ALOFT ASSOCIATED WITH UPR 
TROF HS LED TO DVLPMNT OF SCTD SHWRS AND ISOLD TSTMS IN THE WRN 
OH/ERN IN. SFC RUC INDICATES MARGINAL INSTBY AND AXIS OF MSTR 
CNVRGC. XPCT THIS PRECIP ACTVTY TO DIMINISH WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEATING. WL WATCH RADAR TRENDS WITH AN EVE PD PLANNED FOR SCTD 
COVERAGE OF PRECIP.

SFC HI PRES FM NRN IL THRU NRN IN TO BLD SLOWLY EWD ACRS SRN GRTLKS
THRU PD. UPR TROF TO PIVOT E WITH AXIS TO ERN OH BY MRNG. IN THE 
WAKE OF S/WV XPCT SKIES TO SLOWLY CLR DURG THE EVE HRS IN THE W AND
BCM PTLY CLDY IN THE E. PREFER LOWS A LTL COOLER THAN GUID TNGT
IN LIGHT WND REGIME WITH CLRG SKIES.

UPR TROF TO REMAIN QUASI-STATIONARY SUN WITH UPR LO CUTTING OFF 
OVR ERN TN SUN AFTN. COLDEST TEMPS ALOFT WL EXIST OVR S CNTRL OH/NE
KY WHERE A LO POP CHC OF SHWRS WL BE INCLUDED SUN AFTN. BASED ON
H8 TEMPS...TDA/S READINGS AND LO LVL THICKNESSES PREFER HI/S A 
COUPLE DEGS COOLER THAN GUID SUN. 

UPR LO CUTT OFF FM FLO TO RETROGRADE SLOWLY W THRU THE WEEK. MODEL 
TRENDS A LTL FARTHER S WITH THIS FEATURE. WL GO WITH 30 POPS IN THE 
FAR S ON MON AFTN CLOSER TO TN VLY UPR LO WHERE UPR TEMPS WL BE THE 
COLDEST. AGN HV GONE A COUPLE DEGS COOLER THAN GUID WITH HIGHS.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

FXUS61 KILN 230735
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 AM EDT SAT JUN 23 2001


SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AREA CENTERED OVER VA AND NC EARLY THIS MORNING. 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER WI AND IA BUILDING EAST INTO FA. UPPER 
LOW PRESSURE TROF WILL REMAIN OVER OHIO VALLEY THROUGH TODAY AND 
WEAK UPPER LOW EXPECTED TO BE OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. BY MONDAY MORNING THE UPPPER LOW 
IS FORECAST TO BE OVER TN/KY.

WITH SOME INSTABILITY IN EAST PART OF FA TDA...AFTERNOON HEATING AND 
PRESENCE OF UPPER TROF/LOW...WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER OR 
TWO THIS AFTERNOON. WILL INCLUDE 20 PERCENT CHANCE SHOWERS IN 
EASTERN ZONES. LOWERED HIGH TEMPERATURES A BIT TODAY FROM PREVIOUS 
FORECAST. MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS EXPECTED SUNDAY WITH HIGH 
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE WARMER THAN TODAY.

CUTOFF UPPER LOW IN EXTENDED TIME FRAME WILL BRING INCREASED 
MOISTURE AND CHANCES OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO FA THROUGH WEEK.

MISILN OUT SOON.
 

.ILN...NONE.

PARKER

FXUS61 KILN 230156
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 PM EDT FRI JUN 22 2001

H5 TROF AXIS IN WESTERN INDIANA IS PROGGED TO MOVE TO OUR AREA BY 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  SFC HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE PLAINS IS 
PUSHING COOLER AIR DOWN INTO OHIO. THE HIGH IS FCST TO TRAVEL SLOWLY 
EAST TO THE CENTRAL GREAT LAKES BY SUNDAY.  

THOUGH LOW CLOUDS HAVE LARGELY DISAPPEARED... MID AND HIGH CLOUDS 
ARE HANGING IN THIS EVENING AS SHORT WAVE DIGS BEHIND COLD FRONT 
ALONG THE APPALACHIANS. CLOUDS ARE MOVING SLOWLY EAST...WITH BACK 
EDGE OF OVERCAST HAVING REACHED CVG AT 01Z.  

ILL UPDATE TO KEEP CLOUDS IN LONGER IN THE EAST.  OTHERWISE FCST 
LOOKS GOOD WITH LOWS IN 50S AND LIGHT NORTH WINDS.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO


494 
FXUS61 KILN 221739
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
140 PM EDT FRI JUN 22 2001

DIFFICULT SUBTLETIES IN THE FCST FOR THIS EVENING AND ON SATURDAY.

COLD FRONT HAS MADE IT PAST THE CWFA...LOCATED ACRS WRN PA...WRN W 
VA AND ERN KY.  TEMPERATURES ARE CURRENTLY HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME 
REACHING THE 70 DEGREE MARK.  PART OF THIS PROBLEM IS DUE TO THE 
SHIELD OF CIRRUS ALOFT AS NOTED BY THE IR IMAGERY.  THIS CIRRUS IS 
PREVENTING SOME INSOLATION NEEDED TO TRANSFORM THE LOW LEVEL CLOUDS 
INTO HEALTHY MODERATE CU THAT COULD PRODUCE SOME -SHRA.
ALSO...IF 75 DEGREES IS NOT REACH...THE INVERSION ALOFT WILL NOT 
MIXED OUT...AND THUS THE CURRENT STRATOCUMULUS MAY BE SLOW TO 
DISSIPATE THIS EVENING (BEING TRAPPED UNDER THE INVERSION).  
CLEARING SKIES MAY HAVE TO COME BY WAY OF HORIZONTAL ADVECTION TO 
MOVE SOME OF THE CLOUDS AWAY.  WILL HAVE TO WAIT TO THE LAST MINUTE 
TO ISSUE ZONES TO SEE IF ANY SHOWERS FORM OR IF SATELLITE CONFIRMS 
THAT SHOWERS MAY FORM.  I PLAN ON GOING MOSTLY CLOUDY OR CLOUDY FOR 
THE EVENING HOURS WITH GRADUAL CLEARING WEST AND BECOMING PARTLY 
CLOUDY EAST OVERNIGHT.

FOR SATURDAY...AXIS OF UPR LVL TROF (CURRENTLY FROM WRN ONTARIO 
...MICHIGAN INTO ILLINOIS) MOVES SLOWLY EAST...REACHING THE ERN CWFA 
BY LATE IN THE DAY.  MODEL SOUNDING SHOW THE POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORM ACRS THE ERN CWFA LATE IN THE DAY.  THE BIG FLY 
IN THE OINTMENT IS THE NOTICEABLE ISOTHERMAL/INVERSION LAYER LOCATED 
BETWEEN 675 MB AND 650 MB.  MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THIS 
INVERSION MAY BE SURPASSED IN THE ERN CWFA GIVEN MAX HIGHS IN THE 
UPPER 70S.  HOWEVER...THESE ARE MODEL SOUNDINGS...AND A MINOR TWEAK 
HERE AND THERE CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE.  GIVEN THE 
UNCERTAINTY...WILL KEEP THE TREND OF THE SILENT 20 POPS IN THE ERN 
CWFA...ALLOWING THE SUCCESSIVE SHIFTS MORE TIME TO EXAMINE LATER 
MODEL RUNS AND THE BALLOON SOUNDING AT 12Z.

SKIES WILL CLEAR SATURDAY NIGHT WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.  
UPR LVL TROF BEGINS TO CUT OFF JUST EAST OF THE CWFA ON SUNDAY.  THE 
LOWER LEVELS OF THE AIRMASS BECOME A LITTLE DRIER AND MORE 
ANTICYCLONIC.  ALSO...FCST SOUNDINGS INDICATE A STRONGER CAPPING 
INVERSION.  WILL GO WITH A MOSTLY SUNNY FCST.

CUT OFF UPR LVL LOW IS FCST TO RETROGRADE TO THE SOUTHWEST FOR THE 
BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK.  AS IT DOES...MOISTURE WILL BE PUMPED 
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY REGION...INCREASING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN
























513 
FXUS61 KILN 221353 AAA
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 AM EDT FRI JUN 22 2001

CHANGED MY MIND.  AFTER THINKING SOME MORE...WILL GO AHEAD AND 
INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS WEST. THE 390 J/KG OF CAPE IN THE 
LOW LEVELS COMBINED WITH AN UPR TROF IN THE VICINITY HAS WON ME OVER 
TO INCLUDE THIS CHANCE.


...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
12Z SFC ANALYSIS SHOWED A COLD FRONT ACRS OUR FAR ERN CWFA.  KILN 
RADAR ALSO INDICATED SHOWER ACTIVITY JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT ACRS 
THE SE CWFA.

COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE EAST TODAY...ENDING THE SHOWERS IN THE 
FAR SE CWFA IN THE NEXT HOUR OR SO.  LOW CLOUDS AND DRIZZLE WERE 
OCCURRING BEHIND THE FRONT AS WEAK FORCING FROM UPR LEVEL TROF TO 
THE WEST AND LACK OF CLOUD SEEDING FROM ABOVE.  MAY HAVE TO KEEP 
DRIZZLE GOING INTO EARLY AFTN.  FORECAST HIGH AT ILN CONSIDERING A 
PERIOD OF FOR LOW CLOUDS THROUGH EARLY AFTN YIELDS 71 DEGREES.  
OBVIOUSLY...THE TEMPERATURES WILL BE DEPENDENT ON HOW FAST THE LOW 
STRATUS DEVELOPS INTO STRATOCUMULUS.  MAY GO WITH A RANGE OF 70 TO 
75 DEGREES WHERE CLOUDS MAY HANG TOUGH.  MODEL SOUNDINGS YIELD ONLY 
ABOUT 390 J/KG BY LATE AFTN ALONG WITH A MID LVL INVERSION.  THERE 
IS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER POPPING UP IN THE WEST...BUT WILL TRY 
TO LEAVE IT DRY FOR NOW.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN






















AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EDT FRI JUN 22 2001

MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT THIS CYCLE WITH BRINGING UPR 
TROF THRU TOMORROW. SFC/LLVL TROF GOING THRU ATTM HELPING TO KEEP 
SOME SHOWERS IN THE SE. WILL KEEP A CHC THERE FOR THIS AM BUT WILL 
KEEP THE REST DRY AS SUBSIDENCE TAKES OVER. COULD SEE AN ISOLATED 
SHOWER THIS AFTN BUT DO NOT FEEL ITS WORTH MENTIONING. TOMORROW 
ACTUALLY LOOKS TO HAVE A BETTER CHC OF AFTN POP UPS WITH THE UPR 
TROF SWINGING THRU. BUT MSTR REALLY SCOURS OUT BY THEN AND WILL JUST 
GO WITH THE SILENT 20. GUID TEMPS ARE CLOSE TO EACH OTHER AND 
CURRENT FCST AND SEE LITTLE REASON TO CHANGE.  

.ILN...NONE.

663 
FXUS61 KILN 220744
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EDT FRI JUN 22 2001

MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT THIS CYCLE WITH BRINGING UPR 
TROF THRU TOMORROW. SFC/LLVL TROF GOING THRU ATTM HELPING TO KEEP 
SOME SHOWERS IN THE SE. WILL KEEP A CHC THERE FOR THIS AM BUT WILL 
KEEP THE REST DRY AS SUBSIDENCE TAKES OVER. COULD SEE AN ISOLATED 
SHOWER THIS AFTN BUT DO NOT FEEL ITS WORTH MENTIONING. TOMORROW 
ACTUALLY LOOKS TO HAVE A BETTER CHC OF AFTN POP UPS WITH THE UPR 
TROF SWINGING THRU. BUT MSTR REALLY SCOURS OUT BY THEN AND WILL JUST 
GO WITH THE SILENT 20. GUID TEMPS ARE CLOSE TO EACH OTHER AND 
CURRENT FCST AND SEE LITTLE REASON TO CHANGE.  

.ILN...NONE.

000 
FXUS61 KILN 211945
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 EDT THU JUN 21 2001

WILL SEND OUT A QUICK UPDATE TO INCLUDE PARTS OF WEST CENTRAL AND 
CENTRAL OHIO IN SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 463.



...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
LATEST SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED LOW PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR INDIANAPOLIS 
WITH A COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST INTO S CNTRL IL AND ERN MO.  
THIS WAS FAIRLY CLOSE TO THE 12Z MESO ETA RUN.

UPR LVL TROF AND ASSOCIATED VORT MAX OVER NRN MO...AS DEPICTED BY 
WATER VAPOR...WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SFC LOW PERTURBATION AT INDY.  
FAVORABLE UPR LVL DIV COMBINED WITH SFC HEATING/MOIST AIRMASS/MOIST 
LOW LVL CONV WILL CONTINUE SHOWERS/TSTMS ACRS THE REGION THRU THE 
EVENING HOURS.  COLD FRONT WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE EAST AS UPR LVL TROF 
IS STILL DIGGING ATTM.  FRONT SHOULD PASS THROUGH WRN CWFA BETWEEN 
MIDNIGHT EDT AND 2 AM EDT...AND ERN CWFA BETWEEN 4 AM EDT AND 8 AM 
EDT.  WIDESPREAD THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD HEAD OFF TO THE EAST AND/OR 
WEAKEN ONCE THE SUN GOES DOWN.  WILL WORD FCST AS DECREASING OR  
TAPERING TO SCATTERED SHOWERS OVERNIGHT.

FOR FRIDAY...UPR LVL TROF AXIS STILL DOES NOT MOVE THROUGH THE 
REGION.  SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY DURING THE MORNING 
HOURS AS RAINFALL AND COOLING BEHIND THE FRONT SHOULD TRAP LOWER 
CLOUD CEILINGS ACRS THE CWFA.  BY AFTN...LOW CLOUDS SHOULD MIX 
OUT...LEAVING PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.  SINCE THERE IS A LACK OF LOW LVL 
FOCUSING AND/OR UPR DIV...I WOULD BE INCLINED TO LEAVE FCST DRY.  
HOWEVER...FCST MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATED A SMALL CHANCE OF A 
SHOWER/TSTM DEVELOPING DURING THE LATE AFTN IF FCST MAXES ARE 
REACHED.  THUS...WILL INCLUDE AN AFTN WORDING OF SHOWERS/TSTMS.

ANY SHOWER/TSTM ACTIVITY THAT DEVELOPS FRIDAY AFTN SHOULD DISSIPATE 
BY SUNSET...LEAVING PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.

UPR TROUGH STILL HANGS ACRS THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VLY ON SATURDAY.  
AGAIN...THERE IS A LACK OF LOW LVL FORCING/UPR LVL DIV.  
HOWEVER...MODEL SOUNDINGS AGAIN INDICATE THAT A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM COULD POP UP LATE IN THE DAY.

LONG RANGE MODELS SHOW UPR TROF CUTTING OFF BY EARLY NEXT WEEK.


.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
940 AM EDT THU JUN 21 2001

12Z SFC MAP SHOWED LOW PRESSURE NEAR ST LOUIS WITH A WARM FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY EXTENDING EAST THROUGH S CNTRL IN AND THEN INTO CNTRL OHIO.

CURRENT THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY ACRS THE WRN CWFA WAS IN RESPONSE TO A 
LOW LEVEL JET...CREATING TSTMS OF THE ELEVATED VARIETY.  THESE 
STORMS SHOULD WEAKEN SOMEWHAT AS THEY HEAD EAST.

FAVORABLE UPR LVL DIV AND LOW LVL CONV COUPLET ESTABLISHES ITSELF 
ACRS IL AND IN THIS AFTN...SETTING THE STAGE FOR A DEVELOPING SQUALL 
LINE OF TSTMS.  THESE WILL RACE AHEAD OF THE SFC COLD FRONT...LIKELY 
ARRIVING INTO OUR WRN CWFA BY MID TO LATE AFTN.  MAY MAKE SOME 
ADJUSTMENTS WITH TSTM TIMING...ESPECIALLY THE PMH GROUP.  WILL ISSUE 
SEVERE WEATHER OUTLOOK ONCE AGAIN...HIGHLIGHTNING SEVERE WX 
POTENTIAL.  GREATEST BOUNDARY LAYER HELICITIES WILL BE NEAR THE SFC 
LOW (OUR NRN CWFA) WHERE ISOLATED TORNADOES COULD OCCUR WITH TSTMS.

CURRENT TEMPS LOOK GOOD IF CLOUD COVER HOLDS.

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
338 AM EDT THU JUN 21 2001

07Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING FM WRN PA 
ACROSS SRN OH BACK INTO MO.  A STRONGER THAN PROGD WAVE WAS LOCATED 
ALONG THE FNT IN CNTRL MO. WV IMAGERY SHOWED A STRONG S/WV DROPPING 
INTO THE CNTRL STATES.

MODELS CONSISTENT IN STRENGTHENING THE WAVE AND MOVG IT ACROSS FA BY 
THIS EVENING. WITH STRONG FORCING AND INSTABILITY...SHRA/TSRA WL 
BECOME WIDESPREAD FM W TO E TODAY.  MODELS PROG FAIRLY STRONG MID 
LVL WINDS ACROSS THE OH VLY SO A SQUALL LINE MAY FORM ON THE LEADING 
EDGE OF THE RAIN AND SWEEP ACROSS FA DURING PEAK HEATING.  WL CARRY 
SVR WORDING FOR THE PM HOURS.

SHRA/TSRA WL CONTINUE INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS WITH A DRYING TREND 
FOR CVG-DAY AREAS.  WL INDICATE MAINLY EARLY THERE.  

TEMPS SHOULD HAVE TROUBLE RISING TOO MUCH TODAY DUE TO CLOUDINESS 
AND SHRA/TSRA.  WL STAY NEAR GUIDANCE WITH A SLIGHT DOWNWARD 
ADJUSTMENT.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA OF RELATIVELY STABLE AIR OVER SOUTHWEST OHIO.

SEEMS TO SHOW THIS TREND WITH WESTERN PART OF WEAKENING SHRA LINE 
SAGGING SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE MIAMI VALLEY.  WITH BOUNDARY LIKELY TO 
DROP FARTHER SOUTH TONIGHT AND WITH MODELS INDICATING INCREASED 
UPPER SUPPORT...ILL KEEP CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EDT WED JUN 20 2001

AC DECK HELPING TO KP TMPS DOWN AND AS A RESULT INSTBLTYS. BASED ON 
VSBL SAT PIX...LOOKS LIKE AC DECK MAY BE TRYING TO THIN WHICH MAY 
STILL ALLOW TMPS TO RISE A LTL AND TRIGGER A FEW MORE TSTMS LATER 
THIS AFTN. SFC BNDRY CRNTLY LOCATED FM N CNTRL IND INTO NW OH WL SAG 
SLOWLY S OVRNGT BUT WITH LOSS OF DIURNAL HTG AND NO REAL SUPPORT 
ALF...WL INDICT PCPN MAINLY THIS EVNG.

SFC BDNRY ACRS AREA ON THURS WITH MDLS DVLPG A LOW ACRS SW IND AND 
THEN TRACKING E ALG BNDRY INTO FA. AVN A LTL FATSER THAN ETA/NGM 
WHICH MAY BE A LTL FAST WITH DVLPG TROF ALF SO WL LEAN TWD SLOWER 
SOLUTIONS. WITH THIS...ETA HAS GUD LLVL CONV/UPR LVL DIVG COUPLET 
ACRS FA AT 18Z THURS SO THINK WL SEE PCPN BCM MORE LIKELY THRU LATE 
MRNG AND INTO THE AFTN. MDLS CONSISTENT WITH INDICTG BETTER PCPN 
EFFICIENCIES AND SWATH OF PCPN ALG AND TO THE N OF LOW TRACK ACRS NW 
HALF OF FA ON THURS. HOWEVER...OUT AHD OF LOW ETA DVLPG A 30 KT JET 
ACRS SRN PORTIONS OF THE DAY THURS AFTN. THIS AREA ALSO LIKELY TO 
SEE A LTL MORE SUN THRU THE DAY AND THUS WL BE MORE UNSTBL WITH ETA 
SHWG CAPES OF ARND 2000 J/KG DURG THE AFTN. THEREFORE...THINK WL SEE 
MORE WIDESPRD PCPN ACRS NW HALF OF FA WITH SCT TSTMS DVLPG ACRS SE 
PORTIONS OF FA THRU THE AFTN.  

XPCT PCPN CHCS TO TAPER OFF W TO E ACRS FA THURS NGT AS SFC LOW MOVS 
E AND DRYING WORKS IN FM THE W. HOWEVER...CYCLNC LLVL FLOW CONTS 
ACRS THE AREA ON FRI AND WITH BDNRY JUST TO OUR SE....WL GO WITH CHC 
POPS WITH BEST CHC ACRS THE SE. 

WITH BNDRY ACRS AREA...WL SEE PRETTY GUD GRAD OF TMPS NW TO SE ACRS 
FA ON THURS. MORE UNIFORM TMPS ACRS AREA ON FRI WITH BNDRY TO OUR 
SE. TMPS WL BE HIGHLY DEPENDANT ON CLD COVER AND WL NOT STRAY TOO 
FAR FM GUID NUMBERS.

.ILN...NONE.

AND THE APPROACH OF S/WV CAUSING MO-KS MCS...XPCT ADDITIONAL 
ACTIVITY THIS PM.  WIND FIELDS TOO WEAK FOR ORGANIZED SVR.  XPCT MCS 
ACTIVITY TO DEVELOP TONIGHT ALONG AND N OF THE BOUNDARY SO WL KEEP 
LIKELY POPS GOING.  MODELS FAIRLY CONSISTENT IN BRINGING A MORE 
SIGNIFICANT WAVE THROUGH ON THU SO WL CARRY LIKELY POPS THEN.

TO LIMIT SUN.  WL GENERALLY STICK CLOSE TO GUIDANCE.

WILL HOLD OUT UNTIL 10 PM TO SEND UPDATE WITH EXPIRATION OF WW453. 
EXPECT POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE TO DECREASE THROUGH THE NIGHT WITH LOSS 
OF DAYTIME HEATING...BUT CURRENT STORMS AND INTERACTING BOUNDARIES 
LEFT OVER COULD STILL PRODUCE SOME DAMAGING WINDS AND ESPECIALLY 
LARGE HAIL AS WBZERO HAS DECREASED BY 2KFT TO AROUND 8000FT. DONT 
EXPECT STORMS TO CONTINUE WITH SUCH FORCE OVERNIGHT...BUT COVERAGE 
OVER INDIANA HAS INCREASED DRAMATICALLY AND WILL HAVE TO PUT AT 
LEAST THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDER IN WRN 1/2 OF FCST AREA. 

WILL NOT CHANGE TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT AS UPPER 60S LOOK GOOD ACROSS 
THE BOARD. EVEN IN RAIN COOLED AIR BEHIND FRONT...TEMPERATURES DROP 
AND THEN COME BACK UP TO THE LOW 70S. HOWEVER...WILL MENTION WIND 
SHIFTING TO NORTH OR BECOMING VARIABLE FOR MOST AREAS.

459 
FXUS61 KILN 192103
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
500 PM EDT TUE JUN 19 2001

UPDATED TO INCLUDE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH.

CONVECTION FIRING ALONG COLD FRONT THAT IS PROGGED TO GET INTO FAR 
NWRN CWA LATER THIS EVENING/OVERNIGHT. MAIN DRIVE WITH THIS LINE 
WILL BE THE DAYTIME HEATING AND MOISTURE POOLING IN THE WARM SECTOR 
AHEAD OF FRONT. OUTFLOW WILL HAVE TO BE MONITORED CLOSELY...BUT 
THINK THAT LOSS OF HEATING LATER THIS AFTERNOON WILL PUT A 
RELATIVELY QUICK END TO THREAT FOR SEVERE POTENTIAL. 

...AFTERNOON AFD...

LTST SFC ANALYSIS SHWS HI PRES STRETCHING FM MID ATLANTIC THRU TN VLY
WITH CDFNT FM CNTRL LWR MI THRU NRN IL AND INTO CNTRL PLNS. UPR RDG 
AXIS FM LWR MS VLY THRU MID ATL WHICH HS KEPT SRN OH DRY TDA WL 
BREAK DOWN AS WESTERLIES DROP S.

FLO TO AMPLIFY WITH AFOREMENTIONED CDFNT DROPPING INTO NW OH OVRNGT
AND INTO THE S ON WED. NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF NEW DATA BUT TRENDS 
FM NEW GUID INDICATING A SLOWER PASSAGE WITH THIS FNT. A SERIES OF 
WV/S WL DVLP ON THIS SFC FNT WITH POS TILTED UPR TROF DROPPING INTO 
NRN PLNS/WRN LAKES BY 00Z THU. THIS TROF EXPECTED TO PIVOT THRU THE 
AREA ON THU. 

FAVORABLE LO LVL CNVRGC DVLPS INTO NW OVRNGT WHERE WL MENT CHC POPS 
OF SHWRS/TSTMS. ON WED WL TREND POPS FM LKLY IN NRN MIAMI VLY TO LO 
CHC POPS IN THE SE AS FNT DROPS INTO THE FA. WL GO WITH LKLY POPS ON 
WED NGT ACRS THE ENTIRE REGION WITH GOOD RAIN EVENT N OF THE STALLED 
FNT EXPECTED. LKLY POPS TO CONT ON THU ACRS CVG...CMH AND PMH 
LOCATIONS WITH CHC IN NRN MIAMI AND DAY. 

TEMP WISE...STAYED CLOSE TO GUID TNGT BUT HV TRENDED NUMBERS BACK 
WED/THU DUE TO EXPECTED CLDS AND PRECIP.

.ILN...

MERCER SHELBY AUGLAIZE AND HARDIN COUNTIES.
IN...WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST (10 PM EDT) FOR WAYNE COUNTY.

FXUS61 KILN 181944
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 PM EDT MON JUN 18 2001

INTERESTING FCST SETTING UP FOR MID WEEK.

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS A WARM FRONT ACRS THE SRN GREAT LAKES.  
THE WARM FRONT WAS ATTACHED TO LOW PRESSURE OVER SE SD WITH A COLD 
FRONT TRAILING FROM THE LOW THRU THE CNTRL PLAINS.

THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY TOWARD THE CWFA OVER 
THE NEXT 24 HRS.  FOR TONIGHT...SKIES WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR AS 
SFC RIDGING AND S/WV RIDGING AT 500 MB HOLD.

ON TUESDAY...THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE TO JUST WEST OF THE CWFA BY 
LATE IN THE DAY.  THE PROXIMITY OF THE FRONT WARRANTS A SMALL CHC OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DAYTON/WAPAKONETA GROUPS.  OTHERWISE...A 
HOT AND MORE HUMID DAY CAN BE EXPECTED.

ON TUESDAY NIGHT...THE MESO ETA...AND TO A LESSER EXTENT...THE 
AVN...TRY TO DEVELOP  WEAK SFC LOW PRESSURE ALONG COLD FRONT AS IT 
SAGS SLOWLY INTO THE NW CWFA.  THE LOW PRESSURE IS BEING PERTURBED 
BY FAVORABLE RIGHT REAR QUAD OF UPR JET.  IT IS HARD TO SAY ATTM HOW 
WIDESPREAD SHWRS/TSTMS WILL BE...THUS A 40 POP FOR THE WRN AREAS IS 
A GOOD BET ATTM.  THE CHC/S FOR SHOWERS/TSMTS WILL BE LESS AS ONE 
MOVES TOWARD OUR SE CWFA.

ON WEDNESDAY...THE COLD FRONT BEGINS TO STALL OUT THRU THE MIDDLE OF 
THE CWFA.  WITH THE FRONT IN THE VICINITY...I MUST CONTINUE A 40 
PERCENT CHC OF SHOWERS/TSTMS.

THE NEW AVN TRIES TO DEVELOP SEVERAL WAVES OF LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE 
STALLED FRONT THROUGH THURSDAY.  WITH THIS SCENARIO..I WILL HAVE TO 
WET UP THE FCST THROUGH THURSDAY.  IF THIS PATTERN SETS UP...SOME 
LOCATIONS COULD RECEIVE SEVERAL ROUNDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY 
RAINFALL.  ONLY TIME WILL TELL WHERE AND HOW MUCH.

MOS TEMPS REASONABLE AND HAVE STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO ITS VALUES.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

TRACK RECORD OF THE FWC IN THIS AIRMASS...AND SUPPORTED BY THE ETA 
LLVL THICKNESS...HV MADE MINOR DOWNWARD ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FWC.

FOR TNGT...RIDGING ALOFT CONTS TO BUILD ACRS THE RGN WITH ALL MODEL 
GUID ADVERTISING LOW RH THRU THE ATMOS.  WL INDC MCLR ALL ZONES.  
MORE P-GRADIENT THAN TNGT SO EXPCT TEMPS A CAT OR 2 WARMER.  GUID IN 
GD AGREEMENT AND HV TRENDED CLOSE.  FOR TUE...STRENGTHENING SW FLOW 
AHEAD OF APPROACHING FRONT SHUD PUSH THE WARMEST AIR OF THE SEASON
INTO THE CWFA.  1000/850 THICKNESS FCST BY THE ETA WARMS TO OVER 
1430M BY TUE AFTN OVER THE SOUTH...WITH H8 TEMPS TO +19.  THESE 
VALUES SUPPORTED READINGS IN THE 92-94 RANGE UPSTREAM YDAY...AND 
SUPPORT A BLEND OF THE FWC AND WARMER MAV NUMBERS.  ETA ALSO PROGS 
3000+ J/KG CAPE OVER THE NW...WITH DECENT LLVL CONVERGENCE ALONG 
FRONTAL BNDRY.  WL ADD CHC POPS TO THE NW 1/4 OF THE CWFA.

TUESDAY.

CONDITIONS EXPECTED. WITH TRENDS FOR LOWER 1000-85H AND 1000-90H 
THICKNESSES...FELT IT WOULD BE BEST TO GO A BIT LOWER THAN GUIDANCE 
FOR MAX TEMPS.

W-CTRL OHIO AS SOME CONVECTION MAY MOVE N OF FA LATE IN THE PERIOD. 
CONFIDENCE NOT YET HIGH ON THE REALITY OF FORMATION OF THIS SYSTEM.

TEMPS LOOK OK.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW.

ILN...NONE.

000 
FXUS61 KILN 151853
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
253 PM EDT FRI JUN 15 2001

UPPER LOW IN SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA WILL DRAG A SHORT WAVE AND COLD 
FRONT ACROSS OUR REGION THIS EVENING.  AS UPPER LOW MOVES TO 
NORTHERN QUEBEC...A ZONAL FLOW WILL BE LEFT IN ITS WAKE OVER THE 
NORTHERN CONUS...WITH RATHER HIGH H5 HEIGHTS REMAINING OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY.  

MAIN CONCERN IS FOR SEVERE WEATHER LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS 
EVENING.  WATCH HAS BEEN ISSUED JUST WEST OF OUR AREA..THOUGH STORM 
REPORTS HAVE BEEN LIMITED TO HEAVY RAIN AND GUSTY WINDS SO FAR.  OUR 
AREA MAY BE MORE PRONE FOR SVR SINCE INSTABILITY IS GREATER 
HERE...SO WE ARE CLOSELY MONITORING THE RADAR AS THE LINE MOVES IN.  
SQUALL LINE IS ARRIVING AHEAD OF MODEL QPF PROJECTIONS...WITH ETA 
STARTING PRECIP AT CVG AT 00Z.  FLOODING IS A CONCERN WITH OUR MOIST 
SOIL AND ATMOSPHERE...THOUGH MODERATELY FAST STORM MOTION SHOULD 
HELP.

REST OF FCST PERIOD LOOKS DRY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN RAPIDLY 
TONIGHT BEHIND THE FRONT AND REMAINING THROUGH THE WEEKEND. ETA 
SHOWS WEAK SHORT WAVE WITH LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE EARLY ON 
SUNDAY...BUT LITTLE MOISTURE IS INDICATED AND IT WILL BE COMING 
THROUGH AT A DIURNALLY UNFAVORABLE TIME. THEREFORE ILL GO WITH 
PARTLY CLOUDY FOR SUNDAY.

WARM WEATHER WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEKEND...THOUGH PERHAPS NOT 
AS WARM AS FWC SHOWS FOR DAYTIME HIGHS. ILL ADJUST FWC TEMPS UP FOR 
TONIGHTS LOWS...AND DOWN FOR SATURDAYS AND SUNDAYS HIGHS.

ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

1014 AM EDT FRI JUN 15 2001

UPPER LOW COMING IN PHASE WITH SFC LOW OVER SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA IS 
PUSHING A COLD FRONT THROUGH ILLINOIS.  FRONT WILL CROSS OUR AREA 
THIS EVENING/TONIGHT.

LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS POOLING AHEAD OF THE FRONT IN WESTERN 
INDIANA...WITH A MOIST LOBE EXTENDING FROM NORTHERN INDIANA THROUGH 
WEST CENTRAL OHIO TO PORTSMOUTH.  AS SYNOPTIC SCALE DYNAMICS 
INCREASE TSRA WILL DEVELOP IN THE MOIST POOL.  THOUGH THE BEST 
DYNAMICS WILL BE NORTHWEST OF HERE...OUR INSTABILITY IS HIGH ENOUGH 
SO THAT SEVERE WEATHER IS A GREATER THREAT THAN IN THE LAST TWO 
DAYS.  SQUALL LINE FORMATION SEEMS MOST LIKELY AT THIS POINT WITH 
LOW DIRECTIONAL SHEAR EXPECTED.  CANT RULE OUT TORS THOUGH...AS 
BROKEN BOW SEGMENTS AND POSSIBLE RIGHT MOVERS MAY PROVIDE LOCALIZED 
SPIN.  

ILL UPDATE...KEEPING LIKELY POPS WITH MAINLY LATE WORDING.  ILL 
ALSO INCREASE DAYTON GROUPS TEMPS TO UPPER 80S WITH 80 ALREADY 
REACHED.

ILL REISSUE SPS TO HIGHLIGHT SEVERE THREAT.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
350 AM EDT FRI JUN 15 2001

07Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS COLD FRONT STILL WELL TO THE WEST OVER 
MO/IOWA.  MORE IMPORTANT FTR FOR TDYS WX IS WELL DEFINED OUTFLOW 
BNDRY XTNDG ACRS THE EASTERN PART OF ILLINOIS.  OUTFLOW CONTINUES TO 
DRIVE CONVECTION AS IT HEADS TWRD WESTERN INDIANA...HWVR SAT TRENDS 
HV SUGGESTED A STEADY DCRS IN INTENSITY AS ACTIVITY MVS AWAY FROM 
MORE FAVORABLE UPPER SUPPORT.  GIVEN CURRENT FRONTAL POSN SO FAR 
WEST...AND ONLY MARGINAL FLOW ALOFT TO PUSH BNDRY...HV LEANED TWRD 
THE SLOWER ETA IN REGARDS TO FRONTAL TIMING.  XPCT SCT CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY TO FIRE IN THE SW LATE THIS MORNING/ERLY AFTN ALONG THE 
WEAK CONVERGENT AXIS WHICH HAS BEEN THE CATALYST FOR CONVECTION THE 
PAST CPL DAYS.  BY LATE AFTERNOON...MODERATE INSTABILITY...COPIOUS 
MSTR...AND LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH APPROACHING OUTLFOW SHUD BE 
SUFFICIENT TO TRIGGER AT LEAST A BROKEN LINE OF CONVECTION OVER OR 
JUST WEST OF THE CWFA IN INDIANA.  WL WORD POPS IN THE WEST AS SCT 
THRU LATE AFTN...THEN RAISE TO LIKELY LATE.  IN THE EAST WL KEEP 
POPS IN THE CHC RANGE TDY...MAINLY THIS AFTN.  COMBINATION OF PRETTY 
GOOD INSTABILITY AND SLIGHTLY STRONGER WIND FIELDS SHUD SUPPORT SOME 
SVR WX AS WELL...ESPLY DAMAGING WINDS.   FWC TEMPS LK A LITTLE COOL 
GIVEN SFC TRAJECTORIES AND A WARM START.

BEST PCPN EFFICIENCY MOVES ACRS THE CWFA BEWTEEN 00 AND 06Z.  IF 
ACTIVITY ORGANIZES INTO SQUALL LINE AS XPCTD...MUCH OF THE PCPN WL 
BE OVER IN THE FAR WEST BY 00Z.  WL NOT TRY TO GET TOO FANCY WITH 
TIMING THOUGH...AND MENTION LIKELY BEFORE MIDNIGHT WEST WITH NO 
TIMING SE.  WL LIKELY SEE SOME +RA AS WELL...ESPLY IN LIGHT OF WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY STILL DEPICTING MSTR CONNECTION WITH THE REMNANTS OF 
ALLISON.  GUID TEMPS IN GD AGREEMENT...AND APPEAR IN THE BALLPARK.

MODEL TIMESXNS ADVERTISE A NICE DRYING BEGINNING FROM THE WEST LATE 
TNGT...CONTG INTO SATURDAY.  FWC IN THE U80S-90 LOOK TOO WARM 
HWVR...WITH THE ETA/AVN SUGGESTING MUCH COOLER READINGS.  WL 
MAINTAIN FCST CONTINUITY GENERALLY IN THE M80S.

UPPER RIDGE OVER EASTERN CONUS WILL BEGIN TO ERODE BY FRIDAY AS

OKLAHOMA.  LOW IS PROGGED TO SPIN ALMOST DUE NORTH INTO SOUTHERN 
CANADA AHEAD OF UPPER LOW.  FRONT IS SCHEDULED TO CROSS OUR AREA ON 
FRIDAY NIGHT.

MENTION OF PRECIP FOR TONIGHT PERIOD.  ILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR 
FRIDAY FOR AFTERNOON TSRA WITH FRONT APPROACHING...AIDED BY COOLING 
ALOFT AND FAVORABLE JET STREAK. FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...FWC POPS APPEAR 
UNDERDONE EVEN WRT NGM QPF...SO ILL CONTINUE TREND OF PREVIOUS FCST 
AND GO WITH LIKELY POPS.  CHANCE FOR WIDESPREAD SVR WILL BE GREATER 
LATE ON FRIDAY THAN THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS WITH THE ARRIVAL OF 
UPPER DYNAMICS AND STRONGER WIND FIELDS COMBINING WITH INSTABILITY 
ALREADY IN PLACE (SEE SWODY2). FRONT IS PROGGED THROUGH RATHER 
QUICKLY SO SATURDAY LOOKS DRY.

HIGHS LOOK OPTIMISTIC IN NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND THE FRONT SO ILL 
UNDERCUT THEM A BIT.

EAST...WHERE AIRMASS IS SLIGHTLY DRIER.

IN THIS STALE REGIME...SO NO CHANGES WILL BE NEEDED TO TEMP FCST.

FXUS61 KILN 140639
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM THU JUN 14 2001

CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS MAINLY CLEAR SKIES ACRS THE CWFA.  A 
COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED ACRS THE PLAIN STATES WHILE AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE (FORMER ALLISON) WAS PIN WHEELING NEAR ILM.

FCST PROBLEM FOR TODAY WILL BE THE CHANCE OF ANY AFTERNOON POP 
CORN TYPE THUNDERSTORMS.  SOME WIDELY SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY WAS ABLE TO DEVELOP YESTERDAY ACRS WRN OHIO DUE TO VERY 
WEAK LOW LVL CONVERGENCE.  THE AIRMASS REALLY DOES NOT CHANGE TODAY 
AS WE REMAIN IN A BLOCKING TYPE PATTERN (UPR HIGH BUILDS OVER NEW 
ENGLAND WHILE REMAINS OF ALLISON CONTINUES TO SPIN NEAR THE NC 
COAST).  FCST MODEL SOUNDINGS YIELD CAPES IN THE 2500 J/KG RANGE 
WITH NO CAP TO SPEAK OF.  ALL IT WILL TAKE IS JUST A LITTLE 
CONVERGENCE TO GET A THUNDERSTORM GOING.  THE PROBLEM IS:  WHERE?
I WAS LEANING TOWARD THE CMH/PMH AREAS AS THE CURRENT RUN OF THE 
MESOETA SUGGESTS WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE THERE.  HOWEVER...THIS 
FEATURE MAY SHIFT FROM RUN TO RUN (ANY POSSIBLY COULD STRADDLE 
SOMEWHERE BETWEEN DAY/CVG/PMH/CMH ZONES).  AS A RESULT...I FEEL IT 
IS PRUDENT TO PLACE A LOW CHANCE 20 POP FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF AN 
AFTERNOON TSTM.  TEMPS WILL ONCE AGAIN APPROACH 90 DEGREES.

FOR TONIGHT...MODELS TRY TO SHOW QPF MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTH.  WITH 
A WEAK WIND FLOW AND LACK OF UPR SUPPORT...BELIEVE ANY THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY HERE AND SOUTH OF THE CWFA WOULD TEND TO DIE OFF AFTER 
SUNSET.  THUS...WILL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND LEAVE THE FCST 
DRY.

ON FRIDAY...AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT MOVES TOWARD THE REGION.  A 
FCST OF 40 POPS SEEM REASONABLE GIVEN DAYTIME HEATING AN THE APCH OF 
THE FRONT.  LIKELY POPS FRIDAY NIGHT ALSO LOOK GOOD ATTM AS THAT IS 
WHEN THE COLD FRONT WILL BE PASSING THROUGH.

MOS TEMPS ARE IN THE BALL PARK..SO WILL ONLY ADJUST SLIGHTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 130620
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 AM WED JUN 13 2001

KILN RADAR EARLY THIS MORNING SHOWS THAT THE CONVECTION IGNITED BY 
AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY YESTERDAY AFTN IS NOW OVER.  IN ADDITION 
...SATELLITE TRENDS INDICATE A GRADUAL DISSIPATION IN THE CLOUD 
COVER.  THIS SHOULD CONTINUE TOWARD SUNRISE...LEAVING MOSTLY CLEAR 
SKIES BY THEN.

TODAY/S WX WILL BE MUCH QUIETER THAN YESTERDAY.  MODELS CONTINUE TO
DEVELOP A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE ALOFT ACRS THE MIDDLE OHIO VLY.  WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY INDICATES THAT THE CENTER OF THIS RIDGE IS NEAR SAINT 
LOUIS ATTM.  ALSO...GOES 8 SOUNDER PRECIPITABLE WATER DATA HAS 
VALUES OF ABOUT 0.6 OF AN INCH NEAR SAINT LOUIS...A DRAMATIC DROP IN 
PW COMPARED TO THE 1.66 INCHES ON THE ILN SOUNDING AT 00Z.  THIS 
DRIER AIR IN THE VERTICAL DEPTH OF THE ATMOSPHERE WILL PIVOT NE 
INTO OUR REGION.  THUS...WITH WEAK SUBSIDENCE...LOWER PWS AND NO 
S/WVS OR OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES EXPECTED...MOSTLY SUNNY FCST LOOKS 
GOOD.  TEMPS WILL BE HOT WITH HIGHS AROUND 90.

FOR TONIGHT...SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR AS ANY DAYTIME CU 
DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET.  LOWS WILL BE NEAR 70.

ON THURSDAY...THE UPR LEVEL LOW OVER THE SE U. S. CONTINUES TO PUSH 
TOWARD THE VA/NC COASTAL BORDER.  CURRENT FCST HAS A CHC OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE PMH GROUP.  BELIEVE ATTM WITH A LACK OF ANY 
SIGNIFICANT LIFT AND MOST OF THE MSTR FROM THE LOW STAYING JUST 
SOUTH AND EAST OF THE REGION...A DRY FCST IS THE WAY TO GO...SO WILL 
REMOVE THE POPS THERE.  TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO PEAK AROUND 90 DEGREES 
ONCE AGAIN.

FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...A COLD FRONT FROM THE PLAINS STATES MOVES INTO 
ERN WISCONSIN AND ERN ILLINOIS BY FRIDAY MORNING.  A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS (30 POP) IS POSSIBLY LATE AHEAD OF THIS 
FRONT IN THE WRN CWFA.  WILL KEEP THE ERN CWFA DRY.

WILL CONTINUE SPS FOR MONTGOMERY AND HAMILTON COUNTIES REGARDING THE 
FIRST HEAT WAVE OF THE SEASON.

.ILN...NONE.

ALLISONS REMNANTS. 

WEAK SFC PATTERN WILL PERSIST IN OUR AREA THROUGH THE FCST PERIOD 
WITH MOST ORGANIZED PRECIP NEAR NORTHERN PLAINS LOW AND ALLISONS 
REMNANTS. THIS EVENINGS MAIN CONCERN WILL BE FROM ACTIVITY THAT 
DEVELOPS ALONG OUTFLOW THAT IS ACROSS NORTHERN OHIO. ILL GO WITH 
THIS EVENING PERIOD...WITH BETTER CHANCE NORTH CLOSER TO THE 
BOUNDARY AND 20 POPS SOUTH.

WITH H5 RIDGE BUILDING ON WEDNESDAY AND ALLISONS REMNANTS STAYING 
FARTHER SOUTHEAST THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED...ILL REMOVE POPS IN 
ZONES WHILE PUTTING 20% IN CCF.  FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT...ILL HAVE 30 
POPS ONLY IN THE SOUTHEAST CLOSER TO TROPICAL REMNANTS. FOR 
THURSDAY  ILL GO WITH 30 POPS IN THE EAST WITH PVA AND MOISTURE 
WORKING IN THERE AND DRIER CONDITIONS IN THE WEST.

FWC TEMPS HAVE GENERAL TREND CORRECT WITH HIGHS AROUND 90 THE NEXT 
COUPLE DAYS.  HIGH OF 93 AT DAY ON WEDNESDAY LOOKS A BIT HIGH AND 89 
AT CVG ON THURSDAY LOOKS LOW...BUT REST OF FWC HIGHS LOOK HARD TO 
BEAT.  FWC LOWS IN UPPER 60S APPEAR SLIGHTLY COOL SO ILL GENERALLY 
GO A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE FWC. 

SPS WILL BE ISSUED AGAIN TO HIGHLIGHT THE HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS.

.ILN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 AM EDT TUE JUN 12 2001

MAIN FOCUS THIS MORNING IS THE WEAKENING MCS OVER NRN IN...EXTREME 
WRN OH...AND SRN MI.  ALTHOUGH MCS IS WEAKENING...SOME SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY MAKE IT INTO THE NRN CWFA BEFORE 
DISSIPATING.  POPS AND OR COVERAGE WORDING WILL BE A LAST MINUTE 
DECISION.  OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY BUILD ALOFT TODAY 
AND CONTINUE INTO WEDNESDAY.  THIS WILL PROVIDE HOT TEMPERATURES FOR 
THE FIRST TIME THIS SEASON.  DESPITE BUILDING HIGH PRESSURE 
TODAY...AIRMASS IS FCST TO BE VERY UNSTABLE BY THIS AFTERNOON AS 
TEMPS RISE TO AROUND 90 AND DEWPOINTS HOVER AROUND 70 (RESULTING IN 
SB CAPES AROUND 3500-4000).  OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM CURRENT MCS WILL 
BE A PLAYER FOR CONVECTION THIS AFTN.  IT IS HARD TO DETERMINE ATTM 
WHERE EXACTLY THIS BOUNDARY WILL STOP...BUT CURRENT THINKING IS THAT 
IT WILL END UP SOMEWHERE SOUTH OF I-70 BUT NORTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  
WITH HEAT AND HUMIDITY COMBINED WITH THE FOCUS OF THIS BOUNDARY 
...WILL GO 40 POPS FOR CVG AND PMH GROUPS NORTH OF THE RIVER.  FOR 
THE NRN CWFA...MESO ETA IS HINTING AT A MCV CURRENTLY OVER 
IOWA...MOVING EAST INTO SRN MI OR NRN IN BY LATE IN THE DAY.  IF 
THIS HOLDS TO TRUTH...THE RIPPLING EFFECT FROM THIS S/WV MAY ALSO 
KICK OFF SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS ACRS THE NRN CWFA LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON.  WILL ALSO GO 40 POPS THERE.  THE FAR SOUTH SHOULD HAVE 
THE LEAST CHC OF RAIN AND WILL GO 30 POPS THERE.

FOR TONIGHT...PLAN ON LEAVING SOME EVENING THUNDERSTORM WORDING 
...THEN SKIES SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR.  TEMPS WILL DIP TO AROUND 
70.

ON WEDNESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE IS SITUATED OVER THE CWFA.  HOWEVER 
...MSTR FROM THE REMNANTS OF ALLISON IS FCST TO MOVE INTO THE ERN 
CWFA.  THE AIRMASS...IN THE VERTICAL...REMAINS MUCH DRIER ACRS THE 
WEST THAN THE EAST.  WITH THAT IN MIND...WILL ONLY PLACE A 30 POP IN 
THE ERN CWFA FOR AFTN CONVECTION.

SPS WILL BE ISSUED AGAIN TO HIGHLIGHT THE HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS.


.ILN...NONE.

DEPICTS A PRONOUNCED MOIST AXIS ACRS CENTRAL/SOUTHERN OHIO...ARCING 
NW INTO NORTHERN ILLINOIS AND IOWA.  AIRMASS NOTIECABLY DRIER

AHEAD OF SHORT WAVE.  MCS WL LIKELY FOLLOW ALONG THE NORTHERN EDGE 
OF THE MOISTURE GRADIENT...PROPOGATING ESE ALONG THE 850/300 
THICKNESS CONTOURS.  AXIS OF VERY HIGH PCPN EFFICIENCY AND WEAK LLVL 
CONVERGENCE PROGGED TO MV ACRS NORTHERN SXNS LATE TNGT INTO TUE 
MORNING...A SITN MUCH LIKE LAST NIGHT.  WL BUMP POPS UP (40) OVER 
THE NW...BUT LEAVE ALONE IN THE NE AS TIMING SUGGEST ACTIVTY CUD BE 
MAINLY AFTER SUNRISE.  WL ALSO OPERN WARMER TEMP RANGES IN THE NW 
WITH DWPTS ALREAD AOA 70...OTHW REST OF FCST LOOKS GREAT.

ALL THE UPPER FORCING SWINGS EAST BY EARLY EVENING. ALTHOUGH 850 MB 
MOISTURE INCREASES AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITHOUT A KICKER...WILL REMOVE 
THE MENTION OF PRECIPITATION TONIGHT.  WEAK BOUNDARY SETS UP ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FA MONDAY.  WITH INCREASED LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE...MODELS ARE SHOWING SOME INSTABILITY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
3/4 OF THE FA.  WILL KEEP A 30 POP THERE...BUT THERE IS A LITTLE 
MORE STABLE AIR ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES...SO TRY 
AND LEAVE THEM DRY.

AS UPPER RIDGE TRIES TO BUILD IN MONDAY NIGHT...ONCE AGAIN THERE IS 
A LACK OF A KICKER...SO WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY.  ETA SWINGS A 
PRETTY GOOD VORT FROM EASTERN IA TO NORTHERN MI ON TUESDAY.  IN 
ADDITION...IT PRODUCES AN AREA OF -10 LI AND OVER 4000 J/KG OF CAPE 
ACROSS EXTREME NW OH.  THE AVN IS STRONGER WITH THE UPPER RIDGE AND 
DOESNT HAVE VORT.  FEEL THAT THE ETA IS OVER DONE WITH ITS VORT AND 
INSTABILITY...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH CONTINUITY AND WILL LEAVE 
TUESDAY DRY.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...NGM MOS LOWS LOOK A LITTLE COOL TONIGHT AND 
MONDAY NIGHT...SO WILL ADD A DEGREE OR SO.  HAVE BEEN TRYING TO 
AVOID GOING INTO THE 90S ON TUESDAY. HOWEVER BOTH NGM AND MAV MOS IS 
SHOWING 90S.  STILL FEEL THAT WITH MIGHT BE A LITTLE OVER 
DONE...BUT WILL GO WITH LOW 90S IN THE SW AROUND 90 EVERYWHERE ELSE 
BUT EXTREME NW...THERE WILL GO UPPER 80S.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

LOOKS LIKE SRN PORTIONS OF FA MAY BE CAPPED A LTL. HOWEVER...GIVEN 
INSTBLTY AND PSBLTY OF ANY PCPN ACRS THE N DRIFTING DOWN INTO THE S 
THRU LATE IN THE DAY...WL KP LOW CHC POPS GOING ACRS AREA ON MON BUT 
THINK BEST CHC WL BE ACRS THE N. TMPS CONT TO WARM ON MON WITH 8H 
TMPS ARND 17 C WHICH SHUD ALLOW TMPS TO WARM INTO THE UPPER 80S MOST 
AREAS. 

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT





FXUS61 KILN 100127
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
926PM EDT SAT JUN 9 2001

CURRENT FCST IS HARD TO ARGUE WITH. WILL UPDATE CMH ZONE GROUPING 
ONLY TO DROP TEMPERATURES TO A 50 TO 55 RANGE. HIGHER DEWPOINT AIR 
REALLY ESTABLISHING ITSELF W OF FCST AREA AND SHOULD KEEP A W-E 
(MORE NW-SE WITH ORIENTATION OF HIGH) GRADIENT OF OVERNIGHT LOWS.

UPPER 50S AND LOW 60S DEWPOINTS OVER MUCH OF WRN IN...ILL...AND INTO 
WI AND MI SHOULD REMAIN W AND NW OF FCST AREA OVERNIGHT...BUT WILL 
DEFINITELY PUT A HAMPER ON OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE NORTHWEST. WILL 
LEAVE FCST ALONE HERE WITH MID 50S...AND THIS JIVES FAIRLY WELL W/ 
SURROUNDING OFFICES. 

OTHERWISE...CANT IMPROVE ON CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT VARIABLE WIND 
WITH HIGH SETTLING OVER FCST AREA.

.ILN...NONE.

000 
FXUS61 KILN 091818
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
218 PM EDT SAT JUN 9 2001

HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI/LOWER OHIO VALLEY WILL 
DRIFT EAST...AND WILL BE CENTERED NEAR CVG BY 12Z SUNDAY.  ALL 
MODELS ACGREE IN BRING VORT MAX OVER THE RIDGE AND ACROSS THE U P OF 
MICHIGANSUNDAY.  BEST UPPER DYNAMICS ARE SHUNTED EAST AS SURFACE 
HIGH HANGS TOUGH ON SUNDAY.  MODELS DO TRY TO SWING A VORT SW OF FA 
ON SUNDAY...BUT LOW LEVELS PRETTY DRY AND STABLE...SO IT LOOKS LIKE 
THAT ENERGY WILL BE WASTED.  IT DOES LOOK LIKE THERE WILL BE SOME 
LOW AND MID LEVEL MOISTURE WORKING INTO THE EXTREME NORTHWEST ON 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON...SO WILL MENTION SOME KIND OF BECOMING PARTLY 
CLOUDY WORDING.

WEAKENING FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THE VORT DROPS INTO NORTHERN OHIO ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT.  THE SURFACE HIGH REALLY HOLDS IN AND MODELS ARE 
SHOWING A PRETTY STABLE ATMOSPHERE WITH LI IN THE POSITIVE NUMBERS 
ACROSS THE SOUTH.  IT LOOKS ANY CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE AFTER 
MIDNIGHT IN THE NORTHWEST QUARTER OF THE FA.  THE AVN IS MORE 
AGGRESSIVE WITH THE QPF AND PUSHES IT FARTHER SOUTH ON MONDAY.  WITH 
RAIN ALREADY IN THE FORECAST AND FRONT IN THE AREA...DONT FEEL 
COMFORTABLE TAKING IT OUT.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...LOWS LAST NIGHT WERE GENERALLY IN THE LOWER 
50S.  AT FIRST GLANCE WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S WAS 
EXPECTING THE SAME AGAIN TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY WITH THE CENTER OF THE 
HIGH FORECATS OVER TOP OF THE FA.  ALL GUIDANCE HOWEVER CAME IN 
WARMER...WITH MID 50S.  MOS HAS DEWPOINTS RISING OVERNIGHT...AND 
WITH LOOKING OUT WEST...THERE ARE HIGHER DEWPOINTS.  MOS YESERDAY 
HANDLED THE LOWS VERY WELL...SO WILL ONLY GO WITH MID 50S IN THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTH AND 50 TO 55 IN THE SOUTH.  AS A MATTER OF 
FACT...DIDNT MAKE TOO MANY CHANGES TO IN THE 2ND OR 3RD PERIODS.  
DID TRIM HIGHS ON MONDAY A LITTLE. WITH FRONT IN THE AREA...SHOULD 
SEE SOME CLOUDS...AND DONT THINK WE CAN GET TO MOS NUMBERS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 081853
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EDT FRI JUN 8 2001

CURRENT SAT IMAGERY INDICATES BKN CU ACROSS SRN PORTION OF 
FA...SUPPORTED BY WK SEWRD MOVING S/W. HIGH PRESSURE WNW OF FA WILL 
CONTINUE TO BUILD IN AS THE AFTERNOON PROGRESSES.

THE LATEST MODEL RUNS SHOW LITTLE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THEMSELVES. THE 
ETA TREND HOWEVER IS TO BE FASTER AND A BIT FURTHER NORTH WITH THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS S/W AT 36H. THIS SEEMS TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH THE 
AVN. THE ETA ALSO SEEMS TO BE A BIT FURTHER NORTH WITH THE 
ASSOCIATED UPPER MIDWEST SFC REFLECTION OF THIS SYSTEM...AGAIN 
BRINGING IT MORE IN LINE WITH THE AVN.

AS FOR TONIGHT...EXPECT THE SFC HIGH TO BECOME ESTABLISHED ACROSS 
OUR FA. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP OFF. WILL STAY CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE VALUES.

FOR SATURDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WITH MSUNNY SKIES WILL DOMINATE. 
THICKNESS ANALYSIS VERSUS GUIDANCE VALUES APPEAR IN GOOD AGREEMENT.

FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...WILL BE CONCERNED WITH CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
WELL NW OF FA. FEEL THAT SOME BLOWOFF CLDS WILL AFFECT NRN PORTION 
OF FA. SLIGHT CHC POPS EXPECTED ACROSS EXTREME N PORTION OF FA. WILL 
NOT PUP POP WORDING IN FCST.

FOR SUNDAY...APPEARS BEST FORCING WILL BE JUST N OF FA. EXPECT SOME 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY TO SPILL INTO NRN HALF OF FA...GIVEN ORIENTATION 
OF MEAN CLOUD BEARING LAYER. WILL GO CHC POPS ACROSS NRN HALF OF 
AREA...BUT WILL KEEP POPS OUT OF S. THICKNESS GUIDANCE SHOWS TEMPS 
WARMING TO AROUND 80 MOST LOCATIONS.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
350 AM EDT THU JUN 7 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN IS IN TRANSITION TO A SOMEWHAT MORE AMPLIFIED 
REGIME WITH DEEPENING TROF OVER EASTERN CONUS AND RIDGE IN THE WEST.
WEST-NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT OVER THE OHIO VALLEY THIS MORNING WILL 
TURN NORTHWEST AFTER THE NEXT SHORT WAVE DROPS DOWN THROUGH OHIO 
TONIGHT.  

SFC MAP FEATURES FRONT BETWEEN CVG AND LEX MOVING SLOWLY SOUTH. 
FRONT WAS FOCUS FOR HEAVY RAIN/FLOODING YESTERDAY (SEE CLELSRILN). 
BROAD HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING DOWN BEHIND FRONT WILL DRY THINGS OUT 
CONSIDERABLY OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS.

THERES STILL ENOUGH MOISTURE LEFT OVER BEHIND THE FRONT...ALONG 
WITH A BIT OF PVA AND INSTABILITY TO WARRANT A 20 POP TODAY. 
PARTLY CLOUDY WILL WORK FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUING TO BUILD IN...BRINGING DOWNWARD MOTION AND DRY AIR 
THROUGH MOST OF THE AIR COLUMN. ILL MENTION PATCHY FOG TONIGHT WITH 
LIGHT WINDS AND LOTS OF MOISTURE LEFT NEAR THE GROUND.

FWC TEMPS LOOK A BIT TOO COOL SO ILL GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE...ESPECIALLY 
FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS. 

.ILN...NONE

1056 PM EDT WED JUN 6 2001

SHOWERS SHOULD NOT POSE A THREAT FOR FLOODING. THUNDER ACTIVITY HAS 
DECREASED TO ALMOST NOTHING AS WELL. 

CANT RULE OUT A LINGERING SHOWER UNTIL LAST BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH. 
BOUNDARY IS CURRENTLY SITUATED S OF CMH NR CIRCLEVILLE...THROUGH 
WILMINTON AND SEEMS TO FIZZLE OVER CVG.

WILL TRY AND RE-BLEND ZONE COMBINATIONS TO A MORE REASONABLE 
REPRESENTATION FOR THE REST OF THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD. 

.ILN...NONE

FRANKS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
730 PM EDT WED JUN 6 2001

SFC LOW BROADENING AND STRETCHING ALONG REMNANTS OF WM FRONT WITH 
MAIN LINE OF CONVECTION SLOWLY DROPPING SOUTHEAST INTO S CNTL 
OH...NE KY...AND AIMING TOWARDS WV. INITIALLY THOUGHT TO CLEAR NWRN 
AREAS OF FLOOD WATCH WITH PASSAGE OF MAIN LINE...BUT MORE SHOWERS 
DEVELOPING ALONG A BOUNDARY TO THE NORTHWEST OF IT.

ALREADY HAVE LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE WEST AND MIDNIGHT WORDING FOR 
RAIN IN NORTH HALF OF CWA. WILL NOT MESS WITH CENTRAL OH AS HIGH 
PWATS EXPECTED TO REMAIN OVER REGION THROUGH AT LEAST THIS TIME OR 
UNTIL NE WINDS HAVE A CHANCE OT KICK IN SOME DRIER AIR. THIS IS SAME 
REASONING BEHIND NOT DROPPING FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN WRN FCST AREA.

MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT WITH GENERAL SOUTHERLY MOVEMENT OF 
FRONT...AND CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH IT. EXPECT TO SEND UPDATE 
AROUND 8 PM TO CUT POPS OUT OF FAR NWRN ZONES AND BUMP EVENING WINDS 
A LITTLE. LIKELY EXPECT ANOTHER UPDATE AROUND 11:30 THIS EVENING.

.ILN...

INZ073>075...INZ080.
