FXUS61 KILN 061915
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EDT WED JUN 6 2001

KILN SHOWING CONVECTION DEVELOPING ALONG STATIONARY FRONT WHICH 
STRETCHES FROM NORTH OF CMH TO DAY TO VERSAILLES.  THERE IS A WEAK 
SURFACE LOW NEAR DAY WHICH HELP TO INITIATE THE CONVECTION.  
CONVECTION IS A BIT STRONGER/DEEPER TOWARD VERSAILLES WHICH IS 
CLOSER TO HIGH THETA-E AIR.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLOUDS 
THINNING OVER SOUTHERN OHIO AND CLEARING OUT OVER CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN IL/INDIANA.

WILL TRIM BACK THE FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN THE DAYTON AND RICHMOND 
AREAS AND EXTEND WATCH THROUGH MIDNIGHT TONIGHT FOR THE REST OF THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF FA.  PWS ARE BETWEEN 1.5 AND 2 INCHES THROUGH THIS 
EVENING.  MEAN FLOW STILL SHOWING TRAINING ECHOES WILL BE A 
PROBLEM.  ETA SHOWING LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE OVER ALONG AND NEAR THE 
OHIO RIVER BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z THIS EVENING.  

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH SLIDING FRONT TO THE SOUTH 
OF FA BY LATE TONIGHT.  NOT REAL CONFIDENT ON THIS ASPECT OF 
FORECAST.  TROPICAL DEPRESSION ALLISON OVER SOUTHERN MS MAY HELP TO 
HOLD THINGS UP.  QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARIES SEEM TO HANG AROUND THE 
OHIO VALLEY LONGER THAN EXPECTED.  ETA AND ESPECIALLY THE AVN BRING 
A NORTHERLY WAVE DOWN INTO REGION BY LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING ON 
THURSDAY.  THIS IS A BIT FASTER THAN RUNS FROM YESTERDAY.  AS A 
RESULT OF THESE INGREDIENTS WILL LEAVE 30 AFTERNOON POP EVEN THOUGH 
ALL THE GUIDANCE IS QUIET PALTRY.  

WILL KEEP EXTENDED RELATIVELY DRY EXCEPT FOR THE THREAT OF 
CONVECTION SUNDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

.ILN...
IN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THIS EVENING FOR ZONES INZ066...
INZ073>075...INZ080.

KY...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THIS EVENING FOR ZONES KYZ089>100.

OH...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THIS EVENING FOR ZONES OHZ063>064...
OHZ070>074...OHZ077>082...OHZ088.

135 
FXUS61 KILN 060758
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
359 AM EDT WED JUN 6 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS WEAK H5 RIDGE ACROSS OHIO VALLEY.  WESTERLY 
FLOW ALOFT WILL BECOME NORTHWESTERLY BY FRIDAY AS SHORT WAVES BREAK 
DOWN THE RIDGE.

SFC MAP HAS WARM FRONT JUST NORTH OF ILN. THIS BOUNDARY IS PROGGED 
TO MOVE SLIGHTLY NORTH OF CMH TODAY.  RADAR SHOWS A FEW TSRA NORTH 
OF CMH AND WEST OF DAY MOVING ALONG DEW POINT GRADIENT.  WIDESPREAD 
TSRA FROM MISSOURI INTO ILLINOIS ARE OCCURRING AHEAD OF SHORT WAVE 
OVER WESTERN MISSOURI.  MODELS AGREE IN BRINGING SHORT WAVE THROUGH 
OHIO BY 00Z THIS EVENING.  

ILL KEEP LIKELY POPS TODAY WITH SHORT WAVE MOVING ALONG BOUNDARY 
ACROSS OUR AREA. MODELS SHOW PWAT OF 1.8...GIVING THE SHORT WAVE 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE TO WORK WITH.  TRAINING AND BACK BUILDING WILL 
ALSO BE POSSIBLE TODAY WITH FRONT NEARLY PARALLEL TO UPPER FLOW. 
ILL ALLOW CURRENT FFA TO EXPIRE...BUT WELL ISSUE ESF TO HIGHLIGHT 
RAIN POTENTIAL.

FRONT IS PROGGED TO DROP SOUTH TONIGHT IN THE WAKE OF THE SHORT 
WAVE. THOUGH HIGH SFC DEWPOINTS AND SOME SFC CONVERGENCE WILL STILL 
BE PRESENT...POPS WILL DIMINISH TO CHANCE TONIGHT IN THE ABSENCE OF 
MAJOR UPPER DYNAMIC SUPPORT...WITH HIGHER POPS IN THE SOUTH CLOSER 
TO THE BOUNDARY. ILL ALSO KEEP CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES EXCEPT CMH FOR 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS DEW POINTS WILL REMAIN HIGH AND ANOTHER SHORT 
WAVE WILL ARRIVE LATE IN THE DAY.

FWC HIGH TEMPS LOOK DECENT AND I WONT DIFFER MUCH. THAT MEANS ILL 
BE RAISING FCST TEMPS BOTH DAYS WITH THE FRONT GOING SLOWER THAN 
PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS HAD INDICATED. ILL GO ABOVE FWC LOWS AS DEW 
POINTS ARE LIKELY TO REMAIN HIGHER THAN INDICATED ON THE NGM.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

000 
FXUS61 KILN 051815
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 PM EDT TUE JUN 5 2001

17Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A WARM FRONT FROM EXTREME SW OHIO...THE 
SRN THIRD OF INDIANA...AND THEN INTO CNTRL IL.

SHOWERS AND TSTMS HAVE NOT DEVELOPED IN A WIDESPREAD MANNER (AS 
PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED).  KEY FOR TONIGHT/S CONVECTION WILL BE THE 
NORTHWARD PROGRESS OF THE WARM FRONT COMBINED WITH ANY LOW LVL 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES/UPR LVL S/WVS.

CURRENT VISIBLE IMAGERY INDICATED ONE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY SLICING 
THROUGH THE CWFA (NEAR MGY AND CMH).  THIS HAS STOPPED THE 
ADVANCEMENT OF THE WARM FRONT FROM REACHING DAY AND CMH.  QUESTION 
IS:  HOW FAR WILL THIS WARM FRONT ADVANCE?  BOTH ETA AND AVN HAVE 
THE WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY NORTH OF DAY AND CMH BY 21Z.  AS OF 
NOW...BELIEVE WARM FRONT MAY MAKE IT JUST SOUTH OF DAY AND 
CMH...THEN STALL AS CONVECTION DEVELOPS TO THE WEST...RIDING ALONG 
AND NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY.  MODELS SHOW A S/WV OVER NRN MO MOVING 
ACRS IL AND INDIANA OVERNIGHT...AND INTO OHIO BY MORNING.  THIS UPR 
LVL SUPPORT COMBINE WITH WARM...MOIST FLOW WILL CAUSE SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ACRS THE REGION...MOST NUMEROUS ACRS THE 
NORTH.  THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINFALL AS PW/S REACH 
AROUND 1.5 INCHES.  WILL ISSUE AN ESF (FLOOD POTENTIAL OUTLOOK) TO 
HIGHLIGHT POSSIBLE HYDRO PROBLEMS.  THIS WILL GIVE THE EVENING OR 
MIDNIGHT SHIFT TIME TO PINPOINT THE BEST AREA TO ISSUE A WATCH...IF 
NEEDED.

ON WEDNESDAY...THE WARM FRONT IN THE VICINITY COMBINED WITH WEAK LOW 
LVL FORCING WILL CONTINUE THE THREAT FOR SHOWERS/TSTMS.  ANOTHER 
S/WV PUSHES TOWARD THE REGION BY EVENING.  THIS WILL GRADUALLY SAG A 
COLD FRONT ACRS THE CWFA...DIMINISHING PCPN ACTIVITY FROM NW TO SE.

ON THURSDAY...A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER ACRS THE SOUTH...OTHERWISE 
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES ARE EXPECTED.

TEMPS WILL BE CLOUD/RAIN DEPENDENT.  WILL STICK CLOSE TO MOS.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 051344
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
940 AM EDT TUE JUN 5 2001

SFC MAP AT 12Z DEPICTED A WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY FROM ABOUT 
JKL...THEN ANGLING TOWARD THE NORTHWEST JUST NORTH OF SDF AND 
LEX...THEN INTO SW INDIANA.  ALSO...MOSAIC RADAR SHOWED A MCS ACRS 
NRN INDIANA.

06Z MESO ETA CONTINUES TO SHOW THE WARM FRONT PIVOTING SLOWLY NORTH 
THIS AFTN INTO THE CWFA.  THE MCV NOTED BY RUC40 OVER NRN INDIANA 
MOVES ACRS NRN OHIO THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON.  THE COMBINATION OF THE 
ADVANCING WARM FRONT COUPLED WITH THE MCV AND ANY OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES 
FROM THE MCS SHOULD PRODUCE THE GREATEST THREAT FOR SHWRS/ELEVATED 
TSTMS ACRS THE NRN CWFA.  WHERE THE WARM FRONT PASSES BY...ENOUGH 
SUNSHINE WILL PRODUCE SBCAPES AROUND 1000 J/KG.  THE LOCATIONS SOUTH 
OF THE WARM FRONT WILL LIKELY SEE MORE SCATTERED ACTIVITY.

PW ON KILN SOUNDING IS QUITE MOIST (1.33 INCHES)...SO TSTMS WILL BE  
CAPABLE OF PRODUCING HEAVY RAIN.  WHERE CLOUDS AND RAIN 
PERSIST...MAY HAVE TO TWEAK TEMPS DOWN.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 050659
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 AM EDT TUE JUN 5 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN FEATURES H5 RIDGE AXIS FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE UP TO 
MSP. RIDGE WILL BREAK DOWN OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AS A STRONG 
SHORT WAVE MOVES UP THE WEST SIDE OF THE RIDGE TO NEAR CHI. H5 FLOW 
WILL BECOME WEST-NORTHWESTERLY OVER THE EASTERN CONUS ON THURSDAY AS 
STRONG RIDGE REBUILDS OVER THE FOUR CORNERS REGION.

SFC MAP HAS WARM FRONT ACROSS KENTUCKY EXTENDING FROM BROAD LOW 
PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN HIGH PLAINS.  MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT IN 
BRINGING FRONT NORTH TO THE OHIO RIVER BY 00Z THIS EVENING AS SHORT 
WAVE MOVES NORTHEAST TO CHI. FRONT IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE NORTH 
TONIGHT AND THEN REMAIN ACROSS OHIO ON WEDNESDAY.

TSRA ARE MOVING TOWARD CVG IN WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT ALONG STRONG 
THETA-E GRADIENT NORTH OF WARM FRONT. ILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS IN 
THE SOUTH TODAY WITHOUT TRYING TO TIME THE ACTIVITY AS MORE TSRA MAY 
OCCUR LATER IN THE DAY AS THE FRONT ENCROACHES ON CVG. CHANCE POPS 
STILL LOOK GOOD AT DAY AND CMH AS FRONT WILL REMAIN SOUTH OF THERE 
UNTIL TONIGHT AND MODEL PROGS SHOW STABLE CONDITIONS. WITH FRONT 
PERSISTING TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...ILL KEEP LIKELY POPS BOTH 
PERIODS ALL ZONES. 

FLOODING MAY BECOME A CONCERN OVER THIS FCST PERIOD WITH SLOW MOVING 
FRONT AROUND AND PWAT OVER 1.5.  WELL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE OUT FOR 
ANY AREAS THAT EXPERIENCE RECURRING TSRA...ESPECIALLY IN OUR 
SOUTHERN HALF WHERE FFG VALUES ARE LOWER.

TEMPS WILL WARM UP TODAY AS FRONT APPROACHES...HOW MUCH IS THE 
QUESTION. ILL GO SLIGHTLY BELOW FWC TODAY WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIP 
AROUND...THOUGH IT COULD GO ABOVE FWC IF THE FRONT ARRIVES EARLIER 
THAN EXPECTED. AVN AND ETA INDICATE DEW POINTS ABOVE 65 WEDNESDAY 
12Z SO ILL GO ABOVE FWCS 60-63 FOR TONIGHTS LOW.  FWCS 71-75 
LOOKS A BIT LOW FOR WEDNESDAY SO ILL GO JUST ABOVE.   

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

TONIGHT AND THEN REMAIN ACROSS OHIO ON WEDNESDAY.

TSRA ARE MOVING TOWARD CVG IN WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT ALONG STRONG 
THETA-E GRADIENT NORTH OF WARM FRONT. ILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS IN 
THE SOUTH TODAY WITHOUT TRYING TO TIME THE ACTIVITY AS MORE TSRA MAY 
OCCUR LATER IN THE DAY AS THE FRONT ENCROACHES ON CVG. CHANCE POPS 
STILL LOOK GOOD AT DAY AND CMH AS FRONT WILL REMAIN SOUTH OF THERE 
UNTIL TONIGHT AND MODEL PROGS SHOW STABLE CONDITIONS. WITH FRONT 
PERSISTING TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...ILL KEEP LIKELY POPS BOTH 
PERIODS ALL ZONES. 

FLOODING MAY BECOME A CONCERN OVER THIS FCST PERIOD WITH SLOW MOVING 
FRONT AROUND AND PWAT OVER 1.5.  WELL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE OUT FOR 
ANY AREAS THAT EXPERIENCE RECURRING TSRA...ESPECIALLY IN OUR 
SOUTHERN HALF WHERE FFG VALUES ARE LOWER.

TEMPS WILL WARM UP TODAY AS FRONT APPROACHES...HOW MUCH IS THE 
QUESTION. ILL GO SLIGHTLY BELOW FWC TODAY WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIP 
AROUND...THOUGH IT COULD GO ABOVE FWC IF THE FRONT ARRIVES EARLIER 
THAN EXPECTED. AVN AND ETA INDICATE DEW POINTS ABOVE 65 WEDNESDAY 
12Z SO ILL GO ABOVE FWCS 60-63 FOR TONIGHTS LOW.  FWCS 71-75 
LOOKS A BIT LOW FOR WEDNESDAY SO ILL GO JUST ABOVE.   

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO














815 PM EDT MON JUN 4 2001

WL BE UPDATING TO REMOVE EVENING PD FOR ALL ZONES SHORTLY...AND IT 
LOOKS LIKE THIS WILL BE THE UPDATE FOR THE NIGHT. HAVE ADJUSTED 
SOUTHERN ZONES SLIGHTLY TO MAKE CHC PCP WORDING EITHER LATE OR 
TOWARD DYBREAK. STILL LOOKING AT PRETTY GOOD POTL FOR MCS 
DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT...AND GENERAL THINKING IS STILL FOR A SE 
MOVEMENT FM MO/IA INTO FAR SRN ZONES LATE TNGT. PRIME AREA WL MOST 
LIKELY BE INTO CNTRL KY.

FXUS61 KILN 041839
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 PM EDT MON JUN 4 2001

MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE VORTICITY WAS CENTERED NEAR INDIANAPOLIS THIS 
AFTN.  THIS FEATURE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE CURRENT SHOWERS/TSTMS 
ACRS THE REGION.

GIVEN CURRENT RATE OF PCPN MOVING OFF TO THE EAST...WILL TRY TO HOLD 
ON TO ZONES UNTIL 4 PM IN HOPES MOST OF THE ACTIVITY IS EAST AND 
SOUTH OF THE CWFA.  

I HAVE TAKEN A BLEND OF THE MESO ETA/AVN SOLUTION FOR THE SHORT TERM 
FCST.

LATEST SFC MAP INDICATED A PSUEDO WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACRS THE FAR 
SRN CWFA.  THE MORE PRONOUNCED WARM FRONT WAS LOCATED SOUTH OF 
THIS...EXTENDING FROM ERN TN...S CNTRL KY THEN WESTWARD INTO SRN MO 
AND NE OKLA.  THE PRONOUNCED WARM FRONT SHOULD STAY PRETTY MUCH AT 
BAY OVERNIGHT AS CURRENT OUTFLOW BOUNDARY INTERSECTING IT WILL 
CURTAIL ITS MOVEMENT NORTHWARD.  MOST OF THE REGION SHOULD STAY 
DRY.  HOWEVER...A WEAK MCV OVR CNTRL MO COMBINED WITH WEAK LOW LEVEL 
FORCING CALLS FOR A SML CHC FOR SHOWERS/TSMTS ACRS THE FAR SRN CWFA.

ON TUESDAY...THE AFOREMENTIONED WARM FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY NE 
THROUGH THE CWFA AS MID LVL RIDGING BUILDS WEST OF THE REGION.
HOWEVER...IT WILL STALL OUT ACRS THE CWFA FROM A NW TO SE 
ORIENTATION.  WITHOUT ANY SIGNIFICANT S/WV OR UPR DIV 
EXPECTED...CHC/S FOR SHOWERS/TSTMS WILL BE MAINLY INDUCED BY THE 
WARM FRONT ITSELF.  WILL INTRODUCE 30 POPS FOR THE AFTN IN THE NRN 
ZONES WITH 40 PERCENT FOR THE REST OF THE REGION.

ON TUESDAY NIGHT...S/WV ENERGY AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE INITIATED 
BY A SFC LOW PRESSURE WAVE OVER ILLINOIS WILL GENERATE 
SHOWERS/TSTM.  THESE SHOULD INFILTRATE THE NWRN CWFA.  A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND TSTMS WILL BE KEPT ELSEWHERE.

ON WEDNESDAY...AFOREMENTIONED SFC WAVE AND APCHING COLD FRONT WILL 
BRING LIKELY POPS TO THE REGION.  COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
REGION WED NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING.

MOS TEMPS LOOK GOOD...SO I HAVE NOT STRAYED MUCH FROM THE GUIDANCE.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN






















FXUS61 KILN 041257
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
855 AM EDT MON JUN 4 2001

FCST PROBLEM THIS MORNING/THIS AFTN WILL REVOLVE AROUND THE REMNANTS 
OF THE MCS TO THE WEST OF THE CWFA.

MOSAIC RADAR SHOWS A FAIRLY LARGE AREA OF RAIN ACRS PARTS OF NRN 
IL...CNTRL IL...CNTRL AND SRN IN...AND NRN KY AND SW OH.  THE LARGER 
AREA OF RAIN OVER IL WAS THE RESULT OF A MCS THAT DEVELOPED LAST 
NIGHT.  THE PREVIOUS MESO ETA AND CURRENT 06Z MESO ETA DID NOT PLACE 
THE QPF WITH THIS SYSTEM CORRECTLY.  THIS MAY HAVE TO DO WITH THE 
PLACEMENT OF THE MCV...WHICH IS MORE LIKELY NEAR CNTRL IL THAN S 
CNTRL ILLINOIS (AS THE LAST RUC40 HAS SHOWN).  THUS...FOLLOWING THE 
CLOUD BEARING WIND...WHICH BECOMES MORE ZONAL TOWARD LATE 
MORNING/EARLY AFTN...SOME OF THE RAIN SHOULD PUSH INTO THE FAR NRN 
CWFA (WAPAKONETA) AND ALSO INTO CNTRL OHIO.  OF COURSE...THE TRICKY 
PART IS: HOW MUCH OF THE PCPN WL WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EAST?  RIGHT 
NOW...WILL LIKELY PLACE PCPN IN NRN CWFA AND UP THE POPS DAY/S CNTRL 
OHIO....AND KEEP HIGH POPS ACRS THE SOUTH.  TEMPS TODAY WILL BE 
CLOUD DEPENDENT.  RIGHT NOW...TEMP FCST LOOKS GOOD...BUT I MAY TWEAK 
DOWN JUST A TAD AT THE LAST MINUTE.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

326 AM EDT MON JUN 4 2001

AMPLFIED FLO PTN WITH PAIR OF UPR LOWS...ONE OVR NRN ROCKIES AND SECOND
OVR THE NE. INTIAL S/WV BUCKED RDG OVR MS VLY AND TRACKED ACRS NRN 
KY INTO WV PROVIDING SCTD SHWRS TO FAR S DURG EVE. S/WV OVR MO TO 
SPILL OVR RDG ACRS NRN KY THIS MRNG. ALL MODELS ARE TOO FAR S WITH
MCS OVR MO AND IA. WK H8 CNVRGC ACRS THE S TDA COUPLED WITH UPR
DIV IN RR QUAD OF 250 MB JET. PE/S AND 950MB CNVRGC ALSO FAVORABLE
ACRS NRN KY TDA. XPCT TO SEE ELEVATED CNVCTN TO CONT ESE ACRS FAR
S. WL GO WITH LKLY POPS ACRS NRN KY...AND CHC POPS ACRS SRN OH. 
CNTRL OH SHUD REMAIN DRY TDA...WHERE WL GO WITH SILENT 20 POP.
TEMP WISE...ETA SFC TEMPS AND THICKNESS SCHEMES SUPP HI/S SVRL
DEGS COOLER THAN FWC GUID.

S/WV TO ROTATE ARND WRN UP LO ACRS NRN PLNS TNGT. RDGG TO BLD E
WITH  WRN PTN OF WRMFNT XPCTD TO MOVE FARTHEST N. TRENDS A LTL
SLOWER TAKING FNT N INTO OH VLY. AVN HS BEST RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY
WITH BOUNDARY INTO SRN OH BY 12Z TUE. BEST FORCING REMAINS TO OUR
N AND W TNGT. WL DROP POPS BACK TO CHC CAT AND ONLY ACRS SRN SECTIONS
OVRNGT. HV FAVORED TEMPS CLOSER TO MAV GUID TNGT...ONLY A DEG OR TWO
COOLER THAN FWC.

WRMFNT XPCT TO CONT NWD TO CNTRL OH AS SFC WV DVLPS INTO MID MS VLY.
WL CONT CHC SHWRS/TSTMS WITH BEST THREAT ACRS S AND W SECTIONS. IN WRM
SECTOR XPCT TEMPS AOA GUID TUE. WL INCREASE POPS TO LKLY TUE NGT ACRS
WRN SECTIONS AND MAINTAIN A CHC IN THE E.

.ILN...NONE.

914 PM EDT SUN JUN 3 2001

AREA OF LIGHT RAIN MOVING EAST ACROSS SOUTHEAST INDIANA AND SW OH 
AND A FEW SHOWERS ACROSS NORTHERN KY AT THIS TIME. FORECAST LOOKS ON 
TRACK FOR THE MOST PART. THE BULK OF THE RAIN SHOULD OCCUR AFTER 
MIDNIGHT AS THE WARM ADVECTION INCREASES MAINLY ACROSS THE KY 
COUNTIES IN ILNS CWA AND THE FAR SOUTHERN OH COUNTIES. WILL LOWER 
POPS IN MIAMI VALLEY/EAST CENTRAL INDIANA TO 20 PERCENT AND MAKE 
SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO PRECIPITATION WORDING. SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS 
ALSO TO WINDS. OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPS LOOK GOOD.

FXUS61 KILN 031907
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EDT SUN JUN 3 2001

UPPER LOW DEPARTING TO THE NE...WITH A BROAD BAND OF WAA DRIVEN 
CLOUDS/PCPN RIGHT ON ITS HEELS.  THRU 18Z...AVN QPF LOOKS BEST WITH 
MSRBL PCPN FURTHER NORTH THAN THE ETA OR NGM.  HV FOLLOWED THE AVN 
SOLN MOST CLOSELY TNGT...AND WL TAPER POPS FROM HIGH LIKELY N KY TO 
CHC -RA IN THE DAYTON AREA.  EVEN THE TYPICALLY MORE UNSTABLE NGM 
NOT INDICATING ELEVATED INSTABILITY OVER OUR RGN TNGT...AND WL 
LIKELY REMOVE ALL TSRA MENTION FROM THE FIRST PD.

AREA WL REMAIN NORTH OF THE WARM FRONT ON MONDAY...BUT ALL GUID 
SUGGESTING SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY DVLPG OVER THE SOUTH.  WL HIT 
POPS HIGHEST(LIKELY) IN THE AXIS OF HIGHEST PCPN EFFICENCY OVER THE 
SOUTH...TAPERING TO LOW CHC NE.  WARM FRONT WL CONT TO MAKE SLOW 
PROGRESS NORTH INTO THE RGN MON NGT...CONTG INTO TUE.  WL LIKELY SEE 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX NEAR/JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA MON NGT WITH AN 
ADDITIONAL COMPLEX UPSTREAM IN MO/ILL.  WL CONT LIKELY POPS OVER THE 
FAR SOUTH...WITH CHC ELSW.  EXACT POSN OF WARM FRONT ON TUE HIGHLY 
DEPENDENT ON MESOSCALE EFFECTS...AND WL LIKELY BE SOUTH OF MODEL 
DEPICTION.  THIS WL KEEP ENTIRE AREA UNDER GOOD PCPN POTNL...BUT WL 
USE HIGHEST POPS IN THE NORTH WHERE BEST LARGE SCALE FORCING WL BE 
PRESENT.  AFTER 10-12 INCHES OF RAIN OVER PARTS OF THE CWFA IN 
MAY...ANOTHER ROUND OF EXTENDED CONVECTIVE POTNL IS THE LAST THING 
WE NEED.  WL HV TO CLOSELY MONITOR POTNL FOR +RA THRU MID WEEK.

WITH FAIRLY OPAQUE CLOUD OVER MUCH OF THE AREA TNGT...RAISED FWC 
TEMPS A DEG OR SO.  FOR MON...LEANED CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY COOLER 
FAN NUMBERS.  OTHW...GUID IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND STUCK CLOSE.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

SUGGESTING SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY DVLPG OVER THE SOUTH.  WL HIT 
POPS HIGHEST(LIKELY) IN THE AXIS OF HIGHEST PCPN EFFICENCY OVER THE 
SOUTH...TAPERING TO LOW CHC NE.  WARM FRONT WL CONT TO MAKE SLOW 
PROGRESS NORTH INTO THE RGN MON NGT...CONTG INTO TUE.  WL LIKELY SEE 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX NEAR/JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA MON NGT WITH AN 
ADDITIONAL COMPLEX UPSTREAM IN MO/ILL.  WL CONT LIKELY POPS OVER THE 
FAR SOUTH...WITH CHC ELSW.  EXACT POSN OF WARM FRONT ON TUE HIGHLY 
DEPENDENT ON MESOSCALE EFFECTS...AND WL LIKELY BE SOUTH OF MODEL 
DEPICTION.  THIS WL KEEP ENTIRE AREA UNDER GOOD PCPN POTNL...BUT WL 
USE HIGHEST POPS IN THE NORTH WHERE BEST LARGE SCALE FORCING WL BE 
PRESENT.  AFTER 10-12 INCHES OF RAIN OVER PARTS OF THE CWFA IN 
MAY...ANOTHER ROUND OF EXTENDED CONVECTIVE POTNL IS THE LAST THING 
WE NEED.  WL HV TO CLOSELY MONITOR POTNL FOR +RA THRU MID WEEK.

WITH FAIRLY OPAQUE CLOUD OVER MUCH OF THE AREA TNGT...RAISED FWC 
TEMPS A DEG OR SO.  FOR MON...LEANED CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY COOLER 
FAN NUMBERS.  OTHW...GUID IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND STUCK CLOSE.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1030 AM EDT SUN JUN 3 2001

WV IMAGERY AND LATEST SHORT RANGE GUID DEPICT ONE LAST WEAK 
SHORT WAVE SHEARING ACRS THE CWFA THIS MORNING.  A SFC TROF WAS ALSO 
NOTED MOVG INTO WEST CENTRAL OH ATTM.  SOME WIDELY SCT -SHRA WERE 
OCCURRING NORTH OF DAYTON IN ASSOCIATION WITH THESE FTRS...OTHW 
SKIES WERE PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY ACRS THE RGN.  WL NEED TO KEEP 
LOW POPS INTO THE ERLY AFTN ACRS CENTRAL OHIO AS SHORT WAVE AND SFC 
TROF MV THRU...OTHW LKS TO BE DRY .  BEST CHC FOR CONTD SUNSHINE 
WILL BE OVER THE SOUTH AND WEST...WHERE WL CONT WITH PTLY SUNNY FOR 
THE AFTN.  IN THE NORTH...CU SHUD FILL IN MOST OF THE BREAKS AND WL 
INDC A MCLDY TREND.  WL CUT TEMPS ONE CAT IN THE FAR NORTH...AND 
OPEN COOLER RANGES IN CENTRAL OHIO WITH CLOUDS AND WEAK CAA CONTG.

UPDATED ZFP OUT AFTER 11 AM.

TNGT.

IMAGERY THIS AFTN MOVG INTO NORTHERN MINNESOTA WL SHEAR THRU THE RGN.
WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY LINGERING...AND A LITTLE FORCING 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE AFOREMENTIONED WAVE...WL CARRY LOW POPS MAINLY 
IN THE AFTN OVER THE NE.  FWC TEMPS LK A BIT TOO WARM...ESPLY 
NORTH...GIVEN CONDS UPSTREAM AND GENRALLY UNDERCUT A DEG OR 2.  
STRONG WAA PATTERN DVLPS SUN NGT...ALTHOUGH WITH CONFLUENT FLOW 
ALOFT AND DRY AIR IN PLACE THINK PCPN WL HOLD OFF MOST AREAS TIL 
MON.  WL CARRY LOW POPS ONLY IN THE SW.  WARM FRONT CONTS TO 
APPROACH ON MONDAY.  BEST MSTR AND INSTABILITY (ALTHOUGH NOT BUYING 
INTO M70S DWPTS FROM THE ETA) OVER THE SW WHERE WL INDC LIKELY POPS.
WITH MOST OF THE AREA STILL NORTH OF THE WARM FRONT MONDAY...AND 
SCT-BKN PCPN CVRG XPCTD...HV UNDERCUT THE WARMER FWC NUMBERS.

.ILN...NONE.

SOLN/S. 

SFC LO OVR WI TO TRACK E INTO SRN LWR MI WITH CDFNT MOVG ACRS IL TO 
PASS THRU THE W DURG MID AFTN HRS AND BY LT AFTN IN ERN SECTIONS. 
RADAR SHWS PREFRONTAL WAA SHWRS WEAKENING AS THEY MOV INTO WRN IN.
XPCT THIS TREND TO CONT WITH SCTD SHWRS INTO WRN SECTIONS THIS MRNG. 
SFC CAPES TO BCM MODERATELY UNSTBL WITH VALUES OF 1200-1700 J/KG.
LO LVL MSTR CNVRGC ALONG WITH INSTBY SHUD LEAD TO DVLPMNT OF TSTMS
THIS AFTN. WL INDICATE THIS TIMING IN FCST. BASED ON LO LVL THICKNESS
SCHEMES PREFER TEMPS A LTL WRMR THAN GUID TDA.


UPR LO TRACKS ACRS LWR MI TNGT WITH NXT S/WV PIVOTING THRU OH DURG 
EVE. WL LIMIT CHC SHWRS TO EVE IN ALL BUT NRN ZONES WHERE BEST PE/S 
AND LO LVL CNVRGC WL EXIST. IN CAA WL FOLLOW MAV GUID A LTL COOLER 
THAN FWC GUID.

UPR LO TO SHIFT E THRU ERN GRTLKS SUN WITH WK SFC RDGG INTO THE AREA.
FWC APPEARS TOO FAST WITH WRM UP SUN. XPCT PARTIAL SUNSHINE BUT WL 
GO WITH COMPROMISE BTWN MAV/FWC FOR HI/S. WRMFNT OVERRUNNING PRECIP
INDICATED INTO THE FAR S SUN NGT. BOTH AVN AND ETA INDICATING THIS
FASTER TREND. WL INTRO LO POP LT IN FAR S SUN NGT AND WL HV TO ADD
CHC PRECIP FOR MON WITH WRMFNT PASSAGE XPCTD MON NGT.

.ILN...NONE.

SAT PIX SHWG CLRG ACRS ERN IND WORKING INTO WRN OH. MESOETA CONTS 
TREND OF DRYING OUT LLVLS ACRS THE E THRU THE OVRNGT SO WL INDCT 
CLRG FOR CMH AND PMH AREAS. MEANWHILE...S/W ENERGY EVIDENT ON WV 
IMGRY ROTATING ACRS IA WITH ASCTD TSTMS PUSHG INTO WRN IL ATTM. 
TSTMS PUSHG E A LTL QUICKER THAN DEPICTED BY MESOETA...BUT SHUD 
STILL SEE A WKNG TREND AS THEY PUSH E INTO MORE STABLE AMS. WL KP 
CHC PCPN  GOING ACRS THE W FOR LATE TNGT. IF STORMS HOLD 
TOGETHER...THEY CUD MAKE IT INTO CMH AREA TWD DAYBREAK BUT WL LEAVE 
OVRNGT DRY THERE AS BEST CHC WUD BE ERLY SAT MRNG. TMPS LUK TO BE IN 
DECENT SHAPE WITH DWPTS RUNNING IN THE UPR 40S TO ARND 50.

726 
FXUS61 KILN 011928
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EDT FRI JUN 01 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS AFTERNOON WAS SHOWING CONSIDERABLE 
LOW CLOUDS ACRS THE CWFA.  THIS WAS IN THE WAKE OF A COLD FRONT 
WHICH IS NOW LOCATED OVER EASTERN OHIO.  CLEARING WAS NOTED NEAR THE 
OHIO/INDIANA BORDER.

BELIEVE SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY WEST TOWARD SUNSET AND 
PARTLY CLOUDY EAST AROUND MIDNIGHT.  THIS WILL BE A BRIEF REPRIEVE 
AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT DROPS SE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY SATURDAY 
MORNING.  ASSOCIATED UPR LVL S/WV (VORT MAX) IS QUITE VIGOROUS...AND 
FAVORABLE LOW LVL CONV/UPR DIV COUPLET DEVELOPS OVER THE MID MS VLY 
OVERNIGHT.  HOWEVER...PER ALL MODELS...THE COUPLET BEGINS TO WEAKEN 
AS THE SYSTEM PUSHES INTO OUR CWFA BY LATE TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY 
MORNING.  THUS...I AM ANTICIPATING A LINE OF SHOWERS/TSTMS TO OUR 
WEST OVERNIGHT...WEAKENING AS IT PUSHES INTO THE REGION BY THE PRE 
DAWN HOURS.  

AS THE COLD FRONT PROGRESSES THROUGH THE REGION DURING THE DAY 
SATURDAY...SHOWERS...AND POSSIBLY A TSTM...WILL BECOME MORE 
SCATTERED ACRS THE ERN CWFA.  THE WRN CWFA SHOULD SEE A BREAK IN THE 
PCPN FROM LATE MORNING ON INTO MID AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...500 MB COLD 
POOL COMBINED WITH A WRAP AROUND S/WV WILL BRING ANOTHER CHC OF 
SHOWERS/TSTMS THEREAFTER.  

MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE INTO 
SATURDAY NIGHT.

BY SUNDAY...UPR LVL LOW SHOULD PUSH EAST AND NORTH ENOUGH TO ALLOW 
WEAK SFC RIDGING INTO THE REGION.  WILL GO PARTLY CLOUDY FOR NOW.  
MOS TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE GIVEN CLOUDS/PCPN...SO WILL NOT DEVIATE 
TOO MUCH.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 011331
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 AM EDT FRI JUN 01 2001

KILN RADAR AND VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY DEPICT A COLD FRONT NOW 
MOVING THROUGH THE CWFA.  THE FRONT AT 13Z WAS NEAR A FDY TO ILN TO 
EAST OF A SDF LINE.  AN AREA OF SHOWERS (A PERHAPS A RUMBLE OF 
THUNDER) WAS STILL OCCURRING OVER THE ERN CWFA AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  
MOSAIC RADAR WAS SHOWING NO RAIN ACTIVITY WEST OF THE FRONT.

SINCE FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL SIGNIFY A DECREASE IN DEEP MOISTURE...AM 
INCLINED TO LEAVE FCST DRY BEHIND THE FRONT DESPITE SECONDARY S/WV 
NOW OVER ILLINOIS.  WITH GOOD CAA MOVING INTO THE REGION...TEMPS 
SHOULD NOT REBOUND THAT MUCH TODAY FROM CURRENT READINGS.  WILL HAVE 
TO LEAVE A CHC OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH EARLY AFTN IN THE 
EAST UNTIL THE FRONT GOES THROUGH.  SKIES SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY 
CLOUDY AS COLD POOL ALOFT AND ANY DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD KEEP A 
CLOUD CANOPY ACRS THE REGION.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

253 AM EDT FRI JUN 01 2001

FCST FOCUS THIS MRNG IS CENTERED ON PRECIP CHCS AND TIMING. SFC LO
OVR NE IL WITH WRMFNT EXTENDING ESE THRU SRN IN AND FAR NRN KY JUST
S OF OH RVR AND CDFNT EXTENDS S NR IL/IN BORDER. MESOSCALE CIRCULATION
EVIDENT ON SATL/RADAR CROSSING OH RVR INTO SW OH AND WL CONT TO PUSH
NE THRU CNTRL OH BY 12Z. XPCT AN ERLY MRNG PERIOD OF RAIN AND PERHAPS
A RUMBLE OF THUNDER.  

WRM FNT TO PIVOT NWD WITH AREA INTO WRM SECTOR DURG MRNG. SFC WNDS 
SHIFT TO SW IN WRM SECTOR. XPCT SOME BREAKS TO DVLP IN CLD CVR IN
WAKE OF THIS FIRST BATCH OF PRECIP IN WRM SECTOR. SFC LO TO TRACK NE
INTO LWR MI TDA WITH ASSOCIATED CDFTN INTO THE W ARND MIDDAY AND THE
E BY MID AFTN. WL INDICATE A CHC OF SHWRS/TSTMS WITH MARGINAL INSTBY 
AHD OF FROPA THIS AFTN. IN WARM SECTOR XPCT TEMPS TO WRM SLIGHTLY 
MORE THAN FWC INDICATES ESPECIALLY IN ERN SECTIONS. 

DIGGING S/WV TO DROP SE FM S CNTRL CAN INTO UPR MS VLY THIS EVE AND 
THEN THRU GRTLKS ON SAT. MODEL TRENDS SLOWER WITH THIS DIGGING SYS. 
WL INDICATE PERIOD OF PARTLY CLOUDY COND THIS EVE DUE TO WK SFC RDGG 
AND THEN INTRO CHC SHWRS IN W WITH GOOD UPR DIV INTO W IN LF QUAD OF 
100KT UPR JET LATE TNGT. STG CDFTN TO PASS THRU THE AREA ON SAT WITH
MOD INSTBY DVLPG. WL INCREASE POPS ACRS ENTIRE REGION SAT AND WL CONT
CHC INTO SAT EVE ACRS THE N WITH UPR LO TRACKING ACRS LWR MI. 

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL








FXUS61 KILN 010141
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
940 PM EDT THU MAY 31 2001

01Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE ACROSS CNTRL IL WITH A WARM 
FRONT EXTENDING SEWD ACROSS SRN IN INTO NRN KY.  A MESOLOW WAS ALSO 
PRESENT ACROSS S-CNTRL KY.  

MESOLOW AND AN ASSOCIATED S/WV IS PROGD BY THE 18Z META TO PUSH INTO 
SRN OH BY 09Z.  CURRENT TRENDS SUGGEST THAT IT SHOULD BE IN FA 
SOONER THAN PROGD.  XPCT WDSPRD SHRA TO SPREAD INTO FA SO WL 
CONTINUE HIGH POPS.  WL INCREASE CVG-PMH GROUPS TO 100%.  KILN 
SOUNDING NOT SHOWING AN UNSTABLE LAYERS BUT MODELS INDICATE AN 
INCREASE IN ELEVATED INSTABILITY.  LINE OF SHRA/TSRA MOVG SLOWLY EWD 
WL ALSO AFFECT FA AFTER MIDNIGHT.

TEMPS NEARING FCST LOWS SO MAY HAVE TO LWR IN SPOTS BUT WITH WARM 
SECTOR PUSHING NWD WL NOT GO MORE THAT 1 CAT LWR. 

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

FXUS61 KILN 311821
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EDT THU MAY 31 2001

NARROW BAND OF RAIN CURRENTLY MOVING NE ACROSS FA IN ASSOCIATION 
WITH WEAK S/W AND 85H WAA. A WEAKENING TREND SHOULD CONTINUE ACROSS 
MOST OF FA AS BEST WAA REMAINS NW OF FA.

MODELS IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT THIS RUN...ALTHOUGH TRENDS ARE STILL 
A BIT SLOWER WITH PROGRESSION OF MAIN SYNOPTIC SYSTEMS. THUS HAVE 
GONE WITH A COMPRIMISE BETWEEN THE AVN AND ETA.

FOR TONIGHT...EXPECT ANOTHER WEAK S/W TO MOVE ACROSS THE FA. WITH 
SOME UPPER LVL SUPPORT AND LLVL FORCING IN ASSOCIATION WITH WRM 
FRNT...FEEL CATAGORICAL POPS BEST. CHC TSTORMS HIGHER ACROSS S AS WK 
CAPES AND MARGINAL ELEVATED INSTABILITY IN PLACE. WILL COMPRIMISE 
TEMPS.

FOR FRIDAY...EXPECT CLD FRONTAL PASSAGE DURING THE DAY...WITH THE 
BEST FORCING RESTRICTED TO E PORTIONS OF FA...MAINLY DURING THE 
AFTERNOON/EVENING. WILL ADJUSTE POPS ACCORDINGLY...AND WILL AGAIN 
USE ETA/AVN BLENDED TEMP GUIDANCE.

FRIDAY NIGHT FCST LOOKS TO BE MCLEAR...WITH SOME CHC OF PRECIP 
ACROSS W LATE AS ANOTHER S/W AND SFC FRONT APPROACH. WITH SLOWER 
MODEL TRENDS...FEEL THAT THE BEST THREAT FROM THIS NEXT SYSTEM WILL 
ON SATURDAY. WILL REFLECT THIS IN FCST.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

JTD

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1005 AM EDT THU MAY 31 2001

CLOUDS CONTINUE A SLOW INCREASE ACROSS THE ILN FA. ELEVATED SHOWER 
ACTIVITY CONTINUES TO WEAKEN AS IT MOVES NE...IMPACTING MUCH DRIER 
ATMOS. APPEARS THAT WK S/W ALONG WITH 925H/95H FORCING MAIN 
MECHANISM DRIVING THIS PRECIP. MODELS CONTINUE TO WEAKEN THIS S/W AS 
IT RIDES INTO RIDGE. MODELS BRING BEST LLVL FORCING ACROSS SRN 
PORTION OF FA THIS AFTERNOON. THUS FEEL THE BEST THREAT OF PRECIP 
WILL BE ACROSS SRN PORTION OF FA THIS AFTERNOON. CURRENTLY NO 
INDICATIONS OF SFC BASED OR ELEVATED INSTABILITY ACROSS FA TDY. THUS 
FEEL THE THREAT OF THUNDER THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE GREATLY DIMINISHED.

THUS WILL UPDATE FOR PRECIP WORDING...POPS AND TEMPS.

MISILN OUT SHORTLY

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 AM EDT THU MAY 31 2001

MDLS CONTINUE TO HAVE DIFFERENCES ESP BY END OF SHORT TERM. AVN HAS 
ACTUALLY SHOWN THE BEST RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY BUT STILL LOOKS TOO 
PROGRESSIVE. CURRENT PRECIP JUST A LITTLE FASTER THAN THE ETA SO 
WILL AGAIN LEAN IN THAT DIRECTION. AREA WILL SEE GOOD THETA-E ADV 
AHEAD OF WARM FRONT. AFTN PK HEATING WILL HELP TRIGGER SCT 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WITH BEST CHC BEING SW. WILL BACK OFF ON POPS 
A LITTLE CONSIDERING WIDESPREAD CONVECTION TO THE SOUTH AND SLIGHTLY 
SLOWER TIMING. WARM FRONT MOVES THROUGH OVERNIGHT AND EVERYONE 
SHOULD GET SOME RAIN. WILL KEEP CAT POPS. FRIDAY COULD BE QUITE 
INTERESTING...ESP EAST. COLD FRONT COMING THRU BUT ETA INDICATING 
DRY SLOT AGAIN TDY. BUT GOOD LLVL MSTR AND STEEP LAPSE RATES WILL 
LIKELY CAUSE SOME PROBLEMS. WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS EAST BUT REMOVE 
TIMING. CHC IN THE WEST SHOULD STILL BE FINE.

TEMPS CONTINUE TO BE A PROBLEM WITH ERRATIC CLD CVR. WILL STICK 
CLOSE TO FWC GUID AS IT HAS BEEN DOING WELL. 

.ILN...NONE.

931 PM EDT WED MAY 30 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE KS-MO BORDER WITH 
A WARM FRONT EXTENDING EWD INTO WRN KY.  ABUNDANT MOISTURE WAS IN 
PLACE SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT WITH 60S AND 70S DEWPOINTS CONTRASTING 
LARGELY WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 30S AND 40S ACROSS FA.

AS EXPECTED...FIRST BAND OF SHRA HAS NEARLY DISSIPATED AS IT MOVES 
INTO DRIER AIR OVER THE OH VLY.  NEXT BATCH WILL LIKELY NOT MAKE IT 
TO FA BEFORE 12Z.  OTHERWISE...MID AND HIGH CLOUDINESS WL CONTINUE 
TO SPREAD ACROSS FA.  CURRENT PARTLY AND MOSTLY CLOUDY FCSTS LOOK 
REASONABLE.

TEMPS WL BE WARMEST ACROSS CVG AREA TONIGHT AS THE HIGHER DEWPOINTS 
TRY TO MOVE NEWD.  DRIER AIR WL ALLOW AREAS FURTHER NE TO BE COOLER.

CURRENT FCST LOOKS GOOD SO NO UPDATE PLANNED. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 301902
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM EDT WED MAY 30 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS RIDGE OF HIPRES NOSING SOUTH FROM THE 
WESTERN LAKES INTO OUR RGN.  MAIN WARM FRONT STILL WELL TO THE SOUTH 
OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY...BUT DWPT BNDRY NOTED FROM CENTRAL KY INTO 
MO.  SAT TRENDS CONT TO SHOW CI STREMING IN FROM THE WEST...BUT 
THINNING DOWNSTREAM OF THE MID/UPPER LVL RIGDE AXIS TO THE EAST.  
XPCT LARGE SW-NE TEMP GRAD ACRS THE CWFA TNGT...WITH FAIRLY 
OPAQUE CLOUD AND BETTER LLVL MST XPCT OVER THE FAR SW.  CENTRAL OHIO 
WL HAVE DECENT RADIATIONAL CONDS MOST OF THE NIGHT...AND CUD BE 10+ 
DEG COOLER THAN SW SXNS.  GENERALY MOS TEMPS IN GOOD AGREEMENT...AND 
HV MAD ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.  WL KEEP POPS OVER ONLY THE FAR SW 
GIVEN DRY AIR IN PLACE AND ONLY WEAK LIFT LATE TNGT.

MODEL TIMESXNS SUGGEST MSTR WL INCRS/DEEPEN THRU THE DAY ON 
THURS...AS LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH DPVA AND WAA INTENSIFIES.  STILL LKS 
LIKE A FAIR AMNT OF THE LIFT WL GO INTO SATURATING THE AIRMASS 
INITIALLY...BUT THINK WE WL SEE SOME PCPN ALL AREAS.  WL TAPER POPS 
FROM LIKELY SW TO LOW CHC NE.  ELEVATED CONVECTIVE MACRO SUGGESTS 
THUNDER POTNL ALL BUT THE NE...AND WL CONT MENTION.  BEST LIFT/PCPN 
EFFICIENCY MVS THRU THU NGT...AND WL CARRY CAT POPS ALL ZONES.  AVN 
MUCH QUICKER TO SWING FRONT THRU...AND AS A RESULT ITS GUID MUCH 
COOLER FOR LOWS.  WITH GUID TRENDING SLOWER OF LATE...AM INCLINED TO 
GO AOA THE WARMER FWC NUMBERS.  FOR FRI...STRONG SHORT WAVE WL PIVOT 
THRU ERLY...WITH RGN BECOMING DRY SLOTTED IN THE AFTN.  WL CARRY 
LIKELY POPS EAST ERLY AHEAD OF WAVE/FRONT...AND SCT ACTIVITY ELSW ALL 
DAY.  EXPT BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE DRY SLOT...AND 
AFTER A WARM START SHUD BE ABLE TO EXCEED THE FWC TEMPS.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE




FXUS61 KILN 300734
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT WED MAY 30 2001

MDLS HAVE SLOWED DOWN THIS RUN WITH RESPECT TO THIS NEXT SYS SET 
TO AFFECT THE AREA THU. THIS CHG HAS BROUGHT THE MDLS A LITTLE MORE 
IN LINE WITH EACH OTHER...BUT THERE AE STILL SIGNIFICANT 
DIFFERENCES. AVN IS THE FASTEST WHILE THE ETA/NGM ARE FAIRLY 
SIMILAR. ETA HAS SHOWN THE MOST CONSISTANCY SO WILL LEAN TOWARDS  
THAT SOLN. NONE OF THE MDLS ARE HANDLING THIS MID/HI CLD AHEAD OF 
THE PLAINS SYS WHICH IS CURRENTLY AFFECTING FA. THIS LEADS ME TO 
BELIEVE THE RIDGE IS NOT QUITE AS STRONG AS MDLS THINK. AND WITH THE 
ABUNDANCE OF GROUND MSTR WE STILL HAVE...WILL KEEP FCST A LITTLE ON 
THE WETTER SIDE. SO WILL KEEP A SMALL CHC LATE IN THE SW FOR TONIGHT 
AND THEN HAVE MAINLY AFTN POPS ELSEWHERE THU. WILL HAVE LIKELY SOUTH 
CLOSER TO WARM FRONT AND SMALL CHC NE. 

WARM FRONT LOOKS TO MOVE THRU THU NIGHT WITH FRI POSSIBLY HAVING DRY 
SLOT ISSUES AS SFC LOW TRACKS NW OF FA. WILL LEAVE EXTENDED ALONE AS 
MLDS ARE HAVING A HARD TIME FOCUSING IN ON A SOLN. AS FOR 
TEMPS...CLDS NOW ARE KEEPING US FROM GETTING NEAR FCST LOWS SO WE 
WILL START OUT A GOOD BIT WARMER THAN MDLS THINK. WILL GO NEAR 
CURRENT FCST WHICH IS WARMER THAN GUID. WILL GO ABOVE GUID AGAIN 
TONIGHT WITH SOME CLD CVR EXPECTED. LLVL TEMPS WARM NICELY THU SO 
WILL GO AOA GUID AGAIN. THANKS SDF/JKL FOR COORD.     

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

BEST COVERAGE OF PRECIP IN ERN SECTIONS. WK LO LVL CNVRGC AND MARGINAL
INSTBY AIDING DVLPMNT OF CNVCTN. HV UPDATED ZONES TO CONT SCTD 
SHWRS/TSTMS INTO EVE ALL BUT CVG ZONE. XPCT ACTIVITY TO DIMINISH
QUICKLY WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.    


.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL













000 
FXUS61 KILN 291740
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
140 PM EDT TUE MAY 29 2001

UPPER AIR CHART SHOWS TROF OVER EASTERN CONUS...WITH RIDGE BUILDING 
OVER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  FLOW WILL REMAIN NORTHWEST OVER OUR CWA 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY UNTIL NEXT SHORT WAVE KICKS RIDGE THROUGH THE OHIO 
VALLEY TO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES ON THURSDAY.

SFC MAP FEATURES HIGH EXTENDING FROM CENTRAL CANADA DOWN TO THE 
LOWER OHIO VALLEY.  HIGH WILL HOLD FOR ANOTHER DAY BEFORE NEXT SHORT 
WAVES INFLUENCE BEGINS. FRONT NEAR LAKE ERIE HAS MADE LITTLE 
SOUTHWARD PROGRESS TODAY IN NORTHWEST UPPER FLOW.  

CU THAT HAVE FORMED THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD DISAPPEAR QUICKLY THIS 
EVENING. MID LEVEL CLOUDS NEAR THE FRONT MAY MAKE IT INTO OUR 
NORTHERN COUNTIES TONIGHT...BUT I THINK THAT SHRA NEAR THE LAKE 
SHORE WILL DISSIPATE RATHER THAN MOVE OUT INTACT FROM LAKE BREEZE 
CONVERGENCE.  THEREFORE...PARTLY CLOUDY WILL WORK NORTH...MOSTLY 
CLEAR SOUTH. JUDGING FROM TODAYS SATELLITE AND MODEL RH AND 925MB 
MOISTURE CONVERGENCE PROGS...ILL GO WITH PARTLY SUNNY FOR WEDNESDAY 
ALL ZONES.  

MODELS ARE SPORTING MAJOR DIFFERENCES WITH NEXT SYSTEM. AVN HAS A 
BETTER REPRESENTATION OF CURRENT TSRA ENTERING MISSOURI...AND IT IS 
FASTER AND FARTHER SOUTH THAN ETA...WITH AVN BRINGING QPF TO OUR 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ILL TREND TOWARD AVN PRECIP SOLUTION AND 
INTRODUCE CHC SHRA/TSRA ALL ZONES WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

MODEL DIFFERENCES CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY. AT 00Z FRIDAY THE ETA 
HAS 1000MB LOW NEAR CHICAGO WHILE AVN HAS 1008MB LOW NEAR PMH. 
THOUGH I FAVOR THE AVN SOLUTION FOR LOW POSITION...AVN APPEARS MUCH 
TOO COLD AND STABLE.  WITH LIMITED INSTABILITY INDICATED...ILL 
CARRY SHRA LIKELY/TSRA POSSIBLE.

WITH FRONT ALMOST STALLED AND COOLER AIR HAVING TROUBLE MAKING IN 
HERE...ILL GO A COUPLE DEGREES ABOVE FWC LOWS AT CMH AND DAY 
TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND ILL STAY CLOSE TO FWC AT CVG.   
FWC LOOKS A BIT COOL FOR WEDNESDAYS HIGHS SO ILL GO A COUPLE 
ABOVE.  STORY CHANGES ON THURSDAY WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIP PREVENTING 
TEMPS FROM REACHING FWC LEVELS...SO ILL UNDERCUT FWC BY A COUPLE 
DEGREES...BUT I WONT GO AS COLD AS AVN.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO











596 
FXUS61 KILN 291403
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1004 AM EDT TUE MAY 29 2001

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES THIS AFTERNOON WITH SHORT WAVE 
APPROACHING LOWER GREAT LAKES. SFC FRONT NEAR DTW AT 12Z WILL BE 
PUSHING INTO HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING FROM CENTRAL CANADA INTO THE 
LOWER OHIO VALLEY.  

MODELS SHOW A GENERAL DECREASE IN MOISTURE IN THE MID AND UPPER 
LEVELS DURING THE AFTERNOON ALONG WITH INCREASED CAPPING AT AROUND 
10 KFT BY LATE AFTERNOON.  MARGINAL INSTABILITY SHOWING UP ON MODEL 
SOUNDINGS MOSTLY AT CMH AND AOH AT 16-17Z ALONG WITH SFC FRONTAL 
CONVERGENCE.  BEST UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT ARRIVES LATER WITH SHORT 
WAVE.  ILL KEEP POPS AS IS WITH HIGHEST (30%) AT CMH WHERE 
INSTABILITY AND FRONTAL CONVERGENCE WILL BE GREATER AND 20% IN 
WAPAKONETA GROUP ON THE WESTERN FRINGE OF CONVERGENCE.  ILL STAY 
WITH PARTLY SUNNY OTHER AREAS WHILE MONITORING SATELLITE FOR CU/TCU 
DEVELOPMENT.

FCST HIGH TEMPS IN LOW-MID 70S LOOK REASONABLE WRT 12Z SOUNDING AND 
06Z MESOETA SFC TEMPS.  UPDATE WILL BE FOR WORDING ONLY.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 290715
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 AM EDT TUE MAY 29 2001

VORT-INDUCED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS ALMOST EAST OF AREA ATTM. SKIES 
CLR OUT QUICKLY BEHIND THIS FEATURE WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR DECENT 
WARMING AGAIN TDY. SOME CU IS POSSIBLE AGAIN TDY WITH LINGERING MSTR 
IN THE LOWEST LEVELS AND GOOD LAPSE RATES. A FEW SHOWERS COULD 
DEVELOP AS WEAK COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH. BEST LLVL CONVERGENCE AND 
MSTR SHOWS UP LATE THIS AFTN IN THE NE CLOSEST TO THE LOW. WILL ADD 
A SLIGHT POP TO NW AND LOW CHC TO NE FOR THIS AFTN. MSTR DIMINISHES 
AS THE BOUNDARY MOVES SOUTH...SO WILL NOT ADD MENTION ELSEWHERE AS 
THE THREAT OF -SHRA LOOKS MINIMAL. WILL ALSO NOT LINGER CHC INTO 
TONIGHT PD AS THE THREAT ENDS QUICKLY WITH SS. LLVL THICKNESSES A 
LITTLE HIGHER THAN YDA SO WILL GO A COUPLE OF DEGS WARMER THAN YDA 
EXCEPT NE WHERE IT SHOULD BE ABOUT THE SAME AS YDA.  

COOLER/DRIER AIR WORKS IN WITH NLY FLOW AND THINGS GET A CHC TO DRY 
OUT FURTHER BEFORE NEXT SYS ON THURSDAY. TONIGHT WILL BE A CHILLY 
ONE WITH CLR SKIES AND DRIER AIR. CURRENT FCST LOOKS GOOD. WE SHOULD 
BE ABLE TO WARM NICELY AGAIN WED WITH PLENTY OF SUN AND ONLY A FEW 
CLDS. 

.ILN...NONE.

THRU ABT 06Z. WL CONT TO MONITOR RADAR TRENDS PRIOR TO EVE UPDATE 
BUT WL LKLY OPT FOR DRY FCST DUE TO THE VRY LO PROB OF A SPRINKLE.

WAKE OF THIS SYS. XPCT SKIES TO CLR LTR TNGT AND WL INDICATE THIS IN 
THE ZONE FCST. DUE TO SUNSHINE TDA AND LACK OF PRECIP...SOME DRYING 
TOOK PLACE. ALTHO  PATCHY FOG IS PSBL TNGT BUT VSBYS SHUD NOT BE AS 
LO AS LAST NIGHT. FCST LOW TEMPS APPEAR ON TARGET.

733 
FXUS61 KILN 281732
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
133 PM EDT MON MAY 28 2001

UPPER LOW WILL MOVE FROM THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES TO NEW ENGLAND 
DURING THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.  OUR AREA WILL REMAIN UNDER A 
NORTHWEST FLOW THAT WILL CERTAINLY BE DRIER THAN WHAT WE HAVE BEEN 
EXPERIENCING OVER THE LAST TWO WEEKS.

HUGE SFC HIGH CENTERED IN CENTRAL CANADA IS GRADUALLY BUILDING INTO 
THE OHIO VALLEY.  HIGHS INFLUENCE WILL PERSIST THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  

VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE THAT IS CAUSING ONLY LIGHT SHOWERS IN CAPPED 
AIRMASS OVER IOWA IS PROGGED TO CVG TONIGHT AT 06Z.  
THEREFORE...ILL ADD CHANCE SPRINKLES TONIGHT IN SOUTHERN 
ZONES...WHILE GOING WITH PARTLY CLOUDY OTHER ZONES.

MOST OF ENERGY WITH SHORT WAVE DROPPING TO LAKE ERIE LATER ON 
TUESDAY WILL STAY NORTH OF HERE...THOUGH LOW AND MID LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL INCREASE INTO CENTRAL OHIO AHEAD OF THE WAVE.  PARTLY CLOUDY 
WILL WORK IN OUR NORTHERN ZONES...MOSTLY SUNNY SOUTH.  HIGH PRESSURE 
AND NVA SHOULD RESULT IN MOSTLY CLEAR/SUNNY SKIES TUESDAY 
NIGHT/WEDNESDAY.

WITH CLOUDS AROUND DUE TO SHORT WAVE...LOW TEMPS SHOULD BE ONLY 
SLIGHTLY BELOW FWC TONIGHT.  WITH LOWER DEW POINTS SPILLING DOWN 
FOLLOWING TUESDAYS SHORT WAVE...IT WILL BE COOLER ON TUESDAY NIGHT 
WITH FWCS MID 40S LOOKING GOOD AT DAY AND CMH...WHILE 50 APPEARS 
TOO HIGH AT CVG. FWC HIGHS LOOK A BIT OPTIMISTIC TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY SO ILL UNDERCUT THEM SLIGHTLY. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS H5 LOW CENTERED AT BUF.  NORTHWEST FLOW OVER 
THE OHIO VALLEY IS BRINGING SOMEWHAT DRIER AND LESS UNSETTLED AIR 
THAN IN PREVIOUS DAYS...THOUGH ANOTHER SHORT WAVE WILL ARRIVE THIS 
AFTERNOON.

MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE SHOWING MINIMAL INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON.  
HOWEVER...WITH SHORT WAVE/SFC MOISTURE CONVERGENCE COMING AND LOWER 
ATMOSPHERE MOIST...WDLY SCT SHOWERS/TSRA WILL BE POSSIBLE.  I AGREE 
WITH PREVIOUS SHIFT IN KEEPING SOUTH DRY WITH MODELS AND MORNING 
SOUNDING SHOWING A STRONG CAP THERE.  WELL MONITOR SATELLITE FOR 
TCU DEVELOPMENT IN THE SOUTH...BUT FOR NOW ILL KEEP 20 POPS ONLY IN 
CMH AND WAPAKONETA GROUPS.

WITH MORNING SOUNDING GIVING UPPER 60S HIGH...CURRENT TEMP FCST 
LOOKS GOOD WITH UPPER 60S NORTH/70-75 SOUTH.  AT THIS TIME...ILL 
ONLY NEED TO UPDATE CMH AND WAPAKONETA GROUPS TO CLEAN UP WORDING. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 280712
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 AM EDT MON MAY 28 2001

REGIONAL RADARS INDICATING SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS MAINLY NORTH OF 
FA.  SHOWERS ARE IN RESPONSE TO A WAVE ROTATING THROUGH SOUTHERN 
GREAT LAKES AND IS EVIDENT ON WATER VAPOR.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS 
CLOUD SHIELD ASSOCIATED WITH WAVE 

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT.  AVN IS A BIT MORE AGGRESSIVE 
WITH REINFORCING WAVE THAT MOVES INTO NEW ENGLAND...WHICH MAY RESULT 
IN STRONGER BACK DOOR COLD FRONT ACROSS MAINLY EASTERN FA.  WILL 
MESH AVN WITH ETA/NGM FOR THIS ASPECT OF FORECAST.  CONCERNED ABOUT 
CLOUD COVER AND POPS TODAY.  MODELS INDICATING BEST CLOUD COVER 
ACROSS THE NORTH WITH THE DEEPER MOISTURE...HOWEVER THINK IT WILL BE 
PARTLY/MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS ENTIRE FA.  WILL LIMIT 20 POP WORDING TO 
THE WAPAK AND CMH GROUPS WITH THE DEEPER MOISTURE AND ETA SHOWING 
200 TO 400 J/KG CAPE.  ETA SOUNDINGS INDICATE STORM DEPTHS IN EXCESS 
OF 20 KFT SO WILL ALSO MENTION THUNDER.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST IS ONCE AGAIN TOUGH.  FWC DOESNT LOOK TOO 
BAD.  WILL LOWER TEMPS A BIT TODAY AS SOURCE AIR IS COMING FROM THE 
RFD/LSE/DBQ AREA.  WILL ONLY WARM TUESDAY UP AN ADDITIONAL 2 TO 3 
DEGREES.  

.ILN...NONE.

LLVL FLOW BCMS NWLY MON INTO TUE WITH NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF WAA. 
THINK FWC MAY BE TRYING TO WARM THINGS UP A LTL FAST SO WL OPT FOR 
COMP OF MAV/FWC TMPS FOR HIGHS NEXT CPL DAYS. 

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT





577 
FXUS61 KILN 271408
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1010 AM EDT SUN MAY 27 2001

LTST SFC ANLYS SHWG LOW OVR SRN LWR MICH WITH CLD SHIELD SKIRTING 
ACRS FAR NRN PORTIONS OF FA. LOW PROGD TO SHIFT SLOWLY E ACRS LWR 
MICH THRU THIS AFTN WITH CYCLNC FLOW CONTG ACRS RGN. BEST CHC OF 
PCPN LOOKS TO BE ACRS THE NRN HALF OF FA...CLOSER TO LOW AND IN AREA 
OF BETTER INSTABILTY. FCST SNDGS SHWG A BIT OF A CAP ARND 700 MB 
ACRS SRN PORTIONS OF FA AND THIS AREA PROGD TO RMN MORE STBL THRU 
THIS AFTN. HOWEVER...XPCT TEMPS TO BE A LTL WRMR THAN PROGD PER 
YESTERDAY...SO INSTBLTY PRBLY A LTL UNDERDONE. THUS WL HANG ON TO 
LOW CHC POPS ACRS THE S FOR THIS AFTN. CRNT FCST LOOKS TO BE IN 
PRETTY GOOD SHAPE AND WL ONLY MAKE MINOR CHGS. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 270714
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
313 AM EDT SUN MAY 27 2001

KILN SHOWING BAND OF SHALLOW CONVECTION FROM KCMH TO MAYSVILLE.  
SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES LOW NEAR KSBN WITH THE BEST PRESSURE 
FALLS IN SE MICHIGAN AND NW OHIO.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLOUDS 
HAVE CLEARED OUT IN THE NVA/CAA BEHIND THE COLD/TD FRONT

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH TAKING STACKED SURFACE AND UPPER LOW 
FROM NRN INDIANA INTO ONTARIO/NEW ENGLAND BY MONDAY EVENING.  THIS 
WILL BRING BACK NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND GIVE REGION A CHANCE TO 
DRY OUT AFTER TONIGHT.  WILL HAVE BEST POPS ACROSS THE NORTH CLOSER 
TO UPPER LOW WHERE CYCLONIC FLOW AND DEEPER MOISTURE WILL SPAWN SOME 
CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON.  WILL KEEP SMALL POP ACROSS THE SOUTH AS 
INSTABILITY WILL BE A BIT BETTER THAN ETA IS FORECASTING AS 
AFTERNOON HIGHS ARE EXPECTED TO BE WARMER THAN FWC AND 2M MESOETA 
TEMPS.  THE BIG QUESTION ACROSS THE SOUTH IS A KICKER...850 MB 
SHOWING SOME WEAK CONVERGENCE AT 18Z.

WILL GO WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST FOR TODAYS HIGHS WHICH IS A CAT OR 
TWO WARMER THAN FWC AND MAV.  AFTER FIRST PERIOD WILL STICK CLOSE TO 
FWC/MAV TEMPERATURES.  

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

ELONGATED N-S UPR LO EVIDENT ON WV IMGRY FM NE IL THRU WI. S/WV 
ROTATING ARND BASE OF THIS LO WL TAKE ON A NEG TILT AND PIVOT THRU 
OH OVRNGT. SFC LO OVR EXTREME NW IN TO TRACK ENE INTO SW LWR MI OVRNGT 
AND ACRS SRN MI ON SUN. 

CNVCTN HS DVLPD AHD OF VORT AXIS FM WRN OH THRU SE IN AND WRN KY.
INSTBY MARGINAL WITH LI/S ARND -2. XPCT THIS AREA OF SHWRS AND ISOLD
TSTMS TO CONT PIVOTING INTO OH TNGT AS VORT TAIL SWEEPS THRU THE AREA.
WITH LOSS OF HEATING STORMS SHUD CONT TO WEAKEN SOME...BRIEF HEAVY 
RAIN AND WND GUSTS TO 35 MPH AS MAIN THREATS. 

AFTER THIS BAND OF PRECIP MOVES THRU THE AREA CHC/S FOR RN DIMINISH. 
WL FRESHEN UP PUBLIC FORECAST TO SHOW THIS TIMING.   

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EDT SAT MAY 26 2001

SFC ANLYS HAS LOW OVR WEST CNTRL IL AT 18Z...WHICH IS PROGGED TO 
PUSH SLOWLY ENE TWD FA TNGT.

KILN AND KIND SHOWING ONLY SCT SHRA SE OF FA...THEN ALNG WK BNDRY 
EXTNDGG E FM SFC LO ACRS NRN IN AND FAR NW FA. ADDITIONAL SHRA 
POPPING UP ALNG OH RVR IN INDIANA/KY AND CVG AREA. NOT EXPECTED TOO 
MUCH WITH THESE. BULK OF ACTIVITY TO COME IN LATER.

BEST UVV AND CONVERGENCE IS MOR ASSOC WTH VORT MAX BACK OVR 
IL...WHICH WL SWING THRU IN AND INTO WRN FA TNGT...MAINLY AFTR 
00Z...AND AFTR 06Z IN THE E. STILL WL GO CATEGORICAL POPS IN NRN TWO 
GROUPS...AND LIKELY ELSEWHERE.

AM GOING WITH AN ETA/AVN COMBINATION...WHICH APPEARS TO HAVE SPED 
THINGS UP A BIT SINCE PREV RUNS.

FOR TNGT AND EARLY SUN...COLD AIR ALFT SINKS BACK INTO 
REGION...ALONG WTH PRETTY GOOD PVA. ACTIVITY SHOULD BE WIDESPREAD 
BUT QUIK MOVG. FOR SUN...VORT AND BEST PVA MOVES EASTWARD...BUT 
ESPCY NRN FA WL STILL SEE SCT SHRA...WTH SOME LINGERING INTO SUN NT. 
MEMORIAL DAY NOW LOOKING PRETTY DRY...ALL THE WAY THROUGH WED BEFORE 
THE NEXT SHOT FOR PCP DEVELOPS AGAIN. TMPS REMAIN BLO NORMAL.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 260730
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EDT FRI MAY 25 2001

KILN SHOWING SCATTERED BAND OF CONVECTIONS JUST NORTH OF I-71 
BEGINNING TO FILL IN.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS UPPER LEVEL LOW 
CENTERED NEAR KCHI STILL IN CONTROL OF REGIONS WEATHER.

MODELS ARE ALL IN AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER FA 
THROUGH SUNDAY BEFORE IT BEGINS TO LIFT OFF TO THE NORTHEAST.  
SEVERAL WAVES WILL AFFECT FA.  850 JET CURRENTLY ENHANCING SHALLOW 
CONVECTION OVER FA.  THE JET KEEPS CONVERGENCE OVER FA...ESPECIALLY 
THE NORTH WEST THIRD...THROUGH TONIGHT.  LOOKING AT THE STEERING 
WINDS THERE WILL BE ALLOT OF TRAINING TODAY.  FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE IS 
IN GENERAL 1 INCH FOR 1 HOUR AND 2 INCHES FOR 3 HOURS.  BELIEVE 
PRECIP WILL BE LIGHT TO MODERATE WITH VERY FEW HEAVY CELLS.  WILL 
NOT PUT OUT A FLASH FLOOD WATCH BUT LATTER SHIFTS WILL HAVE TO KEEP 
TABS ON STORM TRACKS AND RAINFALL RATES.  BEST SHORT WAVE MOVES 
THROUGH EARLY TONIGHT AND IS ASSOCIATED WITH SURFACE TROF.  NEXT 
WAVE MOVES ACROSS MAINLY NORTH OR I-70 AND WILL KEEP BEST POPS 
ACROSS THE NORTH.

FWC TEMPS ARE IN PRETTY GOOD SHAPE WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR TWEAKS. 

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON




715 
FXUS61 KILN 260109
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
910 PM EDT FRI MAY 25 2001

UPR LVL LOW PRES SYS CONTINUES TO PIN WHEEL OVER NRN INDIANA.  S/WV 
ENERGY ROTATING AROUND THE UPR LOW WILL AFFECT THE CWFA FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT.

KILN RADAR HAS BEEN SHOWING A DECREASING TREND IN SHOWER ACTIVITY.  
THE CURRENT SHOWER ACTIVITY WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A VORT LOBE PUSHING 
IN FROM CENTRAL INDIANA.  THE NEXT S/WV (VORTICITY) IS EXPECTED TO 
DIVE SE FROM WRN ILLINOIS INTO WRN OHIO BY MORNING.

DESPITE DECREASING TREND...WILL KEEP A 40 OR 50 POP ACRS THE WEST 
AND A 40 POP ACRS THE EAST GIVEN THE PARADE OF S/WVS.  OVERNIGHT 
LOWS IN THE UPPER 40S LOOK GOOD AS TEMPS SHOULD NOT DROP TOO MUCH 
MORE WITH CLOUD COVER.  LIGHTNING ACTIVITY HAS WANED.  HOWEVER 
...BELIEVE THE WRN CWFA MAY STILL RUN A RISK OF THUNDER.  
THUS...WILL KEEP THE POSSIBILITY GOING IN THE WEST.

FOR TOMORROW...LATEST MESO ETA SHOWS A DEVELOPING LOW LEVEL JET 
MOVING ACRS THE REGION.  THIS LOW LEVEL JET HAS BEEN RESPONSIBLE FOR 
A SWATH OF RAIN ACRS MN SOUTHWARD INTO IOWA.  RAIN CHANCES MAY HAVE 
TO BE BUMPED UP ACRS THE DAYTON/WAPAKONETA ZONES TOMORROW.  WILL 
LEAVE THIS DECISION UP TO THE MIDNIGHT SHIFT.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN








AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
318 AM EDT FRI MAY 25 2001

KILN SHOWING SCATTERED WEAK CONVECTION ALONG SURFACE BOUNDARY 
STRETCHING FROM NEAR WAPAK TO JUST EAST OF KILN TO MAYSVILLE.  WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER WESTERN IL WITH NUMEROUS 
WAVES WORKING AROUND IT CYCLONICALLY.  

MODELS ARE ALL IN DESCENT AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING UPPER LOW OVER 
REGION THROUGH SUNDAY BEFORE IT EJECTS TOWARDS TO NEW ENGLAND.  
WAVES WILL CONTINUALLY WORK AROUND LOW KEEPING THE THREAT OF SHALLOW 
CONVECTION OVER FA.  CONVECTIONS WILL BE ENHANCED BY DAYTIME HEATING 
SO WILL GO WITH HIGHEST POPS DURING THE DAY AND LOWEST AT NIGHT.

FWC MOS IS NOT TOO BAD WILL MAKE A FEW TWEAKS HERE AND THERE PER 
LOCAL TECHNIQUES AND SURFACE TEMPS OFF ETA/AVN.  

.ILN...NONE.

WAVES WILL CONTINUALLY WORK AROUND LOW KEEPING THE THREAT OF SHALLOW 
CONVECTION OVER FA.  CONVECTIONS WILL BE ENHANCED BY DAYTIME HEATING 
SO WILL GO WITH HIGHEST POPS DURING THE DAY AND LOWEST AT NIGHT.

FWC MOS IS NOT TOO BAD WILL MAKE A FEW TWEAKS HERE AND THERE PER 
LOCAL TECHNIQUES AND SURFACE TEMPS OFF ETA/AVN.  

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON





FXUS61 KILN 250227
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1025 PM EDT THU MAY 24 2001

S/WV NOTED ON WATER VAPOR WAS PUSHING NE INTO CNTRL OHIO ATTM.
BRIEF NVA WAS SHOWING UP ACROSS SOUTHWEST OHIO.  THIS BRIEF CLEARING 
WILL BE FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER S/WV TONIGHT (ENTERING THE CWFA FROM THE 
SW).  SHOWERS ACRS SE IN/NRN KY WILL PUSH INTO THE SW OHIO REGION 
SOON.  MOST OF THE PREVIOUS THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WAS DIURNALLY 
DRIVEN.  THUS...I AM OPTING TO REMOVE THUNDERSTORMS FROM THE FCST 
TONIGHT.  WILL CUT POPS DOWN A TAD AS COVERAGE DOESN/T FIT A LIKELY 
WORDING.  OVERNIGHT LOWS AROUND 50 STILL LOOK GOOD.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
237 PM EDT THU MAY 24 2001

LARGE MID LVL LOW CONTINUES TO SPIN AND DROP SLOWLY SEWD THIS PM.  
DAYTIME HEATING HAS COMBINED WITH COLD TEMPS ALOFT TO PRODUCE A FEW 
REPORTS OF LARGE HAIL.  XPCT THIS ACTIVITY TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE 
EVENING HOURS BEFORE DIMINISHING.

ETA DEVELOPS ANOTHER SYNOPTIC WAVE OVERNIGHT SIMILAR TO THIS 
MORNINGS WAVE.  COMBINED WITH THIS EVENINGS ACTIVITY WL CARRY 
LIKELY POPS ALL AREAS.

MID LVL LOW IS PROGD TO MOVE INTO THE OH VLY ON FRI.  XPCT SOME 
MORNING SHRA FOLLOWED BY PARTIAL CLEARING AND PM TSRA DEVELOPMENT.  
COULD HAVE MORE HAIL ON FRI.

WL CONTINUE SHOWER CHANCES THROUGH MON AS MODELS PROG LOW TO REMAIN 
IN OUR VCNTY.

GUIDANCE TEMPS IN THE BALLPARK SO WL STAY CLOSE.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
939 AM EDT THU MAY 24 2001

13Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE IA-IL BORDER WITH 
A BOUNDARY EXTENDING SEWD ACROSS IN AND KY.  S/WV LIFTING OUT OF 
LARGE MID LVL LOW OVER IA WAS CAUSING WDSPRD SHRA WITH A FEW TSRA 
ACROSS FA.

DRIER AIR WAS WORKING INTO KCVG AREA AND XPCT THIS TREND TO CONTINUE 
OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS.  THIS WL LEAD TO SOME HEATING AND RESULT IN 
FURTHER DESTABLIZATION.  THUS...XPCT SHRA/TSRA TO CONTINUE MOVG NEWD 
THROUGH THE EARLY PM WITH ADDITIONAL SCATTERED DEVELOPMENT IN THE 
PM. WL LIKELY CUT POPS BACK FOR THE PM HOURS CVG-DAY.

WITH SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS...XPCT TEMPS TO CLIMB INTO THE 60S 
ACROSS FA.  CURRENT FCST HAS THIS TREND HANDLED SO NO CHANGES 
PLANNED.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 240657
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 AM EDT THU MAY 24 2001

MODEL DIFFERENCES ARE FAIRLY NEGLIGABLE WITH STACKED LOW LINGERING 
OVER THE REGION THROUGH THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. AVN SLIGHTLY QUICKER 
THAT OTHER MODELS...BUT IT HARDLY MATTERS WITH MEANDERING NATURE OF 
THIS SYSTEM. BLEND LOOKS REASONABLE. 

FWC TEMPS A LITTLE OPTIMISTIC...CONSIDERING CLOUD COVER AND SHOWERS 
YESTERDAY PUT US ABOUT 5 DEGREES COOLER THAN SURROUNDING REGION. 
WILL TREND TOWARDS COOLER AVN THOUGH FWCS 100 POPS ARE ENTIRELY 
REASONABLE TODAY. WILL CUT POPS TO LIKELY IN THE EAST TONIGHT AND 
CHANCE IN THE WEST...AND APPARENT DRY SLOT TO SET UP OVER FCST 
AREA FOR FRIDAY. WILL STILL KEEP POPS IN HERE BUT DECREASE TO 
CHANCE. THUNDER SHOULD PREVAIL TODAY WITH MARGINAL CAPES...DECENT 
COLD LAYER ALOFT...AND NEG LIS THROUGH THE DAY. SHOWERS ON FRI 
SHOULD BE HIT AND MISS...BUT BEST LIS LIMITED TO THE EAST AND WILL 
PLAY DOWN THUNDER THROUGH THE DAY.

HEAVY RAIN A POSSIBILITY TODAY WITH SLOW MOVING THUNDERSTORMS AND 
PWATS RUNNING AROUND .8 INCH. EXPECT FFGUIDANCE TO COME UP A BIT 
TODAY BUT WILL PASS ON CONCERN FOR FAR SOUTHEAST AREA TO NEXT SHIFT. 
MOST OF FCST AREA LOOKS TO BE ABLE TO HANDLE ANOTHER ROUND OF GOOD 
SHOWERS. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS




FXUS61 KILN 240108
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
905 PM EDT WED MAY 23 2001

WATER VAPOR AND SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A NEARLY VERTICALLY STACKED 
LOW CENTERED NEAR NE IOWA/SW WISCONSIN.  S/WV ENERGY WILL CONT 
ROTATING AROUND THE LOW CENTER...AND THESE WILL BE THE FOCUS FOR 
SHOWERS/TSTMS.

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY AND 18Z MESOETA SHOW ONE S/WV NOW EXITING TO THE 
EAST OF THE CWFA.  SOME NVA WAS NOTED BEHIND THIS FEATURE WITH 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.  THE NEXT S/WV WAS PUSHING THROUGH EASTERN 
INDIANA...AND THIS WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A LINE OF 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS.  A STRONGER S/WV NOW OVER CNTRL NEBRASKA/NE 
KANSAS WILL MOVE INTO THE S AND W CWFA BETWEEN 09Z AND 12Z.

CURRENT FCST FOR THE WRN AREAS LOOKS OK AT THIS TIME...HIGHLIGHTING 
SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS EARLY...THEN LIKELY LATE WITH NEXT 
S/WV FROM NEB/KS.  HOWEVER...THE EASTERN CWFA MAY GO MOSTLY CLEAR 
FOR AWHILE BEFORE NEXT ROUND OF PCPN MOVES INTO THERE.  THIS MAY 
ALSO LEAD TO COOLER TEMPS THAN CURRENT FCST LOW OF 50 DEGREES.  WILL 
MASSAGE ZONES TO REFLECT THE ABOVE CONCERNS.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 231909
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
308 PM EDT WED MAY 23 2001

TSRA BEGINNING TO FIRE JUST WEST OF THE CWFA THIS AFTN...IN AXIS OF 
BETTER INSTABILITY.  MOST OF OUR AREA HAS EXPERIENCED JUST -RA THIS 
AFTN...ASSOCIATED WITH A SHORT WAVE OVER E KY.  WL CARRY SCT POPS 
ERLY TONIGHT...THEN INCRS TO LIKELY WEST LATE AS NEXT WAVE PIVOTS 
IN.  META SFC TEMPS MUCH WARMER THAN STATISTICAL GUID...AND WITH 
DWPTS ARND 50 HV GONE AOA MOS.  FOR THU...NEW GUID IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT THAT LOBE OF HI MEAN RH/PCPN WL MOVE SW TO NE ACRS THE 
AREA ERLY IN THE DAY.  STABILITY PARAMETERS CONT TO SUGGEST TSRA 
POTNL...AND WL INCLUDE ALL ZONES.  WL UNDERCUT FWC TEMPS ALL 
GRPS...BUT RATHER CONSERVATIVELY GIVEN UPSTRAM READINGS IN MO/ILL.

FOR THE REST OF THE SHORT RANGE...AND INTO THE MED RANGE FOR THAT 
MATTER...GUID IN QUITE GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE HANDLING OF THE CUT 
OFF UPPER LOW.  SYS SHUD DROP SLOWLY SE TWRD THE RGN THRU 
FRI...WOBBLE BACK TO THE WEST SAT...AND DRIFT BACK THRU SUN INTO 
MONDAY.  THE INDIVIDUAL SHORT WAVES...WHICH OBVIOUSLY WL BE CRITICAL 
TO PCPN CVRG/TIMING AND INTENSITY...WILL BE MUCH MORE DIFFICULT TO 
PREDICT.  FOR NOW...WITH FAIRLY CLOSE PROXIMITY OF UPPER SYS ON 
FRI...AND FAVORABLE DIURNAL TIMING...WL CARRY LIKELY POPS ALL ZONES 
FRI.  FOR TEMPS...HV BASICALLY NARROWED DIURNAL RANGES DUE TO XPCTD 
CLOUD/PCPN CVRG.

WL BE INTERESTING TO SEE HOW THIS PLAYS OUT FROM A HYDRO 
PERSPECTIVE.  CLOSED UPPER SYS A FEW DEG LONGITUDE TO THE WEST 
PROVIDES A FAVORABLE CONCEPTUAL SETUP FOR SLOW MOVG WARM TOP 
CONVECTION IN THE WARM SEASON.  BIG QSTN IS WHETHER ENUF MSTR WL BE 
RECYCLED/ADVECTED TO LEAD TO SOME LOCALIZED HEAVY RAIN...WHICH WOULD 
BE A REAL PROBLEM OVER THE WATERLOGGED EASTERN SXN OF THE CWFA.  WL 
CONT TO MONITOR.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE







1025 AM EDT WED MAY 23 2001

NICE DPVA AHEAD OF S/WV OVER WESTERN TN/KY...AS WELL AS WEAK 
WAA...DRIVING AREA OF SHRA MOVG ACRS SW PORTIONS OF THE CWFA ATTM.
PCPN FALLING OUT OF MID CLOUD DECK...AND WITH FAIRLY DRY AIR BLO HV 
SEEN MAINLY LIGHT AMNTS THUS FAR.  LATEST SHORT RANGE GUID SUGGEST 
MSTR/LIFT WL CONT TO SPREAD NE...ELONGATING INTO A N-S BAND OVER THE 
EASTERN 2/3 OF THE AREA ERLY THIS AFTN.  CLOUD CVR LIMITING 
INSOLATION/INSTABILITY...BUT STILL XPCT ENUF HEATING TO ALLOW SOME 
TSRA TO FORM.  BEST INSTABILITY WL BE OVER THE WEST...WHERE BEST CHC 
FOR CLEARING EXISTS AND MID LVL TEMPS A LTL COOLER.  WL HAVE TO 
WATCH ANY TSRA FOR SMALL HAIL/GUSTY WIND POTNL. 

TEMPS JUMPED FROM M50S TO 67 IN CENTRAL OHIO YDAY WITH JUST A CPL 
HOURS OF SUN...SO AM INCLINED TO LV CURRENT FCST TEMPERATURES ALONE.
MAIN FOCUS OF UPDATE WL BE TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING...AS WELL AS TO 
MAKE A FEW COSMETIC CHGS.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 230633
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 AM EDT WED MAY 23 2001

THANKS TO CLE FOR COORD...

GENERAL WX PATTERN WILL BE SET FOR THE NEXT WEEK WITH STACKED LOW 
SPINNING JUST WEST OF FCST AREA IN ILLINOIS. MODELS IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT WITH POSTION AND FEATURES...BUT IVE GOT A HARD TIME 
HANGING MY HAT ON ANY DETAIL IN THE FORECAST WITH SUCH A BROAD AREA 
OF INCREASED RHS WITH ANY NUMBER OF SHORTWAVES AND MINI JETS 
SWINGING AROUND. 

FOR TODAY HOWEVER...LOOKS LIKE SHOWERS OVER MO/SRN ILL ARE FOCUSED 
AHEAD OF H8/H9 LL WIND MAXIMA AND BEST CONVERGENCE. JET AND MODEL 
QPF BRINGS JET OVERTOP OF SW FCST AREA BY 18Z AND SCOOTS IT TOWARDS 
WRN LK ERIE BY 0Z. LIKLEY POPS REASONABLE TODAY WITH GENERALLY LIGHT 
SHOWERS. DONT EXPECT MUCH TONIGHT THOUGH AN EVENING SHOWER SHOULD 
REMAIN POSSIBLE OVER THE NORTH HALF OF F.A. AND IN THE WEST TOWARDS 
MORNING. INSTABILITY SEEMS TO GET PUMPED UP A LITTLE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND I CANT RULE OUT SOME THUNDER, BUT WILL LIMIT IT TO THE WEST AND 
PLAY IT DOWN. 

JUST READ AFD FROM JKL AND COULDNT AGREE MORE. LOW CHANCE POPS TO 
INCREASE TO LIKELY ON THURSDAY WITH CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF BROAD SFC 
FRONT...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO PLAY DOWN MENTION OF THUNDER. 

COOL...MOIST/WET PERIOD TO CONTINUE THROUGH HOLIDAY WEEKEND. DONT 
EXPECT THE BROAD AREA OF INSTABILITY TO BRING THAT MUCH THUNDER AND 
HEAVY RAINS TO CWA SO WILL LET ESF PREVIOUSLY ISSUED DIE, THOUGH 
WELL BE FAR FROM DRY.

MISILN OUT EVENTUALLY. COOPERATION OF MATRIX WILL DETERMINE HOW SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





320 PM EDT TUE MAY 22 2001

MDLS CONTINUE TO HAVE GOOD CONTINUITY WITH HUGE LOW CAMPING OUT OVER 
THE MIDWEST THIS WEEK. THE CENTER OF THE UPR LOW WILL BE TO OUR 
WEST...KEEPING US IN SWLY FLOW WITH DECENT DIV ALOFT. BEST LAPSE 
RATES WILL BE CLOSER TO CORE...BUT SCT AFTN SHOWERS A POSSIBILITY 
TOMORROW. BEST CHC OF RAIN COMES WED NITE INTO THU WITH SERIES OF 
SHORT WAVES ROTATING AROUND LOW. WILL GO LIKELY BOTH PDS. AM WORRIED 
THAT BEST FOCUS WILL BE SE WHERE BEST UPR LVL DIV WILL BE. THEY 
CANNOT HANDLE MUCH RAIN EVEN WITH A DAY OFF. WILL ISSUE ESF 
HIGHLIGHTING CHC FOR FLOODING WED NITE-FRI IN SE ZN. 

TEMPS WILL BE INTERESTING WITH COLD AIR ALOFT. WILL KEEP CLOSE TO 
CURRENT FCST AS THIS IS IN LINE WITH SOURCE REGION TEMPS. WILL BE 
CLOSING DIURNAL RANGE A BIT CONSIDERING MOIST CONDITIONS.

MISILN ON ITS WAY.

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

THE COLD POOL AND SUNSHINE SHOULD BRING SOME WIDESPREAD CU/SC INTO 
THE PICTURE FOR A MOCLOUDY FORECAST.

LEAST ONE MORE UPDATE TO REMOVE SHOWERS LATER THIS MORNING FOR REST 
OF WRN 1/2 OF FCST AREA.

FXUS61 KILN 220926
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
525 AM EDT TUE MAY 22 2001

...INCLUDED LEWIS COUNTY TO WATCH WITH ZONE ISSUANCE...

CDFNT MAKING ITS WAY THROUGH FCST AREA TODAY AND WILL EXPECT MAINLY 
MORNING SHOWERS WEST ALONG WITH SOME THUNDER POSSIBLE IN THE EAST. 
WITH RAIN YESTERDAY...FLASH FLOODING STILL A REAL POSSIBILITY IN 
SCIOTO RIVER VALLEY JUST NORTH OF THE OHIO...AND WILL EXTEND THE 
WATCH FOR 4 COUNTIES BUTTING UP AGAINST CHARLESTONS CWA THROUGH 
NOON. DONT THINK THAT THE THUNDER HAS THAT MUCH OF A CHANCE TO GET 
FURTHER NORTH...AND CERTAINLY NOT MUCH FURTHER WEST WITH PROGRESSION 
OF FRONT. 

DOWNWARD MOTION SHOULD TURN OFF ANY SHOWERS IN COLD POOL BEHIND 
FRONT THOUGH SOME SPRINKLES CANT BE RULED OUT. WILL KEEP A SILENT 
20 IN WITH THIS THINKING. DRY SLOT LOOKS PROMINENT TODAY...BUT CU/SC 
SHOULD FILL IN NICELY WITH COLD POOL ALOFT. 

AFTER THIS MORNING SHOT...WILL STAY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE AND BELOW 
CLIMATOLOGY FOR TEMPERATURES WITH H5 LOW PARKED OVER WRN GT LKS AND 
HIGHER THAN NORMAL ON POPS WITH SHORTWAVES MOVING AROUND LOW.

WILL THROW IN PATCHY FOG TONIGHT IN THE EASTERN HALF OF FCST AREA 
WHERE RAIN EXPECTED TO BE HIGHEST TODAY. 

.ILN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH THIS MORNING FOR LEWIS COUNTY IN KY AND
HOCKING...ROSS...PIKE...AND SCIOTO COUNTIES IN OHIO.

FRANKS

SHORT WAVE AND SFC FRONT HAVE PASSED EAST AND PRECIP HAS TEMPORARILY 
ENDED.  NEXT BATCH OF SHRA IS ON ITS WAY FROM THE SOUTHWEST...AHEAD 
OF AN ELONGATED SHORT WAVE OVER ILLINOIS.

WITH HIGHER DEW POINTS LINGERING OVER SOUTHEAST OHIO AND MODELS 
INDICATING MOISTURE CONVERGENCE...SHOWERS THAT WILL MOVE IN THERE 
LATE TONIGHT COULD STILL CONTAIN HEAVY RAIN...SO ILL KEEP FLOOD 
WATCH IN EFFECT IN OUR SOUTH CENTRAL COUNTIES.

UP TO LIKELY IN THE WEST. 

LOW TEMPS FROM 50 TO 55 WEST CENTRAL UP TO 60 SOUTHEAST LOOK GOOD 
WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR ADVECTING IN TONIGHT.

HAVING OCCURRED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM EDT MON MAY 21 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS COLD FRONT OVER ILL...TRAILING RATHER DEEP 
SFS LPRES OVER WI.  SECOND SFC WAVE NOTED OVER ARKANSAS...WHERE 
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SUGGESTS VERY GOOD DIVERGENCE ALOFT.  DIURNAL 
CONVECTION AHEAD OF SFC BNDRY BEGINNING TO FIRE OVER WESTERN SXNS OF 
THE CWFA.  LACK OF INSOLATION HAS KEPT THE AREA RELATIVELY STABLE 
TDY...AND AS A RESULT UPDRAFTS HV BEEN RATHER SMALL AND LACKING IN 
ORGANIZATION.  GIVEN CURRENT WIND FIELDS HWVR...AND WITH SOME HOLES 
OPENING IN THE CLD CVR...XPCT A CONTD EVOLUTION INTO DEEPER/MORE 
ORGANIZED CONVECTION WITH MODERATE STRAIGHT LINE WIND POTNL.  WL 
LIKELY SEE A BOX ISSUED BEFORE 4 PM...AND MAY HOLD ZONES A LITTLE 
LATER IN ANTICIPATION.  OTHW...SECOND WAVE PROGGED BY LATEST SHORT 
RANGE GUID TO BRING PCPN BACK IN AFTER MIDNIGHT.  BEST PCPN 
EFFICENCY AND LOWEST FFG VALUES ARE OVER THE SE AND WL CONT WATCH 
TNGT.  ELSW...WL ALLOW FFA TO EXPIRE ALTHOUGH LATER SHIFTS WL HV TO 
MONITOR CONVECTIVE TRENDS OVERNIGHT.  

WL HIT POPS HARDEST EAST TUE...TAPERING TO 60 POPS IN THE NW.  WL 
MENTION +RA STIL IN THE SE...BUT ALLOW MID SHIFT DETERMINE IF FFA 
NEEDS TO BE EXTENDED.  DRYING TREND XPCTD TUE NGT...ALTHOUGH WL HOLD 
ONTO LOW POPS IN THE SE ERLY.  NOT MUCH FORCING ON WED...AND IN FACT 
AREA LKS TO BE IN BIT OF A DRY SLOT.  WL KEEP LOW CHC POPS HWVR 
GIVEN STEEP LAPSE RATES AND MOIST BNDRY LAYER.  TRENDED TWRD WARMER 
FWC VALUES THROUGHOUT AS AT LEAST A LITTLE SUN XPCTD.

.ILN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TONIGHT SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO AND NORTH 
CENTRAL KY.

H8 ANALYSIS THIS MORNING SHOWS AREA AT THE NOSE OF 40+ KNOT 
JET...AND IN NICE THERMAL RIDGE.  PLENTY OF MSTR AVAILABLE...WITH A 
BAND OF +15 DWPT AIR AT 850 MB AND PWATS AOA 1.75 ADVECTING IN.  
REGIONAL RADAR HAS BEEN PRETTY EFFECTIVE AT DETECTING THE SMALLER 
SCALE SHORT WAVES EMBEDDED IN THE BROAD CYCLONIC FLOW...WITH THE 
MOST NOTABLE FTRS EVIDENT MOVG INTO CENTRAL KY AND ALSO OVER W 
CENTRAL INDIANA.  WAVE EVIDENT SOUTH OF SDF WL PIVOT NE INTO SOUTH 
CENTRAL OH THRU THE SHORT TERM...AND PROVIDE AN ADDNL FOCUS FOR +RA 
IN AN AREA WHICH HAS SEEN ENTIRELY TOO MUCH RAIN THE PAST WEEK.  

ELSW...WIDESPRD CLDS LIMITING INSOLATION AND SAT TRENDS SUGGEST THIS 
SHUD CONT.  XPCT A MORE SCT-BKN TYPE PCPN CVRG FOR THE REST OF THE 
DAY...BUT WITH ANY HEATING CUD SEE SOME LOCALIZED HVY RAIN.  WL KEEP 
FFA UP AS IS...BUT MENTION MORE LOCALIZED NATURE TO +RA.  WITH CLDS 
WL BE MAKING SOME DOWNWARD TEMP ADJUSTMENTS...M70S JUST ABT 
EVRYWHERE.

FXUS61 KILN 210637
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EDT MON MAY 21 2001

STRONG 500 MB VORT WILL LIFT OUT OF MO TODAY AND ACROSS THE FA.  
LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION IS CURRENTLY ASSOCIATED WITH THE VORT IN 
MO/IL.  THIS CONVECTION IS FORECAST TO LIFT ACROSS THE FA LATER THIS 
MORNING WITH THE VORT. ADDITIONAL CONVECTION SHOULD FORM AHEAD OF A 
COLD FRONT THAT WILL SWING THROUGH THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES TODAY AND
THE FA TONIGHT.  INSTABILITY IS MODERATE...WITH LI FORECAST TO FALL 
TO -2 TO -4 AND CAPES TO REACH 1000 J/KG.  CURRENT FORECAST OF 
OCCASIONAL RW/TRW STILL LOOKING GOOD.

PRECIP WATER OF OVER 1.50 WILL BE ACROSS THE FA DURING THE DAY.  THE 
FFG IS SHOWING TWO AREAS OF VERY LOW VALUES...AN INCH OR LESS IN 1 
HR.  FIRST IS IN THE SOUTHWEST AND THE OTHER IN SOUTHEAST.  WILL 
ONLY ISSUE A WATCH FOR THE SOUTHWEST RIGHT NOW.  THE VORT IS 
FORECAST TO SWING SW TO NE ACROSS THE FA...WHICH WOULD PUT THAT AREA 
IN THE HIGHEST THREAT FOR THE HEAVIER RAINS.  THE FIRST AREA MIGHT 
MISS THE SE COUNTIES.  ALTHOUGH SE MIGHT GET SOME HEAVY RAINS WITH 
THE FRONT...THAT MIGHT NOT BE UNTIL TONIGHT.

AS MENTIONED BEFORE...COLD FRONT SWINGS ACROSS THE FA OVERNIGHT.  
SHOULD SEE CONVECTION ALONG FRONT. WILL PUSH POPS TONIGHT INTO THE 
CATEGORICAL RANGE.  UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR THEN PUSHES INTO THE FA 
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK.  MODELS FORECASTING 850 
TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY FROM +2 TO +8 C.  THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR 
INSTABILITY SHOWERS TO FORM.

NEW MOS PRETTY CLOSE TO CURRENT FORECAST...SO PROBABLY ONLY A TWEAK 
OR TWO IN THE TEMPERATURES.

.ILN...
IN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY INZ050-058>059-066-073>075-080.
KY...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY KYZ091>093.
OH...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY OHZ060>062-070>072-077>078.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
229 PM EDT SUN MAY 20 2001

ZONAL FLO TO AMPLIFY AS ENERGY DROPS SE FM CAN INTO CNTRL U.S. 
CARVING OUT DEEP UPR TROF OVR UPR MS VLY BY END OF PD. ETA/NGM HV 
TRENDED FASTER CLOSER TO AVN SOLN WITH FROPA ON MON. WL FOLLOW 
BLEND OF ETA/AVN SOLNS.

INITIAL S/WV OVR SRN PLNS TO EJECT NE INTO MID MS VLY THIS EVE AND 
LWR OH VLY OVRNGT. WL FOLLOW FASTER TREND WITH CNVCTN DVLPG LT TNGT 
WITH RETURN FLO AND WRMFNT. WL GO WITH LKLY POPS ACRS ALL BUT NRN
MIAMI AND CNTRL OH WHERE WL OPT FOR 50 POPS LT. TEMP WISE...DUE TO
INCRSG CLDS AND DWPTS XPCT LOWS A LTL WRMR THAN FWC TNGT.
 
S/WV ROTATING ARND E SIDE OF UPR TROF THRU OH VLY. MID LVL 50KT
WND MAX XPCTD DURG AFTN WITH 40-50KT H8 FLO. LO LVL JET WL PROVIDE
FAVORABLE AXIS OF LO LVL CNVRGC. THIS LO LVL CNVRGC COUPLED WITH 
UPR DIV DURG AFTN. SFC BASED CAPES FCST TO BE BTWN 1000-1500 J/KG.
DMGG WND AND LARGE HAIL WL BE PSBL MON. PRECIP EFF INCRS TO 1.5 INCHES
ON MON. ADDITIONAL RAINFALL OF 1.0 TO 1.5 INCHES WL BE PSBL THRU TUE.
GROUND IS VRY SATURATED AND RIVERS ARE RUNNING HI FROM RECENT RAINS.
THEREFORE...WL CONT FLOOD POTENTIAL OUTLOOK.

WL GO WITH LKLY POPS WITH HIGHEST POPS IN ERN SECTIONS MON NGT. 
NXT MAIN S/WV TO ROTATE ARND THE UPR TROF INTO OH VLY ON TUE. THIS
WL ENHANCE SHWR/TSTM THREAT DURG THE DAY. WL GO WITH CATAGORICAL POPS
OF SHWRS AND CHC OF TSTMS WITH MARGINAL INSTBY DUE TO COOLING ALFT.  

DUE TO CLD CVR AND RAIN WL TREND TEMPS A LTL COOLER THAN FWC GUID
BOTH MON AND TUE.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL









948 AM EDT SUN MAY 20 2001

ZONAL FLO TO AMPLIFY AS ENERGY DROPS SE FM CAN INTO CNTRL U.S.
CARVING OUT UPR TROF THRU THE PD. INITIAL S/WV OVR SRN PLNS TO
EJECT NE INTO MID MS VLY THIS EVE AND LWR OH VLY OVRNGT. MODELS
CONT TO TREND TWD FASTER SOLN WITH CNVCTN DVLPG LT TNGT WITH 
RETURN FLO AND WRMFNT. 

IN SHORT TERM...WK HI PRES CNTRD OVR ERN GRTLKS TO PROVIDE ERLY
LO LVL FLO TDA. DRIER AIR ACRS THE N WHERE MAINLY JUST THIN CI 
EXPECTED THIS AFTN. ACRS THE S XPCT SCT TO BKN CU DVLPMNT. WL 
CONT PARTLY SUNNY SKY COND S. ENERGY BLOCK METHOD APPLIED TO 
ILN/S 12Z SOUNDING YIELDS A HI NR 79 DEG. THIS LOOKS REASONABLE
AND AGREES WITH CURR FCST. WL UPDATE ZONE PACKAGE WITH ONLY 
MINOR ADJUSTMENT REMOVING FOG IN THE S.

770 
FXUS61 KILN 200644
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 AM EDT SUN MAY 20 2001

WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL PROVIDE A BRIEF RESPITE FROM THE RAIN 
TODAY.  DRIER AIR ACROSS THE NORTH SHOULD ALLOW FOR A LITTLE MORE 
SUNSHINE VERSES THE SOUTH....WHERE  A LITTLE MORE CU IS EXPECTED.

S/W EJECTS NORTHEAST FROM OK/AR TONIGHT INTO THE LOWER OHIO 
VALLEY...PUSHING WARM FRONT INTO THE REGION.  SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A 
THUNDERSTORM TRY TO FIRE ALONG THE FRONT TONIGHT.  SHORTWAVE LIFTS 
ACROSS THE FA MONDAY.  THIS SYSTEM IS FOLLOWED QUICKLY BY LARGE 
DEEPENING UPPER LOW ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS.

AVN IS A LITTLE QUICKER IN PUSHING COLD FRONT ACROSS THE FA.  AVN 
HAS THE SYSTEM INTO WRN PA BY 12Z TUESDAY.  THE ETA/NGM PUTS THE 
FRONT BACK INTO WESTERN OHIO.  PREFER THE LITTLE SLOWER SOLUTION 
WHICH WOULD MEANS THAT THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WOULD AFFECT 
THE FA LONGER MONDAY NIGHT.  AVERAGE RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF AROUND AN 
INCH ARE EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT 24 TO 36 HOURS...WHICH WILL KEEP THE 
GROUND SATURATED.  COULD SEE HIGHER AMOUNTS IN THUNDERSTORMS...WHICH 
MIGHT GIVE FLOODING PROBLEMS.  WILL ISSUE AN ESF HIGHLIGHTING THE 
SITUATION.

ONLY TWEAKED MOS TEMPS HERE AND THERE.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

S/WV OVR NW TN TO TRACK ESE ACRS TN VLY TNGT. MODEL TRENDS ARE

ACRS CNTRL KY WITH LO PRES OVR WRN KY. THIS WV OF LO PRES TO TRACK 
ESE INTO ERN TNY OVRNGT. FAVORABLE LO LVL CNVRGC AND PE/S ACRS THE 
FAR SE SECTIONS TO EXIT THE RGN THIS EVE. WL MONITOR LTST RADAR 
TRENDS AND WL LKLY KEEP EVE CHC SHWRS OVR S CNTRL OH/NE KY. S/WV
RDGG TO BLD IN FM W OVRNGT INTO SUN. XPCT CLRG WHICH HS TAKEN
PLACE OVR NRN OH TO WORK INTO CNTRL OH THIS EVE. ONLY XPCT
PARTIAL CLRG ACRS THE FAR S LT TNGT. WET GROUND...CLRG SKIES
AND LGT WNDS SHUD RESULT IN FOG FORMATION TNGT. TEMP WISE...PREFER
LOWS SLGTLY COOLER THAN FWC TNGT.
     
XPCT FOG TO BURN OFF ERLY SUN AND GIVE WAY TO SCT/BKN CU DVLPMNT
IN THE FAR S WHERE WL GO WITH PARTLY SUNNY SKY COND. ACRS NRN MIAMI
VLY...DRIER AIR SHUD RESULT IN MSTLY SUNNY COND. HV STAYED CLOSE OR 
SLGTLY WRMR THAN FWC GUID WITH HIGHS SUN.

FLO AMPLIFIES AS ENERGY DROPS S INTO PLNS SUN NGT. ETA HS TRENDED 
FASTER WITH THIS NEXT WX SYS. AVN IS THE FASTEST SOLN AND HS BEST
CONTINUITY. WL MENT CHC OF SHWRS/TSTMS IN WRN SECTIONS LT SUN NGT
WITH WRMFNT PIVOT NE INTO OH VLY. PREFER WRMR LOWS CLOSE TO MAV
SUN NGT.

OH IS IN WRM SECTOR ON MON WITH CDFNT INTO THE W DURG AFTN. WL 
CONT LKLY CHC SHWRS/TSTMS MON WITH HIGHEST POPS IN THE W. FWC GUID
APPEARS A LTL WRM THEREFORE...HV GONE A FEW DEGREES COOLER.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 190646
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 AM EDT SAT MAY 19 2001

STATIONARY BOUNDARY IS LOCATED JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE FA...WITH 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS STILL TRAINING ALONG IT.  MODELS BRING 
WAVE ALONG FRONT...PUSHING IT NORTH TO THE OHIO RIVER.  THIS WILL 
PUSH THE RAINS BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE FA.  LIKELY POPS 
SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER AND 50 POPS IN SOUTH OHIO/IN STILL LOOK 
GOOD.  IN THE NORTHERN PARTLY OF THE FA...SKIES SHOULD BE PARTLY 
CLOUDY.

AFTER YESTERDAYS RAINS...THE REAL FFG WILL BE BEEN LOWER THAN THE 
POSTED NUMBERS.  WITH WEST TO EAST MOVEMENT...TRAINING WILL STILL BE 
A CONCERN...SO WILL CONTINUE THE FFA INTO SATURDAY.  THE WAVE SHOULD 
FINALLY PUSH FRONT THROUGH THE AREA BY LATE AFTERNOON...BRINGING AN 
END TO THE RAINS.

AS WEAK HIGH BUILDS IN TONIGHT...SKIES SHOULD CLEAR IN THE 
NORTH...CLOUDS COULD LINGER IN THE SOUTHEAST. WILL MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF FOG. 

DEEPENING UPPER LOW IN THE CENTRAL U.S. WILL CAUSE THE ONSET OF THE 
NEXT ROUND OF RAIN TO BE DELAYED.  WILL TAKE OUT THE MENTION OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON SUNDAY NIGHT.

MOS TEMPERATURES LOOK PRETTY GOOD FOR THE FIRST 3 PERIODS...SO ONLY 
A TWEAK HERE OR THERE.  WILL GO A CATEGORY WARMER ON SUNDAY NIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.

.ILN...
IN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY INZ066-073>075-080.
KY...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY KYZ089>100.
OH...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY OHZ070>074-077>082-088.


FXUS61 KILN 181838
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 PM EDT FRI MAY 18 2001

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT EXTENDING FROM EXTREME SE 
MI...EXTREME NW OHIO...SOUTHWEST INTO CNTRL INDIANA...THEN INTO S 
CNTRL IL.  A WEAK SFC LOW WAS NOTED ACRS SW OHIO WITH ANOTHER WEAK 
SFC LOW DEVELOPING ACRS S CNTRL IL.

MODELS ARE NOT IN TOO MUCH DISAGREEMENT REGARDING THE NXT 48 HOURS.  
WILL LEAN TOWARD AN ETA/AVN BLEND.

MAIN CONCERN OVERNIGHT WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING/FLASH 
FLOODING.  KILN RADAR CONTINUES TO SHOW SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS 
PRODUCING HEAVY RAIN ACRS SRN OHIO.  THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO A VERY 
MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS.  PW/S WILL CONTINUE TO BE HIGH...AROUND 
1.7 INCHES ACRS SRN OHIO...SE INDIANA AND NRN KY THROUGH TONIGHT.  
CURRENT ROUND OF SHOWERS/STORMS WILL PUSH INTO S CNTRL OHIO/NRN KY 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTN.  FOR THIS EVENING INTO 
TONIGHT...THE SECOND SFC LOW PRESSURE OVER S CNTRL IL...IN 
CONJUNCTION WITH AN UPR LVL S/WV ABOVE...WILL BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF 
SHOWERS/STORMS TO THE SRN CWFA.  THUS...WILL CONTINUE A FF WATCH IN 
THIS REGION.  FOR THE NRN CWFA...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL GRADUALLY SAG 
SOUTH AND EAST THERE OVERNIGHT.  INSTABILITY/LOW LVL 
CONVERGENCE/PCPN EFFICIENCY WILL NOT BE AS GREAT AS THE SRN CWFA.  
THUS...WILL CANCEL FF WATCH THERE (INCLUDING DAYTON...COLUMBUS AND 
WAPAKONETA).  AREAS OF FOG WILL BE MENTIONED DUE TO SO MUCH MSTR ON 
THE GROUND.

FOR SATURDAY...CLEARING WILL GRADUALLY TAKE PLACE FROM NORTH TO 
SOUTH.  WILL CARRY POPS DURING THE MORNING FOR CVG EASTWARD INTO PMH.
SOUTH OF THE RIVER...WILL CARRY POPS INTO EARLY AFTN.  

BY SATURDAY NIGHT...UPR LVL FLOW BECOMES MORE ANTICYCLONIC.  SFC 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING ALSO TAKES PLACE.  WILL GO MOSTLY CLEAR NRN 
AREAS WITH PARTLY CLOUDY/CLEARING SOUTH.  FOG COULD AGAIN BE A 
PROBLEM SATURDAY NIGHT OVER THE SOUTH...DEPENDENT ON WHEN THE 
CLEARING/DRYING TAKES PLACE.

ON SUNDAY...INCREASING SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST RETURN FLOW IN RESPONSE TO 
A DIGGING S/WV INTO THE NRN PLAINS STATES WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO WARM 
BACK TO AROUND 80.  SKIES SHOULD REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY.


.ILN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 8 AM EDT SAT FOR 
       INZ066-073>075-080-
       KYZ089>100-
       OHZ070>074-077>082-088

HICKMAN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 PM EDT FRI MAY 18 2001

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT EXTENDING FROM EXTREME SE 
MI...EXTREME NW OHIO...SOUTHWEST INTO CNTRL INDIANA...THEN INTO S 
CNTRL IL.  A WEAK SFC LOW WAS NOTED ACRS SW OHIO WITH ANOTHER WEAK 
SFC LOW DEVELOPING ACRS S CNTRL IL.

MODELS ARE NOT IN TOO MUCH DISAGREEMENT REGARDING THE NXT 48 HOURS.  
WILL LEAN TOWARD AN ETA/AVN BLEND.

MAIN CONCERN OVERNIGHT WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING/FLASH 
FLOODING.  KILN RADAR CONTINUES TO SHOW SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS 
PRODUCING HEAVY RAIN ACRS SRN OHIO.  THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO A VERY 
MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS.  PW/S WILL CONTINUE TO BE HIGH...AROUND 
1.7 INCHES ACRS SRN OHIO...SE INDIANA AND NRN KY THROUGH TONIGHT.  
CURRENT ROUND OF SHOWERS/STORMS WILL PUSH INTO S CNTRL OHIO/NRN KY 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTN.  FOR THIS EVENING INTO 
TONIGHT...THE SECOND SFC LOW PRESSURE OVER S CNTRL IL...IN 
CONJUNCTION WITH AN UPR LVL S/WV ABOVE...WILL BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF 
SHOWERS/STORMS TO THE SRN CWFA.  THUS...WILL CONTINUE A FF WATCH IN 
THIS REGION.  FOR THE NRN CWFA...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL GRADUALLY SAG 
SOUTH AND EAST THERE OVERNIGHT.  INSTABILITY/LOW LVL 
CONVERGENCE/PCPN EFFICIENCY WILL NOT BE AS GREAT AS THE SRN CWFA.  
THUS...WILL CANCEL FF WATCH THERE (INCLUDING DAYTON...COLUMBUS AND 
WAPAKONETA).  AREAS OF FOG WILL BE MENTIONED DUE TO SO MUCH MSTR ON 
THE GROUND.

FOR SATURDAY...CLEARING WILL GRADUALLY TAKE PLACE FROM NORTH TO 
SOUTH.  WILL CARRY POPS DURING THE MORNING FOR CVG EASTWARD INTO PMH.
SOUTH OF THE RIVER...WILL CARRY POPS INTO EARLY AFTN.  

BY SATURDAY NIGHT...UPR LVL FLOW BECOMES MORE ANTICYCLONIC.  SFC 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING ALSO TAKES PLACE.  WILL GO MOSTLY CLEAR NRN 
AREAS WITH PARTLY CLOUDY/CLEARING SOUTH.  FOG COULD AGAIN BE A 
PROBLEM SATURDAY NIGHT OVER THE SOUTH...DEPENDENT ON WHEN THE 
CLEARING/DRYING TAKES PLACE.

ON SUNDAY...INCREASING SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST RETURN FLOW IN RESPONSE TO 
A DIGGING S/WV INTO THE NRN PLAINS STATES WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO WARM 
BACK TO AROUND 80.  SKIES SHOULD REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY.


.ILN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR 
       INZ066-073>075-080-
       KYZ089>100-
       OHZ070>074-077>082-088

HICKMAN

          











792 
FXUS61 KILN 181359
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1000 AM EDT FRI MAY 18 2001

KILN SOUNDING THIS MORNING STILL INDICATES THAT A VERY MOIST AIRMASS 
IS IN PLACE ACRS THE REGION.  PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WERE 
MEASURED AROUND 1.70 INCHES.  THIS VERY MOIST AIRMASS WILL SET THE 
STAGE FOR POSSIBLE FLOOD/FLASH FLOODING DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
TONIGHT.

LATEST VISIBLE IMAGERY SHOWED  PARTIAL CLEARING OVER SE INDIANA/SW 
OHIO.  UNLIKE YESTERDAY...SOME ADDITIONAL HEATING IN THE PARTIAL 
CLEARING AREA WOULD ALLOW FOR SFC BASED CONVECTION VERSUS ELEVATED.  
REGARDLESS...SB CAPES/ELEVATED CAPES WILL RANGE BETWEEN 1000 TO 1500 
J/KG...PLENTY OF INSTABILITY FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  SFC MAP 
DEPICTED A FRONTAL BOUNDARY FROM SRN ONTARIO ...SOUTHWEST INTO NW 
OHIO AND THEN ACRS CENTRAL INDIANA.  THIS BOUNDARY WILL BECOME THE 
FOCUS FOR WIDESPREAD SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTN/TONIGHT AS A 
MID LVL S/WV NEAR MO/IL BORDER ENHANCES A SFC LOW ALONG THE BOUNDARY 
INTO SRN OHIO.  STORMS WILL BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
OF AT LEAST 2 INCHES PER HOUR.  WITH FFG VALUES ALONG AND NORTH OF 
THE OHIO RIVER BETWEEN 0.8 AND 1.2 INCHES...FLASH FLOOD WATCH IS 
WARRANTED.  ALTHOUGH FF GUIDANCE SOUTH OF THE OHIO IS HIGHER. 
..RAINFALL RATES AS MENTIONED ABOVE IS STILL A CAUSE FOR CONCERN 
THERE.

MAY TWEAK TEMPS DOWN ACRS THE NORTH WHERE SUNSHINE MAY NOT 
MATERIALIZE.

.ILN...IN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT INZ050-058>059-066-
            073>075-080.
         
       KY...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT KYZ089>100.
            

       OH...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT OHZ026-034>035-
            042>046-051>056-060>065-070>074-077>082-088.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 181244
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 AM EDT FRI MAY 18 2001

LOOKING AT THE LATEST OBSERVATIONS...VISIBILITIES HAVE COME UP 
ACROSS THE AREAS THAT HAD THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL MID-MORNING.
THUS...WILL LET THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY DIE A NATURAL DEATH AT 9 AM 
EDT.  ZONES WILL BE UPDATED TO REFLECT THIS.

.ILN...IN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT INZ050-058>059-066-
            073>075-080.
         
       KY...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT KYZ089>100.
            

       OH...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT OHZ026-034>035-
            042>046-051>056-060>065-070>074-077>082-088.
