

FXUS61 KILN 180911
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
510 AM EDT FRI MAY 18 2001

WAS HOPING THAT THE RAIN WOULD MOVE INTO THE AREA AND STIR UP THE 
FOG...BUT IT IS SLOW GETTING IN.  FOG IS BECOMING MORE WIDESPREAD.  
WILL ISSUE A DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR ALL BUT EXTREME SOUTH AND 
SOUTHEAST.

ORIGINAL DISCUSSION....

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE OUT OF THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND INTO THE FA 
BY 00Z.  LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION IS ALREADY ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
FRONT ACROSS MO/IL.  THE AVN WHICH BRINGS A SWATH OF INCH PLUS QPF 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE FA...APPEARS TO HAVE INITIALIZED 
BEST WITH ITS QPF OVER MO/IL.  GROUND IS SATURATED FROM THE RECENT 
RAINS...SO WILL ISSUE FLASH FLOOD WATCH.  FFG OVER KY COUNTIES A 
LITTLE HIGHER THAN THE REST OF THE FA...SO AT FIRST WAS GOING TO TRY 
AND LEAVE KY COUNTIES OUT OF THE FFG. THUNDERSTORMS HAVE FIRED ALONG 
A BOUNDARY IN KENTUCKY...AND WITH MOVEMENT EAST TO WEST...COULD SEE 
TRAINING...SO ADDED THEM TO THE WATCH. 

MODELS DIVERGE TONIGHT.  AVN/NGM PUSHES FRONT THROUGH THE FA...WHILE 
THE ETA HANGS IT UP ACROSS THE EXTREME SOUTH....THEN LINGER SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO SATURDAY.  WILL LEAN TOWARDS THE AVN/NGM 
SOLUTION.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FOR THE WEEKEND.

NGM TEMPERATURES LOOK TOO WARM FOR TODAY...SO WILL KNOCK A FEW 
DEGREES OFF...WHILE WILL ADD A FEW ON SATURDAY.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...IN...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT INZ050-058>059-066-
         073>075-080.
            DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL MID-MORNING INZ050-058>059-066- 
         073>075-080.

       KY...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT KYZ089>100.
            DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL MID-MORNING KYZ091>093.

       OH...FLASH FLOOD WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT OHZ026-034>035-
         042>046-051>056-060>065-070>074-077>082-088.

            DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL MID-MORNING OHZ026-034>035-
         042>046-051>056-060>065-070>074-077>078.

SITES







679 
FXUS61 KILN 180136
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
937 PM EDT THU MAY 17 2001

AREA IN CALM BETWEEN STORMS WITH TODAYS TSRA COMPLEX WEAKENING OVER 
VIRGINIA AND NEXT BATCH NEAR FRONT ENTERING ILLINOIS. SCT TSRA 
REMAIN ON OUR SOUTHEASTERN FRINGE. 

ILL UPDATE TO REMOVE POPS ALL ZONES EXCEPT SOUTHEAST WHERE 30% WILL 
WORK.  I WILL ALSO ADJUST WIND DIRECTION TO SOUTH.  ILL KEEP 
MENTION OF FOG WITH VSBY DROPPING BELOW 7SM ALREADY AT A FEW 
STATIONS.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO


FXUS61 KILN 180136
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
937 PM EDT THU MAY 17 2001

AREA IN CALM BETWEEN STORMS WITH TODAYS TSRA COMPLEX WEAKENING OVER

CONIGLIO











FXUS61 KILN 171916
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EDT THU MAY 17 2001

SQUALL LINE CONTINUES TO MOVE E ACROSS FA. EXPECT THE BEST THREAT 
FOR SVR TO HAVE EXITED THE AREA BY ISSUANCE TIME. AFTER COORDINATION 
WITH SPC...IT IS FELT THAT THE SVR TSTM WATCH WILL BE ALLOWED TO 
EXPIRE...ALTHOUGH A FEW WARNINGS MAY STILL BE NECESSARY. REGARDING 
THE FLASH FLOOD WATCH...WILL CONSIDER CANCELATION AT ISSUANCE TIME 
SINCE STRONGEST STORMS WILL HAVE MOVED E OF THE AREA.

MODELS ARE A BIT DIFFERENT TDY...ESPECIALLY WITH THE HANDLING OF THE 
NEXT SYSTEM WHICH SHOULD IMPACT OUR FA BEGINNING FRIDAY. AT THIS 
TIME WE HAVE DECIDED TO GO MORE WITH THE AVN SOLUTION...EXCEPT TO 
KEEP THE TRACK OF FRIDAYS LOW A BIT FURTHER SOUTH.

FOR TONIGHT...WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN FCST GIVEN THAT THE ATMOS WILL 
STILL BE SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE AND THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHS. TEMP 
GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD.

FOR FRIDAY...SEEMS WITH RATHER MODEST MID-UPPER LVL 
SUPPORT...MARGINAL INSTABILITY AND WK LOW LVL FORCING...WILL KEEP 
LIKELY POPS IN FCST.

LOOK FOR POTENTIAL FAIR WX BY SATURDAY.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO









536 
FXUS61 KILN 171916
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

STILL BE SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE AND THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHS. TEMP

FOR FRIDAY...SEEMS WITH RATHER MODEST MID-UPPER LVL 
SUPPORT...MARGINAL INSTABILITY AND WK LOW LVL FORCING...WILL KEEP 
LIKELY POPS IN FCST.

LOOK FOR POTENTIAL FAIR WX BY SATURDAY.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO

FXUS61 KILN 170746
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EDT THU MAY 17 2001

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING FM THE 
MO-IA BORDER SEWD INTO THE APPALACHIANS.  THE BOUNDARY LIES BTWN CVG 
AND ILN ACROSS FA OR ALONG GRADIENT OF WET AND RELATIVELY DRY GROUND.

SHORT TERM PROBLEM IS FOG FORMING THIS AM ACROSS FA DUE TO VERY WET 
GROUND.  ATTM VSBYS ARE NOT TOO BAD SO WL JUST MENTION PATCHY DENSE 
FOG.  

MCS MOVG ACROSS IA INTO NWRN IL IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE ALONG THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND PUSH INTO FA.  SOME WEAKENING POSSIBLE THIS AM 
BUT ACTIVITY SHOULD REINTENSIFY BY THIS PM WITH HEATING. ATMOSPHERE 
WL BE MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS PM WITH DEWPOINTS APPROACHING 70F NE 
OF KCVG. WL CARRY 50 POPS ALL AREAS XPCT CVG WHERE WL GO WITH 40 
POPS.

MAIN THREAT AGAIN TODAY WL BE HEAVY RAIN WITH ONLY ISOLATED SVR 
EXPECTED.  WL ISSUE STATEMENT HIGHLIGHTING FLOOD THREAT BUT WL NOT 
ISSUE FLOOD WATCH ATTM.

DUE TO HIGH DEWPOINTS WL CARRY HUMID WORDING.  TEMPS ARE TOUGH AGAIN 
TODAY WITH HIGHS DEPENDING ON TIMING OF THUNDERSTORMS.  WL GO A 
LITTLE BLO NGM MOS GUIDANCE SINCE XPCT TSRA BEFORE PEAK HEATING.

BOUNDARY PRODG TO LAY OUT MORE EAST-WEST TONIGHT AND FRI. WITH 
IMPULSES MOVG ALONG THE BOUNDARY...XPCT SEVERAL ROUNDS OF SHRA/TSRA 
TONIGHT AND FRI.  WL KEEP CHC EARLY CVG-PMH FRI NIGHT AND GO DRY 
ELSEWHERE.

.ILN...NONE.

MIDNIGHT IN THE EAST.

FXUS61 KILN 161919
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EDT WED MAY 16 2001

CONVECTION CONTINUES TO WEAKEN AS IT DROPS SOUTH. NOT MUCH IN THE 
WAY OF A DOMINANT FORCING MECHANISM TO HELP SUSTAIN DEEP CONVECTION. 
AFTER CONFERENCE WITH SPC...HAVE DECIDED TO CANCEL SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORM WATCH WITH ISSUANCE OF AFTERNOON PACKAGE. ALSO TIED TO 
THIS WEAKENING CONVECTION IS THE DECISION TO ALSO CANCEL THE FLOOD 
WATCH...ESPECIALLY WITH THE MODELS NOT REALLY SHOWING DEVELOPED 
FORCING FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD.

FOR THIS PACKAGE...APPEARS THE MODELS ARE IN FAIR AGREEMENT WITH 
MAJOR SYNOPTIC FEATURES. FOR TONIGHT...ETA APPEARS TO DEVELOP UPPER 
LVL DVRG ACROSS SRN PORTION OF FA. APPEARS THIS A DIRECT FEEDBACK OF 
CURRENT CONVECTION. WITH WK LLVL FORCING AND LACK OF ANY PROMINANT 
S/W...WILL OPT FOR SLT CHC EARLY ACROSS THE S. IN ADDITION...AFTER 
TDYS RAIN AND WITH LT WINDS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT...THE POSSIBILITY OF 
FOG WILL NEED TO BE ASSESSED.

FOR THURSDAY...WILL GO CHC POPS ENTIRE FA. ALTHOUGH SFC FORCING 
WEAK...SOME FORCING IS EVIDENT ABOVE THE BDRY LAYER. ALSO BETTER 
INSTABILITY NOTED ACROSS NRN PORTIONS. SOME UPPER LVL SUPPORT AS 
WELL.

FOR FRIDAY...EXPECT CLD FRONT TO DROP INTO THE AREA...WITH CHC POPS 
EXPECTED ENTIRE FA.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO

FXUS61 KILN 160741
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
341 AM EDT WED MAY 16 2001

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE OVER WI WITH A WARM FRONT 
EXTENDING SEWD INTO SWRN OH AND NERN KY.  SHRA/TSRA CONTINUE TO 
DEVELOP TO THE NE OF THIS BOUNDARY.  RAINFALL AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN 
GENEROUS BUT NOT EXCESSIVE.

XPCT CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY TO WEAKEN DURING THE MORNING HOURS AS THE 
ELEVATED CONVERGENCE WEAKENS.  SOME ACTIVITY WL CONTINUE ACROSS THE 
NRN MIAMI VALLEY AND VC CMH THIS AM BUT XPCT REST OF FA TO BE DRY 
UNTIL PEAK HEATING.  WARM FRONT WL PUSH NEWD BUT STILL MAY NOT MAKE 
IT PAST KCMH DUE TO BLOCKING ALONG THE NE COAST.

MODERATE INSTABILITY WL DEVELOP DURING THE PM HOURS AND SHOULD LEAD 
TO TSRA DEVELOPMENT IN THE PM.  WL PLAY PERSISTENCE AND KEEP THE 
HIGHEST POPS WHERE IT HAS RAINED THE LAST 2 DAYS.  SFC DEWPOINTS AND 
CONVERGENCE SHOULD BE MAXIMIZED NE OF CVG AREA.  AM TEMPTED TO LEAVE 
CVG AREA DRY TODAY BUT PRESENCE OF WK CDFNT COULD LEAD TO THE 
BREAKING OF THE CAP THERE.  WL CARRY A LOW CHANCE POP.

WL NOT MENTION SVR TODAY IN ZONES.  SETUP IS SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY 
BUT LLVL CONVERGENCE SHOULD BE WEAKER.

WL CONTINUE THE MENTION OF SHRA/TSRA TONIGHT AS CDFNT DROPS THROUGH 
FA.  MODELS TRY TO DRY OUT AREA ON THU SO WL GO DRY.  WL CARRY CHC 
SHRA/TSRA THU NIGHT AND FRI.

HIGHS TODAY SHOULD BE VERY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY SO WL MAKE SOME 
TWEEKS TO GUIDANCE.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
313 PM EDT TUE MAY 15 2001

CONVECTION EXPECTED TO SPARK ALONG NW-SE ORIENTATION ACROSS CWA. 
MOST OF INSTABILITY IS SFC BASED...AND LARGE TEMPERATURE GRADIENT 
NOTICED FROM RAIN COOLED AND CLOUD COVERED AREA OF CMH TO PTSUNNY 
SKIES AND MOIST AIR NEAR CVG. THREAT FOR SEVERE SHOULD TURN OFF 
QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET AS WERE STILL UNDER A H5 RIDGE...THOUGH A 
WEAKEND ONE. 

AFTER CONVECTION BECOMES MANAGEABLE LATER THIS EVENING...THREAT 
OVERNIGHT IS GENERALLY GOING TO BE TRAINING ECHOS MOVING SOUTHEAST 
AND POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING. MODELS IN SOMEWHAT OF A DISAGREEMENT... 
BUT THINK THAT ETA WILL BE CLOSE...IF NOT A BIT TOO FAR NORTHEAST. 
DONT EXPECT ANOTHER MCS TO DEVELOP...BUT IF ONE WERE TO I IMAGINE 
ALONG WI THIS EVENING AND MOVE TOWARDS NRN IND WITH FLOW MOVING 
SOUTH OF EAST. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 151423
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1020 AM EDT TUE MAY 15 2001

CURRENT FORECAST HAS THINGS WELL IN HAND AND WILL ONLY MAKE A MINOR 
ADJUSTMENT OR TWO. 

AREA OF SHOWERS AND SCATTERED THUNDER STILL LOCATED NORTHEAST OF 
WARM FRONT. WITH CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP EXPECTED FOR THE MAJORITY OF 
THE DAY IN NE ZONES...EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BE SERIOUSLY HAMPERED. 
CURRENT HIGHS OF 70 TO 75 MAY BE A BIT TOO OPTIMISTIC AND I EXPECT 
TO CUT A TIER OF COUNTIES IN THE NORTHEAST OUT TO DROP READINGS TO 
THE UPPER 60S AND HOPE THEY CAN EVEN MAKE THIS. 

DONT EXPECT MUCH IN THE LINE OF SEVERE WX HERE WITH POSSIBLE 
EXCEPTION OF FLOODING OVERNIGHT. WILL HAVE TO SEE WHAT MODELS ARE 
DOING...BUT FIRST GLANCE AND YESTERDAYS THINKING TELLS ME THAT 
ANOTHER MCS TO SET UP IN FAR NRN CWA JUST S OF MI/OH STATE LINE. 
WILL TOUCH THIS WITH AN ESF AND TRY TO FIGURE OUT WHERE I WANT TO 
ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS IN THE AFTERNOON 
PACKAGE. THINK THAT THE LARGE HAIL THREAT MENTIONED HERE IS GOING TO 
BE DIMINISHED WITH LACK OF LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY WITH TEMPERATURES 
BEING SEVERELY HAMPERED. WILL KEEP THE THREAT FOR HAIL RUNNING NW-SE 
OVER CENTRAL ZONES AND ALREADY THIS MORNING HAVE GOTTEN TWO PEA SIZE 
REPORTS FROM ONE OR TWO OF THE BETTER CELLS.

POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE SHOULD BE LOCATED ALONG THE WARM FRONT AND IN 
THE SUNNIER AIR THIS AFTERNOON WHERE INSTABILITY WILL BE AT A MAX. 
CELLS SHOULD BE ISOLATED OR WIDELY SCATTERED...BUT BOUNDARIES MIGHT 
PUSH SOME OF THESE INTO THE BAD CATEGORY. MAIN CONCERN HERE IS FROM 
RICHMOND TO DAYTON TO PORTSMOUTH. WILL KEEP MENTION OF POSSIBLE 
LARGE HAIL ALONG THIS LINE AND HEAVY RAIN IN NE 2/3 OF FCST AREA.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS




FXUS61 KILN 150742
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
342 AM EDT TUE MAY 15 2001

07Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICTED A WARM FRONT EXTENDING FROM CENTRAL MN 
SEWD INTO SWRN IN.  KILN 88D ALSO INDICATED AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY 
PUSHING INTO ERN IN AND NRN KY.  IMPRESSIVE MCC OVR MI WAS DROPPING 
INTO FA WITH INCREASING LIGHTNING ACROSS NRN FA.

MODELS PROG SFC BOUNDARY TO PUSH SLOWLY EWD INTO WRN FA TODAY.  THIS 
WL LEAD TO A SHARP TEMP GRADIENT WITH HIGHS IN PARTS OF NRN KY IN 
THE MID 80S AND AROUND 70 IN CENTRAL OH.  THIS BOUNDARY WL CONTINUE 
TO BE THE FOCUS OF SHRA/TSRA TODAY.  SOME TRAINING CAN BE EXPECTED 
SO WL INCLUDE HEAVY RAINFALL MENTION FOR ALL BUT CVG AREA.  WL 
MENTION SVR WITH LARGE HAIL THE MAIN THREAT ALL AREAS BUT SW OF 
KCVG. 

XPCT CVG AREA TO HAVE SOME SUN AND FOR TSRA ACTIVITY TO BUILD SWWD 
DURING PEAK HEATING DUE TO BLOCKING OVER THE NERN STATES.

BOUNDARY WL REMAIN ACROSS FA TONIGHT AND WED SO WL KEEP SHRA/TSRA IN 
THE FCST.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON





713 
FXUS61 KILN 150101
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
900 PM EDT MON MAY 14 2001

ELEVATED CONVECTION NORTH OF WARM FRONT IS WEAKENING...BUT CONTINUES 
TO DROP SOUTH TO SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FA.  ALL THE MODELS DONT HAVE 
QPF AS FAR SOUTHWEST AS IS OCCURRING...BUT INSTEAD WANT TO PUSH THE 
CONVECTION EASTWARD OVERNIGHT.  THIS MIGHT BE TRUE AS WARM FRONT 
MAKES A PUSH EAST.  WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS UNTIL MIDNIGHT IN CENTRAL 
OHIO...THEN TAPER TO CHANCE.  FARTHER WEST...IT LOOKS LIKE CHANCE 
POPS WILL DO.

CURRENT TEMPS LOOK GOOD.

MISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES

712 
FXUS61 KILN 142210
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
605 PM EDT MON MAY 14 2001

AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER NE INDIANA...NW OHIO IS 
SLIDING MOVE SE AND INTO THE FA.  WILL UPDATE ZONES TO MOVE UP 
TIMING OF PRECIP AND TO INCREASE SOME POPS.

MISILN OUT.

SITES







FXUS61 KILN 141851
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EDT MON MAY 14 2001

THANKS TO CLE, IWX, AND RLX FOR COORD...

FAIR AGREEMENT THAT MCS WILL DEVELOP N OF FCST AREA AND TRACK 
SE...JUST A LITTLE NE OF SFC WM FRONT. PROBLEM IS IS THAT MODELS 
SEEM TO BE A LITTLE TOO FAR NE OF FRONT WITH MCS IF YOU LOOK BACK AT 
PREVIOUS RUNS AND LAST NIGHTS MCS. AXIS OF GOOD THETA E AIR JUST TO 
THE EAST OF AN AREA OF INCREASED CAPE SHOULD MOVE SLOWLY E OVERNIGHT 
WITH WMFNT. EXPECT DEVELOPMENT OF MCS BETWEEN MKE AND GRR AND MOVE 
TOWARDS CMH BY MORNING. WILL MENTION HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE...WITH 
LIKELY POPS IN NORTHEAST...TRAILING TO LOW CHANCE POPS IN SOUTHWEST.

MORNING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD DIE DOWN A BIT FOR 
TOMOROW...BUT OUTFLOW FROM MORNINGS SHOWERS COULD MOVE SW AND BLOW 
UP SOME STORMS ALONG THE WM FNT THAT BISECTS CWA FROM WAPAKONETA TO 
PORTSMOUTH. RIGHT NOW...LACK OF A FOCUS IS NOTED ON THE MODELS...AND 
WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS SOUTHWEST WITH MAINLY LATE WORDING 
TOMORROW. SNEAKY WARM TEMPERATURES EXPECTED BEHIND FRONT...WITH SOME 
MID 80S POSSIBLE IN FAR SOUTHWEST TOWARDS LVX. WILL WORD 80 TO 85 
HERE AND QUICKLY TAPER TO HIGHS AROUND 70 IN THE NORTHEAST WITH 
PRECIP COOLED AIR AND CLOUD COVER. FWC NUMBERS DONT LOOK 
UNREASONABLE HERE, BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS 
JUST UNDER AND SOUTHWEST OF THE FRONT...SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE IN THE 
NORTHEAST.

S/W CUTS UNDER RIDGE NEXT NIGHT AND BRINGS EVEN BETTER CHANCE OF 
PRECIP TO FCST AREA...CONCENTRATED ALONG WM FNTL BOUNDARY. 

BASICALLY...WILL KEEP PRECIP CHANCES LOWER SOUTHWEST AND REMAIN 
LIKELY NORTHEAST WITH SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPS IN SOUTHWEST WILL 
BE CLOSER TO AVN GUIDANCE THAN MOS...BUT MOS IS EXPECTED TO BE QUITE 
GOOD IN CMH AREA FOR HIGHS.

MISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS






FXUS61 KILN 141430
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1029 AM EDT MON MAY 14 2001

EXPECT INCREASING CLOUDS FROM THE SOUTHWEST THIS MORNING/EARLY 
AFTERNOON AND ANOTHER MID DECK TO COME IN FROM THE NORTHWEST. 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN WI/IL/IA ARE NOTED IN FAVORABLE AREA OF 
THETA E ADVECTION MAXIMA...WITH CLOUD COVER FOLLOWING CLOSELY WITH 
H7-H3 WIND/HEIGHTS. 

BY 18Z...THETA E MAX PROGGED TO BE BTWN CHI AND MKE WITH WIND FIELD 
PUSHING THICKER CLOUDS OVER DAY AND CVG. CANT RULE OUT A SHOWER IN 
THE NORTHWEST THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THINK THAT CONVECTION WILL REALLY 
START TO SPARK LATE THIS EVENING WITH AN MCS DEVELOPING IN SW MICH. 
CONVECTION LIKELY TO CONTINUE DEVELOPING ALONG PRONOUNCED GRADIENT 
IN WRN 1/2 OF CWA OVERNIGHT. POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING AND POSSIBLY 
LARGE HAIL EXPECTED TO MOVE FROM NW OH TO CENTRAL OH BY MORNING WITH 
THE MOVEMENT OF MCS. 

AS FOR TODAYS FCST, WILL REMOVE MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON WORDING 
AND GO WITH BECOMING CLOUDY WEST AND INCREASING CLOUDS LATE IN THE 
EAST. PREVIOUS 30 AND 20 POPS IN NW GROUP FOR SHOWERS THIS PM LOOKS 
ENTIRELY REASONABLE BUT THINK THAT DEVELOPMENT REALLY WONT START 
UNTIL THE EVENING. WONT TOUCH POPS EITHER UP OR DOWN RIGHT NOW AND 
TEMPERATURES LOOK WELL WITHIN REASON WITH EXPECTED CLOUD COVER. IF 
CLOUDS LAY OFF...MAY HAVE TO UPDATE AROUND NOON OR 1 PM TO RAISE 
TEMPS MAINLY IN THE EAST. 

CHANGES THIS MORNING MORE COSMETIC THAN ANYTHING ELSE.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





FXUS61 KILN 140732
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT MON MAY 14 2001

MID/HIGH LVL MSTR WL INCRS ACRS THE CWFA TDY IN DVLPG WAA PATTERN.  
SFC HIGH...WHICH AT 07Z WAS CENTERED JUST TO OUR EAST...WILL SHIFT 
SLOWLY EAST TODAY AND TNGT ALLOWING A WARM FRONT TO APPROACH.  WL 
INDC INCRSG CLDS ALL ZONES TDY...THIS MORNING WEST AND THIS 
AFTERNOON IN THE EAST.  WAA TDY PRIMARILY WELL ABV THE BL...SO WITH 
MORE CLDS THAN YDAY XPCT ONLY A CPL DEG OF WARMING.  LEANED CLOSER 
TO THE COOLER AVN BASED GUID FOR HIGHS.  WL CONT LOW POPS ONLY IN 
THE NW COUNTIES...WHERE BEST LIFT AND MARGINALLY FAVORABLE PCPN 
EFFICIENCY PROGGED BY 00Z.

BIG CHALLENGE FOR TNGT IS DETERMINING AXIS OF BEST PCPN CVRG IN WHAT 
LOOKS LIKE A DECENT MCS PATTERN.  DPROG/DT OF THE 00Z MODEL RUNS 
SHOW MUCH BETTER RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY WITH THE ETA/AVN WITH 
REGARDS TO SFC FTRS/QPF.  NGM HAS TRENDED TWRD THE FURTHER NE 
ETA/AVN QPF AXIS...BUT STILL SUGGESTS PCPN POTNL FURTHER SW.  
ACTIVITY TNGT IS FIRING ON THE GRADIENT BETWEEN HIGHEST PCPN 
EFFICIENCY OVER CENTRAL ILL-EASTERN IOWA...AND BEST INSTABILITY/LLVL 
FORCING OVER NORTHERN MO.  MODEL QPF FROM ALL GUID IS TOO FAR EAST 
WITH MAX QPF...AND XPCT A SIMILAR SITN TNGT OVER OUR CWFA.  HV CONTD 
PREV FCST TREND OF HIGH POPS TNGT...AND MNTN OF LOCALLY +RA OVER ALL 
BUT THE SE.  NOT AS MUCH ELEVATED INSTABILITY TNGT AS WHATS DRIVING 
CURRENT ACTIVITY TO THE WEST...BUT ENUF TO SUPPORT AT LEAST A FEW 
HAILERS.  GUID TEMPS IN GD AGREEMENT AND STAYED CLOSE.

ETA/AVN INDC FRONT WL BCM QUASI-STATIONARY BETWEEN CVG-CMH ON 
TUESDAY.  MESOSCALE EFFECTS FROM TNGTS CONVECTION WL BE CRITICAL FOR 
ACTUAL BNDRY POSN...AND WUD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE IT SLIGHTLY 
FURTHER SOUTH.  AT ANY RATE...INSOLATION AND POOLING MSTR (ETA LKS 
OVERDONE AGAIN) WL CREATE A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS IN THE VCNTY 
OF THE BNDRY.  WIND FIELDS SUGGEST GD ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE POTNL... 
SO CUD BE A BUSY AFTN.  HV KEPT POPS IN THE LIKELY RANGE ALL ZONES.  
TYPICALLY COOL META PROGGING SFC TEMPS IN THE U80S SW...RANGING TO 
NR 70 NE.  WL PLAY IT CONSERVATIVE FOR NOW WITH ARND 80 SW...AND 
STICK CLOSE TO THE FWC NUMBERS ELSW.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE







626 
FXUS61 KILN 131904
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EDT SUN MAY 13 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER REGION.  
SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES WAA CLOUDS TO OUR WEST OVER IL/MO WITH 
EMBEDDED CONVECTION OVER MO.

MODELS INITIALIZED WELL AND ARE IN RELATIVE AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE 
PICTURE.  DPROG/DT INDICATES ON A REGIONAL SCALE THAT WARM FRONT/WAA 
IS A BIT SLOWER WITH EACH OF THE PAST THREE RUNS ON BOTH THE ETA AND 
AVN.  THE AVN ALSO HAS BEEN GETTING STRONGER WITH WAVE OVER THE 
UPPER MS VLY MONDAY NIGHT WHICH HAS RESULTED IN AN OPEN WAVE IN THE 
500 MB PATTERN.

FORECAST IS TRICKY AND IT ALL EVOLVES AROUND THE WARM FRONT TO OUR 
WEST.  WARM FRONT WILL LIKELY HAVE SOME CONVECTION ALONG IT 
TOMORROW...WHICH WILL THROW BLOW OFF INTO WESTERN FA AROUND NOON ON 
MONDAY.  THIS WILL IMPEDE HIGH TEMPERATURES.  AVN IS MORE AGGRESSIVE 
THAN ETA OR NGM IN DEVELOPING CONVECTION OVER NRN IN/SRN MI MONDAY 
AFTERNOON.  NOT CONVINCED THIS WILL HAPPEN BUT WILL NOT RULE IT 
OUT.  IT SEEMS TO ME THAT MODEL QPF IS TO FAR TO THE EAST.  LOOKING 
AT PROGGED INSTABILITY...CINH...850 JET/CONVERGENCE AND 250 
JET/CONVERGENCE IT SEEMS TO BE POINTING CLOSER TO THE WARM FRONT 
OVER INDIANA/WESTERN OHIO.  CONVECTION MAY DEVELOP OVER FA MONDAY 
NIGHT OR ROLE DOWN INTO FA FROM THE NORTH AS INITIATION NEAR THE TOP 
OF THE RIDGE DIVES SOUTHWARD WITH THE THICKNESS PATTERN.  AGREE WITH 
SPC SLIGHT RISK...ALTHOUGH ITS NOT SURE THING...BUT THINK RISK 
MIGHT BE A BIT FARTHER TO THE WEST.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES WILL UNDERCUT DAY/WAPAK ON MONDAY AS MID LEVEL 
DEBRIS CLOUDS SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES AROUND 70 OR LOWER.  WILL 
BUMP UP CVG MONDAY NIGHT AS POOLING NEAR THE COLD SHOULD KEEP THEM 
IN THE UPPER 50S.

THANKS TO IWX AND CLE FOR COOR.  MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON







FXUS61 KILN 131338
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
937 AM EDT SUN MAY 13 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE TO OUR WEST WITH LIGHT 
NORTHEASTERLY FLOW.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS CLEAR SKIES OVER FA 
WITH SOME VALLEY FOG IN THE SCIOTO AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS.  06Z 
MESOETA AND MORNING ILN SOUNDING SUGGEST CURRENT HIGH TEMPS LOOK 
GOOD.  MORNING SOUNDING AND PROGGED MESOETA SOUNDING OFF BUFKIT 
SUGGEST FEW-SCT CU THIS AFTERNOON THUS MOSTLY SUNNY WORDING LOOKS 
GOOD.

WILL UPDATE CMH AND CVG ZONE GROUPS AROUND 945 AM.  CMH GROUP TO 
REMOVE MORNING FOG AND CVG GROUP TO OPEN UP RANGE TO 65 TO 70.  OWEN 
COUNTY WILL LIKELY BE NEAR 70 WHILE LOCALS NORTH OF CVG WILL BE 
CLOSER TO MID 60S.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

FXUS61 KILN 130733
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT SUN MAY 13 2001

RIDGING AT THE SFC/ALOFT WL DOMINATE OUR WX THE FIRST CPL FCST PDS.  
FOR TDY...SHUD SEE AT LEAST A FEW CU DVLP WITH LINGERING LLVL MSTR AND 
STEEP LAPSE RATES.  ALSO XPCT A FEW PATCHES OF CI...SO WL INDC MSNY 
VS SUNNY FOR SKY COND.  LLVL TEMP PROFILE JUST ABOUT THE SAME AS 
YDAY...IF ANYTHING A LITTLE COLDER AT H8.  WITH NR FULL SUN HWVR 
SHUD BE ABLE TO REACH OR SLIGHTLY EXCEED YDAYS HIGHS...IN LINE WITH 
THE NEW FWC NUMBERS.  FOR TNGT...MODELS BRING A PATCH OF HIER MID 
LVL RH ACRS FROM THE NW IN THE DVLPG WAA PATTERN.  CLOUDS FAIRLY 
WIDESPRD UPSTREAM OVER WI/NORTHERN MI BUT XPCT A GRADUAL THINNING 
HEADING SE.  WL CHG FROM CLR TO MCLR ALL ZONES TNGT.  FOR TEMPS...HV 
LEANED CLOSER TO THE WARMER META SFC TEMPS WHICH HV BEEN DOING 
FAIRLY WELL AT NIGHT LATELY.

XPCT A LITTLE MORE WIDEPSREAD CLOUDINESS IN THE STRENGTHENING WAA 
PATTERN MONDAY...ESPLY OVER THE NORTH AND WEST.  PDEFS IN THE 
295-305K LAYER DROP STEADILY THRU THE DAY...AND ARE LOW ENUF LATE TO 
JUSTIFY CONTG LOW POPS IN THE N AND W ZONES.  BEST CHC FOR PCPN LKS 
TO BE MON NGT INTO TUE...BUT WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHC RANGE FOR 
NOW.  MAV TEMPS ACTUALLY RUNNING COOLER THAN THE FWC MON AFTN.  HV 
LEANED CLOSER TO THE WARMER FWC NUMBERS AS AIRMASS WUD SUPPORT QUITE 
WARM READINGS WITH JUST A LITTLE SUNSHINE.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

FXUS61 KILN 130153
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 PM EDT SAT MAY 12 2001

STRATO CU HAS DISSIPATED WITH SUNSET AND AREA OF AC IS PULLING 
EAST.  THAT WILL LEAVE JUST SOME CIRRUS THIS IS DROPPING S ACROSS 
LAKE MI TO AFFECT THE REGION OVERNIGHT.

BIGGEST CONCERN IS LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT.  MID TO UPPER 30 
DEWPOINTS ARE JUST TO OUR NORTH AND WEST...BUT THE DEWPOINTS ACROSS 
THE FA ARE HOLDING UP.  MESOETA SURFACE TEMPERATURES ARE SHOWING 
THAT THE AREA WOULD STAY IN THE 40S OVERNIGHT...BUT LOOKING AT ITS 
SURFACE DEWPOINTS...IT WAS PUSHING A NOSE OF 50 DEWPOINTS INTO THE 
FA AT 00Z...WHICH DIDNT VERIFY...SO DONT KNOW HOW MUCH TO BELIEVE 
IT.

WITH THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE STILL HANGING AROUND FROM YESTERDAYS 
RAINS...DONT FEEL THAT THE DEWPOINTS WILL FALL TOO FAR. LAMP HAD A 
GOOD HANDLE ON CURRENT TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS AT 23Z...AND AS 
FORECASTING LOWS NEAR 40.  WILL ONLY LOWER SOUTH CENTRAL OH/NE KY TO 
THE LOWER 40S.

WILL TWEAK WINDS DOWN TO LIGHT NORTH.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES

.ILN...NONE.



FXUS61 KILN 121845
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 AM EDT SAT MAY 12 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER MS 
VLY...WHICH IS KEEPING COOL NORTHERLY FLOW OFF THE GREAT LAKES OVER 
FA.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING SCT-BKN CLOUDS OVER FA.

MODELS ARE ALL IN DESCENT AGREEMENT WITH BUILDING HIGH PRESSURE INTO 
INDIANA AND OHIO OVERNIGHT.  RIDGE OF CALM WINDS SHOULD REMAIN JUST 
TO THE WEST AND NORTH OF FA...WHICH WILL KEEP A LIGHT GRADIENT OVER 
FA.  THE BIG QUESTION IS...WILL IT FROST OF FOG TONIGHT?  TDS WILL 
STAY UP IN THE LOWER 40S OVERNIGHT WITH POSSIBLY A FEW UPPER 30S 
ACROSS THE NORTH.  HOWEVER...GROUND IS STILL WET/DAMP FROM HALF INCH 
TO TWO INCH RAINFALL LAST NIGHT.  WIND SPEEDS WILL LIKELY BE THE 
CRITICAL FACTOR IN FOG FORMATION.  BELIEVE COMBINATION OF LIGHT 
GRADIENT...WET/DAMP GROUND AND TDS FALLING TO AROUND 40 WILL MAKE 
THIS MORE OF A FOG NIGHT THAN A FROST NIGHT.  EVENING SHIFT WILL 
HAVE TO MONITOR.

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL AN IMPRESSIVE WARM FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON.  THERE ARE SEVERAL THINGS THAT 
CONCERN ME ABOUT THIS WARM FRONT.  1) OVER THE UPPER MS VLY/SOUTHERN 
CANADA ON SUNDAY NIGHT IT APPEARS CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP FROM A 
RIDGE RIDER.  THICKNESS PATTERN WOULD PUSH IT DUE SOUTH.  2) BETWEEN 
18Z MONDAY AND 00Z TUESDAY THE WARM SECTOR GETS VERY UNSTABLE WITH 
2000 TO 3000 J/KG.  THE WARM SECTOR APPEARS TO BE CAPPED.  3)  THE 
VORT MAX MOVING SOUTHWARD IN THE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW INTENSIFIES IN 
THE AFTERNOON.  IS THIS CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK?  GUT FEEL IS THAT 
CONVECTION WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL EVENING AND THEN FA WILL STAY IN THE 
FOCUS THROUGH TUESDAY.  HOWEVER...THERE ARE ENOUGH QUESTION MARKS TO 
THROUGH IN A 30 POP LATE ON MONDAY IN THE WEST.     

THANKS TO IWX AND CLE FOR COOR.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON





AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
935 AM EDT SAT MAY 12 2001

WL UPDATE BY 945 AM TO REMOVE PRECIP WORDING IN CENTRAL ZONE GROUP 
AND TO OPEN UP TEMPERATURES RANGE FOR THE BOTH DAY/CMH ZONE GROUP TO 
60 TO 65.

RADAR AND SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING VORT INDUCED PRECIPITATION TO 
THE NORTH AND EAST OF FA MOVING EAST.  CLEARING FROM THE WEST IS 
WORKING IN WITH A FEW PATCHES OF SC EVIDENT IN OVER EASTERN 
MI...WESTERN OHIO AND EASTERN IN.  CLOUD COVER IS A TOUGH CALL 
TODAY.  CAA OF THE GREAT LAKES USUALLY MEANS PLENTY OF CU.  HOWEVER 
THIS TIME OF YEAR THE SUN HAS A TENDENCY TO MIX OUT THE BOUNDARY 
LAYER.  WILL KEEP CURRENT CLOUD FORECAST GOING FOR NOW AND MONITOR 
FOR POSSIBLE UPDATES.  06Z MESOETA INDICATES A BIT OF SPREAD ACROSS 
CENTRAL OHIO/EASTERN INDIANA MIGHT WORK OUT BETTER AS GRADIENT WILL 
BE TIGHTER THAN USUAL WITH 60 EXPECTED NORTH OF DAY/CMH AND MID 60S 
SOUTH.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 120746
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EDT SAT MAY 12 2001

COLD FRONT IN THE VCNTY OF INTERTSTATE 71 ACRS OUR CWFA AT 07Z.  
BNDRY SLOWED A BIT IN RESPONSE TO WELL DEFINED SHORT WAVE TO OUR 
NW...BUT APPEARS TO BE MAKING PROGRESS ONCE AGAIN.  WL NEED TO CARRY 
LEFTOVER WX ERLY THIS MORNING FOR SHRA IN THE SE ALONG THE 
FRONT...AS WELL AS FROM DAY-NORTH IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE TAIL OF 
THE AFOREMENTIONED WAVE.  IN CENTRAL OHIO WL CARRY SLGT CHC POPS 
THRU MID-MORNING.  SUBSIDENCE BEHIND SHORT WAVE SHUD ALLOW A RATHER 
QUICK CLEARING...BUT THIS WL BE TEMPERED BY PLENTY OF MSTR IN THE BL 
AND ROBUST CAA IN THE H8-H9 LAYER.  WL TREND TWRD PCLDY ALL ZONES 
TDY.  SFC TRAJECTORIES TODAY ORIGINATING FROM DUE NORTH...GENERALY 
OVER NORTHERN LWR MI.  AFTN TEMPS THERE YDAY WERE U40S-M50S...BUT 
OBVIOUSLY LAKES CONTRIBUTED TO COOLER READINGS. LLVL THICKNESS 
AND 850 TEMP TECHNIQUES FROM THE ETA SUGGEST READINGS 1-2 CATS 
COOLER THAN THE STATISTICAL GUIDANCE...BUT WITH SUCH A WARM START WL 
ONLY MAKE MINOR DOWNWARD ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FWC.

SFC RIDGE BUILDS IN TNGT...WITH GOOD RADIATIONAL CONDS UNDER MCLR 
SKIES.  GUID TEMPS IN GOOD AGREEMENT...BUT THE TYPICALLY COOLER META 
SFC TEMPS RUNNING ABOUT A CAT WARMER.  HV STAYED CLOSE TO THE MOS 
GUIDANCE.  LKS LIKE COOL ENUF READINGS FOR PATCHY FROST IN THE 
NORTH...WHERE WL INCLUDE MENTION IN ZONES.  SAW PLENTY OF FOG A FEW 
NIGHTS AGO 18-24 HOURS AFTER WIDESPREAD RAIN...AND THIS MAY BE OF 
CONCERN AGAIN TNGT.  WL OMIT MENTION NOW AS SHUD SEE A BIT BETTER 
DRYING TDY...AND MIXING WL BE FAIRLY GD ERLY TNGT.  FOR 
SUNDAY...1000-850 LAYER ACTUALLY PROGGED TO BE A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
TDY BUT XPCT MORE SUN.  GENERALLY SHAVED A DEG OR 2 OFF THE FWC.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS TROF ENTERING GREAT LAKES WITH RIDGE ALONG

SFC MAP HAS COLD FRONT THROUGH NORTHWEST OHIO.  TSRA ARE OCCURRING 
IN TWO BANDS...ONE NEAR OUR SOUTHERN FRINGE AND ANOTHER AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT IN OUR NORTHWEST COUNTIES. PLENTY OF LEFTOVER INSTABILITY IS 
KEEPING TSRA GOING.  ILL KEEP MENTION OF SHRA/TSRA IN ALL 
ZONES...THOUGH ILL DECREASE TO SCT POPS IN NORTHWEST COUNTIES WHERE 
ACTIVITY WINDING DOWN.  OTHERWISE...WIND DIRECTION NEEDS ADJUSTMENT 
WITH FROPA/WSHFT.

FXUS61 KILN 111910
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 PM EDT FRI MAY 11 2001

CAP IS FINALLY BREAKING OVER CWA AND CONVECTION FORMING ALONG WEAK 
CONVERGENT BOUNDARIES AT SFC CAUSED BY DIFFERENTIAL HEATING AND 
POSSIBLY SOME LEFTOVER OUTFLOWS FROM LAST NIGHTS STORMS IN THE 
MIDWEST. 

MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT THOUGH A ETA HOLDING BACK ON THE ACTUAL 
FRONT A LITTLE BETTER THAN NGM/AVN. REGARDLESS...FROPA DURING THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS FROM NW-SE AND DID NOT TRY TO GET FANCY WITH POPS 
TONIGHT. WENT 70-80 ACROSS THE BOARD AND COULD SEE AN ISOLATED CASE 
OF SEVERE THIS PM WITH DOWNBURST WINDS AND POSSIBLY HAIL. MOST 
MODELS INDICATING SPLIT DYNAMICS OVER FCST AREA WITH A GOOD SHOT TO 
THE NORTH WITH DECENT S/W ALONG H5 TROF. ANOTHER SHOT TO SOUTHWEST 
COMBINES A WEAKER S/W WITH LLVL CONVERGENCE AS SFC FRONT GETS BUTTED 
UP AGAINST RIDGE OVER WESTERN APPALACHIANS. 

WAS CONCERNED ABOUT LACK OF QPF NOTED IN CVG/DAY AREA FROM MESOETA 
OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...AND STILL FEEL THAT THE BEST CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION HERE IS GOING TO BE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING WITH 
HEATING. SOME SHOWERS EXPECTED WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE DURING THE 
NIGHT...BUT THUNDER SHOULD BE SEVERELY HAMPERED ACROSS MUCH OF FCST 
AREA WITH SETTING OF THE SUN. 

STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON TEMPS AND KEPT A SILENT 10/20 POP IN THE 
EAST TOMORROW MORNING.

EXPECT SOME CU TOMORROW...MAINLY NORTH AND EAST, WITH DAYTIME HIGHS 
TO THE LOW AND MID 60S. AM WITHIN A CATEGORY OF MOS BUT UNDERCUT BY 
A DEGREE OR TWO FOR FIRST FEW PERIODS.

MISILN ALREADY OUT AND ZONES TO COME BY 3:30.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1013 AM EDT FRI MAY 11 2001

WILL UPDATE THE FCST TO REMOVE MORNING/AFTERNOON WORDING DEALING 
WITH THUNDERSTORM POSSIBILITY. 40KT H8 JET AHEAD OF FRONT THIS 
MORNING REALLY LOSES ITS PUNCH AND BEST UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE 
OCCURS SW-NE OVER FCST AREA AT 0Z ACCORDING TO MESOETA. 

EXPECT CONVECTION TO BEGIN FOR MOST OF FCST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH 
DAYTIME HEATING. AVN HOLDS ON TO AN AXIS OF NEG LIS IN THE 
SOUTHEAST THROUGH 6Z THOUGH ETA AND NGM DROP BEST LIS AFTER DAYTIME 
HEATING. EXPECT THUNDERSTORMS TO PERSIST INTO THE EVENING AND 
OVERNIGHT...BUT LOSE THE BEST PUNCH WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEATING. 

LITTLE SHEAR TO NOTE WITH THUNDER THIS AFTERNOON AND POSSIBILITY OF 
SVR SHOULD REMAIN FAIRLY ISOLATED. 

TEMPS LOOK OKAY...BUT WILL BUMP A CATEGORY IN THE NORTHWEST TO GO 
MID 70S AS 70 TO 75 CURRENTLY IN ZONES IS ALREADY BEING APPROACHED 
AS OF 10 AM UNDER PTCY VS MOCY SKIES.

FXUS61 KILN 110747
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EDT FRI MAY 11 2001

VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE EVIDENT ON W/V IMAGERY OVER EASTERN ND THIS 
MORNING WL DIG SE TWRD THE CWFA TDY...AND DRIVE FAIRLY STRONG COLD 
FRONT THRU THE RGN THIS EVE/OVERNIGHT.  

LINE OF SHRA/FEW TSRA HAS MADE GD PROGRESS INTO NW INDIANA THIS 
MORNING... ALONG WELL DEFINED OUTFLOW FROM YDAY EVES CONVECTION 
UPSTREAM.  EXPECT THIS LINE TO GRADUALLY WEAKEN PUSHING EAST INTO 
DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR...AND ALSO AWAY FROM MORE FAVORABLE UPPER 
SUPPORT.  STILL CUD REACH NW SXNS BEFORE DISSIPATING...WHERE WL NEED 
POPS ALL DAY.  OTHW OUTFLOW REMNANTS WL LIKELY PROVIDE NICE FOCUS 
FOR DIRUNAL CONVECTION LATER TDY...ESPLY N AND W.  WL TAPER POPS 
FROM CAT NW... TO CHC SE.  BEST WIND FIELDS AND FORCING FOR LIFT 
DONT AFFECT OUR REGION UNTIL AFTER PEAK HEATING...BUT STILL CUD SEE 
SOME ACTIVE CONVECTION THIS AFTN.  ETA PROBABLY OVERDONE AGAIN WITH 
M-U60S DWPTS...BUT STILL SHUD SEE CAPES AOA 1500 AND ENUF OF A 
FAVORABLE WIND FIELD FOR SOME ORGANIZATION.  WL HIGHLIGHT SLIGHT 
RISK OF SVR VIA SPS.  CLOUD CVR UNCERTAINTY MAKES FOR A TRICKY TEMP 
FCST TDY.  INITIAL INCLINATION WAS TO UNDERCUT GUIDANCE...BUT WITH 
CIRRUS CONTG TO WARM/THIN HV STUCK CLOSE TO FWC/FAN NUMBERS.

STRONG/DEEP FORCING FOR LIFT MVS ACRS THE CWFA OVERNIGHT... 
COINCIDENT WITH AXIS OF HIGH PCPN EFFICIENCY.  WL FCST CAT POPS OVER 
ALL BUT THE SE.  MUCH COOLER AIR WL BE DRIVEN SOUTH BEHIND 
FRONT...AND LOOKING AT UPSTRAM TEMPS THE COOLER AVN BASED GUID LKS A 
LITTLE BETTER THAN THE WARMER FWC/META SFC TEMPS.  EASTERN COUNTIES 
WL STILL BE AHEAD OF VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE SAT MORNING...ALTHOUGH DEEP 
MSTR WL HV PULLED EAST.  WL HOLD ONTO LOW CHC POPS ERLY...OTHW PCLDY 
ALL ZONES WITH A FAIR AMNT OF CU POTNL.  GUID TEMPS IN GD AGREEMENT 
AND WL NOT STRAY MUCH.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

FAVORABLE WIND FIELD FOR SOME ORGANIZATION.  WL HIGHLIGHT SLIGHT 
RISK OF SVR VIA SPS.  CLOUD CVR UNCERTAINTY MAKES FOR A TRICKY TEMP 
FCST TDY.  INITIAL INCLINATION WAS TO UNDERCUT GUIDANCE...BUT WITH 
CIRRUS CONTG TO WARM/THIN HV STUCK CLOSE TO FWC/FAN NUMBERS.

STRONG/DEEP FORCING FOR LIFT MVS ACRS THE CWFA OVERNIGHT... 
COINCIDENT WITH AXIS OF HIGH PCPN EFFICIENCY.  WL FCST CAT POPS OVER 
ALL BUT THE SE.  MUCH COOLER AIR WL BE DRIVEN SOUTH BEHIND 
FRONT...AND LOOKING AT UPSTRAM TEMPS THE COOLER AVN BASED GUID LKS A 
LITTLE BETTER THAN THE WARMER FWC/META SFC TEMPS.  EASTERN COUNTIES 
WL STILL BE AHEAD OF VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE SAT MORNING...ALTHOUGH DEEP 
MSTR WL HV PULLED EAST.  WL HOLD ONTO LOW CHC POPS ERLY...OTHW PCLDY 
ALL ZONES WITH A FAIR AMNT OF CU POTNL.  GUID TEMPS IN GD AGREEMENT 
AND WL NOT STRAY MUCH.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE





691 
FXUS61 KILN 110106
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
907 PM EDT THU MAY 10 2001

H5 RIDGE OVER UPPER OHIO VALLEY IS FLATTENING AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
MOVES IN FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS.  SFC MAP SHOWS HIGH OFF THE SOUTH 
CAROLINA COAST AND LOW OVER IOWA...WITH WARM SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER OUR 
REGION.  TSRA ARE OCCURRING IN PVA AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE OUT 
AHEAD OF THE LOW FROM SOUTHERN MICHIGAN TO EASTERN ILLINOIS.

SATELLITE SHOWS HIGH CLOUDS SPILLING SOUTHEAST FROM TSRA INTO OUR 
AREA.  CLOUDS ARE MORE PREVALENT THAN 18Z MESOETA INDICATED.  ILL 
UPDATE TO PARTLY CLOUDY INSTEAD OF MOSTLY CLEAR.  ILL CONTINUE TO 
MONITOR PROGRESS OF TSRA AS THEY ARE WELL EAST OF MODEL QPFS.  

WIND DIRECTION NEEDS ADJUSTMENT TO SOUTH. LOW TEMP FCST IN UPPER 50S 
TO 60 LOOKS GOOD SO NO OTHER CHANGES ARE NEEDED.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
154 PM EDT THU MAY 10 2001

H5 RIDGE ALONG APPALACHIANS EXPECTED TO GET KICKED OUT TO THE ATLANTIC 
WITH DEEPENING H5 TROF OVER THE GTLKS TOMORROW NIGHT. AS TROF DEEPENS, 
SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY SHOULD FIRE AHEAD OF A SFC LOW THAT IS 
PROGGED TO PASS OVER FCST AREA OVERNIGHT FRIDAY.

MODELS ARE IN FAIR AGREEMENT AND BETWEN 5 OF THEM THROUGH 5 PERIODS ARE 
ONLY SHOWING A 4 OR 5 DEGREE DIFFERENCE ON BOTH HIGHS AND LOWS. WILL 
NOT STRAY BY MORE THAN A DEGREE OR TWO FROM MOS GUIDANCE HERE IN ANY 
PERIOD OF THE SHORT TERM. 

MODEL GURUS AT NCEP FAVORING AVN FOR LATER PERIODS WITH A SLOWER 
SOLUTION. THIS SHOULDNT CHANGE MUCH FOR TIMING OF PRECIP OVER CWA. 
RAIN SHOULD FINISH UP BY SATURDAY MORNING FOR ALL BUT POSSIBLY THE 
SOUTHEASTERN PORTION OF CWA...WILL REMOVE MENTION OF MORNING SHOWERS 
FOR REST OF FCST AREA BUT LEAVE LOW CHANCE POPS IN EARLY ON SATURDAY 
FOR PORTSMOUTH GROUP. PRECIP SHOULD TURN OFF AROUND MIDNIGHT IN THE 
NORTHWEST...AND CHALLENGE WITH THE RAIN COMING IN IS A START TIME FOR 
THE SOUTHEAST. RIGHT NOW I THINK THAT THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY DURING THE AFTERNOON TO INCLUDE CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS, 
WHICH IS IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST. 

MISILN OUT EVENTUALLY.

.ILN...NONE.

655 
FXUS61 KILN 100644
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 AM EDT THU MAY 10 2001

SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER SE MN.  A COLD FRONT 
EXTENDED FROM THIS LOW INTO NRN NEB.  A WARM FRONT EXTENDED EAST 
OVER THE U. P. OF MI.

IR SATELLITE WAS SHOWING AN INCREASE IN HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS INTO THE 
REGION.  THE HIGH CLOUDS WERE THE RESULT OF CONVECTION ACRS THE UPR 
AND MIDDLE MS VLY.  CIRRUS SHOULD THIN AS IT MOVES SOUTH AND EAST 
TODAY.  WITH SOME 850 MB MSTR...SOME AFTN CUMULUS CLOUDS ARE 
EXPECTED.  FOR NOW...WILL GO PARTLY SUNNY WEST AND MOSTLY SUNNY 
EAST.  

PREFER THE MESO ETA FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FCST PD THROUGH 
SATURDAY MORNING.  THIS MODEL SEEMS TO BE HINTING AT AN OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARY PUSHING SOUTH AND EAST INTO LOWER MICHIGAN...NRN INDIANA 
AND IL.  SPC SEEMS TO BE BUYING INTO THIS...AND THIS IS REASONABLE 
GIVEN CONVECTION THAT HAS OCCURRED OVERNIGHT.  IF THIS IS THE 
CASE...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD DEVELOP LATE IN THE 
AFTN/EVENING ACRS THE AFOREMENTIONED REGION.  WILL NOT PLACE PCPN IN 
FAR NW ZONE TONIGHT...BUT DAYSHIFT WILL HAVE TO MONITOR IF ANY 
CONVECTION STRAYS A LITTLE FARTHER SE INTO THE REGION.  WITH 
CONVECTION...CIRRUS BLOW OFF IS EXPECTED.  AS A RESULT...I PLAN ON A 
PARTLY CLOUDY FCST TONIGHT.

ON FRIDAY...THE COLD FRONT ACRS THE UPR MS VLY INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS 
WILL CONTINUE SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE OHIO VLY. S/WV ENERGY IN THE FAST 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL GIVE IT THE NECESSARY PUSH.  BY FRIDAY 
NIGHT...UPR LVL FLOW BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED.  SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BREAK OUT FRIDAY AFTN ACRS THE FAR NW AS THE COLD 
FRONT SAGS SOUTHEAST.  I PLAN TO PLACE HIGHEST POPS FAR NW TO LOWEST 
SE FOR FRIDAY AFTN.  BY FRIDAY NIGHT...THE FCST AREA WILL BE UNDER 
THE FAVORABLE RR QUAD OF THE ENTRANCE REGION OF 250 MB JET.  THIS 
UPR DIVERGENCE COMBINED WITH INCREASING DEWPOINTS INTO THE LOWER TO 
MID 60S AND SFC CONVERGENCE WITH FRONT SHOULD PRODUCE A MORE 
EXPANSIVE AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY NIGHT.  WILL GO 
LIKELY FRIDAY NIGHT..EXCEPT FAR NW WHERE THE COLD FRONT WILL 
HAVE PASSED SOUTH AND EAST.
 
MOS TEMPS LOOK GOOD SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FAST WEST TO EAST ZONAL FLO PTN WITH WK S/WV MOVG THRU GRTLKS. THIS

FOR TONIGHT...SOME THIN HI LVL DEBRIS CLDS FROM TSTMS OVR UPR MS VLY
MAY DRIFT INTO OH VLY. WL CONT MSTLY CLR SKY COND FCST. STAYED CLOSE
TO GUID TEMPS TNGT ONLY CUT A DEG OR TWO FM FWC VALUES.

MID LVL RDGG BLDS INTO SRN OH ON THU. XPCT TO SEE SOME CU BUT CONDS 
SHUD BE MSTLY SUNNY. IN CONTD WAA PTN XPCT HI/S TO BE ABT ONE CAT
WRMR THAN TDA/S VALUES. H8 TEMP AND LO LVL THICKNESS TECHNIQUES SUGG
HI/S NR 80 N AND LWR 80S S ON THU. AGN GUID APPEARS CLOSE HERE.

S/WV TO TRACK E FM NRN PLNS INTO GRTLKS ON FRI. ASSOCIATED CDFNT 
TO DROP SE INTO OH DURG AFTN. ETA HS TRENDED A LTL LESS AMPLIFED
AND A LTL FASTER. THIS APPEARS REASONABLE GIVEN FAST ZONAL FLO.
INSTBY INCREASES TO 1000-1500 J/KG WITH FAVORED UPR DIV/LO LVL CNVRGC
COUPLET INTO W CNRL OH DURG AFTN. FOLLOWING SOLN CLOSER TO ETA...WL 
PLACE 50 PERCENT POPS IN NRN MIAMI VLY...40 POPS AFTN IN DAY AND 30 
POPS LATE IN CVG AND CMH. WL LEAVE PMH ZONE DRY UNTIL FRI EVE.  IN 
WAA AHD OF CDFNT XPCT HI TEMPS FRI TO BE SVRL DEGS WRMR THAN FWC.


.ILN...NONE.

CU FIELD SHUD THIN AND DISPT THRU LT AFTN. WL WORK THESE AREAS BCMG
MSTLY SUNNY.

AC. THIS AC FM NRN IL THRU NRN OH HS SHWN NORMAL DIURNAL EROSION
AND ONLY XPCT SCTD TO FW AC TO DRIFT ACRS NRN SECTIONS TDA.

ENERGY BLOCK HI TEMP METHOD APPLIED TO 12Z ILN SOUNDING YIELDS 
A HI ARND 75. ADJUSTING FOR WK WAA XPCT HI/S IN THE UPPER 70S.
CURR FCST HS GOOD HANDLE ON TEMPS.  

FOR TONIGHT...XPCT ANY CU THAT DVLPS TO QUICKLY DISPT WITH LOSS
OF DAYTIME HTG. SOME THIN CI PSBL IN THE FORM OF BLO OFF DEBRIS
FROM TSTM OVR UPR MS VLY. WL CONT MSTLY CLR SKY COND FCST.

013 
FXUS61 KILN 090633
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 AM EDT WED MAY 9 2001

FIRST FCST PROBLEM IS THE PREVALENCE OF FOG ACRS PARTS OF THE ERN 
CWFA.

SFC HIGH PRESSURE NEAR RLX WAS PROVIDING FOR A WEAK WIND FLOW ACRS 
THE REGION.  11.9-3.9 MICRON SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATED THAT 
STRATUS/FOG WAS EXPANDING OVER THE ERN CWFA.  BASED ON SFC 
OBSERVATIONS AND SOME CALLS TO LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES...WILL 
ISSUE A DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THIS AREA.

FOR THE REST OF TODAY...A WEAK S/WV WAS NOTED ON WATER VAPOR ACRS 
INDIANA/MICHIGAN.  THIS S/WV WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR MID CLOUDS...WHICH 
SHOULD PUSH INTO THE DAYTON/WAPAKONETA LOCATIONS BY MORNING.  AS A 
RESULT...WILL GO PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THE MORNING HOURS HERE AND MOSTLY 
SUNNY BY AFTN (AS MID CLOUDS SHIFT FARTHER EAST AND PERHAPS 
DISSIPATE WITH SOME INSOLATION).  FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
REGION...MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ARE EXPECTED AS SFC HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES.  

FOR TONIGHT...SOME CIRRUS MAY BLOW DOWN INTO THE AREA FROM 
CONVECTION ACRS THE UPR MS VLY.  HOWEVER...THE CLOUDS SHOULD BE 
THIN...AND THUS...MOSTLY CLEAR WILL SUFFICE.  

ON THURSDAY...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE WESTERN 
GREAT LAKES.  WITH A WEAK S/WV RIDGE ALOFT...THE REGION WILL HAVE 
ONE MORE DAY OF MOSTLY SUNNY WEATHER.

MOS TEMPS LOOK HARD TO BEAT...SO WILL ONLY TWEAK A DEGREE OR TWO.



.ILN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EDT FOR
       KYZ098>100
       OHZ056-064-065-073-074-081-082-088

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 081045
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
645 AM EDT TUE MAY 8 2001

LATEST RADAR AND SFC OBSERVATIONS HAVE SHOWN THAT THE COLD FRONT HAS 
JUST GONE THROUGH DAYTON AND WILL SOON PASS THROUGH CINCINNATI.  I 
WILL MAKE AN UPDATE SOON TO BREAK OFF THE FAR WESTERN ZONES AS THE 
RAIN HAS COME TO AN END.

.ILN...NONE. 

HICKMAN












867 
FXUS61 KILN 080606
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
205 AM PM EDT TUE MAY 8 2001

WATER VAPOR INDICATED A MID LEVEL RIDGE STILL HOLDING STRONG OFF THE 
EASTERN CST OF THE UNITED STATES.  HOWEVER...THIS WILL BEGIN TO 
BREAK DOWN AS A MID LVL TROUGH ACRS THE CENTRAL SECTION OF THE 
UNITED STATES BEGINS TO PUSH/DIG SOUTH AND EAST.

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS AND RADAR MOSAIC INDICATE THAT A SFC COLD FRONT 
EXTENDS FROM WEST OF DETROIT...SOUTHWEST TO JUST EAST OF 
INDIANAPOLIS...THEN JUST EAST OF EVANSVILLE.  THE COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE SLOWLY THROUGH THE CWFA DURING THE MORNING/EARLY AFTN HOURS.  
CURRENT ESTIMATES (AND ALSO CLOSE TO THE 00Z MESO ETA) BRINGS THE 
FRONT THROUGH DAYTON JUST BEFORE 8 AM EDT...COLUMBUS AROUND NOON 
EDT...AND JUST EAST OF NEWARK BY 2 PM EDT.  AS IS USUALLY THE 
CASE...THE NRN END OF THE FRONT IS MOVING FASTER THAN THE SRN 
END...SO LOCATIONS SOUTH OF THE AFOREMENTIONED CITIES (LIKE CVG) CAN 
EXPECT FRONTAL PASSAGE ABOUT AN HOUR OR SO LATER.  ILN RADAR WAS 
SHOWING QUITE A BIT OF SHOWER ACTIVITY ACRS THE WRN CWFA AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE EAST.  WITH EXPECTED 
TIMING...SHOWERS(AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM DUE TO MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY) WILL END DURING THE MORNING HOURS WEST...AROUND NOON 
CENTRAL (CMH AND PMH) AND THE FAR ERN SECTION BY EARLY AFTERNOON.  
SKIES WILL CLEAR ABOUT ONE TO TWO HOURS AFTN FRONTAL PASSAGE AS MUCH 
DRIER AIR FILTERS INTO THE REGION.  DESPITE DRIER AIR AND RH PROGS 
SHOWING DEEP DRYING...SOME AFTN CUMULUS CLOUDS ARE STILL EXPECTED 
DUE TO THE MSTR ALREADY ON THE GROUND.  MOS TEMPS LOOK GOOD 
TODAY...SO WILL ONLY STRAY MAYBE A DEGREE OR TWO.

FOR TONIGHT...SKIES WILL CLEAR AS WEAK SFC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO 
THE OHIO VLY.  ONE FLY IN THE OINTMENT...HOWEVER...WILL BE THAT A 
MEAN MID LVL TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION TONIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY.  A WEAK S/WV IS FCST TO PIVOT ACRS THE LOWER GREAT LAKES 
TONIGHT.  THIS FEATURE MAYBE CLOSE ENOUGH TO BRING SOME 
STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS TO THE FAR NW CWFA.  WILL LEAVE MOSTLY CLEAR 
THERE FOR NOW AND CLEAR ELSEWHERE.  TEMPS SHOULD COOL INTO THE UPPER 
40S AND LOWER 50S.

ON WEDNESDAY...SFC HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE TO THE EAST.  ANOTHER 
S/WV IS FCST TO PIVOT SE TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY.  THE LOW LEVELS OF 
THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE DRY.  HOWEVER...MODELS ARE SHOWING MID LVL 
MSTR DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THE S/WV.  RIGHT NOW...THIS SHOULD AFFECT 
THE WAPAKONETA/DAYTON AREAS...BRINGING PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS 
THERE.  ELSEWHERE...SKIES WILL REMAIN MOSTLY SUNNY.  WITH AIRMASS 
MODIFICATION AND A RETURN OF A WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW...TEMPS WILL WARM 
ABOUT 5 DEGREES.  MOS TEMPS LOOK GOOD SO WILL NOT DEVIATE.

.ILN...NONE. 

HICKMAN









LOSS OF DAYTIME HEADING HAS REALLY PUT THE KAIBASH ON CONVECTION 
ACROSS FCST AREA. ONLY A FEW SPOTS NORTHWEST OF CMH EXPECTED TO HOLD 
ON TO STORMS STRONG ENOUGH TO SUPPORT LIGHTNING. WILL CANCEL THE 
WATCH AND SEND UPDATED ZONES AT 8 PM. 

ANOTHER S/W PROGGED TO GET INTO TRI-STATES AREA AFTER 6Z FROM THE 
SOUTH ON MESOETA...AND DOWNSTREAM OBS WOULD SUPPORT THIS SOLUTION. 
WILL KEEP THUNDER IN FOR EVERYBODY AFTER MIDNIGHT BUT EXPECT STORMS 
TO BEHAVE AND BE SUB-SEVERE WITHOUT DIFFERENTIAL HEATING TO DRIVE 
THEM.

WILL BREAK OUT NW ZONES AND DECREASE THE CHANCE FOR THUNDER BUT 
STILL LEAVE THE POSSIBILITY OF A ROGUE STORM OVERNIGHT.

.ILN...NONE.

18Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A CDFNT EXTENDING FM LMICH ACROSS ERN IL 
INTO SERN OK.  UNSTABLE AIR MASS ACROSS IN WAS LEADING TO DEVELOPING 
TSRA.  XPCT THESE STORMS TO SOLIDIFY INTO A LINE AND PUSH INTO WRN 
FA THIS EVENING.  BASED ON STRENGTH OF FORCING...LOW WBZ VALUES AND 
DAPE OF 50+ MPH...WL INCLUDE MENTION OF SVR FOR THIS EVENING VC 
DAY-CVG.  FOR CMH-PMH...DUE TO LOWER INSTABILITY AND EXECTED STORM 
ARRIVAL AROUND MIDNIGHT...WL NOT MENTION SVR.  WL CARRY CAT POPS ALL 
AREAS.

MODELS INDICATE THAT SHRA/TSRA MAY BE EXITING CMH-PMH REGIONS AROUND 
12Z TUE.  WL CARRY A MORNING MENTION IN THOSE AREAS AND KEEP DRY TO 
THE W.  

NGM MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD SO WL 
STAY CLOSE.

FXUS61 KILN 071345
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 AM EDT MON MAY 7 2001

13Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A CDFNT EXTENDING FM WI SWD INTO ERN OK.  
AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE A MOIST AXIS WITH 60+ DEWPOINTS EXTENDED FM 
THE TN VLY NWD INTO IN AND WRN OH.  VISIBLE IMAGERY SHOWED CLEARING 
ACROSS IN AND WRN OH.

WITH PLENTY OF SS EXPECTED THIS PM AND TEMPS ALREADY APPROACHING 70 
...WL UPDATE TO INCREASE HIGHS TODAY AT LEAST 1 CAT.  THIS WL LEAD 
TO INCREASED INSTABILITY WITH MODIFIED 12Z KILN SOUNDING SHOWING 
POTENTIAL FOR CAPES AROUND 2000 J/KG.  WHILE MAIN TSRA ACTIVITY 
SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL THIS EVENING...IT MAY REACH IN COUNTIES 
BEFORE 00Z. ALSO...WIDELY SCATTERED TSRA MAY DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE 
MAIN LINE.  WL ADD MENTION OF TSRA THIS PM FOR DAY-CVG BUT LEAVE 
CMH-PMH DRY. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 070748
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EDT MON MAY 7 2001

SCT LGT RAIN SHWRS HAV BEEN FALLING APART ACRS WRN PORTIONS OF FA 
PAST FEW HRS. WK BNDRY TO OUR S WL LIFT N ACRS THE AREA THIS MRNG 
BUT WITH WK VORT LOBE PUSHG TO THE N...SUBSDC DVLPS THRU LATE MRNG. 
WL KP AN EYE ON RADAR TRENDS BUT AM LEANING TWD KPG ERLY MENTION OF 
SHWRS OUT OF FCST. SAT PIX SHWG CLRG ACRS WRN KY/IND AND XPCT THIS 
TO MOVE INTO FA WITH SUBSDNC. DID SEE SOME CU DVLPMT TO OUR W YSTRDY 
AND WITH SOME CI BLOWOFF THRU THE AFTN...WL GO WITH BCMG PRTLY 
SUNNY. AMS DOES DSTBLZ THRU THIS AFTN BUT INSTBLTY AXIS AHD OF FNT 
STILL JUST TO OUR W AT 00Z. CONCEIVABLE WE COULD SEE SOMETHING INTO 
OUR FAR W TWD 00Z BUT LOOKS LIKE BULK OF PCPN SHUD MOVE INTO FA ERLY 
THIS EVNG. WL GO WITH CAT POPS ACRS THE W BUT WITH FORCING FALLING 
APART SOME THRU THE OVRNGT AND DCRSG INSTBLTY...WL JUST KP PCPN IN 
THE LIKELY CATEGORY FOR THE E AND TRY TO SHOW SOME TIMING TWD 
MIDNIGHT. FNT PUSHES E OF FA THRU TUE MRNG SO WL KP A CHC OF PCPN 
ACRS THE E ERLY...OTRWS XPCT DCRSG CLDS THRU THE AFTN. 

AS FOR TMPS...WL GO WRMR THAN GUID TMPS FOR HIGHS TDA AS MDLS LOOK 
TO BE OVERDOING CLD COVER AND 8H TMPS SUPPORTING HIGHS INTO THE 
MID/UPR 70S. CAA NOT ALL THAT IMPRESSIVE BEHIND FNT SO PREFER WRMR 
NGM ON TUE AND WL STICK PRETTY CLOSE TO FWC TMPS.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
855 PM EDT SUN MAY 6 2001

SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR STILL DOWNSLOPING THROUGH MOST OF FCST AREA ON 
EAST WINDS...AS CONVECTION CONTINUES BEHIND A BOUNDARY THAT IS 
ALREADY IN THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF FCST AREA. EXPECT THE DRIER AIR TO 
CONTINUE TO HOLD BEST CONVECTION OUT OF MAJORITY OF ZONES...AND WITH 
THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING EXPECT THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
DECREASE IN BOTH COVERAGE AND INTENSITY. LOCAL GUSTY WINDS EXPECTED 
WITH THE STORMS...DUE TO ABUNDANCE OF OUTFLOW BOUNDARYS.

TEMPS LOOK GOOD THIS EVENING BUT EXPECT TO RESOLVE MIDNIGHT WORDING 
WITH UPDATE AND BREAK OUT COUNTIES IN SE GROUP ALONG OHIO TO 
INCREASE THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT. 

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 061936
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 PM EDT SUN MAY 6 2001

...UPDATE...
RADAR AND SATELLITE SHOWING SOME DEVELOPMENT ALONG WARM FRONT.  WILL 
ADD 20 POP IN THE EAST FOR TONIGHT.


...ORIGINAL DISCUSSION...
500 MB RIDGE CURRENTLY OVER UPPER OHIO VALLEY PULLS EAST INTO THE 
APPALACHIANS BY MORNING.  VORT MAX LIFTING NORTH ON BACKSIDE OF 
RIDGE...PUSHES AREA OF QPF NORTHEAST INTO THE FA.  MODELS CONTINUE 
TO TRY TO FORECAST QPF FORMING OVER ERN TN/KY..THEN MOVE IT 
NORTH/NORTHWEST TO JOIN AREA OF QPF ASSOCIATED WITH VORT.  IT 
APPEARS THAT THEY MOVE IT ALONG THE WARM FRONT THAT IS CURRENTLY 
LOCATED NEAR THE OHIO RIVER.

THERE IS SOME LIGHTNING STRIKES ALONG THE TN/NC BORDER ATTM...BUT 
THE NGM IS PRINTING OUT QPF BACK TO SDF BY 18Z.  THUS WILL TRY TO 
DISCOUNT ITS FORECAST.  AVN/ETA ONLY HAVE THE QPF OVER TN/NC AT 
18Z...BUT MOVE IT QUICKLY NORTH AND NORTHWEST BY 00Z.  AS MENTIONED 
BEFORE...THIS APPEARS TO BE ALONG THE WARM FRONT.  MODELS HAVE BEEN 
TO AGGRESSIVE IN BRINGING CLOUDS AND PRECIP EAST THE LAST SEVERAL 
EVENTS.  IT DOENST MAKE SENSE THAT THE STORMS COULD MOVE SO FAR 
NORTH THAT QUICKLY UNDER THE RIDGE.  ALTHOUGH I AGREE THAT THERE 
WILL BE FORCING FROM THE VORT...IT IS WEAKENING AS IT LIFTS TO THE 
NORTH.  THIS WOULD GIVE MY WESTERN COUNTIES THE BETTER LIFT.  IN 
ADDITION...FLOW IS FROM SOUTHEAST...WHICH SHOULD ACT AS DRYING 
INFLUENCE.  WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS IN THE WEST AND DRY IN 
THE EAST.

FOR MONDAY...THE LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WEAKENS ONCE AGAIN OVER MY 
FA...AS IT STRENGTHEN AHEAD OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  THERE MIGHT 
BE A LINGERING SHOWER IN THE MORNING...AN IN CASE THEY DRIFT OVER 
CENTRAL OHIO...WILL CARRY A 30 POP THERE.  AS CONVERGENCE LINE MOVE 
EAST...THE WEST SHOULD SEE A CHANCE LATE IN THE DAY.  FRONT IS JUST 
TO THE WEST AT 12Z TUESDAY...THEN PUSHES ACROSS THE AREA ON TUESDAY. 
WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS IN THE WEST MONDAY NIGHT AND IN THE WEST ON 
TUESDAY.

DIDNT MESS WITH MOS TEMPERATURES TONIGHT...BUT GENERALLY WENT A 
LITTLE WARMER THAN MOS ON TEMPERATURES MONDAY. THIRD AND FOURTH 
PERIODS NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE.

MISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

591 
FXUS61 KILN 061936
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 PM EDT SUN MAY 6 2001

...UPDATE...
RADAR AND SATELLITE SHOWING SOME DEVELOPMENT ALONG WARM FRONT.  WILL 
ADD 20 POP IN THE EAST FOR TONIGHT.


...ORIGINAL DISCUSSION...
500 MB RIDGE CURRENTLY OVER UPPER OHIO VALLEY PULLS EAST INTO THE 
APPALACHIANS BY MORNING.  VORT MAX LIFTING NORTH ON BACKSIDE OF 
RIDGE...PUSHES AREA OF QPF NORTHEAST INTO THE FA.  MODELS CONTINUE 
TO TRY TO FORECAST QPF FORMING OVER ERN TN/KY..THEN MOVE IT 
NORTH/NORTHWEST TO JOIN AREA OF QPF ASSOCIATED WITH VORT.  IT 
APPEARS THAT THEY MOVE IT ALONG THE WARM FRONT THAT IS CURRENTLY 
LOCATED NEAR THE OHIO RIVER.

THERE IS SOME LIGHTNING STRIKES ALONG THE TN/NC BORDER ATTM...BUT 
THE NGM IS PRINTING OUT QPF BACK TO SDF BY 18Z.  THUS WILL TRY TO 
DISCOUNT ITS FORECAST.  AVN/ETA ONLY HAVE THE QPF OVER TN/NC AT 
18Z...BUT MOVE IT QUICKLY NORTH AND NORTHWEST BY 00Z.  AS MENTIONED 
BEFORE...THIS APPEARS TO BE ALONG THE WARM FRONT.  MODELS HAVE BEEN 
TO AGGRESSIVE IN BRINGING CLOUDS AND PRECIP EAST THE LAST SEVERAL 
EVENTS.  IT DOENST MAKE SENSE THAT THE STORMS COULD MOVE SO FAR 
NORTH THAT QUICKLY UNDER THE RIDGE.  ALTHOUGH I AGREE THAT THERE 
WILL BE FORCING FROM THE VORT...IT IS WEAKENING AS IT LIFTS TO THE 
NORTH.  THIS WOULD GIVE MY WESTERN COUNTIES THE BETTER LIFT.  IN 
ADDITION...FLOW IS FROM SOUTHEAST...WHICH SHOULD ACT AS DRYING 
INFLUENCE.  WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS IN THE WEST AND DRY IN 
THE EAST.

FOR MONDAY...THE LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WEAKENS ONCE AGAIN OVER MY 
FA...AS IT STRENGTHEN AHEAD OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  THERE MIGHT 
BE A LINGERING SHOWER IN THE MORNING...AN IN CASE THEY DRIFT OVER 
CENTRAL OHIO...WILL CARRY A 30 POP THERE.  AS CONVERGENCE LINE MOVE 
EAST...THE WEST SHOULD SEE A CHANCE LATE IN THE DAY.  FRONT IS JUST 
TO THE WEST AT 12Z TUESDAY...THEN PUSHES ACROSS THE AREA ON TUESDAY. 
WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS IN THE WEST MONDAY NIGHT AND IN THE WEST ON 
TUESDAY.

DIDNT MESS WITH MOS TEMPERATURES TONIGHT...BUT GENERALLY WENT A 
LITTLE WARMER THAN MOS ON TEMPERATURES MONDAY. THIRD AND FOURTH 
PERIODS NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE.

MISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

500 MB RIDGE IS OVER OHIO AT 12Z.  IT DOESNT MAKE A LOT OF PROGRESS 
EASTWARD DURING THE DAY.  WITH FLOW ALMOST SOUTHERLY DONT KNOW HOW

WASNT SHOWING MUCH IN THE WAY OF CU DEVELOPMENT.

MODELS ARE STILL BRINGING SHORTWAVE UP THE BACKSIDE OF THE RIDGE 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON...PRODUCING SOME QPF IN THE SW.  THIS SHORTWAVE 
MIGHT BE ABLE TO PRODUCE SOME CLOUDS.  WILL GO A LITTLE MORE 
OPTIMISTIC WITH MOSTLY SUNNY EVERYWHERE BUT THE SW.

WITH MORE SUN EXPECTED...WILL RAISE TEMPERATURES A CATEGORY ACROSS 
THE FA.  LOOKS LIKE WINDS TRY TO PICK UP LATE IN THE AFTERNOON AS 
THEY TURN TO THE SOUTHEAST.

FXUS61 KILN 051809
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
208 PM EDT SAT MAY 5 2001

AVN COMING IN SLOWLY...BUT HAVE LOOKED AT IT THROUGH 42 HOURS.

MODELS SIMILAR TONIGHT IN PUSHING FRONT BACK NORTHEAST...AS 500 MB 
RIDGE PUSHES EAST. NGM A LITTLER COOLER WITH TEMPERATURES AT 850 
TONIGHT. PREFER THE WARMER AVN/ETA TEMPERATURES WHICH WOULD YIELD 
LOWS IN THE 50S.  TREND OF MOS HAS BEEN WARMER WITH THE LOWS 
TONIGHT...SO WILL TWEAK SOME MOS LOCATIONS TO BRING THEM IN LINE.  
EXPECT JUST SOME INCREASING CI TONIGHT. WASNT SURE WEATHER TO GO 
WITH MOSTLY CLEAR OR PARTLY CLOUDY.  WILL GO WITH MOSTLY CLEAR IN 
THE EAST AND A MOSTLY CLEAR...PARTLY CLOUDY AFTER MIDNIGHT WORDING 
IN THE WEST.

AS 500 MB RIDGE PASSES TO THE EAST LATE TOMORROW...AREA COMES UNDER 
SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT. ETA HAS BACKED OFF ITS 00Z FORECAST OF 
BRINGING A GOOD ARE OF QPF INTO SW OHIO BY 00Z...TRENDING TOWARDS 
THE AVN...WHICH HAS KEPT A PATCH OF QPF ACROSS IL AND ONE IN SE KY. 
ETA IS STILL A LITTLE FARTHER NORTH THAN THE AVN WITH THE QPF...AS 
IT FORMS SOME OVER THE SOUTHERN FA AFTER 18Z.  NGM REMAINS ALONE IN 
BRINGING A MORE SOLID AREA OF QPF.  FROM WHAT I CAN SEE THE NGM IS 
STRONGER WITH THE 300 MB DIVERGENCE AT 00Z MON AND THIS MIGHT BE 
DRIVING ITS QPF.

WILL BACK OFF ON THE QPF AND WILL LIMIT IT TO THE SOUTHWEST IN THE 
AFTERNOON.  WILL CARRY A 20 POP IN THE SE...BUT CANT USE SLIGHT 
CHANCE WORDING IN THE SECOND PERIOD.

MODELS DO AGREE IS PUSHING AN AREA OF SHOWERS INTO THE FA SUNDAY 
NIGHT.  LIFT WEAKENS AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES...SO AM NOT CONFIDENT 
THAT IT WILL MAKE CENTRAL OHIO.  WILL STILL CARRY A 30 POP IN 
CENTRAL OH HOWEVER.  ON MONDAY...GOOD 500 LOW...CONTINUES TO DROP 
INTO THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  OUT AHEAD OF IT...A COLD FRONT 
WILL BE PUSHING UP THE OHIO VALLEY. DONT EXPECT IT TO REACH THE FA 
BEFORE 00Z HOWEVER.

PREFER THE GENERALLY WARMER AVN NUMBERS...BOTH MAV AND FAN...FOR THE 
SECOND THROUGH 4TH PERIODS. WILL BUMP LOWS DOWN SIGNIFICANTLY 
MONDAY....BUT NOT AS COLD AS NGM MOS.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

WND SHIFT LINE NOW DOWN PAST THE OHIO RIVER BUT COLDER AIR STILL UP  
ACRS NRN OHIO. NARROW BAND OF LGT RAIN SHWRS CRNTLY ACRS NW PORTION

AFTN BUT NOT A WHOLE LOT OF SUPPORT WITH IT OUTSIDE OF SOME WK LLVL 
CONV. COLD AIR PUSH NEVER REALLY MAKES IT INTO THE S WITH ETA 8H 
TMPS RANGING FM AROUND 10 DGRS N TO 15 DGRS FAR S. THUS...THINK WL 
SEE A FAIRLY SHARP TMP CONTRAST N TO S. IN FACT 8H TMPS ACRS THE FAR 
SW THIS AFTN ARE SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY. WE WL HAV MORE CLDS ARND TDA 
THO BUT WITH BEST MSTR RMNG ACRS THE N...THINK WL SEE FAIR AMT OF 
SUN TDA...ESPCLY ACRS THE S. WL GRADUATE TMPS FM 70-75 N TO 80-85 
FAR S. 

QUITE A BIT OF DIFF WITH MDLS FOR SUN. ALL SHWG FNT PUSHG BACK TO 
THE N AS A WARM FNT BUT ETA/NGM APPEAR OVERDONE...TRYING TO CRANK 
OUT UPWARDS OF AN INCH OF RAIN ACRS OUR SW. WL LEAN TWD DRIER AVN 
AND ONLY GO WITH CHC POPS ACRS THE W FOR SUN AFTN AND THEN CHC POPS 
ACRS ENTIRE FA FOR SUN NGT. WITH THIS...ALSO PREFER WARMER AVN TMPS 
ON SUN THO INCRSG CLDS THRU THE AFTN MAY KP TMPS DOWN A LTL. WL 
THUS SPLIT THE DIFF BETWEEN WARMER MAV TMPS AND COOLER FWC TMPS FOR 
HIGHS.

OF A CAP THIS AFTN COMPARED TO YESTERDAY AND WITH WK VORT 
ALF...THINK WL SEE A FEW MORE TSTMS POP UP THIS AFTN. BEST CHC FOR 
THIS LOOKS TO BE ACRS THE SE HALF OF FA. MEANWHILE..FNT DROPPING 
DOWN FM THE N LATE THIS AFTN WITH SOME WK CONV ACRS THE FAR N ALG 
WITH A SECONDARY AREA OF SLGTLY HIGHER INSTBLTYS SO HARD TO RULE OUT 
AN ISOLD TSTM LATE IN THE NW TOO. THEREFORE...WL GO AHD AND INCLUDE 
A SLGT CHC OF TSTMS FOR THIS AFTN ACRS ENTIRE FA. 

FNT CONTS TO PUSH S TNGT BUT FORCING FALLS APART AS IT PUSHES INTO 
FA SO WL ONLY CARRY LOW CHC POPS ACRS THE N FOR OVRNGT. FNT PUSHES S 
OF FA ON SAT. SOME INSTBLTYS LINGER ALG THE FNT IN OUR FAR S FOR SAT 
SO MAY BE A CHC OF SHWR/TSTM IN THE S BUT BLV CHC LOW ENUF TO KP OUT 
OF FCST ATTM.

8H TMPS/LLVL TCKNSS SIMILAR TDA AS YESTERDAY SO THINK WL SEE ANOTHER 
DAY WITH HIGHS UP INTO THE MID 80S...CLOSE TO GUID TMPS. COOLER AIR 
BEGINS TO WORK IN TONIGHT ACRS THE N AND OVR RMDR AREA ON SAT. WITH 
NELY SFC FLO AND SOME CLDS...PREFER COOLER FWC TMPS FOR HIGHS ON SAT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
308 AM EDT FRI MAY 4 2001

SAT PIX SHWG AC BCMG A BIT MORE WDSPRD ACRS AREA WITH A FEW TSTMS 
SHWG UP ACRS FAR ERN KY. THIS APPEARS TO BE IN RESPONSE TO WK VORT 
MAX DEPICTED OVR NRN/ERN KY BY ALL THREE MODELS. THIS VORT PROGD TO 
ROTATE SLOWLY NE ACRS AREA THRU THIS AFTN. WE SAW A FEW TSTMS POP UP 
ACRS SE PORTION OF FA THURS AFTN. FCST MDL SNDGS INDCTG A LTL LESS 
OF A CAP THIS AFTN COMPARED TO YESTERDAY AND WITH WK VORT 
ALF...THINK WL SEE A FEW MORE TSTMS POP UP THIS AFTN. BEST CHC FOR 
THIS LOOKS TO BE ACRS THE SE HALF OF FA. MEANWHILE..FNT DROPPING 
DOWN FM THE N LATE THIS AFTN WITH SOME WK CONV ACRS THE FAR N ALG 
WITH A SECONDARY AREA OF SLGTLY HIGHER INSTBLTYS SO HARD TO RULE OUT 
AN ISOLD TSTM LATE IN THE NW TOO. THEREFORE...WL GO AHD AND INCLUDE 
A SLGT CHC OF TSTMS FOR THIS AFTN ACRS ENTIRE FA. 

FNT CONTS TO PUSH S TNGT BUT FORCING FALLS APART AS IT PUSHES INTO 
FA SO WL ONLY CARRY LOW CHC POPS ACRS THE N FOR OVRNGT. FNT PUSHES S 
OF FA ON SAT. SOME INSTBLTYS LINGER ALG THE FNT IN OUR FAR S FOR SAT 
SO MAY BE A CHC OF SHWR/TSTM IN THE S BUT BLV CHC LOW ENUF TO KP OUT 
OF FCST ATTM.

8H TMPS/LLVL TCKNSS SIMILAR TDA AS YESTERDAY SO THINK WL SEE ANOTHER 
DAY WITH HIGHS UP INTO THE MID 80S...CLOSE TO GUID TMPS. COOLER AIR 
BEGINS TO WORK IN TONIGHT ACRS THE N AND OVR RMDR AREA ON SAT. WITH 
NELY SFC FLO AND SOME CLDS...PREFER COOLER FWC TMPS FOR HIGHS ON SAT.

.ILN...NONE. 

LOTT

650 PM EDT THU MAY 3 2001

WILL SEND OUT UPDATE AROUND 715 TO REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING WITH 
LAST LINGERING SHOWER OR TWO DYING OUT BY THEN. 

TEMPS FCST OF 55 TO 60 IS GOOD...BUT SEVERAL OBS IN LOW-LYING AREAS 
WILL LIKELY DROP TO BELOW THIS RANGE FOR ANOTHER NIGHT. WILL MENTION 
A COOLER IN RURAL AREAS FOR THIS. DO NOT EXPECT TO REALIZE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT WINDS AND WILL CUT CURRENT 5 TO 10 TO LIGHT AND VARIABLE 
OR LIGHT SOUTHWEST.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 030731
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT THU MAY 3 2001

UPPER RIDGE PERSISTS ACROSS EASTERN CONUS. RIDGE IS A BIT STRONGER 
THAN YESTERDAYSS MODELS HAD INDICATED. RIDGE WILL GET SQUASHED BY 
SATURDAY AS STRONG SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH SOUTHEASTERN CANADA.

SFC HIGH CENTERED OFF THE CAROLINA COAST WILL ALSO REMAIN NEARLY 
STATIONARY UNTIL A COLD FRONT BEGINS TO PUSH IT SOUTH LATE ON 
FRIDAY.  THE HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO PUMP WARM AIR INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY WELL INTO FRIDAY.

SATELLITE SHOWS CIRRUS CLOUDS THAT ARE THICKER OVER NORTHERN OHIO.  
MODELS SHOW MOISTURE AROUND AT MID LEVELS BUT THERE ARE NO CLOUDS 
ASSOCIATED WITH IT.  WILL KEEP MOSTLY SUNNY FCST TODAY.  LIMITED LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE IN MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIRMASS MAY RESULT IN ISOLATED 
SHRA AGAIN LATE THIS AFTERNOON BUT COVERAGE SHOULD NOT BE ENOUGH TO 
MENTION IN ZONES.  MOSTLY CLEAR FCST WILL HOLD FOR TONIGHT.  

WITH FRONT MOVING TOWARD THE AREA ON FRIDAY...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL INCREASE A BIT ALONG WITH INSTABILITY AND CONVERGENCE.  
THEREFORE ILL KEEP CHANCE AFTERNOON TSRA.

FWC TEMPS IN MID 80S LOOK GOOD FOR TODAY...THOUGH 86 AT CMH MAY BE 
TOO HIGH.  FOR TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...FWC LOOKS TOO LOW SO 
ILL GO A FEW DEGREES ABOVE. 

.ILN...NONE. 

CONIGLIO






FXUS61 KILN 020723
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
322 AM EDT WED MAY 2 2001

UPPER RIDGE REBUILDING TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  RIDGE WILL SHIELD 
THE OHIO VALLEY FROM SHORT WAVE ENERGY RIDING FROM THE PLAINS TO THE 
WESTERN GREAT LAKES.  SFC HIGH WILL REMAIN OFF THE EAST COAST 
THROUGH THE PERIOD...WITH WARM SOUTHERLY FLOW PERSISTING OVER OUR 
AREA.

SATELLITE SHOWS DEBRIS CLOUDS OVER SOUTHEAST OHIO LEFT OVER FROM 
LAST EVENINGS TSRA...WHICH FIRED IN PVA AHEAD OF VORT MAX OVER 
NORTHWEST OHIO.  I DONT EXPECT A REPEAT PERFORMANCE OF TSRA TODAY 
AS PVA AND CAPE WILL BE WEAKER WITH WARMING ALOFT UNDER BUILDING 
UPPER RIDGE.  SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR OVER NORTHWEST OHIO...WITH 
DEBRIS CIRRUS SPILLING IN FROM WESTERN LAKES TSRA. 

WILL GO WITH MOSTLY SUNNY TODAY WEST WHERE CIRRUS SHOULD NOT 
INTERFERE MUCH WITH SUN.  PARTLY SUNNY WILL BE APPROPRIATE EAST 
WHERE PERSISTENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL RESULT IN SOME CU FORMATION.
WITH RIDGE STRENGTHENING AND MOISTURE DECREASING...MOSTLY SUNNY WILL 
WORK ALL ZONES ON THURSDAY.  

FWC TEMPS LOOK CLOSE TODAY...AND A BIT LOW TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT WITH LOW LEVEL THICKNESS INCREASING UNDER RIDGE.  WILL GO 
ABOVE FWC INTO MID 80S FOR THURSDAY...AND ALSO ABOVE FWC NIGHTTIME 
LOWS TOWARD 60.

.ILN...NONE. 

CONIGLIO

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
313 PM EDT TUE MAY 1 2001

KILN SHOWING STRONG TO PULSE SEVERE CONVECTION ALONG BOUNDARY WITH 
CRW.  KIND SHOWING SOME CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN WESTERN INDIANA IN 
AN AREA OF SURFACE CONVERGENT.  WILL ADD IN THREAT OF EVENING 
CONVECTION ACROSS FA.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH KEEP SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL OF FA.  THE STABLENESS OF THE PATTER IS DO TO THE UPPER LOW 
SETTLING INTO THE WEST THROUGH THE WEEKEND WHICH KEEPS OHIO VALLEY 
IN UPPER AIR RIDGING.  THERE APPEARS TO BE ONLY TWO TIMES IN THE 
NEXT 7 DAYS WHEN ISOLATED TO SCATTERED PRECIP WILL BE POSSIBLE.  THE 
FIRST WILL OCCUR WITH WEAK BACK DOORISH TYPE COLD FRONT SLIPPING 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY.  WILL CONCENTRATE POPS TO 
AFTERNOON/EVENING WITH THE FRONT ACROSS THE SOUTH.  THE NEXT WILL BE 
WITH A WARM FRONT MOVING THROUGH ON MONDAY.

FWC TEMPS APPEAR TO BE A BIT COOL ESPECIALLY ON THURSDAY WHERE MAV 
AND LOW LEVEL TEMPS AND THICKNESSES OFF THE ETA SUGGEST MID 80S.  
WILL ALSO KEEP IT WARM IN FRONT OF COLD FRONT WITH THETA-E POOLING.

MISILN SENT TO ALL.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 011331
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
931 AM EDT TUE MAY 1 2001

CURRENT FORECAST IN GREAT SHAPE.  NO UPDATE PLANNED THIS MORNING.

KILN IS SHOWING A DYING CELL OVER MASON COUNTY AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS TO OUR SOUTHEAST.  SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO 
BRING HIGHER TDS INTO EASTERN FA THIS AFTERNOON.  TEMPS AND TDS WILL 
POOL TO SOME DEGREE AHEAD OF A WEAK LINE OF CONVECTION/CONVERGENT 
BOUNDARY THAT IS CURRENTLY OVER NORTHERN IN/IL.  WITH CONVECTION TO 
OUR EAST AND WEST...CAPE VALUES BY AFTERNOON EXPECTED TO BE WELL 
ABOVE 1000 J/KG WITH NO CINH OR CAP POPS ARE WARRANTED THIS 
AFTERNOON.  06Z MESOETA POINTS TO SOME CONVERGENT IN THE WEST BY 
EARLY AFTERNOON IN THE LOW LEVELS WHICH SEEMS TO FIT WITH THE 
CONVERGENT AREA ASSOCIATED WITH THE WEAK CONVECTION.  CONVECTIVE 
PARAMETERS ALL POINT TO SUB SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS.  OF COURSE THERE 
MAY BE AN EXCEPTION OR TWO.

HIGH TEMPERATURES LOOK GOOD WHEN LOOKING AT MORNING SOUNDING AND 06Z 
MESOETA.    

.ILN...NONE. 
 TIPTON

FXUS61 KILN 010741
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EDT TUE MAY 1 2001

UPPER RIDGE REMAINS IN CONTROL.  SHORT WAVE ENTERING MISSOURI WILL 
DROP TOWARD THE SOUTHEAST KEEPING MOST OF ENERGY SOUTH OF HERE.  
SLIGHT HEIGHT FALLS WILL OCCUR TODAY IN RESPONSE TO THE SHORT WAVE 
BEFORE RIDGE REBUILDS AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

SFC MAP SHOWS EARLY SEASON BERMUDA HIGH...WITH LOW MOVING INTO 
NORTHERN PLAINS.  OUR AREA HAS WARM SOUTHERLY FLOW BETWEEN SYSTEMS.
RADAR SHOWS A COUPLE SHOWERS ON OUR WESTERN FRINGE AHEAD OF 
INSTABILITY MAX NEAR SDF.  INSTABILITY IS MOVING THIS WAY AND WILL 
CROSS OUR AREA TODAY.

ILL KEEP CHANCE TSRA TODAY WITH INSTABILITY MOVING IN AND SOME PVA 
OCCURRING.  BEST CHANCE APPEARS TO BE DURING THE AFTERNOON NEAR 
COLUMBUS.  WITH WEAK WIND FLOW THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE I DONT 
ANTICIPATE SEVERE STORMS.  WITH STABILITY INCREASING...WILL KEEP DRY 
FCST TONIGHT.  THOUGH THERE WILL BE A BIT OF INSTABILITY ON 
WEDNESDAY IT LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE MUCH LESS THAN TODAY SO ILL KEEP 
FCST DRY. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD WRT GENERAL PATTERN...THOUGH A BIT COOL.  WILL 
GO 1 TO 2 DEGREES ABOVE FWC THROUGH THE FCST. 

.ILN...NONE. 
 
CONIGLIO

907 PM EDT MON APR 30 2001

SAT PIX SHWG DIURNAL CU ACRS THE S HAS DSIPTD WITH A LTL CI DRIFTING 
INTO WRN PORTIONS OF FA. DWPTS STILL ON THE LOW SIDE WITH MOST AREAS 
RUNNING IN THE 40S...THO A FEW HIGHER DWPTS CREEPING INTO THE SW. 
18Z MESOETA CONTG THIS TREND...WITH DWPTS GRADUALLY INCRSG SW TO NE 
ACRS FA OVRNGT. SCT SHWRS/TSTM ACRS SRN IL PUSHG SLOWLY NE BUT AMS 
ACRS FA RMNS MORE STABLE THRU THE OVRNGT HRS AND WITH LOSS OF 
DAYTIME HTG...THINK THESE WL DSIPT BEFORE REACHING OUR AREA. SKIES 
SHUD RMN MSTLY CLR ACRS WRN FA FOR AT LEAST A FEW MORE HRS SO WL 
BACK OFF ON INCRSG CLD WORDING AND GO MSTLY CLR WITH BCMG PRTLY CLDY 
LATE. TMPS ALREADY DOWN INTO THE UPPER 60S/LOW 70S. HOWEVER...WITH 
DWPTS SLOWLY RISING OVRNGT...THINK CRNT LOW TMP FCST OF MID TO UPR 
50S WL HOLD.

DAYTIME HTG...THINK THESE WL DSIPT BEFORE REACHING OUR AREA. SKIES

BACK OFF ON INCRSG CLD WORDING AND GO MSTLY CLR WITH BCMG PRTLY CLDY 
LATE. TMPS ALREADY DOWN INTO THE UPPER 60S/LOW 70S. HOWEVER...WITH 
DWPTS SLOWLY RISING OVRNGT...THINK CRNT LOW TMP FCST OF MID TO UPR 
50S WL HOLD.

.ILN...NONE. 
 
LOTT






831 
FXUS61 KILN 301858
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM EDT MON APR 30 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS AFTN WAS SHOWING DEVELOPING CUMULUS 
CLOUDS ALONG AND JUST SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  THIS WAS IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH INCREASING DEWPOINTS FROM THE SOUTH/SOUTHWEST.  
SOME THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WAS NOTED NEAR THE SE KY/NE TN BORDER.  
THIS ACTIVITY WAS IN RESPONSE TO A WEAK S/WV ALOFT COMBINED WITH 
DAYTIME HEATING.

CLOUD/TEMP FCST WILL BE A LITTLE TRICKY FOR THE NXT 24 TO 48 HRS.  
FIRST OF ALL...S/WV OVER THE KY/TN AREA IS FCST TO MOVE LITTLE AND 
PERHAPS ELONGATE OVERNIGHT.  LOOKING AT MODEL DATA...NGM SEEMS TO BE 
DEVELOPING SOME SPURIOUS CONVECTION ACRS OUR WRN AREAS AND CONTINUES 
THIS INTO TOMORROW.  THIS IS BEING DISCOUNTED.  USING THE 
AVN/ETA...THERE REALLY IS NO STRONG LOW LVL FORCING OVERNIGHT ACRS 
OUR REGION IN CONJUCTION WITH A MOISTENING AIRMASS.  WITH THAT 
SAID...PLAN ON KEEPING A DRY FCST.  CUMULUS CLOUDS TO THE 
SOUTH/SOUTHWEST SHOULD DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET.  AS A RESULT...AN 
INCREASE IN MID AND HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS IS ANTICIPATED ACRS THE WRN 
CWFA OVERNIGHT.

ON TUESDAY...COLD FRONT CURRENTLY ACRS THE NRN PLAINS STATES WILL 
FALL APART AS IT MOVES INTO A MEAN H5 RIDGE ALOFT.  S/WV ASSOCD WITH 
COLD FRONT BEGINS TO STRETCH/SHEAR AS IT MOVES TOWARD THE 
OHIO/INDIANA BORDER BY LATE AFTN.  AGAIN...I AM HAVING A HARD TIME 
FINDING ANY REAL FOCUSING MECHANISM (OTHER THAN SHEARING S/WV) TO 
TRIGGER CONVECTION TOMORROW.  HAVE DECIDED TO LEAVE A LOW 30 POP IN 
ALL LOCATIONS GIVEN THAT THE MSTR AND INSTABILITY WILL BE 
AVAILABLE.  THUS...DAYTIME HEATING WILL HAVE TO BE THE MAIN TRIGGER 
MECHANISM FOR POPCORN TYPE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY.

BY TUESDAY NIGHT...ANY DAYTIME CONVECTION SHOULD DISSIPATE AFTER 
SUNSET.  THUS...PARTLY CLOUDY EARLY...THEN MOSTLY CLEAR SHOULD 
SUFFICE.

ON WEDNESDAY...ANOTHER S/WV AND ASSOCD SFC COLD FRONT APCH THE MS 
VLY REGION.  LIKE DEJA VU...THESE ALSO WILL NOT BE ABLE TO BUCK A 
REDEVELOPING H5 MID LVL RIDGE.  WILL LEAVE OUT DAYTIME CONVECTION ON 
WEDNESDAY DUE TO THE INCREASED MID LVL WARMING NOTED ON THE ETA 
MODEL ABOVE 700 MB...PRODUCING A CAPPING INVERSION (DESPITE SAME 
AIRMASS).

WARM CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY UNDER H5 MID LVL 
RIDGING.  A THIRD COLD FRONT WILL FINALLY PUSH THROUGH DURING 
FRIDAY...ALLOWING FOR A SMALL CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY 
SOUTH OF THE WAPAKONETA AREA.  SKIES WILL CLEAR BY SATURDAY 
...BRINGING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES BUT MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES.

.ILN...NONE. 
 
HICKMAN



















@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 300733
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
333 AM EDT MON APR 30 2001

MID LVL RDG AXIS TO CONTROL WX OVR OH VLY TDA. DRY AMS OVR RGN ATTM
BUT XPCT RETURN FLO ON BACKSIDE OF SFC HI TO ADVCT INCRSGLY MORE
MOIST AIR FM THE SW. XPCT SUNNY COND TDA WITH CONTD SUBSIDENCE.
IN WAA PTN XPCT NICE WARMUP TDA. BASED ON THICKNESS AND ENERGY BLOCK 
SCHEMES YIELD HI/S CLOSE TO FWC GUID. THEREFORE WL STAY CLOSE TO 
GUID. FIRE WEATHER WISE...10 HR FUEL MSTR VALUES HV DROPPED INTO 5 
TO 6 PERCENT RANGE BUT INCRS IN DWPTS SHUD KEEP MIN RH VALUES IN 
UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S. COND XPCTD TO APPROACH BUT SHUD NOT MEET RED 
FLAG CRITERIA TDA. THEREFORE...WL NOT ISSUE RED FLAG WRMG.

BNDRY WELL TO OUR SOUTH TO RETURN BACK TWD THE RGN TNGT INTO TUE.
MID LVL RDG FLATTENS AS WESTERLIES PUSH FAST MOVG S/WV AXIS INTO 
WRN GRTLKS/UPR MS VLY OVRNGT. FORCING OVR OH VLY IS WEAK TNGT AND
WITH LACK OF TRIGGER AND LIMITED MSTR...CHC FOR PRECIP WL HINGE ON 
INSTBY. RECENT TREND HS BEEN FOR GUID TO OVERDO RETURN MSTR AND QPF.
WL CONT THE UNMENTIONED 20 PCT RANGE. TEMP WISE...WL GO A LTL WRMR
THAN FWC WITH LOWS TNGT.  

MORE CLDS XPCTD ON TUE WITH WK S/WV AXIS PIVOTING INTO THE AREA FM
THE W. SBCAPES XPCTD TO BE IN 1000-1500 J/KG RANGE. GIVEN INSTBY AND
S/WV AXIS WL INTRO LO POP CHC OF SHWRS/TSTMS. PREFER HI/S A LTL WRMR 
THAN FWC GUID TUE GOING WITH COMP BTWN MAV/FWC.

.ILN...NONE. 

RANDALL

000 
FXUS61 KILN 291844
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EDT SUN APR 29 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS INDCS HIPRES NOW CENTERED EAST OF THE REGION...WITH 
A FRONTAL BNDRY JUST TO THE SOUTH TENNESSEE ARCING NW INTO MISSOURI.
LLVL FLOW REMAINS MAINLY EASTERLY THIS AFTN...BUT WL GRADUALLY SHIFT 
TO SOUTHWESTERLY BY TMRW.  AIRMASS CHG LKS TO OCCUR IN 2 STEPS...THE 
FIRST TMRW AS SHIFT TO SW WINDS ADVECTS MUCH WARMER BUT STILL DRY 
AIR IN.  OVERNIGHT LIGHT SE GRADIENT AND CLR SKIES PROVIDES DECENT 
RADIATIONAL CONDS.  LAST NIGHT SAW HUGE RURAL-CITY TEMP DIFFS(41 AT 
CMH...30 AT VTA) AND XPCT THIS AGAIN TNGT.  OVERALL GUID IN GD 
AGREEMENT AND WL NOT STRAY FAR...ALTHOUGH GENERALLY USED MOS NUMBERS 
AS HIGH END OF LARGE RANGES.  GD WARMUP STILL ON TAP FOR MON WITH 
NEAR FULL SUN XPCTD ONCE AGAIN.  LLVL THICKNESS INCRS OF 20-30M 
PROGGED BY THE ETA...WHICH SHUD SUPPORT PREV FCST TEMPS AOA 80.  HV 
USED BLEND OF COOLER FWC/WARMER MAV NUMBERS ACRS THE BOARD.

THE SECOND AIRMASS CHG WL BE ASSOCIATED WITH A RETURN OF INCREASED 
MSTR.  NEW SHORT RANGE GUID IN AGREEMENT BRINGING THE BOUNDARY 
CURRENTLY WELL TO OUR SOUTH BACK TWRDS THE RGN MON NGT INTO 
TUE...AND ALSO IN TRYING TO DVLP NOCTURNAL CONVECTION NR THE BNDRY 
OVER KY IN THE 3RD PD.  OVERALL...RECENT TREND IN THE GUIDANCE(ESPLY 
THE ETA) HAS BEEN TO OVERDO AMNT OF MSTR RETURNING/POOLING ACRS OUR 
RGN.  THE POTNL FOR PCPN MON NGT HINGES GREATLY ON THE PRESCENCE OF 
INSTABILITY...WHICH CUD EASILY BE NON-EXISTANT WITH JUST A LITTLE 
LESS LLVL MSTR THAN THE MODELS DEPICT.  AN UPPER LVL DIVERGENCE/LLVL 
CONVERGENCE COUPLET IS SUGGESTED BY ALL THE GUID...BUT THIS APPEARS 
TO BE MORE A RESULT OF THE MODELS CONVECTION THAN ACTUAL LARGER 
SCALE FORCING.  FOR NOW...WL KEEP POPS IN THE UNMENTIONED 20 PCT 
RANGE.  AS FAR AS TEMPS GO...WL CONT TO RAISE THE FWC A DEG OR 2 AS 
IT HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY TOO COOL RECENTLY WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW.

.ILN...NONE. 

JOHNSTONE













AMPLFIED MID LVL FLO PTN WITH RDG OVR MS VLY BLDG E INTO GRTLKS AND

WL BLD SE TO PSN OFF MID ATLANTIC CST BY 00Z SUN. LTST SATL IMGRY
SHWS CLR SKIES WITH NEAREST CLDS OVR UPR MS RVR VLY. THESE CLDS WL
STAY TO OUR N ARND THE PERIPHERY OF THE MID LVL HI. IN DRY AMS XPCT
SUNNY CONDITIONS TDA. TEMPS SHUD BE ABT ONE CAT WRMR THAN YDA.
SLIGHT MODIFICATION TO AMS TDA WL YIELD MIN RH/S IN THE UPR 20
PERCENT RANGE. ALSO...10 HR FUEL MSTR VALUES HV ADJUSTED UP TO
7-8 PERCENT ACRS ENTIRE CWA AND SFC WNDS WL BE LIGHTER TDA UP TO
10 MPH. THEREFORE WL MENTION THESE CONDS APPRCHG RED FLAG COND IN
FIRE WX FCST BUT WL NOT ISSUE WRNG THIS MRNG.

IN CONTD DRY AMS SHUD SEE DECENT RAD COOLING SETUP SUN NGT. 
THERFORE...PREFER LOWS CLOSER TO THE COOLER MAV NUMBERS.
 
MID LVL RDG TO SLIDE E ACRS THE AREA ON MON WITH STG WESTERLIES ACRS
THE NRN PLNS PUSHING INTO GRTLKS MON NGT. XPCT SOME INCRS IN MSTR
MON AS SFC FLO BCMS SWRLY. ETA QPF DVLPS BULLSEYE OF PRECIP OVR
S CNTRL OH. BEST DYNAMICS TO OUR NW WITH SOME WK LO LVL CNVRGC
INTO WRN SECTIONS MON NGT. ETA APPEARS TO BE OVERDONE WITH PRECIP AND
WL MAINTAIN DRY FCST...INDICATING INCRSG CLDS MON NGT. XPCT CONTD
WRMUP MON. BASED ON LO LVL THICKNESS AND ENERGY BLOCK TECHNIQUES
PREFER HI/S TRENDED TOWARD WRMR MAV GUID MON AFTN.

.ILN...NONE.

739 
FXUS61 KILN 281839
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EDT SAT APR 28 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS 1035MB HIPRES OVER MICHIGAN/L-HURON WITH A 
NEARLY STATIONARY BNDRY NR THE KY/TN BORDER.  HIGH TO THE NORTH WL 
HV THE MAIN INFLUENCE ON OUR WEATHER FOR THE FIRST CPL FCST 
PDS...MAINTAINING A RELATIVELY COOL LLVL FLOW.  STATISTICAL GUID AND 
META SFC TEMPS IN REAL GOOD AGREEMENT TNGT...RANGING FROM M30S NORTH 
TO ARND 40 SOUTH.  WITH FAIRLY LIGHT WINDS/CLR SKIES WL BE ISSUING 
FROST ADVSRY FOR ALL BUT THE FAR SOUTHERN CWFA.  AS MENTIONED 
ABV...AREA WL REMAIN IN COOLER AIRMASS SUNDAY WITH MAINLY EASTERLY 
FLOW.  ETA HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY COOLER IN THIS PATTERN...WITH LLVL 
THICKNESS AND H8 TEMP SCHEMES KEEPING READINGS IN THE 60S.  MAV 
GUIDANCE MUCH WARMER...WELL INTO THE 70S.  THE FWC NUMBERS LOOK 
BEST...OFFERING A NICE COMPROMISE AND MAINTAINING FCST CONTINUITY.

NEW GUIDANCE IN GOOD AGREEMENT BRINGING BOUNDARY TO OUR SOUTH BACK 
THRU AS A WARM FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY.  SHUD SEE DECENT 
RADAITIONAL CONDS AHEAD OF THE BNDRY SUN NGT...AND HV LEANED CLOSER 
TO THE COOLER MAV NUMBERS.  THE TRANSITION BACK INTO THE WARMER 
AIRMASS(18Z TEMPS ALREADY L/M 80S NOT THAT FAR TO THE SW) SHUD YIELD 
A NICE INCRS IN TEMPS.  WL NOT GO AS WARM AS THE MAV (87 AT CMH) 
BUT HV RAISED THE FWC ALL ZONES.  MCLR/MSNY LOOKS BEST WITH MODEL 
TIMESXNS INDCIATING LITTLE IN THE WAY OF MSTR.

.ILN...FROST ADVISORY ALL BUT NORTHERN KY AND FAR SW OHIO.  

JOHNSTONE





@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 281839
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EDT SAT APR 28 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS 1035MB HIPRES OVER MICHIGAN/L-HURON WITH A 
NEARLY STATIONARY BNDRY NR THE KY/TN BORDER.  HIGH TO THE NORTH WL 
HV THE MAIN INFLUENCE ON OUR WEATHER FOR THE FIRST CPL FCST 
PDS...MAINTAINING A RELATIVELY COOL LLVL FLOW.  STATISTICAL GUID AND 
META SFC TEMPS IN REAL GOOD AGREEMENT TNGT...RANGING FROM M30S NORTH 
TO ARND 40 SOUTH.  WITH FAIRLY LIGHT WINDS/CLR SKIES WL BE ISSUING 
FROST ADVSRY FOR ALL BUT THE FAR SOUTHERN CWFA.  AS MENTIONED 
ABV...AREA WL REMAIN IN COOLER AIRMASS SUNDAY WITH MAINLY EASTERLY 
FLOW.  ETA HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY COOLER IN THIS PATTERN...WITH LLVL 
THICKNESS AND H8 TEMP SCHEMES KEEPING READINGS IN THE 60S.  MAV 
GUIDANCE MUCH WARMER...WELL INTO THE 70S.  THE FWC NUMBERS LOOK

KDENFXUS61 KILN 280710
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 AM EDT SAT APR 28 2001

MODELS IN AGREEMENT WITH SYNOPTIC FEATURES TDA. AMPLFIED MID LVL FLO 
PTN WITH RDG OVR PLNS AND TROF OVR SE CAN AND NE US. CONTD NW FLO  
OVR OH VLY TDA. LTST SFC ANLYS SHWS CDFNT WHICH DROPPED S THRU CWA
YDA IS LOCATED TO OUR S THRU CNTRL KY WITH HI PRES STRETCHING FM 
JAMES BAY THRU THE NRN GRLTKS. THIS SFC HI WHICH WL BLD S INTO 
GRTLKS TDA WL PROVIDE SUBSIDENCE AND DRY AMS TO THE RGN. LTST SATL
IMGRY SHWS SOME DEBRIS CLDS TO OUR NW. ONLY XPCT SOME THINNING HI
LVL CLDS TDA. BASED ON PLENTY OF SS FWC GUID VALUES APPEAR TOO COOL
WITH TDA/S HI/S. PREFER NUMBERS CLOSER TO WRMR MAV GUID. IN DRY AMS
XPCT MIN RH/S TO DROP TO THE LWR AND MIDDLE 20 PERCENT RANGE. 10 HR 
FUEL MSTR VALUES RUNNING 5-6 PERCENT ACRS S CNTRL OH AND NRN KY AND
7-8 PERCENT ELSEWHERE. BOTH THESE ELEMENTS EXCEED THRESHOLD VALUES
OF 25 PERCENT RH AND 8 PERCENT FUEL MSTR. THEREFORE...WL ISSUE RED
FLAG WARNING FOR THIS AFTN. XPCT SFC WND TO BE IN 10 TO 15 MPH 
RANGE.

BASED ON DRY AMS AND LGT WND REGIME OVRNGT A GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING
SCENARIO SHUD BE OBSERVED. DRIEST DWPTS SHUD BE OVR CMH ZONE TNGT.
WL INDICATE A RANGE OF TEMPS IN MST LOCATIONS. GUID HS COME IN 
CONSIDERABLY COOLER THAN LAST RUN. WL TREND FCST LOWS TO COOLER VALUES
AND INDICATE POTENTIAL FOR SCTD FROST TNGT BUT WL HOLD OFF ON 
ISSUANCE OF FROST ADVSY.

MID LVL RDGG TO BLD E INTO OH VLY ON SUN AND THEN FLATTEN MON AS 
WESTERLIES PUSH E ACRS NRN TIER INTO GRTLKS. WL INDICATE A CAT WRMUP
ON SUN WITH MSTLY SUNNY COND CONTG. AGN FWC GUID APPEARS TOO COOL. 
HV TRENDED FCST TOWARD WRMR MAV GUID.

.ILN...RED FLAG WARNING FOR CWA THIS AFTERNOON. 

RANDALL
