@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 271813
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
210 PM EDT FRI APR 27 2001

EXTREMELY BENIGN PATTERN SETTING UP FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS WITH 
NO SIGN OF PRECIP THROUGH FCST WITH POSSIBLE XCPTN OVERNIGHT 
MON/TUES.

H5 RIDGE TO TRANSLATE EAST OVER THE NEXT DAY OR TWO AND SLOWLY BREAK 
DOWN AS A BROADER RIDGE SETS UP OVER ERN 2/3 OF COUNTRY FOR EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. THICKNESSES BECOMING A BOTHER AS ONE OR TWO STATIONS 
SHOWING A DECREASE IN THICKNESS WITH A CORRELATING INCREASE IN 
TEMPS. 

AXIS OF H8 RIDGE PASSING FROM W TO E OVER FCST AREA OVERNIGHT SAT 
SHOULD BRING THE LAST CHANCE FOR COOL OVERNIGHT TEMPS. AFTER 
THIS...H8 TEMPS WARM TO +10 OR BETTER AND ANY RADIATIONAL COOLING 
AFTER THIS SHOULD ONLY BE ABLE TO DROP MINS TO THE 50S. WILL GO WITH 
THE TREND AND GRADUALLY INCREASE DAYTIME HIGHS AND NIGHTTIME LOWS 
WITH TIME...MAXING OUT IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 80S AND UPPER 50S TO 
AROUND 60, RESPECTIVELY.

FLY IN THE OINTMENT COULD BE OVERNIGHT MON INTO TUES WHERE INCREASE 
IN H7 MOISTURE NOTED AND AVN MODEL PAINTING SOME PRECIP FOR FCST 
AREA. THIS WOULD CUT TEMPS BY A BIT...AND WILL KEEP DRY AT THE 
MOMENT WITH UNCERTAINTY IN THE STRENGTH OF THE S/W MOVING THROUGH AT 
THIS TIME. 

WX CONCERN WILL BE DRYNESS AND POSSIBILITY OF FIRE WX HAZARDS WITH 
LOW DAYTIME HUMIDITIES INTO NEXT WEEK. THANKFULLY...WINDS ARE NOT 
GOING TO BE A MAJOR PLAYER AS HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES FCST.

.ILN...NONE. 

FRANKS/HICKMAN




ERN GRTLKS AND ST. LAWRENCE RVR VLY. WK S/WV OVR UPR MS RVR VLY TO 
DROP SE PROVIDING WK PVA THIS AFTN TO SRN OH/NRN KY. CDFNT FM CNTRL 
LWR MI THRU NRN IL INTO CNTRL PLNS TO DROP S OF OH RVR BY 00Z. FORCING
IS WEAK WITH THIS SYS. WK SFC-H8 CNVRGC XPCTD DURG THE AFTN. ETA SFC
DWPTS INITIALIZED TOO HI OVR MID MS VLY. XPCT SFC DPWTS TO INCRS INTO
UPR 40S BUT NOT AS HI AS ETA IS INDICATING. LO LVL CNVRGC...ALONG 
WITH SFC HTG AND MARGINAL INSTBY SHUD LEAD TO WDLY SCTD SHWRS AND 
PERHAPS A TSTM INVOF OF FNT. WL CUT BACK ON CURR FCST TO JUST A 20 
POP DURG AFTN HRS. UPSTREAM HI TEMPS...FCST LO LVL THICKNESS AND
ENERGY BLOCK METHOD SUGG HI/S IN UPR 70S ACRS THE FAR S. WL ADJUST
FCST HI/S UP A LTL TDA.

LOOKS TO BE GOOD RAD COOLING NIGHT. XPCT LOWS A COUPLE DEGS COOLER 
THAN GUID. 

SFC HI PRES TO BLD SE INTO GRTLKS ON SAT. THIS HI WL PROVIDE 
SUBSIDENCE...DRY WX AND COOLER TEMPS. A MOST ONLY XPCT SOME THIN
CI CLDS. HI TEMPS CLOSE TO GUID.

FIRE WEATHER WISE...CRITERIA FOR RED FLAG WARNING APPEARS JUST BELOW 
THRESHOLD TDA. 10 HR MSTR VALUES BTWN 7-8 PERCENT...TRANSPORT WINDS 
ARND 15 MPH...BUT SFC RH XPCTD TO BE NR 30 PERCENT THIS AFTN. GIVEN
THIS SCENARIO DO NOT XPCT RED FLAG WRNG.

.ILN...NONE.

A WEAK PERTUBATION OR TWO INDICATED TO TRY AND SQUEEZE THROUGH. 
ATTM...WILL ONLY GO WITH PC SKIES DURING PASSAGE OF THESE WEAK S/WS.

STRENGTH OF COOLER AIR BEHIND FRONT TO PLAY INTO 3RD PERIOD LOWS. 
RIGHT NOW WITH DRY AIRMASS...WILL LEAN ON COOL SIDE FOR SATURDAY 
MORNING LOWS...A LITTLE LESS COOLER ON NE WINDS AT CVG.

NO BIG CHANGES TO ZONES WITH AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

.ILN...FIRE WEATHER WATCH UNTIL 8 PM FOR SOUTHERN/EASTERN FCST AREA

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1010 AM EDT THU APR 26 2001

FEEL THAT FCST TEMPS NEAR 70 TODAY WILL BE THE HIGH END OF THE 
SPECTRUM...THOUGHT OF UPDATING FCST TO GO 65-70 BUT WILL LEAVE ALONE 
AS 70 SHOULD BE QUITE CLOSE. MIXING DOWN FROM H8 SHOULD BRING MID 
60S AIR DOWN...BUT BOUNDARY LAYER SHOULD WARM AN ADDITIONAL COUPLE 
OF DEGREES WITH FULL SUNSHINE AND LIGHT WINDS.

FIGURING ON MID 30S DEWPOINTS TO HANG TOUGH ACROSS REGION AND UPPER 
60S FOR MAX TEMPS...THIS LEADS TO RHS APPROACHING THE DANGER VALUE 
OF 25% FOR AREA FIREFIGHTERS. LIGHT TO NO WINDS ARE A PLUS...BUT 
HAVE ISSUED A RED FLAG WATCH FOR THIS AFTERNOON IN SRN AND ERN FCST 
AREA FOR A FEW ISOLATED AREAS THAT REACH THIS MINIMUM THRESHOLD.

NO CHANGES NECESSARY THIS MORNING.

.ILN...RED FLAG WATCH THIS PM FOR SOUTHERN/EASTERN FCST AREA.

FRANKS

THANKS TO JKL AND CLE FOR COORD.

FEEL THAT FCST TEMPS NEAR 70 TODAY WILL BE THE HIGH END OF THE 
SPECTRUM...THOUGHT OF UPDATING FCST TO GO 65-70 BUT WILL LEAVE ALONE 
AS 70 SHOULD BE QUITE CLOSE. MIXING DOWN FROM H8 SHOULD BRING MID 
60S AIR DOWN...BUT BOUNDARY LAYER SHOULD WARM AN ADDITIONAL COUPLE 
OF DEGREES WITH FULL SUNSHINE AND LIGHT WINDS.

FIGURING ON MID 30S DEWPOINTS TO HANG TOUGH ACROSS REGION AND UPPER 
60S FOR MAX TEMPS...THIS LEADS TO RHS APPROACHING THE DANGER VALUE 
OF 25% FOR AREA FIREFIGHTERS. LIGHT TO NO WINDS ARE A PLUS...BUT 
HAVE ISSUED A FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR THIS AFTERNOON IN SRN AND ERN 
FCST AREA FOR A FEW ISOLATED AREAS THAT REACH THIS MINIMUM THRESHOLD.

NO CHANGES NECESSARY THIS MORNING.

.ILN...FIRE WEATHER WATCH THIS PM FOR SOUTHERN/EASTERN FCST AREA.

FRANKS







276 
FXUS61 KILN 261411
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1010 AM EDT THU APR 26 2001

FEEL THAT FCST TEMPS NEAR 70 TODAY WILL BE THE HIGH END OF THE 
SPECTRUM...THOUGHT OF UPDATING FCST TO GO 65-70 BUT WILL LEAVE ALONE 
AS 70 SHOULD BE QUITE CLOSE. MIXING DOWN FROM H8 SHOULD BRING MID 
60S AIR DOWN...BUT BOUNDARY LAYER SHOULD WARM AN ADDITIONAL COUPLE 
OF DEGREES WITH FULL SUNSHINE AND LIGHT WINDS.

FIGURING ON MID 30S DEWPOINTS TO HANG TOUGH ACROSS REGION AND UPPER 
60S FOR MAX TEMPS...THIS LEADS TO RHS APPROACHING THE DANGER VALUE 
OF 25% FOR AREA FIREFIGHTERS. LIGHT TO NO WINDS ARE A PLUS...BUT

@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 260710
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 AM EDT THU APR 26 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWING RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE STRETCHED FROM NEW 
ENGLAND INTO THE MID MS VLY.  SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS SKIES CLEAR 
OVER THE REGION.

MODELS ARE ALL IN AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL OF 
FA FOR THE NEXT 5 DAYS.  HOWEVER THERE WILL BE A WEAK COLD FRONT 
MOVE THROUGH ON FRIDAY.  THIS FRONT MAY TRIGGER A FEW SHRA/SPRINKLES 
IN CENTRAL OHIO AND FEW AFTERNOON SHRA/TSRA ACROSS SOUTHERN FA.  ETA 
SUGGESTS CAPE VALUES GREATER THAN 500 J/KG WHICH MAY BE UNDER DONE 
AS THE FORECAST WILL GO OUT WITH HIGHS WARMER THAN THE MODEL 
SUGGESTS. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE...EXCEPT FOR FRIDAY WHERE THE MAV...850 
TEMPS AND 1000-850 THICKNESSES SUGGEST A CAT RISE WOULD WORK OUT 
BETTER.  WILL ALSO GO CLOSER TO MAV NUMBERS ACROSS THE NORTH TONIGHT 
AS THETA-E PULLING AHEAD OF FRONT WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES A BIT 
WARMER.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

524 
FXUS61 KILN 251820
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EDT WED APR 25 2001


SURFACE HIGH REMAINS OVER THE FA TONIGHT.  WINDS WILL BE LIGHT AGAIN 
TONIGHT...AND WITH DEWPOINT TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 
30S ACROSS THE FA...TEMPERATURES SHOULD DIP INTO THE MID TO UPPER 
30S AGAIN.  WILL ISSUE FROST ADVISORY ACROSS THE SOUTH.

HIGH BEGINS TO SLIDE OFF TO THE EAST COAST TOMORROW...ALLOWING 
SLIGHTLY WARMER AIR TO WORK IN.  ATMOSPHERE IS STILL DRY...SO EXPECT 
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.

COLD FRONT DROPS DOWN ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES THURSDAY NIGHT.   
ETA/AVN ARE A LITTLE MORE GENEROUS WITH THE QPF.  BOTH MODELS ARE 
SHOWING GOOD 850 CONVERGENCE AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE WITH THE 
FRONT.  WITH THE DRYNESS OF THE ATMOSPHERE...WILL KEEP THURSDAY 
NIGHT DRY...BUT WILL MENTION INCREASING CLOUDS LATE.  CONVERGENCE 
WEAKENS ON FRIDAY AS THE FRONT PROGRESSES SOUTH. BEST LIFT WILL BE 
CLOSER TO THE LOW IN THE NORTHEAST...SO WILL ADD A 30 POP TO THE 
NORTH AND NORTHEAST COUNTIES.

NEW MOS TEMPERATURES LOOK IN THE BALL PARK...SO WONT TWEAK TOO MUCH.

THANKS TO CLE FOR THE COORDINATION.


.ILN...
IN...FROST ADVISORY TONIGHT INZ066-073>075-INZ080.
KY...FROST ADVISORY TONIGHT KYZ089>100.
OH...FROST ADVISORY TONIGHT OHZ070>072-077>082-OHZ088.

@RUKWBCe6KDENFXUS61 KILN 250754
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
353 AM EDT WED APR 25 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM NORTH OF LAKE 
ERIE TO TEXAS.  SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES A UPPER LEVEL WAVE 
MOVING INTO NORTHERN IL AND CLOUD SHIELD TO OUR SOUTHEAST.

MODELS ARE ALL CONSISTENT IN WEAKENING THIS WAVE AS IT MOVES EAST 
AND TRIES TO WORK THROUGH THE SURFACE RIDGE.  WESTERN FA WILL SEE 
SOME DEBRIS CLOUDS AS THE WAVE SLIDES TO OUR WEST/SOUTHWEST.  RIDGE 
SLOWLY SLIDES SOUTH TO EXTEND ACROSS OUR SOUTHERN FA.  THIS WILL 
BRING THE THREAT OF FROST ONCE AGAIN TO MAINLY OUR SOUTHERN FA.  
CONCERNED THAT TEMPS MAY FALL TO AROUND FREEZING IN VALLEYS ACROSS 
SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO AND NORTHEAST KENTUCKY IN THE RIDGE AXIS.  
HOWEVER THINK THERE IS AN EQUAL CHANCE THAT RIDGE AXIS WILL SET UP 
JUST FAR ENOUGH SOUTH AND KEEP TEMPS AND TDS A BIT WARMER AS A 
RESULT WILL LET DAY-SHIFT RESOLVE IF AND WHERE FROST HEADLINES WILL 
NEED TO BE ISSUED.

TEMPERATURES FORECAST A BIT TRICKY TODAY...EVEN THOUGH MODELS VERY 
SIMILAR.  LOW LEVEL THICKNESSES AND TEMPERATURES VARY TO 
SIGNIFICANTLY BETWEEN THE AVN AND ETA...ESPECIALLY THURSDAY.  FWC 
TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD DESPITE MODEL DIFFERENCES WILL ONLY MAKE 
MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.  BIGGEST CHANGE WAS MADE ON THURSDAY WHERE 2 TO 3 
DEGREES WILL BE ADDED TO FWC...WHICH IS MORE IN LINE WITH THE MAV.

MISILN ALREADY OUT AND THANKS TO JKL AND SDF FOR COOR.

.ILN...NONE.

TIPTON

LTST SFC ANALYSIS SHWS HI PRES RDG AXIS FM SE LWR MI THRU CNTRL IN
AND SRN IL. THIS RDG TO BLD SE BCMG CNTRD OVR OH BY MRNG. LTST IR 
SATL IMGRY SHWS MOSTLY CLR SKIES ACRS CWA. 00Z ILN SOUNDING SHWD SOME
HI LVL MSTR AND MSTR BTWN 4K FT AGL AND 6K FT AGL. A FEW PATCHES OF 
CLDS ARND 6K FT CONT OVR CNTRL OH. THESE CLDS ARE HI BASED REMNANTS
OF TDA/S CU. XPCT THESE CLDS TO CONT THIN OUT AND TRACK SE. CNVCTN HS
DVLPD ON THE BACKSIDE OF THIS RDG OVR UPR MS RVR VLY IN FAVORABLE LO 
LVL CNVRGC. SOME DEBRIS HI LVL CLDS SPILLING SE ACRS NRN IL INTO IN. 
THESE CLDS SHUD THIN AND WILL TRACK ACRS THE FA OVRNGT. WL CONT 
MSTLY CLR SKY COND WORDING.          

XPCT LOWS IN MID 30S ACRS THE N WHERE WNDS WL BE THE LOWEST. ACRS
THE S XPCT LOWS OF 35 TO 40. BASED ON GROWING SEASON CRITERIA WL 
MENT PATCHY FROST IN NRN ZONES AND WL CONT FROST ADVISORY IN THE S.  

.ILN...

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 241831
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EDT TUE APR 24 2001

UPPER TROF AXIS REMAINS TO OUR WEST.  SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
THROUGH OUR AREA BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z WEDNESDAY MORNING.  MORE SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY WILL ROUND THE BASE OF THE TROF LATE WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY...CAUSING THE TROF TO AMPLIFY AS ITS AXIS REACHES THE EAST 
COAST.  AVN AND ETA IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH SHORT WAVES...WITH AVN 
SHOWING STRONGER VORTICITY.

SFC MAP HAS HIGH MOVING INTO MISSOURI.  HIGH IS FCST TO STRETCH INTO 
OUR AREA TONIGHT...THEN TO NEW ENGLAND BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH 
RIDGING REMAINING OVER HERE THROUGH THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.  
THEREFORE WELL HAVE A DRY FCST...WITH A FEW CLOUDS AROUND FROM TIME 
TO TIME.

THOUGH MODELS SHOW 850 MB MOISTURE HANGING AROUND TONIGHT...CLOUDS 
WILL FALL APART AS SUNSET APPROACHES...SO ILL KEEP MOSTLY CLEAR 
FCST. SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS COMING DOWN IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT ARE 
PROGGED TO ARRIVE DURING WEDNESDAY...SO PARTLY CLOUDY WILL WORK FOR 
THEN.  MOSTLY CLEAR LOOKS GOOD FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH ONLY HIGH 
CLOUDS AROUND.  WILL GO WITH MOSTLY SUNNY ON THURSDAY WITH THE BULK 
OF MID LEVEL MOISTURE STAYING NORTH OF HERE.

FWC TEMPS APPEAR CLOSE TO TARGET WITH 30S FOR LOWS AND A GRADUAL 
WARMUP TO NEAR 70 ON THURSDAY.  WILL GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FWC TONIGHT 
ON CCF WITH METRO AREAS STAYING A BIT WARMER...BUT FCST LOWS IN 30S 
WILL STILL REQUIRE FROST ADVISORY IN THE SOUTH INCLUDING CINCI.

.ILN...
IN...FROST ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT FOR 
ZONES INZ066...INZ073>075...INZ080.

KY...FROST ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT FOR ZONES KYZ089>100.

OH...FROST ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT FOR ZONES 
OHZ070>072...OHZ077>082...OHZ088.

12Z UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS TROF AXIS JUST WEST OF OHIO.  STRONG 
SHORT WAVE WILL PASS NORTH OF HERE TODAY...WHILE A WEAKER WAVE 
STRETCHES OUT THROUGH KENTUCKY.  

SFC HIGH PRESSURE OVER OKLAHOMA/KANSAS WILL MOVE TO INDIANA BY 00Z 
THIS EVENING.  SATELLITE SHOWS LOTS OF CLOUDS LEFT OVER BEHIND LAST 
NIGHTS FRONT.  CLOUDS ARE BECOMING CUMULIFORM AS DRIER AIR MIXES IN 
FROM THE NORTHWEST.

WITH A FEW BREAKS IN CLOUDS NOW AND SLIGHT DRYING OCCURRING WILL 
UPDATE TO PARTLY SUNNY ALL ZONES.  FCST HIGH TEMPS IN MID 50S TO LOW 
60S LOOK GOOD.  WILL ALSO MAKE ADJUSTMENTS TO WINDS.

@RUKWBCe%KDENFXUS61 KILN 240737
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 AM EDT TUE APR 24 2001

KILN SHOWING COLD FRONT THROUGH ALL BUT SOUTHWEST OHIO/NORTHEAST KY 
WITH A FEW SHOWERS ALONG FRONT.  SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS COLDER AIR 
WORKING INTO WESTERN SECTIONS.  IR IMAGERY SHOWING SC DECK WITH BACK 
EDGE IN SOUTHWESTERN WI AND WESTERN IL.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT.  COLD FRONT PUSHES EAST OF FA 
BY 12Z WITH CAA AND CYCLONIC FLOW OVER FA THIS MORNING.  CLOUDS 
WILL BE MORE PESKY IN THE NORTHEAST (CMH) AND BEGIN TO BREAK UP BY 
EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR WORKS IN AND FLOW AT 925 AND 850 
BECOMES DIVERGENT.  RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL SET UP OVER FA AND 
DOMINATE THE EASTERN U.S. WEATHER THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  A 
NORTHWESTERLY WAVE TRIES TO BUCK THE RIDGE ON WEDNESDAY BRINGING 
SOME CLOUDS AND PERHAPS A SPRINKLE IN THE DAY/LIMA GROUP.  THINK 
CLOUDS WILL DISSIPATE RATHER QUICKLY AS THE DAY WEARS WITH PLENTY 
OF DRY AIR ENTRENCHED IN THE SURFACE RIDGE.

FWC TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD.  AM FEELING MORE OPTIMISTIC WITH THE 
CLOUDS TODAY AND THUS WARMER BUT NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO GO MUCH 
WARMER THAN FWC.  CONCERNED THAT MORE SUN ON WEDNESDAY WILL RESULT 
IN WARMER TEMPS BUT AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER STILL IN QUESTION.  
OVERNIGHT LOWS TONIGHT LOOK GOOD.  WILL MENTION FROST POSSIBLE EVERY 
WHERE AND LEAVE HEADLINE TO DAY SHIFT ACROSS THE SOUTH AS ETA 
SURFACE TDS WHERE NEAR 40.  BELIEVE THIS IS TO WARM.  (NOTE:  
NORTHERN FA FROST/FREEZE HEADLINES BEGIN APRIL 27TH.)   

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.   THANKS TO CLE AND IWX FOR COOR.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON




321 
FXUS61 KILN 240737
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 AM EDT TUE APR 24 2001

KILN SHOWING COLD FRONT THROUGH ALL BUT SOUTHWEST OHIO/NORTHEAST KY 
WITH A FEW SHOWERS ALONG FRONT.  SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS COLDER AIR 
WORKING INTO WESTERN SECTIONS.  IR IMAGERY SHOWING SC DECK WITH BACK 
EDGE IN SOUTHWESTERN WI AND WESTERN IL.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT.  COLD FRONT PUSHES EAST OF FA 
BY 12Z WITH CAA AND CYCLONIC FLOW OVER FA THIS MORNING.  CLOUDS 
WILL BE MORE PESKY IN THE NORTHEAST (CMH) AND BEGIN TO BREAK UP BY 
EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR WORKS IN AND FLOW AT 925 AND 850 
BECOMES DIVERGENT.  RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL SET UP OVER FA AND 
DOMINATE THE EASTERN U.S. WEATHER THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  A 
NORTHWESTERLY WAVE TRIES TO BUCK THE RIDGE ON WEDNESDAY BRINGING 
SOME CLOUDS AND PERHAPS A SPRINKLE IN THE DAY/LIMA GROUP.  THINK 
CLOUDS WILL DISSIPATE RATHER QUICKLY AS THE DAY WEARS WITH PLENTY 
OF DRY AIR ENTRENCHED IN THE SURFACE RIDGE.

FWC TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD.  AM FEELING MORE OPTIMISTIC WITH THE 
CLOUDS TODAY AND THUS WARMER BUT NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO GO MUCH 
WARMER THAN FWC.  CONCERNED THAT MORE SUN ON WEDNESDAY WILL RESULT 
IN WARMER TEMPS BUT AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER STILL IN QUESTION.  
OVERNIGHT LOWS TONIGHT LOOK GOOD.  WILL MENTION FROST POSSIBLE EVERY 
WHERE AND LEAVE HEADLINE TO DAY SHIFT ACROSS THE SOUTH AS ETA 
SURFACE TDS WHERE NEAR 40.  BELIEVE THIS IS TO WARM.  (NOTE:  
NORTHERN FA FROST/FREEZE HEADLINES BEGIN APRIL 27TH.)   

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.   THANKS TO CLE AND IWX FOR COOR.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

WILL MAKE A QUICK UPDATE TO REMOVE THUNDERSTORMS AND INCREASE THE

COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM ABOUT LANSING MI SOUTHWEST THROUGH 
CENTRAL INDIANA.  COLD FRONT WILL BE NEAR THE OHIO/INDIANA BORDER BY 
11 PM...TO A DAYTON/CINCINNATI LINE AROUND MIDNIGHT...AND THEN TO 
COLUMBUS TO A PORTSMOUTH LINE AROUND 3 AM.  KILN SOUNDING SHOWED A 
CAPPING INVERSION.  ALTHOUGH THIS WILL MODIFY SOMEWHAT DUE TO THE 
APCHING FRONT...BELIEVE THUNDERSTORM THREAT HAS DIMINISHED GREATLY.  
AN ISOLD TSTM IS STILL POSSIBLE...BUT I DO NOT THINK IT IS HIGH 
ENOUGH TO CARRY IN THE ZONES.

718 
FXUS61 KILN 231839
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EDT MON APR 23 2001

UPPER TROF MOVING IN FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL CROSS OUR 
REGION BY WEDNESDAY BEFORE RIDGE BUILDS BACK IN BY THE WEEKEND. 
SHORT WAVE TRAVELING UP EAST SIDE OF TROF WILL AFFECT US TONIGHT. 

SFC MAP SHOWS 997 MB LOW CRANKING THROUGH NORTHERN WISCONSIN...WITH 
A STRONG COLD FRONT (30F TEMP GRADIENT) MOVING THROUGH ILLINOIS.  
MODELS AGREE TAKING LOW TO QUEBEC BY 12Z TUESDAY AS FRONT MOVES 
ACROSS OHIO.  

ETA STILL UNDERESTIMATING QPF FOR CURRENT TSRA OVER ILLINOIS.  ETA 
HAS INCREASED TONIGHTS QPF FOR OUR AREA...WITH ETA AND AVN QPF NOW 
CONVERGING AT AROUND .20.  MODELS LOOK GOOD BRINGING PRECIP TO OUR 
WEST COUNTIES BY 00Z.  CAPPING AROUND 10KFT SHOULD LIMIT ACTIVITY IN 
OUR AREA OUT AHEAD OF THE FRONT. 

WITH PRECIP MORE CERTAIN THAN FWC POPS...WILL KEEP SHRA/TSRA FOR 
TONIGHT WHILE INCREASING POPS TO 80%...WITH UNTIL MIDNIGHT WORDING 
IN THE WEST.  WITH FRONT CONTINUING TO ACCELERATE WRT MODELS...WILL 
PULL CHANCE SHRA ON TUESDAY IN EAST. FAVORABLE LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES 
AND MOISTURE WARRANTS CONTINUATION OF MOSTLY CLOUDY FCST IN NORTH ON 
TUESDAY. PARTLY SUNNY WILL WORK IN THE SOUTH WITH LESS LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INDICATED.

HIGH BUILDING IN BY TUESDAY NIGHT WILL BRING DRY AIR AT MOST LEVELS 
...WITH ETA SHOWING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ACROSS CENTRAL OHIO.  WILL 
KEEP MOSTLY CLEAR IN WEST AND GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY IN OUR EASTERN 
COUNTIES.  ON WEDNESDAY...SHORT WAVE MOVING DOWN FROM THE WESTERN 
GREAT LAKES WILL PUSH SOME LOW AND MID LEVEL MOISTURE OUR WAY...SO 
PARTLY SUNNY WILL WORK THEN.

FWC TEMPS ARE NOT LOW ENOUGH WRT RAPID TEMP DROP BEHIND FRONT.  WILL 
GO 1-3 DEGREES BELOW FWC TONIGHT TOWARD MESOETA.  WILL STAY CLOSE TO 
FWC ON TUESDAY WITH TEMPS REBOUNDING INTO 50S BEHIND FRONT.  
ACCORDING TO ETA TEMP/DEWPOINT PROGS...FWC TOO LOW FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT...SO ILL GO A COUPLE DEGREES ABOVE. WILL STAY CLOSE TO FWC 
AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY WITH SLOW WARMUP EXPECTED.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO












1025 AM EDT MON APR 23 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS RIDGE ALONG EAST COAST WITH GREAT PLAINS 
TROF MOVING TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY.  SHORT WAVE MOVING UP SOUTHEAST 
FLANK OF TROF WILL AFFECT OUR AREA THIS EVENING INTO TONIGHT.

SFC MAP SHOWS 998 MB LOW OVER SOUTHEAST MINNESOTA.  STRONG COLD 
FRONT IS HANGING SOUTH OF LOW THROUGH MISSOURI AND IOWA...WITH 25F 
TEMP GRADIENT ACROSS FRONT.  MODELS SHOWS FRONT NEARING OUR WESTERN 
PERIPHERY BY 00Z THIS EVENING. 

SATELLITE SHOWS LINE OF CONVECTION ALONG FRONT OVER MISSOURI HEADED 
IN OUR GENERAL DIRECTION...WITH MESOETA UNDERESTIMATING QPF AND AVN 
GIVING A BETTER REPRESENTATION.  WILL NEED TO MONITOR LINE AS IT 
COULD ACCELERATE AHEAD OF MODEL PROGS AND REACH HERE BEFORE DAYTIME 
HEATING HAS DISAPPEARED.  MODELS BLOW UP TSRA OVER ILLINOIS AND 
INDIANA THIS AFTERNOON...THEN WEAKEN THEM AFTER DARK AS THEY MOVE 
THROUGH OUR AREA...WITH AVN SHOWING MORE PERSISTENT ACTIVITY.  

WILL KEEP PARTLY SUNNY FCST FOR NOW.  FCST HIGH TEMPS IN UPPER 
70S-LOW 80S LOOK GOOD WRT MORNING SOUNDING.  WILL UPDATE TO ONLY TO 
ADJUST WINDS.

.ILN...NONE.

ONE MORE DAY OF SUMMER-LIKE TEMPS BEFORE COLD FRONT MOVES THRU 
TONIGHT. NICE UPR LOW IN THE PLAINS WILL PULL NE TAKING BEST 
DYNAMICS WITH IT. CWFA LOOKS TO POSSIBLY GET IN THE SPLITS TONIGHT 
AS UPR LOW HEADS FOR LAKES AND BEST INSTABILITY STAYS SOUTH. ETA 
DOING THE BEST JOB DEPICTING THE CURRENT PRECIP OVER THE PLAINS AND 
THINK ITS FASTER/WEAKENING TREND MAKES THE MOST SENSE. WILL KEEP 
POPS LIKELY TONIGHT BUT IT LOOKS LIKE A FAIRLY QUICK SHOT AS FRONT 
IS OVER THE EAST BY 12Z. WILL LINGER A MRNG POP IN THE EAST AS PER 
CURRENT FCST. 

WE SHOULD SEE PTSUNNY SKIES AGAIN TDY WITH SOME INCREASE OF LOWER 
CLDS IN THE WEST THIS AFTN. TEMPS SHOULD BE ABOVE GUID NUMBERS 
AGAIN...ESP IN THE EAST. SOUTH WINDS WILL INCREASE AS FRONT 
APPROACHES AND WITH GOOD MIXING THINGS COULD GET KIND OF GUSTY. WILL 
SPLIT DIFFERENCE OF AVN/NGM GUID TONIGHT ON AS COLD AIR COMES IN 
FAIRLY QUICKLY. WILL NOT SEE MUCH RECOVERY OF TEMPS ON TUES WITH 
GOOD CAA AND MOCLDY SKIES. WILL KEEP CHC RW IN THE NORTH WED AS WEAK 
SYS SWINGS THRU LAKES.  

.ILN...NONE.

INDICTG SOME ELVTD INTBLTYS OVRNGT...ESPCLY ACRS THE W. HAV HAD A 
TUF TIME GETTING THUNDER PAST FEW NGTS WITH SIMILAR PARAMTERS SO WL 
ONLY MENTION THUNDER IN THE NW AND JUST GO WITH SHWRS ELSWR. DPR 
MSTR AND FORCING SHIFTS OFF TO THE N FAIRLY QUICKLY ON SUN SO WL 
TAPER PCPN OFF SW TO NE THRU THE MRNG HRS. TROF APRCHG FM THE W ON 
MON ALLOWS FOR SOME BRIEF RDGG ACRS FA SUN NGT INTO ERLY MON. ETA A 
LTL FASTER THAN AVN WITH APRCH OF TROF AND ASCTD CDFNT LATE MON... 
HINTING AT A CHC OF PCPN ACRS THE FAR W TWD 00Z TUE. BEST CHC FOR 
PCPN STILL LOOKS TO BE MON NGT SO WL TRY AND LEAVE MON DRY FOR NOW. 

FAIR AMT OF SUN HAS ALLOWED FOR SOME PRETTY GOOD WINDS TO MIX DOWN 
ACRS AREA THIS AFTN. WL INDICT DCRSG WNDS OVRNGT BUT THEY SHUD STILL 
STAY UP SOMEWHAT SO WL GO AT OR JUST ABOVE GUID TMPS FOR LOWS. 8H 
TMPS AND LLVL TCKNSS ON SUN INDTCTG TMPS A LTL WRMR THAN TDA...INTO 
THE UPR 70S TO ARND 80. THINK WL SEE MORE WRMG INTO MON WITH GOOD 
SWLY FLOW CONTG SO WL TREND TWD MUCH WRMR MAV TMPS FOR HIGHS. 

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT







AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EDT SAT APR 21 2001

MDLS IN DECENT AGRMT TNGT INTO SUN INDTCTG A WK MID LVL S/W PUSHG 
ENE ACRS FA LATE TNGT AND SUN MRNG. THIS IS IN COMBINATION WITH 
INCRSG SWLY FLOW AT BOTH 850 AND 925 MB OVRNGT JUST TO OUR SW. AS A 
RESULT...LLVL CONV BNDRY SETS UP W TO E ACRS NRN 2/3 OF FA AFT 06Z 
TNGT AND CONTS INTO SUN MRNG. XPCT TO SEE SOME PCPN RDVLP AGN LATER 
TNGT ACRS MUCH OF FA WITH BEST CHC ACRS THE FAR N...TAPERING OFF TO 
THE S...AND WL BREAK OFF A GROUP ACRS THE FAR S TO LEAVE DRY. MDLS 
INDICTG SOME ELVTD INTBLTYS OVRNGT...ESPCLY ACRS THE W. HAV HAD A 
TUF TIME GETTING THUNDER PAST FEW NGTS WITH SIMILAR PARAMTERS SO WL 
ONLY MENTION THUNDER IN THE NW AND JUST GO WITH SHWRS ELSWR. DPR

AFTN. 06Z MESOETA SHWG DECENT INSTBLTY DVLPG ACRS NW FA THRU LATE 
AFTN WITH CAPES APRCHG 1000 J/KG. HOWEVER...NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF 
FORCING LEFT BY THAT TIME. THUS...XPCT BEST CHC FOR ANY PCPN IN THE 
N TO BE THRU ERLY AFTN AS PCPN ACRS NRN IND CONTS TO PUSH ENE. WL GO 
AHD AND LWR POPS FOR THE N BUT WL ALSO AND A CHC OF THUNDER. 
MEANWHILE...STILL A FEW SHWRS LINGERING ACRS SE PORTIONS OF FA 
BUT XPCT THESE TO BE OUT OF AREA WITHIN NEXT CPL HRS. WL KP LOW CHC 
POPS FOR SHWRS THROUGH NOON OR SO TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS.  CUD SEE SOME 
SUN THIS AFTN...ESPCLY ACRS THE S...BUT THINK GNRL CLD TREND WL BE 
MSTLY CLDY TDA. HOWEVER...STILL XPCT SWLY FLOW TO ALLOW TEMPS TO 
MAKE IT INTO THE 70S PER CRNT FCST. 

.ILN...NONE.

POPS AS YOU GO SOUTH. RAIN LOOKS TO EXIT ARND MIDDAY WITH LLVLS 
WARMING HELPING TO CAP AMS. SECOND ROUND OF RAIN OVER IA/MO SHOULD 
DISSIPATE AND HEAD NE...STAYING OUT OF AREA. RAIN TOMORROW NIGHT

LITTLE MORE DIFFICULT WITH AMOUNT OF SUN IN QUESTION TDY. WILL STICK 
CLOSE TO CURRENT FCST.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
211 PM EDT FRI APR 20 2001

18Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A WARM FRONT EXTENDING FROM NW OH INTO 
CENTRAL OH. SHARP TEMP BOUNDARY STILL EXISTED BTWN IN AND RAIN 
COOLED AIR OVER FA.

MODELS INDICATE ANOTHER LLVL JET DEVELOPING TONIGHT ACROSS THE MS 
AND OH VLYS IN RESPONSE TO SYSTEM LIFTING OUT INTO THE PLAINS.  THIS 
SHOULD INTERACT WITH THE TEMP BOUNDARY TO PRODUCE ANOTHER AREA OF 
RAINFALL OVERNIGHT.  BOTH ETA/NGM ARE PROGING ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
SO WL GO WITH SHRA/TSRA LIKELY ALL AREAS XPCT CHC VC PMH.  TIMING 
LOOKS TO BE AFTER MIDNIGHT SO WL WORD ACCORDINGLY.

WL KEEP A LOW POP ON SAT DUE TO LEFTOVERS FROM THE OVERNIGHT 
ACTIVITY.  HOWEVER...MUCH OF DAY SHOULD BE DRY WITH ANOTHER CHC IN 
THE PM HOURS WITH SOME HEATING MAINLY VC DAY AND NRN MIAMI VLY. 
ANOTHER MCS EXPECTED ON SAT NIGHT SHOULD ONLY AFFECT NRN FA SO WL 
CARRY CHC POPS DAY-CMH AND LEAVE CVG-PMH DRY.

STRONG MID LVL SYSTEM WL LIFT OUT OF THE SWRN US TROF WHICH SHOULD 
CAUSE STRONG RIDGING ACROSS FA ON SUN.  WL GO WITH A DRY FCST.

WL MAKE LAST MINUTE CALL FOR TEMPS TONIGHT WITH CURRENT READINGS IN 
SPOTS BLO FCST LOWS.  WL GO A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR LATER 
PERIODS.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 200700
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 AM EDT FRI APR 20 2001

LATEST MODEL GUID...SUPPORTED BY RADAR/SAT IMAGERY...SUGGESTS 
INITIAL SHOT OF PCPN WL END RATHER QUICKLY FROM THE WEST THRU ERLY 
AFTN.  STRONG WAA COINCIDENT WITH NICE DPVA DRIVING INCRSG AREA OF 
SHRA/TSRA OVER INDIANA ATTM...WITH LIFT ENHANCED BY BULLSEYE OF 
DIVERGENCE ALOFT.  JUST ENUF ELEVATED INSTABILITY TO SUPPORT GOOD 
CVRG THUNDER...AND WL KEEP MENTION OF THUNDER IN ERLY TDY.  UPPER 
SUPPORT PROGGED TO WEAKEN RAPIDLY LATER TDY...BUT ENUF LLVL FORCING 
REMAINS TO KEEP MENTION OF SCT SHRA THRU THE AFTN.  FAN/FWC IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT FOR HIGHS...IN LINE WITH PREV FCST. 

DECENT MCS POTNL TNGT...ESPLY OVER THE NORTH AND WEST CWFA.  NOSE OF 
H8 JET...STRONG THETA-E ADVECTION...AND PCPN EFFICIENCY BULLSEYE WL 
BE FOCUSED JUST TO OUR WEST.  850-300 THICKNESS CONTOURS FAVORABLE 
FOR AN ESE PROPAGATION INTO OUR AREA.  WL HIT POPS HARDEST (LIKELY) 
NW TAPERING TO LOW CHC SE.  NOCTURNAL CONVECTION ALWAYS MAKES FOR A 
TRICKY TEMPERATURE FCST...BUT FEEL FAIRLY CONFIDENT LEANING TWRD THE 
WARMER MAV NUMBERS WITH RATHER VIGOROUS SW FLOW.

TEMPS AND PCPN CVRG SATURDAY WL BE QUITE DEPENDENT ON THE EVOLUTION 
OF ANY OUTFLOWS FM TNGTS CONVECTION.  PLENTY OF POTNL FOR 
SIGNIFICANT WARMING GIVEN THE STRONG SW FLOW...BUT CLOUDS ARE OF 
CONCERN.  FEEL WE SHUD BE ABLE TO SEE SOME SUN HWVR...AND CONT 
CURRENT FCST WHICH LEANED TWRD THE WARMER AVN DERIVED GUID.  WL KEEP 
POPS IN THE CHC RANGE ALL ZONES...WITH THE HIGHEST IN THE NORTH. 

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE


@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 200131
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 PM EDT THU APR 19 2001

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS SHOWED HIGH PRESSURE SITUATED OFF THE SE COAST 
OF THE UNITED STATES.  MEANWHILE...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WAS LOCATED 
ACRS THE NRN AND CNTRL PLAINS STATES.

FCST PROBLEM FOR TONIGHT REVOLVES AROUND WHETHER TO INCREASE THE 
CHC/S FOR SHOWERS/TSTMS.  THE FOUR RUNS OF THE MESOETA MODEL HAS 
BEEN CONSISTENT ON DEVELOPING A COMPLEX OF PCPN...BEGINNING ACRS 
CNTRL ILLINOIS TONIGHT...GROWING AND EXPANDING IN COVERAGE AS IT 
PROPAGATES TOWARD THE REGION LATE TONIGHT/FRIDAY MORNING.  THE 
NATURE OF THE PCPN COMPLEX WILL BE OF AN ELEVATED ORIGIN.  S/WV 
REFLECTED AT 700 MB TO 500 MB IS CURRENTLY MOVING TOWARD THE MID MS 
RIVER VLY (AND VERIFIED BY WIND PROFILERS).  THIS IS ALSO ASSOCIATED 
WITH A DEVELOPING 250 MB JET IN WHICH THE OUR REGION WILL FIND 
ITSELF IN THE FAVORABLE LF QUAD BY MORNING.  AT THE SAME TIME...A 
925 MB TO 850 MB LOW LVL JET WILL NOSE INTO THE MIDDLE OHIO VLY 
OVERNIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING.  STRONG THETA E ADVECTION COMBINED 
WITH LOW LVL SPEED CONVERGENCE WILL PROVIDE THE LOW LEVEL DYNAMICS.  
AS OF THE RESULT OF THE ELEMENTS DESCRIBED ABOVE...FEEL CONFIDENT 
THAT A SIZABLE MCS WILL DEVELOP.  SOME HINTS OF THIS ARE NOTED BY 
LDS WHICH INDICATES A FEW LIGHTNING STRIKES OVER WRN ILLINOIS ATTM.  
WILL RAISE POPS TO NEAR 100 PERCENT WRN ZONES FOR LATE TONIGHT (PCPN 
BEGINNING SOMETIME BETWEEN 4 AM AND 6 AM)...AND CONTINUE THAT VALUE 
INTO FRIDAY MORNING.  WILL ALSO RAISE POPS FOR THE ERN ZONES
PCPN EFFICIENCIES INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF HEAVY RAIN.  THUS...I 
WILL INTRODUCE SOME HEAVY RAIN WORDING...MAINLY FOR THE WRN CWFA.

OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK OK AS OF NOW...BUT WILL TAKE ONE LAST LOOK 
BEFORE ZONE ISSUANCE TO SEE IF ANY ADJUSTING IS NEEDED.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN












315 
FXUS61 KILN 191945
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 PM EDT THU APR 19 2001

BROAD UPPER RIDGE DOMINATES CENTRAL CONUS WITH TROFS ALONG COASTS.  
MULTIPLE BURSTS OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL NUDGE RIDGE EASTWARD OVER 
THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AS WESTERN TROF MOVES TO THE GREAT BASIN.

MODELS DOING A GOOD JOB REPRESENTING SFC LOW OVER WESTERN SOUTH 
DAKOTA AT 18Z.  LOW IS PROGGED TO MOVE UP THE WEST SIDE OF UPPER 
RIDGE THROUGH MINNESOTA ON FRIDAY.  SHORT WAVE IN WARM ADVECTION 
SOUTHEAST OF THE LOW WILL INFLUENCE OUR WEATHER LATE TONIGHT AND 
FRIDAY.  ANOTHER SHORT WAVE AND ASSOC SFC LOW WILL TRACK UP THE WEST 
SIDE OF THE UPPER RIDGE ON SATURDAY...WITH THE LOW PROGGED TO BE A 
BIT FARTHER EAST OVER WISCONSIN.  

GENERALLY THE ETA GIVES US MORE QPF THAN THE AVN OVER OUR AREA OVER 
THE NEXT TWO DAYS...WITH THE AVN KEEPING MORE OF THE ACTIVITY NEAR 
THE LOW CENTER.  ETA QPF APPEARS OVERDONE...ESPECIALLY ON SATURDAY 
12Z WITH .30+ FROM WYOMING THROUGH OHIO. 

THOUGH THEY HAVE SLOWED A COUPLE HOURS FROM PREVIOUS RUN...MODELS 
STILL SHOW SHOWERS MOVING IN LATE TONIGHT.  WILL GO WITH SHRA LIKELY 
LATE IN WEST...WITH CHANCE SHRA TOWARD MORNING IN EAST. WILL 
CONTINUE MENTION OF POSSIBLE TSRA...THOUGH THREAT IS LOW WITH SFC 
EXPECTED TO BE STABLE AND FCST ELEVATED LAPSE RATES NOT THAT 
IMPRESSIVE EITHER.   

FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY IS A PROBLEM WITH DIVERGENT MODEL FCSTS.  ETA 
HAS AREA UNDER ISENTROPIC LIFT/WARM FRONT ASSOC WITH LOW MOVING 
THROUGH WISCONSIN.  AVN KEEPS LIFT NORTH OF HERE.  AVN GIVES US 
LITTLE IF ANY QPF...WHILE ETA COVERS US WITH UP TO .45 BY 12Z 
SATURDAY...WITH MORE AFTER 12Z.  SFC INSTABILITY MAY ALSO COME INTO 
PLAY IN WARM SECTOR ON SATURDAY.  WILL GO BETWEEN THE TWO SOLUTIONS 
WITH CHANCE SHRA/TSRA BOTH PERIODS. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK DECENT.  WILL DROP FRIDAYS FCST HIGHS TO MID/UPPER 
60S...STILL ABOVE FWCS 60-65...WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIP AROUND.  
WONT DEVIATE MUCH OTHER PERIODS AS FWC APPEARS TO HAVE GOOD HANDLE 
ON WARMING TREND.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO








@RUKWBCe-KDENFXUS61 KILN 191945
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 PM EDT THU APR 19 2001

BROAD UPPER RIDGE DOMINATES CENTRAL CONUS WITH TROFS ALONG COASTS.  
MULTIPLE BURSTS OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL NUDGE RIDGE EASTWARD OVER 
THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AS WESTERN TROF MOVES TO THE GREAT BASIN.

MODELS DOING A GOOD JOB REPRESENTING SFC LOW OVER WESTERN SOUTH 
DAKOTA AT 18Z.  LOW IS PROGGED TO MOVE UP THE WEST SIDE OF UPPER 
RIDGE THROUGH MINNESOTA ON FRIDAY.  SHORT WAVE IN WARM ADVECTION 
SOUTHEAST OF THE LOW WILL INFLUENCE OUR WEATHER LATE TONIGHT AND 
FRIDAY.  ANOTHER SHORT WAVE AND ASSOC SFC LOW WILL TRACK UP THE WEST 
SIDE OF THE UPPER RIDGE ON SATURDAY...WITH THE LOW PROGGED TO BE A 
BIT FARTHER EAST OVER WISCONSIN.  

GENERALLY THE ETA GIVES US MORE QPF THAN THE AVN OVER OUR AREA OVER 
THE NEXT TWO DAYS...WITH THE AVN KEEPING MORE OF THE ACTIVITY NEAR 
THE LOW CENTER.  ETA QPF APPEARS OVERDONE...ESPECIALLY ON SATURDAY 
12Z WITH .30+ FROM WYOMING THROUGH OHIO. 

THOUGH THEY HAVE SLOWED A COUPLE HOURS FROM PREVIOUS RUN...MODELS 
STILL SHOW SHOWERS MOVING IN LATE TONIGHT.  WILL GO WITH SHRA LIKELY 
LATE IN WEST...WITH CHANCE SHRA TOWARD MORNING IN EAST. WILL 
CONTINUE MENTION OF POSSIBLE TSRA...THOUGH THREAT IS LOW WITH SFC 
EXPECTED TO BE STABLE AND FCST ELEVATED LAPSE RATES NOT THAT 
IMPRESSIVE EITHER.   

FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY IS A PROBLEM WITH DIVERGENT MODEL FCSTS.  ETA 
HAS AREA UNDER ISENTROPIC LIFT/WARM FRONT ASSOC WITH LOW MOVING 
THROUGH WISCONSIN.  AVN KEEPS LIFT NORTH OF HERE.  AVN GIVES US 
LITTLE IF ANY QPF...WHILE ETA COVERS US WITH UP TO .45 BY 12Z 
SATURDAY...WITH MORE AFTER 12Z.  SFC INSTABILITY MAY ALSO COME INTO 
PLAY IN WARM SECTOR ON SATURDAY.  WILL GO BETWEEN THE TWO SOLUTIONS 
WITH CHANCE SHRA/TSRA BOTH PERIODS. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK DECENT.  WILL DROP FRIDAYS FCST HIGHS TO MID/UPPER 
60S...STILL ABOVE FWCS 60-65...WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIP AROUND.  
WONT DEVIATE MUCH OTHER PERIODS AS FWC APPEARS TO HAVE GOOD HANDLE 
ON WARMING TREND.

.ILN...NONE.

945 
FXUS61 KILN 190622
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
222 AM EDT THU APR 19 2001

SHIFT IN THE WX PATTERN COMING IN WITH H8 RIDGE PASSING OVER FCST 
AREA TODAY. LLJET SETS UP OVERNIGHT AND A PSEUDO WARM FRONT BEST 
SHOWN AT H7 LIFTS NE THROUGH CWA BY 12Z. THIS FRONT SHOULD BE FOCUS 
FOR SH/TS BEGINNING LATE OVERNIGHT FOR MUCH OF REGION. VIGOROUS S/W 
NOTED AT SAME TIME WITH STRONG UVV AND NOSE OF 50-60KT H8 JET. 

THOUGH SFC IS STABLE...ELEVATED CONVECTION SHOULD BE REALIZED 
OVERNIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY. A BREAK IN PRECIP EXPECTED DURING THE 
DAY...BUT CHANCE SH/TS TO COME BACK IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST BY EVENING 
WITH NEXT S/W APPROACHING. 

WITH TEMPS...LIKE THE THINKING OF SURROUNDING OFFICES WITH THE 
WARMER MAV/FAN NUMBERS ON SAT AND SAT PM...WITH A GENERAL AGREEMENT 
IN TEMPS NOTICED IN FIRST 2 PERIODS. THIS IS IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS 
FCST AND CURRENT THINKING. NO BIG CHANGES...JUST TIMING AND WORDING 
OF PRECIP COMING IN LATE THURS/EARLY FRIDAY AND AGAIN FRI PM INTO 
SAT. 

NOTE OF CONCERN IS THAT AVN IS NOT SHOWING THE SECOND SHOT OF PRECIP 
NOTED IN LAST FEW PERIODS OF ETA. FEEL THAT IT WILL BE DIFFICULT TO 
GET NEXT S/W AND ELEVATED FRONT TO NOT RAIN.

FROST WARNING EXPIRES AT 8 AND WILL LET IT DIE A NATURAL DEATH.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

940 PM EDT WED APR 18 2001

00Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED AN AXIS OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING FROM 
THE LOWER MS VLY NE INTO THE MIDDLE OHIO VLY.

REGION WILL CONT UNDER A NWLY FLOW ALOFT OVERNIGHT.  THUS...AM ONLY 
EXPECTING A SCATTERING OF HIGH CLOUDS.  DEWPOINTS ARE CURRENTLY IN 
THE LOWER AND MID 20S.  EVEN THOUGH THESE MAY CREEP UP A LITTLE DUE 
TO A LIGHT SWLY FLOW...BELIEVE SHELTERED AREAS IN THE SRN CWFA WILL 
DROP TO NEAR 30 DEGREES TONIGHT (SUCH AS HAO AND ILN).  PMH AT 
930 PM WAS ALREADY DOWN TO 38 DEGREES.  THUS...HAVE DECIDED TO 
UPGRADE THE FROST ADVISORY TO A WARNING...OPENING UP A RANGE OF 30 
TO 35 DEGREES IN THE WARNING AREA.

.ILN...FROST WARNING TNGT SOUTHERN OHIO...NORTHERN KY...FAR SE 
       INDIANA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EDT WED APR 18 2001

WL CONT TO SEE SOME CI MV ACRS THE AREA IN THE NW FLOW...BUT GIVEN 
THE XPCTD THIN NATURE WL MAINTAIN MCLR FCSTS FOR TNGT.  SFC HIGH 
CENTER WL PASS TO OUR SOUTH...BUT STILL XPCT WINDS TO GO FAIRLY 
LIGHT IN THE RIDGE AXIS WHICH WL MV ACRS OVERNIGHT.  HV LEANED TWRD 
THE SLIGHTLY COOLER MAV TEMPS TNGT...A DEG OR 2 BLO THE FWC.  DECENT 
FROST CONDS TNGT ALL AREAS...AND WL ISSUE ADVISORY SOUTH PER LOCAL 
GUIDELINES.

MODEL TIMESXNS DEPICT A FAIR AMNT OF HIGH/MID CLOUD IN THE WAA 
PATTERN THU...AND WL WORD AS PSNY ALL ZONES.  FAIRLY SUBSTANTIAL 
WARMING...WITH THE ETA PROGGING 50+ METERS WARMER THAN TDY IN THE 
1000-850 LAYER.  STILL...FWC LKS A TAD WARM AND HV LEANED TWRD THE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER MAV NUMBERS.  

ETA INDCS THE WESTERN CWFA WILL BE AT THE NOSE OF A 60-70 KT LLVL 
JET LATE FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT ITS MODEL SOUNDINGS/INDICIES REMAIN 
STABLE.  NGM A LITTLE MORE UNSTABLE...SHOWING A FAIR AMNT OF LEVATED 
INSTABILITY BY 12Z FRI.  GIVEN THE AMNT OF FORCING FOR LIFT 
EXPECTED...CUD SEE SOME THUNDER EVEN WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY AND 
WL INCLUDE MENTION IN THE WEST.  WL KEEP POPS IN THE CHC RANGE NORTH 
AND WEST...AND INCLUDE AFTER MIDNIGHT WORDING.  WL KEEP THE SE DRY 
FOR NOW AS ANY PCPN SHUD HOLD OFF UNTIL AFT 12Z.  ETA QUITE 
AGGRESSIVE WITH QPF ON FRIDAY...IN STARK CONTRAST TO THE AVN WHICH 
IS NEARLY DRY OVER THE SOUTHERN 1/3.  WL COMPROMISE WITH LIKELY POPS 
NORTH AND WEST...CHC SE.  CLDS AND AREAS OF PCPN SHUD HOLD TEMPS 
DOWN A BIT...AND HV UNDERCUT THE FWC SLIGHTLY.

.ILN...FROST ADVISORY TNGT SOUTHERN OHIO...NORTHERN KY...FAR SE 
INDIANA.

AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 AM EDT WED APR 18 2001

FCST CONCERNS COMING UP WILL GENERALLY BE WITH REGARDS TO 
HIGHS/LOWS. MAIN PATTERN IS FOR AXIS OF H8 COLD AIR TO MOVE E OF 
FCST AREA AND SLOWLY WARM IN THE FIRST TWO PERIODS. AFTER THIS...H8 
RIDGE IS OVER TOP OF CWA EARLY THURS AND A RETURN TO WARMER TEMPS IS 
NOTED WITH INCREASING SW WIND. TEMPS CONCERN ON WED PM THROUGH THURS 
WILL BE DUE TO HI CLOUDS SPILLING OVER RIDGE.

WITH DECREASED MOISTURE AND FAIRLY SUNNY SKIES TODAY...WILL TREND 
WARMER THAN GUIDANCE FOR ALL AREAS BUT NORTHEAST. LOWS TONIGHT 
SHOULE BE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE...AND I LIKE THE WARMING TREND ON 
THURSDAY DAYTIME AND OVERNIGHT ALTHOUGH THICKNESSES AND H8 TEMPS 
SUPPORT COOLER HIGHS. 

GOOD LLVL JET TO SET UP LATE THURS TO THE SW WITH STRONG ISENTROPIC 
LIFT NOTED ACROSS OH VLY AND GT LKS REGION. S/W IS PROGGED TO PUSH 
INTO THIS AREA BY FRI MORNING, AND WEAK TROFFINESS NOTED AT H7 BUT 
NOT AT H5. LOOKING AT STABILITY, LIS STAY POSITIVE AND NO CAPE 
NOTED IN ETA MODEL AT 60 HOURS. HOWEVER, STRONG VEERING/SHEAR OF 
WINDS NOTED FROM SFC TO H8 COUPLED WITH NOSE OF LLVL JET AND 
INCREASED OMEGA WOULD SUGGEST SOME CONVECTION POSSIBLE, IF ONLY 
ELEVATED. WILL WAIT TO MENTION THUNDER FOR THURS NIGHT...BUT PASS ON 
TO NEXT SHIFT FOR A MORE DETAILED LOOK.

FREEZE WARNING EXPIRES AT 9 AM, AND TEMPS TOMORROW NIGHT SHOULD BE 
MARGINAL SO WILL NOT ISSUE ANY HEADLINES FOR SECOND PERIOD.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EDT TUE APR 17 2001

FAIRLY WDSPRD SHSN CONTG ACRS FA THIS AFTN WITH VSBYS OCNLY DRPG BLO 
1 MILE. THIS IS A COMBINATION OF DAYTIME HTG AND FINAL VORT MAX DRPG 
DOWN ACRS AREA. VORT AXIS PUSHES SE OF FA THRU ERLY EVNG AND WITH 
SS...XPCT SHSN TO TAPER OFF THRU LATE AFTN/ERLY EVNG.

SUBSDNC THEN DVLPS ACRS THE AREA OVRNGT WITH DRYING WORKING IN FM 
THE NW SO WL GO WITH CLRG SKIES NW TO SE. WNDS STAY UP OVRNGT BUT 
WITH CLRG SKIES AND TMPS ONLY RUNNING IN THE MID 30S ATTM...SHUD SEE 
TMPS DROP DOWN INTO THE MID 20S MOST AREAS. THUS...WL CONT WITH 
FREEZE WRNG FOR TONIGHT ACRS THE S. MEANWHILE...RECORD LOW FOR DAY 
IS 25 SO WL CARRY NEAR RECORD WORDING THERE. 

UPR LVL RDGG BEGINS TO NUDGE E INTO RGN AND THEN FLATTENS OUT INTO 
MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW THRU THURS.  MEANWWHILE...COLD POOL PROGD TO 
SHIFT SLOWLY E ON WED WITH WAA DVLPG THRU THE DAY ON THURS AS LLVL 
FLOW SWINGS ARND TO THE SW. MAY SEE SOME CU DVLPMT ACRS THE E WED 
WITH COLD POOL JUST TO OUR E AND A LTL BIT OF LLVL MSTR. WL GO PRTLY 
CLDY E AND MSTLY SUNNY W FOR WED AND THEN MSTLY CLR ALL AREAS WED 
NGT. CUD SEE SOME HI LVL MSTR WORKING IN ON THUR FOR PRTLY SUNNY 
SKIES.

WL STAY AT OR JUST BLO GUID TMPS FOR LOWS TNGT. LLVL THCKNSS AND 8H 
TMPS BOTH SUGGESTING GUID TMPS MAY BE A LTL WARM WITH HIGHS NXT CPL 
DAYS SO WL UNDERCUT A CAT OR SO. WL ALSO GO A LTL COOLER FOR WED NGT 
AS WE SHUD SEE SOME DECENT RAD COOLING.

.ILN...
IN...FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT FOR ZONES INZ066-073>075-080.
KY...FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT FOR ZONES KYZ089>100.
OH...FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT FOR ZONES OHZ070>072-077>082-088.

SS...XPCT SHSN TO TAPER OFF THRU LATE AFTN/ERLY EVNG.

SUBSDNC THEN DVLPS ACRS THE AREA OVRNGT WITH DRYING WORKING IN FM 
THE NW SO WL GO WITH CLRG SKIES NW TO SE. WNDS STAY UP OVRNGT BUT 
WITH CLRG SKIES AND TMPS ONLY RUNNING IN THE MID 30S ATTM...SHUD SEE 
TMPS DROP DOWN INTO THE MID 20S MOST AREAS. THUS...WL CONT WITH 
FREEZE WRNG FOR TONIGHT ACRS THE S. MEANWHILE...RECORD LOW FOR DAY 
IS 25 SO WL CARRY NEAR RECORD WORDING THERE. 

UPR LVL RDGG BEGINS TO NUDGE E INTO RGN AND THEN FLATTENS OUT INTO 
MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW THRU THURS.  MEANWWHILE...COLD POOL PROGD TO 
SHIFT SLOWLY E ON WED WITH WAA DVLPG THRU THE DAY ON THURS AS LLVL 
FLOW SWINGS ARND TO THE SW. MAY SEE SOME CU DVLPMT ACRS THE E WED 
WITH COLD POOL JUST TO OUR E AND A LTL BIT OF LLVL MSTR. WL GO PRTLY 
CLDY E AND MSTLY SUNNY W FOR WED AND THEN MSTLY CLR ALL AREAS WED 
NGT. CUD SEE SOME HI LVL MSTR WORKING IN ON THUR FOR PRTLY SUNNY 
SKIES.

WL STAY AT OR JUST BLO GUID TMPS FOR LOWS TNGT. LLVL THCKNSS AND 8H 
TMPS BOTH SUGGESTING GUID TMPS MAY BE A LTL WARM WITH HIGHS NXT CPL 
DAYS SO WL UNDERCUT A CAT OR SO. WL ALSO GO A LTL COOLER FOR WED NGT 
AS WE SHUD SEE SOME DECENT RAD COOLING.

.ILN...
IN...FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT FOR ZONES INZ066-073>075-080.
KY...FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT FOR ZONES KYZ089>100.
OH...FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT FOR ZONES OHZ070>072-077>082-088.

LOTT

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EDT TUE APR 17 2001

MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT IN SHORT TERM. SCATTERED -SN/FLURRIES TO 
CONTINUE FOR FCST AREA TODAY...ENDING MOST AREAS BY AFTERNOON WITH A 
CHANCE FOR -RA TO MIX IN BRIEFLY DURING DAYTIME HIGH. 

AS H5 LOW TRAILS EASTWARD...RIDGE OF SFC HI PRESSURE EXPECTED TO BE 
JUST WEST OF FCST AREA TONIGHT/WED AND SETTLE OVER AREA BY 12Z 
THURS. FCST TEMPS ON WED PM COULD BE TOO WARM WITH RELATIVELY LIGHT 
WINDS AND CLEAR/PC SKIES...BUT COLD POOL ALREADY OUT OF THE AREA 
WITH THERMAL RIDGE BUILDING TO THE WEST. GOOD WAA NOTED AFTER 
PASSAGE OF RIDGE FOR LATTER HALF OF WEEK.

WILL NOT STRAY MUCH FROM GUIDANCE AND PREVIOUS FCST...THINK THAT 
TEMPS ON WED MAY BE TOO WARM AS CU SHOULD HOLD WARMING A BIT. WILL 
CUT DIFFERENCE BETWEEN FWC AND COOLER FAN NUMBERS FOR 
HIGHS...OTHERWISE HOLDING NEAR GUIDANCE.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...

255 PM EDT MON APR 16 2001

NICE SHOWERS ARE DEVELOPING UP IN NE OH WITH SOME SHSN WORKING DOWN 
INTO NRN IN. UPR LOW OVER UPR MIDWEST WILL DIVE SOUTH OVERNIGHT 
BRINGING SHSN TO MUCH OF THE AREA. ANOTHER VORT WILL ROTATE ARND LOW 
TOMORROW AFTN AS WELL SO LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER CHC FOR SN/RW SHOWERS. 
NGM MOVES QUICKEST WITH THE SFC TROF BUT KEEPS ALL OF THE PRECIP 
BEHIND IT. ETA/AVN ARE SIMILAR BRINGING TROF THRU TOMORROW. AFT TUES 
VORT AND 850 THRMAL TROF...CLDS SHOULD START TO CLR OUT. WILL GO 
WITH DECREASING CLDS TUE NITE AND MOSUNNY WED. TEMPS ARE A BIG 
QUESTION WITH VARIABLE CLDS CVR AND WINDS. WILL GO AROUND 30 NW TO 
LOWER 30S ELSEWHERE. WILL KEEP NPW GOING SINCE TEMPS ARE BORDERLINE. 
TEMPS TDY ARE IN THE 30S OVER UPR MIDWEST SO AM INCLINED TO GO 
CLOSER TO AVN GUID TUE. WILL UNDERCUT GUID AGAIN WED A LITTLE WITH 
GOOD COLD AIR STILL OVER US.    

.ILN...

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 160638
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
238 AM EDT MON APR 16 2001

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN FORECASTING THAT COLD UPPER LOW 
CURRENTLY OVER NORTHERN MINNESOTA WILL DROP THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES 
AND INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY 48 HOURS.  

CLOUDS AND SCATTERED SHOWERS MOVING THROUGH INDIANA ARE ASSOCIATED 
WITH A SURFACE TROF. THIS FEATURES WILL SWING ACROSS THE FA THIS 
MORNING.  WILL ADD MENTION OF WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS TO THE 
NORTHERN HALF TODAY.  CLOUDS ARE A TOUGH CALL TODAY.  ETA CURU IS 
SHOWING OVC CLOUDS ALL DAY.  NGM CURU HOWEVER IS HINTING AT SOME 
DRYING WORKING IN DURING THE AFTERNOON. SINCE THE STRONGEST CAA 
DOESNT KICK IN UNTIL TONIGHT...WILL BE A LITTLE OPTIMISTIC AND WILL 
GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES IN THE SOUTH.

1000-850 THICKNESSES DROP BELOW 1300M QUICKLY TONIGHT.  WILL 
CONTINUE WITH MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS NORTH AND RAIN SHOWERS TURNING 
TO SNOW SHOWERS SOUTH.  BIGGER QUESTION IS WHETHER OR NOT TO MENTION 
ANY ACCUMULATIONS.  BUFKIT DATA IS SHOWING ABOUT A TENTH OF AN INCH 
OF QPF OVERNIGHT...WHICH WOULD TRANSLATE TO ABOUT AN INCH.  WARM 
GROUND FROM THE RECENT WARM SPELL SHOULD EAT AWAY AT SOME OF THE 
SNOW HOWEVER.  WILL GO WITH LESS THAN AN INCH OF ACCUMULATION.

SINCE A LOT OF THE PUBLIC HAD BEEN WORKING OUTSIDE RECENTLY WILL 
ISSUE A FROST WARNING FOR TONIGHT.  THIS WILL ALLOW MORE TIME FOR 
THE PUBLIC TO TAKE ACTION...RATHER THAN WAITING UNTIL 4 PM.

SCATTERED RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE TUESDAY AS LOW PULLS AWAY.  
COULD BE CLOSE TO SOME RECORDS TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT SINCE THAT IS 
4TH PERIODS WILL NOT MENTION RECORDS IN THE ZFP RIGHT NOW.  DONT 
SEE THE CLEAR SKIES THE NGM MOS IS FORECASTING ON TUESDAY NIGHT.  
WILL GO PARTLY CLOUDY.

TREND OF TEMPERATURES HAS BEEN DOWN.  WONT STRAY TO MUCH FROM THE 
NEW MOS.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.


.ILN...
IN...FREEZE WARNING TONIGHT INZ066-INZ073>075-INZ080.
KY...FREEZE WARNING TONIGHT KYZ089>100.
OH...FREEZE WARNING TONIGHT OHZ070>072-OHZ077>082-OHZ088.

SITES

847 PM EDT SUN APR 15 2001

UPDATED A SHORT TIME AGO TO ACCOUNT FOR LIGHT RAIN THAT HAS 
DEVELOPED DAYTON NORTH AND EASTWARD.  THIS APPEARS TO BE IN RESPONSE 
TO SOME CONVERGENCE ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW...WHICH IS CURRENTLY 
OVER NORTHERN WV.

DONT PLAN ON UPDATING UNTIL PRECIP LEAVE THE DAYTON/WAPAK AREAS OR 
IT IS EVIDENT THAT IT WILL LAST PAST MIDNIGHT.  WILL CONTINUE TO 
WATCH CLEARING OVER WESTERN/NORTHWESTERN INDIANA TO SEE IF SKY COVER 
NEEDS TO BE ADJUSTED WITH UPDATE.  OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK 
REASONABLE.     

.ILN...NONE.

SFC LOW MOVING INTO ERN OH WITH NARROW BAND OF PRECIP ALONG TRAILING 
BOUNDARY. THIS BAND WILL BE GOING THROUGH ERN COUNTIES SO WILL KEEP 
MENTION FOR THIS EVE THERE. OTHERWISE JUST CLDS FOR TONIGHT AND MUCH

MOVES THROUGH LATE TOMORROW. WE START TO SEE GOOD CAA AT 850 BY 
MORNING AND THIS PAIRED WITH CLDS WILL MEAN LITTLE TEMP RISE. TEMPS 
UPSTREAM ARE GENERALLY IN THE LOWER 40S AND THINK THIS IS REASONABLE 
CONSIDERING HOW LITTLE TEMPS ROSE TODAY. THE CHC FOR MIXED PRECIP 
WILL COME LATE MONDAY NW AND MONDAY NIGHT ELSEWHERE AS STRONG UPR 
LOW AND CAA COMBINE. THE CHC LOOKS TO LINGER INTO TUE AS SFC 
REFLECTION SWINGS THRU. SOME TS POSSIBLE WITH THIS AS TEMPS ALOFT 
ARE SO COLD...BUT WILL LEAVE OUT FOR NOW AS BEST CHC FOR PRECIP IS 
COMING MON NITE. BLO FREEZING TEMPS WILL AFFECT AREA FOR 2 OR 3 
NIGHTS BUT THEN A MODERATING TREND FOR END OF WEEK.     

.ILN...NONE.

145 
FXUS61 KILN 150640
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EDT SUN APR 15 2001

MODELS ARE CONVERGING TOWARDS A SIMILAR SOLUTION THIS MORNING.  
YESTERDAY...THE ETA WAS ONLY MODEL WITH CLOSED SURFACE LOW IN THE 
OHIO VALLEY BY 12Z THIS MORNING.  ETA HAS TRENDING SLOWER WITH THE 
LOW NOW WITH IT IN CENTRAL IL...BUT THE NGM AND ETA NOW ARE FARTHER 
EAST.  ETA IS A LITTLE FARTHER NORTH WITH THE LOW VERSES THE NGM/AVN 
AS IT CROSSES THE FA TODAY.  LI DROP TO -2 TO -4 TODAY ACROSS THE 
SOUTH.  WITH 40 KNOT 850 JET FEEDING UP AHEAD OF LOW...WILL MENTION 
A CHANCE OF SEVERE IN THE SOUTHEAST.

AFTER LOW PASSES TO THE EAST...COLD ADVECTION BEGINS.  FEEL THAT 
THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTH TONIGHT AND 
MONDAY IN THE CAA.  1000-850 THICKNESSES DROP BELOW 1300M MONDAY 
NIGHT...SO THE MENTION OF RAIN/SNOW STILL LOOKS GOOD.

NGM MOS WAS REALLY TURNED COLD TODAY...AND WITH NO AVN MOS WILL 
TREND TOWARDS CURRENT FORECAST NUMBERS. I KNOW ITS APRIL...BUT WITH 
EXTREMELY COLD AIRMASS DROPPING ACROSS FA...WILL KNOCK 2 TO 3 
DEGREES OFF HIGHS FOR MONDAY.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCe(KDENFXUS61 KILN 150640
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EDT SUN APR 15 2001

MODELS ARE CONVERGING TOWARDS A SIMILAR SOLUTION THIS MORNING.  
YESTERDAY...THE ETA WAS ONLY MODEL WITH CLOSED SURFACE LOW IN THE 
OHIO VALLEY BY 12Z THIS MORNING.  ETA HAS TRENDING SLOWER WITH THE 
LOW NOW WITH IT IN CENTRAL IL...BUT THE NGM AND ETA NOW ARE FARTHER 
EAST.  ETA IS A LITTLE FARTHER NORTH WITH THE LOW VERSES THE NGM/AVN 
AS IT CROSSES THE FA TODAY.  LI DROP TO -2 TO -4 TODAY ACROSS THE 
SOUTH.  WITH 40 KNOT 850 JET FEEDING UP AHEAD OF LOW...WILL MENTION 
A CHANCE OF SEVERE IN THE SOUTHEAST.

AFTER LOW PASSES TO THE EAST...COLD ADVECTION BEGINS.  FEEL THAT 
THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTH TONIGHT AND 
MONDAY IN THE CAA.  1000-850 THICKNESSES DROP BELOW 1300M MONDAY 
NIGHT...SO THE MENTION OF RAIN/SNOW STILL LOOKS GOOD.

NGM MOS WAS REALLY TURNED COLD TODAY...AND WITH NO AVN MOS WILL 
TREND TOWARDS CURRENT FORECAST NUMBERS. I KNOW ITS APRIL...BUT WITH 
EXTREMELY COLD AIRMASS DROPPING ACROSS FA...WILL KNOCK 2 TO 3 
DEGREES OFF HIGHS FOR MONDAY.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES




@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 150115
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 PM EDT SAT APR 14 2001

WILL UPDATE AROUND 10 PM TO RESOLVE EVENING WORDING OF CONVECTION 
ALONG A BOUNDARY THAT STRETCHES FROM JUST SOUTH OF BMG TO CVG TO 
PKB.  SURFACE CONVERGENCE ALONG THIS BOUNDARY SEEMS TO BE PLENTIFUL 
BUT UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT IS LIMITED.  THIS BOUNDARY WILL BE PUSHED 
NORTH AS LOW DEEPENS IN THE MID MS VLY AND MOVES INTO OHIO SUNDAY 
MORNING.  CONVECTION CURRENTLY IN THE MID MS VLY SPREAD INTO EASTERN 
INDIANA AND WESTERN OHIO BY DAWN AND THEN INTO CENTRAL BY MID 
MORNING.  HOWEVER...WILL LEAVE SMALL POP EAST AS CONVECTION MAY MOVE 
FASTER ALONG THE BOUNDARY AND IT SHOULD BE IN CENTRAL OHIO BY 12Z.

CONCERNED ABOUT THE THREAT OF STRONG TO SEVERE CONVECTION ACROSS 
SOUTHERN FA ON SUNDAY AS LOW CONTINUES TO DEEPEN AS IT MOVES ACROSS 
CENTRAL OHIO.   

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

@RUKWBCe KDENFXUS61 KILN 141932
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 PM EDT SAT APR 14 2001

SOME CI SPILLING INTO THE SRN PART OF CWFA AND DWPTS HAVE CLIMBED 
INTO THE 45 TO 50 RANGE AHEAD OF SYS IN THE SRN PLAINS. MDLS HAVE 
SPED UP THIS SYS WHICH MAKES SENSE CONSIDERING FAST ZONAL FLOW. BUT 
ETA HAS NOT ONLY JUMPED WAY AHEAD BUT IS ALSO QUITE DEEP WITH THE 
SYS. THIS SEEMS UNREASONABLE CONSIDERING THE ZONAL FLOW SO AM 
DISCOUNTING IT. AM STICKING CLOSEST TO AVN WHICH HAS BEST RUN-TO-RUN 
CONSISTENCY. IT IS A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH THAN NGM BUT THIS LOOKS 
GOOD WITH WEAK RIDGING OVER LE/NW OH AS PER 12Z UA ANALYSIS. 

PRECIP EFFECIENCIES INDICATE RAIN WILL MOVE INTO SW AFT MIDNIGHT 
TONIGHT AND SPREAD NORTH AND EAST THROUGH 12Z. THEN BY AFTN DRY SLOT 
MOVES INTO WEST WITH SOME S/W RIDGING BEHIND SFC WAVE. WILL TIME 
RAIN ACCORDINGLY. WILL ALSO MENTION TS IN THE SRN GRPS SUN WITH 
MARGINAL INSTABILITY. COULD GET SOME THUNDER IN THE SW BEFORE 
12Z...BUT THINK THE BEST CHC IS AFTER SR. MID/UPR MSTR SCOUR OUT 
FAIRLY QUICKLY ALONG WITH GOOD LIFT SO WILL NOT MENTION PRECIP AGAIN 
UNTIL TUE WITH BACKDOOR COLD FRONT. 

TEMPS WILL BE TRICKY THIS FCST DUE TO CLDS AND GOOD CAA MONDAY. 
AVN/NGM GUID CLOSE FIRST 2 PDS AND WILL STICK CLOSE. FOR SUN 
NITE/MON...WILL UNDERCUT QUITE A BIT. LLVL TKNS AND 850 TEMPS 
INDICATE UPR 40S TO MID 50S FOR MONDAY SO WILL GO CLOSE TO AVN GUID. 

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.



@RUKWBCe&KDENFXUS61 KILN 140638
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 AM EDT SAT APR 14 2001

DYING FRONT TO MOVE ACROSS OHIO TODAY.  SCATTERED SHOWERS ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE FRONT HAVE BEEN DISSIPATING SLOWLY AS THEY MOVE EASTWARD.  
MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT IS CONTINUING THIS TREND.  WILL REMOVE 
MENTION OF SPRINKLES FROM THE MIAMI AND WHITEWATER VALLEYS...BUT 
WILL LEAVE THEM FOR THE NORTHERN MIAMI VALLEY.  TAKING A LOOK AT THE 
SATELLITE...OTHER THAN CLOUDS RIGHT ALONG THE FRONT...THE SKIES ARE 
PRETTY CLEAR.  WILL GO A LITTLE MORE OPTIMISTIC IN THE SOUTH WITH 
MOSTLY SUNNY.  CENTRAL ZONES ARE A TOUGH CALL.  WILL CONTINUE WITH 
PARTLY CLOUDY THERE.  WITH MORE SUNSHINE FORECAST THAN WHAT NGM MOS 
IS GIVING ME..WILL GO A DEGREE OR SO WARMER WITH HIGHS TODAY.

ALTHOUGH THE MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AT 500 MB THROUGH 48 
HOURS...THEY BEGIN TO DIVERGE AT THE SURFACE AND 850 MB BY 30 
HOURS.  THE ETA IS THE QUICKEST AND STRONGEST IN PUSHING A SURFACE 
LOW UP THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH THE LOW LOCATED NEAR SDF BY 12Z 
SUNDAY.  ETA THEN PUSHES THE LOW EASTWARD TO NEAR BKW BY 00Z 
MONDAY.  THE NGM AND AVN MEANWHILE...KEEP MORE OF A BROAD LOW BACK 
ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  IT APPEARS THAT THE ETA FORMS A 120 
KT JET AT 300MB OVER NRN OH.  THIS PRODUCES A GOOD AREA OF 
DIVERGENCE IN THE RIGHT REAR QUAD.  FEEL THAT IS THE REASON THE ETA 
FORMS THE SURFACE AND 850 LOWS STRONGER THAN THE NGM/AVN.

DPROG/DT ON THE ETA...NGM AND AVN...ARE SHOWING THAT UNTIL THIS 
RUN...THE ETA HAD BEEN HOLDING THE SURFACE HIGH STRONGER...MORE LIKE 
THE NGM.  THE AVN HAS BEEN TRENDING FARTHER WEST WITH ITS LOW.  THE 
NGM/AVN SOLUTION BLENDS WITH THE CURRENT FORECAST SO WILL GO WITH 
IT...BUT WILL ADD MENTION OF RAIN SUNDAY TO THE NORTH AND EVERYWHERE 
SUNDAY NIGHT.

WONT TINKER WITH LOWS TONIGHT...BUT WILL GO WITH A COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE CURRENT FORECAST AND WARMER NGM MOS.  ON SUNDAY 
NIGHT...WILL GO WITH THE WARMER NGM MOS ACROSS THE BOARD.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER


.ILN...NONE.

SITES
















AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
924 PM EDT FRI APR 13 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN FEATURES WESTERLY FLOW.  SFC MAP HAS HIGH CENTERED 
AROUND INDIANA.  SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES ACROSS OUR AREA...WITH 
CLOUDS ASSOC WITH SHORT WAVE TO THE WEST STILL A FEW HOURS FROM 
ARRIVING HERE.

CLOUDS ARE WELL REPRESENTED BY MESOETA 700 MB RH...WHICH TIMES THEIR 
ARRIVAL IN OUR WESTERN COUNTIES BY 09Z...TO EASTERN ZONES BY 12Z.  
THEREFORE...ILL KEEP CURRENT FCSTS CLEAR/PARTLY CLOUDY LATE IN 
WEST.

LOW TEMPS FROM 35 TO 45 LOOK GOOD WRT CLEAR SKIES...DRY AIR...AND 
LOWERING WINDS.  WILL UPDATE TO ADJUST WINDS.

.ILN...NONE.



@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 131822
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EDT FRI APR 13 2001

FCST IS FAIRLY STRAIGHT FORWARD FOR THE NEXT 24 TO 36 HRS...THEN 
MODELS HAVE A HARD TIME COMING UP WITH A REASONABLE SOLUTION BEYOND 
36 HRS.

CUMULUS CLOUDS THAT DEVELOPED THIS MORNING WERE GRADUALLY 
DISSIPATING PER VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY.  AS A RESULT...SFC HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR SPRINGFIELD...IL WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO VLY 
OVERNIGHT.  RH FIELDS ARE FCST TO BE ON THE DRY SIDE FOR MOST OF THE 
NIGHT...SO A CLEAR FCST IS IN STORE ACRS MOST OF THE REGION.  CLOUDS 
WILL BE ON THE INCREASE...HOWEVER...LATE TONIGHT/TOWARD DAWN ACRS 
THE WRN CWFA AS A S/WV (NOW OVER THE NRN PLAINS) MOVES EAST.  
WAA...REFLECTED ALOFT...WILL BRING IN AN AC DECK.  THIS WILL REACH 
THE WRN AREAS BETWEEN 5 AM AND 8 AM...AND THE ERN AREAS BETWEEN 7 AM 
AND 10 AM.  WENT A LITTLE BELOW MOS GUIDANCE TONIGHT GIVEN LIGHT 
WINDS EXPECTED WITH SFC HIGH AND THE LATE APCH OF CLOUDS.

ON SATURDAY...THE WAA CLOUDS WILL BE FOLLOWED BY A COLD FRONT.  THE 
MAIN DYNAMICS ASSOCD WITH THIS FRONT WILL AFFECT LOCATIONS GENERALLY 
NORTH OF OUR REGION.  MESO ETA STILL HINTS AT THE POSSIBILITY OF A 
FEW SPRINKLES AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  THUS...WILL CARRY AFTN SPRINKLES 
IN FOR THE DAY AND WAPAKONETA GROUPS (CLOSER TO UPR SUPPORT).  TEMPS 
WILL BE A LITTLE WARMER THAN TODAY GIVEN THE WAA AHEAD OF THE FRONT.
MOS TEMPS ARE JUST ABOUT ON TARGET.

THINGS GET COMPLICATED FOR SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  ALL MODELS 
SHOW THE COLD FRONT SAGGING SOUTH ALONG THE OHIO RIVER BY SUNDAY 
MORNING.  HOWEVER...THE ETA VS THE AVN/NGM DIFFER ON THE STRENGTH 
AND SPEED OF A S/WV EJECTING OUT OF THE SW UNITED STATES INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY.  ON ONE HAND...THE AVN DEVELOPS A DEEPER...FASTER SFC 
LOW ALONG THE FRONT...RESULTING IN A STRONGER LOW LEVEL JET.  IT HAS 
BEEN CONSISTENT WITH ITS STRONG LOW LEVEL JET...BUT I BELIEVE IT IS 
TOO STRONG.  ON THE OTHER HAND...THE ETA IS SLOWER/WEAKER WITH ITS 
SFC LOW DEVELOPMENT/LOW LEVEL JET.  IT...ALSO...HAS BEEN SOMEWHAT 
CONSISTENT.  AS A RESULT...A BLENDED COMPROMISE SEEMS THE WAY TO 
GO.  WILL INTRODUCE A CHC OF SHOWERS CVG GROUP FOR LATE SATURDAY 
NIGHT...LEAVING OTHER LOCATIONS DRY.  WILL CONTINUE A CHC OF 
SHOWERS/TSTMS FOR THE CVG AND PMH GROUPS ON SUNDAY...LEAVING THE 
REMAINDER OF THE FCST ZONES DRY.  THE REASONING FOR THIS IS THAT THE 
MEAN FLOW REMAINS WESTERLY...SO ANY PCPN THAT DEVELOPS WILL TEND TO 
MOVE EAST INSTEAD OF NORTH.  WILL ALSO GO COOLER THAN THE MOS SINCE 
FRONT IS SOUTH OF THE REGION...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN COOLER TEMPS 
THAN WHAT MOS IS SHOWING.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN













FEW SPRINKLES AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  THUS...WILL CARRY AFTN SPRINKLES

CONSISTENT.  AS A RESULT...A BLENDED COMPROMISE SEEMS THE WAY TO 
GO.  WILL INTRODUCE A CHC OF SHOWERS CVG GROUP FOR LATE SATURDAY 
NIGHT...LEAVING OTHER LOCATIONS DRY.  WILL CONTINUE A CHC OF 
SHOWERS/TSTMS FOR THE CVG AND PMH GROUPS ON SUNDAY...LEAVING THE 
REMAINDER OF THE FCST ZONES DRY.  THE REASONING FOR THIS IS THAT THE 
MEAN FLOW REMAINS WESTERLY...SO ANY PCPN THAT DEVELOPS WILL TEND TO 
MOVE EAST INSTEAD OF NORTH.  WILL ALSO GO COOLER THAN THE MOS SINCE 
FRONT IS SOUTH OF THE REGION...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN COOLER TEMPS 
THAN WHAT MOS IS SHOWING.

.ILN...NONE.



511 
FXUS61 KILN 131340
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
940 AM EDT FRI APR 13 2001

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS MORNING INDICATED A S/WV PIVOTING NE ACROSS 
THE CWFA.  THIS S/WV IS FCST TO MOVE AWAY THIS AFTN...ALLOWING WEAK 
HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SFC AND ALOFT TO MOVE INTO THE REGION.

VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWED SOME CAA CUMULUS DEVELOPING ACRS W CNTRL 
AND CNTRL OHIO ATTM.  LOOKING AT THE KILN SOUNDING...BELIEVE CUMULUS 
WILL HAVE A SHORT LIFE SPAN.  AS THE AIR CONTINUES TO MIX UP TO 850 
MB AND SLIGHTLY ABOVE...THE CUMULUS BASE WILL PUSH INTO MUCH DRIER 
AIR.  AS A RESULT...THE CUMULUS CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO DISSIPATE BY 
EARLY TO MID AFTN.  THUS...WILL KEEP MOSTLY SUNNY FCST 
...ANTICIPATING THAT ANY PARTLY CLOUDY COVERAGE WILL NOT LAST THE 
WHOLE DAY.

MESOETA TEMPS AT 850 MB HAVE COME AROUND TO THE NGM/AVN VALUES OVER 
THE LAST 4 RUNS.  THE TEMPS WERE WITHIN ONE DEGREE C OF THE 12Z 
ILN...ILX AND DTX SOUNDINGS.  AS A RESULT...TODAYS FCST TEMPS ARE 
NEARLY ON TARGET.  HOWEVER...BELIEVE SOME LOCATIONS ALONG AND SOUTH 
OF THE OHIO RIVER WILL REACH THE LOWER 70S.  CONSEQUENTLY...I WILL 
BREAK OFF COUNTIES THERE FROM THE CVG AND PMH AREAS.

PER DISCUSSION ABOVE...WILL MAKE SOME CHANGES TO ZONES.

.ILN...NONE.


@RUKWBCe(KDENFXUS61 KILN 131340
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
940 AM EDT FRI APR 13 2001

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS MORNING INDICATED A S/WV PIVOTING NE ACROSS 
THE CWFA.  THIS S/WV IS FCST TO MOVE AWAY THIS AFTN...ALLOWING WEAK 
HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SFC AND ALOFT TO MOVE INTO THE REGION.

VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWED SOME CAA CUMULUS DEVELOPING ACRS W CNTRL 
AND CNTRL OHIO ATTM.  LOOKING AT THE KILN SOUNDING...BELIEVE CUMULUS 
WILL HAVE A SHORT LIFE SPAN.  AS THE AIR CONTINUES TO MIX UP TO 850 
MB AND SLIGHTLY ABOVE...THE CUMULUS BASE WILL PUSH INTO MUCH DRIER 
AIR.  AS A RESULT...THE CUMULUS CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO DISSIPATE BY 
EARLY TO MID AFTN.  THUS...WILL KEEP MOSTLY SUNNY FCST 
...ANTICIPATING THAT ANY PARTLY CLOUDY COVERAGE WILL NOT LAST THE 
WHOLE DAY.

MESOETA TEMPS AT 850 MB HAVE COME AROUND TO THE NGM/AVN VALUES OVER 
THE LAST 4 RUNS.  THE TEMPS WERE WITHIN ONE DEGREE C OF THE 12Z 
ILN...ILX AND DTX SOUNDINGS.  AS A RESULT...TODAYS FCST TEMPS ARE 
NEARLY ON TARGET.  HOWEVER...BELIEVE SOME LOCATIONS ALONG AND SOUTH 
OF THE OHIO RIVER WILL REACH THE LOWER 70S.  CONSEQUENTLY...I WILL 
BREAK OFF COUNTIES THERE FROM THE CVG AND PMH AREAS.

PER DISCUSSION ABOVE...WILL MAKE SOME CHANGES TO ZONES.

.ILN...NONE.


486 
FXUS61 KILN 130642
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
243 AM EDT FRI APR 13 2001

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL FEATURES THROUGH 48 HOURS. 
VORT MAX PUSHES THROUGH THE FA AROUND 12Z...PUSHING WAVE ON THE 
FRONT EAST.  PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THE WAVE IS CLOSE TO MY SE KY 
COUNTIES...BUT LATEST LOOK AT RADAR LOOP IS SHOWING THAT IT SHOULD 
SLIDE JUST TO THE SOUTH...THEN IT SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA BY 
SUNRISE.

QUICK SHOT OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN TODAY.  AFTER SOME EARLY 
MORNING CLOUDS...SHOULD SEE PLENTY OF SUN IN THE AFTERNOON.  MODELS 
ARE A LITTLE SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUN IN BRINGING CLOUDS INTO THE FA 
TONIGHT...AS IT MIGHT ALMOST BE SUNRISE BEFORE THE CLOUDS GET INTO 
THE WEST.  WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHES ACROSS OH ON SATURDAY.  THE ETA 
AND AVN PRINT OFF QPF ACROSS THE NORTH. WHILE THE NGM BRINGS IT 
SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  AFTER TODAY THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD BE DRY 
IN THE LOW LEVELS. WITH THIS BEING A FAST MOVING SYSTEM...THINK THAT 
THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE HAVE A HARD TIME MOSITENING UP...SO WILL ONLY 
MENTION SOME SPRINKLES ACROSS THE NORTH ON SATURDAY.

BY 60 HOURS...THE AVN IS STRONGER WITH VORT IN THE SOUTHERN STREAM.  
AS A RESULT IT IS PRODUCING MUCH HIGHER QPF THAN THE ETA ACROSS THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY...AS WELL AS HOLDING IT BACK FURTHER.  ETA SEEMS 
TO BE A LITTLE MORE CONSISTENT...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH MENTION OF 
RAIN ALL AREAS SATURDAY NIGHT.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...MODELS WERE TOO COLD DURING THE WARM SPELL.  
NGM MOS NUMBERS IN CVG LOOK GOOD...BUT FOR DAY/CMH AND NORTHWARD 
THEY LOOK TOO COOL.  WILL CONTINUE WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST.  FROM 
TONIGHT THRU SATURDAY NIGHT MOS LOOKS REASONABLE AND HARD TO 
BEAT...SO WONT TINKER TOO MUCH.

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.


.ILN...NONE.

SITES






)KDENFXUS61 KILN 130141
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
940 PM EDT THU APR 12 2001

UPPER RIDGE IS MOVING EAST TO THE ATLANTIC COAST...TAKING 80 DEGREE 
TEMPS WITH IT.  SHORT WAVE ENERGY IN SOUTHERN CANADA IS PUSHING 
RIDGE OUT WITH FLOW BECOMING ZONAL BY FRIDAY.

SFC PRESSURE GRADIENT IS LOOSENING AS LOW MOVES NORTHEAST OUT OF THE 
UPPER GREAT LAKES.  SUSTAINED WINDS HAVE DROPPED BELOW 20 MPH.  

SATELLITE SHOWS MID CLOUDS MAINLY SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER OUT AHEAD 
OF SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH ILLINOIS.  LOW CLOUDS ASSOC WITH GREAT 
LAKES SHORT WAVE ARE IN NORTHWEST OHIO.  I EXPECT BOTH AREAS OF 
CLOUDS TO STAY MAINLY OUT OF OUR AREA...SO ILL CONTINUE PARTLY 
CLOUDY FCST...EXCEPT IN SOUTH CENTRAL GROUP WHERE THICKER MID LEVEL 
CLOUDS WILL WARRANT MOSTLY CLOUDY FCST.

LOW TEMPS FROM MID 40S WEST CENTRAL TO LOW 50S SOUTH CENTRAL LOOK 
GOOD.  WILL UPDATE TO LOWER WIND SPEEDS.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

@RUKWBCe&KDENFXUS61 KILN 121838
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 PM EDT THU APR 12 2001

FIRST FCST PROBLEM THIS AFTERNOON IS THE WIND.  18Z OBS WERE STILL 
INDICATING WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA.  CURRENT WIND ADVISORY EXPIRES AT 
4 PM.  WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND A WELL MIXED ATMOSPHERE...FEEL 
WIND ADVISORY WILL HAVE TO BE EXTENDED UNTIL 7 PM FOR THE NORTHERN 
THREE GROUPS (WAP...DAY AND CMH).  WILL LET THE WIND ADVISORY DIE A 
NATURAL DEATH SOUTH OF THESE AREAS AS WINDS SHOULD BE UNDER CRITERIA 
THRESHOLD.  EITHER WAY...A REST OF THIS AFTERNOON WORDING WILL BE 
EMPLOYED.

AT 18Z...SFC COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED NEAR THE FAR ERN OHIO BORDER.  
THE FRONT WILL SAG TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OVERNIGHT.  A S/WV...MOVING 
ACRS THE SRN PLAINS AT THIS TIME...WILL PIVOT NE INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY OVERNIGHT.  THIS S/WV SHOULD ENHANCE SOME MID AND HIGH LVL 
CLOUDINESS ACRS THE SRN CWFA.  THUS...PARTLY CLOUDY THERE LOOKS GOOD.
FOR THE NRN CWFA...STRATOCUMULUS DECK TO THE WEST FROM INDIANA WILL 
GRADUALLY PUSH MORE EAST AS THE WIND AT THE CLOUD LVL CHANGES TO A 
MORE WESTERLY DIRECTION.  PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES DAY AND CMH WITH 
MOSTLY CLOUDY WAPAKONETA SHOULD WORK OUT (HOWEVER...JUST N OF DAY IT 
COULD BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY...WILL LET EVENING SHIFT SEE HOW THIS 
WORKS OUT).  MOS TEMPS SEEM REASONABLE.

ON FRIDAY...THE UPR LVL FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL.  THE AFOREMENTIONED 
S/WV PIVOTS AWAY FROM THE REGION...ALLOWING SFC HIGH PRESSURE TO 
WEDGE IN THE WEST.  NGM/AVN ARE MUCH DRIER AT 850 MB THAN THE 
ETA.  BELIEVE THERE WILL BE SOME CUMULUS IN CAA TOMORROW...BUT 
MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS WILL PREDOMINATE.  ETA 850 MB 
TEMPS/THICKNESSES ARE COOLER THAN AVN/NGM.  AT THIS POINT...CAN NOT 
DETERMINE WHY THIS IS SINCE ALL MODELS INITIALIZE THE SAME WAY 850 
MB.  ETA IN THE PAST WEEKS HAS BEEN TOO COOL WITH THICKNESSES.  
BASED ON PAST EXPERIENCE...WILL LEAN TOWARD WARMER MOS/MAV VALUES.

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...A WEAK COLD FRONT IN THE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT 
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST.  CLOUDS WILL INCREASE ACRS THE WEST WITH 
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS EAST.

THE WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES ACRS THE REGION ON SATURDAY.  DYNAMICS ARE 
PALTRY AND BELIEVE ONLY A FEW SPRINKLES WILL OCCUR AT THIS 
TIME.  SINCE FCST RULES PRECLUDE THE USE OF SPRINKLES BEYOND THE 
FIRST PERIOD...WILL LEAVE A DRY FORECAST WORDING.

MUCH COOLER WEATHER IS IN STORE FOR NEXT WEEK AS A MAJOR PATTERN 
SHIFT OCCURS.

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 7 PM EDT FOR WAPAKONETA...DAYTON AND 
       COLUMBUS ZONE AREAS.

HICKMAN












9KDENFXUS61 KILN 121357
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 AM EDT THU APR 12 2001

13Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT FROM THE ERN THIRD OF MI SW 
THROUGH THE ERN THIRD OF INDIANA...THEN JUST EAST OF THE MS RIVER 
INTO KY AND TN.  VISIBLE SATELLITE MATCHES UP WITH THIS ANALYSIS BY 
SHOWING A THIN BAND OF CLOUDS.

THE COLD FRONT IS FCST TO BE NEAR A CMH TO JUST WEST OF A PMH LINE 
BY 2 PM.  AS THE COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE WEST LATE THIS 
MORNING INTO THE EARLY AFTN...I EXPECT THE WIND SPEEDS AND GUSTS TO 
PICK UP.  THIS WILL BE DUE TO THE COMBINED EFFECTS OF SFC PRESSURE 
GRADIENT AND STRONG 925 MB TO 890 MB WINDS ALOFT.  IN FACT...OBS IN 
ERN INDIANA (JUST BEHIND THE FRONT) INDICATED WIND GUSTS TO 40 KTS 
(46 MPH).  THUS...WIND ADVISORY FOR THE NWRN TWO THIRDS OF THE CWFA 
LOOKS GREAT.  ADVISORY IS EXPECTED TO EXPIRE AT 4 PM...BUT WILL HAVE 
TO REEVALUATE THE WIND CONDITIONS BY NEXT FCST ISSUANCE TO SEE IF IT 
WILL BE EXTENDED INTO THE LATE AFTN/EARLY EVENING.

850 MB TEMPS BEGIN TO FALL RAPIDLY ACRS THE NW CWFA TODAY...THEN 
GRADUALLY INCREASING TOWARD OUR SE CWFA (LAST LOCATION TO HAVE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE).  TEMPS IN THE NORTHWEST SHOULD STABILIZE (OR 
SLIGHTLY FALL ) FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTN WITH WARMER TEMPS 
EXPECTED SOUTH AND EAST.

WILL UPDATE ZONES TO MAKE SOME SKY WORDING CHANGES AS WELL AS TEMPS.

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY THIS AFTERNOON FOR ALL ZONES 
       BUT NRN KY AND VC PMH.

HICKMAN

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 120704
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
303 AM EDT THU APR 12 2001

07Z SFC ANALYIS INDICATED A DEEP LOW OVER SERN MN WITH AN OCCLUDED 
FRONT EWD ACROSS WI INTO MI.  A CDFNT EXTENDED SWD ALONG THE IL-IN 
BORDER.  AREA OF SHRA/TSRA AHEAD OF THE FRONT APPEARS TO BE 
WEAKENING BUT COULD PRODUCE SOME WIND GUSTS TO 50 MPH THIS AM.

MODELS INDICATE BEST MOISTURE ACROSS FA THIS MORNING AND THEN WL 
PUSH RAPIDLY E OF FA.  INSTABILITY EXPECTED TO BE MINIMAL BUT WL 
INCLUDE CHC/TSRA THIS AM.  AS DRY AIR PUSHES INTO FA XPCT SKIES TO 
CLEAR WITH ONLY A LITTLE CU FORMATION IN THE PM.

CONCERN TODAY WL BE STRONG CORE OF WINDS THAT ROTATES THROUGH THE OH 
VLY.  MODELS SHOW A NEARLY STACKED WIND MAX FROM THE LOW LEVELS TO 
300 MB.  WITH MIXING XPCT TO SEE WIND GUSTS TO 50 MPH ACROSS NWRN 
PARTS OF FA.  WITH THE RECENT HEAVY RAINS CREATING VERY WET 
SOIL...THIS MAY BE ENOUGH TO CAUSE SOME TREE DAMAGE. WL ISSUE A WIND 
ADVISORY FOR DAY-CMH-CVG AREAS BUT WL LEAVE NRN KY AND PMH AREAS 
JUST BLO CRITERIA.

GUIDANCE TEMPS APPEAR MUCH TOO COOL TODAY SO WL RAISE BY 1-2 CATS.  
TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR OTHER PERIODS.    

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY TODAY FOR ALL ZONES BUT NRN KY AND VC PMH.

WILKINSON

@RUKWBCe$KDENFXUS61 KILN 120136
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
935 PM EDT WED APR 11 2001

UPPER RIDGE IS MOVING TO THE EAST COAST...WITH VIGOROUS CUTOFF LOW 
MOVING TOWARD THE UPPER GREAT LAKES.  SFC MAP HAS 984 MB LOW OVER 
EASTERN NEBRASKA...WITH STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT SURROUNDING THE 
LOW.  MOISTURE IS CONTINUING TO ADVECT NORTH IN THE STRONG SOUTHERLY 
FLOW ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE LOW...WITH GOOD SFC WIND AND MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE PRESENT INTO NORTHERN OHIO.

THOUGH SFC PATTERN IS FAVORABLE FOR TSRA...H5 NVA IN WARM SECTOR 
ALONG WITH CAP AT AROUND 10 KFT HAVE CURTAILED ACTIVITY IN OUR AREA 
THIS EVENING.  I EXPECT SCT SHRA/TSRA WILL MOVE IN LATE TONIGHT AS 
COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  BEST CHANCE FOR 
SEVERE TSRA WILL BE IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO CLOSER TO LOW CENTER WHERE 
HELICITY WILL BE GREATER.  OTHER TSRA OVER WESTERN TENNESSEE MAY 
MOVE UP AND AFFECT CVG AS PER ETA QPF.  AGREE WITH PREVIOUS SHIFT IN 
GOING ABOVE FWC POPS...THOUGH MOST OF THE ACTIVITY WILL BE NORTHWEST 
OF HERE NEAR THE SFC LOW.

OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK GOOD NEAR FWC IN LOW 60S.  WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE 
EVENING WORDING.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO


@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 111822
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EDT WED APR 11 2001

A BIT OF A TOUGH FORECAST AS FAR AS TIMING AND JUST HOW UNSTABLE WE 
WILL BE THIS EVENING AHEAD OF THE SQUALL LINE APPROACH. THE 
ETA/AVN/NGM HAVE ALL INITIALIZED PRETTY POORLY ON THE SFC LOW 
DEPTH...AS WELL AS SOME LOW LVL CHARACTERISTICS. 

FCST SFC DWPTS MAY BE A BIT TOO PESSIMISTIC...BUT THERE STILL 
REMAINS SOME 70 DWPTS IN CNTRL OH. WE ARE ALSO NOTICING SOME MDT CU 
DVLPMNT. WL BREAK TONIGHT INTO EVENING AND TONIGHT PERIOD...KEEPING 
CHANCE OF EVENING SHRA/TSRA...THEN LIKELY OVERNIGHT.  

TO OUR ADVANTAGE...THE SQL LINE REACHES THE WRN FA BTWN 08Z AND 
10Z...AND SHOULD BE NEAR THE ERN FA BTWN ABOUT 12Z AND 14Z. THIS 
COMES DURING A PERIOD WHERE WE ARE MORE STABLE AND THE BEST DYNAMICS 
SEEM TO REMAIN CLOSER TO THE VORT ITSELF OVR NRN IL/NRN IN AND THEN 
SKIRTING THE N OF OUR FA. ANOTHER BENEFIT IS THE SPEED OF THE SQUALL 
LINE MOVEMENT...AS THERE REMAINS SOME MINOR RIVER FLOODING AND 
RESIDUAL SMALL STREAM FLOODING IN PORTIONS OF THE MIAMI...SCIOTO AND 
HOCKING RIVER BASINS. LOOKS LIKE HEAVY RAIN SHOULDNT BE A PROBLEM. 
MAY SEE SOME ISOLD 1 INCH AMOUNTS WTH TSTMS LATE TONIGHT...BUT NOT 
THE LARGE AREAS OF 1 TO 3 LIKE LAST NIGHT. 

AM LEANING MORE TOWARD AN NGM/ETA COMBINATION...AS IT SEEMS THE AVN 
HAS INITIALIZED THE POOREST. WL KEEP TMPS TNGT A BIT ABOVE MOS...AND 
PRETTY CLOSE FOR THU AND FRI.

BEHIND THE FRONT THURS AFTN...WE ARE VERY POSSIBLY GOING TO REACH 
WIND ADVIS CRITERIA. WL KEEP WINDY WORDING IN FCST AND THE DECISION 
WL BE ONE FOR THE MID SHIFT.

.ILN...NONE.

JDR








381 
FXUS61 KILN 111822
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EDT WED APR 11 2001

A BIT OF A TOUGH FORECAST AS FAR AS TIMING AND JUST HOW UNSTABLE WE 
WILL BE THIS EVENING AHEAD OF THE SQUALL LINE APPROACH. THE 
ETA/AVN/NGM HAVE ALL INITIALIZED PRETTY POORLY ON THE SFC LOW 
DEPTH...AS WELL AS SOME LOW LVL CHARACTERISTICS. 

FCST SFC DWPTS MAY BE A BIT TOO PESSIMISTIC...BUT THERE STILL 
REMAINS SOME 70 DWPTS IN CNTRL OH. WE ARE ALSO NOTICING SOME MDT CU 
DVLPMNT. WL BREAK TONIGHT INTO EVENING AND TONIGHT PERIOD...KEEPING 
CHANCE OF EVENING SHRA/TSRA...THEN LIKELY OVERNIGHT.  

TO OUR ADVANTAGE...THE SQL LINE REACHES THE WRN FA BTWN 08Z AND 
10Z...AND SHOULD BE NEAR THE ERN FA BTWN ABOUT 12Z AND 14Z. THIS 
COMES DURING A PERIOD WHERE WE ARE MORE STABLE AND THE BEST DYNAMICS 
SEEM TO REMAIN CLOSER TO THE VORT ITSELF OVR NRN IL/NRN IN AND THEN 
SKIRTING THE N OF OUR FA. ANOTHER BENEFIT IS THE SPEED OF THE SQUALL 
LINE MOVEMENT...AS THERE REMAINS SOME MINOR RIVER FLOODING AND 
RESIDUAL SMALL STREAM FLOODING IN PORTIONS OF THE MIAMI...SCIOTO AND 
HOCKING RIVER BASINS. LOOKS LIKE HEAVY RAIN SHOULDNT BE A PROBLEM. 
MAY SEE SOME ISOLD 1 INCH AMOUNTS WTH TSTMS LATE TONIGHT...BUT NOT 
THE LARGE AREAS OF 1 TO 3 LIKE LAST NIGHT. 

AM LEANING MORE TOWARD AN NGM/ETA COMBINATION...AS IT SEEMS THE AVN 
HAS INITIALIZED THE POOREST. WL KEEP TMPS TNGT A BIT ABOVE MOS...AND 
PRETTY CLOSE FOR THU AND FRI.

BEHIND THE FRONT THURS AFTN...WE ARE VERY POSSIBLY GOING TO REACH 
WIND ADVIS CRITERIA. WL KEEP WINDY WORDING IN FCST AND THE DECISION 
WL BE ONE FOR THE MID SHIFT.

.ILN...NONE.

JDR


@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 111417
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1015 AM EDT WED APR 11 2001

LATEST SFC MAP SHOWS WMFNT HAS LIFTED TO N A BIT. MIDNIGHT SHIFT 
LEFT ME WITH A GOOD FCST...BUT WL NEED TO UPDATE FOR WNDS AS MOST 
AREAS ARE STAYING SE AND SHOULD SHIFT TO S THIS AFTN. WL ADJUST 
ACCORDINGLY. 

ILN 12Z SNDG HAS WBZ UP TO 11.5K FT...SO LOOKS LIKE IT WL BE MORE 
DIFFICULT TO GET HAILERS TODAY. WL HAVE TO WATCH WHEN WNDS FINALLY 
DO KICK OVER TO THE SOUTH TO SEE WHAT POPS UP. REST OF FCST LOOKS 
GOOD.

DEALING WTH MINOR RIVER FLOODING THIS MORNING ALSO (THANKS FOR COORD 
RLX). MIAMI AND PORTIONS OF HOCKING AND LOWER SCIOTO VALLEYS CANT 
STAND ANY MORE PRECIP...SO HOPEFULLY THERE IS NOT MUCH DEVELOPMENT  
TDY. AS FNT COMES THROUGH OVERNIGHT...MOVEMENT WILL HOPEFULLY BE 
QUICK ENOUGH TO NOT CAUSE FLOODING PROBLEMS.

WX MAGIC GIVES US A MAX TMP OF ABOUT 81 DEGREES AT ILN. 

.ILN...NONE.

JDR

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 110719
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
318 AM EDT WED APR 11 2001

07Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A STATIONARY BOUNDARY TO THE N OF 
DAY-CMH.  A MCS MOVG ALONG THE BOUNDARY WAS AFFECTING MUCH OF OH-IN 
WITH MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL.

MODELS INDICATE THAT RIDING WL BUILD INTO FA TODAY AHEAD OF STRONG 
SYSTEM ACROSS THE PLAINS.  HOWEVER...NWD MOVEMENT OF FRONT WL BE 
COMPLICATED BY OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES.  AS LLVL WARMTH SURGES NWD XPCT 
SFC BASED INSTABILITY TO DEVELOP BY THE PM HOURS.  CONSIDERING ALL 
THE ABOVE...WL KEEP THE CHANCE FOR SHRA/TSRA IN ALL GROUPS TODAY 
WITH THE BEST CHANCE ACROSS THE NRN MIAMI VLY AND LOWEST CVG-PMH. DO 
NOT XPCT ORGANIZED SVR STORMS SO WL LEAVE MENTION OUT OF FCST.

FA WL BEGIN TO FEEL THE EFFECTS OF DEEP LOW OVER THE PLAINS TONIGHT. 
THIS FEATURE WL HAVE IMPRESSIVE WIND FIELDS.  LOTS OF UNCERTAINTY AS 
TO THE TIMING OF SHRA/TSRA TONIGHT.  IF THE STORMS MOVE THROUGH 
BEFORE 06Z THEY COULD BE SVR BUT IF LATER WOULD LIKELY FALL APART IN 
MINIMAL INSTABILITY.  WL CARRY A CHC AND ISSUE SPS MENTIONING 
POSSIBLE SVR STORMS TONIGHT.

WITH STRONG WIND FIELDS WL CARRY BREEZY WORDING TONIGHT AND WINDY ON 
WED.

WENT A LITTLE WARMER THAN NGM MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS TONIGHT DUE TO 
STRONG SLY WINDS.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON





790 
FXUS61 KILN 101949
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
350 PM EDT TUE APR 10 2001

THANKS TO SDF FOR POINING OUT MISTAKE IN MISILN.

SFC FRONT STILL IN NRN FCST AREA BUT PRESSURE RIDGE AND DIFFERENTIAL 
HEATING CAUSING SHOWERS TO THE SOUTH. EXPECT BEST STORMS TO BE ALONG 
AND SOUTH OF OHIO RIVER THIS EVENING...WITH A SLOW PROGRESSION 
NORTHWARD TOWARDS FRONT AS HEATING IS LOST. 

TEMPS SHOULD REBOUND TOMORROW AS SOUTHERLY WINDS KICK IN FOR ANOTHER 
DAY AS PLAINS SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEAST. CUT BACK A LITTLE ON 
HIGHS...BUT WAS STILL THINKING WARM. CONVERGENT BAND LOOKING LIKE A 
COLD FRONT WEDNESDAY PM SHOULD NOT COOL TEMPERATURES TOO MUCH AND 
THURSDAY SHOULD SEE ONLY A SLOW RISE IN TEMPS AS WINDS TURN 
NORTHWEST. 

CHANCE FOR SHOWERS IN EXTENDED SHOULD MAINLY FOCUS IN NORTHEAST AND 
FAR NORTH WITH NORTHWEST FLOW...AND CONFIDENCE DECREASES IN LATTER 
PERIODS. 

MISILN OUT.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS







WILL BE DIFFICULT TO STAY AHEAD OF THE WX TODAY. TRYING TO STILL 
WRAP UP FROM LAST NIGHT WHILE FIELDING INCOMING CALLS. 

BOUNDARY CURRENTLY ALONG NRN CWA SHOULD STAY ORIENTED W-E AND REMAIN 
OVER CWA THROUGH THE DAY. CURRENT THINKING IS FOR SHOWER ACTIVITY TO 
BE FOCUSED ALONG AND NORTH OF BOUNDARY WITH POSSIBLE OUTFLOWS 
RUNNING SOUTH AND INTENSIFYING. LARGE COMPLEX DEVELOPING IN SE ILL 
COULD MAKE IT TO FCST AREA THIS AFTERNOON ON SOUTH SIDE OF FRONT IN 
MORE FAVORABLE AIRMASS. CANT PIN DOWN ANY TYPE OF TIMING OR IMPROVE 
POPS ON STORMS...SO WILL MAKE ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO WINDS/TEMPS 
IN AN ATTEMPT TO IMPROVE FCST. 

ZONES OUT AROUND 11.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 100714
AFDILN



AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
313 AM EDT TUE APR 10 2001

07Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED BOUNDARY EXTENDING ACROSS CNRL OH WITH 
LARGE CLUSTER OF SHRA/TSRA MOVG JUST N OF THE BOUNDARY.  MODELS 
INDICATE THAT THIS BOUNDARY WL REMAIN ACROSS NRN FA TODAY.  
CONVERGENCE ALONG THE BOUNDARY AND STRONG UPPER LVL DIVERGENCE WL 
LEAD TO CONTINUED THREAT OF SHRA/TSRA THIS AM.  WL COUNT ON SOME 
RELOADING THIS PM WITH SOME HEATING.  BASED ON CURRENT RADAR WL 
MENTION SVR ALL ZONES XPCT FOR NRN KY WHERE MORE STABLE ATMOSPHERE 
IS IN PLACE.

OTHER THREAT TODAY WL BE HEAVY RAIN.  HEAVIEST AMOUNTS ON MON 
EVENING FELL ACROSS CENTRAL OH TO THE S OF KCMH.  IF HEAVIEST 
RAIN MOVES INTO THESE SAME AREAS...WL HAVE TO CONSIDER A FLASH 
FLOOD WATCH.  CURRENT TRENDS SUGGEST THAT HEAVIEST RAIN WL FALL JUST 
N OF THIS AREA.  WL MONITOR FOR LAST MINUTE DECISION. 

STRONG SYSTEM TO MOVE INTO THE PLAINS BY TONIGHT WL PUSH THE 
BOUNDARY BACK N BY WED.  WL INCLUDE SHRA/TSRA TONIGHT ALL AREAS WITH 
THE BEST CHANCE IN NRN FA AS LLVL CONVERGENCE WL CONTINUE ALONG THE 
BOUNDARY.  WL CARRY A CHANCE ON WED WHICH SHOULD MAINLY BE IN THE AM 
HOURS.  CDFNT WL SWEEP THROUGH ON WED NIGHT WITH ADDITIONAL 
SHRA/TSRA. 

TEMPS TOUGH TODAY WITH SHARP GRADIENT ACROSS FA.  WL GO CLOSE TO NGM 
MOS GUIDANCE ALL AREAS.  IF SUN BREAKS OUT TEMPS COULD GET WARMER 
BUT DUE TO UNCERTAINLY WL STAY CLOSE.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON







@RUKWBCe	KDENFXUS61 KILN 091803
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
200 PM EDT MON APR 9 2001

AFTER COORD WITH SPC...WILL CANCEL THE WATCH EAST OF COLUMBUS WITH 
ISSUANCE OF AFTERNOON PACKAGE. S/W SPINNING UP CONVECTION AND 
ENHANCING CELLS ALONG A BOUNDARY THAT IS ALMOST THROUGH CWA JUST 
SCREAMS EASTWARD TO THE COAST THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

VERY WEAK H5 RIDGE OVER ERN U.S. SHOWING LITTLE CHANGE THROUGH NEXT 
2 DAYS...AS LOW OVER THE ROCKIES DEEPENS AND CUTS OFF ANY STEERING 
OR KICKING MECHANISMS. LOW STARTS TO EJECT ON THURSDAY AND SPINS UP 
STRONG CYCLOGENESIS IN NRN PLAINS...ENHANCING H5 RIDGE IN THE EAST 
AND ALLOWING IT TO START MOVING EWD. PROBLEM IN NEXT DAY OR TWO IS 
LOCATION OF STRONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY CURRENTLY OVER NRN OH. MODELS 
DROP BOUNDARY S TONIGHT AND THEN KICK IT BACK TO THE NORTH IN FAIRLY 
UNIFORM SW FLOW.

WITH PLACEMENT OF SFC BOUNDARY IN NRN HALF OF FCST AREA TONIGHT AND 
COUPLED NOSE OF WEAK H8 JET AND UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE...MCS SHOULD 
DEVELOP SOMEWHERE IN CNTL IN WITH ENHANCED PRECIP BANDS DUE TO S/WS 
MOVING THROUGH NRN CWA. WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS FOR NRN HALF OF 
FCST AREA AND QUICKLY CUT THEM TO LOW CHANCE IN KY. COULD SEE LITTLE 
TO NO PRECIP S OF OH RIVER...BUT OUTFLOWS MOVING S AND SE FROM SFC 
FRONT COULD SPARK CONVECTION ALMOST ANYWHERE IN CWA. WEAKENING OF 
CAP AND MODERATE INSTABILITY COULD RESULT IN SOME ISOLD SVR...WITH 
MAIN THREAT OCCURRING WHEREVER OUTFLOWS SET UP. 

AS BOUNDARY LIFTS N ON TUES...ANOTHER MCS COULD BE IN THE WORKS FOR 
THE EVENING PERIOD FOR NRN 1/2 OF F.A.  IN A NUTSHELL...LOOKS LIKE 
MORE OF THE SAME FOR MUCH OF CWA WITH BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP 
OCCURRING IN LATE PM AND EARLY EVENING. CONVERGENT BOUNDARY THAT 
LOOKS LIKE A CDFNT TO PUSH THROUGH F.A. EARLY ON THURS LOOKS TO SET 
UP ANOTHER BOUNDARY TO THE SOUTH OVERNIGHT AS SFC AND H5 LOWS EJECT 
NEWD INTO CANADA FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS. 

AS MODELS GO...LIKE THE MAVS NUMBERS ON TEMPS AND WILL ERR ON THE 
WARM SIDE EVEN HERE...ESP AT NIGHT. SFC AND H5 FIELDS SHOWING MINOR 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEEN ETA AND AVN...WILL RUN WITH AVN AS IT SEEMS TO 
HAVE A GOOD CONSISTENCY. ETA PRECIP FIELDS LOOK MORE IN LINE WITH 
CURRENT THINKING AS OPPOSED TO USUAL BROAD PATTERN OF AVN.

.ILN...SVR THUNDERSTORM WATCH 105 UNTIL ISSUANCE OF ZONES AROUND 
330 FOR FAIRFIELD AND LICKING COUNTIES.

FRANKS




