AS MODELS GO...LIKE THE MAVS NUMBERS ON TEMPS AND WILL ERR ON THE 
WARM SIDE EVEN HERE...ESP AT NIGHT. SFC AND H5 FIELDS SHOWING MINOR 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEEN ETA AND AVN...WILL RUN WITH AVN AS IT SEEMS TO 
HAVE A GOOD CONSISTENCY. ETA PRECIP FIELDS LOOK MORE IN LINE WITH 
CURRENT THINKING AS OPPOSED TO USUAL BROAD PATTERN OF AVN.

.ILN...SVR THUNDERSTORM WATCH 105 UNTIL ISSUANCE OF ZONES AROUND 
330 FOR FAIRFIELD AND LICKING COUNTIES.

FRANKS





@RUKWBCe	KDENFXUS61 KILN 091503
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1100 AM EDT MON APR 9 2001

WILL HAVE MORNING UPDATE TO INCLUDE WATCH BOX 105 IN FAR NORTHEAST 
CWA. CURRENT BOUNDARY SHOULD SEE A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION SPARK TO 
THE NORTH ALONG SHARP FRONTAL AREA JUST S OF LAKE ERIE.

OTHER BOUNDARY SEEMS TO BE WEAKENING OVER IL/IN BUT STORMS ALONG IT 
WOULD MOVE DUE EAST INTO SWRN CWA. WILL UPDATE ALL AREAS TO INCLUDE 
AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER IN THE SOUTH INSTEAD OF THE 
SILENT 20.

.ILN...SVR TSTM WATCH NE OF COLUMBUS IN FAIRFIELD AND LICKING 
COUNTIES.

@RUKWBCe	&KDENFXUS61 KILN 090738
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 AM EDT MON APR 9 2001

BNDRY NE OF THE CWFA THIS MORNING...ALONG WITH BKN BAND OF 
CONVECTION.  AS WEVE SEEN A CPL TIMES THE PAST SVRL DAYS...SLGTLY 
DRIER AIR IS ADVECTING IN FROM THE SOUTH...WITH THE BEST MSTR 
FOCUSED TO THE WEST.  THUS...MODELS LIKELY OVERESTIMATING DEGREE OF 
INSTABILITY FOR OUR AREA TDY...ESPLY IN THE SOUTH.  BEST FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTION LATER TDY SHUD BE AHEAD OF MIDWEST SFC WAVE...WHICH AT 
06Z ANALYSED ABT 3MB DEEPER THAN THE ETA/AVN FCST.  DECENT LLVL 
CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THIS WAVE...WITH LIFT ENHANCED BY FAIRLY NICE 
DIVERGENCE ALOFT.  850-300 THICKNESS ORIENTED SUCH THAT UPSTREAM 
MCS WL MOVE MORE EAST THAN SE...SO WL LIKELY NEED OUTFLOWS TO GET 
ACTIVITY GOING FURTHER SOUTH.  WL HIT POPS HARDEST THIS AFTN OVER 
THE FAR NORTH CLOSER TO BNDRY...TAPERING TO CHC ALONG THE OH RIVER.  
FOR OUR SOUTHERN KY COUNTIES MAY JUST GO DRY THIS AFTN...AND WL MAKE 
LAST MINUTE DECISION AFTER QUICK LOOK AT 06Z ETA AND LATEST TRENDS.  
SHUD BE A FAIR AMNT OF SUN TDY...ESPLY SOUTH...AND WL CONT LEANING 
TWRD WARMER MAV NUMBERS.

AXIS OF HIGH PCPN EFFICIENCY ORIENTED NW-SE ACRS THE AREA TNGT...AND 
WITH LLVL JET CRANKING UP SHUD SEE PCPN CVRG INCRS A BIT.  THIS OF 
COURSE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON TODAYS OUTFLOWS...BUT LKS LIKE DECENT MCS 
POTNL OVER THE N-NE.  WL TAPER POPS FROM LIKELY NORTH TO CHC SOUTH.  
META SFC TEMPS CONT MUCH WARMER THAN STATISTICAL GUID...AND HV 
RAISED ACRS THE BOARD.  BNDRY WL MAKE SOME PROGRESS INTO THE AREA 
TUE-TUE NIGHT...BUT MODEL TRENDS ARE FOR MORE AND MORE OF THE AREA 
TO REMAIN IN/NEAR WARM SECTOR.  WL MAINTAIN CHC POPS ALL ZONES TUE WITH 
AFOREMENTIONED BNDRY IN THE VICINITY...AND INTRODUCE BACK INTO THE 
4TH PD AS WELL.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

@RUKWBCe$KDENFXUS61 KILN 081835
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EDT SUN APR 8 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING LINE OF MODERATE OR MORE 
SUBSTANTIAL CU JUST SOUTH OF DAY TO IND.  THIS IS IN AN AREA OF 
SURFACE CONVERGENCE AND ON THE NORTHERN END OF THETA-E AXIS.  KILN 
IS NOT SHOWING ANY RETURNS YET HOWEVER KIND IS SHOWING A FEW.

IMMEDIATE CONCERN IS AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION.  CAPE VALUES 
ARE APPROACHING 2000 J/KG OVER FA WITH REALLY NO INHIBITION.  
SURFACE DELTA THETA-E VALUES ARE IN EXCESS OF 25 DEGREES.  SHEAR 
VALUES ARE ALSO AROUND 25 M/S.  12Z ETA INDICATES A WEAK WAVE MOVING 
ACROSS THE REGION THIS EVENING.  THIS SHOULD BE THE FINAL KICKER IF 
JUST THE CONVERGENCE NEAR THE AFOREMENTIONED BOUNDARY ISNT ENOUGH 
TO GET IT GOING.  WILL CONTEMPLATE PUTTING IN SEVERE WORDING BEFORE 
ISSUING.

OVERNIGHT SHOULD REMAIN RELATIVELY DRY AFTER THE EVENING CONVECTION 
MOVES OFF TO THE EAST.  ANOTHER BATCH OF CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO 
FIRE OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND AFFECT NORTHERN FA MONDAY MORNING.  
HOWEVER 1000 TO 500 MB THICKNESS SUGGEST IT SHOULD TURN A BIT 
SOUTH.  LATTER SHIFTS WILL HAVE TO MONITOR TO SEE IF WORDING FOR 
SOUTHERN FA NEEDS UPDATING.  ONCE AGAIN CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO 
REFIRE IN WAKE OF MCS AS DAYTIME HEATING OCCURS.

FWC TEMPS LOOK TOO COOL WITH FA STAYING IN THE WARM SECTOR AND TDS 
AROUND OR IN THE LOWER 60S SO WILL BUMP UP LOWS A CAT TONIGHT AND A 
COUPLE CATS MONDAY NIGHT.  WILL ONLY BUMP UP A DEGREE OR TWO MONDAYS 
HIGH.  TUESDAYS HIGH LOOKS REASONABLE.

MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

SHOWERS ALONG CONVERGENT BOUNDARY IN SOUTH CENTRAL WHICH IS 
PROPAGATING SOUTHEAST.

CONCERNED ABOUT PULSE CONVECTION THIS EVENING.  06Z MESOETA SHOWING 
CAPE VALUES GREATER THAN 1000 J/KG WITH LITTLE IF ANY CINH OR CAP 
AND SURFACE TO THETA-E DIFFERENCE GREATER THAN 25 DEGREES.  THE BIG 
QUESTION IS WILL THERE BE ANYTHING TO KICK IT OFF.  06Z MESOETA 
SHOWING A SMALL WEAKENING WAVE MOVING ACROSS FA AROUND 00Z.  IS THIS 
REAL OR WILL IT BE ENOUGH?  WILL TAKE A LOOK AT THE NEW 12Z RUN 
BEFORE ADDING ANY 20% EVENING WORDING TO DAY AND CMH GROUPS.  

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
730 AM EDT SUN APR 8 2001

...UPDATED PORTION...

SHRA JUST ABOUT OUT OF THE CWFA...AND WL BE UPDATING BEFORE 8 AM TO 
REMOVE LEFTOVER  WX.  LKS LIKE A FEW MORE CLDS WL MV BACK INTO 
CENTRAL OHIO THAN PREV XPCTD...AND WL UPDATE WORDING TO PSNY TDY.  
TEMPS STARTING OUT 65-70...AND PLAN NO CHGS.

...ORIGINAL DISC...

MAPS DATA CONTS TO SHOW MSTR CONVERGENCE BULLSEYE BTWN DAY-IND... 
WHERE WIDELY SCT SHRA/TSRA HV BEEN REDEVLOPING.  00Z MODEL GUID IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT SHIFTING INSTABILITY/DEEP MSTR NE OUT OF THE CWFA BY 
12Z...WITH FORCING FOR LIFT ALSO DIMINISHING.  WL CARRY LEFTOVER WX 
NORTH OF I-70 TO ACCOUNT FOR ONGOING ACTIVITY...OTHW SAT/MODEL 
TRENDS SUGGEST MORE SUN THAN CLDS IN THE NORTH TDY AND WL WORD AS 
MSNY.  IN THE SOUTH...DEEPER MSTR AND SOME INSTABILTY PROGGED TO 
LINGER...AND WL INCLUDE SLGT CHC POP TO ACCOUNT FOR A LITTLE DIURNAL 
CONVECTION.  FOR TEMPS...A LITTLE COOLING ABV THE BL TODAY YIELDS 
SLIGHTLY LOWER 1000/850 THICKNESS...BUT ONLY ENUF TO SUPPORT A CPL 
DEG OF COOLING GIVEN THE XPCTD SUNSHINE.  HV RAISED FWC ALL ZONES.

WL KEEP LOW POPS IN THE NW TNGT...WHERE QUASI-STATIONARY BNDRY IS 
CLOSEST AND UPSTREAM MCS ACTIVITY CUD APPROACH LATE.  DOESNT LK 
LIKE ENUF GRADIENT TO KEEP TEMPS AS WARM AS THE CURRENT READINGS... 
BUT STILL WELL ABV THE FWC FCST TEMPS.  WL LEAN TWRD THE WARMER 
MAV.  NEW GUID SUGGESTS BNDRY WL TRY TO SAG SOUTH TWRD THE AREA ON 
MONDAY...BUT WITH NEW SFC WAVE APPRCHG XPCT IT TO REMAIN TO OUR 
NORTH.  BETTER MSTR/INSTABILITY IN PLACE...AND XPCT A LITTLE BETTER 
CVRG OF CONVECTION.  WL HIT POPS HARDEST IN THE NORTH...AND TAPER TO 
LOW CHC IN THE SOUTH.  GUID TEMPS IN RSNBL AGREEMENT...AND WITH 
UNCERTAINTY ABOUT CONVECTIVE CVRG/CLOUD CVR WL STICK CLOSE.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE


@RUKWBCe)KDENFXUS61 KILN 071841
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EDT SAT APR 7 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVER 
OHIO AND SOUTHERN INDIANA WITH A CONVERGENT BOUNDARY JUST BEHIND THE 
SURFACE THETA-E AXIS OVER NORTHWESTERN INDIANA.  MSAS LIS ARE 
GENERALLY IN THE -4 TO -6 RANGE WITH TEMPS AROUND 80 INTO THE LOWER 
80S.

BIG QUESTION FOR FORECAST IS CONVECTION IN THE SHORT-TERM AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST.  MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT AVN IS A 
BIT SOUTH OF ETA LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES 36 TO 48 HOURS OUT.  ETA 
INDICATING 50+KT 850 JET NOSING INTO FA BETWEEN 21Z AND 03Z THIS 
EVENING.  AT 250 MB THERE ALSO IS SOME UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE.  THE 
ADDED CONVERGENCE FROM THE 850 JET ALONG WITH THE CONVERGENT 
BOUNDARY SHOULD BE ENOUGH TO KICK OFF CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON.  
CAPE VALUES WILL LIKELY BE IN THE 1500 TO 2000 J/KG.  BELIEVE THE 
MAIN THREAT WILL BE A SOME KIND OF A SQUALL LINE WILL DEVELOP AND 
SLIDE THROUGH FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST WITH THE MAIN THREAT BEING 
DAMAGING WIND GUSTS.  

BOUNDARY LAYER CONVERGENT BOUNDARY THEN STALLS OVER SOUTHERN FA 
OVERNIGHT KEEPING THE THREAT OF CONVECTION (MCS) OVERNIGHT.  BELIEVE 
THIS WILL BE A RAIN THREAT.  DONT PARTICULARLY FEEL THAT FLOODING 
WILL BE A PROBLEM...HOWEVER IF CONVECTION GETS FOCUSED ENOUGH ALONG 
AND NORTH OF OHIO RIVER IN SOUTHERN OHIO THEN FLOODING WILL HAVE TO 
BE MONITORED.

CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO BE A THREAT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AS FA 
STAYS IN THE WARM SECTOR WITH FOCUSING MECHANISMS MOVING ACROSS AND 
JUST TO OUR NORTH.

WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN FWC AND MAV NUMBERS SINCE FWC APPEARS TO 
COOL WHEN COMPARING WITH 850 AND 1000-850 THICKNESS TECHNIQUES. 

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

A CAT OR 2 ABV THE FWC.  SAME SCENARIO PCPN WISE ON SUNDAY...WITH

DAY...WITH HIGH CHANCE ELSEWHERE...USING MAINLY BEFORE MIDNIGHT 
WORDING IN WEST WITH FRONT LIFTING FARTHER NORTH TONIGHT.

SATURDAY.  HOWEVER...WITH PERSISTENT MOIST UNSTABLE AIR NEAR SFC AND 
MID AND UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT...ILL KEEP 30% POPS ALL ZONES FOR 
AFTERNOON TSRA.  WITH FAVORABLE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND JET 
DYNAMICS...WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR TSRA SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY.

WITH 60 DEWPOINTS AROUND...FWC LOWS ARE TOO LOW...SO ILL BUMP THEM 
UP A FEW DEGREES.  FWC ALSO APPEARS TOO LOW FOR SATURDAYS HIGHS 
WITH FEWER CLOUDS AROUND THAN TODAY.  FWC HIGHS LOOK GOOD FOR 
SUNDAY.

THRU THE SHORT RANGE...ALTHOUGH A SUCCESSION OF SHORT WAVES WL 
GRADUALLY FLATTEN THE RIDGE FOR OUR REGION.

MAIN FCST CHALLENGE IN THE FIRST PERIOD IS POPS.  ETA/NGM HV BEEN 
MUCH TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH QPF IN THE WARM SECTOR THUS FAR...AS 
INSTABILITY HAS BEEN INSUFFICIENT TO GENERATE PCPN WITH LACK OF 
FOCUSING MECHANISM.  THE NEW SHORT RANGE GUIDANCE IS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC FTRS...BUT WL LEAN TWRD THE AVN QPF 
WHICH FOCUSES QPF CLOSER TOO THE WARM FRONT AND EXISTING OUTFLOW 
BNDRYS.  WL KEEP POPS IN THE CHC RANGE ALL ZONES TDY...TAPERING FROM 
50 FAR NORTH TO 30 IN THE SOUTH.  SAT TRENDS AND SFC OBS DEPICT 
PLENTY OF CLDS ARND...BUT SHUD SEE A FEW BREAKS DVLP BY AFTN AS THE 
LOWER CLOUD MIXES OUT A BIT.  LLVL THICKNESS WARMS ABV 1400M OVER 
THE SW THIS AFTN...WHICH WUD SUPPORT TEMPS 80-85 WITH FULL SUN.  
GIVEN THE AFOREMENTIONED CLDS...THE MID-UPPER 70S FROM THE PREV FCST 
SEEM MORE RSNBL.

BAND OF HIER MEAN RH/INSTABILITY LFTS NORTH THRU THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT...AND WL KEEP LOW CHC POPS ACRS THE NORTH.  STRONG SW FLOW 
AND 60+ DWPTS WL KEEP TEMPS UP...AND HV RAISED MOS ACRS THE BOARD.
WL MAINTAIN LOW CHC POPS SUNDAY AS WEAK FORCING AND DIURNAL 
INSTABILITY COULD YIELD SOME SHRA/TSRA.  WITH ENUF SUN CUD SEE SOME 
80S OVER THE SW.  WL GO AOA THE WARMER FWC TEMPS.

.ILN...NONE.

00Z...AND THIS COULD VERIFY WITH 60 DP OVER WESTERN KENTUCKY 
HEADED THIS WAY.

SATURDAY...ENOUGH LOW TO MID LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE PRESENT IN 
COMBINATION WITH INSTABILITY AND PVA TO REINTRODUCE CHANCE POPS FOR 
TSRA. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY.  FWC LOOKS TOO LOW FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH 60 DEW POINTS AT NIGHT AND 1000-850 
THICKNESS OF 1400 AT CVG GIVING A HIGH OF 81.  WILL GO WITH 76-78

SATURDAY MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL TODAY WITH 
MAINLY HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS SPILLING INTO THE REGION ON THE EAST SIDE 
OF THE UPR RIDGE AXIS.  PLAN ON USING A PARTLY SUNNY WORDING WITH 
FILTERED SUNSHINE EXPECTED.  TEMPS WILL MODIFY FROM YESTERDAY/S 
READINGS...RANGING FROM THE MID 60S NORTH TO AROUND 70 SOUTH.  

THE AMPLIFIED UPR FLOW PATTERN WILL CAUSE THE AFOREMENTIONED WARM 
FRONT TO PIVOT NE TOWARD THE MIDDLE OHIO VLY TONIGHT.  HAVE DECIDED 
TO USE THE ETA MODEL WITH THIS FCST PERIOD AS IT TENDS TO DO BETTER 
WITH CONVECTION (ALTHOUGH THE PLACEMENT OFTEN TIMES CAN DEVIATE).  
THE ETA MODEL IS INDICATING THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SHOWERS BREAKING 
OUT AHEAD OF THE WARM FRONT ACRS THE SW CWFA THIS EVENING.  MODEL 
ELEVATED LIS APCH ZERO...SO AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM IS NOT OUT OF 
THE QUESTION EITHER.  MEANWHILE...S/WVS ARE FCST TO MOVE INTO THE 
IL/IN REGION THIS EVENING...DEVELOPING CONVECTION THERE.  SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM THIS REGION WILL DIVE SE WITH THE 850 MB-300 
MB THERMAL WIND PATTERN INTO THE NW CWFA AFTER MIDNIGHT...WEAKENING 
BUT SPREADING INTO THE DAY AND CMH LATE.  THUS...WILL CARRY POPS 
TONIGHT WITH THE HIGHEST EXPECTED FOR THE NW.  OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK 
GOOD AS INCREASING DEWPOINTS INTO THE LOWER TO UPPER 50S WILL NOT 
ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP OFF TOO FAR.

ON FRIDAY...THE WARM FRONT PUSHES NORTH OF THE REGION.  HOWEVER 
...THE ETA MODEL CONTINUES TO SHOW RESIDUAL SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY ACRS THE REGION...DIMINISHING THE ACTIVITY BY THE MID 
AFTERNOON HOURS.  WILL FCST MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WITH A CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS EVERYWHERE...AGAIN WITH THE HIGHEST POP 
ACRS THE NW.  MOS TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE DESPITE EXPECTED RAINFALL 
TOMORROW.  WARM...MOIST FLOW FROM THE SOUTHWEST SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS 
INTO PUSH INTO THE UPPER 60S NORTH TO THE MID 70S SOUTH.
  
.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN











548 
FXUS61 KILN 041818
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
218 PM EDT WED APR 4 2001

AMPLFIED FLO PTN WITH MID/UPR LVL OVR CNTRL U.S. BLDG INTO OH VLY
AND GRTLKS THRU THE WEEK. NW FLO WITH SFC HI CNTRD OVR UPR MI BLDG 
SLOWLY SE TNGT. THIS HI WL PROVIDE SUBSIDENCE TO THE OH VLY TNGT.
ONLY XPCT SOME THIN CI TO SPILL OVR UPSTREAM RDG AXIS. WITH 
ANTICYCLONIC FLO AND RELATIVELY DRY AMS XPCT TEMPS TO DROP A LTL 
COOLER THAN FWC GUID TNGT. THIS HS BEEN THE RECENT TREND WITH OVRNGT 
LOWS.

SFC RDG AXIS TO SLIDE ESE WITH WRMFNT WHICH EXTENDS FM THE SRN PLNS THRU
THE GULF STATES MOVG N TWD THE OH VLY. XPCT TO SEE AN INCRS IN CLDS DURG
THE AFTN. ETA MODEL SHWG SOME LO LVL CNVRGC AND AN INCRS IN PRECIP 
EFF. BEST FORCING AND MSTR TO OUR W SO WL ONLY GO WITH 20 POPS FOR 
SW OH. SINCE CHC IS LO WL NOT MENT THIS PROB IN THE FCST. NGM IS THE 
WARMEST WITH TEMPS AND ETA APPEARS TOO COOL. WL GO A DEG OR TWO WRMR 
THAN FWC GUID CLOSER TO MAV. THIS ALSO HS BEEN THE TREND LATELY.

MODELS DIVERGE ON SOLNS THU NGT/FRI. AVN FARTHER N WITH OVERRUNNING
PCPN COMPARED TO THE ETA WITH RDG RIDER S/WV. AVN INITIALIZED TOO 
HI WITH H5 HEIGHTS AND MAY BE TOO FAR N WITH PRECIP. WL TREND SOLN
TWD ETA. THU NGT WL TREND CHC/S OF TSTMS FM 50 PERCENT ACRS NRN MIAMI
TO 40 ACRS DAY AND 30 ACRS CVG AND CMH. ON FRI WL CONT CHC POPS ACRS 
THE CWA WITH BEST POPS N. UPR 50S DWPTS ADVCT INTO OH VLY IN WRM 
SECTOR THU NGT. WL GO A LTL WRMR THAN FWC WITH LOWS. ON FRI WL GO 
CLOSER TO FWC GUID WITH HI/S. MAV GUID IS 7 TO 10 DEGS WRMR THAN FWC
WITH FRI/S HI/S. THIS IS DUE TO THE STGR RDGG AND APPEARS TOO 
WRM.         
  
.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

ANY CU THAT DVLP TO BE FLAT. AC WHICH CLIPPED SW OH HS ERODED AND

MAINTAIN MOSTLY SUNNY SKY COND. MODIFIED ENERGY BLOCK METHOD APPLIED 
TO ILN/S 12Z SOUNDING YIELDS A HI IN THE LOWER 60S. CURR TEMPS APPEAR
ON TARGER. WL UPDATE FCST ADJUSTING SKY COND IN CVG ZONE AND WL MAKE

722 
FXUS61 KILN 040702
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 AM EDT WED APR 4 2001

06Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT LOCATED NEAR THE 
TN/KY BORDER.  A WARM FRONT WAS ALSO NOTED FROM NRN AL...INTO SW 
TN...NRN ARKANSAS...THEN INTO NE OKLA.  HIGH PRESSURE WAS CENTERED 
NEAR LAKE SUPERIOR...RIDGING INTO THE MIDDLE OHIO VALLEY.

SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS MORNING SHOWED SOME ALTOCUMULUS CLOUDS 
SPREADING SE INTO THE CWFA. MODELS HAVE SHOWN THIS...AND THESE 
CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SE THROUGH THE REGION.  BY SUNRISE...I 
EXPECT MOST OF THE CLOUDS TO BE EXITING THE REGION.  THUS...WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE...SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY TODAY.  TEMPS STILL 
DIFFICULT TO FIGURE OUT.  THE NGM TEMPS AT 850 MB HAVE TRENDED 
SLIGHTLY COOLER...THE ETA WARMER...AND THE AVN ABOUT THE SAME.  WITH 
ABUNDANT SUNSHINE AND A MODIFYING AIRMASS...A BLEND OF THE NGM/AVN 
LOOKS LIKE A GOOD BET WITH A SLIGHT TREND TOWARD WARMER VALUES.

FOR TONIGHT...SFC HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY SHIFT SOUTH AND EAST 
WHILE AN H5 UPR LVL RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE MID SECTION OF 
THE UNITED STATES.  MODELS SHOW HIGH LEVEL MSTR SPILLING OVER THE 
EAST SIDE OF THE UPR LVL RIDGE AXIS INTO THE REGION.  MOST OF THE 
TIME...IF THE UPR LVL RIDGE IS AMPLIFIED ENOUGH...THE CIRRUS TENDS 
TO BE THIN.  WITH THAT SAID...WILL CARRY MOSTLY CLEAR WORDING 
TONIGHT IN ANTICIPATION OF THIN CIRRUS.

ON THURSDAY...SKIES WILL BE PARTLY SUNNY DUE TO SUNSHINE FILTERING 
THROUGH HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS.  SOME AFTERNOON CUMULUS CLOUDS MAY 
DEVELOP ACRS THE SRN CWFA AS RETURN FLOW FROM THE SOUTH AT 850 MB 
BRINGS SOME MSTR NORTHWARD.  WITH 850 TEMPS MODIFYING...EXPECT TEMPS 
TO BE WARMER.  WILL TAKE A BLEND OF THE MOS/AVN...TRENDING TOWARD 
SLIGHTLY WARMER.  

BY THURSDAY NIGHT...A WARM FRONT BEGINS TO PUSH NORTH THROUGH THE 
REGION.  MESOETA SEEMS TO BE THE ONLY MODEL DEVELOPING SOME ELEVATED 
CONVECTION OVER IOWA/ILLINOIS...WHICH IF IT DEVELOPS AND HOLDS 
TOGETHER...COULD AFFECT THE WRN CWFA (DAY TO WAPAKONETA) BY FRIDAY 
MORNING.  PARTLY CLOUDY FORECAST FOR THURSDAY NIGHT LOOKS GOOD AT 
THIS TIME.  HAVE TRENDED WARMER ON THE LOWS FROM MOS AS HIGHER 
DEWPOINTS ARE EXPECTED ONCE WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH.  ALSO...SOME 
DEBRIS BLOW OFF SHOULD KEEP TEMPS WARMER.
  
.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

00Z SFC CHART INDICATED A CDFNT S OF THE OH RIVER WITH DECENT CAA

SWD OVERNIGHT WHICH WL KEEP ALL XCPT HIGH LVL MOISTURE AWAY FROM FA. 
XPCT MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT WITH TEMPS FALLING INTO THE 30S BY 
DAYBREAK.  CURRENT FCST HAS THIS HANDLED WELL SO DO NO PLAN ON 
UPDATE THIS EVENING.

027 
FXUS61 KILN 031925
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 PM EDT TUE APR 3 2001

SLOW MOVING UPPER RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL 
INFLUENCE THE AREAS WEATHER FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK.  NORTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT WILL CONTINUE OUR DRY WEATHER. 

AT SFC...COLD FRONT THAT SHIFTED WINDS TO THE NORTH TODAY IS MOVING 
SOUTHEAST AWAY FROM HERE.  HIGH PRESSURE IS DROPPING DOWN TOWARD NEW 
YORK STATE IN NORTHWEST UPPER FLOW.  HIGH IS PROGGED TO REMAIN 
NORTHEAST OF HERE OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS...WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT 
NORTH OF ROCKIES LOW STAYING ACROSS PLAINS AND WESTERN GREAT LAKES. 

SFC COLD ADVECTION IS OCCURRING NOW IN NORTH FLOW BEHIND FRONT.  
TEMPS HAVE DROPPED A DEGREE OR TWO IN THE LAST HOUR AROUND DAY AND 
CMH. COLD ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE TONIGHT BEFORE NEUTRALIZING ON 
WEDNESDAY.  WARM ADVECTION WILL THEN TAKE OVER ON THURSDAY AS SFC 
FLOW RETURNS TO SOUTHEAST. 

WITH PREVALENT DOWNWARD MOTION AND LITTLE MOISTURE...CLOUDS AND 
PRECIP WILL NOT BE A PROBLEM OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS.  WILL GO WITH 
MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT AND MOSTLY SUNNY FOR WEDNESDAY. H5 MOISTURE IS 
PROGGED TO SPILL OVER THE RIDGE ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...ESPECIALLY INTO 
OUR NORTHERN SECTIONS. WILL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY AT DAY AND 
CMH...MOSTLY CLEAR AT CVG FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  FOR THURSDAY... 
MOISTURE IS FCST TO MOVE BACK IN BY LATE AFTERNOON FROM 700-500MB 
MAINLY IN OUR WESTERN COUNTIES.  WILL USE MOSTLY SUNNY ALL ZONES 
...WITH INCREASING AFTERNOON CLOUDS WEST

WILL STAY CLOSE TO FWC/AVN AND ABOVE ETA THROUGH THE FCST PERIOD.  
TEMPS SHOULD COOL INTO 35-40 RANGE TONIGHT. ABUNDANT SUNSHINE SHOULD 
ALLOW READINGS TO RISE BACK NEAR WHERE THEY ARE TODAY...WHILE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER WITH CLOUDS AT H5. 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL COME IN ON THURSDAY AS SOUTHEAST FLOW 
SETS UP. 
  
.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

293 
FXUS61 KILN 031349
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
949 AM EDT TUE APR 3 2001

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH RIDGE 
OVER THE GREAT PLAINS AND TROF OVER EAST COAST.  SHORT WAVES ARE 
MOVING THROUGH KENTUCKY AND LAKE ERIE TODAY...WITH MOST OF THE 
EFFECTS STAYING OUT OF OUR AREA.

SCT SHOWERS ARE OCCURRING IN OUR SOUTH CENTRAL COUNTIES WELL NORTH 
OF SFC WARM FRONT OVER MISSOURI BOOTHEEL.  THESE SHOWERS WILL LINGER 
INTO THE AFTERNOON SO ILL KEEP 40% POPS SOUTH CENTRAL.  CLOUDS 
SHOULD STAY AROUND AT CVG SO MOSTLY CLOUDY WILL WORK THERE.  THOUGH 
ITS MOSTLY SUNNY AT DAY AND CMH NOW...WILL KEEP THOSE ZONES PARTLY 
CLOUDY SINCE I EXPECT CU TO FORM BY AFTERNOON.

OTHER SFC FEATURE IS WEAK AND DRY SFC FRONT THAT IS CURRENTLY MOVING 
ACROSS OHIO.  MAIN EFFECT OF FRONT IS WIND SHIFT TO NORTHEAST BEHIND 
IT.

FCST TEMPS IN UPPER 50S TO LOW 60S SHOULD BE CLOSE. THE ONLY OTHER 
CHANGES IN THE FCST WILL BE TO WIND DIRECTION WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE 
OCCURRING.
  
.ILN...NONE.



@RUKWBCe8KDENFXUS61 KILN 030656
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 AM EDT TUE APR 3 2001

05Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED A COLD FRONT FROM WRN MI..SW INTO NRN 
IL...THEN INTO NRN MO.  ALSO...A WARM FRONT WAS NOTED FROM WRN TN 
INTO SRN MO.

MODELS SHOW WEAK S/WVS RIPPLING ALOFT NORTH OF THE WARM FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY.  THIS..ALONG WITH A LOW LEVEL JET...HAS CAUSED THE 
RAINFALL OCCURRING MAINLY SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER THIS MORNING.  
LOOKING AT THE LAST KILN RADAR LOOP...IT APPEARS THE RAIN HAS 
REACHED JUST ABOUT AS FAR NORTH AS IT IS GOING TO GET.  THIS IS IN 
PART DUE TO THE AFOREMENTIONED APCHING COLD FRONT.  THE FRONT WAS 
BEING PUSHED ALONG BY ANOTHER UPR LVL S/WV...WHICH IS FCST TO DIVE 
SE TOWARD THE NJ/NY COAST BY EVENING.  AS A RESULT...THE APCHING 
FRONT WILL CAUSE THE PCPN AREA TO BEGIN PUSHING SOUTH AND EAST AWAY 
FROM THE REGION TODAY.  A SMALL CHC OF SHOWERS WILL HAVE TO KEPT 
THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS...MAINLY SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  
OTHERWISE...PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES NORTH...AND BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY 
BY AFTERNOON SOUTH LOOKS REASONABLE.  MOS TEMPS ARE IN THE BALL PARK.

BY TONIGHT...THE COLD FRONT WILL HAVE PUSHED THROUGH THE 
REGION...USHERING SOME COOLER AIR.  SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR 
AS SFC HIGH PRESSURE RIDGES INTO THE REGION.  SOME MID LVL 
CLOUDINESS MAY CLIP THE FAR SW TONIGHT AS AN UPR LVL RIDGE BUILDS 
INTO THE PLAINS STATES...SO WILL LEAVE PARTLY CLOUDY THERE FOR NOW.

ON WEDNESDAY...SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY AS ONLY SOME HIGH LVL 
CIRRUS CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED.  HAVE NOTICED THAT THE AVN IS A LITTLE 
WARMER WITH ITS 850 MB TEMPS COMPARED TO THE NGM AND ETA.  ALTHOUGH 
ETA THICKNESS SCHEMES WOULD TELL ME TO GO COOLER TOMORROW...HAVE 
OPTED TO STAY WITH MOS.  ETA THICKNESS SCHEMES HAVE NOT BE DOING 
WELL FOR ABOUT THE LAST FIVE DAYS...BEING COLDER THAN MOS WHILE MOS 
HAS BEEN ABOUT RIGHT ON.  ALSO...THE LAST TWO MOS TRENDS HAVE BEEN 
ABOUT THE SAME...AND THE AVN MOS IS EVEN WARMER.  WITH PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE AND A MODIFYING AIRMASS...WILL NOT DEVIATE FROM MOS 
TOMORROW.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN







@RUKWBCe1KDENFXUS61 KILN 030149
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
948 PM EDT MON APR 2 2001

01Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A WARM FRONT EXTENDING FROM OK ACROSS MO 
INTO TN. A CDNFT ALSO EXTENDED FROM WI INTO IA.

SHRA ACTIVITY WAS OCCURING WELL N OF THE WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY IN A 
ZONE OF ISENTROPIC LIFT.  MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS WL PUSH NWD TO 
NR KCVG AGAIN LATER TONIGHT DUE TO INCREASED LLVL JET. SINCE EARLIER 
-SHRA MADE IT N OF KCVG IN A MUCH DRIER AIR MASS...AM INCLINED TO 
BLV THAT IT WL HAVE NO PROBLEM GETTING THAT FAR N AGAIN LATER 
TONIGHT.

WL MONITOR RADAR TRENDS AND 00Z MODEL RUN TO DETERMINE IF POPS NEED 
TO BE INCREASED FOR SRN FA.  OTHERWISE...TEMPS AND WINDS LOOK GOOD.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON




@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 021923
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
323 PM EDT MON APR 2 2001

AREA UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH TROF MOVING TO ATLANTIC COAST 
AND RIDGE BUILDING INTO MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  SHORT WAVES WILL MOVE 
THROUGH KENTUCKY AND EASTERN LAKE ERIE TONIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY 
BEFORE UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD INTO THE OHIO VALLEY ON 
WEDNESDAY.    

SFC PATTERN SHOWS RIDGE AXIS THROUGH OUR AREA. WARM FRONT IS 
BEGINNING TO EXTEND TOWARD CVG FROM LOW OVER SOUTHERN PLAINS. MODELS 
IN FAIR AGREEMENT IN BRINGING FRONT TO OUR COUNTIES ALONG THE OHIO 
RIVER LATE TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY.  

TSRA ARE CURRENTLY OCCURRING IN MISSOURI ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE WARM 
FRONT.  I DONT EXPECT TSRA TO AFFECT OUR AREA TONIGHT AS 
UPPER DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE WILL SHEAR OUT IN OUR CONFLUENT 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.  I WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS TONIGHT AND EARLY 
TUESDAY IN OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES FOR ANY SHOWERS THAT DEVELOP IN 
ISENTROPIC LIFT ASSOC WITH FRONT.  FARTHER NORTH AT DAY AND 
CMH...WILL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY TONIGHT/PARTLY SUNNY TUESDAY.

AFTER SHORT WAVES MOVE EAST...FRONT IS PROGGED TO SAG SOUTH LATER ON 
TUESDAY.  THIS WILL ALLOW AN INFLUX OF DRIER AIR TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY.  FOR TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY...WILL GO WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR/MOSTLY SUNNY DAY AND CMH...PARTLY CLOUDY/PARTLY SUNNY CVG AND 
PORTSMOUTH WHERE MORE MOISTURE SHOULD LINGER NORTH OF THE FRONT.

ITS HARD TO GO AGAINST FWC TEMPS WITH THEIR RECENT ACCURACY.  ETA 
SHOWS STRONGER COLD ADVECTION THAN OTHER MODELS TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY...BUT AVN HAS SHOWN BETTER SKILL LATELY SO ILL STICK 
CLOSE TO FAN/FWC RATHER THAN WITH THE COOLER ETA.   

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO







@RUKWBCe	KDENFXUS61 KILN 021409
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1008 AM EDT MON APR 2 2001

UPPER TROF MOVING EAST TODAY WITH FLOW ALOFT BECOMING MORE 
WESTERLY.  WARM ADVECTION OCCURRING AT SFC TOO IN RETURN FLOW OF 
HIGH MOVING INTO SOUTH CAROLINA.

SATELLITE/OBS SHOW A GOOD AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE...ESPECIALLY IN OUR 
EASTERN COUNTIES.  CLOUDS MOVING IN FROM INDIANA ARE HAVING 
DIFFICULTY MAKING IT INTO OUR DRIER AIRMASS.  MODELS SHOW 700 MB 
MOISTURE DECLINING AS IT MOVES ACROSS OHIO. 

WILL UPDATE TO MOSTLY SUNNY WITH INCREASING CLOUDS IN COLUMBUS AND 
PORTSMOUTH GROUPS...WHILE KEEPING CVG/DAY PARTLY SUNNY AS SOME SUNNY 
BREAKS WILL OCCUR THERE.  

FCST TEMPS IN MID 50S LOOK GOOD SO NO CHANGES NEEDED. 
OTHERWISE...WILL ADJUST WIND DIRECTION AND NOTHING ELSE. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

@RUKWBCe KDENFXUS61 KILN 020731
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EDT MON APR 2 2001

SAT PIX SHWG MID/HI CLDS SLIDING SE ACRS IL/IND THIS MRNG. 7H FLOW 
BCMS MORE WLY THRU THIS AFTN SO XPCT TO SEE MORE OF AN EWRD PUSH 
WITH THESE CLDS AND WL GO WITH A PRTLY SUNNY FCST FOR TDA. 

LLVL FLOW BACKS SLGTLY THRU THIS EVENG WITH ISENT LIFT DVLPG ON THE 
290-295K SFCS OVRNGT AND INTO ERLY TUE...WITH BEST LIFT ACRS THE S. 
HOWEVER...S/W ENERGY DROPPING DOWN ACRS THE LWR GTLKS TNGT INTO 
TUE...TURNS FLOW BACK ARND TO THE N AND PRETTY MUCH CUTS OFF ISENT 
LIFT IN THE S THRU TUE MRNG. THERE ALSO APPEARS TO BE A PRETTY SHARP 
CUTOFF TO THE DPR MSTR TNGT AND TUE SO WL ONLY GO WITH A LOW CHC OF 
SHWRS ACRS THE S FOR LATER TNGT AND HANG ON TO A CHC INTO TUE MRNG. 
NEW AVN HAS ALSO TRENDED A LTL FARTHER S WITH PCPN FOR TUESDAY NGT 
AND WED AND BASED ON THIS...WL ONLY HANG ON TO A CHC OF SHWRS ACRS 
THE S FOR TUE NGT AND THEN TRY AND KP THINGS DRY ON WED. 

AM RELUCTANT TO STRAY TOO FAR FM FWC FOR HIGHS AS LLVL THCKNS 
SCHEMES PRETTY MUCH IN LINE WITH THEM AND FWC HAS BEEN DOING FAIRLY 
WELL LAST FEW DAYS. MAY GO A LTL WRMR WITH LOWS...ESPCLY ACRS S WHR 
CLDS SHUD BE MORE WDSPRD. 

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT



336 
FXUS61 KILN 011844
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EDT SUN APR 1 2001

PCPN IN THE EAST CONTINUES TO FALL APART AS IT PULL AWAY.  MEANWHILE 
CLEARING LINE CONTINUES TO WORK ACROSS FA AND IS ALMOST HALF WAY 
ACROSS.  THE CU ACROSS IL AND WESTERN INDIANA IS DIURNAL...SO EXPECT 
SKIES TO BECOME CLEAR OVERNIGHT.  DO EXPECT SOME CI TO WORK BACK 
INTO THE SOUTHWEST LATE TONIGHT...BUT FEEL THAT A MOSTLY CLEAR 
WORDING WILL BE FINE.

HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES TONIGHT INTO 
TOMORROW...PROVIDING PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES....THEN WARM FRONT TRIES TO 
DEVELOP ACROSS TN/KY MONDAY NIGHT.  AVN IS ALONE MONDAY NIGHT IN 
FORMING AN MCS AND SLIDING SE ALONG THE FRONT PRODUCING OVER .75 
INCHES MONDAY NIGHT.  THIS APPEARS TO BE IN RESPONSE TO ENERGY 
DROPPING SE NORTH OF THE GREAT LAKES.  ETA AND NGM ARE MORE 
CONSERVATIVE AND TRY TO KEEP SHOWERS SOUTH OF THE FRONT.  WILL 
DISCOUNT AVN SOLUTION AS IT APPEARS OVERDONE WITH THE NORTHERN 
STREAM ENERGY. HOWEVER...FEEL THAT WITH GOOD LIFT ACROSS FRONT THAT 
A FEW SHOWERS COULD FORM IN THE SOUTHWEST MONDAY NIGHT...SO WILL 
CONTINUE TO MENTION THEM.  WILL PULL OUT THE PCPN MONDAY NIGHT 
ELSEWHERE.

WARM FRONT PUSHES NORTH ON TUESDAY.  PER REASONING ABOVE...WILL 
MENTION CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE FA TUESDAY.  THINK THE 
SOUTHWEST MIGHT GET INTO THE WARM SECTOR ON TUESDAY...SO WILL ADD 
MENTION OF THUNDER.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES.  MOS WAS TRENDED WARMER TONIGHT ALL LOCATIONS. 
ALTHOUGH COULD SEE SOME PATCHY FOG AND HIGH CLOUDS...THINK THAT IT 
IS TOO WARM AND WILL CONTINUE WITH THE CURRENT FORECAST NUMBERS 
WHICH ARE IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S.  MOS CONTINUES TO SHOW 
TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER TO MID 50S. THOSE NUMBERS LOOK PRETTY 
GOOD...SO JUST MIGHT TWEAK HERE OR THERE.

WITH WARM FRONT STILL TO THE SOUTH MONDAY NIGHT WILL TRIM OVERNIGHT 
LOWS DOWN TO MOS NUMBERS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.


.ILN...NONE.

SITES










@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 011417
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1015 AM EDT SUN APR 1 2001

AREA OF PRECIPITATION IS FARTHER EAST THAN WHAT WAS EXPECTED 
YESTERDAY...HAVING CLEARED MOST OF THE WESTERN COUNTIES. TIMING ON 
THE PRECIP WOULD PUSH IT OUT OF THE EAST DURING THE EARLY AFTERNOON 
HOURS. WILL PLAY UP THE SNOW WORDING...BUT WILL NOT MENTION 
ACCUMULATIONS.

PRETTY SHARP CLEARING LINE ACROSS INDIANA AT THE MOMENT.  NGM CURU 
IS CALLING FOR NO CU DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON...WHILE ETA KEEPS A 
LOT OF CLOUDS.  THE NGM APPEARED TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE ON THE 
CLOUD LINE AT 12Z...SO WILL FAVOR THAT SOLUTION AND WILL CONTINUE 
WITH THE BECOMING PARTLY SUNNY.

WILL LEAVE HIGHS AS IS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.


.ILN...NONE.

SITES

@RUKWBCe2KDENFXUS61 KILN 010750
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
350 AM EDT SUN APR 1 2001

MAIN AREA OF PCPN PUSHG E INTO WRN FA THIS MRNG WHILE SCT SHWRS 
CONTG ACRS CNTRL OH. PCPN APPEARS TO BE MAKING PRETTY GOOD EWD MOVMT 
AND THINK IT WILL END ACRS WRN FA THRU THIS MRNG AND SHUD BE OUT OF 
THE E BY ERLY AFTN. 

SAT PIX SHWG SHARP CLRG EDGE MOVG INTO WRN IN BUT WITH CAA DVLPG... 
XPCT TO SEE SOME CU DVLPMT THRU RMDR AFTN SO WL KP SKIES MSTLY CLDY 
ONCE PCPN ENDS. ALSO WITH GOOD ISENT DOWNGLIDE DVLPG...SHUD SEE 
WINDS PICK UP THRU THIS MRNG INTO 15 TO 25 MPH RANGE. CU SHUD THEN 
DSIPT THIS EVNG WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HTG FOR CLRG SKIES. LLVL WINDS 
BACK ARND TO THE SW MON AFTN INTO MON NGT WITH DECENT ISENT LIFT 
DVLPG ACRS THE SW OVRNGT AND ACRS ENTIRE AREA ON TUE. XPCT MAINLY 
MID/HI LVL CLDS ON MON FOR PRTLY SUN SKIES WITH CLDS THEN THICKENING 
UP MON NGT WITH A CHC OF RAIN ACRS SW 1/2 OF FA AFT MDNGT. 

HIGH TMPS TRICKY NEXT CPL OF DAYS. TMPS CRNTLY RUNNING IN THE LOW TO 
MID 40S BUT WITH CAA DVLPG SHUD SEE TMPS DROP OFF INITIALLY AND THEN 
RECOVER SOMEWHAT SO WL GO WITH HIGHS MAINLY IN THE MID 40S. GUID 
TMPS FOR MON HIGHS OFF 00Z MDLS A CPL CATS WRMR THAN 12Z MDLS AND 
THINK THEY MAY BE TRYING TO WRM THINGS UP A LTL TOO QUICK AS GOOD 
WAA DOES NOT KICK IN TIL LATE IN THE DAY. WL SHAVE A CPL DEGREES OFF 
COOLER FWC AND HOPE THAT WE DO NOT END UP WITH MORE SUN THAN XPCTD.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

1055 PM EST SAT MAR 31 2001

SFC LOW NOW OVR SW MI/NRN IN. MDL RUNS COMING IN APPEAR TO HAVE 
INITIALIZED PRETTY WELL...AND STILL LOOKS LIKE HEAVIEST PRECIP WL 
STAY MAINLY TO SOUTH OF CWA. CHCS OF TSTMS HAVE ALSO DIMINISHED...SO 
WL TAKE OUT ALL MTN OF THUNDER AND CLEAN UP TIMING. CRNT FCST LOWS 
LOOK GOOD. 

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW. 

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 311924
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
223 PM EST SAT MAR 31 2001

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE MAJOR FEATURES OVER THE NEXT 48 
HOURS. STRENGTHENING VORT DIVES FROM NORTHERN PLAINS INTO LOWER OHIO 
VALLEY BY 12Z. THEN BROAD 500 MB TROF GOES A LITTLE NEGATIVE TILT AS 
IT SWINGS ACROSS THE FA ON SUNDAY...BEFORE LIFTING NORTHEAST SUNDAY 
NIGHT.

ALL MODELS SEEM TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THE POSITION OF THE RAINS 
OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ATTM.  IT APPEARS THAT THE ETA AND AVN 
TRY TO FORM SOME SHOWERS ACROSS INDIANA THIS AFTERNOON...PUSHING  
QPF INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS BEFORE 00Z TONIGHT. NGM MEANWHILE 
WAITS TILL AFTER 06Z TO BRING IN THE QPF.  KIND RADAR IS SHOWING 
SOME RETURNS AND CLOUDS ARE SHOWING SOME DEVELOPMENT ON THE VISIBLE 
SATELLITE.  IN THE HWEST...WILL MENTION A CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
BEFORE MIDNIGHT...THEN WILL INCREASE IT TO CATEGORICAL OR LIKELY 
AFTER MIDNIGHT.

BEST PUSH OF COLD AIR TOMORROW IS ACROSS INDIANA INTO KENTUCKY. 
ALTHOUGH 1000-850 MB THICKNESS DROP BELOW 1300M TONIGHT OVER 
INDIANA...THEY QUICKLY WARM.  WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION ONLY RAIN.  
WITH COLD POCKET PASSING SOUTH THROUGH CENTRAL KY ON 
SUNDAY...THOUGHT THERE MIGHT BE A CHANCE OF THUNDER IN THE SOUTH.  
LOOKED AT SFC BASED LI AND ELEVATED LI...AT IT APPEARS THAT THE 
CHANCE OF THUNDER WILL BE OVER JKL AND CRW AREAS.

AS MENTIONED EARLIER...SYSTEM PULLS NORTHEAST SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL 
CONTINUE TO LINGER RAIN IN CENTRAL OHIO EARLY SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT 
FEEL THAT IT WILL BE EAST OF THE NORTHERN MIAMI VALLEY BY 00Z... SO 
WILL GO DRY THERE.  PARTS OF THE SOUTHWEST COULD SEE CLEARING BY 
MONDAY MORNING...BUT WILL GO WITH CLOUDY...BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY.

IN GENERAL MOS LOOKS TO BE IN THE BALLPARK.  DID TWEAK CVG MOS UP 
TONIGHT BASED ON THE CLOUD COVER AND RAIN. WENT A DEGREE OR TWO 
COOLER ON MONDAY THAN MOS FOR HIGHS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1111 AM EST SAT MAR 31 2001

STRATUS HAS CLEARED LICKING AND FAIRFIELD COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO.  
SATELLITE IS SHOWING SOME CU FORMING OVER THE SAME AREA...BUT FEEL 
THAT A PARTLY CLOUDY SHOULD SUFFICE.

THERE ARE A FEW OTHER ROUGE AREAS OF CLOUDS FLOATING ACROSS CENTRAL 
PORTIONS OF THE FA...BUT PARTLY CLOUDY/SUNNY SHOULD DO FINE.

BIGGEST QUESTION IS WHAT TO DO ABOUT THE KY COUNTIES.  THEY ARE 
PRETTY CLOUDY RIGHT NOW.  HOWEVER THE CLEARING IN SE INDIANA DOES 
SEEM TO PUSHING SOUTHEAST...SO WILL LEAVE THE VARIABLE CLOUDINESS. 
MIGHT TWEAK TEMPERATURES A LITTLE IN NRN KY AND SOUTH CENTRAL OH/NE 
KY GROUPS.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MOMENTS...THEN ZFP.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 310808
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 AM EST SAT MAR 31 2001

RADAR SHWG SCT LGT RAIN SHWRS CONTG ACRS SRN THIRD OF FA. S/W 
PRODUCING PCPN WL PUSH E THRU 12Z BUT WL PRBLY HAV TO CARRY AN ERLY 
PD TO ACCOUNT FOR SHWRS ACRS THE SE. OTHRWS...FAIR AMT OF MID AND 
HIGH LVL CLOUDS ACRS AREA ATTM THO SOME CLRG PRESENT ACRS CNTL IL 
AND INTO IN. AM LEANING TWD A MSTLY CLDY FCST FOR TDA BUT AM A LTL 
WORRIED ABT SOME OF THE CLRG TO OUR W WORKING IN THRU THIS AFTN.  

ETA AND AVN BOTH TRENDING A LTL FARTHER S WITH MAIN VORT BUT STILL 
BROAD AREA OF PVA PUSHG ACRS FA LATE TNGT AND SUN. NOT MUCH IN THE 
WAY OF ISENT LIFT SO LIFT MAINLY DYNAMICALLY DRIVEN WITH BEST LIFT 
FM LATE TNGT THRU ERLY SUN AFTN SPRDG SW TO NE ACRS FA. WL CONT WITH 
TREND OF CRNT FCST WITH LIKELY POPS ACRS SW AFT MIDNGT AND CHC POPS 
RMNDR FA MAINLY LATE TNGT. WL THEN GO WITH CAT POPS ALL BUT SW FOR 
SUN. ACRS THE SW...PCPN EVNT LOOKS TO BE MAINLY IN THE MRNG SO WL 
JUST GO WITH LIKELY POPS. 

WITH COLD AIR MOVG IN ALF...LI/S DROP BELOW ZERO ACRS THE SE THRU 
18Z SUN AND WITH DECENT DYNAMICS...WL INCLUDE A MENTION OF THUNDER 
FOR FAR S AND SE. MEANWHILE...THCNSS DROP OFF PRETTY GUD THRU THE 
DAY ON SUN BUT BNDRY LAYER STILL WRM ENUF THAT PCPN SHUD RMN IN THE 
FORM OF RAIN. 30-40 KT 925 MB WNDS PROGD ACRS AREA BY SUN AFTN AND 
WITH CAA DVLPG...SHUD BE ABLE TO MIX SOME OF THIS DOWN SO WL INDICT 
BCMG BREEZY SUN AFTN. 

FOR SUN NGT...WL ONLY KP A CHC OF PCPN ACRS THE NE AS FORCING LIFTS 
OFF TO THE NE QUICKLY. HOWEVER IN CAA PATTERN...THINK CLDS WL LINGER 
ACRS MUCH OF FA THRU SUN NGT. 

LLVL THCKNS SCHEMES TDA AGN PRETTY CLOSE TO YSTRDY SO WL FCST HIGHS 
ABT THE SAME AS ON FRI AND THIS CLOSE TO GUID. THINK WITH MORE CLDS 
ARND TNGT THRU SUN NGT THO...FWC TMPS A LTL TOO COLD WITH LOWS AND 
MAYBE A LTL TOO WARM WITH HIGHS FOR SUN.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

RAIN IS CONTINUING ACROSS THE SRN FRINGE OF CWFA. MESO LOW HAS 
FORMED N OF CVG AND AS A RESULT WINDS HAVE SHIFTED IN RESPONSE. THIS 
HAS NOT INCREASED RAIN COVERAGE OR INTENSITY THO. BUT THE RAIN IS 
MOVING A LITTLE SLOWER THAN EXPECTED SO WILL TAKE OUT MIDNIGHT 
WORDING. WILL BUMP TEMPS UP IN THE SRN GRPS AS MORE SOUTHERLY WINDS 
WILL HELP KEEP TEMPS UP.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 302015
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EST FRI MAR 30 2001

WEAK S/WV MOVG ACROSS THE LOWER OH VLY THIS PM WL BRUSH AREAS ALONG 
AND S OF THE OH RIVER BEFORE 06Z AND THEN MOVE E OF FA.  WL CARRY 
LIKELY POPS IN NRN KY AND VC PMH...AND CHANCE POPS FOR CVG.  DUE TO 
SHARP EDGE OF RAIN SHIELD...WL INCLUDE ONLY SPRINKLES DAY-CMH.

FA WL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS ON SAT AND WITH MODELS SHOWING SOME DRYING 
WL GO WITH P/C SKIES.  A POTENT SYSTEM WITH STRONG DYNAMIC LIFT WL 
MOVE QUICKLY INTO THE OH VLY ON SAT NIGHT.  WL GO WITH LIKELY POPS 
VC CVG AND CHC ELSEWHERE.  MODELS KEEP ELEVATED INSTABILITY S OF THE 
OH RIVER SO WL NOT INCLUDE THUNDER ATTM.

MID LEVEL LOW IS PROGD TO BECOME CLOSED OVER THE LOWER OH VLY ON 
SUN.  DAY-CMH AREAS WL BE IN DEFORMATION AREA WITH STRONG LIFT.  
DESPITE CRASHING 1000-500 MB THICKNESSES...LWR LVLS ARE PROGD TO 
REMAIN WARM.  THIS TYPE OF DEFORMATION PRECIP CAN CHANGE TO SNOW IN 
THE HEAVIEST BURSTS WHEN THE TEMP PROFILE IS MARGINAL.  LATEST MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT LLVLS WL BE A LITTLE TOO WARM FOR A 
CHANGEOVER BUT IT WL HAVE TO BE WATCHED.  WL CARRY CAT POPS FOR 
DAY-CMH AND NRN MIAMI VLY.

FOR CVG-PMH GROUPS...RAIN MAY END FOR A WHILE ON SUN AM BEFORE SOME 
ADDITIONAL SHOWERS IN THE PM.  WL CARRY LIKELY POPS.

TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE IN ALL PERIODS SO WL STICK CLOSE.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
946 AM EST FRI MAR 30 2001

LATEST VISIBLE IMAGERY INDICATING LLVL CLOUDS MOVG SWWD INTO THE CMH 
AREA AND MID/HIGH CLOUDINESS APPROACHING FROM THE SW.  12Z KILN 
SOUNDING DEPICTS THIS WELL WITH NELY FLOW BELOW 700 MB AND WLY FLOW 
ABOVE.

COMBINATION OF CLOUDS TYPES WL LEAD TO A M/CDY AFTERNOON. WEAK MID 
LVL SYSTEM OVER WRN KY AREA WL SPREAD NEWD BUT WL BE SLOWED BY DRY 
LLVL AIR.  WL KEEP 30% POPS IN CVG-PMH GROUPS AND THEN BREAK OFF A 
CARROLLTON KY GROUP AND RAISE POPS TO 50%.

TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE.  ONLY CHANGE WL BE TO THE CMH GROUP.  LOWER 
CLOUDS MAY LIMIT INSOLATION A BIT SO WL LOWER HIGHS TO 50-55.

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 AM EST FRI MAR 30 2001

MDLS IN DECENT AGRMT TDA WITH WK S/W LIFTING UP ACRS OH VLY THRU 
LATE AFTN AND ERLY THIS EVNG. AREA RADARS INDICTG LGT PCPN CRNTLY 
PUSHG INTO WRN KY AND SRN IL. THIS WL MOV SLOWLY E THRU TDA BUT WITH 
RELATIVELY DRY LLVLS...PCPN SHUD HOLD OFF TIL LATE AND BE PRETTY 
LGT. WL GO WITH LOW CHC POPS ACRS THE S FOR LATE THIS AFTN AND JUST 
MSTLY CLDY IN THE N. S/W WL PUSH ACRS FA OVRNGT BUT FORCING RMNS 
FAIRLY WEAK SO WL SCALE BACK FCST TO CHC POPS ENTIRE FA WITH HIGHEST 
POPS RMNG ACRS THE S. CUD SEE A FEW LGT SHWRS LINGER INTO SAT MRNG 
ACRS THE E WITH OTHRWS MSTLY CLDY SKIES CONTG. 

SOME MDL DIFFERENCES ARISE AS WE GET INTO SAT NGT. AVN SIG STGR WITH 
NEXT VORT COMPARED TO ETA AND AS A RESULT TRYING TO CRANK OUT QUITE 
A BIT MORE PCPN. AVN HAS BEEN TRENDING FASTER WITH THIS SO WL BEEF 
UP WORDING FOR SAT NGT A LTL ACRS THE SW. IF AVN ENDS UP BEING RIGHT 
...MAY EVEN SEE A FEW TSTMS. WL ALSO HAV TO WATCH PCPN TYPE FOR SUN 
WITH THICKNSS DRPG OFF FAIRLY QUICKLY THRU THE DAY BUT WITH BNDRY 
LAYER STILL XPCTD TO BE ON THE WARM SIDE...WL KP PCPN RAIN ATTM. 

AS FOR TMPS...LLVL THCKNSS ABT THE SAME TDA AS THUR. HOWEVER...MAY 
SEE A LTL MORE SUN TDA SO WL GO CLOSE TO GUID TMPS FOR HIGHS WHICH 
WUD BE A CPL OF DGRS WRMR THAN YSTRDY. WITH CLDS TNGT...WL GO A LTL 
WRMR THAN GUID FOR LOWS. STUCK PRETTY CLOSE TO GUID RMNDR FCST THO 
SAT NGT CUD BE TRICKY IF COLD AIR GETS IN AS QUICK AS AVN IS SHWG. 

.ILN...NONE.

255 AM EST FRI MAR 30 2001

MDLS IN DECENT AGRMT TDA WITH WK S/W LIFTING UP ACRS OH VLY THRU 
LATE AFTN AND ERLY THIS EVNG. AREA RADARS INDICTG LGT PCPN CRNTLY 
PUSHG INTO WRN KY AND SRN IL. THIS WL MOV SLOWLY E THRU TDA BUT WITH 
RELATIVELY DRY LLVLS...PCPN SHUD HOLD OFF TIL LATE AND BE PRETTY 
LGT. WL GO WITH LOW CHC POPS ACRS THE S FOR LATE THIS AFTN AND JUST 
MSTLY CLDY IN THE N. S/W WL PUSH ACRS FA OVRNGT BUT FORCING RMNS 
FAIRLY WEAK SO WL SCALE BACK FCST TO CHC POPS ENTIRE FA WITH HIGHEST 
POPS RMNG ACRS THE S. CUD SEE A FEW LGT SHWRS LINGER INTO SAT MRNG 
ACRS THE E WITH OTHRWS MSTLY CLDY SKIES CONTG. 

SOME MDL DIFFERENCES ARISE AS WE GET INTO SAT NGT. AVN SIG STGR WITH 
NEXT VORT COMPARED TO ETA AND AS A RESULT TRYING TO CRANK OUT QUITE 
A BIT MORE PCPN. AVN HAS BEEN TRENDING FASTER WITH THIS SO WL BEEF 
UP WORDING FOR SAT NGT A LTL ACRS THE SW. IF AVN ENDS UP BEING RIGHT 
...MAY EVEN SEE A FEW TSTMS. WL ALSO HAV TO WATCH PCPN TYPE FOR SUN 
WITH THICKNSS DRPG OFF FAIRLY QUICKLY THRU THE DAY BUT WITH BNDRY 
LAYER STILL XPCTD TO BE ON THE WARM SIDE...WL KP PCPN RAIN ATTM. 

AS FOR TMPS...LLVL THCKNSS ABT THE SAME TDA AS THUR. HOWEVER...MAY 
SEE A LTL MORE SUN TDA SO WL GO CLOSE TO GUID TMPS FOR HIGHS WHICH 
WUD BE A CPL OF DGRS WRMR THAN YSTRDY. WITH CLDS TNGT...WL GO A LTL 
WRMR THAN GUID FOR LOWS. STUCK PRETTY CLOSE TO GUID RMNDR FCST THO 
SAT NGT CUD BE TRICKY IF COLD AIR GETS IN AS QUICK AS AVN IS SHWG. 

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

052 
FXUS61 KILN 291931
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
231 PM EST THU MAR 29 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING PARTIALLY THIN CIRRUS OVER FA.  WATER 
VAPOR SHOW 3 MAIN SHORT WAVES OVER THE SOUTHERN U.S. AND GULF OF 
MEXICO.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH ONLY MINOR DIFFERENCES IN 
STRENGTH AND TIMING.  THE ONLY DIFFERENCE THAT MAY AFFECT THE 
FORECAST IS TIMING OF BOUNDARY/WEAK SURFACE LOW OVER THE WESTERN 
OHIO VALLEY SATURDAY AFTERNOON/NIGHT.

WILL CONTINUE DRY FORECAST OVERNIGHT AND THEN INTRODUCE LOW POPS IN 
SOUTHWEST FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS WAVE CURRENTLY OVER EASTERN TEXAS 
SHEARS OUT AND HEADS NORTH.  THIS WILL BRING SOME LIGHT RAIN TO 
MAINLY SOUTHERN FA FRIDAY NIGHT.  NEXT THREAT OF RAIN WILL COME 
SATURDAY NIGHT AS STRONG UPPER LOW PUSHES COLD FRONT THROUGH FA WITH 
MUCH COLDER AIR FILLING IN BEHIND IT.  UPPER LOW WILL THEN DEEPEN 
OVER REGION KEEPING THE THREAT OF RAIN THROUGH MONDAY.  CONCERNED 
ABOUT SNOW POTENTIAL ACROSS THE SOUTH ESPECIALLY SUNDAY NIGHT BUT 
WILL HOLD OFF ON MENTION FOR KNOW AS MODELS HAVE HAD A HARD TIME 
DEALING WITH THESE STRONG SYSTEMS AND TIMING AND POSITIONING WILL 
LIKELY BE DIFFERENT THAT CURRENT PROGS.  HOWEVER, IF AVN/MRF WERE A 
PERFECT PROG THEN THREAT OF SNOW COULD BE REAL AS PLENTY OF COLD 
AIR ALOFT WITH MARGINAL LOW LEVEL THICKNESS COULD BRING A MIX OR 
SWITCH OVER TO ANY PRECIP.  UKMET AND EUROPEAN MODELS HAVE SAME FEEL 
FOR UPPER TROUGH BUT VARY IN TIMING AND RESOLUTION.  LATTER SHIFTS 
WILL HAVE TO MONITOR THIS POTENTIAL SNEAKY SNOW EVENT.

CLOUD COVER SHOULD REMAIN CLOUDY OR MO CLOUDY.  HOWEVER THERE MAY BE 
A TIME TOMORROW AND SATURDAY WHEN THE SUN BREAKS OUT.  FEEL THAT ANY 
DESCENT BREAKS WILL FILL IN RATHER QUICKLY AS THE LCL IS REACHED.  
FWC LOOKS GOOD BUT WILL TAKE A BLEND OF MAV/FWC ON SATURDAY AS FWC 
LOOKS TOO COLD.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON





355 AM EST THU MAR 29 2001

H5 FLOW HAS TURNED SOUTHWEST WITH RIDGE ALONG THE ATLANTIC COAST 
WITH TROF CENTERED OVER TEXAS.  MODELS ARE KEEPING UPPER DYNAMICS 
FARTHER WEST THAN PREVIOUS RUNS.  SHORT WAVE IS CURRENTLY ENTERING 
OUR WESTERN COUNTIES.  SHORT WAVE WILL LIFT THROUGH OHIO BY 18Z 
TODAY.  ANOTHER SHORT WAVE WILL AFFECT OUR REGION LATE ON FRIDAY.

SFC PATTERN DIFFUSE WITH WEAK TROF ALONG THE OHIO VALLEY EXTENDING 
TOWARD HIGH OVER MASSACHUSETTS.  AREA UNDER SOUTHERLY FLOW WITH WARM 
ADVECTION AND DRY DEWPOINTS WHERE IT IS NOT RAINING.  

OBS/RADAR SHOW LIGHT RAIN THAT IS DRIVEN BY NARROW BAND OF 
ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF FIRST SHORT WAVE FROM CVG TO DAY.  RAIN 
SHOULD END AT CVG AND DAY BY 6 AM...AND AT CMH BY MID MORNING AS 
SHORT WAVE PASSES THROUGH. 

WILL GO WITH EARLY THIS MORNING PERIOD WITH LIGHT RAIN...THEN MOSTLY 
CLOUDY WEST...RAIN ENDING MID MORNING EAST.  MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS 
ARE LACKING FOR TONIGHT WRT PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS.  WILL PULL POPS ALL 
ZONES.  WITH PVA AND MOISTURE ADVANCING SLOWLY NORTH...ILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS IN THE SOUTH LATE ON FRIDAY...WHILE REMOVING POPS IN THE 
NORTH.  WITH SFC LOW PROGGED OVER WEST VIRGINIA CARRYING A GOOD SHOT 
OF MOISTURE...WILL ADJUST FRIDAY NIGHT FROM MOSTLY CLOUDY TO RAIN 
LIKELY SOUTH/CHANCE RAIN NORTH.

FWC TEMPS STILL LOOK OK.  TODAYS 48 AT DAY LOOKS TOO LOW BUT 51 AT 
CVG AND CMH APPEAR ABOUT RIGHT.  NIGHTTIME LOWS ARE A BIT TOO LOW 
AGAIN WITH CLOUDS AND WIND EXPECTED...SO ILL GO A COUPLE DEGREES 
ABOVE FWC FOR LOWS.  FRIDAYS HIGHS LOOK TOO HIGH IN NORTHEAST FLOW 
AND WITH CLOUDS...SO ILL UNDER CUT BY COUPLE DEGREES.

.ILN...NONE.

905 PM EST WED MAR 28 2001

IMPRESSIVE DRY LAYER NOTED FROM 650 TO 700MB THIS PM, AND AGAIN AT 
THE SFC WITH A EXPANSIVE AREA OF DEWPOINTS IN THE TEENS. IT SHOULD 
TAKE SOME TIME ERODING THIS DRY AIR TO PRODUCE PRECIPITATION ACROSS 
FCST AREA, BUT THINK THAT IT WILL HAPPEN EVENTUALLY. MAIN CONCERN 
RIGHT NOW IS THE MENTION OF SNOW IN THE NORTH. MODEL SOUNDINGS AND 
THICKNESSES INDICATE A CHANCE OF MIXING FOR A PERIOD, IF NOT 
STARTING AS JUST SNOW IN THE FAR NORTH. WILL HOLD ON TO PREVIOUS 
WORDING AS IT ONLY INDICATED THE POSSIBILITY.

RAIN MAY BE TOO STRONG OF A WORD FOR WHATS COMING DOWN THE LINE, 
AND ILL PROBABLY SWITCH TO LIGHT RAIN ALONG WITH SPRINKLES IN THE 
NORTH WHERE IT WILL BE A LITTLE TOUGHER TO OVERCOME THE DRY AIR 
WITH A LITTLE LESS FORCING.

LOW TEMPS WERE RUNNING ON UNTIL I NOTICED IT WAS 39 HERE AT ILN. 
READINGS WERE FAIRLY UNIFORM UNDER CLOUD SHIELD...AND WILL HOLD ON 
TO PREVIOUS SHIFTS LOWS AS WE SHOULD CLIMB BACK UP TO WHAT REST OF 
THE REGION IS COMING IN AT WITH LOW AND MID 40S.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
259 PM EST WED MAR 28 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING MAINLY CLEAR SKIES OVER FA WITH CLOUDS 
ENCROACHING FROM THE WEST.  REGIONAL RADAR IMAGE SHOWS SCATTERED 
RETURNS OVER WESTERN ILLINOIS.

MODELS HAVE SUBTLE DIFFERENCES.  THE NGM IS THE FARTHEST NORTH WITH 
THE TRACK OF THE LOW WITH THE ETA/AVN SIMILAR ALTHOUGH THEY HAVE 
DIFFERENCES IN ITS STRENGTH.  THANKFULLY THESE DIFFERENCES DO NOT 
AFFECT THE FORECAST MUCH.  

CLOUDS WILL INCREASE DURING THE EVENING WITH THE THREAT OF PRECIP 
AFTER MIDNIGHT WILL GO WITH A POSSIBLE MIX I-70 NORTH AS TDS WILL BE 
DRY TO BEGIN WITH AND THICKNESSES MARGINALLY SUPPORT.  WILL GO WITH 
THE BETTER POPS ACROSS THE SOUTH CLOSER TO THE LOWER AND MID LEVEL 
JETS AND PLAY DOWN A LITTLE WITH THE NORTHERN VORT MAX.  WILL BRING 
KEEPS IT DRY ACROSS THE NORTH ON THURSDAY AS ALL THE FOCUSING WILL 
BE ACROSS THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWARD UNTIL THE SURFACE LOW ACTUALLY 
KICKS NORTHEASTWARD THURSDAY NIGHT.  ONCE AGAIN WILL KEEP BEST POPS 
ACROSS THE SOUTH.  AFTER THE LOW PASSES...SURFACE RIDGING WILL KEEP 
SATURDAY DRY BUT MAINLY CLOUDY AS PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTER WILL 
REMAIN.  THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL AFFECT FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY 
BRINGING A GOOD SHOT OF RAIN AND IF THE 12Z AVN IS CORRECT FA WILL 
BE IN THE MIDST OF REDEVELOPMENT SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY.

FWC AND MAV CLOSE...IN FACT TOUGH TO BEAT FWC.  SO WILL STAY 
RELATIVELY CLOSE.

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
312 AM EST WED MAR 28 2001

H5 RIDGE IS BUILDING IN THIS MORNING...WITH ITS AXIS TO BISECT OHIO 
AT 18Z.  FLOW ALOFT IS PROGGED TO TURN SOUTHWEST BY LATE TONIGHT 
WITH A CORRESPONDING INCREASE IN MOISTURE.

AT SFC...WARM ADVECTION IS OCCURRING IN SOUTHERLY FLOW BEHIND HIGH 
OVER VIRGINIA.  HIGH WILL CONTINUE EAST-NORTHEAST TODAY AS LOW 
DEVELOPS ALONG THE GULF COAST.  MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT IN BRINGING 
LOW UP THE APPALACHIANS TO VIRGINIA AT 12Z FRIDAY...WITH ETA BEING A 
BIT FASTER.  WITH GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT AND SHORT WAVE WELL AHEAD OF 
LOW...MODELS HAVE PAINTED QPF OVER OUR AREA BEGINNING AT ABOUT 02Z 
TONIGHT.  ALSO...FWC POPS HAVE INCREASED TO 90%.

MODELS CONSISTENT WITH MOISTURE INCREASING FROM 500-300 MB BY LATE 
AFTERNOON.  WILL CONTINUE PREVIOUS FCST FOR TODAY...MOSTLY SUNNY 
WITH INCREASING CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON. 

CHANGES ARE NECESSARY FOR TONIGHTS FCST.  WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT AND 
DEEP MOISTURE ARRIVING BY 06Z THURSDAY...WILL INCREASE POPS TO 
LIKELY IN THE SOUTH AND KEEP CHANCE POPS NORTH.  WITH DRYING AT 500 
MB AND SHORT WAVE MOVING EAST...CHANCE POPS ARE STILL APPROPRIATE 
FOR THURSDAY.   

AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FWC LOWS WITH 
OVERCAST SKIES.  FWC HIGHS HAVE BEEN HARD TO BEAT LATELY SO I WONT 
DEVIATE MUCH FROM THEM.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO



@RUKWBCe:KDENFXUS61 KILN 271958
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EST TUE MAR 27 2001

CLOUDS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE THE ACHILLES HEAL FOR TONIGHT/S FCST.

CURRENT VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOULD EXTENSIVE CUMULUS CLOUDS 
ACRS THE REGION.  SOME OF THE HEALTHIER CUMULUS AND PERHAPS IN THE 
ALTOCUMULUS STAGE WAS NOTED ACRS THE NORTHERN CWFA.  LAST 
NIGHT...CLOUDS HUNG AROUND ALL NIGHT LONG.  HOWEVER...I BELIEVE 
TONIGHT SHOULD BE A LITTLE DIFFERENT.  LAST NIGHT FEATURED A S/WV 
MOVING INTO THE AREA ALONG WITH A PERSISTENT COLD POOL ALOFT.  THIS 
EVENING...A S/WV WILL SWING BY TO THE S AND E...ALLOWING FOR MID LVL 
RIDGING ALOFT (ANTICYCLONIC MOTION) ALONG WITH SOME WAA ALOFT.  
WHERE THE CUMULUS IS MIXING WITH DRIER AIR ALOFT (FAR SWRN 
CWFA)...SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR.  WHERE THE CLOUDS ARE 
BOUNTIFUL (NRN AND ERN CWFA)...IT WILL TAKE AWHILE OVERNIGHT FOR 
CLOUDS TO CLEAR OUT.  WILL FCST LOWS GENERALLY IN THE LOWER 
20S...ALTHOUGH THE CVG AIRPORT MAY GET SNEAKY COLD.

MID LEVEL S/WV RIDGING SHOULD PROVIDE FOR A MOSTLY SUNNY START ON 
WEDNESDAY.  THEN...HIGH LVL CLOUDINESS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AHEAD 
OF THE NXT S/WV TO AFFECT THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY 
MORNING.  ETA THICKNESS SCHEMES CONTINUE TO BE COLD...WHILE MOS/MAV 
ARE STILL SHOWING A DECENT WARM UP TOMORROW.  IT IS HARD TO DENY THE 
CONSISTENCY OF THE MOS/MAV...SO WILL ONLY STRAY A DEGREE OR TWO FROM 
GUIDANCE.  WILL TAKE A QUICK LOOK AT SFC OBS OVR NRN MO BEFORE 
ISSUANCE TO SEE HOW TEMPS ARE WARMING THERE.  THE AFOREMENTIONED 
S/WV WILL PUSH INTO THE WRN CWFA AFTER MIDNIGHT...THEN IT WILL PIVOT 
INTO THE ERN CWFA TOWARD MORNING.  THIS SYSTEM DOESN/T HAVE A LOT OF 
MSTR TO WORK WITH.  HOWEVER...IT SHOULD BE VIGOROUS ENOUGH TO 
PRODUCE A FEW SHOWERS.  WILL GIVE ALL LOCATIONS AN ACRS THE BOARD 
POP OF 40 PERCENT.

A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO THURSDAY FOLLOWED BY A RESPITE BEFORE 
THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM FCST FOR THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY.  
AVN/MRF HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT IN BRINGING A SRN STREAM S/WV OUT OF 
THE GULF OF MEXICO AND INTO THE OHIO VLY.  LATEST RUNS HAVE BEEN 
TRENDING TOWARD A SLOWER AND MORE STRONGER SOLUTION.  AS NCEP HAS 
NOTED...MODELS MAY BE UNDERDOING THE JET ENERGY ACRS THE ERN 
PACIFIC...SOME OF WHICH WILL HAVE AN INFLUENCE ON THE DEVELOPING LOW 
IN THE GULF.  BELIEVE RAIN IS STILL A GOOD BET...AND WILL KEEP 
LIKELY POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

OCCUR....AND THUS WILL LEAVE JUST THE CHANCE WORDING.  

I WILL TAKE A PEAK AT THE NOON TIME TEMPS TO SEE IF ANY ADJUSTING 
MAY BE NEEDED.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN









656 
FXUS61 KILN 271418
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
920 AM EST TUE MAR 27 2001

WATER VAPOR AND MESOETA MODEL DATA INDICATE A S/WV ACRS NE INDIANA 
AND NW OHIO.

STRATOCUMULUS HAS ERODED THIS MORNING ACRS THE SW CWFA.  A MODIFIED 
ILN SOUNDING YIELDS ABOUT 150 TO 200 J/KG OF SBCAPE.  THUS...I AM 
EXPECTED CUMULUS/MDT CUMULUS REDEVELOPMENT IN AREAS WHERE THE SUN IS 
SHINING AT THIS TIME.  THE COMBINATION OF THE CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT 
AND THE S/WV PIVOTING ACRS THE CWFA DURING THE AFTN SHOULD BE ENOUGH 
TO KEEP A CHC OF SNOW FLURRIES IN THE FCST.  AS OF NOW...TEMPS SEEM 
TO BE REASONABLE...BUT WILL KEEP A WATCH ON THEM.

WILL SEND OUT A QUICK UPDATE TO REFLECT MORNING SUNSHINE IN THE SW 
CWFA.

 

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN


@RUKWBCe	KDENFXUS61 KILN 270916
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
415 AM EST TUE MAR 27 2001

UPPER TROF STILL IN CONTROL OVER OHIO VALLEY TODAY.  MODELS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT IN BRINGING RIDGE AXIS TO ILN AT 12Z WEDNESDAY.  AFTER 
RIDGE EXITS EAST...SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL INCREASE MOISTURE SOMEWHAT BY 
THURSDAY.

HIGH PRESSURE IS MOVING THROUGH THE AREA TODAY...TO THE VIRGINIA 
COAST BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.  PLENTY OF MOISTURE AT 850 MB IS 
HANGING AROUND IN NORTHWEST FLOW OF LAKE MICHIGAN AS SHOWN BY THE 
CLOUDS OVER MOST OF OUR AREA.  MODELS SHOW MOISTURE PERSISTING AT 
850 MB INTO TONIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS 
SHOWING ENOUGH INSTABILITY BELOW INVERSION TO SUSTAIN CLOUDS TODAY.

RADAR/OBS CURRENTLY SHOWING NO SNOW.  WITH PVA AND 850 MB 
MOISTURE...CANT RULE OUT FLURRIES.  WILL REMOVE POPS FROM TODAY 
PERIOD...BUT KEEP CHANCE FLURRIES ALL ZONES ALONG WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES.  WITH UPPER RIDGE CANCELING CYCLONIC FLOW TONIGHT AND 850 MB 
MOISTURE DECREASING IN BACKING FLOW...WILL GO WITH BECOMING PARTLY 
CLOUDY.  

MOISTURE BEGINS TO RETURN FROM 500-300 MB LATER ON WEDNESDAY AS FLOW 
BECOMES SOUTHWEST.  WILL FORECAST MOSTLY SUNNY IN THE MORNING/PARTLY 
SUNNY IN THE AFTERNOON AS I EXPECT SUNSHINE TO FADE BEHIND HIGH 
CLOUDS.

FWC TEMPS LOOK TOO WARM FOR DAYTIME PERIODS...BUT FAIRLY CLOSE FOR 
NIGHTTIME LOWS.  WILL STAY CLOSER TO PREVIOUS FCST WITH MID TO UPPER 
30S FOR TODAYS HIGHS.  LOWER 20S LOOK GOOD FOR TONIGHT WITH 
CLEARING SKIES ALLOWING GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING.  LOTS OF VARIATION 
BETWEEN MESOETA AND FWC/MAV ON WEDNESDAY...WITH MESOETA GIVING 39-43 
FOR HIGHS CONTRASTING WITH 50-55 ON THE FWC.  WILL STAY BELOW FWC 
BUT ABOVE MESOETA AND GO IN THE 45-50 RANGE.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO




SOME CLEARING HAS OCCURRED ALONG THE OH RIVER NR KCVG AND ALSO NEAR

MIAMI VALLEY TO M/CDY BUT LEAVE OTHERS P/CDY.  00Z MODELS AND

THE 15 TO 20 RANGE.



@RUKWBCe:KDENFXUS61 KILN 261858
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
155 PM EST MON MAR 26 2001

COLD POOL OF AIR ALOFT HAS ALLOWED FOR WIDESPREAD CUMULUS/MODERATE 
CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT.  ALSO...WATER VAPOR INDICATED A WK S/WV 
PIVOTING INTO THE NRN CWFA ATTM.  KILN RADAR AND SFC OBSERVATIONS 
WERE SHOWING SCATTERED FLURRIES ACRS THE REGION.

TONIGHT/S SKY AND TEMPERATURE FCST WILL BE A TRICKY ONE.  
AFOREMENTIONED S/WV WILL PASS TO THE SE DURING THE EVENING HOURS.  
CONVECTIVELY DEVELOPED CUMULUS SHOULD DECREASE IN COVERAGE SOMEWHAT 
ONCE THE SUN GOES DOWN.  HOWEVER...AS THE LOWER PART OF THE CLOUD 
DISSIPATES...THE TOPS OF THE CLOUDS SHOULD REMAIN (UNDER AN 
INVERSION ALOFT).  THE BIG QUESTION IS:  HOW MUCH?  FOR NOW...PARTLY 
CLOUDY FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT SEEMS REASONABLE (AND THIS WILL ALLOW 
THE EVENING SHIFT TO ASSESS HOW MUCH CLEARING HAS TAKEN PLACE).  
FLURRIES MAY LAST INTO THE EARLY EVENING AND WILL MONITOR THIS 
BEFORE ZONE RELEASE.  ANOTHER S/WV IS POISED TO DROP SOUTH AND EAST 
FROM THE NRN GREAT LAKES INTO THE REGION BY LATE TONIGHT.  THIS 
SYSTEM DOES NOT SHOW MUCH LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE/VERTICAL MOTION.  IT 
DOES...ON THE OTHER HAND...DEPICT SOME PVA.  THIS PVA MAYBE ENOUGH 
TO GENERATE SOME SNOW SHOWERS ACRS THE NORTH LATE TONIGHT...AND 
POSSIBLY SOME FLURRIES ACRS THE SOUTH BY MORNING.  WILL LEAN MORE 
TOWARD THE MAV NUMBERS OVERNIGHT IN HOPES THAT A FEW BREAKS WILL 
OCCUR BEFORE THE S/WV MOVES IN LATE TONIGHT.

FOR TUESDAY...COLD POOL BEGINS TO SHIFT SLOWLY EAST ALONG WITH 
S/WV.  A FEW MORNING FLURRIES/SNOW SHOWERS MAY OCCUR.  OTHERWISE 
...PARTLY CLOUDY WEST/MOSTLY CLOUDY EAST LOOKS GOOD.  WILL SHADE A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES FROM MOS/MAV GUIDANCE.

BY TUESDAY NIGHT...S/WV RIDGING ALOFT ALONG WITH SFC HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL ALLOW SKIES TO CLEAR.  BELIEVE MOS VALUES ARE TO WARM...AND 
WILL SHAVE THESE VALUES BY AT LEAST A CATEGORY.

ON WEDNESDAY...HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS BEGINS TO ENCROACH THE CWFA.  
INCREASING CLOUDS STILL SEEMS APPROPRIATE.  MOS/MAV BOTH WARM 
TEMPERATURES MUCH MORE THAN WHAT ETA THICKNESS SCHEMES ARE SHOWING 
(BY AT LEAST 10 DEGREES).  SINCE THIS IS THE FIRST RUN OF THE ETA TO 
EXTEND INTO WEDNESDAY...AM NOT 100 PERCENT CONFIDENT TO GO AS COLD 
AS THE ETA.  HOWEVER...MOS/MAV MAY BE TRYING TO WARM THE 
TEMPERATURES TOO FAST.  PLAN ON SHAVING MOS/MAV HIGHS AT LEAST BY 4 
OR 5 DEGREES.

NEXT CHANCE FOR PCPN APPEARS TO BE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT AS A 
S/WV AND ASSOCIATED SFC LOW MOVES INTO THE MIDDLE OHIO VALLEY.  IT 
HAS BEEN A DRY WINTER...SO SOME RAINFALL WOULD BE NICE.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN












@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 261432
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 AM EST MON MAR 26 2001

COLD AIR ALOFT WILL REMAIN OVER THE FCST REGION TODAY.  VISIBLE 
SATELLITE IMAGERY WAS BEGINNING TO SHOW CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT.  I 
EXPECT THE CUMULUS COVERAGE TO INCREASE AS THE DAY PROGRESSES.

WATER VAPOR INDICATED A WEAK S/WV IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT ACRS LAKE 
MICHIGAN.  THIS IS DEPICTED WELL BY THE MESOETA.  THIS S/WV WILL 
PIVOT SE INTO THE NRN CWFA THIS AFTN.  THE S/WV WILL HELP WITH 
SOME SNOW FLURRY DEVELOPMENT THERE.  NONETHELESS...CUMULUS CLOUDS 
EVERYWHERE SHOULD BECOME VERTICALLY DEVELOPED TO PRODUCE A FEW 
FLURRIES ALL LOCATIONS (ALTHOUGH IT MAY TAKE INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE 
AFTN BEFORE FLURRIES ARE PRODUCED).

WITH COLD AIRMASS IN PLACE...TEMPS WILL STRUGGLE TO REACH THE LOWER 
30S SOUTH AND THE MID TO UPPER 20S NORTH.  CURRENT FCST HIGHS LOOK 
GOOD ATTM.

AN UPDATE WILL NOT BE ISSUED THIS MORNING AS FCST ON TRACK.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

FXUS61 KILN 260804
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 AM EST MON MAR 26 2001

COLD WEATHER TO CONT ACRS OH VLY NXT COUPLE DAYS. MODELS IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT. UPR LO OVR ERN GRTLKS TO TRACK SLOWLY E INTO NEW ENGLAND 
THRU THE PD WITH RDDG BLDG INTO OH FM THE WEST TUE/TUE NGT. 

S/WV AXIS ROTATING THRU SRN OH PROVIDING SOME LO LVL CNVRGC IS 
RESPONSIBLE FOR BAND OF SCTD SNW SHWRS DROPPING THRU SRN OH. THIS 
FEATURE WL BE S OF THE AREA BEFORE SUNRISE. A PAIR OF WK S/WVS TO 
DROP SE THRU THE AREA TDA IN CYCLONIC FLO. XPCT CLDS TO RE-DVLP 
TDA. WL MENT SOME SCTD FLURRIES PSBL. COLD H8 POOL -16 TO -18 DEG 
SLIDES ACRS AREA TDA. FAVOR HI TEMPS CLOSER TO COLDER FWC GUID TDA.
          
ANOTHER S/WV XPCTD TO DROP S THRU OH TNGT. WL CONT MENT OF CHC 
FLURRIES. FLO OFF LM BCMS FAVORABLE THIS EVE WHICH MAY ENHANCE 
OF SNW SHWRS/FLURRIES INTO MIAMI VLY. PREFER LOWS CLOSER TO COLDER 
MAV GUID TNGT. RECORDS LOWS TUE ARE 11 FOR DAY...14 FOR CVG AND 15 
FOR CMH. WL MENT NR RECORD POSSIBILITY IN CVG AND CMH ZONES.

LO LVL MSTR REMAINS ON TUE AND SHUD KEEP CLDS IN THE E. XPCT A 
DECREASE IN CLDS IN THE W AS RDG BEGINS TO BLD IN DURG AFTN. AGN 
PREFER HI/S A LTL COOLER THAN FWC GUID. 

.ILN...NONE.
RANDALL

02Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE NY-PA BORDER WITH 
A CDFNT TRAILING SWWD ACROSS CNTRL OH.  LLVL CONVERGENCE ALONG THIS 
FEATURE HAS LED TO A PERSISTENT BAND OF -SHSN WITH LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS.  OTHERWISE...MOST OTHER -SHSN ACTIVITY HAS DISSIPATED 
AND NOT MUCH LAKE EFFECT WAS OCCURRING DOWNWIND OF LMICH.

XPCT THE BAND OF -SHSN TO WEAKEN OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS.  UPDATE WL 
GO WITH P/C SKIES AND AT LEAST FLURRIES.  WL MONITOR BAND FOR ANY 
CONTINUED MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS.

TEMPS AND WINDS LOOK GOOD SO NO CHANGES PLANNED.

621 
FXUS61 KILN 251945
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EST SUN MAR 25 2001

SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES CONTINUE ACROSS PORTIONS OF IN AND OH 
WHILE PTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS NOTED FROM OHIO RIVER AND SOUTH. AREA OF 
PRECIPITATION WILL MAKE AN ATTEMPT TO MOVE S AND SE THROUGH THE 
EVENING HOURS AS RATHER VIGOROUS MID/LVL S/W MOVE SE ACROSS FA. 
PROBLEM IS THAT THIS PRECIP ENCOUNTERING WELL MIXED DRIER AIR ALONG 
AND S OF OH RIVER. ALTHOUGH FORCING WILL BE DOMINANT IN THIS AREA 
THIS EVENING...FLURRIES AS OPOSED TO CHC POPS MIGHT BE THE BEST BET 
HERE AS THE DRY CONDITIONS WILL BE HARD TO OVERCOME.

ONCE THIS S/W MOVES OUT OF THE AREA TONIGHT...SOME PARTIAL CLEARING 
POSSIBLE AS STRONGER DVV MOVES INTO THE FA. WITH ANY AREAS THAT 
EXPERIENCE PARTIAL CLEARING...TEMPERATURES WILL HAVE A BETTER CHC TO 
DROP OFF. ALTHOUGH THE WINDS OVERNIGHT SHOULD HELP OFFSET ANY REAL 
RADIATIONAL COOLING. PURE CAA HOWEVER WILL STILL ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP 
OFF TO NEAR RECORD LOWS.

FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK...THE MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT. WE SHOULD HAVE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING IN FROM THE NW WITH 
A WEAK SFC TROUGH EXPECTED TO BE POISED JUST TO OUR WEST MONDAY 
NIGHT. THE MOST WE SHOULD EXPECT FROM THIS AT THE MOMENT IS POSSIBLE 
FLURRIES ACROSS THE W-CTRL OH AND WHITEWATER/MIAMI VALLEYS DURING 
THAT TIME. THIS TROUGH SHOULD WEAKEN AS IT MOVES E ACROSS FA ON 
TUESDAY.

OTHERWISE...COLD THROUGH MONDAY WITH SOMEWHAT MILDER CONDITIONS FOR 
TUESDAY.

MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO











@RUKWBCe-KDENFXUS61 KILN 251945
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EST SUN MAR 25 2001

SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES CONTINUE ACROSS PORTIONS OF IN AND OH 
WHILE PTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS NOTED FROM OHIO RIVER AND SOUTH. AREA OF 
PRECIPITATION WILL MAKE AN ATTEMPT TO MOVE S AND SE THROUGH THE 
EVENING HOURS AS RATHER VIGOROUS MID/LVL S/W MOVE SE ACROSS FA. 
PROBLEM IS THAT THIS PRECIP ENCOUNTERING WELL MIXED DRIER AIR ALONG 
AND S OF OH RIVER. ALTHOUGH FORCING WILL BE DOMINANT IN THIS AREA 
THIS EVENING...FLURRIES AS OPOSED TO CHC POPS MIGHT BE THE BEST BET 
HERE AS THE DRY CONDITIONS WILL BE HARD TO OVERCOME.

ONCE THIS S/W MOVES OUT OF THE AREA TONIGHT...SOME PARTIAL CLEARING 
POSSIBLE AS STRONGER DVV MOVES INTO THE FA. WITH ANY AREAS THAT 
EXPERIENCE PARTIAL CLEARING...TEMPERATURES WILL HAVE A BETTER CHC TO 
DROP OFF. ALTHOUGH THE WINDS OVERNIGHT SHOULD HELP OFFSET ANY REAL 
RADIATIONAL COOLING. PURE CAA HOWEVER WILL STILL ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP 
OFF TO NEAR RECORD LOWS.

FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK...THE MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT. WE SHOULD HAVE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING IN FROM THE NW WITH 
A WEAK SFC TROUGH EXPECTED TO BE POISED JUST TO OUR WEST MONDAY 
NIGHT. THE MOST WE SHOULD EXPECT FROM THIS AT THE MOMENT IS POSSIBLE 
FLURRIES ACROSS THE W-CTRL OH AND WHITEWATER/MIAMI VALLEYS DURING 
THAT TIME. THIS TROUGH SHOULD WEAKEN AS IT MOVES E ACROSS FA ON 
TUESDAY.

OTHERWISE...COLD THROUGH MONDAY WITH SOMEWHAT MILDER CONDITIONS FOR 
TUESDAY.

MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO










994 
FXUS61 KILN 251454
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 AM EST SUN MAR 25 2001

SOMEWHAT COMPLEX MESOSCALE PATTERN TO DEAL WITH TDY. CURRENT SAT 
IMAGERY SHOWING LOWER LVL INSTABILITY BEING MANIFEST IN DEVELOPING 
CONVECTIVE CLOUDS ACROSS MOST OF FA. MESOETA INDICATING BEST 
CONVERGENCE BELOW 90H ACROSS ERN AND CTRL PORTION OF FA THIS 
AFTERNOON. THIS APPEARS IN LINE WITH CURRENT RADAR IMAGERY AS BEST 
REFLECTIVITY NOW ACROSS CTRL/NE PORTION OF FA...WITH YET STRONGER 
RETURNS ACROSS CTL PORTION OF IWX FA.

FEEL CHC/SCT WORDING FOR SHSN JUSTIFIED ACROSS MOST OF FA. WILL 
ADJUST SOMEWHAT ACCORDING TO CURRENT AND LATEST FCST TRENDS. TEMPS 
SOMEWHAT OF A PROBLEM AS WELL AS THOSE LOCATIONS WHICH WILL SEE 
LITTLE IN THE WAY OF SUNSHINE MAY NOT RECOVER MUCH. THUS MAY MAKE A 
FEW ADJUSTMENTS HERE AS WELL.

MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

MODELS HV GENERALLY CONVERGED CLOSER TO YDA/S AVN SOLN. AVN MODEL IS 
MOST CONSISTENT AND IS PREFERED MODEL.  

UPR LO DUMBELLS SE THRU GRTLKS TDA/TNGT. FAVORABLE PVA AND 950MB 
CNVRGC DVLPS ACRS THE AREA THIS AFTN. XPCT SCTD SNW SHWRS TO DVLP
IN COLD AIRMASS. BEST THREAT FOR SNW SHWRS WL BE ACRS NRN SECTIONS
WHERE WL GO WITH 40 POPS. WL GO WITH 30 POPS ELSEWHERE. LTST SATL 
IMGRY SHWS CLDS COMING OFF LM WITH SOME SCTD SNW SHWRS INDICATED 
ACRS NRN IN. XPCT CLDS TO INCRS ACRS THE AREA THIS MRNG. GUID
TEMPS HV TRENDED DOWN. THIS LOOKS REASONABLE GIVEN CLDS AND COLD
H8 TEMPS.      

XPCT SCTD SNW SHWRS TO CONT THIS EVE WITH S/WV AXIS PIVOTING THRU 
AREA. -18 TO -20 H8 COLD POOL SETTLES OVR OH TNGT. CYC FLO AND COLD
FLO OFF LM WL KEEP CLDS AND PSBL FLRYS/SNW SHWRS GOING ACRS THE N.
THE S SHUD BCM PTLY CLDY. WL MENT NR RECORD TEMPS OVRNGT IN DAY 
(12)...CVG (13) AND CMH (15). 

WL CONT CHC OF SNW SHWRS NRN MIAMI AND CMH AREAS MON ESPECIALLY IN
MRNG. SFC RDGG BLDS INTO SW OH SHUD INHIBIT THREAT OF SNW SHWRS.
WL BUMP MON FCST HI TEMPS DOWN A LTL.

.ILN...NONE.

AT THE SURFACE...THE COLD FRONT IS WELL SOUTH OF THE FA AND HIGH
PRESSURE IS BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST. LOOKS LIKE COLD AIR WILL 
REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. SHORT WAVES ROTATING 
AROUND UPPER LOW WILL BE MAIN WEATHER MAKERS NEXT 48 HRS. WILL LEAN 
TO AVN WHICH IS FURTHER SOUTH AND STRONGER WITH VORT MAX LATE SUN. 
LATEST AVN RUN IS ALSO A BIT SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS. LOOKS LIKE THREAT 
FOR SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE MAINLY FROM MIAMI VALLEY TO 
COLUMBUS AND NORTH LATE SUN THROUGH MON/MON MRNG. DRY FORECAST FOR 
SOUTH PART OF FA THROUGH 48 HRS. VARIED A FEW DEGREES FROM NGM MOS 
TEMPERATURES.

831 
FXUS61 KILN 240827
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
328 AM EST SAT MAR 24 2001

S/WV EVIDENT ON WV IMGRY ROTATING SE THRU GRTLKS. ASSOCIATED SFC
CDFNT FM NW OH THRU CNTRL IN AND SRN IL TO SWEEP THRU OH THIS MRNG.
FAVORABLE SFC/H8 CNVRGC SETTING OFF SCTD SHWRS INVOF THIS FNT. MSTR
IS LIMITED SO PRECIP IS RATHER LIGHT. BOUNDARY LYR STARTS OUT WRM
BUT IN WAK OF THE FNT IN CAA IT QUICKLY BCMS COLD ENOUGH TO SUPP
SNW SHWRS. XPCT MAIN CHC FOR PRECIP TO OCCUR ERLY THIS MRNG IN THE 
WEST AND BY LT MRNG E. LTST SATL IR PICS SHWS CLRG IN WAKE OF FNTL
CLDS ACRS PTNS OF NRN IL AND IA. XPCT SOURTHERN OH/NRN KY TO SEE 
SOME SUNSHINE THIS AFTN. WL KEEP CNTRL OH AND NRN MIAMI MSTLY CLDY
WHERE BETTER LO LVL MSTR XPCTD. TEMP WISE...XPCT ERLY HI/S PRIOR TO
FROPA AND THEN TEMPS DROPPING INTO 30S ERLY. H8 TEMPS DROP ARND 8 DEG
TDA...SO AFTER INTIAL DROP THERE MAY BE A COUPLE DEGS OF RECOVERY 
ESPECIALLY IN THE S. SFC GRAD INCRS IN WAKE OF THE FNT. WL GO WITH
15 TO 25 MPH NW WNDS IN ALL BUT PMH ZONE.

VRY COLD AMS FOR LATE MARCH WITH -16 DEG TO -12 DEG H8 TEMPS 
SETTLING INTO OH TNGT. FAVORABLE FLO OFF LM WL LKLY RESULT IN 
SOME CLDS IN NRN MIAMI VLY.  WL MAINTAIN PARTLY CLDY ACRS THE NRN
SECTION AND MSTLY CLR S. BASED ON UPSTREAM READINGS PREFER TEMPS
CLOSER TO COLDER MAV NUMBERS TNGT.

MODEL DIFFERENCES ON HANDLING OF SECONDARY S/WV DUMBELLING SE THRU
GRTLKS/OH VLY SUN AFTN/NGT. ETA HS TRENDED FASTER AND FARTHER S WITH
THIS FEATURE WHILE AVN IS A LTL SLOWER. AVN HAS BETTER RUN TO RUN
CONTINUITY AND IS PREFERED. XPCT SCTD SNW SHWRS FLURRIES TO DVLP
SUN AFTN INTO SUN NGT. BEST CHC FOR SNW SHWRS WILL OCCUR ACRS NRN 
MIAMI VLY WHERE WL GO WITH 50 POPS. WL MENT 40 POPS DAY AND CMH
AND 30 IN THE S. BASED ON LO LVL THICKNESS...AGN PREFER TEMPS COOLER 
THAN FWC GUID IN VRY COLD
AMS.  
     
.ILN...NONE.

ENUF FORCING TO THINK THAT SOMETHING MIGHT STILL GET GOING. WL BACK

ALSO ADJUST LOW TMPS UP A TAD TO AGREE WITH THIS. FINALLY...WNDS A 
LTL GUSTY JUST BEHIND FNT ACRS IA AND SW WI. XPCT SOME OF THIS WL

272 
FXUS61 KILN 231811
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
111 PM EST FRI MAR 23 2001

FWC GUIDANCE IS FINALLY COMING AROUND WITH THE STRENGTH OF THE COLD 
AIR THAT COMES IN ON SATURDAY...WILL STILL GO WITH AROUND A 5 DEGREE 
DIURNAL AND MENTION STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING TEMPERATURES. CLOUD 
COVER SHOULD BE SIGNIFICANT AND DAYTIME HIGHS WILL BE HARD TO 
RECOVER.

PREVIOUS FCST IS RUNNING ON IN THE FIRST COUPLE OF PERIODS AND DO 
NOT EXPECT TO CHANGE TOO MUCH HERE...THOUGH ILL HAVE A GOOFY 
BREAKDOWN OF THE ZONES TO TRY TO ACCOUNT FOR TIMING OF FRONT AND 
PRECIPITATION ALONG WITH LEFTOVER MORNING WX IN THE EAST/SOUTHEAST. 

WITH REGARD TO LOW TEMPS IN THE 3RD AND 4TH PERIODS...WENT AROUND 20 
YESTERDAY FOR ALL AREAS...AND WILL HOLD THIS THINKING FOR THE MOMENT 
WITH CLEARING SKIES IN THE NIGHTTIME HOURS BOTH PERIODS. AS FOR 
DAYTIME...COLD POOL IS SIGNIFICANT AND LAPSE RATES AT 1000-850 ARE 
FROM +8 TO +10 WITH DECENT INSTABILITY NOTED IN ALL AREAS BETWEEN 
H925 AND H850/800. THIS DOESNT SHOW UP WELL ON MODELS AS THEY ARE 
CALCULATING INSTABILITY THROUGH H5. AM THINKING OF MOCLOUDY FOR NEXT 
TWO, MAYBE THREE, DAYTIME PERIODS ALONG WITH CHANCE FOR SNOW SHOWERS 
IN THE NORTH AND FLURRIES IN THE SOUTH. NO ACCUMULATIONS.

H5 TROF ROTATES THROUGH ERN GREAT LAKES OVERNIGHT SUNDAY THOUGH FLOW 
REMAINS NORTHWEST. A THIN BUT SIGNIFICANT DRY LAYER ASSOCIATED WITH 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE IS NOTED IN THE SOUTHWEST AND WILL WORD AS 
PARTLY CLOUDY FOR MONDAY...THOUGH THE CONTINUED NW FLOW SHOULD BRING 
MOCLOUDY SKIES AND CHANCE OF -SHSN TO THE NORTHEAST.

EXTENDED FCST IS DIFFICULT. PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS HAD SOME PRECIP 
POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT TUE IN THE SOUTH BUT NEW AVN IS SUGGESTING A 
LATER ARRIVAL. TRENDS THIS SEASON SEEM TO BE FOR MODELS TO PUSH 
PRECIP IN EARLY AND ACTUALLY HAVE THE EVENT ARRIVE LATE. WILL REMOVE 
CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY NIGHT BUT KEEP A SILENT 20 POP IN THE 
AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTH WITH FLOW OFF OF THE LAKES AND WEAKENING 
AXIS OF COLD POOL STILL EXITING TO THE NE. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

475 
FXUS61 KILN 231515
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1015 AM EST FRI MAR 23 2001

TEMPS ACROSS CWA THIS A.M. ARE ON AVERAGE +5 FROM 24 HOURS AGO. 
ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WITHOUT THE INCREASED CIRRUS FOUND YESTERDAY 
SHOULD ALLOW US TO REALIZE AN INCREASE IN HIGHS TODAY ABOUT THE SAME 
5 DEGREES. THIS RUNS WELL WITH CURRENT FCST...THOUGH SOME CLOUDS 
OFF OF L MICH COULD HAMPER TEMPS A BIT IN THE NORTHWEST. 

WINDS SHOULD BE FROM NORTHWEST THROUGH 0Z AND THEN SLACK AND TURN A 
BIT MORE WEST...AND NW AT 10 TO 15 SHOULD BE REPRESENTATIVE FOR 
TODAY. WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES THIS MORNING...THOUGH WILL MONITOR 
FOR HIGHER GUSTS AND UPDATE IF NECESSARY. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 231515
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1015 AM EST FRI MAR 23 2001

TEMPS ACROSS CWA THIS A.M. ARE ON AVERAGE +5 FROM 24 HOURS AGO. 
ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WITHOUT THE INCREASED CIRRUS FOUND YESTERDAY 
SHOULD ALLOW US TO REALIZE AN INCREASE IN HIGHS TODAY ABOUT THE SAME 
5 DEGREES. THIS RUNS WELL WITH CURRENT FCST...THOUGH SOME CLOUDS 
OFF OF L MICH COULD HAMPER TEMPS A BIT IN THE NORTHWEST. 

WINDS SHOULD BE FROM NORTHWEST THROUGH 0Z AND THEN SLACK AND TURN A 
BIT MORE WEST...AND NW AT 10 TO 15 SHOULD BE REPRESENTATIVE FOR 
TODAY. WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES THIS MORNING...THOUGH WILL MONITOR 
FOR HIGHER GUSTS AND UPDATE IF NECESSARY. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS




873 
FXUS61 KILN 230824
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 AM EST FRI MAR 23 2001

PATTERN CHANGE TO TAKE PLACE WITH ONE MORE MILD DAY TDA AND
THEN CONSIDERABLY COLDER TEMPS FOR THE WEEKEND. S/WV ENERGY TO
DROP S AND CARVE OUT E-W ELONGATED UPR LO THRU THE GRTLKS AND NE
U.S. BY SUN. DIFFERENCES IN MODEL SOLN/S ON HOW FAR S THIS SYS
EVOLVES. ETA A LTL FARTHER N THAN AVN AND NGM. ALTHO AVN HS TRENDED
A LTL FARTHER N IT APPEARS TO HV BEST CONTINUITY PAST TWO RUNS.
WL TREND FCST TOWARD AVN SOLN.  

INITIAL S/WV PIVOTING THRU GRTLKS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MID LVL CLDS
ACRS NRN OH. THESE CLDS SHUD SWING THRU AREA ERLY BUT XPCT SOME
ADDITIONAL CLDS THIS AFTN. WL MAINTAIN PARTLY SUNNY SKY COND FCST 
TDA. TEMP GUID CLOSE TDA AND HV NOT STRAYED MUCH.

CDFNT TO MOV THRU OH TNGT WITH PVA BTWN 06Z-12Z. BEST UPR DIV
ACRS THE N WITH BEST LO LVL CNVRGC ACRS THE S. PRECIP EFF. ARE
MARGINAL BUT THE FORCING ASSOCIATED WITH THE FNT SHUD BE SUFFICIENT
TO RESULT IN LGT PRECIP. WL BUMP UP POPS INTO LKLY CAT ACRS ALL BUT
PMH AREA WHERE WL GO WITH HI POP CHC. BOUNDARY LAYER IS WRM TO BEGIN 
WITH BUT STG LO LVL CAA COOLS SOUNDING OFF ENOUGH FOR SNW LT TNGT. 
BY THE TIME COLD AIR ARRIVES BEST MSTR AND LIFT IS ALREADY TO THE E. 
WL MENT A CHANGE OVR LT IN WRN SECTIONS. NO ACCUM EXCPECTED. 
 
S/WV ROTATING THRU SRN GRTLKS...FAVORABLE FLO OFF LM AND LO LVL
LAPSE RATES WL RESULT IN SCTD SNW SHWRS ACRS NRN MIAMI VLY SAT AFTN.
WL MENT FLURRIES IN DAY AND CMH AREAS. WL KEEP SRN OH/NRN KY DRY.

DIFFERENCES IN MODEL TEMPS SAT NGT. WL TREND TOWARD COOLER MAV GUID 
FOR LOWS. MORE SIGNIFICANT S/WV TO PIVOT THRU OH VLY SUN. THIS SHUD
RESULT IN SCTD SNW SHOWERS ACRS THE CWA.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

499 
FXUS61 KILN 220804
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
302 PM EST THU MAR 22 2001

CLDS HAVE CLEARED OUT OF AREA BUT A FINGER OF STRATUS/FOG IS 
CRUISING SOUTH AND WILL AFFECT THE CMH ZN THIS AM. OTHERWISE...A 
NICE ON TAP FOR THE AREA AS RIDGING BUILDS IN. SOME CI TRYING TO 
STREAM ACROSS IN BUT IS HAVING A HARD TIME. WILL LEAVE MOSUNNY 
TODAY. WEVE COOLED OFF SOMEWHAT FROM YDA BUT WITH GOOD 
INSOLATION...CAN DEFINITELY SEE TEMPS WELL INTO THE 50S TDY. 

MDLS DIVERGE IN THE LATER PDS WITH THE AVN BRINGING A FRONT 
THRU FRI NITE AND ETA HOLDING OFF BUT BRINGING THRU A DEEPER SYS. 
AGREE WITH THE MDL DISCUSSION THAT THE FASTER SOLN LOOKS BETTER 
GIVEN THE FAST UPPER FLOW. WILL LEAN IN THAT DIR WITH A LITTLE 
MODERATION OF THE COLD AIR COMING IN. SYS WILL HAVE DRY AIR TO 
OVERCOME...BUT DECENT LIFT DOES ACCOMPANY IT. WILL PUT IN CHC OF 
RAIN/SNOW FRI NIGHT AS FRONT COMES THRU. AFT FRI..LOOKS LIKE A COLD 
FEW DAYS WITH SOME SCT FLURRIES/SHSN. 

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE







923 
FXUS61 KILN 221832
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
132 PM EST THU MAR 22 2001

LOOKS LIKE AN ARCTIC AIRMASS TO ENTER THE REGION ON SATURDAY. 

PC/MOCLEAR SKIES SHOULD BE IN STORE THROUGH FRIDAY PM...AS 
INCREASING CLOUDS/MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH NEG TILTING H5 LOW JUST N 
OF LK SUPERIOR PUSHES THROUGH OVERNIGHT...ALONG WITH SFC CDFNT. I 
IMAGINE THAT IT SHOULD BE A RELATIVELY SHORT PERIOD WHERE PRECIP IS 
POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT FRIDAY AND WILL GO WITH RAIN. COLDEST AIR IS 
ALOFT AND SFC WONT COOL OFF UNTIL DAWN/EARLY SATURDAY. WILL MENTION 
EARLY HIGHS WITH STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS DURING THE DAY.

INITIAL THOUGHTS FOR SAT WERE PTCLDY WITH LESS OF A CHANCE FOR 
PRECIP...BUT SECOND THINKING TELLS ME THAT THAT COLD OF AN AMS OVER 
THE REGION AND WARMER SFC AIR EARLY IN THE DAY COULD BRING SOME 
CONVECTIVE MIXING. WILL WORD SAT WITH VARIABLY CLOUDY AND KEEP LOW 
CHANCE POPS OF SNOW SHOWERS IN ALL ZONES. 

SUNDAY AM TEMPS COULD BE QUITE TRICKY...CURRENTLY RUNNING LOWER 
20S...WILL DROP TO AROUND 20 FOR MOST AREAS AS AVN IS SHOWING COLDEST
POOL OF SFC AIR AT CVG/SDF IN THE MID TEENS. ETA DOESNT GO OUT THIS 
FAR...BUT WAS SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN AVN FROM H48-60 AT SFC...WHICH 
LETS ME BELIEVE THAT AVN COULD BE ON THE $. LOOKING AT RECORDS FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR...PREVIOUS COLD SNAPS HAVE PUSHED LOWS TO THE 
LOWER AND MIDDLE TEENS ACROSS FCST AREA SO THESE TEMPS ARE 
DEFINITELY WITHIN THE REALM OF POSSIBILITY CLIMATALOGICALLY SPEAKING.

WILL LIMIT CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS ON SUNDAY TO JUST THE NORTH AS H5 
LOW OVER ERN GTLKS ROTATES THROUGH AND AXIS OF H8 COLD POOL 
APPROACHES REGION.

REST OF EXTENDED FCST LOOKS PC/MOCLEAR WITH A GRADUAL WARMUP. NEXT 
SYSTEM STARTS TO SPIN UP IN CENTRAL PLAINS AHEAD OF DIGGING H5 TROF 
BY MID WEEK...AND WILL INTRO CHANCE SHOWERS IN LAST PERIOD. 

HOPE TO HAVE MISILN OUT BY 3.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS







MOSUNNY SKIES AND DRY AIR IN PLACE SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
REALIZE UPPER 50S TO AROUND 60 IN THE SOUTH...MID TO UPPER 50S IN

EXPECT IT TO LOOSEN AS SFC LOW MOVES OUT. WINDS SHOULD STAY AROUND 
THE 10 MPH RANGE.

WILL NOT CHANGE FORECAST THIS MORNING...BUT REALIZE THAT NRN FCST 
AREA COULD BE A TOUCH WARMER THAN MID 50S.

FXUS61 KILN 220202
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
902 PM EST WED MAR 21 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY WAS INDICATING A CLEARING TREND FROM NW TO SE 
ACROSS FA.  THIS TREND SHOULD CONTINUE BUT BASED ON CURRENT SPEED 
AND META H8 MOISTURE PROGS...SHOULD TAKE MUCH OF NIGHT TO CLEAR ALL 
OF CMH AND PMH GROUPS.  THUS...WL REMOVE TIMING OF CLEARING AND 
RAISE TEMPS TO MID 30S VC CMH.  ALSO WITH SFC GRADIENT MAINTAINING 
10 MPH OR GREATER WINDS AND DRIER AIR MOVG IN...WL REMOVE MENTION OF 
FOG FORMING.

.ILN...NONE.


@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 211830
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
130 PM EST WED MAR 21 2001

MODELS IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT IN PULLING UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER 
THE SOUTHEAST...OFF CAPE HATTERAS BY 12Z THURSDAY.  THIS SHOULD 
ALLOW LOCATIONS THAT STILL HAVE CLOUDS TO CLEAR OVERNIGHT. AM A 
LITTLE CONCERNED ABOUT THE POSSIBILITY IF FOG FORMING OVERNIGHT 
...ESPECIALLY FROM ABOUT I-71 SOUTH.  THIS IS WHERE THE CLOUDS HAVE 
YET TO CLEAR AND THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS TRAPPED.  WILL THROW A 
MENTION OF CLOUDS IN THOSE LOCATIONS.

WEAK SURFACE HIGH AND WEAK 500 MB SHORTWAVE RIDGE ARE OVER THE FA 
THURSDAY.  THIS SHOWED ALLOW FOR MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.   LOOKED AT THE 
CURU...AND EVEN IN THE WEAK COLD ADVECTION...CU SHOULD BE LIMITED.

CLOUDS WILL INCREASE THURSDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF WEAK COLD FRONT 
DROPPING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES.  FRONT SWINGS THROUGH THE FA ON 
FRIDAY. ETA IS THE MOST AGGRESSIVE IN PRINTING OUT QPF ACROSS THE 
FA.  THERE IS SOME 850 MOISTURE CONVERGENCE WITH THE FRONT.  THE 
UPPER DIVERGENCE IS WEAK ALTHOUGH THE FA IS IN THE NOSE OF A 250MB 
JET STREAK.  BEST LIFT WILL BE TO THE NORTH OF THE FA...SO WILL DROP 
THE MENTION OF PRECIP ON FRIDAY.

TEMPERATURE WISE...MOS NUMBERS ARE HARD TO BEAT FOR THE FIRST THREE 
PERIODS.  WILL GO ABOUT A CATEGORY COOLER ON FRIDAY HOWEVER.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES




@RUKWBCe+KDENFXUS61 KILN 211543
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1040 AM EST WED MAR 21 2001

SO MUCH FOR THE BEST LAID PLAINS.  THE CLOUDS IN THE WEST HAVE 
REALLY FALLEN APART AND SKIES ARE NOW MOSTLY SUNNY. NEED TO UPDATE 
FOR THAT RIGHT NOW.  IN ADDITION...IN THE SUN THE TEMPERATURES HAVE 
REALLY SOURED.  WILL UPDATE THE TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTHWEST TO THE 
MID 50S...IN THE SOUTHWEST TO 50 TO 55. 

THE FORECAST IN THE EAST IS A LITTLE MORE COMPLICATED. STILL SEEING 
A LINE OF LIGHT SHOWERS RUNNING FROM NEAR VTA-ROSS CO OH-BRACHEN CO 
KY. IN ADDITION THERE ARE SPRINKLES RUNNING FROM ILN-OWEN CO KY.  
ALL THIS PRECIP IS SPINNING EAST TO SOUTHEAST.

WILL DO SOME CHOPPING OF THE ZONES TO ACCOUNT FOR RAIN OVER THE NEXT 
COUPLE OF HOURS.

CLEMISILN AVAIL SOON...THEN THE ZFP.

.ILN...NONE.

682 
FXUS61 KILN 211413
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 AM EST WED MAR 21 2001

WILL DO AN EARLY UPDATE.  WILL REMOVE MENTION OF SNOW IN THE EAST.  
SURFACE TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN INTO THE LOWER 40S FROM CMH TO 
PMH...SO THE LOWEST LEVELS SHOULD BE DEEP ENOUGH TO MELT ANY SNOW 
BEFORE IT REACHES THE GROUND.

IN THE NORTHWEST WE HAVE PARTLY SUNNY GOING.  ALTHOUGH THE CLEARING 
LINE IS GRADUALLY MOVING EAST...TIMING DOESNT BRING IT INTO UNTIL 
AROUND NOON. WILL CHANGE THE CLOUDS TO MOSTLY CLOUDY THIS 
MORNING...PARTLY SUNNY THIS AFTERNOON.  THIS WILL PROBABLY CAUSE THE 
NEED FOR ANOTHER UPDATE AROUND NOON...BUT OH WELL.

CLEMISILN AVAIL SOON...THEN THE ZFP.

.ILN...NONE.
