AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 AM EST WED MAR 21 2001

RAIN CONTINUES TO PUSH INTO SRN AND ERN SECTIONS OF CWFA. SOME WET 
FLAKES ARE ALSO MIXING IN WITH THE HEAVIER PRECIP IN THE SE. THIS 
MIXING WILL BECOME LESS LIKELY AS UVVS WEAKEN WITH LOW PULLING 
TOWARD THE COAST. ALL MDLS IN GOOD AGREEMENT TAKING SFC/UPR LOWS 
TOWARD CAROLINA COAST AND UP THE ERN SEABOARD. AS THIS HAPPENS 
TDY...BEST RAIN CHCS WILL SHIFT TO THE NE PORTION OF CWFA. SOME RAIN 
WILL LINGER IN THE SOUTHWEST GRP SO WILL GO WITH AN ELY PD THERE. 
WILL GO LIKELY IN THE ERN ZNS AS RAIN WILL STICK AROUND MOST OF THE 
DAY. BUT AS LOW MOVES UP CST...BEST DYNAMICS SHIFT EAST OF AREA 
FAIRLY QUICKLY. WILL KEEP TONIGHT DRY. ETA PRETTY AGGRESSIVE WITH 
CLEARING TONIGHT AND THINK IT IS A LITTLE OVERDONE. WILL SHOW TREND 
OF DECREASING CLOUDS WEST TO EAST...BUT WILL GO A LITTLE SLOWER THAN 
ETA. 

COOLER 850 TEMPS IN PLACE FOR THURS BUT WITH PLENTY OF SUN...TEMPS 
SHOULD RISE NICELY. WILL STICK CLOSE TO CURRENT FCST HIGHS. SOME 
CLDS WORK IN AHEAD OF SHEARING LAKES SYS SO WILL KEEP MOCLDY THU 
NIGHT.

MISILN AVAIL SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE























@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 210215
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 PM EST TUE MAR 20 2001

UPR LO EVIDENT ON WV IMGRY MOVG INTO SW GA. THIS LO IS XPCTD TO 
TRACK SLOWLY ENE ACRS SE STATES TNGT/WED TO PSN OFF N CAROLINA CST
BY THU MRNG. SRN OH/NRN KY ON THE NRN FRINGE OF THIS SYS. INITIAL 
PRECIP BAND HAS ROTATED N FM SRN OH/NRN KY INTO CNTRL OH. THIS BAND
OF PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH FAVORABLE 850MB/700MB CNVRGC AND UPR DIV. 
FAVORABLE 850MB/700MB CNVRGC CONTS OVRNGT ESPECIALLY E OF CVG. RADAR
MOSAIC SHWS ADDITIONAL RAIN FILLING ACRS ERN KY BEGINNING TO SPREAD
NNW INTO S CNTRL OH. WITH AMS MOISTENED UP FROM INITIAL BAND OF 
PRECIP...XPCT NEXT BAND TO BE EVEN MORE EFFICIENT. WL CONT PDS OF RN 
ACRS PMH ZONE AND BUMP UP POPS IN CVG/DAY AND CMH AREAS. WL INTRODUCE
LO POP CHC IN NRN MIAMI TNGT. NXT QUESTION IS WHETHER PRECIP HS CHC
OF MIXING WITH SNW. DYNAMIC COOLING RESULTED IN A CHANGE TO SNW OVR
CNTRL KY LT THIS AFTN. BOUNDARY LYR WRM WITH FREEZING LVL FM 00Z ILN
SOUNDING AT 3.9K FT. BNDRY LYR REMAINS WRM OVRNGT. CHC FOR MIX WITH
WET SNW FLAKES APPEARS MINIMAL LTR TNGT. WL REMOVE MENT OF MIX FM 
FCST.      

ON WED AS LO PULLS AWAY S/WV RDGG BLDS INTO OH FM THE W. CHC OF PRECIP
REMAINS PSBL IN MRNG IN ERN SECTIONS AND THEN DIMINISHES. 

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL






















643 
FXUS61 KILN 202027
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EST TUE MAR 20 2001

AREA ON NORTHERN FRINGE OF CUTOFF UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER ALABAMA.  
CUTOFF IS PROGGED TO BE OFF THE CAROLINA COAST BY 12Z THURSDAY. 

SFC PATTERN FEATURES INVERTED TROF EXTENDING NORTH INTO OHIO FROM 
INTENSIFYING LOW OVER GEORGIA.  TROF WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT OUR WX 
UNTIL MAIN LOW MOVES OFF INTO THE ATLANTIC ON THURSDAY.

RADAR SHOWS ECHOES OVER OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES. CALLED A FEW COUNTIES 
AND GOT SPRINKLE REPORTS. MOST OF THE ECHOES ARE NOT CURRENTLY 
REACHING THE GROUND WITH DRY AIR IN PLACE. AS THE LAYER BETWEEN 700 
MB AND THE SFC MOISTENS...I EXPECT THAT SOME MEASURABLE RAINFALL 
WILL OCCUR...BEGINNING LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT...AS HAS BEEN 
ADVERTISED ON THE ETA...AND TO A LESSER EXTENT THE AVN.  WILL GO 
WITH RAIN LIKELY SOUTH CENTRAL COUNTIES...AND 40% CHANCE OF RAIN 
FARTHER NORTH INCLUDING CVG.  WILL KEEP CHANCE SPRINKLES AT 
CMH...ADD SPRINKLES AT DAY AND KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY AT WAPAKONETA.

FOR WEDNESDAY...WITH LOW PULLING AWAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE MORNING 
RAIN SOUTH CENTRAL...AND SPRINKLES AT CMH.  WILL CONTINUE MOSTLY 
CLOUDY FCST AT DAY AND CVG...WITH PARTLY SUNNY WAPAK.

WITH MOISTURE MOVING TOWARD THE ATLANTIC COAST...PARTLY CLOUDY WILL 
WORK FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  MID AND HIGH ALTITUDE MOISTURE WILL ALLOW 
PARTLY SUNNY SKIES ON THURSDAY.

FWC TEMPS LOOK DECENT.  WILL GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FWC TONIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH CLOUDS AND WINDS KEEPING READINGS UP AT NIGHT.  
60 SEEMS OPTIMISTIC AT CVG ON THURSDAY IN COLD ADVECTION/NORTHERLY 
FLOW BEHIND LOW SO ILL UNDERCUT FWC A BIT.

MISILN AVAILABLE.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO




















@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 201510
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1010 AM EST TUE MAR 20 2001

AREA UNDER WEAK EASTERLY FLOW UP TO 440 MB WITH H5 RIDGE AXIS FROM 
NEW JERSEY THROUGH PENNSYLVANIA INTO OHIO.  MAIN FEATURE IS STRONG 
CUTOFF NEAR THE GULF COAST THAT IS PUSHING A STRENGTHENING SFC LOW 
AND PLENTIFUL MOISTURE OUT AHEAD OF IT.  MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL 
STAY SOUTH OF HERE WITH H5 RIDGE PROTECTING US...BUT WE ARE GETTING 
MID AND HIGH CLOUDS. 

PRECIP IS OCCURRING OVER SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY.  MODEL QPF IS BRUSHING 
SOUTHEAST OHIO...BUT IT APPEARS OVERDONE WITH SOUNDING SHOWING DRY 
AIR FROM SFC TO 640 MB.  WILL CONTINUE PRECIP FREE FCST...WHILE 
KEEPING AN EYE ON NORTHWARD MOVEMENT OF PRECIP OVER KENTUCKY.
WITH THICKER CLOUDS SOUTH...WILL KEEP CURRENT PARTLY SUNNY 
NORTH/MOSTLY CLOUDY SOUTH. 

FCST TEMPS IN 50S LOOKING GOOD.  WILL ADJUST SOUTHERN GROUPS UP TO 
MID 50S WITH 10 AM TEMP OF 48 AT PORTSMOUTH AND CINCINNATI.  WILL 
ALSO CHANGE WIND DIRECTION TO SOUTHEAST ALL ZONES. 

MISILN AVAILABLE.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

@RUKWBCe$KDENFXUS61 KILN 200836
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EST TUE MAR 20 2001

STRONG SE SYS WILL JUST GRAZE CWFA ELY IN THE FCST PD BRINGING 
CLOUDS AND A SMALL CHC OF RAIN. ETA CONTS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON 
THE BIG PICTURE WITH THIS SYS SO WILL GO WITH IT. THINK ETA QPF IS 
OVER DONE ON THE NW EXTENT SO WILL DEFINITELY BACK OFF OF IT. HAVE A 
NICE SHIELD OF CI/AC ACROSS MUCH OF AREA AND THESE CLDS WILL 
DETERMINE TEMPS TDY. SOME DOWNSLOPING IS POSSIBLE ELY IN THE EAST 
WITH LLVL WINDS GOING SE...BUT THINK THEY WILL BACK AROUND TO THE 
EAST FAIRLY QUICKLY. BUT IT SHOULD BE ENUF TO KEEP ANY PRECIP FROM 
FALLING UNTIL TONIGHT. EVEN WITH LIMITED SUN IN THE SE...WAA HAS 
KEPT TEMPS UP OVERNIGHT SO THEY DO NOT HAVE FAR TO GO. WILL STICK 
CLOSE TO CURRENT FCST TEMPS. 

AS SYS MOVES NE UP THE EAST COAST...BEST MSTR JUST SKIMS ERN AREA. 
WILL KEEP LOW CHC POPS IN THE SE TONIGHT. BEST LIFT AND MSTR LOOKS 
TO STAY CLOSER TO THE APPS. WITH CLDS AND WINDS STAYING UP 
OVERNIGHT...WILL GO ABV GUID TEMPS. 

LOW HEADS NE WED BRINGING BETTER MSTR TO THE CMH GRP. WILL INTRODUCE 
SPRINKLES BEST LIFT IS WELL EAST. MOCLDY WORKS FOR OTHER AREAS AND 
WILL STICK CLOSE TO GUID/FCST TEMPS AS THEY LOOK REASONABLE. 
  
MISILN AVAILABLE.

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
900 PM EST MON MAR 19 2001

UPR LO OVR THE LWR MS VLY TO DEEPEN AND TRACK E ACRS THE GULF STATES
TNGT/TUE AND INTO SE TUE NGT. MID AND HI LVL CLDS MSTR SPREADING 
NWD THRU TN VLY INTO OH VLY. WL ADJUST INCRSG CLOUDINESS WORDING
TO MSTLY CLDY TNGT. ERLY SFC GRAD SHUD RESULT IN WNDS IN 5 TO 10 
MPH RANGE. WNDS ALONG WITH CLDS SHUD KEEP TEMPS UP TNGT. CURR TEMPS 
CLOSE TO MOS 3 HRLY GUID. WL KEEP CURR TEMP FCST.
     
SRN SECTIONS WL BE IN FAVORABLE UPR DIV TUE AFTN/NGT ALONG WITH 
H8 CNVRGC. BEST FORCING AND MSTR STAYS WELL TO OUR S AND E. PRECIP
EFF. SUGGS VRY LGT RN OR SPRINKLES PSBL IN S CNTRL OH/NE KY. WL 
ADD LIGHT WORDING.   

.ILN...NONE.



@RUKWBCe	KDENFXUS61 KILN 192008
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
308 PM EST MON MAR 19 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN HAS H5 RIDGE JUST TO OUR EAST...WITH CUTOFF LOW 
OVER CENTRAL PLAINS.  RIDGE WILL MOVE TO THE ATLANTIC COAST...WHILE 
CUTOFF MOVES SOUTH OF HERE ACROSS THE GULF STATES.  OUR AREA WILL 
REMAIN IN WEAK RIDGING NORTH OF THE CUTOFF...WITH NORTHERN STREAM 
SHORT WAVE SHEARING AS IT CROSSES THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES. 

WITH SFC HIGH PRESSURE OVER LAKE ERIE AND TROF ENTERING TENNESSEE 
VALLEY...RATHER TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT IS EVIDENT HERE.  HIGH IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE SLOWLY EAST TO THE CANADIAN MARITIMES BY 
WEDNESDAY...WITH TROF STRENGTHENING TO A VIGOROUS LOW OFF THE 
VIRGINIA COAST. 

CLOUDS ARE ALREADY SPILLING INTO OUR REGION AHEAD OF SFC TROF.  AS 
THE TROF STRENGTHENS...IT WILL BEGIN TO INFLUENCE OUR WEATHER A BIT 
MORE...THOUGH MOST OF ITS EFFECTS WILL REMAIN SOUTHEAST OF HERE.   
ETA GIVES QPF TO OUR ENTIRE AREA...WITH THE HEAVIEST AMOUNT BEING 
.26 AT PORTSMOUTH.  WITH DRY AIR NEAR THE SFC AND THE ETAS RECENT 
TENDENCY TO EXAGGERATE QPF WITH SYSTEMS TO OUR SOUTH...WILL TREND 
TOWARD DRIER AVN...WHICH HAS A HISTORY OF HANDLING SOUTHERN SYSTEMS 
BETTER.  MOST OF OUR  AREA WILL PROBABLY EXPERIENCE JUST THICKENING 
CLOUDS FROM THE SYSTEM...BUT OUR SOUTH CENTRAL COUNTIES MAY SEE SOME 
RAIN.

WITH LOW LEVELS SO DRY AND SFC HIGH SLOW TO MOVE...WILL DISCOUNT 
TONIGHTS LIGHT QPF AND GO WITH INCREASING CLOUDS.  LOOKS LIKE THERE 
WILL BE ENOUGH HOLES IN MID LEVEL CLOUDS TO USE PARTLY SUNNY MOST 
ZONES ON TUESDAY. THE EXCEPTION WILL BE SOUTH CENTRAL GROUP WHERE 
ILL GO WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY/30% CHANCE AFTERNOON RAIN. 

MID AND UPPER LEVEL RH SHOULD REMAIN HIGH ENOUGH FOR CLOUDS TO 
PERSIST TUESDAY NIGHT.  WILL GO WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY ALL ZONES...WITH 
30% CHANCE RAIN SOUTH CENTRAL ZONE.  MID AND UPPER DYNAMICS WILL 
MOVE EAST ALONG WITH MOISTURE ON WEDNESDAY...SO THERE IS NO NEED TO 
CONTINUE POPS THEN.  WILL GO WITH PARTLY SUNNY WEST...MOSTLY CLOUDY 
EAST. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK FAIRLY GOOD.  WILL GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FWC THROUGH THE 
FCST PERIOD AS MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL INSULATE SOMEWHAT AT NIGHT 
WHILE ALLOWING SOME DAYTIME SOLAR HEATING.  WINDS WILL ALSO KEEP 
TEMPS UP A BIT AT NIGHT.
 
.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO












785 
FXUS61 KILN 191450
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EST MON MAR 19 2001

H5 RIDGE IS CRESTING OVER THE CENTRAL OHIO VALLEY TODAY. SFC MAP 
SHOWS HIGH OVER LAKE ERIE WITH TROF MOVING INTO TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
RATHER TIGHT SFC PRESSURE GRADIENT HAS DEVELOPED BETWEEN HIGH AND 
TROF. 

OUR AREA WILL ONLY HAVE TO CONTEND WITH HIGH CLOUDS SPILLING OUT 
NORTH OF TROF. MID CLOUDS NEAR PAH SHOULD STAY SOUTHWEST OF OUR 
REGION UNTIL 00Z AS PER MESOETA 80% H5 RH. THUS...WILL STAY WITH 
MOSTLY SUNNY FCST ALL ZONES. 

FCST TEMPS RANGING FROM UPPER 40S NORTHWEST TO 50-55 SOUTH ALSO LOOK 
FINE WRT MORNING SOUNDING AND YESTERDAYS UPSTREAM HIGHS...ALLOWING 
FOR MODIFICATION OF AIRMASS BY STRONG MARCH SUN.

WITH DECENT PRESSURE GRADIENT ALREADY RESULTING IN 15 MPH WINDS AT 
CVG AND 18 MPH AT DAY...WILL UPDATE TO INCREASE WINDS UP TO 10 TO 20 
MPH. OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO











@RUKWBCe2KDENFXUS61 KILN 191450
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EST MON MAR 19 2001

H5 RIDGE IS CRESTING OVER THE CENTRAL OHIO VALLEY TODAY. SFC MAP 
SHOWS HIGH OVER LAKE ERIE WITH TROF MOVING INTO TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
RATHER TIGHT SFC PRESSURE GRADIENT HAS DEVELOPED BETWEEN HIGH AND 
TROF. 

OUR AREA WILL ONLY HAVE TO CONTEND WITH HIGH CLOUDS SPILLING OUT 
NORTH OF TROF. MID CLOUDS NEAR PAH SHOULD STAY SOUTHWEST OF OUR 
REGION UNTIL 00Z AS PER MESOETA 80% H5 RH. THUS...WILL STAY WITH 
MOSTLY SUNNY FCST ALL ZONES. 

FCST TEMPS RANGING FROM UPPER 40S NORTHWEST TO 50-55 SOUTH ALSO LOOK 
FINE WRT MORNING SOUNDING AND YESTERDAYS UPSTREAM HIGHS...ALLOWING 
FOR MODIFICATION OF AIRMASS BY STRONG MARCH SUN.

WITH DECENT PRESSURE GRADIENT ALREADY RESULTING IN 15 MPH WINDS AT 
CVG AND 18 MPH AT DAY...WILL UPDATE TO INCREASE WINDS UP TO 10 TO 20 
MPH. OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED.

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
253 AM EST MON MAR 19 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLEAR SKIES OVER FA WITH SOME BLOW CS JUST 
TO OUR WEST.  SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWING HIGH PRESSURE OVER NORTHERN 
OHIO.

MODELS ARE ALL IN DESCENT AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING SURFACE HIGH OVER 
REGION THROUGH TUESDAY.  DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE OVER SOUTHERN GULF 
STATES WILL BRING SOME BLOW OFF CLOUDS INTO FA...ESPECIALLY THE 
SOUTH.  TEMPERATURES ARE THE TOUGHEST PART OF THE FORECAST.  FWC 
ONCE AGAIN IS IN DESCENT SHAPE...BUT MAV SEEMS A BIT BETTER 
ESPECIALLY AFTER 3RD PERIOD WHEN COMPARED TO LOCAL TECHNIQUES.  
TODAYS HIGH SHOULD BE ABOUT 4 DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY AS 
AIRMASS MODIFIES.  TUESDAYS SHOULD BE EVEN A FEW DEGREE WARMER 
ACROSS THE NORTH AS MORE SUN IS EXPECTED WITH THE SOUTH ABOUT THE 
SAME (IE. MORE CLOUD COVER EXPECTED).

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.  

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

11-3.9 SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLOUDS HAVE CLEARED ACROSS FA.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH BUILDING HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
FA.  ETA/AVN DO DIFFER OVER OVER THE SOUTHEAST 48 TO 60 HRS BUT THIS 
DOES NOT AFFECT REGIONS WEATHER.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE THE BIGGEST 
CHALLENGE.  IN GENERAL FWC SEEMS A BIT TOO WARM FOR THE FIRST 3 
PERIODS ESPECIALLY FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS TONIGHT AND HIGHS MONDAY.  ALL 
TECHNIQUES EXCEPT THE 850 TECHNIQUE INDICATE COOLER HIGHS BOTH TODAY 
AND MONDAY.  BELIEVE WE WONT MIX TO 850 EITHER DAY SO WILL CUT BACK 
A DEGREE TODAY AND A COUPLE ON MONDAY.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.  

.ILN...NONE.

SHWD THIS MSTR BLO 780 MB. MESO-ETA 1000-700MB LYR AVG RH HS GOOD HANDLE

THAN FWC CLRG...CLOSER TO MAV. XPCT TO SEE THE FOLLOWING CLRG 
TIMING...NRN MIAMI BY LT EVE...DAY ARND 03Z...CVG ARND 05Z...CMH 04Z-06Z
AND PMH 06Z-08Z. WNDS HV BCM LGT NW AND SHUD BECOME N BY MRNG. COOL 
GUID TEMPS APPEAR REASONABLE CONSIDERING CLRG AND LGT WNDS. WL ONLY

BASED ON LATEST OBS CHANGEOVER TO SNOW APPEARS TO BE OCCURRING A

IS AFFECTING FA ATTM AND SHOULD CONTINUE FOR MUCH OF THE EVENING.  
HAVE UPDATED TO INCREASE POPS...MOVE TIMING UP FOR SNOW CHANGEOVER 
DAY-CMH AND INCREASE SNOW ACCUMULATION TO 1-2 INCHES FOR THE NRN 
MIAMI VALLEY.  NO CHANGES TO TEMPS AND WINDS.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON





@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 162033
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
333 PM EST FRI MAR 16 2001

UPPER TROF SITUATED OVER GREAT LAKES WILL PERSIST INTO SUNDAY.
A COUPLE SHOTS OF PVA WILL AFFECT THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT AND 
SATURDAY...THOUGH MOST OF PRECIP WILL STAY NORTH AND EAST OF HERE. 

SFC LOW IS CENTERED SOUTH OF CMH WITH TROF THROUGH CVG INTO SOUTHERN 
INDIANA. MODELS AGREE IN MOVING LOW TO PENNSYLVANIA BY 
SATURDAY...WITH TROF HANGING BACK INTO MICHIGAN...AND WRAP AROUND 
PRECIP MAINLY ALONG OUR NORTHERN FRINGE. 

RADAR LOOKING RATHER EMPTY IN RELATION TO MODEL QPF...THE EXCEPTION 
BEING OUR SOUTH CENTRAL COUNTIES. WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS TONIGHT IN 
AT CVG...LIKELY SOUTH CENTRAL FOR -SHRA CHANGING TO SNOW LATE. WILL 
GO WITH SCT POPS FARTHER NORTH AT DAY AND CMH FOR RAIN...CHANGING TO 
SNOW LATE. WILL STAY WITH SNOW LIKELY MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT IN WEST 
CENTRAL COUNTIES WHERE COLD AIR HAS REMAINED ENTRENCHED.

ON SATURDAY...SNOW LIKELY WILL WORK WEST CENTRAL...WITH CHANCE 
-RA/-SN ELSEWHERE. WILL USE MORNING WORDING IN THE WEST.

WITH NORTHWEST UPPER FLOW AND SFC RIDGING ON SATURDAY NIGHT...DRYING 
WILL OCCUR THROUGH MOST OF THE AIR COLUMN. AS USUAL...MOISTURE IS 
SHOWN TO PERSIST IN LOW LEVELS...THOUGH EVEN THE 925 MB MOISTURE IS 
PROGGED TO BE BELOW CLOUD FORMATION THRESHOLDS BY 12Z SUNDAY. WILL 
GO BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR ALL ZONES EXCEPT PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH 
CENTRAL COUNTIES WHERE MOISTURE WILL STAY THE LONGEST. 

SUNDAY LOOKS MOSTLY SUNNY WITH VERY DRY HIGH PRESSURE MOVING IN. 

WILL STAY CLOSE TO FWC THROUGH THE FCST PERIOD. SUNDAYS FWC HIGHS 
LOOK HIGH AT FIRST GLANCE AND IN COMPARISON TO MESOETA...BUT 
SUNSHINE WILL PROBABLY ALLOW FWC TO VERIFY. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

203 
FXUS61 KILN 160905
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
405 AM EST FRI MAR 16 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS LOW PRESSURE JUST TO THE EAST OF KSTL WITH 
WARM FRONT DRAPED INTO EASTERN KY.  3 HOUR PRESSURE CHANGES 
INDICATE LOW STARTING TO TRACK A BIT FARTHER NORTH.  COMPARISON OF 
SATELLITE IMAGERY AND SURFACE LOW SHOWS UPPER LOW STILL TO THE NORTH 
AND WEST OF SURFACE LOW. 

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH ETA/AVN MOST SIMILAR WITH 
NGM WANTING TO PULL LOW OFF TO THE EAST A BIT FASTER AT 36 TO 48 
HRS.  SURFACE LOW WILL TRACK JUST NORTH OF OHIO RIVER.  NORTH OF LOW 
WILL GO WITH CAT POPS WITH LIKELY POPS SOUTH.  TRACK OF LOW WILL 
ALSO BRING A DRASTIC TEMPERATURE GRADIENT WITH HIGHS AROUND 40 NEAR 
LIMA TO 50 TO 55 AROUND THE OHIO RIVER.  AS COLDER AIR WORKS INTO 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT RAIN WILL 
CHANGE TO SNOW BEGINNING IN THE NORTHWEST.  AT THE MOMENT AROUND 
INCH SEEMS REASONABLE.  WILL KEEP MENTION OF CHANCE OF SNOW NORTH ON 
SATURDAY AS INVERTED TROUGH ALONG WITH SOME GREAT LAKES MOISTER 
PERSISTS.

FWC LOOKS GOOD WILL BUMP CVG UP A BIT AS IT APPEARS THEY WILL GET IN 
THE WARM SECTOR.  

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.  THANKS TO CRW FOR COOR.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

948 PM EST THU MAR 15 2001

02Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A DEEP LOW OVER E-CENTRAL MO WITH A WARM 
FRONT EXTENDING EWD INTO SRN IN.  WV IMAGERY SHOWED A VIGOROUS S/WV 
MOVG ALONG THE MO-AR BORDER.  

THE S/WV IS PROGD TO TURN NE OVERNIGHT AND HEAD TOWARD FA.  LATEST 
GUIDANCE SHOWS A H8 CONVERGENCE/H3 DIVERGENCE COUPLET MOVG INTO FA 
AFT 06Z CREATING STRONG UPWARD VERTICAL MOTION.  KILN 00Z SOUNDING 
SHOWS A SHARP CHANGE IN WIND DIRECTION ABOVE 700 MB AND 12Z RUN 
GUIDANCE INDICATED SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY FROM 750-500 MB ALONG 
THE OH RIVER AT 12Z.  THUS...BLV THAT SOME OF THE TSRA OVER IL AND 
WRN KY WL MAKE IT INTO FA.  WL ADD THUNDER TO CVG AND PMH GROUPS.

OTHERWISE...ONLY ADJUSTMENTS TO WINDS EXPECTED WITH UPDATE.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 152019
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
318 PM EST THU MAR 15 2001

WIDESPREAD RAIN OVER SE COUNTIES NOW FALLING APART...AS UPPER 
SUPPORT SHEARS OFF TO THE EAST.  NEXT SHOT OF LIFT ARRIVES LATE 
TNGT...WITH FAIRLY STRONG ISETROPIC LIFT ENHANCED BY A NICE BULLSEYE 
OF UPPER DIVERGENCE.  MAY INCLUDE MENTION OF SPRINKLES ERLY TNGT IN 
THE WEST...BUT HOLD POPS OFF UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT.  WL USE CAT 
WORDING WEST...AND LIKELY EAST.  GUID IN GOOD AGREEMENT...BUT META 
SFC TEMPS SUGGEST MAY BE ABLE TO RAISE A DEG OR SO.

DECENT MODEL AGREEMENT TDY...AND MUCH BETTER RUN TO RUN FLOW.  AVN 
REMAINS MOST CONSISTENT...AND WL CONT TO USE AN ETA/AVN BLEND THIS 
FCST.  SFC LOW WL MOST LIKELY TRACK JUST SOUTH OF CVG...AND INTO S 
CENTRAL OH.  HV BROKE OFF OUR S-SE COUNTIES DUE TO WIND DIRECTION... 
AND TEMPS WHICH CUD WARM WELL INTO THE 50S.  WL ALSO CONT MENTION OF 
THUNDER TO THE SOUTH OF THE XPCTD LOW TRACK.  ETA MODEL SNDGS 
YIELDING FZRA OVER THE FAR NORTH FOR THE AFTN...BUT CRITICAL LLVL 
THICKNESS VALUES MUCH WARMER.  CONSIDERING CURRENT TEMPS... 
CLIMATOLOGY...AND A TENDENCY FOR A TOO COLD BNDRY LYR ON THE 
ETA...WL CONT WITH PREV THINKING OF RAIN TO SNOW.  WL FCST A CHGOVER 
FAR NW IN THE ERLY AFTN...WITH UP TO AN INCH ACCUM.  CRITICAL THKNS 
ALSO SUPPORT A MIX/CHG DOWN TO ABT I-70 LATE IN THE DAY. GUID TEMPS 
IN GD AGREEMENT...BUT CUD BE MUCH WARMER AT CVG/CMH WITH A MINOR 
NORTHWARD ADJUSTMENT IN LOW TRACK.  WL NOT STRAY FAR FROM GUIDANCE.

SFC LOW TRACKS E OF THE CWFA FRI EVE...WITH COLD AIR SURGING IN.  WL 
KEEP HIGHEST POPS IN THE BEST MEAN RH OVER THE N...TAPERING TO CHC 
FAR SOUTH.  AVN TENDS TO OVERDO QPF IN THE WRAP-AROUND MSTR...BUT 
WUD NOT BE SURPISED TO SEE AN ADDITIONAL INCH OR 2 FAR NORTH.  WL 
KEEP LOW POPS ERLY SAT IN THE NORTH AS LAST SHORT WAVE PIVOTS 
THRU...THEN MCLDY AND WELL BLO NORMAL TEMPS WITH STRONG NORTHERLY 
FLOW.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

250 AM EST THU MAR 15 2001

SRN S/W PROGGED TO SWING EAST AND DISSIPATE WITH SFC LOW TRACKING 
WELL S OF FCST AREA. NRN EXTENT OF PRECIP SHOULD ALLOW FOR LIGHT 
RAIN TO OVERSPREAD A GOOD PORTION OF FCST AREA DURING THE DAY 
TODAY...BUT AM CONCERNED THAT DRIER AIR MAY HOLD SWAY OVER THE 
NORTH. NEXT SYSTEM WITH H5 LOW CUTTING OFF IN THE PLAINS SWINGS 
TOWARDS OH VLY ON FRIDAY. ASSOCIATED SFC LOW TO TRACK OVER SRN FCST 
AREA, STALL AND WEAKEN AS THE UPPER SUPPORT GETS WASHED OUT.

WILL CONTINUE TO GO WITH THE MODEL GURUS EVALUATION AT NCEP AND RUN 
WITH THE ETA SOLUTION. THIS IS IN LINE WITH YESTERDAYS FCST...BUT 
AM STILL OF BELOW NORMAL CONFIDENCE. DUE TO LOWER CONFIDENCE...WILL 
NOT CHANGE MUCH IN THE WAY OF THE CHANGEOVER WORDING ON FRIDAY... 
GENERALLY A RAIN EVENT THAT SHOULD MIX WITH AND CHANGE TO SNOW FROM 
THE NORTHWEST. 

GUIDANCE NUMBERS SHOULD BE CLOSE...THOUGH THE FALLING DAYTIME TEMPS 
ON FRIDAY WILL POSE SOME MORE UNCERTAINTY.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCe/KDENFXUS61 KILN 141947
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
246 PM EST WED MAR 14 2001

MID AFTN SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS HIPRES CENTERED JUST SOUTH OF THE OHIO 
RIVER...WITH A RIDGE XTNDG SOUTH TO THE GULF COAST.  RIDGE WL SHIFT 
SLOWLY EAST TNGT...WITH THE LATEST SHORT RANGE GUID INDICATING A 
GRADUAL INCRS IN MID/HIGH LVL MSTR FROM THE SOUTH AND WEST.  WL CONT 
PREV TREND OF INCRSG CLDS...BUT WITH SVRL HOURS OF GD RADIATIONAL 
CONDS...ESPLY NORTH AND EAST...WL TREND AOB THE FWC TEMPS.  MODELS 
HV TRENDED SLOWER BRINING DEEP MSTR/PCPN IN TNGT...AND WL INCLUDE 
LOW POPS ONLY IN THE FAR SW.

DIGGING NORTHERN STREAM SYS OVER WY/MT HAS ALREADY KICKED SYS OUT 
OF THE SW.  INITIAL SHORT WAVE WL PROVIDE NICE SHOT OF LIFT TO THE 
AREA THU.  BEST ISENTROPIC LIFT/MSTR PROGGED OVER THE SOUTH/ 
SOUTHEAST TMRW...AND WL HIT POPS HARDEST THERE.  FAR NW LKS TO BE 
BETWEEN SYSTEMS MOST OF THE DAY...AND WL TAPER POPS BACK TO LIKELY 
IN THE DAY-AOH GROUPS.  FWC TEMPS MAYBE A DEG OR 2 TOO WARM GIVEN 
CLDS/PCPN...AND WL TREND TWRD THE COOLER FAN.

DPROG/DT ANALYSIS OF THE LAST FEW MODEL RUNS DEPICTS A FAIR AMNT OF 
RUN TO RUN VARIABILITY...WITH ALL GUID TRENDING WEAKER AND FURTHER 
SOUTH WITH THE SFC LOW THU NGT-FRI.  AVN SHOWING THE BEST RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY...AND HV FOLLOWED AN AVN/ETA BLEND FOR THE 3RD AND 4TH 
PDS.  BEST FORCING FOR LIFT/PCPN EFFICIENCY PROGGED OVER THE REGION 
THU NIGHT...AND WL INCLUDE CAT POPS ALL ZONES.  LLVL CONVERGENCE/ 
UPPER LVL CONVERGENCE COUPLET MVS ACRS THE SE COUNTIES...AND WITH 
LIS DROPPING TO 0-2 WL INCLUDE THUNDER THERE.  FOR FRI COLDER AIR 
BLEEDS IN THROUGHOUT THE DAY...WITH CRITICAL THICKNESS VALUES 
SUPPORTING SNOW OVER THE NORTH AND WEST DURING THE AFTN.  WITH 
WEAKER SYS MAY NOT BE A WHOLE LOT OF PCPN LEFT IN THE COLDER 
AIR...BUT WL STILL INDC A CHANGEOVER/MIX.  FWC TEMPS LK A BIT WARM 
FRI...AND THIS MAY BE EVEN MORE EVIDENT IF SYS CONTS TRENDING SOUTH.
HV GENERALLY UNDERCUT A DEG OR 2.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE









226 
FXUS61 KILN 141947
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
246 PM EST WED MAR 14 2001

MID AFTN SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS HIPRES CENTERED JUST SOUTH OF THE OHIO 
RIVER...WITH A RIDGE XTNDG SOUTH TO THE GULF COAST.  RIDGE WL SHIFT 
SLOWLY EAST TNGT...WITH THE LATEST SHORT RANGE GUID INDICATING A 
GRADUAL INCRS IN MID/HIGH LVL MSTR FROM THE SOUTH AND WEST.  WL CONT 
PREV TREND OF INCRSG CLDS...BUT WITH SVRL HOURS OF GD RADIATIONAL 
CONDS...ESPLY NORTH AND EAST...WL TREND AOB THE FWC TEMPS.  MODELS 
HV TRENDED SLOWER BRINING DEEP MSTR/PCPN IN TNGT...AND WL INCLUDE 
LOW POPS ONLY IN THE FAR SW.

DIGGING NORTHERN STREAM SYS OVER WY/MT HAS ALREADY KICKED SYS OUT 
OF THE SW.  INITIAL SHORT WAVE WL PROVIDE NICE SHOT OF LIFT TO THE 
AREA THU.  BEST ISENTROPIC LIFT/MSTR PROGGED OVER THE SOUTH/ 
SOUTHEAST TMRW...AND WL HIT POPS HARDEST THERE.  FAR NW LKS TO BE 
BETWEEN SYSTEMS MOST OF THE DAY...AND WL TAPER POPS BACK TO LIKELY 
IN THE DAY-AOH GROUPS.  FWC TEMPS MAYBE A DEG OR 2 TOO WARM GIVEN 
CLDS/PCPN...AND WL TREND TWRD THE COOLER FAN.

DPROG/DT ANALYSIS OF THE LAST FEW MODEL RUNS DEPICTS A FAIR AMNT OF 
RUN TO RUN VARIABILITY...WITH ALL GUID TRENDING WEAKER AND FURTHER 
SOUTH WITH THE SFC LOW THU NGT-FRI.  AVN SHOWING THE BEST RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY...AND HV FOLLOWED AN AVN/ETA BLEND FOR THE 3RD AND 4TH 
PDS.  BEST FORCING FOR LIFT/PCPN EFFICIENCY PROGGED OVER THE REGION 
THU NIGHT...AND WL INCLUDE CAT POPS ALL ZONES.  LLVL CONVERGENCE/ 
UPPER LVL CONVERGENCE COUPLET MVS ACRS THE SE COUNTIES...AND WITH 
LIS DROPPING TO 0-2 WL INCLUDE THUNDER THERE.  FOR FRI COLDER AIR 
BLEEDS IN THROUGHOUT THE DAY...WITH CRITICAL THICKNESS VALUES 
SUPPORTING SNOW OVER THE NORTH AND WEST DURING THE AFTN.  WITH 
WEAKER SYS MAY NOT BE A WHOLE LOT OF PCPN LEFT IN THE COLDER 
AIR...BUT WL STILL INDC A CHANGEOVER/MIX.  FWC TEMPS LK A BIT WARM 
FRI...AND THIS MAY BE EVEN MORE EVIDENT IF SYS CONTS TRENDING SOUTH.
HV GENERALLY UNDERCUT A DEG OR 2.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1015 AM EST WED MAR 14 2001

WILL UPDATE ZONES THIS MORNING TO REMOVE EARLY WORDING...AND TO 
DROP TEMPERATURES 1 CATEGORY IN THE NW CWFA.  12Z KILN SOUNDING 
DEPICTS SHARP INVERSION ARND 900MB...WITH VERY DRY AIR ABV.  
COMBINATION OF MODEST WAA THROUGHOUT THE INVERSION LAYER TDY...AND 
DIURNAL MIXING DRIVEN BY THE SMMS(STRONG MID MARCH SUN)...WL ALLOW 
CONTD DRYING IN THE LLVLS.  WL GO MSNY ALL ZONES.  TEMPS LAGGING FWC 
3 HOURLIES TEMPS AT 15Z.  COMPUTED FULL SUN TEMP FROM 12Z SOUNDING 
ONLY 45 TDY...BUT AS MENTIONED ABV INVERSION WL BE ERODING.  WL MAKE 
SOME DOWNWARD TEMP ADJUSMENTS IN THE NW...OTHW NO CHGS.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

244 
FXUS61 KILN 140730
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 AM EST WED MAR 14 2001

AM HAVING A HARD TIME UNDERSTANDING MODEL SOLUTIONS TONIGHT. 
CONFIDENCE DECREASES EXPONENTIALLY WITH TIME. 24 HOURS AGO HAD SPLIT 
SYSTEMS MERGING IN SRN GT LKS REGION. NOW THE SPLIT SYSTEMS DONT 
MERGE ALTHOUGH ENERGY FROM SRN S/W DOES GET PULLED INTO NRN SYSTEM 
TO ENHANCE SFC LOW OVER ILL.

ONLY SAVING GRACE RIGHT NOW IS THAT THE MODELS ARE TRENDING TO A 
SOLUTION...BUT ARE STILL OFF BY A COUPLE HUNDRED KM ON SFC FEATURES 
IN LATTER PERIODS. WILL DEFER TO NCEP FOLKS AND TAKE THEIR ADVICE 
USING THE ETA AS MODEL OF CHOICE.

IN THE HERE AND NOW...SOME LOWER CLOUDS NOTED ON SAT IMAGE COOINCIDE 
WITH H9 80% LINE. THIS GETS SHIFTED TO ERN AND NRN FCST AREA BY 12Z 
AND WILL GO WITH SOME MORNING CLOUDS IN THESE AREAS. OTHERWISE... 
SUBSIDENCE AND REALTIVELY DRY AIR IN LOWER LEVELS SHOULD PROVIDE FOR 
A MOSUNNY DAY ACROSS OH VLY. GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE RELATIVELY CLOSE 
BETWEEN THE FWC/FAN/MAV...AND WILL TAKE THE HIGHER END OF THESE 
NUMBERS FOR HIGHS TODAY. EXPECT AN INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS 
OVERNIGHT...WHICH MAY OR MAY NOT HOLD TEMPERATURES UP IN THE EAST. 
PREVIOUS FCST HAS 40 POPS IN WRN ZONES WITH LATE WORDING. WILL HOLD 
ON TO THIS AS ITS ENTIRELY REASONABLE...BUT BRING POPS DOWN 10% 
ACROSS THE BOARD AND THROW 20 POPS IN SOUTHEAST GROUP DUE TO THE 
SPLIT SYSTEMS APPROACHING FROM W AND SW.

RAINY THURSDAY NOTED IN ZONES. NO PROBLEMS HERE...BUT WILL CUT 80 
POPS OVER NE FCST AREA TO LIKELY. CONTAMINATION BETWEEN 2 SFC LOWS 
SHOWS PRECIP OVER ENTIRE REGION...BUT ETA SUGGESTING AT A WEDGE OF 
NO PRECIP FROM NE OH TO N CNTL OH DURING THE DAY. NE FLOW OVER 
REGION AT THIS TIME IS DOWNSLOPING AND THIS LOOKS REASONABLE. 

BY FRIDAY MY CONFIDENCE IN MODELS IS IN A TAIL SPIN...WILL KEEP 
PREVIOUS FCST ALTHOUGH CURRENT MODEL SOLUTION WOULD SUGGEST A RAIN 
CHANGING TO SNOW EVENT AS OPPOSED TO JUST SNOW.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

FXUS61 KILN 131935
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
235 PM EST TUE MAR 13 2001

VORT MAX MOVG ACRS SRN IND ATTM WITH ASCTD COLD POOL MOVG IN ALF. 
SHWRS HAV BCM FAIRLY WIDESPRD ACRS ERN IND/WRN OH PAST CPL HRS. 
BOUNDARY LAYER HAS WARMED UP ENUF TO PRETTY MUCH KP ALL PCPN IN THE 
FORM OF RAIN ALTHO HAV HAD A SMALL HAIL RPT OR TWO FM ERN IND. 
WL HAV TO HANG ON TO AN ERLY MENTION OF PCPN IN THE WEST AND EVNG 
WORDING IN THE EAST BEFORE VORT MAX SWINGS THRU AND THINGS BEGIN TO 
DRY OUT. HAV NOT SEEN ANY LTGG STRIKES SO FAR BUT PCPN LOOKING RADAR 
LOOKING PRETTY CONV AND WITH COOLING CONTG ALF...WL CONT WITH A 
MENTION OF SOME THUNDER IN THE S AND E. 

OTHER CONCERN FOR TNGT WL BE WINDS. QUITE A FEW WIND GUSTS IN THE 30 
TO 35 KT RANGE ACRS IL AND IND ASCTD WITH 50 KT 8H JET THAT IS FCST 
TO SWING ACRS SRN FA THRU ARND 00Z. WL GO WITH WINDY WORDING ERLY 
THAN INDICT DCRSG WINDS OVRNGT. 

GOOD SUBSDC ACRS REGION ON WED WITH DRY AMS IN PLACE FOR PRTLY TO 
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. MDLS CONT TO TRY AND PHASE THE NRN/SRN STREAM 
SYSTEMS FOR LATE WED NGT AND THUR. MDLS HAV ALSO BEEN TRENDING A LTL 
FASTER WITH NGM THE FASTEST. BASED ON THIS WL GO AHD AND BRING A CHC 
OF PCPN INTO WRN PORTIONS OF FA LATE WED NGT AND GO WITH MAINLY CAT 
POPS FOR THUR. COOLER AIR MOVS IN ON BACK SIDE THUR NGT AND WL 
INDICT CHC RAIN CHGG TO SNOW LATE OVR ALL BUT SE.

DID NOT DEVIATE TOO MUCH FM FWC GUID NUMBERS THRU PD.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 AM EST MON MAR 12 2001

LEFTOVER WX MAY BE NEEDED IN THE EAST EARLY THIS MORNING...WILL WAIT 
AND SEE IF PROGRESSION OF COLD FRONT IS AS QUICK AS MODELS ARE 
SUGGESTING. 

COLD POOL HANGS ON BEHIND FROPA TODAY, AND AXIS OF MOISTURE IS 
LOCATED JUST N OF VORT MAX SWINGING THROUGH SRN FCST AREA THIS PM. 
THIS SHOULD BE ENOUGH TO SPARK A FEW AFTERNOON SHOWERS, AND IM A 
LITTLE WORRIED FOR SE FCST AREA THIS PM WITH 50 KT H8 JET PROGGED TO 
BE THERE AT 0Z. ANY SHOWERS AHEAD OF JET MAY BRING A FEW GUSTS TO 40 
OR SO. WILL HOLD ON TO BRISK WORDING WITH GUSTY 15 TO 25 MPH WINDS 
TODAY...AND BE AWARE THAT IT MAY INCREASE WITH HIGHER GUSTS IN PM. 

AFTER SCATTERED SHOWERS TODAY, SFC RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST AND WINDS SHUT OFF LATE TONIGHT. TEMP GUIDANCE S ARE 
WITHIN 2-3 DEGREES FOR THE NEXT 4 TO 5 PERIODS AND WILL STAY CLOSE 
HERE.

NEXT SHOT OF PRECIP IS WITH A MERGING SW AND NW SYSTEM OVER FCST 
AREA ON THURSDAY. DONT BELIEVE THAT THIS SCENARIO WILL PLAY OUT 
WITH THEM MERGING OVER THE GT LKS...BUT WILL DEFINITELY INDICATE 
SHOWERS FOR THURSDAY WHICH WAS PREVIOUSLY DRY.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

494 
FXUS61 KILN 130235
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
935 EST MON MAR 12 2001

AREA UNDER SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH UPPER TROF MOVING THROUGH 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  PLENTY OF MOISTURE AROUND WITH 00Z SOUNDING 
SHOWING PWAT OF 1.01. 

RADAR INDICATES SHRA ACROSS MUCH OF EASTERN OHIO IS ASSOC WITH UVV 
ALONG SFC WARM FRONT SOUTHEAST OF LOW OVER WISCONSIN.  A FEW MORE 
SHRA ARE CROPPING UP IN WESTERN OHIO AND EASTERN INDIANA BEHIND THE 
MAIN AREA.  A LINE OF TSRA HAS FORMED ALONG THE COLD FRONT ALONG THE 
INDIANA-ILLINOIS BORDER.  THIS LINE MATCHES UP WELL WITH MESOETA 700 
MB OMEGA AND SHOULD REACH SOUTHWEST OHIO AROUND 06Z. 

WITH ACTIVITY IN WEST CURRENTLY RATHER SPARSE...WILL UPDATE WESTERN 
ZONES TO TIME SHRA/TSRA MAINLY LATE.  WILL LEAVE EASTERN ZONES ALONE 
FOR NOW AND POSSIBLY UPDATE THEM AT AROUND 11 PM.  LOWS IN 40S LOOK 
GOOD SO NO TEMP ADJUSTMENT IS NEEDED. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 122029
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 PM EST MON MAR 12 2001

RAIN TRYING TO FILL IN ACROSS PARTS OF THE AREA THIS AFTN. WARM 
FRONT IS PUSHING THRU SRN IN WITH DWPT IN LOUISVILLE INTO THE LOWER 
50S. FIRST FRONT/PREFRONTAL TROF COMES THRU LATE TONIGHT WITH A 
CHANCE OF THUNDER SOUTH WITH BEST DWPTS/INSTABILITY. MDLS CONT TO 
SHOW A SLOWER TREND WITH THIS WHOLE SYS AND NOW A SECONDARY FRONT 
COMES THRU LATE TOMORROW WITH THE UPPER TROF. THIS MAKES THINGS 
INTERESTING SINCE UPPER LVLS ARE COLDER AND WE COULD SEE SOME PEAKS 
OF SUN WITH LLVL FLOW BACKING DURING THE AFTN. AS VORT DIVES IN LATE 
TOMORROW THINK WE COULD SEE SOME THUNDER AGAIN IN THE SOUTH. CHC 
LOOKS BEST EARLY EVE IN THE SE. WILL GO LIKELY POPS TUE WITH GULF 
CONVECTION NOT ARND TO CUT THINGS OFF. 

TUE NIGHT WILL SEE THIS SECOND FRONT/UPPER TROF CLEAR THE CWFA WITH 
COLD AIR FILTERING IN BEHIND IT. LOOKS LIKE THE MSTR WILL BE OUT 
BEFORE COLD AIR ARRIVES IN THE WEST BUT THE CHC IS THERE FOR 
FLURRIES IN CNTRL OH. HI BUILDS IN WED WITH LLVL MSTR FINALLY 
EXITING. BUT RESPITE IS SHORT-LIVED AS ZONAL FLOW BRINGS NEXT SYS IN 
FRI.

WILL GO AOA GUID TEMPS/CLOSER TO MAV NUMBERS FIRST 2 PDS AND A 
DEGREE OR TWO COOLER WED.

.ILN...NONE.

WHITE

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 120729
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 AM EST MON MAR 12 2001

MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT AS THEY LIFT UPPER LOW OUT OF THE GREAT 
PLAINS.  SURFACE LOW LIFTS THROUGH THE NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
INTO THE GREAT LAKES.

THREE DIFFERENT VORT MAXS AFFECT THE FA THIS FORECAST PACKAGE.  
FIRST LIFTS ACROSS THE FA THIS AFTERNOON IN WAA AHEAD OF THE SURFACE 
LOW.  SECOND SWINGS THROUGH AROUND 12Z TUESDAY WITH COLD FRONT.  
THIRD DROPS DOWN IN NORTHWEST FLOW THROUGH KY AROUND 00Z WED.

GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT ACROSS THE FA TODAY...BUT SOME OF IT WILL BE 
USED TO MOISTEN THE ATMOSPHERE.  STILL LOOKS LIKE MAINLY AN 
AFTERNOON EVENT.  CURRENT POPS AND WORDING HAVE THIS COVERED WELL 
WILL PUSH POPS INTO THE CATEGORICAL RANGE OVER NIGHT.  FEEL THAT 
ALMOST EVERY ONE WILL SEE SOME RAIN TONIGHT.  ALTHOUGH NEW SWODY1 
HAS ENTIRE FA IN GENERAL THUNDER....WILL CONTINUE TO ONLY CARRY IT 
IN THE SOUTH.  THIS IS WHERE THE BEST DEWPOINTS WILL BE AND LOWEST 
LI.

COLD AIR SEEMS TO TAKE LONGER TO GET IN THIS RUN...SO WILL KEEP THE 
PCPN ALL RAIN DURING THE DAY ON TUESDAY.  WILL THEN MAKE THE CHANGE 
OVER MONDAY NIGHT.

A FEW MINOR TWEAKS TO THE TEMPERATURES...OTHERWISE CURRENT FORECAST 
WILL RUN.


.ILN...NONE.

SITES

AND SEE IF PROGRESSION OF COLD FRONT IS AS QUICK AS MODELS ARE 
SUGGESTING. 

COLD POOL HANGS ON BEHIND FROPA TODAY, AND AXIS OF MOISTURE IS 
LOCATED JUST N OF VORT MAX SWINGING THROUGH SRN FCST AREA THIS PM. 
THIS SHOULD BE ENOUGH TO SPARK A FEW AFTERNOON SHOWERS, AND IM A 
LITTLE WORRIED FOR SE FCST AREA THIS PM WITH 50 KT H8 JET PROGGED TO 
BE THERE AT 0Z. ANY SHOWERS AHEAD OF JET MAY BRING A FEW GUSTS TO 40 
OR SO. WILL HOLD ON TO BRISK WORDING WITH GUSTY 15 TO 25 MPH WINDS 
TODAY...AND BE AWARE THAT IT MAY INCREASE WITH HIGHER GUSTS IN PM. 

AFTER SCATTERED SHOWERS TODAY, SFC RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST AND WINDS SHUT OFF LATE TONIGHT. TEMP GUIDANCE S ARE 
WITHIN 2-3 DEGREES FOR THE NEXT 4 TO 5 PERIODS AND WILL STAY CLOSE 
HERE.

NEXT SHOT OF PRECIP IS WITH A MERGING SW AND NW SYSTEM OVER FCST 
AREA ON THURSDAY. DONT BELIEVE THAT THIS SCENARIO WILL PLAY OUT 
WITH THEM MERGING OVER THE GT LKS...BUT WILL DEFINITELY INDICATE 
SHOWERS FOR THURSDAY WHICH WAS PREVIOUSLY DRY.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
934 PM EST SUN MAR 11 2001

UPPER RIDGE OVER OHIO VALLEY THIS EVENING. SHORT WAVE MOVING INTO 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL BRING INCREASING CLOUDS LATE TONIGHT AND 
RAIN ON MONDAY. 

SFC MAP SHOWS WARM FRONT EXTENDING FROM SOUTHERN PLAINS LOW TO 
KENTUCKY JUST NORTH OF LEX. STRONG TEMP GRADIENT IN PLACE WITH 49 AT 
CVG AND 35 AT DAY. FRONT IS PROGGED TO CROSS OUR REGION ON MONDAY AS 
LOW CRANKS UP AND TAKES OFF TOWARD LAKE MICHIGAN. 

INCREASING CLOUDS LAGGING BEHIND MODEL FCSTS.  WILL UPDATE TO 
INDICATE THIS TREND AND WORD MOSTLY CLEAR WITH INCR CLDS LATE/TOWARD 
DAYBREAK...EXCEPT JUST MOSTLY CLEAR AT CMH. WILL ALSO DROP TEMPS A 
CAT AT DAY. OTHERWISE TEMP AND WIND FCST HOLDING UP SO NO OTHER 
CHANGES ARE ANTICIPATED.

.ILN...NONE

TO JUST S OF CVG. CLDS HV DISSIPATED ACRS ALL BUT NE SECTIONS
OF CWA. WL START OUT SKY COND MSTLY CLR. HI LVL CLDS XPCTD TO
INCRS LT TNGT AHD OF APPROACHING SYS. PREFER TEMPS A COUPLE DEGS
COOLER THAN FWC GUID DUE TO CLR SKIES AND DRY AMS.

ENE ACRS CNTRL PLNS TNGT AND INTO MID MS VLY MON. 295-300K
ISENT SFC/S SHW NR CROSS CONTOUR FLO AND FAVORABLE LIFT DVLPG
BY AFTN IN THE S AND SPREADING NE ACRS CWA. LO LVL CNVRGC TO
DVLPG AHD OF 40-50KT LLJ. ETA SHWS A QUICK SHOT OF RAIN AHD
OF APPROACHING WRMFNT AND THEN AREA BEING DRY SLOTTED. THIS
LOOKS REASONABLE BASED ON FAST SWRLY FLO. BASED ON STG WAA
XPCT TEMPS TO RISE CLOSE TO WRMR MAV TEMPS MON.


CDFNT TO PASS THRU THE AREA FM W TO E MON NGT. AHD OF THIS FNT
XPCT TO SEE SFC DWPTS INCRS INTO THE LOWER 50S IN NRN KY AND 
FAR SRN OH MON NGT. WL GO WITH SHWRS LKLY MON NGT AND WL PLACE
MENT OF TSTMS IN THE FAR S. XPCT FROPA TO OCCUR AFTR MIDNGT W
AND LT IN THE E. IN CAA PREFER MON NGT LOW TEMPS A LTL COOLER
THAN FWC GUID.


UPR TROF TO SWING THRU ON TUE WITH VORT MAX XPCTD TO DROP SE
FM NRN PLNS INTO MN TROF PSN OVR OH VLY. BEST THREAT OF SHWRS 
LOOKS TO BE ACRS THE N WHERE LKLY CAT WL BE CONTD. WL GO WITH 
CHC POPS ELSEHWERE. IN CAA PTN THERMAL PROFILE WL BE COLD XPCT
FOR BOUNDARY LYR. ACRS NW GRPS WL INDICATE MIX WITH SNW SHWRS
PSBL DURG AFTN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 AM EST SUN MAR 11 2001

COLD FRONT RUNNING FROM NEAR LAN-GSH-SPI AT ATTM IS FCST TO PUSH 
INTO THE NW PORTION OF FA BY 12Z. FRONT THEN GETS STRETCHED OUT WEST 
TO EAST DURING THE DAY. ONLY SPRINKLES BEING REPORTED ACROSS THE 
EXTREME NORTHERN COUNTIES ATTM.  SURFACE OBS ACROSS IN/IL ARE 
REPORTING SOME LIGHT RAIN...SO WILL CARRY THE MENTION OF SPRINKLES 
EARLY TODAY ACROSS THE NORTH.  ANY FARTHER SOUTH WILL BE A LAST 
SECOND LOOK AT THE RADAR AS THE ZFP IS ISSUED.

AS UPPER DYNAMICS PULL EAST THIS MORNING...PRECIP WILL END QUICKLY.  
MODELS CONSISTENT IN DECREASING RH TODAY.  WILL CONTINUE WITH THE 
BECOMING PC THIS AFTERNOON. 

FA IN BETWEEN SYSTEM TONIGHT...BUT SHOULD SEE A GRADUALLY INCREASE 
IN CLOUDS BY MORNING.  AVN AND ETA ARE SIMILAR IN TRACK OF SURFACE 
LOW...TAKING IT THROUGH MICHIGAN BY 60 HRS.  THE NGM IS A LITTLE 
FARTHER SOUTHEAST.   RAIN LIKELY ON SUNDAY STILL LOOKS FINE.

MODELS ARE DIFFERING ON THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY SUNDAY NIGHT.  NGM 
IS THE MOST UNSTABLE PUSHING -5 LI INTO THE CVG AREA BY 12Z.   THE 
ETA MEANWHILE KEEPS ALL NEGATIVE LI OUT IN IL/IN.  THE AVN IS A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.   WILL ADD MENTION OF THUNDER IN THE 
SOUTHWEST RIGHT NOW.   IN ADDITION SUNDAY NIGHT LOOKS LIKE IT COULD 
BE BREEZY/BLUSTERY.  WILL ADD SOME TYPE OF WORDING.

LITTLE CHANGE IN THE TEMPERATURES.  MOS AND TEMPERATURES TECHNIQUES 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE CURRENT NUMBERS.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 PM EST SAT MAR 10 2001

MODELS GENERALLY SIMILAR WITH MAIN FEATURES THRU ERLY PART OF FCST.
SPLIT UPR FLO WITH NRN STREAM S/WV OVR NRN PLNS TO PIVOT E THRU
GRTLKS TNGT/ERLY SUN. AHD OF THIS SYS S/WV RDGG PROVIDING SUBSIDENCE
AND MSTLY CLR SKY CONDITION. SKIES TO START OUT MSTLY CLR WITH AN
INCRS IN CLDS OVRNGT. ASSOCIATED CDFNT FM WRN GRTLKS THRU CNTRL PLNS
TO PUSH E INTO WRN OH LT TNGT. BEST DYNAMICS STAYS TO OUR N WITH
NRN PTN OF THE FNT MOVG FASTER THAN THE SRN PART. MARGINALLY 
FAVORABLE PE/S INTO THE FAR N LT TNGT ALONG WITH 950MB LO LVL 
CNVGRC. THIS AREA IS ALSO IN RR QUAD OF UPR JET WHICH PROVIDES
SOME WK UPR DIV. THEREFORE...WL MAINTAIN A CHC OF SHWRS ACRS THE N
LT TNGT. ACRS CNTRL OH WL MENT SPRINKLES PSBL LATE. TEMPWISE...DUE
TO DRY AIR AND MSTLY CLR COND ERLY WITH TREND TOWARD COOLER MAV GUID
TNGT.
 
AS FNT DROPS S ACRS CWA ON SUN IT STRETCHES OUT E-W WITH FAVORABLE
MSTR AND FORCING TO OUR N AND E. THEREFORE...WL ONLY MENT A FW 
SPRINKLES ERLY IN CNTRL OH BUT OTHERWISE WL LEAVE FORECAST DRY. IN 
THE WAKE OF THE FNT DRYING AND SUB INTO THE AREA. WL INDICATE SKIES 
BCMG PARTLY CLDY. SUN FCST HI TEMPS BASED ON LO LVL THICKNESS 
SCHEMES AND GENERALLY FALL BTWN WRM FWC AND COOLER MAV.
       

FOCUS SHIFT TO SRN STREAM UPR LO XPCTD TO LIFT FM FOUR CORNERS 
INTO THE CNTRL PLNS SUN NGT AND INTO MID MS VLY MON. MODELS HV
TRENDED SLOWER WITH THIS SYS CLOSER TO AVN SOLN. OH VLY LOOKS 
TO REMAIN DRY SUN NGT IN THE WAKE OF FNTL PASSAGE. 

FLO BACKS WITH INITIAL S/WV AND WRMFNT PASSAGE XPCTD ON MON DURG
AFTN. 45-50KT LO LVL JET TO PROVIDE FAVORABLE LO LVL CNVRGC. WL
MAINTAIN RAIN LKLY FCST ACRS ENTIRE AREA WITH THE BEST POPS IN 
SW OH. BIG DIFFERENCES IN GUID HI TEMPS MON. FWC NUMBERS APPEAR
TOO COLD WITH WRM PUSH OF AIR. WL TREND TOWARD WRMR MAV GUID
HERE. ELEVATED CNVCTN WL BE PSBL MON AFTN WITH THE STRONG JET
AND ADVCTN OF MSTR.       

CLEMISILN ALREADY OUT.

.ILN...NONE

@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 100735
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 AM EST SAT MAR 10 2001

HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ACROSS SOUTHERN IN ATTM WILL SLIDE EAST TODAY 
AND SHOULD PROVIDE SUNNY SKIES FOR THE FA TODAY.  CURRENT FORECAST 
FOR TODAY HIGHS ARE MATCHING TEMPERATURES TECHNIQUES AND MOS...WHICH 
HAS BEEN TRENDING DOWNWARD...SO NO CHANGES THERE.

COLD FRONT CURRENTLY SOUTH OF LAKE WINNIPEG...DROPS INTO NORTHWEST 
OHIO BY 12Z SUNDAY.  BEST UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS SWING NORTH OF THE 
FA...WITH 500 MB VORT SLIDING ACROSS MICHIGAN. WEAK 300 MB 
DIVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH RIGHT REAR QUAD OF JET DOES AFFECT THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF OHIO BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z SUNDAY.  ETA CONTINUES TO 
BE THE MOST AGGRESSIVE WITH THE QPF...ALTHOUGH THIS TIME THE AVN IS 
SUGGESTING THAT SOME QPF MIGHT MAKE IT AS FAR SOUTH AS I-70.  I WAS 
TOO AGGRESSIVE LAST NIGHT WITH THE PRECIP FROM THIS FRONT.  WILL 
CARRY A 20 POP IN DAY AND CMH TONIGHT...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO ONLY 
MENTION POPS IN THE ZFP ACROSS THE EXTREME NORTHERN COUNTIES.

ALTHOUGH THE FRONT SITS ACROSS THE FA ON SUNDAY...ALL UPPER SUPPORTS 
QUICKLY PULLS AWAY. PRECIP ALSO SEEMS TO PULL OUT QUICKLY ON 
SUNDAY...SO DONT PLAN ON CARRYING POPS IN THE NORTH.  THERE IS GOOD 
DOWNWARD MOTION BEHIND THE FRONT ALONG WITH DRY AIR...SO WILL 
MENTION PARTLY CLOUDY FOR SUNDAY...DESPITE THE LOCATION OF THE 
FRONT.  WITH COOLER AIR OVER THE NORTHERN SECTIONS...WILL DROP 
TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO MOS NUMBERS SUNDAY. 50-55 STILL LOOKS OKAY IN 
THE SOUTH.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE

COLD FRONT CURRENTLY SOUTH OF LAKE WINNIPEG...DROPS INTO NORTHWEST 
OHIO BY 12Z SUNDAY.  BEST UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS SWING NORTH OF THE 
FA...WITH 500 MB VORT SLIDING ACROSS MICHIGAN. WEAK 300 MB 
DIVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH RIGHT REAR QUAD OF JET DOES AFFECT THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF OHIO BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z SUNDAY.  ETA CONTINUES TO 
BE THE MOST AGGRESSIVE WITH THE QPF...ALTHOUGH THIS TIME THE AVN IS 
SUGGESTING THAT SOME QPF MIGHT MAKE IT AS FAR SOUTH AS I-70.  I WAS 
TOO AGGRESSIVE LAST NIGHT WITH THE PRECIP FROM THIS FRONT.  WILL 
CARRY A 20 POP IN DAY AND CMH TONIGHT...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO ONLY 
MENTION POPS IN THE ZFP ACROSS THE EXTREME NORTHERN COUNTIES.

ALTHOUGH THE FRONT SITS ACROSS THE FA ON SUNDAY...ALL UPPER SUPPORTS 
QUICKLY PULLS AWAY. PRECIP ALSO SEEMS TO PULL OUT QUICKLY ON 
SUNDAY...SO DONT PLAN ON CARRYING POPS IN THE NORTH.  THERE IS GOOD 
DOWNWARD MOTION BEHIND THE FRONT ALONG WITH DRY AIR...SO WILL 
MENTION PARTLY CLOUDY FOR SUNDAY...DESPITE THE LOCATION OF THE 
FRONT.  WITH COOLER AIR OVER THE NORTHERN SECTIONS...WILL DROP 
TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO MOS NUMBERS SUNDAY. 50-55 STILL LOOKS OKAY IN 
THE SOUTH.

CLEMISILN OUT LATER.

.ILN...NONE       

SITES






@RUKWBCe	KDENFXUS61 KILN 091921
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EST FRI MAR 9 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS WIDESPREAD CLOUDINESS ACRS THE CWFA 
THIS AFTN.  KILN RADAR WAS INDICATING SOME SCATTERED SNOW FLURRIES.
SKIES SHOULD BE SLOW TO CLEAR THIS EVENING...ESPECIALLY IN THE 
EAST.  WITH HIGH PRESSURE MOVING INTO THE REGION AT THE SFC AND 
ALOFT...ANTICYCLONIC MOTION SHOULD ALLOW FOR CLOUD DISSIPATION FROM 
WEST TO EAST.  SOME OF THE CLOUDS MAY GET TRAPPED UNDER AN INVERSION 
(ESPECIALLY EAST) AS INDICATED BY MODEL SOUNDINGS...BUT STILL 
CONFIDENT CLEARING WILL COMMENCE IN THOSE AREAS AFTER MIDNIGHT.
THUS...WILL KEEP GRADUAL CLEARING WEST AND MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH 
GRADUAL CLEARING AFTER MIDNIGHT EAST.  WILL TAKE A LOOK AT THE RADAR 
BEFORE ISSUANCE TO SEE WHICH AREAS MAY NEED AN EVENING FLURRY 
WORDING.

WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION ON SATURDAY...SKIES WILL BE 
MOSTLY SUNNY TO SUNNY.  THICKNESS SCHEMES STILL INDICATE THAT MOS 
MAY STILL BE ON THE WARM SIDE.  AS A RESULT...WILL GO CLOSER TO THE 
AVN MAV VALUES.

BY SATURDAY NIGHT...A S/WV DIVING SE FROM THE WRN PROVINCES OF 
CANADA WILL MOVE ACRS THE GREAT LAKES.  THE AVN KEEPS THIS SYSTEM A 
LITTLE STRONGER THAN THE ETA (THE ETA TENDS TO SHEAR THE SYSTEM 
APART).  OVERALL...THE STRONGER DYNAMICS REMAIN NORTH OF OUR CWFA.  
AS THE COLD FRONT SWINGS ACRS NRN OHIO BY LATE SATURDAY NIGHT...A 
FEW RENEGADE SHOWERS MAY SKIM THE NRN CWFA.  WILL INTRODUCE A SMALL 
POP THERE LATE.

ON SUNDAY...THE COLD FRONT STALLS ACRS THE NRN CWFA AS THE 
AFOREMENTIONED S/WV MOVES AWAY FROM THE SFC FRONTAL BOUNDARY.  A FEW 
SHOWERS MAY LINGER IN THE NORTH...ESPECIALLY IN THE MORNING.  
OTHERWISE MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH TO PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ACRS THE 
SOUTH LOOK REASONABLE ATTM.  TEMPS WILL BE MILD.

NXT SYSTEM WILL APCH THE REGION FROM THE SRN PLAINS BY MONDAY 
...BRINING AN INCREASING CHANCE FOR RAIN.

.ILN...NONE       

HICKMAN








FXUS61 KILN 091448
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EST FRI MAR 9 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE THIS MORNING WAS SHOWING CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT.  
THIS IS IN LINE WITH KILN SOUNDING...WHICH SHOWS A STEEP ADIABATIC 
LAPSE RATE UP TO ABOUT 820 MB.  I EXPECT MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY 
CONDITIONS ACRS THE CWFA DURING THE AFTN HOURS.  A PIECE OF SHEAR 
VORTICITY IS FCST TO DIVE SE INTO CNTRL OHIO THIS AFTN.  THIS MAY 
ENHANCE SNOW SHOWER POTENTIAL THERE.  OTHERWISE...CAN NOT RULE OUT A 
SNOW SHOWER/FLURRY EVERYWHERE GIVEN 150 TO 160 J/KG OF CAPE 
EXPECTED.  925 MB TO 850 MB FLOW OFF OF LAKE MICHIGAN WILL GIVE THE 
ADDED MSTR NEEDED TO PRODUCE SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES.

ATTM...FCST TEMPS FROM THE MID TO UPPER 30S LOOK REASONABLE.  
HOWEVER...MAY TWEAK DOWN A LITTLE ACRS THE NRN MIAMI VLY.

.ILN...NONE       

HICKMAN

@RUKWBCe	5KDENFXUS61 KILN 090753
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
253 AM EST FRI MAR 9 2001

UPPER LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES THIS MORNING...IS FORECAST TO PUSH 
EASTWARD TODAY.  850MB COLD POOL STAYS TO THE NORTH OF THE FA DURING 
THE DAY...BUT 850 MB WINDS REMAIN FROM THE NW OFF OF LAKE MICHIGAN.  
WILL KEEP MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS.  CURU ON BOTH MODELS ARE SHOWING 
OVC SKIES FOR TODAY.  BASED ON THE CURRENT SATELLITE PICTURE THIS 
MIGHT BE A LITTLE OVERDONE...SO WILL GO MOSTLY CLOUDY.

MOS HAS BEEN RUNNING A LITTLE TOO COOL UNTIL YESTERDAY...WHEN IT 
CAME IN TOO WARM.  850 TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE A LITTLE COOLER 
THAN YESTERDAYS. THIS WOULD INDICATE TEMPS MAYBE A COUPLE OF DEGREES 
COOLER.   THIS PUTS IT IN THE RANGE OF MOS.  WONT STRAY FROM MOS 
TODAY.

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO TONIGHT....WHICH SHLOULD ERODE THE 850 
MOISTURE...SOWILL KEEP THE GRADUAL CLEARING. ONCE AGAIN MOS 
TEMPERATURES LOOK HARD TO BEAT.  HIGH PULLS TO EAST ON SATURDAY.  SW 
FLOW ON BACKSIDE SHOULD ALLOW FOR GOOD WARM UP.  NGM IS THE WARMEST 
OF THE 3 MODELS.  WILL PLAY TEMPERATURES SATURDAY IN BETWEEN NGM AND 
MAV MOS.

ETA TRIES TO BRING IN RAIN SATURDAY NIGHT.  MEANWHILE THE AVN KEEPS 
THE RAIN NORTH OF THE AREA. NGM MOS IS GIVING 30 POPS IN THE 
NORTHWEST.  WILL ADD POPS THERE SATURDAY NIGHT.  THE FRONT LOOKS 
LIKE IT HANGS UP ACROSS THE FA ON SUNDAY...SO WILL ADD PCPN TO ALL 
ZONES ON SUNDAY.


CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE       

SITES

AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
937 PM EST THU MAR 8 2001

H5 5240M CUTOFF IS OVER NORTHERN LOWER MICHIGAN THIS EVENING. SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY ALONG THE SOUTHERN PERIPHERY OF THE CUTOFF IS DRIVING 
SFC COLD FRONT WITH SCANT MOISTURE ACROSS OHIO.

RADAR/OBS SHOW FLURRIES AND A FEW -SHSN STREAMING DOWN FROM THE LAKE 
MICHIGAN VICINITY.  A DUSTING OF ACCUMULATION ACCOMPANIED THE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE AT DAYTON EARLIER THIS EVENING.  CURRENT OBS SHOW NO 
VISIBILITY UNDER 7SM IN OUR AREA.  HOWEVER...BRIEFLY LOWER VSBYS 
ARE  OCCURRING BETWEEN SITES/OBS. 

I EXPECT SCT -SHSN TO CONTINUE TONIGHT IN PVA AND CAA.  ACTIVITY IS 
LESS PREVALENT THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED...SO ILL UPDATE TO LOWER 
POPS ALL ZONES.  ILL ALSO REMOVE MENTION OF RAIN WITH TEMPS TOO 
LOW...AND GO WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY INSTEAD OF CLOUDY WITH PLENTY OF 
BREAKS ON SATELLITE. 

.ILN...NONE       

CONIGLIO

175 
FXUS61 KILN 081945
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EST THU MAR 8 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS AFTN SHOWS LOWER CLOUDS MAKING A SLOW 
ENCROACHMENT INTO THE REGION.  A TEMPERATURE CONTRAST EXISTS GIVEN 
WHERE CLOUDS/COOLER AIR ALOFT HAS INFILTRATED THE WRN CWFA VS. 
SUNSHINE/WARMER AIR ALOFT ACRS THE EAST.

UPR LVL LOW CENTERED OVR THE U.P. OF MICHIGAN WILL MOVE VERY SLOWLY 
TO THE EAST OVR THE NEXT 24 TO 36 HRS AS SPOKES OF ENERGY CONTINUE 
TO WRAP AROUND IT.  THE MAIN S/WV TO AFFECT THE REGION TONIGHT WAS 
CURRENTLY PUSHING SE INTO ILLINOIS.  I EXPECT THIS S/WV TO PIVOT TO 
THE SE...MOVING ACRS THE SRN CWFA OVERNIGHT.  WITH THESE TYPES OF 
SYSTEMS...PCPN (ALBEIT LIGHT) TENDS TO FALL TO THE LEFT OF THE 
VORTICITY TRACK.  GIVEN THIS TRAJECTORY...THE BEST CHC OF PCPN WILL 
BE ACRS THE NRN CWFA.  WILL LAYER POPS FROM 60 FAR NORTH TO 40 SOUTH 
OVERNIGHT.  BELIEVE WITH DRIER LOW LEVELS AND COOLING ALOFT...CHANGE 
OVER TO SNOW (ESPECIALLY IN THE SE CWFA) SHOULD OCCUR BEFORE 
MIDNIGHT.  WAPAKONETA/DAYTON/COLUMBUS SHOULD STAY ALL SNOW.  
CINCINNATI MAY MIX WITH A LITTLE RAIN AND PORTSMOUTH WILL BE 
RAIN...THEN IT WILL CHANGE TO SNOW BEFORE MIDNIGHT.  WILL GO A 
LITTLE WARMER FOR THE OVERNIGHT LOWS GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.

FOR FRIDAY...LOW CLOUDS WILL HANG AROUND.  WITH CYCLONIC FLOW/SHEAR 
VORTICITY ALOFT...COMBINED WITH A LITTLE INSOLATION THAT MAY BREAK 
THROUGH THE CLOUDS...BELIEVE THERE WILL BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO 
CONTINUE CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS (30 POP WEST/40 POP EAST).
CLEARING SHOULD OCCUR GRADUALLY FRIDAY NIGHT WITH A FEW FLURRIES 
LINGERING IN THE EAST EARLY.

ON SATURDAY...S/WV RIDGING ALOFT ALONG WITH SFC HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BRING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.  BASED ON THICKNESS SCHEMES...THE MAV 
TEMPS LOOK MORE REASONABLE THAN THE MOS ATTM...SO WILL TREND TOWARD 
THE MAV VALUES.

A WEAK FRONT WILL PASS ACROSS THE REGION ON SUNDAY.  WILL KEEP FCST 
DRY FOR NOW.

.ILN...NONE       

HICKMAN

@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 080810
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
308 AM EST THU MAR 8 2001

06Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE OVER LAKE SUPERIOR WITH A 
TROF EXTENDING SWD ACROSS MI AND IN AND A CDFNT TRAILING BACK INTO 
WI AND IA.  LOW CLOUDS BEHIND THIS TROF WERE ADVANCING SEWD AND 
SHOULD OVERSPREAD MOST OF FA BY DAYBREAK.

MODELS PROG MID LVL LOW TO DROP INTO THE LAKES TODAY KEEPING FA IN 
CYCLONIC FLOW.  SEVERAL MID-LVL DISTURBANCES ARE PROGD TO ROTATE 
THROUGH THE FLOW.  DESPITE LOWERING 1000-500 THICKNESSES... SFC 
TEMPS SHOULD RECOVER INTO THE 40S ACROSS FA.  THIS SHOULD LEAD TO 
ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SOME SHOWERS TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON.  
BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS WL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR SHOWERS TO START AS RAIN 
AND THEN CHANGE TO SNOW AS COLDER AIR ALOFT IS DRAGGED DOWN.  CLOUD 
COVER TODAY IS TRICKY.  SKY CONDITIONS SHOULD START OUT CLOUDY XCPT 
VC PMH.  HOWEVER MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A STEEP UNSTABLE LAYER 
DEVELOPING UP TO AROUND 8000 FEET BY LATE PM.  THIS SHOULD LEAD TO 
PLENTY OF BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS. ALSO...HAVE BUMPED UP THE WINDS FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON.  WITH SOUNDINGS SHOWING A DRY-ADIABATIC LAPSE RATE 
TO 8000 FEET...STRONGER WINDS SHOULD BE ABLE TO MIX DOWN.

WL CONTINUE MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS FOR AREAS N OF THE OH RIVER 
TONIGHT BUT JUST FLURRIES IN NRN KY.  WL CARRY MENTION OF A MIX WITH 
RAIN EARLY VC PMH. ANY SNOW ACCUMULATION TONIGHT WL BE LESS THAN 1 
INCH.

MID-LVL LOW WL PULL E OF FA ON FRI.  WL CONTINUE CHC AM FLURRIES AND 
SNOW SHOWERS.
  
.ILN...NONE       

WILKINSON




306 
FXUS61 KILN 080810
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
308 AM EST THU MAR 8 2001

06Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE OVER LAKE SUPERIOR WITH A 
TROF EXTENDING SWD ACROSS MI AND IN AND A CDFNT TRAILING BACK INTO 
WI AND IA.  LOW CLOUDS BEHIND THIS TROF WERE ADVANCING SEWD AND 
SHOULD OVERSPREAD MOST OF FA BY DAYBREAK.

MODELS PROG MID LVL LOW TO DROP INTO THE LAKES TODAY KEEPING FA IN 
CYCLONIC FLOW.  SEVERAL MID-LVL DISTURBANCES ARE PROGD TO ROTATE 
THROUGH THE FLOW.  DESPITE LOWERING 1000-500 THICKNESSES... SFC 
TEMPS SHOULD RECOVER INTO THE 40S ACROSS FA.  THIS SHOULD LEAD TO 
ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SOME SHOWERS TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON.  
BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS WL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR SHOWERS TO START AS RAIN 
AND THEN CHANGE TO SNOW AS COLDER AIR ALOFT IS DRAGGED DOWN.  CLOUD 
COVER TODAY IS TRICKY.  SKY CONDITIONS SHOULD START OUT CLOUDY XCPT 
VC PMH.  HOWEVER MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A STEEP UNSTABLE LAYER 
DEVELOPING UP TO AROUND 8000 FEET BY LATE PM.  THIS SHOULD LEAD TO 
PLENTY OF BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS. ALSO...HAVE BUMPED UP THE WINDS FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON.  WITH SOUNDINGS SHOWING A DRY-ADIABATIC LAPSE RATE 
TO 8000 FEET...STRONGER WINDS SHOULD BE ABLE TO MIX DOWN.

WL CONTINUE MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS FOR AREAS N OF THE OH RIVER 
TONIGHT BUT JUST FLURRIES IN NRN KY.  WL CARRY MENTION OF A MIX WITH 
RAIN EARLY VC PMH. ANY SNOW ACCUMULATION TONIGHT WL BE LESS THAN 1 
INCH.

MID-LVL LOW WL PULL E OF FA ON FRI.  WL CONTINUE CHC AM FLURRIES AND 
SNOW SHOWERS.
  
.ILN...NONE       

WILKINSON





642 
FXUS61 KILN 080130
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
830 PM EST WED MAR 7 2001

H5 CUTOFF LOW IS MOVING ACROSS LAKE SUPERIOR TONIGHT. COLD FRONT 
THROUGH LAKE MICHIGAN IS TRAILING SFC LOW JUST EAST OF H5 LOW.
ADDITIONAL SFC CONVERGENCE IS OCCURRING OVER OHIO WITH WIND SHIFT 
LINE BETWEEN WESTERN AND CENTRAL OHIO. 

MOISTURE IN THE FORM OF CLOUDS IS APPROACHING. SATELLITE SHOWS LOW 
LEVEL CLOUDS BEHIND LAKE MICHIGAN FRONT...AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS AHEAD 
OF H5 VORT MAX. MOISTURE FEEDING INTO WEAK CONVERGENCE MAY RESULT IN 
FLURRIES LATE TONIGHT...AS COVERED IN PREVIOUS FCST. 

WILL UPDATE TO ADJUST SKY CONDITION AND TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. 
OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPS IN UPPER 20S LOOK GOOD WITH CLEAR SKIES ALLOWING 
RAPID EVENING DROPOFF. 

.ILN...NONE       

CONIGLIO

FXUS61 KILN 071944
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EST WED MAR 7 2001

CLDS CLRG FM THE W AND SHUD CONT TO CLR OUT ACRS THE E THRU LATE 
AFTN AS LLVL FLOW BCMS MORE WLY. MAY HAVE TO HANG ON TO SOME CLDS 
ERLY FOR CMH AND PMH AREAS. OTRWS...XPCT MSTLY CLR THRU THIS EVNG. 
MDLS SHWG SOME WK WAA OVRNGT TNGT WITH SOME WK ISENT LIFT AHD OF 
TROF AXIS THAT SWINGS THRU LATE TNGT. THIS ACCOMPANIED BY AN INCRS 
IN MSTR BLO 850 SO WL INDICT BCMG MSTLY CLDY LATE. ALSO...WITH SOME 
SHEARED VORTICTY ACRS THE N...WL HANG ON TO A FEW FLURRIES LATE.

MDLS IN DECENT AGRMT DRPG UPR LVL LOW DOWN ACRS AREA THURS AND FRI. 
GOOD LLVL CAA DOES NOT KICK IN TIL LATE THURSDAY INTO THURS NGT 
WHILE BETTER COOLING DVLPS ALF DURG THE AFTN. THUS...CUD DSTBLZ 
SOMEWHAT THRU THE AFTN WITH SCT SHWRS DVLPG LATE IN THE DAY. FCST 
SNDGS SHWG A FAIRLY DEEP WRM LAYER AT THE SFC ACRS THE S SO WL GO 
WITH MAINLY RAIN THERE BUT CUD SEE SOME SNOW MIX IN TWD EVNG WITH 
SHWRS BEING SOMEWHAT CONVECTIVE. DAY AND CMH AREAS BORDERLINE FOR 
RAIN/SNOW THURS AFTN WITH MAINLY ALL SNOW FOR WAPOK AREA. GOOD 
CYCLNC FLOW FOR THURS NGT SO WL CONT MENTION OF SNOW SHWERS WITH 
HIGH CHC POPS ENTIRE FA. SCT SNOW SHWRS SHUD TAPER OFF FM W TO E 
THRU THE DAY ON FRI AS RDGG BEGINS TO BUILD IN FM THE W AND DPR MSTR 
SHIFTS OFF TO THE E. 

WITH CLDS AND LLVL COLD POOL...WL GO A LTL COOLER THAN GUID TMPS FOR 
HIGHS ON FRI...OTRWS STUCK PRETTY CLOSE TO GUID FOR TEMPS.

.ILN...NONE

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 070821
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 AM EST WED MAR 7 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING BACK EDGE OF CLOUDS OVER CNTRL IN AND 
CNTRL KY.  MODELS INDICATE THAT HIGH LVL RH WL MOVE EWD LEAVING THE 
LLVL MOISTURE TO CONTEND WITH.  MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE AN 
INVERSION THIS AM WHICH WL WEAKEN IN THE PM WITH WAA AROUND H8.  
XPCT SOME CU FORMATION AS THE MAIN CLOUD SHIELD MOVES E.  WL GO WITH 
M/CDY EARLY BECMG P/C. GUIDANCE TRENDING A LITTLE WARMER WITH TEMPS 
TODAY SO WL SHADE UPWARD A LITTLE.

NEXT SYSTEM WL DROP INTO THE LAKES TONIGHT TURNING FLOW ACROSS THE 
OH VLY TO THE SW.  SKIES SHOULD START OUT M/CLEAR BUT CLOUDS WL 
INCREASE AFTER MIDNIGHT.  XPCT A FEW FLURRIES DUE TO WAA AHEAD OF A 
WARM FRONT.  GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE.

FA WL BE IN WARM SECTOR ON THU.  XPCT TEMPS TO CLIMB INTO THE 40S 
DESPITE CRASHING 1000-500 MB THICKNESSES.  ETA MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW 
100-200 J/KG CAPES BY THE PM HOURS.  STRONG MID AND UPPER LEVEL JETS 
ARE PROGD TO ROTATE THROUGH THE LWR OH VLY WHICH SHOULD COMBINE WITH 
THE SFC FRONT TO PRODUCE SHOWERS.  ACROSS THE NRN MIAMI VALLEY THE 
SHOWERS SHOULD BE MAINLY IN THE FORM OF SNOW.  HOWEVER ACROSS MOST 
OF FA BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS WL BE WARM ENOUGH TO SUPPORT RAIN.  WL 
MENTION A MIX OF RN/SN DAY-CMH.  FOR CVG-PMH...WL CARRY PREDOMINANT 
RAIN WITH A MENTION OF MIXING WITH SNOW.

WL CONTINUE MENTION OF SNOW SHOWERS ON THU NIGHT AND FRI.

.ILN...NONE       

WILKINSON

241 
FXUS61 KILN 061949
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 PM EST TUE MAR 6 2001

UPR LO OFF THE VA CST TO CONT MOVG EWD TNGT. CYC FLO TO CONT TNGT ACRS
OH VLY WITH VORT OVR SRN LM DROPPING SE ACRS SRN OH THIS EVE. AXIS
OF MSTR OVR ERN SECTIONS AND AXIS OF MSTR COMING OFF LM INTO ERN 
IND AND SWRN OH IN FAVORABLE AREA OF LO LVL MSTR CNVRGC. XPCT CLDS
TO HANG TUFF OVRNGT IN CYC FLO. WL MAINTAIN MSTLY CLDY SKY COND. A
FW FLURRIES WL REMAIN PSBL ESPECIALLY THIS EVE. BASED ON UPSTREAM
LO TEMPS AND LO VL THICKNESSES PREFER TEMPS CLOSER TO SLGTLY WRMR
MAV NUMBERS.

MODELS SIMILAR WITH S/WV ENERGY DROPPING SE FM S CNTRL INTO WRN GRTLKS
AND DVLPG INTO CLOSED LO. THIS FEATURE XPCTD TO ROTATE THRU LWR MI 
ON THU AND INTO NEW ENGLAND FRI. 

FLO TO BACK AHD OF THIS SYS ON WED WITH SKIES BCMG PARTLY CLOUDY.
MORE SUNSHINE AND WAA SHUD ENABLE TEMPS TO WRM UP ABT ONE CAT WRMR
THAN TDA/S HI/S. GUID IS CLOSE AND AGN PREFER SLGTLY WRMR MAV 
NUMBERS.

XPCT CLDS TO INCRS ON WED NGT IN WAA PTN. FORCING IS WEAK AND MSTR
IS LIMITED. CDFNT LOOKS TO MOV ACRS WRN SECTIONS LT AND INTO CNTRL
OH BY 12Z. WK FORCING AND LO LVL CNVRGC MAY PRODUCE A FW FLURRIES.
STAYED CLOSER TO WRMR MAV NUMBERS.

WITH UPER LO TRACKING THRU SRN GRTLKS CHANNELED VORT TO PIVOT THRU
OH VLY ON THU. COLD POOL ALOFT SHUD LEAD TO SCTD SHWRS ESPECIALLY
DURG AFTN HRS. WL INTRO CHC SHWRS ALL LOCATIONS WITH HIGHEST CHC
ACRS THE N CLOSER TO UPR LO. CRITICAL THICKNESSES WUD SUGG MIX WITH
RN/SN PSBL S. FWC APPEARS TOO WRM. WL TREND TEMPS CLOSER TO COOLER 
MAV.

.ILN...NONE       

RANDALL

FORCING OVR ERN SECTIONS (CMH AND PMH) TDA. IN THESE LOCATIONS SNW 
SHWRS WL PRODUCE SOME ADDITIONAL ACCUM LESS THAN ONE INCH. FARTHER W 
XPCT LITTLE ACCUM. ENERGY BLOCK METHOD APPILED TO ILN/S 12Z SOUNDING 
GIVES A HI TEMP IN THE UPPER 20S. THIS LOOKS REASONABLE GIVEN LO LVL

XPCTD.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 060825
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
324 AM EST TUE MAR 6 2001

06Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A DEEP LOW OFF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST WITH 
A TROF EXTENDING WWD INTO THE OH VLY.  AN ENHANCED AREA OF SNOW WAS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE ACROSS SWRN OH.  FETCH FROM LMICH HAS 
ENDED BUT -SHSN CONTINUE DUE TO ANOTHER S/WV ROTATING AROUND THE 
STRONG UPPER LOW.  H8 WINDS HAVE BECOME ALIGNED FROM LHURON ACROSS 
WRN LERIE INTO CENTRAL OH.

MODELS INDICATE THAT S/WV CURRENTLY AFFECTING FA WL WL DROP INTO THE 
LWR OH VLY BY 12Z.  THIS COULD LEAVE FA IN A LULL THIS AM WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF THE AFOREMENTIONED LAKE BAND.  AS THE STORM ALONG THE 
EAST COAST CONTINUES TO DEEPEN...MODELS FCST WRAPAROUND MOISTURE ALL 
THE WAY BACK INTO CENTRAL OH THIS PM.  THIS SEEMS REASONABLE BASED 
ON COLD CLOUD TOPS PUSHING WWD ACROSS NY AND PA.  WL CONTINUE CHC 
SNOW SHOWERS TODAY ALL GROUPS XPCT CVG.  VC CVG...XPCT A LITTLE MORE 
SUNSHINE THAN OTHER AREAS.  INSTABILITY SHOULD LEAD TO SOME FLURRIES 
THERE.

AM CONCERNED ABOUT VTA AND LHQ AREAS WHERE LAKE BAND COMBINED WITH 
SYNOPTIC FORCING COULD LEAD TO TOTAL ACCUMULATIONS AROUND 2 INCHES.  
WL BREAK OFF A SEPARATE GROUP TO INDICATE HIGHER ACCUMULATIONS THAN 
VC CMH.

WL LINGER SNOW SHOWERS FOR CMH-PMH AREAS TONIGHT AND FLURRIES VC 
DAY-CVG.  ON WED...XPCT A CLEARING TREND FROM THE NW AS CORE OF 
COLDER AIR SHIFTS EWD.  WL GO WITH P/C DAY-CVG AND M/C CMH-PMH.

GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO WL STICK CLOSE. 

.ILN...NONE       

WILKINSON

FXUS61 KILN 060825
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
324 AM EST TUE MAR 6 2001

06Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A DEEP LOW OFF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST WITH 
A TROF EXTENDING WWD INTO THE OH VLY.  AN ENHANCED AREA OF SNOW WAS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE ACROSS SWRN OH.  FETCH FROM LMICH HAS 
ENDED BUT -SHSN CONTINUE DUE TO ANOTHER S/WV ROTATING AROUND THE 
STRONG UPPER LOW.  H8 WINDS HAVE BECOME ALIGNED FROM LHURON ACROSS 
WRN LERIE INTO CENTRAL OH.

MODELS INDICATE THAT S/WV CURRENTLY AFFECTING FA WL WL DROP INTO THE 
LWR OH VLY BY 12Z.  THIS COULD LEAVE FA IN A LULL THIS AM WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF THE AFOREMENTIONED LAKE BAND.  AS THE STORM ALONG THE 
EAST COAST CONTINUES TO DEEPEN...MODELS FCST WRAPAROUND MOISTURE ALL 
THE WAY BACK INTO CENTRAL OH THIS PM.  THIS SEEMS REASONABLE BASED 
ON COLD CLOUD TOPS PUSHING WWD ACROSS NY AND PA.  WL CONTINUE CHC 
SNOW SHOWERS TODAY ALL GROUPS XPCT CVG.  VC CVG...XPCT A LITTLE MORE 
SUNSHINE THAN OTHER AREAS.  INSTABILITY SHOULD LEAD TO SOME FLURRIES 
THERE.

AM CONCERNED ABOUT VTA AND LHQ AREAS WHERE LAKE BAND COMBINED WITH 
SYNOPTIC FORCING COULD LEAD TO TOTAL ACCUMULATIONS AROUND 2 INCHES.  
WL BREAK OFF A SEPARATE GROUP TO INDICATE HIGHER ACCUMULATIONS THAN 
VC CMH.

WL LINGER SNOW SHOWERS FOR CMH-PMH AREAS TONIGHT AND FLURRIES VC 
DAY-CVG.  ON WED...XPCT A CLEARING TREND FROM THE NW AS CORE OF 
COLDER AIR SHIFTS EWD.  WL GO WITH P/C DAY-CVG AND M/C CMH-PMH.

GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO WL STICK CLOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
900 PM EST MON MAR 5 2001

TIGHT SURFACE GRADIENT ON THE BACK SIDE OF LOW OFF THE NEW ENGLAND 
COAST IS CAUSING BLUSTERY WINDS OF 15 TO 25 MPH.  THIS IS A LITTLE 
LOWER THAN CURRENT FORECAST.  WILL LOWER TO 15 TO 25 ALL ZONES.  IN 
ADDITIONAL WILL MAKE THE DIRECTION NORTHWEST.

WILL CHANGE CHARACTER OF WEATHER IN CENTRAL OHIO TO SNOW SHOWERS AND 
WILL LOWER POPS TO 50.  CURRENT FLOW OFF OF LAKE MICHIGAN WOULD TAKE 
THE BEST SNOW SHOWERS IN THE NORTHWEST QUARTER OF THE FA.

WILL LEAVE OVERNIGHT LOWS AS IS.  WIND CHILL READINGS BY MORNING 
WILL BE CLOSE TO -20 F...BUT WILL NOT ISSUE WIND CHILL ADVISORY.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP. 

.ILN...NONE

205 PM EST MON MAR 5 2001

THANKS TO CLE FOR COORDINATION.

AM NOT IMPRESSED WITH AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE COMING OFF OF GT 
LKS RGN WITH PASSAGE OF H5 LOW AND INVERTED SFC TROF TONIGHT. LOOKS 
LIKE THE DYNAMICS SHUT OFF SHORTLY AFT 6Z...AND ONLY A LINGERING 
SHOWER SHOULD BE EXPECTED IN ERN FCST AREA. PWATS ACROSS THE REGION 
RANGE FROM .12 AND .13 AT APX/DTW/GRB TO .20-.25 DVN/ILX/ILN AT 12Z 
TODAY. 

DWPTS NW OF FCST AREA ARE IN SINGLE DIGITS ATTM...AND EXPECT DRIER 
AIR TO INFILTRATE CWA THIS EVENING AS FLOW SHIFTS TO THE WEST WITH 
INVERTED TROF TO THE NORTH OF FCST AREA. THIS WOULD ALSO CUT LOW 
TEMPS TONIGHT...AND H925 FCST DWPTS FROM ETA ARE ALSO AROUND THE 
10-15 DEGREE RANGE.

WILL CUT SNOWFALL AMOUNTS TONIGHT ACROSS THE BOARD TO AROUND AN INCH 
CMH GROUPING...AND KEEP REST OF FCST AREA UNDER AN INCH OR EVEN 
LITTLE TO NO ACCUM FOR CVG AREA. 

ASIDE FROM SNOW CHANCES/AMOUNTS TONIGHT...WILL KEEP TEMPS ON COOLER 
SIDE WITH GOOD NORTHWEST FLOW THROUGH TUES PM. WRN AND SRN AREAS 
SHOULD WARM UP A BIT ON WED WITH SOME CLEARING EXPECTED...BUT WILL 
KEEP CMH ZONES ON COOL SIDE AS H8 RH DOESNT REALLY CLEAR OUT 
THROUGH FCST PERIOD.

NEXT SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE IT MAY BEGIN TO HIT SRN FCST AREA ON 
THURS...AND PREVIOUS FCST HAS THIS IN HAND. WILL NOT MESS AROUND TOO 
MUCH WITH EXTENDED...BUT LOOKS LIKE A SIMILAR SFC LOW COMING OUT OF 
THE SOUTH BEING SPUN UP WITH A LOBE OF THE H5 LOW FOR THE WEEKEND.

.ILN...NONE

BELOW FREEZING. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TODAY TO BE NEARLY STEADY...ANY 
SUNSHINE IN BETWEEN CLOUDS WILL NOT BE ENOUGH TO OVERCOME STRONG 
CAA.

FXUS61 KILN 050810
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION       
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 AM EST MON MAR 5 2001

CAA AND STRONG VORT TO BE THE MAIN PLAYERS IN THIS FCST PACKAGE. CWA 
WILL BE IN A MORE DECEMBER LIKE REGIME WITH LAKE EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS 
AND SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE FROM EAST COAST LOW IN THE EASTERN 
COUNTIES ON TUES. 

WILL LEAN TOWARD AVN MODEL AS IT SEEMS TO BE DEPICTING MOISTURE 
FIELD AND ASSOCIATED SNOW WITH UPPER SYSTEM BEST. WILL GO WITH CHC 
POPS FOR AFTN SNOW SHOWERS WITH CAA AND VORT COMBINATION. LOOKS LIKE 
THIS WILL PEEK THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT WITH WRAP AROUND COMING 
INTO PLAY IN THE EAST BY TUES MORNING. WILL GO NEAR MOS GUID POPS 
TONIGHT WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE. ETA AND AVN PRODUCING LESS THAN A 
TENTH OF AN INCH QPF ACROSS CWA WITH BETTER AMOUNTS IN THE EAST.
WILL PLACE BETTER ACCUMULATION IN CMH AREA AND LESSER AMOUNTS TO THE 
WEST AND SOUTH. COULD SEE SOME LIGHT ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE 
EAST ON TUES BUT WILL NOT MENTION AT THIS POINT. WILL KEEP WINDS IN 
BLUSTERY CATEGORY THRU FCST PERIOD.

AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUID INDICATING NEAR STEADY TEMPS TODAY. WILL 
JUST INDICATE A HIGH. WILL GO A BIT ABOVE GUID TONIGHT WITH CLOUDS 
AND WIND AND NEAR GUID FOR TUES. 

.ILN...NONE

@RUKWBCe1KDENFXUS61 KILN 041948
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
247 PM EST SUN MAR 4 2001

KILN SHOWING RAIN BASICALLY ALONG AND SOUTHEAST OF I-71.  NORTHEAST 
OF I-71 SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN.  WATER VAPOR SHOWS FA IN DEFORMATION 
ZONE WITH DRY SLOW TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST.  SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
SURFACE LOW JUST TO THE EAST OF JKL AND DEEPENING.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE AVN/ETA IN THE MOST 
AGREEMENT WITH POSITION.  AS THE LOW DEEPENS AND TRANSFERS ENERGY TO 
THE EAST COAST TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO DROP RAPIDLY OVER FA.  
THIS COULD BRING A SWITCH OVER FROM RAIN TO SNOW AS PRECIPITATION 
ENDS.  AFTER PRECIP ENDS FA WILL BE IN A UPPER RIDGE IN BETWEEN BIG 
POLAR VORTEX LOW AND UPPER LOW EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS.  THIS WILL 
BRING AN END TO THE PRECIP UNTIL UPPER LOW MOVES OVER REGION 
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT.  WE WILL PROBABLY EVEN SEE A FEW PEAKS OF SUN 
MONDAY.  INVERTED TROUGH AND UPPER LOW WILL BEGIN TO BRING MOISTURE 
FROM BOTH THE ATLANTIC AND LIMITED MOISTURE FROM THE LAKES (LAKE 
ERIE STILL HAS SIGNIFICANT ICE) INTO CENTRAL OHIO LATE IN THE DAY ON 
MONDAY.  THIS WILL BRING THE THREAT OF SNOW ACROSS FA WITH BEST 
THREAT OF ACCUMULATING SNOW IN CENTRAL OHIO.  BELIEVE A COUPLE 
INCHES IS POSSIBLE AT THE MOMENT.  LATTER SHIFTS WILL HAVE TO 
MONITOR FOR POSSIBLE ADVISORY DEPENDING ON HOW SITUATION SETS UP.

FWC LOOKS PRETTY GOOD SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  THANKS TO CLE AND RLX FOR 
COOR.  MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE       
 TIPTON

KILN SHOWING PCPN OVER FA BEGINNING TO BREAK UP AS IT MOVES NE.

THAN 00Z/06Z PROGGED SOUNDINGS FROM LAST NIGHT.  AS A RESULT WILL 
DROP TEMPS A BIT ACROSS FA AND KEEP TABS ON ANY CHANGE OVER TO SNOW 
ON THE NORTH SIDE OF PRECIP AND ANY HEAVIER EMBEDDED BANDS.

LEAVE CURRENT POPS IN ACROSS THE SOUTH AS THE NORTHERN DEFORMATION 
ZONE WILL KEEP PCPN FALLING A MAJORITY OF THE DAY.  WILL ALSO LOWER 
TEMPS ACROSS FA AS MENTIONED ABOVE.

AM.

@RUKWBCe5KDENFXUS61 KILN 040752
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
252 AM EST SUN MAR 4 2001

MODELS CLOSE THRU 06Z WITH REGARDS TO SFC/UPR FEATURES...BUT ETA LKS 
BEST WITH SLIGHTLY FURTHER WEST SFC LOW POSN.  MODEL QPF ALSO IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT...BUT ONCE AGAIN ETA HAS BEST HANDLE ON HEAVIER 
PCPN IN THE COMMA HEAD OVER ARK.  THE LAST 2 MODEL RUNS HV TRENDED 
SFC LOW AND QPF STEADILY NW...NOW BRINGING THE LOW OVER SE KY AND 
MSRBL PCPN OVER ALL BUT THE FAR NW.  LOOKING AT LATEST PRES 
FALLS...AND CONSIDERING THE FURTHER NW TREND...ANTICIPATE A TRACK 
EVEN FURTHER NORTH INTO KY BETWEEN LEX AND JKL.  WL INCLUDE POPS ALL 
ZONES...WITH CATEGORICAL WORDING OVER ALL BUT THE FAR NW.  HV ALSO 
NOTED PERSISTANT LTG STRIKES NEAR THE SFC LOW...AND AT NOSE OF 
PRONOUNCED DRY SLOT ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY.  SOME ELV INSTABILITY 
PROGGED OVER FAR SE SXNS TDY...AND WL LIKELY INCLUDE MENTION OF 
THUNDER THERE.  THIS FURTHER NORTH TRACK IS ALSO WARMER...WITH FCST  
PARTIAL THICKNESS VALUES SUGGESTING ALL RAIN ALL DAY.  LOOKING AT 
THE MODEL SOUNDINGS HWVR...AREAS FROM DAY-CMH CUD SEE SOME MIXNING 
WITH SNOW LATE AS HEAVIER PCPN CONTS TO FALL IN THE COMMA HEAD WITH A 
DEEP ISOTHERMAL LAYER JUST ABV FREEZING.  MAY TRY TO SHADE A DEG OFF 
FWC TEMPS WITH PCPN AND NE WINDS ALL DAY...BUT GENERALLY GUID 
NUMBERS LK GD TDY.

SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE WL MV EAST OF THE REGION THIS EVE...WITH 
STORM INTESIFYING IN BETTER BAROCLINICITY TO THE EAST.  CUD SEE A 
PERIOD OF SNOW IN THE EAST CWFA BEFORE PCPN TAPERS OFF...AND HV USED 
INCH OR LESS WORDING.  ELSW...XPCT SOME SCT SHSN WITH INCREASINGLY 
COLD CYCLONIC LLVL FLOW ACRS THE LAKES.  THIS PATTERN CONTS INTO 
MONDAY...BEFORE DEEPER MSTR WRAPS BACK IN FROM THE NORTH AND EAST.
NGM A LITTLE LESS AGGRESSIVE WITH COLD AIR MONDAY...AND GIVEN 
STRENGTH OF THIS STORM I THINK THE COLD AIR WL HV NO TROUBLE SURGING 
IN.  WL LEAN TWRD COOLER FAN TEMPS.  CUD SEE SOME ACCUMULATING SNOW 
MON NIGHT INTO ERLY TUE...ESPLY EAST...AND HV UPPED POPS ACCORDINGLY.

MISILN ALREAY OUT...COMMENTS WELCOME.

.ILN...NONE       

JOHNSTONE









FXUS61 KILN 040752
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
252 AM EST SUN MAR 4 2001

MODELS CLOSE THRU 06Z WITH REGARDS TO SFC/UPR FEATURES...BUT ETA LKS 
BEST WITH SLIGHTLY FURTHER WEST SFC LOW POSN.  MODEL QPF ALSO IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT...BUT ONCE AGAIN ETA HAS BEST HANDLE ON HEAVIER 
PCPN IN THE COMMA HEAD OVER ARK.  THE LAST 2 MODEL RUNS HV TRENDED 
SFC LOW AND QPF STEADILY NW...NOW BRINGING THE LOW OVER SE KY AND 
MSRBL PCPN OVER ALL BUT THE FAR NW.  LOOKING AT LATEST PRES 
FALLS...AND CONSIDERING THE FURTHER NW TREND...ANTICIPATE A TRACK 
EVEN FURTHER NORTH INTO KY BETWEEN LEX AND JKL.  WL INCLUDE POPS ALL 
ZONES...WITH CATEGORICAL WORDING OVER ALL BUT THE FAR NW.  HV ALSO 
NOTED PERSISTANT LTG STRIKES NEAR THE SFC LOW...AND AT NOSE OF 
PRONOUNCED DRY SLOT ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY.  SOME ELV INSTABILITY



@RUKWBCe9KDENFXUS61 KILN 031957
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EST SAT MAR 3 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLOUDS HAD DISSIPATED ACROSS THE FA.  
CLOUDS HOWEVER WHERE BEGINNING TO STREAM IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST AS 
THE LOW BEGINS TO DEEPEN AND ORGANIZE ALONG THE GULF COAST.

FORECAST A TOUGH ONE TODAY.  ALL 3 MODELS ARE ALL IN VERY CLOSE 
AGREEMENT.  THEY HOWEVER HAVE BEEN TRENDING WEST AND NORTH WITH BOTH 
UPPER POLAR LOW AND DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW.  THE AVN HAS BEEN IN 
GENERAL MORE CONSISTENT...BUT STILL SHOWS THIS TREND OVER THE PAST 3 
RUNS.  CONCERNED THAT THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE FOR THE NEXT RUN AND 
BRING THE HEAVIER PRECIP FARTHER INTO OH/IN.  ALSO CONCERNED THAT 
LOW IS NOT PROGGED DEEP ENOUGH AS THE UPPER LOW IS WELL TO THE 
NORTHWEST OF LOW.  THIS COULD MEAN COLDER NORTH/NORTHEASTERLY FLOW 
GETS PULLED IN CLOSER TO LOW AND TURNS RAIN OVER TO SNOW RATHER 
QUICKLY.  AT THE MOMENT IT APPEARS THAT PRECIPITATION COMES TO AN 
END AS THE COLD AIR WORKS IN.  HOWEVER LOOKING AT PROGGED SOUNDING 
FROM BUFKIT AND WEATHER MAGIC IT LOOKS LIKE FREEZING LEVEL WILL BE 
AWFULLY CLOSE TO THE GROUND BY AFTERNOON (I.E. < 2KFT).  THIS MAY 
CAUSE ANY MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN TO BRING THE FREEZING LEVEL TO THE 
GROUND PREMATURELY.  WITH ALL THIS SAID WILL GO WITH RAIN ACROSS THE 
FAR SOUTH UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING WHEN RAIN SHOULD QUICKLY TURN TO SNOW 
(HOPEFULLY NOT BEFORE).  THE CHANGE OVER WILL OCCUR ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL SECTIONS DURING THE AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER AS THINGS STAND 
DONT FEEL THINK THERE WILL BE AN ACCUMULATION.  WILL KEEP FAR NORTH 
DRY FOR THE MOMENT UNTIL UPPER LOW WORKS ACROSS SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY.

FWC/MAV IN VERY CLOSE AGREEMENT AND LINE UP WELL WITH LOCAL 
SCHEMES.  THE ONLY TWEAK WILL BE IN 4TH PERIOD WHERE A BIT COOLER 
THAN FWC SEEMS THE WAY TO GO.

THANKS TO SDF...JKL...RLX AND PIT FOR COOR.

.ILN...NONE       
 TIPTON





@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 030812
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
311 AM EST SAT MAR 3 2001

BETTER AGREEMENT AMONG MODEL SOLNS TONITE.  DPROG/DT ANALYSIS OF THE 
00Z RUNS CONTS TO SHOW THE LEAST VARIABILTIY WITH THE ETA/AVN 
SOLNS...AND HV FOLLOWED A BLEND OF THESE THROUGHOUT THE SHORT RANGE.

INITIAL PROBLEM TDY IS CLOUD CVR AND EFFECT ON TEMPS.  STRATO-CU 
WIDESPREAD OVER THE CWFA THIS MORNING...XTNDG WEST INTO ILLINOIS AND 
SOUTH INTO KY.  A FAIR AMNT OF CS ALSO STREAMING IN.  EVEN IF LOW 
CLOUDS CLEAR OUT MCLDY LKS BEST OVER THE SOUTH WITH MAINLY OPAQUE 
CIRRUS.  IN THE NORTH 2/3...STILL XPCT THE STRATO-CU TO SLOWLY BREAK 
UP DIURNALLY...AND WL INDICATE A BECMG PSNY TREND.  SUNSHINE YDAY 
BOOSTED TEMPS WELL ABV THE FWC...AND THE FAN/MAV NUMBERS DID MUCH 
BETTER.  NEW FWC HAS TRENDED MUCH COOLER TDY...BUT THE AVN BASED 
GUIDANCE...AS WELL AS THE META SFC TEMPS ARE 3-5 DEG WARMER.  WL 
SHADE A DEG OR 2 ABV THE FWC ALL ZONES.

ETA A LITTLE QUICKER TO BRING PCPN INTO THE S TNGT...WITH THE AVN 
LINGERING A LITTLE LONGER ON SUNDAY.  WL TREND SLIGHTLY 
SLOWER...FURTHER SOUTH THAN THE ETA AND KEEP POPS (CHC) ONLY NEAR 
AND SOUTH OF THE OH RIVER TNGT.  THICKNESS/BNDRY LAYER TEMPS SUPPORT 
MAINLY RAIN TNGT...ALTHOUGH MARGINAL FOR SNOW ON THE NORTHERN EDGE 
LATE AND WL INCLUDE MIX WORDING.  FOR SUNDAY COLDER AIR CRASHES IN 
AS PCPN ENDS FROM THE WEST.  WL HIT POPS HARDEST(LIKELY) FAR SOUTH 
TAPERING TO CHC CVG AREA.  WL LEAN TWRD WARMER FAN NUMBERS TNGT WITH 
THICKENING CLDS...AND COOLER FAN NUMBS SUNDAY WITH FAIRLY STRONG CAA.

HV MADE SOME CHCGS TO THE 4TH AND 5TH PDS...NAMELY TO RAISE TEMPS 
SUN NIGHT AND INTRODUCE SHSN ALL ZONES ON MON.  WL HIT SNOW HARDEST 
(LIKELY) NE WHERE BEST SYNOPTIC SCALE MSTR WRAPS BACK IN THROUGHOUT 
THE H8-H7 LAYER.

.ILN...NONE       

JOHNSTONE

646 
FXUS61 KILN 022039
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
341 PM EST FRI MAR 2 2001

CONFLUENT WESTERLY FLOW CONTINUES ALOFT BETWEEN NORTHERN STREAM 
UPPER LOW OVER NORTHEAST CANADA AND SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER RIDGE OVER 
SOUTHEAST CONUS.  STRONG SHORT WAVES IN BOTH JET STREAM BRANCHES 
WILL INFLUENCE OUR WEATHER OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...THOUGH OTHER 
LOCATIONS WILL FEEL MORE OF THE EFFECTS.

SFC MAP SHOWS WEAK RIDGE ALONG THE OHIO VALLEY WITH WEAK TROF INTO 
WESTERN OHIO TRAILING LOW OVER LAKE HURON.  DIFFUSE SFC PATTERN WILL 
CONTINUE ON SATURDAY.  LOW WILL DEVELOP OVER ALABAMA LATE ON 
SATURDAY...THEN MOVE TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 12Z SUNDAY. 
MODELS HAVE TRENDED NORTH WITH THIS SYSTEM WRT PREVIOUS RUNS...WITH 
ETA AND AVN GIVING OUR AREA RATHER LIGHT QPF SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY.

WITH CLOUDS FALLING APART FROM DAY TO CMH...WILL STAY WITH PARTLY 
CLOUDY FOR TONIGHT. WILL GO WITH VARIABLE CLOUDS ALONG THE OHIO 
RIVER WHERE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN HANGING IN.  PARTLY SUNNY STILL 
LOOKS GOOD FOR SATURDAY WITH SOLID MOISTURE INDICATED AT 300 MB.

WITH MODELS INDICATING TEMPS IN THE 30S AND 1000-850 THICKNESS 
AROUND 1300 M...WILL ADD CHANCE POPS FOR RAIN AND SNOW SATURDAY 
NIGHT ALL ZONES EXCEPT WEST CENTRAL COUNTIES...30% AT DAY AND 
CMH...40 AT CVG AND 50 AT PMH. WILL GO WITH CHANCE RAIN AND SNOW ON 
SUNDAY...WITH EARLY WORDING AT DAY AND CVG WITH SYSTEM PULLING 
MOISTURE WITH IT AS IT TRANSFERS TO THE EAST COAST.

WILL GO A FEW DEGREES ABOVE FWC TONIGHT CLOSER TO MESOETA. FWC LOOKS 
CLOSE FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT SO I WONT DEVIATE MUCH. FWC 
LOOKS A BIT TOO WARM ON SUNDAY WITH COLD ADVECTION INDICATED ON 
NORTH SIDE OF SFC LOW.

.ILN...NONE       

CONIGLIO

1015 AM EST FRI MAR 2 2001

CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES AS VORT MAX SHEARS OUT AS IT MOVES 
THROUGH OHIO.  LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY ERODE THIS 
AFTERNOON AS DOWNWARD MOTION TAKES OVER AFTER 18Z.   

LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE IS FALLING OUT OF OUR LOW CLOUDS IN TRACE 
AMOUNTS. WILL UPDATE TO INCLUDE SPRINKLES ALL ZONES WITH RADAR 
ECHOES EVIDENT ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. WILL ALSO INCREASE WINDS 
WITH STRONGER THAN EXPECTED GRADIENT IN PLACE. 

TEMPS NEAR FWC IN 40S LOOK FINE WRT 12Z MESOETA AND SOUNDING AND 
WITH CLOUDS ALLOWING LITTLE DAYTIME HEATING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EST FRI MAR 2 2001

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY DEPICTS MID LVL CIRCULATION CENTER MOVG INTO 
NORTHERN ILLINOIS THIS MORNING.  LATEST SHORT RANGE GUID INDC THIS 
FTR WL SHEAR EAST ACRS THE CWFA THRU ERLY AFTN...AND PROVIDE A BRIEF 
SHOT OF FORCING FOR LIFT.  MOST OF THE ATMOS HAS DRIED OUT IN THE 
STRONGLY CONFLUENT MID/UPPER LVL FLOW...BUT ENUF LLVL MSTR WL REMAIN 
TO PSBLY SQUEEZE OUT SOME VERY LIGHT PCPN IN THE NORTH.  MOST LIKELY 
P-TYPE IS SPRINKLES WITH BL TEMPS ABV FREEZING AND TEMPS WELL ABV 
-10C IN THE CLOUD BEARING LAYER...BUT WITH A FEW REPORTS UPSTREAM WL 
MENTION FLURRIES IN THE FAR NORTH.  XPCT LOW CLDS TO THIN LATE IN 
THE WEST...HANG IN ALL DAY IN THE EAST.  WITH CLOUDS MOST OF THE DAY 
HV GONE AOB THE COOLER FWC/MAV NUMBERS.

AREA WILL REAMIN IN CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT THRU THE SHORT 
RANGE...SANDWICHED BETWEEN MASSIVE BLOCK TO THE NE AND SLOWLY 
EJECTING SW SYS.  TIMESXNS INDC DRYING BELOW H8 TONITE WITH MAINLY 
WESTERLY FLOW AND A WEAKENING INVERSION...AND WL CONT PREV TREND OF 
ALLOWING LOW CLDS TO DISSIPATE.  GUID NUMBERS/META SFC TEMP FCSTS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT AND WL STICK CLOSE.  HIGH LVL MSTR WL INCRS 
SAT...ESPLY SOUTH AND WL INDC A PC TREND ALL ZONES.  NO REAL SURGE 
OF CAA WITH WEAK NNW FLOW...WITH ETA THICKNESS SUPPORTING THE 
WARMER FWC TEMPS.  CONSIDERING THE SSMS(SUDDENLY STRONG MARCH SUN) 
...WL STICK CLOSE TO THE FWC NUMBERS.

.ILN...NONE       

JOHNSTONE






FXUS61 KILN 020841

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EST FRI MAR 2 2001

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY DEPICTS MID LVL CIRCULATION CENTER MOVG INTO 
NORTHERN ILLINOIS THIS MORNING.  LATEST SHORT RANGE GUID INDC THIS 
FTR WL SHEAR EAST ACRS THE CWFA THRU ERLY AFTN...AND PROVIDE A BRIEF 
SHOT OF FORCING FOR LIFT.  MOST OF THE ATMOS HAS DRIED OUT IN THE 
STRONGLY CONFLUENT MID/UPPER LVL FLOW...BUT ENUF LLVL MSTR WL REMAIN 
TO PSBLY SQUEEZE OUT SOME VERY LIGHT PCPN IN THE NORTH.  MOST LIKELY

FXUS61 KILN 020309
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1010 PM EST THU MAR 1 2001

SOME SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES HAVE BEEN MAKING THEIR WAY ACROSS IN/KY 
THIS EVENING. DO NOT HAVE MENTION OF PRECIP IN THE NORTHERN GRPS 
RIGHT NOW BUT WILL ADD IT SINCE SOME PRECIP COULD WORK IN THERE. 
WILL MENTION IT AFTER MIDNIGHT IN THE CNTRL OH GRP AND BECAUSE OF 
TIMING WILL ONLY MENTION FLURRIES. ACCORDING TO 00Z ILN 
SOUNDING...CLOUD TOPS ARE RIGHT AT -10 C AND THIS SUPPORTS THE 
FLURRIES THAT ARE OCCURRING OVER NRN INDIANA. VORT SHOULD CONTINUE 
TO SHEAR OUT AS IT MOVES INTO THE UPR RIDGE SO DO NOT ANTICIPATE ANY 
MEASURABLE PRECIP WITH THE LIMITED MSTR/WEAKENING DYNAMICS. WILL 
BUMP TEMPS UP MOST PLACES AS CLDS KEEPING THINGS WARMER. 

.ILN...NONE       

WHITE
