@RUKWBCe1KDENFXUS61 KILN 012049
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
348 PM EST THU MAR 1 2001

SPLIT UPPER FLOW WILL PERSIST INTO THE WEEKEND WITH CONFLUENCE 
OCCURRING OVER OUR REGION. SHORT WAVE ENTERING IOWA WITH LIMITED 
MOISTURE WILL BE SHEARED AS IT MOVES THROUGH OHIO ON FRIDAY. BACK 
DOOR SHORT WAVE ROUNDING SOUTHEASTERN CANADA CUTOFF IS FCST TO 
IMPINGE ON NORTHERN OHIO LATE ON SATURDAY.  

SFC MAP SHOWS WEAKENING HIGH OVER KENTUCKY. MODELS INDICATE WEAK 
RIDGING TO CONTINUE THROUGH MOST OF THE NEXT TWO DAYS. WEAK COLD 
FRONT TRAILING LOW NEAR BUF IS PROGGED TO CROSS THE REGION ON 
SATURDAY RESULTING IN A WIND SHIFT AND SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS.

CLOUDS SOUTH OF IOWA SHORT WAVE ARE HEADED HERE AS PER MESOETA RH 
PANELS. LEADING EDGE OF CLOUDS NOW OVER INDIANA ARE MID 
LEVEL...WITH LOW CLOUDS TRAILING OVER MISSOURI. THESE CLOUDS WILL 
MOVE INTO OUR AREA TONIGHT...AND HANG AROUND ON FRIDAY. SLIGHT MODEL 
QPF APPEARS OVERDONE WITH MOISTURE ONLY IN LOW LEVELS. WILL CONTINUE 
CLOUDY FCST TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH CLOUDS ARRIVING LATE TONIGHT 
IN THE EAST.

ILL INDICATE CLEARING TREND FRIDAY NIGHT WITH MOISTURE EXITING 
EXCEPT AT UPPER LEVELS.  WILL GO WITH PARTLY SUNNY SOUTH AND MOSTLY 
SUNNY NORTH ON SATURDAY WITH HIGH CLOUDS MORE PREVALENT NEAR THE 
OHIO RIVER AND WITH SHORT WAVE STILL NORTH OF HERE.

FWC TEMPS LOOK DECENT FOR NIGHTTIME LOWS. DAYTIME HIGHS LOOK TOO 
HIGH WITH CLOUDS ON FRIDAY AND COLD ADVECTION ON SATURDAY SO ILL 
UNDERCUT FWC BY A COUPLE DEGREES. 

.ILN...NONE       

CONIGLIO                                






















HIGH.

CINCINNATI GROUP TO MAKE MINOR COSMETIC CHANGES TO WINDS AND SKY 
CONDITION.



@RUKWBCe7KDENFXUS61 KILN 010755
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 AM EST THU MAR 1 2001

MODELS ARE IN SIMILAR AGREEMENT THRU ABOUT 12Z FRIDAY...THEN THEY 
DIVERGE ON A DIFFERENT SOLUTION CONCERNING A DEVELOPING SFC LOW OVR 
THE ERN GREAT LAKES.

FOR TODAY....THE REGION REMAINS IN A CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT WITH SFC 
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUING.  HARD TO DETERMINE PARTLY SUNNY VS MOSTLY 
SUNNY FCST GIVEN THE SPLIT NATURE OF THE FLOW NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE 
OHIO VALLEY.  HOWEVER...HAVE DECIDED THAT THE SRN CWFA WILL MOSTLY 
LIKELY HAVE PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AS THEY ARE CLOSER TO THE PATH 
OF THE HIGH CLOUDS SPILLING FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS.  THE NRN CWFA 
SHOULD JUST SEE PATCHES OF HIGH CLOUDS...SO WILL GO MOSTLY SUNNY 
HERE.  MOS HAS BEEN HARD TO BEAT THESE LAST FEW DAYS.  HAVE POURED 
OVER ALLOW AVAILABLE METHODS (THICKNESS, SOUNDINGS ETC.)...AND THEY 
ALL INDICATED JUST ABOUT WHAT MOS IS SHOWING.  

FOR TONIGHT...A S/WV CURRENTLY ACRS ERN CO AND WRN KS WILL MOVE EAST 
INTO THE CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT.  THERE WILL BE AN INCREASE IN 850 MB 
MSTR...BUT GIVEN THE LACK OF LOW LVL FORCING...ONLY VIRGA IS 
EXPECTED ATTM.  THUS...WILL LEAVE FCST DRY. LOW TEMPS AROUND 30 OR 
IN THE LOWER 30S LOOKS REASONABLE.

ON FRIDAY...THE AFOREMENTIONED S/WV BECOMES SHEARED APART AS IT GETS 
PULLED INTO THE CONFLUENT FLOW.  AGAIN...AM NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN 
THE WAY OF PCPN AS DYNAMICS WEAK WITH NO LOW LVL FOCUSING.  WILL 
TRIM TEMPS A COUPLE DEGREES FROM MOS GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.

AVN AND ETA SHOW A S/WV MOVING ACRS SRN CANADA INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION BY FRIDAY.  THEY BOTH AGREE ON BRINGING A WESTWARD MOVING 
S/WV FROM THE H5 ERN CANADIAN BLOCKING LOW CLOSE TO THE EASTWARD 
PROGRESSING S/WV.  THEY DISAGREE...HOWEVER...ON WHETHER TO MERGE 
THESE AS ONE MAIN S/WV OR KEEP THEM SOMEWHAT SEPARATE (THE ETA WANTS 
TO MERGE...THE AVN DOES NOT).  THUS...THE ETA CREATES A STRONGER SFC 
LOW OVER THE ERN GREAT LAKES THAN THE AVN.  THIS COULD AFFECT HIGHS 
ON SATURDAY (COOLER) GIVEN THE ETA SOLUTION.  SINCE THIS IS THE 
FIRST RUN (60 HOURS) THAT THE ETA HAS SHOWN THIS...IT IS PROBABLY TO 
EARLY TO TELL WHAT WILL HAPPEN.  AS A RESULT...I DO NOT PLAN TO 
CHANGE TEMPS FOR SATURDAY ATTM.

.ILN...NONE       

HICKMAN                                



















FXUS61 KILN 281859
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
200 PM EST WED FEB 28 2001

SPLIT FLO PTN TO CONT WITH OH VLY UNDER INFLUENCE OF MID LVL 
COUNFLUENCE TNGT INTO THU. MODELS SIMILAIR WITH MAIN FEATURES WITH 
SFC HI PRES EXTENDING FM CNTRL PLNS INTO OH VLY TO BLD SE THRU TN
VLY THRU FRI MRNG. THIS HI PRES WL PROVIDE SUBSIDENCE TNGT INTO
THU ACRS THE AREA. NRN STREAM S/WV OVR WRN GRTLKS TO DROP SE THRU
THE LAKES RGN OVRNGT. MAIN BAND OF MID/HI LVL CLDS SHUD STAY N OF 
THE FA TNGT. XPCT SOME CI BUT THESE CLDS SHUD BE THIN. OVRNGT LOW
GUID TEMPS HV COOLED A LTL. WITH DRY AMS IN PLACE...MSTLY CLR SKIES 
AND WITH GRAD RELAXING PREFER TEMPS CLOSER TO COOLER MAV.

OH VLY TO REMAIN IN BTWN STREAMS ON THU. XPCT TO SEE A FAIR AMT OF 
SUNSHINE WITH SOME SCTD MID/HI LVL CLDS BRUSHING NRN SECTIONS. 
ENERGY BLOCK METHOD APPLIED TO 12Z SOUNDING YIELDS A HI IN THE UPPER
30S AT ILN. GIVEN ADDITION OF WAA XPCT TO SEE A HI ARND 43 DEG. LO
LVL THICKNESS TECH ARE IN LINE WITH THESE HI/S WHICH ARE A LTL COOLER
THAN FWC TRENDING TOWARD MAV GUID. BASED ON COOL START TO THE DAY THIS
LOOKS REASONABLE.

SRN STREAM S/WV ENERGY TO LIFT NE FROM THE UPR LO OVR THE SW U.S. 
INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS THU AND MID MS VLY THU NGT. OH TO REMAIN E OF 
MID/UPR LVL RDG AXIS. SO XPCT TO SEE AN INCRS IN MAINLY UPR LVL
MSTR THU NGT. THESE CLDS SHUD BE THICKEST IN SW SECTIONS. HV NOT
STRAYED TOO MUCH FROM GUID TEMPS THU NIGHT.

THIS S/WV TO BUCK THE RDG ON FRI WITH A CONTD INCRS IN UPR LVL MSTR 
AND AND INCRS IN LO LVL MSTR. FORCING IS VRY WEAK AND DEEP MSTR IS 
LACKING WITH THIS SYS. AN AFTN SPRINKLE PSBL IN WRN SECTIONS BUT AT 
THIS POINT WL MAINTAIN A DRY FCST DUE TO LO PROB OF MEASUREABLE 
PCPN. FWC HI/S APPEARS A LTL TOO WRM FRI. READINGS SHUD WARM SOME 
BUT BASED ON CLDS PREFER HI/S CLOSER TO MAV GUID.

.ILN...NONE                                       

RANDALL

@RUKWBCe-KDENFXUS61 KILN 280744
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EST WED FEB 28 2001

AVN/ETA ARE SIMILAR WITH SYNOPTIC SCALE FEATURES OVR THE NXT 36 TO 
48 HRS.  HOWEVER...THEY DIFFER WITH THE AMOUNT AND POSITION OF
MID AND UPR LVL RH FIELDS...WHICH WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE BETWEEN A 
PARTLY CLOUDY OR MOSTLY SUNNY FCST.

THE REGION WILL REMAIN UNDER A SPLIT FLOW IN THE NRN AND SRN 
BRANCHES OF THE JET STREAM.  THE TWO STREAM MERGE OVER THE 
REGION...PROVIDING CONFLUENCE ALOFT...AND THUS RESULTING IN 
DIFFLUENCE AT THE SFC.  THIS WAS VERIFIED BY SFC HIGH PRESSURE 
EXTENDING FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  THE CLOUDY 
CONDITIONS CURRENTLY OVER THE REGION WILL GIVE WAY TO MOSTLY 
SUNNY/PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS.  RIGHT 
NOW...WILL WORD PMH...CVG AND POINTS SOUTH AS BECMG PARTLY CLOUDY.  
SKIES MAY ACTUALLY BECOME MOSTLY SUNNY IN THESE LOCATIONS BY 
AFTN...BUT HARD (AT THIS POINT IN TIME) TO ASCERTAIN HOW THICK 
CIRRUS CLOUDS WILL BE.  WILL ONLY SHAVE A DEGREE OR TWO OFF MOS 
GUIDANCE.

FOR TONIGHT...AN H5 S/WV ROTATING AROUND BLOCKING H5 LOW OVR ERN 
CANADA WL DIVE SOUTH INTO THE SRN GREAT LAKES.  ONLY SOME MID AND 
HIGH LVL CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND THEY SHOULD 
AFFECT THE NRN PART OF THE CWFA.  WILL STICK CLOSE TO MOS TEMPS 
OVERNIGHT.

ON THURSDAY...PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WILL CONTINUE.  MOS SEEMS TO BE 
WARMING TEMPS TOO MUCH...SO HAVE CHOSEN A BLEND BETWEEN MOS AND MAV 
GUIDANCE.

.ILN...NONE                                       

HICKMAN









@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 280216
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 PM EST TUE FEB 27 2001

SOME LIGHT PCPN WL CUT THRU THE SOUTHERN 1/4 OF THE CWFA THE NEXT 
CPL HOURS...BEFORE STRONG DRYING AT ALL LVLS BEGINS TO PUSH IN FROM 
THE NW.  THE BEST CVRG/QPF WILL BE OVER THE FAR SOUTH...WHERE PCPN 
WL CHG FROM RAIN TO SNOW BEFORE ENDING.  WL INDC LITTLE OR NO ACCUM.
MAIN FOCUS OF UPDATE WL BE TO INTRODUCE SOME TIMING TO THE PCPN 
TONITE...NAMELY TO ALLOW FOR TAPERING OFF AFTER MIDNIGHT.  ALSO WL 
INCLUDE SOME CLEARING WORDING FAR NORTH WHERE SAT TRENDS SUGGEST 
CLOUDS THINNING QUICKLY FROM THE NORTH.  NO CHGS XPCTD FOR TEMPS.

.ILN...NONE                                       

JOHNSTONE








@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 272002
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM EST TUE FEB 27 2001

STRONG WESTERLY FLOW CONTINUES ACROSS THE AREA. FLOW IS PROGGED TO 
BECOME NORTHWEST BY 12Z THURSDAY AS CUTOFF OVER NORTHEAST CANADA 
MOVES EAST. 140 KT JET MAX WILL DROP SOUTH ACROSS OUR REGION DURING 
THE TRANSITION. 

SFC MAP HAS STRONG HIGH OVER NORTHERN PLAINS WITH INVERTED TROF 
CROSSING THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. TROF IS PROGGED TO STAY WELL 
SOUTH OF HERE AS HIGH SQUEEZES DOWN IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THOUGH 
AREA OF HEAVIER PRECIP WITH THE TROF WILL STAY SOUTH...MODELS DO 
SHOW QPF TONIGHT WELL TO THE NORTH OF TROF INTO OUR AREA. THIS 
APPEARS OVERDONE...ESPECIALLY ON THE ETA...AS PRECIP WILL HAVE A 
TOUGH TIME MAKING IT DOWN TO THE GROUND THROUGH THE DRY AIR BETWEEN 
925 TO 700 MB. FWC POPS REFLECT THIS TREND WITH TONIGHTS POPS AT 
CVG DROPPING FROM 68 TO 43.

WILL STAY WITH PREVIOUS FCSTS LINE OF REASONING AND GO WITH CHANCE 
POPS CVG AND PMH...WITH LIKELY POPS IN THE STRIP OF NORTHERN 
KENTUCKY COUNTIES ON OUR SOUTHERN FRINGE. WITH TEMPS STILL ABOVE 
FREEZING EARLY TONIGHT...WILL KEEP MENTION OF RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW. 
WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION MINIMAL ACCUMULATIONS FAR SOUTH.

FOR WEDNESDAY...MODELS SHOW DRYING AT ALL LEVELS AS UPPER FLOW 
BECOMES NORTHWEST. CLOUDS SHOULD PERSIST LONGER IN THE SOUTH WITH 
CLOUDS EXITING IN THAT DIRECTION. WILL CONTINUE TREND OF PREVIOUS 
FCST AND INDICATE IMPROVEMENT TO MOSTLY SUNNY NORTH AND PARTLY 
CLOUDY SOUTH. 

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT...MODELS SHOW VORT MAX DROPPING SOUTHEAST 
THROUGH OHIO...WITH SFC LOW HEADING TOWARD BUF. WITH DEEPER MOISTURE 
STAYING NORTH...I EXPECT NOTHING MORE THAN SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS FOR 
OUR AREA...SO PARTLY CLOUDY LOOKS LIKE A WINNER.  ON THURSDAY... 
MOISTURE STREAMING BETWEEN SPLIT FLOW SHOULD KEEP NOTHING MORE THAN 
A FEW CLOUDS SO PARTLY CLOUDY SOUNDS GOOD AGAIN.

FWC TEMPS LOOK DECENT. WILL GO 1-3 DEGREES ABOVE TONIGHT WITH CLOUDS 
AROUND. WONT DEVIATE MUCH FROM FWC WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
WILL GO SLIGHTLY BELOW FWC ON THURSDAY AS IT APPEARS A BIT TOO 
QUICK WITH WARMUP.

.ILN...NONE                                       

CONIGLIO







220 
FXUS61 KILN 270729
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST TUE FEB 27 2001

AT 06Z...SFC COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM SE LOWER MI...NE 
INDIANA...THEN EXTENDED SW INTO S CNTRL IL.  THIS LOCATION WAS CLOSE 
TO THE MESO ETA PREDICTION.

REGION WILL REMAIN UNDER A CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT AS SPLIT IN THE NRN 
AND SRN BRANCHES OF THE JET STREAM CONTINUE.  PRECIPITATION 
OCCURRING OVER IOWA/NRN ILLINOIS THIS MORNING (POST FRONTAL) 
...SHOULD WEAKEN TOWARD MORNING AS LOW LVL DEFORMATION AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WEAKEN.  THUS...AM NOT EXPECTING ANY PCPN TODAY 
BEHIND COLD FRONT. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD SLIDE SLOWLY SOUTH TO A NE 
OHIO...S OF CMH...TO NEAR CVG BY 12Z...THEN INTO THE NRN CWFA BY 
NOON.  PLENTY OF MID AND HIGH LVL CLOUDS (AND A LITTLE LOW LVL MSTR 
BEHIND FRONT) WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY TODAY.  TEMPS WILL BE A 
LITTLE TRICKY...DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH LOW LVL CAA MOVES INTO THE 
REGION.

FOR TONIGHT...WEAK...SHEARED OUT VORTICITY MOVES ACRS THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY.  IN CONJUNCTION WITH THIS...VERY WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT IS 
NOTED AT THE 295 K LEVEL BETWEEN 00Z AND 09Z (FOCUSED NEAR THE OHIO 
RIVER AND SOUTH).  MODELS ARE SHOWING LIGHT QPF DURING THIS TIME 
FRAME.  GIVEN RELATIVELY DRY LOW LVLS AND WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT...I 
AM WONDERING HOW MUCH OF THIS WILL BE USE UP AS VIRGA.  AS A 
RESULT...WILL CUT BACK POPS AT DAY AND CMH TO 20 PERCENT (AND WILL 
NOT MENTION PCPN IN ZONES).  FOR CVG AND PMH GROUPS...WILL MENTION A 
40 POP.  FOR SOUTH OF THE RIVER...WILL GIVE A 50 POP.  PCPN WILL MAY 
MIX WITH A LITTLE RAIN AT PMH AND CVG BRIEFLY.  SOUTH OF THE 
RIVER...PCPN SHOULD BEGIN AS LIGHT RAIN...THEN CHANGE TO SNOW.  
LITTLE OR NO SNOW ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED.

ON WEDNESDAY...SFC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION FROM THE 
WEST.  DESPITE SHEARED OUT VORTICITY ALOFT ACRS THE REGION...MODELS 
INDICATE DRY RH LVLS FROM 925 MB ON UP.  THUS...MOSTLY SUNNY TO 
PARTLY SUNNY SHOULD SUFFICE.  TEMPS WILL BE ON THE COOL SIDE.

.ILN...NONE                                       

HICKMAN










@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 271529
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1029 AM EST TUE FEB 27 2001

AREA IS UNDER STRONG WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. WITH JET MAX PASSING TO 
OUR NORTH...WE HAVE GOOD MID TO UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS WITH CLOUDS 
RESULTING. 

AT SFC...WE ARE IN A NORTHERLY FLOW BEHIND THE FRONT THAT PASSED 
THROUGH EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS AFTERNOON...AREA WILL BE BETWEEN 
RIDGING TO THE NORTH AND INVERTED TROF MOVING THROUGH THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  

RADAR/OBS SHOW PRECIP IN SOUTHERN ILLINOIS NORTHEAST OF INVERTED 
TROF. 06Z MESOETA SHOWS QPF WORKING INTO OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES. WITH 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING THE AIR COLUMN IS DRY FROM 925 TO 700 
MB...WE ARE THINKING THAT WITH PRECIP FALLING THROUGH THE DRY 
LAYER...THE QPF IS OVERDONE. EARLY PANELS FROM 12Z RUN ALSO SUPPORT 
LEAVING OUT PRECIP. THUS...WILL STAY WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY FCST WHILE 
MONITORING THE EASTWARD PROGRESS OF PRECIP OVER SOUTHERN ILLINOIS. 

FAIRLY STRONG EAST-WEST ORIENTED TEMP GRADIENT IS IN PLACE 
TODAY....WITH LOW 30S IN THE NORTH TO MID 40S SOUTHEAST. CURRENT 
FCST HAS THIS PATTERN WELL COVERED...EXCEPT WILL ADJUST WORDING TO 
TEMPERATURES NEARLY STEADY IN CMH AND FAR SOUTH GROUPS. OTHERWISE NO 
CHANGES ARE NEEDED.  

.ILN...NONE                                       

CONIGLIO












@RUKWBCe7KDENFXUS61 KILN 261955
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EST MON FEB 26 2001

19Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED BROAD HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE OH VLY AND 
A CDFNT EXTENDING FM WI SWWD INTO NE.

MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS WL BE ON THE INCREASE ACROSS FA 
OVERNIGHT.  AS A RESULT...TEMPS WL NOT FALL TOO FAR.  MID/HIGH 
CLOUDS WL REMAIN ACROSS FA ON TUE.  MODEL TIME SECTIONS ALL SHOW DRY 
LOW LAYERS SO DO NOT XPCT ANY PRECIPITATION ON TUE.  CDFNT WL DROP 
THROUGH FA ON TUE WHICH WL CREATE A FAIRLY LARGE TEMP RANGE ACROSS 
FA BY LATE PM. 

MODELS BRING A WEAK MID LEVEL SYSTEM THROUGH FA ON TUE NIGHT. WK 
ISENTROPIC LIFT AROUND 295K AND UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE WL COMBINE TO 
PROVIDE FORCING.  BLV THAT CVG-PMH GROUPS WL LIKELY SEE 
PRECIPITATION WITH A SHARP CUTOFF TO THE N.  WL INDICATE CHC -SN 
DAY-CMH AND KEEP NRN MIAMI VALLEY DRY. AS FAR AS PRECIP TYPE IN SRN 
FA...LLVL THICKNESSES AND THE WARM BOUNDARY LAYER INDICATE THAT THE 
PRECIP COULD START AS RAIN ACROSS NRN KY AND VC PMH.  SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS WL LIKELY BE 1 INCH OR LESS CVG-PMH AND LITTLE OR NO 
VC DAY-CMH.

NGM MOS GUIDANCE LOOKS TOO COLD FOR TUE NIGHT SO WENT CLOSER TO AVN 
GUIDANCE AND ETA SFC TEMPS.

.ILN...NONE                                       

WILKINSON





AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
952 AM EST MON FEB 26 2001

LOW CLOUDS ACROSS FA APPEAR TO BE BREAKING UP SLOWLY THIS AM.  12Z 
META GUIDANCE INDICATES THAT WEST WINDS AND DECREASING RH AT THE 
CLOUD LVL SHOULD LEAD TO A CONTINUED BREAK UP OF THE CLOUDS.  RIGHT 
NOW LEANIG TOWARD PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THE PM HOURS BUT WL WATCH TRENDS 
FOR EXACT WORDING.  TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO NO ADDITIONAL CHANGES 
PLANNED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION             
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 AM EST MON FEB 26 2001

TRYING TO GET A HANDLE ON LOW CLDS HANGING IN ACRS THE N THIS MRNG. 
SAT PIX CONTG TO SHOW IT PUSHG S AND 925 MB FLOW ACTUALLY BCMS MORE 
NLY THRU 12Z SO AM WORRIED ABT HOW FAR S IT WL PUSH THIS MRNG. 925 
MB FLOW BCMG MORE ACYCLNC THRU 18Z SO XPCT TO SEE CLDS ERODE FM THE 
W LATER THIS MRNG BUT WL HAVE TO HANG ON TO SOME KIND OF MRNG CLD 
WORDING AT LEAST ACRS THE N. THEN...SHUD SEE SKIES BCM MSTLY SUNNY 
IN THE N WITH DRYING AND SBSDC ACRS THE REGION. MSTLY CLEAR INTO 
TNGT BUT WITH WK CDFNT DRPG DOWN FM THE NW AND SOME MID LVL MSTR ON 
THE INCRS AHD OF IT...WL GO WITH INCRSG CLDS IN THE N AFT MDNGT.

DPR MSTR ON THE INCRS FM THE SW THRU THE DAY ON TUE AS SHEARED OUT 
VORT MAX PUSHES ACRS AREA. 294K ISENT SFCS SHWG SOME WK ISENT LIFT 
INTO SRN PORTIONS OF FA THRU THE DAY WITH PDEFS DRPG OFF THRU THE 
AFTN. HOWEVER LLVLS START OFF PRETTY DRY AND WITH CONFLUENT FLOW 
ALF...THINK ETA MAY BE OVRDOING PCPN...ESPCLY ACRS THE N. WL LEAN 
TWD DRIER AVN AND ONLY GO WITH LOW CHC POPS FOR LGT PCPN CVG AND CMH 
AREAS AND A LTL HIGHER POPS FOR PMH AREA. WL JUST MENTION FLURRIES 
FOR DAY GROUP. PCPN TYPE A BIT OF A PRBLM WITH COLD AIR SPILLING IN 
FM THE N. THICKNSS AND FCST SNDGS INDCTG ANY PCPN SHUD BE MAINLY 
SNOW DAY/CMH BUT MAINLY RAIN OR A MIX FOR CVG AND PMH. FOR NOW WL GO 
WITH RAIN...PSBLY MIXING WITH SNOW IN THE S AND THEN GO WITH RAIN 
AND SNOW FOR TUE EVNG.

STUCK PRETTY CLOSE TO GUID TMPS TDA AND TNGT BUT WL UNDERCUT A LTL 
TUE AND TUE NGT WITH CAA DVLPG. 

.ILN...NONE                                       

LOTT

230 PM EST SUN FEB 25 2001

COLD FRONT NEAR I-71 CORRIDOR. WILL CONT TO PUSH EAST. COLD POOL TO 
LIFT NORTH AND EXPECT CLOUDS TO DO THE SAME THROUGH THE EVENING. 
WINDS DIMINISH AND PLAN TO LET ADVISORY EXPIRE UNLESS THINGS LOOK 
DIFFERENT NEAR PRESS TIME. JUST BARELY GETTING ADVISORY WINDS NOW. 


RIDGE TRIES TO BUILD IN BUT WITH CENTER WELL TO THE NORTHWEST AND 
FAST SPLIT FLOW WILL SET UP RETURN OF MOISTURE BY 36 TO 48 HRS. WILL 
LEAN TOWARD ETA SOLUTION. BEST MOISTURE WILL BE TO THE SOUTH WITH 
MORE MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS CWA. WILL PUT IN LOW CHC POPS 
FOR CVG AND PMH AREAS FOR TUES WHEN BETTER LIFT APPROACHES. NOT MUCH 
QPF AND EXPECT LIGHT AMOUNTS. SOME QUESTION ABOUT PRECIP TYPE BUT 
RIGHT NOW WILL STICK WITH RAIN AS TEMPS SHLD WARM UP ENOUGH. COULD 
BE A FLURRY OR SPRINKLE IN DAY AND CMH AREAS BUT WILL GO DRY FCST 
FOR NOW.

AS FOR TEMPS...WILL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM MOS GUID. WILL LEAN 
TOWARD COOLER FAN NUMBERS FOR HIGHS. WITH CLOUDS DONT EXPECT MUCH 
RISE ON TUES. WITH WINDS STAYING UP BELIEVE FAN NUMBERS A BIT TOO 
COLD TONIGHT BUT LOOK A BIT BETTER FOR MONDAY NIGHT WITH MID AND 
HIGH CLOUDS MOVING IN. 

.ILN...NONE

ACRS SE IND AND PLAN ON TRYING TO HANDLE ANY SVR WINDS WITH SVR TSTM 
WRNGS. WL KP WIND ADVISORY GOING THRU THIS AFTN. MAIN CONCERN FOR 
HIGH WINDS IS ON THE BACK SIDE OF PCPN THRU 18Z. GOOD DOWNGLIDE 
DVLPS ON ISENT SFCS THRU 18Z. PSBLTY OF SOME SUNSHINE IN THE DRY 
SLOT THRU LATE MRNG WHICH WL ALSO HELP MIX DOWN WNDS. WITH 50 KTS 
SHWG UP AT 900 MB...AND 60+ KTS HANGING ON AT 850 MB THRU 18Z... 
THINK WE WL SEE WNDS IN THE HIGH END OF WND ADVS...APRCHG HIGH WIND 
WRNG CRITERIA. WL GO WITH 30 TO 40 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 55 MPH IN THE 
ZONES...THEN DCRSG FM W TO E THRU THIS AFTN. BCMG MSTLY CLR TNGT 
THEN MSTLY SUNNY ON MON. TMPS TUF TDA AS WE SHUD SEE ERLY HIGHS IN 
THE W THEN DRPG OFF THRU THE AFTN AS COLDER AIR BEGINS TO FILTER IN. 
HOWEVER...DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH SUN WE SEE IN DRY SLOT...TMPS CUD 
JUMP UP PRETTY GOOD BEFORE COOLER AIR GETS IN...ESPCLY ACRS THE E. 
WL GO MID 60S FOR PMH AREA BUT WITH ENUF SUN...TMPS CUD APRCH 70.

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY THRU THIS AFTN FOR THE ENTIRE AREA.

936 
FXUS61 KILN 250209
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
910 PM EST SAT FEB 24 2001

LLVL FLOW HAS MAINTAINED A SLIGHT EASTERLY COMPONENT THIS 
EVENING...WITH THE BONDARY LAYER REMAINING RELATIVELY DRY OVER ALL 
BUT THE FAR SOUTH AND WEST PORTION OF THE CWFA.  STILL...THE 
ATMOSPHERE HAS MOISTENED UP SUBSTANTIALLY PER 1+ INCH PWAT ON 00Z 
SOUNDING.  AS TREMENDOUS FORCING FOR LIFT COMES INTO PLAY 
OVERNIGHT...ESPLY IN THE LLVLS...WIDESPREAD RAIN WL DVLP.  
INSTABILITY NOT PROGGED TO BE AS HIGH IN OUR AREA AS THAT WHICH IS 
SUPPORTING WIDESPREAD DEEP CONVECTION UPSTREAM...BUT THUNDER WL CONT 
GIVEN INTENSE DYNAMICS AND CONTD WEAK INSTABILITY.  TEMPS STILL IN 
THE 60S OVER THE SOUTHERN 1/3...AND HV BEEN SLOWLY RISING OVER THE 
NORTH.  PREV TEMPS FCST APPEARS IN GD SHAPE...AND PLAN ONLY SOME 
WORDING ADJUSMENTS.

00Z UA ANALYSIS INDCS AREA OF 70-75 KNOT H8 WINDS EVEN LARGER THAN 
FCST BY THE ETA.  THE LLJ IS PROGGED TO STRENGTHEN OVERNIGHT TO 80+ 
KNOTS AT H8...60 KNOTS AT 925.  WINDS HV BEEN WELL BELOW ADVSRY 
CRITERIA THIS EVE IN UPGLIDE/WAA PATTERN...HWVR EITHER CONVECTIVE 
PRECIPITATION OR POST FRONTAL SUBSIDENCE WL MIX DOWN THE STRONGER 
WINDS.  WL KEEP WIND HEADLINE AS ADVISORY FOR NOW...AS DAMAGING WIND 
THREAT LIKELY BEST COVERED BY SVRS.

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY TONIGHT AND SUNDAY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA.

JOHNSTONE

950 
FXUS61 KILN 242023
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 PM EST SAT FEB 24 2001

WARM FRONT NOW PUSHING THROUGH FA...RUNNING FROM NEAR ILN-DAY-GUS... 
THEN EXTENDING WEST TO SURFACE LOW IN OK PANHANDLE.  AS SURFACE LOW 
PUSHES INTO THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...THE WARM FRONT SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO PUSH NORTH TONIGHT...LEAVING THE FA IN WARM SECTOR.

BIGGEST CONCERN TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY IS HOW STRONG THE WINDS WILL 
GET.  MODELS STILL SHOWING 80 PLUS KTS AT 850 SWING THROUGH AFTER 
06Z AND 40 TO 50 KTS AT 925 MB.  WAA TONIGHT SHOULD LIMIT THE 
STRONGEST WINDS FROM MIXING TO THE SURFACE.  A BIGGER CONCERN IS 
EARLY SUNDAY...AFTER FROPA...WHEN TIME SECTONS SHOW THE THETA LINES 
DROPPING FROM NEAR 850 TO THE SURFACE.  THIS WOULD ALLOW 40 TO 45 KT 
WINDS BEHIND THE FRONT TO MIX DOWN.  WILL ISSUE HIGH WIND ADVISORY 
FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY.

ELEVATED LI ON NGM WAS HANDLING CONVECTION TO THE WEST BETTER.  THE 
NGM LIFTS THIS CONVECTION NORTH OF THE FA INTO NORTHERN OHIO AND 
MICHIGAN.  STILL FEEL THAT THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF CONVECTION 
ALONG THE FRONT.

WILL GO WITH MORNING HIGHS IN THE WEST....THEN FALLING 
TEMPERATURES.  DRY SLOT WORKS INTO THE WEST QUICKLY ON SUNDAY...SO 
WILL KEEP WEST DRY AND WILL LINGER SOME RAIN IN THE EAST.

HIGH BUILDS IN GRADUALLY SUNDAY NIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY TONIGHT AND SUNDAY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA.

SITES





MICHIGAN.  STILL FEEL THAT THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF CONVECTION

WILL GO WITH MORNING HIGHS IN THE WEST....THEN FALLING 
TEMPERATURES.  DRY SLOT WORKS INTO THE WEST QUICKLY ON SUNDAY...SO 
WILL KEEP WEST DRY AND WILL LINGER SOME RAIN IN THE EAST.

HIGH BUILDS IN GRADUALLY SUNDAY NIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY TONIGHT AND SUNDAY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA.

SITES





@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 240818
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 AM EST SAT FEB 24 2001

BATCH OF WAA CLDS LIFTING N ACRS CNTRL IND ATTM. RADAR PICKING UP 
SOME PRETTY GUD RETURNS BUT THIS LOOKS TO BE FALLING OUT OF A MID 
LEVEL DECK WITH NOT MUCH REACHING THE GROUND. LOOKS LIKE THIS MAY 
CLIP A FEW OF OUR NW CNTYS OVR THE NXT HR OR SO. WITH TMPS HOVERING 
RIGHT ARND FREEZING...WL HAV TO KP AN EYE ON IT BUT PLAN ON HANDLING 
WITH NOWS FOR RIGHT NOW. 

OTRWS...GOOD WAA ACRS AREA TDA WITH FA IN WARM SECTOR. MDLS IN LINE 
BRING SOME PCPN INTO PARTS OF THE W AND N THRU MID TO LATE AFTN WITH 
MAIN THREAT BEING TNGT WITH GOOD UVV DVLPG. WL CUT BACK A LITTLE ON 
CRNT FCST TIMING/POPS AND INDICT LATE FOR CMH AND CVG AREAS AND 
LEAVE PMH DRY...THEN GO WITH HIGH POPS TNGT. INSTBLTY LOOKS FAIRLY 
WK WITH ELEV LI/S GNRLY RMNG ABV ZERO AND ONLY MINOR CAPE PROGD IN 
BETWEEN 06 ZND 12Z TNGT. THINK ANY TSTMS WL BE ISOLATED BUT WL HANG 
ON TO A MENTION OF THEM AFT MDNGT TNGT.

WNDS WL BE ON THE INCRS THRU THIS AFTN AND INTO TNGT AS STG LLVL JET 
MOVS IN. 00Z ETA HAS BACKED OFF A LTL WITH 8H WNDS BUT STILL SHWG AN 
80 KT JET MOVG ACRS AREA FM 06Z TO 12Z. AREA STILL IN DECENT WAA AT 
THAT TIME SO THINK STGST WNDS WL HOLD OFF TIL SUN MRNG WHEN GOOD 
ISENT DOWNGLIDE DVLPS. TIME XSCTS SHWG ABT 50 KTS OF WND AT 900 MB 
MIXING DOWN TWD 18Z SUN. LOOKS LIKE WE WL STAY JUST BLO HIGH WND 
WARNING CRITERIA LATE TNGT AND SUN MRNG SO WL NOT ISSUE WATCH BUT 
THIS ALSO TOO FAR OUT FOR AN ADVISORY. FOR NOW...WL CONT SPS AND 
STILL HIT WNDS PRETTY HARD IN FCST.

STUCK CLOSE TO GUID FOR HIGHS TDA BUT WITH WNDS TNGT...THINK TEMPS 
WL STAY PRETTY STEADY. TRICKY TEMPS ON SUN AS WE COULD SEE A DECENT 
WRMUP...ESPCLY ACRS THE E BEFORE CAA STARTS TO FILTER IN BEHIND FNT. 
WL HANG ON TO SOME TYPE OF FALLING TMP WORDING IN THE W.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
900 PM EST FRI FEB 23 2001

MID/UPPER LVL RIDGE AXIS REMAINS WELL TO THE WEST OF THE AREA. 
CIRRUS WERE THINNING ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE RIDGE...BUT SAT TRENDS 
INDC SOME AC WAS BEGINNING TO SPREAD IN FROM THE WEST/SOUTHWEST.  
FOR SKY COND TNGT...WL USE THICKENING CLOUDS WORDING OVER ALL BUT 
THE SE WHERE PC LOOKS BEST DUE TO MAINLY THIN CLOUD.  ETAS QPF 
VERIFYING BEST THRU 00Z...ALTHOUGH MAYBE A LITTLE TOO FAR NORTH AND 
EAST WITH MSRBL PCPN.  PREV ETA RUN ADVERTISED LIGHT QPF IN WAA 
PATTERN LATE TNGT OVER WESTERN OHIO...ALTHOUGH BASED ON CURRENT 
TRENDS AND VERY DRY AIRMASS THIS LOOKS A LITTLE OVERDONE.  BEST SHOT 
FOR -ZR/-IP OVER FAR NW PART OF THE CWFA...AND WL ADD LOW CHC POP 
WITH UPDATE.  PREV TEMP FCSTS LK RSNBL...NO CHGS PLANNED.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCe	KDENFXUS61 KILN 232009
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
307 PM EST FRI FEB 23 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS CLOUDS HAVE CLEARED ACROSS FA AS RIDGE OF 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES BRIEFLY INTO THE REGION.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT.  AVN HAS BEEN THE MOST 
CONSISTENT FROM RUN TO RUN WITH THE ETA/NGM TRENDING TOWARDS IT.  SO 
WILL GO WITH AN AVN/ETA SOLUTION.  SURFACE RIDGE QUICKLY MOVES TO 
OUR EAST OVERNIGHT WITH RETURN SOUTHERLY FLOW BEGINNING AFTER 06Z.  
THIS RETURN FLOW AND ADVANCING CLOUD COVER WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FROM BOTTOMING OUT TOO MUCH OVERNIGHT.  GRADIENT DEEPENING LOW OVER 
THE MID MS VLY WILL QUICKLY ISSUE IN WARMER AIR AND WINDY CONDITIONS 
TO THE FA ON SATURDAY.  IN FACT...SUSTAINED WINDS OF 30 TO 35 MPH 
WILL BE COMMON BY 00Z SUNDAY OVER FA.  850 JET SATURDAY NIGHT WILL 
MAX OUT AT 80 KTS.  CONCERNED ABOUT A HIGH WIND EVENT.  THE QUESTION 
THOUGH IS WILL IT BE ASSOCIATED WITH THUNDER OR NOT.  SPC HAS PARTS 
OF WEST OUTLOOKED WITH A SLIGHT RISK.  THIS LOOKS GOOD AS 
PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH MOVES.  TROUGH WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH ELEVATED 
LIS AROUND ZERO ALONG WITH THE LOW LEVEL JET (80 KTS) IN CLOSE 
PROXIMITY.  SINCE THIS EVENT IS STILL MORE THAN 24 HOURS OUT IN 
ADVANCE AND NOT SURE ABOUT THE THUNDER THREAT WILL HOLD OFF ON A 
HIGH WIND WATCH.  WILL HOWEVER ISSUE AN OUTLOOK SUMMARIZING THE 
LATEST THINKING.  THIS WILL GIVE MID-SHIFT THE GREATEST FLEXIBILITY 
FOR RESOLVING THIS EVENT.

FWC TEMPS SEEM DESCENT OVERNIGHT BUT TOO COLD BEGINNING SATURDAY AS 
IT/NGM CANT RESOLVE LOW LEVELS AS WELL AS ETA/AVN.

MISILN SENT TO ALL.  

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON




@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 230805
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 AM EST FRI FEB 23 2001

LOW CLDS HANGING TUF ACRS AREA WITH SAT PIX SHWG CLDS ACRS ALL OF 
IND AND INTO SRN IL. ETA INDICTG SOME DRYING INTO THE W THRU ERLY 
AFTN AT 925 AND 950 MB SO WL TRY TO INDCT BCMG PRTLY CLDY THERE THIS 
AFTN BUT MAY HAV TO HANG ON TO SOME CLDS THRU MUCH OF THE DAY IN THE 
E. 

NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF TEMP ADV THRU THIS AFTN AND WITH CLDS ARND 
TMPS MAY STRUGGLE TO WARM MUCH. LLVL THCKNS PATTERNS AND ENERGY 
BLOCK METHOD OFF FCST SNDGS INDICTG HIGHS ONLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 
30S. NEW FWC GUID HAS BACKED OFF SIGNIFICANTLY FM PREVIOUS RUN WITH 
HIGHS TDA AND APPEARS TO BE PRETTY GUD SO WL STAY CLOSE.

8H FLOW BACKS TNGT AND INCRSS IN ADVANCE OF APRCHG LOW. WITH SOME 
MID AND HIGH LEVEL MSTR PUSHG ACRS THE REGION OVRNGT WL GO WITH 
PRTLY CLDY SKIES FOR TNGT. LOOKS LIKE WNDS MAY STAY UP A LTL SO WL 
TAKE A BLEND OF COOLER FWC AND WRMR MAV NUMBERS FOR LOWS TNGT. 

AVN DEEPER AND THUS SLOWER THAN ETA WITH UPR LVL LOW SUN INTO MON. 
GIVEN STRENGTH OF SYS AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY...THINK AVN MAY HAV 
A BETTER HANDLE ON SIT AND WL TREND FCST THAT WAY. ETA/AVN BOTH 
INDICTG STG LLVL JET DVLPG SAT AFTN INTO SAT NGT WITH ETA SHWG 90+ 
KTS AT 850 MB AND 60+ KTS AT 925 MB. AVN NOT AS STG BUT STILL 
IMPRSV. WAA PATTERN MAY HELP KP WNDS FM GETTING TOO OUT OF HAND BUT 
STILL LOOKS TO BE AT LEAST BREEZY ON SAT AND WNDY SAT NGT.

GOING WITH SLOWER AVN...WL BACK OFF ON PCPN TIMING ON SAT AND GO 
WITH LIKELY POPS W/CHC E FOR THE AFTN. WITH GOOD WAA AND WNDS... 
THINK FWC TMPS WAY TOO COLD FOR SAT AND SAT NGT AND WL GO CLOSER TO 
MUCH WRMR MAV TMPS. 

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
910 PM EST THU FEB 22 2001

CLOUD COVER HOLDING TOUGH OVER THE STATE AND LOOKS LIKE IT WONT BE 
UNTIL VERY LATE TONIGHT/EARLY TOMORROW BEFORE ANY BREAKS OCCUR.

CENTRAL OH DUE TO HIGH DEWPOINT AIR HOLDING SWAY ON SOUTHWEST WINDS 
AROUND 10 MPH.

WILL SEND AN UPDATE TO BUMP UP OVERNIGHT LOWS BY A CATEGORY IN MOST 
AREAS. GRADUAL CLEARING MENTIONED IN ALL ZONES...AND LOOKS LIKE 
BREAKS MAY OCCUR TOO LATE TO ALLOW RADIATIONAL COOLING TO DROP TEMPS 
TO THE LOW 20S AND NEAR 20. EXPECT TO OPEN UP A 20-25 RANGE IN 
CENTRAL OH...MID 20S REST OF FCST AREA. WILL WORD AS PARTIAL 
CLEARING LATE IN THE WEST AND NORTHWEST...MOCLOUDY ELSEWHERE.

@RUKWBCe0KDENFXUS61 KILN 221948
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
248 PM EST THU FEB 22 2001

19Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A WEAKENING INVERTED TROF JUST W OF THE 
APPALACHIANS WITH A COL OVER THE NWRN HALF OF OHIO.  ANOTHER LOW WAS 
LOCATED OVER THE NRN LAKES.  VISIBLE IMAGERY SHOWED EXTENSIVE CLOUDS 
TO THE W OF FA BUT SOME OF THE CLOUDS OVER IN APPEARED DIURNAL.  
INDICATIONS OF DOWNWARD MOTION COULD BE SEEN OVER IA-MO AS THE 
CLOUDS WERE RAPIDLY DISSIPATING THERE.

FA WL GET CAUGHT UP IN THE FLOW FROM THE NRN LAKES LOW TONIGHT WHICH 
WL SHIFT THE WINDS TO THE W.  WITH STRONG DOWNWARD MOTION AND 
DECREASING LLVL RH...BLV THAT SKIES WL CLEAR TONIGHT.  TEMPS RUNNING 
WELL BLO GUIDANCE ATTM SO WL SHADE DOWN A LITTLE BUT DO NOT XPCT A 
RAPID DROP OVERNIGHT.

HIGH PRESSURE WL BUILD INTO THE OH VLY ON FRI LEADING TO A M/S DAY.  
TEMPS WL RECOVER FROM TODAY BUT WL GO A LITTLE LOWER THAN GUIDANCE 
TEMPS.  THERE SHOULD BE SOME HIGH CLOUDINESS ON FRI NIGHT ALONG WITH 
A TIGHTENING GRADIENT.  THUS...WL RAISE NGM MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS A 
LITTLE.

STRONG STORM OVER THE CENTRAL PART OF THE COUNTRY WITH PUSH WARM AIR 
INTO FA ON SAT.  ALONG WITH THE WARMTH WL COME SOME RAIN AND WIND.  
WL HIT POPS HARD SAT PM AND NIGHT AND MENTION BREEZY ON SAT.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON





248 PM EST THU FEB 22 2001

19Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A WEAKENING INVERTED TROF JUST W OF THE 
APPALACHIANS WITH A COL OVER THE NWRN HALF OF OHIO.  ANOTHER LOW WAS 
LOCATED OVER THE NRN LAKES.  VISIBLE IMAGERY SHOWED EXTENSIVE CLOUDS 
TO THE W OF FA BUT SOME OF THE CLOUDS OVER IN APPEARED DIURNAL.  
INDICATIONS OF DOWNWARD MOTION COULD BE SEEN OVER IA-MO AS THE 
CLOUDS WERE RAPIDLY DISSIPATING THERE.

FA WL GET CAUGHT UP IN THE FLOW FROM THE NRN LAKES LOW TONIGHT WHICH 
WL SHIFT THE WINDS TO THE W.  WITH STRONG DOWNWARD MOTION AND 
DECREASING LLVL RH...BLV THAT SKIES WL CLEAR TONIGHT.  TEMPS RUNNING 
WELL BLO GUIDANCE ATTM SO WL SHADE DOWN A LITTLE BUT DO NOT XPCT A 
RAPID DROP OVERNIGHT.

HIGH PRESSURE WL BUILD INTO THE OH VLY ON FRI LEADING TO A M/S DAY.  
TEMPS WL RECOVER FROM TODAY BUT WL GO A LITTLE LOWER THAN GUIDANCE 
TEMPS.  THERE SHOULD BE SOME HIGH CLOUDINESS ON FRI NIGHT ALONG WITH 
A TIGHTENING GRADIENT.  THUS...WL RAISE NGM MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS A 
LITTLE.

STRONG STORM OVER THE CENTRAL PART OF THE COUNTRY WITH PUSH WARM AIR 
INTO FA ON SAT.  ALONG WITH THE WARMTH WL COME SOME RAIN AND WIND.  
WL HIT POPS HARD SAT PM AND NIGHT AND MENTION BREEZY ON SAT.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

834 
FXUS61 KILN 221451
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
951 EST THU FEB 22 2001

14Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED AN INVERTED TROF EXTENDING ALONG THE WEST 
SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS.  KILN RADAR INDICATED AREAS OF LIGHT SNOW 
ACROSS FA.  PRIMARY S/WV WAS MOVG INTO THE MID-ATLANTIC REGION WHILE 
A SECONDARY S/WV WAS MOVG ACROSS IL-IN. ACCUMULATIONS FROM OVERNIGHT 
AND EARLY THIS MORNING SEEM TO VARY FROM A DUSTING TO 2-3 INCHES.

SECONDARY S/WV WL PUSH ACROSS NRN FA THIS PM.  WL NEED TO KEEP CHC 
SNOW WITH THIS FEATURE FOR ALL GROUPS BUT NOT MUCH PM ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED.  WL DROP ADVISORY FOR S-CENTRL OH AND PARTS OF NRN KY WITH 
THIS ISSUANCE.

NOT MUCH OF A TEMP RECOVERY EXPECTED FOR DAY-CMH GROUPS SO WL CUT 
BACK THERE.  TEMPS A BIT WARMER CVG-PMH SO WL KEEP THEM NEARLY THE 
SAME.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCe	KDENFXUS61 KILN 220902
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
402 AM EST THU FEB 22 2001

BROAD TROF PERSISTS ACROSS EASTERN CONUS THIS MORNING. STRONG SHORT 
WAVE MOVING INTO OHIO VALLEY WILL HAVE MAJOR EFFECT ON OUR WX TODAY. 
AFTER SHORT WAVE PASSES EAST...FLOW ALOFT WILL BE DRY NORTHWEST ON 
FRIDAY. RIDGE WILL THEN BUILD IN BY SATURDAY MORNING AHEAD OF MAJOR 
SYSTEM DUE TO AFFECT OUR REGION LATE IN THE WEEKEND.

SFC MAP SHOWS LOW OVER ALABAMA WITH TROF EXTENDING TOWARD OHIO. 
RADAR SHOWS PRECIP OVER ILLINOIS INDIANA AND KENTUCKY. ECHOES AT 
LEADING EDGE ARE VIRGA AS DEW POINTS ARE IN SINGLE DIGITS/TEENS. 

WITH AREA OF SNOW APPROACHING THIS MORNING...WILL GO WITH 100 POPS 
ALL ZONES. WILL REMOVE ALL LIGHT WORDING...AND INCREASE SNOWFALL 
AMOUNTS TO AROUND AN INCH WEST CENTRAL...AND 1-3 IN SOUTH-CENTRAL 
OHIO AND NORTHERN KENTUCKY WHERE ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT. 
WILL STAY WILL 1-2 AT CVG AND AROUND AN INCH AT DAY AND CMH. HAVE 
SCALED BACK MENTION OF MIXED PRECIP AS MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A 
MOSTLY SNOW EVENT. MODELS/RADAR SHOW A RATHER SHORT DURATION 
EVENT...SO WILL WORD AS ENDING BY NOON WEST AND AROUND NOON EAST. 
WILL TAKE OUT THE EVENING CHANCE EAST AS WELL. 

WILL GO BELOW FWC TEMPS TODAY WITH COLD ADVECTION...CLOUDS AND 
PRECIP KEEPING READINGS DOWN. CONVERSELY...WILL STAY ABOVE FWC 
TONIGHT WITH CLOUDS HANGING AROUND AND WARM ADVECTION KICKING IN 
LATE TONIGHT. FOR FRIDAY...FWC AGAIN LOOKS TOO HIGH ESPECIALLY WITH 
50 AT CVG. WILL GO CLOSER TO PREVIOUS FCST WITH 47 AT CVG.  

.ILN...WINTER WX ADVIS FOR KYZ089-090-094>096 THIS MORNING.        
WINTER WX ADVIS FOR KYZ097>100-OHZ079>082-088 THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON.

CONIGLIO

913 PM EST WED FEB 21 2001

THICK OVERCAST CI DECK CREEPING INTO SW FCST AREA WILL CONTINUE TO 
OVERSPREAD REGION. WILL UPDATE TO CLOUDY OVERNIGHT INSTEAD OF 
INCREASING CLOUDS IN THE WEST AND SOUTH...AND THIS WILL REMOVE THE 
TIMING IN WEST CENTRAL OH GROUP AS WELL. 

PREVIOUS FCST HAD LEFTOVER WX FOR THURS EVE...AND WILL REMOVE IT 
FROM WRN FCST AREA. WOULD LIKE TO REMOVE FROM THE EAST...BUT WILL 
LIKELY JUST GO WITH EARLY WORDING HERE AND BUMP DOWN FROM 40 POP TO 
30. 

TEMPS LOOK TO BE RUNNING ON TONIGHT. ONLY MINOR TWEAKS EXPECTED SUCH 
AS OPENING A RANGE OF 20-25 IN CVG AND SOUTHEAST GROUPING INSTEAD OF 
LOWER 20S. CLOUD COVER SHOULD HOLD OFF A DRASTIC DROP IN TEMPS FOR 
MOST OF FCST AREA...THOUGH SHEER DRYNESS OF AIR WITH SINGLE DIGIT 
DWPTS WORRIES ME FOR AREAS NORTHEAST OF CMH. CURRENT LOWS IN UPPER 
TEENS STILL LOOK REASONABLE THOUGH.

.ILN...WINTER WX ADVIS FOR FAR SOUTHERN KY COUNTIES LATE TONIGHT AND 
       THU MORNING.
       WINTER WX ADVIS FOR NE KY AND SC OH THU.

758 
FXUS61 KILN 211945
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EST WED FEB 21 2001

THE WEAK RIDGE THAT WILL BE PASSING OVER AREA EARLY TONIGHT WL 
MAINLY STAY TO N OF FA...BUT ILN FA WL GET SOME OF THE CAA. A 
COMBINATION BETWEEN THE AVN/ETA SEEMS TO BE MODEL(S) OF CHOICE...AS 
IT SEEMS NGM HAD SOME INITIALIZATION PROBLEMS APPARANT AT 850 AND 
SFC. 

ETA DOES SEEM TO HAVE SLOWED DOWN THE LEADING EDGE OF PCPN A BIT 
OVER THE PAST 3 RUNS. SO THE EVENT LOOKS TO BE MAINLY TOMORROW AM 
THROUGH MOST OF FA...AND INTO THE LATE AFTN IN SE GROUP. SN WL BE 
THE PCPN TYPE FROM N OF A LINE THAT RUNS JUST S OF CVG THEN ENE TO 
CHILLICOTHE OH. SE OF THIS LINE...WL ISSUE ADVIS FOR FAR SOUTHERN KY 
ZONES AND SC OHIO FOR ZR ON WED FOR IP AND ZR. PCPN WL BEGIN IN OUR 
FAR SW KY COUNTIES AS SOME SN...THEN CHANGE TO IP AND ZR...WITH A 
LITTLE ICING POSSIBLE. IN THE PORTSMOUTH AREA...A CHC OF SN LATE TNT 
BEFORE THE SURGE OF WARMER AIR CREATES A ZR SITUATION THROUGH THE 
DAY THU. BY THU NT...THERE MAY BE SOME LINGERING ZR IN THE SE...BUT 
SHOULD BE LIGHT. WL KEEP CHC OF LT SN THU NT ALL BUT NW GROUP.


.ILN...WINTER WX ADVIS FOR FAR SOUTHERN KY COUNTIES LATE TONIGHT AND 
       THU MORNING.
       WINTER WX ADVIS FOR NE KY AND SC OH THU.

FXUS61 KILN 210913

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
413 AM EST WED FEB 21 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS BROAD TROF COVERING NORTHEAST CONUS. WEAK 
RIDGE WILL BUILD IN EARLY TONIGHT BEFORE ANOTHER SHORT WAVE MOVES 
DOWN TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT LATE TONIGHT.

SFC MAP FEATURES HIGH MOVING IN FROM UPPER PLAINS BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT THAT PASSED THROUGH LAST EVENING. HIGH IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
QUICKLY TO THE EAST COAST BY 12Z THURSDAY AS AN INVERTED TROF OVER 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY POKES INTO OUR REGION TONIGHT. 

HIGH IS CLEARING SKIES AND BRINGING COLDER TEMPS. WILL STAY WITH 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES TODAY SINCE SC ARE FORMING IN THE COLD AIR SOUTH 
OF THE LAKE ERIE SHORE AND I EXPECT SIMILAR FORMATION FARTHER SOUTH 
AS THE COLD AIR GETS MORE ESTABLISHED. 

LATEST MODELS SHOW MORE NORTHERLY TRACK FOR INVERTED TROF TONIGHT. 
WITH INVERTED TROF NOW FCST TO SEND UP TO .50 QPF INTO OUR AREA LATE 
TONIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY...WILL ADD CHANCE POPS TO NORTHERN ZONES 
AND LIKELY TO SOUTHERN ZONES...WITH SOME ACCUMULATION EXPECTED.  
WILL USE AFTER MIDNIGHT WORDING WEST...AND TOWARD MORNING EAST.  
WILL MENTION SLEET IN SOUTH CENTRAL GROUP.

FWC TEMPS LOOK FAIRLY DECENT BUT SOME ADJUSTMENT IS NECESSARY.  WILL 
GO A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW FWC TODAY IN STRONG COLD ADVECTION. WILL 
STAY RIGHT NEAR FWC TONIGHT. WILL GO A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW AGAIN ON 
THURSDAY WITH 06Z MESOETA INDICATING COLD ADVECTION BEHIND INVERTED 
TROF. 

THANKS TO CRW JKL SDF FOR COORD.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 200817
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE CLEVELAND OH
317 AM EST TUE FEB 20 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS BROAD TROF ACROSS NORTHERN CONUS. HEIGHT 
FALLS ARE FCST FOR THE OHIO VALLEY OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AS TROF 
DROPS SOUTH. WEAK SHORT WAVE ROUNDING BASE OF TROF WILL CAUSE 
NOTHING MORE THAN CLOUDS AND PERHAPS LIGHT SPRINKLES TODAY.

SFC COLD FRONT CURRENTLY NEAR CMI IS PROGGED TO BE ACROSS OUR AREA 
BY 00Z THIS EVENING.  GOOD WARM ADVECTION IS OCCURRING AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT...WITH TEMPS STAYING IN THE 40S TONIGHT.  NO PRECIP IS 
OCCURRING WITH THE FRONT.  STRONG COLD ADVECTION IS EVIDENT IN HIGH 
PRESSURE BEHIND THE FRONT WITH READINGS IN THE 20S.  

WITH NEARLY DRY FRONT APPROACHING...WILL PULL POPS FOR TODAY AND GO 
WITH CHANCE SPRINKLES.  THERE WILL BE PLENTY OF CLOUDS AROUND SO 
WILL USE MOSTLY CLOUDY ALL ZONES.  IN COLD ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT  
TONIGHT...WILL MENTION SPRINKLES EARLY AND FLURRIES LATE.  WILL ALSO 
MENTION FLURRIES FOR WEDNESDAY IN NORTHERLY FLOW OFF LAKES. 

AS THE HIGH SKIRTS OUR AREA TO THE NORTH ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AN 
INVERTED TROF IS FCST TO MOVE THROUGH KENTUCKY AND PUSH SOME 
MOISTURE INTO OUR AREA.  THIS FEATURE IS MORE PROMINENT AND FARTHER 
NORTH THAN PREVIOUS MODELS HAD INDICATED. WILL ADJUST WEDNESDAY 
NIGHTS FCST TO MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH/CHANCE SNOW SOUTH.

GUIDANCE TEMPS HAVE INCREASED SINCE THE LAST RUN.  THIS APPEARS TO 
JIBE WITH CURRENT TEMP/THICKNESS TRENDS SO WILL INCREASE TODAYS 
FCST TEMPS ALL ZONES.  WILL GENERALLY STAY JUST BELOW FWC GUIDANCE 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  WILL GO ABOVE FWC ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH A GOOD 
AMOUNT CLOUDS LIKELY TO BE AROUND AS INVERTED TROF MOVES SOUTH OF 
HERE.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO







PRESSURE BEHIND THE FRONT WITH READINGS IN THE 20S.  

WITH NEARLY DRY FRONT APPROACHING...WILL PULL POPS FOR TODAY AND GO 
WITH CHANCE SPRINKLES.  THERE WILL BE PLENTY OF CLOUDS AROUND SO 
WILL USE MOSTLY CLOUDY ALL ZONES.  IN COLD ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT  
TONIGHT...WILL MENTION SPRINKLES EARLY AND FLURRIES LATE.  WILL ALSO 
MENTION FLURRIES FOR WEDNESDAY IN NORTHERLY FLOW OFF LAKES. 

AS THE HIGH SKIRTS OUR AREA TO THE NORTH ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AN 
INVERTED TROF IS FCST TO MOVE THROUGH KENTUCKY AND PUSH SOME 
MOISTURE INTO OUR AREA.  THIS FEATURE IS MORE PROMINENT AND FARTHER 
NORTH THAN PREVIOUS MODELS HAD INDICATED. WILL ADJUST WEDNESDAY 
NIGHTS FCST TO MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH/CHANCE SNOW SOUTH.

GUIDANCE TEMPS HAVE INCREASED SINCE THE LAST RUN.  THIS APPEARS TO 
JIBE WITH CURRENT TEMP/THICKNESS TRENDS SO WILL INCREASE TODAYS 
FCST TEMPS ALL ZONES.  WILL GENERALLY STAY JUST BELOW FWC GUIDANCE 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  WILL GO ABOVE FWC ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH A GOOD 
AMOUNT CLOUDS LIKELY TO BE AROUND AS INVERTED TROF MOVES SOUTH OF 
HERE.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO







@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 200128
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE CLEVELAND OH
827 PM EST MON FEB 19 2001

LOWER CLDS FILLING IN FAIRLY QUICKLY ACRS NRN PORTIONS OF FA WITH S 
STILL CLR. SAT PIX SHWG SOME LOWER CLDS ALSO TRYING TO DVLP ACRS SRN 
IL AND SW IND. THIS PRETTY MUCH IN LINE WITH 18Z MESOETA WHICH SHWS 
700-850 MB MSTR ON THE INCRS FM SRN IND INTO OH BETWEEN 03Z AND 06Z. 
WL JUST GO WITH MSTLY CLDY N AND KP INCRSG CLDS IN THE S. WITH SOME 
WK WAA LIFT OVRNGT...WL HANG ON TO LOW CHC POPS BUT MAY END UP JUST 
BEING SOME SPRINKLES.  WNDS SHUD STAY UP SOME TNGT AND WITH SOME 
CLDS DVLPG A LTL ERLYR THAN XPCTD...MAY NUDGE TMPS UP A TAD IN THE N.

.ILN...NONE.

362 
FXUS61 KILN 192033
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 PM EST MON FEB 19 2001

SAT IMAGERY SHOWING MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS ACROSS ILN FA...ALLOWING 
TEMPS TO RISE INTO THE 45 TO 50 RANGE. THESE CLEAR SKIES WILL USHER 
IN THE EVENING PERIOD. ALTHOUGH INCREASING CLOUDS WILL BE THE 
EMPHASIS TONIGHT.

THE MODELS THIS RUN HAVE BEEN IN FAIR AGREEMENT. ALTHOUGH THE ETA 
CONTINUES TO BE A BIT QUICKER WITH THE COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE 
TOMORROW AND TOMORROW NIGHT. ALTHOUGH ALL MODELS HAVE TENDED TO BE A 
BIT FASTER WITH SYSTEMS...THE AVN APPEARS TO BE MORE CONSISTANT. 
THUS HAVE TENDED TOWARD THIS MODEL WITH MAIN SYNOPTIC FEATURES.

FOR TONIGHT...WILL GO WITH IC ALL LOCATIONS. WK S/W SHOULD MOVE 
ACROSS FA LATE TONIGHT INTO EARLY TUESDAY. 85H WAA AS WELL AS SOME 
LLVL FORCING IS FCST IN ADVANCE OF CLD FRONT APPROACHING FROM THE 
NW. WILL GO CLOSE TO GUIDANCE...KEEPING CHC POPS...FOR MAINLY LATE 
IN THE PERIOD. CLDS AND SOME WIND SHOULD HELP KEEP THE TEMPS FROM 
FALLING TOO MUCH. THUS WILL GO SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN GUIDANCE.

FOR TUESDAY...FRONT SHOULD WORK ITS WAY ACROSS MOST OF THE FA. BOTH 
THE MID LVL S/W AS WELL AS THE LOWER LVL FORCING WILL BE WEAK 
THROUGH THIS PERIOD. WILL KEEP CHC POPS...WITH RAIN EXPECTED TO BE 
LIGHT. WILL STAY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...CLOUDS SHOULD HANG ON...WITH PARTIAL CLEARING 
LATE ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE WRN PORTION OF FA. W-CTRL OHIO COULD SEE 
SOME SNOW FLURRIES EARLY. WILL KEEP CHC POPS ELSEWHERE AS SOME 
RESIDUAL LIGHT RAIN POSSIBLE WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE. MUCH COLDER.

FOR WEDNESDAY...MUCH COLDER WITH FLURRIES POSSIBLE ALL LOCATIONS.

MISILN ALREADY OUT.

.ILN...NONE.

JTD

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
338 AM EST MON FEB 19 2001

INITIAL WK S/WV IN MID MS VLY TO TRACK E THRU OH VLY THIS MRNG.
FORCING IS IN THE MID/UPR LVLS WITH THIS SYS. SATL IMGRY SHWS BAND 
OF MID/UPR LVL CLDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYS. MODEL TIME SECTIONS 
DEPICT A SURGE OF THIS MSTR ASSOCIATED WITH ISENT LIFT IN WAA PTN
MAINLY DURG MRNG IN THE W AND THRU ERLY AFTN IN ERN SECTIONS.
SOME DRYING FOR THE AFTN SO WL INDICATE SOME PARTIAL SUNSHINE.
LLVL MSTR PROGGED TO INCRS OVER THE NW THIS AFTN AHEAD OF SFC
BNDRY...SO WL CONT MENT MSTLY SKY COND IN NRN MIAMI VLY. GOOD WARM 
UP XPCTD TDA. BASED ON THICKNESS/FCST SOUNDINGS AND PREFER HIGHS A 
COUPLE DEGS COOLER THAN FWC GUID CLOSER CLOSER TO MAV.
   
DOUBLE CENTERED WEAK PAIR OF SHORTWAVES TO TRACK THRU OH VLY AHD
OF SLO MOVG CDFNT TNGT. FORCING REMAINS WK AND MSTR INCREASES BUT
REMAINS LIMITED. WL MAINTAIN LO POPS OVRNGT. TEMPS DO NOT LOOK TO  
DROP MUCH TNGT WITH CLDS AND SW WNDS. HV STAYED CLOSE TO WRM  GUID 
VALUES.
        
MODELS DIFFER WITH TIMING OF CDFNT TUE/TUE NGT. AVN CONTS TO BE
FURTHER NORTH WITH THE BNDRY AND WARMER BUT HS TRENDED A LTL 
FASTER. WL FOLLOW SOLN CLOSER TO ETA WHICH HAS SHOWN BETTER
CONTINUITY...ANTICIPATING FRONT PUSHING INTO SOUTHERN SXNS LATE IN 
THE DAY TUE. FORCING IS WK SO WL JUST MENT PSBL SPRINKLES WITH
20 POPS. BOUNDARY LYR REMAINS WRM SO WL KEEP LIQUID IN ALL BUT
NW WHERE COOLING TAKES PLACE DURG AFTN SO WL MENT FLURRIES PSBL.


.ILN...NONE.
RANDALL

@RUKWBCe5KDENFXUS61 KILN 181953
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
252 PM EST SUN FEB 18 2001

HIGH AND MID LVL MSTR PROGGED TO INCRS TNTG PER LATEST SHORT RANGE 
GUID...AND SUPPORTED BY SAT IMAGERY.  THE CLDS WL BE THIN FOR MUCH 
OF THE NIGHT...BUT MORE OPAQUE CLOUD WL ARRIVE LATE IN STRENGTHENING 
WAA PATTERN.  WL CONT INCRSG CLOUD TREND...STRESSING LATE NATURE IN 
THE EAST.  SFC RIDGE OVER THE AREA ATTM WL SHIFT STEADILY EAST THIS 
EVE...INCRSG THE SW GRADIENT.  GOOD RADIATIONAL CONDS ERLY 
THOUGH...AND WL CONT TREND OF TEMPS BOTTOMING ERLY IN THE WEST THEN 
RISING AS WINDS/CLOUDS INCRS.  META SFC TEMPS COLDER THAN FWC 
NUMBERS...AND HV GENERALLY GONE WITH A COMPROMISE.

TIMESXNS DEPICT A SURGE OF FAIRLY DEEP MSTR ERLY ON MON...WITH SOME 
DRYING FOR THE AFTN.  LLVL MSTR PROGGED TO INCRS OVER THE NW BY AFTN 
AHEAD OF SFC BNDRY...SO WL CONT MENTION OF MCLDY AL DAY.  ELSW WL 
ALLOW FOR A LITTLE MORE AFTN SUN THAN CURRENTLY FCST.  NICE WARMUP 
IN STORE...WITH ETA DEPICTING 50-60M WARMING IN THE 1000/850 LAYER.  
GUID TEMPS IN DECENT AGREEMENT...ALTHOUGH AS TYPICAL THE MAV MUCH 
COOLER.  WL USE BLEN OF MAV/FWC...WHICH MAINTAINS CONTINUITY AND 
LINES UP WELL WITH META SFC TEMPS.  ONLY PCPN MENTION WL BE 
SPRINKLES IN THE NW COUNTIES.

NEW GUIDANCE CLOSE WITH SLOW MOVG FROM OVER NW SXNS OVERNIGHT 
MONDAY.  ENUF MSTR AND WEAK LIFT TO SUPPORT LOW CHC POPS OVER ALL 
BUT THE SE.  TEMPS LIKELY WONT DROP MUCH WITH CLOUDS AND SW 
WINDS...AND WL GO AOA THE FWC NUMBERS.  MODEL DIFFERENCES EMERGE 
WITH FRONTAL POSN ON TUE...WITH STRONGER AVN FURTHER NORTH WITH THE 
BNDRY AND MUCH WARMER.  WL USE BLEND OF AVN/ETA POSN...ANTICIPATING 
FRONT PUSHING INTO SOUTHERN SXNS LATE IN THE DAY.  CHC POPS ALL 
ZONES...AND WL KEEP P-TYPE ALL LIQUID DUE TO WARM BL EVEN OVER THE 
NW.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

934 
FXUS61 KILN 180821
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
322 AM EST SUN FEB 18 2001

NW FLO WITH 1038 MB SFC HI PRES OVR MID MS VLY BLDG SE ACRS OH VLY
TDA. THIS HI WL PROVIDE GOOD SUBSIDENCE. LTST SATL IMGRY SHWS LO
CLDS E OF CWA WITH A BAND OF MID LVL CLDS FM CNTRL IL THRU SRN IN.
XPCT THESE CLDS TO DROP SE THRU SW OH/SE IN/NRN KY ERLY THIS MRNG.
WL MENT SOME MRNG CLDS TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE CLDS THEN HV SKY COND
BCM MSTLY SUNNY. TEMPS TO START OUT ON THE COLD SIDE THIS MRNG.
BASED ON LO LVL THICKNESS/H8 TEMPS AND UPSTREAM TEMPS PREFER HI/S
A LTL COOLER THAN FWC CLOSER TO MAV.

XPCT SKIES TO START OUT MSTLY CLR THIS EVE WITH AN INCRS IN UPR LVL
MSTR LT TNGT. INITIAL WK S/WV TO TRACK FM CNTRL PLNS THRU MID MS VLY
AND DEAMPLIFY OVRNGT. AHD OF THIS SYS ON THE BACK SIDE OF SFC LO XPCT
TO SEE AN INCRS IN SWRLY WNDS AND MID/UPR LVL WNDS. IN WRN SECTIONS
XPCT TO SEE AN ERLY LO AND THEN A SLO RISE. PREFER LOWS A DEG OR TWO 
WRMR THAN FWC GUID TNGT.

ON MON XPCT TO SEE A GOOD DEAL OF MID AND UPR LVL MSTR ACRS THE 
AREA. FORCING IS WK AND COLUMN IS NOT SATURATED SO WL KEEP ALL 
LOCATIONS DRY XPCT FOR THE NRN MIAMI VLY WHERE MSTR AND FORCING
IS A LTL MORE FAVORABLE. WL ONLY MENT A FEW AFTN SPRINKLES HERE. 
TEMP WISE...NGM APPEARS A LTL TOO WRM WITH HI/S. BASED ON FCST 
SOUNDINGS/LO LVL THICKNESS WL TREND TEMPS A LTL COOLER THAN FWC
GUID.

AHD OF APPROACHING CDFNT WL INTRODUCE A CHC OF LGT RN ALL SECTIONS
MON NGT. WL GO WITH LO POPS ALL LOCATIONS WITH BEST THREAT ACRS THE
N.   
 

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

719 
FXUS61 KILN 180155
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
855 PM EST SAT FEB 17 2001

SAT PIX SHWG CLDS TRYING TO ERODE FROM THE W WITH A FEW LINGERING 
SNOW SHWRS STILL ARND. 06Z MESOETA SHWG WHAT IS LEFT OF LAKE MICH 
FETCH CUTTING OFF AFT 03Z SO SHUD CONT TO SEE DIURNALLY DRIVEN/LK 
ENHANCED CLDS CONT TO DSIPT THRU EVNG. FCST HAS GUD HANDLE ON THIS 
AND WL JUST TWEAK WORDING TO REMOVE TIMING IN THE W. NARROW BAND OF 
AC MOVG ACRS SRN IL/SRN IND MAY CLIP FAR SW PORTION OF FA THRU MDNGT 
BUT THINK FOR THE MOST PART...SW FA WL BE MSTLY CLR TNGT. WITH SKIES 
BCMG CLR...TMPS SHUD BE ABLE TO REACH CRNT FCST LOWS SO WL LEAVE AS 
IS. 

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT





855 PM EST SAT FEB 17 2001

SAT PIX SHWG CLDS TRYING TO ERODE FROM THE W WITH A FEW LINGERING 
SNOW SHWRS STILL ARND. 06Z MESOETA SHWG WHAT IS LEFT OF LAKE MICH 
FETCH CUTTING OFF AFT 03Z SO SHUD CONT TO SEE DIURNALLY DRIVEN/LK 
ENHANCED CLDS CONT TO DSIPT THRU EVNG. FCST HAS GUD HANDLE ON THIS 
AND WL JUST TWEAK WORDING TO REMOVE TIMING IN THE W. NARROW BAND OF 
AC MOVG ACRS SRN IL/SRN IND MAY CLIP FAR SW PORTION OF FA THRU MDNGT 
BUT THINK FOR THE MOST PART...SW FA WL BE MSTLY CLR TNGT. WITH SKIES

@RUKWBCe:KDENFXUS61 KILN 171958
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 PM EST SAT FEB 17 2001

CU HAS FILLED IN ALMOST COMPLETELY THIS AFTN...XCPT OVER THE FAR 
SOUTH PORTION OF THE CWFA.  SCT FLURRIES CONT...BUT WITH LOSS OF 
INSOLATION XPCT THESE TO QUCIKLY DISSIPATE.  BASED ON CONDS AT PRESS 
TIME...WL LIKELY NEED A LEFTOVER PD TO ACCOUNT FOR ONGOING FLURRY 
ACTIVITY.  OTHW SKY COND FCST...AND THUS TEMPS...A BIT PROBLEMATIC 
TNGT.  FCST SNDGS FROM 12Z META SUGGEST STRONG INVERSION WL HOLD 
TNGT...WITH MSTR REMAINING TRAPPED OVER THE EAST MOST OF THE NIGHT.
A SHIFT TO MORE WESTERLY FLOW...WEAK WAA IN THE INVERSION 
LAYER...AND LOSS OF INSOLATION WL HELP CLDS CLEAR FROM THE SOUTH AND 
WEST THIS EVE.  CLEARING WL BE SLOWER IN THE EAST...ESPLY CENTRAL 
OHIO...AND WL USE LATE WORDING FOR CLEARING HERE.  FWC TEMPS LK 
RSNBL...ALTHOUGH HAVE OPENED WARMER RANGES ARND CMH DUE TO STRATO-CU 
...AND IN THE SW WITH SOME MID CLOUD OVERHEAD.

SUBSIDENCE/HIGH PRES OVER THE REGION SUNDAY...WITH A MODEST RISE 
PROGGED FOR LLVL THICKNESS VALUES.  WL CONT PREV MSNY FCSTS.  META 
SFC TEMPS AND THICKNESS NUMBERS SUPPORT THE SLIGHTLY COOLER READINGS 
FROM THE MAV...AND THUS HV UNDERCUT THE FWC SLIGHTLY.  ALL MODEL 
GUIDANCE SUGGEST AND INCREASE IN MAINLY MID/HIGH LVL MSTR SUNDAY 
NIGHT...BUT NOT BEFORE SVRL HOURS OF GOOD RADIATIONAL CONDS.  WL USE 
ERLY LOWS THEN TEMPS RISING WORDING WEST AS WINDS INCREASE AS WELL 
AS THE CLDS...AND OMIT RISING WORDING IN THE EAST FOR NOW.  BEST 
MSTR AND LIFT PROGGED OVER THE NORTHERN CWFA MON...BUT EVEN HERE LKS 
LIKE DEEP MSTR IS LACKING.  WL TAPER POPS FROM 50 NORTH TO 30 
SOUTH...AND CONT ERLY MENTION OF SNOW IN THE NORTH HALF.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

12Z SOUNDING DEPICTS DECENT MSTR/INSTABILITY THRU H8...CAPPED BY A 
STRONG INVERSION.  INSTABILITY COUPLED WITH A LMICH FETCH HAS 
RESULTED IN FAIRLY WIDESPREAD FLURRIES ALONG WITH SOME GROUND 
COVERING SNOW SHOWERS.  ALSO NOTED A BAND OF ENHANCED CLOUD ALONG A 
WEAK BNDRY OVER NORTHERN OHIO...ASSOCIATED WITH ADDITIONAL -SHSN.  
WL UPDATE TO CHG FLURRIES TO CHC SHSN ALL ZONES...AND USE LITTLE 
ACCUM WORDING.  WL TAPER PCPN BACK TO FLURRIES BY LATE AFTN.

TEMPS HV DROPPED BLO CURRENT STEADY WORDING...AND WL ADJUST TO ALLOW 
FOR A SLIGHT BOUNCE IN THE AFTN.

.ILN...NONE.

763 
FXUS61 KILN 171135
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
636 AM EST SAT FEB 17 2001

WL UPDATE CVG FCST TO INCLUDE MENT OF SCATTERED FLURRIES. BAND OF 
LAKE EFFECT FLURRIES COMING OFF LM AFFECTING SW OH. XPCT THESE 
FLURRIES TO AFFECT SW OH MAINLY THIS MRNG.  


EARLY MORNING DISCUSSION...
RDDG OVR W CST WITH NW FLO FM CNTRL CAN THRU ERN U.S. S/WV AXIS
TO PIVOT SE THRU GRTLKS TDA. AXIS OF LO LVL CNVRGC TO SWING THRU
OH THRU ERLY AFTN. MST FAVORABLE CNVRGC TO AFFECT NW OH THRU CNTRL
OH. SATL AND RADAR IMGRY SHWS LAKE EFFECT SNW SHWRS/FLRYS COMING 
OFF LM. H8 -22 DEG C AIR SLIDING DOWN LM WITH FAVORABLE TRAJECTORY
INTO NRN MIAMI VLY AND CNTRL OH. INVRSN TO 4K FT SHUD LIMIT PRECIP
TO SCTD FLRYS. NRN MIAMI MAY SEE A FW SCTD SNW SHWRS ERLY THIS MRNG 
BUT PREDOMINANT PRECIP SHUD BE FLURRIES. LO LVL FLO BEGINS TO BACK
CUTTING OFF LM TRAJ AND LE FLURRIES. WL MENT SCTD FLRYS IN NRN 
MIAMI...DAY AND CMH GRPS TDA. LO LVL CAA PTN SHUD LIMIT DIURNAL TEMP
RISE TDA. XPCT VRY LTL RISE WITH TEMPS RANGING FM MID 20 NRN MIAMI
VLY TO ABT 30 IN PMH AREA.

   
SFC RDGG BLDS INTO OH VLY TNGT PROVIDING GOOD SUBSIDENCE. XPCT SKIES
TO CLR. UPSTREAM TEMPS SUGGS LOWS IN SINGLE DIGITS TO LWR TEENS 
OVRNGT.

AHD OF NXT SYS XPCT TO SEE SOME HI LVL CLDS SPILLING OVR S/WV RDGG
ON SUN. THESE CLDS SHUD BE THIN SO WL GO WITH MSTLY SUNNY SKY COND 
WORDING. LO LVL WAA DVLPS ON SUN IN CONJUNCTION WITH SUNSHINE SHUD 
ALLOW TEMPS TO WRM TO NR MAV NUMBERS.

XPCT INCRS IN HI/MID LVL MSTR SUN NGT WITH FLO BACKING AHD OF S/WV
WHICH TRACKS FM CNTRL PLNS INTO MID MS VLY BY 12Z MON. PREFER SLGTLY
WRMR MAV NUMBERS FOR LOWS SUN NGT.    

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

SYSTEMS EXTENDING FROM THE NC COAST BACK INTO AL.  A LARGE DOME OF 
HIGH PRESSURE WAS CENTERED OVER THE PLAINS STATES.

CLOUDS WERE SLOWLY CLEARING FROM THE NW ACROSS THE OH VLY THIS 
EVENING.  XPCT THIS TREND TO CONTINUE SO WL KEEP THE TREND OF BECMG 
P/C.  STRONG CAA EXPECTED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  
LOOKS LIKE A COLD WEEKEND.

036 
FXUS61 KILN 161907
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
207 PM EST FRI FEB 16 2001

THANKS TO SDF AND IWX FOR COORD.

STRONG CONTINENTAL COLD AIRMASS COMING INTO CWA LATE TONIGHT BEHIND 
PASSAGE OF LARGE AREA OF PRECIP THAT SHOULD EXIT CWA BY THIS 
EVENING. WILL TRY TO TIME PRECIP OUT OF SRN FCST GROUPING...BUT MAY 
HAVE TO PLAY WITH ENDING WORDING JUST ALONG AND N OF THE OHIO. WILL 
WAIT UNTIL LAST MINUTE TO DECIDE THIS. A BRIEF MIX MAY OCCUR LATE 
THIS PM BEFORE PRECIP ENDS...BUT WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY MENTION ATTM 
UNLESS REPORTS OF A MIX START FILTERING IN BEFORE PM ISSUANCE. 

GUIDANCE TEMPS ARE FAIRLY CLOSE TO EACH OTHER AND WILL TREND TOWARDS 
THE LOWER NUMBERS DURING THE DAY GIVEN STRENGTH OF COLD AIR IN 
MN/IA/WI THIS MORNING. NIGHTTIME TEMPS SAT PM SHOULD BE A LITTLE 
WARMER THAN GUIDANCE AS NO SNOW COVER SHOULDNT ALLOW US TO DROP TO 
THE SINGLE DIGITS. COLD AMS STAYS IN PLACE THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT, 
WITH WAA DURING PM HOURS AHEAD OF DEVELOPING LOW OVER THE NRN GT 
LKS. EXPECT THAT MOST PRECIP ON MON WILL BE -RA IN GOOD WAA...BUT 
WILL THROW MENTION OF SNOW MIX IN THE NORTHWEST EARLY...AND AGAIN 
FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OVERNIGHT IN CASE CAA ON BACK SIDE OF LOW IS 
STRONG ENOUGH. CANADIAN MODEL SHOWING CHANCE OF A MIX EARLY TUE 
MORNING. 

AFTER THIS, CONFIDENCE IN EXTENDED IS SHOT. JUDGING FROM THE AVN/MRF 
SOLN, ANOTHER SHOT OF GOOD WAA WILL TAKE PLACE AHEAD OF ANOTHER LOW 
ON TUES PM, BUT H5 PATTERN DOESNT LOOK TOO GOOD TO SUPPORT ANY VERY 
STRONG SFC HI OR LO PRESSURE CENTERS. MODELS BRING IN A STRONG LOW 
OVER PACIFIC ON THURSDAY, BUT EXPECT TO SEE THE H5 LOW CONTINUE TO 
DIG AND DEEPEN, SLOWING ANY OTHER SYSTEMS PASSING THROUGH ERN U.S. 
DOWN. 

ONLY CHANGE EXPECTED FOR EXTENDED IS TO INCREASE TEMPS ON TUESDAY 
AND PUT IN POPS OVER NRN FCST AREA. EXPECT TO INTRO POPS ALL ZONES 
FOR WED WITH PASSAGE OF CDFNT. REST WILL LEAVE AS IS AND TACK ON A 
DAY 7

MISILN OUT AROUND 3:00.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





@RUKWBCe4KDENFXUS61 KILN 161452
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EST FRI FEB 16 2001

WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO INCLUDE POSSIBILITY OF MIXED PRECIP 
BETWEEN RICHMOND DAYTON AND COLUMBUS. OBS ALONG GOOD TEMPERATURE 
GRADIENT IN SRN ILL AND IND ARE COMING IN WITH SOME SNOW AND RAIN 
AND FEEL THAT FAR NORTHERN EDGE OF WIDESPREAD RAIN MAY CONTINUE THIS 
TREND.

EXPECT TO OPEN UP A RANGE OF TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTHWEST AS 
READINGS ARE NOT RECOVERING MUCH IF AT ALL. FEEL THAT STEADY TEMPS 
IN THE MID AND UPPER 30S MAY BE A FEW DEGREES TOO OPTOMISTIC. 

WINDS LOOK TO BE A BIT OVERDONE AT 10 TO 20 MPH. THIS WILL PROBABLY 
BE THE CASE LATE TODAY AND THIS EVENING...BUT FOR CHARACTERISTIC OF 
THE DAY FEEL THAT AROUND 10 OR 10 TO 15 IS MORE REPRESENTATIVE. WILL 
HAVE MISILN OUT SOON AND SEND UPDATED PACKAGE ABOUT 10 MINS AFTER.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 AM EST FRI FEB 16 2001

SFC WV OVR ERN KY MOVG E WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FNT EXTENDING
W THRU TN VLY INTO LWR MS VLY. UPR TROF OVR W TX TO TRACK E ACRS
SRN PLNS AND DEAMPLIFY TDA. UPR DIV AND LO LVL CNVRGC COUPLET
OVR THE S TDA. A SHARP GRADIENT INDICATED IN PRECIP EFF. WITH 
BEST MSTR ACRS NRN KY TDA. WL LEAVE NRN MIAMI VLY DRY WITH
TREND FM CHC POPS ACRS DAY AND CMH TO CATEGORICAL ACRS NRN KY.
LO LVL WNDS SHIFT TO NW WITH LO LVL CAA KEEPING TEMPS NRLY 
STEADY AND THEN DROPPING OFF DURG AFTN.
 

S/WV TRACKS E ACRS TN VLY AND WEAKENS OVRNGT WITH NW FLO DVLPG
AND NRN STREAM S/WV PIVOTING SE THRU GRTLKS ON SAT. WL CONT A
CHC IN PMH ZONE THIS EVE. CLDS WL BE TRICKY TNGT. XPCT DRYING
TO OCCUR ACRS NW HALF OF ZONE. WL KEEP AREAS SE OF I-71 MSTLY
CLDY. GUID TEMPS CONSISTENT OVRNGT AND HV NOT STRAYED TOO MUCH.

FAVORABLE FLO OFF LM TO BRING SOME CLDS AND PERHAPS A FW FLYRS
ON SAT WITH H8 -20 TEMPS OVR LM. WL LIMIT MENT OF FLRYS TO 
WRN ZONES. TEMPS WL BE CONSIRERABLY COLDER ON SAT AND HAV GONE
CLOSER TO COLDER MAV NUMBERS BASED ON LO LVL THICKNESS AND 2M
TEMPS.


.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

1000 PM EST THU FEB 15 2001

02Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A FRONTAL SYSTEM EXTENDING FROM ARKANSAS 
THROUGH KY INTO NRN WV.  A WEAK LOW MOVED ALONG THE FRONT THIS 
EVENING ACTING TO PUSH THE FRONT A LITTLE S OF FA.  THUS...TEMPS 
HAVE DROPPED BACK INTO THE 40S IN NRN KY AND VC PMH.  WL REMOVE 
RISING TEMPS IN THESE GROUPS AND GO WITH LOWS IN THE LOWER 40S.  
ELSEWHERE...WL CARRY STEADY TEMPS.

EARLY LOOK AT 00Z MODEL RUNS AND RECENT RADAR TRENDS SUGGEST THAT 
RAINFALL WL BE VERY LIGHT ACROSS FA TONIGHT.  THUS...WL CUT BACK TO 
LIKELY POPS FOR MOST AREAS AND CALL LIGHT RAIN.  WL KEEP CAT POPS 
ACROSS NRN KY AND CUT BACK TO CHANCE IN THE NRN MIAMI VLY.  TEMPS IN 
NRN MIAMI VLY RUNNING JUST ABOVE FREEZING SO WL KEEP THE MENTION OF 
A MIX WITH -FZRA. WL ALSO ADD MENTION OF PATCHY DENSE FOG FOR 
CVG-PMH AND NRN KY GROUPS.

WL LIKELY CUT BACK ON RAINFALL ON FRI AS WELL.

.ILN...NONE.

650 
FXUS61 KILN 151928
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EST THU FEB 15 2001

FRONT REMAINS JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE FA.  SURFACE LOW PUSHES 
NORTHEAST ALONG THE FRONT TONIGHT...BRINGING A GOOD AREA OF QPF 
ACROSS THE SOUTH.  RIGHT NOW IT LOOKS LIKE QPF AMOUNTS WILL STAY 
BELOW FFG VALUES...WHICH ARE RUNNING ABOUT 1.3 OR 1.4 FOR 6 HOURS 
AND 1.8 FOR 12 HOURS....SO WONT ISSUE IN FFAS.

ACROSS THE EXTREME NORTH...TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE FOR FREEZING 
RAIN POTENTIAL.  LOOKING AT MESO ETA SURFACE TEMPERATURES...THEY 
START OFF AROUND 32 THIS EVENING...BUT RISE TOWARDS THE MID 30S BY 
MORNING.  WILL ONLY GO WITH RAIN MIXING WITH FREEZING RAIN RIGHT 
NOW...SO WILL NOT ISSUE A WSW.

WAVE PUSHES BY TOMORROW....ALLOWING THE COLD AIR TO FILTER IN.  THE 
ETA IS QUICKER WITH THE COLD AIR...AS IT IS THE FASTEST WITH IN 
MOVING THE WAVE TO THE WEST.  AVN HAS BEEN THE BEST IN HANDLING THIS 
SYSTEM...SO WILL TREND TOWARDS IT.  STILL PRECIP MIGHT CHANGE TO 
SNOW BEFORE ENDING. 

STRONG COLD ADVECTION ON SATURDAY...BUT VERY DRY 850 RH AND ANTI 
CYCLONIC FLOW WILL LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF SNOW SHOWERS.  STILL FEEL 
CHANCE POPS ARE NECESSARY.

NGM MOS LOOKS TOO COLD TONIGHT...SO WILL TREND TOWARDS CURRENT 
FORECAST.  WILL THEN DROP TEMPERATURES FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY 
TOWARDS MOS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.


.ILN...NONE.

SITES

COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED SOUTH OF A SDF-LEX-HTS LINE.  CURRENT RADAR 
LOOP SHOWING THAT RAIN AREA IS MOVING ALMOST DUE EAST.  MODELS ARE 
INDICATING THAT A SURFACE WAVE WILL PUSH THE FRONT BACK NORTH LATER 
TODAY.  SO WILL BREAK OFF THE EXTREME SOUTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES AND 
WILL WILL LEAVE CATEGORY RAIN.  FOR THE COUNTIES NORTH OF THE OHIO 
RIVER WILL GO WILL CAT POP WILL WILL MENTION TIMING OF MAINLY LATE.  

WILL ALSO DROP POPS FROM CENTRAL OHIO...BUT WILL LEAVE CHANCE POPS 
IN MIAMI AND WHITEWATER VALLEYS FOR LATE THIS AFTERNOON.

TEMPERATURE WISE WILL LOWER TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTH TO GO NEAR 
STEADY 30 TO 35.  MEANWHILE IN NRN KENTUCKY COUNTIES WILL UP 
TEMPERATURES TO 50 TO 55.

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.


.ILN...NONE.

410 AM DISCUSSION....
SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS COLD FRONT AROUND OHIO RIVER AND SLOWLY 
DRIFTING SOUTH.  KILN SHOWING SCATTERED SHOWERS MAINLY SOUTH OF I-70.

MODELS ARE ALL IN DESCENT AGREEMENT THROUGH 24 TO 36 HOURS THEN AVN 
SHOWS SLOWER TENDENCY.  UKMET AND MM5 AGREE MORE WITH AVN SOLUTION.  
WILL BACK OFF POPS TODAY KEEPING CHC/LIKELY GOING IN THE SOUTH.  
WILL ONCE AGAIN HIT TONIGHT HARD AS NEXT WAVE COMES OUT OF TEXAS IN 
THE BROAD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW.  WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL WORDING GOING 
ON FRIDAY AND THEN BRING AN END TO THE PRECIP FRIDAY BEFORE 
MIDNIGHT.  THIS LATTER ENDING OF THE PRECIP GOES MORE IN LINE WITH 
AVN/UKMET/MM5.  FWC TEMPS APPEAR TOO COOL TODAY AND TONIGHT SO WILL 
BUMP THEM UP.  THE LAST TWO PERIODS THEY GOOD.

MISILN SENT TO ALL. 

.ILN...NONE.

305 PM EST WED FEB 14 2001

COLD FRONT ACROSS INDIANA/ILLINOIS WILL SWING ACROSS THE FA 
TONIGHT...PUSHING TO JUST SOUTH OF THE FA BY 12Z.  RADAR COMPOSITE 
SHOWING AREAS OF RAIN TO THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST.  ALTHOUGH IT WONT 
RAIN CONTINUOUSLY TONIGHT...FEEL THAT AS THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH 
RAIN WILL PICK UP...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH CATEGORICAL POPS.  MODELS 
SOUNDING ARE SHOWING THAT THE LOWEST COUPLE OF THOUSAND FEET COULD 
DROP BELOW FREEZING LATE TONIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH MENTION OF 
SLEET OR FREEZING RAIN.

PREFER THE WETTER ETA MODEL...VERSES AVN AS WE HAD NO NGM TODAY DUE 
TO COMPUTER UPGRADE...TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. SO WILL KEEP MENTION OF 
POPS ALL NIGHT TONIGHT.  DONT SEE THE CHANCE OF THUNDER IN THE SOUTH 
UNTIL WAVE APPROACHES AFTER MIDNIGHT...THEN IT LINGERS DURING THE 
MORNING HOURS IN THE SOUTHWEST AND ALL DAY IN THE SOUTHEAST.  WONT 
CARRY THUNDER IN THE DAY AND CMH GROUPS.

AS MENTIONED BEFORE...PREFER THE WETTER ETA...SO WILL UP POPS 
TOMORROW THROUGH FRIDAY. WILL LEAVE EXTREME NORTHWEST DRY THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  DIDNT CHANGE TEMPERATURES A WHOLE LOT FROM 
PREVIOUS PACKAGE.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY. 

.ILN...NONE.

649 
FXUS61 KILN 141043 AAA
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
542 AM EST WED FEB 14 2001

UPDATED MIAMI VALLEY TO POST DENSE FOG ADVISORY.  ASOS AND PHONE 
CALLS TO SHERIFF INDICATED THAT VISIBIES <1/4 OF MILE WERE COMMON.  
FOG SHOULD BEGIN TO LIFT AROUND MID MORNING.

*********************************************************

KILN SHOWING LIGHT PCPN SURROUNDING FA.  WATER VAPOR INDICATES BROAD 
MOISTURE PLUME FROM THE PACIFIC INTO OHIO VALLEY.  PATCHY DENSE FOG 
FORMING ACROSS FA.  AT THE MOMENT...IT IS MAINLY CONCENTRATED AROUND 
DAY.

MODELS ARE ALL IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FIRST 36 TO 48 
HOURS.  AROUND 60 HOURS THE ETA AND AVN BEGIN TO VEER.  THE AVN 
WANTS TO WAVE THE STATIONARY SURFACE BOUNDARY BACK INTO SRN FA.  
UKMET AGREES WITH AVN SCENARIO SO WILL GO WITH THIS WETTER 
SOLUTION.  AS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...THINK CONVECTION WILL HOLD OFF 
FOR THE MOST PART UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT AS FAVORABLE LOW 
LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE FALL INTO PLACE.  
AROUND 00Z 850 JET IS 50KTS.  WILL THROW IN THE MENTION OF THUNDER 
ACROSS THE SOUTH THIS EVENING AS ELEVATED LIS APPROACH ZERO.  ACROSS 
THE FAR NORTH WILL MENTION RAIN POSSIBLY TURNING TO FREEZING RAIN OR 
SLEET AFTER MIDNIGHT.

BASICALLY WENT WARMER THAN FWC TEMPS.  TEMPS ARE ALREADY IN THE MID 
50S OVER WESTERN TN/KY.  THIS IS OUR SOURCE AIR WHICH WILL WORK.  
AFTER THAT..WILL GENERALLY SPLIT MEX AND FWC.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY. 

.ILN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY
OH...042-043-044-051>053-060>062-070>072
IN...050-058-059-066

 TIPTON

ACROSS THE SOUTH THIS EVENING AS ELEVATED LIS APPROACH ZERO.  ACROSS 
THE FAR NORTH WILL MENTION RAIN POSSIBLY TURNING TO FREEZING RAIN OR 
SLEET AFTER MIDNIGHT.

BASICALLY WENT WARMER THAN FWC TEMPS.  TEMPS ARE ALREADY IN THE MID 
50S OVER WESTERN TN/KY.  THIS IS OUR SOURCE AIR WHICH WILL WORK.  
AFTER THAT..WILL GENERALLY SPLIT MEX AND FWC.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY. 

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON











604 
FXUS61 KILN 140840
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 AM EST WED FEB 14 2001

KILN SHOWING LIGHT PCPN SURROUNDING FA.  WATER VAPOR INDICATES BROAD 
MOISTURE PLUME FROM THE PACIFIC INTO OHIO VALLEY.  PATCHY DENSE FOG 
FORMING ACROSS FA.  AT THE MOMENT...IT IS MAINLY CONCENTRATED AROUND 
DAY.

MODELS ARE ALL IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FIRST 36 TO 48 
HOURS.  AROUND 60 HOURS THE ETA AND AVN BEGIN TO VEER.  THE AVN 
WANTS TO WAVE THE STATIONARY SURFACE BOUNDARY BACK INTO SRN FA.  
UKMET AGREES WITH AVN SCENARIO SO WILL GO WITH THIS WETTER 
SOLUTION.  AS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...THINK CONVECTION WILL HOLD OFF 
FOR THE MOST PART UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT AS FAVORABLE LOW 
LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE FALL INTO PLACE.  
AROUND 00Z 850 JET IS 50KTS.  WILL THROW IN THE MENTION OF THUNDER 
ACROSS THE SOUTH THIS EVENING AS ELEVATED LIS APPROACH ZERO.  ACROSS 
THE FAR NORTH WILL MENTION RAIN POSSIBLY TURNING TO FREEZING RAIN OR 
SLEET AFTER MIDNIGHT.

BASICALLY WENT WARMER THAN FWC TEMPS.  TEMPS ARE ALREADY IN THE MID 
50S OVER WESTERN TN/KY.  THIS IS OUR SOURCE AIR WHICH WILL WORK.  
AFTER THAT..WILL GENERALLY SPLIT MEX AND FWC.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY. 

.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 PM EST TUE FEB 13 2001

SPLIT FLO WITH UPR LO OVR SRN CA AND A SERIES OF WEAK S/WVS TRACKING
FM SRN PLNS INTO TN/OH VLYS. IN MEANTIME NRN STREAM S/WV TRACKS ACRS
NRN GRTLKS WITH ASSOCIATED CDFNT DROPPING SE THRU OH WED NIGHT. 

IN WARM SECTOR AHD OF THE CDFNT A WEAK S/WV AXIS IS EXPECTED
TO PIVOT ENE THRU OVRNGT.
   
MODELS CONT TO TREND BACK ON TIMING OF PRECIP. RADAR IMGRY SHWS 
VRY LGT RAIN INTO SW OH. PRECIP EFF. SUGGS THAT WK LO LVL CNVRGC
COUPLED WITH UPR DIV AND MST FAVORABLE MSTR OVR FAR SWRN AND WRN 
SECTIONS OVRNGT. WL ADJUST POPS DOWN A LTL OVRNGT IN ERN SECTIONS.
TEMPS XPCTD TO REMAIN NRLY STEADY TNGT IN WAA PTN.
   
FAVORABLE INGREDIENTS COME TOGETHER FOR RN ON WED ESPECIALLY IN
AFTN WITH LLJ INCRSG TO 50KTS. LO LVL 950MB CNVRGC COUPLED WITH PE/S
INCRSG TO 1.2 TO 1.3 INCHES TO RESULT IN WIDESPREAD RN EVENT ACRS
ENTIRE CWA WED AFTN/NGT.  

.ILN...NONE.



405 
FXUS61 KILN 132004
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EST TUE FEB 13 2001

BROAD RIDGE PERSISTS ACROSS EASTERN CONUS WITH WESTERLY FLOW ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY.  UPPER TROF ALONG THE PACIFIC COAST WILL CONTINUE 
TO DIG SLOWLY EAST OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS AND DRAW LOTS OF PACIFIC 
MOISTURE ACROSS MEXICO INTO THE MISSISSIPPI AND OHIO VALLEYS.   

SFC MAP SHOWS HIGH TO OUR EAST...WITH DEVELOPING TROF OVER THE 
MISSOURI RIVER VALLEY.  AREA UNDER WARM ADVECTION WITH WINDS 
SWITCHING AROUND TO SOUTH.  WARM ADVECTION IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY UNTIL TROF/COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY 
EVENING. 12Z MODEL RUN IS SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUN...WHICH HAD THE 
FRONT MOVING THROUGH AT AROUND 15Z WEDNESDAY.  THIS TREND WILL 
IMPACT PRECIP AND TEMP FCST. 

MODELS HAVE GENERALLY BACKED OFF ON TONIGHTS RAIN. NATIONAL RADAR 
LOOP (FROM INTERNET) SHOWS PRECIP APPROACHING FROM MISSOURI. MODELS 
SHOW THIS AS AN AREA OF LIGHT RAIN THAT WILL ARRIVE LATE THIS 
EVENING.  RAIN SHOULD ARRIVE AFTER 00Z AT CVG. AM LESS CERTAIN 
ABOUT IT REACHING CMH AND WILL DROP POPS TO 80 PERCENT THERE. 

INGREDIENTS WILL BE COMING TOGETHER FOR MORE RAIN ON WEDNESDAY. 
FACTORS INCLUDE 60 KT 850 MB JET WITH STRONG WARM/MOIST ADVECTION IN 
LOWER LEVELS...500 MB PVA...700MB OMEGA...AND PLENTIFUL 
MOISTURE...WITH SFC BOUNDARY PROVIDING FOCUS. DURATION OF PRECIP 
WILL BE RATHER LONG AS SLOW MOVING SFC FRONT WILL BE ALMOST PARALLEL 
TO UPPER FLOW. WILL GO WITH 100 POPS FOR PERIODS OF RAIN ALL ZONES.  
WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY STILL INDICATED...WILL CONTINUE MENTION OF 
POSSIBLE THUNDER SOUTH.

WITH SLOW MOVING SYSTEM...WILL CONTINUE WET FCST WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
WITH LIKELY POPS. WITH FRONT FINALLY MOVING EAST OF HERE ON 
THURSDAY...WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS IN THE MORNING. 

AFTER EXAMINING 1000-850 MB THICKNESS ADVECTION PATTERN...WILL TREND 
TOWARD ETA AND AVN FOR TEMPS AND GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FWC. WILL RAISE 
TEMPS SLIGHTLY FROM PREVIOUS FCST WITH SLOWER FRONTAL MOVEMENT 
RESULTING IN A LONGER PERIOD OF WARM ADVECTION.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO








INDICATED...SO 20 POP IN OUR SOUTHWEST COUNTIES IS APPROPRIATE. BEST 
LIFT...LOW LEVEL JET AND DEEPER MOISTURE WILL BRING CATEGORICAL 
PRECIP LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY ACCORDING TO 06Z ETA.

THICKNESS...12Z ILN SOUNDING...AND MESOETA SFC TEMPS. WILL UPDATE 
ONLY TO ADJUST WIND DIRECTION.

305 AM EST TUE FEB 13 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLOUDS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WITH AN 
ELONGATED SUCKER HOLE FROM LAKE ERIE INTO WEST CENTRAL INDIANA.

MODELS ARE IN DESCENT AGREEMENT WITH EJECTING WAVE FROM THE GREAT 
BASIN INTO MS/OH VLYS LATTER TODAY.  THIS WILL BRING THE BEGINNING 
OF A RATHER WET PERIOD FOR THE REGION...ESPECIALLY ALONG AND SOUTH 
OF THE OHIO RIVER.  RAIN WILL SPREAD INTO FA TONIGHT AS A DUAL UPPER 
LEVEL JET COMBINES WITH AN 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET TO FOCUS CONVECTION 
OVER FA.  WILL LEAVE OUT THE THREAT OF THUNDER AT THE MOMENT FOR 
TONIGHT BUT WILL ADD IT IN ACROSS THE SOUTH OF TUESDAYS AS ELEVATED 
LIS OFF BOTH ETA/AVN APPROACH ZERO.  THREAT OF PRECIPITATION WILL 
THEN CONTINUE THROUGH SUNDAY AS ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW KEEPS OHIO 
VALLEY IN THE STROM TRACK.

FWC AND MAV IN PRETTY GOOD SHAPE.  WILL ONLY MAKE A FEW ADJUSTMENTS 
TO ACCOUNT FOR LOCAL SCHEMES.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 130158
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
900 PM EST MON FEB 12 2001

01Z SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTED AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVR THE U. P. OF 
MICHIGAN.  A COLD FRONT TRAILED FROM THIS LOW ACRS ERN WI...THEN IT 
EXTENDED SW ACRS THE MS RIVER VLY BETWEEN IOWA/ILLINOIS.  A WEAK 
WARM FRONT ALSO TRAILED FROM THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ACRS LOWER 
MICHIGAN.

THE COLD FRONT WILL BASICALLY WEAKEN AND WASHOUT OVERNIGHT 
...ALLOWING FOR HIGH PRESSURE TO MOVE INTO THE OHIO VLY AT THE SFC.  
DESPITE THE SFC HIGH...A MOIST WEST/SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP 
LOW CLOUDS PRESENT.  THUS...MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR TONIGHT 
STILL LOOK GOOD.  OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL RANGE FROM THE LOWER 30S NORTH 
TO THE UPPER 30S SOUTH.

18Z MESOETA INDICATES THAT PCPN MAY NOT START ACRS THE SRN CWFA 
UNTIL THE EVENING HOURS.  WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY CHANGES AND WILL WAIT 
FOR NEW RUN TO SEE IF IT CONTINUES THIS TREND.

ATTM...I DO NOT SEE ANY CHANGES NECESSARY TO THE FORECAST.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 122000
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
300 PM EST MON FEB 12 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS BROAD LOW AMPLITUDE RIDGE ACROSS EASTERN 
CONUS WITH NEARLY ZONAL WEST-SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY.  LARGE WEST COAST TROF WITH EMBEDDED CUTOFF IN IS FCST TO 
DIG SLOWLY SOUTHEAST TO ARIZONA OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS.  FLOW 
AROUND THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROF IS BRINGING PACIFIC MOISTURE 
ACROSS MEXICO AND TEXAS TO THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS. THIS 
PATTERN OF PACIFIC MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL PERSIST FOR THE NEXT FEW 
DAYS...AFFECTING CENTRAL OHIO VALLEY WX WITH CLOUDS AND SOME 
PRECIPITATION.

SFC ANALYSIS HAS WEAK LOW OVER LAKE SUPERIOR WITH WARM FRONT 
EXTENDING TO LAKE ERIE. WEAK SHORT-LIVED HIGH IS PROGGED TO BUILD IN 
TONIGHT BEFORE ANOTHER WARM FRONT WORKS ITS WAY UP LATE TUESDAY 
AHEAD OF DEVELOPING LOW OVER TEXAS. WILL KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY FCST FOR 
TONIGHT AS HIGH WILL NOT BE STRONG ENOUGH TO SCOUR OUT CLOUDS.

AVN/ETA IN FAIR AGREEMENT IN BRINGING PRECIP TO OUR SOUTHERN 
COUNTIES BY LATE TUESDAY.  WILL ADD 30% POPS TO DAY GROUP...40% TO 
PORTSMOUTH...AND RAISE CVG POPS TO 50%...WITH AFTERNOON WORDING. 
WILL LEAVE CMH AND WAPAK GROUPS POP-FREE ON TUESDAY. 

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AS WARM FRONT MOVES IN...SOLID QPF FCST IS 
INDICATED ON ETA...WITH AVN HAVING SLIGHTLY LOWER AMOUNTS POSITIONED 
BIT FARTHER SOUTH.  WILL GO WITH CAT 80% POPS SOUTHERN HALF AND 
LIKELY 70% POPS NORTHERN HALF.  MOST OF RAIN SHOULD OCCUR BY 12Z 
WEDNESDAY AS SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO SLIDE EAST AND MARGINAL DRYING AND 
COLD ADVECTION IS EXPECTED BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.  FOR WEDNESDAY 
WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS MAINLY BEFORE NOON AT CVG...LIKELY WITH NO 
TIME CONSTRAINT AT PMH...AND CHANCE POPS OTHER ZONES.  

FWC TEMPS LOOK TOO LOW. WILL GENERALLY GO 2-5 DEGREES ABOVE FWC 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. AM MORE CONFIDENT ABOUT NIGHTTIME TEMPS BEING 
ABOVE FWC WITH PLENTY OF CLOUDS INSULATING LOWER ATMOSPHERE.  WILL 
STAY CLOSE TO FWC ON WEDNESDAY WHEN FWC APPEARS ABOUT 1 DEGREE TOO 
LOW.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1009 AM EST MON FEB 12 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS QUASIZONAL FLOW.  SFC FEATURES WARM 
ADVECTION ON EAST SIDE OF WEAK LOW OVER MINNESOTA.

WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT AND SOUTHERLY FLOW AT SFC BRINGING IN MILDER AND 
SOMEWHAT MOIST AIR IN THIS AFTERNOON.  MOISTURE IS ADVECTING NORTH 
ACROSS OUR AREA FROM SFC TO 875 MB WITH SOME MORE MOISTURE AROUND 
700 MB...SO WE HAVE LOW AND MID CLOUDS TO DEAL WITH.  I DONT EXPECT 
PRECIP CURRENTLY OVER SOUTHERN KENTUCKY TO REACH OUR AREA...BUT ILL 
KEEP AN EYE ON ITS PROGRESS.

WILL UPDATE FCST TO ADJUST WIND DIRECTIONS ALL ZONES...AND CLOUD 
COVER IN WEST CENTRAL COUNTIES.  OTHERWISE...MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES 
WITH HIGHS IN LOW TO MID 40S LOOKS GOOD. 

.ILN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
340 AM EST MON FEB 12 2001

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLEAR SKIES OVER NWRN FA WITH HIGH CLOUDS 
OVER REST OF FA.  AC DEVELOPING OVER INDIANA WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT 
EASTWARD AND SC DECK FORMING OVER KY/TN WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT 
NORTHWARD.

MODELS IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT IN THE FIRST 36 HOURS AND THEN BEGIN 
TO VEER.  AVN CONTINUE ITS SLOWER TREND WITH STORM SYSTEM IN 
NORTHERN PLAINS.  00Z UKMET AND 12Z EUROPEAN AGREES WITH THIS 
SOLUTION.  SO WILL GO TRANSFER FROM ETA TO AVN AROUND 36 HOURS.  ETA 
SHOWS LOTS OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE STREAMING INTO FA TODAY BENEATH 
CIRRUS SHIELD.  THIS APPEARS REASONABLE WHEN LOOKING AT CLOUD DECKS 
TO OUR SOUTH WHICH LINE UP WELL WITH 925 AND 850 RH FIELDS.  FEEL 
CLOUD DECK WILL HANG AROUND TONIGHT WITH POSSIBLY A FEW BREAKS.  
CLOUDS WILL THEN HANG AROUND THROUGH THE REST OF FA AS ZONAL 
WESTERLY FLOW PREVENTS ANY DRY AIR TO WORK INTO FA.  WILL BRING COLD 
FRONT TROUGH ON WEDNESDAY ACCORDING TO AVN AND START PRECIP ABOUT A 
6 TO 12 HOURS LATTER THAN FWC.  RAINFALL WILL BE INTERESTING LATTER 
IN THE WEEK AS AVN BRINGS COLD FRONT BACK AS WARM FRONT AND KEEPS 
SURFACE LOW/WARM FRONT OVER FA WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE.

WILL MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO FWC TEMPS TODAY...MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT.  TONIGHT LOOKS REASONABLE.  TODAY FEEL CLOUD COVER WILL 
INHIBIT TEMPS CLIMBING INTO THE UPPER 40S TO NEAR 50S SO WILL CUT A 
BACK TO MID 40S.  MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WILL ADJUST FOR WARMER FOR 
LATTER FRONTAL PASSAGE.  WILL ADJUST MAV DOWN A CAT FOR TUESDAY.

MISILN WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON





@RUKWBCe1KDENFXUS61 KILN 120149
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
845 PM EST SUN FEB 11 2001

01Z SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR LAKE ONTARIO.  
COLD AIR DAMMING WAS ALSO NOTED EAST OF THE SRN APPALACHIANS.  A 
WEAK INVERTED SFC TROF WAS LOCATED ACRS THE TN VLY.  FINALLY...SFC 
LOW PRESSURE WAS LOCATED NEAR NE NEB/S DAKOTA BORDER WITH A TRAILING 
WARM FRONT EXTENDING INTO THE SRN PLAINS.

IR SATELLITE IMAGERY DEPICTED ENHANCED CIRRUS PUSHING NE INTO THE 
OHIO VLY.  THE CIRRUS SHOULD REMAIN ACRS THE CWFA THROUGH THE EARLY 
MORNING HOURS OF MONDAY (5 AM)...AS INDICATED BY PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS 
AND 18Z MESOETA.  THUS...AM INCLINED TO WORD THE SKY CONDITION AS 
MOSTLY CLOUDY ACRS THE ENTIRE CWFA OVERNIGHT.  THE WEAK INVERTED SFC 
TROF WAS A REFLECTION OF FAST MOVING LITTLE S/WVS IN THE SW H5 FLOW 
ALOFT.  WITH THE SMALL SIZE AND SPEED OF THE S/WVS...HARD TO 
PINPOINT TIMING.  NONETHELESS...WAA/ISENTROPIC LIFT ASSOCD WITH 
THESE FEATURES ONLY BRING MID AND LOWER LVL CLOUDS TO THE REGION 
OVERNIGHT INTO MONDAY...WITH CONDENSATION PRESSURE DEFICITS FALLING 
TO AS LOW AS 30 MB OVER THE FAR SRN CWFA.  IN OTHER WORDS...PCPN 
SHOULD STAY JUST S OF THE CWFA.  WEATHER SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS STATES 
WILL PASS TO OUR NORTH...BRINGING A WARM FRONT THROUGH THE 
REGION...BUT IT SHOULD ALSO REMAIN DRY ALONG THE WARM FRONT.

WITH HIGH CLOUDS IN PLACE AND AN EAST WIND AROUND 10 MPH.  
TEMPERATURES HAVE PRETTY MUCH BOTTOMED OUT FOR THE NIGHT.  
THUS...CURRENT FCST VALUES LOOK GOOD.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN






DVLPG OVRNGT ON THE 295-300K SFCS BUT LWR PDEFS NOW S OF FA. LIFT 
MAY BE ENUF TO PRODUCE A FEW SPRINKLES BUT GIVEN LACK OF DPR 
MSTR...WL GO AHD AND REMOVE LOW CHC POP OF -FZRA FROM THE FAR S AND 
JUST GO WITH INCRSG CLD WORDING. UP ACRS THE N...THINK WL JUST SEE 
SOME CI CONT OVRNGT FOR MSTLY CLR SKIES. 

OTRWS...ZONAL FLOW TO SET UP ACRS RGN THRU TUE WITH FA RMNG IN 
BETWEEN SYSTEMS. CUD STILL SEE A FEW SPRINKLES LINGERING ACRS THE 
FAR SE MON MRNG BUT WL LEAVE OUT OF FCST. HOWEVER...WL HANG ON TO 
SOME CLDS ACRS THE S AND E FOR MON BEFORE SRN SYS MOVS E. SOME GUD 
DRYING INTO THE NW SO WL GO BACK TO PC FOR THERE ON MON. WL THEN 
JUST GO PC/PS FOR MON NGT AND TUE.

XPCTD AT NGT...HOWEVER GUID TMPS APPEAR TO BE IN BALLPARK THRU PD.

ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS FA.
