FXUS61 KILN 101918
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EST SAT FEB 10 2001

RADAR STILL SHWG SOME SCT -SHSN ACRS NRN PORTIONS OF FA BUT CLDS 
BGNN TO DSIPT ACRS THE S. LLVL FLOW BCMS ACYCLNC AFT 00Z SO SHUD SEE 
ANY LK EFFECT FLURRIES TAPER OFF THRU LT AFTN WITH SKIES BCMG MSTLY 
CLR. WITH HIGH PRES BUILDING IN FM THE NW OVRNGT...SHUD SEE WNDS 
BECMG FAIRLY LGT OVRNGT WHICH SHUD ALLOW FOR GUD RAD COOLING. WL 
STAY CLOSE TO GUID TNGT WITH LOWS IN THE 10 TO 15 DGR RANGE.  

HI PRES STILL IN PLACE ON SUN WITH TIME XSCTNS SHWG JUST SOME HI LVL 
MSTR ACRS AREA THRU THE DAY SO WL GO WITH MSTLY SUNNY SKIES. SFC 
FLOW OUT OF THE E SO DO NOT XPCT TMPS TO BE TOO MUCH WRMR THAN TDA. 
THIS IN LINE WITH FWC/MAV NUMBERS SO WL AGN NOT DEVIATE TOO MUCH.

MDLS HAV BEEN TRENDING A LTL FARTHER N WITH SYSTEM MOVG UP FM THE SE 
SUN NGT/MON. NGM STILL KPG ANY PCPN TO OUR S...BUT ETA AND AVN BOTH 
TRYING TO BRING SOME PCPN INTO AT LEAST SE PORTIONS OF FA LATE SUN 
NGT AND ERLY MON. ETA SHWG DECENT 8H WAA DVLPG SUN NGT WITH SOME WK 
ISENT LIFT INTO PMH AREA AND PRES DEFS DRPG OFF BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z. 
ETA FCST SNDG SHWG PRETTY GUD WARM LAYER ALF BUT SFC TMPS WL LIKELY 
BE AT OR JUST BLO FREEZING. THUS WL INCLUDE A LOW CHC POP LATE SUN 
NGT FOR SOME LGT FREEZING RAIN ACRS PMH AREA. WL HANG ON TO LOW POPS 
FOR MON MRNG BUT ONLY CALL IT RAIN SHWRS FOR NOW AS TMPS SHUD WRM 
ABV FREEZING THRU THE MRNG HRS.

WITH INCRSG CLDS ACRS THE S AND E SUN NGT...WL GO A LTL WRMR THAN 
GUID TMPS FOR LOWS AND A TAD COOLER FOR HIGHS ON MON.

.ILN...NONE.

FXUS61 KILN 101215 AAA
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
715 AM EST SAT FEB 10 2001

715 AM DISCUSION...
CLOUDS CLEARING MORE SLOWLY THAN EXPECTED AND FLURRIES MORE PREVALENT 
SO WILL UPDATE ZONES TO ADD/ADJUST.  06Z MESOETA STILL GIVES HINTS OF 
CLEARING THIS AFTERNOON.

TIPTON


325 DISCUSION...

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CLEARING WORKING INTO NORTHWESTERN INDIANA 
WITH LAKE MI CREATING SOME LAKE EFFECT CU/FLURRIES.  FLOW OFF ETA 
INDICATES A BRIEF WINDOW THIS MORNING WHEN CLOUDS AND FLURRIES COULD 
WORK INTO NORTHERN MIAMI VALLEY.

MODELS ARE ALL IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT.  CAA WEAKENS TODAY WITH 
TEMPERATURES BOTTOMING OUT BETWEEN 12Z AND 15Z THEN ONLY REBOUNDING 
A FEW DEGREES.  HIGH PRESSURE JUST TO THE NORTHWEST OF FA OVERNIGHT 
WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING TONIGHT WITH TEMPERATURES 
FALLING INTO THE TEENS.  BELIEVE FOG WILL NOT BE A PROBLEM AS AIR 
MASS IS VERY DRY AND THERE WILL ALMOST BE 24 HOURS FOR GROUND TO DRY.

FA APPEARS TO BE IN BETWEEN SYSTEMS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  
THE SOUTHERN WAVE IS A BIT CLOSER AND POPS MAY NEED TO BE ADDED 
ALONG AND SOUTH OF OHIO RIVER IF MODEL TRENDS CONTINUE.

FWC NOT AVAILABLE.  MAV (AVN GUIDANCE) LOOKS PRETTY GOOD.  WILL WARM 
OVERNIGHT LOWS BY A FEW DEGREES FOR TONIGHT.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON

001 
FXUS61 KILN 100205
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
905 PM EST FRI FEB 9 2001

02Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTIVE LINE ACROSS 
CENTRAL OH WITH A CDFNT EXTENDING FM NWRN OH INTO NRN KY.  THE FRONT 
WAS INDICATED ON RADAR BY A BKN LINE OF SHOWERS.  MUCH COLDER AIR 
WAS MOVG INTO FA ALONG WITH SOME FLURRIES.  THE PRE-FRONTAL 
CONVECTIVE LINE BROUGHT AREAS OF 50+ MPH WINDS TO FA THIS EVENING.

SECOND AREA OF 40+ MPH GUSTS ACROSS WRN OH IS EXPECTED TO PUSH 
RAPIDLY ACROSS FA OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS AS THE COLD AIR ADVECTS 
EWD.  PLAN A 10 PM UPDATE TO DROP THE WIND ADVISORY DAY-CVG AND MAY 
BE ABLE TO DROP IT FOR CMH-PMH BY MIDNIGHT.

AS STRONG MID LVL TROF MOVES ACROSS THE OH VLY...A FEW FLURRIES ARE 
POSSIBLE.   

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY TONIGHT FOR 
KYZ097>100-OHZ045-046-054>056-063>065-073-074-079>082-088.

@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 100205
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
905 PM EST FRI FEB 9 2001

02Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED A PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTIVE LINE ACROSS 
CENTRAL OH WITH A CDFNT EXTENDING FM NWRN OH INTO NRN KY.  THE FRONT 
WAS INDICATED ON RADAR BY A BKN LINE OF SHOWERS.  MUCH COLDER AIR 
WAS MOVG INTO FA ALONG WITH SOME FLURRIES.  THE PRE-FRONTAL 
CONVECTIVE LINE BROUGHT AREAS OF 50+ MPH WINDS TO FA THIS EVENING.

SECOND AREA OF 40+ MPH GUSTS ACROSS WRN OH IS EXPECTED TO PUSH 
RAPIDLY ACROSS FA OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS AS THE COLD AIR ADVECTS 
EWD.  PLAN A 10 PM UPDATE TO DROP THE WIND ADVISORY DAY-CVG AND MAY 
BE ABLE TO DROP IT FOR CMH-PMH BY MIDNIGHT.

AS STRONG MID LVL TROF MOVES ACROSS THE OH VLY...A FEW FLURRIES ARE 
POSSIBLE.   

.ILN...WIND ADVISORY TONIGHT FOR 
KYZ097>100-OHZ045-046-054>056-063>065-073-074-079>082-088.

WILKINSON





731 
FXUS61 KILN 091952
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
252 PM EST FRI FEB 9 2001

STRONG UPPER TROF MOVING THROUGH MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IS PROGGED TO 
LIFT THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES TO NORTHEAST CANADA BY SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON. IN THE MEANTIME WE ARE DEALING WITH RECORD HIGH 
TEMPS...STRONG WINDS...AND POSSIBLE SVR WX. 

MODELS DOING GOOD JOB IN PLACING SFC LOW OVER MICHIGAN AT 18Z. 
STRONG COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH FROM LOW IS FCST TO MOVE THROUGH 
BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z. STRONG LOW LEVEL FLOW AHEAD AND ALONG FRONT HAS 
RESULTED IN WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA BEING MET. WINDS SHOULD SUBSIDE 
BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA RATHER QUICKLY BEHIND FRONT...BY MIDNIGHT IN 
WEST AND AFTER MIDNIGHT IN EAST. 

LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL ALSO ENERGIZE SHRA/TSRA. MAIN AREA OF PRECIP IS 
ALONG INDIANA/ILLINOIS BORDER. THOUGH NO SVR TSRA HAVE BEEN 
OCCURRING TO OUR WEST...WILL KEEP MENTION OF POSSIBLE SVR ALONG OHIO 
RIVER WITH POTENTIAL DAMAGING GUSTS.  

A RETURN TO COLDER AND MORE TRANQUIL CONDITIONS WILL FOLLOW THE 
FRONT WITH RAPID DRYING INDICATED AS HIGH MOVES IN. MOSTLY SUNNY AND 
COLDER WILL WORK FOR SATURDAY...WITH SIMILAR CONDITIONS ON SUNDAY. 
CLOUDS SHOULD INCREASE SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SYSTEM PASSING SOUTH NEAR 
THE GULF COAST. 

FWC TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY GOOD THROUGH THE FCST PERIOD...SO I WILL 
NOT DEVIATE MORE THAN A COUPLE OF DEGREES.  TONIGHTS LOWS LOOK A 
BIT OPTIMISTIC SO WILL UNDERCUT SLIGHTLY AT CVG AND DAY. SATURDAYS 
HIGHS LOOK SLIGHTLY LOW...AND SUNDAYS SLIGHTLY HIGH AT CVG AND CMH. 

.ILN...
...WIND ADVISORY THIS EVENING FOR 
INZ050-058-059-066-073>075-080-KYZ089>096-OHZ026-034-035-042>044-051>
053-060>062-070>072-077-078.
...WIND ADVISORY TONIGHT FOR 
KYZ097>100-OHZ045-046-054>056-063>065-073-074-079>082-088.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1052 AM EST FRI FEB 9 2001

COLD FRONT GATHERING STRENGTH AND ACCELERATING AS IT MOVES FROM STL 
TO OUR AREA BY THIS EVENING. SYSTEM FEATURES STRONG 850 MB JET AHEAD 
OF IT AND GOOD STRATOSPHERIC INTRUSION BEHIND IT...ALONG WITH HIGH 
PWAT...AMONG OTHER PARAMETERS.

FOR OUR AREA...THIS MEANS RECORD HIGH TEMPS...STRONG WINDS AND 
POSSIBLE SVR TS THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.  I EXPECT SYNOPTIC WINDS 
TO STAY BELOW WARNING CRITERIA SO WILL HOIST WIND ADVISORY IN EAST 
AND CONTINUE IT IN WEST...WHILE DROPPING HIGH WIND WATCH.  WILL 
MONITOR WINDS IN CASE IT APPEARS WARNING CRITERIA WILL BE REACHED. 
MENTIONED POSSIBLE SVR TS IN ZONES. ALSO INCREASED POPS TO 60% IN 
WEST BY EVENING.

.ILN...

@RUKWBCe	8KDENFXUS61 KILN 090856
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
355 AM EST FRI FEB 9 2001

KILN SHOWING AN ISOLATED SHOWER OVER WEST CENTRAL OHIO.  SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWING BROAD WARM AIR ADVECTION OVER FA WITH SURFACE LOW 
STRETCHING FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE WESTERN GREAT 
LAKES.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT.  THE ETA/NGM HAVE SLOWED DOWN 
CLOSER TO THE AVN/UKMET SOLUTION...WHICH HAS BEEN THE MOST 
CONSISTENT.  AS A RESULT WILL CUT BACK FWC POPS TO CHANCE AND GO 
WITH CATEGORICAL THIS EVENING WITH FROPA.

WINDS WILL BE A CONCERN BETWEEN 18Z THIS AFTERNOON AND 06Z TONIGHT.  
SURFACE FLOW OFF THE ETA AND AVN SHOW 30 TO 40 KTS THIS AFTERNOON 
OVER FA.  AS A RESULT WILL RESOLVE HIGH WIND WATCH THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH A WIND ADVISORY ACROSS THE WEST AND STRONG WORDING IN THE 
EAST.  WILL LEAVE UP HIGH WIND WATCH THIS EVENING THROUGH MIDNIGHT 
AS THE THREAT EXISTS FOR CONVECTIVE WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH COLD FRONT 
TO EXCEED 50 KTS.  THE BIG QUESTION IS WILL THERE BE THUNDER.  AGREE 
WITH SPCS ASSESSMENT OF POTENTIAL.  HOWEVER IT IS STILL POSSIBLE 
FOR THE LINE NOT TO CONTAIN THUNDER.  SINCE THE POSSIBILITY STILL 
EXISTS WILL LEAVE WATCH STAND.  WILL DANCE AROUND THE SEVERE/HIGH 
WIND WATCH BY MENTIONING IN THE BODY THIS EVENING THAT DAMAGING 
WINDS ARE POSSIBLE.  

ONCE FROPA OCCURS THEN MUCH COOLER AIR (I.E. NEAR NORMAL) WILL 
RETURN TO THE OHIO VALLEY FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.  

WILL STICK PRETTY CLOSE TO MOS.  CLOUD COVER TODAY WILL DICTATE HIGH 
TEMPERATURE.  HAVE A FEELING THAT IN THE WARM SECTOR THAT THE CLOUDS 
WILL DISSIPATE TO SOME DEGREE.  RECORD WORDING WILL BE INCLUDED.  

THANKS TO RLX..JKL..SDF..IND..IWX..CLE FOR COOR.

.ILN...
IN...HIGH WIND WATCH THIS EVENING THROUGH MIDNIGHT FOR ZONES
       INZ050...INZ058>059...INZ066...INZ073>075...INZ080.
     WIND ADVISORY THIS AFTERNOON FOR ZONES                          
       INZ050...INZ058>059...INZ066...INZ073>075...INZ080.

KY...HIGH WIND WATCH THIS EVENING THROUGH MIDNIGHT FOR ZONES
       KYZ089>100.
     WIND ADVISORY THIS AFTERNOON FOR ZONES KYZ089>096.

OH...HIGH WIND WATCH THIS EVENING THROUGH MIDNIGHT FOR ZONES
       OHZ026...OHZ034>035...OHZ042>046...OHZ051>056...OHZ060>065...
       OHZ070>074...OHZ077>082...OHZ088.
     WIND ADVISORY THIS AFTERNOON FOR ZONES                          
       OHZ026...OHZ034>035...OHZ042>044...OHZ051>053...OHZ060>062...
       OHZ070>072...OHZ077>078.

@RUKWBCe		KDENFXUS61 KILN 090208
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
905 PM EST THU FEB 8 2001

01Z SFC ANALYSIS SHOWED A WARM FRONT EXTENDING FROM NW PA...ACRS 
LAKE ERIE...FAR SRN LOWER MI..THEN SOUTHWESTWARD TO AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE NEAR MOLINE IL.  A COLD FRONT TRAILED FROM THE SFC LOW INTO 
NW MO...FAR SE KS...NW OKLA...THEN INTO NRN TX.

KILN RADAR AND RADARS TO THE WEST WERE INDICATING SCATTERED SHOWER 
ACTIVITY.  SOME LIGHTNING STRIKES WERE BEING OBSERVED ACRS IL AND IN.
THE PRECIPITATION WAS DEVELOPING FROM LOW LVL CONVERGENCE ASSOCD 
WITH AN H85 LOW LVL JET.  18Z MESOETA PIVOTS THE NOSE OF THIS LOW 
LVL JET INTO NW OHIO/SRN LOWER MICHIGAN AFTER MIDNIGHT.  THUS...BEST 
CHC FOR SHOWERS WILL BE CLOSER TO THIS REGION...THE NRN MIAMI 
VLY/WAPAKONETA AREA.  FARTHER SOUTH...SHOWER ACTIVITY SHOULD RAPIDLY 
DECREASE.  WILL EMPLOY 40 POPS FAR NORTH...30 POP FOR DAY...AND 20 
POP FOR CVG.  OVER THE ERN AREAS...MAY GO WITH A 20 POP CMH AND JUST 
SPRINKLES FOR THE PMH GROUP.  AS STATED BEFORE...SOME LIGHTNING WAS 
OBSERVED TO THE WEST (ELEVATED CONVECTION).  FOR NOW...I AM LEANING 
NOT TO INCLUDE TSTM CHC/S IN THE FAR NORTH...BUT AN ISOLD ONE COULD 
STILL DEVELOP.

TOMORROW LOOKS TO BE REAL INTERESTING.  VERY STRONG WINDS ALOFT (55 
KTS AT 925 MB AND 85 KTS AT 850 MB) AHEAD AND JUST BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT COULD POSE SOME PROBLEMS.  RIGHT NOW...CAN FORESEE A 
CONCENTRATED LINE OF CONVECTION WITH THE COLD FRONT.   TSTM 
POTENTIAL LOOKS BEST ACRS THE SRN CWFA WHERE BETTER LOW LVL MSTR 
WILL BE REALIZED.  HOWEVER...SHOWERS ALONE COULD ALLOW STRONG WINDS 
ALOFT TO REACH THE SFC.  HIGH WIND WATCH LOOKS GOOD ATTM AS SFC 
WINDS WILL BE IN THE 30 TO 40 MPH RANGE.  HOW THE VERY STRONG WIND 
GUSTS WILL BE HANDLE TOMORROW WILL DEPEND ON WHAT EXACTLY 
MATERIALIZES WITH THE FRONT.  WE WILL SEE.



.ILN...HIGH WIND WATCH ENTIRE CWFA FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY   
       FRIDAY NIGHT.

HICKMAN









@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 082012
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
312 PM EST THU FEB 8 2001

STRONG UPPER TROF OVER ARIZONA IS CARVING A PATH TOWARD THE OHIO 
VALLEY.  MODELS DIFFER WITH AVN BEING A BIT DEEPER AND SLOWER. 

SFC MAP HAS LOW OVER SOUTHERN ROCKIES. MASSIVE INVERTED SFC TROF 
NORTHEAST OF LOW EXTENDS TO UPPER LAKES. PRECIP IS ALREADY OCCURRING 
IN OUR SOUTHWEST COUNTIES IN WARM ADVECTION WELL AHEAD OF THE MAIN 
SYSTEM. SHOWERS SHOULD AFFECT OUR WHOLE AREA IN SCATTERED FASHION BY 
LATE EVENING. WILL INCLUDE CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES FOR EVENING 
SHOWERS. 

SFC LOW CENTER IS PROGGED TO LAKE MICHIGAN BY 12Z FRIDAY WITH STRONG 
COLD FRONT TRAILING TO THE GULF OF MEXICO. FRONT IS THEN FCST TO BE 
OVER OUR AREA FRIDAY EVENING. MAIN PROBLEM WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL 
INVOLVE WINDS AS MODELS INDICATE 30KT+ SUSTAINED AT SFC WITH 90KTS 
AT 850 MB. WILL ISSUE HIGH WIND WATCH FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH CLE PROVIDING GOOD GUIDANCE FOR THIS EVENT. 

PLENTY OF MOISTURE ASSOC WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BE MOVING INTO OUR 
REGION ON FRIDAY WITH PWAT APPROACHING 1.5. WILL GO WITH 70 - 80 
POPS IN WEST ON FRIDAY...WITH 50 POPS EAST AT CMH AND PMH. WILL GO 
WITH 80 POPS ALL ZONES FRIDAY NIGHT...ENDING BY/AROUND MIDNIGHT IN 
THE WEST. SVR TS ALSO COULD BE A PROBLEM WITH STRONG FLOW. EXPECT 
PRECIP TO END BEFORE REALLY COLD AIR ARRIVES SO WILL NOT MENTION 
SNOW AT ALL FRIDAY NIGHT.

FWC TEMPS LOOK FAIRLY GOOD CONSIDERING THE DIFFERENCE FROM 
CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMALS. WILL GO ABOVE FWC TONIGHT WITH WINDS STAYING 
UP...AND NEAR FWC WITH RECORD HIGHS ON FRIDAY.  FWC LOOKS TOO WARM 
ON FRIDAY NIGHT IN STRONG COLD ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT SO WILL 
UNDERCUT BY A FEW DEGREES. LOW TO MID 30S LOOK OK FOR SATURDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

AREA UNDER UPPER RIDGE.  STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW AT SFC AHEAD OF HUGE 
LOW OUT WEST IS BRINGING WARM TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON. 

SATELLITE SHOWS MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS OUR AREA. 
CONVECTIVE CLOUDS WITH LIGHTNING ARE MOVING INTO SOUTHERN INDIANA 
NEAR EVANSVILLE. EXPECT THAT ACTIVITY TO MOVE SOUTH OF OUR AREA WITH 
BEST MID LEVEL INSTABILITY BUT WILL MONITOR CLOSELY.

NOT MAKING ANY CHANGES TO CURRENT FCST EXCEPT ADJUSTING WINDS 
WORDING.  FCST TEMPS IN LOW TO MID 60S LOOK GOOD AFTER ANALYZING 12Z 
SOUNDING SO NO CHANGES TO TEMPS ARE NEEDED.

.ILN...NONE.

NEAR EVANSVILLE. EXPECT THAT ACTIVITY TO MOVE SOUTH OF OUR AREA WITH 
BEST MID LEVEL INSTABILITY BUT WILL MONITOR CLOSELY.

NOT MAKING ANY CHANGES TO CURRENT FCST EXCEPT ADJUSTING WINDS 
WORDING.  FCST TEMPS IN LOW TO MID 60S LOOK GOOD AFTER ANALYZING 12Z 
SOUNDING SO NO CHANGES TO TEMPS ARE NEEDED.

.ILN...NONE.


CONIGLIO







@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 080720
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
219 AM EST THU FEB 8 2001

NOT EXPECTING ANY BIG CHANGES IN THINKING WITH SYSTEM THAT MOVES 
THROUGH OH VLY ON FRIDAY AS PREVIOUS FCSTS WERE FOCUSING ON AVNS 
SOLUTION. ETA AND NGM ARE BEGINNING TO SLOW DOWN COME IN LINE WITH 
THE LARGER FEATURES ON AVN, WHICH HAS A GOOD RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY 
AFTER VIEWING H5 FIELDS ON DPROG/DT.

HOWEVER, WITH THE WIND EVENT WITHIN THE FORECAST REALM OF THE ETA, 
ITS SHOWING MOISTURE ANOMALIES ON THE ORDER OF +7.0 STANDARD 
DEVIATIONS ABOVE NORMAL WITH A LLJET OVER IN/MI ON THE +5-6 SCALE 
TOO. 

CONCERN RIGHT NOW IS HOW MUCH WIND WELL GET AHEAD OF FRONTAL 
PASSAGE. MODELS POINTING AT A SCREAMING LLJET OVER FCST AREA ON 
FRIDAY. ETAS 90KTS AT THIS LEVEL IN NW OH AT 18Z LOOKS A BIT 
OVERDONE, BUT AVN PROGGING A 70KT JET IN SAME PLACE BY 0Z. ETA WIND 
FIELDS ARE SIGNIFICANTLY STRONGER AND NOTICEABLY FURTHER EAST AHEAD 
OF APPROACHING SYSTEM WHEN COMPARED TO AVN. WHICHEVER MODEL IS 
REALIZED DOESNT MATTER. ITS GONNA START WITH BREEZY TODAY AND 
TONIGHT AND WORK ITS WAY UP TO WINDY ON FRIDAY. AM UNSURE AS TO HOW 
MUCH OF THIS JET WILL ACTUALLY GET TRANSLATED TO THE GROUND IN WAA, 
SO WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY CHICKEN LITTLE OUTLOOKS ATTM.

IN A NUTSHELL, PREVIOUS FCSTS HAVE A HANDLE ON WHATS COMING DOWN 
THE LINE AND WILL ONLY BE TRYING TO FIGURE OUT HOW MUCH WAA WILL BE 
TAKING PLACE FOR TEMPERATURES - AND TRY TO TIME PRECIP ON FRIDAY. 
WITH MODELS TRENDING SLOWER...FROPA OVER CWA SHOULD BE SOMETIME 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. WILL TWEAK WORDING OF PRECIP AS 
CHARACTERISTIC OF THE DAY SHOULDNT BE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN 
THE WEST...AND EASTERN CWA COULD BE MAINLY DRY THROUGH THE DAY IF 
AVNS POSITION IS RIGHT. 

MISILN COMING SOON TO A THEATER NEAR YOU.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS




@RUKWBCe9KDENFXUS61 KILN 080156
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
855 PM EST WED FEB 7 2001

01Z ANALYSIS DEPICTED A SFC WARM FRONT STRETCHING ALONG THE TN/KY 
BORDER...THEN EXTENDING NORTHWEST INTO SRN IL AND NRN MO.

SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS EVENING WAS SHOWING AN AREA OF LOWER LVL 
CLOUDINESS (850 MB AND ABOVE) MOVING ACRS THE CWFA.  THIS WAS WELL 
IN ADVANCE OF THE AFOREMENTIONED WARM FRONT.  SKIES SHOULD REMAIN 
MOSTLY CLOUDY OVER THE NRN CWFA THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS (2 
AM TO 3 AM)...THEN BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY.  FOR THE DAY/CMH 
AREAS...CLOUDS SHOULD STICK AROUND UNTIL ABOUT MIDNIGHT...THEN 
BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY.  FOR CVG AND POINTS SOUTH...SKIES WILL REMAIN 
PARTLY CLOUDY AS CIRRUS BECOMES THE DOMINANT CLOUD TYPE.  
TEMPERATURE WORDING MAY HAVE TO BE TWEAKED A LITTLE TONIGHT...BUT 
OVERALL IT LOOKS TO BE IN THE BALL PARK.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN







@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 071926
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST WED FEB 7 2001

LOW CLDS FINALLY BREAKING UP ACRS SW BUT CLDS HAV HELPED KP TMPS 
DOWN...ESPCLY NEAR CVG. WITH SOME LATE SUN...SHUD SEE TMPS WRM UP A 
LTL BUT IT WL STILL MAKE FOR A TUF TMP FCST TNGT AS WE WL PRBLY SEE 
TMPS DROP OFF SOME AFT SS BEFORE LVLG OFF AND PSBLY BEGINNING TO 
RISE A LTL. WL SEE WHR TMPS STAND AT ZONE ISSUANCE...BUT WL PRBLY 
HAV TO INDICT SOME KIND OF SLOWLY RISING TMPS TNGT. OTWS WL JUST GO 
WITH PRTLY CLDY SKIES TNGT. 

MDLS TRENDING A LTL FASTER WITH APRCHG SYSTEM FOR THUR NGT/FRI BUT 
AVN STILL SIG SLOWER THAN ETA AND TO A LESSER DGR NGM. GIVEN TREND 
WL LEAN TWD FASTER SOLUTIONS BUT NOT QUITE AS FAST AS ETA FOR FCST. 
WL BRING FNT THRU FA THRU FRI AFTN/ERLY FRI EVNG. ETA STILL TRYING
TO PRODUCE SOME PCPN ACRS NWRN PORTIONS OF FA THUR AFTN BUT WITH 
AREA IN WARM SECTOR THINK THIS MAY BE OVRDONE AND WL TRY TO KP 
THINGS DRY THRU THE DAY. 

SWLY LLVL FLOW ON THE INCRS LATE THUR NGT INTO FRI WITH ETA SHWG 8H 
JET IN EXCESS OF 80 KTS PUSHG ACRS FA AHD OF FNT WITH A 925 MB JET 
IN EXCESS OF 50 KTS. BEST FORCING HOLDS OFF TIL FRI BUT WL INCLUDE 
LOW CHC POPS ACRS THE W FOR LATE THUR NGT AND THEN BRING CAT POP IN 
FOR ENTIRE FA ON FRI. INSTBLTY NOT VERY GOOD WITH ETA SHWG MINIMAL 
CAPES (LESS THAN 100) ON FRI AND LI/S RMNG ABV +2 OR SO. HOWEVER... 
ETA SEEMS TO BE TOO COOL WITH ITS SFC TMPS GIVEN GOOD SLY FLOW SO 
XPCT INSTBLYS TO ACTUALLY BE A LTL BETTER THAN THIS AND WL INCLUDE A 
MENTION OF THUNDER FOR FRI. WITH SUCH HIGH WINDS JUST OFF THE 
SFC...POTENTIAL WL EXIST TO MIX SOME OF THIS DOWN ON FRI AND WL 
INDICT WINDY FOR NOW. ETA HANGING ON TO 40-50 KT 8H WINDS ON BACK 
SIDE OF CDFNT AND WITH GOOD ISENT DOWNGLIDE...SHUD BE FAIRLY EASY TO 
BRING SOME OF THIS DOWN TO THE SFC FRI NGT. 

AS FOR TMPS...XPCTG SOME SUN ON THUR AND WITH DECENT WAA PREFER 
WRMR FWC GUID TMPS FOR HIGHS. WL GO A CPL CATS WRMR THAN GUID FOR 
LOWS THUR NGT WITH WAA CONTG/INCRSG CLDS AND SFC WIND STAYG UP SOME. 
TMPS ON FRI WL DEPEND ON EXACT TIMING OF FNT. IF FNT IS A LTL SLOWER 
THAN XPCTD...CUD END UP WITH TMPS INTO THE 70S. FOR NOW WL STCK 
PRETTY CLOSE TO FWC NUMBERS IN THE MID TO UPR 60S BUT THESE STILL 
AOA RECORDS SO WL HAV TO MENTION NEAR RECORD WORDING FOR FRIDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT




@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 070733
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
232 AM EST WED FEB 7 2001

MAIN QUESTIONS WITH MORNING PACKAGE WILL BE CONCERNING CHANCE OF 
PRECIP THIS EVENING IN NORTHWEST WITH PASSAGE OF WARM FRONT AND ODDS 
OF PRECIP ON THURSDAY. 

RIGHT NOW...AVN HAS BEST HANDLE ON MID LEVEL CLOUD COVER CURRENTLY 
OVER KY. ALL MODELS PUSH HIGHEST MOISTURE THROUGH CWA FROM 0-6Z 
TONIGHT AND MESOETA BRINGS A WEAK LINE OF MEASURABLE PRECIP TO THE 
NORTHWEST. THIS COOINCIDES WITH AN AREA OF BEST 850-700 UVV OVER 
NORTHERN INDY DURING SAME TIME FRAME. RIGHT NOW...40 AND 30 POPS 
RUNNING FOR WAPAKONETA AND DAYTON...WILL PROBABLY BUMP DOWN TO 30 
AND 20 (SPRINKLES) AND MENTION BEFORE MIDNIGHT OR EVENING WORDING. 
WILL TAKE MENTION OF SPRINKLES OUT OF DAYTIME PERIOD. 

NEXT PROBLEM IS CHANCE OF PRECIP ON THURSDAY. WITH VERY GOOD LLVL 
JET SETTING UP...MOISTURE WILL BE SURGING INTO FCST AREA WITH BEST 
ADVECTION CLOSEST TO SFC FRONT. AVN KEEPS ENTIRE AREA DRY...AND WITH 
RH FIELDS AT H8 AND H7 ON THE DRIER SIDE UNDER A RIDGE...I LIKE THIS 
THINKING. ETA/MESOETA SHOW RELATIVELY SAME RH FIELDS...BUT CRANK OUT 
PRECIP FOR MUCH OF FCST AREA...ESPECIALLY IN THE WEST. RIGHT NOW...I 
WONT CHANGE THE 30 POPS WE CURRENTLY HAVE RUNNING IN THE NORTHWEST 
...BUT FAVOR THE DRIER AVN. REASONING WITH THIS IS THAT CWA SHOULD 
BE IN RIGHT EXIT REGION OF LLVL JET AND THERE IS ONLY SOME WEAK H3 
DIVERGENCE. H5 RIDGE STILL IN PLACE THOUGH SLOWLY PROGRESSING EAST 
AHEAD OF DIGGING TROF IN PLAINS STATES.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS





LOWER CLDS OVER NRN HALF OF FA MAKING SLOW PROGRESS EXITING THE 
AREA. WILL GO ALONG WITH 18Z ETA IN CONTINUING THIS SLOW CLEARING 
OVERNIGHT. STRONG DVV SHOULD ALSO HELP IN THIS PROCESS. 
HOWEVER...LATEST SAT PICS SHOWING LOWER CLDS AND FOG DEVELOPING 
ACROSS CTRL IL AND NW IN. AM CONCERNED ABOUT HOW EXTENSIVE THE 
SPREAD OF THIS LLVL MOISTURE UNDER THE DEVELOPING INVERSION WILL BE. 
BUT AT THIS TIME...WILL GO WITH CONTINUED PARTIAL CLEARING TREND 
WITH STILL THE MENTION OF FOG DEVELOPING. FEEL ALSO THAT SOME 
DOWNWARD ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPS IN ORDER AS RADIATIONAL COOLING MAY BE 
ENHANCED IN THOSE AREAS EXPECTING PARTIAL CLEARING.

UPDATED MISILN OUT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.

081 
FXUS61 KILN 061944
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 PM EST TUE FEB 6 2001

19Z SFC ANLYS SHWG CDFNT/WNDSHIFT LINE FM ABT MFD THRU DAY TO ARND 
SDF. PERSISTENT SCT -SHRA LINGERING ACRS SRN PORTIONS OF FA. THIS 
SEEMS TO BE ENHANCED BY RRQ OF UPR LVL JET AND SOME WK LLVL CONV ALG 
BNDRY. WL KP AN EYE ON THIS BUT WL PRBLY HAV TO INCLUDE SOME 
LEFTOVER WX FOR AREA S OF CVG AMD PMH AREA. MEANWHILE...CLDS TRYING 
TO BREAK UP IMMEDIATELY BEHIND BNDRY BUT LWR CLDS PIVOTING DOWN ACRS 
NRN IND/NRN OH CATCHING UP TO THIS. ETA INDICTG DECENT DRYING BLO 
850 AFT 00Z THIS EVNG SO THINK WE WL SEE THESE CLDS BREAK UP LATER 
THIS EVNG. WL INCTG SOME ERLY CLDS THEN CLRG. SFC HIGH BUILDS IN 
OVRNGT SO SHUD SEE WINDS GO LGT WITH DECENT RAD COOLING. WITH ERLYR 
PCPN...WL MENTION AREAS OF FOG DVLPG OVRNGT. 

WRMFNT LIFTS N ACRS AREA THRU WED AFTN WITH BEST ISENT LIFT/LLVL 
CONV AND DPR MSTR MAINLY RMNG TO THE W OF OUR FA. CUD SEE A FEW 
SPRINKLES DVLP THRU LATE AFTN ACRS DAY AND WAPOK AREAS. ELSEWHR...WL 
GO WITH MSTLY SUNNY IN THE MRNG...BCMG PRTLY SUNNY IN THE AFTN AS 
SOME MID/HIGH LVL CLDS SPREAD IN. DECENT WAA DVLPS THRU THE DAY SO 
WL GO AT OR A LTL ABOVE FWC NUMBERS WITH HIGHS IN THE 45 TO 50 DGR 
RANGE. 

WL HAVE A CHC OF SHWRS ACRS THE FAR N WED NGT WITH WRMFNT JUST TO 
OUR N. WITH WAA CONTG...THINK TEMPS WL DROP OFF JUST A BIT OR RMN 
STEADY SO WL GO A LTL WRMR THAN FWC TMPS FOR LOWS. GOOD WAA AGN ON 
THU WITH BEST FORCING RMNG TO OUR W AND N. WL KP THINGS DRY OVR ALL 
BUT FAR N WHR WL CONT WITH LOW CHC POPS. RAIN SHUD THEN OVRSPRD FA 
THUR NGT INTO FRI. DECENT LLVL JET ACRS FA ON THU WITH GOOD WAA. WL 
NUDGE UP GUID TMPS A BIT AND INDICT BREEZY CONDS.

.ILN...NONE.

LOTT

1137 AM EST TUE FEB 6 2001

BACK EDGE OF PCPN PRETTY MUCH THRU NW 1/2 OF FA. PCPN NOW LOOKS TO 
BE MAINLY RAIN ALG AND S OF THE OHIO RIVER. WL UPDATE ZONES TO DROP 
PCPN FM THE NW AND TWEAK RAIN/SNOW WORDING ELSEWHR. WITH WIND NOW  
SHIFTING ARND TO THE W THINK WRMR TMPS TO THE S WL HAV A TUF TIME 
MAKING IT N. WL GO AHD AND LWR TMPS A CAT OR SO MOST AREAS. 

.ILN...NONE.

INDICTG BTWN A HALF INCH AND AN INCH OF ACCUM. MDL THCKNSS 
SUGGESTING MAINLY RAIN BUT 12Z ILN SNDG SHWG DECENT DRY LAYER OFF

WORDING THEN MIXING/CHANGING OVR TO RAIN THIS AFTN. ALSO INCLUDED

FXUS61 KILN 060745
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
245 AM EST TUE FEB 6 2001

THANKS TO IND FOR COORD.

QUESTION WITH FCST WILL BE DEALING MAINLY WITH CHANGEOVER AND ENDING 
OF PRECIP THIS MORNING AND ONSET OF PRECIP WITH APPROACH OF DIGGING 
PLAINS TROF LATE THIS WEEK. RIGHT NOW...H5 RIDGE OVER ERN U.S. 
TOWARDS THE END OF THE WEEK LOOKS TO HOLD BACK PRECIPITATION EVENT 
THURSDAY AND AVN MODEL HAS SLOWED DOWN A BIT TO ACCOMODATE THIS 
SOLN. WILL LIKELY HOLD OFF PRECIPITATION UNTIL FRIDAY...AND GO WITH 
LOW CHANCE POPS OVERNIGHT THURS IN NWRN CWA. 

TODAY WILL SEE PREICP ENDING FROM WEST TO EAST WITH VORT SLIDING TO 
THE EAST IN NEAR ZONAL H5 FLOW. EXPECT PRECIP TO CHANGE OVER IN 
SOUTH DURING THE MORNING...AND COULD START OUT AS RAIN MIXED WITH 
SNOW IN THE SOUTHWEST. ALL SNOW EXPECTED NORTHWEST...AND DRYING CUTS 
OFF PRECIP PRETTY QUICKLY IN THE MORNING HERE...EARLY AFTERNOON FOR 
REST OF CWA. WARMING SHOULD NOT AFFECT PTYPE OVER NORTHWEST AS ANY 
TEMP MODIFICATION WILL OCCUR AFTER END OF PRECIP.

ASIDE FROM TEMPS TONIGHT WITH FAIRLY DECENT RADIATIONAL COOLING... 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS SHOULD BE PRETTY HARD TO IMPROVE UPON. WILL CUT 
OVERNIGHT MOS NUMBERS AND FAVOR THE MAV...WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS 
KICKING IN WED PM FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK IN GOOD WAA. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EST MON FEB 5 2001

AREAS OF DZ/FLURRIES DISSIPATING AS THEY HEAD THRU AREA. DRYING 
OCCURS IN LOWER LVLS BRIEFLY AS FA IS AFFECTED BY RDG TO THE S...BUT 
AS NXT AREA OF LIFT APCHS FM UPR MDWEST TNGT...ATMOS MOISTENS BACK 
UP BY 06Z. WHILE IT TAKES AWHILE FOR ATMOS TO MOISTEN UP AGAIN... 
THERE IS LLVL MSTR AND SOME ISENT LIFT (290K) AVAILABLE. SO WL START 
OFF PCPN OVERNIGHT AS -SN...WTH -SN MIXING WTH AND CHANGING TO -RN 
FOR TUE. 

LIM AREA COULD SEE AROUND AN INCH TNGT...WTH OTHER AREAS JUST TRACE 
AMOUNTS. AFTER CHANGE OVER TO RN...SUBSIDENCE AND PARTIAL CLEARING 
WORKS IN FOR TUE NT. 

NOICE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES IN ETA/AVN ESPCY...WTH AVN A LTL 
SLOWER WTH PCPN ON TUE AND NEXT BATCH OF PCPN WORKING IN WED NIGHT 
WTH ADVANCING WARM FNT. ETA NOW BRINGS PCPN IN BY 00Z THU...WHILE 
AVN HOLDS THINGS BACK. WL COMPROMISE BTWN THE TWO.

THU AND ESPCY FRI WL BRING WARMING TMPS AND AN OPEN GULF. SHUD BE NR 
50 TO PERHAPS EVEN 55 IN S FOR THU/FRI...WTH PLENTY OF RAIN BY FRI. 
RAIN COULD CHANGE TO SNOW LATE...WTH SOME LINGERING -SHSN EARLY 
SATURDAY BUT AN OTHERWISE DRY BUT COLDER WEEKEND.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 050721
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 AM EST MON FEB 5 2001

SHORTWAVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY THIS MORNING SWINGS TO NEW ENGLAND 
BY 00Z. SURFACE LOW OVER MICHIGAN WILL CONTINUE TO WEAKEN TODAY AS 
THE ENERGY IS TRANSFERED TO STRENGTHENING LOW OFF THE EAST COAST. 
STILL SOME LIGHT SNOW ACROSS INDIANA ATTM...SO 30 POPS CURRENTLY IN 
THE FORECAST LOOK GOOD.  SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS IN BY AFTERNOON.

NEXT SHORTWAVE SPEEDS OUR WAY LATE TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  ETA IS 
ONCE AGAIN THE MOST AGGRESSIVE WITH THE QPF TONIGHT...PUSHING IT AS 
FAR EAST AS OH/PA BORDER BY 12Z. ATMOSPHERE THAT FAR EAST IS PRETTY 
DRY AT THE LOWER LEVELS...SO WILL KEEP IT DRY IN CENTRAL OHIO 
TONIGHT.  WILL ADD A MENTION OF SNOW IN CMH AND CVG ZONES TUESDAY 
MORNING BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN.

CURRENT FORECAST CLOSE TO MOS FIRST 3 PERIODS.  NGM MOS CLOUDS OF 
OVERCAST FOR TUESDAY NIGHT LOOK WAY OVERDONE WITH THE CLEARING 
EXPECTED. PREFER THE COOLER MAV NUMBERS.   

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

845 PM EST SUN FEB 4 2001

SHORT WAVE ROUNDING BASE OF 500 MB CUTOFF IS ENTERING OUR REGION 
THIS EVENING. SHOWERS ASSOC WITH SFC TROF OVER WESTERN INDIANA ARE 
WEAKENING AS THEY APPROACH OUR AREA. BRIEF TSRA THAT WERE OCCURRING 
WITH TROF HAVE ENDED AS LIMITED DAYTIME HEATING HAS WANED. EXPECT 
ACTIVITY TO WEAKEN FURTHER AS PER MESOETA OMEGA AND QPF BUT IT WILL 
STILL WARRANT SCT/CHC POPS.   

WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND TO ADJUST PRECIP AND 
WINDS. WILL GO WITH SCT/CHC RAIN SHOWERS MIXING WITH 
SLEET/FZRA...THEN CHANGING TO SNOW LATE AS TEMPS DROP BELOW 32.

021 
FXUS61 KILN 041907
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
208 PM EST SUN FEB 4 2001

MAIN FCST CHALLENGE THIS AFTN REVOLVES ARND PRECIP CHC/S AND TYPE 
OVRNGT. MODELS GENERALLY SIMILAR WITH MAIN FEATURES WITH UPR LO OVR 
NRN IL OPENING UP AND TRACKING E THRU GRTLKS TNGT/MON. S/WV TO 
ROTATE ARND THE BASE OF THE TROF INTO INTO LWR OH VLY PROVIDING PVA
TO SRN OH THRU THE EVE. AXIS OF DEEPER MSTR AND AREA OF SHWRS EVIDENT
ON SATL/RADAR OVER ERN IN ASSOCIATED WITH THIS S/WV. LO LVL CNVRGC 
WEAKENS AND PIVOTS THRU FA DURG EARLY EVE. WL MONITOR RADAR TRENDS 
AND WL LKLY MENT EVE SHWRS IN ERN SECTIONS. 

DRY SLOT EVIDENT ON SATL IN WAKE OF THIS 1ST S/WV ACRS SE IL AND 
WRN IN. NXT S/WV DROPPING INTO W CNTRL IL. THIS FEATURE TO BEGIN 
AFFECTING WRN SECTIONS ARND 06Z AND ERN SECTIONS LT. IN CAA PTN
THICKNESSES FALL AND BOUNDARY COOLS. ETA FCST SOUNDINGS WUD SUGG
POTENTIAL FOR SNW/IP ACRS CNTRL AND N AND ZR/IP/SN IN THE S. EVENT
EXPECTED TO LGT AND WL WORD AS SUCH. BASED ON UPSTREAM TEMPS GUID 
VALUES LOOK REASONABLE TNGT.

TRENDS ARE A LTL FASTER WITH UPR SYS EXITING THE AREA. WL GO WITH
LO POP CHC AND MAINLY MRNG WORDING WITH SFC CDFNT SWINGING THRU.
PRECIP TYPE SHUD CHANGE TO SNW ALTHO SOME LGT FREEZING RN/DRIZZLE
IS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION.     
  

IN QUICK FLO NXT SYS TO DROP FM NRN PLNS INTO UPR MS VLY MON NGT.
294K SFC SHWS GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT DVLPG WITH 40-45KT NR CROSS 
CONTOUR FLO DVLPG. LOWEST PRES COND DEFF ACRS THE FAR NW LT. WL
MENT LO POP CHC OF LGT SNW LT AND A FW FLURRIES IN MIAMI VLY TOWARD
SUNRISE TUE. 

S/WV WEAKENS WITH BEST DYNAMICS AND MSTR TO OUR N ON TUE. WL CONT
CHC POPS. IN WAA PTN CRITICAL THICKNESSES SHIFT N WITH PRECIP THREAT 
CHANGING TO RAIN ACRS ENTIRE AREA. WL TREND POPS FM 50 IN THE N TO
30 S. NO MAJOR DIFF IN TEMPS BUT HV STAYED CLOSER TO SLIGHTLY COOLER 
MAV NUMBERS TUE. 


.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

PRECIP TYPE SHUD CHANGE TO SNW ALTHO SOME LGT FREEZING RN/DRIZZLE
IS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION.     
  

IN QUICK FLO NXT SYS TO DROP FM NRN PLNS INTO UPR MS VLY MON NGT.
294K SFC SHWS GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT DVLPG WITH 40-45KT NR CROSS 
CONTOUR FLO DVLPG. LOWEST PRES COND DEFF ACRS THE FAR NW LT. WL
MENT LO POP CHC OF LGT SNW LT AND A FW FLURRIES IN MIAMI VLY TOWARD
SUNRISE TUE. 

S/WV WEAKENS WITH BEST DYNAMICS AND MSTR TO OUR N ON TUE. WL CONT
CHC POPS. IN WAA PTN CRITICAL THICKNESSES SHIFT N WITH PRECIP THREAT 
CHANGING TO RAIN ACRS ENTIRE AREA. WL TREND POPS FM 50 IN THE N TO
30 S. NO MAJOR DIFF IN TEMPS BUT HV STAYED CLOSER TO SLIGHTLY COOLER 
MAV NUMBERS TUE. 


.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
956 AM EST SUN FEB 4 2001

FCST CHALLENGE THIS MRNG REVOLVES ARND PRECIP CHC/S AND TYPE TDA.
UPR LO OVR MID MS VLY TO CONT TO DROP SE ACRS NRN IL TDA AND THEN
OPEN UP AND PIVOT E THRU SRN GRTLKS OVRNGT/MON. 

S/WV TO ROTATE ARND THE BASE OF THIS TROF INTO LWR OH VLY PROVIDING
PVA TO SRN OH THIS AFTN. LIFT IS VRY WEAK AND ASSOCIATED WITH 
MID LVL FORCING ERLY TDA AND THEN DEEPENS LT THIS AFTN ALTHO REMAINS
WK. 12Z ILN SOUNDING SHWS DRY AMS BLO 700 MB WITH FREEZING LVL AT
3.4K FT AGL. GIVEN THIS SOUNDING XPCT AT BEST A FW SPRINKLES IN THE
S THIS MRNG WITH A LO CHC OF A LGT SHWR THIS AFTN WHEN BETTER FORCING
COMES INTO PLAY. ACRS THE FAR NRN MIAMI VLY...MESO-ETA FCST SOUNDING 
WUD SUGG SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES WITH POTENTIAL FOR FREEZING DRZL
TOWARD SUNSET.   

ENERGY BLOCK METHOD APPLIED TO 12Z SOUNDING YIELDS A HI IN THE MID 40S
AT ILN. TEMPS HV WARMED UP QUICKLY TO 38 DEG AT ILN WITH SHALLOW 
INVERSION IN PLACE. WL MAKE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPS GOING
SLGTLY WRMR. ALSO...WL UPDATE DROPPING BACK POPS A LTL IN THIS
AFTN PERIOD ACRS MIAMI VLY AND CMH GRPS.

.ILN...NONE.

067 
FXUS61 KILN 040719
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 AM EST SUN FEB 4 2001

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS CYCLE IN DROPPING WEAK CLIPPER 
SOUTHEAST FROM MINNESOTA INTO EAST CENTRAL IL BY 00Z TONIGHT. SOME 
SCATTERED PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED TO ACROSS THE FA AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM...BUT BETTER MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE BEHIND IT. CHANCE OF 
MIXED PRECIPITATION APPEARS OVER IN THE SOUTHWEST AS SURFACE 
TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN ABOVE FREEZING.  WILL LEAVE THE MENTION IN 
THE EAST EARLY.  HIGH TEMPERATURES STILL IN QUESTION FOR TODAY.  
HIGHS YESTERDAY TO OUR SOUTHWEST WERE IN THE LOWER TO MID 40S. MESO 
ETA SURFACE TEMPERATURES WERE 7 DEGREES TO COOL AT 06Z...AND ADDING 
THE 7 TO ITS TEMPERATURES AT 21Z WOULD GIVE LOWER TO MID 40S.  THIS 
MATCHES WELL WITH COOLER MAV NUMBERS.

UPPER TROF SWINGS ACROSS FA TONIGHT. AT THE SURFACE...THE LOW OVER 
THE OHIO VALLEY WEAKENS IN FAVOR OF EAST COAST LOW. CHANCE POPS WITH 
RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW LOOKS GOOD. WEAK SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE 
REGION BY MONDAY AFTERNOON.  WILL TRY TO LIMIT MENTION OF SNOW TO 
MORNING HOURS.  THEN FAST MOVING SYSTEM TRIES TO SPREAD SNOW BACK 
INTO THE FA AFTER 06Z MONDAY NIGHT.  WILL ADD CHANCE OF SNOW IN THE 
WEST.

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.


.ILN...NONE.

SITES

FCST CHALLENGE THIS AFTN CENTERED ON PRECIP TYPE AND CHC/S THRU THE 
PD. MODELS ARE GENERALLY SIMILAR WITH UPR LO BEING CARVED OUT AS 
S/WV ENERGY OVR NRN PLNS DROPS SEWD FM THE NRN PLNS INTO THE MID MS 
VLY. THIS UPR LO OVR MID MS VLY 12Z SUN TO TRACK E ACRS SRN GRTLKS
PRECIP WL BE MAINLY LIGHT WITH THIS SYS DUE TO LIMITED MSTR.

ISENT LIFT DVLPS TNGT AHD OF THIS APPROACHING SYS PROVIDING LIFT
ACRS THE OH VLY. XPCT TO SEE AN INCRS IN MAINLY MID LVL CLDS OVRNGT. 
WL ONLY MENT CHC OF MEASUREABLE LGT SNW IN FAR NW SECTION WHERE BEST
MSTR WL EXIST. WL MENT A FEW FLURRIES PSBL IN CMH ZONE BUT WL KEEP
CVG AND PMH AREAS DRY. 

TEMP WISE...XPCT TO SEE ERLY LOWS WITH READINGS RISING TOWARD 
SUNRISE DUE TO WAA IN SRLY FLO. 

S/WV TO ROTATE ARND UPR LO THRU OH VLY ON SUN. BIG QUESTION IS 
PRECIP TYPE. ETA IS CONSIDERABLY COLDER THAN NGM. HAVE GONE COOLER
THAN FWC GUID WITH TEMPS CLOSER TO MAV NUMBERS. THICKNESS SCHEMES
SHWS A WARM UP WITH PRECIP LKLY CHANGING TO RAIN ACRS MST OF CWA 
DURG AFTN. WL PLACE BEST POPS IN THE N WHERE DEEPEST MSTR IS 
EXPECTED. WL TREND POPS FM 60 ACRS NRN MIAMI TO 30 PERCENT IN PMH 
GROUP.                 

AS THE COLD FRONT TRACKS E THU THE AREA SUN NGT RN SHUD CHANGE
TO SNW. WL CONT CHC OF SNW MON WITH UPR TROF AXIS OVR OH. BEST
CHC APPEARS TO BE IN ERN SECTIONS.    

.ILN...NONE.


@RUKWBCe3KDENFXUS61 KILN 030751
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 AM EST SAT FEB 3 2001

FORECAST FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY HAS SUDDENLY BECOME A LOT MORE 
COMPLICATED.  BUT BEFORE WE GET TO THAT...LETS TAKE CARE OF TODAY. 
AREA OF LIGHT SNOW ACROSS IL/WESTERN INDIANA IS IN AN AREA OF STRONG 
WAA...IN COMBINATION WITH PVA FROM VORT MAX DROPPING SE.  VORT IS 
FORECAST TO BE ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN COUNTIES BY 12Z...BUT IT HAS 
OUTRUN THE WAA WHICH WILL STILL BE ACROSS INDIANA. THEREFORE DONT 
EXPECT THE SNOW TO REACH US...ONLY CLOUDS FROM THE SYSTEM.

AM STRUGGLING WITH HOW MUCH CLOUDS WE WILL HAVE TODAY. SATELLITE 
LOOP IS SHOWING CLEARING ACROSS IL BEHIND THE VORT.  THE RH FIELDS 
ON THE MODELS ARENT OVERLY IMPRESSIVE EITHER. I HATE TO FLIP FLOP ON 
THE FORECAST...BUT FEEL THAT MOSTLY CLOUDY WILL BE TOO PESSIMISTIC.  
WILL GO WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY THIS MORNING...MOSTLY CLOUDY THIS 
AFTERNOON. MOS TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO THE CURRENT FORECAST...SO NO 
ARGUMENTS THERE. 

NOW BACK TO TONIGHT.  THE ETA IS THE MOST AGGRESSIVE IN PUSHING QPF 
INTO THE WEST BY 06Z AND ACROSS THE ENTIRE FA BY 12Z. THE 00Z 
MESO-ETA DELAYS THE QPF TIL AFT 09Z AND KEEPS IT ONLY ACROSS THE 
NORTH...WHILE THE AVN AND NGM HOLD OFF THE QPF TIL AFTER 12Z. IF QPF 
DOES MAKE IT IN OVERNIGHT THE PRECIP TYPE IS IN DOUBT. THE ETA 
PUSHES THE 850 MB 0C LINE AS FAR NORTH AS DAY BY 06Z. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS ARE SHOWING A LARGE ELEVATED AREA OF ABOVE ZERO TEMPS A 
COUPLE THOUSAND FEET THICK.  THE 1000-850 THICKNESS WOULD SUGGEST 
THAT THE PRECIP WOULD BE RAIN FOR A GOOD PART OF THE NIGHT.   OF 
COURSE WITH SURFACE TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING THAT WOULD MEAN 
FREEZING RAIN.  HOWEVER BUFKIT IS INDICATING THAT THE PRECIP WOULD 
BE MOSTLY SNOW...SUGGESTING THAT THE COLD AIR AT LOW LEVELS WOULD BE 
DEEP ENOUGH TO CHANGE THE RAIN BACK TO SNOW.

WILL GO WITH THE COMPROMISE MESO-ETA AND WILL KEEP THE MENTION OF 
PRECIP ONLY IN THE NORTH TONIGHT. WILL CHANGE THE CURRENT FORECAST 
OF CHANCE OF SNOW AFTER MIDNIGHT...TO A CHANCE OF SNOW...SLEET OR 
FREEZING RAIN. WILL THAN HAVE TO MENTION A MIX IN THE MORNING IN THE 
SOUTH.  LOOKING AT THE THICKNESSES...I HAVE HAVING A HARD TIME 
BELIEVING THAT THE WE WILL MAKE IT AS WARM NGM MOS THINKS ON SUNDAY. 
WILL GO WITH THE MAV TEMPERATURES ALTHOUGH I HAVE MY DOUBTS THAT WE 
WILL EVEN GET THAT WARM. WILL HAVE THE PRECIP CHANGING TO ALL RAIN 
IN THE AFTERNOON FOR ALL LOCATIONS. WILL GO WITH A SWITCH BACK TO 
SNOW SUNDAY NIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES






@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 021928
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST FRI FEB 2 2001

ARCTIC COLD FRONT WAS EAST OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON.

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS AREAS OF CUMULUS CLOUD DEVELOPMENT 
...MOST CONCENTRATED IN WRN AND CNTRL OH.  CUMULUS CLOUDS SHOULD 
GRADUALLY DISSIPATE THIS EVENING AS LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY DECREASES 
AFTER SUNSET.  FORECAST PROBLEM FOR TONIGHT WILL BE THE ARRIVAL OF 
MAINLY MID AND HIGH LVL MSTR FROM THE NRN PLAINS STATES.  THE MSTR 
IS AN ASSOCIATION WITH MID LVL WAA AND WEAK S/WV ENERGY IN THE NW 
FLOW ALOFT.  THE MSTR...IN THE FORM OF AC/CI...WILL STOP ANY EARLY 
EVENING COOLING.  IN FACT...TEMPERATURES WILL PROBABLY ACTUALLY 
SLOWLY RISE OVERNIGHT ONCE THE AC BECOMES ESTABLISHED.  THE 
DISSIPATION OF THE CUMULUS AND THE ARRIVAL OF THE AC/CI WILL MAKE 
FOR A DIFFICULT CLOUD WORDING TONIGHT.  WILL EITHER MENTION 
INCREASING CLOUDS WHERE IT IS MAINLY CLEAR NOW AND VARIABLE CLOUDS 
WHERE CUMULUS IS LOCATED.  WITH THE TRICKY CLOUD FCST...WILL STICK 
CLOSE TO MOS VALUES FOR EARLY NIGHT TIME LOWS.

ON SATURDAY...S/WV ENERGY NOW PUSHING INTO THE PAC NW WILL DIVE INTO 
THE NRN PLAINS STATES.  A SFC WARM FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE 
REGION.  ANOTHER BATCH OF MAINLY MID AND HIGH LVL MSTR WILL MOVE OUT 
AHEAD OF THE S/WV AND SFC WARM FRONT.  THUS...WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY 
CLOUDY...ALTHOUGH A FEW PEAKS OF THE SUN WILL NOT BE OUT OF THE 
QUESTION...ESPECIALLY DURING THE LATE MORNING.  WITH A DEVELOPING 
SOUTH WIND...TEMPERATURES SHOULD CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 20S AND LOWER 
30S.  MOS IS DEPICTING THIS...AND THIS IS ALSO VERIFIED WITH LOW LVL 
THICKNESS SCHEMES.

BY SATURDAY NIGHT...THE AFOREMENTIONED PAC S/WV AND SFC WARM FRONT 
WILL BE MOVING INTO THE REGION.  AN INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL 
MSTR...ALONG WITH STRONGER LOW LVL WAA/ISENTROPIC LIFT...MAY 
GENERATE SOME LIGHT SNOW...MAINLY ACRS THE NRN CWFA.  WILL INTRODUCE 
A CHANCE OF SNOW THERE...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
FALL SLIGHTLY OR HOLD STEADY AS THE WARM FRONT PASSES THROUGH.

ON SUNDAY...THE REGION REMAINS UNDER AN H5 TROF WITH SOME MORE 
SHEARED OUT VORTICITY MOVING THROUGH THE FLOW.  I DO NOT SEE ANY 
TREMENDOUS FOCUS FOR WIDESPREAD PCPN ATTM.  HOWEVER...WITH CYCLONIC 
FLOW ALOFT...I CAN NOT RULE OUT A CHC FOR PCPN.  ANY PCPN THAT FALLS 
WILL BE IN THE FORM OF RAIN AS SFC TEMPS RISE INTO THE UPPER 30S TO 
LOWER 40S.  A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT 
...CONTINUING A CHC OF RAIN/SNOW.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN










517 
FXUS61 KILN 021928
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST FRI FEB 2 2001

ARCTIC COLD FRONT WAS EAST OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON.

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS AREAS OF CUMULUS CLOUD DEVELOPMENT 
...MOST CONCENTRATED IN WRN AND CNTRL OH.  CUMULUS CLOUDS SHOULD 
GRADUALLY DISSIPATE THIS EVENING AS LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY DECREASES 
AFTER SUNSET.  FORECAST PROBLEM FOR TONIGHT WILL BE THE ARRIVAL OF 
MAINLY MID AND HIGH LVL MSTR FROM THE NRN PLAINS STATES.  THE MSTR 
IS AN ASSOCIATION WITH MID LVL WAA AND WEAK S/WV ENERGY IN THE NW 
FLOW ALOFT.  THE MSTR...IN THE FORM OF AC/CI...WILL STOP ANY EARLY 
EVENING COOLING.  IN FACT...TEMPERATURES WILL PROBABLY ACTUALLY 
SLOWLY RISE OVERNIGHT ONCE THE AC BECOMES ESTABLISHED.  THE 
DISSIPATION OF THE CUMULUS AND THE ARRIVAL OF THE AC/CI WILL MAKE 
FOR A DIFFICULT CLOUD WORDING TONIGHT.  WILL EITHER MENTION 
INCREASING CLOUDS WHERE IT IS MAINLY CLEAR NOW AND VARIABLE CLOUDS 
WHERE CUMULUS IS LOCATED.  WITH THE TRICKY CLOUD FCST...WILL STICK 
CLOSE TO MOS VALUES FOR EARLY NIGHT TIME LOWS.

ON SATURDAY...S/WV ENERGY NOW PUSHING INTO THE PAC NW WILL DIVE INTO 
THE NRN PLAINS STATES.  A SFC WARM FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE 
REGION.  ANOTHER BATCH OF MAINLY MID AND HIGH LVL MSTR WILL MOVE OUT 
AHEAD OF THE S/WV AND SFC WARM FRONT.  THUS...WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY 
CLOUDY...ALTHOUGH A FEW PEAKS OF THE SUN WILL NOT BE OUT OF THE 
QUESTION...ESPECIALLY DURING THE LATE MORNING.  WITH A DEVELOPING 
SOUTH WIND...TEMPERATURES SHOULD CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 20S AND LOWER 
30S.  MOS IS DEPICTING THIS...AND THIS IS ALSO VERIFIED WITH LOW LVL 
THICKNESS SCHEMES.

BY SATURDAY NIGHT...THE AFOREMENTIONED PAC S/WV AND SFC WARM FRONT 
WILL BE MOVING INTO THE REGION.  AN INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL 
MSTR...ALONG WITH STRONGER LOW LVL WAA/ISENTROPIC LIFT...MAY 
GENERATE SOME LIGHT SNOW...MAINLY ACRS THE NRN CWFA.  WILL INTRODUCE 
A CHANCE OF SNOW THERE...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
FALL SLIGHTLY OR HOLD STEADY AS THE WARM FRONT PASSES THROUGH.

ON SUNDAY...THE REGION REMAINS UNDER AN H5 TROF WITH SOME MORE 
SHEARED OUT VORTICITY MOVING THROUGH THE FLOW.  I DO NOT SEE ANY 
TREMENDOUS FOCUS FOR WIDESPREAD PCPN ATTM.  HOWEVER...WITH CYCLONIC 
FLOW ALOFT...I CAN NOT RULE OUT A CHC FOR PCPN.  ANY PCPN THAT FALLS 
WILL BE IN THE FORM OF RAIN AS SFC TEMPS RISE INTO THE UPPER 30S TO 
LOWER 40S.  A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT 
...CONTINUING A CHC OF RAIN/SNOW.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN











@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 021434
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
930 AM EST FRI FEB 2 2001

ARCTIC COLD FRONT WAS NOW EAST OF THE CWFA AT 14Z.

THE SNOW ASSOCD WITH THE ARCTIC FRONT SHOULD BE OUT OF THE CWFA 
AROUND 1030 AM THIS MORNING.  AFTER THAT...SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY 
CLOUDY.  THE BIG FCST PROBLEM FOR THIS AFTN WILL BE THE CHC/S FOR 
FLURRIES AND TEMPS.  LOOKING AT THE 06Z MESOETA...LOW LEVEL FLOW 
FROM 925 MB TO 850 MB REMAINS SHEARED ACRS THE REGION.  AS A 
RESULT...I AM NOT EXPECTING ANY LAKE MICHIGAN SNOW BANDS TO OCCUR 
THIS FAR SOUTH.  HOWEVER...WITH FCST MODEL SOUNDINS SHOWING LOW 
LEVEL INSTABILITY AND SOME MSTR FROM LAKE MICHIGAN FROM 925 MB TO 
850 MB...A FEW RENEGADE FLURRIES ARE NOT OUT OF THE 
QUESTION...ESPECIALLY ACRS THE NRN CWFA.  WILL MAKE LAST MINUTE 
DECISION ON WHETHER TO KEEP A CHC OF FLURRIES IN THE SOUTH.  TEMPS 
HAVE CONTINUED TO FALL THIS MORNING.  DAYTON WAS ALREADY DOWN TO 11 
DEGREES.  WITH THE A BRISK NORTHWEST WIND...THIS WAS CREATING WIND 
CHILL VALULES AROUND MINUS 20 DEGREES BELOW ZERO.  THIS IS RIGHT AT 
THE THRESHOLD FOR A WIND CHILL ADVISORY.  RIGHT NOW...I AM LEANING 
TOWARD ISSUING A SPS TO COVER THE WIND CHILL VALUES AROUND MINUS 
20.  THE HOPE IS THAT THE TEMPS WILL NOT DROP NO LOWER THAN 10 
DEGREES.  WITH THE FRESH 0.5 TO 1 INCH SNOW COVER...BELIEVE TEMPS IN 
THE WEST SHOULD HOLD IN THE 10 TO 15 DEGREE RANGE THE REST OF 
DAY...WITH TEMPS DROPPING INTO THE MID TEENS TO AROUND 20 EAST.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN








CLOSE TO ADVISORY CRITERIA...BUT SHOULD STAY JUST ABOVE IT.  ISSUED

618 
FXUS61 KILN 020738
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EST FRI FEB 2 2001

COLD FRONT IS JUST TO THE WEST OF THE FA. MODELS TAKE THE FRONT 
THROUGH THE FA BY 12Z...AND TIMING OF BACK EDGE OF SNOW TAKES IT TO 
THE EASTERN EDGE BY 12Z.  WILL LOWER POPS IN THE EAST AND WILL JUST 
MENTION FLURRIES.  IN THE WEST...THE SYNOPTIC SNOWS SHOULD HAVE COME 
TO AN END BY 12Z.  THE QUESTION IS WEATHER THE WEST WILL SEE ANY 
FLURRIES AS THE FLOW BECOMES NORTHWEST OFF THE LAKES.  WITH STRATO 
CU EXPECTED TO DEVELOP IN THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...WILL LEAVE 
FLURRIES IN THE WEST.

WITH STRONG COLD ADVECTION...DONT EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO REBOUND 
TODAY...SO 12Z TEMPS WILL BE THE HIGHS.  WILL TWEAK STARTING 
TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY DOWN A FEW DEGREES...BUT GENERAL TREND OF 
FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.

GOOD WAA ON SATURDAY AT 850...BUT DONT EXPECT ALL THAT WARMTH TO MIX 
DOWN.  WILL TRIM A FEW DEGREES OF THE CURRENT FORECAST...GOING 
CLOSER TO NEW MOS.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.


.ILN...NONE.

SITES

AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 PM EST THU FEB 1 2001

SHORT WAVE AND SFC COLD FRONT ABOUT TO ENTER OUR REGION. MESOETA 
DOING GOOD JOB WITH FRONTAL POSITION AND WITH LIGHT SNOW BEHIND 
FRONT. THOUGH FRONT BOASTS STRONG TEMP GRADIENT MOISTURE IS LOW. 
POST FRONTAL SNOW NOT TOO IMPRESSIVE WITH VISIBILITIES DROPPING ONLY 
TO 3SM IN ILLINOIS. AS FRONT MOVES THROUGH LATE TONIGHT...SCT -SN 
WILL RESULT IN MINIMAL ACCUMULATIONS BEFORE CLEARING SKIES ARRIVE 
EARLY FRIDAY. 

WILL UPDATE CURRENT FCST ONLY TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND ADJUST 
SKY CONDITIONS. OTHERWISE...LOW TEMPS IN TEENS WEST AND 20S EAST 
STILL LOOK GOOD SO NO CHANGES TO TEMP FCST ARE NECESSARY.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

714 
FXUS61 KILN 020258
AFDILN

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
955 PM EST THU FEB 1 2001

SHORT WAVE AND SFC COLD FRONT ABOUT TO ENTER OUR REGION. MESOETA



@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 011925
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EST THU FEB 1 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY WAS SHOWING LOW LEVEL CLOUDS SLOWLY MOVING 
OUT OF THE CWFA THIS AFTN.

AS WEAK WAA CONTINUES ALOFT THROUGH THIS EVENING...LOW LEVEL CLOUDS 
SHOULD MOVE OUT OF THE ERN CWFA.  THUS...THERE WILL BE A BREAK IN 
CLOUD COVER THIS EVENING (MOST LOCATIONS) BEFORE ARCTIC COLD FRONT 
MOVES INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT.

ALL MODELS ARE SIMILAR WITH THE SYNOPTIC FEATURES ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE ARCTIC COLD FRONT.  THE NGM MAY BE JUST A TAD FASTER.  ALL IN 
ALL...HAVE USED A BLEND OF THE ETA/AVN FOR THE TIMING.  MSTR NOT 
VERY IMPRESSIVE WITH THE FRONT.  HOWEVER...MODELS SHOW AN INCREASE 
IN PVA OVERNIGHT.  THUS...AREAS OF LIGHT SNOW SHOULD BREAK OUT ALONG 
AND JUST BEHIND THE FRONT IN THE WEST AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND LATE IN 
THE ERN CWFA.  A LIGHT DUSTING IS ONLY EXPECTED ATTM.

BIG QUESTION WILL BE HOW COLD IT WILL GET BY TOMORROW MORNING AND ON 
FRIDAY ONCE THE ARCTIC FRONT PASSES THROUGH.  TEMPERATURES WERE 
DROPPING INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS BEHIND THE FRONT AFTER PASSAGE.  
HOWEVER...THESE AREAS (IN THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND WESTERN GREAT 
LAKES) STILL HAVE SNOW COVER.  I AM NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH AT THIS 
TIME TO GO EXTREMELY COLD FOR LOWS BY FRIDAY MORNING ( BETWEEN 7 AM 
AND 9 AM WESTERN LOCATIONS) AS I AM NOT CERTAIN HOW THE LACK OF SNOW 
COVER WILL RETARD THE STRENGTH OF THE COLD PUSH.  FOR NOW...WILL 
KEEP THE GENERAL TEMPERATURE TREND WE HAVE BEEN EMPLOYING THE LAST 
FEW FORECASTS.  THE EVENING SHIFT SHOULD HAVE A BETTER FEEL OF 
WHETHER TO LOWER TEMPS BY THE MORNING HOURS DEPENDING HOW 
TEMPERATURES FALL ACRS THE SNOWLESS PARTS OF CNTRL IL AND IN.

ON FRIDAY...TEMPERATURES WILL SHOW LITTLE RECOVERY.  CYCLONIC FLOW 
ALOFT COMBINED WITH SOME MSTR FROM THE GREAT LAKES SHOULD RESULT IN 
A PARTLY CLOUDY DAY.  A FEW FLURRIES MAY FLOAT ACRS THE REGION FROM 
TIME TO TIME...MAINLY IN THE NORTH.

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...SFC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION.  
HOWEVER...A WEAK S/WV IN THE H5 NWLY FLOW ALOFT WILL SPREAD SOME MID 
AND HIGH CLOUDS INTO THE REGION.  THIS COMBINED WITH A DEVELOPING 
SOUTHWEST FLOW...HAVE DECIDED TO STICK CLOSE TO MOS TEMPERATURES.

SATURDAY WILL BE MOSTLY CLOUDY AS SOME LOW AND MID LVL MSTR CONTINUE 
TO STREAM ACRS THE REGION IN A WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT.  SOUTHWEST TO 
SOUTH FLOW SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RISE INTO THE LOWER AND MID 
30S.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

A PARTLY CLOUDY DAY.  A FEW FLURRIES MAY FLOAT ACRS THE REGION FROM 
TIME TO TIME...MAINLY IN THE NORTH.

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...SFC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION.  
HOWEVER...A WEAK S/WV IN THE H5 NWLY FLOW ALOFT WILL SPREAD SOME MID 
AND HIGH CLOUDS INTO THE REGION.  THIS COMBINED WITH A DEVELOPING 
SOUTHWEST FLOW...HAVE DECIDED TO STICK CLOSE TO MOS TEMPERATURES.

SATURDAY WILL BE MOSTLY CLOUDY AS SOME LOW AND MID LVL MSTR CONTINUE 
TO STREAM ACRS THE REGION IN A WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT.  SOUTHWEST TO 
SOUTH FLOW SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RISE INTO THE LOWER AND MID 
30S.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN










@RUKWBCe$KDENFXUS61 KILN 011436
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
935 AM EST THU FEB 1 2001

CWFA WILL REMAIN UNDER A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT FOR THIS AFTN.  

LOW CLOUDS CONTINUE ACRS THE REGION PER VISIBLE SATELLITE LOOP.  
BACK EDGE OF CLEARING IS NOW PUSHING INTO ERN INDIANA.  BASED ON 
SATELLITE TRENDS...THE WRN CWFA SHOULD BEGIN TO CLEAR BETWEEN 11 AM 
AND 1 PM.  FOR THE ERN AREAS...CLEARING MAY NOT OCCUR UNTIL MID 
AFTN.  REGARDLESS...CURRENT WORDING OF BECOMING MOSTLY SUNNY WEST 
AND PARTLY SUNNY EAST LOOK GOOD.  USING LATEST ILN SOUNDING AND 
MODEL SOUNDINGS...FCST TEMPS INTO THE UPPER 30S TO AROUND 40 ARE 
REASONABLE...WITH THE FAR EASTERN LOCATIONS REACHING THE LOWER END 
OF THE UPPER 30S TODAY (37).

AN ARCTIC FRONT WAS PUSHING THROUGH WISCONSIN AND IOWA THIS 
MORNING.  THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO TRAVERSE THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY 
TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING...BRINGING MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES AND 
PERHAPS A LITTLE LIGHT SNOW.

AN UPDATE WILL BE ISSUED THIS MORNING...MAINLY TO CLEAR UP WORDING 
AND ADJUST TIMING OF CLEARING TREND.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

KDENFXUS61 KILN 010810
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
310 AM EST THU FEB 1 2001

07Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE OVER LAKE SUPERIOR WITH A 
CDFNT TRAILING SWWD ACROSS MN INTO SD.  MUCH COLDER AIR WAS SWEEPING 
SEWD BEHIND THIS FRONT.  PLENTY OF LLVL MOISTURE REMAINED ACROSS THE 
OH VLY WITH CLEARING PUSHING TO THE IL-IN LINE.

LLVL WAA WL CONTINUE TO ERODE THE LOW CLOUDINESS THROUGH THE AM 
HOURS.  XPCT CLEARING TO DAY-CVG BY LATE AM AND THEN AT LEAST 
PARTIAL CLEARING TO CMH-PMH DURING THE PM HOURS. WL RAISE HIGHS A 
LITTLE VC DAY AND LOWER A LITTLE VC CMH.  OTHERWISE FWC TEMPS LOOK 
GOOD.

DECENT S/WV AND ASSOCIATED CDFNT WL DROP INTO FA OVERNIGHT.  XPCT 
SCT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA WITH A DUSTING POSSIBLE.  TEMPS WL 
FALL SHARPLY LATE TONIGHT REACHING VALUES A LITTLE LOWER THAN 
GUIDANCE PER META SFC TEMPS.  TEMPS MAY CONTINUE TO FALL THROUGH FRI 
AM HOURS BEFORE HOLDING STEADY OR A SLIGHT RECOVERY IN THE PM.  WL 
HANDLE WITH NEARLY STEADY WORDING.

WL CONTINUE FLURRIES ON FRI BUT WITH SECONDARY S/WV SWINGING THROUGH 
...A FEW SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE FOR THE NRN MIAMI VLY AND VC CMH.  WL 
USE BRISK WORDING AS STRONG CAA WL CREATE WINDS IN THE 15-25 MPH 
RANGE.  WIND CHILLS ARE EXPECTED TO FALL BELOW ZERO ON FRI.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

SNPL AT CMH WITH RADAR FILLING IN AND PRECIP MOVING TOWARD CENTRAL

518 
FXUS61 KILN 312045 CCA
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
216 PM EST WED JAN 31 2001

FAST MOVG S/WV TO AFFECT THE OH VLY THIS EVENING AND THEN ATTENTION 
SHIFTS TO SHARPENING TROF WHICH PIVOTS THRU GRTLKS THU NIGHT/FRI.
MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MAJOR UPR FEATURES.
 
INTIAL FOCUS IS CENTERED ON THE EFFECTS OF FAST MOVG S/WV OVR
MO WHICH IS EXPECTED TO TRACK E THRU THE OH VLY THIS EVE TO THE 
OH/PA LINE BY 06Z. BEST LIFT TO OCCUR ACRS SRN SECTIONS BTWN 00Z AND 
04Z. THE S HS OBSERVED SOME BREAKS IN LO CLDS WHICH HS ALLOWED TEMPS 
TO CLIMB TO NR 40F. FCST SOUNDING WUD SUGG THAT ALL BUT BNDRY LAYER 
WL BE BLO ZERO DEG C THIS EVE. FREEZING LVL APPEARS TO BE BTWN 1K 
AND 1.3K FT AGL ERLY THIS EVE. THIS SHUD ALLOW FOR ENOUGH MELTING SO 
THAT PRECIP WL FALL AS LIQUID AT ONSET ESPECIALLY ACRS THE S. WL SHW 
A MIX OF RN AND SNW IN THE S AND MAINLY SNW IN DAY GRP AND JUST 
FLURRIES IN NRN MIAMI VLY. HV NOT STRAYED TOO FAR FM GUID TEMPS TNGT.

IN THE WAKE OF THIS INITIAL S/WV SUBSIDENCE WL PREVAIL THU. XPCT
LO CLDS TO CLR WRN SECTIONS ERLY AND ERN SECTIONS BY LT MRNG. WL
OPT FOR BCMG PARTLY SUNNY WORDING. AGN HV STAYED CLOSE TO GUID
TEMPS.

NXT SYS WITH STRONG CDFNT TO SWEEP THRU OH THU NGT. XPCT 
A CHC OF SNW SHWRS ALONG AND BHD THIS ARCTIC FRONT. THERE ARE 
SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES...WITH ETA/NGM A LTL FASTER THAN AVN.
PREFER FASTER TIMING OF ARCTIC AIR WITH ETA TYPICALLY SUPERIOR 
HANDLING ARCTIC AIR. WL INTRO CHC OF SNW SHWRS ALL ZONES THU NGT.

XPCT TEMPS TO REAMIN NEARLY STEADY AND PERHAPS DROP OFF A LTL DURG
THE DAY FRI. WL CONT SNW FLURRIES IN COLD AIRMASS. LAKE EFFECT DOES
NOT APPEAR FAVORABLE FOR ILN/S CWA DUE TO HI SHEAR.   

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

WHICH MAY PROVIDE FAVORABLE COND FOR SOME VRY LGT PRECIP TDA. 
SOUNDING WUD SUGG THAT PRECIP WL LKLY BE FROZEN GIVEN LO FREEZING
LVL OF 299 FT AGL. WL INDICATE MIX WITH A FW SPRINKLES IN ERN
SECTIONS AND JUST FLRYS IN THE WEST.

LTST VIS SATL IMGRY SHWS EXTENSIVE SHIELD OF LO CLDS. SOME BREAKS ARE 
EVIDENT BUT THESE SHUD FILL IN GIVEN LO LVL LAPSE RATE BTWN SFC AND H8
ON 12Z ILN SOUNDING. ENERGY BLOCK METHOD APPLIED TO 12Z SOUNDING YIELDS
A HIGH OF 36.5 DEG. GIVEN LO LVL CAA TEMPS MAY STRUGGLE TO REACH 35 IN 
SOME LOCATIONS. WL ONLY MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO THE ZONES.

E OF FA. DO NOT XPCT TO CARRY A LEFTOVER WEATHER PERIOD THIS AM.

FA WL BE IN CYCLONIC FLOW TODAY SO XPCT TO KEEP THE SKIES CLOUDY. 
WEAK S/WVS WL MOVE THROUGH THE FLOW AND MAY CAUSE A FEW SPRINKLES 
AND FLURRIES.  DO NOT XPCT MUCH OF A TEMP RISE TODAY DUE TO 
EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER.

WL CARRY LOW CHC OF SNOW SHOWERS CVG-PMH AND FLURRIES DAY-CMH.  XPCT 
A DRY DAY ON THU BUT SKIES WL REMAIN CLOUDY.  NEXT S/WV WL DROP 
ACROSS THE LAKES ON THU NIGHT SO WL INCLUDE SOME FLURRIES.  VERY 
COLD H8 TEMPS WL MOVE ACROSS THE LAKES ON FRI CREATING SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS.  LOWERED TEMPS FROM PREVIOUS FCST FOR FRI-SAT DUE TO 
EXPECTED STRENGTH OF COLD PUSH. 

.ILN...NONE.

368 
FXUS61 KILN 310214
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 PM EST TUE JAN 30 2001

HIGHER DBZ ON RADAR NOT GOING ANYWHERE AND NOW WE ARE GETTING SLEET 
HERE AT THE OFFICE.  MIGHT HAVE TO MAKE A MINI ZONE OF CLINTON AND 
GREEN AND TO MENTION SLEET...THEN WILL ADD IT TO CENTRAL OHIO ALSO.

SURFACE TROF/FRONT HAS PUSHED THROUGH THE FA...BUT PRECIPITATION 
CONTINUES TO BE PERSISTENT ACROSS MUCH OF THE FA. IT APPEARS THAT 
THE PRECIPITATION IS ALIGNED ALONG THE VORT GRADIENT AT 500 MB.  
THIS GRADIENT DROPS SOUTH BUT VERY SLOWLY OVERNIGHT.  I HAVE THE 
FEELING THAT THE PRECIPITATION WILL LINGER ACROSS SOUTHERN PARTS OF 
THE FA ALL NIGHT LONG.  THIS BRINGS INTO PLAY A CHANGE OVER.  
ALREADY SEEING REPORTS OF SNOW AND UP ACROSS INDIANA.

SO...WILL BREAK OUT NORTHWEST ZONE AND WILL ONLY MENTION A 30 POP OF 
A LIGHT RAIN OR SNOW SHOWER.  WILL INCREASE POPS AS I GO SOUTH. WILL 
USE SOME SORT OF RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW WORDING.

ALSO LOOKING AT CURRENT TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE FA AND IN 
INDIANA...WILL NEED TO LOWER TEMPS A LITTLE TONIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.



.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
915 PM EST TUE JAN 30 2001

HIGHER DBZ ON RADAR NOT GOING ANYWHERE AND NOW WE ARE GETTING SLEET 
HERE AT THE OFFICE.  MIGHT HAVE TO MAKE A MINI ZONE OF CLINTON AND 
GREEN AND TO MENTION SLEET...THEN WILL ADD IT TO CENTRAL OHIO ALSO.

SURFACE TROF/FRONT HAS PUSHED THROUGH THE FA...BUT PRECIPITATION 
CONTINUES TO BE PERSISTENT ACROSS MUCH OF THE FA. IT APPEARS THAT 
THE PRECIPITATION IS ALIGNED ALONG THE VORT GRADIENT AT 500 MB.  
THIS GRADIENT DROPS SOUTH BUT VERY SLOWLY OVERNIGHT.  I HAVE THE 
FEELING THAT THE PRECIPITATION WILL LINGER ACROSS SOUTHERN PARTS OF 
THE FA ALL NIGHT LONG.  THIS BRINGS INTO PLAY A CHANGE OVER.  
ALREADY SEEING REPORTS OF SNOW AND UP ACROSS INDIANA.

SO...WILL BREAK OUT NORTHWEST ZONE AND WILL ONLY MENTION A 30 POP OF 
A LIGHT RAIN OR SNOW SHOWER.  WILL INCREASE POPS AS I GO SOUTH. WILL 
USE SOME SORT OF RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW WORDING.

ALSO LOOKING AT CURRENT TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE FA AND IN 
INDIANA...WILL NEED TO LOWER TEMPS A LITTLE TONIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.



.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 301901
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
200 PM EST TUE JAN 30 2001

NEW MODEL RUNS ARE COMPLEMENTING FCST FROM YESTERDAY. DONT EXPECT 
TOO MANY CHANGES FOR THE BIG PICTURE.

H5 LOW WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY TRANSLATE ENERGY UNDER WEAK RIDGE 
OVER NEW ENGLAND. SFC ENERGY WILL FOLLOW AND RE-DEVELOP AS IT HITS 
THE COAST. MEANWHILE, A NEBULOUS PIECE OF THE ENERGY SHOULD HANG 
TOUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES. WAITING FOR H5 TROF TO SPIN IT UP 
SOMETIME LATE THURSDAY/EARLY FRIDAY.

THIS ALONG WITH H8 COLD POOL SLOWLY OVERSPREADING THE FCST AREA WILL 
KEEP MOCLOUDY SKIES AND CHANCE FOR LIGHT PRECIP WITHOUT ANY OBVIOUS 
TRIGGER TO SUPPORT SHOWERS. WILL PROBABLY KEEP WORDING OF SPRINKLES 
AND FLURRIES OR GO WITH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS.

FOR TONIGHT, 1000-850 THICKNESSES BEGIN TO SUPPORT A CHANGEOVER TO 
SNOW JUST BEFORE DAYBREAK BUT DECREASING UPWARD MOTION OVERNIGHT 
SUGGESTS THAT ANY PRECIP OCCURRING WILL NOT BE MEASURABLE OR 
SIGNIFICANT.

TEMPERATURES BEHIND WEAK FRONT (MORE OF A WINDSHIFT) DROP TO THE MID 
30S FOR MUCH OF FCST AREA AND HOLD NEARLY STEADY UNDER MOCLOUDY 
SKIES TONIGHT. 

GENERAL FORECAST TREND OF SPRINKLES/FLURRIES AND SMALL DIURNALS 
TONIGHT AND A GRADUAL LOWERING OF TEMPS THROUGH FRIDAY. H8 THERMAL 
TROF BUILDS TO THE NORTH OF FCST AREA OVER NEXT DAY OR TWO AND 
FINALLY SWINGS THROUGH DURING THE DAY FRIDAY WITH WAA IN ITS WAKE. 
MAV GUIDANCE LOOKS QUITE REASONABLE AND WILL NOT STRAY MUCH FROM IT. 

MISILN OUT BY 3 PM.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

MODELS INDICATING FOR S/W ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK BAND OF SHOWERS IN 
WEST CENTRAL OHIO TO ROTATE NORTH INTO THE H5 LOW. AFTER THIS, 
ANOTHER SHOT OF LIGHT RAIN WITH EMBEDDED SHOWERS IS EXPECTED TO 
ENTER SWRN FCST AREA. VORTICITY ADVECTION THROUGH THE AFTERNOON IS 
NEUTRAL TO WEAKLY NEGATIVE, ALTHOUGH ANOTHER NOSE OF PVA IS EXPECTED 
TO ENTER ALONG THE OHIO RIVER AROUND 0Z. GOOD 50+KT H8 JET PROGGED 
TO REMAIN OVER SRN FCST AREA IN KY, AND RIGHT NOW ONLY SECTION OF 
FCST AREA THAT STANDS ANY CHANCE OF THUNDER IS THE SOUTH. ELEVATED 
LAPSE RATES ACTUALLY DECREASE SLIGHTLY AS THE DAY PROGRESSES, AND 
ARE BEST IN NORTHERN FCST AREA AHEAD OF VORT.

WILL REMOVE THUNDER FOR ALL AREAS AND UPDATE IF NECESSARY.

AS FOR POPS, WILL NOT REDUCE THE 90% THAT WE HAVE FOR WRN FCST AREA 
AS AN AREA OF RAIN IS ENCROACHING FROM THE SOUTHWEST. HOWEVER, I 
FEEL THAT CHARACTERISTIC OF THE DAY WILL NOT BE SHOWERS. WILL TRY TO 
WORD IT WITH MO CY WITH A PERIOD OR PERIODS OF SHOWERS. IN CENTRAL 
OH WILL MENTION MAINLY LATE.

.ILN...NONE.

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 300805
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
304 AM EST TUE JAN 30 2001

06Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED AN OCCLUDED FRONT ALONG THE OH-IN BORDER 
WHICH EXTENDED FROM A DEEP LOW OVER WRN IA.  A SECONDARY LOW 
PRESSURE WAS LOCATED OVER ERN MO.  THIS SECONDARY LOW WAS ASSOCIATED 
WITH A STRONG S/WV MOVG QUICKLY ACROSS MO-AR TOWARD THE OH VLY.  
ANOTHER BATCH OF -SHRA HAD DEVELOPED ALONG THE OCCLUDED BOUNDARY DUE 
TO FORCING FROM THE S/WV.

S/WV AND ASSOCIATED STEEP MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WL MOVE ACROSS FA FM 
12Z-15Z.  XPCT AN AREA OF SHRA/TSRA TO AFFECT FA DURING THE AM 
HOURS.  THE RAIN MAY DECREASE IN COVERAGE DURING THE MID TO LATE AM 
HOURS.  HOWEVER...ANOTHER S/WV IS PROGD TO MOVE INTO THE OH VLY 
DURING THE PM HOURS.  META SHOWS 50+ H8 JET ACROSS KY WITH THE 
ASSOCIATED CONVERGENCE ACROSS SRN OH.  THIS SHOULD LEAD TO 
WIDESPREAD SHRA WITH SOME TSRA FOR THE PM HOURS.  A NARROW AREA OF 
HEAVY RAIN IS POSSIBLE SOMEWHERE IN SWRN AND CNTRL OH.  WL CARRY CAT 
POPS ALL AREAS BUT VC PMH AND NRN KY.  BEST FORCING SHOULD BE NORTH 
OF THOSE AREAS.

XPCT WIDESPREAD SHRA BEFORE MIDNIGHT AND THEN ACTIVITY WL SHIFT TO 
THE E OF FA.  COLDER AIR SHOULD BEGIN TO FILTER INTO FA BUT NOT 
QUICKLY ENOUGH TO CHANGE RAIN TO SNOW.  PLENTY OF MOISTURE ON WED 
BUT LITTLE FORCING SO WL MENTION FLURRIES AND SPRINKLES.

MAV GUIDANCE LOOK MUCH BETTER THAN NGM MOS WHICH INDICATES FALLING 
TEMPS TODAY.  WL ALSO TREND TOWARD MAV VALUES TONIGHT AND WED.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

@RUKWBCe&KDENFXUS61 KILN 291838
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
138 PM EST MON JAN 29 2001

INTERESTING FORECAST IN STORE FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS WITH AN 
EXTREMELY UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN SHAPING UP FOR FCST AREA. 

MODELS DIVERGE ON WEDNESDAY WITH SEVERAL WEAK WAVES MOVING THROUGH 
THE H5 PATTERN. CURRENTLY, IT LOOKS LIKE A GENERAL TREND IS THE ONLY 
THING TO HANG THE FORECAST ON. THOUGH MODELS DIFFER IN STRENGTH AND 
POSITIONS OF SURFACE AND H5 FEATURES...THE BROAD PICTURE IS IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT. NAMELY...THE SURFACE BOMB OVER IOWA GETS UNDERCUT BY THE 
H5 CLOSED LOW AND WEAKENS CONSIDERABLY IN THE DOWNWARD MOTION ON NW 
SIDE. COLD FRONT WITH CATEGORICAL SHOWERS AHEAD OF IT SCREAMS PAST 
FCST AREA TONIGHT, AND SFC LOW REDEVELOPS SOMEWHERE IN THE GENERAL 
VISCINITY OF NEW YORK STATE. THEN IT MOVES TO SOMEWHERE IN NEW 
ENGLAND BY 12Z WED. H5 TROF AND LEFTOVER SFC FEATURES HANG TOUGH 
OVER GT LKS AND WAITS FOR NEXT S/W TO SWING DOWN AND FIRE UP A WHOLE 
NEW SFC LOW IN CENTRAL MICHIGAN OVERNIGHT WEDNESDAY. 

AT H8, THERMAL RIDGE PASSES OVER FCST AREA TONIGHT, WITH DECENT COLD 
POOL ENTERING OVERNIGHT TUESDAY. AS ENERGY IN ATMOSPHERE REMAINS IN 
GT LKS REGION, MOIST LOWER LEVELS WILL NOT HAVE A CHANCE TO GET 
SCOURED OUT. RH AND COLD AIR MAKE FOR CLOUDY. NEUTRAL TO WEAK COLD 
TEMP ADVECTION IN LOWER LEVELS BEHIND SFC FRONT WOULD IMPLY A SMALL 
DIURNAL, AND CLOUD COVER SAYS EVEN SMALLER. H8 TEMPS SLOWLY DECREASE 
THROUGH FRIDAY...AND WILL KEEP CLOUDS AND CHANCE FOR PRECIP THROUGH 
THIS TIME. THOUGH IT WONT BE A TOTAL WASH-OUT THROUGH THIS PERIOD, 
WILL TRY TO INDICATE SPRINKLES FOR SOME AREAS WHEN PRECIP IS LESS 
LIKELY (TUES NIGHT-WED).

AS FOR TEMPERATURES, WILL NOT DIVERGE MUCH FROM PREVIOUS FCST. WILL 
EXPECT TO HAVE AT LEAST ONE OR TWO PERIODS OF STEADY WORDING AS WELL.

IN SRN HALF OF FCST AREA TONIGHT...LIS GO TO ZERO OR A LITTLE 
NEGATIVE AROUND 12Z AND ETA SHOWING SOME WEAK SFC BASED CAPE ALONG 
WITH ELEVATED INSTABILITY. WILL THROW IN POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM 
WORDING. 

IN SHORT TERM, RAIN AND SHOWERS TAPERING FROM WEST TO EAST 
OVERNIGHT. NEAR STEADY OR EVEN SLOWLY RISING TEMPS. 

HOPE TO HAVE MIS AVAILABLE BTWN 2:30/3:00.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

FXUS61 KILN 290830
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EST MON JAN 29 2001

WIDESPREAD LIGHT -FZRA OVER NORTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES THIS MORNING.
AMOUNTS MAINLY TRACE TO .01 OVER CENTRAL OHIO...BUT FURTHER WEST 
INDICATIONS ARE PROBLEMS WERE A BIT WORSE.  MIE HAD .06 THE PAST 2 
HOURS...SO LOOKS LIKE MSRBL PCPN AND TRAVEL PRBLS TO CONTINUE.  
RADAR TRENDS INDC A SLOW NORTHWARD PROGRESSION TO THE BACK EDGE OF 
PCPN...AND TEMPS WARMING SLOWLY...SO CURRENT 13Z WSW EXPIRATION LKS 
PRETTY GUD.  MAY HV TO XTEND A COUNTY OR 2 BEFORE DAYBREAK...BUT 
WILL WAIT AND SEE.  OTHW LOOKS LIKE MAIN SLUG OF PCPN COMES IN LATE 
TDY AND ERLY TNGT AS UPPER SYS AND PLENTY OF GULF MSTR SPREAD NE 
INTO THE AREA.  WL CARRY LIKELY POPS WEST THIS AFTN...CHC POPS 
CENTRAL OHIO...AND LEAVE THE SE COUNTIES DRY.  GUIDANCE TEMPS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT IN THE SOUTH AND WL STICK CLOSE.  IN THE NORTH...SNOW 
CVR AND CLOUDS SHUD KEEP TEMPS BLO THE FWC NUMBERS...AND HV LEANED 
CLOSER TO THE COOLER MAV READINGS.

PLENTY OF MSTR WITH THIS SYS...WITH META BRINGING PWATS OVER 1 INCH 
ALL AREAS.  ALSO EXCELLENT FORCING FOR LIFT/DYNAMICS...WITH A STRONG 
LLVL JET NOSING INTO THE CWFA.  WL CARRY UNQUALIFIED POPS ALL 
ZONES...BUT LIKE IWX IDEA OF TAPERING PCPN OFF AFTER MIDNIGHT...AT 
LEAST IN THE WEST.  TEMPS SHUD HOLD JUST ABOUT STEADY TNGT...BUT WL 
ALLOW A BRIEF DIP WITH ALL THE PCPN AROUND.  STILL XPCT WARMER 
READINGS THAN THE FWC...CLOSER TO THE MAV/META SFC TEMPS.

ADDNL SHOT OF LIFT ON TUESDAY...AND WITH STRONG COOLING ALOFT WE 
ACTUALLY BECOME A LITTLE UNSTABLE.  WL CONT LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERY 
PCPN.

.ILN...WINTER WX ADV FOR OHZ026-034-035-042>046-051-052-054>056 
UNTIL 8 AM.

JOHNSTONE

INDICATIONS ARE PROBLEMS WERE A BIT WORSE.  MIE HAD .06 THE PAST 2 
HOURS...SO LOOKS LIKE MSRBL PCPN AND TRAVEL PRBLS TO CONTINUE.  
RADAR TRENDS INDC A SLOW NORTHWARD PROGRESSION TO THE BACK EDGE OF 
PCPN...AND TEMPS WARMING SLOWLY...SO CURRENT 13Z WSW EXPIRATION LKS 
PRETTY GUD.  MAY HV TO XTEND A COUNTY OR 2 BEFORE DAYBREAK...BUT 
WILL WAIT AND SEE.  OTHW LOOKS LIKE MAIN SLUG OF PCPN COMES IN LATE 
TDY AND ERLY TNGT AS UPPER SYS AND PLENTY OF GULF MSTR SPREAD NE 
INTO THE AREA.  WL CARRY LIKELY POPS WEST THIS AFTN...CHC POPS 
CENTRAL OHIO...AND LEAVE THE SE COUNTIES DRY.  GUIDANCE TEMPS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT IN THE SOUTH AND WL STICK CLOSE.  IN THE NORTH...SNOW 
CVR AND CLOUDS SHUD KEEP TEMPS BLO THE FWC NUMBERS...AND HV LEANED 
CLOSER TO THE COOLER MAV READINGS.

PLENTY OF MSTR WITH THIS SYS...WITH META BRINGING PWATS OVER 1 INCH 
ALL AREAS.  ALSO EXCELLENT FORCING FOR LIFT/DYNAMICS...WITH A STRONG 
LLVL JET NOSING INTO THE CWFA.  WL CARRY UNQUALIFIED POPS ALL 
ZONES...BUT LIKE IWX IDEA OF TAPERING PCPN OFF AFTER MIDNIGHT...AT 
LEAST IN THE WEST.  TEMPS SHUD HOLD JUST ABOUT STEADY TNGT...BUT WL 
ALLOW A BRIEF DIP WITH ALL THE PCPN AROUND.  STILL XPCT WARMER 
READINGS THAN THE FWC...CLOSER TO THE MAV/META SFC TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EST SUN JAN 28 2001

SFC ANLYS HAS LOW OVR SWRN MO AND TRENDING TWD NNE. SN AND SOME 
IP/ZR OVR IL AND NOW INTO CNTRL IN. ETA 18Z TIME STEP STILL 
FOLLOWING PRETTY GOOD WTH 18Z 6HR OBSERVED PCPN. DAY/LIM/CVG AREAS 
STAND A CHC FOR EVENING PCPN. BIG QUESTION IS WHERE IT WL BE 
ZR/IP/SN AND HOW LONG WL IT LAST. WL DIVIDE OUR WRN ZONES INTO EARLY 
PD THEN REST OF TNGT...AS THINKING THERE SHOULD BE A BIT OF A LET UP 
BEFORE THE GREATER CHC BEGINS. 

AS INENT LIFT BEGINS NR MDNGT...MAINLY AN IP TYPE SITUATION...WTH 
SOME PDS OF ZR. GIVEN THE PROGRESSION FURTHER E THAN ORIGINALLY 
THOUGHT...HAVE CHANGED INITIAL THINKING OF KEEPING ERN AREAS PCP 
FREE OVERNIGHT. WL BRING IN MTN OF CHC ZR IN S CNTRL AND IP AND 
PXBLY LT ZR IN CMH AREA MAINLY AFTR MIDNIGHT. 

PCP SHOULD BE FAIRLY LIGHT. WTH BEST MSTR MAINLY KEEPING W OF FA 
OVERNIGHT...AM NOT THINKING ENOUGH FOR ADVIS CRITERIA ON THE ZR 
ATTM. 12Z ILN SNDG HAD PWS OF 0.08...BUT UPR AND MID LAYERS ARE 
MOISTENING UP THRU TDY. EVEN WTH LOW LVLS STILL PRETTY DRY THRU 
EVENING...WHATS OUT THERE NOW IS FALLING FROM PRETTY HIGH LEVELS. 
MOST PCP STARTING BEFORE 10 PM SHOULD BE SN/IP INITIALLY WTH SOME 
EVAP COOLING. AS WE WARM OVERNIGHT AND MOISTEN UP LLVLS...MDL SNDGS 
INDICATING MAINLY IP WTH PDS OF ZR AFTR MIDNIGHT. 

AVN STILL HAS BEEN MOST CONSISTENT OF ETA/AVN/NGM...SO AM GOING TO 
KEEP WITH AN ETA/AVN MIX ON TIMING...AND ONLY SLIGHTLY UNDER ETA ON 
PCP AMTS. 

SOME LINGERING ZR IN THE AM ON MON...THEN CHANGING TO SHRA THROUGH 
MON. WL BRING IN CATEGORICAL FOR MON NT...AND KEEP MTN OF TSRA FOR 
MON NT AS LLJ OF 70KTS...ELEV INSTABY AND CONVGG COME TOGETHER OVR 
SRN FA. 


.ILN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EST SUN JAN 28 2001

HIGH CLOUDS CONT TO STREAM INTO THE CWFA FROM THE WEST...BUT WITH 
AREA DOWNSTREAM OF RIDGE AXIS THE CLOUDS WERE THINNING.  ALSO A BIT 
OF STRATUS OVER THE FAR NORTH...BUT XPCT THIS TO EXIT THE AREA ERLY 
THIS MORNING.  WL USE PTLY SUNNY ALL ZONES WITH FILTERED SUNSHINE.
SNOW CVR WHICH HAS HELPED VTA DROP TO 4 DEG THIS MORNING WL KEEP 
TEMPS RATHER COOL ACRS THE NORTH TDY.  FWC HAS MADE A DOWNWARD 
ADJUSTMENT...AND LINES UP FAIRLY WELL WITH THE META SFC TEMPS AND 
THE COOLER MAV NUMBERS.  WL STICK CLOSE TO THE FWC.

DPROG/DT ANALYSIS OF THE 00Z MODEL RUNS INDC THE ETA HAS BEEN 
GRADUALLY TRENDING TWRD THE STRONGER...FURTHER WEST...AND QUITE 
CONSISTENT AVN SOLN.  THE NGM REAMINS CONSISTENTLY MUCH WEAKER...AND 
AS A RESULT IS MUCH LESS AGGRESSIVE SPREADING PCPN AND WARMER AIR 
INTO THE RGN.  AS FAR AS QPF GOES...THRU 06Z THE NGM IS NOTICEABLY 
UNDERDONE OVER MO/KS...WITH THE AVN AND ETA MUCH BETTER.  GIVEN THE 
IMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF THE UPPER SYS ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY...A 
NOTICEABLE INFLUX OF GULF MSTR OVER TX...AND THE AFOREMENTIONED 
INITIAL QPF ISSUES HV LEANED TWRD AN AVN/ETA COMPROMISE THIS PKG.  

INITIAL BAND OF LIGHT PCPN DRIVEN BY ISENTROPIC LIFT DEPICTED OVER 
THE WESTERN CWFA AFTER MIDNIGHT.  06Z ETA MORE AGGRESSIVE...BUT 
GIVEN VERY DRY INITAL CONDS WL CONT TO MENTION PCPN ONLY IN THE 
WESTERN 2/3 OF THE CWFA.  MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST MAINLY -ZR...WITH 
SOME IP MIXED IN NORTH.  WITH CLOUDS AND STRENGTHENING LLVL FLOW HV 
MADE SIZEABLE UPWARD ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FWC NUMBERS TNGT...IN LINE 
WITH THE MAV/META SFC TEMPS.  2 SHOTS OF PCPN PSBL ON MONDAY...WITH 
ERLY -ZR/RA NORTH WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT...THEN BAND OF SHRA IN LARGER 
SCALE LIFT APPROACHING FROM THE WEST LATE IN THE DAY.  WL KEEP POPS 
IN THE CHC RANGE OVER ALL BUT THE SW.  FWC TEMPS LK TOO COOL GIVEN 
EXPEECTED STRONGER SOUTHERLY FLOW...AND WL BE MAKING UPWARD 
ADJUSTMENTS(ALBEIT CONSERVATIVE OVER THE SNOW COVERED NORTH).

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST FRI JAN 26 2001

MAIN FCST CONCERN IS NEXT SYSTEM THATS EXPECTED TO HIT OHIO VALLEY 
MON INTO TUES. ALL MODELS SHOWING A GOOD CONCENSUS ON WHERE H5 LOW 
IS GOING TO BE AT 0Z TUES...RIGHT ALONG THE MO/KS BORDER SOUTH OF 
MKC. SFC CYCLOGENESIS OCCURS OVER ARKANSAS EARLIER ON MONDAY WITH 
APPROACH OF H5 LOW IN WRN KS AT 12Z. 

MODELS DIFFER SLIGHTLY FROM HERE...ETA BRINGS THE SFC LOW JUST A BIT 
FURTHER EAST AHEAD OF H5 LOW. THIS TRANSLATES A LITTLE MORE ENERGY 
INTO THE WARM SECTOR THAT STRETCHES OVER OHIO DURING THE DAY. THOUGH 
MODEL DISCUSSIONS ARE TRENDING TOWARDS THE ETA SOLN OVER TIME...I 
THINK THAT THE AVN HAS A BETTER HANDLE ON WHAT PRECIP IS ACTUALLY 
GOING TO OCCUR AWAY FROM THE H5 AND SFC LOWS. 

SOUTHEAST WIND IN LOW LEVELS WITH THE GULF OPENING UP ON MONDAY 
SHOULD BRING A CONSTANT LOWERING OF CLOUD DECK THAT SHOULD BE IN 
PLACE BY MORNING. PROBLEM HERE IS THAT THE DRY LAYER A FEW THOUSAND 
FEET ABOVE SFC IS QUITE DEEP AND I FEEL THAT THE ETA MOISTENS IT UP 
JUST A BIT TOO QUICK AND THEN STARTS TO CRANK OUT PRECIP WITHOUT 
MUCH FORCING...JUST SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT. MESOETA AND AVN LOOK TO BE 
FAIRLY CONSISTENT WITH PLACING BEST QPF CLOSER TO THE SOUTHWEST AND 
KEEPS THE EASTERN PORTION OF FCST AREA DRY. WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS 
IN THE WEST...CHANCE OR HIGH CHANCE WITH EMPHASIS ON EARLY IN THE 
EAST. DRY SLOT SETS UP AND THERE SEEMS TO BE A BREAK BEFORE MAIN 
BATCH OF RAIN COMES IN AHEAD OF SFC LOW. LOW LEVEL TEMPS START OUT 
QUITE COLD...SO WILL MENTION PRECIP BEGINNING AS FZRA IN ALL AREAS. 
WILL HOLD OFF ON POPS FOR SUNDAY PM IN THE EAST...AND GO LOWER 
CHANCE IN THE WEST WITH FZRA.

AS FOR TEMPS...WILL LIKELY UNDERCUT MOS TONIGHT AS CLOUD SHIELD IS 
QUICKLY BEING ERODED AND MID TEENS DWPTS ARE FOUND JUST UPSTREAM. 
GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD THROUGH MONDAY...BUT WILL GO WITH NEARLY STEADY 
WORDING MONDAY PM AS GOOD GRADIENT IN WAA HOLDS OVER FCST AREA. 

MISILN OUT BY 3 PM. 

.ILN...NONE.

INVOLVED.  FORCING FOR LIFT WITH THIS FTR WILL QUICKLY SHIFT EAST OF 
THE AREA AFTER 12Z...WITH ALL MODEL GUID DEPICTING A DEEP DRYING OF 
THE ATMOS WITH SUBSIDENCE.  AS IS TYPICAL LLVL MSTR WL LINGER HWVR.
11-3.9U IMAGERY SHOWING AREAS OF STRATO-CU BACK INTO WISC.  H8 COLD 
POOL WL BEGIN TO ROTATE EAST OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON...AND ALL 
MODELS SHOWING DRYING IN THE LLVLS FROM WEST TO EAST MAINLY AFTER 
12Z.  WL USE BECMG PC WEST THIS AFTN...AND PARTIAL CLEARING LATE IN 
THE EAST.  TEMPS JUST ABOUT STEADY TDY...ALTHOUGH WL ALLOW FOR A 
SLIGHT REBOUND WEST.  GENERALY LEANED TWRD COOLER FAN NUMBERS 
...ALTHOUGH WL HV TO BE WARY OF 12Z TEMPS.  

ANY LINGERING CLOUDS IN THE EAST SHUD CLEAR OUT ERLY TNGT...SETTING 
THE STAGE FOR DECENT RADIATIONAL CONDS.  1-2 INCHES NEW SNOW ACRS 
THE NORTHERN 2/3 OF THE CWFA...AND WL ONCE AGAIN LEAN TWRD FAN 
NUMBERS WHICH ARE CLOSEST TO META SFC TEMPS AND PREV FCST.  FOR 
SUNDAY...REGION IN AN AREA OF CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT DOWNSTREAM OF 
SHORT WAVE RIDGE.  DVLPG SOUTHWEST FLOW PUSHES 1000/850 THICKNESS 
15-20 METERS WARMER THAN TDY...AND WITH SUNSHINE SHUD BE A DECENT 
WARMUP.  FWC TEMPS LK GOOD SOUTH...BUT WL UNDECUT WITH THE SNOW CVR 
NORTH.  NEW GUID IN GD AGREEMENT SPREADING PCPN A LTL FASTER INTO 
THE SW SUN NGT.  WL TAKE A QUICK LK AT THE 06Z ETA TO SEE IF TREND 
CONTS...AND MAY ADD CHC -FZRA FAR SW LATE SUN NGT.

.ILN...NONE.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
855 PM EST FRI JAN 26 2001

SNOW HAS CHANGED TO RAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHWESTERN COUNTIES.  JUST 
RECEIVED A PILOT REPORT FROM NEAR CINCINNATI OF +3 C AT 3000 FEET. 
SURFACE TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF INDIANA ARE IN THE 
MID 30S. WILL REMOVE MENTION OF MIXED PRECIP ACROSS THE SOUTH EARLY 
TONIGHT.

NOT SURE IF THE RAIN WILL PUSH AS FAR NORTH AS DAYTON.  IND IS 
REPORTING A RAIN/NOW MIXTURE HOWEVER. WILL GO WILL RAIN/SNOW MIX 
THERE.

WILL TAKE DOWN ADVISORIES EVERYWHERE BUT CENTRAL 
OHIO.

CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.                   

.ILN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH 7 AM CENTRAL OHIO.

SITES





@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 262021
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
320 PM EST FRI JAN 26 2001

...WILL ADD ADVISORY TO CENTRAL GROUP...

KILN SHOWING GOOD BATCH OF WAA PRECIP OVER EASTERN FA WITH KIND 
SHOWING ADDITIONAL SNOW OVER ENTERING WESTERN FA.  SATELLITE IMAGERY 
SHOWING DRY PUNCH PUSHING TOWARDS THE TRI-STATE.  AS A RESULT WILL 
CUT BACK ON POPS TONIGHT WHICH GOES ALONG WITH THE DEEP MOISTURE 
BORDERING THIS AREA.

MODELS ARE ALL IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING DEEP MOISTURE OVER 
FA OVERNIGHT...HOWEVER IN THE WEST IT BECOMES DRIER BY MORNING.  
HOWEVER, MODELS ARE BRINGING THROUGH A SUBSTANTIAL WAVE AT 500 MB 
WITH PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AROUND AROUND 12Z.  IT IS SHALLOW 
THOUGH.  CLOUD TOP TEMPS ARE PROGGED TO REMAIN ABOVE -10 FOR SNOW 
NUCLEI FORMATION BUT IN THE SOUTHWEST CLOUD TOP IS AROUND -8 TO -9.  
AS A RESULT WILL LEAVE IN THE MENTION OF PRECIP ALL NIGHT AND THE 
THREAT OF FLURRIES SATURDAY MORNING.  SKIES SHOULD CLEAR RAPIDLY ON 
SATURDAY AS SUBSTANTIAL SINKING MOVES OVERHEAD AND MOISTURE IS 
SHALLOW TO BEGIN WITH.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN DOMINATE WEATHER 
THROUGH SUNDAY.

THE TIMING FOR THE STORM THAT IS CURRENTLY AFFECTING THE WEST COAST 
HAS BEEN SPEED UP.  THE THREAT OF RAIN WILL BEGIN MONDAY AND PERHAPS 
GET A BIT HEAVIER ON TUESDAY AS LOW DEEPENS DRAMATICALLY OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS AND THEN OCCLUDES OVER THE OHIO VALLEY.

FWC LOOKS GOOD WILL ONLY BUMP HIGHS UP TONIGHT PER EXPECTED CLOUD 
COVER.

MISILN SENT TO ALL.  THANKS TO CLE FOR COOR.                   

.ILN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH MIDNIGHT WEST AND 7 AM IN THE 
EAST.
 TIPTON

804 
FXUS61 KILN 271925
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST FRI JAN 26 2001

MAIN FCST CONCERN IS NEXT SYSTEM THATS EXPECTED TO HIT OHIO VALLEY 
MON INTO TUES. ALL MODELS SHOWING A GOOD CONCENSUS ON WHERE H5 LOW 
IS GOING TO BE AT 0Z TUES...RIGHT ALONG THE MO/KS BORDER SOUTH OF 
MKC. SFC CYCLOGENESIS OCCURS OVER ARKANSAS EARLIER ON MONDAY WITH 
APPROACH OF H5 LOW IN WRN KS AT 12Z. 

MODELS DIFFER SLIGHTLY FROM HERE...ETA BRINGS THE SFC LOW JUST A BIT 
FURTHER EAST AHEAD OF H5 LOW. THIS TRANSLATES A LITTLE MORE ENERGY 
INTO THE WARM SECTOR THAT STRETCHES OVER OHIO DURING THE DAY. THOUGH 
MODEL DISCUSSIONS ARE TRENDING TOWARDS THE ETA SOLN OVER TIME...I 
THINK THAT THE AVN HAS A BETTER HANDLE ON WHAT PRECIP IS ACTUALLY 
GOING TO OCCUR AWAY FROM THE H5 AND SFC LOWS. 

SOUTHEAST WIND IN LOW LEVELS WITH THE GULF OPENING UP ON MONDAY 
SHOULD BRING A CONSTANT LOWERING OF CLOUD DECK THAT SHOULD BE IN 
PLACE BY MORNING. PROBLEM HERE IS THAT THE DRY LAYER A FEW THOUSAND 
FEET ABOVE SFC IS QUITE DEEP AND I FEEL THAT THE ETA MOISTENS IT UP 
JUST A BIT TOO QUICK AND THEN STARTS TO CRANK OUT PRECIP WITHOUT 
MUCH FORCING...JUST SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT. MESOETA AND AVN LOOK TO BE 
FAIRLY CONSISTENT WITH PLACING BEST QPF CLOSER TO THE SOUTHWEST AND 
KEEPS THE EASTERN PORTION OF FCST AREA DRY. WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS 
IN THE WEST...CHANCE OR HIGH CHANCE WITH EMPHASIS ON EARLY IN THE 
EAST. DRY SLOT SETS UP AND THERE SEEMS TO BE A BREAK BEFORE MAIN 
BATCH OF RAIN COMES IN AHEAD OF SFC LOW. LOW LEVEL TEMPS START OUT 
QUITE COLD...SO WILL MENTION PRECIP BEGINNING AS FZRA IN ALL AREAS. 
WILL HOLD OFF ON POPS FOR SUNDAY PM IN THE EAST...AND GO LOWER 
CHANCE IN THE WEST WITH FZRA.

AS FOR TEMPS...WILL LIKELY UNDERCUT MOS TONIGHT AS CLOUD SHIELD IS 
QUICKLY BEING ERODED AND MID TEENS DWPTS ARE FOUND JUST UPSTREAM. 
GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD THROUGH MONDAY...BUT WILL GO WITH NEARLY STEADY 
WORDING MONDAY PM AS GOOD GRADIENT IN WAA HOLDS OVER FCST AREA. 

MISILN OUT BY 3 PM. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 261634
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1130 AM EST FRI JAN 26 2001

WILL ISSUE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR WHITEWATER AND MIAMI VALLEYS 
FOR POTENTIAL OF 3 INCHES OF SNOW BY MIDNIGHT.  UP TO 2 INCHES IS 
FALLING OVER INDIANA THIS MORNING WITH 12Z ETA SHOWING POTENTIAL FOR 
AN ADDITIONAL INCH THIS EVENING.

WILL ALSO ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER ADIVSORY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO AND 
NORTHEAST KENTUCKY FOR FREEZING RAIN THREAT BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON.  
FREEZING RAIN/SNOW LINES UP WELL WITH 1300 M 1000-850 THICKNESS.  
THE 1300 M HANGS NEAR OHIO RIVER DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

MISILN SENT AT 11AM...WILL ISSUE OFFICIAL SET ASAP.
                       

.ILN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY
OH...042-051>053-060>062-070>072-077>082
IN...050-058-059-066-073>075-080
KY...089-100

590 
FXUS61 KILN 271627
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1125 AM EST FRI JAN 26 2001

WILL HAVE UPDATED ZFP OUT SHORTLY BEFORE NOON TO REMOVE MORNING 
WORDING. CELLULAR NATURE OF CLOUDS IN SOUTHWEST SHOULD CONTINUE TO 
SEE BREAKS...AND WILL KEEP THE BECOMING PARTLY SUNNY WORDING. DONT 
THINK THAT PARTLY CLOUDY WILL BE FOUND IN WEST AND NORTHWEST F.A. 
UNTIL LATE. WILL KEEP CLOUDS THROUGH THE DAY IN FAR NORTHWEST WITH 
UNIFORM FLOW OFF OF LAKE MICHIGAN AND MENTION DECREASING CLOUDS OR 
CLEARING LATE IN THE WEST. ERN FCST AREA SHOULD REMAIN MOCLDY 
THROUGH DAYLIGHT HOURS.

TEMPERATURES SHOULD ONLY SEE AN INCREASE OF A DEGREE OR TWO...AND 
CURRENT FCST HAS THIS IN LINE. ONLY CHANGES THIS MORNING WILL BE 
LINGERING CLOUD COVER FOR MOST AREAS...AND EXTENDING FLURRIES IN 
NORTHWEST WITH GRADIENT OFF OF THE LAKE.

WINDS IN WEST AND SOUTHWEST HAVE ALREADY DECREASED TO 10 TO 20 
MPH...BUT WILL KEEP BLUSTERY WORDING IN THE EAST AND HAVE DECREASING 
WINDS LATE. 

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS
