NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
330 AM EST FRI JAN 26 2001

SURFACE HIGH QUICKLY MOVG TO THE EAST. SW IN THE PLAINS TRACKING 
EAST WITH INITIAL SHOT OF MOISTURE ALREADY MISSOURI/ILLINOIS BORDER. 
MODELS INDICATING MOSTLY A SNOW EVENT FOR CWA. BELIEVE THERE WILL BE 
SOME RAIN ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER AND WILL INDICATE THIS. 
NEW MESOETA HINTING AT THIS POSSIBLITY. WILL NOT ISSUE ANY HEADLINES 
AT THIS POINT. NOT CONFIDENT IN REACHING 3 INCH CRITERIA IN DAY AND 
CMH AREA. WILL LET DAY SHIFT TAKE A LOOK AT THIS AND ISSUE ADVISORY 
IF NEEDED. SYSTEM QUICKLY EXITS AREA ON SATURDAY. GOOD DRYING SO 
EXPECT SOME SUNSHINE FOR SATURDAY. 

AS FOR TEMPS...WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MOS WITH UNCERTAINTY OF WARM 
UP TODAY AND CLOUDS AND CAA TONIGHT AND SAT. 

.ILN...NONE.

632 
FXUS61 KILN 270823
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
325 AM EST FRI JAN 26 2001

COLD FRONT MOVG ACRS THE CWFA THIS MORNING...WITH PCPN ALL SNOW NOW 
XCPT OVER THE FAR SE(CALL TO DAYTON INDCS SNOW VS RAIN).  DECENT 
SHORT WAVE DEPICTED BY WATER VAPOR IMAGERY/PROFILER DATA MOVG INTO 
NORTHERN INDIANA ATTM...WITH VERY NICE DRYING FOLLOWING.  FORCING 
WITH THIS SHORT WAVE PROVIDING AN ADDITIONAL SHOT OF LIGHT 
SNOW...ESPLY IN THE FAR NORTH WHERE A LITTLE LMICH MSTR IS 
INVOLVED.  FORCING FOR LIFT WITH THIS FTR WILL QUICKLY SHIFT EAST OF 
THE AREA AFTER 12Z...WITH ALL MODEL GUID DEPICTING A DEEP DRYING OF 
THE ATMOS WITH SUBSIDENCE.  AS IS TYPICAL LLVL MSTR WL LINGER HWVR.
11-3.9U IMAGERY SHOWING AREAS OF STRATO-CU BACK INTO WISC.  H8 COLD 
POOL WL BEGIN TO ROTATE EAST OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON...AND ALL 
MODELS SHOWING DRYING IN THE LLVLS FROM WEST TO EAST MAINLY AFTER 
12Z.  WL USE BECMG PC WEST THIS AFTN...AND PARTIAL CLEARING LATE IN 
THE EAST.  TEMPS JUST ABOUT STEADY TDY...ALTHOUGH WL ALLOW FOR A 
SLIGHT REBOUND WEST.  GENERALY LEANED TWRD COOLER FAN NUMBERS 
...ALTHOUGH WL HV TO BE WARY OF 12Z TEMPS.  

ANY LINGERING CLOUDS IN THE EAST SHUD CLEAR OUT ERLY TNGT...SETTING 
THE STAGE FOR DECENT RADIATIONAL CONDS.  1-2 INCHES NEW SNOW ACRS 
THE NORTHERN 2/3 OF THE CWFA...AND WL ONCE AGAIN LEAN TWRD FAN 
NUMBERS WHICH ARE CLOSEST TO META SFC TEMPS AND PREV FCST.  FOR 
SUNDAY...REGION IN AN AREA OF CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT DOWNSTREAM OF 
SHORT WAVE RIDGE.  DVLPG SOUTHWEST FLOW PUSHES 1000/850 THICKNESS 
15-20 METERS WARMER THAN TDY...AND WITH SUNSHINE SHUD BE A DECENT 
WARMUP.  FWC TEMPS LK GOOD SOUTH...BUT WL UNDECUT WITH THE SNOW CVR 
NORTH.  NEW GUID IN GD AGREEMENT SPREADING PCPN A LTL FASTER INTO 
THE SW SUN NGT.  WL TAKE A QUICK LK AT THE 06Z ETA TO SEE IF TREND 
CONTS...AND MAY ADD CHC -FZRA FAR SW LATE SUN NGT.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE



@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 252002
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EST THU JAN 25 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS RIDGE BUILDING INTO OHIO VALLEY. RAPIDLY 
CHANGING PATTERN OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS HAS STRONG SHORT WAVE 
REPLACING RIDGE BY LATE FRIDAY. 

SFC HIGH CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN ILLINOIS IS PROGGED TO MOVE TO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 12Z FRIDAY. SFC LOW AHEAD OF SHORT WAVE 
WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT OUR REGION BY FRIDAY EVENING.

WITH HIGH SOUTH OF HERE...WILL STAY WITH MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT.

MODELS IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT IN BRINGING PRECIP EARLIER THAN 
PREVIOUS RUNS. WILL NEED TO ADD CHANCE SNOW FRIDAY AFTERNOON IN DAY 
...CHANCE SNOW LATE AT CMH...CHANCE RAIN AND SNOW AT CVG...AND 
CHANCE RAIN LATE AT PMH. 

WITH SFC LOW...PVA AND SUFFICIENT MOISTURE...SNOW LIKELY WILL WORK 
FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...CLOSE TO FWCS 70 POPS. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW ALL 
SNOW NORTH WITH RAIN EARLY SOUTH.  QPF INDICATES ACCUMULATIONS OF 
AROUND AN INCH SNOW SOUTH AND 2 INCHES NORTH. WILL NOT MENTION 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THIS ZONE PACKAGE BUT WE WILL ISSUE SPS COVERING 
POTENTIAL. 

30% CHANCE SNOW SHOWERS LOOKS GOOD FOR SATURDAY IN NORTHWEST FLOW 
OFF LAKE MICHIGAN. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE LOWERING CAP DURING 
SATURDAY SO I EXPECT SHSN WILL DIMINISH BY LATE AFTERNOON.

WITH HIGH PRESSURE AND CLEAR SKIES...I EXPECT TONIGHTS TEMPS TO 
DROP A BIT BELOW FWCS 17-19 TO 13-17. FRIDAYS FWC TEMPS HAVE 
LOWERED A FEW DEGREES AND I AGREE WITH THAT TREND WITH CLOUDS 
ARRIVING EARLIER THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED. WILL GO WITH MID 30S 
NORTH AND UPPER 30S SOUTH. WITH RELATIVELY WARM AIR STAYING AROUND 
SATURDAY NIGHT...WILL STICK CLOSE TO FWCS 24-28...VERY CLOSE TO ETA 
SFC TEMP FCST. WILL GO A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW FWC ON SATURDAY IN COLD 
ADVECTION BEHIND SFC LOW.  

EXTENDED DISC...MRF AND UKMO IN DECENT AGREEMENT IN EJECTING SLOW 
MOVING CUTOFF FROM SO CALIFORNIA TO THE GREAT LAKES BY WEDNESDAY. 
FCST FOR DAYS 4-7 WILL FEATURE PRECIP WITH DAY 3 DRY. I EXPECT 
MOSTLY RAIN AND MILDER TEMPS DAYS 4-7 WITH STRONG SFC LOW PROGGED TO 
OUR NORTHWEST. 

.ILN...NONE.
 
CONIGLIO

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 AM EST THU JAN 25 2001

HIGH AMPLITUDE UPPER TROF AXIS WAS LOCATED OVER APPALACHIANS AT 12Z. 
AXIS OF RIDGE ENTERING MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IS PROGGED TO CROSS HERE 
BY 12Z FRIDAY.

AT SFC...AREA IS IN NORTHERLY FLOW ON EAST SIDE OF HIGH CENTERED AT 
STL. SC STREAMING DOWN FROM MICHIGAN APPARENTLY NOT BRINGING ANY 
SNOW WITH LOW CAP.

WILL UPDATE TO ADJUST SKY CONDITION. WILL GO WITH PARTLY SUNNY AS 
CLOUDS WILL BE IN AND OUT...THOUGH THERE WILL BE A CLEARING TREND BY 
LATE AFTERNOON WITH MODELS INDICATING DRYING AT 925-850 MB. 

HIGH TEMPS IN UPPER 20S-30 LOOK GOOD ACCORDING TO MESOETA SFC TEMPS
AND SOUNDING.

166 
FXUS61 KILN 250756
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
255 AM EST THU JAN 25 2001

WATER VAPOR WAS SHOWING S/WV PIVOTING SE AWAY FROM CWFA.  KILN RADAR 
INDICATED SCATTERED -SHSN STILL LINGERING. 

WILL HAVE TO CARRY AN EARLY MORNING GROUP...PARTICULARLY THE SRN 
CWFA FOR LINGERING SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS...OTHERWISE SKIES WILL 
GRADUALLY CLEAR FROM WEST TO EAST TODAY AS HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SFC 
AND ALOFT BUILDS INTO THE REGION.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE TRICKY.  
THICKNESS AND SOUNDINGS SHOW LITTLE WARMING TODAY...ALTHOUGH TEMPS 
CLOSE TO MOS VALUES ATTM.  WILL PROBABLY STICK CLOSE TO 
MOS...POSSIBLY SHAVING A DEGREE HERE AND THERE.

FOR TONIGHT...SKIES WILL BE MAINLY CLEAR AS HIGH PRESSURE PASS JUST 
SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  HIGH CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO SPILL FROM THE 
NW AHEAD OF NXT WX SYSTEM PUSHING INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS.

FOR FRIDAY...MODELS SIMILAR WITH TIMING OF S/WV FROM THE CNTRL 
PLAINS...ALTHOUGH THE THERMAL FIELDS ARE NOT MATCHING UP.  PCPN MAY 
BEGIN LATE FRIDAY AFTN IN THE FAR WEST...BUT WILL OPT TO JUST WORD 
FCST WITH INCREASING CLOUDS ATTM.  FOR THE EAST...SKIES WILL BE 
PARTLY SUNNY.  AVN...AND TO A LESSER EXTENT...THE NGM TRY TO PUSH A 
WARM BULGE NORTH INTO THE SRN CWFA FRIDAY EVENING.  IF THIS SCENARIO 
HAPPENS...THERE COULD BE A RAIN/SNOW MIX OR MAYBE JUST RAIN IN THE 
SOUTH FOR A SHORT DURATION.  ETA...ON THE OTHER HAND...PORTENDS THAT 
THE PCPN WILL BE ALL SNOW.  WILL HEDGE ON THE WARMER SIDE AND PLACE 
A RAIN/SNOW CHC IN THE SOUTH WITH A CHC OF SNOW NORTH.

.ILN...NONE.
 
HICKMAN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
230 PM EST WED JAN 24 2001

DIFFICULT CLOUD AND TEMPERATURE FCST FOR TODAY.

11-3.9 MICRON SATELLITE IMAGERY WAS SHOWING DEVELOPING LOW LEVEL 
CLOUDS ACRS THE WRN AND NRN CWFA.  THIS APPEARS TO BE ASSOCIATED 
AHEAD AND JUST BEHIND A WEAK SFC TROF NOW SLICING THE CWFA IN TWO.  
LOOKING AT LOW LEVEL RH FIELDS ON THE MESOETA...975 MB MSTR 
INDICATES THAT THE CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND ACRS THE REMAINDER 
OF THE CWFA THROUGH SUNRISE.  BELIEVE THIS WILL BE THE CASE AS THIS 
IS OCCURRING ON SATELLITE LOOPS.  BIG QUESTION FOR TODAY WILL BE:  
WILL SOME AREAS...PARTICULARLY THE SRN CWFA...SEE ABUNDANT SUNSHINE 
BEFORE NEXT BATCH OF LOW CLOUDS ARRIVE THIS AFTN THROUGH SUNSET FROM 
ASSOCD COLD FRONT NOW OVER THE WRN GREAT LAKES?  I BELIEVE THE SRN 
CWFA WILL SEE SOME SUNSHINE ONCE THE SFC TROF EXITS TO THE EAST AND 
SOME SUNSHINE TRIES TO ERODE SHALLOW MOIST LAYER.   WILL LAKE LAST 
MINUTE DECISION ON HOW TO WORD TODAY/S SKY CONDITION.  THICKNESS 
SCHEMES INDICATE TEMPS MAY BE CLOSE TO YESTERDAY/S HIGHS ESPECIALLY 
SOUTH AHEAD OF COLD FRONT.  WILL BUMP UP JUST A TAD.  WILL KEEP CHC 
OF AFTN/LATE AFTN FLURRIES IN THE NORTH AS COLD AIR PUSHES ACRS LAKE 
MICHIGAN.

FOR TONIGHT...VIGOROUS H5 S/WV AND ASSOCD VORT MAX PIVOTS SE JUST 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT INTO THE MIDDLE OHIO VLY.  ALL MODELS 
GENERALLY AGREE WITH SPEED AND POSITION.  DEEP MOISTURE IS LACKING 
WITH THIS S/WV.  HOWEVER...WITH PVA AND LOW LVL CONVERGENCE 
INDICATED BY 850-700 MB Q-VECTORS...BELIEVE SOME SCT -SHSN SHOULD 
DEVELOP.  WILL KEEP LOW 30 POP IN THE FCST.

ON THURSDAY...S/WV QUICKLY MOVES OFF TO THE SOUTHEAST. NVA AND WAA 
ALOFT BEGIN TO WORK ACRS THE REGION FROM WEST TO EAST.  ALTHOUGH WAA 
IS INDICATED...BELIEVE CLEARING WILL BE A SLOW PROCESS. MOSTLY 
CLOUDY WEST IN THE MORNING...THEN PARTLY CLOUDY IN THE AFTN LOOKS 
GOOD AT THIS TIME.  MOSTLY CLOUDY EAST FOR MOST OF THE DAY ALSO 
LOOKS LIKE THE WAY TO GO.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON THE COLD SIDE IN 
THE LOWER AND MID 20S.

SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR THURSDAY NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
INTO THE REGION.  NEXT SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION SOMETIME 
FRIDAY AFTN/EVENING.



.ILN...NONE.

AND MAINLY HIGH CLOUDS WILL SPILL INTO THE REGION...PROVIDING FOR

MOST OF THE DAY.  THE ONLY EXCEPTION IS THE FAR NORTH WHERE HIGH 
CLOUDS COULD BE THICK ENOUGH FOR MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS.  WILL BE 
OPTIMISTIC ATTM.  THICKNESS SCHEMES INDICATE TEMPERATURES WILL 
GENERALLY BE UNIFORM OVER THE REGION.  SLIGHT VARIATIONS WILL BE THE 
RESULT OF HOW MUCH SUNSHINE GETS THROUGH CLOUDS.

FOR TONIGHT...WEAK FRONT/TROF WASHES OUT OVER THE REGION.  UPR LVL 
FLOW BEGINS TO AMPLIFY AS MORE S/WV ENERGY DIGS SOUTHWARD FROM 
CANADA.  SKIES ARE EXPECTED TO BE MAINLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT...EXCEPT 
THE SRN CWFA WHERE CIRRUS STREAMING FROM SRN PLAINS STATES WILL KEEP 
SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY.

ALL MODELS HAVE BEEN TRENDING TOWARD A MORE DEEPER...SHARPER H5 
TROUGH ON WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY.  A BLEND OF THE AVN/ETA SOLUTION 
IS PROBABLY THE BEST WAY TO GO.  I BELIEVE MOST LOCATIONS WILL HAVE 
ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WEDNESDAY MORNING BEFORE LOW LEVEL CLOUDS BEGIN 
TO MOVE SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES.  COLD AIR OVER LAKE MICHIGAN 
MAY GENERATE A FEW SNOW FLURRIES ACRS THE NRN CWFA DURING THE AFTN.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...WITH S/WV ENERGY MOVING THROUGH THE 
REGION COMBINED WITH SOME LAKE MSTR...THINK SOME SCATTERED SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP.  AS A RESULT...WILL INTRODUCE A CHC OF SNOW 
SHOWERS.  ON THURSDAY...WITH SLOWER H5 TROUGH...WILL BE MORE 
PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD CLOVER AS COLD POOL AT H85 WILL LINGER A 
LITTLE LONGER.

.ILN...NONE.

STORM WARNING EXPIRE AT 4 PM WITH ZONE ISSUANCE.

SNOW LINGERS AS FAR WEST AS THE OH/IN LINE...IN AN AREA OF 700 MB 
WAA ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE UPPER LOW. WILL THROW IN A LEFT OVER 
WEATHER PERIOD FOR THE WESTERN COUNTIES.  NEXT IS HOW LONG WILL THE 
SNOW LAST IN THE EAST.  WILL GO WITH A LEFT OVER WEATHER PERIOD FOR 
SNOW...THEN A MENTION OF FLURRIES EARLY IN THE EAST.

NORTHWESTERN EDGE OF THE CLOUD SHIELD IS FINALLY BEGINNING TO MOVE 
EAST.  SKIES WILL CLEAR TONIGHT. DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE SINGLE DIGITS 
JUST TO THE NORTH AND WEST OF THE CLOUDS.  WILL GO 5 TO 10 ABOVE 
TONIGHT IN THE WEST AND AROUND 10 CENTRAL OHIO AND 10 TO 15 IN THE 
SOUTHEAST. 

SHORTWAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES TOMORROW. MOISTURE IS 
LIMITED...BUT SOME CLOUDS COULD BE THROWN INTO THE AREA.  WILL 
CONTINUE WITH THE MOSTLY SUNNY FORECAST. MOISTURE LINGERING INTO 
SUNDAY NIGHT FROM THE SHORTWAVE...SO MOSTLY CLEAR SUNDAY NIGHT.

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.

       OHZ073-074-079-080>082-088-KYZ099-100.

FXUS61 KILN 180856

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
358 AM EST THU JAN 18 2001

UPPER TROF DIGGING INTO NORTHERN MEXICO HAS BEGUN TO TURN FLOW ALOFT 
TO SOUTHWEST.  MODELS GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT THROUGH 48 HRS IN 
BRINGING TROF AXIS ROUGHLY FROM WISCONSIN TO LOUISIANA 00Z  
SATURDAY. 

SFC RIDGE IN PLACE WILL GIVE WAY TO INVERTED TROF BY THIS EVENING. 
MODELS DIVERGE IN LOCATION OF INVERTED TROF...WITH ETA AND CANADIAN 
POINTING TROF AT SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO AND AVN TAKING IT FARTHER EAST 
AROUND WEST VIRGINIA AT 06Z TONIGHT. 

PRECIP ALREADY OCCURRING IN TENNESSEE AHEAD OF DEVELOPING SFC TROF.  
ETA AND AVN DOING DECENT JOB WITH QPF WITH NGM TOO FAR SOUTH.  ETA 
AND AVN DIFFER WRT QPF IN RELATION TO POSITION OF SFC TROF...WITH 
AVN GIVING US MUCH LESS.  AVN GIVES QPF ONLY TO OUR SOUTH CENTRAL 
COUNTIES...WHILE THE ETA GIVES SOME QPF TO OUR WHOLE CWFA INCLUDING 
METRO AREAS.  SINCE UPPER SUPPORT STAYS WEST...AVN PROBABLY TOO FAR 
EAST WITH SFC TROF.  THEREFORE...WILL LEAN TOWARD ETA...WHICH STILL 
HAS LESS AND LATER QPF THAN ON EARLIER MODEL RUNS. 

WITH PRECIP FARTHER SOUTH AND SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS...WILL 
NEED TO ADJUST TODAYS FCST TO LOWER/DROP POPS ALL ZONES. WILL ALSO 
NEED TO LOWER POPS TONIGHT AND FRIDAY. FOR TODAY...WILL DROP POPS AT 
DAY CMH AND WAPAKONETA.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS LATE FOR RAIN AT 
CVG...WITH SCT -SHRA SOUTH CENTRAL. FOR TONIGHT...WILL GO WITH 
CHANCE AT CVG DAY AND CMH...WITH ALL SNOW AT DAY...RAIN CHANGING TO 
SNOW AT CVG AND CMH...AND RAIN LIKELY AT PORTSMOUTH.  ON FRIDAY 
CHANCE OF SNOW WILL WORK AT CVG CMH AND DAY...WITH RAIN LIKELY 
CHANGING TO SNOW DURING THE AFTERNOON AT PORTSMOUTH. 

FZRA IS NO LONGER INDICATED ON MODEL SOUNDINGS TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...EXCEPT AT ONSET THIS MORNING SOUTH CENTRAL. AT CVG SFC 
SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH BY THE TIME ANY PRECIP ARRIVES TO PRECLUDE 
FZRA.  TONIGHT AS TROF MOVING TO SOUTHEAST WILL ALLOW COLD ADVECTION 
...NO WARM AIR ALOFT IS PROGGED SO RA SHOULD SWITCH TO SN WITH NO 
FZRA.

FWC TEMPS APPEAR TO BE CONTINUING RECENT TREND OF BEING TOO WARM 
DURING THE DAY AND TOO COLD AT NIGHT. FOR TODAY...WILL GO NEAR FWC 
(41) AT CVG AS MILDER AIR WILL BE PUSHED AHEAD OF INVERTED TROF.  
WILL GO BELOW FWC AT DAY AND CMH INTO MID-UPPER 30S WITH MILDER AIR 
NOT LIKELY TO REACH THERE AS MUCH. CLOUDS TONIGHT SHOULD KEEP 
READINGS IN LOWER 30S...A FEW DEGREES ABOVE FWCS 27-29. ON 
FRIDAY...FWCS 33 AT CVG AND CMH LOOKS GOOD...THOUGH 29 AT DAY 
APPEARS A COUPLE DEGREES LOW.  

.ILN...NONE.

UPPER TROF DIGGING INTO NORTHERN MEXICO HAS BEGUN TO TURN FLOW ALOFT 
TO SOUTHWEST.  MODELS GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT THROUGH 48 HRS IN 
BRINGING TROF AXIS ROUGHLY FROM WISCONSIN TO LOUISIANA 00Z  
SATURDAY. 

SFC RIDGE IN PLACE WILL GIVE WAY TO INVERTED TROF BY THIS EVENING. 
MODELS DIVERGE IN LOCATION OF INVERTED TROF...WITH ETA AND CANADIAN 
POINTING TROF AT SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO AND AVN TAKING IT FARTHER EAST 
AROUND WEST VIRGINIA AT 06Z TONIGHT. 

PRECIP ALREADY OCCURRING IN TENNESSEE AHEAD OF DEVELOPING SFC TROF.  
ETA AND AVN DOING DECENT JOB WITH QPF WITH NGM TOO FAR SOUTH.  ETA 
AND AVN DIFFER WRT QPF IN RELATION TO POSITION OF SFC TROF...WITH 
AVN GIVING US MUCH LESS.  AVN GIVES QPF ONLY TO OUR SOUTH CENTRAL 
COUNTIES...WHILE THE ETA GIVES SOME QPF TO OUR WHOLE CWFA INCLUDING 
METRO AREAS.  SINCE UPPER SUPPORT STAYS WEST...AVN PROBABLY TOO FAR 
EAST WITH SFC TROF.  THEREFORE...WILL LEAN TOWARD ETA...WHICH STILL 
HAS LESS AND LATER QPF THAN ON EARLIER MODEL RUNS. 

WITH PRECIP FARTHER SOUTH AND SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS...WILL 
NEED TO ADJUST TODAYS FCST TO LOWER/DROP POPS ALL ZONES. WILL ALSO 
NEED TO LOWER POPS TONIGHT AND FRIDAY. FOR TODAY...WILL DROP POPS AT 
DAY CMH AND WAPAKONETA.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS LATE FOR RAIN AT 
CVG...WITH SCT -SHRA SOUTH CENTRAL. FOR TONIGHT...WILL GO WITH 
CHANCE AT CVG DAY AND CMH...WITH ALL SNOW AT DAY...RAIN CHANGING TO 
SNOW AT CVG AND CMH...AND RAIN LIKELY AT PORTSMOUTH.  ON FRIDAY 
CHANCE OF SNOW WILL WORK AT CVG CMH AND DAY...WITH RAIN LIKELY 
CHANGING TO SNOW DURING THE AFTERNOON AT PORTSMOUTH. 

FZRA IS NO LONGER INDICATED ON MODEL SOUNDINGS TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...EXCEPT AT ONSET THIS MORNING SOUTH CENTRAL. AT CVG SFC 
SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH BY THE TIME ANY PRECIP ARRIVES TO PRECLUDE 
FZRA.  TONIGHT AS TROF MOVING TO SOUTHEAST WILL ALLOW COLD ADVECTION 
...NO WARM AIR ALOFT IS PROGGED SO RA SHOULD SWITCH TO SN WITH NO 
FZRA.

FWC TEMPS APPEAR TO BE CONTINUING RECENT TREND OF BEING TOO WARM 
DURING THE DAY AND TOO COLD AT NIGHT. FOR TODAY...WILL GO NEAR FWC 
(41) AT CVG AS MILDER AIR WILL BE PUSHED AHEAD OF INVERTED TROF.  
WILL GO BELOW FWC AT DAY AND CMH INTO MID-UPPER 30S WITH MILDER AIR 
NOT LIKELY TO REACH THERE AS MUCH. CLOUDS TONIGHT SHOULD KEEP 
READINGS IN LOWER 30S...A FEW DEGREES ABOVE FWCS 27-29. ON 
FRIDAY...FWCS 33 AT CVG AND CMH LOOKS GOOD...THOUGH 29 AT DAY 
APPEARS A COUPLE DEGREES LOW.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO






@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 180207
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
905 PM EST WED JAN 17 2001

TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE TO STAY NEARLY STEADY OR EXPERIENCE A SLOW 
DROP THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. THIS SLOW DROP WILL FALL 
INTO LINE WITH CURRENT FCST...SO NO CHANGES EXPECTED HERE TONIGHT. 
CLOUDY SKIES MAY SEE A BREAK OR TWO...MAINLY IN THE NORTHWEST WHERE 
A FEW BREAKS ALREADY IN CENTRAL INDIANA MAY INTRUDE. 

MAIN CONCERN IS IF PREICP WILL GET INTO SRN FCST AREA OVERNIGHT. 
INITIAL THOUGHT IS THAT MAYBE TOWARDS MORNING. WILL SEND UPDATE TO 
LOWER POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE IN SW OHIO...AND REMOVE MIDNIGHT WORDING 
IN SRN FCST AREA. MAIN THREAT FOR ANY PRECIP WILL BE LATE...AND 
MAINLY S OF OH RIVER.

WEAK WAVE EXPECTED TO BE ON SW BORDER OF FCST AREA BY 12Z...WITH 
SOME LIGHT PRECIP EXPECTED AHEAD OF IT. ATTM...IT LOOKS LIKE MID 
LEVEL CLOUDS MAY SEED LOWER CLOUD DECK TO PRODUCE SNOW...BUT CHANCE 
FOR LIGHT FZRA CANT BE RULED OUT IF DRY AIR IN BETWEEN HOLDS SWAY.

IN OTHER WORDS...ONLY MINOR CHANGES EXPECTED. PREVIOUS FCST LOOKS TO 
BE A WINNER.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

@RUKWBCe KDENFXUS61 KILN 172032
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
335 AM EST WED JAN 17 2001

WATER VAPOR INDICATES A HUGE TROF IN THE SW U.S.  VISIBLE SATELLITE 
IMAGERY SHOWING LOW CLOUDS ERODING FROM THE WEST WITH HIGHER CLOUDS 
STREAMING IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST.

COMPLICATED FORECAST WITH MODELS STILL NOT IN AGREEMENT.  THE ETA IS 
THE FARTHEST NORTH WITH SURFACE LOW WITH THE AVN A BIT FARTHER SOUTH 
WITH DEVELOPING STORM FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  THE UKMET IS WEAKER 
WITH CYCLOGENISIS WITH THE MM5 SHOWING SURFACE LOW TRACKING THROUGH 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TO THE MID ATLANTIC.  IF ETA IS PERFECT PROG 
THEN BLIZZARD WARNINGS WOULD LIKELY BE NEEDED FOR AT LEAST SE 
PORTION OF FA.  NOT CONVINCED YET WITH OTHER MODELS FARTHER SOUTH 
AND THE TREND OF AVN AND ETA IS FOR A MORE SOUTHEASTERLY TRACK.

IN THE SHORTER TERM PRECIPITATION WILL SPREAD INTO FA LATE TONIGHT 
INTO THURSDAY WITH A WAVE WORKING IN THE BROAD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW.  
CONCERNED ABOUT ONSET AS LOWS WILL GET BELOW FREEZING ACROSS FA AND 
WILL BE SLOW TO WARM ON THURSDAY.  PROGGED SOUNDINGS INDICATE SNOW 
AND/OR FREEZING RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE FROM THE INITIATION.  WILL 
HOLD OFF ON ADVISORY FOR NOW SINCE ONSET SHOULD WILL BE AFTER 12Z 
THU AND THE DURATION OF FZRA WILL LIKELY BE SHORT.  IN OTHER WORDS 
WILL LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT RESOLVE.

WILL CLOSE THE RANGE ON FWC TEMPERATURES PER EXPECTED CLOUD AND THE 
THOUGHT OF A MORE SOUTHEASTERLY TRACK OF THE LOW.

THANKS TO CLE...SDF AND JKL FOR COOR.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON


@RUKWBCe-KDENFXUS61 KILN 171445
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
945 AM EST WED JAN 17 2001

...NO UPDATE PLANNED THIS MORNING...

KILN SHOWING SOME MID LEVEL RETURNS ACROSS NORTHERN FA.  VISIBLE 
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER OVER REGION.  
MORNING SOUNDING SHOWS THAT TEMPS WILL JUST REACH FORECASTED HIGHS 
WHICH MEANS ABOUT A 5 DEGREE RISE FROM OVERNIGHT LOWS.  06Z MESOETA 
LOW LEVEL PARAMETERS ALSO AGREE WITH FORECASTED HIGHS.  MOIST LOW 
LEVEL SOUNDING ALONG WITH SEEDING ALOFT FROM AC AND SHEARED SHORT 
WAVE WORKING ACROSS THE NORTH WILL KEEP THE THREAT OF FLURRIES 
ACROSS FA.  FZDZ SHOULD NOT BE A PROBLEM TODAY AS TEMPS WILL CLIMB 
TO OR ABOVE FREEZING THIS AFTERNOON.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON



674 
FXUS61 KILN 170846
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
347 AM EST WED JAN 17 2001

CONFLUENT WESTERLY FLOW CONTINUES ALOFT. FLOW WILL BACK TO SOUTHWEST 
BY THURSDAY AS HIGH AMPLITUDE SLOW MOVING LONG WAVE TROF DIGS 
THROUGH NORTHERN MEXICO. WITH TROF TAPPING GULF OF MEXICO... 
ATMOSPHERE OVER OHIO VALLEY WILL MOISTEN CONSIDERABLY.  TROF IS 
PROGGED TO INDUCE A PROLONGED PERIOD OF PRECIP STARTING ON 
THURSDAY...WITH THE FOCUS BEING IN THE SOUTHERN PART OF OUR CWFA 
NEAR THE OHIO RIVER.

SFC RIDGE BEING PULLED THROUGH THE REGION TODAY WILL BE REPLACED BY 
INVERTED TROF ON THURSDAY. TROF WILL PERSIST TO OUR SOUTH INTO  
FRIDAY AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROUNDS BASE OF LONG WAVE UPPER TROF.

FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...DOWNWARD MOTION ASSOC WITH WEAK RIDGING WILL 
NOT BE ENOUGH TO SCOUR CLOUDS FROM LOW LEVELS...SO ILL KEEP MOSTLY 
CLOUDY FCST.  

PROBLEMS ARISE FOR THURSDAY. CURRENT FCST HAS CHANCE RAIN. WITH 
EVENTS OCCURRENCE MORE DEFINITE...WILL RAISE POPS TO 40-50 NORTH 
AND 70 SOUTH...BELOW FWC BUT ABOVE PREVIOUS FCST.  MODEL SOUNDINGS 
AND THICKNESSES INDICATE FREEZING RAIN/RAIN SOUTH TRENDING TO SNOW 
NORTH.  THOUGH ETAS SFC TEMPS APPEAR A BIT TOO LOW...EVEN IF IT 
TURNS OUT A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER THAN THE ETA SHOWS IT WILL STILL 
BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME FREEZING/FROZEN PRECIP.  WILL FOLLOW ETA AND 
SWITCH FCST FROM LIQUID TO LIQUID/FREEZING/FROZEN PRECIP.  SW/NE 
ORIENTATION OF TEMP PATTERN WILL DICTATE PRECIP FCST.  AT CVG AND 
CMH...WILL GO WITH SN AND FZRA...POSSIBLY CHANGING TO RA. AT 
DAY...WILL GO WITH SN...POSSIBLY MIXING WITH FZRA. AT PMH...WARMER 
AIR INDICATES FZRA CHANGING TO RA.

FAIRLY HIGH QPF AROUND .25 INDICATED BY ETA AT PMH. ETA INDICATES 
LESSER AMOUNTS OF .15 AT CVG...DOWN TO ABOUT .05 AT DAY AND CMH.  
WILL DETAIL STORM POTENTIAL WITH STATEMENT. 

WILL NEED TO ADJUST THURSDAY NIGHT FOR CONTINUITY WITH THURSDAY. 
WILL SHIFT MORE TOWARD FREEZING AND FROZEN PRECIP.  AT CVG WILL WORD 
AS RA AND SN LIKELY CHANGING TO ALL SN LATE AS COLD ADVECTION WORKS 
IN FROM THE NORTHWEST. AT PMH WILL GO WITH RA LIKELY. AT DAY WILL 
USE CHANCE SN/FZRA. AT CMH WILL GO WITH CHANCE SNOW AND RAIN.

FWC TEMPS LOOK GOOD FOR TODAYS HIGHS FROM 32-35. FWC LOOKS TOO LOW 
TONIGHT WITH CLOUD COVER SO WILL STAY ABOVE.  THURSDAYS HIGHS LOOK 
A BIT TOO HIGH AND WILL UNDERCUT BY A DEGREE OR TWO.  WITH LATE COLD 
ADVECTION INDICATED...WILL DROP TEMPS THURSDAY NIGHT A COUPLE 
DEGREES ALL ZONES. 

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO



@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 161922
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
220 PM EST TUE JAN 16 2001

LOW LVL CLOUD DECK CONTINUES TO HOLD SWAY ACRS THE CWFA THIS AFTN.  
IN FACT...VISIBLE LOOP IMAGERY HAS SHOWN LITTLE EROSION.  THUS 
...WITH STG INVERSION FCST TO REMAIN ABOVE THE CLOUD DECK...WILL 
KEEP SKIES CLOUDY OVERNIGHT.  LAST NIGHT/S LOWS ONLY DROPPED ABOUT 5 
DEGREES FROM THE YESTERDAY/S HIGHS GIVEN THE CLOUD COVER.  I WOULD 
EXPECT ABOUT THE SAME TONIGHT.  HOWEVER...SOME WEAK CAA AT SFC TO 
THE WEST MAY ALLOW TEMPS TO APCH MOS VALUES...PARTICULARLY IN THE 
WRN CWFA (DAY AND WAP).  WILL TAKE A GAMBLE AND GO ABOUT 2 TO 3 
DEGREES WARMER THAN MOS TONIGHT (AND HOPE FOR NO BINOVC).

WILL USE A BLEND OF THE AVN/ETA FOR THE REST OF THE SHORT TERM 
PACKAGE.  THE NRN AND SRN BRANCHES OF THE JET STREAM ARE EXPECTED TO 
REMAIN CONFLUENT ACRS THE OHIO VLY ON WEDNESDAY.  S/WV EJECTING OUT 
OT THE SWRN UNITED STATES WILL BE SHEARED CONSIDERABLY AS IT MOVES 
INTO THE OHIO VLY.  LACK OF VERTICAL MOTION IN THE LOW LVLS AS WELL 
AS A DRY WEDGE NOTED FROM 850 MB TO 700 MB TOMORROW SPELL LITTLE IN 
THE WAY OF PCPN FOR THE REGION.  HAVE DECIDED TO LEAVE NRN 2/3 OF 
THE CWFA DRY WITH ONLY A CHC OF AFTN FLURRIES IN THE SOUTH.

THINGS GET INTERESTING BEGINNING WED NIGHT CONTINUING INTO FRIDAY AS 
THE NRN AND SRN BRANCHES OF THE JET STREAM BEGIN TO PHASE WITH EACH 
OTHER.  I TYPICALLY PREFER THE ETA/S HANDLING OF LOW LEVEL JETS AT 
925 MB AND 850 MB.  IT EJECTS ONE IMPULSE INTO KY BY THURSDAY 
MORNING...THEN IT HEADS NE INTO WEST VA.  LOOKS LIKE WAA PATTERN 
SETTING UP ALONG WITH THE LOW LVL CONVERGENCE ASSOCD WITH THE JET 
WILL BRING A THREAT OF RAIN TO THE SRN CWFA ON THURSDAY.  THE FAR 
NORTH SHOULD REMAIN DRY.  THERE IS AN OUTSIDE CHANCE THE PCPN MAY 
BEGIN AS A LITTLE IP OR FZRA IN THE SOUTH...BUT WILL BANK THAT TEMPS 
WILL WARM UP TO FREEZING BEFORE ONSET OF ANY PCPN IN THE SOUTH.
WENT ALONG WITH THE MAV TEMPS FOR THURSDAY DESPITE THICKNESS SCHEME 
SHOWING MAINLY LOWER TO MID 40S EVERYWHERE.  THE ETA SHOWS MORE OF A 
E TO NE FLOW.  THUS...AS LONG AS THE FLOW DOESN/T BECOME SOUTHERLY 
AS THE AVN/NGM PORTEND...TEMPS SHOULD ONLY REACH THE MID TO UPPER 
30S NW OF A CVG TO CMH A LINE...WITH 40 TO 45 SE THEREOF.

LONG RANGE MODELS AGREE ON A STORM SYSTEM MOVING NE OUT OF THE GULF 
COAST STATES TO THE WRN SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS (WRN VA) BY FRIDAY 
MORNING.  THEY DISAGREE...HOWEVER...ON THE EXACT TRACK AND 
AMPLIFICATION OF THE SFC LOW.  FOR NOW...WILL GO ALONG WITH NCEP AND 
DISREGARD THE AGGRESSIVENESS OF THE AVN MODEL TO CLOSE OFF AN H5 LOW 
OVR THE MO VLY BY SAT MORN.  THUS...A MORE PROGRESSIVE SOLUTION WILL 
BE IMPLEMENTED WHICH WOULD BRING THE BEST CHC OF ACCUMULATING SNOW 
TO OUR SE CWFA BY FRIDAY AFTN OR EVENING.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN











THINGS GET INTERESTING BEGINNING WED NIGHT CONTINUING INTO FRIDAY AS 
THE NRN AND SRN BRANCHES OF THE JET STREAM BEGIN TO PHASE WITH EACH 
OTHER.  I TYPICALLY PREFER THE ETA/S HANDLING OF LOW LEVEL JETS AT 
925 MB AND 850 MB.  IT EJECTS ONE IMPULSE INTO KY BY THURSDAY 
MORNING...THEN IT HEADS NE INTO WEST VA.  LOOKS LIKE WAA PATTERN 
SETTING UP ALONG WITH THE LOW LVL CONVERGENCE ASSOCD WITH THE JET 
WILL BRING A THREAT OF RAIN TO THE SRN CWFA ON THURSDAY.  THE FAR

WENT ALONG WITH THE MAV TEMPS FOR THURSDAY DESPITE THICKNESS SCHEME 
SHOWING MAINLY LOWER TO MID 40S EVERYWHERE.  THE ETA SHOWS MORE OF A 
E TO NE FLOW.  THUS...AS LONG AS THE FLOW DOESN/T BECOME SOUTHERLY 
AS THE AVN/NGM PORTEND...TEMPS SHOULD ONLY REACH THE MID TO UPPER 
30S NW OF A CVG TO CMH A LINE...WITH 40 TO 45 SE THEREOF.

LONG RANGE MODELS AGREE ON A STORM SYSTEM MOVING NE OUT OF THE GULF 
COAST STATES TO THE WRN SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS (WRN VA) BY FRIDAY 
MORNING.  THEY DISAGREE...HOWEVER...ON THE EXACT TRACK AND 
AMPLIFICATION OF THE SFC LOW.  FOR NOW...WILL GO ALONG WITH NCEP AND 
DISREGARD THE AGGRESSIVENESS OF THE AVN MODEL TO CLOSE OFF AN H5 LOW 
OVR THE MO VLY BY SAT MORN.  THUS...A MORE PROGRESSIVE SOLUTION WILL 
BE IMPLEMENTED WHICH WOULD BRING THE BEST CHC OF ACCUMULATING SNOW 
TO OUR SE CWFA BY FRIDAY AFTN OR EVENING.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN











@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 161421
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
920 AM EST TUE JAN 16 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY AND SFC OBS SHOW CLOUDY SKIES ACRS THE 
REGION THIS MORNING.

MAIN S/WV NOW NEAR THE WRN NY/NW PA BORDER.  THE REGION WILL REMAIN 
UNDER NEUTRAL OR SLIGHTLY WAA ALOFT FOR THE DAY.  12Z ILN SOUNDING 
SHOWS MSTR FROM 925 MB TO 839 MB...THEN IT DRIES OUT ABOVE 839 MB 
WITH A STEEP INVERSION.  I EXPECT THE INVERSION TO HOLD THROUGH THE 
DAY...NOT ALLOWING THE LOW CLOUDS TO BREAK UP ANY.  AS A 
RESULT...ENERGY BLOCK SCHEME INDICATES ONLY A 2 TO 3 DEGREE RISE 
FROM CURRENT TEMPS.  FCST TEMPS AT THIS TIME LOOK OK.

LIGHT DZ WAS BEING REPORTED AT CMH.  BELIEVE THIS WILL BE VERY 
ISOLD...SO I AM NOT PLANNING TO ADD DZ TO CURRENT FCST.

FCST PROBLEM FOR TONIGHT WILL ONCE AGAIN REVOLVE AROUND CLOUD 
COVER.  WITH THE DEMARCATION LINE OF THE LOW CLOUDS JUST SOUTH OF 
THE REGION (NEAR AN EVV TO SDF TO LOZ LINE)...WILL HAVE TO DETERMINE 
WHETHER WEAK WAA TONIGHT WILL BE ENOUGH TO ERODE LOW CLOUDS FROM OUR 
FAR SRN AREAS.  THIS WILL HAVE AN EFFECT ON OVERNIGHT LOWS.

UPDATES ARE NOT PLANNED ATTM.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 160813
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
313 AM EST TUE JAN 16 2001

WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL PERSIST FOR ABOUT THE NEXT 1.5 DAYS. FLOW 
WILL BACK TO SOUTHWEST ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS TROF DIGS INTO SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES.

UPPER FLOW IS PULLING SFC RIDGE INTO OHIO VALLEY. RIDGE WILL PERSIST 
UNTIL INVERTED SFC TROF MOVES TOWARD THE REGION AHEAD OF WESTERN 
UPPER TROF ON WEDNESDAY. IT WILL STAY CLOUDY TODAY AS RIDGE IS NOT 
STRONG ENOUGH TO ERODE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. MODELS INDICATE DRYING AT 
850 MB TONIGHT WITH MOISTURE PERSISTING AT 925 MB AND INCREASING 
LATE AT UPPER LEVELS...SO ILL CONTINUE MOSTLY CLOUDY FCST.

MODELS KEEP MOISTURE AT 925 MB ON WEDNESDAY...WITH MID AND UPPER 
LEVEL MOISTURE STILL AROUND AHEAD OF INVERTED TROF. DRIER AIR 
BETWEEN 50-70 PERCENT RH IS PROGGED FROM 4 TO 9 KFT. MOST OF UPWARD 
MOTION IS INDICATED FROM ABOUT 15 TO 30 KFT...WITH CONFLUENCE AT 500 
MB RESULTING IN DOWNWARD MOTION. 

ALL IN ALL...MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS WILL NOT BE SUFFICIENT TO PRODUCE 
A LOT OF PRECIP ON WEDNESDAY. ETA QPF GIVES OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES A 
COUPLE HUNDREDTHS WITH OTHER AREAS DRY. WILL KEEP CLOUDY FCST FOR 
WEDNESDAY...WITH CHANCE FLURRIES NORTH AND 30 POP CHANCE LIGHT SNOW 
SOUTH.

FWC TEMPS LOOK PRETTY GOOD FOR TODAY. WILL STAY RIGHT AROUND 35 AT 
CVG AND CMH...AND JUST A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE FWCS 32 AT DAY. WITH 
CLOUDS AROUND FWC LOOKS TOO WARM FOR TONIGHT. WILL STAY AROUND 
PREVIOUS FCSTS MID TO UPPER 20S...CLOSE TO MESOETA SFC TEMPS AND 
ABOUT 3 DEGREES ABOVE FWCS 22-25. ON WEDNESDAY...WILL AGAIN STAY 
NEAR FWC FOR HIGHS IN LOW TO MID 30S. WILL ADJUST WEDNESDAY NIGHTS 
LOWS UPWARD NEAR FWC (IN LINE WITH MESOETA) AS CLOUDS AND SOUTHERLY 
SFC FLOW WILL PROBABLY KEEP TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 20S.

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 151910
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
205 PM EST MON JAN 15 2001

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS AFTERNOON CONTINUES TO SHOW AN UPR LVL LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM ACRS THE WRN GREAT LAKES.  PIECES OF SHEARED 
VORTICITY WERE NOTED SOUTH OF THE LOW ACRS IL...IN AND OH.  
MEANWHILE...A MORE WELL DEFINED S/WV (VORTICITY MAX) WAS LOCATED OVR 
NRN WISCONSIN.  FOR TONIGHT...THE WISCONSIN S/WV WILL BE THE MAIN 
PLAYER...BUT VERY LITTLE WX IS EXPECTED WITH THIS SYSTEM...AT LEAST 
FOR OUR CWFA.  THIS S/WV WILL MOVE ACRS THE SRN GREAT LAKES 
TONIGHT...THEN INTO NE OH/NW PA BY TUESDAY MORNING.  AS OF NOW...WL 
DOWN PLAY THE WX WITH THIS SYSTEM AS LOW LVL FORCING IS ALMOST 
NEGLIGENT.  THUS...WILL MENTION A SML CHC OF SNOW SHOWERS OR 
FLURRIES IN MY MOST NRN AND ERN ZONES...CLOSER TO THE TRACK OF THE 
S/WV.  OTHERWISE...SKIES WILL REMAIN CLOUDY IN A CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT.
TEMPS WILL SLOWLY DROP INTO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S OVERNIGHT.

FOR TUESDAY...THE OHIO VALLEY WILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF 
CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT.  THIS IS NOT FAVORABLE FOR MUCH WX...IN TERMS 
OF PCPN.  HOWEVER...SKIES WILL BE CLOUDY AS LOW LVL MSTR WILL BE 
HARD PRESSED TO SCOUR OUT OF THE AREA.  THERE WILL BE A SMALL 
DIURNAL CHANGE FROM OVERNIGHT LOWS TO TUESDAY/S HIGHS.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...ALL MODELS...INCLUDING THE 
AVN...ARE NOW IN LINE WITH THE NRN JET STREAM S/WV APCHING THE GREAT 
LAKES FROM CNTRL CANADA AND THE SRN STREAM S/WV EJECTING OUT OF THE 
SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES.  BEFORE...THE AVN WAS MUCH SLOWER AND 
THUS DEEPER WITH THE NRN JET STREAM S/WV.  NOW...IT HAS COME MORE IN 
LINE...BUT IS STILL JUST A TAD SLOWER.  NONETHELESS...THIS HAS 
SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCED THE POSSIBILITY OF A GENEROUS SNOWFALL FOR THE 
MIDDLE OHIO VLY.  WITH THE NRN STREAM S/WV FASTER...CONFLUENT FLOW 
CONTINUES ACRS THE REGION.  AS A RESULT...AS THE SRN STREAM S/WV 
EJECTS INTO THE OHIO VLY BY WEDNESDAY....IT IS HIGHLY SHEARED OUT.  
WAA ADVECTION IS VERY WEAK WITH THE SYSTEM AS WELL AS DYNAMICAL 
LIFT.  I EXPECT JUST A SML CHC OF SNOW SHOWERS ACRS THE SRN CWFA...A 
CHC OF AFTN FLURRIES DAY AND CMH AREAS...AND JUST MOSTLY CLOUDY 
CONDITIONS FOR THE NRN MIAMI VLY.

IN THE EXTENDED...THE AVN ONCE AGAIN TRIES TO DIG A SIGNIFICANT S/WV 
OUT OF CNTRL CANADA...EVENTUALLY MERGING IT WAS A SRN STREAM S/WV.  
THIS SCENARIO WOULD DEVELOP A GOOD SNOWFALL FOR THE MIDDLE AND ERN 
OHIO VLY.  HOWEVER...WITH ITS PREVIOUS BIAS...WOULD HAVE TO BE 
SUSPICIOUS OF THIS SCENARIO ATTM.  WILL JUST CARRY A CHC OF SNOW FOR 
WEEKS END IN THE EXTENDED...BUT I AM NOT SOLD ON A MAJOR SNOWSTORM 
YET.  ONLY TIME WILL TELL.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN





AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
940 AM EST MON JAN 15 2001

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY CONTINUES TO SHOW A BAND OF SHEAR VORTICITY ACRS 
THE REGION.  THIS IS ALSO VERIFIED BY THE NEW ETA MODEL RUN...NOW 
TRICKLING INTO THE DATABASE.

KILN RADAR INDICATES VERY LGT PCPN ALONG AND AHEAD OF A COLD 
FRONT....STRETCHING FROM JUST WEST OF CMH AND EAST OF CVG.  UPR LVL 
DYNAMICS WILL CONTINUE WEAK TODAY IN THE CHANNELED VORTICITY 
PATTERN.  NEW ETA INDICATES WEAK OMEGA AT 850 MB AND 700 MB ACRS THE 
ERN SECTIONS THIS AFTN.  THUS...WILL KEEP A LOW CHC POP IN THE ERN 
SECTIONS.  WESTERN SECTIONS SHOULD ONLY HAVE SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES.

NEW ETA CONTINUES TO SHOW A SLOW PUSH OF COLDER AIR INTO THE ERN 
SECTIONS TODAY...ESPECIALLY S CNTRL OHIO AND N CNTRL KY.  TEMPS IN 
THIS REGION ARE CURRENTLY IN THE MID AND UPPER 40S.  WILL KEEP 
SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS INTO THE UPPER 30S BY LATE AFTN.  FEEL MOST OF 
THE PCPN...IF IT DOES FALL...WILL REMAIN OF THE LIQUID VARIETY FOR S 
CNTRL OH AND N CNTRL KY.  CNTRL OHIO MAY SEE A LITTLE MIX OF SNOW BY 
MID AFTN...ESPECIALLY WEST OF CMH.

DUE TO ABOVE ISSUES...WILL UPDATE ZONES TO CLEAN UP WORDING AND TO 
LOWER POPS WEST TO SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

818 
FXUS61 KILN 150807
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
308 AM EST MON JAN 15 2001

IN SPLIT FLO PTN UPR LO OVR NRN WI TO DRIFT SLOWLY E ACRS NRN GRTLKS
TDA AND THEN OPEN UP AND MOV ACRS ERN GRTLKS AND INTO NEW ENGLAND 
TNGT. TREND IS A LTL FASTER WITH THIS SYS. SFC LO OVR ERN WI WITH 
SWRD TRAILING CDFTN MOVG E THRU IN. THIS FNT TO SWEEP E THRU FA
THIS MRNG. SCTD SHWRS HV DVLPD IN FAVORABLE LO LVL CNVRGC ALONG AND
AHD OF SFC FNT. S/WV ROTATING THRU BASE OF THE TROF TO PROVIDE SOME
LIFT IN FAVORABLE PVA. WL CONT MENT OF LO POP CHC OF SHWRS. WL TREND
POPS SLGTLY HIGHER IN ERN SECTIONS WHERE LO LVL CNVRGC IS EXPECTED
TO BE MORE FAVORABLE.
 
CRITICAL RN/SN THICKNESSES SUGG A CHANGE TO SNW IN W DURG MRNG AND 
DURG ERLY AFTN IN CNTRL OH AND BY LT AFTN IN S CNTRL OH. XPCT HI/S 
TO OCCUR ERLY IN CAA PTN IN THE WAKE OF THE FNT.

IN CYC FLO LO CLDS TO HOLD SWAY TNGT. WL CONT CHC OF SNW SHWRS/FLRYS
IN ERN SECTIONS AND ACRS THE N TNGT WHERE PVA AND LLC REMAINS FAVORABLE
ESPECIALLY ERLY. TEMPS CLOSE TO FWC GUID TNGT OR A DEG OR SO WARMER
APPEARS REASONABLE TNGT.
  

XPCT LO CLDS TO CONT ACRS AREA ON TUE. A FEW FLYRS PSBL OVR
NRN MIAMI VLY DUE TO FLO OFF LM BUT THIS APPEARS MARGINAL. PREFER
TEMPS A DEG OR TWO COOLER THAN FWC FOR HI/S. 

MODELS SOLN/S DIVERGE TUE NGT/WED. AVN IS SLOWER WITH NRN STREAM
S/WV AND STGR WITH SRN S/WV WITH SFC CYCLOGENESIS IN TN VLY. THIS
SOLN WUD SUGG SOME MEASUREABLE SNW PSBL IN THE S TUE NGT/WED. ETA
IS FASTER WITH NRN STREAM S/WV AND THEREFORE SHWS MORE CONFLUENCE
AND WEAKENING (SHEARING) TO SRN SYS. WL INTRO LO POP CHC OF SNW
IN SRN ZONES TUE NGT/WED AND FLRYS IN N. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AND
MODEL DIFFERENCES WL NOT GO HIGHER THAN CHC POPS AT THIS TIME.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL


@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 150807
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
308 AM EST MON JAN 15 2001

IN SPLIT FLO PTN UPR LO OVR NRN WI TO DRIFT SLOWLY E ACRS NRN GRTLKS
TDA AND THEN OPEN UP AND MOV ACRS ERN GRTLKS AND INTO NEW ENGLAND 
TNGT. TREND IS A LTL FASTER WITH THIS SYS. SFC LO OVR ERN WI WITH 
SWRD TRAILING CDFTN MOVG E THRU IN. THIS FNT TO SWEEP E THRU FA
THIS MRNG. SCTD SHWRS HV DVLPD IN FAVORABLE LO LVL CNVRGC ALONG AND
AHD OF SFC FNT. S/WV ROTATING THRU BASE OF THE TROF TO PROVIDE SOME
LIFT IN FAVORABLE PVA. WL CONT MENT OF LO POP CHC OF SHWRS. WL TREND
POPS SLGTLY HIGHER IN ERN SECTIONS WHERE LO LVL CNVRGC IS EXPECTED
TO BE MORE FAVORABLE.
 
CRITICAL RN/SN THICKNESSES SUGG A CHANGE TO SNW IN W DURG MRNG AND 
DURG ERLY AFTN IN CNTRL OH AND BY LT AFTN IN S CNTRL OH. XPCT HI/S 
TO OCCUR ERLY IN CAA PTN IN THE WAKE OF THE FNT.

IN CYC FLO LO CLDS TO HOLD SWAY TNGT. WL CONT CHC OF SNW SHWRS/FLRYS
IN ERN SECTIONS AND ACRS THE N TNGT WHERE PVA AND LLC REMAINS FAVORABLE
ESPECIALLY ERLY. TEMPS CLOSE TO FWC GUID TNGT OR A DEG OR SO WARMER
APPEARS REASONABLE TNGT.
  

XPCT LO CLDS TO CONT ACRS AREA ON TUE. A FEW FLYRS PSBL OVR
NRN MIAMI VLY DUE TO FLO OFF LM BUT THIS APPEARS MARGINAL. PREFER
TEMPS A DEG OR TWO COOLER THAN FWC FOR HI/S. 

MODELS SOLN/S DIVERGE TUE NGT/WED. AVN IS SLOWER WITH NRN STREAM
S/WV AND STGR WITH SRN S/WV WITH SFC CYCLOGENESIS IN TN VLY. THIS
SOLN WUD SUGG SOME MEASUREABLE SNW PSBL IN THE S TUE NGT/WED. ETA
IS FASTER WITH NRN STREAM S/WV AND THEREFORE SHWS MORE CONFLUENCE
AND WEAKENING (SHEARING) TO SRN SYS. WL INTRO LO POP CHC OF SNW
IN SRN ZONES TUE NGT/WED AND FLRYS IN N. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AND
MODEL DIFFERENCES WL NOT GO HIGHER THAN CHC POPS AT THIS TIME.

.ILN...NONE.

RANDALL

928 PM EST SUN JAN 14 2001

02Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE OVER SWRN WI WITH A WEAK 
CDFNT TRAILING SWD ACROSS IL.  AREA OF SHOWERS MOVG INTO WRN FA ATTM 
DUE TO AN AREA OF 925 MB CONVERGENCE SHOWN ON BOTH THE 18Z AND 00Z 
META.

XPCT SHOWERS TO MOVE ACROSS FA OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS PRODUCING 
ONLY A FEW HUNDRETHS.  A FEW MORE -SHRA MY AFFECT FA TOWARD DAYBREAK 
DUE TO NEXT S/WV PROGD INTO FA AROUND 12Z MON.  TEMPS HOLDING STEADY 
IN THE WARM SECTOR AND MAY DROP A LITTLE LATE CVG-DAY AS CDFNT 
PASSES.  CURRENT FCST HAS ALL OF THE ABOVE VARIABLES HANDLED WELL SO 
NO UPDATE PLANNED ATTM.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 PM EST SUN JAN 14 2001

DEEPER MSTR CONTS TO PULL AWAY PER SATELLITE AND LATEST SHORT RANGE 
GUID...HWVR PLENTY OF LLVL MSTR WILL HANG ARND THRU THE NEXT CPL 
DAYS.  INITIAL BATCH OF SHRA CONTS TO PUSH EAST...AND SHUD EXIT THE 
CWFA BY 21Z.  NEXT POTNL FOR PCPN WL BE SCT -SHRA ALONG WEAK 
FRONT...WHICH IS PROGGED TO MV ACRS THE AREA OVERNIGHT.  WL CARRY 
LOW CHC POPS ALL ZONES.  WIDESPREAD VSBYS AOB 2 MILES FROM AOH-DAY 
WEST....AND WL INCLUDE FOGGY MENTION IN THE NORTHERN/NORTHWESTERN 
GROUPS.  WITH M40S DWPTS ADVECTING INTO THE SOUTH ATTM...AND ONLY 
WEAK CAA STARTING LATE TNGT...THINK MOST AREAS FROM CVG-CMH EAST WL 
REMAIN AOA 40 OVERNIGHT.

SOME -SHRA CUD LINGER IN THE EAST ALONG FRONT ERLY MONDAY...OTHW 
XPCT ONLY SCT FLURRIES/DRIZZLE.  WITH CAA...ALBEIT WEAK...AND PLENTY 
OF LOW CLOUDS XPCT TEMPS TO HOLD JUST ABOUT STEADY TOMORROW AND WL 
NOT STRAY FAR FROM FWC NUMBERS.

XPCT LOW CLOUDS TO LINGER INTO TUE...AND WL USE LOWER DIURNAL RANGES 
THAN NEW FWC GUID.  META SFC TEMPS KEEP READINGS AOA 30 DEG ALL ACRS 
THE AREA MON NIGHT...WITH ONLY A SLIGHT REBOUND ON TUE.  WEAK SHORT 
WAVE SHEARS THRU IN THE NW FLOW MON NIGHT...AND WL KEEP LOW CHC 
-SHSN IN THE NORTH.  LIKE MORE SHEARED LOOK OF UKMET WITH SYS 
EJECTING OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST INTO CONFLUENT FLOW ON WED...BUT STILL 
CUD SEE SOME SNOW SPREAD INTO THE AREA FROM THE SOUTH.    

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

FXUS61 KILN 140755
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
256 AM EST SUN JAN 14 2001

FCST CHALLENGE IS CENTERED ON NEED FOR HEADLINE IN FAR N FOR 
POTENTIAL FOR FREEZING RAIN AT THE ONSET OF PRECIP EVENT TDA.

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH UPR LO OVR CNTRL PLNS LIFTG NE INTO
MID MS VLY TDA AND THE GRTLKS TNGT/MON. DEEP MSTR AND LIFT INTO
WRN SECTIONS ERLY THIS MRNG AND INTO ERN SECTIONS BY AFTN. STG UPR
DIV OVR MID MS VLY IN LEFT FRONT QUAD WEAKENS AS IT ENTERS OUR FA
TDA. MOST FAVORABLE UPR DIV TO OUR N ASSOCIATED WITH DEFORMATION 
ZONE. 

FAVORABLE LIFT AND MSTR ACRS AREA BTWN 12Z-18Z. THICKESSES WUD SUGG
THAT EVENT WL BE ALL RAIN TDA. SFC TEMPS ACRS THE FAR N HV COOLED 
BLO FREEZING WITH LGT NE FLO LAST EVENING. LO LVL FLO IS WEAK BUT
HS SWUNG ARND TO THE SE AND TEMPS SHWG SLO WRMG TREND. TEMPS
SHUD CONT TO WRM WITH A CHC OF SOME MINOR FREEZING RAIN AT ONSET.
ALTHO ANY FREEZING PRECIP SHUD BE LIMITED WL GO WITH WINT WX ADVSY
FOR FREEZING RAIN ACRS FAR N THRU 10 AM. WL LET DNS FOG ADVSY 
EXPIRE WITH VSBYS IMPROVING INTO MVFR CAT AS SE FLO DVLPS AND 
TEMPS BEGIN TO WRM. 

BEST THREAT FOR PRECIP APPEARS TO BE IN WRN SECTIONS WHERE WL OPT 
FOR LKLY POPS AND WL GO WITH SCTD CHC WORDING IN THE E TDA.

NXT S/WV TO ROTATE THRU BASE OF TROF INTO OH LT TNGT INTO ERLY MON.
SFC CDFNT TO MOV E THRU AREA LT TNGT. IN CAA PTN THICKNESS SUGG 
PRECIP MAY MIX WITH SOME SNW IN FAR W LT TNGT. WL INDICATE CHC 
POPS ACRS THE AREA WITH 50 PERCENT N AND 40 PERCENT S.

CYC FLO CONTS IN CAA PTN WITH CHANNELED VORT ACRS OH VLY MON. WL
CONT CHC POPS WITH BEST THREAT TO THE N. IN CAA TEMPS WL LKLY REMAIN
NRLY STEADY IN ALL BUT THE SE.
 
.ILN...WIND WX ADVISORY THRU 10 AM OHZ026-034>035-043>045.

RANDALL

LOOKS LIKE WK BNDRY ACRS CNTRL PORTIONS OF FA WITH NELY FLOW ACRS 
THE N AND SE IN THE S. THIS BNDRY APPEARS TO BE PUSHG SLOWLY N WITH 
FLOW RECENTLY GOING MORE ELY ACRS MIAMI VLY. THIS MAY HELP KP FOG FM 
PUSHG MUCH FURTHER S. SAT PIX AND CHECK WITH SPOTTERS INDCTG PRETTY 
DENSE FOG ACRS UNION AND DELAWARE CNTYS SO WL EXPAND DENSE FOG 
ADVISORY E A LTL TO INCLUDE THEM. HI CLDS MOVG IN FM THE W SO 
HOPEFULLY THIS WL HELP KP FOG FM GETTING TOO OUT OF HAND ELSWR ACRS 
THE N. CLDS SHUD ALSO HELP LVL TEMPS OFF SO CRNT FCST TMPS LOOK TO 
BE CLOSE. 

.ILN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY OVRNGT OHZ026-034>035-043>046.

@RUKWBCe
KDENFXUS61 KILN 132006
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EST SAT JAN 13 2001

FOG CONTS TO CLEAR ACRS THE FAR NORTH...LEAVING FULL SUNSHINE ACRS 
THE CWFA THIS AFTN.  MODELS HV BACKED OFF SLIGHTLY IN TERMS OF 
TIMING PCPN INTO THE AREA...ESPLY THE AVN.  GIVEN CURRENT LOCATION 
OF PCPN OVER WESTERN MO...AND DRY AIR IN PLACE WL FOLLOW NEW MODEL 
TRENDS/PREV FCST AND KEEP FCST DRY TNGT.  RH PROGS/TIMESXNS DO 
ADVERTISE AN INCRS IN MID/HIGH LVL MSTR TNGT...BUT LOOKS LIKE PLNTY 
OF BREAKS IN THE AC/CI UPSTREAM ATTM  LOOKS LIKE SVRL MCLR HOURS IN 
THE WEST ERLY TNGT...ALL NIGHT IN THE EAST...AND HV GENERALLY LEANED 
TWRD COOLER MAV NUMBERS WITH DECENT RADIATIONAL CONDS.

BAND OF HIGH MEAN RH/DECENT FORCING FOR LIFT MVS ACRS THE AREA SUN 
MORNING/ERLY AFTN...FOLLOWED QUICKLY BY STRONG DRYING ABV 700 MB.
SOME SHRA CUD LINGER IN THE WEST THRU THE AFTN...BUT WL USE MAINLY 
ERLY WORDING TO STRESS BEST CVRG.  WL NOT USE TIMING EAST...BUT EVEN 
HERE CUD SEE MOST PCPN OVER BY MID AFTN.  DEPENDING ON WHETHER DRY 
SLOT ALLOWS CLEARING OF LOWER CLOUD IN THE SW CUD REALLY SEE A NICE 
WARMUP...BUT GENERALY HV STUCK CLOSE TO GUIDANCE WHICH IS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT.  WL KEEP POPS...RAIN SOUTH AND EAST MIXED WITH SNOW 
NW...ALONG AND BEHIND WEAK FRONT WHICH WL MV THRU SUN NGT.  META SFC 
TEMPS MUCH WARMER THAN ANY MOS GUIDANCE...KEEPING THE SOUTH AND EAST 
IN THE L40S ALL NIGHT.  HV RAISED THE FWC A CPL DEG ALL ZONES.  WITH 
A LITTLE WRAP ARND MSTR IN PLACE...AND A CPL WEAK SHORT WAVES 
PROGGED TO SHEAR THRU...WL KEEP LOW POPS ALL ZONES INTO MONDAY.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE

CALLS TO ASOS LOCATIONS NORTH OF I-70 INDCS M1/4 VSBYS CONTINUE.  
ERLY VIS IMAGERY INDCS A SLOW EROSION OF THE FOG HAS BEGUN FROM THE 
SE...AND DIURNAL MIXING WL ALLOW A FAIRLY QUICK IMPROVEMENT THRU 
MIDDAY.  HWVR CURRENT NPW EXPIRES AT 15Z...AND WL HAVE TO EXTEND 
OVER WEST CENTRAL OHIO AND AREAS NORTH OF COLUMBUS.  OTHW PREV FCST 
LOOKS PRETTY GD...ALTHOUGH MAY MAK SOME DOWNWARD TEMP ADJUSTMENTS IN 
THE NORTH WHERE FOG/STRATUS WL LINGER LONGEST.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL NOON FOR NRN MIAMI...MIAMI 
VLY...NORTH OF COLUMBUS.

UPR TROF OVR THE SW U.S. PROGRESSES INTO THE CNTRL PLNS TDAZ WITH UPSTREAM
RDG BLDG E INTO OH VLY. INITIAL FCST CHALLENGE IS CENTERD ON LO CLD AND
DNS FOG. LTST 11U-3.9U SATL IMGRY SHWS LEADING EDGE OF STATUS FM DELAWARE
CTY TO JUST E OF DAY TO WRN HAMILTON CTY. LO LVL INVERSION AND WK FLO
ALLOWED THESE CLDS TO DVLP. 925MB VRY LIGHT NRLY FLO TO BCM SRLY AND 
INCRS A LTL. THIS SHUD INHIBIT MUCH ADVCTN OF LO CLDS. FCST SOUNDINGS
SHW THIS MSTR TO BE VRY SHALLOW. SHALLOW NATURE OF THIS MSTR AND 
BEING ON THE PERIPHERY OF THE CLDS XPCT QUICK IMPROVEMENT THIS MRNG. 
WL CONT AND SLIGHTLY EXPAND DNS FOG ADVSY THRU MID MRNG.

XPCT SKIES TO IMPROVE WITH CI SPILLING OVR UPR RDG. UNDER WAA PTN
TEMPS SHUD BE CLOSER TO WRMR FWC GUID TDA. ENERGY BLOCK METHOD WITH
LO CLDS IN MRNG AND HI CLDS THIS AFTN YIELDS A HI OF 47 DEG AT ILN.

AS UP LO LIFTS ENE INTO THE MID MS VLY CLDS WL INCRS ACRS THE AREA
TNGT. MAIN DYRNAMICS PIVOT N ARND SYS AND WEAKEN. XPCT RN TO BE 
JUST ON OUR WRN HORIZON BY 12Z SUN. 

INITIAL S/WV AXIS TO ROTATE NE THRU OH BTWN 12Z AND 18Z SUN WHEN
DEEP MSTR AND LIFT DVLP ACRS THE AREA. UPR DIV WEAKENS WITH MST
FAVORABLE DIV STAYING TO OUR N ASSOCIATED WITH DEFORAMTION ZONE.
WL GO WITH LKLY POPS IN THE W AND CHC IN THE E ON SUN. LO LVL
THICKNESS SUGG PRECIP WL BE RAIN WITH 1000/850MB THICKNESSES ABV 
1310M.

NXT S/WV TO ROTATE ARND THE BASE OF THE TROF INTO OH VLY SUN NGT. 
WL CONT CHANCE OF SHWRS AND WITH CAA DVLPG WL INDICATE A MIX TO
SNW IN NRN MIAMI VLY.

.ILN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY EARLY FOR NRN MIAMI...MIAMI VLY...WHITE
WATER VALLEY...TRI-STATE RGN AND NRN PTNS OF CNTRL OH.

SE IN...AS WELL AS EASTWARD MOVEMENT INTO WEST-CENTRAL OH. ILN 
SOUNDING SHOWING SHALLOW BDRY LAYER INVERSION ABOUT 500 FT AGL. IT 
APPEARS THIS INVERSION MAY BE TRAPPING THE LOWER LVL MOISTURE 
SITUATED TO OUR WEST...AS MOST CIGS SHOWN BELOW THIS LEVEL. ALSO 
NOTING THAT CURRENT 00Z ETA SHOWING WEAK CAA BETWEEN 975 MB AND 925 
MB. LOW LVL CLDS APPEAR TO BE FOLLOWING CURRENT TRAJECTORY WITHIN 
THIS LAYER. SFC RIDGING NOTED AS WELL ACROSS THIS AREA.

WELL AS FOR POTENTIAL ISSUANCE OF DENSE FOG ADVISORY.

AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
205 PM EST FRI JAN 12 2001

LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS CWFA IN A LARGE SWISS 
CHEESE HOLE.  MODELS INDICATE THAT HIGH PRESSURE IN THE LOWER LVLS 
SHOULD KEEP LOW CLOUDS AROUND THE PERIPHERY OF THE CWFA.  HOWEVER 
...SOME STRATUS WAS TRYING TO MOVE SE TOWARD RICHMOND, IN.  WILL GO 
MOSTLY CLEAR ALL LOCATIONS FOR NOW...AND MAY MAKE A LAST MINUTE 
CHANGE BASED ON SATELLITE LOOP.  WITH MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS 
OVERNIGHT AND LIGHT WINDS...TEMPERATURES SHOULD RADIATE NICELY.  THE 
NRN MIAMI VLY WILL BE THE COLDEST DUE TO SNOW COVER...WHILE THE 
REMAINDER OF THE REGION SHOULD FALL INTO THE LOWER 20S.

H5 TROUGH OVR THE WRN UNITED STATES WILL MOVE SLOWLY OVER THE NXT 24 
HRS.  AN H5 RIDGE AHEAD OF IT WILL INFLUENCE OUR WEATHER ON 
SATURDAY.  SOME CIRRUS FROM THE TX REGION MAY SKIM OUR SRN AREAS.  
ALSO...ANOTHER BATCH OF HIGH CLOUDS FROM THE NRN PLAINS MAY BRUSH 
THE NORTH.  BELIEVE CIRRUS WILL BE THIN.  AS A RESULT...MOSTLY SUNNY 
FOR SATURDAY LOOKS GOOD.  TEMPS SHOULD REBOUND NICELY...RANGING FROM 
40 TO 45 FAR NORTH AND AROUND 50 FAR SOUTH.

AS THE AFOREMENTIONED H5 TROUGH MOVES INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS SATURDAY 
NIGHT...MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WILL EJECT NE INTO THE REGION.  MID 
CLOUDS SHOULD PREVENT A BIG TEMPERATURE DROP...AND THIS IS REFLECTED 
IN THE OVERNIGHT LOWS.

ON SUNDAY...SHOWERS WILL MOVE OUT AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT INTO THE 
REGION.  DYNAMICAL LIFT BEGINS TO WEAKEN FROM WEST TO EAST ON SUNDAY 
AS UPR LVL VORTICITY BECOMES SHEARED.  SO...BEST CHANCE OF RAIN 
SHOULD BE ACRS THE WRN CWFA.  

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN

725 
FXUS61 KILN 112018 AAA
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EST THU JAN 11 2001


BASED ON LATEST RADAR TRENDS WILL GO WITH SPRINKLES ACROSS ALL THE 
SOUTHERN AREAS. CLEMISILN OUT IN A FEW MINUTES.


...ORIGINAL DISCUSSION...

DUEL SHORTWAVES CONTINUE THEIR TREK TOWARD THE FA.  ANALYSIS OF 12Z 
500 MB SHOWED THAT THE NORTHERN SYSTEM STILL HAD ITS STRONGEST WINDS 
ON THE WEST SIDE...THEREFORE THE SYSTEM SHOULD DIG A LITTLE FARTHER 
SOUTH.  AS IT DOES...THE TWO SYSTEMS KIND OF MERGE TO THE SOUTH OF 
THE FA ON FRIDAY.  BIG QUESTION IS WHETHER OR NOT THE PCPN ACROSS 
IL/IN/KY WILL PUSH INTO SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FA TONIGHT.  MODELS 
CONTINUE TO SHOW VERY DRY LOW LEVELS...WHICH WOULD INHIBIT PCPN.  
HOWEVER THE ETA AND MESO-ETA CONTINUE TO BE CONSISTENT IN PUSHING 
THE PCPN INTO THE FA.  AT 18Z...THE ETA/MESO-ETA HAD THE BEST HANDLE 
ON THE POSITION OF THE QPF FIELD. THEREFORE WILL INTRODUCE A MENTION 
OF PCPN IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FA. ACROSS NORTHERN KY INTO 
SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO...WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS AND IN CVG TO 
CHILLICOTHE WILL GO WITH SPRINKLES.

NOW THAT I HAVE MENTIONED PCPN...WHAT TYPE TO FORECAST. SOUNDINGS 
ARE SHOWING A VERY DEEP LOW LEVEL WARM LAYER...ALMOST 4-5K FEET. 
HOWEVER I AM PLANNING TO GO WITH LOWS EITHER AROUND 30 OR IN THE 
LOWER 30S...SO WILL MENTION RAIN AND FREEZING RAIN. SO I WILL BE 
GOING WITH LOW POP...WILL NOT ISSUE WSW ATTM.

ALTHOUGH SOME HIGHER RH LINGERS INTO FRIDAY...THE BEST LIFT PULLS TO 
THE EAST WITH THE UPPER SYSTEM...SO WILL GO DRY ON FRIDAY...WITH 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOK IN THE BALL PARK.

500 MB SHORTWAVE RIDGE BUILDS IN ON SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES COULD GET 
SNEAKY WARM...BUT THINK THAT THE NGM NUMBERS ARE A LITTLE TOO WARM.  
WILL KNOCK A DEGREES OR TOO OFF.

CLEMISILN OUT ASAP.

.ILN...NONE.

SITES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EST THU JAN 11 2001

HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO GIVE REGION CLEAR SKIES BUT HIGH CLOUDS 
ARE WORKING THEIR WAY NE. THESE HIGH CLDS AND SOME MID CLOUDS WILL 
SPILL INTO THE AREA LATER THIS AFTN INTO TONIGHT IN ASSOC WITH BOTH 
THE NRN AND SRN STREAM WAVES. BOTH OF THESE SYSTEMS ARE WEAKENING AS 
THEY MOVE EAST.THE SRN STREAM LOOKS TO BE MORE DOMINATE BUT THE AVN 
DISAGREES SOMEWHAT. THE AVN IS TRYING TO KEEP A MORE DISTINCT TROF 
MOVING THRU THE NRN STREAM WHILE THE ETA/NGM SHEAR IT OUT. AM 
LEANING MORE TOWARDS THE ETA SOLN SINCE THE WAVE IS MOVING INTO A 
RIDGE. EITHER WAY...MSTR IS LIMITED TO MID LVLS AND ABOVE. CANNOT 
RULE OUT SOME SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES BUT DO NOT THINK THE CHCS ARE 
GOOD. CLDS HANG AROUND UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT THEN UPR RIDGING MOVES 
BACK IN AHEAD OF MORE SIGNIFICANT SYS PROGGED TO ARRIVE SUN. 

TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WARM THRU THE WEEKEND. HIGHS TDY SHOULD BE 
A FEW DEGS WARMER THAN YDA GIVEN WARMER START AND PLENTY OF SUN ELY. 
WILL GENERALLY ONLY MODIFY GUID SLIGHTLY THRU THE PD.
 
.ILN...NONE.

245 PM EST WED JAN 10 2001

HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL REMAIN ALMOST 
STATIONARY TONIGHT...THUS SKIES WILL BE CLEAR AGAIN TONIGHT. LOW 
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT ARE TRICKY AS SURFACE WINDS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
THE SOUTH...BACK AND WEAKEN TONIGHT.  THIS SHOULD HELP THE WINDS TO 
DECOUPLE AND ALLOW FAIR COOLING CONDITIONS...AS DEWPOINTS ARE 
CURRENTLY IN THE UPPER TEENS. HOWEVER WE DID GET WARMER TODAY THAN 
THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS...WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW ALTHOUGH WEAK...AND 
LOSS OF SNOW PACK ACROSS THE SOUTH...WOULD MAKE LOWS A LITTLE WARMER 
THAN LAST NIGHT. WILL KNOCK A CATEGORY OFF CURRENT FORECAST AND FWC 
TO GIVE LOWER 20S.

SYSTEM LIFTING OUT OF THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT IS TRENDING FARTHER NORTH ON ALL MODELS.  THE ETA IS CURRENTLY 
THE ONLY MODEL PRINTING OUT QPF ACROSS THE FA. THE ETA LOOKS 
INCONSISTENT WITH ITSELF.  CROSS SECTIONS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PART 
OF THE FA ON THURSDAY NIGHT IS SHOWING ONLY 70 PERCENT RH ONLY FROM 
10000 FEET AND UP.  IN ADDITION...COULDNT FIND ANY ISENTROPIC LIFT. 
EXPECT THAT THERE WILL BE A TIGHT DEFORMATION ZONE...AND CUTOFF 
BETWEEN RAIN AND NO RAIN.   WILL LEAVE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY DRY 
FOR NOW.

AFTER HAVING PROBLEMS WARMING TODAY...WILL GO ABOUT A CATEGORY 
COOLER THAN MOS FOR TOMORROW. WITH CLODS THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY...CURRENT FORECAST NUMBERS LOOK GOOD...SO WONT CHANGE TOO 
MUCH.

THANKS TO IWX FOR THE COORDINATION CALL. CLEMISILN OUT SOON.
 
.ILN...NONE.

SITES




AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 AM EST WED JAN 10 2001

CLEAR SKIES WILL PREVAIL OVER AREA AS RIDGING CONTS TO BUILD TO THE 
SOUTH. CWFA SHOULD REMAIN DRY WITH JUST SOME CLOUDS MOVING IN LATE 
THU. WAA CONTINUES TDY WITH TRAJECTORIES COMING FROM SRN IL/NRN AR 
WHERE HIGHS WERE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. WILL CONTINUE WITH GOING 
RANGES. WITH CLEAR SKIES AGAIN TONIGHT TEMPS SHOULD FALL OFF MORE 
THAN GUID...ESP SOUTH WHERE WINDS WILL BE LIGHTER.
 
SYS MOVING EAST ALONG GULF COAST WILL STAY TO THE SOUTH OF AREA WITH 
JUST SOME CLOUDS SPILLING INTO THE SRN AREAS. ANOTHER WEAKER TROF 
WILL BE MOVING THRU THE PLAINS AT THE SAME TIME. THIS SYS IS 
WEAKENING AS IT MOVES EAST AND WILL AFFECT THE LAKES...LEAVING CWFA 
IN THE SPLITS. JUST EXPECTING CLOUDS FROM THESE SYS AS ANY 
APPRECIABLE LIFT AND DEEPER MSTR WILL BE ELSEWHERE. WITH SUN FOR 
MUCH OF THE DAY THURSDAY...WILL STICK CLOSE TO GUID TEMPS.

 
.ILN...NONE.

559 
FXUS61 KILN 091932
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
233 PM EST TUE JAN 9 2001

UPPER AIR PATTERN SHOWS TROF NEARING EAST COAST. EARLY WINTER TREND 
OF BELOW NORMAL HEIGHTS IS COMING TO AN END AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY...WITH THE PACIFIC COAST NOW BECOMING THE 
FOCUS FOR MUCH OF THE CONUS BAD WX.

AT SFC...HIGH CURRENTLY CENTERED OVER THE MISSOURI BOOT HEEL IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH TENNESSEE TO THE CAROLINAS BY THURSDAY 
MORNING. HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO RESULT IN MAINLY CLEAR SKIES THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

ON THURSDAY A COUPLE SYSTEMS ARE FCST TO MOVE TOWARD OUR 
REGION...WITH THE HIGH CENTER BEING SQUEEZED OUT INTO THE ATLANTIC. 
A LOW IS PROGGED TO MOVE NEAR THE GULF COAST...AND ITS ASSOC UPPER 
LEVEL MOISTURE IS EXPECTED TO ADVECT NORTH OF THE LOW INTO OUR AREA. 
THE OTHER SYSTEM IS A WEAKENING COLD FRONT SWINGING DOWN FROM THE 
GREAT LAKES...WHICH WILL POSSIBLY CONTRIBUTE SOME HIGH CLOUDS AS 
WELL.

WILL GO WITH MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND MOSTLY 
SUNNY ON WEDNESDAY. ON THURSDAY...MOSTLY SUNNY WITH INCREASING 
AFTERNOON CLOUDS WILL WORK.

AS FOR TEMPS...THOUGH FWC HAS IMPROVED WRT REALITY SINCE 
YESTERDAY...IT STILL APPEARS GENERALLY TOO HIGH. WITH LOW DEW POINTS 
AND LIGHTER WINDS TONIGHT...I WILL UNDERCUT FWCS 17-19 DOWN TO THE 
13-16 RANGE...SPLITTING THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN FWC AND MESOETA SFC 
TEMPS. WITH MESOETA INDICATING TEMPS ABOUT 10 DEGREES BELOW 
FWC...WILL SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE AND UNDERCUT FWC FOR THE REST OF THE 
FCST PERIOD BY 3-5 DEGREES AS WELL.
 
.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

DAY AND CMH. WILL NOT UPDATE AT THIS TIME...BUT MAY UPDATE BY EARLY 
AFTERNOON IF IT APPEARS TEMPS WONT REACH FCST LEVELS.

355 AM EST TUE JAN 9 2001

DRY NEXT FEW DAYS IN STORE AS WE GET INTO THE RIDGING OF AMPLIFIED 
PATN. A FEW LAKE INDUCED CLDS MOVING ACROSS SWRN PART OF AREA BUT 
THOSE ARE FINALLY DISSIPATING. SOME STRAGGLERS WILL PROBABLY 
CONTINUE DURING THE DAY BUT THINK THEY WILL LESSEN AS THE FLOW BACKS 
DURING THE DAY. MOSUNNY SHOULD SUFFICE. WAA GETS GOING TDY ALLOWING 
850 TO WARM ABOUT 10 DEGS OVER THE NEXT 24 HRS. WITH THE COLD START 
TO THE DAY WILL GO SLIGHTLY BLO GUID MOST GRPS. 

HIGH BUILDS INTO GULF STATES THRU WED WHICH WILL KEEP SKIES MOCLR 
AND ALLOW FOR GOOD RAD COOLING DESPITE LLVL WAA. THINK WE SHOULD 
DECOUPLE TONIGHT WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR TEMPS A GOOD BIT LOWER THAN 
GUID. BUT WE SHOULD BE ABLE TO WARM TO NEAR GUID ON WED WITH SWLY 
FLOW PICKING UP. 

NEXT SYSTEMS...ONE ALONG GULF AND ANOTHER WEAKER ONE STRETCHED FROM 
ONT TO CNTRL PLAINS...WILL LIKELY NOT AFECT US THURS BUT WILL LEAVE 
IN AS MDLS SHOWING INCREASING MSTR. 

.ILN...NONE.



251 
FXUS61 KILN 082003
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
304 PM EST MON JAN 8 2001

GENERAL PATTERN OF THIS WINTER CONTINUES WITH UPPER TROF ACROSS 
EASTERN CONUS. A SHIFT IN THE PATTERN WILL OCCUR BY LATER THIS WEEK 
AS PACIFIC STORMS WILL PUSH RIDGE INTO OUR REGION.

SFC MAP HAS LOW ALONG EAST COAST AND LARGE HIGH ACROSS THE MIDDLE OF 
THE CONUS. HIGH IS PROGGED TO BECOME CENTERED SOUTH OF HERE BY 
TUESDAY NIGHT AFTER UPPER TROF AXIS PASSES EAST. WITH INFLUENCE OF 
MASSIVE SLOW MOVING HIGH...LITTLE OR NO PRECIP IS IN STORE FOR THE 
NEXT TWO DAYS AT LEAST.

OUR AREA IS EXPERIENCING COLD ADVECTION THIS AFTERNOON IN THE 
NORTHERLY FLOW BETWEEN SYSTEMS. FLOW IS KEEPING MOST OF LAKE 
MOISTURE WEST AND EAST OF OUR AREA...THE EXCEPTION BEING FLURRIES 
NEAR CMH.  ETA INDICATES THAT NORTHERLY FLOW WILL  CONTINUE TONIGHT 
SO WILL GO WITH CLEARING/PARTLY CLOUDY...WITH SCATTERED FLURRIES AT 
CMH AND PMH IN MINIMAL LAKE EFFECT. 850 MB WINDS WILL SHIFT TO WEST 
ON TUESDAY AND MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW INVERSION AT AROUND 1 
KFT...WHICH SHOULD END THE CHANCE FOR LAKE CLOUDS AND FLURRIES. 

SHORT WAVE PASSING NORTH OF HERE ON TUESDAY IS FCST TO DRAG MID 
LEVEL MOISTURE THROUGH. THIS FEATURE WILL PROBABLY NOT BRING ENOUGH 
MOISTURE THIS FAR SOUTH TO MAKE MORE THAN SCT AC. THEREFORE WILL 
KEEP MOSTLY SUNNY FCST FOR TUESDAY. WILL FOLLOW WITH MOSTLY CLEAR 
TUESDAY NIGHT/MOSTLY SUNNY WEDNESDAY AS HIGH BECOMES ESTABLISHED 
SOUTH OF HERE.

TEMP FCST IS A PROBLEM WITH MODELS NOT IN AGREEMENT. FWC IS 
GENERALLY QUITE A BIT WARMER THAN ETA SFC TEMPS THROUGH THE FCST 
PERIOD. FOR TONIGHT ETA SHOWS SLUG OF VERY COLD AIR DROPPING DOWN 
FROM MICHIGAN...WITH TEMPS RANGING FROM NEAR ZERO IN OUR NORTHWEST 
COUNTIES TO AROUND 15 FAR SOUTH. FWC HAS 15-17 FOR LOWS. WILL STAY 
NEAR FWC AT CVG WHERE COLD DRY AIR WILL HAVE MORE TROUBLE ADVECTING 
IN. WILL ALSO STAY NEAR FWC AT CMH WHERE A FEW MORE CLOUDS SHOULD 
HELP TO KEEP TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY. WILL GO BELOW FWC BY A FEW AT DAY 
WITH COLD AIR MORE LIKELY TO REACH THERE.

WITH ETA SHOWING TEENS FOR HIGHS ON TUESDAY AND THERMAL TROF 
CENTERED HERE...WILL UNDERCUT FWCS 27-29 INTO THE 20 TO 25 RANGE. 
AGAIN...ETA IS MUCH LOWER THAN FWC TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. WITH 
CLEAR SKIES...I EXPECT WE WILL DROP BELOW FWCS 22-25 TO NEAR 20 
TUESDAY NIGHT. MILDER TEMPS ARE LIKELY ON WEDNESDAY AS HIGH 
CONTINUES SLOWLY EAST. STILL...FWCS 45-49 APPEAR TOO OPTIMISTIC AND 
SO WILL GO 35 TO 40...CLOSE TO MAV.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO







THE CONUS. HIGH IS PROGGED TO BECOME CENTERED SOUTH OF HERE BY 
TUESDAY NIGHT AFTER UPPER TROF AXIS PASSES EAST. WITH INFLUENCE OF 
MASSIVE SLOW MOVING HIGH...LITTLE OR NO PRECIP IS IN STORE FOR THE 
NEXT TWO DAYS AT LEAST.

OUR AREA IS EXPERIENCING COLD ADVECTION THIS AFTERNOON IN THE 
NORTHERLY FLOW BETWEEN SYSTEMS. FLOW IS KEEPING MOST OF LAKE 
MOISTURE WEST AND EAST OF OUR AREA...THE EXCEPTION BEING FLURRIES 
NEAR CMH.  ETA INDICATES THAT NORTHERLY FLOW WILL  CONTINUE TONIGHT 
SO WILL GO WITH CLEARING/PARTLY CLOUDY...WITH SCATTERED FLURRIES AT 
CMH AND PMH IN MINIMAL LAKE EFFECT. 850 MB WINDS WILL SHIFT TO WEST 
ON TUESDAY AND MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW INVERSION AT AROUND 1 
KFT...WHICH SHOULD END THE CHANCE FOR LAKE CLOUDS AND FLURRIES. 

SHORT WAVE PASSING NORTH OF HERE ON TUESDAY IS FCST TO DRAG MID 
LEVEL MOISTURE THROUGH. THIS FEATURE WILL PROBABLY NOT BRING ENOUGH 
MOISTURE THIS FAR SOUTH TO MAKE MORE THAN SCT AC. THEREFORE WILL 
KEEP MOSTLY SUNNY FCST FOR TUESDAY. WILL FOLLOW WITH MOSTLY CLEAR 
TUESDAY NIGHT/MOSTLY SUNNY WEDNESDAY AS HIGH BECOMES ESTABLISHED 
SOUTH OF HERE.

TEMP FCST IS A PROBLEM WITH MODELS NOT IN AGREEMENT. FWC IS 
GENERALLY QUITE A BIT WARMER THAN ETA SFC TEMPS THROUGH THE FCST 
PERIOD. FOR TONIGHT ETA SHOWS SLUG OF VERY COLD AIR DROPPING DOWN 
FROM MICHIGAN...WITH TEMPS RANGING FROM NEAR ZERO IN OUR NORTHWEST 
COUNTIES TO AROUND 15 FAR SOUTH. FWC HAS 15-17 FOR LOWS. WILL STAY 
NEAR FWC AT CVG WHERE COLD DRY AIR WILL HAVE MORE TROUBLE ADVECTING 
IN. WILL ALSO STAY NEAR FWC AT CMH WHERE A FEW MORE CLOUDS SHOULD 
HELP TO KEEP TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY. WILL GO BELOW FWC BY A FEW AT DAY 
WITH COLD AIR MORE LIKELY TO REACH THERE.

WITH ETA SHOWING TEENS FOR HIGHS ON TUESDAY AND THERMAL TROF 
CENTERED HERE...WILL UNDERCUT FWCS 27-29 INTO THE 20 TO 25 RANGE. 
AGAIN...ETA IS MUCH LOWER THAN FWC TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. WITH 
CLEAR SKIES...I EXPECT WE WILL DROP BELOW FWCS 22-25 TO NEAR 20 
TUESDAY NIGHT. MILDER TEMPS ARE LIKELY ON WEDNESDAY AS HIGH 
CONTINUES SLOWLY EAST. STILL...FWCS 45-49 APPEAR TOO OPTIMISTIC AND 
SO WILL GO 35 TO 40...CLOSE TO MAV.  

.ILN...NONE.

CONIGLIO

AXIS.  THE ONE AREA THAT WILL NEED TO BE MONITORED ON SUNDAY AS JET

THE MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL STAY TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF FA.

TONIGHT AS LESS CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED THAN FWC EXPECTS.  WILL STICK

WITH FLOW OFF LMICH WL AFFECT ENTIRE AREA.  WL INCLUDE CHC SNOW IN 
NRN MIAMI VALLEY AND CMH AREAS AND FLURRIES ELSEWHERE.

XPCT TO LOSE THE LOW CLOUDS ON SAT BUT THERE SHOULD BE SOME HIGH 
CLOUDINESS TO KEEP SKIES P/S.  A RETURN TO LLVL MOISTURE SHOULD KEEP 
SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY SAT NIGHT AND SUN.  THERE MAY BE A FEW FLURRIES 
BUT WL KEEP DRY ATTM.

NEXT BEST SHOT OF SNOW SHOULD BE ON MONDAY.  FOLLOWED UKMET IDEA OF 
BRINGING DECENT MID LEVEL SYSTEM ACROSS THE OH VLY FOLLOWED BY A 
BRIEF SHOT OF COLD AIR.  THEN...RIDGING AND WARMER CONDITIONS WL 
RETURN TO FA.

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON





FXUS61 KILN 052006
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
305 PM EST FRI JAN 5 2001

19Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW PRESSURE OVER ONTARIO WITH A TROF 
EXTENDING BACK INTO NRN IN. ENHANCED CLOUDINESS BEARING -SN WAS 
DROPPING OUT OF LWRM MI INTO NWRN OH.

S/WV IS EXPECTED TO MOVE ACROSS SWRN OH THIS EVENING.  DEEPER 
MOISTURE WL AFFECT NRN MIAMI VLY AND CMH AREAS.  LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
WITH FLOW OFF LMICH WL AFFECT ENTIRE AREA.  WL INCLUDE CHC SNOW IN 
NRN MIAMI VALLEY AND CMH AREAS AND FLURRIES ELSEWHERE.

REACHED THE OH-IN LINE BUT WAS STALLING IN ITS EWD PROGRESS.

MODELS INDICATE THAT A SECONDARY S/WV WL MOVE RAPIDLY SE ACROSS FA 
AROUND 21Z.  WITH THE TRACK OVER DAY-CVG AREAS WL ONLY INDICATE 
FLURRIES THERE.  TO THE LEFT OF THE TRACK.. IE THE NRN MIAMI 
VLY...CMH AND PMH WL CARRY CHC OF SNOW WITH LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS.  
BLV THAT CLOUD COVER WL HANG TOUGH TODAY WITH PLENTY OF LLVL 
MOISTURE AND A SECOND S/WV MOVG THROUGH.  WL GO WITH VARIABLY CLOUDY 
DAY-CVG TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CURRENT BREAKS.

TEMPS SHOULD HOLD NEARLY STEADY THIS PM WITH SOME CAA.  WL LOWER 
WINDS TO 15-25 MPM.

@RUKWBCe	3KDENFXUS61 KILN 050950
AFDILN

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
445 AM EST FRI JAN 5 2001

SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWING BROAD SURFACE TROF OVER INDIANA WITH TEMPS 
AT OR ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS THE SOUTH.  KILN/KIWX SHOWING ECHOES 
DEVELOPING OVER NW FA.

TOUGH FORECAST EVEN THOUGH MODELS ARE IN DESCENT AGREEMENT.  THE AVN 
IS THE SHARPEST AND SLOWEST WITH SYSTEM THAT WILL AFFECT FA ON SAT 
NT/SUN.  UKMET SEEMS TO BE A COMPROMISE BETWEEN ETA/AVN. 

PRECIP TYPE...DURATION AND INTENSITY IS A TOUGH CALL TODAY.  UPPER 
AND SURFACE TROF ARE SHARPENING OVER FA THIS MORNING AS 50H WAVE 
DEEPENS.  CLEARING EVIDENT ON LATEST IR LOOP ACROSS WESTERN 
INDIANA.  AS MENTIONED ABOVE TEMPS ARE AT OR AROUND FREEZING ACROSS 
THE SOUTH WITH YET WARMER AIR TO OUR SOUTH AND WEST.  WILL GO WITH 
SNOW ACROSS THE NORTH AND A MIX WITH POSSIBLE RAIN ACROSS THE 
SOUTH.  CONCERNED ABOUT THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING AS A SECOND WAVE 
DIVES SOUTH OVER LAKE MI WITH 850 FLOW SHOWING A GOOD BIT OF 
CONVERGENCE ACROSS THE SOUTH.  MODEL SOUNDINGS WARM CLOUD TOP TEMPS 
TO >-10C WITH DRYING ALOFT.  THIS APPEARS TO BE A GOOD DZ/FZDZ 
SOUNDING.  HOWEVER WITH SUCH STRONG WINDS AT 850 THEIR MAY BE SOME 
NUCLEATION OCCURRING TO BRING SOME FLURRIES.  NEXT SHIFT WILL HAVE 
TO MONITOR FOR POSSIBLE ADVISORY.  

WILL GO A BIT WARMER THAN FWC THE FIRST THREE PERIODS AND STICK 
CLOSE THE 4TH.

MISILN SENT TO ALL.  THANKS TO CLE...RLX AND JKL FOR COOR.  ZFP OUT 
IN A FEW MINUTES.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON




@RUKWBCe4KDENFXUS61 KILN 050252
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
950 PM EST THU JAN 4 2001

FORGOT TO MENTION THAT I WILL BE CHANGING THE SECOND PERIOD (FRIDAY) 
TO FLURRIES OR FREEZING DRIZZLE.  FCST SOUNDINGS INDICATED A CHANCE 
OF FREEZING DRIZZLE OCCURRING...ESPECIALLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF A 
RICHMOND...DAYTON AND COLUMBUS LINE.  FLURRIES OR FREEZING DRIZZLE 
MAY OCCUR NORTH OF THIS LINE.


PREVIOUS DISCUSSION

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS EVENING INDICATED A VIGOROUS S/WV LOCATED 
OVER MN.  THIS S/WV WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MIX BAG OF PCPN ACRS 
OUR CWFA OVERNIGHT.

18Z MESOETA STILL SHOWS A DISJOINTED RELATIVE HUMIDITY SCHEME.  IT 
WILL TAKE AWHILE FOR THE LOW LEVELS (700 MB TO 850 MB) TO MOISTEN 
UP.  THUS...CURRENT RADAR MOSAIC WEST OF THE CWFA IS STILL 
INDICATING VIRGA AHEAD OF AFOREMENTIONED S/WV.  LOOKING AT FCST 
MODEL SOUNDINGS...PCPN SHOULD BE MAINLY SNOW FROM WAPAKONETA 
SOUTHEAST TO COLUMBUS (WITH A LITTLE SLEET).  FROM DAY TO 
CHILLICOTHE...SNOW MAY MIX WITH A LITTLE SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN.  
FARTHER SOUTH FROM CARROLLTON TO CVG TO PMH...A COMBINATION OF 
SNOW...SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN IS POSSIBLE.  NEW RUN OF ETA NOW 
TRICKLING IN AND SHOWING LESS QPF THAN 18Z MESOETA.  WITH THE LOW 
LEVELS TAKING A LONG TIME TO SATURATE...WILL CUT BACK SNOW AMOUNTS 
TO JUST 1 INCH.  WILL NOT ISSUE AN ADVISORY AT THIS POINT FOR THE 
SRN AREAS (FOR FREEZING RAIN) DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY OF THE 
INTENSITY AND DURATION OF THE FREEZING PCPN.  TEMPS OVERNIGHT WILL 
REMAIN STEADY.

.ILN...NONE.

HICKMAN








AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
301 PM EST THU JAN 4 2001

VIGOROUS MID LEVEL SYSTEM WL DIG SEWD INTO THE OH VLY OVERNIGHT AND 
THEN INTO PA BY FRI PM. ETA PROGS COUPLED H8 CONVERGENCE AND H2 
DIVERGENCE OVER FA AROUND 06Z FRI.  ISENTROPIC SFCS SHOW A BRIEF 
SHOT OF LIFT AND DECENT MOISTURE.  LIMITING FACTORS FOR THIS SYSTEM 
WL BE BRIEF DURATION AND INITIAL DRY MID LEVELS. 

STRONG H8 WAA EARLY TONIGHT WL BRING A WARM BUT DRY LAYER INTO FA.  
STRONG LIFT WL EVAPORATIONALLY COOL THIS LAYER TO A MAINLY SNOW 
EVENT FOR DAY-CMH.  HOWEVER...WL LEAVE MENTION OF A MIX IN THOSE 
REGIONS. WRAPAROUND MOISTURE WL CONTINUE THE SNOW INTO FRI AM.  
THINKING AROUND 2 INCHES TOTAL ACCUMULATION VC CMH AND LESS THAN 2 
VC DAY BASED ON LEMO TECHNIQUE.  

VC CVG-PMH...XPCT PRECIP TO BE LIGHTER.  WITH THE H8 WARM LAYER AND 
THE POSSIBLITY OF -FZDZ  IN THE DRY SLOT...WL MENTION CHC OF MIXED 
PRECIPITATION WITH LITTLE OR NO ACCUMULATION.

ETA SHOWS STRONG DOWNWARD MOTION ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE VIGROUS S/WV 
ON FRI.  THIS SHOULD TRANSLATE INTO WINDY CONDITIONS DAY-CMH.  WINDS 
APPEAR TO BE A LITTLE WEAKER CVG-PMH SO WL STICK WITH 15-25 MPH 
THERE.

WITH LEFTOVER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND FLOW OFF LMICH WL LEAVE CHC 
-SHSN DAY-CMH AND FLURRIES VC CVG-PMH ON FRI NIGHT.

TEMPS SHOULD BE NEARLY STEADY TONIGHT WITH A SMALL RISE TO NEAR THE 
FREEZING MARK ON FRI.  

.ILN...NONE.

WILKINSON

AREA OF FREEZING DRIZZLE IS MAKING A SLOW PROGRESSION TO THE NORTH 
AND EAST. THIS IS IN LINE WITH ENERGY GETTING TRANSLATED TO SFC LOW 
THAT IS MOVING NORTHEAST FROM GREAT LAKES REGION. 

AFTER CALLING SEVERAL COUNTIES...HAVE ALLOWED ADVISORY TO EXPIRE 
OVER ALL OF INDIANA...AND MIAMI VALLEY OF OHIO.

OBS ACROSS CENTRAL AND WEST CENTRAL OHIO STILL SHOWING A REDUCTION 
IN VSBYS...AND CALLS TO LAW ENFORCEMENT HERE SHOWS THAT FZDZ STILL 
GOING ON IN MOST AREAS. HAVE EXTENDED ADVISORY IN THIS AREA UNTIL 10 
AM TO PLAY IT SAFE.

ZONES OUT IN A MINUTE.

THROUGH 10 AM.

978 
FXUS61 KILN 040901 AAA
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
400 AM EST THU JAN 4 2001

...UPDATED TO INCLUDE LEFTOVER WX IN NORTH AND TO DROP ADVISORY IN 
SOUTH.

LITTLE TO NO PRECIP EXPECTED OVER SRN FCST AREA THIS MORNING...WILL 
UPDATED WSW TO CANCEL WITH MORNING ISSUANCE. FORGOT TO HEADLINE 
NORTHERN ZONES WITH WSW.

FCST PROBLEMS ARE CONCENTRATING ON NEXT CLIPPER SYSTEM WITH S/W 
MOVING THROUGH NRN GT LKS RGN OVERNIGHT FRIDAY. BROAD AREA OF 
INCREASED WIND SPEEDS WILL INCREASE WAA IN LOWER LEVELS STARTING 
LATE IN THE DAY.

PRECIP EFFICIENCIES ARE ONLY SHOWING A BRIEF PERIOD OF SHOWERS...AND 
RIGHT NOW IT COULD BE SNOW AND FZRA MIX...ESPECIALLY FOR SRN 2/3 OF 
FCST AREA. DRIER...WARMER MID LEVELS WOULD/COULD PRECLUDE SNOW 
NUCLEI FROM DROPPING INTO THE COLUMN OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. UPWARD 
MOTION REALLY GETS GOING IN STRONGER WINDS. TIMING OF PRECIP LOOKS 
TO BE WITH ENHANCED UVV AND VORT...AN HOUR OR THREE ON EITHER SIDE 
OF 6Z...BUT PRECIP IS ONLY EXPECTED FOR A FEW HOURS AT BEST.

FEEL THAT TEMPS WILL HOLD STEADY ON FRI WITH NW FLOW...ALONG WITH A 
CHANCE OF LAKE EFFECT SHOWERS FRI NIGHT. WILL UNDERCUT MOS BY A BIT 
HERE.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...WSW FOR FREEZING DRIZZLE NORTH HALF OF FCST AREA THROUGH 6 AM.

FRANKS

OF 6Z...BUT PRECIP IS ONLY EXPECTED FOR A FEW HOURS AT BEST.

CHANCE OF LAKE EFFECT SHOWERS FRI NIGHT. WILL UNDERCUT MOS BY A BIT 
HERE.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS






534 
FXUS61 KILN 040816
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 AM EST THU JAN 4 2001

FCST PROBLEMS ARE CONCENTRATING ON NEXT CLIPPER SYSTEM WITH S/W 
MOVING THROUGH NRN GT LKS RGN OVERNIGHT FRIDAY. BROAD AREA OF 
INCREASED WIND SPEEDS WILL INCREASE WAA IN LOWER LEVELS STARTING 
LATE IN THE DAY.

PRECIP EFFICIENCIES ARE ONLY SHOWING A BRIEF PERIOD OF SHOWERS...AND 
RIGHT NOW IT COULD BE SNOW AND FZRA MIX...ESPECIALLY FOR SRN 2/3 OF 
FCST AREA. DRIER...WARMER MID LEVELS WOULD/COULD PRECLUDE SNOW 
NUCLEI FROM DROPPING INTO THE COLUMN OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. UPWARD 
MOTION REALLY GETS GOING IN STRONGER WINDS. TIMING OF PRECIP LOOKS 
TO BE WITH ENHANCED UVV AND VORT...AN HOUR OR THREE ON EITHER SIDE 
OF 6Z...BUT PRECIP IS ONLY EXPECTED FOR A FEW HOURS AT BEST.

FEEL THAT TEMPS WILL HOLD STEADY ON FRI WITH NW FLOW...ALONG WITH A 
CHANCE OF LAKE EFFECT SHOWERS FRI NIGHT. WILL UNDERCUT MOS BY A BIT 
HERE.

MISILN OUT SOON.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS







265 
FXUS61 KILN 040615
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
115 AM EST THU JAN 4 2001

REPORTS OF FZDZ IN SOUTHERN FCST AREA ARE SPOTTY AT BEST...BUT WILL 
LET ADVISORY CONTINUE THROUGH 6 AM WITH SOME UVV EXPECTE TO REMAIN 
AHEAD OF WEAKENING SFC TROF. 

TROF WAS BEST PRONOUNCED AT 3Z OVER NRN IND...AND IS PROGGED TO 
WEAKEN BTWN 9 AND 12Z AS ENERGY GETS TRANSLATED TO RETREATING SFC  
LOW IN SRN CANADA. THOUGH MEAN RH GETS SHUNTED EAST WITH RIDGING 
BUILDING IN TO THE WEST AT 12Z...LLVL MOISTURE SHOULD BE A BIT 
DIFFICULT TO SCOUR OUT THIS MORNING. ANY FORCING THROUGH THIS PERIOD 
SHOULD RESULT IN SOME LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE. RIDGE BUILDS IN EARLY 
THIS MORNING...BUT OCCURRANCE OF FZDZ STILL BEING FOUND IN WRN 
PORTIONS OF CWA PER CALLS TO LOCAL AGENCIES...AND IN NRN CWA BY SFC 
OBS. WILL RE-ISSUE WSW TO EXTEND NRN FCST AREA THROUGH 6 AM. 

.ILN...WINTER WX ADVISORY UNTIL 6 AM FOR FREEZING DRIZZLE ACROSS 
ENTIRE FCST AREA.

FRANKS





@RUKWBCe&KDENFXUS61 KILN 040138
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
835 PM EST WED JAN 3 2001

MADE A FEW CALLS THIS EVENING ACRS THE NRN MIAMI VLY AND WRN 
SECTIONS OF CNTRL OHIO.  FZDZ IS STILL OCCURRING IN THESE AREAS.  
ALSO...SOME FREEZING PCPN HAS BEEN REPORTED AT DAYTON RECENTLY. KILN 
RADAR IS DOWN...BUT KIWX IS BACK UP.  KIWX RADAR SHOWS SOME WEAK 
RETURNS...ENOUGH TO VERIFY THAT THE RADAR IS DETECTING LIGHT PCPN.  
AIRMASS WILL CONTINUE TO BE BORDERLINE FOR FREEZING PCPN AS MID 
LEVELS ARE DRY AND THE TEMPERATURE AT THE TOP OF THE LOWER LEVEL 
MOIST LAYER REMAINS NEAR -9 C (JUST WARM ENOUGH TO EXCLUDE ICE 
CRYSTAL FORMATION).  THUS...WILL CONTINUE WINTER WX ADVISORY 
NORTHERN SECTIONS AT LEAST UNTIL MIDNIGHT.  WILL NOT ISSUE A WINTER 
WX ADVISORY FOR THE SOUTH ATTM SINCE PCPN MAY BE VERY SPOTTY WHEN IT 
REACHES THESE AREAS.  HOWEVER...TIME WILL TELL...AND I WILL ASSESS 
THE POSSIBILITY OF AN ADVISORY IF FREEZING PCPN IS REPORTED IN THESE 
AREAS.


.ILN...WINTER WX ADVISORY UNTIL MIDNIGHT FOR FREEZING DRIZZLE ACRS 
       WEST CENTRAL AND CENTRAL OHIO...AND EAST CENTRAL INDIANA.

HICKMAN








FXUS61 KILN 040138


588 
FXUS61 KILN 032045
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
345 PM EST WED JAN 3 2001

UPDATED PORTION...COUNTY CANVAS REVEALS FZDZ CAUSING TRAVEL PROBLEMS 
OVER E-CENTRAL INDIANA.  WL BE ISSUING ADVISORY FOR CMH-DAY AND WEST 
CENTRAL OHIO GROUPS THRU MIDNIGHT.

INITIAL FCST CHALLENGE REVOLVES AROUND FZDZ/-SN CHCS ERLY IN THE 
FIRST PD.  THE WINTERY MIX OF LIGHT PCPN HAS BEEN FAIRLY WIDESPREAD 
OVER THE NORTHERN 1/2 OF INDIANA TDY...BUT COORD WITH UPSTREAM 
OFFICES INDC LITTLE IN THE WAY OF ACCRUAL ON ROADS ETC.  SECONDARY 
SHORTWAVE EVIDENT OF SAT PIX DIVING INTO NORTHERN IL ATTM.  FORCING 
FOR LIFT AHEAD OF THIS SYS HAS LED TO A FAIRLY DRAMTIC COOLING/ 
EXPANSION TO THE HIGH AND MID CLOUDS.  THIS DEEPER MOIST LAYER SHUD 
HELP FEED/SEED MORE ICE CRYSTALS INTO THE LOWER MSTR AND LIMIT THE 
FZDZ POTNL TO PATCHY.  WL MAKE LAST MINUTE DECSION ON NEED FOR 
ADVISORY...BUT CURRENTLY LEANING TWRD NO HEADLINE.   AS FAR AS 
SNOW...WL MENTION JUST FLURRIES OVER THE S-W...TAPERING TO LIKELY 
POPS FOR -SN OVER THE NE.  PERFECT PROGGING THE 18Z ETA...CUD SEE A 
FEW HUNDRETHS IN THE NE WHICH WUD FLUFF UP TO AN INCH IN SPOTS.  
TIMING LOOKS TO BE MAINLY BEFORE 06Z...AND WL WORD APPROPRIATELY.  
META TEMPS ADV NEARLY STEADY TEMPS AT OR A LITTLE WARMER THAN NEW 
FWC NUMBERS.  WL MAKE ONLY SLIGHT UPWARD ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FWC.

LLVL MSTR WL LINGER BEHIND THIS SYS ON THU...AND WL MENTION A MCLDY 
TREND ALL ZONES.  META SFC TEMPS REMAIN VERY CLOSE TO THE FWC 
NUMBERS...4-6 DEG COOLER THAN THE AVN BASED GUIDANCE.  GIVEN THE 
DEPTH AND EXTENT OF SNOWPACK...WL LEAN TWRD COOLER TEMPS.  NEXT 
ENERGETIC SHORT WAVE DIGS IN FRI NIGHT...WITH LIMITED MSTR AND EVEN 
WARMER TEMPS IN THE LLVLS.  LLVL THICKNESS PROGS FROM ALL MODELS 
SHOW A PD OF LIGHT FREEZING PCPN PSBL IN THE WEST AND SOUTH...AND WL 
INCLUDE MENTION.  SFC CAA ON FRIDAY LOOKS FAIRLY MODEST...BUT WITH 
AFOREMENTIONED SNOWPACK CANNOT SEE THE L40S ADVERTISED BY THE FAN.  
COOLER FWC NUMBERS STILL LK BEST.

.ILN...WINTER WX ADVISORY UNTIL MIDNIGHT FOR FREEZING DRIZZLE ACRS 
WEST CENTRAL AND CENTRAL OHIO...AND EAST CENTRAL INDIANA.

JOHNSTONE







NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
959 AM EST WED JAN 3 2001

PATCHY FZDZ OVER NORTHERN INDIANA/ILLINOIS THIS MORNING.  GOOD SHOT 
OF FORCING FOR LIFT ERLY TDY...WITH FAIRLY VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE 
COINCIDENT WITH DECENT WAA.  MSTR LIMITED TO THE LLVLS HWVR...AND 
TEMPS IN THE CLOUD BEARING LAYER AOA 10C EXPLAINS THE MIX OF -SN AND 
FZDZ.  LIFT PROGGED TO WEAKEN QUICKLY THIS AFTERNOON...BEFORE NEXT 
SHOT OF FORCING THIS EVE.  WITH BOUNDARY LAYER OVER OUR CWFA DRYING 
DIURNALLY...AND BEST LIFT STAYING NORTH AM INCLINED TO LEAVE 
FREEZING DRIZZLE MENTION OUT OF ALL BUT THE FAR NW.

AFTER A COLD START...TEMPS LAGGING THE FWC 3 HOURLIES BY 7-10 DEG AT 
15Z.  META SFC TEMPS LOOK BETTER...AND SUGGEST READINGS ARND A 
CATEGORY BLO CURRENT FCST VALUES.  WITH GOOD SNOW PACK REMAINING 
...M30S LOOKS TOO WARM TMRW.  META SFC TEMPS AND NEW FWC GUID 1-2 
CATS COLDER...AND HV MADE DOWNWARD ADJUSTMENTS.

.ILN...NONE.

JOHNSTONE







FXUS61 KILN 031459
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
959 AM EST WED JAN 3 2001

PATCHY FZDZ OVER NORTHERN INDIANA/ILLINOIS THIS MORNING.  GOOD SHOT 
OF FORCING FOR LIFT ERLY TDY...WITH FAIRLY VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE 
COINCIDENT WITH DECENT WAA.  MSTR LIMITED TO THE LLVLS HWVR...AND 
TEMPS IN THE CLOUD BEARING LAYER AOA 10C EXPLAINS THE MIX OF -SN AND


@RUKWBCe*KDENFXUS61 KILN 030742
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
240 AM EST WED JAN 3 2001

CURRENT FCST WITH FLURRIES IN MOST OF CWA LOOKS GOOD. LOW CHANCE 
POPS THIS AFTERNOON AND TONITE ALSO SEEM THE WAY TO GO OVER NORTHERN 
FCST AREA WITH A RELATIVELY MOISTURE STARVED CLIPPER SYSTEM MOVING 
THROUGH. COULD SEE ACCUM UNDER AN INCH...MAINLY IN COLUMBUS GROUPING.

THE MIX OF PRECIP SLATED FOR THURS PM IS QUESTIONABLE. NOT THE 
MIX...BUT THE PRECIP OVER THE SOUTH. THERE SHOULD BE A QUICK 
CHANGEOVER TO ALL SNOW BY MORNING...AND SOME WRAP-AROUND SHOWERS 
LOOK EVIDENT FOR FRIDAY. CURRENT FRIDAY IS DRY IN SOUTH...WILL ADD 
CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS. EXPECT TO REMOVE MENTION OF PRECIP IN 
SOUTHEAST THURSDAY PM...DRY AIR IN PLACE SHOULD HOLD OFF MOST OF 
PRECIP HERE.

TEMPS WILL BE A LITTLE ON THE DIFFICULT SIDE FOR THURSDAY AS TO 
WHICH WILL WIN OUT...WAA OR SNOW COVER. CURRENTLY THINKING THAT WAA 
IS DOMINANT WITH STRONG WINDS...AND LIKE THE WARMER MAV TEMPS HERE. 
OTHERWISE...GUIDANCE TEMPS SHOULD BE ON THE HARD SIDE TO BEAT...AND 
WILL ERR WITH DRIER THINKING WITH ANY PRECIP PRODUCING SYSTEMS 
MOVING THROUGH. 

HOPE TO HAVE MISILN OUT AROUND 3:30.

.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS




SYSTEM SLOWLY MOVES OUT OVERNIGHT AS LWR LVL MOISTURE LINGERS THROUGH
THE EVENING AND EXITS OVRNIGHT. A WEAK RIDGE BUILDS IN BEHINDS THE
CLDS AND TIME SECTIONS HERE SHOW GOOD SUBSIDENCE. NEXT SYS FOR
THURSDAY LOOK TO HAVE QUITE A WARM UP AS THICKNESSES JUMP TO THE
540/S. NICE THERMAL RIDGE BUILDS ACRS THE AREA AND GOOD ISENTROPIC
WAA PATTERN ALSO. EXPECT LOTS OF CLDS WITH THIS SYS ON THURS AS THE
WARMER AIR TRAVERSES THE VAST SNOWPACK OF THE MIDWEST. THIS LACK OF
SUN MAY LIMIT SFC TEMPS.

FINGER OF LAKE EFFECT CLOUDS IS QUICKLY DISSIPATING AS IT MOVES



125 
FXUS61 KILN 022014
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
315 PM EST TUE JAN 2 2001

VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING BATCH OF CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE 
NORTH.  OTHERWISE CLEAR SKIES OVER FA AND TO OUR WEST.   SURFACE 
ANALYSIS INDICATES TEMPERATURES ARE ONLY ABOUT 5 DEGREES ABOVE FWC 
LOWS FOR TONIGHT.

MODELS ARE ALL IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT.  THE ONLY REAL 
DISCREPANCIES COMES NEAR 60 HOURS WHEN DEVELOPING LOW OVER SOUTH 
CENTRAL CANADIAN PLAINS WHERE THE AVN IS FARTHER SOUTH AND ETA 
STRONGER WITH LOW.  RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SETS UP OVER FA OVERNIGHT 
AND SOURCE AIR IS FROM NORTHERN IL WHERE LOWS WERE AROUND TO BELOW 
ZERO.  WITH HIGH NOT DIRECTLY OVER GRADIENT SHOULD KEEP TEMPS A FEW 
DEGREES HIGHER THAN EXPECTED TDS.  THIS IS ABOUT 10 TO 12 DEGREES 
COLDER TO FWC AND ABOUT 5 COLDER THAN MAV.  WAA SETS UP FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND TEMPS SLOWLY RISE HOWEVER WITH SUCH A COLD START AND 
THICKENING CLOUDS TEMPS WILL ONLY CLIMB INTO THE LO-MID 20S.  BEST 
LIFT AND DEEPEST MOISTURE WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM STAYS NORTH OF FA.  
WILL HOWEVER THROW IN CHC POPS ACROSS THE NORTH AND FLURRIES TO THE 
SOUTH.  PRECIP WILL BE MAINLY FOCUSED WITH SECOND WAVE OR COLD 
FRONT.  WAA WILL START UP RATHER QUICKLY OVERNIGHT ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AS RIDGING TAKES PLACE.  EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND WAA SHOULD 
OFFSET ANY RADIATIONAL COOLING AND TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN STEADY.  FWC 
LOOKS PRETTY GOOD FOR THE LAST TWO PERIODS.

THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL MOVE THRU THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY BRINGING 
WITH IT THE THREAT OF MIX PRECIP.  IN FACT AVN THICKNESS POINT TO 
MAINLY FZRA BUT WILL DISCUSS WINTER MIX AS PRECIP IS STILL 72 HOURS 
AWAY.  FURTHER OUT THE MRF HAS COME AROUND TO THE UKMET SOLUTION OF 
TAKING RESPECTABLE SURFACE LOW OVER FA LATTER IN THE WEEKEND.

MISILN WILL BE SENT SHORTLY.

.ILN...NONE.
 TIPTON








