@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 020720
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
215 AM EST TUE JAN 2 2001

AFTER SOME MORNING FLURRIES IN THE SOUTHEAST...LOOKS TO BE A QUIET 
NEXT DAY OR SO UNDER HIGH PRESSURE UNTIL NEXT S/W PASSES NORTH OF 
FCST AREA ON WED AFTERNOON/EVENING. MODEL QPF FROM THIS SYSTEM IS ON 
LIGHT SIDE AND DRY AIR IN PLACE WITH HIGH PRESSURE TODAY MAKES A 
LIGHT SNOW EVENT LOOK REASONABLE. SOME FORCING EXPECTED AHEAD OF 
WEAK SFC TROF...WHICH GETS WASHED OUT OVERNIGHT WEDNESDAY WITH 
RIDGING RIGHT BEHIND THE TROF. CURRENT FCST HAS THIS IN HAND WITH 
CHANCE POPS EVERYWHERE...HIGHEST IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO. EXPECT TO 
KEEP 50 POPS RUNNING THERE AND IN CENTRAL OHIO.

RIGHT NOW...ETA AND AVN HAVE POSSIBILITY OF AN INCH OR SO IN CENTRAL 
OHIO...WILL MENTION ACCUMS POSSIBLE. REST OF CWA SHOULD BE FAIRLY 
LIGHT.

NEXT SYSTEM IS A STRONG LOW PUSHING INTO HUDSON BAY ON FRIDAY...WITH 
SFC CDFNT OVER FCST AREA PRODUCING SNOWFALL OVERNIGHT THURS INTO 
FRIDAY. THIS IS UNDERNEATH A FAIRLY GOOD H5 TROF THAT PUSHES INTO OH 
ON FRIDAY. MODELS ATTM HINTING AT POSSIBILITY OF A MIX...AND CURRENT 
FCST IS WELL IN HAND WITH RAIN/SNOW POSSIBLE.

MAIN CHALLENGE WITH FCST THIS MORNING WILL BE TEMPS IN LACK OF CLOUD 
COVER. IF WE STARTED AT THE 20 DEGREES THAT WE WERE YESTERDAY 
MORNING...MOS WOULD BE TOO COOL. RIGHT NOW...STATIONS ACROSS FCST 
AREA ARE AT 20...BUT MIE DROPPED 7 DEGREES IN AN HOUR WITH CLEARING 
SKIES. THINK THAT CLEARING WILL MAKE ITS WAY INTO MOST OF FCST AREA 
BEFORE DAWN...AND FWC SHOULD BE CLOSE TODAY FOR MOST PLACES. AVN 
GUIDANCE STILL MUCH BETTER ON LOWS OVERNIGHT UNDER CLEAR SKIES.
 
.ILN...NONE.

FRANKS

452 
FXUS61 KILN 011925
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
225 PM EST MON JAN 1 2001

MODELS IN FARILY GOOD AGREEMENT...WITH ETA/AVN RATHER CONSISTANT 
WITH LAST RUN. MID LEVEL PATTERN INDICATING CURRENT SW-NE TROUGH 
WILL CONTINUE TO TRANSLATE EAST. VERY LITTLE IN THE WAY OF MID LVL 
FORCING UNTIL APPROACH OF NEXT S/W TROUGH WHICH WILL APPROACH FROM 
THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND AFFECT ILN FA ON WEDNESDAY. PRIMARY 
SFC FEATURE THROUGH 48HR WILL BE BUILDING HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM TO 
OUR SW WHICH WILL EXTEND INTO OUR FA. SFC TROUGH...IN ASSOCIATION 
WITH MID LVL S/W...WILL APPROACH FROM THE NW AND BEGIN TO AFFECT OUR 
WX ON WEDNESDAY.

CURRENTLY 88D STILL SHOWING LT SN SHOWERS/FLURRIES AFFECTING SRN 
PORTION OF FA. ENHANCED REFLECTIVITY ALSO INDICATED ACROSS CTRL IN. 
ETA INDICATES WK MID LVL VORT TRACKING S INTO FA. THIS FEATURE WILL 
CONTINUE SOUTHWRD TRACK INTO ACROSS FA TONIGHT. FEEL LT SN 
SHR/FLURRIES WILL RESULT.

ADDITIONAL FCST PROBLEM WITH THIS CURRENT PACKAGE WILL BE TEMPS AND 
CLD COVER. WILL KEEP MC TONIGHT WITH NR AVN/ETA GUIDANCE TEMPS. WILL 
GO PTLY SUNNY FOR TOMORROW AS THOSE CONDITIONS NOW EVIDENT SW OF FA. 

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.
 
.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO


@RUKWBCeKDENFXUS61 KILN 011503
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1003 AM EST MON JAN 1 2001

88D INDICATING AREA OF LT SNOW STRETCHING FROM W-CTRL 
IN...SOUTHEASTWARD INTO NRN KY AND EXTREME SRN OH. VERY LITTLE IN 
THE WAY OF MAJOR SYNOPTIC FEATURES HELPING TO SUPPORT THIS 
PRECIPITATION. APPEARS THAT BEST FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR THIS PRECIP 
OUTBREAK SHOWS UP IN THE ISENTROPIC DIAGNOSTICS BETWEEN THE 272-278K 
SURFACES. ETA MODEL INDICATES BEST LIFT AND MOISTURE ALONG THESE 
SURFACES WILL REMAIN SW AND S OF ILN FA THROUGHOUT THE DAY...WITH A 
CONTINUED TRANSLATION TO THE SE WITH THIS MOISTURE.

THUS FEEL THAT ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO CURRENT PACKAGE REGARDING 
PRECIPITATION IS IN ORDER. REGARDING TEMPERATURES...THE MUCH COLDER 
TEMPS TO BEGIN THE DAY WITH ACROSS THE NORTH WILL NOT ALLOW FOR 
REVOVERY TO CURRENT FCST TEMPS. WILL ADJUST THESE ACCORDINGLY. WINDS 
ALSO ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN LIGHT TDY. WILL ADJUST THESE AS WELL 
WHERE NECESSARY.

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.
 
.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO






435 
FXUS61 KILN 011503
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
1003 AM EST MON JAN 1 2001

88D INDICATING AREA OF LT SNOW STRETCHING FROM W-CTRL 
IN...SOUTHEASTWARD INTO NRN KY AND EXTREME SRN OH. VERY LITTLE IN 
THE WAY OF MAJOR SYNOPTIC FEATURES HELPING TO SUPPORT THIS 
PRECIPITATION. APPEARS THAT BEST FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR THIS PRECIP 
OUTBREAK SHOWS UP IN THE ISENTROPIC DIAGNOSTICS BETWEEN THE 272-278K 
SURFACES. ETA MODEL INDICATES BEST LIFT AND MOISTURE ALONG THESE 
SURFACES WILL REMAIN SW AND S OF ILN FA THROUGHOUT THE DAY...WITH A 
CONTINUED TRANSLATION TO THE SE WITH THIS MOISTURE.

THUS FEEL THAT ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO CURRENT PACKAGE REGARDING 
PRECIPITATION IS IN ORDER. REGARDING TEMPERATURES...THE MUCH COLDER 
TEMPS TO BEGIN THE DAY WITH ACROSS THE NORTH WILL NOT ALLOW FOR 
REVOVERY TO CURRENT FCST TEMPS. WILL ADJUST THESE ACCORDINGLY. WINDS 
ALSO ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN LIGHT TDY. WILL ADJUST THESE AS WELL 
WHERE NECESSARY.

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.
 
.ILN...NONE.

DISTEFANO

KDENFXUS61 KILN 011213
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
713 AM EST MON JAN 1 2001

DENSE FOG GETTING MORE WIDESPREAD IN CENTRAL OHIO AND THE NORTHERN 
MIAMI VALLEY.  WILL UPDATE ZONES TO ADD MENTION OF DENSE FOG.

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.
 
.ILN...NONE.


142 
FXUS61 KILN 010749
AFDILN
AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE WILMINGTON OH
250 AM EST MON JAN 1 2001

NORTHWEST FLOW ON BACK SIDE OF NORTHEAST U.S. LOW CONTINUES TO 
GENERATE AREA OF FLURRIES. THIS AREA IS SLOWLY DRIFTING TO THE 
SOUTHEAST...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT SOUTH CENTRAL OHIO/NE KY AND 
IS EXPECTED TO LINGER INTO THE DAY.

AREA OF LIGHT SNOW CONTINUES TO DEVELOP ACROSS KY IN RESPONSE TO 
UPPER LOW WHICH WILL SWING THROUGH OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS TODAY. 
WILL MENTION SOME LIGHT SNOW IN THE KENTUCKY COUNTIES...TAPERING TO 
FLURRIES ACROSS SOUTHERN OHIO.

WINDS TURN NORTHWEST AGAIN TONIGHT...BRINGING FLOW OFF THE LAKES.  
WILL MENTION A CHANCE OF A FLURRY IN THE WEST.

SHORTWAVE RIDGE BUILDS IN ON TUESDAY...CLEARING OUT SKIES.

NO CHANGE TO CURRENT FORECASTED TEMPERATURES EXPECTED.

CLEMISILN OUT SOON.
 
.ILN...NONE.

SITES
